ngiemboon: Mezíŋ pàmangʉa njʉ̀’ Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd, éfóo na ngẅɛ Ábalam e mɔɔn:
en: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Ábalam la zyé Esâg, Esâg zyé Yakwɔ́b, Yakwɔ́b zyé Jẅida pâ mefɛ́ pé.
en: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

ngiemboon: Jẅida zyé Fares pɔ́ Zara, má wɔ́b gwɔ́ Tamar, Fares zyé Esrom, Esrom zyé Aram.
en: and Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

ngiemboon: Aram zyé Aminadab, Aminadab zyé Naason, Naason zyé Salmoŋ,
en: and Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

ngiemboon: Salmoŋ zyé Booz, má pà Booz gwɔ́ Raab, Booz zyé Obed, má pà Obed gwɔ́ Lẅid, Obed zyé Jesé,
en: and Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

ngiemboon: Jesé zyé fùɔ Ndavíd, fùɔ Ndavíd la zyé Salomo, mbà má pà Salomo láa nzwě Wiri.
en: and Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of herthat had been the wifeof Urias;

ngiemboon: Salomo zyé Loboam, Loboam zyé Abia, Abia zyé Asaf,
en: and Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

ngiemboon: Asaf zyé Josafad, Josafad zyé Joram, Joram zyé Ozias,
en: and Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

ngiemboon: Ozias zyé Joatáŋ, Joatáŋ zyé Asház, Asház zyé Ezékias,
en: and Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;

ngiemboon: Ezékias zyé Manase, Manase zyé Amoŋ, Amoŋ zyé Josias,
en: and Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

ngiemboon: Josias zyé Yekonia pâ mefɛ́ pé. Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌ mé gwoonte pà Israel, pɔ́ cʉ́’ megàŋa tsǎŋa ncù, mé lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgee Mbabilonia
en: and Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:

ngiemboon: Yɛ̂ kwò pʉ̀a tɔ́g, Yekonia zyé Salatiɛl, Salatiɛl zyé Zorobabel,
en: and after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

ngiemboon: Zorobabel zyé Abiud, Abiud zyé Eliakím, Eliakím zyé Azɔr,
en: and Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

ngiemboon: Azɔr zyé Sadɔg, Sadɔg zyé Akím, Akím zyé Eliud
en: and Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

ngiemboon: Eliud zyé Eléazar, Eléazar zyé Matan, Matan zyé Yakwɔ́b,
en: and Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b zyé Yesyɛ̂b, Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ ndǔm Malîɛ, Malîɛ gwɔ́ má pà Yěsô gẅie mé tóŋo le*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

ngiemboon: E lɔgɔ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ mejwoŋó ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ nê legém tà fó ná Ábalam ńgʉa ńkúu nà Ndavíd, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ mejwoŋó ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ nê legém tà fó ná Ndavíd ńkúu nà fʉ̀’ gie mé la gwoon pà Israel, pɔ́ cʉ́’ megàŋa tsǎŋa ncù, mé lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgee Mbabilonia, ḿbɔ́ɔnte mé gíŋe ńgẅiin mejwoŋó ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ nê legém tá ńgʉa ńkúu ná*Nzà’nkÿo
en: So all the generations from Abraham to Davidarefourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylonarefourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christarefourteen generations.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ á la cʉa pú’u, tá mé zyé Yěsô Kristo. Má wé Malîɛ la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Yesyɛ̂b kaŋá yé, tà mé zẅíŋ ngie à zɔ́’ɔ yé, tá á nyé té gʉa tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a yé, mé gyá á gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ̌ gÿǒ
en: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Àndǔm we Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ nyìŋ ńkíbe*lepʉ̌ tɛ’ tá’, ńké té nê ńkwoŋo lékyag nzèm yé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ pá’*lepʉ̌ lá’ sɔ́b né ńzɛ́te pú’u wɔ́, ńně ńkwaŋa pɔ́ pá’ à ge lʉ’ʉ yé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntsèm tà nyìŋ le zsé,
en: Then Joseph her husband, being a justman, and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.

ngiemboon: ńnyé ńkwaŋa kwaŋ, ńdyé njÿòon ńgyá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tóŋo yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Yesyɛ̂b, gu gẅie ɔɔ na ngẅɛ fuɔ Ndavíd, kẅé nzwě gù Malîɛ ńnéŋe ndá té pɔ́g, mélà’mie aa shwoŋ pɛ́’ɛ, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ̌ gÿǒ.
en: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: À ge táa zyé múɔ mbàŋa, ɔ̀ tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Yěsô, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Ssé ge gÿo mé tsẅɛ́, é tóŋo yé pú’u, mélà’mie yé zɔ ge gÿo pʉ̀a lá’ pɔ́b tsẅɛ́ ndòon menò tepòŋ mɔ́b
en: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔgɔ ḿbumte pá’ɔɔn nà shwóŋó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lɔ́g ncwò Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ we ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: mè tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Emanuel, e lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé ee nùɔ pege».
en: which being interpreted is, God with us.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn pú’u, Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ tà ńzyeen, ńgÿo mmó gie à tsẅǐ né yé, ńkẅé nzwě we ńnéŋe ndá.
en: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ yé ké ńdá’ tè nuŋe, tà á gÿo ńzyé múɔ ŋwɛ́, Yesyɛ̂b tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Yěsô
en: and knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.

ngiemboon: Mé gwaa zyé Yěsô á tÿǒsoŋ Mbetélehem á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, é gwɔ́ ngù’ fùɔ*Herôd. Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌, etsɔ́ pàzsé nò nà mecÿɔ́’ saŋ fó lá’ pɔ́b mbu’ sǎ’ nèm ńtóo Yerósalem,
en: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judæa in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ ńzɛ́te ngie: Àfùɔ pà Yuda gẅie mé ka zyé yé la gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́? Peg ka tyé lá’ peg mbu’ sǎ’ nèm ńgyá saŋ we, peg tóo pá’ɔɔn léná mekù’ mé.
en: saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgwá ńzɛ́te pú’u, ànò àyɛ̌ gwe metuŋó fùɔ*Herôd, ḿbú ńcu’u twó yé, ńcu’u twó pʉ̀a metsèm tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem.
en: When Herod the king had heardthese things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd leen ńké ńtóŋ*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsé tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie mé ge lá’ zyé*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ á nzɔ̌ jʉ’ʉ?
en: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ shwóŋó yé ngie: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie mé ge lá’ zyé yé á Mbetélehem, pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Jẅidea wɔɔn, mélà’mie*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e ngie:
en: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judæa: for thus it is written by the prophet,

ngiemboon: á nue àfùɔ gẅie à ge lá’ sá’ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn pà Israel ge lá’ kẅɛ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi».
en: That shall rule my people Israel.

ngiemboon: *Herôd jú’ pú’u, ńtóŋ pàzsé nò nà mecÿɔ́’ saŋ, pâ pɔ́ tyé ntsèm, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi ka zye légyá wɔɔn cÿɔ́’ saŋ tà fó síŋe?
en: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ píte shwóŋó yé, á leen ńké ńtúmo wɔ́b Mbetélehem, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ńcÿó nnɛ́ fa’a múɔ ŋwɛ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńtó shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gʉa yɔ́ɔn ńná mekù’ mé.
en: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have foundhim, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.

ngiemboon: Pàzsé nò nà mecÿɔ́’ saŋ jú’u nò gie fùɔ*Herôd gɔ̌ɔn, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńgíŋ ńzye légyá cÿɔ́’ saŋ gẅie pɔ́ la gyá lá’ pɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ mvfò ńgiŋe pɔ́ giŋe, ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie múɔ aa wó ńdeen ńtyé, à tè gíŋe ńŋele wɔ́.
en: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá pú’u, ḿbú ńkág tɛ’,
en: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

ngiemboon: ńzyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá, ńgyá múɔ pɔ́ má we Malîɛ, ńkẅí’te ssé, ńná mekù’ múɔ ḿbiŋ ńta’ pɔ̀ɔn sɔ́b, ńnéŋe shʉ̀ŋe múɔ nê ngɔ̂l pɔ́ làméndɔ́ɔnntí pʉ̀a.
en: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ńnéŋe tà né ḿbiŋe nzèm, e Ssé lɔg njÿòon shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńcʉa lejʉ́ŋ fùɔ*Herôd. Pɔ́ leen ńké ńcʉ́’ ḿpfó pɔ́ nzsè ndyɛ̀’ɛ tá ḿbiŋ né lá’ pɔ́b.
en: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ńgʉa, Yesyɛ̂b lyé njÿòon, ńgyá tsɔ̌*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ńkáa múɔ, pi lâ mápfò kÿo, ńgʉa lê tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto, ńnéŋe wó. Mèŋ, n ge gÿo shwóŋó gú fʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ ge piŋ nzèm. Á nue*Herôd ge fa’a múɔ wɛ̂ lézẅé yé.
en: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b lu ssé pɔ́ letsẅɛ́’, ńkaa múɔ, pâ mápfò gʉa lê tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto,
en: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:

ngiemboon: ńdá’ ńnéŋe wó tà fùɔ*Herôd kwé. Mɔɔn menò lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńdɔg ncwò Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ we ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n ge gÿo Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto ḿbiŋ nzèm»
en: and was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.

ngiemboon: *Herôd gwɔ́ tà ńgyá ngie pàzsé nò nà mecÿɔ́’ saŋ ka paba yé, ńgyáŋa lóŋ tɛ’, ńdeen ńtúm pʉ̀a ngie pɔ́ gʉa tÿǒsoŋo Mbetélehem tà mbɔɔ menkwɔ’ɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbú ńzẅéte penkʉ́ ntsèm pie e kǔ’ ngù’ pʉ́a mbɔɔ pie é nyé tè ku’ ngù’ pʉ́a, ńdɔgɔ ńdʉŋte pú’u, nà fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ ka shwóŋó yé ngie cÿɔ́’ saŋ la kẅɛ.
en: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ḿbumte nà nò gie Yeremi,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: Á pú tè né ńkwoŋo ngie mé tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mé wɔ́».
en: And would not be comforted, because they are not.

ngiemboon: *Herôd la gwɔ́ tà ńkwé, Yesyɛ̂b lyé njÿòon Egipto, ńgyá àtsɔ̌*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó,
en: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ńkáa múɔ, pi lâ mápfò piŋ nzèm lê tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Israel. Á nue pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kɔ́ɔn fa’a lézẅé múɔ kěen ńkwéte.
en: saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b lu ssé, ńkáa múɔ, pâ mápfò ne ḿbiŋe nzèm né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Israel,
en: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

ngiemboon: á jú’ ngie Arkélawẅis zɔ né sá’a pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, tà fó pá’ tá we*Herôd ka kwě, ńně ńcÿɔ’ɔ légʉa Jẅidea, ńdyé njÿòon, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a náa yé ntÿɔgɔ́. Á cʉ́’ ńgʉa pɔ́ lê tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea,
en: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judæa in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:

ngiemboon: ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńně ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, mé tóŋo lê Nǎzarɛd, á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná pá’ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn nò ná*Nzà’nkÿo ngie: «Mé ge lá’ tóŋo yé lê nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd».
en: and he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.

ngiemboon: Á zye ńnéŋe, Jâŋ Mbabtis kẅɛɛ nkwòŋo tsẅɛ Jẅidea, ńně sá’a ngie:
en: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judæa,

ngiemboon: Pi kúbe mà gẅi, á nue àfʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge nyɛ lefùɔ sé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: and saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsè mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ».
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ laa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ḿma’ nzsǒ, mbà mé la lɔg menoŋ kamel ḿbá’, ńdɔgɔ*ngùb nɔ̀ɔn ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌’ yé, àyé mmó léjÿó e gwɔ́ ngǐm ńgÿo nŋwá’ tsẅɛ.
en: And the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ně fóo Yerósalem, éfóo Jẅidea, mbɔɔ ná pàga ngwòŋ gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Jurdeŋ, ńtóo, ńgyá Jâŋ,
en: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judæa, and all the region round about Jordan,

ngiemboon: ńtyé mvfò mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńzẅíŋe meno tepoŋ mɔ́b, á nu’u wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: and were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gyá pá’ pʉ̀a ná nùɔ pà*farisay paa pʉ̀a ná nùɔ pà*sadukay tó yɔ́b tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pá’ à ge nu’u wɔ́b ntse, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: ngẅɛ̀ mennú, pàpá’ legye, àwɔ́ zɔ piŋ shwóŋó gẅi lékÿo ngɔ́’ gie pi lyɛbté tà é ne ńge gwe á ná pi.
en: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo pɔ́ menò mbòŋo mie e nyɛɛ ngie pi kubé mà.
en: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔg pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò gẅi ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg ee ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam. Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, e Ssé ku’u lésele metóon pɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam
en: and think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham toourfather: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

ngiemboon: Mé ně ńzɔɔn ndá’ ńkaa ńzɔɔn lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ yɛ̌ yɛ̌ tÿǒ wɔ́ gie á té zém ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́, éfó ssé kɔ́’ɔ yé, e ké ma’ pɔ́ mmɔ̌g
en: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gẅiin yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ lénu’u gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, lélɔg ńnyɛ ngie pi kubé mà. Tá nyìŋ gẅie aa nzèm mèŋ ńne ńtóo, ge tó yé néŋ pʉ̀a mbwó Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, é néŋ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g. À cʉa wɔ̀ɔn, tà mèŋ n tè ku’u lésẅɛ melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, andwithfire:

ngiemboon: À ge tó tyɛ́te shúm sie mé lagá nká’. E néŋ sé mbòŋo tsɛ̀ɛ nkìŋ. E cʉ́’ kʉ̀ŋe, à pÿɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g gẅie é té ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: whose fanisin his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké fó Galilea ńtóo ncwò ntse Jurdeŋ, ńgyá Jâŋ légwɔ́ gie Jâŋ ge nu’u yé ntse.
en: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ ně ńdʉ’ʉ, ńně ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Gù zɔ gẅiin lénu’u wɔ̀ɔn ntse, ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńtó ngie mèŋ n nu’u gú tsɛ̀ɛ ntse lá?
en: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Zẅíŋ ngie á gwɔ́ pú’u, fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mélà’mie pɔ́gɔ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, tá á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie e Ssé né ńzɛ́te. Jâŋ leen ńké ńzẅíŋ,
en: And Jesus answering said unto him,Sufferit to be sonow: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness.Then he suffered him.

ngiemboon: ńnu’u yé ntse. Yěsô gwɔ́ tá ńkẅɛ, ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé. Á gyá Zẅìge Ssé fó tÿǒ ésẅɛ́’ ńgwɔ́ pá’ kàpʉŋ la, ńtó ńnéŋe ná yé.
en: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:

ngiemboon: Ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Wɔɔn aa Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo yé tɛ’, aa wɔ̀ɔn lekág
en: and lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ssé fó jʉ’ó, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgee nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, pá’ Sátà ge kwa’te yé.
en: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.

ngiemboon: Á ńnéŋe wó lyɛ̌’ lá’ móm lekùɔ té pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà nzyè gyáŋa yé.
en: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.

ngiemboon: Sátà tó ńkwa’te yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé lá, leen ńké ńtsẅi né metóon pɛ̂ ngie é sele ńcʉ́’ʉ mmó léjÿó ɔ̀ jÿó.
en: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

ngiemboon: À lɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌ shwóŋó wɔ́ gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò Ssé».
en: But he answered and said,It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.

ngiemboon: Sátà lɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé nà ntsɔ́’ gie ee*jʉ’ʉ Ssé,
en: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé lá, kyɛ́ɛ ńtyé ssé, mélà’mie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Ssé ge shwóŋ mecÿɔ́’ pé pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo ná gù, pɔ́ ge lɔg mbwó mɔ́b kaa gú tà ɔ̀ le túu kwò jú ná tóon wɔ́».
en: Lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Mé la gíŋ ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «MÀbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ létsíŋe Cʉapʉa Ssé ye tsíŋe ngie à gÿo mmó ná yé»
en: Jesus said unto him,It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

ngiemboon: Sátà gíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé ndùm tsɔ̌ lekwɛ́ sie é gʉa taa tÿǒ, ńtyé wó, ńnyɛɛ yé mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó mbɔɔ mmó gie pɔ́ lɔgɔ fáŋa,
en: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkẅí’te mvfò mèŋ ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn, m bú ńná né gu.
en: and saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Sátà, fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ sẅɛ’te nnɛ́, mélà’mie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Nyìŋ gu’te pɔ́ ndà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gíle yé ḿbiŋ ńjú’ pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò wé».
en: Then saith Jesus unto him,Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńké ńnyé Yěsô.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tó, ne ńkẅéte yé.
en: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe Jâŋ ndá tsǎŋ, Yěsô gÿo ńjú’, ńgʉa lê Galilea,
en: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;

ngiemboon: ńkúu Nǎzarɛd ńcʉa cʉa ńgʉa ńnéŋe Kapernawúm. Á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ Galilea, á lá’ gie Zabuloŋ pɔ́ Neftali tÿɔ́’te yé ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: and leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, tá nò gie Esǎya*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn lɔg ḿbumte. À la gɔɔn ngie:
en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: pi pʉ̀a Galilea, pi pie pi lâ pʉ̀a pie e té Ssé zsé neŋé
en: Galilee of the Gentiles;

ngiemboon: ná pʉ̀a pie e ka neŋé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie ssé nzěm we legwé à kaa wó».
en: Light is sprung up.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ Kapernawúm pú’u, ńzye léshwóŋó nò Ssé, ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kúbe mà gẅi, á nue àfʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge nyɛ lefùɔ sé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte
en: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say,Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgiŋe ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ Galilea, ńgyá Símo gẅie mé gíŋ ńtóŋo yé ngie Piɛ, mbɔɔ Ndeléya gẅie aa fɛ́ Símo ŋwɛ́. Pɔ́ ne ma’a lekÿò ntse.
en: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó, ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, n dɔgɔ gẅi ńgÿo pàfà’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And he saith unto them,Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé menkÿò ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And they straightway lefttheirnets, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Mé ná’a ńzye ńgiŋ, Yěsô gyá Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, é gwɔ́ gubé Zebede, pâ tá wɔb pú ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńne ńnyɛte menkÿò mɔ́b, á tóŋo wɔ́b.
en: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, Jamesthe sonof Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé kanú’ mbɔɔ tá wɔb ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgwá ńgiŋe jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ Galilea, ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, ésá’a nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é shwóŋó pʉ̀a pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ee pú’u, ńně ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí guɔ wɔ́ ka yɛ̌ ntí*lɔ̌’ wɔ́, zeŋe
en: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, mé lɔg lezíŋ sé ésa ngwòŋ Siria ntsèm. Mé ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a metsèm pie meguɔ ntí ntí laa ná pɔ́b, é pʉ̀a pie*messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b, mbɔɔ pàgwe gwá’, lâ megàŋa kwʉ́’te ńtóo, Yěsô gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ menùɔ menùɔ fô Galilea, éfô tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ legém, éfô Yerósalem, éfô Jẅidea tà mbɔɔ ná yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, andfromDecapolis, andfromJerusalem, andfromJudæa, andfrombeyond Jordan.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ menùɔ lá’ tǒ, ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńnéŋe ssé,*ngàŋa kwò yé tó ńkẅɛ́te yé.
en: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:

ngiemboon: Á zye léla’te nò mbwó pɔ́b ngie:
en: and he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Blessedarethe poor in spirit: for their's is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie Ssé ge gÿo tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b
en: Blessedarethey that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó ngwòŋ».
en: Blessedarethe meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie Ssé ge gÿo pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ mmó».
en: Blessedarethey which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie e Ssé ge gÿo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b yɔ́b».
en: Blessedarethe merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo gyá Ssé».
en: Blessedarethe pure in heart: for they shall see God.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie mé ge lá’ tóŋo wɔ́b lê púɔ Ssé».
en: Blessedarethe peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé».
en: Blessedarethey which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for their's is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: «Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo ná fʉ̀’ gie mé ge ne zoonte gẅí, é ne kʉ́e gẅí, é tÿɔ́gɔ sóon ntí ntí twó pi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn».
en: Blessed are ye, whenmenshall revile you, and persecuteyou, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

ngiemboon: Pi kág ńzɔb ńzíŋ, mélà’mie e Ssé nyɛté máa máa ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ né ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te gẅí. Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’, mé la gÿo nà pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pie é la vɔg ńtó tá pi tó.
en: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for greatisyour reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔ ngwáŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. Ngwáŋ ee pé’e ńgwɔ́ gie é lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńdebe lebe, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo lêkɔ́ tá é gíŋe ńdʉm? É té gíŋe ńku’u nà tsɔ̌ nò wɔ́, mé cʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ lepÿɛɛ pǐ, mé lɔg mekwò ńneŋte.
en: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔ kyɛ̀’ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. Mé lɔɔn ńkwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le lyeen.
en: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

ngiemboon: Mé ké tè piŋ ńdyɛɛ lâm, ńdɔg ngwʉ̌ŋ ńkábte wɔ́. Mé lyɛɛ lâm, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ ndùm tápelè, á kyɛ’ pʉ̀a metsèm pie ée ndá.
en: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

ngiemboon: Aa yɛ̌ tá á poŋ ngie pi kyɛ’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tá pɔ́ gyá nò mbòŋo gie pi ne ńgÿo, ńdeen ńké ńgu’te Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie mèŋ n ka tǒ lépyág*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ka pɔ́ nò gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn wɔ́. Ngǎŋ, n ka tè tóo lépyág wɔ́, mèŋ n ka tǒ pɔ́ légÿo mé cwoŋo ńjú’.
en: Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, lefàŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge lá’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mùɔ mélǎga nò lê pilé, múɔ mémmó lê pilé le nà*lepʉ̌ pyé. À ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, tà ńkú fʉ̀’ gie àkɔ̌kɔ gie*lepʉ̌ gɔɔn à pumté.
en: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ gẅie à gʉ̌a nà mbʉ̌, éfó fʉa pɔ́ tsɔ̌ mùɔ métsẅǐ ḿbiŋ ńzí’i tsɔ́ pʉ̀a légÿo yɔ́b pá’ yé, mé ge lá’ náa yé tàa nzèm tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé. À piŋ ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à tÿɔgɔ́ kwó mǒ, ḿbiŋ ńzí’i petsɔ́ pʉ̀a légÿo pú’u, mé lá’ ńnáa yé tàa mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teachthem, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: !Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi lɔɔn té kú’te*lepʉ̌ mbòŋo ńtɔ́g*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pà*farisay wɔ́, mbà pi tě ńdá’a ńkúu ná nò*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́.
en: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceedthe righteousnessof the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn mbwó pàmangʉa njʉ̀’ pégè ngie: «Tà nyìŋ lá’ ńzẅé nyìŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅé nyìŋ, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ yé gʉa mvfò ntsɔ́’te mentsaŋ».
en: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn yɔ́ɔn né pi ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgyáŋa lóŋ nà fɛ́ we, mé gẅiin lélɔgɔ yé ńgʉa mvfò ntsɔ́’te mentsaŋ. Nyìŋ gẅie à toŋó fɛ́ we lê gʉ̀gʉ̀, mé gẅiin lélɔgɔ yé gẅie à tǒŋ ńgʉa mvfò cú’tè pàsá’a lá’. Nyìŋ gẅie à toŋó fɛ́ we lê tè zsé Ssé, à ku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ Ssé ma’a yé mmɔ̌g.
en: but I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔg shúm pwɔ́’ sé ńtóo jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó lénáa mbwo Ssé, ńkímte ngie à ka fʉa nò mbwó fɛ́ we,
en: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;

ngiemboon: àngàŋ nyé shúm pwɔ́’ sé, ńzɔɔn ńgʉa ńgyá fɛ́ we pɔ́ yé maga yɛ̌ nò, tá á leen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm ńná shúm pwɔ́’ sé á mbwó Ssé.
en: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkʉ́a nyìŋ njǔ, pɔ́ yé nyé mánzsè ne ńgee jʉ’e ntsaŋ, á fa’ shÿó pɔ́ yé mag ntsaŋ, tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà à ge kúu mbwó tándá pà zá’ ntsaŋ, à náa ngàŋ mbwó pàpyɛ́b ndá tsǎŋ, pɔ́ gʉa ḿma’a yé tsǎŋ.
en: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àngàŋ ge lá’ gwɔ kẅɛɛ tsǎŋ, é pú toŋo kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie mé ne ńkʉ́a mbwo yé tà tsɔ́ le pyé.
en: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Tà nyìŋ lá’ ńgÿo gÿɛ́».
en: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

ngiemboon: !Tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdíe manzwě ńtsɔ́ɔn á zsé ngie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé mámbàŋa, mbà à ně ńdá’ ńgÿo gÿɛ́.
en: but I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

ngiemboon: Lejÿɔ́g shú sé pwó tʉ̀ lɔɔn ńtsóte gú ɔ̀ fʉa nò, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ ńgwá’a taa taa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a. Mvfò ee pá’ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná mekèm mbùm mú pyé, mé piŋ ńké le lá’ ḿma’a gú tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g wɔ́.
en: And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and castitfrom thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and notthatthy whole body should be cast into hell.

ngiemboon: Àpwó jú ye tʉ̀ lɔɔn ńtsóte gú ɔ̀ fʉa nò, ɔ̀ zá’ ńgwá’a taa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a. Mvfò ee pá’ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná mekèm mbùm mú pyé, mé piŋ ńké le lá’ ḿma’a gú tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g wɔ́.
en: And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and castitfrom thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and notthatthy whole body should be cast into hell.

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgee ńjwoŋ nzwě we, á náa ŋwà’ne lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

ngiemboon: !Tá’ mèŋ, n gɔɔn né pi ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo nzwě we, té gwɔ́ gie manzwě gÿǒ gÿɛ́, mbà a tsoté yé légÿo gÿɛ́ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgʉa ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ. Nyìŋ piŋ ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě gẅie ndǔm we jwoŋó yé, mbà à gÿǒ gÿɛ́».
en: but I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.

ngiemboon: Pi la gíŋ ńjú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn mbwó pàmangʉa njʉ̀’ pégè ngie: «Nyìŋ lá’ ńgɔɔn nò tà ńdɔg lezíŋ Ssé ńkʉa, àngàŋ gÿo yɛ̌ nò».
en: Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:

ngiemboon: !Tá’, mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Tà pi gɔɔn nò tà ńdɔg lezíŋ Ssé ńkʉa. Tà pi lɔgɔ tÿǒ lepwó ńkʉa, á nue aa jʉ’ gie e Ssé ńnéŋe wó
en: but I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God's throne:

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔgɔ tsetsá’ ńkʉa, á nue ee ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwó Ssé. Tà pi lɔgɔ Yerósalem ńkʉa, á nue aa tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ we lÿò
en: nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.

ngiemboon: Tè ké ńdɔgɔ twó jú ńkʉa nò, á nue ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ légÿo tà’ nnoŋo twó jù fɔ́g wɔ́, é ke légÿo é síŋ wɔ́.
en: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

ngiemboon: Oon gẅi gwɔ́ pɔ́ oon, ngǎŋ gẅi gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngǎŋ, àgie mé kẅi’i mǒ fóo mbwó Sátà.
en: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ pyág lejÿɔ́g nyìŋ, àngàŋ pyág sé, nyìŋ tsɔ́’ lesoŋ nyìŋ, àngàŋ tsɔ́’ sé».
en: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

ngiemboon: !Tá’ mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Tà pi tsɔ́’ɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie à gÿǒ nò tepòŋ ná pi ńnáa yetsɔ́. Nyìŋ cúɔ pwó letuŋó nyìŋ, á sele yetsɔ́ gwǒŋ á mege ńcúɔ.
en: but I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ fa’a lésẅiŋe nyìŋ jʉ’e ntsaŋ, pá’ à ge gwoon nzsǒ ngàŋ yé ma’ e kẅé, àngàŋ pú ńnyé wɔ́b yé fÿɔ́g né yé.
en: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him havethycloke also.

ngiemboon: Mékéle lɔg tʉ̀ sẅɛ́ɛ nyìŋ ngie à kaa pì’ yé, ńdɔg ńgiŋe mmó tà’ kilometà lê gwǒŋ, á lɔg ńgiŋe nà mmó mekilometà méntá.
en: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ náa mmó mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńdúɔ mmó mbwó yé. Tà nyìŋ ké ńtém nzèm nyìŋ gẅie à zɛté ngie à fuu yé mmó.
en: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ kwoŋo fɛ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ, ḿbʉa ngàŋ mbù we».
en: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

ngiemboon: !Tá’, mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi kwoŋ megàŋ mbù pi. [Pi sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’].
en: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pi ge gwɔ́ kwà’ púɔ Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó. À gÿo nèm we tʉ́a ná pʉ̀a tèpòŋ mbɔɔ nà pʉ̀a membòŋo, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mbʉ̀ŋ luu ná pʉ̀a pie é kú’te*lepʉ̌ sé mbɔɔ pie é té kú’te.
en: that ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋ pɔ́ ndá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwoŋo gẅí, mbà mé ge gíŋe ná ndǎg né pi ná kɔ́?*Pàkẅé ncùb pà Roma gíŋe ne ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtsyɛ’te pɔ́ ndà’ mefɛ́ pí, mbà pi gÿǒ kɔ́ yé sẅé? Pàte zsé Ssé gíŋe ne ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye morethan others? do not even the publicans so?

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, pi gwɔ́ pàtè*lɔ̌’, pá’ Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó aa tè*lɔ̌’
en: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńge ńgÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te, pi laga twó gí létóŋo lá’ tá ńgÿo, á nà ntí gie mé ge ne líe gẅí. Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó tè gÿo tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ gí wɔ́.
en: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgee ńná nkáb mbwó pàte mmó, tè gÿo pé pá’ mé ge tyé ne gyá. Megàŋa ŋá’te nnɛ́ zɔ̌ gÿo pú’u. Pɔ́ kúu*ndá cú’tè, ńtyé mbɔɔ metwó nzsè tá ńnáa mmó, pú’u, ngie pʉ̀a gɔ’te wɔ́b. Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pɔ́ ně ńda’ ńkẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ wɔ́b.
en: Therefore when thou doestthinealms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná gu, mbà ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńge ńná nkáb mbwó pàte mmó, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà mbòŋ shǔ gù zsé.
en: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, ámmó gie ɔ̀ náa, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntsèm, Tá gù Ssé gẅie à gyá mmó gie mé náa tsɛ̀ɛ ntsèm, à gÿo ńtsɔ́’ɔ fà’a jú.
en: that thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne sẅíŋte Ssé, tà pi gÿo pá’ pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pɔ́ kwoŋo létyé tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè mbɔɔ metwó nzsè tá sẅíŋte Ssé, pá’ pʉ̀a metsèm ge gyá wɔ́b. Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pɔ́ ně ńda’ ńkẅé ńtsɔ́’ɔ fà’ wɔ́b.
en: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocritesare: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńge sẅíŋte Ssé, ɔ́ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ lúm ndá, ńkábte ncwò ndá, ńnéŋe lelyěen tá sẅíŋte Tá gù gẅie aa jʉ’e lelyěen. Yé gẅie à gyá mmó gie ɔ̀ gÿo jʉ’ʉ lelyěen, à ge gÿo tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ jú.
en: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne sẅíŋte Ssé, tà pi gɔɔn nò té zá’a pàa pá’ pʉ̀a pie é té Ssé zsé, pɔ́ kwaŋ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge gɔɔn nò tɛ’ tá Ssé jú’.
en: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathendo: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

ngiemboon: Tà pi fʉ̀’ʉ wɔ́b, á nue Tá gẅi à ne ńzsé mmó gie á ne ńzága mbwó pi, tà pi gwaa lúɔ á ne ńzsé.
en: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

ngiemboon: Gÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ zsé ngie ee ndà’ gú ńgwɔ́ Ssé.
en: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

ngiemboon: Gÿo mé ne ńjú’u ncwò gú ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, pá’ mé ne jú’u tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, asit isin heaven.

ngiemboon: Náa yég mmó léjÿó gie á ge ku’u ná peg nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn,
en: Give us this day our daily bread.

ngiemboon: lege mefʉa még, ńná né peg, pá’ peg ne ńdege yég ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fʉ̌a nò mbwó peg la.
en: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

ngiemboon: Tè zẅíŋ ngie peg kúu tsɛ̀ɛ nkwà’te, kẅé wég mbwó Sátà. [Á nue gù zɔɔ fùɔ, metʉ̀ ntsèm piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mú, mé ne ńgu’te pɔ́ ndà’ gú mengù’u mengù’. Ameŋ].
en: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńdege mefʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, tá mbà Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó ge gÿo lege mí gí.
en: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi lɔɔn ńké tè lege mefʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà Tá gẅi těen nge gÿo lege mí gí wɔ́
en: but if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè lésẅíŋte Ssé, tà pi sẅé’e shÿó gẅi pá’ pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g. Pɔ́ sẅé’e shÿó wɔ́b, ńdɔg ńnyɛ ngie pɔ́ ne ńnéŋe nzyè lésẅíŋte Ssé. Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pɔ́ ně ńdá’ ńgẅiin ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ wɔ́b.
en: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńnéŋe nzyè lésẅíŋte Ssé, ɔ̀ sɔg shÿó gú, ésyɛbɛ twó jú.
en: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ le zsé ngie ɔ̀ ne ńnéŋe nzyè lésẅíŋte Ssé wɔ́. Tá gù gíle yé gẅie mé té gyá yé wɔ́ zɔ zsé. Yé gẅie à ne ńgyá mmó gie ɔ̀ gÿo lelyěen ge gÿo tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ jú.
en: that thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

ngiemboon: Tà pi cú’te shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ sí ndùmo tsetsá’. Á jʉ’ gie àsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ vɛkɔ́ɔn ge pfɛ́ ntsèm, ńké tè pú’u wɔ́, metsǒŋ pwɔ́’ ndá, ńkáa.
en: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

ngiemboon: Pi cú’te shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ sí pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, áa jʉ’ó àsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ vɛkɔ́ɔn té mmó cʉŋte. Metsǒŋ piŋ ńké tè ku’u lépwɔ́’ ndá ńkaa mmó wɔ́.
en: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

ngiemboon: Á nue eshúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ shú lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà ntʉ́m gú ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mú ee mbwó gù ńgwɔ́ pá’ lâm gẅie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgyá jʉ’, menÿɔ́g mú lɔɔn tè síŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá jʉ’ mboŋó.
en: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

ngiemboon: Tá menÿɔ́g mú piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà síŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm. Nÿɔ́g mú gwɔ́ tà síŋ pá’ mé gɔɔn lɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mwòon nzém.
en: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how greatisthat darkness!

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nkwɔɔn lé jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a mépʉ́a tà’ legʉ̀a wɔ́. À ge jú’ ncwò tá we, e lʉ’ʉ lé jú’ ncwò nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ. À ge kwoŋo tà’ nyìŋ, é pʉa wetsɔ̌. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńgíŋe ne ńzába nà nkáb wɔ́.
en: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔgɔ shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Tà pi ńnéŋe ḿbú’u mbùm gí ngie peg ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́, peg ge lɔg ntse nzɔ̌ é núu? Peg ge lɔg nzsǒ nzɔ̌ ma’a? Gẅi le gwɔ́ wó tè cʉa shúm léjÿó wɔ̂? Mbùm nyìŋ piŋ tè gwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa menzsǒ wɔ́?
en: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

ngiemboon: Pi líe meshʉ́ŋ tá ńgyá, pɔ́ ee ntě ḿbye mmó wɔ́, ńké tě ńdaga shúm ńnáa ndá wɔ́, pɔ́ té ntaŋ gẅiin, e Ssé gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ jÿɔ̀gɔ wɔ́b. Pi ee mbwó Ssé ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa meshʉ́ŋ.
en: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

ngiemboon: Àwɔ̌ aa ná pi gẅie ńgwɔ́ á seen ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ à pǔ’ mbùm ye, ńku’u lékẅi’i tà’a lyɛ̌’ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mé?
en: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

ngiemboon: Tà pi pú’u mbùm gí nà nò menzsǒ mélà’a kɔ́? Pi líe metôtǒ mie ee nà legǐ nká’ ńgyá. Legǐ aa ntě fa’a fà’ wɔ́, ńké tě ḿbá’a menzsǒ wɔ́.
en: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, legǐ à ma’ nzsǒ tà mbà fùɔ Salomo la lá’ ńgwɔ́ nà we legú’ ntsèm ntsèm, à tè lá’ ḿma’ nzsǒ tà é pòŋ pá’ yɔ̀b wɔ́
en: and yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

ngiemboon: Tà Ssé lɔɔn ḿma’ nzsǒ mbòŋo á nà legǐ gẅie à zɔ́gɔ nká’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, njÿó lʉ́a mé kɔ́’ ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g, mbà á ge kúu ná pi tá à zág nzsǒ lá? Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: Pi té záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven,shall henot much moreclotheyou, O ye of little faith?

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ḿbú’ mbùm gi, ńgɔɔn ngie mé ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́? Mé ge lɔg ntse nzɔ̌ é núu? Mé ge lɔg nzsǒ nzɔ̌ é ma’a?
en: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

ngiemboon: Pàte zsé Ssé zɔ̌ ńnéŋe ńgẅiin yɛ̌ ntí nkwaŋá. Á gʉa ná pi, mbà Tá gẅi Ssé zsé shúm sie é ge kẅéte gẅí.
en: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

ngiemboon: Pi vɔg mvfò fa’ pɔ́ nò*lefùɔ Ssé, lâ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, à leen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnáa sɛ̌ shúm ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pi pú’ mbùm gi ná nò lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ jǔɔ. Àlyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ jǔɔ, a ge gÿo tó lâ mé menò. Yɛ̌ ngɔ́’ wɔ́ ku’u nà yé lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.
en: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the dayisthe evil thereof.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ńnéŋe ńtúu*melɔ̌’ pʉ̀a, ḿbɔ́g Ssé létúu gí*lɔ̌’.
en: Judge not, that ye be not judged.

ngiemboon: Á ge fó pɔ́ nà ntí gie pi lɔgɔ ńtúu*lɔ̌’ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, tá Ssé túu*lɔ̌’ɔ gí gí. Pi zsé ngie: E Ssé ge táa ńnéŋe pɔ̀ɔn gí pɔ́ pá’ pi zɔɔn ńnéŋe yé petsɔ́ pʉ̀a
en: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ɔ̀ ne ńgyá mùɔ méfùbe pǐŋ gie e gwě lejÿɔ́g fɛ́ gù, tá kúme núŋe lejÿɔ́g gù, ɔ̀ piŋ ńké tè ne ńgyà wɔ́?
en: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ gÿo lêkɔ́, tá ńgɔɔn né fɛ́ gù ngie: Àfɛ́, cʉ́’ mèŋ n kẅile fùbe pǐŋ yɛ̂ gie ee lejÿɔ́g gù lɛ̂, ńgwáa gɔɔn, éfó le ne ńgyá kúmo gẅie á nuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ shú wɔ́?
en: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beamisin thine own eye?

ngiemboon: Ànkwoŋ menÿɔ́g! Vɔg ńkẅile kúmo gẅie aa lejÿɔ́g gù, tà ne ńcwoŋo ńgyá jʉ’ tá ńku’u lékẅile fùbe pǐŋ á tsɛ̀ɛ lejÿɔ́g fɛ́ gù.
en: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.

ngiemboon: Tà pi náa mmó gie aa yé Ssé, á mbwó ngwé. Tà pi ma’a tɔgɔ́ tsye gí á mvfò mekúnɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ ge neŋte nê mekwó é piŋ sele nnɛ́ lúmte gẅí.
en: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.

ngiemboon: Pi lúɔ, e Ssé ge náa mbwó pi. Pi fa’, e Ssé ge gÿo pi gyá. Pi kwá’te ncwò ndá, à ge tsɔ́’ ńná né pi.
en: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lúɔ mmó, mbà mé ge náa mbwó yé, éfa’, mbà à ge gyá, ḿbiŋ ńkwá’te ncwò ndá, mbà mé ge tsɔ́’ e ná né yé.
en: for every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ metá penkʉ́, míŋ wɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔɔn ńdúɔ mbelég, mbà à ge náa tóon né yé?
en: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

ngiemboon: Míŋ wɔ̌ lúɔ mbab ssó, mbà à ge gwoon nnú ńnáa mbwó yé?
en: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi fʉ̀’ nò tɛ’ zsé léna shúm mbòŋo á mbwó gubé gí, tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ ná Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó? À ge ná shúm mbòŋo mbwó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lǔɔ mbwó yé.
en: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?

ngiemboon: Àmmó gie pi ne ńtsɔɔn ngie mé gÿo ná pi la, pi gÿo kwà’ yɛ̌ gí ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà á ge gwɔ́ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mbɔɔ meŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé zɛ́te
en: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ʉ léfa’a mánzsè tÿǒ lepwó, ḿpfó pɔ́ nà ncwò nká’ gẅie é kʉ́mte kʉmtě. Ncwò nká’ gẅie é gú’ tɛ’, é gee pɔ́ né lá’ legwé. Mánzsè gẅie à gee lá’ legwé gú’ tɛ’, lelÿò pʉ̀a né ḿpfó pɔ́ wɛ̌.
en: Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wideisthe gate, and broadisthe way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:

ngiemboon: Tá ncwò nká’ gẅie é gee lá’ letsẅɛ́ temi, kʉ́mte kʉmtě. Mánzsè piŋ ńtege tege, pà pfó wɛ̌ té gyɔ́ɔn.
en: because straitisthe gate, and narrowisthe way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí nà pʉ̀a pie é cÿɔɔ nò ngie pɔ́ ee pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé. Pɔ́ gwaa tóo lejʉ́ŋ pi ḿma’*ngùb*njʉ̀njÿò tá nkwaŋá wɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ we menɔ́ɔn ngẅi.
en: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

ngiemboon: Pi ge zsé wɔ́b nà ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b. Mé e ntě ńkába shʉ́shÿó na tÿǒ shʉ́shÿó nè wɔ́, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le káb lepfo á nà tÿǒ lengɔ́ɔn wɔ́.
en: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

ngiemboon: Tÿǒ mbòŋo zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo, tá tÿǒ tepòŋ zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn tepòŋ,
en: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ mbòŋo le zém ntɔ̌ɔn tepòŋ wɔ́, àtÿǒ tepòŋ ké le zém ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́.
en: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neithercana corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

ngiemboon: Àtÿǒ gie á té zém ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́, mé kɔ́’ ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g.
en: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi ge gÿo gwaa zsé pʉ̀a pie é cÿɔɔ nò ngie pɔ̀ ee pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, é cʉa pɔ́ ná mà wɔ́b
en: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie é tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pɔ́ metsèm zɔ̌ té lá’ jÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́. Ndà’ pʉ̀a pie é gÿo mmó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé gÿo.
en: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mèŋ n ge ńtsɔ́’te mentsaŋ, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Peg lɔ̌ɔn ntě ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ lezíŋ shú éshwóŋó nò Ssé gwaa? Peg lɔ̌ɔn ntě ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ lezíŋ shú ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ gwaa? Peg lɔ̌ɔn ntě ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ lezíŋ shú ńgÿo ndaa gyá nò gwaa?
en: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ tè gẅi zsé, pi ee pàfʉate menò, pi fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́
en: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńzẅí’te shwóŋò yɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te, mbà ngàŋ gwá’a tsɔ̌ nzsè nòwá gẅie, à la cʉ́’ʉ lékwɛ́ ndá yé, ńtúŋo jʉ’ tà ńgyá máa tóon, ńtÿɔ́g ndá ndùm wɔ́.
en: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:

ngiemboon: Mbʉ̀ŋ gÿo ńdú, ngʉa ntse tó, fefà cʉ’ʉ, ńtéme nà ndá. Ndá tè gwe, mélà’mie mé la tÿɔ́g ndá ná tóon.
en: and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à ju’ú shwóŋò yɔ́ɔn, à tè gÿo pá’ n gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ gwá’a gʉ̀gʉ̀ nyìŋ gẅie à la kwɛ́ ndá yé té túŋo cÿó.
en: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:

ngiemboon: Mbʉ̀ŋ gÿo ńdú, tsìtsyɛ̀ tó, fefà cʉ’ʉ ńtéme nà ndá ayɛ̌, é keme ḿbʉle ssé.
en: and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zí’i pʉ̀a mɔ̀ɔn menò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, àlá’ pú mɔ̂ɔn ye ntí lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó,
en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à lɔ̌ɔn ntě ńgÿo pá’*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê wɔ́. À lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i tà ńzsé mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌.
en: For he taught them asonehaving authority, and not as the scribes.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ, ńgwaa fó ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sẅɛ́’, menùɔ lá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ ngàŋ nkà’ páb tó ńkẅí’te mvfò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mèŋ n zsě ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ku’u légÿo mèŋ n zeŋe.
en: And, behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńtsege pwó ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋe, nkà’ gwóon ḿmaga ná yé, á gwóon ńzeŋe.
en: And Jesus put forthhishand, and touched him, saying,I will; be thou clean.And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pɔ́ɔn lé ké ńkím tà nyìŋ jú’, tá’ ké ńgʉa ńnyɛ mbùm ɔ̀, á mbwó nùŋe pwɔ́’, ḿbiŋ ńnáa mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te mbwó nyìŋ gẅie nkà’ é magá ná yé, epʉ̀a metsèm lêen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ zeŋě.
en: And Jesus saith unto him,See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Kapernawúm, àtsɔ̌ tándá ncù pà*Roma zá’a yé, ésẅíŋte yé,
en: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mênkʉ́ wɔ̀ɔn nuŋe ndá, mbà kwʉ́’te gwǒon yé, à ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’.
en: and saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge gʉa gÿo à zeŋe.
en: And Jesus saith unto him,I will come and heal him.

ngiemboon: Tá tándá ncù tsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ n tsẅíle nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ tɔ́g tà ńkúu ndá mèŋ. Tyé pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ ńtsẅi lê ncwò gú mênkʉ́ wɔ̀ɔn zeŋe.
en: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn nzèm nyìŋ, ńjú’u ncwò wé, ńgíŋ ńgẅiin yɔ́ɔn pà lÿɔ́’ ncù nzèm mèŋ, pɔ́ ne ńjú’u wɔ̀ɔn. N dɔɔn ńgɔɔn né tsɔ̌ ngie gʉa, á gʉa, ńgɔɔn né tsɔ̌ ngie, too, á to, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né nkwɔɔn yɔ̀ɔn ngie gÿo pá’ɔɔn, á gÿo.
en: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to thisman, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doethit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’u yɔ̀ɔn shwóŋò gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò tándá ncù ńgɔ’te yé, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ gie aa nzèm yé ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Israel, mèŋ n kaa gyá tsɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ pá’ yé wɔ́.
en: When Jesus heardit, he marvelled, and said to them that followed,Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge zɔɔn gíŋe shwóŋó gẅie ngie: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge lá’ fó meshÿó meshÿó ndùmo tsetsá’, é tó kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ tÿǒ lepwó, pâ Ábalam, lê Esâg, mbɔɔ Yakwɔ́b temte ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn
en: And I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Megʉ̀ gwaa gwɔ́ wó, mbà mé kẅilé púɔ ntɔ́’ ńnáa pǐ tsɛ̀ɛ mwòon nzém. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó ne ńdʉate, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó
en: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó tándá ncù ngie: Piŋ nê mbʉ̀a gù! Pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ lá, àmmó gie ɔ̀ tsɔ̌ɔn ge gwɔ́ pú’u, ńgɔɔn pú’u, mênkʉ́ tándá ncù leen ńzeŋe pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó.
en: And Jesus said unto the centurion,Go thy way; and as thou hast believed,sobe it done unto thee.And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa ndá piɛ, ńkúu wó ńgyá màkẅi’ Piɛ nuŋe, nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ yé.
en: And when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kíbe pwó yé, nnɛ́ zá’a. Á nyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye yé.
en: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.

ngiemboon: Ncwò nzém gÿo ńgwɔ́, mé lɔg pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie*messé tepòŋ ne ńgege wɔ́b ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, á gɔɔn nò tà’ legʉa*messé tepòŋ fó ná pʉ̀a ńkẅɛ, megàŋa gûɔ pú ńzeŋe.
en: When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits withhisword, and healed all that were sick:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ḿbumte ná nò gie à*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya la gɔɔn ngie: «Yé zɔ la kaa*melɔ̌’ mégè ḿbi’, ńgíŋe fó nà pège ńkẅile meguɔ mégè ḿbi’».
en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bareoursicknesses.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ lá’ cú’te lejʉ́ŋ yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtsẅi mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pâ pɔ́ túm né yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ ntse.
en: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: tsítsà, ɔ̀ ge gʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mèŋ n ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm gù.
en: And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Meshʉ̀shʉ̀ gẅiin membÿé, meshʉ́ŋ piŋ ńgẅiin menkʉ̀a mɔ́b. Tá*Míŋ Nyìŋ tè gẅiin jʉ’ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á zẅɛte wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus saith unto him,The foxes have holes, and the birds of the airhavenests; but the Son of man hath not where to layhishead.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie ee nzèm yé gɔɔn né yé ngie: Àndè cʉ́’ mèŋ n zɔɔn ńgʉa ńtúŋo tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Cʉ́m pɔ́ nzèm mèŋ, ńnyé mepfó pɔ́ túŋ mepfó pɔ́b.
en: But Jesus said unto him,Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’,*ngàŋa kwò yé kú yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ wó,
en: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.

ngiemboon: ńně ńgee, tsɔ̌ máamáa fóm gwe ndùm ntse, ńzye lécʉ’ ńkaa ntse kaa tà é cʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ lékábte kanú’. Á gwaa gwɔ́ Yěsô ne ńdyé.
en: And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńzyeen yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kẅé wég mbwó legwé. Pège kwě tà ńdem.
en: And his disciples came tohim, and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi pɔ́gɔ kɔ́? Pi tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́! Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdu ssé, ńcÿɔ́gɔ fóm pɔ́ ntse. Ejʉ’ láŋte lê kěm.
en: And he saith unto them,Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith?Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ métsèm pú ḿmɔɔn, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Yɔ̀ɔn ee yɛ̌ ntí nyìŋ tà mbɔɔ fóm pɔ́ ntse jú’u ncwò wé?
en: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ. É gwɔ́ ngwòŋ pà Garazania, etsɔ̌ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a pie*messé tepòŋ leen ńkúu ná pɔ́b fó jʉ’e mé túŋo pʉ̀a wó ńkẅɛ ńzá’a yé, mbà pɔ́ leen fʉ̀’ nò fʉ̀’ tà nyìŋ tè gíŋe ḿpfó wɛ̌ shÿó wɔ́.
en: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ga’te ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ fa’a légÿo lêkɔ́ ná peg, Míŋ Ssé? Ɔ̀ ka tóo jʉ’ɔɔn pɔ́ létʉ́ njÿó ńnéŋe wég tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ ka?
en: And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ àtsɔ́ nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ó ńne ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm.
en: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo wég, ɔ̀ zẅíŋ peg gʉa ńkúu nà nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn pi.
en: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lò. Pɔ́ leen ńké fó nà pʉ̀a pá ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ńkúu nà mekúnɔ́ɔn. Mé gwaa gyá, ànùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn pá fóo kenkʉ́ŋe, ńtága, ńzẅɛ ḿbʉle tsɛ̀ɛ letʉŋ, ńnú ntse ńkwéte.
en: And he said unto them,Go.And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ké ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mekúnɔ́ɔn gyá pú’u, ńtága ńkÿote, ńgʉa tÿǒsoŋ ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́ gie á cʉ̌a, tà mbɔɔ ye pʉ̀a pie*messé tepòŋ kěen ná pɔ́b la.
en: And they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ jú’, éfó tÿǒsoŋ ḿbú ńkẅɛ, ńtóo légyá Yěsô, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à fó lá’ pɔ́b ńgʉa.
en: And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besoughthimthat he would depart out of their coasts.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńtúm ntse ḿbiŋ né tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b,
en: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ńtó, á nuŋe ná páŋte. Yěsô gyá ntí gie, mbàŋa gie é lɔgɔ́ yé ńtó, lɔg ńzab ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn ɔ́ɔ shÿó mbòŋo! Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwó gù.
en: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy;Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńjú’, ńne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ wɔ̀ɔn kaŋá lʉŋe Ssé mboo!
en: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, Thismanblasphemeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gÿo lêkɔ́ ńgẅiin yɛ̀ ntí mekwaŋá tepòŋ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí?
en: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said,Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ ngie á zeŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie: Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú, ka pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie lu ssé ńgiŋ?
en: For whether is easier, to say,Thysins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge ké nyɛɛ gẅi ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ aa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà mé la ná metʉ̀ né yé lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kẅʉ́’te ngie: Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù, ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a gù.
en: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins,(then saith he to the sick of the palsy,)Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ lu ssé, ńgʉa nê mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And he arose, and departed to his house.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ gyá yɔ̀ɔn nò á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ ne ńgu’te Ssé ná pá’ à nǎ yɔ̀ɔn ntí metʉ̀ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: But when the multitudes sawit, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ńgwaa cʉa jʉ’ gie mé kẅé ncùb pà*Roma wó, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńnéŋe, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Matio. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tóo pɔ́gɔ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe. Á lu ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him,Follow me.And he arose, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndá Matio ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, petsɔ́ pà kẅé ncùb pà*Roma tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, lâ tsɔ́ ngàŋa tsẅé tepòŋ, tó ńkẅɛ́te Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé, pâ pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay gyá pú’u, ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ tá gẅi pâ pà kẅé ncùb pà*Roma lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ teme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ?
en: And when the Pharisees sawit, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pá’ pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, ésaga mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ńtentʉ́, ńgʉa fa’a ngÿo meffo wɔ́, nyìŋ guɔ tá fa’a yé.
en: But when Jesus heardthat, he said unto them,They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n ne ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi gʉa nzí’i mmó gie yɔ̀ɔn nò gie mé la ŋwe’e lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn: «Mèŋ n kwoŋo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, ńcʉa pwɔ́’ gẅie mé lɔgɔ ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn». Yɔ̀ɔn aa mmó gie á gÿo, mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: N ka te tó letóŋ pʉ̀a membóŋo wɔ́, mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńtóo ntí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉa ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwó Ssé.
en: But go ye and learn whatthatmeaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Jâŋ gÿo ńtó, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Peg lâ pà*farisay neŋé ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, epú ké tè pú’u, gÿo mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gʉa leluŋó nyìŋ, á nyé ńnéŋe ńnéŋe meshǔ pie mé ně ńtóŋ ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔg mélà’a kɔ́? Tá’ mé ge lá’ fó mbwó pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sa’a yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉ̀’ó la.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ság ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ sẅé ńdɔg ńtsɛ́ lepÿé nà nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ gÿò pú’u, mbà mmó nzsǒ sẅé ge kẅi’i shʉa nzsǒ, lepÿé pú fáŋ.
en: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgee ńde’e melù’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’*ngùb, mbà mé te néŋ melù’ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́’ɔ á tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntú’ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ngÿo pú’u, mbà melù’ mesẅé ge fu’, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntú’ ŋwɛ́, mé sɔ́ɔn melù’, ésɔ́ɔn ntú’. Á zɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melù’ mé sẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’ yé sẅé, melù’ pɔ́ ntú’ pú ńtsẅɛ́.
en: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn nò mbwó pɔ́b pú’u, àtsɔ̌ ndÿò tó, ńnuŋe mekwò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn we manzwě lěen ńkwé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, tá tóo ńzába pwó jú ná yé à gwɔ́ wó.
en: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lu ssé, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And Jesus arose, and followed him, andso didhis disciples.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ né ńgee, àtsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ nùɔ lá’, ńgẅiin guɔ máshúɔ, mbà á gegé yé gege ngù’ tsɔ́b pʉ́a nê legém. Á ná’te, éfó nzèm, ńtó ńkíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ Yěsô,
en: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behindhim, and touched the hem of his garment:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N dɔɔn ńzé’e pwó yɔ́ɔn tà fó ńkíbe pɔ́ nzsǒ yé, mbà mèŋ n ge zeŋe!
en: for she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ́ɔ shÿó mbòŋo, ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m gú ná mèŋ lɛ̂, gÿǒ ɔ̀ zeŋe. Á gwóon ńzeŋe pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó fʉ̀’ó.
en: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said,Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole.And the woman was made whole from that hour.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a ndÿò wá, ńgyá, mbà pàpú’ shúm ńdɔg ńtúŋo mpfó, ně ndá’ ńtó tà ńtyéte, àlá’ piŋ ne ńzẅɛɛ shwǒŋ. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,

ngiemboon: Pi gʉate, múɔ manzwě kaa kwé, à lye lyě. Àlá’ jú’ ńgẅe yé gẅe.
en: he said unto them,Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth.And they laughed him to scorn.

ngiemboon: Mé fó ndá ńkẅile pʉ̀a. Yěsô kúu ndà, ńkíbe pwó múɔ manzwě, á gwóon ńdu ssé.
en: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yɔ̀ɔn nò ḿbú saa jʉ’ nà yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó ne ńgee, etsɔ́ pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g mépʉ́a cʉ́me nzèm yé, ńne ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe még.
en: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying,ThouSon of David, have mercy on us.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ńkúu ndá, pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g pá tó ńkẅɛ́te yé, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kwǎŋ ngie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gÿo mmó gie pi zɛ́te lɛ̂? Pɔ́ yé oon mé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ɔ̀ ku’u légÿo.
en: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them,Believe ye that I am able to do this?They said unto him, Yea, Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńzába pwó ná menÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie á poŋ ngie à kɔ́ɔkɔ́ à gwɔ́ pá’ pi zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ ńkwaŋ ngie á ge gwɔ́.
en: Then touched he their eyes, saying,According to your faith be it unto you.

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńké ńgyá jʉ’. Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b ngie: MÀbɔ́ɔn gẅi lé ké ńgÿo tà nyìŋ zsé pá’ á cʉ̌a pú’u.
en: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying,Seethatno man knowit.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ zyɛ́’ tà ńkúu pǐ ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô ḿbú saa jʉ’ ntsèm ná yɛ̌ pàga lá’.
en: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.

ngiemboon: Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gwaa fó ndá kẅɛ, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, mbà tsɔ́*ssé tepòŋ la gÿo á cʉ́’ʉ mbu’ ncwò.
en: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tà ńjwoŋ yɛ̌*ssé tepòŋ, mbu’ ncwò ŋwɛ́ gwóon ńzye légɔɔn nò. Àlá’ gyá ḿbú ḿmɔ́ɔn, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé laa zɔɔn ńgyá yɛ̂ ntí nò á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Israel wɔ́.
en: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pà*farisay gɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: Tándá*messé tepòŋ zɔ gÿo tá Yěsô ku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ
en: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ně ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ melá’, ńkúu nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ ńgee*ndá cú’tè, ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, ésá’a nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie éshwóŋó pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ee pú’u, ńgÿo meguɔ ntí ntí maga nà pʉ̀a,*melɔ̌’ ntí ntí maga mbùm pʉ̀a,
en: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.

ngiemboon: ńgyá menùɔ lá’, mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé, mélà’mie pɔ́ laa pá’ nùɔ*menjʉ̀njÿò mie àmpfele tè wó wɔ́. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ mezìŋe mezìŋe, mbà pɔ́ pǔ ńtsáŋ
en: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Eshúm sie mé gee nká’ ńdagá é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, nzẅìŋ ngàŋa fà’ piŋ ńkɔ́g.
en: Then saith he unto his disciples,The harvest trulyisplenteous, but the labourersarefew;

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie pi sẅíŋte ngàŋ nká’ à kẅi’i megàŋa fà’ pie pɔ́ ge ne laga shúm sé.
en: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńtóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńná metʉ̀ mbwó pɔ́b lélɔg ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ, mbɔɔ lélɔg ńgÿo meguɔ ntí ntí maga ná pʉ̀a, mbɔɔ légÿo*melɔ̌’ ntí ntí maga mbùm pʉ̀a.
en: And when he had called untohimhis twelve disciples, he gave them poweragainstunclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ megàŋ ntúm Yěsô ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém ŋwɛ́ é mɔ̀ɔn: Ànduŋ mvfò aa Símo gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Piɛ. Wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ Ndeléya ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ Piɛ. Petsɔ́ gwɔ́ Jâg míŋ Zebede pɔ́ fɛ́ we Jâŋ,
en: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; Jamesthe sonof Zebedee, and John his brother;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Filib pɔ́ Patelemî, ńgÿo Tomáse pɔ́ Matio, á nkẅè ncùb pà*Roma, ńgÿo Jâg míŋ Alfe pɔ́ Tadé,
en: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; Jamesthe sonof Alphæus, and Lebbæus, whose surname was Thaddæus;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Símo múɔ ngwòŋ pɔ́ Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la gÿo sẅiŋe Yěsô
en: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwaa túm megàŋ ntúm pɔɔn ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, tà pi kúu tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ pà Samalîɛ.
en: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying,Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and intoanycity of the Samaritans enter ye not:

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa fa’ pɔ́*menjʉ̀njÿò Ssé mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mendá pà Israel, mbà é la pyé.
en: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa sá’ éshwóŋ pʉ̀a ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe, ńgÿo mepfó zím, ńgÿo megàŋ nkà’ pǎb zeŋe, ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ. Mé nǎ mbwó pi sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ, pi gíŋe ńná gí sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ.
en: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.

ngiemboon: Tà pi néŋ nkáb pɔ̀ɔn, tà mbɔɔ pá’ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ láa wɔ́.
en: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ́ cʉ́me mánzsè ńdyɛbe pɔ̀ɔn, tà pi píi kúbe nzsǒ, tà pi píi kúbe melɔ̌ɔn, tà pi tẅi’i tÿǒ. N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ne fa’a nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà mmó léjÿó yé ge fó jʉ’ó
en: nor scrip foryourjourney, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ka tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a wɔ́, pi túŋte lézsé ka nyìŋ gẅie à ge kúe gẅi ge kẅɛɛ jʉ’ó wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, pi ńnéŋe pɔ́ mbʉ̀a yé tà ńdá’ fó yɛ̌ lá’ ńgʉa.
en: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu ndá nyìŋ, pi gɔɔn ngie: E Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔ̀ɔn ndá.
en: And when ye come into an house, salute it.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá lɔɔn ńkúe gẅí, mbà Ssé ge néŋ mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b! Tá ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔɔn tè gẅi kúe, mbà mbʉ́lè gi ge piŋe ná pi.
en: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.

ngiemboon: Pi kúu mbʉ̀a nyìŋ ka pɔ́ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, mé lʉ’ʉ lékúe gẅí, ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u shwóŋó gí, pi fó wó ńgʉa, ńgwaa gʉa ḿbú’u pfepfɔ́b nà mekwò mí ńgwá’
en: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àlyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ge lá’ ne tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa yé pʉ̀a Sodom pâ yé pʉ̀a Gomor
en: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n túmo gẅi pé pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé túm mvfó tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn ngẅi, pi ké ńgwaa giŋ ńdÿɔ́’ pá’ nnú, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pàteŋag ntsaŋ pá’ kàpʉŋ la
en: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí, mélà’mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gÿo sẅiŋe gẅi mé ŋaga gẅí, ńdɔ́g mengwɔ̀ɔn ńcuɔ gẅi á tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè mɔ́b
en: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;

ngiemboon: Mé ge lá’ ŋaga gẅi á mvfò pà ngumnɔ́ɔn lâ mefùɔ melá’ mɔ̀ɔn. Pi lɔg ńgẅiin shÿó lélɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b mbɔɔ pàte zsě Ssé, á nyìŋ gẅie méŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: and ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ne ńdɔgɔ gẅi ńgee, tà pi pú’ mbùm gi ngie pi ge tóo wó gɔɔn ngie kɔ́ wɔ́? Aa gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, e Ssé náa gẅi shwóŋó,
en: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pi zɔ tě ge zɔɔn lá’ gɔɔn nò wɔ. Àzẅìge Tá gẅi zɔ̌ ge lá’ lɔgɔ gẅi gɔɔn nò.
en: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ge gwoon fɛ́ we ńná mé zẅé, tá múɔ gwoon míŋ we ńná mé zẅé, gubé ge lá’ lu ssé cʉ́’ megàŋ mbù metá pɔ́b, e gÿo mé zẅé wɔ́b.
en: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up againsttheirparents, and cause them to be put to death.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, tá’ nyìŋ gẅíe à shÿɔ̌g shÿɔg tè kʉ́a zɔ ge gÿo tsẅɛ́
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńkʉe gẅi a tsɛ̀ɛ yɔ̀ɔn tÿǒsoŋ, pi kÿo ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ yetsɔ́. Mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi tè lá’ kú metÿǒsoŋ Israel tà ḿmag té gwɔ́ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ tǒ wɔ́.
en: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.

ngiemboon: Nzì’i mmó tè tsítsà we cʉa, nkwɔɔn piŋ ńké tè tá we cʉa.
en: The disciple is not abovehismaster, nor the servant above his lord.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtóŋo ngàŋ ndá ngie: Bɛlzebùl, mbà mé ge kúu nà pʉ̀a ndá pé, tá nyé té tóŋo wɔ́b pú’u, keen? Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie kɔ́ la gÿo tsítsà wɔ́, mbà yɛ̌ mmó ge lá’ gÿo nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńzí’i nò yé, ńgwɔ́ gie kɔ́ la gÿo tá pà nkwɔɔn wɔ́, mbà yɛ̌ mmó ge gíŋe lá’ gÿo nkwɔɔn yé.
en: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much moreshall they callthem of his household?

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tà pi pɔ́g pʉ̀a pie é nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’, mélà’mie ànò gie aa lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lelyěen, á gẅiin le lá’ ńkẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌, tsɔ́ nò té gwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lyeen tà mé lá’ le zsé wɔ́
en: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.

ngiemboon: Ànò gie mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn mbwó pi á tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, ejʉ’ lɔɔn ńgÿo fɔ́g pi gɔɔn. Ànò gie n demté pɔ́ letuŋó pi, pi gÿo ńkwɔ́’ɔ gyɛ̌ tá sá’a yɛ̌ nò.
en: What I tell you in darkness,thatspeak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear,thatpreach ye upon the housetops.

ngiemboon: Tà pi pɔ́g pʉ̀a mesoŋ, pɔ́ ku’ pɔ́ ndà’ lézẅé nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké tè ku’u légÿo tà ńtɔ́g pú’u wɔ́. Pi pɔ́g pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé, á nue ńgwɔ́ á zẅé nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńku’u léma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g.
en: And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

ngiemboon: Mé ée lá’ɔɔn, ésẅiŋ mejʉŋé mémbʉ́a é té ku’u tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ á le gwe ssé té gwɔ́ gie Tá gẅi Ssé à zẅǐŋ wɔ́.
en: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pi, mbà Ssé ne ńzsé nzẅìŋ menoŋo twó mí.
en: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ḿbɔ́g, pi ee mbwó Ssé ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa mejʉŋé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn mvfò lá’ ngie: Mèŋ n ge nyìŋ Yěsô. Mbà mèŋ n ge lá’ gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn mvfò Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ aa wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ.
en: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ piŋ ńgɔɔn mvfò lá’ ngie: Mèŋ n tè nyìŋ Yěsô wɔ́, mbà mèŋ*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn mvfò Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie aa tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ tè wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ wɔ́
en: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie mèŋ n ka lɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mèŋ n ka tè lɔg mbʉ́lè ńtó wɔ́, ńka lɔg pɔ́ fagte ńtó.
en: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka to ḿma’a fagte tsetsɛ̀ɛ nyìŋ pɔ́ tá we, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ múɔ manzwě pɔ́ má we, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ nzwě múɔ pɔ́ má ndǔm we.
en: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ mbù nyìŋ ge kẅɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsìŋe ndá yɔ́b
en: And a man's foesshall bethey of his own household.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ kwoŋo tá we ka pɔ́ má we wɔ́, tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà ngàŋ tè ku’u légwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ wɔ́. Nyìŋ kwoŋo míŋ we we mbàŋa ka we manzwě wɔ́ tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à tè ku’u légwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ, ńdɔg ńzẅíŋe lékwé tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ á le ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́
en: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngie à ge pɔ́ɔn we légwɔ́ wó, mbà à ge pyé, tá nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńzẅíŋe lépyé mélà’ mɔ́ɔn zɔ gÿó ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkúe gẅí, mbà à kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn, nyìŋ piŋ ńkúe wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn
en: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkúe tà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pá’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mbà mé ge lá’ ńná wé ńtsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ pá’ we*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé. Nyìŋ piŋ ńkúe nyìŋ gẅie à kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé, mbà mé ge lá’ ná ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ wé pá’ we nyìŋ gẅie á kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé.
en: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet's reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man's reward.
