ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńná pɔ́ ndà’ galase ntse gẅie é ne sẅéte á mbwó múɔ mémúɔ, ńdɔgɔ pá’ wɛ̌ muɔ aa*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn ńnáa, mbà wé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of coldwateronly in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn yɔ̀ɔn nò mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, éfo jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ńgiŋe ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó ḿbiŋe ńtsẅì nkʉ̀ mbòŋo tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ na yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’o, Jâŋ Mbabtis gwɔ́ ndá ntsǎŋ, ńjú’ mé ne shwóŋó á na menò mie Yěsô gẅie aa Kristo ne ńgÿo. Á túm tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńzɛ́te yé ngie,
en: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,

ngiemboon: aa*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé ne ńzẅí’te yé lá ka pɔ́ gíŋ ńzẅí’te pɔ́ tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́?
en: and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńgyá Yěsô, á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ḿbíte mmó gie pi jǔ’ mbɔɔ gie pi gyǎ éshwóŋó Jâŋ,
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:

ngiemboon: éshwóŋó yé ngie: Mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ne ńgyá jʉ’, pà pwɔ́’te mekwò ne ńgiŋe mbóŋo, megàŋ nkà’ ne ńzeŋe, pà mbǔ’ metuŋó ne ńjú’u jʉ’, mepfó ne ńzyeen, mé ne sá’a nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé mbwó mefÿɔ́g
en: the blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.

ngiemboon: Àshÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à tè kwɔɔnte ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwe ssé wɔ́!
en: And blessed ishe, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Jâŋ gʉa, Yěsô cʉ́’ ńgɔɔn nò ńtí Jâŋ, á mbwó lá’ gie aa jʉ’ó, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Á kaa fʉ̀’e Jâŋ pi gʉa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ ńgyá kɔ́? Á kekà’a gie fefà ne ńcʉ’te lá? Ngǎŋ.
en: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John,What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee pɔ́ ńgyá kɔ́? Ányìŋ gẅie à ma’ menzsǒ nkáb lá? Tá pà ma’ yɛ̌ ntí menzsǒ ńnéŋe pɔ́ nɔ’?
en: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear softclothingare in kings' houses.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgyá pɔ́ wɔ́? Á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá? Oon tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, à kaa wɛ̌, tà ńcʉa mbɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.

ngiemboon: ńne ńnyɛte mánzsè gù tá ɔ̀ tó».
en: Which shall prepare thy way before thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó tà ńtɔ́gɔ Jâŋ Mbabtis wɔ́. Tá á ké yɔ̀ɔn, mbà nyìŋ gẅie à pú ńkɔ́gɔ nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé, mbà á pú fáŋ ńcʉa Jâŋ.
en: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

ngiemboon: Tà fó nà fʉ̀’e Jâŋ Mbabtis, ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mé ne ńjwoŋo ńkúu nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé. Pʉ̀a pie é lɔgɔ pɔ́ tʉ̀ ńgÿo menò mɔ́b ne fa’a lekàŋ*lefùɔ Ssé ŋwɛ́
en: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.

ngiemboon: Aa pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie Mǒsê pâ pà Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ Ssé metsèm la gɔɔn nò tà ńkúu ná fʉ̀’ yé Jâŋ.
en: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ne ńkwoŋo lézsé nyìŋ gẅie Jâŋ aa wɛ̌, mbà mèŋ n ge ké shwóŋó gẅi ngie à lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́*Elîɛ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńge gíŋe tó
en: And if ye will receiveit, this is Elias, which was for to come.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ n ge lɔgɔ kɔ́ pí fʉ̀’ nà pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn? Pɔ́ leen ńgwá’a gubé gie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ndùmo gÿɛ̌, ńně ńzɔbɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtúu ńkẅé ngie:
en: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,

ngiemboon: Peg ka pú’ leluŋó pi tè zíŋ, ńtú legwé pi tè lʉa.
en: and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̂ kwà’ pá’ pɔ́ la gÿo nà Jâŋ. À la tó à tè mmó pfɛ́, à tè melù’ ńnú, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie aa pʉ̀a.
en: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ keen ńtó yé fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó ḿbiŋe ńnúu melù’, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie mé líe yé tà ńgyá, nyìŋ wɛ̂ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mpfɛɛ mmó, ńgwɔ́ nú melù’, ńgwɔ́ sǒ pà kẅé ncùb pà*Roma mbɔɔ we petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ. Tá mé ké ne ńgyá ngie: Sɔ̀ɔn ee kwà’ legye Ssé ńcʉa pɔ́ nà mefà’ mie yɔ̀ɔn nò ne fa’a.
en: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńzye léla’ pʉ̀a metÿǒsoŋ mie à la gʉa wó, ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn, pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ ké tè sele nnɛ́ ńcʉ́me nzèm Ssé wɔ́.
en: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ndoon ee twó pi pʉ̀a Kolazîŋ, mbɔɔ twó pi pʉ̀a Mbetsayida, menò mɔ̀ɔn mie mé la gÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, é laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ, mbà pɔ́ leen ńdá’ ńkúbe mà, ḿmÿɔ́g, éshʉa mepɔ́ɔn ḿma’, ńzɔ́’ɔ pfó ńdɔg ńdúŋ
en: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

ngiemboon: Aa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, egi ngʉ̀gʉ̀ cʉa yé pʉ̀a Tir lâ yé pʉ̀a Sidoŋ,
en: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.

ngiemboon: ńgʉ́a nà pi pʉ̀a Kapernawúm, pi kwǎŋ ngie Ssé ge kwé’e gẅi kwé’e tà pi kúu lefaŋ káa? Éshwóŋó gẅi ngie: Ngǎŋ, à ge sẅé’e gẅi sẅé’e pi gʉa tà ńkúu lá’ mepfó ssé. Á nue menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie mé la gÿo lá’ pi, à laa pé’e ńgÿo pɔ́ Sodom, mbà Sodom aa yé pɔ́ wó tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn
en: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.

ngiemboon: Aa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, égi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉa yé pʉ̀a Sodom.
en: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔ̀ sá’a tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ tsetsá’, mèŋ sǐe gú pá’ ɔ̀ keen ńnyɛ mɔɔn menò á mbwó mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ, ńdÿoon mbwó mengye pâ pʉ̀a pie é la zí’i.
en: At that time Jesus answered and said,I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.

ngiemboon: Oon me Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ la gyá ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo yɔ̀ɔn nò pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn leen ńnyé kɔ́ɔkɔ́ nà mbwó mɔ́ɔn, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ le zsé múɔ wɔ́, ndà’ Tá zɔ zsé yé. Nyìŋ ké le zsé Tá wɔ́, ndà’ míŋ we zɔ zsé yé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie múɔ kwoŋó lényɛɛ Tá we á mbwó yé
en: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, andheto whomsoever the Son will revealhim.

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm pie pi kǎ pì’ á zɛɛ gẅi tà pi kʉ́a, pi tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, n gÿo pi zẅɛte.
en: Come unto me, allyethat labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

ngiemboon: Pi píi*kɔ̌’ yɔ́ɔn ńjÿɔ́gɔ lóŋ pi, ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n zí’i gẅi pá’ pi ge gÿo, á nue m bʉlé, ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn piŋ ńké tè cÿɔ́gte. Mèŋ n ge náa jʉ’ gie pi ge sẅéte ntʉ́m gẅi wó
en: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

ngiemboon: Àyɔ́ɔn*kɔ̌’ pʉ́le, àpì’ gie mèŋ n gee gÿo pi kaa, á zéŋe zeŋe lékaa.
en: For my yokeiseasy, and my burden is light.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda, Yěsô ne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nká’a ngesáŋ ntsíŋ,*ngàŋa kwò yé, pá’ nzyè la ne ńgyáŋa wɔ́b lá, pɔ́ giŋe sẅe ngesáŋ ḿpfɛ́ɛ.
en: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a nà pà*farisay gyá pú’u, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Líe tá ńgyá pá’*ngàŋa kwò jú gÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ té ne ńzɛ́te, ngie mé gÿo lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda wɔ́.
en: But when the Pharisees sawit, they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi laa fó ńtóŋo jʉ’e ŋwà’ne Ssé gie á la’te mmó gie fùɔ Ndavíd la gÿo wɔ́ ka? Pá’ á laa tsɔ̌ lyɛ̌’, nzyè gyáŋa wɔ́b lâ pʉ̀a pé.
en: But he said unto them,Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;

ngiemboon: Á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ḿbí mbelég gie mé nǎ mbwó Ssé, ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná yé*ngàŋa kwò yé, tá*lepʉ̌ gɔɔn ngie ndà’*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ zɔ̌ gẅiin lépfɛ́!
en: how he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the priests?

ngiemboon: Ka pi laa fó ńtóŋo tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Mǒsê, ngie aa lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda,*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pie pɔ́ gẅiin fà’*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ké tè zẅɛte, tá á téen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ fʉa*lepʉ̌ wɔ́.
en: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ aa jʉ’ɔɔn ḿbú ńcʉa*jʉ’ʉ Ssé.
en: But I say unto you, That in this place isonegreater than the temple.

ngiemboon: Pi gwé’e ńzsé mmó gie jʉ’e ŋwà’ne gie á gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n kwoŋo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, ńcʉa pwɔ́’ gẅie mé lɔgɔ ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn» lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn, mbà pi te zába nò twó pʉ̀a pɛ̂, pie pɔ́ kaa nò fʉa wɔ́.
en: But if ye had known whatthismeaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo nà lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda.
en: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pɔ́b.
en: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ mámbàŋa gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà pwó yé leen ńkwé. Pʉ̀a pie é laa ndá ne fa’a mmó gie pɔ́ ge fó mǒ lɔg sẅiŋe Yěsô, zɛ́te yé ngie: Áa nà*lepʉ̌ ségè pé’e ńgwaa we mé gÿo nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse ka ngǎŋ?
en: and, behold, there was a man which hadhishand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Àwɔ̌ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɛ́’ɛ, ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgẅiin mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, á gwe tsɛ̀ɛ tɔ́ɔn lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse, á nyé té fó tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńgwóon ńkẅile yé?
en: And he said unto them,What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and liftitout?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ aa mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa*njʉ̀njÿò, pú’u lá, mé lɔɔn ńgÿo nò mbòŋo á ná nyìŋ mesoŋ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse, mbà mé kaa*lepʉ̌ fʉa
en: How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó kwé pwó ngie: Siŋe pwó jú, á siŋ, mé gyá á gíŋe ńtʉte pá’ yetsɔ́.
en: Then saith he to the man,Stretch forth thine hand.And he stretcheditforth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pà*farisay, pɔ́ fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, ńcú’te fa’ shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tá zẅé Yěsô
en: Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gwɔ́ tà ńzsé, éfó jʉ’ó ńgʉa. Àlá’ cʉ́me nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Á gÿo megàŋa guɔ ntsèm pie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’ zeŋe.
en: But when Jesus knewit, he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tà ḿbʉ́, ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà mé zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: and charged them that they should not make him known:

ngiemboon: Pú’u, ànò gie Ssé la lɔg ncwò Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ we Esǎya ńgɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ḿbumte
en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: à gÿo ńnyɛ ntí lesá’a lá’ gie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mbwó melá’ mie e té pà Israel wɔ́.
en: And he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Mé ké le jú’ á tyé metwó nzsè ńnáa shwóŋò wɔ́.
en: Neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.

ngiemboon: é ké lá’ gÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà ntí lesá’a lá’ gie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ e jÿó mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Till he send forth judgment unto victory.

ngiemboon: Mengwòŋ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó cʉ́’ʉ ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ yé ńnéŋe».
en: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, mbà*ssé tepòŋ leen ńgÿo á fʉ, ńgíŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ támbǎ’. Yěsô gÿo nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ zeŋe, ńgwóon ńzye leshwóŋe, mbɔɔ légyá jʉ’ mboŋó.
en: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ ntsèm pú ńgyá ḿmɔɔn tɛ’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ndyɛ̀’ tsɔ́ aa nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd wɛ̌.
en: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?

ngiemboon: Tá’ pʉ̀a*farisay, jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie: Bɛlzebùl, tándá*messé tepòŋ zɔ́ gÿo tá Yěsô ku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ.
en: But when the Pharisees heardit, they said, Thisfellowdoth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Epʉ̀a tà’a lá’ lɔɔn sele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ lá’ ge pyé. Epʉ̀a tà’a tÿǒsoŋ ka tà’a tsìŋe ndá wɔ́ piŋ sele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ ka yɛ̌ tsìŋe ndá wɔ́ ge pyé.
en: And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them,Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:

ngiemboon: Lefùɔ se Sátà gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kwà’ pú’u, epʉ̀a pé lɔɔn fagte, ńzye lesele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà lefùɔ sé ge pyé.
en: and if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?

ngiemboon: Pi gɔ̌ɔn ngie n dɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Bɛlzebùl tá ńdɔgɔ ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ, tà pá’ pí pʉ̀a gíŋe ńjwoŋo yɔ́b*messé tepòŋ li, pɔ́ piŋe ńdɔgɔ yɔ́b metʉ̀ nzɔ̌ tá ńjwoŋo? Kwà’ pʉ̀a pí ŋwɛ́ nyɛɛ gẅi ngie pi gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ éfʉa fʉa.
en: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children castthemout? therefore they shall be your judges.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa nà mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ssé tá ńjwoŋo. Á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ně ńdá’ ńtó, tà ńgwɔ́ fùɔ á tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó.
en: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.

ngiemboon: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ḿbwɔ́’ ndá tántʉ̀, ńkaa shúm sé té gwɔ́ gie à vɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ yé? À vɔg tà ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, á ku’u lékúu ndá ḿbú ńkaa shúm sé ntsèm.
en: Or else how can one enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdʉ’ pá’ peg yé ge gwɔ́ lê nò, mbà à lɔgɔ ńcʉŋe nò yɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ piŋ ńdʉ’ʉ lékẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, peg yé cú’te pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, mbà à cʉ́’ʉ ńtága wɔ́b ésaa sa.
en: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Ssé lá’ ḿbú ńdege meno tepoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm, ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b, tà mbɔɔ meshwóŋe ntsèm mie pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńzoonte yé. Tá nyìŋ ké ńzoonte Zẅìge Ssé, mbà mé téen ńdá’a ńdege ńnáa mbwó yé wɔ́.
en: Wherefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemyagainsttheHolyGhost shall not be forgiven unto men.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn shwóŋó tepòŋ ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ, mbà Ssé ge lá’ lege ńnáa mbwó yé. Tá nyìŋ ké shwóŋó tepòŋ á nà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná yɔɔn kème njÿó, mé le lege ńnáa mbwó yé wɔ́, e ké le lá’a nà tsɔ́ kème njÿó ńdege ńnáa mbwó yé wɔ́.
en: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in theworldto come.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie: Àtÿǒ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ mbòŋo, mbà á ge zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo. Àtÿǒ ké ńgwɔ́ yé tepòŋ, mbà á ge zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn tepòŋ. Mé zɔ́ɔn ńzsé yɛ̌ tÿǒ wɔ́ pɔ́ nà mentɔ̌ɔn mé.
en: Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known byhisfruit.

ngiemboon: Ngẅɛ̀ mennú, ńgwɔ́ pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ pɛ́’ɛ, ńgɔɔn nò mbòŋo lêkɔ́? Nyìŋ gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé.
en: O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo, mbà á ge gẅiin ncwò mbòŋo, ńgẅiin ntʉ́m tepòŋ, mbà shwóŋó tepòŋ zɔ̌ ge kẅɛɛ ncwò ye
en: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí: Á ge la’a lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé tsɔ́’te metsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅiin lépíte megʉ̀gʉ̀ shwóŋè mie é lǎ kẅɛɛ ncwò yé.
en: But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ lɔg pɔ́ nò gie á lǎ kẅɛɛ ncwò wɔ̌wɔɔ, ézá’ ntsaŋ yé, à tè gwe, á tsẅɛ́.
en: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, etsɔ́*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ tsɔ́ pà*farisay gɔɔn né yé ngie: tsítsà, peg ne ntsɔ́ɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿo tà’a nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿo fʉ’ɔɔn ee pʉ̀a tepòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké ńtʉ pɔ́ twó mbwó Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo tà’a nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn pɔ́ gyá. Tá mé téen ńge ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, tà ńdí ndà’ nò gie á la gÿo Jonase*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But he answered and said unto them,An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Jonase la ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lepfòm máamáa ssó é lyɛ̌’ tá la;*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gÿo yé lyɛ̌’ tá tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’.
en: for as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale's belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, epʉ̀a Ninive lu ssé ńtó ńtyé, ńzába nò twó pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn. Á nue Jonase la gɔɔn nò mbwó pɔ́b, pɔ́ jú’, ńkúbe mà wɔb. Nyìŋ gẅie à piŋe shwóŋó gẅi nò lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pi tě ńzẅíŋe wɔ́, à cʉa Jonase.
en: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonasishere.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, máfùɔ pà Shéba lu ssé ńtó ńtyé, ńzába nò twó pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn, á nue a lá jú’ ngie legye fùɔ Salomo pú ńcʉa se mânyìŋ ntsèm, éfó táa lá’ yé ńdu ssé ńtó, ńdɔg nÿɔ́g mé ńgyá yé. Nyìŋ gẅie a piŋe shwóŋó gẅi nò lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pi tě ńzẅíŋe wɔ́, esé legye cʉa se fùɔ Salomo.
en: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomonishere.

ngiemboon: E*ssé tepòŋ ńnéŋe ná nyìŋ tà ńgÿo ńkẅɛ, ńgwá ńgwó ná jʉ’ sie é júbe jubé, éfa’a jʉ’ gie e ge pʉle ńnéŋe wó, ḿbiŋ ńké tè gyá,
en: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie, á poŋ ngie m biŋ nzèm á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yɔ̀ɔn mie n ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, à lɔɔn ḿbiŋ nzèm ńgyá é tyé sẅɛ̀ɛ, mbà mé keen ńjÿɔg, ńtáŋte shúm tsòló,
en: Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findethitempty, swept, and garnished.

ngiemboon: mbà à ge gʉa gú tsɔ́*messé tepòŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, e gwɔ́ mie pú ńgyɔ́ɔn sóon tà ńcʉa yé, pâ pɔ́ piŋ nzèm ńkúu ná nyìŋ wa, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ndá yɔ́b. Ngɔ́’ ngàŋ pú ńgyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa pá’ e ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́. Á ge lá’ gíŋe gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, nà pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn pie e tepòŋ.
en: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the laststateof that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lá nyé shwóŋó mbwó lá’ shwoŋó, má we pâ mefɛ́ pé tó, ńtyé pǐ ne fa’a légyá yé.
en: hismother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ tó ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Má gù pâ mefɛ́ pú ee pǐ ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá gú.
en: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Àwɔ̌ aa má wɔ̀ɔn, pàwɔ̌ gwɔ́ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn?
en: But he answered and said unto him that told him,Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ pwó ńnyɛ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pɛ̀.
en: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said,Behold my mother and my brethren!

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó ne ńkwoŋo, mbà wɛ̌ nyìŋ aa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we mámbàŋa, ńgwɔ́ we manzwě, ńgwɔ́ má wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńkẅɛɛ ndá lyɛ̌’o, ńgʉa ńnéŋe ngʉ́ŋe letʉŋ.
en: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.

ngiemboon: Menùɔ lá’ cú’tè lejʉ́ŋ yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńnéŋe. Menùɔ lá’ tyé ngʉ̀ŋe ntse.
en: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.

ngiemboon: Á lɔg mesagá nò éshwóŋó wɔ́b menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgʉa ḿmá’ mbyè mmó,
en: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying,Behold, a sower went forth to sow;

ngiemboon: ńtóo ḿma’á, tsɔ́ memvòm gwe mánzsè, meshʉ́ŋ tó ńdagte ḿpfɛ́.
en: and when he sowed, someseedsfell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe ná jʉ’e metóon, á jʉ’ gie tsetsá’ té wó tɛ’ wɔ́, ńtɔ́g sá’, ńtí nue é la zébe zebé.
en: some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:

ngiemboon: Nèm gÿo ńtʉ́a mboŋó, ńtuɔ é júm ńtí nue menŋaŋ la tè lyɛɛ ssé wɔ́.
en: and when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ legǐ tepòŋ, legǐ tepóŋ gÿo ńdu sse éfóme mɛ̌.
en: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe ná jʉ’e tsetsá’ mbòŋo, ésá’ ńgú’, ńzém. Etsɔ́ letsiŋe gwɔ́ ná mvòm nkÿo, etsɔ́ ná mvòm móm ntɔgɔ́, setsɔ́ ná mvòm móm ntá.
en: but other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ lɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn nò mbwó lá’?
en: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé lá gÿó ngie pi pɛ zɔ zsé nó nénʉ́ na lefùɔ sé sie ée lelyěen, ńgʉa nà petsɔ́ pʉ̀a à tè gÿo ngie pɔ́ zsé wɔ́.
en: He answered and said unto them,Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin mmó, mbà mé ge kẅi’i tsɔ́ né yé à lɔg ńgẅiin tà á gyɔ́ɔn. Tá ńké ńgʉ́a ná nyìŋ gẅie à tè mmó gẅiin, mbà mé ge kẅé méjʉ’ gẅie à zɔɔn ńgẅiin
en: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n dɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn nò né pɔ́b, mélà’mie pɔ́ líe jʉ’, ńké tè gyá, ńjú’ jʉ’ ńké tè jú’ tà ńjú’ wɔ́.
en: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.

ngiemboon: ńne líe jʉ’ é ké le mmó gyá
en: And seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ tě ńkwoŋo ngie n gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe wɔ́».
en: And should be converted, and I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná pi, mbà pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo, á nue nÿɔ́g mí ne ńgyá jʉ’, metuŋó mí ne ńjú’u jʉ’.
en: But blessedareyour eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, mbàa pàkú’te*lepʉ̌ la tsɔ́ɔn légyá menò mie pi gyá lɛ̂ tɛ’, pɔ́ té gyá, ńtsɔ́ɔn lé jú’ menò mie pi jú’u lɛ̂, pɔ́ té jú’
en: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteousmenhave desired to seethose thingswhich ye see, and have not seenthem; and to hearthose thingswhich ye hear, and have not heardthem.

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te nò gie sagá nò ná nyìŋ gẅie à pye mmó lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn:
en: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè gẅie tsɔ́ memvòm gwě wó, ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u nò*lefùɔ Ssé, pɔ́ té jú’ tà ńjú’ wɔ́. Sátà tó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wɔ́b ńkẅile.
en: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandethitnot, then cometh the wicked one, and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he which received seed by the way side.

ngiemboon: Àjʉ’e metóon ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u nò Ssé, ésẅɛte ńzẅíŋ nê lekág,
en: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;

ngiemboon: tá pɔ́ té nyé á lyɛ menŋaŋ ntʉ́m pɔ́b wɔ́, á nue pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’. Mé gwɔ́ tà ńzye lékʉ́e wɔ́b, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’ mélà’ nò Ssé pɔ́ gwóon ńgwá’.
en: yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é jú’u shwóŋò Ssé, ńgÿo ńzye lémÿɔg menò njÿó, ńzye lézáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà nkáb. Sɛ̌ shúm gÿo shwóŋò Ssé maga ntʉ́m pɔ́b té zém ntɔ̌ɔn.
en: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie gwě nà tsetsá’a mbòŋo lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋò Ssé tà nkwà’ ńjú’. Pɔ́ ée pá’ metsìŋe shúm mie setsɔ́ gwɔ́ ná memvòm nkÿo, setsɔ́ ná móm ntɔgɔ́, setsɔ́ ná móm ntá.
en: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandethit; which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe shwóŋó wɔ́b tsɔ́ sagá nò ngie: Nò*lefùɔ Ssé gwá’a nò nyìŋ gẅie á la pye mbyè mmó mbòŋo nká’ yé.
en: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

ngiemboon: Tá’ mé gwɔ́ tà ńdyé, ngàŋ mbù we tó ḿbye legǐ tepòŋ gẅie à sẅé mmó mbòŋo yá, ńgʉa.
en: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

ngiemboon: Shúm gÿo sá’, ńgú’ tà ńná metsɔ̀’. Mé gyá mmó tepòŋ gwɔ́ tsetsolo.
en: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa fà’ ngàŋ nká’ wá tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ànde, ɔ̀ la tè pye pɔ́ mbyè mmó mbòŋo tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ gù wɔ́ lê? Legǐ tepòŋ piŋe fóo nzɔ̌ wɔ́?
en: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Áa fà’a tsɔ́ ngàŋ mbù. Megàŋa fà’ pé zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ zẅǐŋ ngie peg gʉa ńtsɔ́’ɔ mmó tepòŋ ŋwɛ́?
en: He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?

ngiemboon: Á yé ngǎŋ, ńgwɔ́ pi tóo ńtsɔ́’ɔ mmó tepòŋ ŋwɛ́, ḿbú ńtsɔ́’ wɔ́b lâ shùm mbòŋo.
en: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.

ngiemboon: Pi nyé pâ shúm mbòŋo pú ngú’ tà ńkú fʉ̀’e lelag shúm. Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó mèŋ n tsẅii mbwó pàlag shúm ngie pɔ́ vɔg ńtsɔ́’ɔ mmó tepòŋ, ńkwɛ́te meka’á meka’á pá’ mé ge tuɔ mmɔ̌g, ńgʉa nà shúm mbòŋo pɔ́ lag ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nkìŋ yɔ̀ɔn.
en: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn tsɔ̌ sagá nò mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé leen ńgwá’a tsɔ̌ ntí lesɔ́ɔn sésɔgsie nyìŋ la pí ḿbye nká’ yé.
en: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí lesɔ́ɔn sésɔg é pú ńkɔ́g ńcʉa memvòm shúm ntsèm, tá’ é la gÿo sá’, ńgú’, ńgʉa tÿǒ ńcʉa shúm léjÿó sie ée nká’ ntsèm, ńcʉ́’ʉ tÿǒ, ńtɔ́g mbwó, meshʉ́ŋ tó ḿbá’ menkʉ̀a mɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò ngie: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ gẅie manzwě lɔg ḿvoŋo faline gie à fʉ̌’ ngʉ̀a sétá ńtsab, ḿbú ḿbú’ pú’ tà méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ ŋwɛ́ gÿo, faline ye ntsab ŋwɛ́ pú ńkwɔ́’.
en: Another parable spake he unto them;The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ké ńdɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò mbwó lá’. Á lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò lê pɔ̌b té sagá nò ńcʉa mǒ wɔ́.
en: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo shwóŋó wɔ́b menò mie ée lelyěen tà fó fʉ̀’ gie mé la nyɛte njÿó».
en: I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńnyé lá’ ńkúu ndá,*ngàŋa kwò yé kẅɛ́te yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: À kyagte sagá nò ná mbyè mmó ye tepòŋ yá éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à pye mmó mbòŋo aa*Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: He answered and said unto them,He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

ngiemboon: Nká’ é gwɔ́ njÿó, mbyè mmó mbòŋo é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé zɔ sá’a wɔ́b, mbyè mmó ye tepòŋ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie Sátà ne sá’a wɔ́b.
en: the field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one;

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ mbù gẅie à pye mbyè mmó ye tepòŋ, á gwɔ́ Sátà. Lelag shúm á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsònzèm, Megàŋa fà’ gwɔ́*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé.
en: the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé tsɔ́’ shúm tepòŋ ńtúɔ mmɔ̌g lá, á ge là’ gíŋe gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná nzsònzèm lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.
en: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ túm mecÿɔ́’ pé, pɔ́ fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pé ńkẅile ngàŋ nkwà’te mbɔɔ pʉ̀a tepòŋ,
en: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;

ngiemboon: é ma’a wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa mmɔ̌g, pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ne ńdʉa, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó.
en: and shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ gwɔ́ pú’u, pʉ̀a pie é kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Tá wɔ́b Ssé sá’a, ńně ńŋwʉŋe pá’ nèm la. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ tsɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ gie á lyeen tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ nká’, nyìŋ gwɔ́ tá ńgyá, ńgíŋe ńde’e, ńdɔgɔ lékág ńkÿote ńgʉa sẅiŋ shúm sé ntsèm, ńdɔg nkáb ńtó njú wɛ̌ nká’.
en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

ngiemboon: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nò ntàŋ metʉ̌a gẅie à fa’a tɔgɔ́ tsye mbòŋo.
en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

ngiemboon: À gwɔ̌ tà ńgyá tsɔ́ tɔgɔ́ tsye gie á jÿó nkáb tɛ’, ńgʉa sẅiŋ shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm, ńdɔg nkáb ńtó ńjúu yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́.
en: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie: Àno*lefùɔ Ssé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pà’ nò lekÿo sie mé ma’a tsɛ̀ɛ letʉŋ, messó kúu tsɛ̀ɛ wó ntí ntí.
en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

ngiemboon: Lekÿo gwɔ́ tà ńdúe, mé shwoŋ ńdɔg ńgee ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, ḿbʉ́le ńnéŋe ssé, ńtyɛ́te messó me mbòŋo, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ metúŋ, ńgwá’ metsɔ́ mie ńgwɔ́ é le kẅéte.
en: which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná nzsònzèm lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ge lá’ tó, éfó nùɔ ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, éfag pʉ̀a tepòŋ,
en: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,

ngiemboon: é ma’a wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ mejʉŋ mmɔ̌g. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ne ńdʉa, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó.
en: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Tà pi jǔ’ mɔɔn menò ntsèm? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Oon, peg jǔ’.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Have ye understood all these things?They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi ké ńzsé ngie nkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsé gẅie à zẅiŋé nò*lefùɔ Ssé à gwá’a tsɔ̌ ndÿò gẅie eshúm ngù’ lâ se ngù’ɔɔn ée tsɛ̀ɛ ntaŋ yé. À néŋe tà mbùm ye poŋ, á gʉa mǒ ńkẅile ntí gie à kwǒŋ.
en: Then said he unto them,Therefore every scribewhich isinstructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a manthat isan householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasurethingsnew and old.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔg mesagá nò ńgɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, éfó jʉ’ó ńgʉa
en: And it came to pass,thatwhen Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.

ngiemboon: né lá’ pɔb, ńkúu wó, ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda. Pʉ̀a pie ée wó jú’u shwóŋò yé, ḿmɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: À lɔgɔ sɛ̂ legye lê metʉ̀ lɔg ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn fóo nzɔ̌?
en: And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath thismanthis wisdom, andthesemighty works?

ngiemboon: À tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ míŋ kápíndɔ́ɔn wɔ́ lê? Lezíŋ má we té lê Malîɛ wɔ́ lê? À tè fɛ́ Jâg, lê Yesyɛ̂b, mbɔɔ Símo lê Jẅide wɔ́ lê?
en: Is not this the carpenter's son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pé pe pànzwě metsèm té gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege wɔ́ lê? À lɔgɔ yɔɔn ntí menò fóo pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath thismanall these things?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò yé. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mé ná mekù’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé jʉ’ ntsèm, tà é cʉ́’ ndà’ lá’ pɔ́b, ńgÿo pʉ̀a tsìŋe ndá yɔ́b
en: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them,A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, à tè gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn wó tà é gyɔ́ɔn wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la tè záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌,*Herôd gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn sá’a pàga ngwòŋ Galilea jú’ pá’ mé kíme Yěsô ńtí menò mie à ne ńgÿo,
en: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó mentsìndá pé ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie mé gɔɔn aa Jâŋ Mbabtis, mbà à zǐm. Áa mmó gie á gÿo, tá á ku’u légÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: and said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

ngiemboon: *Herôd gɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à la gÿo mé gwoon Jâŋ, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé ńnéŋe yé ndá tsǎŋ, mélà’*Herôdiad gẅie à laa nzwě Filib, fɛ́*Herôd ŋwɛ́.
en: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and puthimin prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Jâŋ ka ne ńgwá ńkaga yé ngie:*Lepʉ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe ngie à zɔ́’ɔ*Herôdiad wɔ́.
en: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

ngiemboon: *Herôd jú’, ńzye léfa’ shÿó lézẅé Jâŋ, tá nně ḿbɔ́gɔ nÿɔ́g pà Yuda. Á nue pɔ́b metsèm la ne ńzsé ngie Jâŋ aa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn, lélɔg ńkímte lyɛ̌’ gie mé la zyé fùɔ*Herôd. Míŋ*Herôdiad we manzwě zíŋe mvfò lá’. Ànò pú ḿboŋo fùɔ*Herôd,
en: But when Herod's birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.

ngiemboon: tà á gɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie: À lɔɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ kɔ́ mbwó yé wɔ́, mbà á ge ná.
en: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.

ngiemboon: Má pà múɔ manzwě tsóte múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, ngie à gʉa ńgɔɔn ngie à ne ńkwoŋo twó Jâŋ Mbabtis á tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist's head in a charger.

ngiemboon: Àfùɔ jú’ ḿbú ḿmÿɔg tɛ’. Tá le gwɔ́ gie à ně ńgɔɔn mvfò megʉ̀ pé tà ńkʉa gÿo, á tsẅi ngie mé náa twó Jâŋ mbwó múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́,
en: And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath's sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commandeditto be givenher.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńtúmo nyìŋ, á gʉa ndá tsǎŋ, ńzá’a twó Jâŋ,
en: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ ńdɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, á kẅé, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó má we.
en: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she broughtitto her mother.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ jú’, ńgʉa ndá tsǎŋ ńkaa pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋ. Tà á ku’, pɔ́ gʉa shwóŋó Yěsô nò gie á cʉ̌a.
en: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’u yɔɔn nò, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ne ńgee né jʉ’ gie nyìŋ tè wó wɔ́. Àlá’ zsé, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgiŋe mekʉ̀ŋ ntse ḿvɔg ńzá’a yé.
en: When Jesus heardof it, he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heardthereof, they followed him on foot out of the cities.

ngiemboon: Á kúu jʉ’ó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛ, ńgyá nùɔ lá’, mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé. Á zye légÿo megàŋa guɔ pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzèm,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege ee jʉ’ɔɔn nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, mbà za’ pǐŋ ńcʉa. Tsẅi né pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gʉa jʉ’ gie membʉ̀a ée wó, éfa’ shúm léjÿó ńjú.
en: And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge gʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’ wɔ́. Pi zɔ náa mmó pɔ́ pfɛ́.
en: But Jesus said unto them,They need not depart; give ye them to eat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Peg gẅiin pé ndà’ mbelég mbu’ú ntʉ̀a jʉ’ɔɔn ńgÿo mbaŋ ssó yépʉ́a.
en: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔg ńtó, ńná né mèŋ jʉ’ɔɔn,
en: He said,Bring them hither to me.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtsẅii mbwó lá’ ngie: Pɔ́ pwɔ́’ɔ legǐ ńnéŋe mǒ, ḿbí mbelég ayɛ̌ mbu’ú ntʉ̀a, nê messó mɛ̌ mbaŋ pʉ́a, ḿbʉ’ʉ twó ńdíe tÿǒ, ésíe Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńnáa mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé, pɔ́ gaba mbwó lá’.
en: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves tohisdisciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́. Mé cú’te mepfwɔ’, é lúe tsɛ̀ɛ metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó laa mbàŋa mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a, té sáŋ pànzwě paa gubé.
en: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtsẅii mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pɔ́ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńtúm né yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ, à cʉ́’ nzèm ńde’e menùɔ lá’ e gʉa.
en: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́’ ńde’e menùɔ lá’, ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé. Nzěm gÿo ńgwaa síŋ, á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó pɔ́ gíle yé,
en: And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.

ngiemboon: mbà kanú’ zyě ńgiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ soŋ ntse. Ntse ne ńgege pʉ̀a pé, mélà’mie fefà la ne ńtóo pɔ́ mvfò mvfò.
en: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ nkwɔ̀’ njÿó, Yěsô gwɔ́ jwoŋte wɔ́b, ńně ńgiŋe ndùm ntse.
en: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé, gyá pá’ à ne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse, ńzye lépɔ́g, ńkwaŋ ngie áa gʉgÿɛ́ nyìŋ, ńne ńga’te.
en: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gwóon ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi pʉ́le ńnéŋe, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, tà pi pɔ́g.
en: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying,Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwà’ gú, ɔ̀ gÿo mèŋ n giŋe ndùm ntse ńtó ńzá’a ɔ́.
en: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Tóo! Piɛ kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse légʉa ńzá’a yé.
en: And he said,Come.And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgyá fefà ne ńcʉ’ʉ tɛ’, á pɔ́g, ńzye léme’e tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdeen ńké ńga’te ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n kwě le.
en: But when he saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtsege pwó yé ńkwɔ́bɔ yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: ɔ̀ záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ pɔ́ mejʉ’! Ɔ̀ gwǎ mʉ́’te ńgaa?
en: And immediately Jesus stretched forthhishand, and caught him, and said unto him,O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, fefà zá’a.
en: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ kẅí’te mvfò Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ɔ́ɔ Míŋ Ssé.
en: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ túm ntse tà ńkúu nà nzǐŋ ye Jenezared,
en: And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.

ngiemboon: ńgwaa sẅɛ́’ tà tyé ssé, mé liŋe Yěsô, ńgwóon ńkÿote, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ membʉ̀a ńgÿo mé lɔg megàŋa guɔ ńtó.
en: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were diseased;

ngiemboon: Esẅíŋte yé ngie à fó ńzẅíŋ, pɔ́ kíbe pɔ́ ndà’ tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ yé. Epʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ la kíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ ŋwɛ́ pú ńzeŋe.
en: and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, etsɔ́ pà*farisay pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê fó Yerósalem ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́*ngàŋa kwò jú té giŋe ná nùŋe pà mvfò wɔ́ɔ? Pɔ́ gaa ḿpfɛ́ shúm té sɔg mbwó mɔ́b nà ntí gie mà là’ wege ne ńzɛ́te?
en: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á gʉa ná pi, pi lɔgɔ tsẅé lá’ gí ńgwága Ssé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But he answered and said unto them,Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: «Gÿo mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzoonte tá we ka má we wɔ́, mé zẅé ngàŋ».
en: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pi, pi gɔɔn gí ngie: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gɔɔn mbwó tá we ka má we wɔ́ ngie, á kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔg ńkẅéte yé cʉ’ʉ́ ye Ssé.
en: But ye say, Whosoever shall say tohisfather orhismother,It isa gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ vɔg tà ńgɔɔn pú’u, mbà mé tè gíŋe zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ gÿǒ mekù’ tá gù wɔ́? Pú’u, pi lɔgɔ mà lá’ gẅi ńgwága shwóŋó Ssé.
en: and honour not his father or his mother,he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g! Esǎya á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, lɔ̌ɔn fɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn pá’a shwóŋó nò, pá’ à la gɔɔn ná mà lá’ gẅi ngie e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn ngie:
en: Yehypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,

ngiemboon: ntʉ́m wɔ́b té ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But their heart is far from me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn tá ànò té mǒ wɔ́, ńtí nò gie pɔ́ ńnéŋe twó ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó tɛ’ tá’, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ».
en: Teachingfordoctrines the commandments of men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo lá’, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi zẅí’te, ńcwoŋo ńjú’,
en: And he called the multitude, and said unto them,Hear, and understand:

ngiemboon: àmmó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkúu lepfòm yé, té cʉŋte yé wɔ́, àgie á kẅɛɛ ncwò yé zɔ̌ cʉŋte yé.
en: not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńto ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ ne ńzsé ngie: Ànò gie ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn la gegé pà*farisay tɛ’?
en: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mé ge gÿo pú tsɔ́’ɔ kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ la tè pye.
en: But he answered and said,Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.

ngiemboon: Pi nyé wɔ́b! Pɔ́ ée pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g pie é kíbe pwó petsɔ́. Àfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g lɔɔn ńkíbe pwó wetsɔ́, mbà pɔ́b yé mépʉ́a ge cʉ́me tsɛ̀ɛ gem.
en: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Kyagte sagá nò yɛ̂ shwóŋó wég.
en: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ńzsé ngie sí legye nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g pá’ se petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwaa?
en: And Jesus said,Are ye also yet without understanding?

ngiemboon: Àmmó fó ncwò nyìŋ ńcʉa, ńkúu lepfòm yé, ḿbiŋ fó lepfòm yé ńkẅɛ, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kwɛ.
en: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?

ngiemboon: Tá’, àmmó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkẅɛ, a fóo tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, yɛ̌ zɔ̌ ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ngàŋ.
en: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.

ngiemboon: Á nue menkwaŋá tepòŋ zɔɔn ńkẅɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ, mɛ̌ zɔ̌ tsóte nyìŋ á zẅé wetsɔ̌, á gÿo gÿɛ́, mbàŋa fa’ pànzwě, pànzwě fa’ mbàŋa, á jʉ, ńcÿɔ nò á jʉ’ gie mé ŋaga mentsaŋ wó, ńtÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ.
en: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:

ngiemboon: Gyá shúm sie é ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ á ná nyìŋ, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjÿó shúm té sɔg mbwó pá’ mà lá’ wege ne ńzɛ́te, á le ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná yé wɔ́.
en: these arethe thingswhich defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa ná tsɔ́ pàga ngwòŋ, á shÿó tÿǒsoŋ Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ,
en: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, àtsɔ̌ manzwě Kanaan fó wó ńtó, ńzye léga’te, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd! E*Ssé tepòŋ pǔ ne ńgege míŋ wɔ̀ɔn we manzwě tɛ’.
en: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord,thouSon of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yěsô jú’, ḿbú tè pÿɛ.*Ngàŋa kwò yé tóo lejʉ́ŋ ye, ésẅíŋte yé, ḿbú’ mbwó ngie: Gÿo manzwě wɛ̂ gʉa, à ne ńcu’u twó yégè.
en: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: E Ssé la túmo wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwó*menjʉ̀njÿò mie é la pyé tsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀ ndá pà Israel.
en: But he answered and said,I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Tá’ manzwě awɛ̌ tó, ńkẅí’te mvfò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn!
en: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Á té poŋo lekẅé shúm léjÿó penkʉ́, ḿma’a mbwó ngwé wɔ́.
en: But he answered and said,It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to castitto dogs.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: À Nde, ɔ̀ gɔɔn shwóŋó nò tá’, ngwé ké ńdagte mesɔ́ɔn shúm mie éfóo ndùm tápele tá wɔb ńgwete ssé.
en: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn! Ɔ̀ záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ tɛ’. Á poŋ ngie àmmó gie ɔ̀ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn á pumte! Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, míŋ manzwě wá gwóon ńzeŋe pɔ́ kwà’ fʉ̀’ó.
en: Then Jesus answered and said unto her,O woman, greatisthy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt.And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ sie ée Galilea, ńkwɔ́’ tà ńkúu ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.

ngiemboon: Menùɔ lá’ tó, ńgwaa tó, ńdɔg pàpwɔ́’te mekwò, pâ pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, pâ megàŋ*melɔ̌’, pâ pàtámbǎ’, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ megàŋa guɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo mvfò Yěsô pú’u, á gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe metsèm.
en: And great multitudes came unto him, having with themthose that werelame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus' feet; and he healed them:

ngiemboon: Pàtámbǎ’ gɔɔn nò, mekÿǒon zeŋe, pàpwɔ́’te mekwò giŋ mboŋó, pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gyá jʉ’ mboŋó. Àlá’ gyá ḿmɔɔn tɛ’, ńgu’te Ssé pà Israel.
en: insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mezìŋe lá’ yɔɔn pǔ ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, mélà’ mie ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá, pá’ pɔ́ ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńké tè nyé ńgẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pfɛ́ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa nzyè, mbà pɔ́ té gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgʉa tà ńkú wɔ́.
en: Then Jesus called his disciplesunto him, and said,I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: Ńgwɔ́ peg lɔg mbelég nzɔ̌, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ wɔɔn, ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́g nzẅìŋ lá’ yɔɔn tà pɔ́ zẅɛ́?
en: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gẅiin mbelég jʉ’ɛ mbu’ú shÿɔ́’ɔ? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg gẅiin mbelég mbu’ú sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńgíŋe ńgÿo mbɔɔ ntá’ membaŋ ssó.
en: And Jesus saith unto them,How many loaves have ye?And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi ngie àlá’ ńnéŋe ssé,
en: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńkẅé mbelég ŋwɛ́ mbu’ú sɔɔn mbʉ́a lê messó má, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńnáa mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé, pɔ́ gaba mbwó lá’.
en: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brakethem, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm pú ḿpfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́, mé piŋ ńcú’te pfwɔ’ á lúe metúŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the brokenmeatthat was left seven baskets full.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó lâ mbàŋa ntsá’ lekùɔ, té sáŋ penkʉ́ lâ pànzwě.
en: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi lá’ gʉa, á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Magadaŋ.
en: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay lâ pà*sadukay tó ńzẅí’ ncwò Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie à nyɛɛ wɔ́b liŋé gie á la’te ngie Ssé zɔ túmo yé.
en: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á gʉa ncwò nzém gẅie lefaŋ é selé ḿbaŋ pi gɔɔn ngie: Njÿó ge lʉ́a àlyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ zɔ́g ḿboŋ.
en: He answered and said unto them,When it is evening, ye say,It will befair weather: for the sky is red.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ mba’ámba’ gẅie lefaŋ é pǎŋ sîŋ sǐŋ pi gɔɔn ngie: Àlyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ té ge zɔ́g poŋ wɔ́. Pi gwɔ́ tà ńdíe lefaŋ, ńgwóon ńzsé pá’ àlyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ge gÿo gwɔ́ pú’u, tá ńgʉa nà shúm sie e Ssé ne ńnyɛɛ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pi tè zsé mmó gie sɛ̌ shúm lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And in the morning,It will befoul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. Oyehypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye notdiscernthe signs of the times?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njyó fʉ’ɔɔn pie ée pʉ̀a tepòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké ne ńtʉʉ twó mbwó Ssé tʉ ne ńzɛ́te ngie: Mèŋ n nyɛɛ liŋé. Tá mé té ge nyɛɛ wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, tà ńdí ndà’ nò gie á la gÿo Jonase. Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńnyé wɔ́b jʉ’ó ńgʉa.
en: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas.And he left them, and departed.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńtúm letʉŋ yɔ́b, ńgwaa túm, ńdege té pí mbelég.
en: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pʉ̀a*farisay lâ pʉ̀a*sadukay.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’, ńdeen ńké ne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie, ndyɛ̌’ à gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ, mélà’mie pege ně ńdege té pí mbelég.
en: And they reasoned among themselves, saying,It isbecause we have taken no bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé pá’ pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa pú’u, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ mboŋó wɔ́. Pi kwaŋa pɔ́ nò mbelég gie pi tè gẅiin mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Whichwhen Jesus perceived, he said unto them,O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ ḿbú ńnyé pɔ́ tè zsě nò gwáa? Ńzsé ngie pi kaa kímte mbelég yá mbu’ú ntʉ̀a, pá’ mèŋ n ka lɔg ńjÿɔ́g mbàŋa ntsá’ tʉ̀a la wɔ́ kěen? Pi laa lyɛ̌’ó pá’a ńdag mekèm, é kẅɛ metúŋ meshÿɔ́’ɔ léen,
en: Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pi kaa kímte mbelég yá mbu’ú sɔɔn mbʉ́a, pá’ mèŋ n ka lɔg ńjÿɔ́g mbàŋa ntsá’ lekùɔ la wɔ́ keen? Pi laa lyɛ̌’ó pá’a ńdág mekèm, é kẅɛ metúŋ meshÿɔ́’ɔ léen.
en: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́, pi tè jú’ ngie mèŋ n tě ńgɔɔn nò nà mbelég wɔ́? Mèŋ n giŋé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi pɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pà*farisay lâ pà*sadukay.
en: How is it that ye do not understand that I spakeitnot to you concerning bread, that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké ńjú’ ngie, á kě tě ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ lɔg ńcwoŋte mbelég wɔ́. Á kě ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn mmó gie pà*farisay lâ pà*sadukay zí’i pʉ̀a.
en: Then understood they how that he badethemnot beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu Sezare gẅie Filib lɔ̌ɔn sá’a, ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Àlá’ áa pá’ɔɔn ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ aa wɔ̌?
en: When Jesus came into the coasts of Cæsarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying,Whom do men say that I the Son of man am?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pÿɛ ngie: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Jâŋ Mbabtis, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ*Elîɛ, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Yeremi, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ nà pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: And they said, Somesay that thou artJohn the Baptist: some, Elias; and others, Jeremias, or one of the prophets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌?
en: He saith unto them,But whom say ye that I am?

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, Míŋ Ssé gie ee wó.
en: And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Símo míŋ Jâŋ, ɔ́ɔ shÿó mbòŋo, á nue nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ kaa gÿo, tá ɔ̀ zsé yɔɔn nò nénʉ́ wɔ́. Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ nyɛ̌ gú.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto him,Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-jona: for flesh and blood hath not revealeditunto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: N ge ké gíŋe shwóŋó ɔ́, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Piɛ, ńdɔgɔ ngie tóon, mèŋ n ge gÿo tÿɔ́gɔ cú’te pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn ndùm tóon ŋwɛ́. Tà mbɔɔ legwé lelá’ ńku’u lénʉ’te yɛ̌ cú’tè wɔ́.
en: And I say also unto thee, That thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo ná metsɔ́’ɔ lélɔg ńtsɔ́’ nzsè*lefùɔ Ssé á mbwó gù. Àmmó gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo lʉ’ʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mé gÿo ńdʉ’ʉ tÿǒ lepwó. Àmmó gie ɔ̀ ge zẅíŋe á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ mé ge gÿo zẅíŋe tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅiŋe*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie, tà pɔ́ kím tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌, Yěsô Kristo shʉashʉa ḿbÿe mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie à gʉa Yerósalem. À ge kúu wó gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’ mbwó mekěme lá’, pâ*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, mbɔɔ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pɔ́ gÿo mé zẅé yé. A piŋ nzime na legwé na ḿbɔ́ɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńtóŋo yé ntsem, ńzye lékaga yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tà Ssé zẅíŋ yɛ̌ ntí nò gÿo gú! Ńgwɔ́ á le gwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́.
en: Then Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall not be unto thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ńgɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Fó nzèm mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́ me Sátà! Ɔ̀ cʉ’ʉ́ ńtate wɔ̀ɔn taté. Ɔ̀ tě ńkwaŋa pɛ́’ɛ, á gwɔ́ pá’ Ssé ne ńkwaŋa wɔ́, wɛ̂ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwaŋá pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: But he turned, and said unto Peter,Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn nge gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ, á gwága twó mbùm yé, ńkaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ ńdɔg ńzẅíŋe lékwé, tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: Then said Jesus unto his disciples,If anymanwill come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie á ge zɔɔn fa’a lépɔ́ɔn we le gwɔ́, zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ge pyé we le gwɔ́ wó ŋwɛ́. Tá’ nyìŋ gẅie à kě ḿbyé we le gwɔ́ wó mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, mbà wɛ̌ nyìŋ ge lá’ gwɔ́ wɔ́.
en: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿbú ńkaa njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm ńná né nyìŋ, tá’ á ké ńgwɔ́ gie e ge lɔg pɔ́ twó yé, mbà á ge kẅéte yé nà kɔ́? À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńdɔg ńkúbe twó yé?
en: For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ pâ mecÿɔ́’ pé ge gÿo tó, á tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ Tá we, à leen ńké ńtsɔ́’ɔ fà’a wɔwɔ́, pɔ́ nà ngÿǒ menò mé.
en: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then he shall reward every man according to his works.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, etsɔ́ ntá’ ná pʉ̀a pie ée jʉ’ɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn té gÿo kwé, té gwɔ́ gie pɔ́ gyǎ pá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ tǒ pá’ fùɔ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ ntɔgɔ́, Yěsô faga Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâg, ńgÿo Jâŋ á gwɔ́ fɛ́ Jâg, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa ńkwɔ́’ɔ nà tsɔ̌ mâ lekwɛ́. Pâ pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó gíle pɔ́b.
en: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá àliŋé Yěsô pú sele mvfò pɔ́b, eshÿó wé ŋwʉŋe pá’ nèm la. Menzsǒ mé pú fɔ́g tà ńkyɛ’ jʉ’.
en: and was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá, mbà Mǒsê pɔ́*Elîɛ vegé vege ńkẅɛ, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe.
en: And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ḿvege vege, ńgɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á pǒŋ pá’ pege ee jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn. Zẅíŋe mèŋ n juŋ*mentàb méntá, tà’ gwɔ́ jù, tà’ gwɔ́ ye Mǒsê, yetsɔ́ gwɔ́ ye*Elîɛ.
en: Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

ngiemboon: Á nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, etsɔ́ melɔ́ɔn, mie é ŋwʉŋe ŋwʉŋe sẅɛ́’ ńkábte wɔ́b, ngyè nyìŋ fó tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo yé tɛ’, aa wɔ̀ɔn lekág, pi jú’ ncwò wé.
en: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gwóon ńjú’u yɔɔn nò, ńgwe ssé, ésɔb shÿó wɔ́b ssé, ḿbú ne ḿbɔ́gɔ tɛ’.
en: And when the disciples heardit, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tó, ńzába pwó ná pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi lute ssé, tà pi gíŋe ḿbɔ́g.
en: And Jesus came and touched them, and said,Arise, and be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pʉ’ʉ twó yɔ́b ńnáŋte, ńcʉ́’ ńgyá pɔ́ Yěsô gíle yé.
en: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ gÿo ne fóo ndùm lekwɛ́ ńcwóŋo, á tsẅiŋe wɔ́b ngie, tà pɔ́ kím tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ lwo ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ gyǎ, tà ndá’ ńkú fʉ̀’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ zimé nà legwé.
en: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying,Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tà mélà’a kɔ́*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gɔɔn ngie*Elîɛ ge lá’ vɔg tó?.
en: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi shwóŋó nò, à*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé*Elîɛ vɔgɔ ńtóo, lézába kɔ́ɔkɔ́ nà yé jʉ’.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí,*Elîɛ kěen ńtó, epʉ̀a té yé zẅíŋ, ńnyɛɛ yé ngɔ́’ pá’ pɔ́ kwǒŋ, pɔ́ ge gÿo gíŋe nyɛɛ*Míŋ Nyìŋ ngɔ́’ pɔ́ pú’u,
en: But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed. Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.

ngiemboon: ńgɔ́ɔn pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé leen ńké ńjú’ ngie à gɔɔn pá’a pɔ́ Jâŋ Mbabtis.
en: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie lá’ laa wó, àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ tó ńkẅí’te mvfò Yěsô,
en: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him acertainman, kneeling down to him, and saying,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: A nde, tsétsɔ’, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn, aa ngwègwá’. À gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, à gwǎ ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g, tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse.
en: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ně ńdɔgɔ yé ńtóo mvfò*ngàŋa kwò jú, tá’ pɔ́ té ku’u légÿo á zeŋe wɔ́.
en: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ngie: Yee! Pi pʉ̀a ngù’ɔɔn, pi tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ, aa pá’ɔɔn pege lá’ ńnéŋe tà ńkú pɔ́ síŋe? Mèŋ n ge lá’ shÿɔgɔ ná menò mí tà kú pɔ́ síŋe? Pi lɔgɔ múɔ ŋwɛ́ ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn ńná né mèŋ.
en: Then Jesus answered and said,O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ yé ńtó, Yěsô cÿɔ́g*ssé tepòŋ, é kẅɛɛ ná múɔ ŋwɛ́, á gwóon sẅéte pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó.
en: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.

ngiemboon: Pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgwɔ́ gíle pɔ́b, pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Àkɔ́ ně ńgÿo, peg tè ku’u léjwoŋ*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ wɔ́?
en: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Ee, mélà’mie pi záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé pɔ́ méjʉ’ lepile. Pi lɔɔn fó ńzáb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé pɔ́ méjʉ’ pá’ lesɔ́ɔn sésɔg, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi gɔɔn né lekwɛ́ sɛ̂ ngie: Tsɔ́’ɔ ńgʉa ńtyé jʉ’ʉ, é gʉa ńtyé jʉ’ó. Mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ nò á le lá’ ńcʉa gẅi wɔ. [
en: And Jesus said unto them,Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà yɛ̂ ntí*ssé tepòŋ, mbà nyìŋ lɔɔn tè zɔ́g nzyè, ńké sẅíŋte pɔ́ Ssé, tá ńjwoŋ wɔ́ é le kẅɛ.]
en: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô pú ńcú’te Galilea, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔb ngie: Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them,The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo à kwé, a piŋ ngwɔ́ ḿbɔ́ɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá á zíme na le gwe.*Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿɔg tɛ’.
en: and they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again.And they were exceeding sorry.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu Kapernawúm, pàkẅé ncùb*jʉ’ʉ Ssé tó ńzɛ́te Piɛ ngie: Tá gẅi aa ntě ńnáa yé ncùb*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́ ka?.
en: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tributemoneycame to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa nâ nǎ, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńkúu ndá, ńnyé pɔ́ tè ŋǎ’ ncwò wé, Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Símo, ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie kɔ́. Áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó yɔɔn pé’e, pàwɔ̌ ma’ ncùb ntÿɔ́’ lâ tsɔ́ mencùb, ńná né mefùɔ? Pàlá’ pé ka pàlá’a ntÿɔ́’ɔ?
en: He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying,What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Pʉ̀a lá’a ntÿɔ́’ zɔ̌ ná. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pʉ̀a lá’ té ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin lénáa tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, á té pú’u wɔ́ ka?
en: Peter saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him,Then are the children free.

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà pɔgɔ gÿo nò pÿɔ́g pàkẅé ncùb. Gʉa ntse ḿma’ lezɔ́b. Ɔ̀ ge gwoon ndùŋ mvfò mbab ssó, é nyɛ́’ ncwò we, é gyá pàga nkáb, é kẅile lɔg gʉa ma’ yɔgɔ ncùb.
en: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Àwɔ̌ aa nyìŋ ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo mùɔ memúɔ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò pɔ́b,
en: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi lɔɔn tè kúbe mà gẅí, tà ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ gubé wɔ́, mbà pi tě ndá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́.
en: and said,Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅe’é mbùm yé ńnáa ssé tà ńcʉ́’ pá’ cʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ yɔɔn la, aa nyìŋ gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńkúe mùɔ memúɔ pá’ wɔɔn lɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à kě ńtsóte tsɔ̌ tà’ nà mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ pɔɔn pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, ńtsóte wɔ́b légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge fʉa nò, mbà mvfò áa pá’ ngwɔ́ me cʉŋé máamáa tóon lóŋ ngàŋ, ńtsó yé, ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ mí á jʉ’ʉ zème.
en: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, andthathe were drowned in the depth of the sea.

ngiemboon: Ndoon ee two pʉa pie pɔ ee tsɛ yɔɔn njÿo, ńgÿo pʉa fʉate meno! Aa nenʉ meno mie é lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é gÿo nyìŋ fʉa manzse, ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Mɛ̌ menò téen ndá’a ńzága wɔ́. Tá’ àshÿó tepòŋ ké ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie a ge gÿo nyìŋ fʉa manzse!
en: Woe unto the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ gie apwó ɔ́ ka kwò ɔ́ wɔ́, à tsóte ɔ́, ɔ̀ fʉ́a nò, ɔ̀ zá’ ńgwá’ á taataa ngʉ́a shʉ̀shʉ̀a. Mvfò aa gú légwɔ́ kème pwó ka kème kwò wɔ́, ndá’ ńgwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, ɔ̀ gẅiin mbwó mú mémbʉ́a ka mekwò mú mémbʉ́a wɔ́, ndá’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g gẅie e tě ndá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and castthemfrom thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ gie lejÿɔ́g shú tsóte ɔ́, ɔ̀ fʉa nò, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ ńgwá’ á ngʉa shʉ̀shʉ̀a. Mvfò aa gú légwɔ́ pyé lejÿɔ́g ndá’ ńgwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa gú légẅiin menÿɔ́g mémbʉ́a, ndá’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g.
en: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and castitfrom thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí légwága tsɔ̌ tà’ ná gígyé penkʉ́ pɔɔn. Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie é lie wɔ́b tyé mvfo Ssé fʉ’ ntsem. [
en: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Á nue*Míŋ Nyìŋ la tó pɔ́ léfa’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kúu pyé é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́]
en: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ m bíge gẅi yɔɔn nò: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngwe’e ńgẅiin*menjʉ̀njÿò mé nkÿo, tà’ pyé, mbà à ge gaa? Mbà à tè nyé metsɔ́ ntsɔ́b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, é gʉa fa’ gie pyě wɔ́?
en: How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, à fa’ yɛ̌ tà ńgyá, mbà à ge pú kága ná yɛ̌, é cʉa petsɔ́ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ pie é kaa pyé.
en: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of thatsheep, than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá, Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó tè kwoŋ ngie tsɔ̌ tà’ nà gubé yé pyé wɔ́.
en: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.

ngiemboon: Àfɛ́ gù lɔɔn gÿo no tepoŋ na gù, ɔ̀ gʉa ńgyá yé, pi yé tyé jʉ’ mépʉ́a, ɔ̀ shwóŋó yé. Á jú’, tà ńzẅíŋe mefʉa, mbà ɔ̀ kẅilé yé ná mánzsè tepòŋ
en: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńké tè jù’ ɔ̀ fa’a tà’ nyìŋ ka pʉ̀a mépʉ́a wɔ́, ńzsé «ngie mé ge gwɔ shwóŋó yɔɔn nò pànjÿò ngyá é gwɔ́ ssé mépʉ́a ka métá wɔ́».
en: But if he will not hearthee, thentake with thee one or two more, that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

ngiemboon: Tá’ á ké ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ yɔɔn nò ńgʉa*ndá cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé. Á piŋ ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò gie cú’tè á gɔ̌ɔn, ɔ̀ cʉ́’ ńdíe yé pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à tè Ssé zsé, ka pɔ́ pá’ mé líe nkẅè ncùb pà*Roma wɔ́.
en: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tellitunto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńgyá nò tà ńdʉ’ʉ yɛ̌ nò ndùmo ssé tsétsa’, mbà mé ge gíŋe lʉ’ʉ tÿǒ lepwó. Pi ké ńgyá nò tà ńzẅíŋe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà mé ge gíŋe zẅíŋe yɛ̌ nò tÿǒ lepwó
en: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ nénʉ́, mèŋ n giŋé shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Epʉ̀a mépʉ́a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà’ ncwò á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ jʉ’ɔɔn, ńdúɔ pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ mbwó Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́, mbà à ge ná á mbwó pɔ́b.
en: Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Àjʉ’ gie pʉ̀a mépʉ́a ka pʉ̀a métá wɔ́, cu’té wó nà lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńtó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: À Nde, àfɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn lɔɔn fʉa nò mbwó mèŋ, mèŋ n dege ńnáa mbwó yé ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ? Ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a kêen
en: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ, mèŋ tè gɔɔn ngie ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a ndà’ wɔ́, mèŋ n ge gɔɔn ngie ngʉ̀a móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: Jesus saith unto him,I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá nò*lefùɔ Ssé sẅé nò tsɔ̌ fùɔ gẅie, à la ne ńkwoŋo ngie pafa’a fa’ yé tó pâ pɔ́ sáŋ shúm sé sie ée mbwó pɔ́b pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ńná,
en: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńzye, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ńtóo mvfò yé, pɔ́ yé gẅiin nkáb ta é gwɔ́ memileyoŋ.
en: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

ngiemboon: À tè gẅiin nkáb lélɔg ńtoŋ njǔ yé wɔ́, àfùɔ tsẅi ngie mé sẅiŋe yé, ésẅiŋe nzwě we, pâ penkʉ́ pé, tà mbɔɔ kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie à gẅiin, ńdɔg ńtoŋ njǔ ye.
en: But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

ngiemboon: Tá ngàŋ jú’ ńgwe ssé mvfò fùɔ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ànkwɔbɔ́, mé ná’a shÿɔg ńzẅi’te wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n ge gÿo toŋ tà e mag!
en: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe mé kúu fùɔ, á nyé nkab ye mbwo, ńnyé ye á gʉa.
en: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.

ngiemboon: Tá ngàŋa fà’ wa fó mvfò fùɔ ńgʉa ńkúu mánzsè, ḿbumte tsɔ̌ shǔ we ngàŋa fà’, mbà wɛ̌ ngàŋa fà’ la tó ńkẅé nkáb yé ta é gwɔ́ mmo ntsá’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Á pumte yé pú’u, ńgwoon yé, ńtÿɔ́g ngàg lóŋ yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ná nkáb yɔ̀ɔn ma pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and tookhimby the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wa gwe mvfò yé, ésẅíŋte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Ná’a shÿɔg ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n ge gÿo ná nkáb jù.
en: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

ngiemboon: A te lʉ’ lʉ’ nda’ wɔ́, efó ngiŋe ńdɔgɔ ye ngʉa ma’a nda tsǎŋ.
en: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ megàŋa fà’ fùɔ gyá, á pÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b, tà pɔ́ gʉa ḿbú ḿbíte mmó gie á cʉ̌a éshwóŋó fùɔ.
en: So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.

ngiemboon: Àfùɔ tsẅi mé gʉa ńgwoon wɛ̌ nyìŋ ndɔg ńtó, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tè tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe, mèŋ n ně ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mú, ńnyé nkáb yɔ̀ɔn mbwó gù, mélà’mie ɔ̀ ně sẅíŋte wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ kaa tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe shǔ gù, pá’ n ně ńtsɔ́ɔn mú jú wɔ́?
en: shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò pú ńgyáŋa fùɔ, á túm mé gʉa ńnéŋe yé tsǎŋ, lényɛɛ yé ngɔ́’ tà ńkú fʉ̀’ gie à pǔ ńtoŋ ye njǔ.
en: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, à ge gÿo nà wɔ̌wɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pá’ à lɔɔn tè lege mefʉa fɛ́ we nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m we ntsèm wɔ́.
en: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la ná mɔɔn mentÿɔgɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, éfó Galilea ńkẅɛ, ńdɔg shÿó Jẅidea ńgʉa, á nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: And it came to pass,thatwhen Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Judæa beyond Jordan;

ngiemboon: Àlá’ cʉ́me nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Á kúu wó ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ nùɔ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ná nùɔ pà*farisay tó yɔ́b, ńkwa’te Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tà áa pé’e*lepʉ̌ sége zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwě we tà mbɔɔ ná yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ gie à fʉ̌a?
en: The Pharisees also came unto him, tempting him, and saying unto him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi tè tóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé ńjú’ wɔ́ ka? Mé la ŋwe’e ngie: «E Ssé la fó nùŋe ngwòŋ ḿbwóon mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě».
en: And he answered and said unto them,Have ye not read, that he which madethemat the beginning made them male and female,

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo nyìŋ ńnéŋe tà fag nnɛ́ ye ná tá we pɔ́ má we, ńgʉa ńda nnɛ́ ná we manzwě, pɔ́ yé temte ńcʉ́’ʉ tà’ nyìŋ
en: and said, For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?

ngiemboon: Á fó ná fʉ̀’ó pɔ́ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a wɔ́, pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ. Pú’u la, nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ɔn léfege mmó gie Ssé temté.
en: Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà mélà’a kɔ́, Mǒsê la gɔɔn ngie: «Mé náa ŋwà’ne á mbwó manzwě lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: They say unto him, Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mǒsê lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à la gyá ngie pi tʉʉ twó mbwó Ssé tà á cʉa. Tá á zẅíŋ ngie pi jwóŋ mezwě pí, mbà á la fó nùŋe ngwòŋ ńké tè pú’u, wɔ́.
en: He saith unto them,Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.
