ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo nzwě we té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie à gÿǒ gÿɛ́, ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌, mbà ngàŋ gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́
en: And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, exceptit befor fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Àlɔ́ɔn ndá lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, ḿba mvfò nyìŋ léńnéŋe té zɔ́’.
en: His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so withhiswife, it is not good to marry.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pʉ̀a metsèm zɔ̌ té ku’u lézẅíŋe yɔɔn nò wɔ́. Tá e Ssé kě ńne ńgÿo, étsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ku’u mǒ.
en: But he said unto them,Allmencannot receive this saying, savetheyto whom it is given.

ngiemboon: Eshúm sie é gÿo pʉ̀a té zɔ́’, gwɔ́ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn: Á gʉa nà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pɔ́ té ku’u lézɔ́’ wɔ́ tà fó pɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzye, ńgʉa nà petsɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ̌ la gÿo, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa nà petsɔ́, mbà pɔ́ la zẅíŋe légwɔ́ pú’u, ntíi nò*lefùɔ Ssé. Nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ lézẅíŋe yɔɔn nò à zẅíŋ.
en: For there are some eunuchs, which were so born fromtheirmother's womb: and there are some eunuchs, which were made eunuchs of men: and there be eunuchs, which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven's sake. He that is able to receiveit, let him receiveit.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gÿo ne ńdɔgɔ gubé ńtóo mvfò Yěsô légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ záb mbwó ná pɔ́b, é ne sẅíŋte Ssé. Tá*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b.
en: Then were there brought unto him little children, that he should puthishands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi nyé gubé pɔ́ tó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn, tà pi táte wɔ́b, èpʉ̀a pie ée pá’ gubé zɔ̌ gẅiin nò ná*lefùɔ Ssé,
en: But Jesus said,Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzáb mbwó mé ná pɔ́b, tà á ku’ á fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa.
en: And he laidhishands on them, and departed thence.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ gÿo ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo kɔ́ nò mbòŋo tà ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmí?
en: And, behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ zɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn nò ná mmó gie áa mbòŋ? Nyìŋ mbòŋo gwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi Ssé gwɔ́, ɔ̀ kú’te mbʉ̌ mé.
en: And he said unto him,Why callest thou me good?there isnone good but one,that is, God: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te ngie: É mɛ̌ mbʉ̌? Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: «Tè zẅé nyìŋ, tè gÿo gÿɛ́, tè jʉ́, tè tÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ
en: He saith unto him, Which? Jesus said,Thou shalt do no murder, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,

ngiemboon: Ná mekù’ tá gù, pɔ́ má gù, kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú».
en: Honour thy father andthymother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ shùm ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ, n gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ ku’té ntsèm, àkɔ́ nyé ńzága wɔ̀ɔn?
en: The young man saith unto him, All these things have I kept from my youth up: what lack I yet?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne fa’a lémege ńcʉ́me, ɔ̀ gʉa sẅiŋ shúm sie ɔ̀ gẅiin ntsèm, ńná nkáb mbwó pàtèmmó, ńdeen ńké ndá’ ńgẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tÿǒ lepwó. Gʉa ńgÿo pú’u, ḿbiŋ ńtó ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: Jesus said unto him,If thou wilt be perfect, goandsell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and comeandfollow me.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ shùm jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋó, eshÿó wé sẅɛ́’, á tém nzèm ńgʉa, mélà’mie à la gẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tɛ’.
en: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie: Á tʉʉ mbwó ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie e Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: Then said Jesus unto his disciples,Verily I say unto you, That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n ge gíŋ ńnyɛte shwóŋó gẅi ngie, á zeŋe mbwó shÿɔ́ɔ léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwòŋ lesyɛ’ɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’u yɔɔn nò, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: When his disciples heardit, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô líe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Á cʉa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, e Ssé ku’u légÿo kɔ́ɔkɔ́.
en: But Jesus beheldthem, and said unto them,With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: Tà peg leen nyé shúm ntsèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn, tà yég nò ge lá’ gwɔ́ lêkɔ?
en: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee; what shall we have therefore?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mé ge lá’ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé,*Míŋ Nyìŋ ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ yé gie á gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g, pi pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém pie pi la cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, gíŋe ńnéŋe gí nà melʉŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńŋag pʉ̀a Israel, ngẅɛ̀ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém
en: And Jesus said unto them,Verily I say unto you, That ye which have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ngiemboon: Àwɔ̌wɔɔ gẅie à la nyé mendá, ńnyé mefɛ́ pé pe mbàŋa mbɔɔ pe pànzwě, ka pɔ́ tá we, ka pɔ́ má we, ka pɔ́ penkʉ́ pé, ka pɔ́ menká’ mé wɔ́, ntí lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, à ge lá’ gíŋe gẅiin sɛ̌ shúm ngʉ̀a nkÿo, é gíŋe gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmi.
en: And every one that hath forsaken houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name's sake, shall receive an hundredfold, and shall inherit everlasting life.

ngiemboon: Tá’ lelÿò pàgwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ge lá’ cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ nzèm, lelÿò pàgwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀’ɔɔn e lá’ ńgwɔ́ pàgwɔ́ mvfó
en: But manythat arefirst shall be last; and the lastshall befirst.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé leen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nò tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à la mʉ́ mba’ámba’, ńgʉa fa’ megàŋa fà’ pie à ge ńnéŋe nká’ yé.
en: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a manthat isan householder, which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard.

ngiemboon: Pâ megàŋa fà’ lʉ’te pá’ à ge náa tà’a pàga nkába mbwó tà’ nyìŋ ná lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’. Á leen ńké ńtsẅi pɔ́ gʉa né nká’ yé.
en: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

ngiemboon: Nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ piŋ ńku’, á gíŋe ńkẅɛɛ mbʉ̀a yé, ńgyá tsɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ gíŋe ńtyé mefagá nzsè, pɔ́ té ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa gí nká’ mèŋ fa’a fà’. Mèŋ n ge gÿo lʉŋte gẅi ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ ná fà’a gí.
en: and said unto them; Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gʉa né nká’. Àngàŋ nká’ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ, ńgíŋe ńkẅɛɛ mbʉ̀a yé, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ mbÿɛ̀ njÿó ná nèm tá, ńgíŋe ńkẅɛ, ńgyá megàŋa fà’ fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, ńgɔɔn pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzèm ná nèm tʉ̀a, ńkẅɛ, ńgyá tsɔ́ megàŋa fà’ tyé, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi tyé jʉ’ yɛ tà fó mba’ámba’ té ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó?
en: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Á gwǎ gwɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ kaa tóŋo wég nà fà’ wɔ́. Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pí gʉa gí nká’ mèŋ fa’a fà’.
en: They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard; and whatsoever is right,thatshall ye receive.

ngiemboon: Àfʉ̀’ ye létsɔ́’ɔ fà’ ku’, àngàŋ nká’ tsẅii mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à líe shúm sé ngie: Tóŋ megàŋa fà’, ńná nkáb yɔb, zye ná pʉ̀a pie mèŋ n toŋó wɔ́b nà fà’ pɔ́ nzèm la, ńgʉa ńkúu ná pʉ̀a pie mèŋ n ně ńzye ná pɔ́b
en: So when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the labourers, and give themtheirhire, beginning from the last unto the first.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zyě yɔ́b fà’ ná nèm tʉ̀a ncwò nzém tó, mé náa tà’a pàga nkáb mbwó wɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b.
en: And when they came thatwere hiredabout the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ně ḿvɔg ńzye fà’ gwɔ tó yɔ́b, ńně ńkwaŋa ngie yɔb nkáb ge ná’a gyɔ́ɔn, tá mé gíŋe ńná pɔ́ tà’a pàga nkáb mbwó wɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b.
en: But when the first came, they supposed that they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa kẅé lóŋ wɔb ne ńgyáŋa ńtí ngàŋ nká’.
en: And when they had receivedit, they murmured against the goodman of the house,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pɛ̂ tǒ pɔ́ nzèm, pɔ́ fǎ’ pɔ́ ndà’ ná tà’ nèm, ɔ̀ kě ńgíŋe ḿbéen wɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ peg lá, tá mbà peg ně ńzye fà’ tsɛ̀ɛ mba’ámba’, peg kě ńzɔ́g fa’ pɔ́ tè zẅɛte, nèm ne ńtuɔ wég.
en: saying, These last have wroughtbutone hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nká’ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b ngie: Àshǔ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kaa tsɔ́ nò mbwó gù fʉa. Pɔgɔ ně ńdʉ’te tà ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ, pá’ ɔ̀ ge kẅé tà’a pàga nkáb nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.
en: But he answered one of them, and said, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?

ngiemboon: Kɔ̀ nkáb jù, éfó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́. Á gʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à tǒ pɔ́ nzèm, mbà mèŋ n gyǎ ngie mèŋ n ge ná ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mmó gie mèŋ n nǎ mbwó gù á mbwó yé.
en: Takethatthineis, and go thy way: I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gẅiin lélɔg nkáb yɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n kwǒŋ, á té pú’u, wɔ́ ka? Ka ɔ̀ gyáŋa lóŋ ńtí pɔ́ nò gie ɔ̀ gyǎ n gwɔ́ ngàŋa pòŋo ntʉ́m?
en: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa pú’u tá pàgwɔ́ nzèm ge lá’ cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ mvfò, pàgwɔ́ mvfò e cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ nzèm
en: So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many be called, but few chosen.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem, éfag*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, pâ pɔ́ ne ńgiŋe, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’ mboŋó, pege ee mánzsè ne ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem pá’ɔɔn, é kúu wó, mé sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ á mbwó*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ paa*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê. Pɔ́ ŋaga yé, ńzáb ngie à ge kwé,
en: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,

ngiemboon: ńnáa yé mbwó pàtèzsé Ssé, pɔ́ zoonte yé, ńdɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúɔ yé, ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ. A piŋ ńzíme nà legwé na ḿbɔ́ɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: and shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucifyhim: and the third day he shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Má pà Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, é gubé Zebede, leen ńké ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, ńkẅí’te ssé lélúɔ tsɔ́ mmó mbwó yé.
en: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee's children with her sons, worshippinghim, and desiring a certain thing of him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tsɔɔn ngie n gÿo lêkɔ́? Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie ɔ̀ zẅíŋe mbwó mèŋ ngie, ɔ̀ ge gÿo gwɔ́ fùɔ, egubé yɔ́ɔn mɔɔn yépʉ́a ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ gù, tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó jú ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó jú ye kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: And he said unto her,What wilt thou?She saith unto him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on thy right hand, and the other on the left, in thy kingdom.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi kaa zsé mmó gie pi ee pɛ́’ɛ ńdúɔ yɛ̌ wɔ́. Pi ku’u lénú ntú’ ngɔ́’ gie mèŋ n ge lénǔ? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg ku’u lénú.
en: But Jesus answered and said,Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?They say unto him, We are able.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔb ngie: Pi ge gÿo nú ntú’ yɔ̀ɔn. Tá, ńgʉa nà leneŋé nyìŋ nà gwoŋó pwó yɔ́ɔn ye tʉ̀ ka pɔ́ ye kyɛ̀bɛ wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n zɔ tè gẅiin léná né nyìŋ wɔ́. Tá wɔ̀ɔn zɔ ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie à la nyɛte sɛ̌ jʉ’ ńdɔgɔ ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b.
en: And he saith unto them,Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, butit shall be given to themfor whom it is prepared of my Father.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô legém gwɔ́ tà ńjú’u nò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, ńgyáŋa lóŋ ńtí wɔ́b mépʉ́a.
en: And when the ten heardit, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo wɔ́b metsèm, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ne ńzsé ngie mefùɔ pàtèzsé Ssé ne sá’a lá’, ńnɔ’ pʉ̀a nɔ’, memáa pʉ̀a ne sẅɛ́ɛ lá’ sẅɛ́
en: But Jesus called themunto him, and said,Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké te poŋ ngie á gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńgwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á póŋ ngie à cʉ́’ʉ menkʉ́ gẅie.
en: But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ná pi lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á poŋ ngie á zẅíŋe légwɔ́ nkwɔɔn gi
en: and whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant:

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ la te tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, pɔ́ pá’ epʉ̀a mesoŋ gee fa’a mbwó yé wɔ́, á la tó pɔ́ lefa’a mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ, éfa’ fa’ tà gíŋe náa twó yé lélɔg ncu’ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

ngiemboon: Yěsô paa*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ne foo tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yériko nkẅɛɛ, anùɔ lá’ cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pàfʉ́ menÿɔ́g mépʉ́a pie e ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, jú’ ngie Yěsô ne ncʉà jʉ’ó, ńzye lega’te, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe meg.
en: And, behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried out, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord,thouSon of David.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kaga wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ láŋte, tá pɔ́ fó mege nga’a lega’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe még.
en: And the multitude rebuked them, because they should hold their peace: but they cried the more, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord,thouSon of David.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tyé ńtóŋo wɔ́b, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi tsɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pi?
en: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said,What will ye that I shall do unto you?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gÿo ngie menÿɔ́g még gyá jʉ’.
en: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b, ńzab mbwó mé ná menÿɔ́g mɔ́b, e gwoon nzyé légyá jʉ’, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: So Jesus had compassionon them, and touched their eyes: and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ne ńkúu Yerósalem, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ shÿó Mbedfajé, á jʉ’ʉ lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive. Á leen ńké ńtúm*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a,
en: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ yɛ̂ gie áa mvfò pi lɛ, pi ge leen kúu wó é gyá nzìkásè, mbà mé ně ńcʉŋ, míŋ we gwɔ lejʉ́ŋ yé, pi kyɛ́’ɛ wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó, ńná né mèŋ.
en: saying unto them,Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loosethem, and bringthemunto me.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ, nyìŋ gɔɔn nò, pi tsɔ́’ ngie: A Ndè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn. Mbà à ge gwóon nyé pi lɔg ńgʉa.
en: And if anymansay ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò gwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie à*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la lá’ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe ndùm nzìkásè, á gwɔ́ mùɔ nzìkásè».
en: And a colt the foal of an ass.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgÿo kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô ně ńtsẅi,
en: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,

ngiemboon: ńdɔg nzìkásè pɔ́ múɔ ńtó, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔg mɔ́b nkà’ menzìkásè, Yěsô ńnéŋe nà tsɔ̌.
en: and brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they sethimthereon.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a saŋte menzsǒ mɔ́b ndùm mánzsè, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a fag mbwó tÿǒ ńtó saŋte mánzsè yɔ́b.
en: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawedthemin the way.

ngiemboon: Gugẅî mbwó Ssé tàa tÿǒ lepwó
en: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessedishe that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, àtÿǒsoŋ pú ńcʉ́’ʉ, èpʉ̀a ne ńzɛ́te ngie: Wɔɔn nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌?
en: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?

ngiemboon: Àlá’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa Yěsô á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, à fóo tÿǒsoŋo Nǎzarɛd nà pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńtág pàsẅiŋ shúm pâ pàjúu, ńtsó mekǔ metʉ̌a pàkube nkáb ḿma’a ssé, ńgíŋe ńtág melʉŋ pàsẅiŋ mekàpʉ̀ŋ ńgwá’,
en: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Mé ge lá’a tóŋo ndá yɔ̀ɔn ngie: Ndá sẅíŋtè Tá pi ne ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo nkʉ̀a metsǒŋ»
en: and said unto them,It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

ngiemboon: Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g mbɔɔ pàpwɔ́’te mekwò piŋ tóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, gyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie Yěsô gÿǒ, ńgíŋ ńjú’ pá’ penkʉ́ ée tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńzɔbɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Gugẅî, àgù’te áa mbwó nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd, ńgyáŋa lóŋ,
en: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were sore displeased,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tá ɔ̀ ne ńjú’u mmó gie penkʉ́ ne ńgɔɔn lɛ? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: N ne ńjú’u! MÀbiŋ ngie: Pi laa fó ńtóŋ nkàŋ ŋwà’ne Ssé gẅie é gɔɔn ngie: «Penkʉ́ tà mbɔɔ pûɔ mepÿɛ́, ńne ńdɔgɔ ncwò wɔ́b ńgu’te gú pá’ ɔ̀ ka tsɔ̌ɔn» wɔ ka?
en: and said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them,Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńnyé wɔ́b, éfó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ ńgʉa né Mbetáni, ńkúu wó ńdá’.
en: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a pɔ́ gwaa piŋ né tÿǒsoŋ, nzyè gyáŋa Yěsô.
en: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.

ngiemboon: Á gyá tÿǒ mbÿě ngem ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, ńgʉa tsìŋe wó, ńgyá pɔ́ ndà’ meffo mǒ, ńgɔɔn né tÿǒ ayɛ̌ ngie: Ɔ̀ tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn wɔ́! Àtÿǒ ayɛ̌ gwóon ńjúm.
en: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it,Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever.And presently the fig tree withered away.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gyá pá’ á jǔm, á pú ńcʉa wɔ́b, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Á gÿo lêkɔ́ tá tÿǒ yɔɔn tyé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ yɔɔn ńjúm?
en: And when the disciples sawit, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, tà pi tè mʉ́’te, mbà pi ge ku’u légÿo mmó gie mèŋ n gÿǒ nà tÿǒ mbÿě ngem lɔɔn. Mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi gɔɔn né lekwɛ́ sɛ̂ ngie: Fó jʉ’ɛ ńgʉa ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa! É jú’ ncwò gẅí
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do thiswhich is doneto the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ésẅíŋte yé ńdúɔ kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà à ge ná.
en: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ḿbiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé tà ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé,*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ tó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ lezíŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mɔɔn menò? Kwà’ wɔ̌ zɔ túmo ɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pú’u?
en: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ge zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò. Pi tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó mèŋ, mèŋ n deen ńké shwóŋó gẅi kwà’ nyìŋ gẅie à ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo mɔɔn menò.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Àwɔ̌ la túmo Jâŋ lénu’ pʉ̀a ntse? E Ssé ka nyìŋ mesoŋ? Pɔ́ jú’, ńkwaŋte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pege lɔɔn ngie e Ssé zɔ la túmo yé, mbà à ge zɛ́te wégè ngie tà mélà’a kɔ́ pege la tè zẅíŋe nò gie Jâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn wɔ́?
en: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men?And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà lá’ té ge nyé wégè wɔ́, mélà’mie pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ngie Jâŋ laa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwaŋ pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ pɔ́ ngie: Peg kaa zsé. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n te shwóŋó gẅi nyìŋ gẅie n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sé ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́.
en: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them,Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi jú’u yɔɔn nò, éshwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn gí nò gie pi kwaŋá mǒ. Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgẅiin penkʉ́ pé mépʉ́a, ńgɔɔn mbwó mvɔ́g mvfò ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, gʉa nká’ lyɛ̌’ yɔɔn ńzɔ́gɔ wó fa’.
en: But what think ye? Acertainman had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n dʉ̌’. Mbiŋ ńnéŋe, ńdʉa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo á gɔɔn pú’u, ńgʉa né nká’.
en: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔb gíŋe ńgɔɔn pɔ tà’a nò mbwó wetsɔ́ múɔ, wɛ̌ múɔ tsɔ́’ ngie: Oon, mèŋ n ge gʉa, tá’, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńké tè wó gʉa.
en: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, Igo, sir: and went not.

ngiemboon: Àwɔ̌ nà penkʉ́ pɔɔn mépʉ́a la gÿo mmó gie tá wɔ́b ne ńkwoŋo?*Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa ndùŋ mvfò. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pàkẅé ncùb pà*Roma pâ pàkáa tÿǒ pànzwě ne njÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé ńcʉa gẅí,
en: Whether of them twain did the will ofhisfather?They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them,Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.

ngiemboon: ńti pá’ Jâŋ la tó ńnyɛɛ gẅi mánzsè gẅie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi giŋe mǒ, tá pi lʉ’ʉ nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn lʉ’. Pàkẅé ncùb mbɔɔ pàkáa tÿǒ pànzwě ké ńzẅíŋ, pi piŋ ńké tè gyá pú’u, ńkúbe mà gẅi, ńzẅíŋ gí wɔ́
en: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seenit, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi gíŋe ńjú’ tsɔ̌ sagá nò. Àtsɔ̌ ndÿò lǎ’ ńgẅiin jʉ’ʉ nká’ yé, ńgʉa wó ḿbye metÿǒ mie mé kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn ńdɔg ńnyɛte melù’, ḿbwóon nkàŋ nká’ ńdɔg ḿbú ńkíle, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ ńtúŋo jʉ’ gie mé ge kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn wó, ḿbwóon tà’ shʉ̀a ndá gẅie mé ge kwɔ́’ɔ tyé tsɛ̀ɛ wó tá pyɛ́bɛ nká’, ńgÿo pú’u, ńcʉ́me nká’ mbwó pànyɛte melù’, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa lé túm
en: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:

ngiemboon: Àfʉ̀’ʉ lékáb ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ gÿo ńku’, á túm megàŋa fà’ pé mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée nká’ ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńkẅé mé mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: and when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu wó, pʉ̀a pie ée nká’ yé la gwe ná mvɔ́g mvfò ńcúɔ yé, ńzẅé mbɔ́ɔntè, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg metóon ńtémte mbɔ́ɔntè yétá ńzẅé.
en: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

ngiemboon: Àndÿò wa gíŋe ńtúm petsɔ́ megàŋa fà’ tà pɔ́ gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa pe mvfò. Tá pʉ̀a pa gíŋe ńgÿo pé pá’ pɔ́ zɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo ná petsɔ́ megàŋa fà’ la.
en: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.

ngiemboon: Àndÿò leen ńké ńtúmo kwà’ míŋ we, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie á ge gǎ wɔ́, pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

ngiemboon: Tá pʉ̀a pa gyá míŋ ndÿò wa, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Ànjÿò ndá we wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ̂. Pi tó pege zẅé yé ńjÿó nká’,
en: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgwoon yé, éshwoŋo yé ńdɔg fó nká’ ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ńzẅé!
en: And they caught him, and casthimout of the vineyard, and slewhim.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te ngie: Tà ndÿò wɔɔn ge gÿo tó, é gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pʉ̀a pie à la cʉ́me nká’ né pɔ́b?
en: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

ngiemboon: Mé tsɔ́’ ngie: À ge tó gÿo mé zẅéte mefÿɛ́ apɛ̌, é piŋ cʉ́me nká’ mbwó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mendyɛ̀’ɛ, pie á ge gÿo ku’ fʉ̀’ gie mé kyéen melù’, pɔ́ ná mé.
en: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let outhisvineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.

ngiemboon: á gwɔ́ máa nò mbòŋo á menÿɔ́g pege»?
en: And it is marvellous in our eyes?

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi ngie mé ge kẅé jʉ’ʉ gí tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé, é náa mbwó tsɔ́ túm gie á ge gÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. [
en: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

ngiemboon: Tóon ŋwɛ́ aa gẅie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ ge pwɔ́’te, á piŋ ńgwe ná nyìŋ, mbà à ge pú gwɔ’ɔ ngàŋ.]
en: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pà*farisay jú’ yɔɔn sagá nò, ńdiŋ ngie à gɔɔn né pɔ́b,
en: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

ngiemboon: éfa’ shÿó légwoon yé, tá ḿbɔ́g nÿɔ́g lá’, á nue lá’ la ne ńzsé ngie Yěsô aa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ sagá nò, ńgɔɔn mbwó lá’ gie á ne ńzẅí’te shwóŋó yé ngie:
en: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u. Àtsɔ̌ fùɔ lǎ’ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ́ɔn ná nò lɔ́ɔn ndá míŋ we we mbàŋa.
en: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,

ngiemboon: Àfʉ̀’ʉ léjÿó shúm gÿo ńku’, á túm mentsìndá pé, ngie pɔ́ gʉa fa’ pʉ̀a pie à ka tsẅii mbwó pɔ́b pá’ pɔ́ ge tó pâ pɔ́ pfɛ́ shúm. Tá’ mentsìndá pé gʉa ńgyá wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pɔ́b wɔ́, á lʉ’ lʉ’ létó.
en: and sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe túm petsɔ́ mentsìndá pé, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gɔɔn né pʉ̀a pie mèŋ n ka tóŋo wɔ́b ngie mé cwoŋte shúm léjÿó tà ńtÿɔ́gɔ ssé, ngie mèŋ n tsẅi mé zẅé mefòŋ pɔ́ɔn, ńzẅé menɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ɔn pie e fáŋ tɛ’, ngie shúm ně ndá’ ńtyé ssé, pɔ́ tó mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá.
en: Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen andmyfatlingsarekilled, and all thingsareready: come unto the marriage.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie mé ka tóŋo wɔ́b ná línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá té lɔgɔ nò gie pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ pfó pɔ́ ye nzsè. Wetsɔ́ nyìŋ gʉa né nká’ yé, wetsɔ̌ gee ńtaŋ metʉ̌a we.
en: But they made light ofit, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ gwoon mentsìndá fùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgege wɔ́b, ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: and the remnant took his servants, and entreatedthemspitefully, and slewthem.

ngiemboon: Ànò pú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ fùɔ. Á túm pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pé, ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńzẅéte mefÿɛ́ apɛ̌, ńtuɔ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b,
en: But when the king heardthereof, he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńtsẅi né mentsìndá pé ngie: Mé ně ńdá’ ńtÿɔ́g shúm léjÿó lɔ́ɔn ndá ssé. Epʉ̀a pie mèŋ n ka zɔɔn ńtóŋo wɔ́b é ka tè pie é ku’u lépfɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they which were bidden were not worthy.

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńgʉa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ná metwó nzsè, ńgyá mbaa wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, pi tóŋo yé tóŋ.
en: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.

ngiemboon: Mentsìndá pé pà gʉa ńtyé ná metwó nzsè, ńgyá wɔ̌wɔɔ, ńtóŋo yé, ka à gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mbòŋo wɔ́, ka nyìŋ tepòŋ wɔ́. Mé pú ńnéŋe wɔ́b pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lemù, tà é lúe.
en: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was furnished with guests.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ gÿo ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lemù légyá lá’ gie á tǒ nà lɔ́ɔn ndá, ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa, mbà à kaa nzsǒ lɔ́ɔn ndá ma’à
en: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Àshǔ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gÿǒ lêkɔ́ ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn té ma’ nzsǒ lɔ́ɔn ndá? Nyìŋ awɛ̌ tè zsé nò gie à ge gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: and he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ leen ńké gɔɔn mbwó mentsìndá pé ngie: Pi kwɛ́ mekwò mé, ńkwɛ́ mbwó mé, ḿma’a yé pí, á tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm. À ge ńnéŋe jʉ’ó ne lʉa, lóŋ we ne ffó
en: Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and casthiminto outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ngie: Áa pú’u, nue e Ssé ne ńtóŋo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tá pàgʉa tà ńkú té gyɔ́ɔn.
en: For many are called, but fewarechosen.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgÿo cú’tè, éfa’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fó ná nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn ńgwoon yé,
en: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him inhistalk.

ngiemboon: ńtúm tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ná*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́b, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ná kwò pʉ̀a*Herôd ngie: Pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsa, peg ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńda’te pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgɔɔn té pɔ́gɔ nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké tè líe nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ ná shÿó wɔ́, ńda’te nò nénʉ́ pɔ́ pá’ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿó pú’u.
en: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for anyman: for thou regardest not the person of men.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo weg pá’ ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ná yɔɔn nò:*Lepʉ̌ ségè ée pé’e ńzẅíŋ ngie pege ma’ ncùb Kása pà*Roma ka ngǎŋ?
en: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Cæsar, or not?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá tepòŋ wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pànkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pi kwa’te wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said,Why tempt ye me,yehypocrites?

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn nkáb gie mé lɔgɔ ńnáa ncùb. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pàga nkáb ńtó, ńnyɛɛ yé.
en: Shew me the tribute money.And they brought unto him a penny.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ́ gẅie ée ná nkáb? Sɔɔn gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ?
en: And he saith unto them,Whoseisthis image and superscription?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ée we Kása, lezíŋ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, pi náa mmó gie áa yé Kása á mbwó Kása, ńnáa yé Ssé á mbwó Ssé.
en: They say unto him, Cæsar's. Then saith he unto them,Render therefore unto Cæsar the things which are Cæsar's; and unto God the things that are God's.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à tsɔ̌’ pú’u, á cʉa wɔ́b. Pɔ́ nyé yé jʉ’ó, ńgʉa.
en: When they had heardthese words, they marvelled, and left him, and went their way.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lyɛ̌’o, tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ná nùɔ pà*sadukay leen ńké tóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô. Pà*sadukay ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té zẅíŋ ngie mepfó ge gÿo zíme nà legwé wɔ́. Pɔ́ zɛ́te mbwó Yěsô ngie:
en: The same day came to him the Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection, and asked him,

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, Mǒsê la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbà fɛ́ we gẅiin lesɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, pɔ́ yé zyé penkʉ́, ńdɔg ńnuŋe ngẅɛ̀ fɛ́ we».
en: saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, etsɔ́ mefɛ́ laa wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ndùŋ mvfò zɔ́’, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé té cʉ́a mmó,
en: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first, when he had married a wife, deceased, and, having no issue, left his wife unto his brother:

ngiemboon: mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gíŋe sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g wa, ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó, pɔ́ pú’u, tà pɔ́b sɔɔn mbʉ́a pú ńzɔ́’ɔ wɛ̌ manzwě, ńké ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó.
en: likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zso, manzwě kwé yé.
en: And last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn sɔɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn ŋwɛ́ lɔɔn, mé ge lá’ zíme ná legwé, à gwɔ́ nzwě wɔ́?
en: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Legye sí ne fʉʉ gẅi á nue pi tè mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’né Ssé zsé, ḿbiŋ ńké tè zsé pá’ metʉ̀ Ssé ée pú’u, wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie: Àfʉ̀’ gie mepfó ge gÿo zím la, mbàŋa nê pànzwě le gíŋe ńzɔ́’ wɔ́. Pɔ́ ge gÿo cʉ́’ ńnéŋe yɔ́b pɔ́ pá’*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tÿǒ lepwó,
en: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná mepfó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo zím, mbà pi laa fó ńtóŋo mmó gie Ssé la gɔɔn wɔ́ ka, à la te gɔɔn ngie:
en: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,

ngiemboon: «Mèŋ n gee Ssé Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Esâg, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ́b wa? E Ssé ee Ssé pʉ̀a metʉ̀». Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé e tè Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, e Ssé ee Ssé pʉ̀a metʉ̀.
en: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.

ngiemboon: Menùɔ lá’ mie é laa jʉ’ó la ne ńgɔ’te ntí gie Yěsô lɔgɔ ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó pú’u.
en: And when the multitude heardthis, they were astonished at his doctrine.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pà’ Yěsô jÿɔ̌’ ncwò pʉ̀a*sadukay, ḿbú ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé tà ńgwɔ́ wɛ̌, á tó ńkwa’te Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: Then one of them,which wasa lawyer, askedhim a question, tempting him, and saying,

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, áa nà mbʉ̌ pé’e sɛ̌ gwɔ́ sé lyò.
en: Master, whichisthe great commandment in the law?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ɔ̀, nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m ɔ̀ ntsèm, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ yé mvfò ná jú kɔ́ɔkɔ́, ńzába kwàŋte gu ndà’ ná ye»,
en: Jesus said unto him,Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

ngiemboon: ée*lepʉ̌ sé lÿò ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò.
en: This is the first and great commandment.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a sie é sẅé sɔɔn gwɔ́ ngie: «Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ Kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm jú».
en: And the secondislike unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Mbʉ̌ Mǒsê ntsèm mbɔɔ menò mie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn éfóo pɔ́ ná mbʉ̌ mɔɔn mémbʉ́a.
en: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ tà ńcú’te, Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ gí ngie*nzà’nkÿo aa wɔ̌? Ngie aa míŋ wɔ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Aa nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: saying,What think ye of Christ? whose son is he?They say unto him,The sonof David.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ngǎ, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la jÿó fùɔ Ndavíd á tóŋo yé lê Ndè,
en: He saith unto them,How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,

ngiemboon: tà á lá’ ńkú fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gÿǒ ɔ̀ neŋte megàŋ mbù pú».
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool?

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavíd lɔ̌ɔn ńtóŋo yé lê we Ndè pá’ɔɔn, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ we lêkɔ́?
en: If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà*farisay, nyìŋ tè ku’u léfó ńtsɔ́’ pɔ́ tà’a nò ná nò gie Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́. Á fó lyɛ̌’ ŋwɛ́ nyìŋ tè gíŋe, ńgẅiin shÿɔg, lézɛ́te yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And no man was able to answer him a word, neither durst anymanfrom that day forth ask him any morequestions.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwó menùɔ lá’ tà mbɔɔ mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie:
en: Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,

ngiemboon: *pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pâ pà*farisay gẅiin lékyagte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê.
en: saying,The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat:

ngiemboon: Pú’u, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi jú’ ncwò wɔ́b, ńgÿo kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn né pi. Tá’ tà pi fʉ̀’e tsẅé yɔ́b. Á nue mmó gie pɔ́ zí’i pʉ̀a pɔ́ té yɛ̌ gÿo.
en: all therefore whatsoever they bid you observe,thatobserve and do; but do not ye after their works: for they say, and do not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kâ pi’ gie á zɛ tɛ’, ńzába mekẅi pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tá ńdʉ’ʉ légwɔ́ gie kwà’ pɔ́b ge fó lɔgɔ mentsě tepwó e tsẅi’te mbɔɔ tsẅi’tě.
en: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and laythemon men's shoulders; but theythemselveswill not move them with one of their fingers.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ gÿo kɔ́ wɔ́ nně ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mé gyá wɔ́b. Áa mmó gie á gÿo, pɔ́ gʉa ná shwóŋó Ssé gie mé ŋwe’e ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tétɔ́’, á gie mé kwɛ́ɛ ná zǐ ka ná pwó wɔ́ la, pɔ́ gÿo pɔ́b metétɔ́’ é gú’ pɔ́ nà ntí yé ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Pɔ́ gíŋe ńgÿo yɔb nzsǒ gie mé ma’a ńdɔgɔ ńtsyɛ’te Ssé, metsɔ̌ɔn sag tɛ’
en: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’e melínɔ́ɔn, ńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’e melÿò, ńkúu*mendá cú’tè ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò.
en: and love the uppermost rooms at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwoŋ ngie mé tyé mangǐɛ, ńtsyɛ’te wɔ́b lê mekù’, epʉ̀a piŋ ńnéŋe ńtóŋo wɔ́b lê tsítsà.
en: and greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pi, tà pi gÿo ngie mé tóŋo gẅi ngie tsítsà, á nue pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ tsítsà wémɔ’ɔ́.
en: But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your Master,evenChrist; and all ye are brethren.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tóŋo tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ lê tá gẅi, á nue pi gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ tá wémɔ’ɔ́ á gwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And call nomanyour father upon the earth: for one is your Father, which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ mé tóŋo gẅi ngie pàtyé mvfò, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à tyé mvfò à gwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, ńgwɔ́ nzá’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’.
en: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your Master,evenChrist.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie nyìŋ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔg mbùm ye pɔ́ pá’ nkwɔɔn gi la
en: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋá’te nnɛ́, mbà Ssé ge sẅé’e yé náa ssé, ésẅé’e mbùm yé ńnáa ssé, mbà Ssé ge kwé’e yé
en: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pi pà*farisay. Pi ee pànkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pi ne ńkíle ncwò ndá gẅie pʉ̀a mesoŋ pfó mǒ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé, pú’u, pi tè tsɛ̀ɛ wó kú, ńké tè nyé pʉ̀a pie é ne ńkwoŋo lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ wó kúu wó wɔ́.
en: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go inyourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi pà*farisay lâ pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pi ee ngàŋ mepàb, pi zɔ gwoon mepfɔ̌g ńkẅé mendá mɔ́b, ńcʉ́’ʉ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ńgɔɔn nò á sag, lélɔg ḿbab menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a, pɔ́ kwaŋ ngie pi ee pʉ̀a membòŋo. Á ge cʉa pú’u, pi lá’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ye lÿò.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi pà*farisay lâ pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pi ee ngàŋ mepàb, pi kag tʉ̀ tɛ’ légÿo nyìŋ gẅie à tè Ssé zsé cʉ́me nzèm pi, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ tà ké cʉ́me nzèm pi, pi zɔ̌ gÿo á cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ gẅie à ge kú pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g tà cʉa gẅí.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi pie pi ee mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ne ńkíbe pwó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b mánzsè. Pi gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkʉa nò, mbà e tsɔ̌ ntsaŋ tè gwɔ́ wɔ. Tá ńké ńdɔg pɔ́ tʉ̌ ngɔl gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkʉa nò, mbà à kwǎ’ ńkʉa nénʉ́.
en: Woe unto you,yeblind guides, which say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor!

ngiemboon: Pi tè mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ ńgwɔ́ mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g wɔ́ pé’e, á gʉa ná tʉ̌ ngɔl pɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé àkɔ́ cʉa kɔ́?*Jʉ’ʉ Ssé zɔ̌ té gÿo tá tʉ̌ ngɔl cʉ́’ʉ yé Ssé wɔ́ le?
en: Yefools and blind: for whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó, ńkʉa nò, mbà e tsɔ̌ ntsaŋ tè gwɔ́ wɔ́. Tá ńké ńdɔg pwɔ́’ gẅie ée ndùm wó ńkʉa nò, mbà à kwǎ’ ńkʉa nénʉ́.
en: And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is guilty.

ngiemboon: Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, á gʉa ná jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó, pɔ́ pwɔ́’, àkɔ́ cʉa kɔ́? Àjʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó zɔ̌ té gÿo e pwɔ́’ cʉ́’ we Ssé wɔ́ le?
en: Yefools and blind: for whetherisgreater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?

ngiemboon: Pú’u, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ jʉ’e mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó ńkʉa nò, mbà à lɔgɔ yɛ̌ jʉ’ mbɔɔ mmó gie áa ndùm wó ńkʉa.
en: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkʉa nò, à lɔgɔ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé mbɔɔ Ssé gẅie aa jʉ’ wó ńkʉa.
en: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ tÿǒ lepwó ńkʉa nò, mbà à lɔgɔ lʉŋe Ssé, mbɔɔ Ssé gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ ńkʉa.
en: And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pi pà*farisay, pi ee megàŋ mepàb, pi gabte shúm nná’ sí tà mbɔɔ nzab gi, nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwó Ssé, tá’, ńgwágte nò ná menò mie mé zí’i ná mbʉ̌, é gwɔ́ kwà’ menò mie é kẅéte. Ànò pá’ leshwoŋó nò nénʉ́, letsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe, legù’te pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé, tá yɛ̌ zɔ gwɔ́ mmó gie á kɔ’ɔ́ ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gÿo. Pi gÿo pú’u, tá ńké le wetsɔ̌ gígyé shúm lege.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightiermattersof the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ee mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ne ńkíbe pwó petsɔ̌ pʉ̀a, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b mánzsè, pi pɔ́gɔ lémi nzeenzse á ná mmó gie pi gee núu, ḿbiŋ ḿmii nɔ̀ɔn nnɛ́.
en: Yeblind guides, which strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pi pà*farisay, pi ee megàŋ mepàb. Pi tsí’i mbùm ntú’ lɔg ńnú melù’ mbɔɔ ye káŋ, tá shúm sie pi lɔg tsóŋ lâ ngáte ńgẅiin zɔ̌ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ*farisay, ɔ́ɔ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtsí’i tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’, tà é lʉ́a, mbà nzème pǐ ge pɔ́ɔnte lʉ́a.
en: Thoublind Pharisee, cleanse first thatwhich iswithin the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pi pà*farisay, pi ee megàŋ mepàb, pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mesyè me mbwǒon, mie mé lɔgɔ mbwǒon ńzɔ́’ tà e ne fɔ́gɔ. Ee nzèm pǐ ésí tɛ’, tá’ mekẅǐ mepfó lâ melʉ̀ʉ shúm zɔ̌ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of deadmen'sbones, and of all uncleanness.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé líe gẅi gí, ńgyá pi gwɔ́ mvfò pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé tɛ’, tá ńgwɔ́ megàŋ mepàb, nkwaŋá tepòŋ gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi tá ńdúe.
en: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ, pi*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pi pà*farisay, pi ee megàŋ mepàb, pi ne nyɛte ḿbwóon mesyè á na mejʉ’ mie mé la tuŋ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé wó, pi ne nkẅiŋe mesyè pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gwaa kwé nně ńkíbe*lepʉ̌ mbòŋo.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,

ngiemboon: Tà á ku’ pi gɔɔn ngie: Peg laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ yég wɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ ye pàmangʉa njʉ’ pég, mbà peg la tè zẅíŋ ngie mé zẅé pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́.
en: and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzẅíŋe ngie pi ee púɔ pʉ̀a pie é la zẅéte pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi lɔgɔ fà’a pàmangʉa njʉ’ pí, ńgʉa lê mvfò.
en: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.

ngiemboon: Pi ee ngẅɛ̀ mennú, ńgwɔ pà másèm nnú, ńgwɔ́ pí gǎ ńdá’ ńtsó té kúu tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g?
en: Yeserpents,yegeneration of vipers, how can ye escape the damnation of hell?

ngiemboon: Pi ké ńjú’, mèŋ n ge gÿo túm pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, pâ pàzsé nò, pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê. Pi zẅéte petsɔ̌, ńkim petsɔ̌ ná tÿǒ nkǐ, ńcúɔ petsɔ́ nê mengwɔɔn á tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè mí, éfó metÿǒsoŋ metÿǒsoŋ ńnɔ́ɔn wɔ́b.
en: Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: andsomeof them ye shall kill and crucify; andsomeof them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecutethemfrom city to city:

ngiemboon: Pú’u, metse pàteŋag metsèm mie mé lǎ pfɛte ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ e pú sẅɛ́’ɛ ndù pi. Léfó ná metse Abe gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńgʉa ńkúu nà me Sakarîɛ, míŋ Mbarashi, gẅie pi la zẅé yé á na shʉa gie ee na lekye mɔ́g pwɔ́’ pɔ kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó
en: that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mé ge lá’ tsɔ́’ ndu ndú menò ámɛ̌, é ná né pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn.
en: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

ngiemboon: Àfʉ̀’ ku’ Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pà Yerósalem, pà Yerósalem, pi pie pii ńzẅé pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé zẅé, ńdɔgɔ metóon ńtéme pʉ̀a pie Ssé túmo wɔ́b mbwó pí ńzẅéte, ée ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ pá’ mèŋ fa’á lécú’te gẅí, pá’ mêngáb cú’te púɔ pé lepàb yé, pi ké ńdʉ’ʉ lʉ’?
en: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem,thouthat killest the prophets, and stonest them which are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens underherwings, and ye would not!

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn jʉ’ gie pi la kwɛ́ légu’te Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ wó, yé Ssé ge kyé a tyé sẅɛ̀ɛ
en: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi tè gíŋe gyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tà lá’ kú lyɛ̌’ gie pi ge gɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé gwɔ́ né nyìŋ gẅie à tóo ná lezíŋ sé».
en: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessedishe that cometh in the name of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkẅɛ ne ńgee,*ngàŋa kwò yé tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńgɔɔn ngie à líe ntí gie mé la kwɛ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé tá ńgyá.
en: And Jesus went out, and departed from the temple: and his disciples came tohimfor to shew him the buildings of the temple.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔb ngie: Pi kaa gyá jʉ’ yɛ̂ wa? Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àtsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, mé pú ńtág tà tóon le gíŋe ńzébe nà tsɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto them,See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńnéŋe ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive,*ngàŋa kwò yé fag nnɛ́ ńtó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Shwóŋo wég fʉ̀’ gie yɔɔn nò ge lá’ gÿo. Shwóŋo wég liŋé gie mé ge lá’ lɔg zsé ngie ɔ̀ ne ńtóo, mbɔɔ gie á ge gyo mé zsé ngie lyɛ̌’ gie njÿó ge mag kǔ’.
en: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and whatshall bethe sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉ gẅí.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,Take heed that no man deceive you.

ngiemboon: Á nue pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge gÿo tÿɔ́g lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn mvfò, wɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Aa*Nzà’nkÿo, é gɔɔn pú’u lɔg fʉte pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.

ngiemboon: Pi ge lá’ jú’ mé ne ńgɔɔn nò ná mencù mie é kẅɛ̌ nà gẅi shÿó ka ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a wɔ́, tá’ tà pi ké ńdá’ ńcÿɔ’. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie sɛ̌ shúm vɔg ńcʉate, tá á lěen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie njÿó mǎg wɔ́.
en: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for allthese thingsmust come to pass, but the end is not yet.

ngiemboon: «Àlá’ ge lá’ lu ssé, é lÿɔ́’ɔ yetsɔ́, àfùɔ túm lu ssé, ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌», tsetsá’ ge là’ pú cʉ’e ná mejʉ’ ta ńgyɔ́ɔn, gwáŋá gíŋe ngwe ná mejʉ’ ta ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò ge lá’ lɔgɔ gwɔ́ pá’ manzwě gẅie à zyete lélúme la.
en: All thesearethe beginning of sorrows.

ngiemboon: Mé gwoon gẅi ńná mé nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’, é gÿo mé zẅé gẅí. Melá’ ntsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn
en: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi le gíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, pɔ́ sele sẅiŋ mennɛ́ mɔ́b, ésele ḿbʉa mennɛ́ mɔ́b.
en: And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ’ nò kẅɛte tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, éfʉte lelÿò pʉ̀a.
en: And many false prophets shall rise, and shall deceive many.

ngiemboon: Menò tepòŋ kẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà lelÿò pʉ̀a le gíŋe ńkwoŋe tà ńkwoŋe wɔ́.
en: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.

ngiemboon: Tá, nyìŋ gẅie à shÿɔg shÿɔg té kʉa zɔ́ gÿo ńtsẅɛ́.
en: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Mé ge lá’ tsẅi wɔɔn nkʉ̀ mbòŋo we nò*lefùɔ Ssé á nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, légwɔ́ gie melá’ melá’ ntsèm ge jú’, njÿó leen ńké ḿmag.
en: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations; and then shall the end come.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, pi gyá nyìŋ gẅie*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Ndaniɛ la tóŋo yé lê «nkʉ̀’ʉ ntàgte jʉ’». Á tó ńtyé kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wo. Nyìŋ tóŋo jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’né yɔɔn, á kag tʉ lenyɛte ńjú’.
en: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, stand in the holy place, (whoso readeth, let him understand:)

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie, mé lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, pʉ̀a pie ee Jẅidea kÿo ńdɔg ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ ńgʉa ńdyeen.
en: then let them which be in Judæa flee into the mountains:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà tetʉ́a gie aa ntsɔ̀’ ndá, á pɔ́ɔn lésẅɛ́’ ngie à ge píi mmó ndá tá lɔg kÿo.
en: let him which is on the house top not come down to take any thing out of his house:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, à pɔ́ɔn le gɔɔn ngie à ge piŋe ndá pí nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye.
en: neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

ngiemboon: Yee ngɔ́’ pànzwě pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbɔɔ pie é ge là’ ne nóŋe pûɔ mepÿɛ́ nà mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ le!
en: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ngie tà lekÿo ŋwɛ́ lá’ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’e tyɛb tyɛb mbʉ̀ŋ, ka pɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè wɔ́.
en: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:

ngiemboon: «Á nue ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ge lá’ kú pʉ̀a, ge lá’ gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà mbà mé laa zɔɔn ńgyá tsɔ̌ pú’u wɔ́, tà fó pá’ Ssé la nuŋe njÿó, ńgʉa kú fʉ̀’ɔɔn», mé ké le la’ ngíŋe ńgyá tsɔ̌ pú’u, wɔ́.
en: for then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé laa pé’e, ńzɔɔn tè gyá ngie à ge tsẅɛ́te mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ wɔ́, mbà à gwe tsɔ́ nyìŋ lá’ le tsẅɛ́. Tá à la lɔgɔ nò pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’, tá ńtsẅɛ́te melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ amɛ̌.
en: And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days shall be shortened.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ ké ńdá’ ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: À*Nzà’nkÿo wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn, ka pɔ́ ngie à gẅi jʉ’e wɔ́ tà pi zẅíŋ,
en: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, hereisChrist, or there; believeitnot.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pà nzà’ nkÿo pe cÿɔ̌ nò, lâ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌ nò ge lá’ kẅɛ, é nyɛ memáa meliŋé, é gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn lélɔg fʉte pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà ńgwáa we pɔ́ gwe’e ńku’, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉte mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la tsɔ́’.
en: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; insomuch that, ifit werepossible, they shall deceive the very elect.

ngiemboon: Á yɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n kě ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó gẅí.
en: Behold, I have told you before.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mé lɔɔn ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi gyá,*Nzà’nkÿo gẅi nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, tà pi gʉa wó, ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi gyá, à wɔɔn ńdyeen jʉ’ɔɔn, tà pi zẅíŋ.
en: Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert; go not forth: behold,he isin the secret chambers; believeitnot.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie nně mbʉ̀ŋ gÿo lê ŋwaŋ, éfó sǎ’ nèm, ńgʉa ńkú mbyě nèm mé pú ńgyá lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ tó pɔ́ pú’u.
en: For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth even unto the west; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

ngiemboon: «Àpfó mmó ge gÿo gwɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, megúm cú’te jʉ’ó».
en: For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ge lá’ gwóon tɔ́g, «nèm sele síŋ, saŋ á le gíŋe ńtʉ́a wɔ́, mecÿɔ́’ saŋ fó tÿǒ lefaŋ ńgwete ssé, àkɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie áa lefaŋ wɔ́ à pú ńtága».
en: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

ngiemboon: Àliŋé*Míŋ Nyìŋ leen ńké ńkẅɛɛ lefaŋ. «Mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kɔ́’ legwé ńdʉa, mé leen ńké ńgyá*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn tÿǒ lefaŋ ne ńtóo, ńgẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g mbɔɔ máamáa metʉ́»,
en: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

ngiemboon: é túm mecÿɔ́’ pé, pɔ́ tóŋo máamáa ntaŋ, ńdɔg ńcú’te pʉ̀a pé pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó mesǎg lekùɔ, pɔ́ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńtó.
en: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

ngiemboon: Pi pí fʉ̀’ ná tÿǒ mbÿě ngem, pi gwɔ́ tà ńgyá meffo kwo tà á gíŋe ńzye létáb, pi zsé ngie, àfʉ̀’e lùm ne ńtóo.
en: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When his branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summerisnigh:

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, pi la’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá mɔɔn menò, pi zsé ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ ncwò ndá.
en: so likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near,evenat the doors.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn té ńge lá’ kwéte tà mag té gwɔ́ gie mɔɔn menò ntsèm é tǒ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag tá shwóŋó yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké ńgʉa ná lyɛ̌’ ayɛ̌, pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò ge gÿo cʉa, mbà sɔɔn nyìŋ tè zsé tà mbɔɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie ée tÿǒ lepwó, tà mbɔɔ Míŋ Ssé, ńda’ Tá gíle yé zɔ zsé.
en: But of that day and hour knoweth noman, no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gwaa tó, menò mie é la gÿo fʉ̀’e Nóa gíŋe ńgÿo.
en: But as the days of Noewere, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

ngiemboon: Ntse la gwaa kwɔ́’ jÿó jʉ’, epʉ̀a mesoŋ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm, ńně ńnúu melù’, ńně ńdɔ́ɔn ndá, ńnáa púɔ pɔ́b lɔ́ɔn ndá, tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ gie Nóa lá kúu tsɛ̀ɛ páŋ,
en: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark,

ngiemboon: àlá’ zɔɔn tè ne ńgû’u tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, tà ntse gÿo ńkwɔ́’, ḿbú ḿbyága wɔ́b metsèm.*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge là’ gwaa tó à gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u.
en: and knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa yépʉ́a ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, mé lɔgɔ tà’ ńgʉa, ńnyé wetsɔ̌.
en: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě mépʉ́a ne ńgwɔ’ɔ mmó lùŋo, mé lɔgɔ tà’ ńgʉa, ńnyé wetsɔ̌.
en: Twowomen shall begrinding at the mill; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá pi pɔ́ɔn légwá’a lÿɔ̀g, á nue pi tè ne ńzsé lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅi ge tó wɔ́.
en: Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe ńzsé mbòŋo ngie, nyìŋ laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ gie à ńgwɔ́ á ńnéŋe mbʉ̀a yé, ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie ntsǒŋ ge tó, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lá’ té lyé, ḿbyɛ́b tà ntsǒŋ le kúu mbʉ̀a yé wɔ́.
en: But know this, that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken up.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, mbaa pi gí, pi cwoŋte mbùm gi ḿbyɛ́b, mélà’mie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gÿo vege vege tó.
en: Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ gẅie à jǔ’, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin legye à gwá’a la? Aa gẅie tá fà’ we la cʉ́me pʉ̀a pé mbwó yé, pá’ à ge cʉ́’ ná shúm léjÿó mbwó pɔ́b á nà fʉ̀’ gie á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?

ngiemboon: Àa shÿó mbòŋo pá’ tá fà’ we lɔɔn ńgwaa piŋ nzèm, ńgyá á ne fa’a yɛ̌ fà’.
en: Blessedisthat servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, tá fà’ we ge cʉ́me shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm mbwó yé.
en: Verily I say unto you, That he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńké ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ we tepòŋ, ńgɔɔn lóŋ yé ngie: Tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn tè lwo tó wɔ́,
en: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming;

ngiemboon: ńzye lécúɔ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ fa’a, pâ mepʉ̀a melù’ cú’te ḿpfɛ́ shúm, ḿbiŋ ńnú melù’.
en: and shall begin to smitehisfellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken;

ngiemboon: Mbà tá fà’ we ge vege vege tó, á nà fʉ̀’ gie à tè ne ńzsé wɔ́,
en: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not forhim, and in an hour that he is not aware of,

ngiemboon: é tó, é néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó yé tɛ’, é jwoŋo yé, à gʉa né jʉ’ gie mé jwoŋo pʉ̀a tepòŋ ńnáa wó, é ńnéŋe jʉ’ó ne lʉa, lóŋ we ne ffó.
en: and shall cut him asunder, and appointhimhis portion with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pú’u la, nò*lefùɔ Ssé ge lá’ sẅé nò pûɔ ngùɔ legém pie pɔ́ la kaa melâm pɔ́b, ńgʉa ńzá’ mámbàŋa gẅie à gee ńzɔ́’ɔ.
en: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

ngiemboon: Epe métʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ té legye gẅiin, epe metʉ̀a gẅiin legye.
en: And five of them were wise, and fivewerefoolish.

ngiemboon: Pie é la tè legye gẅiin la gwaa kaa melâm mɔ́b, pɔ́ té gẅiin tsɔ́ mèvɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: They thatwerefoolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

ngiemboon: Epie é la gẅiin legye la gwaa kaa melâm pɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńnéŋ tsɔ́ mèvɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ ńgẅiin.
en: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gee ńzɔ́’ɔ, à tè tɔ́g ńtó wɔ́, pɔ́ ńnéŋe tà lelɔ́g gwoon wɔ́b pɔ́ lyéte.
en: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ ku’, mé jú’ nyìŋ lɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔɔn gẅie à tóo lɔɔn, pi kẅɛ ńgʉa ńzá’a yé.
en: And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.

ngiemboon: Epûɔ ngùɔ pà metsèm leen ńzyeen, wɔ̌wɔɔ kwé’e nkÿo lâm wé.
en: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

ngiemboon: Epie é té legye gẅiin la, gɔɔn mbwó pie é gẅiin legye ngie: Epég melâm ne ḿbyé, pi náa wég mejʉ’ ná mèvɛ mí.
en: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.

ngiemboon: Epie é gẅiin legye tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg tè ná wɔ́, peg lɔɔn ńná, mbà még ge zág. Pi gʉa pɔ́ ndá sɔ̌ɔn ńjú mí.
en: But the wise answered, saying,Not so; lest there be not enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńjúu, nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ́’ɔ cʉ́’ ńtó, pâ pûɔ ngùɔ pie tsɔ́ mmó la tè ne ńzága wɔ́b gwɔ́ kúu ndá línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá, mé jÿɔ́’ ncwò ndá.
en: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut.

ngiemboon: Mé ńnéŋe tà ńjú’ pá’ petsɔ́ pûɔ ngùɔ pie pɔ́ ně ńgʉa ńjú mèvɛ la pú’te ncwò ndá, ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: À Ndè, à Ndè, mé tsɔ́’ ncwò ndá ńná né peg.
en: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.

ngiemboon: Tá á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mèŋ n tě ne ńzsé gẅi wɔ́.
en: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’a twó ngie: Áa yɛ̌ tá pi pɔ́ɔn légwá’a lÿɔ̀g, á nue pi tè ne ńzsé lyɛ̌’ wɔ́, ńké tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ tó wɔ́.
en: Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nò nyìŋ gẅie à la cʉ́’ʉ légʉa legiŋ, ńtóŋ megàŋa fà’ pé, ńnyé nkáb ye mbwó pɔ́b,
en: Forthe kingdom of heaven isas a man travelling into a far country,whocalled his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.

ngiemboon: ńdʉŋte ye wɔ̌wɔɔ pɔ́ ná yé, ńnyé nkáb pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a mbwó ndùŋ mvfò, ńnyé nkáb pàg nkÿo pʉ́a mbwó mbɔ́ɔntè, ńnyé pàg nkÿo mbwó mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa.
en: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ gẅie mé la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a né ye, cʉ́’ ńgwóon ńdwo ńtáŋ ye, tà ńjÿó tsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a.
en: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and madethemother five talents.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie mé la nyé ye pàg nkÿo pʉ́a, gíŋe ńjÿó yé tsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo pʉ́a.
en: And likewise he thathad receivedtwo, he also gained other two.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie mé la nyé pàg nkÿo né yé la, gʉa ńtúŋo gem tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’, ńde’e nkáb tá we tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money.

ngiemboon: Ntyě ná’a sag, tá pà megàŋa fà’ pɔɔn méntá piŋ nzèm, ńtóŋo wɔ́b ńzɛ́te pá’ pɔ́ ka cʉ̌’ ńgÿo ná nkáb pú’u.
en: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a né yé tó, ńnyɛɛ yé tsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn ngie: À Ndè ɔ̀ la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a né mèŋ, n gÿǒ pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a zébe mǒ.
en: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.

ngiemboon: Tá we gɔɔn né yé ngie: Áa mboŋ, ɔ́ɔ ngàŋa fà’ we mbòŋo, ɔ̀ ka gÿo mmó gie n ka ne ńzẅí’te mbwó gù, pá’ ɔ̀ ka pɔ́ɔn mûɔ mémmó mboŋó la, mèŋ n ge cʉ́me shúm mbwó gù tɛ’. Tóo pɔgɔ pú ńkág.
en: His lord said unto him, Well done,thougood and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo pʉ́a né yé lá tó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: À nde, ɔ̀ la nyé nkáb né mèŋ pàg nkÿo pʉ́a, gyá yetsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo pʉ́a gie e zebé mǒ.
en: He also that had received two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents beside them.

ngiemboon: Tá we gɔɔn né yé ngie: Áa mboŋ, ɔ́ɔ ngàŋa fà’ we mbòŋo, ɔ̀ ka gÿo mmó gie n ka ne ńzẅí’te mbwó gù, pá’ ɔ̀ ka pɔ́ɔn mûɔ mémmó mboŋó la, mèŋ n ge cʉ́me shúm mbwó gù tɛ’. Tóo pɔgɔ pú ńkág.
en: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo né yé la tó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: À nde, n ka ne ńzsé ngie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ ńtiŋ tɛ’, ńkába mmó jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ ka tè wó ma’, ḿbwɔ́’ɔ mmó jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ ka tè wó pye.
en: Then he which had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art an hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strawed:

ngiemboon: N ka ne ḿbɔ́gɔ gú, ńgʉa ńde’e mepàg nkáb mú tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’, é mɔɔn! Nkáb jù yɛ̂.
en: and I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo,therethou hastthat isthine.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tá we tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ ngàŋa fà’ we tepòŋ, ńgwɔ́ ndóŋ, ɔ̀ ka ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n gee ńkába mmó jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ka tè wó ma’, ḿbwɔ́’ɔ mmó jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ka tè wó pye.
en: His lord answered and said unto him,Thouwicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strawed:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka ne ńzsé pú’u, àkɔ́ gÿo, ɔ̀ tè gʉa ńná nkáb yɔ̀ɔn mbwó pàtáŋ nkáb pá’ mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ tó kẅé, àpì zébe mǒ wɔ́?
en: thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, andthenat my coming I should have received mine own with usury.

ngiemboon: Pi kẅé nkáb mɛ́ pàg nkÿo mbwó yé, ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin pàg ntsá’,
en: Take therefore the talent from him, and giveitunto him which hath ten talents.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkag tʉ̀ tá ńgẅiin mmó, mbà mé ge kẅi’i, à gẅiin à gyɔ́ɔn, tá nyìŋ ké tè kag tʉ̀ wɔ́, mbà mé ge fó mbwó yé kẅé mbàa mejʉ’ gẅie à gẅiin.
en: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.

ngiemboon: Pi gwoon ngàŋa fà’ we tè ku’u ná tsɔ́ nò wɛ̂, ḿma’a yé pí tsɛ̀ɛ mwòon nzém. À ńnéŋe wó ńdʉa, lóŋ we ne ffó
en: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gwɔ́ tà tóo tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we, tà pâ mecÿɔ́’ pé gwɔ́, à ńnéŋe ná lʉŋ yé, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ gẅie tsɔ̌ tè yé cʉa.
en: When the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory:

ngiemboon: Melá’ ntsèm cú’te mvfò yé, à tyɛ́te pʉ̀a, éfag pá’ mbyɛ̀b mvfó faga*menjʉ̀njÿò á nà mvfó ntʉ̀ la,
en: and before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd dividethhissheep from the goats:

ngiemboon: é tÿɔ́g*menjʉ̀njÿò ná gwǒŋo pwó yé ye tʉ̀, é tÿɔ́g mvfó ntʉ̀ ná gwǒŋo pwó yé ye kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pʉ̀a pie ée nà gwǒŋo pwó yé ye tʉ̀ ngie: Pi pie tá wɔ̀ɔn kěen ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi, pi tó ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ sie e Ssé la lá’ nyɛte ńdɔg ńzẅí’te gẅi tà fó lénuŋe ngwòŋ.
en: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:

ngiemboon: Á nue, nzyè la ne ńgyáŋa wɔ̀ɔn, pi náa mmó m pfɛ́, àgág yɔ́ɔn ne shÿó, pi ná ntse n nú, n daa ngʉ̀ pie kúe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:

ngiemboon: N daa tè nzsǒ pi ná nzsǒ, m ma’. N da ne ńguɔ, pi tó fóŋo wɔ̀ɔn. N daa ndá tsǎŋ, pi tó ńdíe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a ápɛ̌ pie pɔ́ la gÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo jú’ pú’u, ńzɛ́te ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nzyè la gyáŋa gú síŋe, tà peg gyá gú ńnáa mmó ɔ̀ pfɛ́? Ágág jú shÿó síŋe, tà peg gyá gú ńnáa ntse, ɔ̀ núu?
en: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fedthee? or thirsty, and gavetheedrink?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ laa ngʉ̀ pá’ɔɔn síŋe, tà peg kúe gú? Ɔ̀ laa tè nzsǒ síŋe tà peg ná nzsǒ ɔ̀ ma’?
en: When saw we thee a stranger, and tooktheein? or naked, and clothedthee?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ laa síŋe ne ńguɔ, ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ síŋe tà peg tó ńdíe gú?
en: Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?

ngiemboon: Àfùɔ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mbàa yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ wɔ́ gie pi la gÿo mɔɔn menò, ná wɛ̌ mûɔ ményìŋ gẅie aa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, mbà pi lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ ná mèŋ.
en: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have doneitunto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have doneitunto me.

ngiemboon: É leen ké gíŋe gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée ná gwǒŋo pwó yé ye kyɛ̀bɛ, é ye: Pi ee megàŋ ndòon, pi fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńgʉa tà ngʉ̀a sag, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g gẅie é té ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́, é gẅie mé la nyɛte ńtí Sátà paa mecÿɔ́’ pé.
en: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

ngiemboon: Á nue nzyè la gyáŋa wɔ̀ɔn, pi tè náa mmó m pfɛ́ wɔ́, àgág yɔ́ɔn shÿó, pi tè ná ntse mèŋ n nú wɔ́.
en: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

ngiemboon: N daa ngʉ̀, pi tè wɔ̀ɔn kúe. N daa tè nzsǒ, pi tè ná nzsǒ mèŋ m ma’ wɔ́. N da ne ńguɔ, ńgíŋe ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ, pi tè wɔ̀ɔn líe.
en: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b yɔ́b e gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, peg la gyá gú síŋe, nzyè ne ńgyáŋa gú, ńgyá gú síŋe, àgág jú ne shÿó, ńgyá gú síŋe, ɔ̀ gwɔ́ ngʉ̀, ńgyá gú síŋe ɔ̀ gwɔ́ tè nzsǒ, ńgyá gú síŋe, ɔ̀ ne ńguɔ, ńjú’ síŋe ɔ̀ gwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ, peg tè gú kẅéte?
en: Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?

ngiemboon: Fùɔ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mbàa yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ wɔ́ gie pi la tè gÿó mɔɔn menò á ná wɛ̌ mûɔ ményìŋ gẅie aa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, mbà pi la gíŋe tè mmó ná mèŋ gÿo.
en: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye diditnot to one of the least of these, ye diditnot to me.

ngiemboon: Pɔɔn pʉ̀a leen ńké ńgʉa lê jʉ’ gie pɔ́ ge lá’a tsẅé wó, é gyá pɔ́ ngɔ́’ tèmi. Pʉ̀a pie é la gÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, pɔ́ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmi
en: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la zí’i nò Ssé mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńcÿé jʉ’, ńgɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie:
en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie, é cʉ́’ʉ ńzága pɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà. Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ, mé kime yé ná tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: Ye know that after two days isthe feast ofthe passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná melyɛ̌’ amɛ̌,*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěm lá’ cú’te nɔ’ Kaifa, á gwɔ́*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò,
en: Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

ngiemboon: ńcú’te pú’u, ńzáb ngie pɔ́ ge shúte gwoon Yěsô, é zẅé yé.
en: and consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and killhim.

ngiemboon: Tá tà mé ké ńgwoon yé lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn, ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’ létág jʉ’.
en: But they said, Not on the feastday, lest there be an uproar among the people.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ Mbetáni, á ndá Símo,*ngàŋ nkà’ pǎb,
en: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe ssé ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, àtsɔ̌ manzwě kú yé ndá, ńgwɔ́ tóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ tʉ nzẅiŋ ndoŋ, tsɔ́ lèméndɔ́ɔn gie á cÿɔ́g nkáb tɛ’ gwɔ́ tsolo, á pfɛte twó Yěsô.
en: there came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at meat.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gyá, á pÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, pɔ́ zẅɛ́te ngie: À sěen ńcʉŋte yɔɔn làméndɔ́ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But when his disciples sawit, they had indignation, saying, To what purposeisthis waste?

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgwɔ́ mé sẅiŋ, ńkẅé máa nkáb, ńnáa mbwó mepóŋ.
en: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi zẅɛ́te mélà’a kɔ́? À gÿǒ pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná mèŋ.
en: When Jesus understoodit, he said unto them,Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

ngiemboon: Pi ge ne gyá mepóŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pege tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wɔɔn lɔgɔ yɔɔn làméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ mbùm yɔ̀ɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn tá mé taa ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn lesyè.
en: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she diditfor my burial.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ gie mé ge lá’ tsẅi nkʉ mbòŋo wɔɔn wó tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́ɔ, mé ge lá’ gíŋe ne gɔɔn mmó gie manzwě wɛ̂ gÿǒ, é lɔgɔ kímte yé.
en: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world,thereshall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ Jẅidas Iskariod, a gʉa ńgyá*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’,
en: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: N dɔɔn ńnyɛɛ gẅi pá’ pi ge gÿo tá gwoon Yěsô, pi náa kɔ́ né mèŋ? Pɔ́ ná nkáb pàg móm ntá né yé.
en: and saidunto them, What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.

ngiemboon: Á kẅé, ńzye léfa’ shÿó pá’ à ge sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwó pɔ́b.
en: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ná ngàb gie mé lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ*mbelég té mvòŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: ɔ̀ kwǒŋ ngie peg gʉa nzɔ̌, ńcwoŋte jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ ge jÿó*Páskà wó?
en: Now the firstdayof thefeast ofunleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa tÿǒsoŋ, ńgyá mákyè, ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Tsítsà tsẅǐ ngie peg shwóŋó ɔ̀ ngie e ye njÿó ee pá’ɔɔn ne ńku’u, a ne ńkwoŋo ngie pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé jÿó yɔ́b línɔ́ɔn*Páskà pɔ́ mbʉ̀a gù.
en: And he said,Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à tsẅǐ, ńcwoŋte shúm léjÿó*Páskà jʉ’ó.
en: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém ńnéŋe ssé lépfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gee sẅiŋ mèŋ.
en: And as they did eat, he said,Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿɔg, àwɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ zɛ́te ngie: À Ndè, ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn?
en: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie pwó yég yé fóo lépumte tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ, aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he answered and said,He that dippethhishand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge kwé, à gwɔ́ pá’ mé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, tá’, àndù té poŋ aa nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé yé. Mbòŋo laa pá’ mé lɔɔn tè zyé yé wɔ́.
en: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if he had not been born.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas, ngàŋ menáŋ wɛ̌, zɛ́te yé Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà ɔ̀ gɔɔn wɔ̀ɔn ka? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Gù zɔ kě ńgɔɔn!
en: Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him,Thou hast said.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ ne njÿó shúm léjÿó, Yěsô pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńgwaa náa mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kɔ̀ ḿpfɛ́, yɔɔn ee mbùm nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn,
en: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessedit, and brakeit, and gaveitto the disciples, and said,Take, eat; this is my body.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńkaa ntú’ melù’, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ńgwaa náa mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kɔ̀ ḿbú ńnú metsèm.
en: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gaveitto them, saying,Drink ye all of it;

ngiemboon: Á nue mɔɔn ée metse mɔ́ɔn, é metse mie Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwaa kʉa, é mie é pfɛte ná twó pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pá’ e Ssé ge lɔg lege meno tepoŋ mɔ́b.
en: for this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, mèŋ n tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńnúu mɔɔn melù’ wɔ́, tà lá’ cʉ́’ʉ núu pɔ́ me sẅé fʉ̀’ gie pege cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ leen ńké ńzɔb mentse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé, àfʉ̀’ ku’ pɔ́ kẅɛ, ńgʉa né ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive.
en: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgee, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ letsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ yɔɔn, pi metsèm pú ńgwá’a wɔ̀ɔn ńkÿo, á pumte pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Mèŋ n ge lá’ zẅé mbyɛ̀b mvfó,*menjʉ̀njÿò mé saa tsẅɛ».
en: Then saith Jesus unto them,All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà zíme nà legwé, e vɔgɔ Galilea zẅí’te gẅí.
en: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwá’a gú ńkÿo metsèm, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n de gú gwá’.
