en: Peter answered and said unto him, Though allmenshall be offended because of thee,yetwill I never be offended.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gú, kwà’ nénʉ́, mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ letsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ yɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.
en: Jesus said unto him,Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mé lɔɔn fó ḿbúte wɔ́gɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ ńge pɔ́ nzẅě, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de gú moŋe! Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé metsèm gíŋe ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo lê Getsemane, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, mèŋ n gʉa jʉ’ʉ sẅíŋte Ssé,
en: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples,Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.

ngiemboon: éfaga piɛ pâ penkʉ́ Zebede mépʉ́a, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa, á zye lé jú’ kekáŋ ntʉm ye, legwé pfɛ́ɛ yé,
en: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ée pá’ɔɔn ne ḿmÿɔgɔ pɔ́ nà ntí gie ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n kwé kwě. Pi ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ wege légwá’a lÿɔ̀g ńdyé,
en: Then saith he unto them,My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńná’a ńgʉa mvfò, e sẅɛ’ nuŋe ssé, ésɔb shÿó wé ssé, ńne sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ pú’u, ɔ̀ gÿo yɔɔn ntú’ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńtsíŋte! Tá’, tè gÿo wɔ̀ɔn lekwoŋ, gÿo pɔ́ gù lekwoŋ.
en: And he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying,O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thouwilt.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sẅíŋte Ssé pú’u, ḿbiŋ nzèm né lejʉ́ŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgyá pɔ́ ne ńdyé. Á gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Pi fǒ kaa ku’ pá’ ńgwɔ́ pege pú shÿɔgɔ lelɔ́g mbɔɔ ná tá’ ném wɔ́ la!
en: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter,What, could ye not watch with me one hour?

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńdyé, pi sẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwà’te gẅí, pi fʉa nò. Ntʉ́m nyìŋ tʉte tɛ’ tá’, mbùm nnɛ́ pÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌.
en: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeediswilling, but the fleshisweak.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe fó lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b ńgʉa nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, ésẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Tɔ́ɔnme, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie tsɔ̌ légÿo tà sẅɛ’te yɔɔn ntú’ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ à tè gwɔ́ wɔ́, ńke ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ké ńnú nú, ɔ̀ gÿo pá’ ɔ̀ kwǒŋ,
en: He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying,O my Father, if this cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy will be done.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgíŋ ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá pɔ́ ne ńdyé lyě, mélà’mie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà lelɔ́g pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé wɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńgʉa nà mbɔ́ɔntè yétá sẅíŋte Ssé, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie à zɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn,
en: And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pú’u, ńgíŋe fó jʉ’ó ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńkẅɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔb ngie: Pi cwoŋo ńdyé, ńzẅɛte mboŋó. Pi leen ńké ńgyá, áfʉ̀’ ku’ú! Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ á mbwó pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: Then cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them,Sleep on now, and takeyourrest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

ngiemboon: Pi lu ssé pege gʉa! Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé wɔ̀ɔn mbwó pɔb wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ̂!
en: Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, Jẅidas, gẅie aa tsɔ̌ tà’ ná*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém tó, àlá’ gwɔ́ nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńgẅiin menně ncù lâ mekésiŋ, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěme lá’ é tumó wɔ́b.
en: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Jẅidas la shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ à ge gÿo tá pɔ́ liŋe Yěsô, yɛ̌ liŋé gwɔ́ ngie yé lɔɔn ńtsyɛ’te nyìŋ, ńtáŋte yé pɔ́ zsé ngie aa yé ḿbiŋ ńgwoon yé.
en: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwóon ńtsíŋte nnɛ́, ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgɔɔn ngie: À Ndè, n tsyɛ’té, ńdeen ńgwóon ńtáŋte yé.
en: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: À shǔ wɔ̀ɔn, gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ tǒ ngÿǒ. Àlá’ leen ńké ńtó ńgwoon Yěsô.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Friend, wherefore art thou come?Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a pie pâ Yěsô kě ńgwɔ́, soŋ nně ncù á tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ́a lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa fà’ we*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò, é kẅɛ́te letwoŋó sé, ńjúɔ.
en: And, behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched outhishand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's, and smote off his ear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Néŋ nně jù tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ́a, nyìŋ gẅie à soŋo nně ge lá’ kwé pɔ́ nně.
en: Then said Jesus unto him,Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè ne ńzsé ngie á kě ńgwe’e ńgwɔ́ nò ncù, mbà mèŋ n ně ńtóŋo Tá wɔ̀ɔn á gwóon ńtúm mecÿɔ́’ pé, tà e tɔ́g ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém pɔ́ tág nzèm yɔ̀ɔn mɔ́ keen.
en: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels?

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńké ńgÿo pú’u, àmmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé gǎ tà ḿbumte? Á nue mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ wó ngie: Menò ge lá’ cʉate pɔ́ pá’ é cʉate fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn.
en: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó lá’ ngie: Pi gwǎ tó légwoon wɔ̀ɔn, ńgẅiin menně ncù lâ mekésiŋ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi ge ńgwoon ntsǒŋ pá’ɔɔn lêkɔ́? Mèŋ n kaa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé! Pi ké tè wɔ̀ɔn gwoon.
en: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes,Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.

ngiemboon: Tá menò mie é cʉate lɔɔn lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e. Mé gwoon Yěsô pá’ɔɔn,*ngàŋa kwò yé metsèm pú ńgwá’a yé ńkÿo.
en: But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é gwǒon Yěsô lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né nɔ’ɔ Kaifa. Á gwɔ́*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. Mbà*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pâ mekěme lá’ pǔ ńcú’te wó.
en: And they that had laid hold on Jesus ledhimaway to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.

ngiemboon: Piɛ zse nzèm ye tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgʉa tà ńtɔ́g ńkú tetʉ́a*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò, ńgʉa ńnéŋe ssé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ megàŋa fà’, ńně fa’a légyá pá’ yɔɔn nò ge zsote pú’u.
en: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pàsá’a lá’, é ne fa’a cÿɔ̌ nò gẅie pɔ́ ge zába twó Yěsô tá lɔg gÿo mé zẅé yé.
en: Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;

ngiemboon: Ńké tè ne ńgyá wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò la tó tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńzába menò twó Yěsô. Á cʉ́’ nzsotě, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a tó ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: but found none: yea, though many false witnesses came,yetfound they none. At the last came two false witnesses,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ ka gɔɔn ngie: À ku’u lékeme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńdɔg lyɛ̌’ sétá ńkwɛ́.
en: and said, Thisfellowsaid, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.

ngiemboon: *Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò leen ńké ńdu ssé ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ laŋte laŋté ka? Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù lɛ wɔ́ ka?
en: And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? whatis it whichthese witness against thee?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô pú tè tsɔ́b.*Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gɔɔn né yé ngie: Lɔg lezíŋ Ssé gẅie aa ntentʉ́, ńkʉa ngie ɔ́ɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie aa Míŋ Ssé ka ɔ̀ tè wɛ̌ wɔ́?
en: But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn, tà mèŋ n ké nyɛte shwóŋó gẅí, tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi ge gÿo gyá «*Míŋ Nyìŋ ńnéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó tʉ̀ ye Ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsem, é gíŋe gyá à ne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn tÿǒ lepwó ńtóo».
en: Jesus saith unto him,Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.

ngiemboon: *Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò jú’ pú’u, ésele*shʉate menzsǒ mé, ńgɔɔn ngie: À zoonté Ssé, pege giŋé fa’a pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí pàjÿò ngyá. Kwà’ pi gí jǔ’ pá’ à zoonté Ssé.
en: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.

ngiemboon: Pi Kwǎŋ gí ngie kɔ́? Àlá’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé.
en: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńtsɔg metyé shÿó Yěsô, ńtsẅiŋe yé, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńtéme mbwó letuŋó yé,
en: Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smotehimwith the palms of their hands,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: À*Nzà’nkÿo, keme nyìŋ gẅie à cúɔ gú.
en: saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, Piɛ ńnéŋe tetʉ́a. Àtsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ we manzwě tó, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mbɔɔ gù jú pi lâ Yěsô nyìŋ Galilea wɛ̂ kaa nùɔ.
en: Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tyé mvfò mânyìŋ ntsèm, ḿmoŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: N kaa zsé nò gie ɔ̀ fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́!
en: But he denied beforethemall, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńnéŋe né ncwò nká’. Wetsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ we manzwě gyá yé, ńgɔɔn né pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn pɔ́ Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd ka gwɔ̌.
en: And when he was gone out into the porch, anothermaidsaw him, and said unto them that were there, Thisfellowwas also with Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿmoŋe, ńgɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie: Mèŋ n te nyìŋ wɛ̂ zsé.
en: And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.

ngiemboon: Mé ná’a ńnéŋe, pʉ̀a pie kě ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó tóo lejʉ́ŋ Piɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Á té nò fa’ fa’ wɔ́, ɔ́ɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb. E jù ntí leshwóŋe zɔ gÿo tà peg gɔɔn pú’u.
en: And after a while came untohimthey that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also artoneof them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye lé ye: E Ssé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn, à zeŋe yɔ́ɔn me, mèŋ n te ne ńzsé nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́. Mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: Then began he to curse and to swear,saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńkímte pá’ Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn né yé ngie mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá, éfó tetʉ́a ńkẅɛ, ḿbú ńdʉa tɛ’.
en: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a,*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ mekěme lá’ mʉ́ mba’ámba’, ńzáb ngie pɔ́ ge gÿo mé zẅé Yěsô,
en: When the morning was come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

ngiemboon: ńgÿo mé kwɛ́ɛ yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó ngúmnɔ́ɔn*Pilato.
en: and when they had bound him, they ledhimaway, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gẅie à la sẅíŋe Yěsô jú’ pá’ mé zǎ’ ntsaŋ ngie mé ge zẅé Yěsô, ńdeen ńké ńzye lémÿɔgɔ mmó gie à ka gÿo, ḿbí nkáb gie à ka kẅě pàg móm ntá ná yɔɔn nò la, ńdɔg ńgʉa ńgyá*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lâ mekěme lá’,
en: Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ka gÿo no tepoŋ pá’ n ka náa tèfʉa ngie mé zẅé yé. Pɔ́ jú’ ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Peg tè nò mǒ gẅiin, á jú’u lé gù.
en: saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, Whatis thatto us? see thouto that.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas ma’ nkáb á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, éfó jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńcʉŋe.
en: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lagte nkáb, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ńgwɔ́ pege ké le néŋ yɔɔn nkáb nà nkáb*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́, mélà’mie ee nkáb metse nyìŋ.
en: And the chief priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwaŋ tà ńgwɔ́ tà’ ncwò, ńdɔg nkáb ńgʉa ńjú tsɔ́ nká’ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo lê nká’ mbwòon mekʉŋe tsá’, ńjú pú’u, ńdɔg ńgÿo jʉ’ gie mé túŋo megʉ̀ wó.
en: And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter's field, to bury strangers in.

ngiemboon: Tà fó fʉ̀’ó, mé ée ńcʉ́’ʉ ńtóŋo wɛ̌ nká’, pɔ́ ngie nká’a metse tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò gÿo pú’u, ḿbumte ná pá’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Yeremi la gɔɔn ngie: «Pɔ́ kěen ńkẅé nkáb pàg móm ntá, é gwɔ́ nzẅìŋ gẅie pà Israel ka zǎb ngie mé lɔg ńjúu yé».
en: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was valued, whom they of the children of Israel did value;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka ná yɛ̌ nkáb ńdɔg ńjú nká’ mbwòon mekʉŋ tsá’a, á gwɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lá’ ńtsẅi ngie mé gÿo
en: and gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu mvfò Ngúmnɔ́ɔn*Pilato, á zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ fùɔ pà Yuda lá? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u.
en: And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him,Thou sayest.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menò twó Yěsô tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, á ké tè ne ḿbÿɛɛ wɔ́.
en: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

ngiemboon: *Pilato, gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u nzẅìŋ menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù wɔ́ ka?
en: Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô pú tè pÿɛ. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn gyá á pú ńkʉ’ʉ yé tɛ’.
en: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà, Ngúmnɔ́ɔn tsɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gẅie àlá’ zɛté.
en: Now atthatfeast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, àtsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ, mé tóŋo yé lê Yěsô Panepâse.
en: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ tó ńcú’te.*Pilato zɛ́te ngie: Pi kwǒŋ ngie n gʉa ná pʉ̀a pɔɔn ńnyé pɔ́ Yěsô Panepâse ka pɔ́ Yěsô gẅie mé tóŋo ngie Kristo?
en: Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?

ngiemboon: *Pilato lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie mé kwɔ́’ɔ pɔ́ lóŋ ná Yěsô tá sẅiŋe ye.
en: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.

ngiemboon: *Pilato la ne ńŋaga nò Yěsô, ànzwě we túmo nyìŋ ngie à gʉa, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie à laga twó yé ná ntsaŋ nyìŋ wɛ̂, ńgie aa pɛ́’ɛ ńgwɔ́ tèfʉa, ńgie ngàŋ shwóŋó yé ngie yé ně ńdá’a lá’, ńdyé njÿòon ná yé é gege yé tɛ’.
en: When he was set down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńtsóte lá’ ngie á zɛ́te ngie*Pilato tsɔ́’ pɔ́ Panepâse ńgÿo mé zẅé Yěsô.
en: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó lá’ ngie: Mèŋ n ge nyé tà’ ngàŋa tsǎŋ né pi. Pi kwǒŋ ngie mèŋ n gʉa ná pʉ̀a pɔɔn mépʉ́a, ńnyé wɔ́? Pɔ́ yé á Panepâse!
en: The governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie: Tà mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́ ná Yěsô gẅie mé tóŋo lê Kristo? Mânyìŋ ntsèm tsɔ́’ ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ!
en: Pilate saith unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ?Theyall say unto him, Let him be crucified.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ nò tepòŋ gie à gÿǒ gwɔ́ pɔ́ kɔ́? Tá àlá’ kẅi’i ńnáa gwá, ńgɔɔn pé ngie: Ké ńkime yé kim!
en: And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gyá ngie mé té ne ńjú’u nò gie à gɔɔn wɔ́, ńně ńgyá ngie ńgwɔ́ á sele pʉ̀a tág jʉ’, ńdeen ńké ńkaa ntse, ésɔg mbwó mé á mvfò lá’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n te nò ná nò nyìŋ wɛ̂ gẅiin, á ne ńdíe pɔ́ gẅí
en: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, butthatrather a tumult was made, he took water, and washedhishands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see yeto it.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm tsɔ́’ ngie: Metse nyìŋ wɛ̂ sẅɛ́’ɛ ndù peg tà mbɔɔ ndù penkʉ́ peg.
en: Then answered all the people, and said, His bloodbeon us, and on our children.

ngiemboon: *Pilato leen ńké ńkẅile Panepâse ndá tsǎŋ, ńgÿo mé lɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúɔ Yěsô, ḿbiŋ ńná yé ngie mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa, ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: Then released he Barabbas unto them: and when he had scourged Jesus, he deliveredhimto be crucified.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pà*Roma leen ńké ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Ngúmnɔ́ɔn, pɔ́b metsèm cú’te ńkéle yé ńnéŋe soŋ,
en: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole bandof soldiers.

ngiemboon: ḿbú sẅɛ menzsǒ mé, ńcʉ́’ mma’ pɔ́ nzsǒ lefùɔ ná yé,
en: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńdɔg menzóŋ ḿbá’a cÿɔ̀’ shuu twó yé, ńnéŋe kekà’a ná pwó yé ye tʉ̀, ńně ńkẅí’te mvfò yé, ńzoonte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Zɔɔn múɔ, àfùɔ pà Yuda!
en: And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they putitupon his head, and a reed in his right hand: and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!

ngiemboon: Ńně ńtsɔgɔ metyé ná yé, ńkẅé kekà’a, ńcúɔ twó yé,
en: And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.

ngiemboon: ńzoonte yé tà ńkʉ́a, éfó ná yé sẅɛ nzsǒ lefùɔ, ńgíŋe ḿma’ kwà’ mé menzsǒ ná yé. Á ku’ pɔ́ lɔgɔ yé fó wó ńkẅɛ, légʉa ńkime ná tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucifyhim.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔgɔ yé fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgiŋ tà ḿbumte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Sirɛne, mé tóŋo yé lê Símo, mé sẅɛ́ɛ yé ngie à kaa tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô.
en: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to bear his cross.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo lê Golgota, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Àjʉ’ʉ kẅǐ twó.
en: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó gie á lẅe lẅe ḿvoŋ melù’, ńná ngie Yěsô nú. Yěsô zẅí’ à tè kwoŋo lénú wɔ́.
en: they gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tastedthereof, he would not drink.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù leen ńké ńkime yé ná tÿǒ nkǐ, ḿma’a tyéente ńdɔg ńgab menzsǒ mé, ńná ye wɔ̌wɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b
en: And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.

ngiemboon: Á ku’, pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ Yěsô.
en: And sitting down they watched him there;

ngiemboon: Mé ŋwe’e mmó gie à fʉa ńkime tÿǒ á jʉ’ gie twó yé la wó ńgie: Wɔɔn aa Yěsô, fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: and set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋe ńkim metsǒŋ mépʉ́a nâ metÿǒ nkǐ, tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwǒŋo pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ ná gwǒŋo pwó kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.

ngiemboon: Pàcʉa mánzsè la ne ńnyime yé yɔ́b, ńzoonte Yěsô,
en: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ ka ne fa’a lékeme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńdɔg lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ sétá ńkwɛ́. Kwà’ gù zɔ kẅé twó ɔ̀, pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé, éfó ná tÿǒ nkǐ ésẅɛ́.
en: and saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildestitin three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńzoonte yɔ́b Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Likewise also the chief priests mockinghim, with the scribes and elders, said,

ngiemboon: À ka gÿo tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́, tá’ à kâ ku’u lékẅé yé twó á mbwó legwé wɔ́! À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Israel, á fó ná tÿǒ nkǐ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ésẅɛ́’ peg gyá, ńzáb ntʉ́m wég ná yé.
en: He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.

ngiemboon: À la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, e Ssé lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo yé tà shwóŋó nò, á gÿo á tsẅɛ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn! Nyìŋ wɛ̂ la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge Míŋ Ssé.
en: He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ metsǒŋ pie mé la kime wɔ́b nà metÿǒ nkǐ á lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô gíŋe ne ńzoonte yé yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ la gwɔ́ tà ńku’, ejʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pú síŋ, tà ńdá’ ńkúu ná nèm tá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó.
en: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ná nèm tá ŋwɛ́, Yěsô ga’te nê ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie: Eloï, Eloï lama sabatani, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, e Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gwá’a wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́»?
en: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying,Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?that is to say, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: À wɛ̂ gẅie à ne ńtóŋo*Elîɛ lɛ̂!
en: Some of them that stood there, when they heardthat, said, Thismancalleth for Elias.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b gwóon ńkÿote, ńgʉa fa’a kùsáa, ńtsaba tsɛ̀ɛ kikii melù’, éshÿɔ́gɔ nà twó kekà’a, ńtsege ńnéŋe ncwò Yěsô ngie à sẅíte.
en: And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filleditwith vinegar, and putiton a reed, and gave him to drink.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi cʉ́’ pege gyá ka*Elîɛ ge tó fó nà tÿǒ nkǐ ésẅi’i yé wɔ́!
en: The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńga’te nê ngyè tetʉ̀ ndeen ńcʉ́m.
en: Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́m pú’u, nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg ńkʉŋe tsɔ́ jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé fó tÿǒ shʉa pàg pʉ́a tá ńkúu ssé. Tsetsá’ cʉ’ʉ, metóon shʉ́ate,
en: And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;

ngiemboon: metwó mesyè tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé, mepfó pie pɔ́ la záb ntʉ́m ná Ssé zyeente tà ńgyɔ́ɔn,
en: and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,

ngiemboon: éfó tsɛ̀ɛ mesyè ńkẅɛte. Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzíme nà legwé, pɔ́ kúu Yerósalem, á tÿǒsoŋo ndʉalʉ̌a, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyá wɔ́b.
en: and came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lá kwé pá’ɔɔn, tándá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pâ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie é la ne ḿbyɛ́be Yěsô gyá pá’ tsetsá’ pǔ ńcʉ’ʉ, ńgíŋe ńgyá kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́ gie á ne ńcʉa, ḿbú ńcÿɔ’ tɛ’, ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô kaa kwà’ Míŋ Ssé.
en: Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě tá ńgyɔ́ɔn tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ne ńdíe, mbà pɔ́ la zsê nzèm Yěsô tà fó Galilea, ńgiŋe ńkẅéte yé.
en: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:

ngiemboon: Á laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Malîɛ Magdala, ńgÿo Malîɛ má pà Jâg pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b, ńgíŋ ńgÿo má pà gubé Zebede.
en: among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzèm àtsɔ̌ ngàŋa mmó tó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Yesyɛ̂b, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ tÿǒsoŋo Arimaté, ńgwɔ́ yé tsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô.
en: When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathæa, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus' disciple:

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ńgyá*pilato, ńdúɔ pfó Yěsô légʉa ńde’e.*Pilato zẅíŋ, ńtsẅi ngie mé ńná né yé.
en: he went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

ngiemboon: Mé kyɛ́’, Yesyɛ̂b kẅé, ńdɔgɔ pwó nzsǒ sẅé ńzémte pfó ye,
en: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

ngiemboon: ńkaa yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè sie à ka nyě shʉ’ʉ ná tóon, é gwɔ́ sé Yesyɛ̂b. Á ńnéŋe Yěsô tsɛ̀ɛ wó, ńtsóte máamáa tóon ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò ńgʉa.
en: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ ńnéŋe pfó Yěsô jʉ’ó Malîɛ Magdala pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ Malîɛ ńnéŋe ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè, ńne ńgyá.
en: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, á gwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè Ssé gie mé kaa yetsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ne ńnyɛte la.*Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pà*farisay pú ńcú’te mbʉ̀a*Pilato,
en: Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ànkwɔbɔ́, peg ne ńkímte tsɔ́ nò. Àngàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò wɛ̌ ka nyé ntentʉ́, ńgɔɔn ngie: Meŋ n ge lá’ zime nà legwé na mbɔɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá
en: saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá peg ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ tsẅi pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pyɛ́b lesyè tà kúu na ḿbɔ́ɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá. Tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ ngáŋa kwò yé tó ńjʉʉ pfó yé, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa shwóŋó lá’ ngie à zimé nà legwé! Wɛ̌ cÿɔ̌ nò e mege ḿbÿɔ́g tà ńcʉa we mvfò.
en: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù é pɛ̂. Pi gʉa ńgÿo mé pyɛ́b lesyè pá’ pi kwǒŋ!
en: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, makeitas sure as ye can.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó ńcÿɔ’ɔ liŋé ná tóon gẅie mé ně ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́’ lesyè, ńcÿɔ’ɔ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie lesyè ée se njÿɔ̌’, ńdeen ńtÿɔ́g pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, pɔ́ ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ, ḿbɔ́gɔ mmó légÿo ná lesyè.
en: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.

ngiemboon: Àlyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda gÿo ńtɔ́g, á gwɔ́ mba’ámba’ ná ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’ nà ngàba lá’, Malîɛ Magdala pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ Malîɛ gʉa légyá lesyè,
en: In the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the firstdayof the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńkúu wó ńjú’ tsetsá’ pú ńcʉ’ʉ tɛ’.*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́’, ńtó ńkite tóon gẅie mé ka lɔg ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò lesyè, ńkwɔ́’ ńnéŋe ná tóon ŋwɛ́.
en: And, behold, there was a great earthquake: for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ pá’ nně mbʉ̀ŋ la, menzsǒ mé piŋ ne fɔ́gɔ tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́b lesyè gyá pú’u, ḿvɛ, ḿbɔ́g, ńgwete ńnuŋte ssé pá’ mepfó la.
en: and for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as deadmen.

ngiemboon: Tá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn né pànzwě ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g, n zsě ngie pi tóo fa’ Yěsô gẅie mé ka kime yé ná tÿǒ kǐ la.
en: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.

ngiemboon: À tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé nà legwé pá’ à la gɔɔn la. Pi tó ńdíe jʉ’ gie pfó yé kaa wó tá ńgyá.
en: He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

ngiemboon: Pi gwóon ńgʉa shwóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie à zimé nà legwé, ńgie à vɔgɔ́ Galilea ńně ńzẅí’te gẅi lâ pɔ́, pi ge kúu wó tá gyá yé. Yɔɔn aa nò gie mèŋ n kɔ’ɔ́ ńgẅiin léshwóŋó gẅí.
en: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě gwóon fó ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè ńgʉa létsẅii yɔɔn nò mbwó*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô. Ecÿɔ’ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ne ńkága kǎg,
en: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.

ngiemboon: ńtóo légiŋ, ḿbumte Yěsô. Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie. N tsyɛ’té gẅí! Pɔ́ kẅí’te mvfò yé, ńkíbe mekwò mé, ńgu’te yé.
en: And as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying,All hail.And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g. Pi gʉa ńtsẅi né mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ńgie pɔ́ gʉa né Galilea, ńgie pɔ́ ge gyá wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ wó.
en: Then said Jesus unto them,Be not afraid: go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě gwɔ́ mánzsè ne ńgee, etsɔ́ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù ná pie é la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ lesyè gʉa tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie á cʉ̌a, éshwóŋ*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’.
en: Now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, tóŋ mekěme lá’, pâ pɔ̌ cú’te ńnéŋe ssé, ńkwaŋte, ńná ḿbwɔ́’ nkáb mbwó pàlÿɔ́’ ncù,
en: And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gɔɔn pé ngie pi ně ne ńdyé letsẅɛ́’,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tó ńjʉʉ pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole himawaywhile we slept.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn lɔɔn ńké ńjú’, mbà peg ge zsé nò gie peg ge shwóŋó yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅi légyá ngɔ́’.
en: And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù kẅé nkáb, ńgÿo pá’ mé tsẅǐ né pɔ́b. Áa yɛ̌ tá yɔɔn nò leen sá jʉ’, pà Yuda zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ yɛ̌ nò tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ntsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ nê legém la jú’u nò gie Pànzwě pá gɔ̌ɔn, ńgʉa né Galilea, ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sie Yěsô la gwɔ gwɔ́, mbà à la la’te mbwó pɔ́b, ngie pâ pɔ́ ge lá’ pumte wó
en: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tá ńgyá Yěsô, ńkwí’te ssé, ńgu’te yé, tá tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńně ḿmʉ́’te mʉ’té.
en: And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé leen ńná tʉ̀ ntsèm né mèŋ lélɔg sá’ shúm sie ée tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ sie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying,All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi gʉa ngwòŋo ngwòŋ, ńdɔg pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńgÿo*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn, ńnu’u wɔ́b ntse ná lezíŋ Tá, mbɔɔ Múɔ, mbɔɔ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a,
en: Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: ńzí’i wɔ́b létÿɔ́gɔ kwò ná menò ntsèm mie mèŋ n da zí’i gẅí. Pi zsé ngie, kwà’ mèŋ n ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà njÿó lá’ ḿmag.
en: teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway,evenunto the end of the world.Amen.

ngiemboon: Nzyetè Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa Míŋ Ssé, e yɔɔn
en: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;

ngiemboon: à gwɔ́ mvfò ńně ńkɔ́’ɔ nzsè jù, ɔ ne ńtóo.
en: Which shall prepare thy way before thee.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsè mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ»!
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gÿo ńnéŋe tà ńkẅɛɛ nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńně sá’a mbwo lá’ ngie pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔ́b, ńgÿo à nú’u wɔ́b ntse, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn leen ńké fóo tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńtóo, lelÿò fóo Yerósalem ńtóo ńgyá Jâŋ, ńzẅíŋe menò tepòŋ mɔ́b, á nú’u wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: And there went out unto him all the land of Judæa, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ laa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ḿma’ nzsǒ, mbà mé la lɔg menòŋ kamel ḿbá’, ńdɔgɔ*ngùb nɔ̀ɔn ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌’ yé. À lɔ̌ɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ ngǐm ḿbiŋe ńjÿó nŋwá’a tsẅɛ.
en: And John was clothed with camel's hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ aa nzèm mèŋ ńně ńtóo, à cʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ fó tè ku’u mbɔɔ léŋwé’e Ssé, ńkyɛ́’ menkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: and preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńgẅiin yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ lénu’u gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Tá’ á ké ńgʉa ná yé, mbà à ge tó ńnéŋe gẅi pɔ́ mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Á laa nà lyɛ̌’ ásɛ̌, Yěsô leen ńké fó Nǎzarɛd, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea ńtó, ńgyá Jâŋ, á nu’u yé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ně fóo ntse ńkẅɛɛ, ńgyá ncwò tÿǒ lepwó gwóon ńtsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé, Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’, ńgwɔ́ pá’ kàpʉ̀ŋ lá, ńtó ńtyé ná yé.
en: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:

ngiemboon: Ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Ɔɔ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo ɔ́ tɛ’, n záb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ná gù.
en: and there came a voice from heaven,saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge tóo ná Yěsô pá’ɔɔn, ńtsó yé, á gʉa lê nkwòŋo tsẅɛ.
en: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.

ngiemboon: Pâ menɔ̀ɔn zɔ̌ gwɔ́ wó, ńnéŋe ńnéŋe lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ móm lekùa, Sátà gwáa ńtóo ńtsóte yé ngie à fʉa nò.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ne ńdíe yé.
en: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà ńgwoon Jâŋ ńnéŋe ndá tsǎŋ, Yěsô gʉa nê Galilea. À lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’ tà Ssé ge zye lényɛ Lefùɔ sé. Pi kúbe mà gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: and saying,The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgiŋe ngʉ̀ŋe máa ntse gẅie ée Galilea, ńgyá mbàŋa yépʉ́a, á gwɔ́ Símo pɔ́ fɛ́ we Ndeléya. Pɔ́ ne ḿmá’a lekÿo ntse, á nue yɔ́b fà’ laa léfa’ messó.
en: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó pege zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe, mèŋ n gÿo pi cʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé menkÿo mɔ́b, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ná’a ńgiŋ, ńgyá tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a, á Jâg pɔ́ fɛ́ we Jâŋ, é gubé Zebede, pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ne nyɛ́te menkÿo mɔ́b.
en: And when he had gone a little farther thence, he saw James thesonof Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtóŋo wɔ́b yɔ́b, pɔ́ leen ńnyé tá wɔ́b Zebede pâ ngàŋa fà’, á tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ gÿo ńgʉa Kapernawúm, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô gʉa*ndá cú’tè, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.

ngiemboon: Alá’ jú’u shwóŋè yé, ḿbu ḿmɔɔn ye ntí lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó, mélà’mie à lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgÿo pá’*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê wɔ́, à lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i tà ńzse mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌.
en: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.

ngiemboon: Á ne shwóŋe, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà tsɔ̌*Ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé, á ńnéŋe tà ḿvege vege ńgá’te ngie:
en: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

ngiemboon: Yěsô, mûɔ Nǎzarɛd, pege gẅiin kɔ́? Ɔ ka fɔ̌ɔn ńtó pɔ́ lépyága wég ka? Mèŋ n ne ńzsé gú. Ɔ fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ Míŋ we.
en: saying, Letusalone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cÿɔ́g yɛ̌*Ssé tepòŋ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Láŋte, éfó ná nyìŋ wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ!
en: And Jesus rebuked him, saying,Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

ngiemboon: E*Ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gwóon ńtɔ́ɔn ngàŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ yé lê tʉ̀, ńgwɔ fó ná yé kẅɛ, ńgá’te tɛ’.
en: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.

ngiemboon: Á pú ńkʉ’ʉ lá’, pɔ́ mɔɔn, ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Yɔɔn áa lêkɔ́? Áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò sẅé gie á giŋé ńkẅɛ la? À gwɔ̌ tà ńdɔgɔ tʉ̀, ńtsẅii nò mbwo*messé tepòŋ, pɔ́ jú’u ncwó we.
en: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrineisthis? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ Yěsô gwóon saa lá’ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea ŋwɛ́ ntsèm.
en: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa nê ndá pà Símo pɔ́ Ndeléya. Pâ Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ pú ńgwɔ́.
en: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

ngiemboon: Mákẅì’ Símo la nuŋe, nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ yé. Yěsô kúu wó mé gwóon shwóŋó yé.
en: But Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.

ngiemboon: Á sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtyé lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńkíbe pwó yé, ńgÿo á lu ssé. Nnɛ́ zá’a, á gʉa ńnyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye wɔ́b.
en: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.

ngiemboon: Ncwò nzém gÿo ńgwɔ́, tà mbà nèm pyě, pʉ̀a jʉ’ó kaa megàŋa guɔ ntsèm, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie tsɔ́*messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b, ńdɔg ńtó ńgyá Yěsô.
en: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ metsèm cú’te ncwò ndá.
en: And all the city was gathered together at the door.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo meguɔ ntí ntí ná pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mag, ńgíŋe ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ, éfóo ná pʉ̀a ńkẅɛɛ. À lɔ̌ɔn tě ńzẅíŋe tà tsɔ̌*Ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn nò wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó la gÿo ne ńdʉ́a, tà jʉ’ nyé síŋe sǐŋ, Yěsô lu ssé, éfó ndá ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa lê nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńzye lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.

ngiemboon: Símo pâ yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô cʉ́’ nzèm ne fa’a yé,
en: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pʉ̀a metsèm ne fa’a gú.
en: And when they had found him, they said unto him, Allmenseek for thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pege gíŋe ńgʉa jʉ’ʉ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, á tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ melá’ mie ée shÿó jʉ’ó, mèŋ shwóŋó nò Ssé mbɔɔ wó, ée nkẅɛ̌ ndá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he said unto them,Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńgwá ńgiŋe jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea ntsèm, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè, éshwóŋó nò Ssé, ńkúu ńjwóŋo*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a.
en: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ngàŋ nkà’ gÿo ńtó ńkẅí’te mvfò Yěsô, ésẅíŋte yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, mbà ɔ ku’u légÿo n zeŋe.
en: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe mé kúu Yěsô, á tsege pwó ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋe.
en: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forthhishand, and touched him, and saith unto him,I will; be thou clean.

ngiemboon: Nkà’ gwóon ḿmaga ná yé, á zeŋe.
en: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ngie, à gʉa, ńně ńtɔ́’ɔ yé tɛ’,
en: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Pɔ́ɔn léshwóŋó nyìŋ tsɔ́ nò. Gʉa ńnyɛ pɔ́ mbùm ɔ mbwo nùŋe pwɔ́’, ḿbiŋ ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te mbwo nyìŋ gẅie nkà’ é magá ná yé, gÿo pú’u, pʉ̀a metsèm leen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ zeŋe.
en: and saith unto him,See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa, ńdeen ńgwá ńdɔgɔ nò ŋwɛ́ sá jʉ’. Á gwɔ gwɔ́ tà Yěsô tě ńgíŋe shʉ̀a shʉ̀a, ńkúu tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzso pɔ́ mánzsè, á jʉ’ gie pʉ̀a té wó wɔ́. Mé ké ńně fóo jʉ’ ntsèm, ńtóo tǒ, ńgyá yé.
en: But he went out, and began to publishitmuch, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, Yěsô gíŋ ḿbiŋe Kapernawúm. Mé jú’ ngie aa ndá,
en: And again he entered into Capernaum aftersomedays; and it was noised that he was in the house.

ngiemboon: alá’ pú ńcú’te wó tà ntÿɔgɔ́ kwò tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ ncwò ndá, Yěsô zye léshwóŋó wɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receivethem, no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó, ńgẅiin ngàŋa kwʉ́’te, mbà mbàŋa lekùa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b leŋé yé, lélɔg ńtó ńgyá Yěsô.
en: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.

ngiemboon: Alá’ piŋ ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn, tà pɔ́ té ku’u lényɛɛ yé mbwo Yěsô wɔ́, ńgyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́’ ḿpfó pɔ́ nzsè gie e gee tÿǒ ndá, ńdeŋte ńtsɔ́’ɔ jʉ’, á gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie Yěsô aa wó, éfó wó sẅé’e nguɔ wɔ́b nê kǔ wé, ńtÿɔ́gɔ mvfò yé.
en: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had brokenitup, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwo gù.
en: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy,Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńjú’, ńkwaŋte lóŋ pɔ́b ngie:
en: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wɔɔn shwóŋó lêkɔ́ lɛ? À zoonté Ssé. E Ssé gílé yé zɔ ku’u lélege menò tepòŋ nyìŋ.
en: Why doth thismanthus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gǎ ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá ntʉ́m pi?
en: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them,Why reason ye these things in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zeŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ngie mé legé menò tepòŋ mé, kà pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie à lu ssé ńkaa kǔ wé ńdɔg ńgʉa?
en: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy,Thysins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge ké nyɛɛ gẅi ngie, áa ndùmo Ssé tsetsá’, mbà mé la ná tʉ̀ né*Míŋ Nyìŋ, lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b. Yěsô zɛ́te pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ngie:
en: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins,(he saith to the sick of the palsy,)

ngiemboon: Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a gù.
en: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńdu ssé, ńkaa páŋte we, ńdɔg ńně ńgee, alá’ ne ńdíe, á pú ńně ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ̌ɔwɔ́ɔ. Pɔ́ ne ńgu’te Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg laa zɔɔn ńgyá yɔɔn ntí nò wɔ́!
en: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋe ḿbiŋ nzèm nkwɔ’ɔ́ ntse Galilea. Alá’ ne ńtóo ńkẅɛ́te yé, á ne ńzí’i wɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńgiŋe, ńgyá Lěvi míŋ Alfe, á ńnéŋe jʉ’ gie mé kẅé ncùb pà*Roma wó. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tóo pɔgɔ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe. Lěvi lu ssé ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And as he passed by, he saw Levi thesonof Alphæus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Lěvi léjÿó mmó, pâ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńjÿó mmó, lelÿò gwɔ́*pàkẅé ncùb, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pà Yuda lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo wɔ́b lé pʉ̀a tepòŋ, ńtí pʉ̀a ápɛ̌ laa nzèm Yěsô tɛ’.
en: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.

ngiemboon: *Pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pie é laa nà nùɔ pà*farisay, gyá pá’ Yěsô pâ pʉ̀a ápɛ̌ ne ńjÿó mmó, ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Á gÿo lêkɔ́ tá gẅi pâ ńtí pʉ̀a pɛ̂ tem ngwʉ̌ŋ?
en: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ésaga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, ńgʉa fa’a ngÿo meffò wɔ́. Nyìŋ guɔ tá fa’a yé. Mèŋ n ka tè tó pɔ́ létóŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a membòŋo ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwo Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ka tǒ ńtí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉ̀a.
en: When Jesus heardit, he saith unto them,They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

ngiemboon: Á láa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’,*ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ Mbabtis pâ pà*farisay ne*ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie:*Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ pâ pé pà*farisay kwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. E pú piŋ ńké tè gÿo yɔ́b pú’u wɔ́, mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gʉa ńzíŋ leluŋó nyìŋ, á nyé ńnéŋe ńnéŋe, pʉ̀a pie mé ně ńtóŋ ńnéŋe nzyè lêkɔ́? Pâ pɔ̌ lɔɔn ńnyé ńnéŋe ńnéŋe, mbà pɔ́ ge ké pfɛ́ pɔ́ mmó.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mé ge lá’ fó mbwo pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ésa’a yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉ̀’ó.
en: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ sẅé, ńdɔg ńtsɛ́ lepÿé ná nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ gÿo pú’u, mbà mmó nzsǒ sẅé ge kẅi’i shʉa nzsǒ, lepÿé pú fáŋ.
en: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgee ńde’e melù’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’*ngùb, mbà mé té néŋ melù’ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́’ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntú’ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà melù’ sẅé ge fu’, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntú’, mé sɔ́ɔn melù’, ésɔ́ɔn ntú’. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé néŋ mélù’ me sẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’ ye sẅé.
en: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nká’a ngesáŋ ntsíŋ,*ngàŋa kwò yé zye lésẅe ngesáŋ.
en: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pà*farisay gyá, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Líe jú tá ńgyá!*Ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ gÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ségè tɔ’ɔ légÿo nà lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi laa fó ńtóŋo jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne Ssé gie á la’te mmó gie fùɔ Ndavíd la gÿo wɔ́ kà? Mèŋ n gɔɔn fʉ̀’ gie nzyè la gyáŋa yé, anò cʉa wɔ́ba pʉ̀a pé.
en: And he said unto them,Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ó, Abiatar gwɔ́*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, Ndavíd kúu jʉ’ gie mé nuŋo pwɔ́’ wó, ḿbí mbelég gie mé náa mbwó Ssé, ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná ye pʉ̀a pé, tá*lepʉ̌ ségè zɛ́te ngie ndà’*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ zɔ pfɛ́. Tá’, fùɔ Ndavíd la pí ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná yé*ngàŋa kwò yé.
en: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé la gÿo lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ mesoŋ, à lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ ńnáa mbwo lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them,The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo tà mbɔɔ ná*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgíŋe ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà pwó yé léen ńkwé.
en: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńně ńdeŋe yé légyá kà à ge gÿo nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ zeŋe*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè wɔ́, pɔ́ fó mǒ, ésẅiŋe yé.
en: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo kwè pwó ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lu ssé ńtó ńtyé mvfò,
en: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand,Stand forth.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ ngie:*Lepʉ̌ ségè ée pé’e ńtsẅi ngie mé gÿo kɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè? Ńgie mé gÿo nò mbòŋo kà nò tepòŋ? Ńgie mé gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ kà pɔ́ ngie mé zẅé yé? Tsoon nyìŋ wɔ́b tè tsɔ́b.
en: And he saith unto them,Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?But they held their peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô paŋ lejÿɔ́g ńdɔg ńdíe wɔ́b, mbùm yé ne ńtsyɛte ńtí tʉʉ twó yɔ́b, á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ ngie: Siŋe pwó ɔ, á siŋ. Mé gyá á tʉte.
en: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man,Stretch forth thine hand.And he stretcheditout: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay leen fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, pâ pʉ̀a*Herôd gwóon ńcú’te léfa’ shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tá zẅé Yěsô.
en: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgʉa lê ngʉ̀ŋe máamáa letʉ̀ŋ Galilea. Menùɔ lá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́me nzèm yé, éfóo ngwòŋ Galilea mbɔɔ ngwòŋ Jẅidea,
en: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judæa,

ngiemboon: tà mbɔɔ tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem. Petsɔ́ fóo gwoŋó Idẅime, etsɔ́ fóo tà mbɔɔ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ, ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie é ńnéŋe ḿbɔ́ɔnte Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ. Pɔ́ tóo pú’u, légyá Yěsô, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńjú’u kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńgÿo.
en: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumæa, andfrombeyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pú’u, ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie, pɔ́ cwoŋte mûɔ mékanú’, à kúu tsoló, ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’ lésẅɛ́ɛ yé.
en: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à pǔ ńgÿo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn sẅéte, tà pʉ̀a metsèm pie guɔ laa ná pɔ́b nɔ́ɔnte yé, ńzába pwó nà yé, mélà’mie à la ne gÿo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn zeŋe.
en: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie*messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá Yěsô, ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé».
en: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yěsô ne ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tà ḿbʉ́ʉ tɛ’ ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo mé zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie à tsɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́b. Pɔ́ tó,
en: And he goeth up into a mountain, and callethunto himwhom he would: and they came unto him.

ngiemboon: á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńdɔg pʉ̀a ntsɔ́b pʉ́a nê legém, légwɔ́ gie pâ pɔ́ ge gwɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi lezíŋ sɔ́b lé*ngàŋ ntúm, léneŋe ńtúmo wɔ́b pɔ́ shwóŋó nò Ssé,
en: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a.
en: and to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, e pɔɔn: Wɔɔn laa Símo, á tsẅi lezíŋ sé lé Piɛ,
en: and Simon he surnamed Peter;

ngiemboon: wɔɔn gwɔ́ Jâg pɔ́ fɛ́ we Jâŋ, é gwɔ́ gubé zebede. Yěsô tsẅi lezíŋ sɔ́b lé Mboanergès, é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie, epúɔ lefàŋ sie é vɛ́te.
en: and James thesonof Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńtsɔ́’ɔ Ndeléya, pɔ́ Filib, ńgÿo Patelemî nê Matio, pɔ́ Tomáse, ńgÿo Jâg míŋ Alfe, ńgÿo Tadé nê Símo mûɔ ngwòŋ,
en: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James thesonof Alphæus, and Thaddæus, and Simon the Canaanite,

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgÿo Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la táa sẅiŋe Yěsô.
en: and Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu ndá, alá’ gíŋe ńcú’te ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn tà pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé té gyá fʉ̀’ tà ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó wɔ́.
en: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsìŋe ndá pà Yěsô jú’u yɔɔn nò, ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me mánzsè pá’ pɔ́ ge gʉa gwoon yé, ńně ńkwaŋa ngie twó yé cʉŋté.
en: And when his friends heardof it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

ngiemboon: Mbà tsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ně fó Yerósalem ńcwóŋ ńtó, ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: E*Ssé tepòŋ gie mé tóŋo lé Mbelzebùl zɔɔ ná yé. À lɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ tándá*messé tepòŋ.
en: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo wɔ́b pɔ́ tó, á saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà áa nénʉ́ ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Sátà sele ńjwoŋo twó mbùm yé lá?
en: And he called themunto him, and said unto them in parables,How can Satan cast out Satan?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà’a lá’ lɔɔn sele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ lá’ ge pyé.
en: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà’a tsìŋe ndá piŋ sele ńtág mélà’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ tsìŋe ndá ge tága.
en: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

ngiemboon: Sátà lɔɔn sele ńdÿɔ́’ɔ twó mbùm yé, kà fagte zɔ̌ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ sé lefùɔ wɔ́, mbà lefùɔ sé ŋwɛ́ té ge tyé wɔ́, mbà à yé nò ge mag.
en: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ té wó gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, á pwɔ́’ ndá tántʉ̀, ńkaa shúm sé té gwɔ́ gie à vɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ yé wɔ́. À vɔg tà ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, á ku’u lékúu ndá, ḿbú ńkaa shúm sé ntsèm.
en: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ ńke shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Ssé lá’ ḿbú ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b, tà mbɔɔ meshwóŋè ntsèm mie pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńzoonte yé.
en: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzoonte Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbà tsɔ̌ lélá’ ńdege ńnáa mbwo ngàŋ à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, mélà’mie à gẅiin menò tepòŋ mie é téen ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: but he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńgɔɔn ngie metʉ̀ mé fóo pɔ́ mbwo*Ssé tepòŋ.
en: because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

ngiemboon: Má pà Yěsô pâ mefɛ́ pé leen ńke ńtó, ńtyé ncwò ndá, ńtúmo nyìŋ ngie à gʉa ńtóŋo yé ńná né pɔ́b.
en: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pú ńnéŋe Ssé, ńtÿɔ́’te Yěsô ńnéŋe soŋ, mé gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Mé gɔ̌ɔn ngie má ɔ pâ mefɛ́ pú ée pi ńně fa’a ɔ.
en: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie, má wɔ̀ɔn aa wɔ̌, mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pàwɔ̌?
en: And he answered them, saying,Who is my mother, or my brethren?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ésele ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é tÿɔ́’te yé ńnéŋe soŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pɔ̀ɔn pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe lɔɔn.
en: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said,Behold my mother and my brethren!

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà ngàŋ aa má wɔ̀ɔn, mbà aa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn, we mámbàŋa mbɔɔ we manzwě.
en: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋe ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Galilea, anùɔ lá’ tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńnéŋe. Alá’ tyé ngʉ̀ŋe ntse.
en: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

ngiemboon: Á la lɔg*sagá nò ńzí’i wɔ́b menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te ńjú’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgʉa ḿma’ mbyè mmó,
en: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

ngiemboon: ńtóo mma’á, etsɔ́ memvòm gwe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, meshʉ́ŋ tó ńdagte ḿpfɛ́.
en: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe nà jʉ’ʉ metóon, á jʉ’ gie tsetsá’ té wó tɛ’ wɔ́, ńtɔ́g sá’ á nue é la zébe zebé.
en: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:

ngiemboon: Nèm gÿo ńtʉ́a mboŋó, ńtuɔ, é júm, á nue menŋàŋ la tè lyɛɛ ssé wɔ́.
en: but when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ legǐ tepòŋ. Legǐ tepòŋ gÿo ńdu ssé, éfóme mɛ̌, é té zém.
en: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe nà jʉ’ʉ tsetsá’a mbòŋo, ńgú’, éshʉ́a mboŋó. Metsɔ́ metsiŋe gwɔ́ ná mvòm móm ntá, metsɔ́ ná móm ntɔgɔ́, metsɔ́ ná nkÿo.
en: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: And he said unto them,He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gÿo ńgʉa, pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém cʉ́’ nzèm, ńzɛ́te yé ngie à kyagte*mesagá nò éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé lá gÿo ngie pi pɛ̂ zɔ zsé nò nénʉ́ nà lefùɔ sé gie áa lelyěen. Tá á gʉa ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té nà gí nùɔ wɔ́, pɔ́ jú’ yɔ́b pɔ́ ndà’ ngie mé lɔg sagá nò ńgɔɔn nò.
en: And he said unto them,Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, allthesethings are done in parables:

ngiemboon: á lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b.
en: that seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, andtheirsins should be forgiven them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tě ńjú’u yɔɔn*sagá nò wɔ́ pá’ɔɔn, tà piŋ jú’ metsɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pyě mmó, à pye shwóŋè Ssé
en: The sower soweth the word.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, Sátà gwóon ńtó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wɔ́b ńkẅile.
en: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě jʉ’ʉ metóon lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ésẅɛte ńzẅíŋ nê lekág.
en: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

ngiemboon: Tá’, á té lyɛ menŋaŋ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pɔ́b wɔ́, á nue pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, mé gwɔ́ tà ńzye lékʉ́e wɔ́b, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’ mélà’ nò Ssé, pɔ́ gwóon ńgwá’.
en: and have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é jú’u shwóŋè Ssé,
en: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ńzye lémÿɔg menò njÿó, nkáb zye léfʉte wɔ́b, pɔ́ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn setsɔ́ shúm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, sɛ̌ shúm gÿo shwóŋè Ssé maga ntʉ́m pɔ́b té zém ntɔ̌ɔn.
en: and the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě nà tsetsá’a mbòŋo, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ńzẅíŋ, ḿbiŋ ńně ńgÿo pá’ nò Ssé ne ńzɛ́te, ńdɔgɔ ńgee mvfò, pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pá’ mbyè mmó gie tsɔ̌ mvòm gwɔ̌ sá’ tó ńná memvòm móm ntá, yetsɔ̌ ná móm ntɔgɔ́, yetsɔ̌ ná nkÿo.
en: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receiveit, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà a lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔgɔ lâm ńtó, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg ngwʉ̌ŋ ńkábte, kà ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ kesse kǔ wɔ́? Mé té tÿɔ́g pɔ́ nà jʉ’ gie mé pú ńgyá wɔ́ leen?
en: And he said unto them,Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa lélyěen fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ gie mé ge nyɛ mé gyá, anò gie áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ntsèm, mé ge kyɛ́’ shwóŋó mángyɛ̌.
en: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńzẅí’te nò Ssé pi jú’ tà ńjú’. Anò gie pi nyɛté ńjú’ mboŋó, nzẅìŋ gẅie nyìŋ lɔ̌g ńnéŋe twó ńjú’u nò Ssé, ée wɛ̌ tá à gÿo ńdɔg náa zsé nò mbwo ngàŋ, tà ńgíŋe ńkẅi’i.
en: And he said unto them,Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin mmó, mé ge gÿo kẅi’i, nyìŋ gẅie à tè gẅiin, mé kẅé méjʉ’ gẅie à zɔɔn ńgẅiin.
en: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé gwá’a mbyè mmó gie nyìŋ ma’á nɔ̀ɔn yé la,
en: And he said,So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

ngiemboon: à gwɔ̌ tà ḿma’, ńgʉa, kà à ne ńdyé lyě wɔ́, kà à tè ne ńdyé wɔ́ wɔ́, mbà shúm ne ńgú’u zsǒ pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’, à tè zsé mmó gie á gÿo tá é gú’ wɔ́.
en: and should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

ngiemboon: Tsetsá’ gílé yé zɔ gÿo mbyè mmó sá’, ńgú’, éshʉ́a metsɔ̀’, ḿmú’te.
en: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ̀’ gÿo ńtʉ, angàŋa nɔ̀ɔn cʉ́’ ńtúm pɔ́ pʉ̀a nká’ ńdag shúm, mélà’mie afʉ̀’ʉ lélag shúm kǔ’.
en: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege lɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’ pá’*Lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pege lɔgɔ yɛ̌*sagá nò ńtyɛ’te?
en: And he said,Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

ngiemboon: É leen sẅé mbyè mmó gie e kɔ̌g pá’ tsɔ̌ ntí lesɔ́ɔn sésɔ́g. Mé gwaa ma’, é pú ńkɔ́g ńcʉa metsɔ́ membyè shúm léjÿó sie mé pye nká’.
en: It islike a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

ngiemboon: Tá mé ké ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbye, ésá’, ḿbú ńgú’ ńcʉa setsɔ́ shúm léjÿó ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nká’, éshʉ́a memáa mbwó, ḿbú ńgú’, éshú’ tà ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ meshʉ́ŋ ně ńtóo ḿbá’a menkʉ̀a mɔ́b tsoló.
en: but when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó pú’u, ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ mesagá nò pá’ mɔɔn, tá shwóŋó nò Ssé, éshwóŋó nà ntí gie ńgwɔ́ lá’ á ku’u lé jú’.
en: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hearit.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn tě shwóŋó wɔ́b nò té lɔg pé*sagá nò wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé zɔ̌ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́, á pú ńkyagte shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn.
en: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém lyɛ’ó, Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pege túm ntse, ńgʉa nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them,Let us pass over unto the other side.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé nyé nùɔ lá’ jʉ’ó, ńkẅɛ́te yé tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ gie á kɔ’ɔ́ tsòló ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa. Pâ metsɔ́ mekanú’ la púte ńně ńgee,
en: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ máamáa fóm ńnéŋe tà ńzye lécʉ’, ntse ne ḿbʉe ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, tà á cʉ́’ʉ ńgee pé ńdúe,
en: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ nzèm, ńjʉ́’ʉ nà mmó ńně ńdyé,*ngàŋa kwò yé gwɔ́ zyeen yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Andè, tsye ɔ̀ tè ne ńgyá pá’ pege gee ńkwé lɔɔn wɔ́ kà?
en: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zyeen, ńcÿɔ́gɔ fefà pɔ́ ntse, ńtsẅi ngie: Á kǔ’ pɛ́’ɛ̀, pi láŋte! Afóm gwóon ńzá’a, ntse té gíŋe ńcʉ’ʉ wɔ́.
en: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea,Peace, be still.And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie, pi sěen ḿbɔ́gɔ kɔ́, pi fɔ̌ɔn ńnyé pɔ́ tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ kà.
en: And he said unto them,Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ńkẅi’i ńcÿɔ’, ńně ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie, yɔɔn lìi nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́? Tà mbɔɔ fóm pâ ntse jú’u ncwò wé?
en: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé túm ntse tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ, é gwɔ́ ngwòŋ pà Garazania,
en: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

ngiemboon: ńně fóo tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛɛ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwóon ńkẅɛ ńtóo mvfò yé, éfóo mvwɔ́’ metóon, á gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé túŋo mepfó wó, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ, mbà*ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé, ńně ḿbue yé.
en: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé pɔ́ mvwɔ́’ metóon ŋwɛ́, nyìŋ piŋ tè wó gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gíŋe ńku’u lékwɛ́ɛ yé wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ lê tsên wɔ́.
en: who hadhisdwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́, mbà mé lǎ zye ńnéŋe*kɔ̌’ mekwò yé, ńdɔgɔ tsɛ̂n ńkwɛ́ mbwó mé, á pú ḿbwɔ́’te*kɔ̌’, ńzá’te metsɛ̂n tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńku’u ná yé wɔ́.
en: because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could anymantame him.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ kà zsǒ wɔ́, kà tsẅɛ́’ wɔ́, ńgwá ḿbúu, éfóo mvwɔ́’ metóon ńgee ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ ńga’te, ńně ńdɔgɔ metóon ńgwate mbùm ye.
en: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.

ngiemboon: Á tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgyá Yěsô pú’u, ńnɔ́ɔnte yé ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò yé,
en: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,

ngiemboon: ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńga’te ngie: Yěsô Míŋ Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ɔ̀ kẅé kɔ́ mbwo mèŋ? Tsétsɔ’, mèŋ n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Ssé sẅíŋte gú ngie, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lé ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’?
en: and cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus,thouSon of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ la gwaa gɔɔn pú’u, á gwɔ́, mbà Yěsô tsẅǐ né*messé tepòŋ ngie pɔ́ fó ná yé ńkẅɛ.
en: For he said unto him,Come out of the man,thouunclean spirit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lezíŋ shú ée le wɔ̌? Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ée le menùɔ, mélà’mie peg*messé tepòŋ gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn,
en: And he asked him,Whatisthy name?And he answered, saying, My nameisLegion: for we are many.

ngiemboon: ńnyɛte sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Tsétsɔ’, tà á jwoŋ messé ŋwɛ́ tà pɔ́ fóo lá’ ayɛ̌ ńgʉa.
en: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ́ nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, á ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ ńně ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ fa’a shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ.
en: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: Gÿo peg kú pɔ́ nà mekúnɔ́ɔn pɛ̂.
en: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zẅíŋ,*messé tepòŋ leen ńké fóo ná nyìŋ ŋwɛ́, ńkẅɛ ńkúu nà mekúnɔ́ɔn. Anùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn pú ńtága fó ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ ḿbʉle ntse, ńnú ntse ńkwéte. Pɔ́ laa mmó ntsá’ yépʉ́a.
en: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ḿpféle mekúnɔ́ɔn gyá pú’u, ńkÿo, ńgʉa ḿbú ńdɔgɔ nò gie pɔ́ gyǎ, ésaa tÿǒsoŋ, tà mbɔɔ lá’. Alá’ kwɔ́’, ńtó ńgyá mmó gie á gÿǒ,
en: And they that fed the swine fled, and tolditin the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie*messé tepòŋ laa ná yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn la, á ńnéŋe ḿma’ menzsǒ, mbà legyè sé pǐŋ, pɔ́ pú ḿbɔ́g tɛ’.
en: And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mbà pɔ́ ně ńgyá mmó gie á gÿǒ nyìŋ awɛ̌ mbàa mekúnɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ ne ḿbíte shwóŋó pʉ̀a pie é tǒ nzèm.
en: And they that sawittold them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, andalsoconcerning the swine.

ngiemboon: Mé jú’, ńzye lésẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à fó lá’ pɔ́b ńgʉa.
en: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ pá’ à ge cʉ́’ gʉa yé gʉa, nyìŋ wá gẅie à zeŋé la, sẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ, pɔ́ ye gʉa.
en: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lʉ’, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Piŋ nê mbʉ̀a gù, ńkẅɛte pʉ̀a pú, éshwóŋó wɔ́b máa nò mbòŋo gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿǒ ná gú, éshwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ à tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe mú.
en: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him,Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńgʉa ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ ŋwɛ́ ntsèm, ńně shwóŋó nò gie Yěsô ně ńgÿo ná yé. Pʉ̀a metsèm jú’u á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Mé tóŋo yɛ̌ pàga lá’ lê Metÿǒsoŋ Legém.
en: And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and allmendid marvel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔgɔ kanú’ ńtúm ntse tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ. Máamáa nùɔ lá’ cú’te lejʉ́ŋ ye. Á nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nkʉ̀ŋ ntse,
en: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Yayelo, á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nà melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá Yěsô, ńdeen ńnuŋe mekwò ye,
en: And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,

ngiemboon: ḿbú’ mbwó ngie: Tsétsɔ’ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn we manzwě à cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé, tóo, ńzáb mbwó mú ná ye, à sẅéte ńtsẅɛ́.
en: and besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death:I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zẅíŋ, pɔ́ yé cʉ́me mánzsè ńně ńgee, alá’ pú ńgwɔ́ mánzsè tɛ’, ḿbú ne sẅɛ́ɛ Yěsô.
en: AndJesuswent with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé nùɔ, ńně ńguɔ, ńgẅiin guɔ máshúɔ, mbà á gegé yé gege ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém.
en: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

ngiemboon: Mbà à lǎ giŋe mbʉ̀a megàŋa ffo tà ńkʉ́a, ḿbú ńcʉŋte ye nkáb tà é mag, ńké tè sẅéte, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, aguɔ kẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: and had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,

ngiemboon: À la jú’ pá’ mé gɔɔn ngie Yěsô ne ńgÿo pʉ̀a zeŋe, á ná’te fó nzèm ńtó ńkíbe nzsǒ Yěsô,
en: when she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

ngiemboon: ńně ńgɔɔn ntʉ́m yé ngie: N dɔɔn ńkíbe pɔ́ ndà’ nzsǒ Yěsô, mbà n ge zeŋe,
en: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńkíbe, aguɔ yé gwóon ńzá’a, á gíŋe ńjú’, mbà à zeŋé.
en: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt inherbody that she was healed of that plague.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńjú’ pá’ tsɔ́ metʉ̀ kẅɛ̌ mbùm yé, ésele nnɛ́ ńdíe lá’, ńzɛ́te ngie: À wɔ̌ kibé nzsǒ yɔ̀ɔn?
en: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said,Who touched my clothes?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔ̀ gyǎ alá’ pú ne sẅɛ́ɛ gú zẅìŋ wɔɔn, ɔ̀ gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie à wɔ̌ kibé nzsǒ jù wɔ́ la?
en: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

ngiemboon: Yěsô ké sele pɔ́ nnɛ́ ńně ńnáŋte, éfa’a lézsé nyìŋ gẅie à kibé yé.
en: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ cʉ́’ʉ ḿvɛɛ vɛ, ńtí nue à la zsé mmó gie á cʉ̌a ná ye, ńdeen ńké ńtó, ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ḿbú shwóŋó yé kwà’ nò gie á cʉaté ntsèm.
en: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ la, ɔ̀ zeŋé, gʉa lê mbʉ́lè, aguɔ jú mǎg.
en: And he said unto her,Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgɔɔn nò né manzwě ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn, etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a fóo mbʉ̀a Yayelo, ńtó shwóŋó yé ngie míŋ we ně ńdá’ ńkwé, ngie tà á gíŋe ḿbége Ndè.
en: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue'shouse certainwhich said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie à kaa jú’u la, ńgɔɔn né Yayelo ngie: Tè pɔ́g, záb pɔ́ ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue,Be not afraid, only believe.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pɔ́ Yayelo ne ńgee, Yěsô tè zẅíŋ ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b wɔ́, ndà’ Piɛ ńgÿo Jâg pɔ́ fɛ́ we Jâŋ.
en: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu ndá Yayelo, Yěsô gyá mé pú ńgwɔ́ wó ńně ḿbége jʉ’, epʉ̀a ne ńdʉate, petsɔ́ ne ńga’te.
en: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu ndá ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi pǔ ḿbége jʉ’, ńdʉa nzẅìŋ wɛ̂ mélà’a kɔ́? Múɔ kaa kwé, à lye lyě.
en: And when he was come in, he saith unto them,Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ńgẅe yé gẅe. Á gÿo pʉ̀a metsèm fóo ndá ńkẅɛ, tà é cʉ́’ ndà’ tá múɔ pɔ́ má múɔ, ńgÿo*ngàŋa kwò yé yɛ̌. Pâ pɔ̌ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ lûm ndá, á jʉ’ gie múɔ nuŋe wó.
en: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kú’te pwó múɔ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Talita kum, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Múɔ manzwě, lu ssé.
en: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her,Talitha cumi;which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gwóon ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́, ńdu ssé ńzye légiŋ. Pɔ́ gyá á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Múɔ laa mûɔ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she wasof the ageof twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pú ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé mmó gie à gÿǒ, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi ngie mé náa mmó à jÿó.
en: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la fóo jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né lá’ pɔ́b, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gwɔ́.
en: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

ngiemboon: *Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b gÿo ńgwɔ́, á gʉa*ndá cú’tè pɔ́b, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn jú’u shwóŋè yé, ḿmɔɔn, ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn aa ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ yɔɔn ntí menò fóo pɔ́ nzɔ̌? Yɛ̌ ntí legyè fóo nzɔ̌ mbwo yé, à piŋ ngǎ tá ńku’u légÿo yɔɔn ntí menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn?
en: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearinghimwere astonished, saying, From whence hath thismanthese things? and what wisdomisthis which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?

ngiemboon: À tè kápíndɔ́ɔn, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Malîɛ wâ? Ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ pà Jâg, ńgÿo Joses, ńgÿo Jẅide mbɔɔ Símo wâ? Mefɛ́ pé pe pànzwě té gwɔ́ pɔ́ lá’ pege wɔɔn wɔ́ le? Pɔ́ gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò yé.
en: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
