ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mé gÿo mekù’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé jʉ’ ntsèm, tà é cʉ́’ ndà’ lá’ pɔ́b, mé gwága yé nùɔ mefɛ́ pé, á ndá pɔ́b.
en: But Jesus said unto them,A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.

ngiemboon: Á la gwɔ́ gwɔ̌ tà Yěsô pú tè gÿo tsɔ́ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn wó wɔ́, tà ńdí’ ndà’ pá’ à la záb mbwó mé nà tsɔ́ ntá’ megàŋa guɔ, ńgÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healedthem.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa ńzye légiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ shÿó jʉ’ó, ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gÿo ńku’, á tóŋ pʉ̀a pé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńzye létúmo wɔ́b mépʉ́a mépʉ́a, ńná metʉ̀ mbwo pɔ́b lélɔg ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é gwoon pʉ̀a ḿbúe wɔ́b,
en: And he calledunto himthe twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, pi gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’, mé gɔɔn ngie pi lá’a tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́, pi ké ńtsẅé pɔ́ wó tà ńdá’ fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa.
en: And he said unto them,In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tsɔ́ lá’ lɔɔn ńdʉ’ʉ lékúe gẅí, ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u shwóŋè gí, pi fó wó ńgwaa gʉa, ḿbú’u pfepfɔ́b mekwò pi, lélɔg ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngie nò gie pɔ́ gÿǒ, á cʉ́’ʉ ńdíe pɔ́ wɔ́b.
en: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwá ńgiŋe jʉ’ ntsèm ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mânyìŋ ntsèm kúbe mà.
en: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, ńtse mèvɛ nà meguɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healedthem.

ngiemboon: À yɔɔn nò gÿo lezíŋ Yěsô sa jʉ’. Fùɔ*Herôd jú’ yé pá’ mé ne ńgɔɔn menò mie Yěsô ne ńgÿo, tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô ŋwɛ́ ge gǎ wɔ́, é gwɔ́ Jâŋ Mbabtis, mbà à zǐm! Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá á ku’u légÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: And king Herod heardof him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa*Elîɛ, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie aa tsɔ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pá’ pe fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò.
en: Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd jú’ mɔɔn menò, ńgɔɔn yé ngie: Aa Jâŋ gẅie n da gÿo mé zá’a twó yé lá, mbà à zǐm.
en: But when Herod heardthereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà fùɔ*Herôd ka gÿo mé gwoon Jâŋ, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé ńgʉa ḿma’a ndá tsǎŋ, mélà’*Herôdiad gẅie à laa nzwě fɛ́ we Filib, tá á kaa.
en: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.

ngiemboon: Jǎŋ ne ńkaga yé ngie:*Lepʉ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe ngie ɔ̀ kaa nzwě fɛ́ gù wɔ́.
en: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pú’u, tá*Herôdiad pú ńzá’ lekwɔ̀ɔn sé, ńně fa’a shÿó légÿo mé zẅé yé, ńké tè ne ńgyá wɔ́. À tě ngyá shÿó wɔ́,
en: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie fùɔ*Herôd lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo mekù’ Jâŋ, ńně ńzsé ngie aa nyìŋ Ssé, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, pú’u la, tá á ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte yé pɔ́ɔnte, ḿbiŋe ńnéŋe ńkwoŋo lézẅí’te shwóŋè yé tɛ’, tá’ á ke ńgege yé gege.
en: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gÿo ńgwɔ́, eshÿó kẅɛɛ mbwo*Herôdiad, á zẅɛ́’ pá’ mé ne ńjÿó máamáa línɔ́ɔn nɔ’ lélɔg ńkímte lyɛ̌’ gie mé la zyé fùɔ*Herôd, mbà fùɔ*Herôd tǒŋ mekěm, ńtóŋ metándá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, mbɔɔ memáa pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chiefestatesof Galilee;

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńgÿo línɔ́ɔn, míŋ*Herôdiad ŋwɛ́ we manzwě tó ńzíŋe mmó, ńzíŋ tà nò poŋo fùɔ*Herôd pâ pʉ̀a pie à ně ńtóŋo wɔ́b. Afùɔ gɔɔn né múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́ ngie: Zɛ́te jú mmó gie ɔ̀ kwǒŋ ngie mèŋ n dɔg ḿma’a gú, tà à poŋo gú,
en: and when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will giveitthee.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn tà fó ńkʉa ngie: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge zɛ́te wɔ́, mèŋ n ge ná né gù. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn fó ńzɛ́te pɔ́ ngie pɔgɔ gab lefùɔ sɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ n zẅíŋ zẅǐŋ.
en: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will giveitthee, unto the half of my kingdom.

ngiemboon: Múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́ kẅɛ, ńgʉa ńzɛ́te má we ngie: Mèŋ n tsẅi ngie fùɔ lɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿma’a wɔ̀ɔn? Má we tsɔ́’ ngie: Gʉa ńzɛ́te twó Jâŋ Mbabtis.
en: And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

ngiemboon: Múɔ kÿote ńgʉa lejʉ́ŋ fùɔ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n kwoŋo twó Jâŋ Mbabtis, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga káŋ, pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ jú’, shÿó wé leen sẅɛ́’ tá’, le gwɔ́ gie à ně ńgɔɔn mvfò megʉ̀ pé tà ńkʉa gÿo à tè zsé lélʉ’ wɔ́.
en: And the king was exceeding sorry;yetfor his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńtúmo feffò, ńtsẅi ngie à gʉa ńdɔgɔ twó Jâŋ ńtó. Feffò gʉa ndá tsǎŋ ńzá’a twó Jâŋ,
en: And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ ńdɔg ńtó, ńnáa mbwo múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, á kẅé ńgʉa ńnáa mbwo má we.
en: and brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ gÿo ńjú’ ngie mé zẅě tá wɔ́b, ńtó ńkaa pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋ.
en: And when his disciples heardof it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

ngiemboon: *Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô pɛ̌ gʉa tà ḿbiŋ, ńtó ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńně ḿbíte shúm ntsèm sie pɔ́ pǔ ńgÿo, éshwóŋó yé tà mbɔɔ mmó gie pɔ́ zi’í pʉ̀a.
en: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó pege fa’a jʉ’ gie nyìŋ tè wó wɔ́, pi ná’a ńzẅɛte. Á gɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie alá’ la ne ńcʉate, petsɔ́ ne ńgee, petsɔ́ ne ńtóo, tà pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé pú tè gẅiin fʉ̀’ lépfɛ́ɛ mmó wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them,Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while:for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńně ńgee nà jʉ’ gie membʉ̀a té wó wɔ́.
en: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gʉa, alá’ gyá wɔ́b, ńdiŋe wɔ́b, ńzá’te ńgiŋ nê mekwò, éfó metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm ḿbú ńkẅɛ, ḿvɔgɔ nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, ńzẅí’te Yěsô.
en: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.

ngiemboon: Á kúu jʉ’ó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛ, ńgyá nùɔ lá’, mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé, mélà’mie pɔ́ laa pá’ nùɔ*menjʉ̀njÿò gie ampfele tè wó wɔ́ la. Á zye lézí’i wɔ́b menò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.

ngiemboon: Zà’ gÿo ńcʉa,*ngàŋa kwò yé tóo lejʉ́ŋ ye, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege ee jʉ’ɔɔn nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, mbà zà’ cʉ̌a,
en: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the timeisfar passed:

ngiemboon: tsẅi né pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ membʉ̀a mbaa tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, ńjú shúm léjÿó.
en: send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi zɔ náa mmó pɔ́ pfɛ́, pɔ́ tsɔ́’ yɔ́b ngie: Áa pá’ɔɔn peg gʉa ńcʉŋte máamáa nkáb, tà e ne ńku’u medenie nkÿo pʉ́a, tá ńdá’ ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́gɔ lá’ yɔɔn keen?
en: He answered and said unto them,Give ye them to eat.And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gẅiin mbelég mbu’ú shÿɔ́’ɔ? Pi gʉa ńdíe pege gyá. Pɔ́ gʉa ńdíe, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋó yé ngie: Peg gẅiin mbelég mbu’ú ntʉ̀a ńgÿo messó mbàŋ pʉ́a.
en: He saith unto them,How many loaves have ye? go and see.And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gÿo pʉ̀a néŋte nà megǐ menùɔ menùɔ.
en: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

ngiemboon: Mé sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋte ssé menùɔ menùɔ, tsɔ́ menkàŋ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a móm ntʉ̀a, metsɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a nkÿo.
en: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kẅé mbelég ŋwɛ́ mbu’ú ntʉ̀a pɔ́ messó mbàŋ pʉ́a, ḿbʉ’ʉ twó yé, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te mbelég ńnáa mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge gabte mbwo lá’, ńgíŋe ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, nà messó.
en: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gavethemto his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b metsèm pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled.

ngiemboon: Mé lagte mekèm mbelég mbaa messó mie é vwɔ’ɔ́, é lúe metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la pfɛ́ mbelég, la gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà ndà’ mbàŋa gwɔ́ mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a.
en: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwoon ńtsẅii mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pɔ́ kúu kanú’, ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńtúm né yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, á nà gwoŋó Mbetsayida, á cʉ́’ nzèm ńde’e lá’ á gʉa.
en: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.

ngiemboon: Yěsô le’e lá’ tà pʉ̀a gwaa gʉa, á kwɔ́’ɔ ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɔ’ɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.

ngiemboon: Nzěm gÿo ńgwaa síŋ, mbà kanú’ gʉ̌a tà ńgwɔ́ soŋ ntse, Yěsô nyé ńtyé pɔ́ ssé gílé ye,
en: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

ngiemboon: tá ńké ńgyá pá’ ntse ne ńgege pʉ̀a pé, mélà’mie fefà la ne fóo pɔ́ mvfò mvfò ńtóo. Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ nkwɔ́’ njÿó, Yěsô gwɔ jwoŋte wɔ́b, ńne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse, tà fa’a létɔ́gɔ wɔ́b,
en: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.

ngiemboon: pɔ́ gyá pá’ nyìŋ ne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse, ńkwaŋ ngie áa gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ, ńzye léga’te lê tʉ̀.
en: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ metsèm la pú ne ńgyá yé pá’ à tóo, ḿbú ńcÿɔ’, tá Yěsô leen ńtóŋo wɔ́b, éshwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Pi pʉ́le ńnéŋe, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, tà pi pɔ́g.
en: for they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them,Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, fefà zá’a, á cʉa wɔ́b,
en: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie legyè sɔ́b nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g, ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ kaa liŋe mmó gie Yěsô kɔ’ɔ́ ńjÿɔ́gɔ lá’ ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ wɔ́.
en: For they considered notthe miracleof the loaves: for their heart was hardened.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ túm ntse, tà ńkúu nà nzǐŋ ye Jenezared, ńcʉŋe kanú’, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńkẅɛ,
en: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

ngiemboon: ńkẅɛ tà ńgwaa tyé ssé, mé liŋe Yěsô,
en: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,

ngiemboon: ńgwóon ńkÿote ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a fa’ megàŋa guɔ, ńkaa wɔ́b nà mekǔ ńdɔg ńtó ne jʉ’ gie mé jǔ’ ngie aa wó.
en: and ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńcʉa nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a wɔ́, mé ne ńkate meguɔ ńdɔgɔ ńtóo, ńnuŋte jʉ’ gie à ge cʉa wó, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à fó ńzẅíŋ pɔ́ kíbe pɔ́ ndà’ tsɔ́ɔn nzsǒ yé. Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kibé tsɔ́ɔn nzsǒ ŋwɛ́, pú ńzeŋe métsèm.
en: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é fóo Yerósalem tó ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgwɔ́ pà*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê,
en: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: ńgyá*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ne ńjÿó mmó nê*lɔ̌’ nà mbwó mɔ́b, é mbwó mie pɔ́ kaa tsabte.
en: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay pâ pà Yuda metsèm té pfɛ́ɛ mmó té vɔg ńzate ntse nà mbwó mɔ́b tà ńkúu nà ntsìŋe pwó yɔ́b, pá’ nùŋe pà mvfò wɔb ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́,
en: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they washtheirhands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa sɔ̌ɔn tà ḿbiŋ, ḿvɔg ńkẅile*lɔ̌’ ná pɔ́b, tá ńjÿó mmó. Pɔ́ gíŋ ńkú’te tsɔ́ mbʉ̌ tà é gyɔ́ɔn, é mie nùŋe ngwòŋ la záb, ńdɔg ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ntí lesɔgɔ*lɔ̌’ nà mentú’ mbɔɔ nà mekʉ̀ŋ, mbɔɔ ná mekáŋ, (tà mbɔɔ nà mekǔ).
en: Andwhen they comefrom the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold,asthe washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, tá pà*farisay pâ pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te Yěsô ngie:*Ngàŋa kwò jú jÿó mmó nê*lɔ̌’ nà mbwó mɔ́b. Pɔ́ té giŋe ná nùŋe pà mvfò wɔ́ ńdɔgɔ ngǎ?
en: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

ngiemboon: ntʉ́m wɔ́b té ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But their heart is far from me.

ngiemboon: mbwo pʉ̀a ngie áa nò yɔ́ɔn
en: Teachingfordoctrines the commandments of men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: À yɛ̂ gie pi pe’e*lepʉ̌ Ssé ńnáa nzèm, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkú’te pɔ́ se pʉ̀a mesoŋ lɛ.
en: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men,asthe washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé légwá’*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńcwoŋo ńkú’te pɔ́ nùŋe lá’ gẅi mboŋó.
en: And he said unto them,Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn nue Mǒsê la gɔ́ɔn ngie: «Gÿo mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzoonte tá we kà pɔ́ má we wɔ́, mé zẅé ngàŋ».
en: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:

ngiemboon: Tà á gʉa ná pi, pi gɔɔn gí ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo tá we kà má we wɔ́ ngie: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔg ńkẅéte yé cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ “Korban”, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Á cʉ́’ʉ ye Ssé,
en: but ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother,It isCorban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;he shall be free.

ngiemboon: mbà pi ge zẅíŋ ngie à té gíŋe ńgẅiin lékẅéte tá we pɔ́ má we wɔ́.
en: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

ngiemboon: Pi zí’i nùŋe lá’ gẅi pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwá’a shwóŋè Ssé. Pi giŋé ńne ńgÿo lìi menò ámɛ̌ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńtóŋo lá’ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi metsèm téŋe tuŋó, ńcwoŋo ńjú’u nò gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: And when he had called all the peopleunto him, he said unto them,Hearken unto me every oneof you, and understand:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ á fó nzème pǐ, ńkúu ná nyìŋ tà ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná yé á té wó wɔ́, a gie á fó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé zɔ̌ ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ye.
en: there is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.

ngiemboon: [Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’]
en: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo nyé lá’, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɛ́te yé ngie à kyagte nò gie à foo légɔɔn, éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, ńzsé ngie sí legyè nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g pá’ se petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwâ? Ammó gie á fó nzème pǐ ńkúu ná nyìŋ, á té*lɔ̌’ ná ye néŋ.
en: And he saith unto them,Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man,itcannot defile him;

ngiemboon: Á té kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m ngàŋ wɔ́, á kú pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lepfòm sé, ńkẅɛ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kwɛ. Yěsô lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: ammó gie mé jÿó jÿǒ zɔ̌ té gie áa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ gie á ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná nyìŋ wɔ́,
en: because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie, ammó gie á kẅɛɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ zɔ̌ ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ye.
en: And he said,That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

ngiemboon: Menkwaŋá tepòŋ zɔɔn fó pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ, tá ńtsóte mbàŋa pɔ́ fa’a panzwě, epanzwě fa’a mbàŋa, ńtsóte nyìŋ á gwáa ńjʉ, ńtsóte nyìŋ á zẅé wetsɔ̌,
en: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

ngiemboon: ńne ńgÿo gÿɛ́, ńne ńgẅiin kegɔ̀’, ńgẅiin ssé ntʉ́m, ńgẅiin fʉ̀te, ńkúu zɔgɔ́ tepòŋ, ńkwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ sóon twó nyìŋ, ńŋá’te nnɛ́, ńdʉ’ʉ ntÿɔgɔ́ ntsèm.
en: thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ menò tepòŋ mɔɔn kẅɛɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ, tá ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ye.
en: all these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fóo jʉ’ó ńgee nà tsɔ́ pàga ngwòŋ, á shÿó tÿǒsoŋo Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ndá, ńké tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zsé ngie aa jʉ’ó wɔ́. Tá’ mé ké ńzsé zsé.
en: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man knowit: but he could not be hid.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé wó, mbà*ssé tepòŋ ka gwoon míŋ we we manzwě, ńne ḿbue yé. Á jú’ yé mé gɔɔn ngie Yěsô tǒ, á nɔ́ɔnte yé, ńnuŋe mekwò yé,
en: For acertainwoman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:

ngiemboon: ésẅíŋte yé ngie à jwoŋ*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́, e kyɛɛ míŋ we ńnyé. Manzwě awɛ̌ la piŋ tè mûɔ Yuda wɔ́. A laa mûɔ Fénisi, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Siria.
en: the woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ pènkʉ́ jÿó mmó tà ńzẅɛ́, á té poŋo lékẅé shúm léjÿó pènkʉ́ ḿma’a mbwo ngwé wɔ́.
en: But Jesus said unto her,Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to castitunto the dogs.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ gɔɔn shwóŋó nò, tá’ ngwé ké ńdagte mesɔ́ɔn shúm sie pènkʉ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, é gwete ssé.
en: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Mèŋ n jǔ’ ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌g ńtsɔ́’, lo ńgʉa, à cʉa nà shwóŋè jú,*essé tepòŋ fó ná míŋ gù ńkẅɛ.
en: And he said unto her,For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ḿbiŋe mbʉ̀a ye, ńgwaa gyá, múɔ pʉ́le ńnuŋe ndùm kǔ mbà*ssé tepòŋ fǒ ná ye ńkẅɛ.
en: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó Tir, ńne ḿbiŋe né ngʉ̀ŋe letʉ̀ŋ Galilea, ńdɔg ye tÿǒsoŋ Sidoŋ, ńne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga lá’ Metÿǒsoŋ Legém.
en: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtóo mvfò yé, á gwɔ́ mbǔ’ metuŋó, ńgíŋe tè zsé léshwóŋe tà á kẅɛ wɔ́, megàŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à záb mbwó mé ná yé à zeŋe,
en: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔgɔ yé fó tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ pʉ̀a ńkẅɛ, ńnéŋ púɔ tepwó pé tsɛ̀ɛ metuŋó mé, ńtsaba tepwó we lê metyé, ńzába nà lʉ́m yé,
en: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ḿbʉ’ʉ menÿɔ́g mé ńdíe tÿǒ, ńzẅi, ńgɔɔn ngie: “Effata”! Ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsɔ́’ɔ!
en: and looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him,Ephphatha,that is, Be opened.

ngiemboon: Metuŋó mé gwóon ńtsɔ́’ɔ, alʉ́m yé kyɛ́’ɛ, á zye légɔɔn nò té mʉ́’te.
en: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ně ńdɔgɔ yé ńtó ngie: Tà pi gɔɔn tà nyìŋ jú’. Tá ńké ne ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b lêkɔ́ wɔ́, pɔ́ ké ne sá’a yɔɔn nò sǎ’.
en: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they publishedit;

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńjú’u, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn tà ńgɔɔn ngie à gÿo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ. À gÿo pà mbǔ’ metuŋó jú’u nò, mbɔɔ pa támbǎ’ gíŋe shwóŋe.
en: and were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà melyɛ̌’ amɛ̌, epʉ̀a tó, ḿbú ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, ńgíŋe ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, pâ pɔ̌ zye ńnéŋe. Pá’ pɔ́ la piŋ ńké tè mmó mpfɛ́ gẅiin la, Yěsô tóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciplesunto him, and saith unto them,

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe lá’ɔɔn pǔ ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, mélà’mie ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sétá pá’ pɔ́ ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńké tè nyé ńgẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pfɛ́ wɔ́,
en: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńnyé wɔ́b nzyè, pɔ́ piŋ nzèm né membʉ̀a, mbà pɔ́ té ge gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgʉa tà ńkú wɔ́. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɛ̂ fóo tàa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a.
en: and if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lɔg shúm léjÿó nzɔ̌ á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, tà pɔ́ pfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́ɛ?
en: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy thesemenwith bread here in the wilderness?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi zɔɔn ńgẅiin mbelég mbu’ú shÿɔ́’ɔ? Pɔ́ shwóŋó yé ngie pɔ́ gẅiin mbelég mbu’ú sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And he asked them,How many loaves have ye?And they said, Seven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi ngie lá’ ńnéŋe ssé, ńdeen ńké ńkẅé mbelég ŋwɛ́ mbu’ú sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńnáa mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé, pɔ́ gabte mbwo lá’.
en: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set beforethem; and they did setthembefore the people.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pɔ́ gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ́ mbɔ́ púɔ messó, tá’ é té gyɔ́ɔn. Yěsô gíŋe ńkẅé ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé mǒ, ńná ngie pɔ́ gabte mbwo lá’.
en: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also beforethem.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pú ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́. Mé piŋ ńdag mekèm mie é vwɔ’ɔ́, é lúe metúŋ sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a.
en: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the brokenmeatthat was left seven baskets.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á pǐŋ ḿpfɛ́ gwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ ntsá’ lekùa. Yěsô leen ńké ńtsẅi pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńgwóon ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa nê shÿó pàga ngwòŋ Ndálmanuta.
en: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay tó ńne fa’a nò ná ye, ńtsóte yé ngie à gÿo nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn gie á nyɛɛ ngie Ssé zɔ kà túmo yé, ńgie à nyɛɛ wɔ́b liŋé gie á la’te ngie Ssé zɔ tumó yé.
en: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ tà ńzẅi, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: epʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njyó fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n gÿo nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, éfa’a légǎ? Tá’, pi cʉ́’ mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi kwà’ nò nénʉ́, mé té ne nge nyɛɛ wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith,Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńnyé pʉ̀a*farisay jʉ’ó, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńtúm ntse ńgee yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé la gwaa túm ntse gee yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńgẅiin pɔ́ ndà’ lepu’ú mbelég sélemɔ’ɔ́, mbà pɔ́ ně ńdege té pí tsɔ̌ tà é gyɔ́ɔn.
en: Nowthe discipleshad forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgee pú’u, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pà*farisay mbɔɔ ye fùɔ*Herôd.
en: And he charged them, saying,Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, andofthe leaven of Herod.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à kǐm*mvòŋ pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńzye légɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà à tě ńgɔɔn pɔ́ pá’ pege tè mbelég gẅiin wɔ́?
en: And they reasoned among themselves, saying,It isbecause we have no bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé pá’ pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa pú’u, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kwaŋa nò pɔ́ nà mbelég gie pi tè gẅiin mélà’a kɔ́? Pi lɔgɔ ḿbú ńnyé pɔ́ tè zsě nò wâ? Pi fɔ̌ɔn ńnyé pɔ́ tè jǔ’ tà ńjú’ lá? Legyè sí gáa ḿbú ńjÿɔ́’ɔ pɛ́’ɛ̀?
en: And when Jesus knewit, he saith unto them,Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?

ngiemboon: «Pi gẅiin menÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ tè zsé lélɔg ńgyá jʉ’ wɔ́ la? Ńgẅiin metuŋó ḿbiŋ tè nò jú’ la»? Ńzsé ngie pi tè nò kímte la?
en: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n da pwɔ́’te mbelég yɛ̌ mbu’ú ntʉ̀a pi lɔg ńjÿɔ́g pʉ̀a ntsá’ tʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńdagte mekèm é lúe metúŋ méshÿɔ́’ɔ pi kaa? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: É la lúe metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?They say unto him, Twelve.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ḿbwɔ́’te yetsɔ̌ ntá’ sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a, mé lɔg ńjÿɔ́g pʉ̀a ntsá’ lekùa, apfwɔ́’ lúe metǔŋ méshÿɔ́’ɔ, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie, á la lúe metúŋ sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?And they said, Seven.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Tà pi giŋé ńnyé pɔ́ tè jú’?
en: And he said unto them,How is it that ye do not understand?

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé la kúu Mbetsayida, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ńtó, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à záb mbwó mé ná yé à zeŋe.
en: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.

ngiemboon: Á kú’te pwó fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ńdɔgɔ yé fóo tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’ ńkẅɛ, ńdɔg metyé ńtsab nÿɔ́g mé, ńzáb mbwó mé ná yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ ne ńgyá mmó?
en: And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.

ngiemboon: Á náŋte, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńgyá pʉ̀a mesoŋ, pɔ́ ne ńgiŋe, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ metÿǒ la.
en: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzáb mbwó nà menÿɔ́g nyìŋ ŋwɛ́, á cwoŋo ńdíe jʉ’, mbà à sẅeté, tà ne ńcÿó nnɛ́ ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: After that he puthishands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie à piŋ né mbʉ̀a yé, tá’, tà á ke ḿpfó ye tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ yɛ̂.
en: And he sent him away to his house, saying,Neither go into the town, nor tellitto any in the town.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fóo jʉ’ó ńkẅɛ, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńgee né melá’ mie ée shÿó tÿǒsoŋo Sezare we Filib, pâ pɔ́ ne ńgee, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Epʉ̀a ée pá’ɔɔn ńne ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌?
en: And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Cæsarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them,Whom do men say that I am?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie ɔɔ Jâŋ Mbabtis, Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie ɔɔ*Elîɛ, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie ɔɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná*pantsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò.
en: And they answered, John the Baptist: but somesay, Elias; and others, One of the prophets.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌? Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’.
en: And he saith unto them,But whom say ye that I am?And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, ńgɔɔn ngie tà pɔ́ kím tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.

ngiemboon: Éfó mǒ, ńzye lézí’i wɔ́b mmó, ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, mekěme lá’ pú ńgwá’a yé, mbɔɔ*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, é gÿo pú’u, mé zẅé yé. À piŋ ńzíme nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, andofthe chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

ngiemboon: Yěsô shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn, Piɛ leen ńná’a ńtóŋo yé ntsèm, ńzye lékaga yé.
en: And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ńdíe*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńcÿɔ́gɔ Piɛ, ńgɔɔn le yé ngie: Fó nzèm mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́ me Sátà, ɔ̀ tě ńkwaŋa pɛ́’ɛ̀, á gwɔ́ pá’ Ssé ne ńkwaŋa wɔ́, wɛ̂ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwaŋá pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying,Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńtóŋo lá’ mbɔɔ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńge gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ, á gwága twó mbùm yé, ńkaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ ńdɔg ńzẅíŋe lékwé, tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: And when he had called the peopleunto himwith his disciples also, he said unto them,Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge zɔɔn fa’a lépɔ́ɔn we le gwɔ́ zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ge pyé we le gwɔ́ ŋwɛ́. Tá’ nyìŋ gẅie à kě ḿbyé we le gwɔ́ mélà’ mɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ mélà’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie à gʉ̌a ntsẅǐ, mbà à ge lá’ gwɔ́ wó.
en: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿbú ńkaa njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm ńná né nyìŋ, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ gie e ge lɔg pɔ́ twó yé, mbà e ge kẅéte yé nà kɔ́?
en: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńdɔg ńkúbe twó yé?
en: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkú shʉ́ légwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ, mbɔɔ léshwóŋó nò yɔ́ɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pɔɔn pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njyó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ pʉ̀a tepòŋ lɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ pàtè zsě Ssé, mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gíŋe kú ye shʉ́ lélɔgɔ yé ńgÿo we nyìŋ, afʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ piŋ nzèm tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we Tá we, pâ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé gwɔ́.
en: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie: Etsɔ́ ntá’ ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée jʉ’ɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn té ge gÿo kwé té gwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔ̌g nÿɔ́g ńgyá*Lefùɔ Ssé pá’ é tóo lê shʉ́shÿɔ́g wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them,Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ ntɔgɔ́, Yěsô faga Piɛ ńgÿo Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa ńkwɔ́’ɔ nà tsɔ̌ máa lekwɛ́. Pâ pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó gílé pɔ́b, pɔ́ gyá liŋé yé pú sele.
en: And after six days Jesus takethwith himPeter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.

ngiemboon: Menzsǒ mé pú ńcʉ́’ ńŋwʉŋe ŋwʉŋe, ḿbú fɔ́g tà tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔg sɔg nzsǒ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ tà é fɔ́g pú’u, yɛ̌ té wó wɔ́.
en: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô pɛ̌ métá gyá, mbà*Elîɛ pɔ́ Mǒsê kẅɛ̌ ńtyé, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe.
en: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ḿvele vele ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, á pǒŋ pá’ pege jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn. Zẅíŋe peg jwóŋ*mentàb méentá, tà’ gwɔ́ gú, tà’ gwɔ́ we Mǒsê, wetsɔ́ gwɔ́ we*Elîɛ.
en: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgɔɔn yé pɛ́’ɛ̀, tá à tě ńzsé mmó gie à gɔɔn yɛ̌ wɔ́, mbà cÿɔ’ pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa gyá, etsɔ́ melɔ́ɔn sẅɛ́’, ńkábte wɔ́b. Ngyè nyìŋ fóo tsoló ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo yé tɛ’. Pi jú’ ncwò wé,
en: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

ngiemboon: ńgwaa cʉ́me,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô té gíŋe petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ńgyá wɔ́, ndà’ wɔ́ba Yěsô zɔ̌ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́.
en: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ gÿo ńne fóo ndùm lekwɛ́ ńcwóŋo, á tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b ngie tà pɔ́ keme mmó gie pɔ́ gyǎ lá, tà ńdá’ ńkú fʉ̀’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ zimé nà legwé.
en: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zẅíŋ pá’ à gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, ńké ńne ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: À gɔɔn ngie ńzíme nà legwé, ńzíme nà legwé ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tà*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gɔɔn ngie*Elîɛ ge lá’ vɔg tó pé’e mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: «Áa nò, a*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé*Elîɛ vɔgɔ ńtóo lézába kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ nà yé jʉ’», ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ gwɔ́, mbà pá’ mé la gíŋe ńŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔɔn ge lá’ gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, mé kʉ́e yé, mé ŋwe’e pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ngie kɔ́
en: And he answered and told them,Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi pá’ɔɔn, mbà*Elîɛ ŋwɛ́ kéen ńtó, epʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo ná yé pá’ pɔ́ kwǒŋ, á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńtí yé.
en: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwaa piŋ nzèm jʉ’ gie*ngàŋa kwò yé ée wó, ńgyá alá’ pú ńtÿɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńnéŋe soŋ,*ngàŋa kwò yé pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ wó ńzoŋo tsɔ́ nò.
en: And when he came tohisdisciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gwɔ́ tà ńgyá Yěsô kẅɛɛ ná pɔ́b, pɔ́ pú ńnɔ́ɔnte ńgʉa ńtsyɛ’te yé.
en: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running tohimsaluted him.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pɔ́ zoŋo kɔ́ wɔ́?
en: And he asked the scribes,What question ye with them?

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kẅɛɛ nùɔ lá’, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo ye ngie: Andè, mèŋ n dɔgɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn ńtó légyá gú. Á gwɔ́, mbà*ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé, ńtsɛ́ ncwò wé.
en: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;

ngiemboon: E*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ lu ssé ná yé, á gwɔ́ nzɔ̌ jʉ’ wɔ́, é tsẅí’i yé ḿma’a pɔ́ ssé, á tiŋ, éfu’ metyé, ḿpfɛ́ mesoŋ mé. Mèŋ n tǒ pá’a, ésẅíŋte*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ ngie pɔ́ jwoŋ*ssé tepòŋ ya yɛ̌, pɔ́ té mǒ ku’.
en: and wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Akwò pàtè něŋ ntʉ́m nà Ssé, áa pá’ɔɔn pege lá’ ńnéŋe tà síŋe gwɔ́ tá pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé? Mèŋ n ge lá’ shÿɔgɔ ná menò mí tà kú pɔ́ síŋe? Pi lɔgɔ múɔ ŋwɛ́ ńtó, ńná né mèŋ.
en: He answereth him, and saith,O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yé ńtó ńná né ye, essé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ leen ńjú’u gyé Yěsô, ńkaa múɔ ŋwɛ́ ńtéme ssé, á kele ssé, ńzye léfu’ metyé.
en: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te tá múɔ ngie: Yɔɔn guɔ áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ná múɔ tà fó síŋe? Á gɔɔn ngie tà fó fʉ̀’ gie mé la zyé yé.
en: And he asked his father,How long is it ago since this came unto him?And he said, Of a child.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gwoon yé, ńne ḿma’a yé nzɔ̌ wɔ́, ḿma’a ma’, kà tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g wɔ́, kà tsɛ̀ɛ ntse wɔ́, éfa’ pɔ́ shÿó léké ńzẅé yé zẅé. Tsétsɔ’ tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, ńgÿo à sẅéte pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńku’.
en: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉŋe yé ngie: Ɔ̀ piŋe ngie pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńku’ lêkɛ̂? Anò té cʉa nyìŋ gẅie à záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: Jesus said unto him,If thou canst believe, all thingsarepossible to him that believeth.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ leen ńdwo ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon! Mèŋ n zǎb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn nà Ssé, kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà yé.
en: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá, alá’ ne ńnɔ́ɔnte ńkẅi’i ńtóo tǒ, á cÿɔ́g*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn ngie: Gù*ssé tepòŋ gie e tsɛ́ɛ ncwò nyìŋ, ńziŋe pâ metuŋó mé, mèŋ n gwɔ gyá, mbà ɔ̀ fǒ ná múɔ wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ, ḿbɔ́ɔn lélá’ ńgíŋ ḿbiŋ nzèm ńkúu ná ye.
en: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him,Thoudumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.

ngiemboon: E*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ tsẅi’i múɔ ḿma’a ssé, ńgÿo á ga’te, éfó ná yé ńkẅɛ. Á cʉ́’ ńnuŋo ssé ńgÿo pɔ́ pá’ pfó nyìŋ la, tà mé ne ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie à kwě.
en: Andthe spiritcried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô kú’te pwó yé ńkẅéte yé, ńgÿó á lu ssé ńtyé tyé.
en: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ḿbiŋ tà ńkúu ndá, ńgwɔ́ gílé pɔ́b, pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Akɔ́ ně ńgÿo tá peg tè ku’u léjwoŋ yɔɔn*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ wɔ́?
en: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mé lɔg pɔ́ ndà’ lésẅíŋte Ssé tá ńdɔg ńgÿo yɛ̌ ntí*ssé tepòŋ fó ná nyìŋ ńkẅɛ.
en: And he said unto them,This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

ngiemboon: Pâ Yěsô fó wó ńne ńgee, ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galilea, á piŋ ńké tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zsé jʉ’ gie aa wó wɔ,
en: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should knowit.

ngiemboon: ńně ńzí’i*ngàŋa kwò yé mmó, ńne shwóŋó ngie: Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ pɔ́ gÿo à kwé. Tá’, e gwaa gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá à zím.
en: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them,The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé ké tè jú’ mboŋó wɔ́, tá ḿbiŋ ne ḿbɔ́gɔ lé zɛ́te yé nò mǒ.
en: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu Kapernawúm, ńkúu ndá, Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kɔ’ɔ́ ńgiŋe mánzsè ńzoŋo kɔ́ pé’e?
en: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them,What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té tsɔ́b, á nue pɔ́ kɔ’ɔ́ mánzsè, ńne ńzoŋo fa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò wɔb metsèm.
en: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, whoshould bethe greatest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńnéŋe ssé, ńtóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, éshwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ne fa’a létyé ńgwɔ́ mvɔ́g mvfò, mbà á poŋ ngie à zẅíŋe légwɔ́ nzèm, éfa’a mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm,
en: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them,If any man desire to be first,the sameshall be last of all, and servant of all.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtóŋo mûɔ mémúɔ, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b, ńkaa yé ńgẅiin, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńkúe mûɔ memûɔ pá’ wɔɔn lɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn. Nyìŋ piŋ ńkúe wɔ̀ɔn, mbà ngàŋ tě ńkúe pɔ́ ndà’ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, peg ně ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ shú ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ ná pʉ̀a, peg fa’a létɔ’ɔ yé, mélà’mie à tè yé nzèm gù pá’ peg wɔ́.
en: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà pi tɔ’ɔ yé légÿo pú’u, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgwóon ńkíme wɔ̀ɔn tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: But Jesus said,Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa nò yégè tága, aa wege nyìŋ.
en: For he that is not against us is on our part.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwaa náa méjʉ’ʉ ntse né pi, ńnáa, mélà’mie pi ee pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, mbà wé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie à ké ńtsóte tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ nà mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ pɔ́ɔn pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, légwɔ́ gie à ge fʉa nò, mbà ngɔ́’ gie e ge lá’ kúu ngàŋ, e ge gwɔ́ gie e pǔ ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà mvfò gwɔ́ ndà’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé cʉŋe máamáa tóon lóŋ ngàŋ, ḿma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ mí.
en: And whosoever shall offend one oftheselittle ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.

ngiemboon: Apwó ɔ́ zɔ lɔɔn ne ńtsóte gú ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mefʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zá’ ńgwá’, mbòŋo ee gú légwɔ́ kème pwó, tá ńké ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa gú légẅiin mbwó mbʉ́a, tá ḿbiŋ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie mmɔ̌g ée wó, ńgwɔ́ gẅie é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ wɔ́,
en: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

ngiemboon: [á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.]
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: Akwò jú zɔ lɔɔn ne ńtsóte gú ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mefʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zá’ ńgwá’, mbòŋo gú légwɔ́ kème kwò tá ńdá’ ńké ńgwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa gú légẅiin mekwò mú mémbʉ́a tá mé ma’a gú tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g,
en: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

ngiemboon: [á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́,]
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie lejÿɔ́g shú zɔ ne ńtsóte ɔ́, ɔ̀ fʉa nò, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ ńgwá’, mvfò ee gú légwɔ́ pyè lejÿɔ́g tá ńké ńkúu nà nò*Lefùɔ Ssé, ńcʉa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ gẅiin menÿɔ́g mú mémbʉ́a mé piŋ ḿma’a gú tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ʉ mmɔ̌g,
en: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:

ngiemboon: «á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́».
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mmɔ̌g ge lá’ táŋte mawɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé lɔgɔ ngwáŋ ńtáŋte shúm pwɔ́’.
en: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.

ngiemboon: Ngwáŋ ée ssé ńgwɔ́ mmó mbòŋo tá’, é lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà é té ńnyé ne ńdʉme wɔ́ mé gíŋe ńdɔgɔ kɔ́ ńgÿo tá é gíŋe ńdʉm? Á poŋ ngie kwà’ ngwáŋ mbòŋo gwɔ́ lóŋ pi, pú’u, asẅétè gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: Saltisgood: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńdɔg shÿó Jẅidea, ńgʉa nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ. Alá’ gíŋe ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, á leen ńzye lézí’i wɔ́b nò Ssé pá’ à laa mà mbwo yé.
en: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judæa by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay tó yɔ́b, ńgwɔ kwà’te yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tà áa pé’e*lepʉ̌ ségè zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwé we?
en: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put awayhiswife? tempting him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mǒsê la tsẅii tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And he answered and said unto them,What did Moses command you?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie Mǒsê la zẅíŋ ngie «mámbàŋa jwoŋo nzwě we, tá ńké ńgwɔ jwoŋo yé, ḿvɔg ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to putheraway.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mǒsê la ná sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ mbwo pi, pɔ́ mélà’mie à gyǎ pi tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé tà á cʉa.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

ngiemboon: Á la ké fó nùŋe ngwòŋ, á té pú’u, wɔ́. «E Ssé la pwóon mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě».
en: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ńda nnɛ́ nà we manzwě.
en: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a wɔ́, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ tà’ nyìŋ.
en: and they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ɔn léfege mmó gie Ssé temté.
en: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ḿbiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ ndá,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɛ́te yé nò ńtí nò ya yɛ̌.
en: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the samematter.

ngiemboon: Á shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwě we, ńzɔ́’ɔ we ndyɛ̀’ɛ, mbà á cʉ̌a nà*kʉ̀a yɔ́b gie á tagá, á gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́.
en: And he saith unto them,Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

ngiemboon: Manzwě piŋ ńkẅɛɛ nà ndǔm we, ńgʉa ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, mbà á cʉ̌a nà*kʉ̀a yɔ́b ndǔm we, á gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́.
en: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ne ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ gubé ńtóo légwɔ́ gie Yěsô ge záb mbwó twó pɔ́b, tá’*ngàŋa kwò yé piŋ ńne ńtɔ’ɔ.
en: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: andhisdisciples rebuked those that broughtthem.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pú’u, á té yé poŋ, á gɔɔn né*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi nyé gubé pɔ́ tó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn, tà pi táte wɔ́b létó, epʉ̀a pie ée pá’ gubé zɔ̌ gẅiin nò ná*Lefùɔ Ssé.
en: But when Jesus sawit, he was much displeased, and said unto them,Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn tè cʉ́’ pá’ mûɔ mémúɔ, ńzẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a yé wɔ́, mbà pɔ́ Ssé té ńdá’a ńteme nò wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅé wɔ́b ńgẅiin, ńzáb mbwó ná pɔ́b, ńcʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Ssé.
en: And he took them up in his arms, puthishands upon them, and blessed them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńtyé mánzsè ńne ńgee, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kÿote ńtó ńkẅí’te mvfò yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, gù zɔɔ kwà’ nyìŋ mbòŋo. Mèŋ n ge gÿo yɔ́ɔn lêkɔ́ tá gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì?
en: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn le nyìŋ mbòŋo mélà’a kɔ́? É té ndà’ Ssé wɔ́, mbà nyìŋ mbòŋo tè wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Why callest thou me good?there isnone good but one,that is, God.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè ne ḿmoŋe mbʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́. E Ssé la záb ngie: «Tè zẅé nyìŋ, ḿbɔ́ɔn légÿo gÿɛ́, tè jʉ, tè tÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ, tè fʉte nyìŋ, ná mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù»
en: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, tà fó pá’ mèŋ n da nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mûɔ shùm, mèŋ n gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ ku’té ntsèm.
en: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńdíe yé, anò yé poŋo yé, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mémmó wémɔ’ɔ́ nyě ńzága gẅie ɔ̀ ge gÿo. Gʉa, ḿbú sẅiŋ shúm shú ntsèm, ńgab nkáb mbwo pàtèmmó, ńdeen ńké ńdá’ ńgẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tÿǒ lepwó. Gʉa ńgÿo pú’u, ḿbiŋ ńtó ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him,One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wá jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, eshÿó wé gwóon sẅɛ́’. Á tém nzèm, ńgwɔ́ gʉa, ńcʉ́ŋe twó yé cʉ́ŋe, mélà’mie à la gẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tɛ’.
en: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́’ nzèm sele nnɛ́ ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é la tÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋe soŋ, ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Á pú ńtʉ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó zẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples,How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pènkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ lézẅíŋ tà Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé pǔ ńtʉ tɛ’.
en: And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them,Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!

ngiemboon: Á zeŋe mbwo shÿɔ́ɔ léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwòŋ lesyɛ’ɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò fó ḿmege ńkʉ’ʉ*ngàŋa kwò yé. Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie, tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô líe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Á cʉa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le Ssé cʉa, ńtí nue à ku’u légÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: And Jesus looking upon them saith,With menit isimpossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tà peg leen ńnyé shúm ntsèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn la?
en: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le nyé ndá ye, ńnyé mefɛ́ pé pe mbàŋa mbɔɔ pe pànzwě, ńnyé má we pɔ́ tá we, ńnyé pènkʉ́ pé pâ menká’ mé, mélà’ mɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ mélà’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie à gee ntsẅǐ,
en: And Jesus answered and said,Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,

ngiemboon: tà nyé té zye pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn légẅiin setsɔ́ ngʉ̀a nkÿo wɔ́, mé ge tsɛ kʉ́e yé, tá’, e Ssé ké ńgÿo à fó pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgẅiin mendá, ńgẅiin mefɛ́, ńgẅiin memá pé, ńgẅiin gubé yé, ńgẅiin menká’ mé, à piŋ ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: but he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ lelÿò pʉ̀a pie é tyé mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ge lá’ cʉ́’ pà nzsò nzèm, pà gwɔ́ nzèm cʉ́’ pà gwɔ́ mvfò.
en: But manythat arefirst shall be last; and the last first.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgwɔ́ mánzsè ńne ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem, á tÿɔ́gɔ twó yé, ńgwɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b ńne ńgee, tá’, awɔɔn légʉa Yerósalem ŋwɛ́ pú ńcu’u twó yɔ́b, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ ée mánzsè cʉ́’ʉ ńcÿɔ’ɔ cÿɔ’. Yěsô fag*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, pɔ́ tó nê lejʉ́ŋ ye. Á zye léshwóŋó wɔ́b mmó gie á ge gÿo yé, ńgie:
en: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’ mboŋó, pege ee mánzsè ńne ḿbʉʉ nê Yerósalem pá’ɔɔn, é kúu wó, mé sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwo*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pɔ́ ŋaga yé, ńzáb pá’ à ge kwé, é leen náa yé mbwo pʉ̀a túmo ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: saying,Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoonte yé, ńtsɔg metyé ná ye, ńdɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn ńcúa yé, ńzẅé yé, à piŋ ńzíme nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: and they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, épúɔ Zebede sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtó nê lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá weg, tsétsɔ’, peg lɔɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo gù, ɔ̀ zẅíŋ ńnáa yɛ̌ mmó né peg.
en: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kwoŋo ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ né pi?
en: And he said unto them,What would ye that I should do for you?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Tá weg, peg tsɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ gù, ɔ̀ ńnéŋe wég lejʉ́ŋ gù, tà’ nyìŋ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó jú ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó jú ye kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi kaa zsé mmó gie pi ee pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńdúɔ yɛ̌ wɔ́. Pi ku’u lénnú ntú’ ngɔ́’ gie mèŋ n gee lénǔ? Kà pi kǔ’ pɔ́ lézẅíŋ ngie mé nu’u gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie mé gee tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńnǔ’ mèŋ?
en: But Jesus said unto them,Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg ku’. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Áa nénʉ́ ngie pi ge nú ntú’ gie mèŋ n ge ńnǔ, mé ge gíŋe nú’u gẅi gí tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ gie mèŋ n gee ńgyá.
en: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them,Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:

ngiemboon: Tá’, á gʉa nà leneŋé nyìŋ nà gwoŋó pwó yɔ́ɔn ye tʉ̀ kà pɔ́ ye kyɛ̀be wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n zɔ tè gẅiin lénná né nyìŋ wɔ́, esɛ̌ jʉ’ ée se pʉ̀a pie Ssé la nyɛte ńdɔgɔ ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b.
en: but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; butit shall be given to themfor whom it is prepared.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô legém gwɔ́ tà ńjú’u nò gie Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ gɔ̌ɔn, ńzye légyáŋa lóŋ ńtí wɔ́b.
en: And when the ten heardit, they began to be much displeased with James and John.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo wɔ́b métsèm, pɔ́ tó, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ne ńzsé ngie mefùɔ pàtè zsě Ssé gwɔ́ sá’a lá’, ńnɔ’ pʉ̀a nɔ’, memǎ pʉ̀a ne sẅɛ́ɛ lá’ sẅɛ́.
en: But Jesus called themto him, and saith unto them,Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké tè poŋ ngie à gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńgwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńkwoŋo légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á poŋ ngie à sele ńcʉ́’ʉ ménkʉ́ gẅi.
en: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne fa’a légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á poŋ ngie à zẅíŋ nkwɔ̀ɔn mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: and whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ la zɔɔn tè tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge fa’a mbwo yé wɔ́, à la tó pɔ́ léfa’a mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ, éfa’ fa’ tà gíŋe ńnáa twó yé lélɔg ńcu’ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu Yériko, ńne ńcʉa, máamáa nùɔ lá’ kẅɛ, ńcʉ́me nzèm. Atsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, ńne ńdúɔ ndúɔ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Mbàr-Tíme, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ míŋ Tíme.
en: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimæus, the son of Timæus, sat by the highway side begging.

ngiemboon: Á jú’ ngie Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd zɔ ne ńcʉa, ńkwé’e ngyè ye ńnáa tÿǒ, ńzye légɔɔn ngie: Yěsô gù gẅie ɔɔ na ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn.
en: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus,thouSon of David, have mercy on me.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kaga yé ngie à láŋte, tá á fó ḿmege ńgá’, ńná ngyè ye tÿǒ ngie: Nyìŋ ná ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn.
en: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal,ThouSon of David, have mercy on me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tyé ńtsẅi ngie: Mé tóŋo yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ngie: Kag tʉ̀ ńdu ssé, à ne ńtóŋo gú.
en: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gú’u ssé, ńzé’e nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye ḿma’a nzèm, ńgʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ Yěsô.
en: And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tsɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ né gù? Afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gɔɔn ngie: Andè mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńgyá jʉ’.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto him,What wilt thou that I should do unto thee?The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ la, ɔ̀ zeŋé, cʉ́’ ńgʉa jú gʉa. Afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gwoon ńzye légíŋe ńgyá jʉ’, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô pâ pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole.And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ne ńkúu Yerósalem, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lepàa Mbedfajé pɔ́ Mbetáni, á jʉ’ʉ lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, Yěsô túm*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a,
en: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ yɛ̂ gie áa mvfò pi lɛ. Pi ge leen kúu wó, é gyá mûɔ nzikáasè gie mé ně ńcʉŋ, e gwɔ́ gie nyìŋ laa mǒ ńnéŋe, pi kyɛ́’, ńdɔg ńtó.
en: and saith unto them,Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bringhim.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅi ngie: Pi kyɛ́’ɛ nzìkáasè yɛ ńdɔgɔ ńgee nzɔ̌, pi tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, mbà ngàŋ ge gwóon nyé pi lɔg ńtó.
en: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ntúm yɛ̌ gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgyá nzìkáasè, mbà mé ně ńcʉŋe yé ncwò mbu’, á ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, pɔ́ kyɛ́’ɛ yé.
en: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é kɔ’ɔ́ jʉ’ó zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kyɛ́’ɛ nzìkáasè yɛ̂ ńdɔgɔ ńgee nzɔ̌ wɔ́?
en: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ pá’ Yěsô ně ńtsẅi né pɔ́b pú’u. Mé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ lɔg ńgʉa.
en: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg nzìkáasè ŋwɛ́ ńtó, ńgwaa náa yé mbwo Yěsô, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b nkà’ yé, Yěsô kwɔ́’ ńnéŋe mo,
en: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.

ngiemboon: ńně ńdɔgɔ ńgiŋe, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn sáŋte menzsǒ mɔ́b mánzsè. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a fagte yɔ́b pɔ́ meffò tÿǒ nká’, ńdɔg ńtó ńzá’a yé.
en: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawedthemin the way.

ngiemboon: à tóo nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessedishe that cometh in the name of the Lord:

ngiemboon: Gùugẅî gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé tàa tÿǒ lepwó!
en: Blessedbethe kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu Yerósalem, ńgʉa*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ, ḿbú ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie mé ée wó ńgÿo. Pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém gwóon ḿbiŋ nzèm ne Mbetáni, á nue á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà zà’ cʉ̌a.
en: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, pɔ́ gwɔ́ fó Mbetáni piŋ, ńgiŋ tà nzyè gyáŋa Yěsô.
en: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:

ngiemboon: Á mma’ lejÿɔ́g, ńgyá tÿǒ mbÿě ngem, meffo mé ne sẅéte, á gʉa letsìŋe ngie kà à ge gyá ntɔ́ɔn mǒ wɔ́, ńkúu jʉ’ó, ńgyá é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ meffo. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ á té fʉ̀’ gie mbÿě ngém áa ńzéme wɔ́.
en: and seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was notyet.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né tÿǒ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Nyìŋ tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńjÿó mentɔ̌ɔn mú wɔ́, ńgwaa gɔɔn,*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńjú’u.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto it,No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.And his disciples heardit.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, Yěsô gʉa*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńzye létág pʉ̀a pie ée wó sẅiŋe shúm pâ pàjúu, ńtsó mekǔ metʉ̌a pàkúbe nkáb ḿma’a ssé, ńtág mekwɔ́’ɔ pàsẅiŋ mekàpʉ̀ŋ,
en: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;

ngiemboon: ńgwá ńtɔ’ tà tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńkaa mmó ńdɔgɔ ńtɔ́gɔ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́,
en: and would not suffer that any man should carryanyvessel through the temple.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńzye lézí’i wɔ́b ngie: Pi legé ngie Ssé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne yé ngie: «Mé ge lá’ tóŋ ndá yɔ̀ɔn ngie ndá gie ngwòŋo ngwòŋ sẅíŋte Ssé wó». Tá pi leen sele ńdɔg ńgÿo nkʉ̀a metsǒŋ.
en: And he taught, saying unto them,Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.

ngiemboon: Metándá pànùŋo pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gÿo ńjú’, ńzye léfa’ shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tá zẅé yé. Pɔ́ la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ ngie nò yé ge pú jÿó lá’, á nue alá’ ntsèm la ne ńgɔ’te mmó gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i pʉ̀a.
en: And the scribes and chief priests heardit, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gíŋe fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ.
en: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ńgwɔ́ mba’ámba’ ńne ńcʉa, ńgyá, mbà tÿǒ mbÿé ngem yɛ̌ jǔm tà ńkúu nà menŋaŋ mé.
en: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

ngiemboon: Piɛ líe tÿǒ ŋwɛ́, ńkímte mmó gie á ka cʉa, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, gyá pá’ tÿǒ ya gie ɔ̀ kà néŋ ndòon mǒ lá pǔ ńjúm tà ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́.
en: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́g ngie: Pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé.
en: And Jesus answering saith unto them,Have faith in God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwoŋo gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo lekwɛ́ ngie efó jʉ’ɛ̂, ńgʉa ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa, ńgɔɔn té ne ḿmʉ́’te, ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, mbà Ssé ge zẅíŋ à gwɔ́ pú’u.
en: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ne sẅíŋte Ssé ńdúɔ wɔ́, pi zẅíŋ ngie pi ně ńdá’ ńgẅiin, e Ssé náa mbwo pi.
en: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receivethem, and ye shall havethem.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ ne sẅíŋte Ssé lá, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ fʉ̌a nò mbwo gù, ɔ̀ lege ńnáa mbwo ngàŋ. À cʉa pú’u, tá Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, à lege mí mefʉ̀a ńná lé pi.
en: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

ngiemboon: [ Pi lɔɔn ńké tè lege mefʉ̀a petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó kě tè lege mí gí wɔ́.]
en: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gíŋe ńgʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, á kúu*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńne ńgwá ńgiŋte, metándá pà nùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mbɔɔ mekěme lá’ tsóte nnɛ́ ńtó,
en: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,

ngiemboon: ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ lezíŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mɔɔn menò? Wɔ̌ zɔ túmo ńgÿo sɛ̌ shúm?
en: and say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

ngiemboon: Yěsô peŋe ńná né pɔ́b ngie: Pi cʉ́’ mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò wémɔ’ɔ́, pi tsɔ́’ tá mèŋ n deen ńké shwóŋó gẅi kwà’ nyìŋ gẅie à ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo mɔɔn menò.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse laa pé’e, e Ssé zɔ̌ túmo yé fa’ mɛ̌ mefà’ ka pʉ̀a mesoŋ? Pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: The baptism of John, wasitfrom heaven, or of men? answer me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ńkwaŋte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pege lɔɔn ngie: E Ssé zɔ la túmo yé, mbà à ge zɛ́te wégè ngie: Tà mélà’a kɔ́ pege la tè zẅíŋe nò gie Jâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn wɔ́?
en: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

ngiemboon: Tá ḿbiŋ ńké ńgɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà heen! Pɔ́ kwaŋa kékáŋ, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’, á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mânyìŋ ntsèm ne ńzsé ngie Jâŋ aa kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for allmencounted John, that he was a prophet indeed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwaŋ pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ pɔ́ ngie: Peg kaa zsé. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n tè shwoŋo gẅi nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sé ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́.
en: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them,Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ pú’u, ńzye lélɔg*sagá nò ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Atsɔ̌ ndÿò lǎ’ ńgẅiin nká’ wé, ńgʉa wó, ḿbye metÿǒ mie mé kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛte melù’, ḿbwóon nkàŋ nká’ ńdɔg ḿbú ńkíle, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nká’, ńtúŋo jʉ’ gie mé ge kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn wó, ḿbiŋ ḿbwóon tà’ shʉa ndá gẅie mé ge kwɔ́’ɔ tyé tsoló tá pyɛ́bɛ nká’, ńgÿo pú’u, ńcʉ́me nká’ mbwo pà nyɛte melù’ ńdeen ńgʉa nê legìŋ.
en: And he began to speak unto them by parables.Acertainman planted a vineyard, and set an hedge aboutit, and diggeda place forthe winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ʉ le káb ntɔ̌ɔn kú’, á túmo tà’ ngàŋa fà’ we mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée nká’ ngie à gʉa ńkẅé mé mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, ńgwoon ngàŋa fà’ wá, ńcúa yé, ńjwoŋo yé, á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: And they caughthim, and beat him, and senthimaway empty.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ nká’ gíŋe ńtúmo tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ we mbwo pɔ́b. Á kúu wó, pɔ́ zoonte yé, ńcúa yé twó ye.
en: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and woundedhimin the head, and senthimaway shamefully handled.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńtúmo tsɔ̌ tà’. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ tó fʉ̀’ó, pɔ́ zẅé yé. Á gíŋe ńtúm petsɔ́ tà é gyɔ́ɔn. Mé gwoon petsɔ́ ńzẅéte, ńcúa petsɔ́.
en: And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la nyé mbwo ye, à la cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ míŋ we gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’. Á gwaa zsote, ńtúmo wɛ̌ múɔ mbwo pɔ́b, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie, á ge gǎ wɔ́, pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

ngiemboon: Tá á fó ńkúu wó, epʉ̀a pá gɔɔn ngie: Anjÿò ndá we wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ̀, pege zẅé yé, ńjÿó nká’,
en: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be our's.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgwe ná ye, ńgwoon yé ńzẅé, éshwoŋo pfó yé, ńdɔg fó nká’ ńgʉa ńgwá’.
en: And they took him, and killedhim, and casthimout of the vineyard.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńzɛ́te ngie: Pi gyǎ gí ngie ngàŋ nká’ ge gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pɔ́b? À ge tó gÿo mé zẅéte pɔɔn pànyɛte melù’, à cʉ́me nká’ mbwo pe mendyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

ngiemboon: léen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon gẅie yé zɔ pi’ ndá».
en: Is become the head of the corner:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ máa nò mbòŋo menÿɔ́g pege
en: And it is marvellous in our eyes?

ngiemboon: Pasá’a lá’ jú’ pá’ Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò, ńdiŋ ngie à gɔɔn né pɔ́b, éfa’ shÿó légwoon yé tá’, ḿbɔ́g nÿɔ́g lá’, ésóon, ńnyé yé jʉ’ó, ńgʉate.
en: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ńtúm pʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay, pâ nùɔ ye*Herôd ngie pɔ́ gʉa fa’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fó nà nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn ńgwóon yé.
en: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him inhiswords.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsítsà, peg ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò, á gwɔ́ nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn té pɔ́gɔ nyìŋ, ɔ̀ tè líe nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ nà shÿó wɔ́, ńda’te nò nénʉ́ pɔ́ pá’ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo pú’u, shwóŋó wég, tà áa pé’e*lepʉ̌ lá’ ségè zẅíŋ ngie pege ma’ ncùb ńnáa mbwo Kása pà*Roma kà ngǎŋ?
en: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Cæsar, or not?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwà’te wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́? Pi lɔgɔ pàga nkáb ńtó ńnyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn, pɔ́ lɔgɔ pàga nkáb ńtó, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them,Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may seeit.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ́ gẅie ée nà nkáb? Sɔɔn gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ée we Kása, lezíŋ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé.
en: And they broughtit. And he saith unto them,Whoseisthis image and superscription?And they said unto him, Cæsar's.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, pi náa mmó Kása mbwo Kása, ńnáa ye Ssé mbwo Ssé. Pɔ́ jú’ ntí gie à lɔ̌g ńtsɔ́’, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Ncwò wɔ́b júm.
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,Render to Cæsar the things that are Cæsar's, and to God the things that are God's.And they marvelled at him.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*sadukay leen ńké ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô. Pà*sadukay ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té zẅíŋ ngie mepfó ge gÿo zíme nà legwé wɔ́. Pɔ́ zɛ́te mbwo Yěsô ngie:
en: Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, Mǒsê la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ ségè ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbà fɛ́ we gẅiin lésɔgɔ mpfɔ́g ńdɔg ńnuŋe ngẅɛ̀ fɛ́ we».
en: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leavehiswifebehind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mefɛ́ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a, ndùŋ mvfò zɔ́’, ńgÿo ńkwé té cʉa mmó.
en: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó. Mbɔ́ɔntè wɛ̌ tó ńgíŋe sɔg yé mpfɔ́g, ńdá’ ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó.
en: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a lá’ ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, ńdá’ ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó. Á gwaa zsote manzwě kwé yé.
en: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́b sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn lɔɔn, mé ge lá’*zíme nà legwé à gwɔ́ we wɔ̌?
en: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà legyè sí gwá fʉʉ gẅi pɛ́’ɛ̀, á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò gie pi tè mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé zsé, ḿbiŋ ńké tè zsé pá’ metʉ̀ Ssé ée pú’u, wɔ́ wɔ́?
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mé ge lá’ zíme nà legwé, mbàŋa mbɔɔ panzwě le gíŋe ńzɔ́’ wɔ́. Pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie ée tÿǒ lepwó.
en: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà mepfó pie é zimé nà legwé, mbà pi laa fó ńtóŋo mmó gie Mǒsê la ŋwe’e, ńda’te mmó gie e Ssé la gɔɔn né yé, á jʉ’ gie tsɔ̌ mûɔ métÿǒ laa wó, mmɔ̌g gwɔ́ mǒ wɔ́ kà? E Ssé la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ, n gee Ssé Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Esâg, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ́b»
en: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, Iamthe God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé tè Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, ee Ssé pʉ̀a metʉ̀. Pi lɔɔn ńkwaŋ pá’ pi kwaŋa lɛ̂, mbà pi fʉ̌a tɛ’.
en: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ pɛ̂ pʉ̀a ne ńzoŋo pɛ́’ɛ̀, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ nà nùɔ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒse gwɔ́ yé jʉ’ó, ńgwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pá’ Yěsô tsɔ̌’ mboŋó, ńdeen ńtó nê lejʉ́ŋ ye, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:*Lepʉ̌ sie é pú ḿbi’ metsɔ́ ntsèm, ée sɛ̌?
en: And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie:*Lepʉ̌ sie é pú ḿbi’ metsɔ́, ésɔɔn: «Pà Israel, pi jú’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa Ssé yege, yé gílé ye zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And Jesus answered him,The first of all the commandmentsis, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:

ngiemboon: Kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ɔ̀ lê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m ɔ́ ntsèm, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ yé mvfò nà jú kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńzáb nkwaŋá gú ndà’ ná yé, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg metʉ̀ mú ntsèm fa’a mbwo yé»
en: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: thisisthe first commandment.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gwɔ́ ngie: «Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm jú», etsɔ́*lepʉ̌ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó tà ńtɔ́g mɔɔn mémbʉ́a wɔ́.
en: And the secondislike,namelythis, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.

ngiemboon: Ankyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsé gɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: À yɛ̂, Tsítsà, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ shwóŋó nò ngie Ssé ee gílé yé, atsɔ́ cʉ̀apʉ̀a tè gíŋé ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: And the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie nyìŋ kwoŋo yé lê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wé ntsèm, ńdɔgɔ zsé nò yé pâ metʉ̀ mé ntsèm tsèm, éfa’ pɔ́ ndà’ mbwó yé, ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋo fɛ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm yé. Angàŋ gÿo pú’u, á pú ḿboŋ ńcʉa ye létuɔ menɔ̀ɔn ńnáa mbwo Ssé, ńcʉa mbɔɔ sɛ̌ shúm pwɔ́’ wɔ́ sie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á náa mbwo Ssé.
en: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to lovehisneighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ à lɔgɔ́ zsé nò ḿbÿɛ, ńgɔɔn mbwo ye ngie: Egú ngʉ̀a lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ*Lefùɔ Ssé té nyé ság wɔ́. Á fó fʉ̀’ó nyìŋ tè gíŋe fʉ’ʉ lézɛ́te Yěsô tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him,Thou art not far from the kingdom of God.And no man after that durst ask himany question.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kwaŋ gí ngie*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê zí’i pʉ̀a ngie:*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ ge lá’ gwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd pé’e, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple,How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?

ngiemboon: mbwo gù, tà ɔ̀ tÿɔ́g mekwò mú twó pɔ́b»
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ fùɔ Ndavíd zɔ̌ tóŋo*Nzà’nkÿo le we Ndè, tá á piŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ ye lêkɔ́? Epʉ̀a pie é kě jʉ’ó, jú’u nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn, á pú ḿboŋo wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is hethenhis son?And the common people heard him gladly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzí’i wɔ́b ngie: Pi lÿɔ́’*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pá’ɔɔn tɛ’. Pɔ́ kwoŋo léma’ meshʉ̀shʉ̀a menzsǒ ńdɔg ńgwáa ńkʉ́’ʉ, ńkwoŋ ngie mé tó ńtsyɛ’te wɔ́b ndùmo gyɛ̌,
en: And he said unto them in his doctrine,Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, andlovesalutations in the marketplaces,

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńkúu jʉ’ʉ melínɔ́ɔn, ńkwoŋo léńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’ʉ melÿò, ńkú*mendá cú’tè, ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò,
en: and the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ legyè ńkẅé shúm mepfɔ̌g, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te Ssé, ńdɔgɔ légɔɔn nò á sag, ḿbaba menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a, e Ssé ge lá’ záb yɔb ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ e tʉ tɛ’.
en: which devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ jʉ’ gwɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé epʉ̀a gee jʉ’ó ńnéŋe ncùb Ssé. Yěsô gÿo sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe ssé ńne ńdíe pá’ mé ńnéŋe, lelÿò megàŋa mmó ne ńnéŋe nkáb ngyɔ̌ɔn.
en: And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mpfɔ́g manzwě tó yé, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ, ńnéŋ pàg nkáb sépʉ́a, é sie é fó tè nà tsɔ́ mmó ku’.
