en: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá, ńtóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwoŋo gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ampfɔ̌g manzwě wɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ něŋ nkáb jʉ’ó, ńcʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: And he calledunto himhis disciples, and saith unto them,Verily I say unto you, That this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury:

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a zɔ̌ɔn ńtó yɔ́b, ńnéŋ pɔ́ metwó nkáb mɔ́b, tá ńgʉa nà mpfɔ̌g manzwě wɛ, à tsɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbóŋ tá’, à něŋ wé ndà’a mmó gie á ke ńgẅiin lélɔg ńjú sé shúm.
en: for alltheydid cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had,evenall her living.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne fóo*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkẅɛɛ, atsɔ̌ tà’*ngàŋa kwò we gɔɔn ngie: Tá weg, ké ńdíe pɔ́ metóon mie mé la lɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉ’ɔɔn tá ńgyá, ajʉ’ɔɔn ŋwɛ́ áa wó tɛ’.
en: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildingsare here!

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tè líe pɔ́ pá’ mé la séen ńkwɛ́ é gú’ pɛ́’ɛ̀ lɛ. Atsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, mé pú ńkem tà tóon le gíŋe ńzébe nà wetsɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: And Jesus answering said unto him,Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, Yěsô ńnéŋe ssé tà ne ńgyá*jʉ’ʉ Ssé. Piɛ pɔ́ Jâg, ńgÿo Jâŋ pɔ́ Ndeléya fág nnɛ́, ńtó ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég fʉ̀’ gie yɔɔn nò ge lá’ gÿo. Shwóŋo wég liŋé gie mé gé lɔg zsé ngie afʉ̀’ kǔ’?
en: Tell us, when shall these things be? and whatshall bethe sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zye léshwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Pi lag twó sí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉʉ gẅí.
en: And Jesus answering them began to say,Take heed lest anymandeceive you:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge gÿo tÿɔ́g lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn mvfò, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo, é gɔɔn pú’u, lɔg fʉte pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: for many shall come in my name, saying, I amChrist; and shall deceive many.

ngiemboon: Pi lá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńjú’ mé ne ńgɔɔn nò nà mencù mie é kẅɛ̌ nà gẅi shÿó, kà ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a wɔ́, tà pi cÿɔ’. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie sɛ̌ shúm vɔg ńcʉate, tá á lěen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie njÿó mǎg wɔ́.
en: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: forsuch thingsmust needs be; but the endshallnotbeyet.

ngiemboon: Alá’ ge lá’ lu ssé lÿɔ́’ɔ yetsɔ́, afùɔ túm lu ssé ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌, atsetsá’ ge lá’ pú cʉ’e nà mejʉ’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, gwáŋa gíŋe ńgwe. Mɔɔn menò lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nzyète ngɔ́’. Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ múɔ gwoon manzwě shwoŋ la.
en: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: thesearethe beginnings of sorrows.

ngiemboon: Tá’, kwà’ pi máŋwɛ́ cwoŋo ńjú’ gí nò gie á ge gÿo tóo ná pi. Mé ge gÿo lɔgɔ gẅi gʉa jʉ’ gie mé tsɔ́’te ntsaŋ wó, é cúa gẅi mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, é lɔgɔ gẅi gʉa mvfò megúmnɔ́ɔn pâ mefùɔ melá’ mɔɔn, tá à leen ńké ńnáa gẅi shÿɔ́g lélɔg shwóŋó nò yɔ́ɔn mvfò pɔ́b.
en: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.

ngiemboon: Á ké ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé vɔg ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo melá’ ntsèm tá nò yɔɔn njÿó mag.
en: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgwoon gẅí, ńgee ńŋǎg pi, tà pi pú’ mbùm gí ngie pi ge tóo wó é gɔɔn ngie kɔ́ wɔ́, pi gʉa gí gʉa. E Ssé ge kúu jʉ’ó fʉ̀’ó, é ńnéŋe nò ncwò pi, pi gɔɔn. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie, pi ge gʉa tà kúu jʉ’ó, pi zɔ̌ le gíŋe ńgɔɔn nò wɔ́. Azẅìge Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ ńgɔɔn nò nà gí jʉ’.
en: But when they shall leadyou, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ge gÿo gwoon fɛ́ we ná mé zẅé, tá múɔ gwoon míŋ we ńná mé zẅé, egubé ge lá’ lu ssé cʉ́’ megàŋ mbù metá pɔ́b, é gÿo mé zẅé wɔ́b.
en: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up againsttheirparents, and shall cause them to be put to death.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, tá’, tá nyìŋ gẅie à kě shÿɔg shÿɔg té kʉ́a zɔ ge gÿo ńtsẅɛ́.
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, pi gyá nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé le «nkʉ̀’ʉ ntàgte jʉ’ gẅie mé nyiŋe nyiŋe», à tó ńtyé jʉ’ gie á kɔ’ɔ tè tyé wó wɔ́. (Nyìŋ tóŋo jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne yɔɔn, á kag tʉ̀ lényɛte ńjú’). Á poŋ ngie, mé lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, pʉ̀a pie ée Jẅidea kÿo ńdɔg ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ ńgʉa ńdyeen.
en: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judæa flee to the mountains:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà tetʉ́a gie áa ntsɔ̀’ ndá, á pɔ́ɔn lésẅɛ́’ ngie à ge píi mmó ndá tá kÿo.
en: and let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither entertherein, to take any thing out of his house:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, à pɔ́ɔn lé gɔɔn ngie à ge piŋe ndá ye pí nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye.
en: and let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.

ngiemboon: Yěe ngɔ́’ le! Tà panzwě pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbɔɔ pie é ge lá’ ne nóŋe púɔ mepÿɛ́ ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ ge lá’ gwá’a la!
en: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ngie yɔɔn nò gwaa tó, á le gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ mbʉ̀ŋ wɔ́.
en: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.

ngiemboon: Á nue ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ge lá’ kú pʉ̀a lyɛ’ó ge lá’ pú gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà mbà mé laa zɔɔn ńgyá tsɔ̌ pú’u wɔ́. Tà fó pá’ Ssé la nuŋe njÿó, ńgʉa ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mé té lá’ gíŋe gyá tsɔ̌ ngɔ́’ pú’u wɔ́.
en: Forinthose days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie Ssé laa pé’e ńzɔɔn tè gyá ngie à ge tsẅɛ́te mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ wɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lá’ le tsẅɛ́. Tá à la lɔgɔ nò pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé, tá ńtsẅɛ́te melyɛ̌’ amɛ̌.
en: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect's sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ ké ńdá’ ńgɔɔn né pi ngie gyá, à*Nzà’nkÿo wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn, kà ngie gyá, à gẅi jʉ’e wɔ́, pi pɔ́ɔn lézẅíŋ.
en: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, hereisChrist; or, lo,he isthere; believehimnot:

ngiemboon: Á nue tsɔ́ megàŋ cÿɔ nò ge gÿo kẅɛ, etsɔ́ gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ée pà*Nzà’nkÿo, petsɔ́ ne ngie pɔ́ ée pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, é nyɛ meliŋé, é gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn lélɔg ńcʉŋte twó pʉ̀a, tà ńgwáa ńgwe pɔ́ lɔg ńcʉŋte mbɔɔ ye pʉ̀a pie Ssé la tsɔ́’.
en: for false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, ifit werepossible, even the elect.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà mèŋ n kě ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi nò gie á ne ńtóo, pi laga twó gí.
en: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.

ngiemboon: nèm sele síŋ, saŋ le gíŋe ńtʉ́a wɔ́.
en: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ mmó ntʉ̀ tʉ̀ wɔ́ gie áa lefaŋ pú ńtága
en: and the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńgyá «*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn, ńne ńtóo», ńgẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g mbɔɔ máamáa metʉ̀.
en: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

ngiemboon: É túm*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, pɔ́ cú’te pʉ̀a pé pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó mesǎg lekùa, pɔ́ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńtó.
en: And then shall he send his angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi pí fʉ̀’ nà tÿǒ tsɔ̀ɔn nzsó. Pi gwɔ̌ tà ńgyá meffò mé kwoe, tà á gíŋe ńzye létáb, pi gɔɔn ngie: Afʉ̀’ʉ lùm ne ńtóo.
en: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near:

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, pi la’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá mɔɔn menò zye lécʉate, pi zsé ngie afʉ̀’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge tó, tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte, á tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ ncwò ndá.
en: so ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh,evenat the doors.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi kwà’ nenʉ́, akwò pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, té ge lá’ kwéte tà mag, té gwɔ́ gie mɔɔn menò ntsèm tǒ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag, tá’ ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké ńgʉa nà yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’, pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò ge gÿo cʉa, mbà sɔɔn nyìŋ tè zsé, tà mbɔɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie ée tÿǒ lepwó, tà mbɔɔ Míŋ Ssé. Ndà’ Tá gílé yé zɔ zsě.
en: But of that day andthathour knoweth no man, no, not the angels which are in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ńdaga twó gi, tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg, ńdyé. Á nue pi tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie mɛ̌ menò ge gÿo tó wɔ́.
en: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

ngiemboon: Menò fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌ ge gÿo gwɔ́ pá’ nò nyìŋ gẅie à cʉ́’ʉ légʉa legìŋ, ńcʉ́me ndá ye mbwo ngàŋa fa’ yé, ńnáa fà’ gie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ge cʉ́’ ne fa’a, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅii mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ncwò nká’ ngie tà á gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé.
en: For the Son of man isas a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé. Á nue pi tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie ngàŋ mbʉ̀a ne ńtóo wɔ́. Kà à ge tó pɔ́ mbÿɛ̀ njÿó wɔ́? Kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ wɔ́? Kà pɔ́ ntóŋ nkɔ́’ wɔ́? Kà pɔ́ mba’ámba’ wɔ́?
en: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:

ngiemboon: À vege vege ńtó fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà á kaa poŋ ngie à gwaa kẅɛ́te gẅí, pi ne ńdyé wɔ́.
en: lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

ngiemboon: Anò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi lɔɔn, mèŋ n gɔɔn mbɔɔ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm. Tà nyìŋ gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé.
en: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.

ngiemboon: É gÿo ne ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzága lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le*Páskà, ńgwɔ́ melyɛ̌’ mie mé lɔ́ɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ*mbelég té mvòŋ.*Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne fa’a shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge shúte gwoon Yěsô, é zẅé yé,
en: After two days wasthe feast ofthe passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and puthimto death.

ngiemboon: ńkwaŋa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Á té poŋ ngie á gwɔ́ nà lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’ létág jʉ’.
en: But they said, Not on the feastday, lest there be an uproar of the people.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ Mbetáni, á ndá Símo gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé ngie ngàŋ nkà’ pǎb, ńnéŋe ssé ńně ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, atsɔ̌ manzwě kú yé ndá, ńgẅiin ndóŋ tsɔ́ laméndɔ́ɔn mbòŋo gie mé la lɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ twó legǐńgÿo á piŋ ńcÿɔ́g nkáb tɛ’. Á lɔg ńtó, ńtyé lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ḿbwɔ́’ ndóŋ ŋwɛ́, ḿpfɛte laméndɔ́ɔn nà twó Yěsô.
en: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and pourediton his head.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó gyá á pÿága wɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅɛ́te ńgɔɔn ngie: À sěen ńcʉŋte yɔɔn laméndɔ́ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?

ngiemboon: Mé ně ńgwɔ́ pé’e sẅiŋ, mbà mé kẅé mbɔɔ*mendenie nkÿo tà náa mbwo mepóŋ. Ńgɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńzye lézẅɛ́te ńtí manzwě ŋwɛ́.
en: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi kyɛɛ yé ńnyé, pi zẅɛte mélà’a kɔ́? À gÿǒ pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná mèŋ.
en: And Jesus said,Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.

ngiemboon: Pi ge ne gyá mepóŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, pi gÿo nò mbòŋo ná pɔ́b. Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pege tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For ye have the poor with you always, and whensoever ye will ye may do them good: but me ye have not always.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wɔɔn gÿǒ yé mmó gie à ku’u légÿo, ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn, tá mé táa ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: She hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ gie mé ge lá’ tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́, mé ge lá’ gíŋe ne gɔɔn mmó gie manzwě wɔɔn gÿǒ é lɔg kímte yé.
en: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world,thisalso that she hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a Yěsô ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ Jẅidas Iskariod piŋ ńgʉa ńgyá*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ pɔ̌ kwaŋte pá’ à ge gÿo tá sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests, to betray him unto them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, á pú ḿboŋo wɔ́b, tà pɔ́ pÿé yé nkáb gie pɔ́ ge náa mbwo yé. Jẅidas leen ńké ńzye lékwaŋa fʉ̀’ gie à ge sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b tà tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ lekẅɛ.
en: And when they heardit, they were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.

ngiemboon: Ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*mbelég té mvòŋ gwɔ́ tà ńku’, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mé gwaa*menjʉ̀njÿò ńdɔgɔ ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ kwǒŋ ngie peg gʉa nzɔ̌ ńcwoŋte jʉ’, ɔ̀ jÿó*páskà wó?
en: And the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover?

ngiemboon: Á túm*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa tÿǒsoŋ, pi ge kúu wó, é gyá mámbàŋa, à gẅiin tÿóon ntse, pi cʉ́me nzèm yé,
en: And he sendeth forth two of his disciples, and saith unto them,Go ye into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him.

ngiemboon: tà à kúu ndá, pi kú gí, ńgɔɔn né ngàŋ ndá ngie: Tsítsà gɔɔn ngie peg zɛ́te gú ngie awe lûm ndá gẅie pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ge jÿó*Páskà wó, aa wɛ̌ wɔ́?
en: And wheresoever he shall go in, say ye to the goodman of the house, The Master saith, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

ngiemboon: À ge nyɛɛ gẅi máamáa lûm ndá, á ná ndêg we tÿǒ. Tà mbà mé ně ńdá’ ńtáŋte mboŋó, áa jʉ’ gie pi ge cwoŋte ségè shúm línɔ́ɔn wó.
en: And he will shew you a large upper room furnishedandprepared: there make ready for us.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ, ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pá’ Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn. Pɔ́ cwoŋte shúm léjÿó*Páskà jʉ’ó.
en: And his disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ pʉ̀a pé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém cú’te jʉ’ó,
en: And in the evening he cometh with the twelve.

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe ssé, ńzye léjÿó mmó. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gee sẅǐŋ mèŋ, tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie peg yé teme ngwʉ̌ŋ.
en: And as they sat and did eat, Jesus said,Verily I say unto you, One of you which eateth with me shall betray me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿag. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ zɛ́te ngie: Ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn?
en: And they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one,Isit I? and anothersaid, Isit I?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi ngie aa tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém, tà peg yé zɔ teme ngwʉ̌ŋ.
en: And he answered and said unto them,It isone of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge kwé, á gwɔ́ pá’ mé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’né Ssé, tá’, andù tepòŋ aa nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé*Míŋ Nyìŋ. Mbòŋo laa pá’ mé lɔ̌ɔn tè zyé yé wɔ́?
en: The Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had never been born.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ne ńjÿó shúm léjÿó, Yěsô pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’té ńgwaa náa mbwo pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kɔ. Yɔɔn ee mbùm nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn,
en: And as they did eat, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and brakeit, and gave to them, and said,Take, eat: this is my body.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńkaa ntú’ melù’, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ pú ńnú wɔ́b métsèm.
en: And he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gaveitto them: and they all drank of it.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mɔɔn ée metse mɔ́ɔn, é metse mie Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwaa*kʉ̀a, é pfɛte nà twó pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And he said unto them,This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, Mèŋ n tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńnú mɔɔn melù’ wɔ́, tà lá’ cʉ́’ʉ núu pɔ́ me sẅé á fʉ̀’ gie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a njÿó.
en: Verily I say unto you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine, until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ leen ńké ńzɔb mentse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé. Afʉ̀’ ku’, pɔ́ kẅɛ, ńgʉa ne ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive.
en: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: *menjʉ̀njÿò mé saa tsẅɛ».
en: And Jesus saith unto them,All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà zíme nà legwé, é vɔgɔ Galilea zẅí’te gẅí.
en: But after that I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwá’a gú ńkÿo metsèm, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n de ɔ́ gwá’.
en: But Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yetwillnot I.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gú, kwà’ nénʉ́, mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwaa ye à toŋo tǒŋ lêtsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.
en: And Jesus saith unto him,Verily I say unto thee, That this day,evenin this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿbʉŋe mbwo yé kwà’ lê metʉ̀ ngie: Mé lɔɔn fó ḿbúte wɔ́gɔ́ ńne ńdɔgɔ ńgee pɔ́ ńzẅé, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de gú moŋe. Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé metsèm gíŋe ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: But he spake the more vehemently, If I should die with thee, I will not deny thee in any wise. Likewise also said they all.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo le Getsémane, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, n gʉa sẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane: and he saith to his disciples,Sit ye here, while I shall pray.

ngiemboon: É faga Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa. Á zye lé jú’ pá’ cÿɔ’ gwoon yé, legwé pfɛ́ɛ yé,
en: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed, and to be very heavy;

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ée pá’ɔɔn ńně ḿmÿɔgɔ pɔ́ nà ntí gie ńgwɔ́ n kwé kwě. Pi ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ légwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé,
en: and saith unto them,My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death: tarry ye here, and watch.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńná’a ńgʉa mvfò, ńgwe ssé ńne sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé pe’e yɔɔn fʉ̀’ tepòŋ wɔ́, á pe’e,
en: And he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Abba, Tá wɔ̀ɔn, atsɔ́ nò té gú cʉa. Pe’e yɔɔn ngɔ́’ gie e tóo ná mèŋ lɔɔn. Tá’, tè gÿo pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn lekwòŋ, gÿo pɔ́ gù.
en: And he said,Abba, Father, all thingsarepossible unto thee; take away this cup from me: nevertheless not what I will, but what thou wilt.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sẅíŋte Ssé pú’u, ḿbiŋ nzèm lejʉ́ŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgyá pɔ́ ne ńdyé lyě. Á gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Símo, ɔ̀ lyě lá? Ɔ̀ fǒ kaa ku’u léná’a shÿɔgɔ lelɔ́g mbɔɔ ná tà’ nèm wɔ́ la?
en: And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter,Simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńdyé, pi sẅíŋte Ssé ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò. Ntʉ́m nyìŋ tʉte tɛ’, tá’ mbùm nnɛ́ pÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌,
en: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit trulyisready, but the fleshisweak.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe fó lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b ńgʉa sẅíŋte Ssé, ńgɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie à ně ńzɔɔn ńgɔɔn.
en: And again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo ńgíŋe ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá pɔ́ nyé ńdyé lyě, mélà’mie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà lelɔ́g pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ zyeen, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńzsé nò gie pɔ́ ge shwóŋó yé wɔ́.
en: And when he returned, he found them asleep again, (for their eyes were heavy,) neither wist they what to answer him.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa, ńgÿo ńgíŋe ńtóo nà mbɔ́ɔntè ngʉ̀a ntá, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi cwoŋo ńdyé, ńzẅɛte mboŋó. Á zebé. Afʉ̀’ áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’. Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ á mbwo pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them,Sleep on now, and takeyourrest: it is enough, the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

ngiemboon: Pi lu ssé pege gʉa. Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé wɔ̀ɔn mbwo pɔ́b à wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ.
en: Rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, Jẅidas gẅie aa tsɔ̌ tà’ nà pʉ̀a pé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém tó. Alá’ gwɔ́ nzèm ye tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńgẅiin menně ncù lâ mekésiŋ, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, mbɔɔ*mekěme lá’ tǔm.
en: And immediately, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà ngàŋ menáŋ la shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ à ge gÿo tá pɔ́ liŋe Yěsô. Yɛ̌ liŋé gwɔ́ ngie: yé lɔɔn ńtsyɛ’te nyìŋ, ńtáŋte yé, pɔ́ zsé ngie aa yé, ńdeen ńgwóon ye, ḿbiŋ ńnyɛte ńgẅiin yé mboŋó tá ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: And he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he; take him, and leadhimaway safely.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwɔ́ tà ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ngie: Andè, n tsyɛ’té, ńdeen ńgwóon ńtáŋte yé.
en: And as soon as he was come, he goeth straightway to him, and saith, Master, master; and kissed him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a leen ńké ńgwoon Yěsô ńkú’te.
en: And they laid their hands on him, and took him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie pâ Yěsô ke ńgwɔ́, á soŋ nně ncù mbʉ́a, ḿma’ lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa fà’*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, é kẅɛ́te letuŋó sé, ńjúa.
en: And one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ ngie: Pi gwaa tó gwoon wɔ̀ɔn, ńgẅiin menně ncù lâ mekésiŋ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi gee ńgwoon ntsǒŋ pá’ɔɔn lêkɔ́?
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords andwithstaves to take me?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kaa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé. Pi ké tè wɔ̀ɔn gwoon. Tá’, à yɔɔn nò tóo ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé á pumte.
en: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took me not: but the scriptures must be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gyá pá’ mé gwǒon yé, ḿbú ńgwá’a yé métsèm ńkÿo.
en: And they all forsook him, and fled.

ngiemboon: Tà á cʉ́’ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ mûɔ ngwashùm, á cʉ́me nzèm ye, mbà à lɔ̌g pe ndà’ pwó nzsǒ ḿbwóte mbùm ye. Mé gwoon yé.
en: And there followed him a certain young man, having a linen cloth cast abouthisnakedbody; and the young men laid hold on him:

ngiemboon: Á fó mbwo pɔ́b sẅe, ńgwá’ nzsǒ ye ńkÿo té ma’ nzsǒ.
en: and he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa né nɔ’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. Mbà*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, lâ*mekěme lá’ lâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ně ḿbú ńcú’te wó.
en: And they led Jesus away to the high priest: and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.

ngiemboon: Piɛ zse nzèm Yěsô, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgʉa yé tà ńtɔ́g ńkúu tetʉ́a*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò, ńnéŋe yé ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe mmɔ̌g gẅie pà pyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ně nyɛte pâ pɔ̌ ně ńzɔ́gɔ.
en: And Peter followed him afar off, even into the palace of the high priest: and he sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*petsɔ́ pàsá’a lá’ ne fa’a nò gie mé ge zába twó Yěsô tá lɔg gÿo mè zẅé yé, ńké tè ne ńgyá wɔ́.
en: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found none.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tÿɔ́g menò twó yé tɛ’. Mé píte tɛ’, á ké tè pumte.
en: For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, tà’ ncwò ké tè tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kẅɛ.
en: But neither so did their witness agree together.

ngiemboon: *Anùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò lu ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ laŋte laŋté kà? Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù lɛ wɔ́ kà?
en: And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? whatis it whichthese witness against thee?

ngiemboon: Yěsô láŋte laŋté, à tè tsɔ́b.*Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, á Míŋ Ssé?
en: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and said unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n ge wɛ̌. Pi ge gÿo gyá «*Míŋ Nyìŋ ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀ Ssé gẅie tsɔ́ nò té yé cʉa». É gíŋe gyá à fóo tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn tÿǒ lepwó ńtóo.
en: And Jesus said,I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.

ngiemboon: *Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò jú’ pú’u, ésele*shʉate menzsǒ mé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege giŋé fa’a pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí pà njÿò ńgyá?
en: Then the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What need we any further witnesses?

ngiemboon: Pi jǔ’ pá’ à kaŋá lʉŋe Ssé pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńkwaŋ gí ngie kɔ́? Pʉ̀a metsèm gɔɔn ngie: À gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé.
en: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a zye létsɔg metyé ná ye, ńkwɛ́ shÿó we, ńně ńcúa yé, ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Lɔgɔ nò*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé jú yɛ̌, ńkeme nyìŋ gẅie à cǔa gú. Pàpyɛ́bɛ nɔ’ɔ*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò ne ńcúa metuŋó mé.
en: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ńnéŋe tetʉ́a né mecwoŋó, atsɔ̌ tà’ ná panzwě pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn fa’a nɔ’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò tó.
en: And as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest:

ngiemboon: Piɛ ne ńzɔ́gɔ mmɔ̌g, á cwoŋo ńdíe yé tà ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mbɔɔ gù jú, pi Yěsô Nǎzarɛd wɛ ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ.
en: and when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Piɛ moŋe, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ, n kaa zsé, ḿbiŋ tè ne ńjú’u mmó gie ɔ̀ fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́, éfó tsìŋe ssé, ńgʉa né ncwò nká’, [mênkɔ́’ tóŋ].
en: But he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest. And he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gÿo ńgíŋe ńgyá yé, ńzye léshwóŋ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ laa jʉ’ó ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ, aa tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb.
en: And a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This isoneof them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿmoŋe moŋe. Mé ná’a ńnéŋe, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ laa jʉ’ó, gíŋe ńgɔɔn yɔ́b né Piɛ ngie: Á té nò fa’ fa’ wɔ́, ɔɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b. Ɔ̀ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ jú nyìŋ Galilea.
en: And he denied it again. And a little after, they that stood by said again to Peter, Surely thou artoneof them: for thou art a Galilæan, and thy speech agreeththereto.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye légɔɔn ngie, e Ssé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn, à zeŋe yɔ́ɔn mé, mèŋ n tè ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie pi kíme yé wɔ́.
en: But he began to curse and to swear,saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.

ngiemboon: Tà’ mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńgíŋe ńtóŋ, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a. Piɛ leen ńkímte pá’ Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwɔ ye à tóŋo tǒŋ ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá. Piɛ gwóon fó tetʉ́a ńkẅɛ, ńdʉa.
en: And the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. And when he thought thereon, he wept.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńne ńdʉ́a,*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ*mekěm mbɔɔ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pɔ́b*pàsá’a lá’ metsèm mʉ́ mba’ámba’, ńgÿo cú’tè, ńkwɛ́ɛ Yěsô, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńnáa mbwo*Pilato.
en: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carriedhimaway, and deliveredhimto Pilate.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔɔ fùɔ pà Yuda lá? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u.
en: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him,Thou sayestit.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menò twó Yěsô tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gíŋe ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ laŋte laŋtě kà? Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u nzẅìŋ menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù wɔ́ kà?
en: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pú tè tsɔ́b, á kʉ’ʉ*Pilato tɛ’.
en: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*Pilato tsɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gẅie alá’ zɛté yé.
en: Now atthatfeast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ, mé tóŋo yé le Panepâse, pâ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pé gwɔ́ wó, mbà pâ pɔ̌ la ma’a và’ tÿǒsoŋ, tà ńzẅé nyìŋ.
en: And there wasonenamed Barabbas,which laybound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ńzye lézɛ́te yé ngie à gÿo pá’ à lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé gÿo fʉ̀’ʉ línɔ́ɔn.
en: And the multitude crying aloud began to desirehim to doas he had ever done unto them.

ngiemboon: *Pilato tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwǒŋ ngie mèŋ n nyé fùɔ pà Yuda né pi?
en: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie, à la ne ńzsé ngie*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ la kwɔ́’ pɔ́ lóŋ ná Yěsô tá ńdɔgɔ yé ńtó sẅiŋe mbwo ye.
en: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ jú’ á gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ tsóte lá’ ngie pɔ́ zɛ́te ngie*Pilato tsɔ́’ pɔ́ Panepâse ńná le pɔ́b.
en: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gíŋe ńzɛ́te lá’ ngie: Tà pi ee pá’ɔɔn ńkwoŋo ngie mèŋ n gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́ ná nyìŋ gẅie pi tóŋo le fùɔ pà Yuda wɔ́?
en: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall dounto himwhom ye call the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: Alá’ gíŋe ḿbú ńnáa gwá, ńgɔɔn ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ nò tepòŋ gie à gÿǒ áa kɔ́? Tá’, alá’ gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńnáa gwá ngie: Ké ńkime yé kim!
en: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gyá ngie à ge gÿo mmó gie á poŋó lá’, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Panepâse ndá tsǎŋ ńnyé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mé lɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn ńcúa Yěsô. Á náa yé ngie mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńkime nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: AndsoPilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourgedhim, to be crucified.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́’ ncù lɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa ńkúu gyɛ̌, ḿbú ńcú’te yetsɔ́ ngàŋa nùɔ wɔ́b métsèm.
en: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Prætorium; and they call together the whole band.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ma’ nzsǒ lefùɔ ná Yěsô, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg menzóŋ ḿbá’a cÿɔ̀’, éshuu twó ye ngie aa fùɔ,
en: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about hishead,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńzye létsyɛ’te yé, ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé sǐe fùɔ pà Yuda!
en: and began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

ngiemboon: Ńne ńdɔgɔ kekà’a ńcúa twó yé, ńne ńtsɔgɔ metyé ná ye, ḿbiŋe ńtóo ńŋwɔ́’ɔ mvfò yé, ésíe yé.
en: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowingtheirknees worshipped him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoonte yé tà ńkʉ́a, éfó ná yé ésẅɛ nzsǒ lefùɔ, ḿma’ kwà’ mé menzsǒ ná ye, ńdɔgɔ yé fó wó ńkẅɛ ńgʉa. Légʉa ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńdɔgɔ yé ńgee, ḿbumte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, á fóo lé tsẅɛ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Símo, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Sirɛne ńtó, ńgwɔ́ tá pà Alekzáŋdele pɔ́ Rẅifẅis. Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù gwoon yé, ńdɔg tʉ̀ sẅɛ́ɛ yé ngie à kaa tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô.
en: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

ngiemboon: Pâ Yěsô lɔg ye jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo le Golgota, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn nà shwóŋè pà Yuda ngie: Jʉ’ʉ kẅǐ twó.
en: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, éfa’a lénná melù’ mie mé lɔgɔ́ tsɔ́ ffo gie mé tóŋo le*mire ḿvoŋ á mbwo ye, á lʉ’ʉ lénnú.
en: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he receiveditnot.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ḿbí menzsǒ mé, ḿma’a tyèente ńdɔg ńgabte ńná ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ pú’u, ná nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ mba’ámba’.
en: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e mmó gie à fʉ̌a, ńkyɛɛ nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Á gwɔ̂ ngie fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋe ńkim tsɔ́ metsǒŋ mépʉ́a nà metÿǒ nkǐ. Tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

ngiemboon: [Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: Mé léen sáŋa yé nùɔ mefÿɛ́.]
en: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.

ngiemboon: Pàcʉa mánzsè la ne ńnyime yé yɔ́b, ńzoonte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ keme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńdɔgɔ lyɛ̌’ lá’ sétá ńkwɛ́ɛ,
en: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildestitin three days,

ngiemboon: kwà’ gù zɔ kẅé twó ɔ́, éfó nà tÿǒ nkǐ sẅɛ́’ la.
en: save thyself, and come down from the cross.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, ne ńzoonte Yěsô yɔ́b, ésele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: À kà gÿo tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́, tá’ à kaa ku’u lékẅé yé twó mbwo legwé wɔ́.
en: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

ngiemboon: A*Nzà’nkÿo, afùɔ pà Israel, afó nà tÿǒ nkǐ fʉ̀’ɔɔn sẅɛ́’, peg gyá, ńzáb ntʉ́m wég ná ye. Pʉ̀a pie mé la púte wɔ́b lâ pɔ̌ ńkime nà metÿǒ nkǐ la gíŋe ńne ńzoonte yé yɔ́b zoonte.
en: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ la gwɔ́ tà ńku’, ajʉ’ tsèm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pú síŋ, tà ńdá’ ńkúu ná nèm ntá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó.
en: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ná nèm tá ŋwɛ́, Yěsô ga’te nê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Eloï, Eloï lama sa batani», ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, e Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gwá’a wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́»?
en: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying,Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó, jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: À wɛ gẅie à ne ńtóŋo*Elîɛ lɛ!
en: And some of them that stood by, when they heardit, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b kÿote ńgʉa ńtsaba kusáa nà kikíi melù’, éshÿɔ́gɔ nà twó kekà’a, ńtsege ńnéŋe ncwò Yěsô, ńgie à sẅíte, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi cʉ́’ pege gyá kà*Elîɛ ge tó, éfóo nà tÿǒ nkǐ sẅí’i yé wɔ́.
en: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and putiton a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ga’te ngyè tetʉ́ʉ, ńcʉ́m.
en: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́m pú’u, nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg ńkʉŋe tsɔ́ jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie ee*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, éfó tÿó shʉa tà ńkúu Ssé.
en: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

ngiemboon: Tándá palÿɔ́’ ncù gẅie à la tyé ńne ńdíe tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô, gyá ntí gie à lɔ̌g ńcʉ́m, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn kaa kwà’ Míŋ Ssé.
en: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ panzwě la tyé yɔ́b pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ńne ńdíe. Malîɛ Mágdala pɔ́ Salomé, ńgÿo Malîɛ má pà Joses, mbɔɔ we Jâŋ we nkʉ́ gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b,
en: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ panzwě pie pɔ́ la zse nzèm Yěsô, á fʉ̀’ gie à laa Galilea, ńgiŋe ńkẅéte yé. Petsɔ́ panzwě gwɔ́ pie pɔ́b lâ Yěsô métsèm la púte ńkwɔ́’ tà ńkúu Yerósalem.
en: (who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: *Pilato jú’ ngie Yěsô ně ńdá’ ńkwé, ḿmɔɔn tɛ’, ńtóŋo tándá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, ńzɛ́te yé ngie áa nénʉ́, mbà Yěsô kwě wɔ́?
en: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and callingunto himthe centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

ngiemboon: Á shwóŋe yé ngie à ně ńdá’ mé ńkwé.*Pilato leen ńké ńzẅíŋ ngie Yesyɛ̂b gʉa ńkyɛ́’ɛ pfó Yěsô.
en: And when he knewitof the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gʉa ńjúu pwó nzsó, ńgʉa nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ésẅí’i pfó Yěsô ńdɔg nzsǒ ŋwɛ́, ńzémte, ńkáa ńdɔg ńgʉa, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè sie mé la shʉ’ʉ ná máa tóon, ńgíŋe ńtsóte tsɔ̌ tóon ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò.
en: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ ńnéŋe pfó Yěsô jʉ’ó, Malîɛ Magdala, pɔ́ Malîɛ má pà Joses ne ńgyá.
en: And Mary Magdalene and Marythe motherof Joses beheld where he was laid.

ngiemboon: *Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda ŋwɛ́ gÿo ńtɔ́g, Malîɛ Magdala pɔ́ Salomé, ńgÿo Malîɛ má pà Jâg, gʉa ńjúulaméndɔ́ɔn lélɔg ńzɔ́’ɔ pfó Yěsô.
en: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary themotherof James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lʉ́a, tà nèm ne sá’a, pɔ́ mʉ́ ńgʉa ne jʉ’ʉ lesyè. Á laa ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’ nà ngàba lá’.
en: And very early in the morning the firstdayof the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńgiŋe, ńně ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà wɔ̌ ge kúu jʉ’ó kite máa tóon ncwò lesyè né pɔ̌b wɔ́?
en: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà mé ně fó ncwò lesyè ńkite máa tóon ŋwɛ́.
en: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, ńgyá tsɔ̌ mûɔ ngwàshùm ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀, ḿma’a féfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ. Pɔ́ gyá yé ḿbɔ́g tɛ’.
en: And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g, pi fa’a Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd gẅie mé kà kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ la? À zimé nà legwé, à tè nyé jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́. Pi gyá, yɔɔn áa jʉ’ gie mé kà nuŋe pfó yé wó.
en: And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa fʉ̀’ɔɔn shwóŋó Piɛ, pâ yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ngie à vɔgɔ́ Galilea, ńne ńzẅíte gẅi pá’ à la shwóŋó gẅi ngie pi ge lá’ gyá yé wó la.
en: But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.

ngiemboon: Panzwě ŋwɛ́ leen ḿbú ḿbɔ́g pɔ́g, ńkẅɛ ńkÿo, ḿbú ńtebe tà fó tè gíŋe ńku’u létsẅii nò mbwo nyìŋ wɔ́, mbà cÿɔ’ pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b.
en: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they trembled and were amazed: neither said they any thing to anyman; for they were afraid.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la zíme na legwé, á mba’ámba’ mvɔ́g mvfò lyɛ̌’ nà ngàba lá’, ḿvɔg ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo Malîɛ Magdala wá gẅie*messé tepòŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a la gwoon yé, ńne ḿbue yé tá Yěsô kẅé yé mbwo pɔ́b la.
en: Now whenJesuswas risen early the firstdayof the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgʉa ḿbíte shwóŋ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô. Pɔ́ laa tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔg, ḿbú ne ńdʉa.
en: Andshe went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ ngie à zimé nà legwé tà á gyá yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntèntʉ́, pɔ́ pú tè zẅíŋ.
en: And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.

ngiemboon: À la gÿo pú’u, ńgíŋe ńnyɛ mbùm ye nà tsɔ̌ ntí, á mbwo tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a, pɔ́ gwɔ́ mánzsè ńne ńgee né tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a.
en: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them, as they walked, and went into the country.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá yé pú’u, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gíŋe ńké tè yɔ́b zẅíŋ.
en: And they went and tolditunto the residue: neither believed they them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gÿo ńgíŋe ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ nê legém métsèm. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndá mpfɛ́ɛ mmó. Á kaga wɔ́b ná pá’ pɔ́ ně tè zẅíŋ, ńgíŋe ńdʉ’ mbɔɔ lézẅíŋe nò ncwò pʉ̀a pie à zǐm ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwó pɔ́b.
en: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ té vʉ’ʉ tsɔ̌.
en: And he said unto them,Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅǐŋ la, mé nu’u yé ntse, e Ssé gÿo à tsẅɛ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à lʉ’ʉ́ lézẅíŋ lá, à ge lá’ gwe ntsàŋ.
en: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zẅiŋé nò yɔ́ɔn, ge lá’ gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn: pɔ́ ge lá’ lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn jwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, pɔ́ ge lá’ shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zí’i,
en: And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;

ngiemboon: pɔ́ lá’ ńdɔg mbwo mɔ́b ńgwoon nnú, ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔɔn ńjÿó mecÿɔ́b, atsɔ́ mmó le wɔ́b gÿo, pɔ́ ge lá’ záb mbwo mɔ́b nà megàŋa guɔ pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: they shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô la gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b tà ńtẅé jʉ’, e Ssé ŋá’a yé ńdɔg ńkwɔ́’ lé tÿǒ lepwó. Á ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó yé ye tʉ̀.
en: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa, ńzye léshwóŋó nò Ssé jʉ’ ntsèm. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńdíe wɔ́b, ńkẅéte wɔ́b, ńtóonte wɔ́b, pɔ́ gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, mie é nyɛɛ ngie shwóŋè yɔ́b fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: And they went forth, and preached every where, the Lord working withthem, and confirming the word with signs following. Amen.

ngiemboon: Andè; Téofil, ɔ̀ zsě ngie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kéen ńkaa fà’a lécú’te menò mie é ka cʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege tà ńŋwe’e,
en: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,

ngiemboon: ńŋwe’e kwà’ pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gyá pá’ nò yɔɔn zyete, ḿbiŋ ńgyá pá’ á giŋe pú’u.
en: even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;

ngiemboon: Pá’ á ka gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mèŋ n kéen ńgwáa ńtúŋté fa’ yɔ́ɔn tà fó letsiŋé nò la, mèŋ n ka gyá ngie á póŋ mèŋ n táŋte yɔ́ɔn mboŋó, ńŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo gù.
en: it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gÿo pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge tóŋ lɔg zsé ngie menò mie mé la zí’i gú ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ kwà’ pú’u.
en: that thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie*Herôd laa fùɔ lá’ pà Jẅidea, atsɔ̌*nuŋe pwɔ́’ gwɔ́ wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Sakarîɛ, á fa’a nà nùɔ pʉ̀a pé Abia. Anzwě we laa yé nà ngẅɛ̀ Aroŋ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Lisape.
en: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judæa, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abia: and his wifewasof the daughters of Aaron, and her namewasElisabeth.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ pɔ́ nzwě we laa pʉ̀a, ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé kwà’ mboŋó, ńjú’u ncwò Ssé, ḿbiŋe ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie à ne ńkwoŋo tà*lɔ̌’ téen ńkẅɛɛ wɔ́.
en: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tè múɔ gẅiin, mélà’mie Lisape laa nkǐŋ manzwě, mbà pɔ́ giŋé ḿbú ńzẅiŋ.
en: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both werenowwell stricken in years.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ ye nùɔ fà’ we pà Sakarîɛ lêen ńké ńgÿo ńku’, á gwɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé Yerósalem ńne nuŋe pwɔ́’.
en: And it came to pass, that while he executed the priest's office before God in the order of his course,

ngiemboon: Pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé ńgẅiin létyeente ńdɔg fa’a tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gẅie à ge kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá, á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, é tuɔ shúm gyě lélɔg ńgu’te Ssé, ńgÿo pú’u, tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, e Ssé tsɔ́’ɔ Sakarîɛ.
en: according to the custom of the priest's office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ ndá ně tuɔ shúm gyě ŋwɛ́, alá’ gwɔ́ pǐ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ḿbú ne sẅíŋte Ssé metsèm.
en: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ gwaa gyá, atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé vege ńkẅɛɛ mvfò yé, ńtyé jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ shúm gyě wó, á nà gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀.
en: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ gyá yé, além yé tsɔ́’ɔ, ecÿɔ́’ gwoon yé.
en: And when Zacharias sawhim, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ, te gíŋe ḿbɔ́g, e Ssé kéen ńjú’u nò gie ɔɔ ńtsẅé sẅíŋte yé mǒ, tà à ge cÿɔ’ɔ nzwě ɔ̀ Lisape, pi yé zyé tà’ mûɔ mbàŋa, ɔ̀ tsẅi lezíŋ sé le Jâŋ.
en: But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.

ngiemboon: Múɔ ŋwɛ́ ge lá’ gwɔ́ mbwo gù, é gwɔ́ kwà’ mmó lekág, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋe ńkága ná pá’ mé zyě yé.
en: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé é gwɔ́ nyìŋ tɛ’. À piŋ těen ńdá’a ńnúu melù’ wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nú ḿbʉ́a. À ge lá’ zɔɔn gwɔ kẅɛɛ lepfòm má we, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a léen ńjÿó yé
en: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother's womb.

ngiemboon: À gÿo pʉ̀a Israel tà ńgyɔ́ɔn sele ntʉ́m wɔ́b, ḿbiŋe mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔb.
en: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ náa yé metʉ̀, à lɔg ńgwɔ́ yé pá’*Elîɛ,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, lélɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò e fa’a pá’ à ge gÿo metá gẅiin nkwaŋá mbòŋo nà gubé yɔ́b, é piŋ gÿo pàte jǔ’ ncwò gẅiin ntʉ́m pʉ̀a pie é pɔ́g Ssé. Pú’u, e Ssé lɔg ńtáŋte pʉ̀a pie é ge lá’ ku’u légu’te yé.
en: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ge gyá kɔ́ tá zsé ngie á ge lá’ gwɔ́ nò? Pá’ peg wɔ̀ɔn manzwě pú ńzẅiŋ tɛ’ lɔɔn?
en: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n gee Ngáapeleya, ńju’u mbwo Ssé. Yé zɔ tumó wɔ̀ɔn ngie n tó ńtsẅi wɔɔn nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo gù.
en: And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew thee these glad tidings.

ngiemboon: Áa nò gie á ge kwà’ gÿo kẅɛ nà yé fʉ̀’, tá’ pá’ ɔ̀ kaa zẅíŋe lá, ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ támbǎ’ tà yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ gÿo ńku’.
en: And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á laa pi ńzẅí’te Sakarîɛ la gyá, mbà à neŋé tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tà á cʉa, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b.
en: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tà ńkẅɛ, à té gíŋe ńku’u légɔɔn nò mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ ńdɔg pɔ́ mbwo ńtsẅii nò. Pɔ́ gwoon ńzsé ngie à tǒ ndá, e Ssé ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mé, á gyá tsɔ̌ nkʉ̀’ʉ nò. Á fó pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ támbǎ’.
en: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ lu ńgwɔ́ tà mag mé melyɛ̌’ɛ fà’ á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé Yerósalem, ḿbiŋ né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, anzwě we Lisape gwoon shwoŋ, ńnéŋe ndyeen lyeen nà mesaŋ méntʉ̀a, ńne ńgɔɔn ntʉ́m yé ngie:
en: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kéen ńdíe wɔ̀ɔn tà ńgÿo ná mèŋ, lélɔg sẅag shʉ́ gẅie ée ńzɔ́gɔ ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pá’ n tè yɔ́ɔn múɔ gẅiin.
en: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked onme, to take away my reproach among men.

ngiemboon: Lisape gwɔ́ shwoŋ tà ńgwɔ́ mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́, e Ssé túmo Cÿɔ́’ we Ngáapeleya tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ Galilea gie mé tóŋo le Nǎzarɛd,
en: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

ngiemboon: á mbwo tsɔ̌ mûɔ nguɔ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lé Malîɛ, mbà mé ka pÿé yé mbwo Yesyɛ̂b, á nyìŋ nà tsiŋe ndá fùɔ Ndavíd, tà mé ńnéŋe ssé mǒ.
en: to a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin's namewasMary.

ngiemboon: N tsyɛ’té gú, mbà Malîɛ, ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔgɔ́ gú ńgÿo mmó, à ne ńdíe gú tɛ’.
en: And the angel came in unto her, and said, Hail,thou that arthighly favoured, the Lordiswith thee: blessedartthou among women.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ jú’, á pú ńcʉa yé tɛ’, á kwaŋte ngie: Yɔɔn ntí tsyɛ̀’te ée pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: And when she sawhim, she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ, tè pɔ́g, e Ssé cÿǒ gʉm jú.
en: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.

ngiemboon: Jú’u: Ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ shwoŋ, é gÿo zyé tà’ mûɔ mbàŋa, é tsẅi lezíŋ sé le Yěsô.
en: And, behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwɔ́ nyìŋ ndÿò, mè tóŋo yé lé Míŋ Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Kwà’ yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé zɔ gíŋe ńná lefùɔ ngàb ngẅɛ̀ wɔb Ndavíd né yé.
en: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:

ngiemboon: Aa lá’a tsẅé sá’a ngẅɛ̀ Israel ntsèm; lefùɔ sé téen ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.

ngiemboon: Tà yɔɔn nò ge lá’ cʉa lêkɔ́, pá’ n nyě tè zsě mámbàŋa lɔɔn?
en: Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge sẅɛ́’ kúu ná gù, e Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ lɔg metʉ̀ mé ńkábte gú tà yɔɔn nò pumte. À cʉa pú’u, tá mé gÿo ńtóŋo múɔ gẅie ɔ̀ ge zyé le Ndʉalʉ̌a, é gíŋe tóŋo yé le Míŋ Ssé.
en: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Zɔɔn ńgyá fɛ́ gẅi Lisape. Mé ée ńtóŋo yé le nkǐŋ manzwě, à kěen ńzẅiŋ tɛ’ tá’, ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́ pá’ aa shwoŋ, tà à ge táa zyé mûɔ mbàŋa.
en: And, behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nò le Ssé cʉa
en: For with God nothing shall be impossible.

ngiemboon: N gwɔ̌ pɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a: Á póŋ ngie à gÿo menò mie ɔ̀ shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn mɛ̂, è pumte ná mèŋ. Á gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn,*cÿɔ́’ Ssé lêen ńké ńgʉa.
en: And Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ lɔg mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’, ńdu ssé, ńgiŋ pɔ́ lê metʉ̀ ńdɔ́g ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ Jẅidea ḿbʉ ńgʉa lé tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ,
en: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;

ngiemboon: ńgʉ́a tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a Sakarîɛ, ńkúu ndá, ńtsyɛ’te Lisape.
en: and entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.

ngiemboon: Lisape jú’u tsyɛ̀’te Malîɛ, múɔ ŋele lepfòm yé, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’ ńkúu ná yé.
en: And it came to pass, that, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gẅiin mbʉ́lè Ssé, ńcʉa pànzwě metsèm. Mbʉ́lè gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ ná múɔ gẅie ɔ̀ ge táa zyé.
en: and she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessedartthou among women, and blessedisthe fruit of thy womb.

ngiemboon: Má pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn tóo ńguɔ wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn, n gwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn wɔ́?
en: And whenceisthis to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

ngiemboon: Gyá pá’ n děen ńjú’u tsyɛ̀’te ɔ́, múɔ ŋele, ńkága lepfòm mèŋ.
en: For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.

ngiemboon: Ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, mélà’mie ɔ̀ ka zẅǐŋ ngie menò mie Ssé ka tǔm mé tsẅii mbwo gù, ge táa púmte.
en: And blessedisshe that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.

ngiemboon: M bǔ ne ńnáa legú’ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: My soul doth magnify the Lord,

ngiemboon: Ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkága tɛ’ ńtí pá’ à gÿǒ mèŋ n tsẅɛ́.
en: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a mesoŋ nà mejwoŋó mejwoŋó ge lá’a cʉ́’ʉ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lé shÿó mbòŋo,
en: For, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ee Ssé
en: And holyishis name.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgÿo ná púɔ pɔ́b á ná mejwoŋó mejwoŋó
en: From generation to generation.

ngiemboon: À tǎg pàŋá’te nnɛ́ ńdɔg sáa tsẅɛ
en: He hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

ngiemboon: ńkaa mepóŋ ńnéŋe mǒ
en: And exalted them of low degree.

ngiemboon: ńjwoŋ megàŋa mmó pɔ́ gʉa mbwo mesẅɛ̀ɛ
en: And the rich he hath sent empty away.

ngiemboon: À kaa lege lényɛɛ pòŋo ntʉ́m yé wɔ́,
en: In remembrance ofhismercy;

ngiemboon: Á mbwo Ábalam pɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé mejwoŋó mejwoŋó
en: To Abraham, and to his seed for ever.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ la gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ Lisape lá’ ńnéŋe mmó mesaŋ méntá, tá á piŋ nzèm.
en: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e Lisape ge zyé ku’, á zyé mûɔ mbàŋa.
en: Now Elisabeth's full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ́a pâ mefɛ́ pé jú’ pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe mé, ńnáa yé mûɔ, pâ pɔ́ pú ńkág.
en: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ gẅiin lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn, mé tóo lépú’u yé ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé, éfa’a létóŋo yé lé Sakarîɛ pá’ tá we.
en: And it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

ngiemboon: Me tóŋo yé le Jâŋ.
en: And his mother answered and said, Notso; but he shall be called John.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tiŋ ńdʉ’, ńgɔɔn ngie atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè tsetsɛ̀ɛ mefɛ́ pí lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ wɔ́.
en: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

ngiemboon: Ńdêen ńké ńdɔg mbwó ńzɛ́te Sakarîɛ pá’ à kwǒŋ ngie mé tóŋo múɔ pú’u.
en: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te mmó gie à ge ŋwe’e mmó mǒ, mé ná, á ŋwe’e ngie lezíŋ sé ée lé Jâŋ. Pɔ́ gyá á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marvelled all.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ gyá ncwò Sakarîɛ gwoon ńtsɔ́’ɔ tà á gwaa gíŋe zye légɔɔn nò, ńně ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongueloosed, and he spake, and praised God.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ nkwɔ́’ɔ mbʉ́a la jú’ ngie Sakarîɛ giŋé ńgɔɔn nò ḿbú ḿmɔɔn tɛ’. Yɔɔn nò lêen ńké saa lá’, tà mé cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ shÿó mekwɛ́ pà Jẅidea e shwóŋó pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judæa.

ngiemboon: Á zɔ́ɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mé ńtóonte yé.
en: And all they that heardthemlaidthemup in their hearts, saying, What manner of child shall this be! And the hand of the Lord was with him.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó tá we Sakarîɛ, á gɔɔn nò pá’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá, ngie:
en: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

ngiemboon: à tǒ ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pé, ńcu’u wɔ́b ndá nkwɔ̀ɔn.
en: For he hath visited and redeemed his people,

ngiemboon: À kẅɛɛ nà ngẅɛ̀ nda ngàŋa fà’ wé, fùɔ Ndavid,
en: In the house of his servant David;

ngiemboon: oon, à la lɔg ncwò*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ nà mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té ne ńkwoŋo légyá gẅi wɔ́.
en: That we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;

ngiemboon: ńkímte*kʉ̀a ndʉalʉ̌a gie pâ pɔ́ la gwa,
en: And to remember his holy covenant;

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn ńtíi wege ngie:
en: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham,

ngiemboon: tá pɔ́ lêen ńké ńku’u léfa’a mbwo mèŋ té pɔ́g.
en: Might serve him without fear,

ngiemboon: ndùmo Ssé tsetsá’.
en: In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.

ngiemboon: ńnyɛte mánzsé we.
en: For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;

ngiemboon: á tsoté tà ḿbɔ́ɔnte pá’ à ge lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b, é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́,
en: By the remission of their sins,

ngiemboon: À ge túmo Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pege gwɔ́ wó, angàŋ fó tÿǒ ńtó ńgwɔ́ nkà’,
en: Whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,

ngiemboon: é tsege wɔ́b ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè.
en: To guide our feet into the way of peace.

ngiemboon: Míŋ Sakarîɛ gÿo ḿbʉ́le ńgú’ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ndÿò, ńgʉa ńnéŋe nkwòŋo tsẅɛ̀, ńdá’a ńtsẅé pɔ́ wó tà ńkúu lyɛ̌’ gie à la nyɛ mbum ye mbwo pʉ̀a Israel.
en: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa zyé Jâŋ, mbà Áwúse, Kása pà*Roma ŋwe’é ŋwà’ne, ńzáb ngie mé pú sáŋ ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie à ne sá’a wɔ́b.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Cæsar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ lɔ́gɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò lesǎŋ pʉ̀a pú’u. Kirinus gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ ngúmnɔ́ɔn á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Siria.
en: (Andthis taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ lêen ńké ńně ḿbiŋe lesa’á pɔ́b, ńgÿo mé sáŋa yé.
en: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b fó tÿǒsoŋ Nǎzarɛd, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galilea, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, á tÿǒsoŋ Mbetélehem, á jʉ’ gie mé la zyé fùɔ Ndavíd wó, ńgee wó pú’u, mélà’mie aa nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judæa, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nzwě we Malîɛ gwɔ gʉa me sáŋa wɔ́b yé á gwɔ́ shwoŋ,
en: to be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó múɔ gwoon Malîɛ.
en: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

ngiemboon: Á zyé mûɔ letwó we, á gwɔ́ mûɔ mbàŋa, á lɔg shúm nzsǒ ḿbwóte yé, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ shúm léjÿó menɔ̀ɔn, mbà pɔ́ ně ńzága yɔ́b jʉ’e lela’á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá megʉ̀.
en: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó pàpyɛ́b mvfó shÿó jʉ’ó ne ńdá’a pǐ ḿbyɛ́bɛ mvfó yɔ́b,
en: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

ngiemboon: ńgwaa gyá,*cÿɔ́’ Ssé kẅɛɛ mvfò pɔ́b, shéshÿɔ́g Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwoon wɔ́b, ejʉ’ pú ńkyɛ́’ɛ, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ̌g.
en: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

ngiemboon: Tá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g, mèŋ n tóo pɔ́ lépÿé gẅi nò mbòŋo, á gwɔ́ gie á ge náa máa lekág tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅí.
en: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

ngiemboon: Mé la’á tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavíd lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, ńzyé Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pi tsẅɛ́. Aa Kristo gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé la ka’.
en: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ge tó lɔg zsé yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: Pi ge tó gyá mûɔ mbÿɛ, mbà mé lɔ̌g shúm nzsó ḿbwóte yé, ńnuŋe yé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ shúm léjÿó menɔ̀ɔn.
en: And thisshall bea sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn tà ńgwaa cʉ́me, anùɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋe fóo tÿǒ ńtó ńkẅi’i ná yé, pâ pɔ̌ zɔb, ńgu’te Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

ngiemboon: Legu’ gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé á tàa tÿǒ lepwó, asẅétè gwɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ ndùmo Ssé tsetsá’. E Ssé kwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: And on earth peace, good will toward men.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gwɔ́ tà ḿbiŋ nê tÿǒ lepwó, pàpyɛ́b mvfó gɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pege gʉa tà ńkúu Mbetélehem, tá ńgyá nò gie á kẅɛ̌ wó li, á nò gie á kẅɛ̌ tà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a túm ngie mé tó shwóŋó wégè lɔɔn.
en: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ, ńdêen ńdu Ssé ńgʉa lêtʉ tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá Malîɛ pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b, ńgyá mûɔ mbÿɛ́, á núŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ shúm léjÿó menɔ̀ɔn,
en: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńzye lépíte ngwòŋ menò ntsèm mie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé shwóŋó wɔ́b ńtíi yé.
en: And when they had seenit, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ně ńjú’u mɔɔn menò, á ncwò pàpyɛ́b mvfó, ḿmɔɔn tɛ’,
en: And all they that hearditwondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná Malîɛ, á pú ńde’e menò amɛ̌ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, ńně ńkwaŋa nò mǒ fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: But Mary kept all these things, and ponderedthemin her heart.

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́b mvfó gwaa piŋ nzèm, ńgiŋe ńzɔbɔ ńdɔgɔ ńgu’te Ssé, ésíe yé ńtí menò mie pɔ́ ně ńjú’, pɔ́ pǐŋ ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ně shwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.

ngiemboon: Mé la zyé múɔ, é cʉa lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn, mé pú’u yé, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé le Yěsô, é gwɔ́ lezíŋ sie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé la ná tá má we lá’ shwóŋó yé.
en: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ̌’ɛ lésɔgɔ*lɔ’ɔ́ mápfò ná Malîɛ la gwɔ́ tà ne ńku’u, pá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê la ne ńzɛ́te, Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ kaa múɔ ńdɔg ńgʉa lé Yerósalem lényɛɛ yé mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to presenthimto the Lord;

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ ngie: Nyìŋ zyé mûɔ letwó we, á gwɔ́ mûɔ mbàŋa, á náa yé mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a
en: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)

ngiemboon: Malîɛ pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b tó yɔ́b lénuŋe pwɔ́’ pá’*lepʉ̌ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé ná kapʉ̀ŋ sépʉ́a kà ngáb mánzsé yépʉ́a wɔ́
en: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ Yerósalem, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Simeon, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ, ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé ḿbiŋ ńjú’ ncwò wé. Mbà aa ńzɔ́gɔ ńzẅí’te nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ tó, pà Israel lɔgɔ yé ńtʉ, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gwɔ́ ntʉ́m yé.
en: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose namewasSimeon; and the same manwasjust and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.

ngiemboon: Mbà à la lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó yé ngie à těen ńdá’a ńkwé té gwɔ́ gie à zabá léjÿɔ́g ná*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à tǔm wɔ́.
en: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo, á gʉa*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, mbà Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ lɔgɔ́ mûɔ ńtó légÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ la ne ńzɛ́te.
en: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,

ngiemboon: Símeon kẅé yé ńgẅiin mbwo yé, ńně síe Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,

ngiemboon: ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ nyé ngàŋa fà’ gù á pʉ́lè ńkwé pá’ ɔ̀ la gɔɔn.
en: According to thy word:

ngiemboon: pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsẅɛ́.
en: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

ngiemboon: Aa letsẅɛ́ gẅie ɔ̀ la lá’ nyɛte ńzáb lényɛɛ mbwo ngwòŋo ngwòŋ.
en: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;

ngiemboon: mbwo Israel, á lá’ ɔ́.
en: And the glory of thy people Israel.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ jú’ menò mie Símo gɔ̌ɔn ná múɔ á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b.
en: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.

ngiemboon: Simeon cʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Ssé ńdêen ńké ńgɔɔn né Malîɛ ngie: Míŋ ɔ̀ wɔɔn aa pá’ɔɔn ńké ńgwɔ́ gẅie Ssé ge cʉa nzèm yé gÿo eshʉ́ kú pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn Israel wɔɔn, é piŋ gÿo mé ná mékù’ lelÿò pʉ̀a, mélà’mie aa nyìŋ gẅie Ssé lɔgɔ yé ńnyɛɛ mmó gie à ne ńgÿo, tá pʉ̀a mesoŋ ke ńgwága yé gwág.
en: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, thischildis set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, tá mekwaŋte mie ée melóŋ pʉ̀a kẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌. Á gʉa ná gù Malîɛ, mbà nò ge lá’ gÿo ɔ́ tà ɔ̀ jú’ à gwá’a fʉ̀’e mé lɔgɔ́ pù’ sɔbɔ tʉ́m ɔ́ la.
en: (yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ méndÿò manzwě la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yé Yerósalem fʉ̀’ó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Ánɔ́ɔn, á gwɔ́ míŋ Fanuel á nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá Asɛ̀ɛ. À lɔ̌ɔn ńjú’u nò mbwo Ssé é shwóŋó lá’. Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à la lêen ńzɔ́’ yé ńgÿo ndà’ ngù’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a andǔm we kwé.
en: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;

ngiemboon: A la cʉ́’ʉ mpfɔ̌g pú’u, ńké těen ńtsó*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́, ńnéŋe*ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé, ńtsẅé ńgu’te yé fʉ̀’e zsǒ pɔ́ lêtsẅɛ́’, ńdá’ ńgẅiin ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm lefɔ̌ɔn,
en: and shewasa widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but servedGodwith fastings and prayers night and day.

ngiemboon: ńtóo*jʉ’ʉ Ssé tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ pá’ à zɔ̀ɔn ńtóo, ńgwaa kúu wó fʉ̀’ó, mbà mé lɔgɔ́ múɔ ńtó, á gyá yé, ésíe Ssé, ńdêen ńké ńzye léshwóŋó nò wɔɔn múɔ mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ge lá’ cu’u Yerósalem.
en: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ gÿo shwóŋó nò gie pɔ́ tǒ mǒ tà ḿmag pá’*lepʉ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ne ńzɛ́te, ḿbiŋ zèm le Galilea, á tÿǒsoŋo pɔ́b Nǎzarɛd.
en: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Múɔ ne ńgú’u, azsé nò yé né ńkẅi’i tɛ’, á gíŋe ne ńzsé mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo, e Ssé piŋ ńgwɔ́ lê yé.
en: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ̂ ngù’ ntsèm, ńgee Yerósalem léjÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà.
en: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a pâ pɔ́ pú ńgʉa pá’ tsẅé lá’ yɔ́b la ne ńzɛ́te pú’u,
en: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

ngiemboon: ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn ta á mag, ńgwɔ piŋ nzèm, múɔ zsô Yerósalem pɔ́ té zsé.
en: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew notof it.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie aa tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ yɔ́b, tà ńgiŋe tà’a lyɛ̌’, ńdíe yé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀ ndá yɔb pâ pʉ̀a pɔ́b,
en: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him amongtheirkinsfolk and acquaintance.

ngiemboon: ńdá’ tè yé gyá, kékáŋ tà ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, ńgiŋe fa’a yé,
en: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ lẅíŋe lyɛ̌’ tá, pɔ́ gyá yé, á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ*pàkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé, ńné ńjú’u menò mie pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ně ńzɛ́te wɔ́b tsɔ́.
en: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la jú’u shwóŋè yé ně ḿbúu ńgɔ’te zsé nò yé mbɔɔ yé ntí letsɔ’ɔ́ nò.
en: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̌b pɔ́ Malîɛ gwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé ḿbú ḿmɔɔn tɛ’. Má we gɔɔn né yé ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gwǎ zsé ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo yɔɔn nò ná peg pá’ɔɔn á gwa’á la? Ɔ̀ kéen ńtsɔ́’ɔ léme yeg tá gù, peg zɔ́gɔ léfa’a ɔ́, ńně ḿbɔ́gɔ ngie kà tsɔ́ mmó zɔ̌ kéen ńgÿo ɔ́ wɔ́?
en: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi piŋe fa’a wɔ̀ɔn pú’u, mélà’a kɔ́? Pi te ně ńzsé ngie á póŋ mèŋ shwôŋ menò Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́ kà?
en: And he said unto them,How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?

ngiemboon: À la tsɔ́’ pú’u, pɔ́ ké te jú’u nò gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn pú’u, pâ pɔ̌ piŋ nzèm né Nǎzarɛd, á ně ńjú’u ncwò wɔ́b. Má we ké ńde’e mɔɔn menò ntsèm pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé.
en: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgú’u, azsé nò yé né ńkẅi’i, e Ssé gwɔ́ lé yé, pʉ̀a mesoŋ ně ńkwoŋo yé.
en: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔb à nu’u wɔ́b ntse, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsé mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: ńkwɔg melu’ú mie ée ná mánzsé ésaŋte
en: And the rough waysshall bemade smooth;

ngiemboon: Tá à cʉa pú’u, pʉ̀a metsèm gyá pá’ Ssé ge gÿo pege tsẅɛ́».
en: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gɔɔn pú’u, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńtóo pá’ à ge nu’u wɔ́b ntse. Á ně ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ngẅɛ̀ mennú, pà pá’ legyè! Awɔ̌ zɔ pǐŋ shwóŋó gẅi lékÿo ngɔ́’ gie pi lyɛbté tà é ně ńgee ńgwé ná pi?
en: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

ngiemboon: Pi kúbe pɔ́ mà, ńgÿo menò mbòŋo mie é nyɛɛ ngie pi kubé. Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔg pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò gẅi ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg ee púɔ Ábalam. Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí: E Ssé ku’u lésele metóon pɔɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam.
en: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham toourfather: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

ngiemboon: Mé ně ńzɔɔn ńdá’ ńkaa nzɔ́ɔn lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ yɛ̌ yɛ̌ tÿǒ wɔ́ gie á té ně ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́, éfoo Ssé kɔ́’ɔ yé ké ma’ pɔ́ mmɔ̌g.
en: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, peg gǎ?
en: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ńgẅiin menzsǒ mémbʉ́a, á náa tà’ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à zɔɔn tè tsɔ̌ gẅiin. Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌, náa ye nyìŋ gẅie nzyè ne ńgyáŋa yé.
en: He answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, tà peg ge gÿo yég lêkɔ́?
en: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?

ngiemboon: Pi kẅé ndà’ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, tà pi kẅi’i.
en: And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔg metʉ̀ kà cÿɔ̌ nò wɔ́ ésẅɛ́ɛ nyìŋ ńkẅé nkáb ye. Pi zẅí’te pɔ́ ndà’ nkába fà’ gi.
en: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuseanyfalsely; and be content with your wages.

ngiemboon: Pá’ á la gwaa gwɔ́ alá’ ne ńzẅí’te*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ la, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ně ńzɛ́te tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé ngie: Kà Jâŋ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yé wɔ́?
en: And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;

ngiemboon: Tá á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b metsèm ngie: Mèŋ n dêen ńgẅiin yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ lénu’u gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Tá tsɔ̌ ndÿò ne ńtóo; à cʉa wɔ̀ɔn tà mèŋ n tè ku’u lékyɛ́’ menkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́. À ge tó néŋ pʉ̀a mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, é néŋ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g.
en: John answered, saying untothemall, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

ngiemboon: À ge tó fÿɔ́g shúm sie mé pǔ’, é néŋ se mbòŋo nkìŋ, e cʉ́’ kʉ̀ŋe, à pÿɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g gẅie é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: whose fanisin his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ ne shwóŋó nò Ssé pú’u, ńgíŋe ńnáa mentÿɔgɔ́ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mbwo lá’.
en: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.

ngiemboon: Ńkag mbàa ngúmnɔ́ɔn*Herôd ńtí pá’ à la kaa*Herôdiad gẅie à laa nzwě métá we, ńgíŋ ńkaga yé ńtí tsɔ́ menò tepòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip's wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,

ngiemboon: *Herôd gwaa mege cÿɔb, ńtsẅi mé gwoon Jâŋ ḿma’a ndá tsǎŋ
en: added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ la ké ńgwɔ kú tsǎŋ, mbà á laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, á nu’ pʉ̀a ntse tà é mag, Yěsô lêen ńké ńtó yé, á nu’u yé yé ntse. Á gwɔ́ tà ne ńgu’te Ssé, ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé.
en: Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’, ńgwá’a kapʉŋ la, ńtyé ná ye, ngyè fóo tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋó gú tɛ’, ɔɔ wɔ̀ɔn lekág.
en: and the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gwɔ́ zye létsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo, á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ à gẅiin ngù’ móm tá, mé ne ńkwaŋa ngie aa míŋ Yesyɛ̂b. Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ míŋ Eli.
en: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which wasthe sonof Heli,

ngiemboon: Eli gwɔ́ míŋ Matad. Matad gwɔ́ míŋ Lěvi. Lěvi gwɔ́ míŋ Melshi. Melshi gwɔ́ míŋ Janay. Janay gwɔ́ míŋ Yesyɛ̂b.
en: which wasthe sonof Matthat, which wasthe sonof Levi, which wasthe sonof Melchi, which wasthe sonof Janna, which wasthe sonof Joseph,

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ míŋ Matatias. Matatias gwɔ́ míŋ Amos. Amos gwɔ́ míŋ Nawum. Nawum gwɔ́ míŋ Esli. Esli gwɔ́ míŋ Nagay.
en: which wasthe sonof Mattathias, which wasthe sonof Amos, which wasthe sonof Naum, which wasthe sonof Esli, which wasthe sonof Nagge,

ngiemboon: Nagay gwɔ́ míŋ Maad. Maad gwɔ́ míŋ Matatias. Matatias gwɔ́ míŋ Séméen. Séméen gwɔ́ míŋ Joseg. Joseg gwɔ́ míŋ Joda.
en: which wasthe sonof Maath, which wasthe sonof Mattathias, which wasthe sonof Semei, which wasthe sonof Joseph, which wasthe sonof Juda,

ngiemboon: Joda gwɔ́ míŋ Joanaŋ. Joanaŋ gwɔ́ míŋ Résa. Résa gwɔ́ míŋ Zorobabel. Zorobabel gwɔ́ míŋ Salatiɛl. Salatiɛl gwɔ́ míŋ Neri.
en: which wasthe sonof Joanna, which wasthe sonof Rhesa, which wasthe sonof Zorobabel, which wasthe sonof Salathiel, which wasthe sonof Neri,

ngiemboon: Neri gwɔ́ míŋ Melshi. Melshi gwɔ́ míŋ Adi. Adi gwɔ́ míŋ Kosam. Kosam gwɔ́ míŋ Elmandam. Elmandam gwɔ́ míŋ Er.
en: which wasthe sonof Melchi, which wasthe sonof Addi, which wasthe sonof Cosam, which wasthe sonof Elmodam, which wasthe sonof Er,

ngiemboon: Er gwɔ́ míŋ Yěsô. Yěsô gwɔ́ míŋ Eliezɛr. Eliezɛr gwɔ́ míŋ Jorim. Jorim gwɔ́ míŋ Matad. Matad wɔ̀ míŋ Lěvi.
en: which wasthe sonof Jose, which wasthe sonof Eliezer, which wasthe sonof Jorim, which wasthe sonof Matthat, which wasthe sonof Levi,

ngiemboon: Lěvi gwɔ́ míŋ Simeon. Simeon gwɔ́ míŋ Jẅida. Jẅida gwɔ́ míŋ Yesyɛ̂b. Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ míŋ Jonam. Jonam gwɔ́ míŋ Eliakím.
en: which wasthe sonof Simeon, which wasthe sonof Juda, which wasthe sonof Joseph, which wasthe sonof Jonan, which wasthe sonof Eliakim,

ngiemboon: Eliakím gwɔ́ míŋ Méléa. Méléa gwɔ́ míŋ Mena. Mena gwɔ́ míŋ Matata. Matata gwɔ́ míŋ Nataŋ. Nataŋ gwɔ́ míŋ Ndavíd,
en: which wasthe sonof Melea, which wasthe sonof Menan, which wasthe sonof Mattatha, which wasthe sonof Nathan, which wasthe sonof David,

ngiemboon: Ndavíd gwɔ́ míŋ Jesé. Jesé gwɔ́ míŋ Obed. Obed gwɔ́ míŋ Booz. Booz gwɔ́ míŋ Sala. Sala gwɔ́ míŋ Naason.
en: which wasthe sonof Jesse, which wasthe sonof Obed, which wasthe sonof Booz, which wasthe sonof Salmon, which wasthe sonof Naasson,

ngiemboon: Naason gwɔ́ míŋ Aminadab. Aminadab gwɔ́ míŋ Admin. Admin gwɔ́ míŋ Arni. Arni gwɔ́ míŋ Esrom. Esrom gwɔ́ míŋ Fares. Fares gwɔ́ míŋ Jẅida,
en: which wasthe sonof Aminadab, which wasthe sonof Aram, which wasthe sonof Esrom, which wasthe sonof Phares, which wasthe sonof Juda,

ngiemboon: Jẅida gwɔ́ míŋ Yakwɔ́b. Yakwɔ́b gwɔ́ míŋ Esâg. Esâg gwɔ́ míŋ Ábalam. Ábalam gwɔ́ míŋ Tara. Tara gwɔ́ míŋ Nashor.
