en: which wasthe sonof Jacob, which wasthe sonof Isaac, which wasthe sonof Abraham, which wasthe sonof Thara, which wasthe sonof Nachor,

ngiemboon: Nashor gwɔ́ míŋ Serug. Serug gwɔ́ míŋ Rago. Rago gwɔ́ míŋ Faleg. Faleg gwɔ́ míŋ Heber. Heber gwɔ́ míŋ Sala.
en: which wasthe sonof Saruch, which wasthe sonof Ragau, which wasthe sonof Phalec, which wasthe sonof Heber, which wasthe sonof Sala,

ngiemboon: Sala gwɔ́ míŋ Kaynam. Kaynam gwɔ́ míŋ Arfazad. Arfazad gwɔ́ míŋ Sem. Sem gwɔ́ míŋ Noá. Noá gwɔ́ míŋ Lameg.
en: which wasthe sonof Cainan, which wasthe sonof Arphaxad, which wasthe sonof Sem, which wasthe sonof Noe, which wasthe sonof Lamech,

ngiemboon: Lameg gwɔ́ míŋ Matusala. Matusala gwɔ́ míŋ Henɔg. Henɔg gwɔ́ míŋ Jarɛd. Jarɛd gwɔ́ míŋ Malélél. Malélél gwɔ́ míŋ Kaynam.
en: which wasthe sonof Mathusala, which wasthe sonof Enoch, which wasthe sonof Jared, which wasthe sonof Maleleel, which wasthe sonof Cainan,

ngiemboon: Kaynam gwɔ́ míŋ Enos. Enos gwɔ́ míŋ Sɛd. Sɛd gwɔ́ míŋ Adam. Adam gwɔ́ gẅie Ssé la pwóon ye.
en: which wasthe sonof Enos, which wasthe sonof Seth, which wasthe sonof Adam, which wasthe sonof God.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ la gwɔ́ tà ńnu’u Yěsô ntse, á fó nkʉ̀ŋ ntse Jurdeŋ ńgʉa. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó yé, ńgÿo á gʉa lê nkwòŋo tsẅɛ,
en: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,

ngiemboon: ńtsẅé wó lyɛ̌’ lá’ móm lekùa, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńtÿɔ́’te yé, Sátà yé ké né ńgwá ńtóo ńkwa’te yé kwa’te. Yěsô gÿo ńnéŋe wó, ńdá’ tè mmó pfɛ́ tà á cʉ́’ nzsotě, nzyè pú ńgyáŋa yé tɛ’.
en: being forty days tempted of the devil. And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.

ngiemboon: Sátà lêen ńtó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé lá, lêen ńké ńtsẅi né tóon wɛ̂ ngie à sele ńcʉ́’ʉ mmó léjÿó ɔ̀ jÿó.
en: And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Sátà ngie: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Nyìŋ tè lɔg pɔ́ ndà’ mmó gie à pfɛ̌ tá gwɔ́ wó wɔ́
en: And Jesus answered him, saying,It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.

ngiemboon: Sátà lêen ńké ńkwé’e yé ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ jʉ’ taa tÿǒ, ńtyé wó ńgÿo á pú ńgyá mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tà’ legʉ̀a,
en: And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mé léen ḿbú ńná mengwòŋ mɛ̂ lé mèŋ, mèŋ m biŋ ńku’u lé pú ńná né wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie n kwǒŋ. Mèŋ n ge zɔɔn ná lefùɔ né gù, gù zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin shúm mbòŋo sie ée tsòló ntsèm.
en: And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ ngie ɔ̀ kẅí’te mvfò mèŋ, ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn, e lêen ńcʉ́’ shú.
en: If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Nyìŋ gu’te pɔ́ ndà’ Tá wɔb Ssé yé gílé yé, ḿbiŋe ńjú’ pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò wé
en: And Jesus answered and said unto him,Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

ngiemboon: Sátà lêen ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa lé Yerósalem fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé nà ntsɔ̀’ gie ee*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé la, fó jʉ’ɔɔn, ńkyɛ́, ńtyé Ssé, mélà’mie
en: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:

ngiemboon: mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Ssé ge tsẅi mecÿɔ́’ pé tó ḿbyɛ́bte gú
en: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńŋwe’e ngie: Pɔ́ ge lɔg mbwo mɔ́b kaa gú tà ɔ́ le túu kwò ɔ́ ná tóon wɔ́
en: And intheirhands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Sátà ngie: Mé la gíŋ ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: MÀbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ létsíŋe Tá we Ssé tsiŋé ngie à gÿo mmó ná yé.
en: And Jesus answering said unto him,It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

ngiemboon: Sátà kwa’te Yěsô tà ḿmag mentí, ńgyá kékáŋ, ńnyé yé, ńgʉa, ńně ńzẅí’te fʉ̀’e ndyɛ̀’ɛ gie à ge gÿo gíŋe tóo ná yé.
en: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgwaa gíŋe piŋ né Galilea, à Zẅìge Ssé ně ńnáa yé métʉ̀, á lɔgɔ nyɛɛ mefà’ Ssé. Lezíŋ sé pú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́,
en: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à la ne ńda’te nò Ssé á*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, pʉ̀a metsèm ně ńgu’te yé.
en: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lá’ ńnéŋe tà ḿbiŋe Nǎzarɛd, á jʉ’ gie à la gú’u wó. Alyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé yɔ́b ku’. Á gʉa*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda pá’ aa ńzɔɔn ńgee. Afʉ̀’ ku’, á lu ssé létóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé.
en: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.

ngiemboon: Mé píi ŋwà’ne Esǎya*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, ńná né yé. Á nyɛ́’ɛ nà jʉ’ gie mé la ŋwe’e wó ngie:
en: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias. And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,

ngiemboon: ngie n gʉa, ńtág nzèm pʉ̀a pie mé ne sẅɛ́ɛ wɔ́b,
en: To set at liberty them that are bruised,

ngiemboon: yɔɔn ee ngù’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a pé
en: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tóŋo yɛ̌ jʉ’ tà á mag, ńkábte ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a ndá ŋwɛ́, ésẅɛ́’, ńnéŋé ssé lékyagte. Pʉ̀a pie é laa*ndá cú’tè pú ńtÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g ná yá, ńně ńzẅí’te.
en: And he closed the book, and he gaveitagain to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńké ńzye lékyagte, ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Menò mie pi foo lé jú’u tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé lɛ é pumté lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: And he began to say unto them,This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò yé, á gwɔ poŋo wɔ́b, ńgíŋe ne ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ zye lézẅɛ́te, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ te míŋ Yesyɛ̂b wɔ́ le?
en: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this Joseph's son?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi ge gÿo pɛ́’ɛ tà sag né mèŋ ngie: Angÿò meffo zoŋo twó mbùm yé, ńgie mmó gie mèŋ n ka gÿo Kapernawúm, n gíŋe ńgÿo jʉ̀’ɔɔn á lá’ peg, tá pi zẅíŋe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he said unto them,Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅi nénʉ́, mé ee ntě ńzẅíŋe nò*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And he said,Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, á laa fʉ̀’ ye*Elîɛ,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mepfɔ̌g pànzwě gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Israel tɛ’. Mbʉ̀ŋ lá’ ńnéŋe ngù’ tá nê mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́ té lú, tà máamáa gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a pà Israel ntsèm.
en: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;

ngiemboon: Tá, e Ssé ké ńdá’ te túmo*Elîɛ mbʉ̀a tsɔ́ wɔb wɔ́, ńtsẅi, á kẅɛ ńgʉa pɔ́ ndá mpfɔ̌g manzwě Serepta á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Sidoŋ.
en: but unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta,a cityof Sidon, unto a womanthat wasa widow.

ngiemboon: Á lá’ ńgwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ ye*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Elizé, megàŋ nkà’ pǎb gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Israel tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, Elizé la ké tè gÿo tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pɔ́b zéŋe wɔ́, tà ńdí ndà’ Naaman nyìŋ Siria
en: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, saving Naaman the Syrian.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é laa*ndá cú’tè jú’ pú’u, lóŋ wɔb ffó.
en: And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ńdu ssé metsèm, ńgwoon Yěsô ńdɔgɔ yé fó tÿǒsoŋ, ńkẅɛ tà ńkúu nà twó lekwɔ’ɔ́, á jʉ’ gie mé la kwɛɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b wó, ńně fa’a letsó yé ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ kòon.
en: And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tɔ́gɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgʉa.
en: But he passing through the midst of them went his way,

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo pú’u, ńcwóŋ ńgʉa né Kapernawúm, á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ nà pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.*Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzsé yɔ́b kú’, á ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: and came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.

ngiemboon: Mé pu ḿmɔɔn ye ntí lezi’í pʉ̀a mmó, mélà’mie e Ssé la ne ńnáa yé metʉ̀ tá á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn nò.
en: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé*ndá cú’tè ŋwɛ́, tsɔ̌*Ssé tepòŋ gwɔ́ ná yé, ńnéŋe tà ńtsóte yé, á lɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńně ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,

ngiemboon: Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd, pege gẅiin kɔ́? Ɔ̀ ka fɔ̌ɔn ńtó pɔ́ lépyága wég ka? Mèŋ n ne ńzsé ɔ́, ɔ̀ foo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ míŋ we.
en: saying, Letusalone; what have we to do with thee,thouJesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cÿɔ́g yɛ̌*ssé tepòŋ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Láŋte, éfó ná nyìŋ wɛ ńkẅɛ. E*ssé tepòŋ yá sáa nyìŋ wá, ḿma’a ssé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a, ńdêen ńké fó ná yé ńkẅɛ té gÿo mmó ná yé.
en: And Jesus rebuked him, saying,Hold thy peace, and come out of him.And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm lá gyá pú’u, ḿbú ńcÿɔ’, ńzye lésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Ashwóŋè ndÿò wɔɔn áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́ lɛ? Á tʉ tʉ tà ńtsẅii nò mbwo*messé tepòŋ pɔ́ fóo ná nyìŋ ńkẅɛɛ!
en: And they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a wordisthis! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ sé léen ḿbú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kẅɛɛ ndá cú’te, ńgee mbʉ̀a Símo, ńgwaa kúu wó, mbà tsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ nnɛ́ kà gwoon mákẅi’ Símo. Mé sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à kẅéte yé.
en: And he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon's house. And Simon's wife's mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.

ngiemboon: Á tó ńŋwé’e ngʉ̀ŋe kǔ, ńdɔg tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn nò, ennɛ́ jú’ ńzá’a. Mákẅi’ Símo ŋwɛ́ gwoon ńdu ssé, ńnyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye wɔ́b.
en: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.

ngiemboon: Nzèm la gwaa síŋ, pʉ̀a pie megàŋa gùɔ ntí ntí laa mendá pɔ́b lɔ́gɔ wɔ́b ńtó. Yěsô zába mbwó ná wɛ̌wɛ̌ ngùɔ wɔ́, á sẅéte.
en: Now when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ ne ńgwaa fóo nà lelÿò é kẅɛɛ, ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Míŋ Ssé. Tá’ Yěsô cÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b, à tè zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ gɔɔn nò wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la zsé ngie Yěsô aa*Nzà’nkÿo pù’ gẅie Ssé la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God. And he rebukingthemsuffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńně ńdɔgɔ ye nkwòŋo tsẅɛ ńgee, alá’ kẅɛ ńzye lémwoon jʉ’ fa’a yé, ńgyá yé, éfa’a lékú’te yé ngie tà á nyé wɔ́b, ńgʉa.
en: And when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: N gẅiin légíŋe ńgʉa nà metsɔ́ metÿǒsoŋ, ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie Ssé ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn ntẅǐ, légÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ zsé ngie yɔɔn aa fʉ̀’ gie Ssé zyě lényɛ lefùɔ sé,
en: And he said unto them,I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzye légiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo.
en: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe letʉ̀ŋ sie mé tóŋo le Jenezared. Anùɔ lá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tóo lejʉ́ŋ ye lé jú’u nò Ssé, ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn tà mé cʉ́’ʉ sẅɛ́ɛ ye sẅɛ̌.
en: And it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’ nÿɔ́g, ńgyá kanú’ sépʉ́a ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, mbà pàmà’ ssó ně fó tsoló ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ ntse sɔgɔ menkÿò mɔ́b.
en: and saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washingtheirnets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́, á gwɔ́ ye Símo, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à ná’a ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Á zẅíŋ, Yěsô sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńzye léla’te nò Ssé mbwo lá’.
en: And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon's, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńtsẅi né Símo ngie: Lɔgɔ kanú’, ńgíŋe ńgʉa tà ńkuu nà jʉ’ʉ ntse gie á me’e ssé, gu laa pʉ̀a pú lêen ńké ḿma’ menkÿò mí ntse lélɔg ńgwoon messó.
en: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon,Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

ngiemboon: Símo tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, peg lǎ’ pɔ́ légyá ngɔ́’, lémwoon ntse, ńké tè tsɔ́ lagá mmó gwoon. Tá’, pá’ kwà’ gù zɔ gɔ̌ɔn ngie mé gíŋe ḿma’ menkÿò ntse lɛ, mèŋ n ge ma’,
en: And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, pâ pʉ̀a pé gʉa ḿma’ menkÿò tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdɔg ńgwoon messó é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn tà pɔ́ ne shwóŋó, menkÿò mɔ́b zye lézá’te.
en: And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ḿma’te pwó ńdɔg ńtóŋ yetsɔ́ ngàŋa nkwò yɔ́b gie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ yetsɔ́ kanú’, ngie pɔ́ tó ńnéŋ mbwo, pɔ́ tó, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńnéŋ messó tsɛ̀ɛ mekanú’ mémbʉ́a, mekanú’ ŋwɛ́ lúe tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿme’e pɔ́ ntse.
en: And they beckoned untotheirpartners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gyá yɔɔn nò gyǎ, tà ńgʉa ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tsétsɔ’, fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńgʉa, mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tepòŋ mvfò Ssé.
en: When Simon Peter sawit, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

ngiemboon: À la gwaa gɔɔn pú’u, mbà cÿɔ’ pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́ba pʉ̀a pé, ńtí nzẅìŋ messó mie pɔ́ gwǒon.
en: For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ Jâŋ pɔ́ Jâg, é gubé Zebede, gie é laa ngàŋa yetsɔ́ kanú’ la gíŋe ḿbú ḿbɔ́g yɔ́b tɛ’. Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né Símo ngie: Tè pɔ́g pɔ̌g, tà fó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, ɔ̀ ge nyé légwoon messó é cʉ́’ʉ cú’te pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: and sowasalso James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon,Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdɔg mekanú’ ḿbiŋ lé ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, ńkúu wó, ḿbú ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô.
en: And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ. Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, mbà nkà’ léen ḿbú ńjÿó yé tɛ’. Á gyá Yěsô, ńdeen ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n zsě ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ku’u légÿo n zeŋe.
en: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell onhisface, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńtsege pwó, ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋé. Nkà’ gwoon ḿmaga ná yé.
en: And he put forthhishand, and touched him, saying,I will: be thou clean.And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔ’ɔ yé ngie: Pɔ́ɔn lékím tà shwóŋó nyìŋ, gʉa ńnyɛ pɔ́ mbùm ɔ̀ mbwó*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ ḿbiŋ ńnáa mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te mbwo nyìŋ gẅie nkà’ magá ná ye, pʉ̀a metsèm lêen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ zeŋé
en: And he charged him totell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tɔ’ɔ yé pú’u, mé ké ne ńkẅi’i ńkime yé kím, tà lá’ gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńtóo lé jú’u shwóŋè yé mbɔɔ légwɔ́ gie à ge zeŋe megùɔ mɔ́b.
en: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ńnéŋe tà ńdu ssé ńgee jʉ’ gie nyìŋ tè wó wɔ́, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńně ńda’te nò Ssé, pʉ̀a*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé tó ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé, éfóo ná melá’ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea pɔ́ Jẅideá tà mbɔɔ tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem. Metʉ̀ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gwɔ́ nà Yěsô, á lɔgɔ ńzeŋe megùɔ.
en: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judæa, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord waspresentto heal them.

ngiemboon: Mé ńnéŋe tà ńgyá mbàŋa lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ńtó, mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ páŋte ńkaa yé, éfa’ nzsé lékúu ndá ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò Yěsô.
en: And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they soughtmeansto bring him in, and to layhimbefore him.

ngiemboon: Alá’ sẅɛ́ɛ ncwò ndá sẅɛ́ tà pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́’ ńdɔgɔ yé ḿpfó nzsé gie e gee lê ntsɔ̀’ ndá, ńkúu wó, ńtsɔ́’te mmó gie mé la lɔg sẅe ndá, éfó jʉ’ó sẅé’e ngùɔ tsɛ̀ɛ páŋte we, ńnuŋe mvfò Yěsô.
en: And when they could not find by whatwaythey might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling withhiscouch into the midst before Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie pʉ̀a pɔɔn lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgɔɔn né ngùɔ ngie: Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwo ɔ̀.
en: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him,Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

ngiemboon: Pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pà*farisay jú’, ńzye lézẅɛ́te ngie: Wɔɔn aa wɔ̌ gẅie à zoonte Ssé? E Ssé gílé yé zɔ ku’u lélege menò tepòŋ nyìŋ.
en: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ zẅɛ́te mǒ, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gaa ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá ntʉ́m pi?
en: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them,What reason ye in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zéŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie mé legé menò tepòŋ mú kà pɔ́ lé gɔɔn ngie lu ssé ńgiŋ?
en: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge ké nyɛɛ gẅi ngie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà mé la ná metʉ̀ né*Míŋ Nyìŋ lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b. Ńdêen ńké ńgɔɔn né ngùɔ ngie: Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù ńdɔg ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a gù.
en: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins,(he said unto the sick of the palsy,)I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńdu ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńkaa páŋte, ńdêen ńké ńgwaa piŋ lê mbʉ̀a yé, ńgiŋe ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm la gyá á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ né ḿbɔ́gɔ, ńgíŋe ně ńgɔɔn ngie agù’te áa mbwo Ssé, peg gyǎ ndàa gyá lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńkẅɛ ńne ńgee, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé le Lěvi, á gwɔ́*nkẅè ncùb pà Roma, ńnéŋe jʉ’e mé kẅé ncùb pà*Roma wó. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tóo pɔgɔ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe.
en: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him,Follow me.

ngiemboon: Lěvi nyé shúm ntsèm, ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé, pɔ́ yé gʉa.
en: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Lěvi gÿo ńtóŋo máamáa línɔ́ɔn ndá yé ńtí Yěsô. Pàkẅé ncùb tó tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tà mbàa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pà Yuda lɔ́ɔn ḿbú ńtóŋo wɔ́b apɔ̌ le pʉ̀a tepòŋ. Pâ Yěsô pú ne ńteme ńjÿó shúm.
en: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pà*farisay lâ tsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gyá pú’u, ńne ńzẅɛ́te, ńzɛ́te megàŋa nkwò Yěsô ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi lâ pàkẅé ncùb lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ teme shúm ńjÿó?
en: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

ngiemboon: Yěsô saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́ ńgʉa fa’a ńgÿò meffo wɔ́. Nyìŋ guɔ tá fa’a yé.
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka tè tó pɔ́ létóŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwáŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a membòŋo ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwo Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ka tǒ ńtí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉ̀a.
en: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie:*Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ ńnéŋe*ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. Epég pʉ̀a gíŋe ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u. Tá’, epú ké tè pú’u gÿo. Pɔ́ zsé pɔ́ lépfɛ́ɛ mmó ḿbiŋ ńnú melù’.
en: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewisethe disciplesof the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé gʉa leluŋó nyìŋ, á nyé ńnéŋe ńnéŋe, pʉ̀a pie mé ně ńtóŋ ńnéŋe nzyè lêkɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

ngiemboon: Tá’, mé ge lá’ fó mbwo pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sa’a yé, pɔ́ lêen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉ̀’ó la.
en: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe sag ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le zá’a mmó nzsǒ nà nzsǒ sẅé ńdɔg ńtsɛ́ lepÿé nà nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ gÿo pú’u, á lɔg ńcʉŋte nzsǒ sẅé, ammó nzsǒ sẅé gie à ně ńzá’ ké le pumo nà nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́.
en: And he spake also a parable unto them;No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that wastakenout of the new agreeth not with the old.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgee ńde’e melù’, tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’*ngùb, mbà mé té néŋ melù’ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́’ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntú’ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà melù’ sẅé ge fu’, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntú’. Mé sɔ́ɔn melù’, ésɔ́ɔn ntú’.
en: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melù’ mesẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’ ye sẅé.
en: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le nú melù’ mie é ne ńtʉʉ tà é gwoon ncwò wé, á gíŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn lénú melù’ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́. À ge cʉ́’ tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mie é tʉté.
en: No man also having drunk oldwinestraightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́*lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé pà Yuda, Yěsô pâ ngàŋa nkwò yé ne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nká’a ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, ngàŋa nkwò yé gíŋe sẅé ngesáŋ ŋwɛ́, éshʉ’ʉ mbwó pɔ́b ḿpfɛ́ɛ.
en: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbingthemintheirhands.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi gÿo mmó gie mé la pʉ́ légÿo á lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé?
en: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi laa fó ńtóŋo jʉ’e ŋwà’ne Ssé gie á la’te mmó gie fùɔ Ndavíd la gÿo wɔ́ ka? Pá’ á laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, nzyè gyáŋa yé lâ pʉ̀a pé,
en: And Jesus answering them said,Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;

ngiemboon: á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, ḿbí mbelég gie mé nǎ mbwo Ssé, ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná ye ngàŋa nkwò yé, tá*lepʉ̌ gɔɔn ngie ndà’*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ zɔ̌ gẅiin lépfɛ́!
en: how he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó mǒ, ńdêen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo nà lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé pà Yuda.
en: And he said unto them,That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé pà Yuda, Yěsô kúu*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, ńně ńda’te nò Ssé. Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà pwó yé ye tʉ̀ léen ńkwé.
en: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ńnéŋe ssé ńně ńdʉŋe Yěsô ngie kà à ge gÿo nyìŋ zeŋe*lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la zɔɔn ne fa’a mmó gie pɔ́ ge fó mǒ lɔg sẅiŋe yé.
en: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô vɔg ńzsé nkwaŋá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né kwè pwó ngie: Lu ssé ńtó ńtyé mvfò lá’. Á lu ssé ńtó.
en: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand,Rise up, and stand forth in the midst.And he arose and stood forth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo pàkyàgte ŋwà’ne Ssé pâ pà*farisay ngie: N ge zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò. Áa pé’e*lepʉ̌ sége tsẅi ngie mé gÿo kɔ́ lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé yégè? Ngie mé gÿo nò mbòŋo kà nò tepòŋ? Ngie mé gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ kà pɔ́ ngie mé zẅé yé?
en: Then said Jesus unto them,I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroyit?

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńdíe wɔ́b wémɔ’ɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, tà à ku’, á gɔɔn né ngàŋ ngie: Siŋe pwó ɔ́! Á siŋ, mé gyá á tʉte.
en: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man,Stretch forth thy hand.And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gyá, á pú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pege ge gÿo lêkɔ́ lé Yěsô awɛ̌.
en: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgʉa ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé, tà ńdá’a wó lá’.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lʉ́a, á tóŋ*ngàŋa nkwò yé, ńgʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsɔ́’ pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sɔ́b lê ngàŋ ntúm wé.
en: And when it was day, he calledunto himhis disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn laa Símo gẅie Yěsô la tsẅi tsɔ́ lezíŋ sé le Piɛ, ńgÿo Ndeléya, á fɛ́ Símo ŋwɛ́, ńgÿo Jâg, ńgÿo Jâŋ, ńgÿo Filib, ńgÿo Patelemî
en: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Matio, ńgÿo Tomáse, ńgÿo Jâg míŋ Alfe, ńgÿo Símo gẅie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé le mûɔ ngwòŋ,
en: Matthew and Thomas, James thesonof Alphæus, and Simon called Zelotes,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Jẅide míŋ Jâg, ńgÿo Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la táa sẅiŋe Yěsô.
en: and Judasthe brotherof James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋ ntúm yé gie à tsɔ̌’, fó ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sẅɛ́’ tà ńkúu tsìŋe lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńgyá yetsɔ́*Ngàŋa kwò yé gwɔ́ jʉ’ó tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pâ nùɔ lá’, mbà mé fǒ nà pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, éfó tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem, éfó mengʉ̀ŋe metÿǒsoŋo Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ tà mbɔɔ metÿǒsoŋ mie ée nkʉ̀ŋ ntse.
en: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judæa and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b metsèm tóo pú’u, léju’u shwóŋè Yěsô, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge gÿo megùɔ mɔ́b zeŋe. Pʉ̀a pie*messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b é zeŋe yɔ́b.
en: and they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm la ne fa’a lézába pwó ná yé, mélà’mie metʉ̀ la ne fóo ná yé, ńzoŋo wɔ́b metsèm.
en: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healedthemall.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo, pi pie pi ee mepóŋ, mélà’mie*lefùɔ Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ sí.
en: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said,Blessedbe yepoor: for your's is the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo pi pie pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńdʉa, mélà’mie pi ge gÿo gẅe.
en: Blessedare yethat hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessedare yethat weep now: for ye shall laugh.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo, á na fʉ̀’ gie pi cʉmé nzèm*Míŋ Nyìŋ, mé piŋ ne ḿbʉa gẅí, ńne ńkʉ́e gẅí, ńne ńzoonte gẅí, ńne ńcʉŋte lezíŋ sí.
en: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate youfrom their company, and shall reproachyou, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ metá pɔ́b lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo yɔ́b ná*Pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your rewardisgreat in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pi ee kwà’ pàshÿó tepòŋ pi pie pi ee megàŋa mmó, mélà’mie pi lêen ńgẅiin léjÿó sî shúm mbòŋo pɔ́ ndà’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ pi pie pi ne ńgẅe fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mélà’mie pi ge lá’ cʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔg é piŋ ne lʉa.
en: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ epʉ̀a ne ńkíme gẅi pɔ́ mboŋó, mélà’mie á zɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ metá pɔ́b lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo ná*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌ nò.
en: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n gɔɔn mbwo pi pie pi ne ńjú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn ngie, pi kwoŋ megàŋ mbù pí, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ pʉa gẅí.
en: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo á nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn nò tepòŋ ná pi. Pi sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne shwóŋe tépoŋ nà lezíŋ sí.
en: bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ cúa pwó letwóŋó ɔ̀, ɔ̀ sele yetsɔ́ gwǒŋ, ńná á mege ńcúɔ. Nyìŋ gwoon gú ńkẅé nzsǒ fÿɔ́g jù, ɔ̀ mege sẅɛ nzsǒ jù, ńná né yé.
en: And unto him that smiteth thee on theonecheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid notto take thycoat also.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tó ńdúɔ mmó mbwo gù wɔ́, ɔ̀ ná. Nyìŋ tó ḿbíi mmó jú ńdɔg ńgʉa, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lékʉ́a.
en: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods askthemnot again.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie me gÿo ná pi lá, pi gÿo kwà’ yɛ̌ ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋ pɔ́ ndà’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwoŋo gẅí, mbà mé ge gíŋe ná ndǎg né pi nà kɔ́? Megàŋ mefʉ̀a zɔ́ɔn ńkwoŋ yɔ́b pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo nò mbòŋo pɔ́ ndà’ ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo nò mbòŋo ná pi, mbà mé ge gíŋ ná ndǎg mbwo pi nà kɔ́. Mbɔɔ megàŋ mefʉ̀a gíŋe ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ pi.
en: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn fu nkáb pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pi zsě ngie pɔ́ ge gÿo tsɔ́’, mbà mé ge gíŋe ná ndǎg mbwo pi nà kɔ́. Mbɔɔ megàŋ mefʉ̀a gíŋe fu nkáb pɔ́ mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ, ńne ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge táa gíŋe tsɔ́’ pɔ́ yɛ̌ náa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And if ye lendto themof whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á poŋ ngie pi gÿo gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: Pi kwoŋ megàŋ mbù pí, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná pɔ́b. Pi fu nkáb mbwo nyìŋ té sáŋ ngie ngàŋ ge gÿo tsɔ́’. Pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo pú’u, mbà Ssé ge lá’ náa gẅi máa ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’, pi gíŋe ńgwɔ́ púɔ Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńtí nue kwà’ yé ne ńgÿo nò mbòŋo ná pàjÿó ńjÿɔg ncwò, mbɔɔ ná megàŋ sóon.
en: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful andtothe evil.

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a pá’ Tá gẅi Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ńnéŋe ńtúu lɔ’ɔ́ pʉ̀a ḿbɔ́g Ssé létúu gí*lɔ̌’. Tà pi ńnéŋe ńkʉ́e pʉ̀a ḿbɔ́g Ssé lékʉ́e gẅí. Pi ńnéŋe ńdege mefʉ̀a pʉ̀a, e Ssé lege mefʉ̀a mí.
en: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:

ngiemboon: Pi ńnéŋe ńkẅéte pʉ̀a, e Ssé gÿo ńkẅéte gẅí. Mé ge gÿo néŋ shúm tsɛ̀ɛ pɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ tà à lúe mé tsɛte, ńdẅíŋe, tà memvòm pʉle ssé! Pi zsé ngie Ssé ge táa ńnéŋe pɔ́ɔn gí pɔ́ pá’ pi zɔɔn ńnéŋe ye petsɔ́ pʉ̀a!
en: give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe sag ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g kíbe pwó wetsɔ̌ pɔ́ yé giŋ? Ngǎŋ! Mbà pɔ́b mépʉ́a ge gʉa pú gwe tsɛ̀ɛ gem,
en: And he spake a parable unto them,Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ngie: Anzì’i fà’ tè tá fà’ we cʉa. Tá’, anzì’i fà’ gẅie à zi’í fà’ tà ńcʉ́me gÿo yé pá’ tá fà’ we lá.
en: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ngǎ ɔ̀ ne ńgyá múɔ méfùbe pǐŋ gie e gwě lejÿɔ́g fɛ́ gù, tá kúmo nuŋe lejÿɔ́g gù, ɔ̀ piŋ ńké tè gyá?
en: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ gǎ tá ńgɔɔn né fɛ́ gù ngie: Afɛ̌, cʉ́’ n kẅile fùbe pǐŋ yɛ gie ee lejÿɔ́g gù lɛ, ńgwaa gɔɔn éfó le ne ńgyá kúmo gẅie à nuŋe nà shú wɔ́ wɔ́? Ɔ̀ɔ ngàŋ melɔ̀ɔn, vɔg ńkẅile kúmo gẅie aa lejÿɔ́g gù, tà ne ńcwoŋo ńgyá jʉ’ tá ńku’u lékẅile fùbe pǐŋ tsɛ̀ɛ lejÿɔ́g fɛ́ gù.
en: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Atÿǒ mbòŋo té zém ntɔ̌ɔn tèpòŋ wɔ́. Atÿǒ tepòŋ piŋ ńké tè ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo zém.
en: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

ngiemboon: Mé zsé yɛ̌ tÿǒ wɔ́ pɔ́ nà mentɔ̌ɔn mé. Mé ée ntě ńkába shʉ́shÿó nà tÿǒ shʉ́shÿó nè wɔ́. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le káb lepfò nà tÿǒ léngɔɔn wɔ́.
en: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo, mbà à ge gẅiin ncwò mbòŋo, ńgẅiin ntʉ́m tepòŋ, mbà shwóŋè tepòŋ zɔ̌ ge kẅɛɛ ncwò yé, mélà’mie nyìŋ gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé.
en: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi ne ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lé Andè! Andè! MÀbiŋ ńké tè ne ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n tsẅǐ wɔ́?
en: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtó, ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo pá’ á né ńzɛ́te, mbà à ge sẅé nyìŋ gẅie n gee nyɛ̌ pi lɔɔn.
en: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

ngiemboon: Angàŋ gwá’a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wa gẅie à la cʉ́’ʉ lékwɛ́ ndá, ḿvɔg ńtúŋo jʉ’ tǔŋ tà ńkúu nà máa tóon tá ḿbwóon cÿó ndá, tá ńtÿɔ́g ndá mǒ. Mbʉ̀ŋ gÿo ńdú, ngʉ̀a ntse tó ńtéme nà cÿó ndá, tá ńké tè ku’u légÿo tà é ŋele wɔ́, mélà’mie mé la nyɛte ńkwɛ́ ndá mboŋó.
en: he is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.

ngiemboon: Tá, nyìŋ gẅie à ju’ú shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, ńgʉa, à tè gÿo pá’ n gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ gwá’a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à la léen ńkwɛ́ yé ndá kwɛ́ pɔ́ tè pwǒon cÿó. Mbʉ̀ŋ gÿo ńdú, ngʉ̀a ntse tó ńtéme nà ndá, é keme ḿbʉle ssé lê jû.
en: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbiŋ nzèm né Kapernawúm.
en: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ Tá ndá pà lÿɔ́’ ncù nkÿo we pà*Roma gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, ńgẅiin ménkʉ́ we, ḿbú ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’. Ménkʉ́ we ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́, mbà à gwě guɔ, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkwé kwě.
en: And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.

ngiemboon: Tá ndá ncù jú’ mé ne ńkíme Yěsô, á gú melÿò pà Yuda ngie pɔ́ gʉa sẅíŋte yé, à tó ńkẅé ménkʉ́ we mbwo legwé.
en: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńcwoŋo sẅíŋte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá ndá ncù gẅie à tumó wég, à ku’u nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ kẅéte yé.
en: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:

ngiemboon: À kwoŋo lá’a yégè kwoŋ tà mbà à la kwɛ́*ndá cú’tè né peg.
en: for he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńdu ssé pâ pɔ́ gʉa, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu mbʉ̀a tá ndá ncù, ḿbumte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie tá ndá ncù tǔm. Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, tá ndá ncù yě, tè gége mbùm jù ngie ɔ̀ ge gʉa ndá ye, ngie à tsẅilé nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ tɔ́g tà ńkúu ndá yé lɛ.
en: And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo tá kwà’ yé tè tsɔ́’ mekwò mé ńtó ńgyá gú wɔ́. Ngie tsétsɔ́’, leen ńtyé pɛ́’ɛ, ńtsẅi lê ncwò ménkʉ we zeŋe,
en: wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

ngiemboon: ńgie à gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yé nzèm nyìŋ, ńjú’u ncwò we, ńgíŋ ńgẅiin yé pàlÿɔ́’ ncù nzèm yé, pɔ́ ne ńjú’u yé, ńgie à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn né tsɔ̌ ngie gʉa, á gʉa, ńgie tóo, á tó, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né nkwɔ̀ɔn ye ngie gÿo pá’ɔɔn, á gÿo.
en: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doethit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò tá ndá ncù, ńgɔ’te yé, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ gie áa nzèm yé ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Israel, n kaa gyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ pá’ ye wɔ́.
en: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him,I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie tá ndá ncù pà*Roma tumó wɔ́b gÿo ḿbiŋ tà ńkúu ndá, ńgyá, mbà nguɔ zeŋé.
en: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô cʉ́me mánzsé, ńne ńgee né tÿǒsoŋ gie mé tóŋo le Nayin, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé lâ nùɔ lá’ pú ne ńgiŋe.
en: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu tÿǒsoŋ, ńgyá, mbà mé kǎ pfó tsɔ̌ mûɔ mbàŋa, ńdɔgɔ ńgee ńtúŋo. Mbà é kaa ndà’ múɔ mbwo má we, á gwɔ́ mpfɔ̌g. Alá’ pú ńgwɔ́ nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô gyá mpfɔ̌g ŋwɛ́, mezìŋe mé kúu yé, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tè gíŋe ńdʉa,
en: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her,Weep not.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ńtó ńkíbe nkùm mpfó, pʉ̀a pie é la kaa tyé, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mûɔ shùm, n tsẅǐ ngie ɔ̀ zyeen.
en: And he came and touched the bier: and they that barehimstood still. And he said,Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńgwóon ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńnéŋe ńnéŋe, ńzye léshwóŋe, Yěsô kíbe yé ńnáa mbwo má we.
en: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á laa ssé la gyá, ecÿɔ’ gwoon wɔ́b métsèm, pɔ́ gu’te Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Máamáa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé tǒ lá’ peg, e Ssé tǒ ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pé.
en: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg menò mie Yěsô gÿǒ ḿbú saa pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, tà mbɔɔ metsɔ́ melá’ shÿó jʉ’ó.
en: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judæa, and throughout all the region round about.

ngiemboon: *Megàŋa kwò Jâŋ Mbabtis jú’ yɔ́b mɔɔn menò ntsèm, ńtó, ḿbíte shwóŋó yé. Jâŋ tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b,
en: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.

ngiemboon: ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé ka ne ńzẅí’te kà mé gíŋe ńzẅí’te pɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́?
en: And John callingunto himtwo of his disciples sentthemto Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Jâŋ Mbabtis, tumó wég ngie peg tó ńzɛ́te ɔ́ ngie ɔɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé ka ne ńzẅí’te keen, kà mé gíŋe ńzẅí’te pɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́?
en: When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, Yěsô ne ńzoŋo meguɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńně siŋte*melɔ̌’ ntí ntí, ńně ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, ńně ńgÿo pafʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gyá jʉ’.
en: And in that same hour he cured many oftheirinfirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto manythat wereblind he gave sight.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ḿbíte shwóŋó Jâŋ á mmó gie pi gyǎ, mbɔɔ gie pí jǔ’ mé gɔɔn, éshwóŋó yé ngie mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ne ńgyá jʉ’ mboŋó, pàpwɔ́’te mekwò ne ńgiŋe mboŋó, megàŋ nkà’ ne ńzeŋe, pàmbǔ’ metuŋó ne ńjú’u jʉ’, mepfó ne ńzyeen, mefÿɔg ne ńjú’u Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo.
en: Then Jesus answering said unto them,Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à tè kʉ́a lezáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: And blessed ishe, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Jâŋ Mbabtis gʉa, Yěsô cʉ́’ ńgɔɔn nò ńtíi Jâŋ á mbwo lá’ gie áa jʉ’ó, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Á kaa fʉ̀’e Jâŋ pi gʉa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ ńgyá kɔ́? Á kekà’a gie fèfà ne ńnʉ’te lá? Ngǎŋ.
en: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John,What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee pɔ́ ńgyá kɔ́? Á nyìŋ gẅie à ma’ menzsǒ nkáb lá? Tá’ pàma’ yɛ̌ ntí menzsǒ, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin shúm meshúm ńnéŋe pɔ́ nɔ’.
en: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings' courts.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgyá pɔ́ kɔ́? Á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá? Oon tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, à kaa wɛ̌ tà ńcʉa mbɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé!
en: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Ssé la cʉ́’ʉ légɔɔn nò ná yé, ńtsẅi mé ŋwe’e ngie: «Jú’u, mèŋ n ge túmo mántúm wɔ̀ɔn, à vɔg ńtó, ńně ńnyɛte mánzsé ɔ̀ tá ɔ̀ tó».
en: This ishe, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó tà ńtɔ́gɔ Jâŋ Mbabtis wɔ́. Tá á ké yɔɔn, mbà nyìŋ gẅie à zyě fʉ̀’ɔɔn légyá nò*lefùɔ Ssé, à lɔɔn fó ńzɔɔn ńkɔ́g kɔ́g pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà aa shÿó mbòŋo ńcʉa Jâŋ lɔɔn.
en: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm la zẅí’te nò Jâŋ, tà mbɔɔ pàkẅé ncùb pà*Roma, ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé ne ńkwoŋo légÿo peg tsẅɛ́! Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgÿo Jâŋ nu’u wɔ́b ntse.
en: And all the people that heardhim, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pà*farisay, pâ pàkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé, mbà pɔ́ la gwá’a yɔ́b yɛ̌ nò gwǎ’, tá á gwɔ́ gie Ssé la nyɛte ńtíi wɔ́b, ńgwá’ pú’u, pɔ́ té zẅíŋ Jâŋ nu’u wɔ́b ntse wɔ́.
en: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ n ge lɔgɔ kɔ́ pí fʉ̀’ ná pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn? Pɔ́ ee pé’e sẅé pà wɔ̌?
en: And the Lord said,Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńgwá’a gubé gie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ndùmo gyɛ̌, ńně ńzɔbɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńtuu ńkẅé ngie: Peg ka pú’ leluŋó, pi tè zíŋ. Peg ka tú legwé, pi tè lʉa.
en: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̂ aa kwà’ pá’ mé la gÿo ná Jâŋ Mbabtis. À ka tǒ, à tè mmó pfɛ́, à tè melù’ nú, pi gɔɔn ngie aa pʉ̀a.
en: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ kéen ńtó yé fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńně ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋe ńnúu melù’, pi gɔɔn ngie mé líe yé tá ńgyá, nyìŋ wɛ̂ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mpfɛ̀ɛ mmó, ńgwɔ́ nnù melù’, ńgwɔ́ sǒ pàkẅé ncùb pà*Roma, mbɔɔ we petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!

ngiemboon: Tá pʉ̀a metsèm pie é zẅiŋé yɔɔn zsé nò lɔgɔ nyɛɛ ngie à gÿo menò mbòŋo Ssé.
en: But wisdom is justified of all her children.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ*farisay gÿo ńtóŋo Yěsô ngie à tó pɔ́ yé jÿó mmó. Yěsô tó tà ńkúu ndá, ńnéŋe ssé léjÿó mmó.
en: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, ńgwɔ́ káa tÿǒ manzwě, ńjú’ ngie Yěsô aa ndá nyìŋ*farisay, ńcwoŋte laméndɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ múɔ méndáŋ gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ tóon ńdɔg ńtó,
en: And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew thatJesussat at meat in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,

ngiemboon: ńkuu ndá, ńtyé nzèm Yěsô, á ngʉ̀ŋe mekwò mé, ńzye lélʉa, ńdʉa lʉa tà ntse nÿɔ́g mé kẅɛ ńcʉ́mte na mekwò Yěsô. Mé gwɔ gyá manzwě ŋwɛ́ ne ńdɔgɔ menòŋo twó mé ńtsí’i mekwò Yěsô, ńtɔ́ɔn ésiŋte ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ́ɔn yɛ̌ ńzɔ́’ɔ.
en: and stood at his feet behindhimweeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipethemwith the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointedthemwith the ointment.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ*farisay gẅie à ně ńtóŋo Yěsô gyá pú’u, ńkwáŋte ntʉ́m yé ngie, nyìŋ wɔɔn gwe’e ńgwɔ́ kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mbà à zsě lii manzwě gẅie à zába pwó ná ye lɛ, mbà à zsě ngie aa manzwě tepòŋ.
en: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him sawit, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of womanthis isthat toucheth him: for she is a sinner.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Símo, pɔgɔ gẅiin shwóŋè. Á gɔɔn ngie: Tsítsà, n ne ńjú’u.
en: And Jesus answering said unto him,Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee.And he saith, Master, say on.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ne ńkʉ́a njǔ mbwo pʉ̀a mépʉ́a, mvɔ́g mvfò gẅiin létsɔ́’ medenie nkÿo tʉ̀a, mbɔ́ɔntè gẅiin yé létsɔ́’ ndà’ móm ntʉ̀a.
en: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.

ngiemboon: À la kʉ́a, ńgyá pɔ́ té ku’u létoŋ wɔ́, á gɔɔn ngie à te lá’ gíŋe kʉ́a nkáb ŋwɛ wɔ́, ḿbú nyé mbwo pɔ́b. Ɔ̀ gyǎ jú ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b mépʉ́a à ge kwoŋo ngàŋ nkáb ŋwɛ́ tɛ’?
en: And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?

ngiemboon: Símo tsɔ́’ ngie: N kwǎŋ ngie à ge gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie ye njǔ la gyɔ́ɔn. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ shwóŋó nò.
en: Simon answered and said, I suppose thathe, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him,Thou hast rightly judged.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ sele nnɛ́, ńdíe manzwě wá, ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn né Símo ngie: Ɔ̀ ne ńgyá manzwě wɔɔn, mèŋ n ně ńdá’ ńkúu ndá wɔɔn, ɔ̀ kaa náa wɔ̀ɔn ntse lɔg sɔg mekwò wɔ́, tá manzwě wɔɔn lɔ̌g ntse nÿɔ́g mé sɔg mekwò mɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg menòŋo twó mé ńtsí’i.
en: And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon,Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wipedthemwith the hairs of her head.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kaa tsyɛ’te wɔ̀ɔn, ésiŋte wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Tá á gʉa ná yé, mbà tà fó pá’ à ně ńkúu ndá yɔɔn, à ne siŋte mekwò mɔ́ɔn té kʉ́a.
en: Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ně fó te lɔgɔ méjʉ’ʉ mèvɛ ńzɔ́’ɔ twó yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, tá à kě ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ mekwò mɔ́ɔn.
en: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, tá mèŋ shwóŋó ɔ́ ngie, manzwě wɔɔn nyɛɛ yɔɔn ntí nkwòŋo pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie mé pú ńdege menò tepòŋ mé mie é ke ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, ńnáa mbwó yé. Tá ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ ngie menò tepòŋ mé mie mé legé ké tè tsẅe ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’ wɔ́, mbà ye nkwòŋe ge gíŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ méjʉ’.
en: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven,the sameloveth little.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó manzwě wá ngie: E Ssé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwo gu.
en: And he said unto her,Thy sins are forgiven.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ laa ndá ńně ńjÿó shúm jú’, ńzye lézẅɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Wɔɔn nyìŋ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌ tà ńgɔɔn ngie Ssé legé menò tepòŋ nyìŋ?
en: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né manzwě ŋwɛ́ ngie: Ɔ̀ tsẅɛ̌ ndòon menò tepòŋ mú, mélà’mie ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ. Gʉa lê sẅétè.
en: And he said to the woman,Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mbàa tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo ńdɔgɔ ńda’te pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u. Pâ*ngàŋ ntúm yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém gwɔ́ nùɔ.
en: And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelvewerewith him,

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ ntá’ pànzwě gwɔ́ yɔ́b nùɔ, ńgwɔ́ pie à la zoŋ meguɔ ná pɔ́b, ńgÿo pie à la jwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é laa ná pɔ́b ńně ḿbue wɔ́b. Wɔɔn laa Malîɛ múɔ Magdala gẅie à la jwoŋ*messé tepòŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a ná ye,
en: and certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Jâne, nzwě Shuza gẅie à laa mentsindá fùɔ*Herôd, tà mbɔɔ Sesánɔɔn, ńgÿo petsɔ́ pànzwě. Pɔ́ metsèm gwɔ́ nzèm Yěsô ńdɔgɔ nkáb yɔb ńtóonte Yěsô lâ*ngàŋa kwò yé nà fa’a yɔ́b.
en: and Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgiŋe pú’u, anùɔ lá’ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńtó. Á gÿo ńdɔg*sagá nò ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgʉa mma’ mbyè mmó, ńtóo ma’á, tsɔ́ memvòm gwe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsé, mé lɔg mekwò ńneŋ, meshʉ́ŋ tó ńdagte ḿpfɛ́.
en: A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe nà jʉ’ ye metóon, ńtóo lésá’, ńzág ntse, ńgwóon ńjúm.
en: And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńdu ssé, legǐ tepòŋ fóme mɛ̌.
en: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe ná jʉ’ʉ tsetsá’a mbòŋo, ńgú’, ńgÿo ńzém, tà’ letsiŋé ná mvòm nkÿo. Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ngie, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold.And when he had said these things, he cried,He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: *Megàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńzɛ́te yé ngie à kyagte mmó gie yɔɔn*sagá nò ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn é shwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé la gÿo ngie pi pɛ zɔ zsé nò nénʉ́ nà lefùɔ sé sie ée lelyěen. Tá á gʉa ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́ jú’ yɔ́b pɔ́ ndà’ sag legʉa, ńké tè jú’u mmó gie mé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́. Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Pɔ́ ge ne líe jʉ’ pɔ́ le gyá, é ne jú’u, pɔ́ le jú’ tà ńjú’ wɔ́»
en: And he said,Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ʉ lékyagte yɔɔn sagá nò ńgɔɔn ngie: Mbyè mmó lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shwóŋè Ssé.
en: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsé gẅie tsɔ́ memvòm gwě wó, ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, tá Sátà tó fó ntʉ́m pɔ́b ńkẅile, ḿbɔ́gɔ légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge zẅíŋ, E Ssé gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

ngiemboon: Ajʉ’ ye metóon é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ésẅɛte ńzẅíŋ nê lekág tá á té lyɛ menŋaŋ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a lyɛ̌’ɛ lá’, ngɔ́’ gwɔ́ tà ńtó, pɔ́ gwóon ńgwá’.
en: They on the rockare they, which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie é gwě tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’, ńgÿo ńzye lémÿɔg menò nzsè nzsè, ńzye lékwaŋte nkáb pɔ́ leńnéŋe mbòŋo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ashwóŋè Ssé gwóon ḿbyé té gÿo tsɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pɔ́b.
en: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures ofthislife, and bring no fruit to perfection.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě nà tsetsá’a mbòŋo lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ńzẅíŋ lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te, ḿbiŋ ne ńkaga tʉ̀ lékú’te fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ḿbiŋe ne ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn.
en: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keepit, and bring forth fruit with patience.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lyɛɛ lâm ńdɔg ngwʉ̌ŋ ńkábte wɔ́, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le lyɛɛ lâm ńtÿɔ́gɔ kesse kǔ wɔ́. Mé lyɛɛ lâm ńtÿɔ́gɔ ndùm tápele, tà nyìŋ gwaa kúu ndá ńne ńgyá kyɛ̀’.
en: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or puttethitunder a bed; but settethiton a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie, ammó gie áa lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lelyěen, á ge lá’ kẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌, tsɔ́ nò té wó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lyeen tà mé le lá’ ńzsé tà shwóŋó mángyɛ̌ wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neitherany thinghid, that shall not be known and come abroad.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ shwóŋó gẅi ngie pi lag twó sí nà ntí gie pi lɔgɔ ńjú’u shwóŋè Ssé, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin mmó, mbà mé ge kẅi’i. Tá ńké ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à tè mmó gẅiin, mbà mé ge kẅé méjʉ’ gẅie à kwǎŋ ngie à gẅiin.
en: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńda’te shwóŋè Ssé mbwo lá’ pú’u, má we pâ mefɛ́ pé tóo légyá yé, ńké tè ku’u létó tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie aa wó wɔ́, ńtí lá’ légyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then came to himhismother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.

ngiemboon: Mé tó, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Má ɔ̀ pâ mefɛ́ pú ée pi ně fa’a légyá ɔ́.
en: And it was told himby certainwhich said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u nò Ssé, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: And he answered and said unto them,My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé fó lyɛ̌’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pege gʉa tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa.
en: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them,Let us go over unto the other side of the lake.And they launched forth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgee, Yěsô lyé. Mé gwaa gyá tsɔ̌ máamáa fóm tó, ńzye lépʉe ntse, é ně ńkwɔ́’ɔ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ tà á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ à lúe. Pɔ́ pɔ́gɔ légʉa ntse,
en: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filledwith water, and were in jeopardy.

ngiemboon: ńzyeen yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Andè, Andè, pege kwě tà ńdem. Yěsô zyeen, ńdu ssé, ńcÿɔ́gɔ́ fóm pɔ́ ntse. Afóm zá’a, ntse tyé, ejʉ’ láŋte lê kěm.
en: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Akɔ́ gÿǒ pi tè gíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́? Tá pɔ́ ne ńcÿɔ’ɔ cÿɔ’, ésele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Yɔɔn lìi nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ tà ńgɔɔn nò mbɔɔ fóm pɔ́ ntse jú’u ncwò wé?
en: And he said unto them,Where is your faith?And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.

ngiemboon: Pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu Garazania, é ngwòŋ gẅie mé fó nzǐŋ ye pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, é gwɔ́ nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tÿǒsoŋ kẅɛ ńzá’a yé, ńgwɔ́, mbà*messé tepòŋ léen ḿbue yé tà á cʉ́’ʉ ńgwá ńgiŋe pɔ́ tè jÿɔ̌g nzsǒ, ḿbiŋe ńdá’a pɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé túŋo mepfó wó, mbà à la lá’ ńgwá’ mbʉ̀a ye.
en: And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode inanyhouse, but in the tombs.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńgyá Yěsô, ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ńga’te ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Yěsô Míŋ Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ɔ̀ kẅé kɔ́ mbwo mèŋ? E sẅiŋté ɔ́, te ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’,
en: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus,thouSon of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Yěsô cÿɔ̌g yɛ̌*ssé tepòŋ ngie e fóo ná yé ńkẅɛ. E*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ laa pá’ɔɔn, mbà é zyě ńtó, ḿbége yé. E lɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńgwoon yé, á lu ssé ńkÿo, mé jwoŋo yé ńgwoon, ńdɔgɔ metsɛ̂n ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, ńnéŋe*kɔ̌’ mekwò ye. Á zá’te tsɛ̂n, ḿbwɔ́’ɔ*kɔ̌’, e ssé ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ yé ńkÿo pɔ́ ne nkwòŋo tsẅɛ.
en: (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lezíŋ shú ée le wɔ̌? Á gɔɔn ngie: Menùɔ. À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie*messé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ laa ná ye tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn.
en: And Jesus asked him, saying,What is thy name?And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie, tà á túmo wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé.
en: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, etsɔ́ nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńně ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm ndùm lekwɛ́.*Messé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à zẅíŋ, pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu nà mekúnɔ́ɔn. Á zẅíŋ.
en: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lêen ńké fó ná nyìŋ awɛ̌ ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ńkúu nà mekúnɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ fó nkʉnkʉ́ŋe ńtága, ńzẅɛ ḿbʉle tsɛ̀ɛ letʉ̀ŋ, ńnú ntse ńkwéte.
en: Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mekúnɔ́ɔn gyá pú’u, ńtága ńkÿo, ńgʉa ńdɔgɔ yɔɔn nò saa jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ melá’.
en: When they that fedthemsaw what was done, they fled, and went and tolditin the city and in the country.

ngiemboon: Alá’ jú’, ḿbú ńkẅɛ, ńtóo légyá yɔɔn nò, ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie Yěsô laa wó, ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie*messé tepòŋ ně ńkẅɛɛ ná yé lá ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, mbà à zeŋé, legye sé piŋ tà á ma’ nzsǒ. Pɔ́ gyá pú’u, ḿbú ńcÿɔ’.
en: Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é ne ńgyá nzyète nò píte pá’ á ně ńcʉa tá nyìŋ gẅie*messé tepòŋ ke ńgwɔ́ ná yé la, á zeŋe.
en: They also which sawittold them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ná wɛ̌ shÿó metsèm zye lécÿɔ’, ḿbɔ́g pɔ́g tà sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à fó nà wɔ́b shÿó ńgʉa. Yěsô lêen ńké ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ légʉa,
en: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear; and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.

ngiemboon: ńně ńgee, nyìŋ gẅie*messé tepòŋ ně ńkẅɛɛ ná yé lá, sẅíŋte yé ngie pɔ́ yé gʉa. Tá Yěsô lʉ’ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,

ngiemboon: Piŋ pɔ́ le mbʉ̀a gù, éshwóŋó lá’ máa nò mbòŋo gẅie Ssé gÿǒ ná gù. Nyìŋ wá lêen ńké ńgʉa, ńdɔgɔ nò gie Yěsô ně ńgÿo ná yé la ésaa lá’.
en: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee.And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ nzèm tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, alá’ gwɔ́ wó, mbà á ně ńdá’ ńzye lézẅí’te yé, pɔ́ gyá yé ḿbú ńkág tɛ’.
en: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the peoplegladlyreceived him: for they were all waiting for him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda tó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Yayelo, ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ḿbú’ mbwó mbwo yé ngie à tó tà ńkúu ndá yé,
en: And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus' feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńdu Ssé pɔ́ yé gʉa, alá’ zse nzèm ye, ńtÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋe soŋ tà jʉ’ cʉ́’ʉ sẅíbe sẅibé.
en: for he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé nùɔ, ńgẅiin guɔ máshuɔ, mbà á gegé yé gege ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńké tè zá’a, mbà pàgÿo meffò léen ńzoŋ yɔ́b kékáŋ tà ńkʉ́a, á pú sẅiŋ sé shúm ntsèm ntsèm pɔ́ mǒ, ńké te zeŋe.
en: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,

ngiemboon: Á ná’te, éfóo nzèm, ńtó ńkíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsó Yěsô. Aguɔ yé gwóon ḿmag.
en: came behindhim, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te ngie: Awɔ̌ kibé wɔ̀ɔn? Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ně ḿmoŋe moŋe. Piɛ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, mé ne sẅɛ́ɛ gú nzẅìŋ yɔɔn, ɔ̀ zɛ́te ngie mé gɔɔn ngie aa wɔ̌?
en: And Jesus said,Who touched me?When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and pressthee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

ngiemboon: Yěsô cwoŋo ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ kibé wɔ̀ɔn. N jǔ’ pá’ metʉ̀ mɔ́ɔn fa’a fà’.
en: And Jesus said,Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wa, gyá pá’ Yěsô vɔ̌g ńzsé, ńzye lévɛ, ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ḿbú ḿbíte mvfò lá’, éshwóŋó yé mmó gie á ně ńgÿo tá á kíbe yé, ńkíbe yé pú’u, ńzeŋe.
en: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie míŋ wɔɔn, ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ gÿǒ ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́, gʉa né mbʉ́lè,
en: And he said unto her,Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.

ngiemboon: ńně ńgɔɔn mbwo yé pú’u, nyìŋ fóo mbʉ̀a Yayelo ńgɔɔn né Yayelo ngie, tè gíŋ ńgege Ndè sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, míŋ ɔ̀ kwě.
en: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue'shouse, saying to him, Thy daughter is dead: trouble not the Master.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tʉ́a tuŋó ńjú’, ńgɔɔn né Yayelo ngie: Tè pɔ́g, záb pɔ́ ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ, míŋ ɔ̀ ge tsẅɛ́.
en: But when Jesus heardit, he answered him, saying,Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a Yayelo, ńtɔ’ ngie tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ kúu ndá tà ndí’ ndà’ Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâg, pɔ́ Jâŋ, ńgÿo tá múɔ pɔ́ má múɔ.
en: And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà á zyě lé lʉa legwé. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie, tà mé gíŋe ńdʉa, múɔ kaa kwé, à lye lyě.
en: And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said,Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.

ngiemboon: Mé jú’ ńgẅe yé gẅe, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé ngie à kwǎ’ ńkwé.
en: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ké ńgʉa gʉa tà ńkúu pɔ́ jʉ’ gie múɔ la nuŋe wó, ńkíbe pwo yé, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, zyeen.
en: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying,Maid, arise.

ngiemboon: Jʉ́jʉ́ŋ we gwóon ḿbiŋ, á pʉ́’ʉ nnɛ́, Yěsô tsẅi ngie mé náa mmó à jÿó.
en: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ pɔ́ má múɔ gyá, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b. Tá’ Yěsô tɔ’ ngie tà pɔ́ ke shwóŋó nyìŋ mmó gie á cʉ̌a.
en: And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńcú’te pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńná metʉ̀ mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ ku’u lélɔg lezíŋ sé ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ ntsèm mie é pue pʉ̀a, mbɔɔ légÿo meguɔ zeŋe.
en: Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.

ngiemboon: Ńdêen ńké ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa shwóŋ pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u, ńgíŋ ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe,
en: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi gwɔ gʉa ńgẅiin mmó. Tà nyìŋ tẅi’i tÿǒ, tà nyìŋ píi pɔ̀ɔn, tà nyìŋ tsẅága mmó léjÿó, tà nyìŋ pí nkáb, tà nyìŋ ma’ menzsǒ mémbʉ́a.
en: And he said unto them,Take nothing foryourjourney, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’, mé gɔɔn ngie pi lá’a tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́, pi ke ńtsẅé pɔ́ ndá ŋwɛ́ tà ńdá’ ńgʉa.
en: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.

ngiemboon: Nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ gie pi kǔ wó mé lʉ́’ʉ lékúe gẅí, pi fó wó, ńgwɔ gʉa ḿbú’u pfepfɔ́b mekwò pi lélɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie á cʉ́’ʉ ńdíe pɔ́ wɔ́b.
en: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńgʉa, ńkʉ́’ʉ melá’ melá’, ńgiŋe ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, ńgíŋe ně ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe.
en: And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn sá’a pàga ngwòŋ Galilea jú’ mé kíme nò nà mefà’ mie mé ne fa’a nà lezíŋ Yěsô, á gege yé tɛ’, ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, epʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô ŋwɛ́ aa Jâŋ gẅie à kéen ńzím.
en: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ngie aa*Elîɛ gẅie à giŋé ńkẅɛ, petsɔ́ gɔɔn yɔ́b ngie aa tsɔ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé we fʉ̀’e mvfò gẅie à giŋé ńkwɔ́’.
en: and of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.

ngiemboon: *Herôd ne ńgɔɔn yé ngie: Á gʉa ná Jâŋ, mbà mèŋ n zɔ la tsẅi mé zá’a twó yé. Wɔɔn nyìŋ piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌ gẅie mèŋ n ju’u mé gɔɔn menò ná yé pɔ́ nzẅìŋ wɔɔn? Ńdêen ńké ne fa’a légyá Yěsô tá ńzsé.
en: And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô piŋ nzèm, ḿbíte pá’ pɔ́ lɔ̌g fa’ pú’u, éshwóŋó yé. Yěsô jú’, ḿbiŋ faga wɔ́b, pâ pɔ̌ tsẅe nùɔ, ńgʉa lê shÿó tÿǒsoŋo Mbetsayida.
en: And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.

ngiemboon: Alá’ zsé, ńcʉ́me nzèm ye. Á meen ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋe shwóŋó wɔ́b nò nà*lefùɔ Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lézeŋe zeŋe.
en: And the people, when they knewit, followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.

ngiemboon: Nzèm gÿo ne síŋe, megàŋa kwò Yěsô ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pege ee jʉ’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, tsẅii alá’ gʉa mémbʉ̀a éfa’ shúm ḿpfɛ́, ńgíŋe fa’a jʉ’ ye lela’á.
en: And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi zɔ náa mmó pɔ́ pfɛ́. Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Peg gẅiin mbelég jʉ’ɔɔn ndà’ mbu’ú ntʉ̀a, ńgÿo mbàŋ ssó yépʉ́a, é ke ńku’u kɔ́ nà nzẅìŋ lá’ yɔɔn?
en: But he said unto them,Give ye them to eat.And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, nyìŋ mesoŋ gwɔ́ ssé tɛ’, tà mbàŋa ndà’ gwɔ́ mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a. Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé móm ntʉ̀a, móm ntʉ̀a.
en: For they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples,Make them sit down by fifties in a company.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pí mbelég yɛ̌ mbu’ú ntʉ̀a lê messó mɛ̌ mbàŋ pʉ́a, ḿbʉ’ʉ twó yé ńdíe tÿǒ, ésíe Ssé mǒ, ńne ḿbwɔ́’te ńnáa mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ gaba mbwo lá’.
en: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́, mé lágte pfwɔ’ á lúe metǔŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé fag nnɛ́, ńgʉa jʉ’ gie nyìŋ tè wó wɔ́, pá’ à ge sẅíŋte Ssé. Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Alá’ aa pá’ɔɔn ńně ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌?
en: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying,Whom say the people that I am?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pÿɛ ngie: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ngie ɔɔ Jâŋ Mbabtis, petsɔ́ ne ngie ɔɔ*Elîɛ, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie ɔɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe fʉ̀’e mvfò, gẅie à zǐm.
en: They answering said, John the Baptist; but somesay, Elias; and otherssay, that one of the old prophets is risen again.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ, n gee wɔ̌? Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à foo mbwo Ssé.
en: He said unto them,But whom say ye that I am?Peter answering said, The Christ of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, ngie tà pɔ́ gɔɔn tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ jú’,
en: And he straitly charged them, and commandedthemto tell no man that thing;

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’. Mekěme lá’ pâ*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ mbɔɔ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lʉ’ʉ yé, ńgÿo mé zẅé yé, tá’ à gwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá à zíme nà legwé.
en: saying,The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn nge gwɔ́ wɔɔn nyìŋ, á gwága twó mbùm yé, ńkaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ ńdɔg ńzẅíŋe lékwé, tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: And he said tothemall,If anymanwill come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge zɔɔn fa’a lépɔ́ɔn we légwɔ́, zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ge pyé we le gwɔ́ ŋwɛ́, tá nyìŋ gẅie à pyě we le gwɔ́ mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, mbà wɛ̌ nyìŋ ge lá’ gwɔ́ wó.
en: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿbú ńkaa njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm ńná né nyìŋ, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ gie e ge lɔg pɔ́ twó yé, mbà á ge kẅéte yé nà kɔ́?
en: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkú shʉ́ légwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ, mbɔɔ léshwóŋó nò yɔ́ɔn, mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ kú shʉ́ lélɔgɔ yé ńgÿo we nyìŋ á fʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ piŋ nzèm lê legú’ we gẅie aa we Ssé tà mbɔɔ mecÿɔ́’ pé.
en: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, andin hisFather's, and of the holy angels.

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńzsé ngie, tsɔ́ ntá’ ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ee jʉ’ɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn té gÿo kwé té gwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔ̌g nÿɔ́g ńgyá*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́.
en: But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn nò, é gÿo ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn, á faga Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâŋ pɔ́ Jâg, pâ pɔ̌ kwɔ́’ɔ nà tsɔ́ lekwɔ’ɔ́ pá’ à ge tsyɛ’te Ssé,
en: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, á ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé, aliŋé shÿó wé pú ńkúbe, menzsǒ mé pú fɔ́g tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raimentwaswhiteandglistering.

ngiemboon: Mé gyá pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kẅɛ, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe. Á gwɔ́ Mǒsê pɔ́*Elîɛ,
en: And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:

ngiemboon: Mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ shéshÿɔ́g Ssé ńtó, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋó nò nà nzsè Yerósalem, pá’ à ge tóo wó kwé.
en: who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Piɛ pâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pǔ ńdyé tɛ’, pɔ́ gwɔ vege, ńgyá shʉ́shÿɔ́g Yěsô ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’, Yěsô pâ pʉ̀a pá mépʉ́a tyé jʉ’ó.
en: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ la cʉ́’ʉ ne ńgee pɔ́ fegé, Piɛ shÿɔg shÿɔg tà ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, pege lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn, á gwɔ́ mbòŋ. Zẅíŋe peg kwɛ́ méntàb méntá, tà’ gwɔ́ gù, wetsɔ́ gwɔ́ we Mǒsê, wetsɔ́ gwɔ́ we*Elîɛ. Piɛ gɔɔn yé pú’u, à tě ńzsé mmó gie à gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, tsɔ́ melɔ́ɔn sẅɛ́’ ńkábte wɔ́b.*Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gyá pá’ melɔ́ɔn kabté wɔ́b, ḿbú ḿbɔ́g.
en: While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.

ngiemboon: Ngyè nyìŋ fóo tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mie n kǎŋ, pi jú’ ncwò wé.
en: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

ngiemboon: Ngyè ŋwɛ́ shwóŋe tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgyá Yěsô tyé jʉ’ó pɔ́ gílé yé.*Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô la gyá mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn, éfó jʉ’ó, pɔ́ té lwo shwóŋó nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they keptitclose, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé yétá gwaa fó lekwɔ’ɔ́ ŋwɛ́ cwóŋ, mbà lá’ kẅɛ̌ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńtó ńzá’a yé.
en: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ leen fó nùɔ lá’ sẅíŋte yé lê ngyè tetʉ́ ngie: Andè tsétsɔ́’, líe míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn ńgyá, aa mûɔ mbàŋa, ńgwɔ́ ndà’ yé mbwo mèŋ.
en: And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌*ssé tepòŋ ńnéŋe tà ńgwoon yé, á gá’te, ńgwe, ḿbʉ́’, ḿpfɛ́ ncwò wé, éfu’ metyé. E gwoon yé, ńdá’ ńgwɔ kyɛɛ yé nyé, ḿbú ḿbwɔ́’te yé tɛ’.
en: And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sẅiŋté*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ ngie pɔ́ jwoŋ ssé ayɛ̌, tá pɔ́ pú te mǒ ku’.
en: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ngie: Wɛ̌ɛ! Pʉ̀a ngù’ yɔɔn, pi tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ. Aa pá’ɔɔn pege lá’ ńnéŋe tà ńkú pɔ́ síŋe, mèŋ shÿɔgɔ nà menò mi? Lɔgɔ míŋ ɔ̀ ŋwɛ́ ńtó lé jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: And Jesus answering said,O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ ne ńdɔgɔ yé ńtóo, essé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gíŋe ńgwoon yé ńtéme ssé, á pʉ́’ lê tʉ̀. Yěsô leen ńcÿɔ́g*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́, á kyɛɛ múɔ ńnyé á sẅéte. Yěsô kíbe pwó yé, ńnáa yé né tá we.
en: And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tarehim. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.

ngiemboon: Alá’ ne ńgɔ’te menò mie Yěsô gÿǒ. Á gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie:
en: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’u nò gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn lɔɔn mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńkímte. Mé ne ńgee sẅǐŋ*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.

ngiemboon: Tá*ngàŋa kwò yé té cwoŋo ńjú’u yɔɔn nò mboŋó wɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ mmó jÿɔ̌’ legyè sɔ́b légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ té jú’ wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb ké tè shÿɔg tà ńzɛ́te yé ngie ɔ̀ fa’a légɔɔn ngie kɔ́ wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la cʉ́’ʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ̌g.
en: But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ ntsaŋ lêen ńké ńnéŋe tà sá’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, pɔ́ ne fa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò.
en: Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá gẅie ée ntʉ́m pɔ́b, ńtóŋo mûɔ mémúɔ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ lejʉ́ŋ yé,
en: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńkúe mûɔ mémúɔ wɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn. Nyìŋ piŋ ńkúe wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à tě ńkúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn ndà’ wɔ́, à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Pi zsé mboŋó ngie nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi à tè nyɛ nnɛ́ wɔ́ zɔɔ kwà’ ndÿò
