en: and said unto them,Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, peg ně ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ shú ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ ná pʉ̀a, peg fa’a létɔ’ɔ yé, mélà’mie à tè yé nzèm gù pá’ peg wɔ́.
en: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà pi tɔ’ɔ yé légÿo pú’u. Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa nò yégè tága aa wege nyìŋ.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Forbidhimnot: for he that is not against us is for us.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge kaa Yěsô lɔg piŋ ne tÿǒ lepwó gÿo ńku’, Yěsô gyá ngie á zebé pá’ à ge gʉa Yerósalem, ńdêen ńké ńdu ssé ńcʉ́me mánzsé té pɔ́g,
en: And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: ńgwaa gʉa, ḿvɔg ńtúm pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ lá’a Samalîɛ, ńdúɔ jʉ’ tá á tó.
en: and sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.

ngiemboon: Pàlá’ ŋwɛ́ jú’ ngie Yěsô cʉa ńgee ne Yerósalem, ńdʉ’ʉ lé náa jʉ’ mbwo ye.
en: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a, á Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ gÿo ńjú’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, tà ɔ̀ zẅǐŋ ngie peg zɛ́te mmɔ̌g, efó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́’, ńtó ḿbyág pʉ̀a apɛ̌?
en: And when his disciples James and John sawthis, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́ ńdíe wɔ́b, ńcÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b [ ngie pi kaa zsé nkwaŋá gẅie é tsóte gẅi wɔ́.
en: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said,Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie*Míŋ Nyìŋ kà te tó légÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ kúu pyé wɔ́, à la tó pɔ́ légÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́]. Pâ pɔ̌ cʉ́’ ńgʉa pɔ́ le tsɔ́ lá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ, ńdúɔ jʉ’.
en: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men's lives, but to savethem.And they went to another village.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ mánzsé ńne ńgee, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tó, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ ge gʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mèŋ n ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm gù.
en: And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certainmansaid unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Membândum gẅiin membÿé lélyeen wó, meshʉ́ŋ piŋ ńgẅiin menkʉ̀a mɔ́b, tá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ tè gẅiin jʉ’ gie ngwɔ́ á zẅɛte wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Foxes have holes, and birds of the airhavenests; but the Son of man hath not where to layhishead.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ ngie: Cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, pɔgɔ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe. Angàŋ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, cʉ́’ mèŋ n zɔɔn ńgʉa ńtúŋo tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he said unto another,Follow me.But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Nyé mepfó pɔ́ túŋ mepfó pɔ́b. Ɔ̀ gẅiin pɔ́ légʉa shwóŋ pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u.
en: Jesus said unto him,Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gíŋe ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, mèŋ n gee cʉ́me nzèm gù. Tá’, ké ńcʉ́’ n zɔɔn ńgʉa ńde’e pʉ̀a tsiŋe ndá yég tá ńtó.
en: And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzye léjʉ́’ ngwóŋ, tá ḿbiŋ ne ńdíe nzèm, mbà à tè nyìŋ gẅie à ku’u léfa’a nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô tsɔ́’ tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńtúmó wɔ́b mépʉ́a mepʉ́a ngie pɔ́ vɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ pâ mejʉ’ mie à ge gÿo pú cʉa wó.
en: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa gʉa, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Eshúm sie mé gee ńdaga tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, nzẅìŋ megàŋa fà’ piŋ ńkɔ́g. Á poŋ ngie pi sẅíŋte ngàŋ nká’ à kẅi’i megàŋa fà’ pie pɔ́ ge ne laga shúm sé.
en: Therefore said he unto them,The harvest trulyisgreat, but the labourersarefew: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.

ngiemboon: Pi lo, n túmo gẅi pɔ́ pà’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé túm púɔ mvfó tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn ngẅì.
en: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ gʉa ḿbí nkáb, tà pi píi pɔ̀ɔn, tà pi pí melɔ̌ɔn lélɔg ńkúbe metsɔ́. Pi lɔɔn ne ńgee, tà pi zɔ́gɔ mánzsé ńtyé ńtsyɛ’te pʉ̀a.
en: Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu ndá nyìŋ, pi vɔg ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ndá.
en: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peacebeto this house.

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à kwǒŋ mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ndá, mbà mbʉ́lè ge kúu ná yé. Tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà è ge piŋ kúu ná pi.
en: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.

ngiemboon: Pi vɔg tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́, pi ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá ayɛ̌, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńgʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’e ndyɛ̀’ɛ, mé náa kɔ́ wɔ́ pi pfɛ́, ńná melù’ pi nú, té kú shʉ́, mélà’mie nyìŋ fa’a fà’, mbà à ge jÿó pìi fà’.
en: And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, tà pʉ̀a kúe gẅí, pɔ́ ná pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi jÿó.
en: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

ngiemboon: Megàŋa guɔ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó pi gÿo pɔ́ zéŋe, ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: Afʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge zye lényɛ*lefùɔ sé tsoté tà ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ pi.
en: and heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pi lɔɔn ńké ńkúu nà tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, pʉ̀a jʉ’ó lʉ’ʉ lékúe gẅí, pi fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndùmo gyɛ̌, ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie:
en: But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,

ngiemboon: Peg pú’u pfepfɔ́b gí nà mekwò még ngie à piŋ nzèm ńkúu twó pi, tá pi ke ńzsé ngie afʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge nyɛ lefùɔ sé tsoté tà ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ pi.
en: Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

ngiemboon: Oon, mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa ye pʉ̀a Sodom.
en: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie: Ndoon twó pi pʉ̀a Kolazîŋ, mbɔɔ twó pi pʉ̀a Mbetsayida. Menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie mé la gÿo lá’ pi, é laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ, mbà pɔ́ léen ńdá’ ńkúbe mà, ḿmÿɔg, éshʉa mepɔ́ɔn ḿma’, ńzɔ́’ɔ pfó, ńdɔg ńdúŋ légwé.
en: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mboŋó ngie: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, egi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉa ye pʉ̀a Tir pâ pʉ̀a Sidoŋ,
en: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná pi pʉ̀a Kapernawúm, pi kwǎŋ ngie Ssé ge kwé’e gẅi tà pi kúu léfaŋ ka? E shwóŋó gẅi ngie ngǎŋ, à ge sẅí’i gẅi sẅí’i, pi gʉa tà ńkúu lá’ mepfó ssé.
en: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋe shwóŋè gí, mbà à zẅiŋe pɔ́ shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdʉ’ʉ gẅí, mbà à lʉ’ʉ pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn, ńdɔ́gɔ pú’u, ńdʉ’ʉ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn
en: He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a pie Yěsô la túm la, é gʉa, ńgwaa piŋ nzèm ńgiŋe ńkága tɛ’, ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tá weg, afà’ pǔ ńgiŋ tɛ’ tà peg lɔg lezíŋ shú, ńgɔɔn nò mbwo*messé tepòŋ, pɔ́ jú’ ncwò wég.
en: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi shwóŋó nò, mèŋ n ně ne ńdíe, ńgyá pá’ Sátà ye ŋwaŋ pá’ nně mbʉ̀ŋ la, éfó tÿǒ lepwó ńtsɔ́’ɔ ńgwe ssé.
en: And he said unto them,I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’, mèŋ n ka gwaa túmo gẅi pá’a, ńnáa gẅi métʉ̀ lélɔg neŋte membɔ́ɔn pâ pàmangɔ̂ɔn ssé, ńgíŋ ńnáa gẅi metʉ̀ lélɔg ńcʉa Sátà, ngàŋ mbù tà tsɔ́ mmó le gẅi gÿo.
en: Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pú’u, tà pi kág pɔ́ pá’*messé tepòŋ jǔ’ ncwò gẅí, pi kág pá’ Ssé ŋwe’é mézíŋ mí tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn yɔɔn nò, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo letʉ́m sé pú ńkág tɛ’, á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔ̀ sá’a tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ tsetsá’. Mèŋ sǐe gú pá’ ɔ̀ kéen ńnyɛ mɔɔn menò mbwo mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ, ńdÿoon mbwo megye pâ pʉ̀a pie é la zí’i. Oon mè Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ la gyá ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo yɔɔn nò pɔ́ pú’u.
en: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said,I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn léen ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ nà mbwo mɔ́ɔn. Ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ le zsé múɔ wɔ́, ńdà’ Tá we zɔ zsé yé. Nyìŋ ké le Tá zsé, ńdà’ Míŋ we zɔ zsé yé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie múɔ kwoŋó lényɛɛ Tá we mbwo yé.
en: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, andheto whom the Son will revealhim.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ sele nnɛ́, ńtsẅe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo tɛ’ pá’ pi ne ńgyá shúm sie pi ne ńgyá lɛ̀.
en: And he turned him untohisdisciples, and said privately,Blessedarethe eyes which see the things that ye see:

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, lélÿo*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mbàa mefùɔ lǎ tsɔ́ɔn légyá menò mie pi gyá lɛ̀ tɛ’, pɔ́ té gyá, ńtsɔ́ɔn lé jú’ menò mie pi ne ńjú’u lɛ̀, pɔ́ té jú’.
en: for I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seenthem; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heardthem.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê jú’u shwóŋè Yěsô tà ńdu ssé, ńdʉŋte yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo yɔ́ɔn lêkɔ́ tá ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì?
en: And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo jú ŋwà’ne Ssé ńjú’u pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: He said unto him,What is written in the law? how readest thou?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: N tǒŋ ńjú’ ngie: «Kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ɔ̀ nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m ɔ́ ntsèm, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ yé mvfò nà jú kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg metʉ̀ mú ntsèm éfa’a mbwo yé, ńzába kwàŋte ɔ́ ndà’ ná yé, ńgíŋe ńkwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm ɔ́ la».
en: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tsɔ̌’ mboŋó, gÿo pú’u, pi Ssé zɔ lá’a ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe.
en: And he said unto him,Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ zoŋo twó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ayɛ̀ tà ḿboŋ, tà fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ mesoŋ aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́?
en: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔg sagá nò ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ fó Yerósalem, ńně ńcwóŋo né Yériko, metsǒŋ gwoon yé mánzsé, ńkẅé shúm sé, ésẅɛ menzsǒ ná yé, ńcúa yé ḿbwɔ́’te tà á cʉ́’ʉ ńgee pɔ́ ńkwé pɔ́ gwá’ ńkÿo.
en: And Jesus answering said,A certainmanwent down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and woundedhim, and departed, leavinghimhalf dead.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nuŋe pwɔ́’ ye Yuda gÿo ne ńcʉa jʉ’ó, ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nuŋe ssé, á lí’te, ḿpfó nà yetsɔ́ gwoŋó nzsè, ńtɔ́g ńcʉa.
en: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwaa cʉa méjʉ’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, gẅie pɔ́ zɔ̌ fa’a ndá Ssé, á tó yé tà ńkúu jʉ’ó, ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nuŋe, á gíŋe ńgÿo yé pɔ́ pú’u, ńdí’te, ḿpfó nà yetsɔ́ gwoŋó nzsè, ńtɔ́g ńcʉa.
en: And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and lookedon him, and passed by on the other side.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Samalîɛ ne ńgee né legìŋ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ó, ńgyá yé, mezìŋe mé kúu yé.
en: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassionon him,

ngiemboon: Á tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńdɔg melù’ sɔg mefʉ̌ŋ mé, ńdɔg mèvɛ ńcÿɔ’, ńdɔg shúm nzsǒ ńkwɛ́, ńdêen ńké ńkaa yé ná nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à gwaa tó, ńnéŋe mǒ, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá gie megʉ̀ péen, ńdá’a wó, ńdá’a lá’ ńdíe yé.
en: and went tohim, and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, á gyá ngàŋ ndá, éfa’ nkáb pàg pʉ́a, ńnáa mbwo yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Kɔ nkáb yɛ̀, ńcʉ́’ ně ńdɔgɔ ńzoŋo nyìŋ wɔɔn. E lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńkɔ́g tà ɔ̀ kẅi’i pɔ́ láa wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ge cʉ́’ʉ lépiŋ nzèm, é tsɔ́’, ńnáa mbwo gù.
en: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gavethemto the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdêen ńké ńzɛ́te nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé wa ngie: Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pɔɔn métá, awɔ̌ aa mǒ, ńgwɔ́ pá’ fɛ́ nyìŋ gẅie metsǒŋ la gwoon yé lɔɔn?
en: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?

ngiemboon: A gɔɔn ngie: N kwǎŋ ngie aa nyìŋ gẅie à la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé, ńzoŋo yé. Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lò, kwà’ gù jú ńnéŋe ńgÿo jú pú’u.
en: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him,Go, and do thou likewise.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńcʉ́me mánzsé ńně ńgee, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ lá’. Atsɔ̌ manzwě gẅie mé tóŋo yé le Mágtà kúe yé ndá yé.
en: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

ngiemboon: Mágtà la gẅiin fɛ́ we we manzwě, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Malîɛ. Yěsô tó tà ńnéŋe ssé, Malîɛ tó ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńně ńjú’u shwóŋè yé.
en: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus' feet, and heard his word.

ngiemboon: Mágtà ně ńgége mbùm ye lécwoŋte shúm léjÿó, ńnéŋe tà ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, tà ɔ̀ gyǎ jú ngie áa mbòŋ pá’ Malîɛ ně ńgʉa ńnéŋe jʉ’ɛ, ḿbú ńnyé fà’ né mèŋ gílé mèŋ? Tsẅi ngie à tó ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn la.
en: But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mágtà, Mágtà, ɔ̀ pǔ’ mbùm ɔ̀, ńgwá ńgyá ngɔ́’ nà shúm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto her,Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà’a mmó gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, Malîɛ kaŋá yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfó mbwo yé ńkẅé.
en: but one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ jʉ’ ne sẅíŋte Ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò we tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá weg, Jâŋ la zí’i*ngàŋa kwò yé lésẅíŋte Ssé, zí’i wég yég lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgÿo*lefùɔ shú tó
en: And he said unto them,When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńnáa yég mmó léjÿó gie á ge ku’u ná peg á nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn
en: Give us day by day our daily bread.

ngiemboon: Tè zẅíŋ ngie peg kúu tsɛ̀ɛ nkwà’te.
en: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege lɔgɔ yɔɔn ḿbí fʉ̀’: Ɔ̀ gẅiin shǔ ɔ̀, ńgʉa mbʉ̀a ye tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ashǔ, tsétsɔ’ leen ńnáa wɔ̀ɔn mbelég ntá’ tá.
en: And he said unto them,Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn, mbà tsɔ̌ shǔ wɔ̀ɔn fǒ legìŋ, ńtó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn ndá pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, m biŋ tè gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie ngwɔ́ n dɔg ńdye yé wɔ́.
en: for a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ nò shǔ ɔ̀ fóo ndá ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Tè gíŋe ḿbége wɔ̀ɔn, n ně ńdá’ ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò ndá, peg lâ pènkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn ně ńdá’ ńnuŋe kǔ. Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de gíŋ ngie n ge lu ssé ná mbelég né gù wɔ́.
en: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie, pi zsé mboŋó ngie, ashǔ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdu ssé ńná mbelég né gù, mbà à tě ńdu ssé ńnáa ńtí pɔ́ ndà’ pá’ ɔɔ shǔ we wɔ́. Mbà à cʉ’ʉ́ ńnáa ńtí pɔ́, mélà’mie ɔ̀ neŋé twó ḿbége yé pɔ́ tè kʉ́a.
en: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Pi lúɔ, e Ssé ge náa mbwo pi. Pi fa’, e Ssé ge gÿo pi gyá. Pi kwá’te ncwò ndá à ge tsɔ́’ ná né pi.
en: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lúɔ mmó, mbà mé ge náa mbwó yé, éfa’, mbà à ge gyá, ḿbiŋ ńkwá’te ncwò ndá, mbà mé ge tsɔ́’ ná né yé.
en: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ̂ ńgwɔ́ metá pènkʉ́, míŋ wɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔɔn ńdúɔ mbàb ssó, mbà à ge gwoon nnú náa mbwó yé?
en: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or ifhe aska fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?

ngiemboon: Míŋ wɔ̌ piŋ ńdúɔ lepùm ngáb, mbà à ge gwoon ngɔ́ɔn ssé, é ńnéŋe mbwó yé?
en: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi fʉ’ nò tɛ’ zsě léná shúm mbòŋo mbwo gubé gí. Tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ ná Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó? À ge náa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lǔɔ?
en: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shallyourheavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, Yěsô jwoŋ*ssé tepòŋ gie e léen ńkúu ná tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo tántsá’ mbǔ’. E*ssé tepòŋ gwɔ́ tà fó ná ngàŋ ńkẅɛ, tà á zye légɔɔn nò, alá’ pú ńgyá ḿmɔɔn tɛ’.
en: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.

ngiemboon: Tá’ etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne shwóŋte ńgɔɔn ngie: Bɛlzebùl, á tá ndá*messé tepòŋ zɔ gÿo tá Yěsô ku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ.
en: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńtsóte Yěsô tsotě, ńne fa’a liŋé gie á la’te ngie Ssé zɔ tumó yé.
en: And others, temptinghim, sought of him a sign from heaven.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Epʉ̀a tà’a lá’ lɔɔn sele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ lá’ ge pyé. Mendá keme ḿbʉle nà metsɔ́.
en: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them,Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a housedividedagainst an house falleth.

ngiemboon: Lefùɔ se Sátà gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kwà’ pú’u. Epʉ̀a pé lɔ́ɔn fagte, ńzye lésele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà lefùɔ sé ge pyé. Pi gɔ̌ɔn ngie n dɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Bɛlzebùl tá ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ.
en: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.

ngiemboon: Tà pá’ pí pʉ̀a gíŋe ńjwoŋo yɔ́b*messé tepòŋ li, pɔ́ piŋe ńdɔgɔ yɔ́b metʉ̀ nzɔ̌ tá ńjwoŋo? Kwà’ pʉ̀a pí ŋwɛ́ nyɛɛ gẅi ngie pi gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ éfʉa fʉa.
en: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons castthemout? therefore shall they be your judges.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé ńjwoŋo, yɔɔn lɔgɔ nyɛɛ gẅi ngie Ssé ně ńdá’ ńtó tà ńgwɔ́ fùɔ á tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó.
en: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.

ngiemboon: Pi zsě gí ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin shúm ncù, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ḿbyɛ́b mbʉ̀a ye, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ammó yé le pyé.
en: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ ńtʉ ńcʉa yé gÿo ńtó, mbà tsɔ̌ légÿo tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó fʉ̀’ó wɔ́. Mbà wɛ̌ ngàŋ ge tó gwoon yé, é kẅé shúm ncù sé sie á ke ńdɔgɔ ńtʉʉ. E pú tú’ shúm sé, pâ pé pʉ̀a gabte.
en: but when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdʉ’ pá’ peg yé ge gwɔ́ lê nò, mbà à lɔgɔ ńcʉŋe nò yɔ́ɔn. Nyìŋ piŋ ńdʉ’ʉ lékẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, peg yé cú’te pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, mbà à cʉ’ʉ́ ńtága wɔ́b saa sa.
en: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

ngiemboon: E*ssé tepòŋ ńnéŋe ná nyìŋ tà ńgÿo ńkẅɛ, ńgwá ńgwó nà jʉ’ sie é júbe jubé, éfa’a jʉ’ gie à ge pʉ́le ńnéŋe wó, ḿbiŋ ńké tè gyá, ńdêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Á poŋ ngie m biŋ nzèm á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yɔ̀ɔn mie n ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.

ngiemboon: A lɔɔn ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá, mbà mé kéen ńjÿɔg ndá ńtáŋte,
en: And when he cometh, he findethitswept and garnished.

ngiemboon: mbà à ge gʉa gú tsɔ́*messé tepòŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, e gwɔ́ pie é pú ńgyɔ́ɔn sóon tà ńcʉa yé, pâ pɔ̌ piŋ nzèm ńkúu ná nyìŋ wá, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ndá yɔb. Ngɔ́’ ngàŋ pú ńgyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa pà’ e ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́.
en: Then goeth he, and takethto himseven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the laststateof that man is worse than the first.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la ne ńgɔɔn pú’u, atsɔ̌ manzwě, fóo nùɔ lá’ ńkwé’e ngyè ye, ńnáa tÿǒ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Manzwě gẅie à la ńnéŋe ssé ńzyé ɔ́, ńnóŋe gú, aa shÿó mbòŋo.
en: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessedisthe womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ kɔ’ɔ́ gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But he said,Yea rather, blessedarethey that hear the word of God, and keep it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne shwóŋó pú’u, alá’ ne ńkẅi’i ńkwɔ́’ɔ kwɔ̌’, á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn é pú tepòŋ. Pɔ́ ně ńzɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn ngie n nyɛɛ liŋé, tá mé téen ńgee nyɛɛ wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, tà ńdí’ ndà’ nò gie á la gÿo Jonase.
en: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say,This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.

ngiemboon: Pi zsě pá’ Ssé la lɔgɔ Jonase ńnyɛɛ liŋé mbwo pʉ̀a Ninive, Ssé ge gíŋe gÿo ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, é lɔgɔ*Míŋ Nyìŋ nyɛɛ nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn á mvfò pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.

ngiemboon: Mé té lyɛɛ lâm pá’a légʉa ńtÿɔ́gɔ jʉ’ʉ lelyěen wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tè lyɛ tà á ku’ mé kaa loŋgá ńdɔg ńkábte wɔ́. Mé lyɛɛ lâm, ńkaa ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ ná tápele, á jʉ’ gie á ŋá’te lê tÿǒ, légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a é ge gwɔ kúu ndá, é gyá à ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’.
en: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, puttethitin a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mú ée mbwo gù ńgwɔ́ pá’ lâm gẅie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgyá jʉ’, menÿɔ́g mú lɔɔn tè síŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá jʉ’ mboŋó. Tá menÿɔ́g mú piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà síŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm.
en: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but whenthine eyeis evil, thy body alsoisfull of darkness.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ laga twó ɔ́, ḿbɔ́ɔn nÿɔ́g mú lélɔgɔ gú ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm.
en: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò ɔ́ ńdiŋe, ḿbiŋe ne ńkÿo menò mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ menò nzěm mboŋó, mbà ɔ̀ ge giŋe nà nò nénʉ́ kwà’ pá’ nyìŋ gẅiin lâm ńdɔgɔ ńgyá mánzsé mboŋó la.
en: If thy whole body thereforebefull of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ nà nùɔ pà*farisay tóŋo yé mbʉ̀a ye, pá’ pɔ́ yé ge jÿó mmó. Pɔ́ yé gwɔ́ tà ne ńjÿó mmó,
en: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

ngiemboon: nyìŋ*farisay gyá pá’ à kaa sɔg mbwó mé pá’*lepʉ̌ lá’ sɔ́b ée ssé ńne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ yé tɛ’.
en: And when the Pharisee sawit, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Pi pà*farisay, pi nyé tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’, pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ, ésɔg gí pɔ́ mbùm. Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pi tè sɔg sóon gie ee ntʉ́m pi wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe ńkwaŋ pɔ́ légwoon shúm pʉ̀a ńkẅé ńjÿó.
en: And the Lord said unto him,Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.

ngiemboon: Pi ee megʉ̀gʉ̀! Né ngie Ssé gẅie à la nyɛte nzème pǐ zɔ la gíŋ ńnyɛte tsɛ̀ɛ wó lá?
en: Yefools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á ke ḿboŋ ngie pi gÿo gwɔ́ pɔ́ lépí shúm mbòŋo sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mekáŋ mí, ńnáa mbwo pàtèmmó, pɔ́ jÿó yɔ́b. Pi ge gÿo pú’u, tá ntʉ́m gẅi lêen ńké ńdʉ́a mvfò Ssé.
en: But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay, ndòon ee twó pi! Pi gabte shúm nná’ sí tà mbɔɔ nzàb gi nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwo Ssé. Tá’, ńké ńdege légÿo nò mbòŋo mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgíŋe ńdege lékwoŋ Ssé. Pú’u, tá yɛ̌ zɔ̌ gwɔ́ mmó gie á ke ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gÿo. Pi gÿo pú’u, tá ńké le wetsɔ́ gígyé shúm lege
en: But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó pi pà*farisay! Pi kúu*ndá cú’tè, ńkaŋa gí jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò, ńkwoŋ ngie mé tó ńtsyɛ’te gẅi ndùmo gyɛ̌.
en: Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó pi, pi leen ńgwá’a lesyé té liŋé sie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgiŋe mǒ, mbà à ge zyɛ́’ nzsè té zsé, é kaa*lɔ̌’.
en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk overthemare not awareof them.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê jú’ tà ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, tà ɔ̀ zsě ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńdɔgɔ ńnéŋe shʉ́ twó peg yég?
en: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉŋe ngie: Tà mbɔɔ pi gí pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pi tè mboŋó wɔ́. Ndòon ee twó pi, á nue pi kaa pì’, ńzába twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ á ne ńcʉa wɔ́b, pi fó tè lɔgɔ méntsě tepwó ńdɔg ńtsẅí’te, ńkẅéte wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And he said,Woe unto you also,yelawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ndòon ee twó pi. Metá pi léen ńzẅéte*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, pi cʉ́’ nzèm ḿbwóon mesyè mɔ́b, pi ee ńzɔ́gɔ ńkẅiŋe, ḿbiŋe ntě ńkímte nò gie pɔ́ la gɔɔn wɔ́,
en: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pú’u, ńdɔgɔ nyɛɛ ngie ammó gie metá pi la gÿo, á laa mbòŋ. Mé zẅéte*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, pi cʉ́’ nzèm ḿbwóon mesyè mɔ́b, ńzɔ́gɔ ńkẅiŋe.
en: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

ngiemboon: Mbà Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńdɔg legyè sé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n ge túm pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ pɔ́ɔn tà mbɔɔ megàŋ ntúm pɔ́ɔn á mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ tó ńgwoon petsɔ́ ńzẅéte, ńnyɛ petsɔ́ ngɔ́’».
en: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, andsomeof them they shall slay and persecute:

ngiemboon: Tà fó pá’ Ssé la nyɛte njÿó yɔɔn, pɔ́ zẅě*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé tà é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, metse mɔ́b métsèm ge ké pfɛte pɔ́ twó pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿo fʉ’ɔɔn.
en: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie Ssé ge lá’ zɛ́te metse mɔ́b mbwo pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ ngÿo fʉ’ɔɔn zɔɔn ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’. Tà fó ná me Abe gẅie mé la vɔgɔ ná yé lézẅé, ńgʉa ńkúu ná me Sakarîɛ gẅie mé la fó ńzẅé yé pɔ́ ncwò*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó. E Ssé ge lá’ pú zɛ́te wɔ́b métsèm pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: from the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó pi pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pi léen ńkíle mánzsé gẅie pʉ̀a mesoŋ pfó mǒ tá ńzsé mmó gie Ssé gɔɔn, ńdʉ’ʉ kwà’ gẅi méŋwɛ́ lepfo mǒ, ńgíŋe ńtáte pʉ̀a pie é ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lepfo pú’u.
en: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwaa fó ndá kẅɛ, lóŋ pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê là we pà*farisay ne ffó, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ńzɛ́te yé menò pɔ́ ntsote tsotě,
en: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urgehimvehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pú’u, éfa’a létsíŋe yé tà gwɔ á gɔɔn nò éfʉa tsɔ́, pɔ́ zẅɛ́’ ḿbii yɛ̌ ńdɔg sẅiŋe yé.
en: laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne shwóŋe pú’u, alá’ ne ńkẅi’i ńkwɔ́’ɔ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ejʉ’ sẅɛ́ sẅɛ̌ tà mé ne néŋte mekwò pʉ̀a. Á gwaa gɔɔn nò mbwo lá’, ḿvɔg ńgɔɔn mbwo ngàŋa nkwò yé ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pʉ̀a*farisay, tà pi cʉ́’ ngàŋ mepàb pá’ pɔ́b.
en: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all,Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie áa lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lelyěen á gẅiin lé lá’ ńkẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌. Atsɔ́ nò té wɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lyeen tà mé lá’ le zsé wɔ́.
en: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tà ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńdá’ lêtsẅɛ́’, éshÿɔ́g ncwò gẅi ssé, ńgɔɔn nò, mbà jʉ’ ge gÿo fɔ́g mé pú jú’. Anò gie pi lemté pɔ́ letuŋó, á tsɛ̀ɛ lûm ndá, mbà mé ge lá’ kwɔ́’ɔ gyɛ̌ tá sá’a yɛ̌ nò.
en: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò mbwo pi meshǔ pɔ́ɔn ngie tà pi pɔ́g pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pɔ́ ku’ pɔ́ ndà’ lézẅé nyìŋ ḿbiŋ ńké tè ku’u légÿo tà ńtɔ́g pú’u wɔ́.
en: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi nyìŋ gẅie pi gẅiin lépɔ́gɔ yé: Pi pɔ́g pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé á nue ngwɔ́ á zẅé nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńku’u léma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g. Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie pi pɔ́g pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé.
en: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.

ngiemboon: Mé ée lá’ɔɔn sẅiŋ mejʉŋé tá’, mé lɔɔn fó ńcú’te tsɔ́ mbɔɔ méntʉ̀a mé sẅiŋ, ńkẅé mbòŋo kɔ́? Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, e Ssé ké tè tsɔ́ wɔb lege.
en: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo Ssé, pi gwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa mejʉŋé. À léen ńzɔɔn ńdá’ sáŋ menòŋo twó mí tà ńzsé nzẅìŋ. Pú’u la, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ mmó.
en: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n gíŋe shwóŋó gẅi yɔɔn nò, nyìŋ tyé mvfò lá’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ, n gee nyìŋ Yěsô, mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gíŋe tyé yé mvfò*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé é gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ aa wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ.
en: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ tyé mvfò lá’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n tè nyìŋ Yěsô wɔ́, mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge leen ké lá’ tyé mvfò*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé é gɔɔn yé ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ à tè wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: but he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn shwóŋó tepòŋ ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ, mbà Ssé ge lá’ lege náa mbwo yé, tá ńké ńzoonte Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbà mé téen ńdá’a ńdege ńnáa mbwo ngàŋ wɔ́.
en: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie, tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo ku’, mé gwoon gẅí, ńgʉa ńŋaga gẅi kà pɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda wɔ́, kà pɔ́ mvfò mefùɔ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ mvfò pàsá’a lá’ gwɔ́. Mé gwɔ́ tà ne ńdɔgɔ gẅi ńgee, tà pi pú’ mbùm gí ngie pi ge tóo wó é gɔɔn ngie kɔ́ wɔ́? É zoŋo twó gí lêkɔ́ wɔ́?
en: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, anduntomagistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a shwóŋó gẅi nò gie pi ge gɔɔn.
en: for the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ fóo nùɔ lá’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà tsẅi né fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn ngie à gab shúm tá weg yé ńná sɔ́ɔn.
en: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Awɔ̌ la zába wɔ̀ɔn léŋag mentsaŋ mí, kà pɔ́ légab shúm sí ńná né pi?
en: And he said unto him,Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ńgɔɔn mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm ngie: Pi laga twó gí! Tà pi fa’a lécú’te shúm, ńké ńkẅi’i kẅi’i, le gwɔ́ we nyìŋ tè gẅiin tsɔ́ nò ná shúm sie angàŋ gẅiin wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ pá’ à zɔɔn fó ńgẅiin pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́!
en: And he said unto them,Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ ngàŋa mmó lǎ’ ńgwɔ́ wó, metsetsá’ mé gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ ngù’ ńkwɔ́ shúm léjÿó tɛ’.
en: And he spake a parable unto them, saying,The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:

ngiemboon: Á zye lékwaŋ ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá pú le’e shúm sɔ́ɔn? Ajʉ’ ge kɔ́g,
en: and he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n zsé pá’ n ge gÿo. Mèŋ n ge tágte menkiŋ mɔ́ɔn, é kwá kwà’ mie é fáŋ tɛ’, é lag shúm nká’, é pú cú’te wɔ́ba fù’ yɔ́ɔn, é ńnéŋe tsòló,
en: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.

ngiemboon: é sele gɔɔn né twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie: Ashǔ, afù’ áa ssé nà mengù’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, zẅɛte! Pfɛ́ɛ! Núu! Pím pá’ ɔ̀ kwǒŋ!
en: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink,andbe merry.

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔɔ gʉ̀gʉ̀, mèŋ, n ge lɔgɔ gú gʉa pɔ́ kwà’ lêtsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. Eshúm sie ɔ̀ sěen ńcú’te tsɛ̀ɛ menkìŋ lɛ cʉ́’ se wɔ́?
en: But God said unto him,Thoufool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’a twó ngie: Yɔɔn áa nò gie á gÿo nyìŋ gẅie à lagá fù’ ńcú’te ngie aa ngàŋa mmó, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ menÿɔ́g Ssé ńké tè wɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: Soishe that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé gie: N dɔgɔ shwóŋó gẅi ngie tà pi ńnéŋe ḿbú’u mbùm gí nà nò mmó léjÿó ngie: Peg ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́? Tà pi pú’ mbùm gi nà nò nzsǒ ngie: Peg ge ma’a kɔ́?
en: And he said unto his disciples,Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mboŋó ngie, gẅi le gwɔ́ cʉa shúm léjÿó, mbùm nyìŋ piŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa menzsǒ.
en: The life is more than meat, and the bodyis morethan raiment.

ngiemboon: Pi líe meshʉ́ŋ tá ńgyá. Pɔ́ ée ntě ḿbye mmó wɔ́, ńké tě ńdaga shúm ńnáa ndá wɔ́, pɔ́ té ntàŋ gẅiin, menkìŋ mɔ́b té wó wɔ́. E Ssé zɔɔ ńjÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b. Pi ee mbwo Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa meshʉ́ŋ.
en: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le séen ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ pi ne ḿbú’u mbùm gi, ńkú’u lékẅi’i tà’a lyɛ̌’ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mí wɔ́.
en: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pi fó tè ku’u légÿo pú’u wɔ́, pi piŋ ḿbú’ mbùm gi ná setsɔ́ shúm mélà’a kɔ́?
en: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?

ngiemboon: Pi líe metôtǒ mie ée nà legǐ nká’ ńgyá lésí. Legǐ aa ntě fa’a fà’ wɔ́, ńké tě ḿbá’a menzsǒ wɔ́. Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, legǐ ma’ nzsǒ, tà mbà fùɔ Salomo la lá’ ńgwɔ́ nà we legú’ ntsèm ntsèm à tè lá’ ḿma’ nzsǒ tà é poŋ pá’ yɔb wɔ́.
en: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

ngiemboon: Tà Ssé lɔɔn ḿma’ nzsǒ mbòŋo nà legǐ gẅie à zɔgɔ́ nká’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, njÿó lʉ́a mé kɔ́’ ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g, mbà á ge kúu ná pi tá à zág nzsǒ lá? Pi tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much morewill he clotheyou, O ye of little faith?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, tà pi gíŋe ḿbú’ mbùm gí ngie mé ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́, mé ge núu kɔ́?
en: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.

ngiemboon: Pàtèzsě Ssé zɔ̌ ńnéŋe ńgẅiin yɛ̌ ntí nkwaŋá. Á gʉa ná pi, mbà Tá gẅi Ssé zsé shúm sie é ge kẅéte gẅí.
en: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’ pɔ́ pá’ gẅi nkwaŋá ge tyé pɔ́ nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé, à lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńná sɛ̌ shúm ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, pi gwɔ̌ pɔ́ mbó ntá’ tá’, tà pi pɔ́g, mélà’mie Tá gẅi Ssé ka gyǎ ngie à ge ná lefùɔ mbwo pi.
en: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋ shúm sie pi gẅiin, ńná nkáb mbwo pàtèmmó, ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin púɔ pɔ̀ɔn nkáb pie é lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é le tɔ́gte, ńdɔg ńde’e fù’ gí lejʉ́ŋ Ssé. Á jʉ’ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, á le mag, metsǒŋ le ku’u léjʉ wɔ́, asɔ́ɔn á le ku’u léjÿó wɔ́.
en: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńde’e nkáb gi nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà ntʉ́m gẅi ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋte mbùm gi, ńdyɛ melâm, ńtÿɔ́gte!
en: Let your loins be girded about, andyourlights burning;

ngiemboon: Ńńnéŋe pá’ megàŋa fà’ pie é ne ńzẅí’te tá fà’ wɔ́b gẅie à ně ńgʉa jʉ’ ye leluŋó. Pɔ́ lá’a lá’ ńzẅí’te yé légwɔ́ gie à ge tó pú’te ncwò ndá, pɔ́ gwóon ńtsɔ́’.
en: and ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.

ngiemboon: Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée ngàŋa fà’ gie tá fà’ wɔ́b gwaa tó, mbà pɔ́ kaa lyé. Oon, mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, á gwɔ́ nénʉ́, à ge tém nzsǒ fà’, é tsẅi megàŋa fà’ pé ńnéŋe ssé, à lɔg shúm ńcʉa, ńgab pɔ́ pfɛ́.
en: Blessedarethose servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ nò tá fà’ tó tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ kà pɔ́ nkwɔ̀’ njÿó wɔ́, ńtó ńgyá pɔ́ nyé pɔ́ te lyé, mbà pɔ́ ée pàshÿó mbòŋo.
en: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and findthemso, blessed are those servants.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe ńzsé mboŋó ngie nyìŋ laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ ńnéŋe mbʉ̀a ye ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie ntsǒŋ ge tó, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lá’ té lyé, ḿbyɛ́b tà ntsǒŋ le kúu mbʉ̀a yé wɔ́.
en: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, mbàa pi gí, pi cwoŋte mbùm gí ḿbyɛ́b, mélà’mie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gÿo tó, tá pi tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ wɔ́.
en: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.

ngiemboon: Piɛ jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ saga sɔɔn legʉa pá’ɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo peg kà mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm?
en: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ngàŋa fà’ we nénʉ́, á gẅie à gẅiin legyè, aa pé’e ńgwɔ́ wɛ̌? Aa gẅie tá fà’ ge gÿo gwaa gʉa, é gɔɔn né yé ngie: Afà’ gie mèŋ n nyě mbwo gù á yɔɔn, cʉ́’ ná shúm léjÿó mbwo petsɔ́ megàŋa fà’ á nà fʉ̀’ gie á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: And the Lord said,Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whomhislord shall make ruler over his household, to givethem theirportion of meat in due season?

ngiemboon: Tá fà’ we lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwaa piŋ nzèm, ńgyá á ne fa’a yɛ̌ fà’, mbà aa shÿó mbòŋo.
en: Blessedisthat servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, tá fà’ we ge cʉ́me shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm mbwo yé.
en: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.

ngiemboon: Tá pege gɔɔn ngie ngàŋa fà’ cʉ̌’ nzèm, ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn tè lwo piŋ wɔ́, ńdeen ńké ńzye lécúa petsɔ́ megàŋa fà’, pe mbàŋa lâ pe pànzwě, ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ńnú melù’ ḿbʉ́a.
en: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, tá fà’ we vege vege ńtó á nà fʉ̀’ gie à tè ne ńzsé wɔ́, ńnéŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó yé tɛ’, é jwoŋo yé, à gʉa ne jʉ’ gie mé jwoŋo pʉ̀a tepòŋ ńnáa wó.
en: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not forhim, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ gẅie à zsě mmó gie tá fà’ we ne ńkwoŋo, ḿbiŋ ńké tè tsɔ́ mmó cwoŋte, ńké tè gÿo mmó gie tá fà’ we ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́, mé ge lá’ cúa yé tɛ’.
en: And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared nothimself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with manystripes.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie ngàŋa fà’ lɔɔn tè ne ńzsé mmó gie tá fà’ we ne ńkwoŋo ngie à gÿo wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mmó gie ńgwɔ́ mé fó mǒ ńcúa yé tɛ’, mbà mé te gÿo cúa yé tɛ’ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńnáa mmó mbwo nyìŋ á gyɔ́ɔn, mbà mé ge taa gíŋe kẅé à gyɔ́ɔn, mé piŋ ńcʉ́me shúm mbwo nyìŋ tà é gyɔ́ɔn, mbà ée nzẅìŋe mé ge lá’ gíŋe zɛ́te.
en: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with fewstripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Mèŋ n ka tǒ lélyɛ mmɔ̌g ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, m biŋ ně ńtsɔ́ɔn légwaa gyá, mbà é gwǒon tà ne ńkÿó.
en: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo ńnu’u wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ pá’ mé nu’u nyìŋ ntse la. Yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’ lɔɔn ńdá’ ńnyé té tɔ́g, mèŋ n de mboŋó jú’!
en: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie n ka tǒ, ńdɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, n ka lɔg pɔ́ fagte ńtó.
en: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

ngiemboon: Tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, á ge cʉ́’ʉ gee ná pʉ̀a métʉ̀a pie é těm ndá ńnéŋe, afagte gwɔ́ ssé. Pʉ̀a métá tyé ńgwɔ́ tà’ ncwò, pe mépʉ́a púte ḿbʉa wɔ́b. Pe métá pʉ̀a pe mépʉ́a yɔ́b.
en: for from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ ge gÿo lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò míŋ we we mbàŋa, mûɔ mbàŋa lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò tá we. Má múɔ gÿo ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò míŋ we we manzwě, múɔ manzwě à lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò má we. Anzwě múɔ gÿo ńdʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò mándúm we, mándúm lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò nzwě múɔ.
en: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: Pi gwɔ̌ tà ńgyá mbʉ̀ŋ fó nà tsɔ́ shÿó ńkwɔ́’, pi gwóon ńgɔɔn ngie mbʉ̀ŋ gee ndǔ, é ké ńdú,
en: And he said also to the people,When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgyá fefà sele tà ńcʉ́’ fóo pɔ́ shÿó ntsíŋ ńcʉ’ʉ, pi gɔɔn ngie lùm gee ntʉ̌a, á ké ńtʉ́a.
en: And whenye seethe south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ mepàb, pi líe lefàŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ńzsé mmó gie á gee ńgÿǒ, á piŋ ńgaa pi gyá menò mie é ne ńcʉate fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi tè zsé mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́?
en: Yehypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi tè zsé légyá mmó gie mé lɔɔn ńgÿo á gwɔ́ mbòŋ wɔ́?
en: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

ngiemboon: Né ngie, nyìŋ pɔ́ nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin njǔ, á ne fa’a légÿo mé jÿɔ́’ɔ yé ndá tsǎŋ, mbà ngàŋ ge sẅíŋte yé, pɔ́ yé zso mánzsé ńnyɛte. À lɔɔn tè pú’u gÿo, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ yé gʉa mvfò tá ndá pàŋag ntsaŋ, à ŋag mé ńnéŋe yé ndá tsǎŋ.
en: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate,as thou artin the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, ngàŋ ge lá’ gwɔ́ kẅɛɛ tsǎŋ, é pú tóŋo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie mé ne ńkʉ́a tà tsɔ́ le pyé.
en: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ áyɛ̌, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ne ḿbíte menò mie é lǎ cʉa shwóŋó Yěsô, éshwóŋó yé pá’*Pilato la gÿo mé zẅéte pʉ̀a Galilea, á fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ la ne ńnáa shúm pwɔ́’ mbwo Ssé.
en: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilæans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

ngiemboon: Á zẅí’te tà á ku’, á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔgɔ ńkwaŋa ngie pʉ̀a Galilea ápɛ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńkwé pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Megàŋ mefʉ̀a ńcʉa petsɔ́ keen?
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,Suppose ye that these Galilæans were sinners above all the Galilæans, because they suffered such things?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té nò wɔ́, pi zsé ngie pi lɔɔn ńké tè kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge gÿo lége gí pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b.
en: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńkímte pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn nê legém pie máa ndá la keme ńzẅéte wɔ́b á Siloé. Pi kwǎŋ ngie pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ ńcʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Yerósalem metsèm lá?
en: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té nò wɔ́. Pi lɔɔn ńké tè kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge lége gí pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b.
en: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ la pye tÿǒ mbÿě ngěm nká’ yé, ńgÿo ńnéŋe tà ńtóo le káb ntɔ̌ɔn ntÿǒ, à tè mmó gyá,
en: He spake also this parable;A certainmanhad a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo ngàŋa fà’ ngie: Ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngù’ tá pá’ mèŋ n ne ńtóo fa’a ntɔ̌ɔn nà tÿǒ yɔɔn mèŋ n tè ńgyá wɔ́, kɔ́’ɔ ḿma’a ssé, ńtí kɔ́ á jÿó jʉ’ʉ tsetsá’ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ?
en: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, mé ná’a ńnyé yé yɔɔn ngù’, mèŋ n ge túŋ letsiŋé sé, é lɔg kʉ̀ŋe tsáb,
en: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dungit:

ngiemboon: pú’u, kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lá’a fʉ̀’ pá’ɔɔn ńzém ntɔ̌ɔn wɔ́? Ńké ḿbiŋ tè zém ɔ̀ tsẅi mèŋ n kɔ́’.
en: and if it bear fruit,well: and if not,thenafter that thou shalt cut it down.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô gwɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda ńne ńda’te nò Ssé mbwo lá’.
en: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé wó, mbà é gÿǒ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn nê legém pá’ tsɔ̌*ssé tepòŋ la gwoon yé ḿbwɔ́’ nkà’ wé. Tà tsɔ̌ légíŋe ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńtyé tyé te wó wɔ́.
en: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift upherself.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá yé, ńtóŋo yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Agùɔ jú yɛ magá,
en: And when Jesus saw her, he calledher to him, and said unto her,Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzáb mbwo mé twó manzwě ŋwɛ́. Á gwóon ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńtyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he laidhishands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

ngiemboon: Tá ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda gyá pú’u, anò gyáŋa yé, mélà’mie Yěsô gÿǒ nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè. Á gɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie, melyɛ’ɛ́ fà’ ée pá’a ńgwɔ́ ntɔgɔ́, pi ńnéŋe ńdɔgɔ megùɔ mí ńtóo ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ mé zoŋo gẅí, tà pi tó lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè!
en: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Pi ee ngàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, awɔ̌ ná pi tè gʉa lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yégè, ńkyɛ́’ɛ foŋ we, ka pɔ́ nzikáase ye wɔ́, ńdɔg ńgʉa á nú ntse wɔ́?
en: The Lord then answered him, and said,Thouhypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox orhisass from the stall, and leadhimaway to watering?

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná manzwě wɔɔn gẅie aa nà ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam, mbà Sátà la leen ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, tà ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn nê legém, mèŋ n kɔ’ɔ́ le kyɛ́’ nkÿo ná yé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn wɔ́, mélà’mie yɔɔn lyɛ̌’ɛ́ nzsè lá!
en: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

ngiemboon: Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn pú’u, eshʉ́ pú ńkú Megàŋ mbù pé, tá lelÿò pʉ̀a jʉ’ó ne ńkága kǎg ná mɔɔn menò mbòŋo ntsèm mie Yěsô ne ńgÿo.
en: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé ée pé’e ńgwá’a lá, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n dɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’?
en: Then said he,Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?

ngiemboon: É leen ńgwá’a tsɔ̌ ntí lesɔ́ɔn sésɔg sie nyìŋ la pí ḿma’a nká’ yé, é gÿo sá’, ńgú’, tà ńcʉ́’ʉ tÿǒ, ńtɔ́g mbwo, meshʉ́ŋ tó ḿbá’ menkʉ̀a mɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gíŋe ńdɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’ nà*lefùɔ Ssé?
en: And again he said,Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?

ngiemboon: É gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ gẅie manzwě lɔg ḿvoŋo faline gie à*kɔ̌’ loŋgáa sétá, ńtsab, ḿbú ḿbú’ pú’ tà méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ ŋwɛ́ gÿo faline ntsàb ŋwɛ́ á pú ńkwɔ́’.
en: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋ ńtyé mánzsé ńne ńgee Yerósalem, ńcʉa nà metÿǒsoŋ lâ melá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńgiŋe ńda’te nò Ssé mbwo pʉ̀a.
en: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉ’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, tà á pá’ɔɔn, e Ssé lá’ ńgÿo ntá’ pʉ̀a zɔ tsẅɛ́ keen? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm ngie:
en: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved? And he said unto them,

ngiemboon: Pi fa’ shÿó pɔ́ létɔ́gɔ nà ncwò ndá gẅie é kʉ́mte kʉmté. Pi zsé mboŋó ngie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge lá’ fa’a lékúu wó, é piŋ ké le ku’.
en: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ ge lá’ ku’, ngàŋ ndá lu ssé ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò ndá, pi pie pi nyé pi la, pi zye lékwá’te ncwò ndá, ńne sẅíŋte yé ngie: Andè, tsɔ́’ ncwò ndá peg kúu ndá. Tá’, à gɔɔn né pi ngie: Mèŋ, n tè ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie pi ee pɛ̌ wɔ́!
en: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńzye légɔɔn né yé ngie, ńzsé ngie pege zɔ kɔ̌ɔn ńteme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ, ńtéme melù’ ńnúu pé’e? Ɔ̀ lɔ̌ɔn tè ńgiŋe ná pàmánzsé pég mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ még, ńda’te nò Ssé wâ?
en: then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.

ngiemboon: Tá’, à gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie: N tè ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie pi ee pɛ̌ wɔ́. Pi fó ncwò ndá mèŋ ńgʉate, pi ee pàfʉate menò!
en: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, allyeworkers of iniquity.

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńzye lélʉa, lóŋ gẅi ne ffó. À gwɔ gwɔ́, mbà pi mǎ’ nÿɔ́g ńgyá Ábalam, ńgyá Esâg, mbɔɔ Yakwɔ́b, mbɔɔ*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé métsèm. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé. Mbà mé jÿɔ’ɔ́ gẅi pi.
en: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and youyourselvesthrust out.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, mé fóo sá’ nèm, éfó mbyě nèm, éfó twó, éfó ntsíŋ, ḿbú ńtó ńcú’te tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé, ńně ńjÿó máamáa línɔ́ɔn.
en: And they shall come from the east, andfromthe west, and from the north, andfromthe south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie tsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ge lá’ cʉ́’ pà gwɔ́ nzèm, etsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀’ɔɔn lá’ ńgwɔ́ pà gwɔ́ mvfò.
en: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn pú’u, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a*farisay tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Fó jʉ’ɔɔn ńgʉa, mélà’mie fùɔ*Herôd ne fa’a lézẅé ɔ́.
en: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ńgɔɔn né mengyé shʉ̀shʉ̀ áwɛ̌ ngie: Mèŋ, n kě ńnyé ńgẅiin lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mbɔɔ jǔɔ lélɔg ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, é piŋ gíŋ gÿo megàŋa gùɔ zeŋe. À gwɔ́ nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá, m mege fà’ yɔ́ɔn.
en: And he said unto them,Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the thirddayI shall be perfected.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á poŋ, n zɔɔn ńcʉ́me mánzsé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. Ajǔɔ n gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsé, tà mbɔɔ wetsɔ̌ júɔ. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, mélà’mie á té poŋ ngie mé zẅé*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé jʉ’e ndyɛ̀’ɛ té gwɔ́ pɔ́ Yerósalem wɔ́.
en: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and thedayfollowing: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ ku’, á mɔɔn ngie: Pà Yerósalem, pà Yerósalem, pi pie pi ee ńzẅé*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé zẅé, ńdɔgɔ metóon ńtémte pʉ̀a pie Ssé tumó mbwo pi ńzẅéte, ée ngʉa shÿɔ́’ɔ pá’ mèŋ fa’á lécú’te púɔ pí, pá’ mêngáb cú’tè púɔ pé lepàb ye, pi ké ńdʉ’ lʉ’?
en: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hendoth gatherher brood underherwings, and ye would not!

ngiemboon: Cʉ́’ tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí,*jʉ’ʉ Ssé gi ge cʉ́’ʉ fomo ndá, mbà Ssé gwa’á gẅí. Pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tà lá’ kúu lyɛ̌’ gie pi ge gɔɔn ngie: E Ssé gwɔ́ lé nyìŋ gẅie à tóo nà lezíŋ sé.
en: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, untilthe timecome when ye shall say, Blessedishe that cometh in the name of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô gʉa mbʉ̀a tsɔ̌ tá ndá pà*farisay léjÿó mmó. Epʉ̀a pie é laa wó ne ńdeŋe yé leŋ,
en: And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tyé mvfò yé, mbà kwɔ́’te lěen ńgwoon yé.
en: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te pà*farisay pâ pàkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé pie é laa ndá ngie: Áa nà*lepʉ̌ ségè pé’e, ńgwáa ngwe mé gÿo nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yégè kà ngǎŋ?
en: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying,Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ pú tè tsɔ́b, Yěsô kíbe ngùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgÿo á zéŋe, ńtsẅi á gʉa.
en: And they held their peace. And he tookhim, and healed him, and let him go;

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie, awɔ̌ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ gie míŋ we kà foŋ we wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ ntse ntǔŋ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yégè, á nyé té sẅɛte fóo tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńkẅile yé?
en: and answered them, saying,Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?

ngiemboon: Á cʉa wɔ́b, pɔ́ zága pÿɛ.
en: And they could not answer him again to these things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ pʉ̀a pie mé ně ńtóŋo wɔ́b ne ńkúu ndá, éfa’a pɔ́ jʉ’ ye melÿò tá ńnéŋe, ésaga mbwo pɔ́b ngie:
en: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lá’ ńtóŋo ɔ́ jʉ’e línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá, ɔ̀ kúu wó, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn léfa’ pɔ́ léńnéŋe nà jʉ’ ye melÿò, ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à cʉa ɔ́ lépiŋ ńtó nzèm.
en: When thou art bidden of anymanto a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ndá gẅie à toŋó línɔ́ɔn leen ńtó ńgɔɔn né gù ngie: Lu ssé, andÿò wɔɔn ńnéŋe, mbà shʉ́ ge kú ɔ́ légʉa ńnéŋe nzèm.
en: and he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́ tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lá’ ńtóŋo gú nà línɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ tó ńnéŋe jú pɔ́ nzèm. Ɔ̀ ńnéŋe jʉ’ó, nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtóŋo ɔ́ kúu ndá, ńgyá ɔ̀ gwɔ́ nzèm, á gɔɔn né gù ngie: Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, tó lê mvfò, mbà à lɔgɔ ńkwé’e nzẅìŋ ɔ́ mvfò pʉ̀a metsèm pie pi lâ pɔ̌ ee ndá.
en: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋá’te nnɛ́, mbà Ssé ge sẅé’e yé náa ssé, ésẅé’e mbùm ye ńnáa ssé, mbà Ssé ge pʉ’ʉ yé tÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g.
en: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtóŋo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lá’ ne ńtóŋo línɔ́ɔn, fʉ̀’e zsǒ kà ncwò nzém wɔ́, tè tóŋ meshǔ pú, kà mefɛ́ pú wɔ́, kà pʉ̀a nà tsìŋe ndá gí wɔ́, kà megàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ̀a pú pie ée megàŋ nkáb wɔ́, á nue pɔ́ ge gÿo gíŋe tóŋo gú jú, é lɔg tsɔ́’ shʉ́’ gú.
en: Then said he also to him that bade him,When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, northyrich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la’ ne ńtóŋo línɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ tóŋ pàtèmmó, ńtóŋ menkÿǒon, ńtóŋ pànkème kwò, ńtóŋ pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g.
en: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gÿo pú’u, mbà ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, mélà’mie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le tsɔ́’ shʉ́’ gú wɔ́, pú’u, e Ssé lá’ ńtsɔ́’ɔ fà’ ɔ́, á fʉ̀’ gie pʉ̀a pé ge lá’ zíme nà legwé.
en: and thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.

ngiemboon: Mé jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie pâ pɔ̌ la ńnéŋe ssé ńně ńjÿó mmó gɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ jÿó yé mmó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé!
en: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessedishe that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ́ɔn, ńtsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said he unto him,A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e léjÿó shúm gÿo ńku’, á túmo ménkʉ́ we ngie à gʉa ńtóŋo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ leen ńké ńtó fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: and sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pɔ́ metsèm pú fa’ ndiletáŋ lélɔg ńtsó línɔ́ɔn. Amvɔ́g mvfò gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ, n ka jú nká’, á poŋ n gʉa ńgyá, tsétsɔ́’, shwóŋó yé ngie n tè tó wɔ́.
en: And they all with oneconsentbegan to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie: N ka jú mefòŋ legém lélɔg fa’a fà’, mèŋ n ně fa’a légʉa ńzẅí’ ńgyá, tsétsɔ’ gɔɔn ngie à pɔ́ɔn lé la’a wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ ye: Mèŋ, n ka nyě ńzɔ́’ɔ, ńgwɔ́ n de tó.
en: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

ngiemboon: Ménkʉ́ wá piŋ nzèm, éshwóŋó tá we pá’ pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, á pú ńgyáŋa yé tɛ’, á gíŋe ńtúmo ménkʉ́ ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Kÿote lêtʉ̀, ńgʉa tÿǒsoŋ ńtyé metwó nzsè, ńgiŋe nà melyěen nzsè, ńtóŋ pàtèmmó, ńtóŋ menkÿǒon, mbɔɔ mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g pâ pànkème nkwò pia pɔ́ tó.
en: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ḿbiŋ, ńgɔɔn né tá we ngie: Andè, mèŋ, m bǔ ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ ně ńtsẅi, n něŋ pʉ̀a ndá tá’, ajʉ’ nyé pɔ́ wó.
en: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.

ngiemboon: Tá we jú’ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Gʉa metwó nzsè fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbɔɔ nà melyěen nzsè tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie ɔ̀ gyǎ, ɔ̀ lɔg tʉ̀, ńtóŋo yé ngie à tó, ńnéŋe wɔ́b tà ndá yɔɔn lúe.
en: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compelthemto come in, that my house may be filled.

ngiemboon: Zsé mboŋó ngie, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie n ka vɔg ńtsẅii mbwo pɔ́b la, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le mmó léjÿó yɔ́ɔn zẅí’.
en: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńcʉ́me mánzsé ńne ńgiŋe, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ nzèm yé, á kúu tsɔ́ jʉ’, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, à tè kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn ńcʉa tá we, ńcʉa má we, ńcʉa nzwě we, ńcʉa pènkʉ́ pé, ńcʉa mefɛ́ pé pe mbàŋa mbɔɔ pe pànzwě, ńcʉa mbɔɔ kwà’ twó mbùm yé wɔ́, mbà à tè ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: If anymancome to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ ńdɔgɔ ńzẅíŋe lékwé, tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ á le ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ne ńgee ńkwɛ́ máa ndá, mbà à ge zɔɔn ńnéŋe ssé kwaŋte shúm fà’, é zsé nzẅìŋ nkáb gie ńgwɔ́ á lɔg ńkwɛ́ tà ńgyá é ku’u ná ye,
en: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he havesufficientto finishit?

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́gɔ lénuŋe cÿó, ndá ńcʉa yé. Mé lá’a ńzɔ́gɔ ńgyá ńgẅe yé ngie:
en: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finishit, all that beholditbegin to mock him,

ngiemboon: Gyá pá’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wá la zye ndá, à tè ku’u lémege wɔ́.
en: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

ngiemboon: Kà pɔ́ fùɔ túm gẅie à ne ńcwoŋte mbùm ye légʉa ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌ fùɔ túm gẅie à kěm ncù wɔ́, mbà à ge sáŋ pé pʉ̀a gyá ngie kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔg pʉ̀a ntsá’ legém, ńgʉa ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌ fùɔ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a ntsá’ móm mbʉ́a ńtóo wɔ́?
en: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgyá, epé pʉ̀a kɔ́g, mbà fùɔ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ ncù ńtóo ge nyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, à túmo mamekěm, à gʉa sẅíŋte yé ngie à shwóŋó yé mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á ná tá ńgẅiin sẅétè.
en: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’a twó ngie: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, à tè vɔg ńnyé shúm sie à gẅiin wɔ́, mbà à tè ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Ngwáŋ ée mmó mbòŋo, tá ńgwɔ́ gie é lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńdebe lebe, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo lêkɔ́ tà é gíŋe ńdʉm?
en: Saltisgood: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ ngwáŋ ńgwɔ́ é ke le tsetsá’ kẅéte, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le lɔg ńgÿo kʉ̀ŋe wɔ́, mé ŋwa ḿma’a pǐ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metwoŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill;butmen cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: *Pàkẅé ncùb pà Roma lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńkʉ́e wɔ́b ne ńtóo metsèm, á lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô lé jú’u nò yé.
en: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gyá pú’u, ńné ńzẅɛte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ ne ńkúe pʉ̀a tepòŋ tà pâ pɔ̌ teme shúm ńjÿó.
en: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie:
en: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ńgẅiin*njʉ̀njÿò ye nkÿo, ńgʉa tsẅɛ ḿpféle, tà’ pyé, mbà à ge gǎ? Mbà à tè nyé yetsɔ́ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm lepfwɔ’ɔ́, é gʉa fa’ gie e pyě tà gyá wɔ́?
en: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

ngiemboon: À ge fa’ tà gyá, é pú kág, é kaa zába mekẅí yé,
en: And when he hath foundit, he layethiton his shoulders, rejoicing.

ngiemboon: é lɔg piŋ tà kúu mbʉ̀a, é tóŋ meshǔ pé mbɔɔ ngàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ̀a, é gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pege kág ńtí pá’ n gyǎ*njʉ̀njÿò yɔ̀ɔn mie e kà pyě.
en: And when he cometh home, he calleth togetherhisfriends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí: Tà’ ngàŋ mefʉ̀a lɔɔn ńkúbe mà we, mé kága tÿǒ lepwó tɛ’, ńcʉa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé kága ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ pie pɔ́ gyǎ ngie pɔ́ ée nénʉ́ tà ńgwá ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le kúbe mà wɔb wɔ́.
en: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe ńjú’u tsɔ́, manzwě lɔɔn ńgẅiin nkáb ye pàg legém, tà’a pàg pyé, mbà à ge gǎ? Mbà à tè lyɛɛ lâm, é jÿɔg ndá, é ta’ kʉ̀ŋe, é pʉ́le fa’ tà lá’ gyá wá?
en: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she findit?

ngiemboon: À ge gyá, é tóŋ mesǒ pé mbɔɔ ngàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ̀a, é gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó pege kág ńtí pá’ n gyǎ pàga nkáb yɔ́ɔn gie á ka pyě.
en: And when she hath foundit, she callethherfriends andherneighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé kág ńtí tà’ nyìŋ tepòŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie à kubé mà we.
en: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa lǎ’ ńgẅiin gubé yé mbàŋa yépʉ́a.
en: And he said,A certain man had two sons:

ngiemboon: We nkʉ́ ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tɔ̌ɔnmé, gʉa nà shúm ségè, ńná wɔ̀ɔn tÿɔgɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn. Tá we fó ńdɔg shúm sé ńgaba wɔ́b mépʉ́a,
en: and the younger of them said tohisfather, Father, give me the portion of goods that fallethto me. And he divided unto themhisliving.

ngiemboon: é gwaa cʉa lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, múɔ wá sẅiŋ sé shúm, ńdɔg nkáb ńgʉa lê túm, ńkúu zɔ́gɔ tepòŋ, ḿbú ńcʉŋte nkáb ya,
en: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.

ngiemboon: ńcʉŋte nkáb tà é gwɔ mag, gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ. Á zye lézága ye mpfɛ̌.
en: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

ngiemboon: Ńtebe tà ńgʉa ńkúu fà’ mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋe lá’ ŋwɛ́. Á túmo yé nká’ lépyɛ́b mekúnɔ́ɔn.
en: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ, ńnéŋe té pfɛ́ɛ mmó, nzyè pú ńgyáŋa*yé, tà á tsɔ́ɔn shúm mekúnɔ́ɔn, tá nyìŋ tè tsoon fùbe nà shúm mekúnɔ́ɔn né yé ná.
en: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

ngiemboon: Á ńnéŋe tà ńkwaŋte ntʉ́m yé ngie: Ngàŋa fà’ tá wɔ̀ɔn ée mbʉ̀a ńjÿó shúm tà ńgwá’a tsɔ́, n gwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn ńkwé nzyè lá!
en: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge fóo jʉ’ɔɔn gʉa, é piŋ nzèm lê mbʉ̀a tá wɔ̀ɔn, é tó gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, n ka gÿo nò tepòŋ nà Ssé, ńgÿo ná gù.
en: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

ngiemboon: Pú’u, n tè gíŋe ńku’u gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ tóŋ lê míŋ ɔ̀ wɔ́. Fó ńdɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ ɔ̀ lâ.
en: and am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

ngiemboon: Ńkwaŋ pú’u, ńcʉ́me mánzsé, ńně ḿbiŋe nê mbʉ̀a pɔ́b. Tá we tyé ńgyá yé, tà á nyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, mezìŋe mé kúu yé, á nɔ́ɔnte yé, ésiŋte yé, ngie: Wɔɔn aa gú lá?
en: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gɔɔn né tá we ngie: Tɔ̌ɔnmé, n ka gÿo nò tepòŋ nà Ssé, ńgÿo ná gù, n tè gíŋe ńku’u gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ tóŋ lê míŋ gù wɔ́.
en: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tá we gɔɔn né megàŋa fà’ ngie: Pi lwo ńgʉa fa’ nzsǒ mbòŋo ńdɔg ńtó ḿma’a ná yé, ńdíe kwáŋ shÿɔ́gɔ ná múɔ tepwó we, éfa’ melɔ̌ɔn shÿɔ́gɔ mekwò yé.
en: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and putiton him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes onhisfeet:

ngiemboon: Pi fa’a mûɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛ’ la, ńzẅé pege pfɛ́, ńkág,
en: and bring hither the fatted calf, and killit; and let us eat, and be merry:

ngiemboon: ńtí pá’ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn à ka kwě, à zǐm, à ka pyě, n giŋé ńgyá yé. Á gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ zye lékág.
en: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, míŋ we we lÿò gwɔ́ nká’, ńgÿo ne ḿbiŋe, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu mbʉ̀a, ńjú’ mé gwɔ́ wó ńzɔbɔ ńzíŋe.
en: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

ngiemboon: Á tóŋo tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Akɔ́ áa mbʉ̀a?
en: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ gɔɔn ngie: Mémá gù zɔ cʉ̌’ ńtó tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́, tá gù zẅě mûɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛ’ la, mé ne ńdɔgɔ ńkága.
en: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.

ngiemboon: Andyè we jú’ pú’u, ḿbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ tà ńdʉ’ʉ lékúu ndá. Tá we kẅɛɛ pǐ ḿbú’ mbwó mbwo yé ngie à kúu ndá.
en: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tɔ̌ɔn, mèŋ fa’á mbwo gù ngù’ shÿɔ́’ɔ? N dǎ ké fʉa*lepʉ̌ shú? Tà ɔ̀ lǎ fó ńnáa wɔ̀ɔn mûɔ mvfó ndà’ ngie pega meshǔ pɔ́ɔn zẅé ńdɔg ńkág?
en: And he answering said tohisfather, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:

ngiemboon: Míŋ ɔ̀ gẅie pâ mekwàla kéen ḿpfɛ́ nkáb jù, à lěen ńtó, ɔ̀ gwóon ńzẅé mûɔ fòŋ gẅie à fáŋ tɛ’ ńtí yé?
en: but as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.

ngiemboon: Tá we gɔɔn ngie, míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, pɔgɔ zɔɔ ńzɔ́gɔ. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie n gẅiin wɔ́ áa jú.
en: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á kɔ’ɔ́ ḿboŋ ngie pege kág kwà’ mboŋó, mélà’mie afɛ̌ gù wɔɔn à ka kwě, à zimé nà legwé, à kà pyě, mèŋ n gǐŋ ńgyá yé.
en: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe saga mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Atsɔ̌ ngàŋa mmó lǎ’ ńgẅiin ngàŋa fà’ gẅie à pǔ ńdíe shúm sé ntsèm. Mé fó lyɛ̌’ shwóŋó yé ngie à ngàŋa fà’ ŋwɛ́ cʉ’ʉ́ ńcʉŋte shúm sé cʉŋte.
en: And he said also unto his disciples,There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

ngiemboon: Á tóŋo yé ńzɛ́te yé ngie: N jǔ’ mé gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ cʉ’ʉ́ ńgÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́ lɛ? Pʉ́le sáŋ shúm sie n da cʉ́me mbwo gù éshwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ, n cʉ’ʉ́ ńnyé ńkwoŋo ngie ɔ̀ líe shúm sɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ ŋwɛ́ jú’ ńkwaŋte ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo lêkɔ́ pá’ tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn gee njwǒŋ mèŋ lɔɔn? N dɔɔn ngie n ge jʉ́’ ngwóŋ, n dɔg tʉ̀ nzɔ̌? Ńcʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ ndúɔ, mbà á ge gwɔ́ nò shʉ́ ná mèŋ.
en: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.

ngiemboon: Ńńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn ngie: N zsě pá’ mèŋ n ge gÿo tà fʉ̀’ gie mé kẅilé wɔ̀ɔn nà fà’ la, epʉ̀a kúe wɔ̀ɔn membʉ̀a mɔ́b,
en: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pú’u, ńtóŋo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à la gẅiin létoŋ njǔ mbwo tá fà’ we, ńzɛ́te mvɔ́g mvfò ngie, ɔɔ pá’a ńgẅiin láa gẅie ɔ̀ ge náa mbwo tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn?
en: So he called every one of his lord's debtorsunto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie n gẅiin léná mèvɛ kúm nkÿo, ngàŋa fà’ gɔɔn ngie: Ŋwà’ne gie ɔ̀ la ŋwe’e á yɔɔn, ńcʉ́’ ŋwe’e pɔ́ móm ntʉ̀a fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ngie: Ɔɔ pá’a ńgẅiin láa gẅie ɔ̀ ge náa mbwo tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn? Á gɔɔn ngie: ngesáŋ ntsíŋ pɔ̀ɔn nkÿo. Á gɔɔn ngie: Ŋwà’ne jú yɔɔn, ńŋwe’e móm lefɔ̌ɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

ngiemboon: Tá fà’ gÿo ńgyá ntí gie ngàŋa fà’ we lɔ̌g ḿbá’ legyè pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńzẅíŋ zẅíŋ ngie legyè sé ée wó. Yěsô ma’a twó ngie: Áa nénʉ́ ngie pʉ̀a njÿó yɔɔn zsé lépá’ legyè ńdɔg ńtáŋte menò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtɔ́g pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé.
en: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’a twó ngie: Pi lɔg gí shúm se yɔɔn tèpòŋ njÿó, ńkúu kwà’ shǔ gẅie é tsẅé té mì, à lá’ ńtyé fʉ̀’ gie sɛ̌ shúm ŋwɛ́ té nyé wó wɔ́, e Ssé lɔgɔ gẅi ńgʉa lá’ ye, pi tsẅé ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńcʉ́me mûɔ mémmó mbwo nyìŋ, á pɔ́ɔn mboŋó, mbà á ge tó gwɔ́ gie á gyɔ́ɔn, à gíŋe ḿbɔ́ɔn pɔ́ pú’u, ńcʉ́me mûɔ mémmó mbwo nyìŋ à tè pɔ́ɔn mboŋó wɔ́, mbà á ge tó gwɔ́ ye lÿò á le pɔ́ɔn mboŋó wɔ́.
en: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn tè ku’u lépɔ́ɔn shúm se yɔɔn njÿó ye tepòŋ wɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ cʉ́me kwà’ shúm se tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo pi?
en: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the trueriches?

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn tè zsé lépɔ́ɔn mmó nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ náa gie áa kwà’ gí mbwo pi?
en: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ a le fa’a mbwo metá fà’ mépʉ́a wɔ́. À gÿo pú’u, mbà à ge pʉ̀a tsɔ̌, é kwoŋo tsɔ̌, ńké tè pú’u wɔ́, mbà à ge jú’ ncwò wetsɔ̌, é piŋ gwága wetsɔ̌. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńgíŋe ne ńzába nà nkáb wɔ́.
en: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, pà*farisay pie é laa jʉ’ó jú’, ḿbú sóon, ńgẅe yé, mélà’mie pɔ́ gɔ’ nkáb tɛ’.
en: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi pɛ̂, pi zɔ̌g ḿbab pʉ̀a ngie pi ee pʉ̀a mbòŋo, tá’, e Ssé ké ńne ńzsé pá’ letʉ́m sí ée pú’u. Pi zsé ngie: Anò gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gyá ngie áa nò tɛ’, áa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ nò shʉ́.
en: And he said unto them,Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Jâŋ ka gwaa tó, mé ne ńjú’u pɔ́ mbʉ̌ Mǒsê, pɔ́ menò*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mé ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo ńdɔgɔ́ ḿbÿé ngie*lefùɔ Ssé zyě létó. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ne ńkaga tʉ̀ lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a yé.
en: The law and the prophetswereuntil John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.

ngiemboon: Tá n ké tě ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mǎg wɔ́, lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge lá’ mag tá á le tʉ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ múɔ mélǎga nò lê pilé, á le lá’ ḿbyé nà*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê wɔ́.
en: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ n dɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo nzwě we, ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌, mbà pɔ́ wéwɛ̌ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà nò gÿɛ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě gẅie ndǔm we jwoŋó yé, mbà à gÿó pɔ́ gÿɛ́.
