en: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away fromherhusband committeth adultery.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsɔ̌ ngàŋ nkáb lǎ’ ńgwɔ́ wó, ńnéŋe ḿma’a menzsǒ mie é poŋ, ḿbiŋ ńcÿɔ́g nkáb tɛ’, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńjÿó yé pɔ́ línɔ́ɔn.
en: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mbóŋ gwɔ́ yé wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Nǎzalo. Mefʉ̌ŋ pú ńgwɔ́ ná yé tɛ’, á nuŋe ncwò ndá ngàŋ nkáb ŋwɛ́,
en: and there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

ngiemboon: ńně ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ nkáb pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà mé gwá’a pfwɔ́’, á lagte wɔ́, tá’, ńnuŋe jʉ’ó, ngwé zɔ̌ ne ńtóo ńdaŋa mefʉ̌ŋ mé.
en: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ngɔ́’ gÿo ńkwé,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tó ńkaa yé, ńgʉa ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ Ábalam. Ngàŋ nkáb gÿo ńkwé yé, mé kaa yé ńtúŋ.
en: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;

ngiemboon: Á kúu lá’ mepfó, ḿbú ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, ḿma’ lejÿɔ́g ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgyá Ábalam, Nǎzalo ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ ye.
en: and in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nkáb zye léga’te ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn Ábalam, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, ńtúmo Nǎzalo, à cÿɔ’ɔ múɔ tepwó we á nà ntse ńdɔg ńtó, ńcʉ́me nà lʉ́m yɔ́ɔn. Á nue m bǔ ńne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g wɔɔn tɛ’.
en: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

ngiemboon: Ábalam tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, kímte pá’ ɔ̀ ka nyé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ fù’, Nǎzalo ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, Nǎzalo gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ fù’, ɔ̀ ne ńgyá ngɔ́’.
en: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, máamáa sém gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, tà ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn fó jʉ’ɔɔn éfa’a légʉa jʉ’ɛ, á le ku’, éfó jʉ’ɛ fa’a létóo jʉ’ɔɔn, á le ku’.
en: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, thatwould comefrom thence.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nkáb gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, e sẅiŋte gú, ńdyɛ́’ ɔ̀ túmo Nǎzalo, á gʉa mbʉ̀a peg.
en: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:

ngiemboon: Á nue mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe mbàŋa ée mbʉ̀a métʉ̀a. Mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn ngie Nǎzalo piŋ ńkága tuŋó yɔ́b, ńnáa wɔ́b ntÿɔ́gɔ́ ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ pɔ́ ge lá’ gíŋe tó kú yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn jʉ’e ngɔ́’.
en: for I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

ngiemboon: Ábalam tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie, mefɛ́ pú gẅiin ŋwà’ne Mǒsê, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin me*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé. Pɔ́ jú’ ntÿɔgɔ́ gẅie ée tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nkáb gɔɔn ngie: Ngǎŋ, mbà tá wɔ̀ɔn Ábalam, áa nò tá’, nyìŋ lɔɔn fó lá’ mepfó ḿbiŋ ńtó shwóŋó wɔ́b, mbà pɔ́ ge jú’, é kúbe mà wɔ́b.
en: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.

ngiemboon: Tá Ábalam gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pɔ́ lɔɔn tè jú’u shwóŋè Mǒsê mbɔɔ ye*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, mbà nyìŋ zɔɔn ńzím zím, ńtó shwóŋó wɔ́b pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pɔ́ le zẅíŋ.
en: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa nkwò yé ngie: Ammó gie ńgwɔ́ mé fó mǒ fʉa nò, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le zág. Tá’, ashÿó tepòŋ, aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo nyìŋ fʉa nò.
en: Then said he unto the disciples,It is impossible but that offences will come: but woeunto him, through whom they come!

ngiemboon: Mvfò ee pá’ ńgwɔ́ mé cʉŋe máamáa tóon lóŋ ngàŋ, ḿma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ mmí, ńcʉa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé nyé yé, á gÿo tà tsɔ̌ tà’ ná mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ pɔ́ɔn cʉa ná yé tá fʉa nò.
en: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.

ngiemboon: Mémá nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ná yé, á pʉ́le pʉlé shwóŋó yé, á zẅíŋe mefʉ̀a, á lege ńnáa mbwo yé.
en: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

ngiemboon: Efó ńzɔ́gɔ ta’a lyɛ̌’ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ná yé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ ńtó ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńzẅíŋ mefʉ̀a mbwo yé, á lege ńnáa mbwo yé.
en: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kẅéte wég lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie, lesɔɔn sésɔg ée mmó ńkɔ́g tɛ’, nyìŋ gẅi zɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé mbɔɔ méjʉ’ pú’u, mbà à ge gɔɔn né tÿǒ gie á tyé lɛ ngie: Tsɔ́’ɔ ńgʉa ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ mmí, à jú’ ncwò wé.
en: And the Lord said,If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.

ngiemboon: Pege pí fʉ̀’ ngie nyìŋ gẅi gẅiin ngàŋa fà’, à lɔɔn ńzɔ́gɔ tsẅɛ ńjʉ́’ ngwóŋ, kà ńzɔ́g ḿpféle pɔ́ menɔ̀ɔn wɔ́, ńgÿo ḿbiŋ nzèm, mbà yé gẅie aa tá fà’ ge gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Gʉa ńnéŋe ssé letʉ ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó?
en: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?

ngiemboon: Né ngie à ge gɔɔn né yé pɔ́ ngie: Kúbe menzsǒ, ńcwoŋte shúm léjÿó sɔ́ɔn ńtÿɔ́g né mèŋ, ńzẅí’te mèŋ m pfɛ́, ńnú melù’ tá ɔ̀ lêen ńké ḿpfɛ́ shú shúm ḿbiŋ ńnú mú melù’ lá?
en: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?

ngiemboon: À tè séen gíŋe ná ndǎg mbwo ngàŋa fà’, mélà’mie à gÿǒ mmó gie à tsẅǐ wɔ́.
en: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ gí fà’ ké ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u. Pi lɔɔn ńdá’ fa’a fà’ gie mé tsẅǐ mbwo pi tà ḿmag, pi gɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ ngie: Peg gwɔ́ yég pɔ́ megàŋa fà’ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, peg gÿǒ pɔ́ mmó gie mé ně ńtsẅi ngie peg gÿo.
en: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsé ńne ńgee Yerósalem, ńcʉa nà pàa lá’ pà Samalîɛ pâ pà Galilea.
en: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ lá’, megàŋ nkà’ pǎb legém zá’a yé, tà ńtyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a,
en: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

ngiemboon: ńga’te lê tʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Yěsô, Andè, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe még.
en: and they lifted uptheirvoices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔb ngie pi gʉa ńnyɛ mbùm gi mbwo*pànùŋe pwɔ́’. Pɔ́ cʉ́me mánzsé, ńně ńgee, ńgyá, mbà nkà’ magá ná pɔ́b.
en: And when he sawthem, he said unto them,Go shew yourselves unto the priests.And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pɔ́b gyá pá’ à zeŋé, ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńkwé’e ngyè ye ńnáa tÿǒ ńdɔg ńgú’te Ssé.
en: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,

ngiemboon: Ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ńcÿɔ’ɔ zí yé ssé, ńná ndǎg mbwo yé. Angàŋ laa nyìŋ Samalîɛ.
en: and fell down onhisface at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a legém pǔ ńzeŋe, pe lepfwɔ’ɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: And Jesus answering said,Were there not ten cleansed? but wherearethe nine?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pǔ ńzeŋe metsèm, tà ndà’ gù wɔɔn zɔ tǒ lénná ndǎg mbwo Ssé ká?
en: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo nyìŋ Samalîɛ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lu ssé ńgʉa, e Ssé gÿǒ ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́, ńtí pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ.
en: And he said unto him,Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pà*farisay gÿo ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: E Ssé ge lá’ zye lésá’ njÿó pɔ́ síŋe? Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé té gwɔ zye mé ne ńdɔgɔ menÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́.
en: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said,The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ mé le gɔɔn ngie: E sɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn kà pɔ́ lé gɔɔn ngie, e si jʉ’e wɔ́. N zɔɔn ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé ně ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà pi ne ńzẅíŋe lefùɔ sé.
en: neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé gílé pɔ́b ngie: Atsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo gwɔ́ pi tsɔ́ɔn pá’ pi lâ*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge fó gíŋe zɔ́g pɔ́ ndà’ tà’a lyɛ̌’, pi ké le gyá.
en: And he said unto the disciples,The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not seeit.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ge lá’ ne gɔɔn né pi ngie: Yé wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn kà pɔ́ ngie yé gẅi jʉ’ e wɔ́. Pi pɔ́ɔn léjwoŋte, tà pi gwá ńkÿo mendʉ́.
en: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not afterthem, nor followthem.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge zɔɔn lá’ tó mé pú ńgyá yé pá’ nně mbʉ̀ŋ gie e lěen ngie ŋwâŋ, ḿbú ńkyɛ’ jʉ’ ntsèm tsèm.
en: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the onepartunder heaven, shineth unto the otherpartunder heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ge ké zɔɔn gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u,*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgyá ngɔ́’ pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn lʉ’ʉ yé.
en: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwaa tó menò mie é la gÿo fʉ̀’e Noá gíŋe ńgÿo.
en: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ó, epʉ̀a mesoŋ ně ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm, ńnúu melù’, ńně ńdɔ́ɔn ndá, ńnáa púɔ pɔ́b lɔ́ɔn ndá, tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ gie Noá la kúu tsɛ̀ɛ páŋ. Ntse kwɔ́’ ḿbú ḿbyága wɔ́b metsèm.
en: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gíŋe gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ menò mie é la gÿo nà fʉ̀’e Lod: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ la ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ, ńnúu, ńně ńjúu, ńně sẅiŋe, ńně ḿbye shúm, ńně ńkwɛ́ɛ mendá.
en: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;

ngiemboon: Tà ńdá’ ńkúu nà lyɛ̌’ gie Lod la fó tÿǒsoŋo Sodom tà ńkẅɛ. E Ssé fóo tÿǒ lepwó, ńtúm mbʉ̀ŋ mmɔ̌g pâ*mekʉ̀a, é pú ḿbyága lá’ tà á mag.
en: but the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyedthemall.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá nò gie á ge lá’ gíŋe gÿo pʉ̀a, á nà lyɛ̌’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ vege vege tó.
en: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ó, nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà tetʉ́a gie áa ntsɔ̀’ ndá le fó wó sẅɛ́’ ngie à ge píi mmó tá kÿo wɔ́. Nyìŋ gẅie aa nká’ le mbʉ̀a yé piŋ.
en: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte nzwě Lod.
en: Remember Lot's wife.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo fà’a lépɔ́ɔn we le gwɔ́, à ge gÿo pyé, nyìŋ gẅie à zẅiŋé lépyé, yé zɔ gÿo ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.

ngiemboon: Oon mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lêtsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ áyɛ̌, ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a nuŋé kǔ mépʉ́a, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ tà’ nyìŋ gʉa nyé wetsɔ̌,
en: I tell you, in that night there shall be twomenin one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie pànzwě mépʉ́a ne ńgwɔ’ɔ ngesáŋ lùŋo ńkẅéte, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ tà’ gʉa, é nyé wetsɔ̌,
en: Twowomenshall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: [ńgwɔ́ gie mbàŋa ée nká’ yépʉ́a, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ tà’ gʉa, é nyé wetsɔ̌].
en: Twomenshall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké ńzɛ́te yé ngie, Andè, yɔɔn ntí nò ge lá’ gÿo nzɔ̌ jʉ’? Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Apfó mmó ge gÿo gwɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, megúm cú’te jʉ’ó.
en: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them,Wheresoever the bodyis, thither will the eagles be gathered together.

ngiemboon: Yěsô saga tsɔ́ nò, ńdɔg ńda’te mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé pà’ á poŋo lésẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm té kʉ́a.
en: And he spake a parable unto themto this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

ngiemboon: Ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ ntsɔ́’te mentsaŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, à tè Ssé pɔ́g, ḿbiŋ tè líe nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: saying,There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mpfɔ̌g manzwě gíŋ ńgwɔ́ yé wó, ńnéŋe ńtóo fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńgɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Ŋag yɔ̀ɔn ntsaŋ, éfege wég ngàŋ mbù wɔ̀ɔn.
en: and there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

ngiemboon: Ńké ńdá’a ńgwáa ńtóo tǒ à tě ńdíe yé wɔ́, tà fó lyɛ̌’ ńkwaŋa ntʉ́m ye ngie: Mèŋ, n tè Ssé pɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ńké tè líe tsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́,
en: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

ngiemboon: tá, manzwě wɔɔn la lá’ ńzye lépége wɔ̀ɔn tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mèŋ n ge zá’ ntsaŋ ye, á le gíŋe ńgwá ńtó, ńcú’u twó yɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó mǒ ngie: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’ gí nò gie ntsɔ́’te ntsaŋ wɔɔn gɔ̌ɔn, tá ńgwɔ́ tè pɔ̌g Ssé.
en: And the Lord said,Hear what the unjust judge saith.

ngiemboon: Tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ nà Ssé? Á ge gǎ tá á le lwo ńtó ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńdɔg ńgÿo pé wɔ́? Tá pɔ́ ne ńdʉa ńtóŋo yé fʉ̀’e zsǒ pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’?
en: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, à tè láté létó ńkẅéte wɔ́b gwɔ́. Tá’, tà á pá’ɔɔn,*Míŋ Nyìŋ gÿo ńgwaa tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńgyá pʉ̀a mesoŋ ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé?
en: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ saga tsɔ́ nò ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ zɔ̌ gÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ḿbiŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwága petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwǎg,
en: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a lá’ ḿbʉʉ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé lésẅíŋte Ssé, tà’ gwɔ́ nyìŋ nà nùɔ pà*farisay, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ nkẅè ncùb pà*Roma.
en: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ*farisay kúu wó, ńtyé mángyɛ̌ ńně sẅíŋte Ssé ngie: E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n nǎ ndǎg mbwo gù tɛ’, ńtí pá’ ɔ̀ la gÿo mèŋ n tè gwɔ́ pá’ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ ée metsǒŋ, pɔ́ té gÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ ne ńkwòŋo wɔ́, éfʉte mezwě pɔ́b, mèŋ n nǎ ndǎg mbwo gù, mélà’mie mèŋ n tè pá’ nkẅè ncùb pà*Roma ŋwɛ́ wɔ́.
en: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other menare, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gee ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńzɔ́gɔ nzyè ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a nà ngàba lá’, ńgíŋe ńgabte shúm sɔ́ɔn nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwo gù.
en: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

ngiemboon: Ankẅè ncùb ŋwɛ̌ tyé yé pɔ́ taa nzèm, éfó tè ku’u lépʉ’ʉ twó yé ńdíe tÿǒ wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ sɔbɔ twó yé ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé yɔɔn, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n deen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much ashiseyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’a twó yɔɔn nò ngie: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, wɔ̀ɔn nkẅè ncùb la gwaa piŋ lê ndá yé, e Ssé tè nyé ne ńda’a yé wɔ́. Tá, ńké ńgʉa ná nyìŋ pà*farisay wɛ̌, e Ssé ké ne ńdá’a yé la’. Áa pú’u, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋá’te nnɛ́, mbà mé ge sẅé’e yé náa ssé, ésẅé’e nnɛ́, mbà Ssé ge pʉ’ʉ yé tÿɔ́g tÿɔg.
en: I tell you, this man went down to his house justifiedratherthan the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo ńdɔg mbɔɔ púɔ mepÿɛ́, ńtóo mvfò Yěsô légwɔ́ gie à ge záb mbwo twó pɔ́b,*ngàŋa kwò yé gyá ńne ńtɔ́’ɔ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a.
en: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but whenhisdisciples sawit, they rebuked them.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tsẅi mé lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó tó. Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi nyé gígyé gubé pɔ́ tó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn, tà pi táte wɔ́b. Epʉ̀a pie ée pá’ gubé zɔ̌ gẅiin nò nà*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: But Jesus called themunto him, and said,Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn tè cʉ́’ pá’ mûɔ mémúɔ, ńzẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a yé wɔ́, mbà pɔ́ Ssé téen ńdá’a ńteme nò wɔ́, ńzẅíŋ*lefùɔ Ssé pá’ mûɔ wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ à tè ku’u lé lá’ ńkúu nà nò lefùɔ ŋwɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ńkěm pà Yuda tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà we mbòŋo, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì?
en: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn le nyìŋ mbòŋo mélà’a kɔ́? É té ndà’ Ssé wɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ nyìŋ mbòŋo tè wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Why callest thou me good? noneisgood, save one,that is, God.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè ne ḿmoŋe mbʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́, e Ssé la záb ngie: Tè gÿo gÿɛ́, tè zẅé nyìŋ, tè jʉ, tè tÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ, ná mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù
en: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà fó pá’ n dà nyé mûɔ shùm, mèŋ n gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ ku’té ntsèm.
en: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zẅí’te tà ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tà’a mmó kě ńnyé ńzága mbwo ɔ̀. Gʉa sẅiŋ shúm shú ntsèm, ńgab nkáb mbwo pàtèmmó, ńdeen ńké ńdá’ ńgẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tÿǒ lepwó, gʉa ńgÿo pú’u, ḿbiŋ ńtó ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him,Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

ngiemboon: Á jú’, eshÿó wé sẅɛ́’, mélà’mie à la gẅiin shúm nkáb tɛ’.
en: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie eshÿó wé lɔ̌g sẅɛ́’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Á pú ńtʉ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó zẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said,How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

ngiemboon: Á zeŋe mbwo shÿóon léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwóŋ lesyɛ’ɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ńjú’u yɔɔn nò gɔɔn ngie: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: And they that hearditsaid, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Anò gie á cʉa pʉ̀a mesoŋ, á té Ssé cʉa.
en: And he said,The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tà peg léen ńnyé yég kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn lá.
en: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńnyé ndá ye, ńnyé nzwě we, ńnyé méfɛ̌ pé, ńnyé tá we pɔ́ má we, ńgwá’ gubé yé, ńtí léfùɔ Ssé,
en: And he said unto them,Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,

ngiemboon: mbà ngàŋ ge zso pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn gíŋe gẅiin sɛ̌ shúm tà tɔ́g sie à ka nyě, é lá’ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, é gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fâg*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, pâ pɔ̌ tyé, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi jú’ mboŋó, pege ee mánzsè ńne ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem pá’ɔɔn, é kúu wó, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie*pàntsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e ńtí*Míŋ Nyìŋ wɔ́ à pumte.
en: Then he tookunto himthe twelve, and said unto them,Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

ngiemboon: Mé ge zɔɔn kúu wó, ésẅiŋe yé mbwo pàtè zsě Ssé pie pɔ́ sá’a lá’ yɔɔn, pɔ́ zoonte yé, ńtém shʉ́ ná ye, ńtsɔg métyé ná ye,
en: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:

ngiemboon: é lɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn cúa yé, é gÿo mé zẅé yé, à piŋ ńzíme nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: and they shall scourgehim, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn,*ngàŋa kwò yé pú tè jú’u tsɔ́ mmó nà nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́, ashwóŋè yé ké ńtebe wɔ́b tebe, pɔ́ té jú’u nò gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn mboŋó wɔ́.
en: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ne ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Yériko, atsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè ńne ńdúɔ ndúɔ,
en: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

ngiemboon: ńjú’ pá’ alá’ ne ńzẅɛ́ɛ shwǒŋ ńcʉa, ńzɛ́te pʉ̀a ngie: Áa kɔ́?
en: and hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd gẅie à cʉa.
en: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye léga’te lê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Yěsô nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn.
en: And he cried, saying, Jesus,thouSon of David, have mercy on me.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é ke ńgwɔ́ mvfò ńgiŋe, ne ńkaga yé ngie à láŋte. Tá á fó ḿmege ńná ngyè ye tÿǒ ngie: Yěsô, nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd tsɔ́ɔn meziŋe mɔ́ɔn.
en: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more,ThouSon of David, have mercy on me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tyé ńtsẅi ngie mé lɔgɔ yé ńtó ńná né yé, á tó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie:
en: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tsɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ ná gù? Afʉ̀ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, mèŋ n tsɔɔn légíŋe ńgyá jʉ’.
en: saying,What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee?And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ lá, gyá jʉ’!
en: And Jesus said unto him,Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

ngiemboon: Fʉ̀ ŋwɛ́ gwoon ńgíŋe ńgyá jʉ’, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô, ńgiŋe ńgu’te Ssé, alá’ gyá yɔɔn nò, ńgwóon ńzye lé pú ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they sawit, gave praise unto God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu Yériko, ńně ńzyɛ́’ɛ tÿǒsoŋ,
en: AndJesusentered and passed through Jericho.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kẅɛ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Sakîo, á gwɔ́ tá ndá pàkẅé ncùb pà*Roma, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó tɛ’.
en: And, behold,there wasa man named Zacchæus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

ngiemboon: Á kẅɛ pú’u, ńně fá’a légyá yé nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa wɛ̌, tá à tè ne ńgyá shÿó wɔ́, mélà’mie à laa tetu’u nyìŋ, alá’ piŋ ńgwɔ́ nzèm Yěsô tɛ’.
en: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.

ngiemboon: Á kÿote ńgʉa mvfò, á nà shÿó gẅie Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn nge cʉa mǒ, ńkwɔ́’ ńzébe nà tsɔ́ tÿǒ, ḿbyɛ́b pá’ à ge gwaa cʉa à gyá yé.
en: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass thatway.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ó, ḿbʉ’ʉ twó yé ńdíe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Lwo sẅɛ́’ me Sakîo, á poŋ ngie, n dá’ pɔ́ ndá gù lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him,Zacchæus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.

ngiemboon: Sakîo gwôon sẅɛ́’, ńtyé ssé, ńdɔgɔ lékág ńkúe Yěsô.
en: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la gyá pá’ pɔ́ ye gee, ńzẅɛ́te ngie: A gẅie à gee ndá nyìŋ tepòŋ ńda’a lɛ.
en: And when they sawit, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ye gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndá, Sakîo tyé mvfò ye ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ n ge gabte shúm sɔ́ɔn nzsè pʉ́a, é náa tà’ nzsè mbwo pàtèmmó, ńgwɔ́ gie n dǎ lɔgɔ gáte ńkẅé mmó nyìŋ, mbà mèŋ n ge tsɔ́’ náa mbwo ngàŋ ngʉ̀a lekùa.
en: And Zacchæus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restorehimfourfold.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé gÿǒ yɔɔn tsìŋe ndá pú ńtsẅɛ́ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mélà’mie Sakîo giŋé ńgwɔ́ yé tsɔ̌ míŋ Ábalam!
en: And Jesus said unto him,This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ la zɔɔn ńtó pɔ́ léfa’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kúu pyé, é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn nò, alá’ ne ńzẅí’te tà ńgwóon ńně ńkwaŋa ngie*lefùɔ Ssé é ge gwóon tó pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà à gʉ̌a tà ńcʉ́’ n gee pɔ́ lékúu Yerósalem. Yěsô lɔg sagá nò ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mûɔ ntɔ́’ lǎ’ ńdu ssé ńgʉa tàa túm pá’ mé ge lɔgɔ yé gÿo fùɔ ntÿɔ́’ tá à piŋ nzèm, ésá’a yé pàga lá’.
en: He said therefore,A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gʉa, ńtóŋ megàŋa fà’ pé legém, ńnáa pàga nkáb gie áa tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo wɔ̌ɔwɔ́ɔ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi cʉ́’ ńně ńtáŋa nkáb yɛ̂ tà mèŋ n dá’ ḿbiŋ,
en: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgʉa. Tá’, pà lá’ apɛ̌, lɔg pá’ pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿbʉa yé pʉa, ńtúm pʉ̀a jʉ’ gie à gee lê wó, ńgie pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie nyìŋ wɛ̂ sá’a wég wɔ́.
en: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have thismanto reign over us.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa tà ńkúu wó, mé ke ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo pɔ́ fùɔ, á piŋ nzèm fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńtóŋ megàŋa fà’ pé pie à la ná ntà metʉ̌a mbwo pɔ́b la, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge shwóŋó yé pá’ pɔ́ ka cʉ̌’ ńtáŋ tà é gwɔ́ pú’u.
en: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.

ngiemboon: Andùŋ mvfò tó, ńtyé mvfò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Zɔɔn múɔ, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà njÿó pàg legém.
en: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

ngiemboon: Áfùɔ tsɔ́’ ngie, áa mboŋ, ɔɔ ngàŋa fà’ we mbòŋo. Pá’ ɔ̀ pɔ̌ɔn múɔ mémmó mboŋó la, mèŋ n ge ná metÿǒsoŋ legém ɔ̀ ne sá’a.
en: And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè tó yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Ankwɔbɔ́, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà ńjÿó pàg sétʉ̀a.
en: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Á gʉa ná gù, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ́ gú ńgÿo ngúmnɔ́ɔn gẅie ɔ̀ ge sá’ metÿǒsoŋ méntʉ̀a.
en: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ tó ńgɔɔn ngie: Metʉ̌a, tà’a pàga nkáb gù wá wɔɔn, n da lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ ńkwɛ́ ńde’e.
en: And another came, saying, Lord, behold,here isthy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńde’e pú’u, pɔ́ mélà’mie n da ne ḿbɔ́gɔ gú pɔ̌g, ɔɔ nyìŋ ńcÿɔ́g tɛ’, ɔɔ ḿbíi mmó pɔ́ jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ kà tè wó nuŋe, ḿbiŋe ńkába mmó gie ɔ̀ kà tè pye.
en: for I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie a fa’a fa’ we tepòŋ, n ge lɔg pɔ́ ncwò ɔ́ ŋaga gú. Ɔ̀ la zsé ngie mbàŋa nò yɔ̀ɔn tʉ tɛ’, ngie mèŋ n gee ḿbíi mmó jʉ’ gie mèŋ n da tè wó nuŋe, ńtsɔ́’ɔ shúm jʉ’ gie n da tè wó pye.
en: And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee,thouwicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ la tè néŋ nkáb yɔɔn mbâŋ, á jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ge gwaa tó kẅé, apì zébe mǒ wɔ́?
en: wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó ngie: Pi gwoon yé, ńkẅé ye nkáb, ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à jÿǒ legém.
en: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and giveitto him that hath ten pounds.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoŋ ngie: Metʉ̌a, à ně ńdá’ ńgẅiin legém!
en: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkag tʉ̀ tà ńgẅiin mmó, mbà mé ge kẅi’i. Tá nyìŋ ké tè kag tʉ̀ wɔ́, mbà mé ge fóo mbwo yé kẅé mbàa méjʉ’ gẅie à gẅiin.
en: For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná megàŋ mbù pɔ́ɔn, epʉ̀a pá pie pɔ́ ka ne ńdʉ’ʉ ngie mèŋ n tè gwɔ́ fùɔ wɔb wɔ́ la, pi lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn, ńgwaa wɔ́b mvfò mèŋ.
en: But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slaythembefore me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò mbwo lá’ tà ḿmag, ńcʉa ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńně ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ne ńkúu lepàa Mbedfajé pɔ́ Mbetáni, á ngʉ̀ŋe lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, ńtúm*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a,
en: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount calledthe mountof Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ yɛ̂ gie áa mvfò pi lɛ. Pi ge kúu wó gyá múɔ nzikáse gẅie mé ně ńcʉŋ, e gwɔ́ gie nyìŋ laa mǒ ńnéŋe. Pi kyɛ́’ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: saying,Go ye into the village over againstyou; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bringhim hither.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ, nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅi ngie pi kyɛ’ɛ nzikáase yɛ mélà’akɔ́ wɔ́? Pi tsɔ́’ ngie Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loosehim? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie à tumó wɔ́b leen ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô ně shwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ megàŋ nzikáase ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn ngie: Pi kyɛ́’ɛ mûɔ nzikáase yɛ̂ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg nzikáasè ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b nkà’ ye, ńgÿo á kwɔ́’ ńnéŋe ndùmó.
en: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgee, epʉ̀a ne saŋte menzsǒ mɔ́b ndùm mánzsè, á gíŋe ndùmó.
en: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ne fóo lekwɛ́ metÿǒ olive ńcwoŋo,*ngàŋa kwò yé gie é laa nzèm ye tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lá’ zye lékág, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgu’te Ssé nà menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie pɔ́ lǎ gyá Yěsô gÿo,
en: And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;

ngiemboon: agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo yé gẅie aa tàa tÿǒ lepwó.
en: saying, Blessedbethe King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pà*farisay pie é laa yɔ́b jʉ’ó, fóo nùɔ lá’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, gÿo*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ láŋte!
en: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí: Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńdáŋte, mbà metóon ge pége jʉ’!
en: And he answered and said unto them,I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ne ńkúu Yerósalem, ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ ńzye lélʉa,
en: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,

ngiemboon: ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi pà Yerósalem, pi ee lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, pi tè ne ńzsé mmó gie ńgwɔ́ á náa gẅi mbʉ́lè wɔ́, á ké yɛ̂, mbà á lyěen menÿɔ́g pi lɛ.
en: saying,If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the thingswhich belongunto thy peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, megàŋ mbù pí tó, ńkwɛ́ nká’ ńdɔg ńkíle gẅí, éfóo meshÿó meshÿó tó nẅé’e gẅí.
en: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo tó, é gwɔ’ɔ gẅi lâ gubé gí ntsèm, é gíŋe tágte tÿǒsoŋ gí tà pɔ́ le nyé tóon á gíŋe ńzɛ́be nà tsɔ̌ wɔ́. Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mélà’mie pi kaa zsé fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé too légÿo nò mbòŋo ná pi wɔ́.
en: and shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fóo jʉ’ó, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńzye létág pàsẅiŋ shúm,
en: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;

ngiemboon: ńně ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Ndá yɔ̀ɔn ge gÿo gwɔ́ ndá sẅíŋtè. Tá pi léen sele ńdɔg ńgÿo nkʉ̀a metsǒŋ».
en: saying unto them,It is written, My house is the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńně ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé,*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mbàa*mekěm pà Yuda ne fa’a shÿó légÿo mé zẅé yé.
en: And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,

ngiemboon: Tá fá’ shÿó kékáŋ, mélà’mie alá’ ntsèm la ne ńtéŋe letwoŋó tɛ’ ńzẅí’te nò gie Yěsô gɔɔn.
en: and could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó ńdɔgɔ ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo mbwo lá’,*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ tó.
en: And it came to pass,thaton one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came uponhimwith the elders,

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Shwóŋo wég, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ lezíŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mɔɔn menò? Kwà’ wɔ̌ zɔ tumó ɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pú’u?
en: and spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ, n ge zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò. Pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn:
en: And he answered and said unto them,I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ la túmo Jâŋ Mbabtis? E Ssé kà pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ?
en: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ńkwaŋte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pege lɔɔn ngie e Ssé zɔ la túmo yé, mbà à ge zɛ́te wégè ngie tà mélà’a kɔ́ pege la tè zẅíŋe nò gie Jâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn wɔ̂?
en: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ̌ la túmo yé, mbà lá’ ge lɔg metóon téme wégè zẅé, mélà’mie pɔ́ ée nà yɔ́b twó ńne ńzsé ngie Jâŋ laa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.

ngiemboon: Ńkwaŋ pá’ɔɔn, ńcʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ kaa zsé.
en: And they answered, that they could not tell whenceit was.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yé né pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n tè shwóŋó gẅi nyìŋ gẅie n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sé ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzye lélɔg sagá nò ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie: Atsɔ̌ ndÿò lǎ’ ńgẅiin nká’ wé, ńgʉa tsòló ḿbye metÿǒ mie mé kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛte melù’, ńdu ssé ńgee legìŋ, ńgee tóo wó ńnéŋe tɛ’.
en: Then began he to speak to the people this parable;A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e lékáb ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ gÿo ńku’, á túmo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pafa’a fa’ pe mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée nká’ ngie à gʉa ńkẅé mé mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ńdɔg ńtó. Pɔ́ nkúu wó, ńgwoon yé ńcúa, ńjwoŋo yé á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and senthimaway empty.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńtúmo wetsɔ̌, pɔ́ gíŋe wéwɛ̌ ńcúa, ńzoonte yé, ńjwoŋo yé á piŋ mbwo mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreatedhimshamefully, and senthimaway empty.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ nká’ gíŋe ńtúmo mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, pɔ́ gíŋe ńnéŋ mefʉ̌ŋ ná wéwɛ̌, ńjwoŋo yé.
en: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and casthimout.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nká’ leen ńké ńkwaŋte ngie: Mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ pé’e? Ńńnéŋe tà ngie: Mèŋ, n ge túmo Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mie n kwoŋo yé tɛ’. Pɔ́ ge gǎ wɔ́ gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverencehimwhen they see him.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gʉa ńkúu wó, pànyɛte melù’ gyá yé, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Njÿò ndá wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ, pege zẅé yé, ńjÿó nká’.
en: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be our's.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńzɛ́te ngie, pi gyǎ gí ngie ngàŋ nká’ ge tó gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pɔ́b?
en: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killedhim. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

ngiemboon: À ge tó gÿo mé zẅéte pɔɔn pànyɛte melù’, à cʉ́me nká’ mbwo pe mendyɛ̀’ɛ. Alá’ jú’ pá’ Yěsô cʉmé yɔɔn nò pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ ńgwɔ́ á le pɛ́’ɛ wɔ́!
en: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others.And when they heardit, they said, God forbid.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńdíe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà wɔɔn nkaŋ ŋwà’ne gẅie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ée pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́: «Tóon gẅie pàpwóon ndá la gwá’, léen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon gẅie yé zɔ pǔ ḿbi’ ndá»?
en: The same is become the head of the corner?

ngiemboon: Tóon ŋwɛ́ aa gẅie mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ ge pwɔ́’te. Á píŋ ńgwe ná nyìŋ, mbà à ge pú gwɔ’ɔ ngàŋ.
en: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

ngiemboon: Pá’*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, la jú’ yɔɔn sagá nò, ńdiŋ ngie à gɔɔn pɔ́ ne pɔ́b la, pɔ́ fa’ shÿó légwoon yé, tá ḿbɔ́g nÿɔ́g lá’.
en: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńzye légwá ḿbáte yé, ńtúm pà mánáŋ nzèm yé, tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ yɔ́b nzèm yé pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a mbòŋo, tá ne ńzẅí’te pá’ nò ge kẅɛ pɔ́ cwo ye tá mé lɔg ńgwoon yé ńnáa mbwo ngúmnɔ́ɔn pà*Roma.
en: And they watchedhim, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, peg ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńda’té pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ɔ̀ tè líe pʉ̀a pɔ́ nà shÿó wɔ́, ńda’te nò nénʉ́, pɔ́ pá’ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo pú’u.
en: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the personof any, but teachest the way of God truly:

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég:*Lepʉ̌ ségè ée pé’e ńzẅíŋ ngie pege má’ ncùb Kása pà*Roma kà ngǎŋ?
en: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Cæsar, or no?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pɔ́ zẅí’i pɔ́ ncwò we, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them,Why tempt ye me?

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn pàga nkáb. Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ̌ gẅie ée nà nkáb? Sɔɔn é gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie ée we Kása, lezíŋ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé.
en: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it?They answered and said, Cæsar's.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, pi náa mmó gie áa ye Kása mbwo Kása, ńnáa ye Ssé mbwo Ssé.
en: And he said unto them,Render therefore unto Cæsar the things which be Cæsar's, and unto God the things which be God's.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à tsɔ̌’ pú’u, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ té gyá tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ nà shwóŋó gie à gɔ̌ɔn mbwo lá’ gwɔ́, ńdáŋte.
en: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ná nùɔ pà*sadukay leen ńké ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, pà*sadukay ée pʉ̀a pie é té zẅíŋ ngie mepfó ge gÿo zíme nà legwé wɔ́.
en: Then came tohimcertain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsítsà, Mǒsê la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ ségè ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbà fɛ́ we gẅiin lésɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, pɔ́ yé zyé pènkʉ́ ńdɔg nuŋe ngẅɛ̀ fɛ́ awɛ̌.
en: saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég: Etsɔ́ mefɛ́ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ndùŋ mvfò zɔ́’, ńgÿo ńkwé té cʉa mmó.
en: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé té cʉa mmó.
en: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gíŋe sɔ́gɔ mpfɔ̌g wa, ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó. Pɔ́ pú’u, tà pɔ́b sɔɔn mbʉ́a pu ńzɔ́’ɔ wɛ̌ manzwě, ńké ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó.
en: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zsote manzwě kwé yé.
en: Last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́b sɔɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn lɔɔn, mé ge lá’ zíme nà legwé, à gwɔ́ we wɔ̌ fʉ̀’ó?
en: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbàŋa lâ pànzwě ne ńzɔ́’ɔ.
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie Ssé gyǎ ngie à ge zíme wɔ́b, pɔ́ kú yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, mbà tsɔ̌ lézɔ́’ à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó mbwo pɛ̌ mbàŋa lâ pɛ̌ pànzwě wɔ́.
en: but they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ pɔ́ té gíŋe ńgee nkwě wɔ́. Mélà’mie pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé la, ńcʉ́’ púɔ Ssé, ńtí nò gie Ssé kẅě wɔ́b mbwo legwé.
en: neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ Mǒsê la shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńda’te ngie epʉ̀a ge lá’ zíme nà legwé. Áa nà jʉ’e ŋwà’ne gie à la ŋwe’e nà nò mûɔ métÿǒ gẅie à la gyá mmɔ̌g mǒ, á tóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a le, e Ssé Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Esâg, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ́b,
en: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie, e Ssé tè Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, e Ssé ee Ssé pʉ̀a metʉ̀. Pi zsé ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm cʉa nzèm Ssé ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a metʉ̀.
en: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ pú’u, tsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê tóontè ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsítsà ɔ̀ tsɔ̌’ kwà’ mboŋó.
en: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

ngiemboon: Á fo fʉ̀’ó nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńgẅiin shÿɔ́g légíŋe ńzɛ́te yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And after that they durst not ask him anyquestion at all.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwáŋ gí ngie mé zí’i pʉ̀a ngie*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd pɛ́’ɛ̀ á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,How say they that Christ is David's son?

ngiemboon: Tóo ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó yɔ́ɔn ye tʉ̀,
en: Sit thou on my right hand,

ngiemboon: ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavíd tóŋo yé le we Ndè pá’ɔɔn,*Nzà’nkÿo piŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ ye lêkɔ́?
en: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńtsẅe ńně náa ntÿɔgɔ́ mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé, alá’ ntsèm gie á laa jʉ’ó ne ńjú’u. Á gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

ngiemboon: Pi lÿɔ́’*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê. Pɔ́ kwoŋo léma’ meshʉ̀shʉ̀a nzsǒ ńdɔg ńgwáa ńkʉ́’ʉ, ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋ ngie me tsyɛ’te wɔ́b á ndùmo gyɛ̌. Ńkú*mendá cú’tè, ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò. Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’e melínɔ́ɔn, ńnéŋé pɔ́ nà jʉ’e melÿò.
en: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;

ngiemboon: Pɔ zɔ̌ gíŋe ńdɔgɔ legyè ńkẅé shúm mepfɔ̌g, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te Ssé, ńdɔgɔ légɔɔn nò á sag ḿbaba menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a. E Ssé ge lá’ záb yɔb ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ e tʉ tɛ’.
en: which devour widows' houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ésele nnɛ́ ńně ńnáŋte jʉ’, ńgyá pá’ megàŋa mmó ne ńnéŋe shúm pwɔ́’ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie mé ńnéŋe shúm pwɔ́’ wó.
en: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.

ngiemboon: Ńgyá tsɔ̌ mpfɔ́g manzwě, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ tó yé, ńnéŋ pà tà’ ndólà mépʉ́a pie é té tsɔ́ mmó ku’.
en: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àmpfɔ̌g manzwě wɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ, něŋ nkáb, ńcʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: And he said,Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gwaa néŋ nkáb lɔg gÿo sɔ́b shúm pwɔ́’ é gwɔ́ metwó nkáb mɔ́b. Tá ńgʉa ná ye, à tsɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbóŋ tá’, à něŋ wé ndà’a mmó gẅie á ke ńgẅiin lélɔg ńjú sé shúm.
en: for all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé ńnéŋe tà ńdíe*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńne ńgɔ’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Á té poŋ lá, gyá tsɔ̌ ntí metóon mbòŋo mie mé la lɔg ńkwɛ́, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ ntí shúm mbòŋo sie mé la ná mé lɔg ńkẅiŋ! Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie:
en: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,

ngiemboon: Tà pi gyá pɔ́ pá’ á poŋo lɛ, atsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, mé pú ńtág, tà tóon le gíŋe ńzébe nà wetsɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: As forthese things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, yɔɔn nò ge lá’ gÿo síŋe? Mé lɔgɔ kɔ́ tá ńzsé ngie yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ ne ńku’u?
en: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what signwill there bewhen these things shall come to pass?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉʉ gẅí. Á nue pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge gÿo tÿɔ́g lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn mvfò, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ gɔɔn ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo, afʉ̀’ ku’ú. Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, tà pi mɔ́ɔn tà ńcʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b.
en: And he said,Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I amChrist; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.

ngiemboon: Pi lá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńjú’ mé ne ńgɔɔn nò nà mencù mie é kẅɛɛ, kà pɔ́ ná và’ gie á selé ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ gwɔ́, tà pi cÿɔ’. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie sɛ̌ shúm vɔg ńcʉate, tá á lě ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie njÿó gwǒon ḿmag wɔ́.
en: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the endisnot by and by.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Alá’ ge lá’ lu ssé lÿɔ́’ɔ yetsɔ́, afùɔ túm lu ssé ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌.
en: Then said he unto them,Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:

ngiemboon: Tsetsá’ ge lá’ pú cʉ’ʉ nà mejʉ’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, gwá’a pɔ́ gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ mepàg ngwòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Mentʉ̀ menò gÿo, éshúm sie mé ge gyá cÿɔ’ cÿɔ’ kẅɛɛ lefaŋ.
en: and great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò ge zɔɔn lá’ gwaa tó, pi vɔg ńgyá mé gwoon gẅí, ńnyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’, ésẅiŋe gẅí, mé ŋaga gẅi*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, ńnéŋe gẅi tsǎŋ. Mé ge lá’ ŋaga gẅi á mvfò mefùɔ pâ pàngúmnɔ́ɔn, mélà’mie pi jǔ’ ncwò wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecuteyou, deliveringyouup to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Tá à leen ńké ńcʉa pú’u, ńdɔg náa gẅi shÿó léshwóŋó nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tʉ́ njÿó ḿmÿɔg ngie pi ge lá’ kúu jʉ’ʉ ntsàŋ é zoŋo twó gí lêkɔ́ wɔ́?
en: Settleittherefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔ ge zɔɔn lá’ náa zsé nò gie pi ge lɔg tsɔ́’ɔ nò. Pi tsɔ́’ɔ nò tà megàŋ mbù pí le zoŋ, é ké le gíŋe tsɔ́ nò ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ pʉ̀a pí ge lá’ zába nò ná pi, mbɔɔ kwà’ metá pí pâ memá pí, tà mbɔɔ mefɛ́ pí, pâ pʉ̀a pie é tswé’e gẅí, mbɔɔ meshǔ pí. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ gẅi ńgʉa, mé ŋaga gẅí, ńzẅéte pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; andsomeof you shall they cause to be put to death.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn.
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tsɔ̌ tà’ noŋ ké letsɔ́’ɔ twó pi tà ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.

ngiemboon: Pi shÿɔg shÿɔg, ńgÿo ńgẅiin légwɔ́ tèmì.
en: In your patience possess ye your souls.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá pà lÿɔ́’ ncù tó ńzéme Yerósalem tà ḿbume, pi zsé ngie fʉ̀’ gie mé ge tágte tÿǒsoŋ ne ńku’u.
en: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ó la, á poŋ ngie pʉ̀a pie ée Jẅidea kÿo ńdɔg ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ ńgʉa ńdyeen, pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem fó wó ńkẅɛ, epʉ̀a pie ée tsẅɛ pɔ́ɔn légíŋ ḿbiŋ nzèm lê tÿǒsoŋ.
en: Then let them which are in Judæa flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pʉ̀a Yerósalem. Menò mie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé lɔgɔ ḿbumte.
en: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Yee ngɔ́’ le! Tà pànzwě pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbɔɔ pie é ge lá’ ne nóŋe púɔ mepÿɛ́ nà mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ ge lá’ gwá’a lá? E Ssé ge lá’ gyáŋa lóŋ ná pʉ̀a lá’ yɔɔn. Pʉ̀a metsèm gyá kwà’ máamáa ngʉ̀ngʉ̀.
en: But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days! for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔg menně ncù ńgwa pʉ̀a, ńgwoon petsɔ́, ésaa melá’ melá’ pɔ́ cʉ́’ menkwɔ̀ɔn. Yɔɔn ee ntí gie pʉ̀a melá’ mie é té Ssé zsé ge lá’ pú tágte Yerósalem pú’u, é nẅé’e pʉ̀a wó tà yɔ́b fʉ̀’ lá’ ḿmag.
en: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, mé gyá meliŋé kẅɛɛ ná nèm, ńkẅɛɛ ná saŋ mbɔɔ nà mecÿɔ́’saŋ. Ntse té pàa pʉe, ḿbú ńcu’ tà pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ vege ḿbú ḿbɔ́g tɛ’.
en: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ tó pɔ́ ḿbɔ́gɔ mmó gie á ge tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, éshʉ́ŋ. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa lefaŋ, à pú ńtága.
en: men's hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńgyá*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn ńne ńtóo, ńgẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g mbɔɔ máamáa metʉ̀.
en: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńzye létó, pi zẅí’te gí pɔ́ tè pɔ́g, mélà’mie afʉ̀’ gie Ssé gee kẅile gẅi ndá nkwɔ̀ɔn ne ńku’u.
en: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pu’u, ésag ngie: Pi líe tÿǒ tsɔ̀ɔn nzsó pâ metsɔ́ metÿǒ tá ńgyá,
en: And he spake to them a parable;Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ tà ńzye létáb, pi zsé ngie afʉ̀’e lùm ne ńtóo.
en: when they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, pi la’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá mɔɔn menò zye lécʉate, pi zsé ngie afʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge nyɛ*lefùɔ sé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ne ńku’u.
en: So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi, kwà’ nénʉ́, pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn té nge lá’ kwéte tà mag té gwɔ́ gie mɔɔn menò tsèm tǒ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag, tá shwóŋó yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí nà lecʉ’ʉ́ ńzɔ́gɔ ḿpfɛ́ɛ pɔ́ shúm, ńnúu melù’ tà ḿbʉ́a, ḿmÿɔgɔ menò nzsè nzsè, ḿbɔ́g legyè sí lépyé, lyɛ̌’ɛ́ lá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwaa tó, pi le ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ yé wɔ́,
en: And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, andsothat day come upon you unawares.

ngiemboon: á gwɔ́ mbwo pi pá’ lejÿɔ’ la. Pi zsé ngie menò yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’ ge lá’ vege vege gwoon pʉ̀a metsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ntsèm.
en: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lélyé, ńně sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, à náa gẅi tʉ̀ lélɔg ńtsẅɛ́menò ŋwɛ́ mie é ne ńtóo, mbɔɔ lélɔg ńtyé mvfò Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, ńgee ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sie mé tóŋo le lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, éfa’a jʉ’, ńdá’a wó.
en: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is calledthe mountof Olives.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gwaa ye e lʉa lʉ̌a, alá’ ntsèm mʉ́ mbà’a mbà’, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á lejʉ̌ŋ Yěsô lé jú’u shwóŋò yé.
en: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn pà Yuda gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le*Páskà gÿo ne ńku’u, ńdɔgɔ ńzye ngàb gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ tsɔ̌ ntí mbelég té*mvòŋ.
en: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne fa’a shÿó légÿo mé zẅé Yěsô, tá ne ḿbɔ́gɔ nÿɔ́g lá’.
en: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

ngiemboon: Sátà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m Jẅidas, á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, gẅie setsɔ́ lezíŋ sé laa le Iskariod.
en: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgʉa ńgyá*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pàtyé mvfò nà lepyɛ̌b ndá Ssé, pâ pɔ̌ kwaŋte pá’ à ge gÿo tá sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.

ngiemboon: Á pú ḿboŋo wɔ́b, tà pɔ́ zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ ge ná nkáb mbwo ye.
en: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

ngiemboon: Á zẅíŋ, ńgwóon ńzye léfa’ shÿó pá’ à ge sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b tà lá’ le zsé.
en: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́*Páskà ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńtó, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgwaa púɔ*njʉ̀njÿò línɔ́ɔn.
en: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô túmo Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ńcwoŋte ségè shúm*Páskà.
en: And he sent Peter and John, saying,Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ kwǒŋ ngie: Peg gʉa nzɔ̌ ńcwoŋte?
en: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi jú’ mboŋó, pi ge gʉa tà kúu tÿǒsoŋ, é gyá mámbàŋa gẅiin tÿóon ntse, pi cʉ́me nzèm ye, tà á kúu ndá pi kú gí.
en: And he said unto them,Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.

ngiemboon: É gɔɔn né ngàŋ ndá ngie: Tsítsà gɔ̌ɔn ngie peg zɛ́te gú ngie lûm ndá gẅie pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ge jÿó*Páskà wó aa wɛ̌ wɔ́?
en: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

ngiemboon: À ge nyɛɛ gẅi máamáa lûm ndá ná ndêg we tÿǒ, tà mbà mé ně ńdá’ ńtáŋte mboŋó, áa jʉ’ gie pi ge cwoŋte ségè shúm línɔ́ɔn wó.
en: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgyá akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô shwóŋó wɔ́b. Pɔ́ cwoŋte shúm léjÿó*Páskà jʉ’ó.
en: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gÿo ńku’, Yěsô pâ ngàŋ ntúm wé tó ńnéŋe ssé,
en: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

ngiemboon: ńně ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: N ka kě ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ pá’ pege ge pú jÿó wɔɔn*Páskà tá mèŋ n gyá ngɔ́’.
en: And he said unto them,With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mboŋó: N tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńjÿó tsɔ̌*Páskà wɔ́, tà lá’ kú fʉ̀’ gie anò yɔɔn línɔ́ɔn pumté, tà Ssé zɔ̌ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a njÿó.
en: for I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: À la shwóŋó wɔ́b pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńkaa ntú’ melù’, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńgɔ́ɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kɔ ntú’ yɔɔn ḿbú ńnú tà maga gẅí.
en: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said,Take this, and divideitamong yourselves:

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mèŋ, n tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńnúu melù’ wɔ́ tà lá’ kú fʉ̀’ gie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a njÿó.
en: for I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ḿbí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’ ńgwaa náa mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Yɔɔn ee mbùm nnɛ́ yɔɔn [mie mé nǎ nà twó sí. Pi cʉ́’ ne ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn ńdɔ́gɔ ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brakeit, and gave unto them, saying,This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la pfɛ́ shúm léjÿó tà ḿmag, Yěsô kaa ntú’ melù’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Ntú’ yɔɔn ee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kʉa sẅé gie e Ssé lɔgɔ metse mɔ́ɔn ńgwaa. E pfɛte ńtí gẅí].
en: Likewise also the cup after supper, saying,This cupisthe new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie à ge sẅǐŋ mèŋ gwɔ́ jʉ́’ɔɔn tà peg yé ne ńteme ńjÿó mmó.
en: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth meiswith me on the table.

ngiemboon: Áa nò ngie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge kwé pá’ Ssé la lá’ ńzáb, tá’ ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à ge tsege yé ná mé zẅé yé.
en: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Awɔ̌ aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nùɔ pɔ́b ńku’u léfʉ’ yɔɔn ntí nò wɔ́?
en: And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńzye lézoŋo nò, éfa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò.
en: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi giŋé ńzsé gí ngie mefùɔ pà tè zsě Ssé ne sá’a melá’ mɔ́b, ńnɔ’ pʉ̀a, ńké ńkwoŋ pɔ́ ngie me tóŋo wɔ́b le pàgÿo nò mbòŋo.
en: And he said unto them,The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tà pi fʉ’ʉ wɔ́b. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńgwɔ́ ndÿò zɔ sele ńcʉ́’ʉ menkʉ́, nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ ńtyé mvfò pi, ésá’a gẅí, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ngàŋa fà’ gẅi la.
en: But yeshallnotbeso: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn: Á gʉ́a ná nyìŋ gẅie á neŋé Ssé ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńdɔ́ɔn ńkaa ńtÿɔ́g pé’e, awɔ̌ gwɔ́ ndÿò? Nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ssé ḿpfɛ́ɛ zɔ tè ndÿò wá? Tá’, mèŋ n kě ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a mbwo pi.
en: For whetherisgreater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth?isnot he that sitteth at meat? but I am among you as he that serveth.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔɔn zɔ kà ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ nà fʉ̀’ʉ ngɔ́’ yɔ́ɔn.
en: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn léen ńná lefùɔ né mèŋ la, n ge lá’ ná sí lefùɔ.
en: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ Fùɔ la, pege tem shúm ḿpfɛ́, ńnú, pi piŋ ńnéŋe nà melʉŋe lefùɔ, ńŋag ngẅɛ̀ ndá Israel ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn mbwo Piɛ ngie: Símo, Símo, Sátà ně ńdá’ ńdúɔ léta’a gẅi métsèm ńtyɛ́te, pá’ mé tá’a mekú ńtyɛ́te la.
en: And the Lord said,Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desiredto haveyou, that he may siftyouas wheat:

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n ně sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó ɔ́, légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ tè pú kʉ́a kʉ́a nà lezǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́. Ɔ̀ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbiŋe nzèm mèŋ, ɔ̀ ne ńnéŋe ntʉ́m mefɛ́ pú.
en: but I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lekǔ tsǎŋ, mbà aa pɔgɔ, ńtó fó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ legwé, mbà aa pɔgɔ.
en: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Piɛ, tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gú: Mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ lêtsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.
en: And he said,I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi kímte fʉ̀’ gie n da túmo gẅi ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, pi la gʉa té mûɔ pɔ̀ɔn, té pɔ̀ɔn lyɛb, té melɔ̌ɔn, pi ké ńtsẅé ńgiŋe pé’e, ńdá’ ńzága kɔ́? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ, ammó la tè zág.
en: And he said unto them,When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing?And they said, Nothing.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kubé tà nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin mûɔ pɔ̀ɔn nkáb we, á pí, ńgẅiin pɔ̀ɔn lyɛb yé, á lyɛb. Nyìŋ gẅie à tè nně ncù gẅiin, à sẅiŋ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye ńdɔg ńjú ye.
en: Then said he unto them,But now, he that hath a purse, let him takeit, and likewisehisscrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, anò gie mé la ŋwé’e ńtí wɔ̀ɔn ne ńgee mbumté. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Mé ge lá’ sáŋa yé nùɔ mefÿɛ́. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ ké ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńzye zye lépumte.
en: For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Andè, menně ncù mɔɔn ssé mémbʉ́a. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi nyé pɛ́’ɛ.
en: And they said, Lord, behold, herearetwo swords. And he said unto them,It is enough.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅɛ, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa ne ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, pá’ à laa mà mbwo ye.
en: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu wó, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lé kwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò,
en: And when he was at the place, he said unto them,Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńnyé wɔ́b ńgíŋ ńtyé lema’á tóon, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te ssé, ńně sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgyá, ɔ̀ pe’e yɔɔn ngɔ́’ gie, e ne ńtóo ná mèŋ lɔɔn. Tá’, mèŋ n tě ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn lekwoŋ wɔ́. Gÿo pɔ́ gù lekwoŋ. [
en: saying,Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tó ńne ńtóonte yé
en: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

ngiemboon: Legwé ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ yé, á ńkẅi’i sẅíŋte Ssé ńnéŋe twó, tà zì’i cʉ́’ʉ ńkẅɛɛ ná yé, ńcʉ́mte ssé ńgwá’a mekɔ̌ɔn metse la].
en: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

ngiemboon: Esẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbʉ́’ʉ nnɛ́, ḿbiŋ nê lejʉ́ŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgwɔ tó, mbà pɔ́ mÿɔ̌g tà ńkʉ́a ńdyéte.
en: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi ńnéŋe té lyé, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò.
en: and said unto them,Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

ngiemboon: À la nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, anùɔ lá’ tó, tà Jẅidas gẅie à laa tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém gwɔ́ mvfò, ńtsóte nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńtáŋte yé, ńtsyɛ’te yé.
en: And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Jẅidas, ɔ̀ ge lɔg pɔ́ tsyɛ̀’te tá tsege*Míŋ Nyìŋ ka?
en: But Jesus said unto him,Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gie é laa lejʉ́ŋ yé gyá mmó gie á gee ncʉ̌a, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, peg lɔg menně ńdÿɔ́’ɔ?
en: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb gwoon soŋ nně lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa fà’*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, é kẅɛ́te letuŋó sé se gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀, ńjúɔ.
en: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô kaga yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi tsẅé jʉ’, á kǔ’ pɛ́’ɛ, ńdeen ńzába pwó yé nà letuŋó, á sẅéte.
en: And Jesus answered and said,Suffer ye thus far.And he touched his ear, and healed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo*mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ metándá pàpyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé pâ mekemé lá’ pie pɔ́ tǒ légwoon yé ngie: Pi gwaa tó gwoon wɔ̀ɔn, ńgẅiin menně ncù lâ mekésiŋ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi ge ńgwoon ntsǒŋ pá’ɔɔn lêkɔ́?
en: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him,Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?

ngiemboon: Mbà mèŋ n kaa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńké ńně ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, pi ké tè fa’a légwoon wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Tá’, agí fʉ̀’ yɔɔn, mbà á léen ńké ńku’, ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie afùɔ menò nzěm tǒ tà ne sá’a lá’ yé.
en: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwoon yé ńdɔg ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, Piɛ zse nzèm yɔb, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a.
en: Then took they him, and ledhim, and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, mé nyɛte mmɔ̌g soŋ tetʉ́a ńně ńzɔ́gɔ. Piɛ tó yé ńnéŋe nùɔ pɔ́b.
en: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ múɔ manzwě gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn fa’a mbʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ ńnéŋe tà mmɔ̌g kyɛ’ jʉ’, á liŋe Piɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie mé gwǒon yé lɛ, pɔ́ nyìŋ wɔ̀ɔn ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ.
en: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lʉ’, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Manzwě wɛ, mèŋ n tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́!
en: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwaa cʉa méjʉ’, tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa líe yé yé tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔɔ jú tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb. Piɛ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo ngàŋ ngie: Ambàŋa wa! Ngǎŋ, á té nò wɔ́.
en: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.

ngiemboon: Mé ná’a ńnéŋe, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ gɔɔn yé tà ńkʉa ngie: Á té nò fa’ fa’ wɔ́, pɔ́ nyìŋ wɛ ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ, pi zɔɔn ńgyá pá’ aa nyìŋ Galilea pá’ yé.
en: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth thisfellowalso was with him: for he is a Galilæan.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ambàŋa wa! Mèŋ n kaa zsé nò gie ɔɔ pɛ́’ɛ ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́. Piɛ nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ḿma’a léjÿɔ́g ńdíe yé, e nÿɔ́g mɔ́b yé pumte. Piɛ leen ńgwóon ńkímte nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mênkɔ́’ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.
en: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

ngiemboon: Piɛ fóo tetʉ́a ńkẅɛ, ḿbú ńdʉa tɛ’.
en: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kú’te Yěsô la ne ńcúa yé, ńně ńzoonte yé.
en: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smotehim.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋ ńkwɛ́ shÿó wé, ńně ńcúa yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Keme nyìŋ gẅie à cǔɔ gú.
en: And when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ laa pú’u, ńgíŋ ně ńkẅi’i ńnege yé.
en: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńdʉ́a, melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ pâ*mentá ndá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, mbɔɔ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê cú’te, ńtsẅí mé lɔ́gɔ Yěsô ńtóo mvfò pɔ́b.
en: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo, ɔ̀ shwóŋó wég. Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi pi é le zẅíŋ,
en: Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them,If I tell you, ye will not believe:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te gẅi nò, pi é le tsɔ́’.
en: and if I also askyou, ye will not answer me, nor letmego.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’ pá’ Ssé ngàŋ metʉ̀ ntsèm ge ńnéŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ nà gwoŋó pwó yé ye tʉ̀.
en: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ metsèm la jú’ ńdeen ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé wɔ́? Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Á kẅɛ̌ ncwò pi, mèŋ n ge wɛ̌.
en: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them,Ye say that I am.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen sele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀, pege ké ńgíŋe fa’a tsɔ̌ nkẅè ntáŋ la? Kwà’ pege cwoŋó ńjú’u nò gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò yé.
en: And they said, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa cú’tè gɔɔn pú’u, ńdu ssé métsèm, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa nê mvfò*Pilato.
en: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

ngiemboon: Ńzye lésẅiŋe yé ngie: Peg gyǎ nyìŋ wɔɔn ne ngwá ńkʉ́’ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ wég ńcʉŋte twó lá’, ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b léma’ ncùb ntÿɔ́’, nnáa mbwo Kása pà*Roma. A giŋé ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo peg, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie aa fùɔ.
en: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found thisfellowperverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Cæsar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔɔ fùɔ pà Yuda la? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u.
en: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said,Thou sayestit.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gɔɔn mbwo*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ mbɔɔ mbwo lá’ ngie: Mèŋ n tè ne ńgyá mmó gie nyìŋ wɔɔn fʉ̌a tà ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie à gwě ntsàŋ wɔ́.
en: Then said Pilate to the chief priests andtothe people, I find no fault in this man.

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ cwoŋo ńkẅi kẅi, ńgɔɔn ngie: A ne ńgwáa ńkʉ́’ʉ ésẅite pʉ̀a ngie pɔ́ tʉʉ twó. À la zye Galilea, ńkúu Jẅidea, à gie à lɔ̌g ńtó tó tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn.
en: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.

ngiemboon: *Pilato jú’ pú’u, ńzɛ́te ngie: Aa nyìŋ Galilea wá?
en: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilæan.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie oon. Á túmo Yěsô ńná né fùɔ*Herôd, mélà’mie yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn sá’a yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ, ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà à kà tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ Yerósalem ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’.
en: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.

ngiemboon: *Herôd gyâ Yěsô, ḿbú ńkág tɛ’, mélà’mie à lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé ńjú’u mé píte menò ná ye tɛ’, á ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá yé. Á gyá yé pú’u, ńkwaŋ ngie, ndyɛ̀’ Yěsô gÿo tsɔ̌ ndàa gyá nò, à gyá.
en: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a longseason, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te yé menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, à tè tsɔ́ tsɔ́’.
en: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ḿbú ne ńzába menò twó Yěsô tɛ’.
en: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.

ngiemboon: *Herôd pâ pàmékɔ́ɔn pé zoonte Yěsô, ńnyime yé tà ńkaa nzsǒ lefùɔ éshuu ná yé, ńtúm ngie, mé gíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ḿbiŋ ńnáa mbwo*Pilato.
en: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mockedhim, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́*Pilato pɔ́*Herôd gwɔ́ lê mbù, ḿbiŋ fó lyɛ̌’ó pɔ́ cʉ́’ mesǒ.
en: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yé ńkúu wó,*Pilato tóŋ*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, mbɔɔ pàsá’a lá’ lâ lá’,
en: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ně ńgwɔ́ lɔgɔ nyìŋ wɔɔn tóo mvfò mèŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie à ne ńcʉŋte twó lá’. N ŋagá yé pɔ́ mvfò pi. N gʉ̌a nà menò mie pi ně ńgɔɔn ná yé, n tè gyá tsɔ́ mefʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examinedhimbefore you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ fùɔ*Herôd kaa mefʉ̀a ná yé gyá, tà à piŋé yé ńná né mèŋ. N dɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie nyìŋ wɔɔn kàa fʉa tsɔ́ nò, tà ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé wɔ́.
en: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
I will therefore chastise him, and releasehim.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’e línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*Pilato gẅiin lékẅile tà’ ngàŋa tsǎŋ ńnáa mbwo lá’].
en: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)

ngiemboon: Tá, alá’ zye lézẅɛɛ shwǒŋ ngie: Gÿo mé zẅé nyìŋ wɛ, ɔ̀ nyé Panepâse né peg.
en: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with thisman, and release unto us Barabbas:

ngiemboon: Panepâse ŋwɛ́ laa tsǎŋ ńtí và’ gie à la ma’a tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńtí pá’ à la zẅé nyìŋ.
en: (who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)

ngiemboon: *Pilato ne fa’a lékyɛɛ Yěsô ńnyé, tá á cʉa pú’u, á gíŋe ńgɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ gɔɔn.
en: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.

ngiemboon: Tá lá’ ntsèm ké ne ńkẅi’i ḿbége pɔ́ shwǒŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ké ńkime yé pɔ́ nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: But they cried, saying, Crucifyhim, crucify him.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gɔɔn nò ná mbɔ́ɔntè yétá ngie: Nò tepòŋ gie áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà à gÿǒ áa kɔ́? Mèŋ n kaa gyá tsɔ́ nò gie à fʉ̌a tà ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ge tsẅi mé lɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn ńcúa yé, n nyé yé à gʉa.
en: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and lethimgo.

ngiemboon: Alá’ ké ńdɔg pɔ́ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ, ńkẅi kẅi ngie mé kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, tà á cʉa*Pilato.
en: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.

ngiemboon: Á zá’ ntsàŋ pá’ lá’ ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé nyìŋ gẅie pɔ́ la ne ńzɛ́te. Á nyìŋ gẅie à la kúu tsǎŋ ńtí và’ mbɔɔ lézẅé nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńkúu ná Yěsô, ńcʉ́’ ńnáa yé né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńgÿo mmó gie pɔ́ ke ne ńkwoŋo légÿo.
en: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ Yěsô ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńgiŋ tà ḿbumte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Sirɛne, gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé lê Símo, á ne fóo nká’. Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù gwoon yé, ńdɔg tʉ̀ ńnáa tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô ngie à kaa ńdɔg ńcʉ́me nzèm.
en: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bearitafter Jesus.

ngiemboon: Alá’ laa nzèm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pànzwě gwɔ́ nùɔ ńdʉa ńtʉ́ʉ ngɔ́’ Yěsô.
en: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô giŋ tà sele nnɛ́, ńdíe wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: Anzwě we Yerósalem, tà pi lʉa wɔ̀ɔn, pi lʉa pɔ́ gí twó mbɔɔ ye gubé gí.
en: But Jesus turning unto them said,Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ne ńtóo, mie mé ge gɔɔn ngie: Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée mekǐŋ pànzwě, pá’ pɔ́ laa zɔɔn ńzyé wɔ́, mbà pɔ́ laa múɔ nóŋe.
en: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessedarethe barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà pʉ̀a tsẅi né mekwɛ́ ngie: Pi kwɔgɔ sẅɛ́ɛ wég, é tsẅi né mekwɔ’ɔ́ ngie: Pi sẅɛ́’ ḿbwoon wég.
en: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

ngiemboon: É tsɔ́ɔn lékwé pú’u, á nue mé lɔɔn ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn nà tÿǒ gie á ne ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn, mbà mé ge tó kúu nà tÿǒ gie á té ne ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn wɔ́ é gÿo lêkɔ́?
en: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa lɔgɔ Yěsô gʉa, ḿbéle metsǒŋ mépʉ́a ná ye, pá’ mé ge pú zẅé wɔ́b apɔ̌.
en: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu nà tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé lɔɔn ńtóŋo le kẅǐ twó, ńkime Yěsô nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ḿbiŋ ńkim mbɔɔ metsǒŋ pá mépʉ́a, nà mɔ́b metÿǒ nkǐ. Tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
