ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, lege mefʉ̀a mɔ́b, mélà’mie pɔ́ té ne ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ gÿo wɔ́. Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie é laa jʉ’ó ma’a tyeente tá ńdɔg ńgabte menzsǒ mé.
en: Then said Jesus,Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do.And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la tyé ńne ńdíe pá’ mé kime Yěsô. Pàsá’a lá’ ne ńzoonte Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: À la kẅé petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ncwò legwé, à gíŋe ńkẅé kwà’ yé twó, pá’ à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn tà shwóŋó nò ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la tsɔ́’.
en: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them deridedhim, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lá ne ńgíŋe ńyime yé yɔ́b, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńnáa kikíi melù’ né yé.
en: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,

ngiemboon: Ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwà’ fùɔ pà Yuda, ɔ̀ kẅé twó ɔ̀ mbwo legwé.
en: and saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e mmó, ńkime nà tÿǒ á twó Yěsô ngie: Wɔɔn aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nà metsǒŋ pie mé la pú ńkime wɔ́ba Yěsô nà metÿǒ nkǐ ne ńzoonte yé ngie: Mé gɔɔn ngie ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo pù’ ká? Kẅé twó ɔ̀ mbwo legwé, ńkẅé yég la.
en: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ jú’ pú’u, ńkaga yé ngie: Mé pǔ ńkime wégè lâ nyìŋ wɛ̂ nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ɔ̀ gyá pú’u, ɔ̀ tè Ssé pɔ́g la. Á gʉa ná pɔgɔ, mbà mé kime wɔ́gɔ́, á gwɔ́, kwà’ nénʉ́.
en: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

ngiemboon: Pɔgɔ kwé menò mɔ́gɔ. Tá ńgʉa ná yé, mbà à kaa tsɔ́ nò fʉa.
en: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

ngiemboon: Á kaga yé pú’u, ḿbiŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Yěsô, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdá’ ńtóo nà lefùɔ shú, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lélege wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gú, áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie, pé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pɔgɔ ge gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekág mvfò Ssé.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ gÿo ńku’, nèm pyé, nzěm pú síŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ntsèm tà ńkúu ná nèm tá mbÿɛ njÿó.
en: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg ńkʉŋe jʉ’ gie*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ tyé wɔ́ ndá Ssé, éshʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ, éfó tÿǒ ńkúu ssé.
en: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ńnéŋe nà tÿǒ nkǐ, tà ńga’te lê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n nyě zẅìge yɔ́ɔn, á nà mbwo mú, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́m.
en: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said,Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit:and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Tá ndá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pà*Roma jʉ’ó la pú ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie á pǔ ńcʉa, tà ye mbÿɛ̌ gwɔ́ le gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn kaa tèfʉa. Ashwóŋè yé ŋwɛ́ ná mekù’ mbwo Ssé.
en: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie é la nɔ́ɔnte ńgyá mɔɔn menò, la cʉ́’ʉ lépiŋ nzèm, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ zéme pwó.
en: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ mesǒ Yěsô, tà mbɔɔ pànzwě pie pɔ́ la fó Galilea ńcʉ́me nzèm yé la tyé pɔ́ tàa nzèm tá ńgyá mɔɔn menò.
en: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b ŋwɛ́ gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ńdúɔ pfó Yěsô mbwo yé, á zẅíŋ.
en: Thismanwent unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa, éfó nà tÿǒ nkǐ sẅé’e yé, ńdɔgɔ pwó nzsǒ ńzémte yé, ńgʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè sie mé la shʉ’ njʉŋ jʉŋ, á ná tóon kenkʉ́ŋe, tá ḿbiŋ ńnyé té ńnéŋe tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsòló.
en: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe pú’u mbÿɛ̀ njÿó Faladé, mé ne ńtaŋte nnɛ́ pá’ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b ne ńgee nzyě.
en: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě pie pâ Yěsô laa nùɔ, tà fó Galilea la zse nzèm Yesyɛ̌b tà ńkúu lesyè, ńgyá pá’ à nuŋé pfó Yěsô pú’u,
en: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ḿbiŋe tÿǒsoŋ, ńtáŋte laméndɔ́ɔn mbòŋo, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ mèvɛ lélɔg ńtáa ńzɔ́’ɔ pfó Yěsô. Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè zye, pɔ́ pʉ́le ńzẅɛte pá’*lepʉ̌ la ne ńzɛ́te.
en: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.

ngiemboon: Ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’, á nà ngàba lá’ gÿo ńgwɔ́, pànzwě ŋwɛ́ mʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ mba’ámba’, ńdɔgɔ làméndɔ́ɔn gie pɔ́ lá táŋte ńgʉa né jʉ’ʉ lesyè.
en: Now upon the firstdayof the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certainotherswith them.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà mé kà fó ncwò lesyè, ńtsó máamáa tóon gẅie à kaa wó.
en: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zyɛ́’ ńkúu tsòló, ńké tè pfó Ndè Yěsô gyá.
en: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tyé ńdíe jʉ’ é ne ńkʉ́’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwoon ńgyá pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kẅɛ, ḿma’ menzsǒ é fɔ́g tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cÿɔ’ tà ńcʉ́’ ńdíe pɔ́ ssé, tá pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi tóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ mepfó ssé, éfa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa ntentʉ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: and as they were afraid, and bowed downtheirfaces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?

ngiemboon: À cʉ’ʉ́ jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé nà legwé. Pi zɔɔn ńkímte nò gie à la ne ńgɔɔn mbwo pi fʉ̀’ gie pi lâ pɔ́ la nyé Galilea.
en: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwo pʉ̀a tepòŋ, pɔ́ kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, à zíme nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńkímte ngie, ée menò mie Yěsô la zɔɔn shwóŋó wɔ́b,
en: And they remembered his words,

ngiemboon: éfó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa ḿbú ḿbíte menò ntsèm mie é cʉ̌a, éshwóŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b yémmɔ’ɔ́ nê legém mbɔɔ mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a nà nùɔ yɔ́b.
en: and returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě ŋwɛ́ lâ Malîɛ Magdala, ńgÿo Jâne, mbɔɔ Malîɛ má pà Jâg, pâ petsɔ́ pànzwě. Pɔ́ píte menò ŋwɛ́ éshwóŋ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô.
en: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Marythe motherof James, and otherwomen that werewith them, which told these things unto the apostles.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ njÿòon la, pɔ́ té zẅíŋ.
en: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Piɛ lu ssé, ńkÿote tà ńkúu jʉ’ ye lesyè, ńŋwe’e ssé, ńgyá pɔ́ ndà’ shúm nzsǒ sie mé la lɔg ńzémte pfó Yěsô, ńgwɔ piŋ, á giŋe ńkʉ’ʉ yé, à tè ne ńzsé mmó gie á cʉ̌a wɔ́.
en: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

ngiemboon: Á la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lyɛ’ó, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a, á nà nùɔ Yěsô lu ssé Yerósalem, ńně ńgee nê tsɔ́ lá’ gie mé tóŋo le Emawẅis. Ntyě gwɔ́ pá’ mmó mekilo ntsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ nê legém.
en: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalemaboutthreescore furlongs.

ngiemboon: Ńgiŋe shwóŋe nà menò ntsèm mie é ka pǔ ńcʉa.
en: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e pɔ́ la ne shwóŋe, ńně ńzoŋo la, Yěsô lê twó yé kẅɛ́te wɔ́b mánzsè, pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgiŋe.
en: And it came to pass, that, while they communedtogetherand reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, atsɔ́ mmó táte, pɔ́ té yé liŋ.
en: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi sěen ńgiŋe ńzoŋo pɔ́ kɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀? Pɔ́ jú’ ńtyé, ḿma’ mezìŋe, éshʉ́ŋe twó.
en: And he said unto them,What manner of communicationsarethese that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pɔ́b, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Kélopàs zɛ́te yé ngie: Mânyìŋ ntsèm Yerósalem zsě mmó gie á kà gÿo Yerósalem nà melyɛ̌’ mɔɔn, tà é cʉ́’ ndà’ gú la?
en: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie akɔ́ kà gÿo? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie, peg kě ḿmɔɔn pɔ́ menò mie é kà gÿo Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd. À kaa kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé we lÿò, á nà mefà’ mé, mbɔɔ nà shwóŋè yé á mvfò Ssé mbɔɔ mvfò pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And he said unto them,What things?And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:

ngiemboon: Pá’*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pàsá’a lá’ peg ka tsege yé mbwo*Pilato ngie mé gʉa ńŋaga yé, ńzẅé yé. Mé ka leen ńké ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.

ngiemboon: Mbà peg ka ne ńkwaŋa ngie yé zɔ ge lá’ zá’ nkÿo ngɔ́’, á lóŋ Israel à tsẅɛ́. Mɔɔn menò ka gÿo, ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ sétá.
en: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.

ngiemboon: É té ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, etsɔ́ pànzwě tsetsɛ̀ɛ peg ně ńkʉ’ʉ wég. Pɔ́ ně ḿmʉ́ melém njÿó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, ńgʉa jʉ’ gie mé ka le’e yé wó,
en: Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;

ngiemboon: pɔ́ té pfó yé gyá, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋó wég ngie: Pɔ́ kǔ wó,*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé kẅɛɛ mvfò pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́!
en: and when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pég ně ńju’ pú’u, ńdu ssé, ńgíŋe ńgʉa yɔ́b lesyè, ńgyá á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pànzwě ně shwóŋó wɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ké tè Yěsô gyá.
en: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and founditeven so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gwě gígyé. Pi tè ne ńdwo ńzẅíŋe menò ntsèm mie*pàntsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwé’e wɔ́.
en: Then he said unto them,O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:

ngiemboon: Pi kaa zsé ngie, á ka ne ńzɛ́te ngie*Nzà’nkÿo vɔg ńgyá ngɔ́’ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we wɔ́ ka?
en: ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzye lékyagte menò ntsèm mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńne ńdíe yé, éshwóŋó wɔ́b, ńzye nà meŋwà’ne Mǒsê, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ me*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gʉa tà ne ńkúu lá’ gie pɔ́ mépʉ́a lɔ́ɔn ńgee wo. Pɔ́ gyá á fa’a pɔ́ pá’ à giŋé ńge giŋ tà ngʉ̀a sag.
en: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ kú’te yé, ńgie pâ pɔ̌ pú ńdá’, mélà’mie nzèm cʉ’ʉ́ síŋe sǐŋ, zà’ cʉ̌a. Á zẅíŋ pâ pɔ̌ kúu ndá gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgee nê wó.
en: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry with them.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ʉ léjÿó shúm gÿo ńku’, pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé, á pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńná né pɔ́b.
en: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessedit, and brake, and gave to them.

ngiemboon: Tá menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńké ńnyɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ liŋe yé, á gwoon ḿbyé.
en: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ sele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie á kɔ’ɔ ńgÿo tá shwóŋè yé kúte wɔ́gɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie pege kɔ’ɔ ńgwɔ́ mánzsè á ne ńkyagte nò Ssé shwóŋó wɔ́gɔ́ la!
en: And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lu ssé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńgíŋ ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, ńkẅɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ntsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ nê legém, mbà pâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Yěsô cu’té.
en: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

ngiemboon: Ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́b pú’u, pɔ́ shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Áa nénʉ́ ngie Ndè zimé nà legwé, Símo ně ńgyá yé.
en: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ḿbíte yɔ́b mmó gie pɔ́ ně ńtóo mánzsè ńgyá, ńgie pɔ́ ně ńgwaa liŋe yé, mbà à pǐ mbelég tà ne ńgaba.
en: And they told what thingswere donein the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyé shwóŋó shwoŋó, Yěsô gwóon ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsyɛ’te wɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ne pi!
en: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them,Peacebeunto you.

ngiemboon: Aléme yɔ́b tsɔ́’ɔ. Pɔ́ cÿɔ’, ńzɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie áa gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ.
en: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Aléme gí séen ńtsɔ́’ɔ tsɔ’ɔ́ mélà’a kɔ? Pi mʉ’te mʉ’té mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi líe mbwó mɔ́ɔn nê mekwò mɔ́ɔn tá ńgyá, aa kwà’ mèŋ. Pi mwoonte wɔ̀ɔn tá ńjú’, gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ té mbàb nnɛ́ gẅiin, ńké tè mekẅǐ gẅiin, pi ké ńgyá pá’, m biŋ ńgẅiin mbàb nnɛ́ nê mekẅǐ.
en: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gɔɔn ńne nyɛɛ wɔ́b mbwó mé lâ mekwò mé.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed themhishands andhisfeet.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkága tɛ’ tá’ á nyé ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b kʉ’ʉ, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie kà áa nò wɔ́? Yěsô gyá pá’ pɔ́ nyé ḿmʉ́’te mʉ’té la, ńdeen ńké ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌ jʉ’ɔɔn?
en: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them,Have ye here any meat?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fa’a kème ssó ye ntuɔ ńná né yé.
en: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

ngiemboon: Á kẅé, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b ḿpfɛ́.
en: And he tookit, and did eat before them.

ngiemboon: MÀpfɛ́ tà ḿmag, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gyá mmó gie n kɔ̌ɔn shwóŋó gẅí, á fʉ̀’ gie pege ka nyě ńzɔ́gɔ. Mèŋ n da shwóŋó gẅi ngie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie yɛ̌ kɔ́ wɔ́ gie mé la ŋwe’e ná mèŋ wɔ́ à pumte. Menò ŋwɛ́ ntsèm ntsèm ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Mǒsê, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ye*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lâ ye Mezɔ́bɔ Ntse.
en: And he said unto them,Thesearethe words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, andinthe prophets, andinthe psalms, concerning me.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńtsɔ́’ legyè sɔ́b, ńgÿo pɔ́ jú’ menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé.
en: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńgwɔ́ ngie:*Nzà’nkÿo gẅíin lé lá’ ńgyá ngɔ́’, ńkwé, tá Ssé piŋ ńzíme yé nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: and said unto them,Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé lá’ ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńgɔɔn nò Ssé mbwo lá’a lá’ ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kúbe mà we, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mé. Pú’u, é ké zye Yerósalem.
en: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ zɔ ké ńgwɔ́ pànjÿò ńgyá, á lélɔg menò ŋwɛ́ saa lá’.
en: And ye are witnesses of these things.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mèŋ n ge tó túmo mmó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn la ka’a lénáa mbwo pi. Pi ké ńzẅí’te pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ tà ńkúu fʉ̀’ gie metʉ̀ Ssé é ge fó tyǒ lepwó ésẅɛ̌’ kúu ná pi.
en: And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu Mbetáni, ńka’ mbwó ńnáa tÿǒ, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b.
en: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b pú’u, ńně ńkwɔ́’ɔ ńgee nê tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńtyé jʉ’ó ńně ńgu’te yé, tà á ku’, pɔ́ lɔgɔ lekág ḿbiŋ nzèm ne Yerósalem.
en: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńké ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

ngiemboon: Njÿó la gwɔ́ zyète, ashwóŋè gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, yé shwóŋè pɔ́ Ssé laa wó. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Ssé.
en: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

ngiemboon: Yé shwóŋè pɔ́ Ssé gwɔ́ tà fó pɔ́ nzyeté.
en: The same was in the beginning with God.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gwaa gwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa pɔ́ ná yé. Atsɔ́ mǒ té gwɔ́ wó té gwɔ́ gie á cʉ̌a pɔ́ ná yé wɔ́.
en: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ à laa ná yé, le gwɔ́ ŋwɛ́ á gwɔ́ kyɛ̀’ gie á kyɛ’ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

ngiemboon: Akyɛ̀’ ne ńkyɛ’ɛ nzěm, nzěm ké tè kúbe.
en: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gÿo ńtúmo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, lezíŋ se gwɔ́ lé Jâŋ.
en: There was a man sent from God, whose namewasJohn.

ngiemboon: Á tó ńgwɔ́ njÿò ńgyá, á léshwóŋó mmó gie à zsě ńtí kyɛ̀’ ŋwɛ́, légwɔ́ gie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ge záb ntʉ́m we ná kyɛ̀’ ŋwɛ́.
en: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that allmenthrough him might believe.

ngiemboon: À la tè kyɛ̀’ wɔ́, à la tó yé pɔ́ leshwóŋ pʉ̀a nò ná kyɛ̀’.
en: He was not that Light, butwas sentto bear witness of that Light.

ngiemboon: Yé shwóŋè ŋwɛ́ láa kwà’ kyɛ̀’ gie á tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lékyɛ’ɛ mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Thatwas the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.

ngiemboon: Ye shwóŋè laa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, tá pʉ̀a mesoŋ ké tè yé zsé. Mbà pɔ́ la ké ńcʉa pɔ́ ná yé tá ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

ngiemboon: À la tóo kwà’ lá’ pɔ́b, epʉ̀a lá’ pé té yé kúe.
en: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

ngiemboon: Tá’, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a kúe yé, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, á leen ńké ńnáa wɔ́b tʉ̀ lécʉ́’ púɔ Ssé.
en: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God,evento them that believe on his name:

ngiemboon: Legwɔ̌ pú’u, à tě fóo nà ntí gie mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě kwǒŋ ńzyé wɔ́, ńké tě fóo ná lekwoŋ we nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mé gɔɔn légwɔ́ púɔ Ssé, mbà Ssé zɔ kwǒŋ yɛ̌ ntí lezyé.
en: which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè la cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ńtó ńtsẅé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, pege gyá legú’ we, á gwɔ́ legú’ Múɔ wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ Tá, ḿbú ńgẅiin poŋo ntʉ́m, ńnyɛ pɔ́ nò nénʉ́.
en: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gÿo ńgɔɔn mmó gie à zsě nà nyìŋ ŋwɛ́, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Wɛ̂ áa nyìŋ gẅie n kɔ̌ɔn shwóŋó gẅi la, pá’ mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ aa nzèm mèŋ ńne ńtóo, à cʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie mé la gwaa zyé wɔ̀ɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: John bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ keen ńtó, à lɔg pá’ à gẅiin poŋo ntʉ́m, ńcÿó gʉm yégè metsèm tɛ̀’, ńcÿó sele ńcÿó, mélà’mie à gẅiin nkwòŋe tɛ’.
en: And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉa ná Mǒsê, ńná*lepʉ̌, anò nénʉ́ pɔ́ nò lécÿó gʉm yégè piŋ ńcʉa pɔ́ nà Yěsô Kristo.
en: For the law was given by Moses,butgrace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa Ssé gyá, tà ndà’ Múɔ wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie aa Ssé ńgwɔ́ léjʉ́ŋ Tá, à la gÿo mé zsé yé.
en: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declaredhim.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gÿo ńgɔɔn nò ńtí Yěsô. Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda pie ée Yerósalem túm pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pʉ̀a nà ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, ńgie pɔ́ gʉa ńzɛ́te Jâŋ ngie: À gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌?
en: And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?

ngiemboon: Jâŋ shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm té mʉ́’te ngie: Mèŋ n tè*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ wɔ́.
en: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie tà ɔ̀ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌? Ɔ̀ gwɔ́ pɔ́*Elîɛ keen? Jâŋ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ. Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie, ɔ̀ gwɔ́ pɔ́*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gẅie mé ne ńzẅí’te lá keen? Jâŋ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ.
en: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he saith, I am not. Art thou that prophet? And he answered, No.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Shwóŋo wég nyìŋ gẅie ɔ́ɔ wɛ̌, ńzsé ngie peg ge gẅiin nò gie peg ge tó shwóŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ně ńtúmo wég. Kwà’ gù lê twó ɔ́, ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ́ɔ wɔ̌?
en: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?

ngiemboon: Jâŋ lɔgɔ shwóŋè gie*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya la gɔɔn ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n gee nyìŋ gẅie aa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ésá’a ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi siŋte mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉà à tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ».
en: He said, Iamthe voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie mé la túmo wɔ́b mbwo Jâŋ la, lâ pà*farisay.
en: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ńzɛ́te Jâŋ ngie, tà ɔ̀ tè*Nzà’nkÿo wɔ́, ńké tè*Elîɛ́ wɔ́, ńké tè*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gẅie mé ne ńzẅí’te wɔ́, tà mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ nu’u pʉ̀a ntse?
en: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?

ngiemboon: Jâŋ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie à gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n nu’u pʉ̀a pɔ́ ndà’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ké ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi nyé té zsé yé.
en: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;

ngiemboon: Ayé nò ge pɔ́ɔnte yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ fǒ tè kú’u léŋwé’e ssé ńkyɛ́’ nkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: he it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńzɛ́te yé mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn á Mbetáni, á nà yétsɔ́ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ á jʉ’ gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse wó.
en: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Jâŋ gyá Yěsô ne ńtóo, á gɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gẅie Ssé lɔgɔ sẅɛ’ɛ ndòon menò mie pʉ̀a la gÿo.
en: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.

ngiemboon: Àa yé gẅie mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn shwóŋó gẅi la, pá’ mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ aa nzèm mèŋ ńne ńtóo, à cʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie mé la gwaa zyé wɔ̀ɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ n da tè ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo gwɔ́ wɛ̌ wɔ́. Tá mèŋ n ka tǒ yɔ́ɔn, ńne ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse lélɔg ńgÿo pà Israel zsé yé.
en: And I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gíŋe ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò gie à zsé ná Yěsô, ńgie: Mèŋ n da gyá zẅìge Ssé sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe ná yé, ńgwɔ́ pá’ Kàpʉ̀ŋ.
en: And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ n da zɔɔn tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́, tá Ssé gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn ńgie mèŋ n gʉa ńnu’ pʉ̀a ntse, yé zɔ̌ gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo gyá zẅìge Ssé tó ńnéŋe ná nyìŋ. Àa yé gẅie à ge ná pʉ̀a mbwo zẅìge Ssé.
en: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da gyá, tà mèŋ n ne sá’a shwóŋó pʉ̀a ngie aa Míŋ Ssé.
en: And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Jâŋ pâ tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ gie à kaa wó.
en: Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;

ngiemboon: Á má’ lejÿɔ́g, ńgyá Yěsô pá’ à ne ńcʉa, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò Ssé.
en: and looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!

ngiemboon: Ngáŋa kwò Jâŋ yépʉ́a jú’u yɔ̀ɔn shwóŋè, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô.
en: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ńgyá pá’ pɔ́ ée nzèm yé, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi fa’a kɔ́? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Rabbi (ńdɔgɔ ngie tsítsà), ɔ̀ tsẅé nzɔ̌?
en: Then Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them,What seek ye?They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi tó, pi ge gyá. Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgʉa ńgyá jʉ’ gie à tsẅé wó. Á gwɔ gwɔ́ ńgwɔ́ nèm tá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó, pâ pɔ́ ńnéŋe tà yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mag.
en: He saith unto them,Come and see.They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.

ngiemboon: Á la gʉa ná pʉ̀a mépʉ́a pie pɔ́ la jú’u shwóŋè Jâŋ, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô la, lezíŋ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ láa le Ndeléya, á gwɔ́ fɛ́ Símo Piɛ.
en: One of the two which heard Johnspeak, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.

ngiemboon: Ndeléya ŋwɛ́ gʉa ńnyé té shwóŋó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, ḿvɔg ńgyá fɛ́ we Símo, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Peg gyǎ*Nzà’nkÿo, á lɔgɔ ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie Kristo.
en: He first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.

ngiemboon: Ńdɔgɔ Símo, ńgʉa lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, Yěsô cwoŋo ńdíe Símo tà ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Símo míŋ Jâŋ. Mé ge gÿo tóŋo gú le Kéfas. Yěsô tóŋo le Kéfas pá’ɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie Piɛ.
en: And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said,Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas,which is by interpretation, A stone.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô záb ngie à ge gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, ńne ńgee, ḿbumte Filib, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him,Follow me.

ngiemboon: Filib ŋwɛ́ laa nyìŋ Mbetsayida, á tÿǒsoŋo pà Ndeléya pɔ́ Piɛ.
en: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

ngiemboon: Filib gʉa ńgyá Natanayɛl, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Peg gyǎ nyìŋ gẅie mé la ŋwe’e nò ná yé tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne mbʉ̌ Mǒsê, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé. Peg gyǎ yé, á gwɔ́ Yěsô, mìŋ Yesyɛ̂b, á mûɔ Nǎzarɛd.
en: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

ngiemboon: Natanayɛl gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tà mé lǎ zɔɔn ńgyá mmó mbòŋo fó Nǎzarɛd? Filib tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tóo, ɔ̀ ge gyá.
en: And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ Natanayɛl ne ńtóo, ńgɔɔn nò ná yé ngie: Wɔɔn aa kwà’ mûɔ Israel gẅie anò nkÿo nkÿo té ná yé wɔ́.
en: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him,Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!

ngiemboon: Natanayɛl zɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ zsé wɔ̀ɔn nzɔ̌? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Filib ně ńgwaa tóŋo gú pá’a mèŋ n ně ńgyá gú gyá. Ɔ̀ kěen ńnéŋe le tsìŋe tÿǒ mbÿě ngem.
en: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him,Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

ngiemboon: Natanayɛl tsɔ́’ ngie: Rabbi, ɔ́ɔ Mìŋ Ssé, ɔ́ɔ fùɔ pà Israel.
en: Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ zẅíŋe fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mélà’mie mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn ngie n ně ńgyá pá’ ɔ̀ ńnéŋe le tsìŋe mbÿě ngem. Ɔ̀ ge gìŋe gyá menò mie é fáŋ ńtɔ́g mɛ̌.
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi ge gÿo gyá ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ne fóo wó, ésẅɛ́’ɛ ḿbiŋe ńkwɔ́’ɔ, ńtóo ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: And he saith unto him,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ pʉ́a, atsɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ndá gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Kána, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, má pà Yěsô gwɔ́ wó.
en: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋe ńtóŋo Yěsô yé pâ ngàŋa nkwò yé, á jʉ’ʉ lɔ́ɔn ndá ŋwɛ́.
en: and both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

ngiemboon: Melù’ gÿo ḿmag, má pà Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Epʉ̀a té gíŋe ńgẅiin melù’ mie pɔ́ ge nú wɔ́.
en: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ kẅé kɔ́ mbwo mèŋ? À yɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ nyé tè ku’.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

ngiemboon: Má we gʉa ńgɔɔn né pàlyè pʉ̀a ngie à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ pi gÿo.
en: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, doit.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mekʉŋ tóon gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ntɔgɔ́. Pà Yuda kúu ntse tsoló ńdɔgɔ sɔgɔ pʉ̀ tá ńgú’te Ssé pá’*lepʉ̌ lá’ sɔ́b la ne ńzɛ́te. É la gwɔ́ tà ńgwaa ńgwɔ́ mé néŋ ntse tsoon lítà nkÿo tsɛ̀ɛ tà’.
en: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pàlyè pʉ̀a ngie: Pi néŋ ntse tsɛ̀ɛ mekʉŋ ŋwɛ́ tà é lúe. Pɔ́ néŋ ntse tsoló tà é lúe.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Fill the waterpots with water.And they filled them up to the brim.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kú tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à táŋte línɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ kú ńgʉa ná né yé.
en: And he saith unto them,Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast.And they bareit.

ngiemboon: Á zẅí’ ntse gẅie é selé ńcʉ́’ melù’, à te ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mɛ̌ melù’ fóo wó wɔ́, tá pàlyè pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ně ńtú’ ntse ne ńzsé. Nyìŋ gẅie à táŋte línɔ́ɔn, á tóŋo nyìŋ gẅie mé gÿo lɔ́ɔn ndá yé,
en: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mé ée ḿvɔgɔ ńnáa pɔ́ melù’ mbòŋo, tà mé núu tɛ̀’, tá mé náa mie é ná’a ḿmeen meen. Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà yɔɔn áa jú fʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ náa melù’ mbòŋo mbwo pʉ̀a lá?
en: and saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse:butthou hast kept the good wine until now.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Yěsô la zye légÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn. Á laa Kána, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, Yěsô lɔg pú’u, ńda’te legú’ we.*Ngàŋa kwò yé záb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô pâ má we, lâ mefɛ́ pé, ńgÿo*ngàŋa kwò yé, gʉa ne tÿǒsoŋo Kapernawúm, ńkúu wó, ńnéŋe pɔ́ lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́.
en: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.

ngiemboon: Alínɔ́ɔn*Páskà pà Yuda la ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte, Yěsô leen ńké ḿbʉ né Yerósalem,
en: And the Jews' passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńgyá pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsoló ńne sẅiŋe mefòŋ, petsɔ́ ne sẅiŋe*menjʉ̀njÿò, petsɔ́ ne sẅiŋe mekàpʉ̀ŋ, mbɔɔ pàkúbe nkáb néŋte ssé.
en: and found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńdɔg menkÿo ńcwoŋte ngwɔɔn, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńjwoŋ pʉ̀a apɛ̌ lâ*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́b, lâ mefòŋ, ńtsó metápele ńgwá’, nkáb pʉle ssé,
en: and when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers' money, and overthrew the tables;

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo pàsẅìŋ mekàpʉ̀ŋ ngie: Pi lɔg shúm sɛ̂ éfó jʉ’ɔɔn ńgʉa! Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔgɔ jʉ’ʉ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo jʉ’ʉ metʉ̌a.
en: and said unto them that sold doves,Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké ńkímte jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne Ssé gie á gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ, n kwoŋo jʉ’ jú kwoŋ tà mèŋ n ge lá’ kwé pɔ́ mǒ».
en: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’a pà Yuda leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Gÿo ndàa gyá nò mvfò peg ńdɔg ńnyɛɛ wég ngie mé la náa gú tʉ̀ légÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gÿo lɛ̂.
en: Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi keme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé yɔɔn, mèŋ n dɔg lyɛ̌’ sétá, ḿbʉ’ʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mé la lɔg ngù’ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ nê móm lekùa, ńkwɛ́ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé yɔɔn, ńgʉa ná gù, ɔ̀ gɔɔn ngie ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ lɔg lyɛ̌’ sétá ḿbʉ’ʉ ńtÿɔ́g lá?
en: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn,*jʉ’ʉ Ssé gie à kime é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbùm ye.
en: But he spake of the temple of his body.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá à la gÿo ńzíme nà legwé,*ngàŋa kwò yé kímte ngie à la gɔɔn yɔɔn nò, ńdeen ńké ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋe ńzẅíŋe gie ŋwà’ne Ssé la gɔɔn ná yé.
en: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Yerósalem, mé ne ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn*páskà, alá’ gyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie à ne ńgÿo, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn záb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feastday, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yěsô tè gwá’ mbùm ye mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, mélà’mie à né ńzsé pá’ pɔ́ gwɔ́ metsèm.
en: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew allmen,

ngiemboon: À la tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mé kyagte kyagte éshwóŋó yé wɔ́. Kwà’ yé lê twó yé à zsé mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: and needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, atsɔ̌ nkěm pà Yuda gwɔ́ nà nùɔ Pà*farisay, mé tóŋo yé le Nikodem.
en: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńtó tsɔ̌ lêtsẅɛ́’, ńgyá Yěsô, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsítsà, peg zsě ngie e Ssé zɔ la túmo gú ngie ɔ̀ gʉa ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó. Á nue à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie ɔ̀ gÿo lɛ̂ té gwɔ́ gie e Ssé zɔ túmo yé wɔ́.
en: the same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le gyá*lefùɔ Ssé té gwɔ́ gie mé giŋé ńzyé yé tsɔ́ legʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Nikodem gɔɔn ne Yěsô ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gwɔ́ ndÿò mé zyé yé lêkɔ́? Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gíŋe ńkúu lepfòm má we mé gíŋe ńzyé yé?
en: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother's womb, and be born?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le kúu tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé té gwɔ́ gie mé lɔ̌g ntse ńzyé yé, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ zẅìge ńzyé yé wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered,Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water andofthe Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě zyě yé, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, nyìŋ gẅie à Zẅìge Ssé zyě yé, á gẅiin le gwɔ́ gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ we Zẅìge Ssé.
en: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lémɔɔn pá’ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn né gù ngie mé gẅiin légíŋe ńzyé gẅi tsɔ́ legʉ̀a.
en: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

ngiemboon: Fèfà cʉa jʉ’ gie à kwǒŋ, ɔ̀ jú’ pá’ à cʉa, tá ńké tè zsé jʉ’ gie à fóo wó wɔ́, ńké tè zsé jʉ’ gie à gee nê wó wɔ́. Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná nyìŋ gẅie à Zẅìge Ssé zyě yé.
en: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Nikodem leen ńké ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie, á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, ńcʉa lêkɔ́?
en: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Israel ńgwɔ́ tà’ tsítsà tà mé zsé gú tɛ’, ɔ̀ piŋ tè yɔɔn nò zsé la?
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gú, kwà’ nénʉ́, peg gɔɔn nò nà mmó gie pèg ne ńzsé, ńgɔɔn gie peg ne ńzsé nà mmó gie peg la gyá, tá’ pi ké tè zẅíŋe nò gie peg gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi nò ná shúm sie é cʉaté ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, pi tè zẅíŋ. N dɔɔn shwóŋó gẅi nò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ná shúm sie é cʉaté tÿǒ lepwó, mbà pi ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá zẅíŋ?
en: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell youofheavenly things?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńkwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́, ndà’*Míŋ Nyìŋ gẅie à la fó wó sẅɛ́’.
en: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven,eventhe Son of man which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Mǒsê la kwɛ́ nnú ná tà’a tÿǒ, ńkwé’e ńnáa tÿǒ, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ̀ la, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo ńkwé’e*Míŋ Nyìŋ pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná yé, à gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

ngiemboon: Á nue ntí gie e Ssé la lɔg ńkwoŋ njÿó pú’u la gwɔ́ tà á náa Míŋ we wémɔ’ɔ́, légwɔ́ gie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná Míŋ we ŋwɛ́, à tě ńdá’a ńkaa ndòon tèmì wɔ́, à ge lá’ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la tè zɔɔn ńtúmo Míŋ we tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ngie à gʉa ńnéŋ ndòon twó njÿó wɔ́. À la túmo yé pɔ́ légwɔ́ gie à ge gʉa gÿo njÿó tsẅɛ́ ndòon.
en: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m wé ná yé, ndòon le yé gwoon. Nyìŋ gẅie à ké kaa záb ntʉ́m wé ná yé wɔ́ zsé ngie à kǎ ndòon, á nue à kaa záb ntʉ́m wé ná Míŋ Ssé wémɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́.
en: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gẅiin lékaa ndòon ńtí nò kyɛ̀’ gie á léen ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, tá pʉ̀a mesoŋ kwoŋ pɔ́ nzěm ńcʉa kyɛ̀’ ŋwɛ́, mélà’mie ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b té poŋ.
en: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

ngiemboon: Ngÿǒ menò nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn tè ne ḿboŋo wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ ge pʉa kyɛ̀’ pʉa, á le kwoŋo légiŋe jʉ’ gie kyɛ̀’ áa wó wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ nue ngÿǒ menò mé ge kẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌.
en: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńgiŋe nà mánzsè nò nénʉ́, à tóo jʉ’ gie kyɛ̀’ áa wó, ńzsé ngie mé ge gyá ngie ngÿǒ menò mé fóo pɔ́ ná pá’ à ne ńjú’u ncwò Ssé.
en: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa ne tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, pâ pɔ̌ ná’a ńzye ńnéŋe, à ne ńnu’u pʉ́a ntse.
en: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judæa; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gwɔ́ yé Ainon, á ngʉ̀ŋe Salim ńne ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse, á nue ntse laa jʉ’ó tɛ’. Epʉ̀a ne ńtóo, á nu’u wɔ́b ntse.
en: And John also was baptizing in Ænon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mé nyé té ńnéŋe Jâŋ ndá tsǎŋ.
en: For John was not yet cast into prison.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ pà Yuda pâ tsɔ̌ ngàŋa nkwò Jâŋ ńnéŋe tà ńzye lézoŋo nò ná nò lésɔgɔ pʉ̀ tá ńgu’te Ssé.
en: Then there arose a question betweensomeof John's disciples and the Jews about purifying.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ gʉa ńgyá Jâŋ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie Tsítsà, ɔ̀ ne ńkímte nyìŋ wá gẅie pi yé kaa ná yétsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ la? Á nyìŋ wá gẅie ɔ̀ ka gɔɔn nò gie ɔ̀ zsé ná yé la? À ne ńnu’u yé pʉ̀a ntse fʉ̀’ɔɔn, tà lá’ menùɔ menùɔ ne ńgee ńgyá pɔ́ yé.
en: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and allmencome to him.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ náa fà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ pi gí ne ńnyɛte ńzsé ngie mèŋ n ka gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n tè*Nzà’nkÿo wɔ́. Mèŋ n gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n gwɔ́ mvfò yé.
en: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ́’ɔ manzwě zɔ aa ndǔm manzwě. Ashǔ ndǔm tyé lejʉ́ŋ ndǔm, á gɔɔn nò, á jú’ ngyè ye, anò poŋo yé tɛ’. Mèŋ n ne ńkága yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ pú’u, ḿbiŋe ńkága tà ḿmaga ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie yé nò gwaa kẅi’i gee mvfò, ayɔ́ɔn ne ḿbiŋe né nzèm.
en: He must increase, but Imustdecrease.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à fóo tÿǒ lepwó, à cʉa pʉ̀a metsèm. Nyìŋ gẅie aa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ aa nyìŋ tsetsá’, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn nò pɔ́ nà menò mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie à fóo tÿǒ lepwó à cʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.

ngiemboon: À gɔɔn nò gie à zsé nà shúm sie à la gyá mbɔɔ sie à la jú’, tá nyìŋ tè zẅíŋ.
en: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅíŋe nò gie à gɔɔn, lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee nénʉ́ nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé túmo yé, à gɔɔn menò mie é fóo mbwo Ssé, á nue e Ssé gÿo Zẅìge yé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná yé fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measureunto him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá kwoŋo Míŋ we, mbà à léen ńnéŋ shúm ntsèm á nà lɔ̌ɔn pwó Míŋ we.
en: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m we ná Míŋ Ssé, mbà ngàŋ ge gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Nyìŋ gẅie à kě kaa záb ntʉ́m wé ná Míŋ Ssé wɔ́, á le lá’ ńgẅiin kwà’ le gwɔ́ wɔ́. E Ssé ké ńnyé ńkẅi’i ńgyáŋa lóŋ ná yé gyáŋ.
en: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.

ngiemboon: Pa*farisay jú’ mé ne ńgɔɔn ngie nzẅìŋ pʉ̀a pie é ne ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô cʉa pe Jâŋ, á gíŋe ńne ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse é gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa pe Jâŋ.
en: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńké ńgwaa gɔɔn pú’u, kwà’ Yěsô zɔ tě ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse wɔ́,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɔ̌ ne ńnu’u wɔ́b.
en: (though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pà*farisay jǔ’, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńcʉ́me mánzsè lépiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: he left Judæa, and departed again into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie à zyɛ́’ ye tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Samalîɛ.
en: And he must needs go through Samaria.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo pà Samalîɛ, mé tóŋ lé Sikar, á gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe nká’ gẅie Yakwɔ́b la náa mbwo míŋ we Yesyɛ̂b.
en: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

ngiemboon: Ntse ntǔŋ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo lé ntse Yakwɔ́b gwɔ́ jʉ’ó. Yěsô gwɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ cʉ́’ʉ ńku’u ku’, mbà à gǐŋ tà ńkʉ́a, ésẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe ntse ŋwɛ́.
en: Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied withhisjourney, sat thus on the well:andit was about the sixth hour.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě we Samalîɛ tó létú’ ntse, Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ná ntse mèŋ n nú.
en: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her,Give me to drink.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gʉ̌a tÿǒsoŋ léjú shúm léjÿó.
en: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)

ngiemboon: Manzwě we Samalîɛ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Ɔɔ nyìŋ Yuda, ḿbiŋe ńdúɔ ntse nǔ mbwo mèŋ manzwě we Samalîɛ lá? À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, á nue pà Yuda pâ pà Samalîɛ lɔ́ɔn tě ńjú’e wɔ́.
en: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie, ɔ̀ gwé’e ńzsé fù’ gie Ssé náa, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn né gù ngie: Ná ntse n nú, mbà gù zɔ cʉ̌’ ńdúɔ ntse nǔ mbwo yé, á náa gú ńtse gẅie éfóo lesá’a.
en: Jesus answered and said unto her,If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie, andè, ɔ̀ zɔɔn fó tè loŋgá gẅiin, ńtse piŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ssé tɛ̀’ pɛ́’ɛ̀, wɛ̌ ntse gẅie é fóo lesá’a piŋ fó pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

ngiemboon: Tsye ɔ̀ cʉa tá wèg Yakwɔ́b gẅie à la ná wɔɔn ntse ntǔŋ né peg ka? Ńgwaa ná, ńzɔɔn nú yé, pènkʉ́ pé pâ menɔ̀ɔn gíŋe ńnú yɔ́b.
en: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Nyìŋ nú wɛ̂ mɛ́, agág yé ké ńgíŋe shÿó shÿó.
en: Jesus answered and said unto her,Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ nú ntse gẅie mèŋ n zɔ nǎ mbwo yé, mbà gág yé té ńdá’a ńgíŋe shÿó wɔ́. Mbà ntse mɛ́ ge kúu mbùm yé, é cʉ́’ pɔ́ lesá’a ntse, á jʉ’ gie ntse ge ne fóo wó cwoŋo, é náa yé le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Andè, ná wɛ̌ ntse né mèŋ, agág yɔ́ɔn le lá’ ńgíŋe shÿó wɔ́. Mèŋ n de gíŋe ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn ńtú’ ntse wɔ́.
en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Gʉa ńtóŋo ndǔm ɔ̀ pi yé tó.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n tè ndǔm gẅiin.
en: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her,Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gÿǒ mboŋó légɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ tè ndǔm gẅiin. Ɔ̀ lǎ gẅiin tà é gwɔ́ méntʉ̀a, tá nyìŋ gẅie pi yé ńnéŋe fʉ̀’ɔɔn tè ndǔm ɔ̀ wɔ́. Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀ á kẅɛ.
en: for thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, mèŋ n gyá ngie ɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

ngiemboon: Ńgie mbà, metá pég lɔ́ɔn ńgu’te Ssé ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sɔɔn, pi pà Yuda pi èe ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: Ajʉ’ʉ légu’te Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ Yerósalem pɛ́’ɛ̀ mé jú’u yè wɔ́?
en: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mɔ̌ɔn, zẅíŋe nò gie n gee ńgɔ̌ɔn. Afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u pá’ pi tè gíŋe gu’te Tá á ndùm sɔɔn lekwɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́, mbɔɔ Yerósalem wɔ́.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

ngiemboon: Pi gu’te Ssé té zsé mmó gie pi gÿo yɛ̌. Peg pà Yuda peg gwaa gu’te Ssé, ńne ńzsé mmó gie peg gÿo yɛ̌, mélà’mie Ssé cʉa ná pà Yuda tá ńgÿo pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́.
en: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Tá’, afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u, tà á fǒ ńzɔɔn ńku’ ku’, pá’ kwà’ pàgu’te Ssé ge gwɔ gu’te yé Ssé Tá, é zẅí’te ncwò Zẅìge yé, tá gu’te yé nà ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gwɔ̌ pɔ́ zẅìge, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gu’te yé gwɔ́ gu’te yé, ńzẅí’te ncwò Zẅìge yé tá ńgu’te yé nà ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Godisa Spirit: and they that worship him must worshiphimin spirit and in truth.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn ne yé ngie: Mèŋ n zsě ngie*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé tóŋo le Kristo né ńtóo. À ge tó, é pú kyagte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ shwóŋó wég.
en: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ gẅie pɔgɔ shwóŋe lɔɔn, mèŋ n gee yé.
en: Jesus saith unto her,I that speak unto thee amhe.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé tó, ńgyá pɔ́ manzwě ně shwóŋe, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ̀’. Tá’, tsɔ́ wɔb ké tè ku’u lézɛ́te yé ngie áa nò kɔ́ wɔ́ wɔ́, ka légɔɔn ngie pɔ́ yé shwóŋó kɔ́ wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ nyé tÿóon ntse yé jʉ’ó, ḿbiŋe tÿǒsoŋ, ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie:
en: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

ngiemboon: Pi tó ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à shwoŋó wɔ̀ɔn menò ntsèm mie n da gÿǒ. Tà à tè gwɔ́ pɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo wɔ́?
en: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

ngiemboon: Alá’ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńtó né lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ tó pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńtsíŋe yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Rabbi, pfɛ́ɛ mémmó la.
en: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

ngiemboon: Tá á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó léjÿó gie mèŋ n gee ńjÿó, á gwɔ́ gie pi tè ne ńzsé wɔ́.
en: But he said unto them,I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’ pú’u, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉ̌’ ńdɔgɔ mmó léjÿó ńtó ná né yé keen?
en: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought himoughtto eat?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ayɔ́ɔn mmó léjÿó gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie nyìŋ gẅie à ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn à ne ńkwoŋo, mbɔɔ lémege fà’ gie à ka nǎ né mèŋ.
en: Jesus saith unto them,My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ ee ntě ńgɔɔn ngie: É cʉ́’ʉ ńzága mesàŋ lekùa, mé lág shúm wɔ́ leen? Tá’, mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅi yɔ́ɔn ngie: Pi pʉ’ʉ twó gí, ńdíe tsẅɛ tá ńgyá, eshúm tʉ̌ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzɛ́te pɔ́ lélag.
en: Say not ye, There are yet four months, andthencometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à laga shúm, à ne ńkẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ wé, é gwɔ́ pá’ à ne ńcú’te mmó ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ le gwɔ́ tèmì. Légwɔ́ gie ambyè mmó pɔ́ ndàga ge pú kág.
en: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, esàga nò gie e gɔɔn ngie: Ambyè aa wó, andàga gwɔ́ wó lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́.
en: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka túmo gẅi ńdag shúm sie pi ka tè gyá tsɔ̌ ngɔ́’ mǒ ḿbye wɔ́, tsɔ́ pʉ̀a la gyá ngɔ́’, pi ka tó gí, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzẅɛ́’ɛ fà’ yɔ́b zẅɛ̌’.
en: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.

ngiemboon: Á la fó nà shwóŋè manzwě ŋwɛ́ gẅie à la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: À shwoŋó wɔ̀ɔn kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n dǎ gÿo. Pʉ̀a Samalîɛ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie é laa ná yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô,
en: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

ngiemboon: ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie pâ pɔ́ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe. Yěsô zẅíŋ, ńnéŋe jʉ’ó lyě’ pʉ́a.
en: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gíŋ ńkẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m ná ye tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtí shwóŋè yé.
en: And many more believed because of his own word;

ngiemboon: Ńne ńgɔɔn né manzwě ŋwɛ́ ngie: Peg tě ńnyé ńzába ntʉ́m ná Yěsô ńtí pɔ́ shwóŋè jú ndà’ wɔ́, peg zába ntʉ́m ná ye fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńtí pá’ peg yég cwoŋó ńjú’u shwóŋè yé, tà ńzsé ngie aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó e tsẅɛ́.
en: and said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heardhimourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.

ngiemboon: Elyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a sa gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńne ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mbà yé máŋwɛ́ la gɔɔn ngie: Mé té ná mekù’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa tà ńkúu Galilea, pà Galilea kúe yé mboŋó. Á nue pɔ́ ka gʉa línɔ́ɔn Yerósalem, ńkúu wó, ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńgÿo.
en: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ tà ńkúu Kána pɔ́ Galilea, á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie à ka sele ntse wó ńdɔg ńgÿo melù’ la. Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndÿò ná fà’a ngúmnɔɔn gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Kapernawúm, míŋ we ne ńguɔ.
en: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

ngiemboon: Á jú’ ngie Yěsô fǒ Jẅidea ńtóo Galilea, ńgʉa ńgyá yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à cwóŋ ńtó, ńgÿo míŋ we gẅie à cʉ’ʉ́ ńkwé kwě zeŋe.
en: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judæa into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pi lɔɔn tè gyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie é lá’te metʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, láa menkʉ̀’ʉ nò wɔ́, pi le lá’ ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: Then said Jesus unto him,Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ ngúmnɔɔn ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsétsɔ’, Andè, cwóŋo ńgyá míŋ wɔ̀ɔn tá à kwé.
en: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Gʉa! Míŋ gù zeŋé. Wɔɔn ndÿò zẅíŋe nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn né ye, ńgʉa.
en: Jesus saith unto him,Go thy way; thy son liveth.And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé pɔ́ mánzsè ńcwóŋo ńgee, ngàŋa fà’ yé tó ńzá’a yé, éshwóŋó yé ngie míŋ gù aa ntentʉ́.
en: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and toldhim, saying, Thy son liveth.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b fʉ̀’ gie à ka zeŋe, pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Á kaa mbÿɛ̀ njÿó jǔɔ ná tà’ nèm, nnɛ́ zá’a ná yé.
en: Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ jú’, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ fʉ̀’ yá gie Yěsô ka gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Míŋ we zeŋe la. Á leen ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô, pâ pʉ̀a pé metsèm ndá yé.
en: So the father knew thatit wasat the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him,Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo yɔɔn nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, á fʉ̀’ gie à fǒ Jẅidea ḿbiŋe Galilea pá’ɔɔn, á lɔ́gɔ ńgwɔ́ nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gie à gÿǒ Kana.
en: Thisisagain the second miraclethatJesus did, when he was come out of Judæa into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, á fʉ̀’e tsɔ́ línɔ́ɔn pà Yuda ne ńku’u, Yěsô pʉ ńgʉa né Yerósalem.
en: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ́ gÿǒon ntse sɔ́g nnɛ́ gwɔ́ Yerósalem, mé tóŋo nà shwóŋè pà Heber le Betzata, á gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ncwò ndá*menjʉ̀njÿò, mbà mé la lɔg metóon ḿbwóon mekɔ́’ méntʉ̀a ńdɔg ńkéle.
en: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheepmarketa pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ meguɔ ntí ntí nuŋte tsɛ̀ɛ mekɔ́’. Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, pà pwɔ́’te mekwò, mbaa megàŋ kwʉ́’te nuŋte wó, [ńne ńzẅí’te pá’ ntse gé cʉ’ʉ.
en: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

ngiemboon: Á nue, atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe ńgwá sẅɛ́’ɛ ḿbʉe ntse, angùɔ gẅie à vɔ̌g ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntse fʉ̀’ gie e cʉ’ʉ́, á zeŋe nà yé gùɔ tà pá’ á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí wɔ́.]
en: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mbà à gǔɔ guɔ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né móm ntá.
en: And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ à nuŋe, ńzsé ngie à tsẅě jʉ’ó tɛ’, ńzɛ́te yé ngie tà ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo lézeŋe?
en: When Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long timein that case, he saith unto him,Wilt thou be made whole?

ngiemboon: Anguɔ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, awɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á kaa wɔ̀ɔn ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ntse fʉ̀’ gie é ne cʉ’ʉ à tè gwɔ́ wɔ́. Mèŋ n ŋege tà ńgwaa tó, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ vɔgɔ́ ntse.
en: The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ḿbíi mátà gù, ńgiŋ.
en: Jesus saith unto him,Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò gwaa tɔ́g pá’ɔɔn, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda leen ńké ńgɔɔn né nyìŋ gẅie à zeŋé ŋwɛ́ ngie: Ɔ̀ tè gẅiin lékaa mátà ńdɔg ńgiŋ pɛ́’ɛ̀ wɔ́. Á nue yɔɔn áa lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè.
en: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carrythybed.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à gÿǒ mèŋ n zeŋe gɔ̌ɔn né mèŋ ngie: Píi mátà gù, ńgiŋ.
en: He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à gɔ̌ɔn né gù ngie píi mátà gù ńgiŋ aa wɔ̌?
en: Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie á ně ńzeŋe la ké tè ne ńzsé ngàŋ wɔ́. Á nue Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn pú’u, ḿbyéte tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ gie á ke ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being inthatplace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgyá yé tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ kě ńzeŋe mboŋó, tè lá’ ńgíŋ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ ngɔ́’ légíŋe ńkúu gú, tà ńtɔ́g gie ɔ̀ kà zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsoló.
en: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him,Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wá gʉa shwóŋ pàsá’a lá’ ngie nyìŋ gẅie à la zoŋo yé la, à laa Yěsô.
en: The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńzye lépʉa Yěsô, mélà’mie à ně ńgÿo yɔɔn nò, á lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b.
en: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn nyě fa’a pɔ́ fà’ tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn mèŋ n giŋé ne fa’a pɔ́ fà’.
en: But Jesus answered them,My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉ’ó, pà Yuda mege ńgá’a léfa’a mmó gie pɔ́ ge fó mǒ zẅé Yěsô, ńtí nue à la tè fʉa pɔ́*lepʉ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b ndà’ wɔ́, à ka giŋé ńne ńgɔɔn ngie e Ssé aa kwà’ Tá we, ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, Míŋ Ssé tè gÿo tsɔ́ mmó pɔ́ lê yé twó wɔ́, à gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie à ne ńgyá Tá we gÿo. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Tá gÿo, Múɔ giŋé ńgÿo pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: Then answered Jesus and said unto them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.

ngiemboon: Á nue Tá à kwoŋo Múɔ tɛ’, ḿbú ńnyɛɛ yé kɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńgÿo. À giŋé ge nyɛɛ yé shúm sie é fáŋ tà pi gyá à pú ńkʉ’ʉ gẅí.
en: For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.

ngiemboon: Pá’ Tá we gÿo pʉ̀a pie é kwě zím ńgwɔ́ wó la, áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Múɔ giŋé ńku’ yé légÿo nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo yé gwɔ́ wó.
en: For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneththem; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá, aa ntě ńzá’a ntsàŋ nyìŋ wɔ́, à léen ńnyé yɛ̌ jʉ’ mbwo Míŋ we.
en: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, mânyìŋ ntsèm ná mekù’ Míŋ we pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à ne ńnáa me Tá. Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa ná mekù’ Míŋ Ssé wɔ́, angàŋ lɔgɔ tě ńnáa mekù’ Tá we gẅie à la túmo yé wɔ́.
en: that allmenshould honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ jú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, mbà ngàŋ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Mé té ge gíŋe ŋaga yé wɔ́, à tsẅɛ̌ legwé ńcʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u, tà á ně ńzɔɔn ńdá’ ńku’, pá’ mepfó ssé ge jú’ ngyè Míŋ Ssé, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jǔ’ yɛ̌ ngyè pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u mélà’mie Ssé Tá gẅie aa lesa’á le gwɔ́ tèmí, à la ná mɛ̌ metʉ̀ mbwo míŋ we.
en: For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ńnáa yé metʉ̀ lélɔg ńzá’ mentsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mélà’mie yé zɔɔ*Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: and hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.

ngiemboon: Tà á mɔ́ɔn ńkʉ’ʉ gẅi kʉ’ʉ, á nue afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u pá’ mepfó ssé metsèm pie é nuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mesyè ge jú’ ngyè ye,
en: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

ngiemboon: é leen ké fó tsɛ̀ɛ mesyè kẅɛte. Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ka ne ńgÿo nò mbòŋo zíme nà legwé ńkẅé le gwɔ́ tèmì, tá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ka ne ńgÿo nò tepòŋ zím ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: and shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè zá’ ntsaŋ nyìŋ té píge Ssé wɔ́. E yɔ̀ɔn ntí leŋag, é gwɔ́ nénʉ́, mélà’mie mèŋ n tè ne fa’a pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie mèŋ n zɔ kwoŋo wɔ́, n gÿo yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mmó gie Nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkwoŋo.
en: I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ke ńgwɔ́ pé’e ne sele ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie mèŋ n zsé nà twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le yɛ̌ nò zẅíŋ.
en: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zɔ gɔɔn nò gie à zsé ná mèŋ, mèŋ m biŋ ne ńzsé ngie nò gie à gɔɔn ná mèŋ áa nénʉ́.
en: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

ngiemboon: Pi la tè túm pʉ̀a mbwo Jâŋ wɔ́ le? À la gɔɔn nò gie à zsě nà nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ gɔɔn nò gie à zsě ná mèŋ wɔ́. Tá’, mèŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò légwɔ́ gie pi ge cʉa mǒ tsẅɛ́.
en: But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ lâm gẅie mé lyɛ̌ ńtÿɔ́g á ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’. Á kyɛ’ jʉ’, anò poŋo gẅi tá á té ńnéŋe.
en: He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ n ké ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nò gie á la’te nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌, á nue mefà’ mie Tá wɔ̀ɔn la ná ngie mèŋ fa’, kwà’ mɛ̌ mefà’ mie mèŋ n gÿo zɔ́ la’te ngie Tá wɔ̀ɔn la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But I have greater witness thanthatof John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, kwà’ yé máŋwɛ́ ne ńgɔɔn nò gie à zsě ná mèŋ. Pi laa ngyè ye jú’u, ńké tè shÿó wé gyá.
en: And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè yé té ntʉ́m pi wɔ́, mélà’mie pi kaa záb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo yé wɔ́.
en: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.

ngiemboon: Pi mwoon ŋwà’ne Ssé, mélà’mie pi ne ńkwaŋa ngie pi ge cʉa mǒ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Yɛ̌ zɔ ké ne ńgɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ńké tè ne ńkwoŋo létóo mbwo mèŋ ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì wɔ́.
en: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tsɔ̌ ngɔ́ɔnte gie e fóo mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: I receive not honour from men.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńzsé gẅí, pi ee ntʉ́m pi, pi tè Ssé kwoŋ.
en: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka lɔg lezíŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ńtó, pi lʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋe yɔ́ɔn nò. Tá ńgwɔ́ gie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ lɔɔn ńtó fʉ̀’ɔɔn pɔ́ nà sé lezíŋ, mbà pi ge zẅíŋe yé nó.
en: I am come in my Father's name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ pi záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ lêkɔ́? Pi fa’ pɔ́ ngie nyìŋ mesoŋ ná ngɔ́ɔnte wetsɔ̌, pi tè fa’ ngie e Ssé gílé yé zɔ ná ngɔ́ɔnte gi wɔ́, ée ndà’ yé ńgwɔ́ Ssé.
en: How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour thatcomethfrom God only?

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie mèŋ n zɔ ge lá’ tyé mvfò Tá, é zába nò twó pi. Anzàba nò twó pi ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ Mǒsê gẅie pi kwaŋa gí kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ńtÿɔ́gɔ pɔ́ ná yé.
en: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there isonethat accuseth you,evenMoses, in whom ye trust.

ngiemboon: Pi la zɔɔn pé’e ńzẅíŋe nò gie Mǒsê la gɔɔn, mbà pi zẅíŋe yɔ́ɔn, mélà’mie à la ŋwè’e nò ńtí wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi tè ne ńzẅíŋe nò gie Mǒsê la ŋwe’e wɔ́ la, pi ge gǎ tá zẅíŋe nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn?
en: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò tɔ́g, Yěsô túm ńgʉa yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ letʉŋ sie ée Galilea, mé gíŋe ńtóŋ ngie letʉŋ Tiberiad
en: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which isthe seaof Tiberias.

ngiemboon: Alá’ ne ńcʉ́me nzèm yé tɛ’, á nue pʉ̀a la ne ńgyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie à la ne ńgÿo nà megàŋa guɔ.
en: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kwɔ́’ɔ ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɔ’ɔ́, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, afʉ̀’ gie pà Yuda gee ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn yɔ́b gie mé tóŋo le*Páskà ne ńku’u.
en: And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ńnéŋe tà ḿbʉ’ʉ twó yé ńgyá máamáa nùɔ lá’ ne ńtóo né lejʉ́ŋ yé, á gɔɔn né Filib ngie: Pege ge gʉa nzɔ̌ jú mbelég tá lɔg jÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b?
en: When Jesus then lifted uphiseyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip,Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńdʉŋte yé lʉŋte. Kwà’ yé Yěsô ne ńzsé mmó gie à ge piŋ gÿo.
en: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.

ngiemboon: Filib tsɔ́’ ngie: Mé jú mbelég pɔ́ ye medenie nkÿo pʉ́a, nyìŋ wɔ́b pfɛ́ tà é gʉa lʉ́m?
en: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Ndeléya, á gwɔ́ fɛ́ Símo. Á gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie:
en: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, saith unto him,

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mûɔ mbàŋa aa jʉ’ɔɔn, ńgẅiin mbelégmbu’ú ntʉ̀a, ńgÿo messó ntá’ pʉ́a, sɛ̌ shúm ké ńku’u kɔ́ nà nzẅìŋ lá’ yɔɔn?
en: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi gÿo alá’ néŋte ssé, legǐ laa jʉ’ó tɛ’. Epʉ̀a néŋte ssé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mbàŋa mmó ntsá’ yétʉ̀a.
en: And Jesus said,Make the men sit down.Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńgába mbwo lá’, ńgíŋ ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u nà messó, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pfɛ́ɛ mmó pá’ à kwǒŋ.
en: And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́, Yěsô gɔɔn né*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi lag mekèm mie é vʉ’ʉ́ tà mmó le pyé.
en: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples,Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lag mekèm mie é vʉ’ʉ́ nà mbelég gie pʉ̀a pfɛ̌ ntá’ tʉ̀a la, é lúe tsɛ̀ɛ mekèkàg ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: Therefore they gatheredthemtogether, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gyá nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn gie Yěsô gÿǒ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn aa kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gẅie mé ka ne ńzẅí’te ngie à tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá shÿó gẅie pɔ́ ne fa’a légwoon yé ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo fùɔ, ńgíŋe ńnyé wɔ́b ńgʉa né ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ gílé yé.
en: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô cwóŋ ńgʉa né nkʉ̀ŋ ntse Galilea.
en: And when even wasnowcome, his disciples went down unto the sea,

ngiemboon: Ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ kanú’, ńne ńgee né Kapernawúm ná yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, nzěm gwaa síŋ, Yěsô nyé pɔ́ tè kẅɛté wɔ́b.
en: and entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ máamáa fèfà ne ńcʉ’ʉ, ntse ne ḿbʉe.
en: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ kanú’ ńgiŋe mmó mekílo méntʉ̀a ka ntɔgɔ́ wɔ́, ńgyá Yěsô ne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse ńtóo, pɔ́ pɔ́g.
en: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie tà pi pɔ́g, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: But he saith unto them,It is I; be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne fa’a légÿo á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńgwóon ńgyá, mbà mé kǔ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse.
en: Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, alá’ gie mé ně ńyé nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse kímte ngie kanú’ kaa ssé ndà’ yémɔ’ɔ́,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô piŋ ńgwaa lɔg gʉa, pâ Yěsô té gwɔ́. Pɔ́ gʉa pɔ́ gílé pɔ́b.
en: The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, butthathis disciples were gone away alone;

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mekanú’ piŋ fó Tiberiad, ńtóo jʉ’ gie Yěsô ka tyé wó, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé nà mbelég, ńgábte mé pfɛ́ la.
en: (howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà lá’ yɛ̌ gyǎ ngie Yěsô cʉ’ʉ́ jʉ’ó wɔ́,*ngàŋa kwò yé gíŋe ńcʉ́’ʉ yɔ́b jʉ’ó wɔ́, pɔ́ leen ńké ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mekanú’ ŋwɛ́, ńdɔg ye Kapernawúm légwá fa’a Yěsô.
en: when the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsítsà, ɔ̀ tǒ tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn fʉ̀’e kɔ́.
en: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi tě séen fa’a wɔ̀ɔn, pɔ́ mélà’mie pi ka gyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie mèŋ n ka gÿo, é nyɛɛ metʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, pi fa’a wɔ̀ɔn ńtí pɔ́ pá’ pi ka pfɛ́ mbelég tà ńzẅɛ́.
en: Jesus answered them and said,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kag tʉ̀ nà shúm léjÿó sie é té láte, pi kag tʉ̀ pɔ́ nà shúm léjÿó sie nyìŋ jÿǒ, é gÿo á lá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ ge ná sɛ̌ shúm léjÿó mbwo pi, mélà’mie Ssé Tá la cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé yé ná yé.
en: Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Peg ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá gÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo?
en: Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ammó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi gÿo, aa lezáb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ gẅie à ka tǔm.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pʉŋe ngie: Anò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo, à fóo mbwo Ssé tá peg gyá ńzáb ntʉ́m ná gù áa kɔ́? Ammó gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo áa kɔ́?
en: They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?

ngiemboon: Pà mangʉa njʉ’ pég la pfɛ́ɛ mána, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ. Á lɔgɔ ńcʉ́me ná pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «À la náa wɔ́b shúm léjÿó sie é fóo tÿǒ lepwó».
en: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, Mǒsê la tè ná shúm léjÿó sie é fóo tÿǒ lepwó né pi wɔ́. Tá wɔ̀ɔn zɔ ne ńnáa kwà’ shúm léjÿó sie é fóo tÿǒ lepwó né pi.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.

ngiemboon: Á nue shúm léjÿó sie é fóo mbwó Ssé, aa nyìŋ gẅie à fǒ tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’, ńgÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó gwɔ́ wó.
en: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, ńnéŋe ńnáa sɛ̌ shúm léjÿó né peg fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Eshúm léjÿó sie é gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà nzyè tè lá’ gíŋe gyáŋa yé wɔ́. Nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà gag yé té lá’ gíŋe shÿó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto them,I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n ka shwóŋó gẅí, pi ne ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn, ńké tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie Tá wɔ̀ɔn nǎ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, à ge tó tsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn. M biŋ ńké le lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ńkẅile nyìŋ gẅie à tǒ ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńnáa pǐ wɔ́.
en: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.

ngiemboon: Á nue mèŋ n da tè fó tÿǒ lepwó ńtó pɔ́ légÿo yɔ́ɔn mmó gie mèŋ n kwǒŋ wɔ́, n da tó légÿo mmó gie nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn à ne ńkwoŋo.
en: For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkwoŋo, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie tà mèŋ n cʉ́’ tà tsɔ̌ tà’ nà pʉ̀a pie à la náa mbwo mèŋ pyé. À lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsò nzèm lá’ ńgwɔ́, mèŋ n zíme wɔ́b nà legwé.
en: And this is the Father's will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkwoŋo à yɔɔn: Nyìŋ gyá múɔ, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, angàŋ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Mèŋ n dá’a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsò nzèm ńzíme yé nà legwé.
en: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’ leen ńké ńzye lézẅɛ́te nzèm Yěsô, mélà’mie à gɔ̌ɔn ngie aa mmó léjÿó gie à fóo tÿǒ lepwó.
en: The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńgɔɔn ngie nyìŋ wɛ̂ à tè Yěsô míŋ Yesyɛ̂b wɔ́ le! Pege tě ne ńzsé tá we pɔ́ má we wɔ́ le? Á ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá à shwóŋó wégè fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie à ka fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́’?
en: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi gíŋe ńzẅɛ́te!
en: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them,Murmur not among yourselves.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn té gwɔ́ gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn zɔ shwoŋté yé wɔ́. Mèŋ, m biŋ ńdá’a nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsò nzèm, ńzíme yé nà legwé.
en: No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé ngie: «E Ssé lê twó yé ge lá’ zí’i nò yé mbwo mânyìŋ tsèm». Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjú’u nò gie à fóo mbwo Tá, ńzẅíŋe mmó gie à zí’i pʉ̀a, mbà wɛ̌ nyìŋ ge tó tsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn.
en: It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.

ngiemboon: Sɔɔn nyìŋ laa Tá gyá, tà ńdí’ ndà’ nyìŋ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ ye. Àngàŋ zɔ lǎ gyá Ssé Tá.
en: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.
