ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà ngàŋ ge gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.

ngiemboon: Ammó léjÿó gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: I am that bread of life.

ngiemboon: Pà mangʉa njʉ’ pí la pfɛ́ɛ mána nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńgíŋ ńkwé kwé.
en: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ammó léjÿó gie á fóo tÿǒ lépwó sẅɛ́’ɛ, áa gie nyìŋ jÿó, á le gíŋe ńkwé wɔ́.
en: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ máŋwɛ́, mèŋ n gee mmó léjÿó gie á ku’u légÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, á gie á fóo tÿǒ lépwó sẅɛ́’ɛ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjÿó yɛ̌ mmó léjÿó, mbà à ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó mengù’u mengù’. Yɛ̌ mmó léjÿó gie mèŋ n ge ná, ee mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ n ge ná tá à cʉa pú’u, epʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó e gwɔ́ wó.
en: I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, pàsá’a lá’ pá zoŋo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b tɛ’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ná mbab nnɛ́ ye pege pfɛ́?
en: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give ushisflesh to eat?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie, tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi lɔɔn tè pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́*Míŋ Nyìŋ, ńnú metse mé wɔ́, mbà pi tě ge gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn, ńnú metse mɔ́ɔn, á gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Mèŋ n gÿo ńzíme ngàŋ nà legwé á lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsò nzèm.
en: Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

ngiemboon: Á nue mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn ée shúm léjÿó se mbòŋo, metse mɔ́ɔn é gwɔ́ kwà’ mmó nǔ.
en: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn, ńnú metse mɔ́ɔn, mbà à temté ná mèŋ, mèŋ n temte ná yé.
en: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn zɔ ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn, aa lesa’á le gwɔ́. Mèŋ n dɔgɔ pɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ wó, áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ nyìŋ gÿo ḿpfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn, mbà a ge lɔg pɔ́ pú’u, gwɔ́ wó.
en: As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ shúm léjÿó sie é fóo tÿǒ lepwó é gwɔ́, é té pá’ sie metá pí la pfɛ́ ńké ńgíŋe nkwé kwé wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjÿó sɔɔn shúm léjyó, mbà ngàŋ ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò, á fʉ̀’ gie à la ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda á Kapernawúm.
en: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô jú’u shwóŋè yé, lelÿò zye légɔɔn ngie: Ashwóŋe yɛ̂ á tʉ̌ tà ńcʉa! À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ à wɔ̌ zẅí’te?
en: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heardthis, said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńzẅɛ́te ńtí nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn ne ńgege gẅi gege ka?
en: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them,Doth this offend you?

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ gyá*Míŋ Nyìŋ gíŋe ńkwɔ́’ ńgʉa né jʉ’ gie à la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, pi gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: Whatand if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ gÿo mé kwà’ ńgwɔ́ wó. Nyìŋ mesoŋ nê twó yé tè ku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Ashwóŋè gie mèŋ n náa mbwo pi fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ssé, yɛ̌ shwóŋè zɔ̌ gÿo tá mé gwɔ́ wó.
en: It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you,theyare spirit, andtheyare life.

ngiemboon: Tà mbàa pú’u, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi té ne ńzẅíŋe wɔ́. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Yěsô la lá’ ńzsé pʉ̀a pie é té ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́, ńgíŋe ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo sẅiŋe yé.
en: But there are some of you that believe not.For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie, áa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le tó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn té gwɔ́ gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn zɔ gÿǒ ngie ngàŋ tó wɔ́.
en: And he said,Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉ’ó, lelÿò*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô kÿo, pâ pɔ̌ té gíŋe ńgiŋ wɔ́.
en: From thattimemany of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém ngie: Pi tè ne ńkwoŋo gí légʉa wɔ́ ka?
en: Then said Jesus unto the twelve,Will ye also go away?

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, peg ge gʉa kẅɛ́te pɔ́ wɔ̌? Ɔ̀ gẅiin shwóŋè gie á náa le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.

ngiemboon: Peg léen ńdá’ ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋ ne ńzsé ngie ɔ́ɔ kwà’ nyìŋ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi pɛ̂ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, mèŋ n zɔ ka tè tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi wâ? Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ kě ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Sátà.
en: Jesus answered them,Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńgɔɔn Jẅidas, míŋ Símo Iskariod. Yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ge gÿo sẅiŋe Yěsô, tà mbɔɔ pá’ à laa nùɔ pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: He spake of Judas Iscariotthe sonof Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, ńne ńgwá ńgiŋe, à tè ne ńkwoŋo légʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea wɔ́, mélà’mie pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda la ne fa’a lézẅé yé.
en: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, alínɔ́ɔn pà Yuda gie mé tóŋo le línɔ́ɔn*mentàb ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: Now the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Fóo jʉ’ɔɔn ńgʉa né Jẅidea tá*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ gie ée jʉ’ó gyá yɔ́b menò mie ɔ̀ ne ńgÿo.
en: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judæa, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zsé yé, á le lÿoon mmó gie à ne ńgÿo wɔ́. Pá’, ɔ̀ ne ńgÿo memáa menò la, gÿo, alá’ zsé ɔ́.
en: Forthere isno manthatdoeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtí nue kwà’ pɔ́b mefɛ́ Yěsô la tè ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ nyé tè ku’, tá ńgʉa ná pi, mbà fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ áa mbwo pi ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.

ngiemboon: Alɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a njÿó le gẅi pʉ̀a. Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pɔ́ pʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie mèŋ n kě ne shwóŋó wɔ́b shwóŋ ngie ngÿǒ nò wɔ́b té poŋ.
en: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ pʉ ńgʉa jʉ’ʉ línɔ́ɔn. Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n tě ńgee nê wó wɔ́, ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ kaa ku’u.
en: Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; for my time is not yet full come.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b pú’u, ńgíŋ ńnéŋe Galilea.
en: When he had said these words unto them, he abodestillin Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pé piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbʉ nê jʉ’ʉ línɔ́ɔn, á leen ńké ńcʉ́m yé mánzsè. Tá ńgiŋ pɔ́ shute shuté.
en: But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ tà ne ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn, pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda ne ńgwá fa’a yé, ńzɛ́te ngie: Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

ngiemboon: Alá’ ne shwóŋè mencwò mencwò ńtí Yěsô. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa kwà’ nyìŋ. Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie à fʉte pʉ̀a fʉte.
en: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ ké tě ńgɔɔn nò ná yé tà ngyè ye kwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda.
en: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn tà ńgebe, Yěsô gʉa ne*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó.
en: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

ngiemboon: Á kʉ’ʉ pà Yuda, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: À gÿo lêkɔ́ ńzsé ŋwà’ne Ssé pɛ́’ɛ̀, tá mbà à la tè sekúd zí’i?
en: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a té fóo mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ka tumó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Jesus answered them, and said,My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà ngàŋ ge zsé, ka mmó gie mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a fóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, ka á gwɔ́ pɔ́ yɔ́ɔn shwóŋè wɔ́.
en: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, orwhetherI speak of myself.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńgɔɔn nò, ńgwɔ́ gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ shwóŋè yé, mbà à fa’a pɔ́ we legú’. Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne fa’a legú’ nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtúmo yé, mbà ngàŋ shwóŋó nò nénʉ́, atsɔ́ nò nŋwɔ́’te ŋwɔ’té té ná yé wɔ́.
en: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê zɔ la tè ná meŋwà’ne né pi wɔ́ le? Tà wɔ̌ ná pi mɔ̌ɔn ńne ńgiŋe mǒ? Pi piŋe fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Did not Moses give you the law, andyetnone of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?

ngiemboon: Alá’ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ*ssé tepòŋ! Awɔ̌ ne fa’a lézẅé gú?
en: The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ka gÿǒ pɔ́ ndà’ tà’a mmó, á pú ńgege gẅi metsèm.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi ké ńjú’, Mǒsê la zí’i gẅi lépú’u mûɔ mbàŋa, á fó tě fóo pɔ́ ne yé Mǒsê wɔ́, á fóo mbwo pà mangʉa njʉ’. Pi piŋ ne ḿbú’u múɔ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè gí.
en: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à ńgwɔ́ pi pú’u múɔ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè, mbɔ́gɔ pá’ pi ge fʉa*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pi piŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ ná mèŋ ngie mèŋ n gÿǒ nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè mélà’a kɔ́?
en: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?

ngiemboon: Tà pi ŋaga nò nyìŋ té zsé letsiŋé, pi ŋag pɔ́ pá’ áa jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u.
en: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Yerósalem ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ tè nyìŋ wá gẅie mé fa’a lézẅé yé la wâ?
en: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?

ngiemboon: Yé wɛ̂, ńne shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò, nyìŋ tě ńtsɔ́bɔ wɔ́. Ndyɛ̀’ pàsá’a lá’ pégè gyǎ ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo nénʉ́.
en: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?

ngiemboon: Tá’, wɛ̂ nyìŋ aa pɛ́’ɛ̀ peg ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie à fóo wó. Tá ńgʉa ná*Nzà’nkÿo, mbà nyìŋ tè gÿo zsé jʉ’ gie à fóo wó wɔ́.
en: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ fʉ’ó, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ńgɔɔn né ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Pi kwa’ ńne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn, ńgíŋe ńne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mèŋ fóo lê wó la? Mèŋ n zɔ ka tè záb ngie mèŋ n ge tó wɔ́. Tá’ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, aa nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò, mbà áa nò nénʉ́. Pi tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́.
en: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying,Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ne ńzsé yé. Mèŋ fóo pɔ́ ne lejʉ́ŋ yé, mbà yé zɔ ka tumó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’u yɔɔn nò, éfa’a légwoon yé, tá nyìŋ ké tè pwó ná yé záb, mélà’mie à yé fʉ̀’ la nyé tè ku’.
en: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’ ké ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé zǎb, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie, tà*Nzà’nkÿo ge gÿo tó gíŋe gÿo tsɔ́ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tà e tɔ́g mie nyìŋ wɛ̂ ne ńgÿo la?
en: And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which thismanhath done?

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay jú’ pá’ alá’ ne shÿɔ́gɔ ncwò ssé ńkíme Yěsô, pɔ́ gʉa ńgyá mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pɔ̌ túm pàpyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńgwoon Yěsô.
en: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie pege ge gíŋe ná’a ńnéŋe, n gʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus unto them,Yet a little while am I with you, andthenI go unto him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gwá fa’a wɔ̀ɔn, é piŋ ké le wɔ̀ɔn gyá, á nue ajʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó, pi tè ku’u létóo jʉ’ó wɔ́.
en: Ye shall seek me, and shall not findme: and where I am,thitherye cannot come.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a zye légɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Aa pá’ɔɔn ge gʉa pɔ́ nzɔ̌, tà peg le yé gyá? A ge gʉa kẅɛ́te pɔ́ pʉ̀a pégè pie pɔ́ la sa jʉ’, ńgee lá’ pà Gelekia keen? Kà à gee pɔ́ ńzí’i pà Gelekia nò Ssé?
en: Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ntí shwóŋè ee pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́, pá’ à gɔɔn ngie pi ge fa’a wɔ̀ɔn é piŋ ké le wɔ̀ɔn gyá, ḿbiŋ tè ku’u létóo jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee wó wɔ́?
en: Whatmanner ofsaying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not findme: and where I am,thitherye cannot come?

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nzsò nzèm lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn, á gie áa máamáa lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, Yěsô lu ssé ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn né ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Agága nyìŋ lɔɔn ne shÿó, á tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńnú ntse.
en: In the last day, that greatdayof the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying,If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná mèŋ la, mbà nò gie ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ge pumte: «Ntse ge fó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wé kẅɛ ne cwóŋo pá’ ntse gẅie é fóo lesá’a la».
en: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

ngiemboon: A lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgɔɔn Zẅìge Ssé gie pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m ná yé lɔ́ɔn ge kẅé. Á gwaa gwɔ́, a Zẅìge Ssé ŋwɛ́ nyé té tó, á nue Yěsô la nyé tè kǔ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we.
en: (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yetgiven; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)

ngiemboon: Alá’ jú’u shwóŋè Yěsô, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie aa kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie yé zɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo. Tá’, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie*Nzà’nkÿo lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le fó Galilea wɔ́.
en: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?

ngiemboon: Ńtí nue mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie:*Nzà’nkÿo ge lá’ fó pɔ́ nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavíd, ńgie*Nzà’nkÿo ge lá’ fó pɔ́ Mbetélehem á gẅie áa lá’ pà fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?

ngiemboon: Anò Yěsô leen ńké ḿma’a fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: So there was a division among the people because of him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ná pɔ́b ne fá’a légwoon Yěsô, tá’ atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b ké tè ku’u lézába pwó ná yé wɔ́.
en: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé pie mé ně ńtúmo wɔ́b piŋ nzèm ńkẅɛ́te mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pà*farisay, pɔ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ kaa lɔgɔ Yěsô ńtó wɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg laa zɔɔn ńjú’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ shwóŋó pá’ nyìŋ áwe wɛ̌ wɔ́!
en: The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ńzsé ngie à selé twó gí gí wɔ́?
en: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?

ngiemboon: Tsoon tsɔ̌ tà’ ná mekěm peg, tsoon tà’ ná pà*farisay laa záb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́!
en: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?

ngiemboon: Anùɔ lá’ yɛ̂ gie á tè ŋwà’ne Ssé zsé, ée megàŋ ndòon.
en: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay ne ńzoŋo pá’ɔɔn, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b, á Nikodem, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la gʉa ńgyá Yěsô. Á ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn né yetsɔ́ kwò yɔ́b ngie:
en: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

ngiemboon: Áa nà*lepʉ̌ sége pé’e, mé gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ gwě ntsaŋ té gwɔ́ gie mé ju’ú nò gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò yé, ḿbiŋ ńzsé mmó gie à gÿǒ?
en: Doth our law judgeanyman, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?

ngiemboon: Tá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ jú nyìŋ Galilea ka? Ɔ̀ lɔɔn fa’ mboŋó, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá ngie tsɔ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé laa kẅɛɛ Galilea wɔ́.
en: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ésyeente, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gʉa nê mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And every man went unto his own house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó yé jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive,
en: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ḿmʉ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mba’ámba’ ḿbiŋe jʉ’e Ssé. Alá’ ne ńtóo né lejʉ́ŋ yé, á ńnéŋe ssé, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b mmó.
en: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.

ngiemboon: Pàkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê lâ pà*farisay leen ńké ńnéŋe tà ńdɔgɔ tsɔ̌ manzwě ńtó, mbà mé kemé yé á ne ńgÿo gÿɛ́. Pɔ́ tÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, mé kemé manzwě wɔɔn, á ne ńgÿo gÿɛ́.
en: they say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne mbʉ̌, ńnáa mbwo pege ngie pege lɔg metóon ńtémte ntí panzwě pá’ wɔɔn ńzẅé. Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn jú ngie kɔ́?
en: Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ lejÿɔ’ lélɔg ńgwoon yé. Pɔ́ fa’a ndiletáŋ lélɔg sẅiŋe yé. Tá’ Yěsô ŋwé’e ssé, ńzye lélɔgɔ mûɔ tepwó we, ńŋwe’e mmó ssé.
en: This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and withhisfinger wrote on the ground,as though he heard them not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ké ne ńzɛ́te yé zɛ́te, á ńnéŋe tà ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà à laa nò tepòŋ gÿo, à vɔg ńzye lélɔgɔ tóon ńtéme yé.
en: So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them,He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgíŋe ńŋwé’e ssé, ńgíŋe ńzye lélɔgɔ mûɔ tepwó we, ńkʉate mmó ssé.
en: And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńzye légʉate pà wémɔ’ɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, ńzye nà melÿò. Tà á cʉ́’ʉ Yěsô gílé yé, manzwě ke ńnyé ńtyé pɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: And they which heardit, being convicted bytheir ownconscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest,evenunto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉ’ʉ nnɛ́, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌? Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ kaa témé gú wɔ́ ka?
en: When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her,Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Sɔɔn nyìŋ me Ndè. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ̀ɔn, n tè téme gú wɔ́. Gʉa, tè lá’ ńgíŋ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her,Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzye lézí’i mmó mbwo lá’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Akyɛ̀’ gie á kyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ náa né pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, mbà ngàŋ tě ńdá’a ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm wɔ́. Mbà à gẅǐin kyɛ̀’ gie áa kyɛ̀’ɛ mánzsè kwà’ le gwɔ́.
en: Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying,I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò gie ɔ̀ zsé nà twó mbùm jú, ńgwɔ́ mé le zẅíŋe nò gie ɔ̀ gɔɔn ná twó mbùm jú wɔ́.
en: The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n tsɛ ne ńgɔɔn nò gie mèŋ n zsé nà twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn tá’, anò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn ké ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́, á nue mèŋ n ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ka fó wó, ńgíŋe ńne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó. Tá’ ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi tě ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mèŋ fóo nê wó wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tě ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee né wó wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Though I bear record of myself,yetmy record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.

ngiemboon: Pi ŋag pʉ̀a gí pɔ́ nà ntí yé pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n tè ŋaga nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn fó ńŋag pɔ́ ntsaŋ, mbà wɔɔn léŋag aa we nénʉ́, á nue n zɔɔn tè gílé mèŋ wɔ́. Peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ̌. Á yé gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne mbʉ̌ gí ngie: Pʉ̀a mépʉ́a lɔɔn ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ pàjÿó ńgyá nà nò, mbà mé ge zẅíŋ ngie áa nò.
en: It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò gie mèŋ n zsě nà twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn, Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, à giŋé ne ńgɔɔn yé nò gie à zsě ná mèŋ.
en: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Tá gù aa nzɔ̌? Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi tè ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, ńgíŋe tè ne ńzsé mbàa Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Pi ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’e ńne zsé wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi ka giŋé ńzsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn yé.
en: Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered,Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gwaa gɔɔn mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ gie mé ńnéŋe nkáb gie mé náa mbwo Ssé wó. Nyìŋ ké tè yé gwoon, mélà’mie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà yé fʉ̀’ kaa ku’u.
en: These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie: Mèŋ n ge gʉa, pi cʉ́’ ńne ńgwá fa’a wɔ̀ɔn. Tá’, é ké kwé tsɛ̀ɛ nò tepòŋ gí. Pi tè ku’u légʉa jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó wɔ́.
en: Then said Jesus again unto them,I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a leen ńké ńjú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie: Yé zɔ ge zẅé mbùm ye keen? Á nue à gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Pi tè ku’u légʉa jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó wɔ́.
en: Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á gʉa ná pi, mbà pi ee pà ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mèŋ n kě ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tÿǒ lepwó. Pi ee pʉ̀a yɔɔn njÿó, mèŋ n kě tè nyìŋ yɔɔn njÿó wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them,Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi ge gÿo kwé tsɛ̀ɛ menò tepòŋ mí. Á nue pi lɔɔn tè zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê N gee gwɔ́à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ wɔ́, mbà pi ge kwé tsɛ̀ɛ menò tepòŋ mí.
en: I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I amhe, ye shall die in your sins.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gwɔ̌ pɔ́ wɔ̌? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n gee nyìŋ wá gẅie n dà lá’ ńzye léshwóŋó gẅi tà fó nzyeté la.
en: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them,Eventhe samethat I said unto you from the beginning.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gẅiin menò mie mèŋ n ge gɔɔn né pi tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, mbɔɔ mie mèŋ n ge ŋaga gẅi mǒ. Tá’ n gɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó pɔ́ mmó gie n da jú’u mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Àa ńké shwóŋó yé pɔ́ nò nénʉ́.
en: I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, pɔ́ té zsé ngie anò gie à gɔɔn né pɔ́b, à gɔɔn pɔ́ nà Ssé Tá wɔ́.
en: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo ńkwé’e*Míŋ Nyìŋ tà ńnáa tÿǒ, mbà pi ge leen ké zsé ngie N gee gwɔ́, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, é gíŋ zsé ngie mèŋ n gee ntěen ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó pɔ́ le yɔ́ɔn twó wɔ́. N gɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn la zí’i wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus unto them,When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I amhe, andthatI do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, peg yé zɔ gwɔ̌, à kaa nyé wɔ̀ɔn gílé mèŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á poŋo yé.
en: And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mɔɔn menò pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn zye lézáb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: As he spake these words, many believed on him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pà Yuda pie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńkú’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, mbà pi ge gwɔ́ kwà’*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him,If ye continue in my word,thenare ye my disciples indeed;

ngiemboon: Mbà pi ge zsé nò nénʉ́, anò nénʉ́ cu’u gẅí.
en: and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Peg ee pʉ̀a ná ngẅà Ábalam, peg laa zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nkwɔɔn tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́. Ɔ̀ gǎ ńgɔɔn ngie nò nénʉ́ ge cu’u weg?
en: They answered him, We be Abraham's seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à gÿo nò tepòŋ, aa nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: Jesus answered them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.

ngiemboon: Nkwɔɔn ee ntěen ńdá’a ńtsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a wɔ́, mûɔ mbʉ̀a zɔɔ ńdá’a ńtsẅé wó.
en: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever:butthe Son abideth ever.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá ńgwɔ́ gie múɔ lɔɔn ńkẅile gẅi ndá nkwɔɔn, mbà pi ge fó wó kẅɛ, kwà’ nénʉ́.
en: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n né ńzsé ngie pi ee ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam, tá’ pi ne fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn, á nue pi ne ńdʉ’ʉ shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn lʉ’.
en: I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie n dà gyá mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, tá pi piŋe ńgÿo gí pɔ́ mmó gie pi la jú’u mbwo tá gẅi.
en: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tá wèg aa Ábalam. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gwé’e ńgwɔ́ púɔ Ábalam, mbà pi gÿo pá’ yé.
en: They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them,If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi nò nénʉ́ gie mèŋ n ka jú’u mbwo Ssé, pi piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn, mbà Ábalam la tè pú’u gÿo.
en: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’a pɔ́ mefa’ gẅi tá, pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Peg tè púɔ gÿɛ́ wɔ́, peg gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ Tá wémɔ’ɔ́, á gwɔ́ Ssé.
en: Ye do the deeds of your father.Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father,evenGod.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé kě pé’e ńgwɔ́ tá gẅi, mbà pi kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ n da zɔɔn fó pɔ́ mbwo Ssé ńtó. N gwaa gwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn yé zɔ̌ tsẅi. Mèŋ n zɔ la tè záb ngie mèŋ n ge tó wɔ́, yé zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Jesus said unto them,If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ńké tè ne ńjú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́? Áa nue pi tè ku’u lézẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: Why do ye not understand my speech?evenbecause ye cannot hear my word.

ngiemboon: Agẅi tá aa Sátá, pi piŋ né ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie à né ńtsɔ́ɔn. Á gʉa ná yé, mbà tà fó nzyeté, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzẅè nyìŋ. À laa mé ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nò nénʉ́ wɔ́. Ńtí nue à tè nò nénʉ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé gẅiin, tà tsoon lǎg. À gwɔ̌ tà ne ńcÿɔ nò, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋè yé, á nue aa ngàŋa cÿɔ nò, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie yé zɔ la nuŋe cÿɔ nò.
en: Ye are ofyourfather the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, pi tě ńzába ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie mèŋ shwóŋó nò nénʉ́.
en: And because I tellyouthe truth, ye believe me not.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ ná pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á la’te nò tepòŋ gie mèŋ n dǎ gÿo? N dɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ shwóŋó nò nénʉ́, mbà pi piŋ ńké tě ńzẅíŋe wɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa nyìŋ Ssé à zẅí’te shwóŋè Ssé. Pi piŋ tě ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mélà’mie pi tè pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́.
en: He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hearthemnot, because ye are not of God.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Peg lɔɔn ńtóŋo gú ngie nyìŋ Samalîɛ, mbà peg kaa fʉa. Mbɔɔ légɔɔn ngie ssé tépoŋ ee ná gù.
en: Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: E*ssé tepòŋ tè ná mèŋ wɔ́. Mèŋ n gÿo yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mekù’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Pi piŋ ńké tè ne ńgÿo mekù’ mɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: Jesus answered,I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n tě ne fa’a pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn legú’ wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zɔ ne fa’a wɔ̀ɔn legú’, yé zɔ ge zá’ ntsaŋ.
en: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgiŋe nà shwóŋè gie mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn, mbà ngàŋ tě ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà peg zsě ngiessé tepòŋ ee ná gú. Ábalam la kwé, pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gíŋe ńkwé yɔ́b, ɔ̀ piŋ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgiŋe nà shwóŋè jú, á le lá’ ńkwé wɔ́.
en: Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.

ngiemboon: Ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ fáŋa ńcʉa tá wèg Ábalam keen? À la kwé, pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gíŋe ńkwéte yɔ́b. Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ́ɔ kɔ́ mmó?
en: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n zɔ tè fa’a wɔ̀ɔn legú’ wɔ́, mèŋ n dɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, awɔ̀ɔn legú’ le tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à náa legú’ wɔ̀ɔn aa Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Pi ne ńgɔɔn gí ngie aa Ssé gi.
en: Jesus answered,If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:

ngiemboon: Ńké tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́, mèŋ n kě ne ńzsé yé. N dɔɔn ngie mèŋ n tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ge cʉ́’ʉ ngàŋa cÿɔ nò pá’ pi. Tá’ mèŋ n né zsé yé, ḿbiŋe ne ńgiŋe nà shwóŋè yé.
en: yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.

ngiemboon: Ntʉ́m tá gẅi Ábalam la ne ńkága ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm gie à la tsɔ́ɔn légyá fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ge gÿo tó. À la ké ńgyá, ńkág tɛ’.
en: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he sawit, and was glad.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ fǒ nyé pɔ́ tè gẅiin ngù’ móm ntʉ̀a, ɔ̀ ka gyá Ábalam lá?
en: Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, Ábalam la gwaa gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ N gee gwɔ́.
en: Jesus said unto them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdag metóon lélɔg ńtémte Yěsô ńzẅé. Á sele nnɛ́ ḿbyé, éshú fó tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkẅɛ.
en: Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńcʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’, ńgyá tsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, mbà mé la zyé yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀.
en: And asJesuspassed by, he saw a man which was blind fromhisbirth.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, wɔɔn nyìŋ gwaa kẅɛɛ lepfòm, ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g pá’ɔɔn, mbà wɔ̌ gÿo nò tepòŋ? Yé kà má we, kà tá we?
en: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie yé kà pʉ̀a pie é la zyé yé la fʉa tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Àa fʉ̀ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie e Ssé cʉa ná yé ńdá’te mefà’ mé.
en: Jesus answered,Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie, njÿó lɔɔn ńnyé wó pá’ɔɔn, pege fà’ mefà’ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Nzèm ge síŋ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ le gíŋe ńku’u léfa’a fà’ wɔ́.
en: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n nyé tsɛ̀ɛ njyó, mèŋ, n gwɔ́ kyɛ̀’ɛ njÿó.
en: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńtsɔ́g metyé ssé, ńtyɛ́bte tsetsá’ ńdɔg ńzɔ́’te menÿɔ́g fʉ̀.
en: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Gʉa sɔgɔ tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon ntse Siloé. Siloé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie Letúm. Afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gʉa wó é sɔg shÿó wé, ńgwaa pìŋ nzèm ńne ńgyá jʉ’.
en: and said unto him,Go, wash in the pool of Siloam,(which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ̀a pé, lâ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ka ne ńgyá pá’ à lúɔ ndúɔ gyá yé fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ tè nyìŋ gẅie à kɔ̌ɔn ńgwá ńnéŋe ssé ńdúɔ ndúɔ wâ?
en: The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa yé, petsɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ, à sẅé yé sẅé, nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Aa kwà’ mèŋ.
en: Some said, This is he: otherssaid, He is like him:buthe said, I amhe.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Menÿɔ́g mú gÿǒ lêkɔ́ tá ńnyɛ́’ɛ?
en: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé le Yěsô, à tyɛbté tsetsá’, ńdɔg ńzɔ́’te menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie n gʉa Siloé é sɔg shÿó wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gʉa wó sɔg shyó wɔ̀ɔn, ńdeen ńké ńgyá jʉ’.
en: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ aa nzɔ̌? Á tsɔ́’ ngie, mèŋ, n kaa zsé.
en: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

ngiemboon: Mé gwóon ńdɔgɔ nyìŋ gẅie á ke ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g la, ńgʉa mvfò nùɔ pà*farisay.
en: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Yěsô ně ńgwaa tyɛ́bte tsetsá’, é lɔg gÿo menÿɔ́g nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nyɛ́’ɛ, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay zɛ́te yé yɔ́b pá’ á ne ńcʉa pú’u, tá á ne ńgyá jʉ’. Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, á ně ńdɔgɔ tsetsá’, ńzɔ́’te menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gʉa sɔg. Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńgyá jʉ’.
en: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pà*farisay gɔɔn ngie, nyìŋ gẅie à gÿǒ yɛ̂ nò, e Ssé zɔ ka tè yé túm, á nue á kɔ’ɔ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tepòŋ gǎ tá ńgÿo yɛ̂ ntí menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn? Afàgte leen ńké ńgwe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ńzɛ́te nyìŋ áwɛ̌ ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn jú ngie kɔ́ ná nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńnyɛ́’ menÿɔ́g mú? Á gɔɔn ngie, aa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda, ké tè ne ńzẅíŋe ngie ndÿò ŋwɛ́ kɔ’ɔ́ fʉ̀ à pǐŋ ńzeŋe wɔ́. Ńtóŋo tá we pɔ́ má we,
en: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.

ngiemboon: ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Wɛ̂ aa míŋ gẅì gẅie pì gɔɔn ngie mé la gwaa zyé yé á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ lá? Tà à pǐŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńgyá jʉ’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn?
en: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?

ngiemboon: Tá we pɔ́ má we tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa kwà’ míŋ weg, peg ne ńzsé ngie à la kẅɛ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g.
en: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pá’ á ně ńgÿo tá á ne ńgyá jʉ’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà peg kaa nò mǒ zsé. Ka wɔ̌ ně ńgÿo menÿɔ́g mé nyɛ́’ɛ wɔ́, mbà peg giŋé tè ne ńzsé wɔ́. Pi zɛ́te yé, à tè nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ légɔɔn nò gie áa ná yé wɔ́.
en: but by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.

ngiemboon: Tá we pɔ́ má we, gwɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, á nue pɔ́ la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pà Yuda ka zǎb ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô aa*Nzà’nkÿo, mé fóo ndá cú’tè ńjwoŋo ngàŋ.
en: Thesewordsspake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá we pɔ́ má we gɔɔn ngie pi zɛ́te yé, à tè nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ wɔ́.
en: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay gíŋe ńtóŋo nyìŋ gẅie à kaa fʉ̀ la, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie, tyé mvfò Ssé, éshwóŋó nò nénʉ́. Peg ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ wɛ̂ aa nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n kaa zsé kà aa nyìŋ tepòŋ wɔ́, kà à tè nyìŋ tepòŋ wɔ́ wɔ́. Ayɔ́ɔn mmó gie mèŋ n ne ńzsé, gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, mèŋ n kaa fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, mèŋ n ge fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńgyá jʉ’.
en: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinneror no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: À ně ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ná gù? À ně ńgÿo lêkɔ́ tá menÿɔ́g mú nyɛ́’ɛ?
en: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n ně ńdá’ shwóŋó gẅí, pi tè zẅí’te. Pi kwóŋo légwɔ́ gie n gíŋe ńgɔɔn gɔɔn mélà’a kɔ́? Tsye pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn gí lécʉ́’*ngàŋa kwò yé ka?
en: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hearitagain? will ye also be his disciples?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńzye lézoonte yé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Gù zɔɔ*ngàŋa kwò we, peg gwɔ́ pɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Mǒsê.
en: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses' disciples.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńzsé ngie Ssé la gɔɔn nò á mbwo Mǒsê, tá ńgʉa ná wɛ̂ nyìŋ, mbà peg tè ne ńzsé lefǒ sé wɔ́.
en: We know that God spake unto Moses:as forthisfellow, we know not from whence he is.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wá gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi gɔ̌ɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ̀ɔn tɛ̀’ pá’ pi tè ne ńzsé lefǒ sé wɔ́. Tá, mbà à kě ńnyɛ́’ menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn!
en: The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, andyethe hath opened mine eyes.

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm zsě ngie e Ssé aa tě njú’u ngyè nyìŋ tepòŋ wɔ́, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mekù’ Ssé, ḿbiŋ ne ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà Ssé ge jú’ ngyè ye.
en: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.

ngiemboon: Mé laa mé ńjú’u nyìŋ gẅie à nyɛ̌’ menÿɔ́g nyìŋ gẅie mé la gwaa zyé yé á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g wɔ́ le!
en: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ně ńgwɔ́ pé’e, mbà Ssé zɔ ka tè yé túm, mbà à ně tè ku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie, mé la lɔg pɔ́ nò tepòŋ ńzyé gú, ɔ̀ gee ńzí’i peg mmó lá! Ńdeen fó*ndá cú’tè ńjwoŋo yé ńnáa pi.
en: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńjú’ ngie pɔ́ fǒ*ndá cú’tè ńjwoŋo yé, ńgʉa ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ?
en: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him,Dost thou believe on the Son of God?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa wɔ̌ Ndè? Tá mèŋ n záb ntʉ́m nà yé?
en: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ ne ńgyá yé, yé zɔ gɔɔn nò mbwo gù pá’ɔɔn.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n zǎb ntʉ́m ná gù me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te ssé mvfò yé.
en: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ, n ka tóo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ńtí tsɔ́ ŋàg, le gwɔ́ gie epʉ̀a pie é ne ńgyá jʉ’ ge gwɔ́ cʉ́’ mefʉ̀, mefʉ̀ gyá jʉ’.
en: And Jesus said,For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay pie pɔ́ laa jʉ’ó, jú’u yɔɔn nò, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Mé té ńgɔɔn gɔɔn wɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn mefʉ̀ pɛ́’ɛ̀ tà sáŋa wég mǒ ka?
en: Andsomeof the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi ké gwé’e ńgwɔ́ pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, mbà pi tě ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ wɔ́. Tá pá’ pi gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Peg ne ńgyá jʉ’ lá, menò tepòŋ mí lɔgɔ ńgwóŋo ná pi.
en: Jesus said unto them,If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzyɛ́’ pɔ́ lepàa nká’ tà à tè pfó pɔ́ ncwò nká’ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nká’a mvfó wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ aa ntsǒŋ, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ fÿɛ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbyɛ̀b mvfó, mbà à ge pfó pɔ́ ncwò nká’.
en: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ncwò nkà’, à tsɔ́’ ncwò nká’,*menjʉ̀njÿò jú’ ngyè mbyɛ̀b mvfó. Á lɔg mezíŋ menjʉ̀jÿò mé ńtóŋo wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkẅɛ.
en: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo pɔ́ fó nká’ ńkẅɛ tà ḿmag, à gwɔ́ mvfò, pɔ́ gwɔ́ nzèm, mélà’mie pɔ́ lǐŋ ngyè ye.
en: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le cʉ́me nzèm nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, pɔ́ ge kÿo yé kÿo, mélà’mie pɔ́ té ngyè pʉ̀a méndyɛ̀’ɛ liŋ.
en: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò mbwo pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ké tè jú’u mmó gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ncwò nká’ menjʉ̀njyò à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: Then said Jesus unto them again,Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é ka vɔg ńtó, tá mèŋ n tó yɔ́ɔn, gwɔ́ pɔ́ metsǒŋ, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ mefÿɛ́. Tá*menjʉ̀njÿò ka ké tè ngyè yɔb jú’.
en: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

ngiemboon: Ncwò nká’ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfó ná mèŋ ńkúu nká’, mbà ngàŋ ge gÿo tsẅɛ́. À ge ne kúu nká’, é kẅɛɛ pá’ à kwǒŋ, éfa’a mmó mpfɛ̌.
en: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

ngiemboon: Antsǒŋ tó yé pɔ́ léjʉ, pɔ́ lézẅé, pɔ́ lécʉŋte. Mèŋ n ka tǒ légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gẅiin le gwɔ́ gẅie aa kwà’ wɛ̌ pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might haveitmore abundantly.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ. Ambyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo, à náa twó yé ńtí*njʉ̀njÿò yé.
en: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à laba yé pɔ́ nkáb, tà*menjʉ̀njÿò té mé wɔ́, à tè kwà’ mbyɛ̀b mvfó wɔ́. À neŋé tà ńgyá tsò tó, á gwá’a wɔ́b ńkÿo. Tsò gwoon tsɔ̌, ńgÿo pfwɔ́’ sa jʉ’.
en: But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ gwá’a*menjʉ̀njÿò ńkÿo, mélà’mie à ka tǒ pɔ́ ńdab nkáb. Ncʉ̀ŋ*menjʉ̀njÿò té ne ńkúu yé wɔ́.
en: The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo aa mèŋ, mèŋ n ne ńzsé*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I am the good shepherd, and know mysheep, and am known of mine.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gíŋe ne ńzsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ n náa twó yɔ́ɔn ńtí*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn.
en: As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

ngiemboon: N giŋé ńgẅiin tsɔ́*menjʉ̀njÿò mie é té tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ wɔɔn wɔ́. Á ně ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n gʉa ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó. Pɔ́b yɔ́b ge gÿo jú’ ngyè yɔ̀ɔn, à cʉa pú’u, nùɔ njʉ̀njyò gwɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́, ambyɛ̀bɛ gwɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́.
en: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold,andone shepherd.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie mèŋ n náa twó yɔ́ɔn tá gÿo gíŋe kẅé.
en: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɔɔn tè ku’u lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, mèŋ n zɔ kwoŋo náa twó yɔ́ɔn. Mèŋ n ku’u léná, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńkẅé. Áa mmó gie tá wɔ̀ɔn la tsẅi ngie mèŋ n gÿo.
en: No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn shwóŋè gíŋe ḿma’a fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda.
en: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn ngie: E*ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé. Àa pʉ̀a. À gɔɔn kɔ́ tà pi zẅí’te?
en: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ngie: Yɛ̂ té shwóŋè nyìŋ gẅiessé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé wɔ́. Ngwɔ́*ssé tepòŋ nyɛ́’ menÿɔ́g mefʉ̀?
en: Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ Yerósalem ne ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn lélɔg ńkímte pá’ mé la gíŋe ńyɛte jʉ’ʉ lénuŋo pwɔ́’ gie mé la cʉŋte, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’e fÿɔ́g,
en: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgwá ńgiŋte tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, á jʉ’ʉ ncwò kɔ̀’ Salomo.
en: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon's porch.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda leen ńké ńtÿɔ́’ɔ Yěsô ńnéŋe sòŋ, ńzɛ́te yé ngie, peg ge zẅí’te tà kú pɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ tá ɔ̀ shwóŋó wég nyìŋ gẅie ɔ́ɔ yé? Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo, ɔ̀ zyɛ́b zyɛ̌b shwóŋó wég.
en: Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ně ńdá’ shwóŋó gẅí, tá pi tè ne ńzẅíŋe wɔ́. Mefà’ mie mèŋ n ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo ne ńda’te nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: Jesus answered them,I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father's name, they bear witness of me.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi tè ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie pi tè ná nùɔ*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.

ngiemboon: *Me njʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn jú’ ngyè yɔɔn. Mèŋ n zsé wɔ́b, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n naa le gwɔ́ tèmì mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńkaa ndòon tèmì wɔ́. Sɔɔn nyìŋ piŋ tè ku’u léfó mbwo mèŋ ésa’a wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: and I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall anymanpluck them out of my hand.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn à la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ. À gẅiin tʉ̀ ńcʉa shúm ntsèm, sɔɔn nyìŋ tè ku’u léfó mbwó mèŋ é sa’a wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: My Father, which gavethemme, is greater than all; and nomanis able to pluckthemout of my Father's hand.

ngiemboon: Peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ.
en: I andmyFather are one.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gíŋe ńdag metóon, lélɔg ńtémte Yěsô ńzẅé.
en: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ka gÿo pi gyá mefà’ mbòŋo tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn mie é fóo mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, pi laga metóon lélɔg ńtémte wɔ̀ɔn ńzẅé pá’ɔɔn ńtí yɛ̌ mǒ?
en: Jesus answered them,Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Peg tě fa’a lélɔg metóon ńtémte gú ńzẅé, ńtí pɔ́ tsɔ́ fà’a mbòŋo wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nue ɔ̀ zoonté Ssé. Gù gẅie ɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ɔ̀ cʉ’ʉ́ ńgɔɔn pé ngie ɔ́ɔ Ssé.
en: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mé la tè ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ gí ngie Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn ngie pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ messé wâ»?
en: Jesus answered them,Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm ne ńzsé ngie mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ Ssé á téen ńdá’a ńkúbe wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie Ssé la gɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie à gɔɔn nò yé mbwo pɔ́b ée messé,
en: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;

ngiemboon: mèŋ m biŋ ńtyé pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Tá wɔ̀ɔn Ssé la tsɔ́’ ńtúmo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, mélà’a kɔ́ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn ngie mèŋ n gee Míŋ Ssé, pi gɔɔn ngie n zoonté Ssé?
en: say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn tè fa’ mefà’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tà pi záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n dɔɔn fa’, á fó ńgwɔ́ gie pi tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, pi zẅíŋ mefà’ ŋwɛ́. À cʉa pú’u, pi leen ńké ńzsé mboŋó ngie Tá wɔ̀ɔn aa né mèŋ, mèŋ n gwɔ́ né yé.
en: But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Fatherisin me, and I in him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgíŋe fa’ shÿó légwoon yé, tá á tsẅíle nà mbwo mɔ́b.
en: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò tɔ́g, Yěsô gíŋe ḿbiŋe nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ, á jʉ’ gie Jâŋ la zye lénu’ pʉ̀a ntse wó la, ńnéŋe wó.
en: and went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Jâŋ la tè gÿo tsɔ̌ ndàa gyá wɔ́, tá’ akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la gɔɔn nà mbàŋa wɔɔn laa nò nénʉ́.
en: And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ná pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó leen ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô.
en: And many believed on him there.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gÿo ńgwe gùɔ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Nǎzalo. Pâ mefɛ́ pé pe panzwě mépʉ́a, Mágtà pɔ́ Malîɛ pú ńtsẅê tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a Mbetáni.
en: Now a certainmanwas sick,namedLazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn Malîɛ gwɔ́ gẅie a lǎ’ ńdɔgɔ laméndɔɔn, ńzɔ́’ɔ Ndè tà á kû’, á gíŋe ńdɔg menòŋo twó mé ńtsí’i mekwò mé la. Nǎzalo gwe gùɔ pá’ɔɔn,
en: (It wasthatMary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)

ngiemboon: pɔ́b panzwě ŋwɛ́ mépʉ́a túm ńtsẅii mbwo Yěsô ngie: Andè, ashǔ lepyè gù ne ńguɔ tɛ’.
en: Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie, yɔɔn guɔ té gie á ge lɔgɔ yé wɔ́. Á ge gÿo mé ná mekù’ mbwo Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńcʉa mǒ ńná mekù’ mbwo Míŋ Ssé.
en: When Jesus heardthat, he said,This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo Mágtà, pɔ́ Malîɛ mbɔɔ Nǎzalo tɛ’.
en: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

ngiemboon: Ńké ńjú’u guɔ pá’ɔɔn, ńgíŋe ńnéŋe jʉ’ gie à laa wó lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a.
en: When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pege piŋe Jẅidea.
en: Then after that saith he tohisdisciples,Let us go into Judæa again.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ́’ ngie: Tsítsà, ntyě kaa sag pá’ pà Yuda ka ne fá’a lélɔg metóon ńtéme gú ńzẅé wɔ́. Ɔ̀ ge gíŋe piŋe wó lá.
en: Hisdisciples say unto him, Master, the Jews of late sought to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Tà’a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ tè gẅiin menèm ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém wɔ́ le? Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgiŋ fʉ̀’e zsó, mbà à tè kwɔɔnte wɔ́, mélà’mie kyɛ̀’ɛ njÿó ne ńgÿo mé gyá jʉ’.
en: Jesus answered,Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ne ńgiŋe lêtsẅɛ́’, mbà à ge kwɔɔnte, mélà’mie mmó gie á ge kyɛ’ jʉ’ ná né yé á té wó wɔ́.
en: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńgíŋe ngie: Ashǔ wege Nǎzalo ne ńdyé, tá mèŋ n ge gʉa zyeen yé.
en: These things said he: and after that he saith unto them,Our friend Lazarus sleepeth; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé leen ńké ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Andè, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à lyě, mbà à ge tsẅɛ.
en: Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, Yěsô ne shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie Nǎzalo kwě. Tá pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie à gɔɔn ngie à né ńdyé lyě.
en: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké shʉ̀ashʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Nǎzalo kwě.
en: Then said Jesus unto them plainly,Lazarus is dead.

ngiemboon: Á pǐŋ ḿboŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’ pá’ à gwǎ kwé, n tè ssé wɔ́. E Ssé zɔ gÿǒ ngie à gwɔ́ pú’u, ńtí gẅí, ńzsé ngie pi ge fó mǒ, é nyɛte záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ. Tá pege gʉa fʉ̀’ɔɔn tà ńkúu jʉ’ó.
en: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.

ngiemboon: Tomáse gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé le mélefág, gɔɔn mbwo yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ngie: Pi tó pega pɔ́ gʉa, ḿbúte ńkwé.
en: Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà Nǎzalo nuŋé tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè lyɛ̌’ lekùa.
en: Then when Jesus came, he found that he hadlainin the grave four days already.

ngiemboon: Pá’ lefǒ Yerósalem ńgʉa Mbetáni la gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó mekílo méntá la,
en: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off:

ngiemboon: lelÿò pà Yuda gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ tǒ mbʉ̀a Mágtà pɔ́ Malîɛ, létsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńtí fɛ́ wɔb gẅie à ka kwě.
en: and many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.

ngiemboon: Mágtà gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ ngie Yěsô né ńtóo, ńgwaa lu ssé gʉa zá’a yé, Malîɛ cʉ́’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ ndá.
en: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary satstillin the house.

ngiemboon: Mágtà tó ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ kaa pé’e ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn, mbà fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn ka tè kwé.
en: Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mèŋ n zsě ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzɛ́te kɔ́ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, mbà à ge ná ná.
en: But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will giveitthee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Afɛ̌ gù ge gÿo zíme nà legwé.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Thy brother shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Mágtà tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n zsě ngie à ge gÿo zíme nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsò nzèm pá’ mepfó ge lá’ ne zíme.
en: Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n gee nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo mé zíme ná legwé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ ńkwé mbɔɔ kwě, mbà à ge gÿo gwɔ́ wó.
en: Jesus said unto her,I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à nyé ntentʉ́, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, à těen ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́. Tà ɔ̀ zẅiŋé yɔɔn nò?
en: and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Oon me Cʉ̀apùa. Mèŋ, n zẅǐŋ ngie ɔ́ɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé gẅie mé ka né ńzẅí’te ngie à tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.

ngiemboon: Mágtà gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńgʉa ńtóŋo fɛ́ we Malîɛ, ńdemte yé ngie: Tsítsà aa pǐ ne ngie ɔ̀ tó.
en: And when she had so said, she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is come, and calleth for thee.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ jú’ pú’u, ńgwóon ńdu ssé lê tʉ̀ légʉa ńgyá yé.
en: As soon as she heardthat, she arose quickly, and came unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la nyé pɔ́ jʉ’e pɔ́ Mágtà ně ńtyé wó shwóŋe, tà mbà à kaa tɔ́g tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ gwɔ́.
en: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda pie é ně ńtó létsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b Malîɛ, gyá pá’ à fǒ ndá ńkẅɛ lê tʉ̀, ńcʉ́m yɔ́b nzèm yé, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie à gee twó lesyè ńnéŋe wó tá lʉa.
en: The Jews then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, She goeth unto the grave to weep there.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie Yěsô laa wó, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńkẅí’te mvfò ye, ńgɔɔn ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ kaa pé’e ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn, mbà fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn ka tè kwé.
en: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ à ne ńdʉa, pà Yuda pie pâ pɔ̌ pǔ ńtó gíŋ ne ńdʉa yɔ́b, ńzẅi, mbùm ye pú ńtsyɛte.
en: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi ka le’e pfó yé nzɔ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Andè, tóo ńgyá.
en: and said,Where have ye laid him?They said unto him, Lord, come and see.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lʉa.
en: Jesus wept.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gɔɔn ngie, pi gyá pá’ à kɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé.
en: Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him!

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́ ntá’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: Yé gẅie à la nyɛ́’ menÿɔ́g mefʉ̀, akɔ́ ka gÿo, à tè ku’u légÿo wɔɔn nyìŋ le kwé wɔ́?
en: And some of them said, Could not this man, which opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzẅi, ńgʉa jʉ’e lesyè, é gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ mvwɔ́’ɔ jʉ’, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tóon ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò.
en: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi sẅɛ́’te tóon wɛ̂. Mágtà, á fɛ́ mpfó tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, à ge gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn cʉ́’ʉ leme lem. Á nue ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ lekùa pá’ à la kwé.
en: Jesus said,Take ye away the stone.Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath beendeadfour days.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n ně tè gɔɔn né gù ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá legú’ Ssé wɔ́ le?
en: Jesus saith unto her,Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ tà sẅɛ’te tóon, Yěsô pʉ’ʉ twó yé, ńdíe tÿǒ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n nǎ ndǎg pá’ mèŋ sẅíŋte gú, ɔ̀ jú’.
en: Then they took away the stonefrom the placewhere the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted uphiseyes, and said,Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kɔ’ɔ́ ńne ńzsé ngie, n gɔɔn nò fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, ɔ̀ jú’ ngyè yɔ̀ɔn. Tá’ mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tyéte lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ lɔɔn, ńgie pɔ́ zẅíŋ ngie gù zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I saidit, that they may believe that thou hast sent me.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Nǎzalo, kẅɛɛ.
en: And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice,Lazarus, come forth.

ngiemboon: Ampfó kẅɛ. Mbà mé ka lɔg shúm nzsǒ ńzém mekwò mé mbàa mbwó mé, lâ shÿó wé. Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kyɛ́’te yé, ńkyɛɛ yé ńnyé à gʉa.
en: And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them,Loose him, and let him go.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pà Yuda pie pɔ́ ně ńtóo mbʉ̀a pà Malîɛ, é pie pɔ́ gyǎ mmó gie Yěsô gÿǒ, záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô.
en: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ́ ntá’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gʉa ḿbíte mmó gie Yěsô gÿǒ, éshwóŋ pà*farisay.
en: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.

ngiemboon: Mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, pâ pà*farisay leen ńtóŋo cú’tè lÿò, ńtóo tsoló ngie: Pege ge gÿo lêkɔ́? Nyìŋ wɔɔn né ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tɛ’.
en: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many miracles.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔɔn ńnyé yé á lɔg ńgʉa mvfò, mbà mânyìŋ ntsèm ge záb ntʉ́m ná ye. Pà*Roma tó ńgwɔ́ tɔ’, ńtága*jʉ’ʉ Ssé Yerósalem, mbɔɔ ngwòŋ wégè.
en: If we let him thus alone, allmenwill believe on him: and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ Kaifa. Á gwɔ́ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ ná yɛ̌ ngù’. Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi pǔ kaa tsɔ́ mmó nà nò gie pi gɔɔn lɛ̂ jú’u!
en: And one of them,namedCaiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,

ngiemboon: Pi kaa gyá ngie áa mboŋó mbwo pi pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ kwé nà twó lá’, ńcʉa lá’a ntsèm lépú ńdége wɔ́ keen?
en: nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, yé zɔ tě ńgɔɔn wɔ́, pá’ á la gwaa gwɔ́ yé zɔ́ gwɔ́ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ ná yɛ̌ ngù’ la, á tsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé ngie Yěsô ge kwé nà twó lá’ pà Yuda.
en: And this spake he not of himself: but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;

ngiemboon: Á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ nà twó pà Yuda gílé pɔ́b wɔ́, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ lélɔg ńtemte púɔ Ssé pie ée jʉ’ ntsèm, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ tà’ nùɔ.
en: and not for that nation only, but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad.

ngiemboon: Á fó lyɛ’ó, mekěm pà Yuda záb ngie pɔ́ ge fa’ shÿó tà zẅé Yěsô.
en: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó fʉ̀’ó à tè gíŋe shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńcʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda wɔ́. Á lɔg tsɔ́ shÿó lá’ gẅie ée lelyěen, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie mé tóŋo le Efalaim, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ńnéŋe jʉ’ó.
en: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with his disciples.

ngiemboon: Alínɔ́ɔn Páska pà Yuda la ne ńtóo, lelÿò pà Yuda ne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ḿvɔgɔ Yerósalem, á lésɔg*melɔ̌’ ná pɔ́b.
en: And the Jews' passover was nigh at hand: and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne fa’a Yěsô, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ cú’te tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé Yerósalem, ńne sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwǎŋ ngie à ge tóo línɔ́ɔn yɔɔn? Ngwɔ́ à zɔɔn le tó.
en: Then sought they for Jesus, and spake among themselves, as they stood in the temple, What think ye, that he will not come to the feast?

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, pâ pà*farisay ka gɔɔn ngie, nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie Yěsô aa wɔ́, á kem, mé gʉa ńgwoon yé.
en: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that, if any man knew where he were, he should shewit, that they might take him.

ngiemboon: É gÿo ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzága lyɛ̌’ ntɔgɔ́, à gwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà pà Yuda. Yěsô gʉa né Mbetáni, á jʉ’ gie Nǎzalo gẅie à la zíme yé nà legwé la lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé wó.
en: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo ńtóŋo línɔ́ɔn nà lezíŋ sé, Nǎzalo gwɔ́ tsɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a pie pâ Yěsô la ne ńjÿó shúm, Mágtà ne ńgaba shúm léjÿó.
en: There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ ńnéŋe tà kaa kème líta laméndɔɔn gie á cÿɔ́g nkáb tɛ’, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ legǐ gẅie mé tóŋo le nard ńnyɛte. Á lɔg ńzɔ́’ mekwò Yěsô, ńdɔg menòŋo twó mé ńtsí’i. Agyě laméndɔɔn kwɔ́’ ḿbú ńjÿó ndá.
en: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn nge gÿo sẅiŋe Yěsô gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon'sson, which should betray him,

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ mé ně tè sẅiŋe yɔɔn laméndɔɔn ńkẅé*mendenie nkÿo tá, ńná né mepóŋ wɔ́?
en: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

ngiemboon: Jẅidas lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn pú’u, séen ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mezìŋe mepóŋ wɔ́, à laa ntsǒŋ, á nue yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgẅiin mûɔ pɔ̀ɔn nkáb wɔba Yěsô, mé ńnéŋe nkáb tsoló á jʉʉ.
en: This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyé manzwě wɛ̂ pɛ́’ɛ̀, nyé yé, à tʉ́ njÿó ńzɔ́’ɔ pfó yɔ́ɔn, tá mé gÿo ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: Then said Jesus,Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.

ngiemboon: Mepóŋ ge gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm. Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pege tě ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pà Yuda tà ńgyɔ́ɔn jǔ’ ngie Yěsô aa Mbetáni, ńtóo wó, ńké tě séen ńtóo pɔ́ légyá Yěsô wɔ́, ńtóo pɔ́ légyá Nǎzalo gẅie Yěsô ka zíme yé nà legwé la.
en: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

ngiemboon: Metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ gyá pú’u, ńzáb ngie mé fa’ shÿó lézẅé mbɔɔ Nǎzalo.
en: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie lelÿò pà Yuda ka fǒ pɔ́ nà nò Nǎzalo, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkÿo wɔ́b kÿo, ńzába ntʉ́m pɔ́ ná Yěsô.
en: because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, alá’ gie á tǒ línɔ́ɔn Páska jú’ ngie Yěsô ne ńtóo né Yerósalem,
en: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńkɔ́’ meyáŋa letÿǒon, ńdɔg ńkẅɛɛ tÿǒsoŋ, ńgʉa ńzá’a yé, ńne ńgɔɔn né ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: GùugẅîE Ssé gwɔ́ né fùɔ gẅie à lɔgɔ lezíŋ Ssé ńtóo. E Ssé gwɔ́ né fùɔ pà Israel.
en: took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessedisthe King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá mûɔ nzìkásè, ńkwɔ́’ ńnéŋe ndùmó. Á gwɔ́ pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie:
en: And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,

ngiemboon: À ńnéŋe ndùm mûɔ Nzìkásè».
en: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gyá yɔɔn nò, pɔ́ té gwóon ńdwo ńjú’ wɔ́. Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we á tÿǒ lepwó, tá pɔ́ leen ńké ńkímte ngie mé la tʉ́ njÿó ńŋwe’e yɛ̌ nò ńtí yé, ńgíŋ ńkímte ngie alá’ la gÿo ná yé pɔ́ pá’ mé la ŋwe’e.
en: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, andthatthey had done these things unto him.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la gwaa tó zá’a Yěsô, mbà pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ laa ssé fʉ̀’ gie Yěsô la gɔɔn né Nǎzalo ngie à fó tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè ńkẅɛ, á zíme ná legwé, la gwá ńdɔgɔ yɛ̌ nò ésa jʉ’.
en: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo tá lá’ kẅɛ, ńgʉa ńzá’a Yěsô, mélà’mie pɔ́ la jú’ pá’ à gÿǒ yɔɔn nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay gyá pú’u, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: pi kaa gyá ka. Atsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege gÿo á té wó wɔ́. Alá’ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm ye.
en: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Gelekia, lá pʉ ńtóo Yerósalem léjÿó línɔ́ɔn, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó ńgyá Filib, á nyìŋ Mbetsayida nà pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Andè, peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá Yěsô.
en: the same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.

ngiemboon: Filib gʉa shwóŋó Ndeléya, pɔ́ yé mépʉ́a gʉa ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô.
en: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie afʉ̀’ gie mé ge gyá legú’ we*Míŋ Nyìŋ á kǔ’.
en: And Jesus answered them, saying,The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mvòm ngesáŋ lɔɔn tè gwe ssé tà ńkwé wɔ́, mbà e ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́. Tá ńké ńkwé, mbà e ge sá’, é ná memvòm tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkwoŋo we le gwɔ́, mbà à ge pyé le gwɔ́ ŋwɛ́. Nyìŋ ké ńgwága nò ná we le gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, mbà à ge lá’ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne fa’a mbwo mèŋ, á cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ. Àjʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee wó la, ngàŋa fà’ wɔ̀ɔn gÿo ńgwɔ́ yé wó. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne fa’a mbwo mèŋ, mbà Tá wɔ̀ɔn ge gÿo ná mekù’ mé.
en: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him willmyFather honour.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn, mbà lém yɔ́ɔn tsɔ’ɔ́. Mèŋ n ge ké gɔɔn ngie kɔ́? É gɔɔn ngie Tá wɔ̀ɔn gÿo mèŋ n tsẅɛ́ɛ yɔɔn fʉ̀’ la? Mèŋ n dɔ̌ɔn ńzɔɔn ńtóo ńtí pɔ́ yɔɔn fʉ̀’.
en: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, gÿo mé gu’te lezíŋ shú. Ngyè nyìŋ leen ńké fó lepwó ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gÿǒ pú’u. Mèŋ n ge gíŋe gÿo sẅé sẅé.
en: Father, glorify thy name.Then came there a voice from heaven,saying, I have both glorifiedit, and will glorifyitagain.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ gie á laa jʉ’ó jú’ yɛ̌ ngyè ngie: Ée lefàŋ sie é vɛ́te. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔ̌ɔn nò mbwo yé.
en: The people therefore, that stood by, and heardit, said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Yɛ̂ ngyè kaa gɔɔn nò pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ liŋé mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, e nyɛɛ pɔ́ mbwo pi.
en: Jesus answered and said,This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ kǔ’ pá’ e Ssé ge ŋag yɔɔn njÿó. Á fʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge kẅile mûɔ ntɔ́’ yɔɔn njÿó, é náa yé pǐ.
en: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mé lɔɔn ńgÿo ńkwé’e wɔ̀ɔn tà náa tÿǒ, mbà mèŋ n ge shwoŋte pʉ̀a metsèm náa lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ.
en: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw allmenunto me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńda’te ntí legwé gie à ge gÿo kwé yɛ̌.
en: This he said, signifying what death he should die.

ngiemboon: Alá’ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Peg la jú’u tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie:*Nzà’nkÿo ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Ɔ̀ piŋ ngǎ ńgɔɔn ngie, mé ge kwé’e*Míŋ Nyìŋ náa tÿǒ?*Míŋ Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ aa wɔ̌?
en: The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Akyɛ̀’ té ge gíŋe gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ntyě sag wɔ́. Akyɛ̀’ nyé ssé, pi giŋ, ḿbɔ́g nzěm lékẅɛ́te gẅí. Á nue nyìŋ ne ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, á le zsé jʉ’ gie à gee né wó wɔ́.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

ngiemboon: Akyɛ̀’ lɔɔn ńnyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi záb ntʉ́m nà kyɛ̀’, ńdɔg ńcʉ́’ púɔ kyɛ̀’. Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà á ku’, á gʉa ńdyeen jʉ’ gie pɔ́ té ge gyá yé wɔ́.
en: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light.These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tsɛ ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn tɛ’ mvfò pʉ̀a tá’, pɔ́ ké tè záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:

ngiemboon: Tà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kɔ̌ɔn ńnyɛ metʉ̀ mé pɔ́ mbwo pà wɔ̌»?
en: And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

ngiemboon: Esǎya la gíŋe ńgɔɔn mmó gie á ge gÿo tá pà Yuda le záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, à la gɔɔn ngie:
en: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

ngiemboon: à cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ le kúbe mà wɔb à gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe wɔ́».
en: And I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Esǎya gɔɔn nò jʉ’ɔɔn ná Yěsô, á nue à la tʉ́ njÿó ńgyá legú’ Yěsô.
en: These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

ngiemboon: Mé la tsɛ ne ńgwága Yěsô gwǎg tá’, tsɔ̌ lelÿò mekěm pà Yuda záb ntʉ́m ná yé. Tá ńgÿo pɔ́ ndyeen lyeen, ḿbɔ́gɔ pà*farisay léjwoŋo wɔ́b*ndá cú’tè.
en: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confesshim, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ la kwoŋ mekù’ mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ náa mbwo pɔ́b, ńtɔ́g mie é fóo mbwó Ssé.
en: for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn nê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà ngàŋ tě ńzába pɔ́ ndà’ ná mèŋ wɔ́. À giŋé ńzába ná nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Jesus cried and said,He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ wɔ̀ɔn, à giŋé ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gee kyɛ̀’, n ka tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó légwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, á le gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm wɔ́.
en: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn à tè kú’te, mbà mèŋ n zɔ tè ŋaga yé wɔ́. Á nue n da tè tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó léŋag pʉ̀a wɔ́. N da tó légÿo pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́.
en: And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwá’a wɔ̀ɔn, ńdʉ’ʉ shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, mbà ngàŋ gẅiin nyìŋ gẅie à ge ŋaga yé. Ashwóŋè gie mèŋ n ka gɔɔn zɔ̌ ge lá’ ŋaga yé lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsò nzèm.
en: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.

ngiemboon: Á nue n da tè gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie á fóo né mèŋ wɔ́, n da gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn la tsẅi ngie mèŋ n gɔɔn, mbɔɔ nò gie mèŋ n ge gɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ne ńzsé ngie nkʉ̀ gẅie à la cʉ́me mbwo mèŋ àa le gwɔ́ tèmì. Áa pú’u, anò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn, n gɔɔn pɔ́ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn la tsẅi.
en: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉ́’ pɔ́ pá’ njÿó ge lʉ́a mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà, Yěsô ne ńzsé ngie ayé fʉ̀’ kǔ’ pá’ à ge fó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó é gʉa kẅɛ́te Tá we. Pá’ yé Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgwɔ́ pé la, á kẅi’i ńkwoŋo wɔ́b tà ńcʉ́me.
en: Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.

ngiemboon: Ncwò nzém gÿo ńgwɔ́, pâ pɔ̌ ńnéŋe ssé léjÿó shúm. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Sátà ně ńdá’ ńnéŋe kwàŋte lésẅiŋe Yěsô tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m Jẅidas Iskariod, míŋ Símo.
en: And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon'sson, to betray him;

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńzsé ngie Tá we la pú ńnéŋ shúm ntsèm mbwo yé, ńgíŋe ne ńzsé ngie à la fó mbwo Ssé, à piŋ ne ńgee né lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;

ngiemboon: Ńńnéŋe tà ńdu ssé, ésẅɛ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye, ńnuŋe ssé, ḿbíi tágwele ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌’ yé.
en: he riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.

ngiemboon: Ńnéŋ ntse tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ, ńzye lélɔg sɔg mekwò*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńdɔgɔ tágwele gẅie à la tʉ́me zẅɛ̌’ yé ńtsí’i.
en: After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipethemwith the towel wherewith he was girded.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná Símo Piɛ, á gɔ́ɔn né yé ngie: Andè zɔ ge sɔg mekwò mɔ́ɔn lá!
en: Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n ne ńgÿo, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ́ le jú’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́. Tá ké gÿo jú’.
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Azeŋe yɔ́ɔn, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ́ le mekwò mɔ́ɔn sɔg. Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n dɔɔn tè sɔg, mbà pɔgɔ tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him,If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, me Nde, tè sɔg pɔ́ ndà’ mekwò mɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ pú sɔg mbwo mɔ́ɔn pâ twó yɔ́ɔn.
en: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but alsomyhands andmyhead.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gíŋe sɔg mbùm nyìŋ gẅie à sɔ̌g nnɛ́ wɔ́. Á nue ngàŋ pǔ ńdʉ́a. Pi ee pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà mbùm gi lʉ̌a, e ké tè gi metsèm wɔ́,
