en: Jesus saith to him,He that is washed needeth not save to washhisfeet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à la ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo sẅiŋe yé tá ńgɔɔn ngie mbùm gi metsèm kaa lʉ́a.
en: For he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sɔg mekwò mɔ́b tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿma’ nzsǒ ye, ńgíŋe ńnéŋe ssé léjÿó mmó, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie tà pi ju’ú mmó gie mèŋ fóo légÿo ná pi?
en: So after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them,Know ye what I have done to you?

ngiemboon: Pi tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê Tsítsà, ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê Ndè, ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò á nue mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: Ye call me Master and Lord: and ye say well; forsoI am.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ Ndè, ńgwɔ́ Tsítsà, mèŋ sɔ̌g mekwò mí, mbà á zɛ́te ngie pi gí, pi ne sɔgɔ mekwò mí pi né pi.
en: If I then,yourLord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another's feet.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n nyɛɛ gẅi fʉ̀’ légwɔ́ gie pi gí pi ge gÿo pá’ pi gyǎ mèŋ n gÿo.
en: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, anzì’i fà’ tè fáŋ ńtɔ́gɔ tá fà’ we wɔ́, angàŋ ntúm ké tè fáŋ ńtɔ́gɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńtúmo yé wɔ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi né ńzsé fʉ̀’ɔɔn la, pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pi ee pà shÿó mbòŋo.
en: If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě tě ńgɔɔn yɔɔn nò mbwo pi metsèm wɔ́, mèŋ n ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie mèŋ n da tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b. Tá á poŋ ngie ammó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé à pumte. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie nyìŋ gẅie peg yé né ńteme shúm léjÿó ńjÿó kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ mbù wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tʉʉ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi fʉ̀’ɔɔn tà mɔɔn menò gÿo ńtó, pi zẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n gee N gee gwɔ́.
en: Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I amhe.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkúe nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n tumó yé, mbà à kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn. Nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńkúe wɔ̀ɔn, à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, além yé tsɔ́’ɔ tɛ’, á shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pi ge sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said,Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô jú’, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ sele ńdíe fɛ́ we, pɔ́ té zsé nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn yé wɔ́.
en: Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná*ngàŋa kwò yé gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’, á gwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ yé ńne ńjÿó mmó.
en: Now there was leaning on Jesus' bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ myɛ’ lejÿɔ́g ńdɔg ńtsẅi ngie à zɛ́te ngie à gɔɔn wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.

ngiemboon: Á lemte letuŋó Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, angàŋa aa wɔ̌?
en: He then lying on Jesus' breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie, aa nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n ge cÿɔ’ɔ pwɔ́’ɔ mmó léjÿó, é náa mbwo yé. Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ḿbíi pwɔ́’ɔ mmó, ńcÿɔ’. Ńnáa mbwo Jẅidas Iskariod, míŋ Símo.
en: Jesus answered,He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when I have dippedit.And when he had dipped the sop, he gaveitto Judas Iscariot,the sonof Simon.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwɔ́ tà ńkẅé, Sátà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lwo sẅɛte ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin légÿo.
en: And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him,That thou doest, do quickly.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ sɔɔn nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a pie é lâ jʉ’ó, tè jú’u nò gie Yěsô fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńkwaŋa ngie à gɔɔn ngie Jẅidas gʉa ńjú sɔ́ba pɔ̌ shúm línɔ́ɔn, ka pɔ́ ngie à náa mmó mbwo mepóŋ wɔ́, á nue yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgẅiin mûɔ pɔ̀ɔn nkáb wɔba pɔ̌.
en: For someof themthought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buythose thingsthat we have need of against the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas kẅé pú’u, ńgwóon fó ndá ńkẅɛ. Mbà nzěm ně síŋ.
en: He then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwɔ́ tà fó ndá ńkẅɛ, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà mé nǎ legú’ mbwo*Míŋ Nyìŋ. Mbà*Míŋ Nyìŋ ka náa legú’ mbwo Ssé.
en: Therefore, when he was gone out, Jesus said,Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.

ngiemboon: Pá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ ka nǎ legú’ mbwo Ssé la, E Ssé lê twó mbùm yé ge gÿo náa legú’ mbwo yé, tà á cʉ́’ pɔ́ méjʉ’ à ná.
en: If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.

ngiemboon: Pènkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn, pege tè gíŋe ńnéŋe tà ntyě sag wɔ́. Pi ge gÿo ne gwá fa’a wɔ̀ɔn pá’ mèŋ n ka gɔɔn mbwo pà Yuda ngie: Ajʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó, pi tè ku’u létóo wó wɔ́. Mèŋ n giŋé ńgɔɔn yɛ̌ nò mbwo pi fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me: and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say to you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge ná*lepʉ̌ se sẅé né pi, e gwɔ́ ngie: Pi kwoŋe pi né pi. Pá’ mèŋ n da kwoŋo gẅi lá, pi gí kwoŋe pi né pi.
en: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋe pi né pi, mbà mânyìŋ ntsèm ge zsé ngie pi ee*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: By this shall allmenknow that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ gee pɔ́ ne nzɔ̌. Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ajʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó, ɔ̀ tè ku’u lécʉ́me nzèm mèŋ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́. Ɔ̀ ge táa tá cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: Simon Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered him,Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, akɔ́ ge gÿo tá mèŋ n de gwóon ńcʉ́me nzèm gù wɔ́? Mèŋ n ge náa twó yɔ́ɔn e tí gú.
en: Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ ge náa twó jú é tí wɔ̀ɔn? Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gú, kwà’ nénʉ́, mênkɔ’ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ̀ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.
en: Jesus answered him,Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.

ngiemboon: Yěsô giŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò ye ngie: Tà ntʉ́m gẅi gíŋe ḿvɛ. Pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé, ńgíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m gẅi ná mèŋ.
en: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

ngiemboon: Mejʉ’ʉ leńnéŋe, ée ndá Tá wɔ̀ɔn tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Mèŋ n ge gʉa cwoŋte jʉ’ʉ gí. Á kě tè pú’u wɔ́, mbà n tè gẅi shwóŋ. Mèŋ n ge gʉa cwoŋte jʉ’ʉ gí.
en: In my Father's house are many mansions: ifit werenotso, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔɔn ńgÿo ńgʉa tà cwoŋte jʉ’ʉ gí, mbà mèŋ n ge piŋ nzèm fa’a gẅi pege gʉa. À cʉa pú’u, ajʉ’ gie mèŋ n ge lé wó, pi gíŋe ńgwɔ́ gí wó.
en: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am,thereye may be also.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà jʉ’ gie mèŋ ńgee né wó, mbà pi ne ńzsé mánzsè.
en: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

ngiemboon: Tomáse gɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, peg tè ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ gee né wó wɔ́. Peg ge gǎ tá zsé mánzsè?
en: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge mánzsè, mèŋ n ge nò nénʉ́, mèŋ n ge legwɔ̌ wó. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ á le gʉa mvfò Tá wɔ̀ɔn té cʉa pɔ́ ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: Jesus saith unto him,I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pé’e ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi zsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn yé. Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé yé. Mbà pi gyǎ yé.
en: If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

ngiemboon: Filib jú’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, nyɛɛ weg Tá gù ŋwɛ́ à ku’ pú’u.
en: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Filib, pege neŋé nzẅìŋ wɔɔn, ɔ̀ nyé pɔ́ tè zsě wɔ̀ɔn la? Nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ wɔ̀ɔn la, à gyǎ Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Ɔ̀ gǎ tá ngie nyɛɛ wég Tá gù ŋwɛ́?
en: Jesus saith unto him,Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thouthen, Shew us the Father?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè ne ńzẅíŋe ngie mèŋ n ge nê Tá wɔɔn, peg yé pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó wɔ́ ka? Anò gie mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi téen fóo mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa nê mèŋ zɔ lɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn fa’a mefà’ mé.
en: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔɔn shwóŋó gẅi ngie mèŋ n ge nê Tá wɔɔn, peg yé pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó, pi zẅíŋ ngie áa pú’u, éfó ńgwɔ́ gie pi tè zẅíŋe nò gie n gɔɔn wɔ́, pi fó ńdíe pɔ́ mefà’ mie pi gyǎ mèŋ fa’, ńzẅíŋ.
en: Believe me that Iamin the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works' sake.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m ná Mèŋ, mbà à ge fa’ yé mefà’ mie mèŋ ne fa’a, tà mé fáŋ ńtɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, á nue mèŋ n gee né lejʉ́ŋ Tá.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greaterworksthan these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ kɔ́ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo. Á cʉa pú’u, mèŋ múɔ n da’te legú’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo Ssé, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo yɛ̌ mmó.
en: If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will doit.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi ge gÿo kú’te mbʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn.
en: If ye love me, keep my commandments.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dêen ńké sẅíŋte Tá wɔ̀ɔn, à náa wetsɔ̌ Ntàg Nzèm né pi, á gẅie pi lâ pɔ̌ zɔ ge cʉ́’ʉ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;

ngiemboon: Antàg Nzèm wéwɛ̌ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge Ssé, à la’te nò nénʉ́. Epʉ̀a njÿó té ku’u lékúe Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ té ne ńgyá mefà’ mé wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́. Tá pi ne ńzsé yé, mélà’mie aa lejʉ́ŋ pi, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ ná pi.
en: eventhe Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen ńge ńnyé gẅi pi gwɔ́ púɔ metsé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ne ńtóo ne lejʉ́ŋ pi.
en: I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ pɔ́ méjʉ’, pʉ̀a njÿó le gíŋ ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tá ńgʉa ná pi, pi ne ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn gyǎ, mélà’mie n gwɔ̌ pɔ́ ntentʉ́. Pi gÿo ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ gí ntentʉ́.
en: Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ó, pi zsé ngie peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn pǔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó, é gíŋe zsé ngie pi ee nê mèŋ, mèŋ n gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi.
en: At that day ye shall know that Iamin my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn, ńne ńgíŋe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ aa nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn. Tá wɔ̀ɔn ge kwoŋo nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n gíŋe ńkwoŋo wɛ̌ nyìŋ, ńgÿo à zsé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.

ngiemboon: Jẅide, mé ké tě ńgɔɔn Iskariod wɔ́, gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, á ge gwɔ́ lêkɔ́ tá ɔ̀ gÿo peg ndà’ zɔ gyá gú, epʉ̀a metsèm le gyá gú wɔ́?
en: Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à ge kú’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn. Tá wɔ̀ɔn piŋ ńkwoŋo yé, peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn tó ńtsɛ́ɛ yé, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m ye.
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋ, mbà à tè kú’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́. Ashwóŋè ŋwɛ́ zɔɔn tě fóo pɔ́ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. Á fóo pɔ́ mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn gẅie à ka túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father's which sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò á fʉ̀’ gie pege nyě ńgwɔ́ lɔɔn.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, beingyetpresent with you.

ngiemboon: Pi ge cʉ́’ nzèm, Tá wɔ̀ɔn lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńtúmo Ntàg Nzèm gẅi, à gwɔ́ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a. À tó ńzí’i gẅi shúm ntsèm, ńgÿo pi kímte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mèŋ n dǎ shwóŋó gẅí.
en: But the Comforter,which isthe Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi cʉ́’ nzèm ntʉ́m gẅi gíŋe ḿvɛ, tà pi cÿɔ’. Mèŋ n ge néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, e gwɔ́ mbʉ́lè gie e fóo ná mèŋ, e tè gie mé fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njyó wɔ́.
en: Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

ngiemboon: Pi jǔ’ pá’ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge gʉa tá gíŋe piŋ nzèm gyá gẅí. Pi é kě ńgwɔ́ pé’e ńne ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi kág kǎg pá’ mèŋ n gee né lejʉ́ŋ Tá, á nue Tá à fǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and comeagainunto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ tʉ́ʉ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi tá yɛ̌ nò gÿo tó, á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tá ńtó, pi záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

ngiemboon: Tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn pege tè gíŋe ńgee shwóŋe wɔ́. Á nue fùɔ gẅie à sá’a yɔɔn njÿó ne ńtóo. À tè gẅiin shÿó légÿo mmó ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: Hereafter I will not talk much with you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.

ngiemboon: Tá mé zẅǐŋ ngie à tó pú’u, epʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lêen ńke ńzsé ngie mèŋ kwoŋo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, n ne ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie à tsẅǐ ngie mèŋ n gÿo. Pi lu ssé pege fó jʉ’ɔɔn ńgʉa.
en: But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee kwà’ letsiŋé tÿó. Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a mǒ.
en: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

ngiemboon: Á gyá pwó tÿǒ gie à té ne ńzéme wɔ́, ńkɔ́’, ńtóo ná gie à ne ńzéme mentɔ̌ɔn, ńnyɛte ńkwɔ́gɔ wé wɛ̌, á cwoŋo ńzém mentɔ̌ɔn mboŋó.
en: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and everybranchthat beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mèŋ n ka zí’i gẅi kéen ńdá’ ńgÿo pi gwɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

ngiemboon: Pi temté ná mèŋ, pá’ mèŋ n temté yɔ́ɔn ná pi! Apwó tÿǒ lɔɔn tè temte nà letsiŋé tÿó wɔ́, mbà à té ku’u lézém mentɔ̌ɔn wɔ́. Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pi lɔɔn tè temte ná mèŋ wɔ́, pi le ku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà á poŋ wɔ́.
en: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

ngiemboon: Letsiŋé tÿó aa mèŋ, mbwó tÿǒ gwɔ́ gẅí. Nyìŋ gẅie à la nnɛ́ ná mèŋ, mèŋ n da nnɛ́ ná yé yɔ́ɔn, aa nyìŋ gẅie aa ńgÿo shúm mbòŋo tɛ’. Á nue pege lɔɔn tè gwɔ́, pi le tsɔ́ mmó gÿo.
en: I am the vine, yearethe branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè la nnɛ́ ná mèŋ wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pá’ pwó tÿǒ gẅie mé*kɔ̌’, ḿma’a nzèm nká’ á júm. Mé gÿo ḿbí ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g.
en: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and casttheminto the fire, and they are burned.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńda nnɛ́ ná mèŋ, ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi, pi lúɔ mmó gie pi kwǒŋ, mbà mé ge gÿo yɛ̌ mbwo pi.
en: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gÿo mé gu’te Tá wɔ̀ɔn, aa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi gÿo shúm mbòŋo tɛ’, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.

ngiemboon: Pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn ma, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n kwoŋo gẅí. Pi la nnɛ́ gi ná mèŋ nà ntí gie mèŋ n ge ké ne kwoŋo gẅi kwoŋ.
en: As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge ne kwoŋo gẅi kwoŋ. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mèŋ n da kú’te mbʉ̌ Tá wɔ̀ɔn á piŋ ne ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋ.
en: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò mbwo pi légwɔ́ gie lekág gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ ge gíŋe gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, pi gẅiin kwà’ lekág.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, andthatyour joy might be full.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ sɔ́ɔn e sɔɔn: Pi kwoŋe pi né pi pá’ mèŋ n ka kwoŋo gẅi la.
en: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńgẅiin nkwòŋe tà é tɔ́g ye nyìŋ gẅie à náa we le gwɔ́ nà twó pʉ̀a pie à kwoŋo wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n zɛté gẅí, mbà pi cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ meshǔ pɔ́ɔn.
en: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè gíŋe ńtóŋo gẅi le pènkʉ́ wɔ́, á nue mênkʉ́ fà’ tè zsé mmó gie tá fà’ we ne ńgÿo wɔ́. Mèŋ n tóŋo gẅi le meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, mélà’mie ngwòŋo nò ntsèm gie mèŋ n ka jú’u mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gÿǒ pi zsé.
en: Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ la tè tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, mèŋ n zɔ la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, ńtúmo gẅi ngie pi gʉa fa’a fà’ yɔ́ɔn. Ammó gie pi gÿǒ lá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, á le cʉa sẅɛɛ wɔ́. À cʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ kɔ́ mbwo Tá wɔ́, mbà à ge náa mbwo pi.
en: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, andthatyour fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie n kě ńzɛ́te gẅí, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, pi gẅiin nkwòŋe pi né pi.
en: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a njÿó lɔɔn ne ḿbʉa gẅí, pi zsé ngie pɔ́ la vɔg ḿbʉa wɔ̀ɔn yɔ́ɔn.
en: If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me beforeit hatedyou.

ngiemboon: Pi kěen ńgwɔ́ pé’e ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a njÿó, mbà njÿó kwoŋo gẅi tɛ’, á nue njÿó kwoŋo mmó gie áa yé. Tá’ pi ké tè pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́, mèŋ n zɔ ka tsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, éfaga gẅi nà pʉ̀a njÿó. Áa mmó gie á gÿo njÿó pʉa gẅí.
en: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte nò gie mèŋ n da gɔɔn mbwo pi ngie: Mênkʉ́ fà’ tè fáŋ ńtɔ́gɔ tá fà’ we wɔ́, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ la pʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pɔ́ gé gíŋ pʉa gẅi gí pɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ la kú’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, mbà pɔ́ ge gíŋe kú’te gí pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep your's also.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u ná pi ńtí nue pi ee pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ piŋ ńké tè ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅi à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, because they know not him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n daa pé’e, n tè tó, n daa pé’e pega pɔ̌ té shwóŋe, mbà tsɔ́ menò tepòŋ té ná pɔ́b wɔ́. Tá’ á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn atsɔ́ nò gie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtí menò tepòŋ mɔ́b té wó wɔ́.
en: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no cloke for their sin.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à lɔgɔ ḿbʉa Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n daa pé’e ńké tè gÿo mefà’ mie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńgÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b wɔ́ wɔ́, mbà pɔ́ té menò tepòŋ gẅiin. Tá á nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie pɔ́ gyá la, pɔ́ ké ńgíŋe ńně ḿbʉa wɔ̀ɔn pʉa mbɔɔ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte nà nò gie mé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ yɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ka pʉa wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ lê sóon.
en: Butthis cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

ngiemboon: Antàg Nzèm gẅie mèŋ n ge gÿo fó lejʉ́ŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn túmo mbwo pi, áa Zẅìge gie á fóo mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, á la’te nò nénʉ́. Yé zɔ ge gÿo shwóŋó nò gie à zsé ná mèŋ.
en: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father,eventhe Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me:

ngiemboon: Pi gí gíŋe ńgwaa shwóŋó nò gie pi zsé ná mèŋ, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pege zɔ gwɔ́ tà fó nzyetě.
en: and ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò légwɔ́ gie pi tè cʉ́’ nzèm gwá’a lézáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

ngiemboon: Mé ge gÿo fóo tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda é jwoŋo gẅí. Á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́. Afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u pá’ nyìŋ ge gÿo gwɔ́ zẅé tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, é kwaŋ ngie à nuŋe pɔ́ pwɔ́’ mvfò Ssé.
en: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ kaa Tá zsé, ńké tè wɔ̀ɔn zsé.
en: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

ngiemboon: N ka gwaa zye, mèŋ n tè shwóŋó gẅi yɔɔn nò wɔ́, mélà’mie n ka nyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńgee né lejʉ́ŋ Nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ ne ńgee, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi kě kaa zɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ gee pɔ́ nê nzɔ̌ wɔ́ wɔ́?
en: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

ngiemboon: Pi kě ne ḿmÿaga mÿag, mélà’mie mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi ngie n ge gʉa.
en: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

ngiemboon: Tá mèŋ n ké ne shwóŋó gẅi pá’ɔɔn pɔ́ nò nénʉ́, ngie áa nò mbòŋo mbwo pi ngie n gʉa. Á nue mèŋ n dɔɔn tè gʉa, mbà Ntàg Nzèm gẅi tè tó tsɛ́ɛ gẅi wɔ́. Tá mèŋ n ke ńgwɔ́ tà ńgʉa, mbà mèŋ n ge tó túmo yé ná né pi.
en: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.

ngiemboon: Aa gÿo gwɔ́ tà tó, é nyɛɛ mbwo pʉ̀a njÿó ngie pɔ́ gÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ, tá pɔ́ téen ńzsé mmó gie menò tepòŋ ée mɛ̌ wɔ́, pɔ́ téen zsé mmó gie nò nénʉ́ áa yɛ̌ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké těen nzsé mmó gie aŋàg, áa yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

ngiemboon: Nò tepòŋ gie à ge tó nyɛɛ wɔ́b, áa pá’ pɔ́ kaa záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: of sin, because they believe not on me;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá ngie mèŋ wɔɔn zɔɔ nò nénʉ́, á nue mèŋ m biŋe né lejʉ́ŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn, pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zsé ngie Ssé ge lá’ ŋaga wɔ́b, mélà’mie fùɔ gẅie à sá’a yɔɔn njÿó kéen ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n giŋé ńgẅiin menò mie mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅi tɛ’, tá’ ńgwɔ́ pi le jú’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́.
en: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

ngiemboon: À zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge gÿo tó, é gÿo pi zsé nò nénʉ́ ntsèm, á nue yé zɔ la’te nò nénʉ́, à tè gÿo gɔɔn pɔ́ yé nò wɔ́. À ge gÿo gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie à jǔ’, é piŋ shwóŋó gẅi menò mie é ne ńtóo.
en: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear,thatshall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn legú’, mélà’mie à ge kẅé mbwo mèŋ tá zí’i gẅí.
en: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shewitunto you.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn áa yɔ́ɔn. Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ, tá mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge gÿo jú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, é tó shwóŋó gẅí.
en: All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shewitunto you.

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ʉ mejʉ’ pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, à piŋ ńké ńgwaa láte pi gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie, à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? À gɔɔn ngie: á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ pege le gíŋe ńgyá yé wɔ́, à gíŋe ńcʉa méjʉ’ pege gíŋe ńgyá yé, ńgíŋe ngie, à gee né lejʉ́ŋ Tá we.
en: Then saidsomeof his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us,A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me:and,Because I go to the Father?

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn méjʉ’ méjʉ’ gẅie à gɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Pege tè ne ńjú’u mmó gie à fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́.
en: They said therefore, What is this that he saith,A little while?we cannot tell what he saith.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ pɔ́ ně fa’a lézɛ́te yé nò, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi ngie: Á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, à piŋ ńké ńgwaa láte, pi gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn. Yɛ̌ zɔ̌ gÿo tá pi fa’a lézɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn nò keen?
en: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them,Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ, pi ge gÿo lʉa, é cúa mbùm gí, é ńnéŋe nê lemÿɔg, epʉ̀a njÿó ne ńkága yɔ́b kǎg. Tá lemÿɔg gẅi gÿo sele ńcʉ́’ pɔ́ lekág.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

ngiemboon: Manzwě gwɔ̌ tà ne ńdúme, ńzye lé jú’ té poŋ, mélà’mie afʉ̀’ʉ ngɔ́’ kǔ’, ńké ńgwɔ́ tà ńzyé, à tè gíŋe ńkímte fʉ̀’ gie múɔ kɔ’ɔ́ ne ńdúmo yé wɔ́, mbùm ye cʉ́’ ḿboŋ poŋ ńtí pá’ tà’ nyìŋ mesoŋ tǒ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

ngiemboon: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ḿmÿɔgɔ mÿɔg, tá mèŋ n ge gÿo gíŋe gyá gẅí, pi lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkága kǎg. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ le ku’u lévéle gẅi lekág wɔ́.
en: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

ngiemboon: Áa gÿo gwɔ́ lyɛ’ó, pi le gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nò gie pi ge zɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pi lɔɔn ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à ge ná.
en: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will giveityou.

ngiemboon: Tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi laa zɔɔn ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ tsɔ́ mmó mbwo Ssé wɔ́. Pi lúɔ à ná né pi, lekág nyɛte ńdúe tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí.
en: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò. Atsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, ń de gíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pi wɔ́. Mèŋ n cʉ́’ʉ shʉ̀ashʉ̀a shwóŋó gẅi nò gie á líe Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.

ngiemboon: À lyɛ’ó, pi lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo Ssé. Mèŋ n tè shwóŋó gẅi ngie mèŋ n ge gÿo sẅíŋte Tá wɔ̀ɔn ná né pi wɔ́.
en: At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:

ngiemboon: Á nue kwà’ yé Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo gẅí. À kwoŋo gẅí, mélà’mie pi ka kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, ḿbiŋe ne ńzẅíŋe ngie yé zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: for the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da fóo mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, mèŋ m biŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgee ne ńtsɛ́ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Gyá pá’ ɔ̀ shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò té lɔg sagá nò.
en: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

ngiemboon: Peg zsě fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ zsé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ tà ḿvɔg ńzsé mmó gie peg fa’a lézɛ́te gú. Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ peg zẅíŋ ngie ɔ̀ fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie, ńzsé ngie pi lěen ńké ńzẅíŋ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ̂!
en: Jesus answered them,Do ye now believe?

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u, tà á zɔ̌ɔn ńku’ ku’, pá’ pi ge tága sa jʉ’. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ lɔg wé nkwɔ’ɔ́, ńnyé wɔ̀ɔn gílé mèŋ, tá n ké tè gílé mèŋ wɔ́, peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn zɔ gwɔ́.
en: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò légwɔ́ gie pi ge la nnɛ́ ná mèŋ, mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi. Pi ge gÿo gyá ngɔ́’ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, tá’ tà pi cÿɔ’. N kéen ńcʉa njÿó.
en: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbʉ’ʉ twó yé, ńdíe tÿǒ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, afʉ̀’ ku’ú, gÿo pʉ̀a gyá legú’ Míŋ gù, Míŋ gù gÿo yé, epʉ̀a gyá legú’ gù.
en: These words spake Jesus, and lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said,Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la ná metʉ̀ mbwo yé lélɔg ńdíe pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńzsé ngie à ge náa légwɔ́ tèmì, á mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm pie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo yé.
en: as thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ tèmì wéwɛ̌, á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge zsé gú, gù gẅie ɔɔ kwà’ ndà’ Ssé ye nénʉ́ gílé gù, é gíŋe zsé nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la túmo yé, á gwɔ́ Yěsô Kristo.
en: And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

ngiemboon: N ka gÿo mé gyá legú’ gù ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mèŋ m magá fà’ gie ɔ̀ ka náa mbwo mèŋ.
en: I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn me Tá wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n ne ńdúɔ ngie ɔ̀ gíŋe náa wɔ̀ɔn legú’ gẅie mèŋ n da gẅiin lejʉ́ŋ gù, á legú’ gẅie n da gẅiin lejʉ́ŋ gù, tà yɔɔn njÿó nyé té gwɔ́ wó.
en: And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la fóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, éfag pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńnáa mbwo mèŋ, mèŋ n ka zí’i wɔ́b lézsé nyìŋ gẅie ɔ́ɔ wɛ̌. Pɔ́ laa pʉ̀a pú, ɔ̀ piŋ náa wɔ́b mbwo mèŋ. Pɔ́ kéen ńké ńjú’u shwóŋó jú, ńkú’te.
en: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have kept thy word.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé ngie, à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, fóo mbwo gù.
en: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.

ngiemboon: N kéen ńké ńtsẅi menò ntsèm mie ɔ̀ la cʉ́me mbwo mèŋ á mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅíŋ, ńcwoŋe ńzsé ngie mèŋ fóo lejʉ́ŋ gù, ńgíŋe ńzsé ngie gù zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have receivedthem, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ésẅíŋte gú nà twó sɔ́b, mèŋ n těen sẅíŋte gú nà twó pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú pɔ́ nà twó pʉ̀a pie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ, pɔ́ ée kwà’ pʉ̀a pú.
en: I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me; for they are thine.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa mbwo mèŋ áa jú. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa mbwo gù áa yɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́b pɔɔn zɔ̌ ne ńgÿo mé gyá wɔ̀ɔn legú’.
en: And all mine are thine, and thine are mine; and I am glorified in them.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’, ń de gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́, á nue mèŋ n ge piŋ ne lejʉ́ŋ gù. Tá ńgʉa ná pɔ́b, mbà pɔ́ ké ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. Tá wɔ̀ɔn ée ndà’ gú ńgwɔ́ Ssé, lɔg metʉ̀ mú, é metʉ̀ mie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ la, ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pɔgɔ ée tà’ nyìŋ la.
en: And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as weare.

ngiemboon: Á kaa fʉ̀’ gie peg lâ pɔ́ ka gwɔ̌, mèŋ n ne ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mú, é metʉ̀ mie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ la, ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b. N ka tÿɔ́’te wɔ́b tà tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b tè pyé. Nyìŋ gẅie á la ne ńzɛ́te ngie à pyé zɔ ká pyě. Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte nà nò gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé.
en: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name: those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn mèŋ n ne ńtóo né lejʉ́ŋ gù. Tá’ n kě ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgɔɔn yɔɔn shwóŋè légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge gẅiin wɔɔn lekág ntʉ́m pɔ́b, á kwà’ lekág.
en: And now come I to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka tsẅi nò jú mbwo pɔ́b, pà tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó pʉa wɔ́b ńtí nue pɔ́ zɔɔn tè pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́ pá’ mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n tè nyìŋ jÿó wɔ́.
en: I have given them thy word; and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen sẅíŋte ɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ fóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńkẅile wɔ́b gwɔ́, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú pɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn wɔ́b ná Sátà nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n tè nyìŋ njÿó wɔ́.
en: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

ngiemboon: Lɔgɔ nò nénʉ́ jú ńgÿo pɔ́ cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pú tà shwóŋó nò. Ashwóŋè jú áa nénʉ́.
en: Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

ngiemboon: Pá’ ɔ̀ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó la, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n túmo wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná mèŋ, m bǔ ná mbùm yɔ̀ɔn mbwo gù ńtí wɔ́b, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ gee fó nà nò nénʉ́, é cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pú tá shwóŋó nò.
en: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tě sẅíŋte gú pɔ́ ndà’ nà twó sɔ́b wɔ́, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú mbɔɔ nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ge gÿo cʉa nà shwóŋè yɔ́b, é záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́b metsèm gwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ, pá’ gù Tá wɔ̀ɔn ɔ̀ temte ná mèŋ, mèŋ n temte ná gù. Tsétsɔ’, gÿo peg lâ pɔ̌ pú ńgwɔ́ tà’. Tá pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó zẅíŋ ngie ɔ̀ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: that they all may be one; as thou, Father,artin me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

ngiemboon: Legú’ gẅie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ la, aa wɛ̌ gẅie n ka náa mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ pá’ pɔgɔ ée tà’ nyìŋ.
en: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gwɔ́ nê pɔ́b, ɔ̀ gwɔ́ nê mèŋ. Pɔ́ gẅiin tà’ ncwò. Pà tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lêen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn, ńgíŋe ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ kwoŋ pʉ̀a pɔɔn pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ. Mèŋ m biŋ ne ńkwoŋo ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee ne wó, ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn legú’, á legú’ gẅie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ, á nue ɔ̀ la kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn tà fó ńnyé pɔ́ tè nyɛte njÿó.
en: Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ́ɔ nénʉ́, tá pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ka tè gú zsé, mèŋ n kě ńne ńzsé gú, pɔɔn pʉ̀a kéen ńzsé ngie gù zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: O righteous Father, the world hath not known thee: but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka zí’i wɔ́b lézsé nyìŋ gẅie ɔ́ɔ wɛ̌, mèŋ n ge ké ne gÿo pɔ́ ne ńzsé gú zsě, ńkwoŋe pɔ́b nê pɔ́b pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ m biŋ ńgwɔ́ ntʉ́m pɔ́b. Gÿo pɔ́ zsé lezíŋ shú, mèŋ n ge gíŋe gÿo pɔ́ zsé gú. À cʉa pú’u, nkwòŋe gie ɔ̀ la lɔg ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, e gwɔ́ ná pɔ́b. Mèŋ n gwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn né pɔ́b.
en: And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declareit: that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn pú’u, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ fú’, ńtúm ntse Sedeloŋ, ńgʉa nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ. Etsɔ́ nká’ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé kúu tsoló.
en: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́ Jẅidas gẅie à la sẅiŋe yé ne ńzsé jʉ’ áyɛ̌ kwà’ mboŋó, á nue Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé lɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe ńgwá ńcú’te jʉ’ó.
en: And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas ńnéŋe tà ńtó, ńgwɔ́ mvfò nùɔ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pà*Roma pâ pà pyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, é pie metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pà*farisay ně ńtúm. Pɔ́ gẅiinte menkà’ mmɔ̌g, lâ melâm, mbɔɔ shúm ncù.
en: Judas then, having received a bandof menand officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nò gie á ne ńtóo ná yé, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ né mvfò pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi fa’a wɔ́?
en: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them,Whom seek ye?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Á Yěsô ye Nǎzarɛd. Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Àa mèŋ. Yěsô gwɔ́ gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, Jẅidas gẅie à ně sẅiŋe yé gwɔ́ nùɔ.
en: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them,I amhe.And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tà ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Àa mèŋ, pɔ́ piŋ nzème nzème, ńgwete ssé.
en: As soon then as he had said unto them, I amhe, they went backward, and fell to the ground.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi fa’a wɔ́? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Á Yěsô ye Nǎzarɛd.
en: Then asked he them again,Whom seek ye?And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi ngie aa mèŋ. Á lɔɔn ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi tóo fǎ’ mèŋ, pi nyé pɔɔn pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa.
en: Jesus answered,I have told you that I amhe: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, ashwóŋè gie Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn mbwo Ssé lɔgɔ ḿbumte. À ně ńgɔɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ la, kaa pyé.
en: that the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake,Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gẅie à la gẅiin nně ncù leen ńké soŋ nně mbʉ́a, ńdɔg ńcúa ngàŋa fà’ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, ńjúa letuŋó sé se pwó tʉ̀. Lezíŋ nyìŋ áwɛ̌ laa le Malkus.
en: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest's servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Néŋ nně jù mbʉ́a! Mèŋ n tè nú ntú’ ngɔ́’ gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn nǎ ngie mèŋ n nú wɔ́ ka?
en: Then said Jesus unto Peter,Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?

ngiemboon: Anùɔ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, pâ tándá wɔb lâ pà pyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé, é pie mekěm pà Yuda ně ńtúm, lêen ńké ńgwoon Yěsô, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé.
en: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwɛ́ɛ Yěsô pú’u, ńdɔgɔ yé ḿvɔg ńgʉa nɔ’ɔ Ánnɔ́ɔn. Ánnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ tákẅì’ Kaifa gẅie à laa ngù’ áyɛ̌, ńgwɔ́ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’.
en: and led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.

ngiemboon: Yé Kaifa aa nyìŋ gẅie à la gɔɔn mbwo mekěm Pà Yuda ngie: Mvfò aa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ kwé nà twó lá’.
en: Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ pɔ́ tsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô la zse nzèm Yěsô. Pá’ Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ la ne ńzsé wɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô la, mé gwaa lɔgɔ Yěsô tɔ́g né tsɛ̀ɛ nɔ’ɔ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, á gwɔ́ yé pɔ́ nzèm.
en: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, andso didanother disciple: that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.

ngiemboon: Piɛ zso nzème pǐ ńtyé, á ncwò nɔ’. Wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô wá gẅie tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ la ne ńzsé yé la, á gʉa ńgɔɔn nò né manzwě gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ncwò nɔ’, ńgÿo Piɛ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ nɔ’.
en: But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ncwò nɔ’ gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Ɔ̀ tè jú tsɔ̌ tà’ nà*ngàŋa kwò nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́ le? Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n tè*ngàŋa kwò we wɔ́.
en: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou alsooneof this man's disciples? He saith, I am not.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà megàŋa fà’ lâ pàpyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé ně ńnyɛte mmɔ̌g. Efÿág ne ńkúu, pɔ́ ne ńzɔ́gɔ. Piɛ tyé yé pâ pɔ̌ ne ńzɔ́gɔ mmɔ̌g.
en: And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ mvfò*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. Á ne ńzɛ́te yé nò ná ngàŋa kwò yé, mbɔɔ ná mmó gie à zí’i pʉ̀a.
en: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò mbwo lá’, mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, á jʉ’ gie pà Yuda cú’te wó. Mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò pɔ́ ńdÿoon lÿoon wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered him,I spake openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort; and in secret have I said nothing.

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ zɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn menò? Zɛ́te nò gie n ka gɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie é ka ne ńjú’u. Pɔ́ ne ńnyɛte ńzsé mmó gie n da gɔɔn.
en: Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them: behold, they know what I said.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pàpyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé gẅie á kě jʉ’ó téme pwó letuŋó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ aa pá’ ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ nò mbwo*Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò?
en: And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie n gɔ̌ɔn té poŋ, ɔ̀ shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn mmó gie áa mǒ ńgwɔ́ ye tepòŋ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn mboŋó, mbà ɔ̀ piŋe ńcúa wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Jesus answered him,If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?

ngiemboon: Ánnɔ́ɔn lêen ńké ńtsẅi, tà Yěsô nyé pɔ́ menkÿo, mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa náa mbwo Kaifa, á*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò.
en: Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ké ńnyé ne ńzɔ́gɔ pɔ́ mmɔ̌g, mé gɔɔn né yé ngie: Gù jú, ɔ̀ tè tsɔ̌ tà’*ngàŋa kwò nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́ le? Piɛ moŋe, ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n tè*ngàŋa kwò we wɔ́.
en: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, Art not thou alsooneof his disciples? He deniedit, and said, I am not.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ngàŋa fà’*Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò, ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ nyìŋ wá gẅie Piɛ ka júa letuŋó sé la, á gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Mèŋ n ka tè gyá gẅi lâ pɔ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ wáa?
en: One of the servants of the high priest, beinghiskinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿmoŋe. Mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

ngiemboon: Mé fóo nɔ’ɔ Kaifa, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a ngúmnɔ́ɔn Pà*Roma. Á gwɔ́ mba’ámba’. Mekěm pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ Yěsô ńtó ké tè yɔ́b ndá ngúmnɔ́ɔn kú, ḿbɔ́gɔ lékaa*lɔ̌’, á tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b léjÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà.
en: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.

ngiemboon: *Pilato kẅɛ́te wɔ́b pǐ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi sẅiŋe nyìŋ wɔɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Nyìŋ áwɛ̌ ně ńgwé’e tè nò tepòŋ gÿo, mbà peg kaa lɔgɔ yé ńtóo mvfò gù wɔ́.
en: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.

ngiemboon: *Pilato leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńŋaga yé gílé pi, pá’*lepʉ̌ sí kwoŋ pú’u. Mekěm tsɔ́’ ngie:*Lepʉ̌ ség té zẅíŋ ngie peg zẅé nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie Yěsô la cʉ́’ʉ léshwóŋ ntí gie à ge gÿo kwé ńgɔɔn.
en: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.

ngiemboon: *Pilato leen ńké ḿbiŋe ndá, ńgÿo Yěsô tó, á zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ fùɔ pà Yuda lá?
en: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Kwà’ gù zɔ kwaŋte ńgɔɔn, kà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a zɔ̌ shwoŋó gú ngie mèŋ n gee fùɔ?
en: Jesus answered him,Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?

ngiemboon: *Pilato tsɔ́’ ngie, ɔ̀ jǔ’ ngie mèŋ n gee nyìŋ pà Yuda ka? Pàlá’ pí pâ mekěm pànuŋe pwɔ́’ sẅiŋé gú mbwo mèŋ. Ɔ̀ ka gÿo kɔ́?
en: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Esɔ́ɔn lefùɔ té se yɔɔn njÿó wɔ́. Lefùɔ sɔ́ɔn ke ńgwɔ́ se yɔɔn njÿó, mbà pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn ně ńtág nzèm yɔ̀ɔn, tà mé té wɔ̀ɔn mbwo mekěm pà Yuda néŋ. Tá’, mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn ngie sɔ́ɔn lefùɔ ké tè se yɔɔn njÿó wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered,My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

ngiemboon: *Pilato leen ńké ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ wɔ́? Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie, ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, mèŋ n gee fùɔ. Jú’u mmó gie á la gÿo mé zyé wɔ̀ɔn, ńgíŋe ńjú’u mmó gie á la gÿo mèŋ n tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. N da tó légɔɔn mmó gie mèŋ n zsé nà nò nénʉ́. Nyìŋ gwɔ́ ná nò nénʉ́, á jú’ ngyè yɔ̀ɔn.
en: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered,Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, mèŋ n tě ně ńgyá mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ tá gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ wɔɔn gwě ntsaŋ wɔ́.
en: And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no faultat all.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pá’ aa mà mbwo pege légwɔ́ fʉ̀’e línɔ́ɔn*páskà, ńtsɔ́’ɔ tà’ ngàŋa tsǎŋ la, pi kwǒŋ ngie mèŋ n tsɔ́’ɔ fùɔ pà Yuda ńná né pi?
en: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ḿbú ńnáa gwá, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ngǎŋ, tè tsɔ́’ɔ wɛ̂ nyìŋ, tsɔ́’ pɔ́ Panepâse, ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn Panepâse ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ kwà’ ntʉ̀ ntsǒŋ.
en: Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.

ngiemboon: *Pilato lêen ńké ńnáa Yěsô ngie mé lɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúa yé.
en: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourgedhim.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔg menzóŋ ḿbá’a cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ, éshuu twó Yěsô, ḿbíi pepaŋ nzsǒ ḿma’a ná yé.
en: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and putiton his head, and they put on him a purple robe,

ngiemboon: Ńne sẅɛ́’te nnɛ́ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésíe yé ngie: Mé tsyɛ’té fùɔ pà Yuda! Ńtéme mbwó metuŋó yé.
en: and said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gíŋe ńkẅɛ́ɛ pǐ ńgɔɔn né mekěm pà Yuda ngie: Mèŋ n ge lɔgɔ nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tó ná né pi. Pi ké ńzsé ngie mèŋ n kaa gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie à fʉ̌a wɔ́.
en: Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgwaa kẅɛ, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ menzóŋ, ḿma’a paŋ nzsǒ.*Pilato gɔɔn né mekěm pà Yuda ngie: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ wɛ̂.
en: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. AndPilatesaith unto them, Behold the man!

ngiemboon: Tá metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pà pyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé gyá Yěsô, ńzye lénáa gwá ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.*Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pi kɔ yé, kwà’ pi zɔ kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Mèŋ n tě ně ńgyá mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ, tá zẅé yé wɔ́.
en: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucifyhim, crucifyhim. Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucifyhim: for I find no fault in him.

ngiemboon: Mekěm tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: À fʉ̌a*lepʉ̌ ség. Mé ge zẅé yé ńtí*lepʉ̌ sie à fʉ̌a. À gɔ̌ɔn ngie aa Míŋ Ssé.
en: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pú’u, éfó ḿmege ńcÿɔ’.
en: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋe ndá, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ nyìŋ zsɔ̌? Tá Yěsô fó tè tsɔ́b.
en: and went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

ngiemboon: *Pilato lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n gɔɔn nò ɔ̀ tě ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́ la? Ɔ̀ tè ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n ku’u légÿo mé nyé gú, pá’ mèŋ n giŋé ńku’u légÿo, mé kime gú nà tÿǒ nkǐ wɔ́ ka?
en: Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: E Ssé lɔɔn ńnyé té ńná metʉ̀ mbwo gù, ɔ́ le ku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó ná mèŋ wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá nyìŋ gẅie à ka sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn mbwo gù, à yé nò tepòŋ cʉa jú.
en: Jesus answered,Thou couldest have no powerat allagainst me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zye fʉ̀’ó léfa’ shÿó pá’ à ge nyé Yěsô. Tá’ pà Yuda zye lénáa gwá ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńnyé yé, mbà ɔ̀ tè shǔ Kása pà*Roma wɔ́. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à gɔɔn ngie yé aa fùɔ, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋ mbù Kása.
en: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Cæsar's friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Cæsar.

ngiemboon: *Pilato jú’ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô fóo ndá ńkẅɛ, ńnéŋe nà lʉ̀ŋe nzà’ ntsaŋ, á jʉ’ gie mé la lɔg metóon ńnuŋe, mé tóŋo ná shwóŋè pa Heber ngie Gabata.
en: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mé cwoŋte línɔ́ɔn*Páskà, ńgwɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ.*Pilato gɔɔn né pà Yuda ngie: Afùɔ gẅi wɛ.
en: And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour: and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King!

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda náa gwá ngie: Mé zẅé yé, mé zẅé yé. Gÿo mé kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.*Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n zɔ ge kime fùɔ gẅi ná tÿǒ nkǐ ka? Mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ tsɔ́’ ngie: É té ndà’ Kása wɔ́, mbà peg tè tsɔ̌ fùɔ gẅiin.
en: But they cried out, Away withhim, away withhim, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Cæsar.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa.
en: And they took Jesus, and ledhimaway.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ fóo tÿǒsoŋ kẅɛ, kwà’ yé zɔ̌ kaa tÿǒ nkǐ yé, pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgee nê tsɔ́ jʉ’, mé tóŋ lê kẅǐ twó. Á gwɔ́ ná shwóŋè pà Heber, ńgwɔ́ Golgota.
en: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place calledthe placeof a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ńgíŋe ńkim petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a nà mɔ́b metÿǒ nkǐ. Tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ́ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó ye kyɛ̀bɛ. Yěsô gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ.
en: where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gÿo mé ŋwe’e mmó, ńkime nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Á gwɔ́ mǒ ńgwɔ́ ngie: Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd, fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: And Pilate wrote a title, and putiton the cross. And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Ajʉ’ gie mé la kime Yěsô wó laa ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem. Pà Yuda tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńcʉa jʉ’ó ńtóŋo mmó gie mé ŋwe’é. Á gwɔ́ ná shwóŋè pà Heber, ńgwɔ́ ná shwóŋè pà*Roma mbɔɔ ná shwóŋè pà Gelekia.
en: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew,andGreek,andLatin.

ngiemboon: Mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pà Yuda lêen ńké ńgʉa ńgyá*Pilato ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Á té poŋo léŋwe’e ngie fùɔ pà Yuda wɔ́, ŋwe’e pɔ́ ngie à la gɔɔn ngie yé aa fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.

ngiemboon: *Pilato tsɔ́’ ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n ŋwe’é, n ně ńdá’ ŋwe’e.
en: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù la kime Yěsô ná tÿǒ nkǐ tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbí menzsǒ mé, ńgabte nzsè lekùa. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pí ye nzsè, tà é cʉ́’ nzsǒ ye ye lÿò, é gie mé la tè vfo vfo wɔ́. Mé la pú ḿbá’ pá’, éfó tÿǒ ńtyé ssé.
en: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and alsohiscoat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́’ ncù gɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà pege shʉa yɔɔn. Pege tyéente, nyìŋ gẅie à jÿǒ, pege náa mbwo yé. Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Pɔ́ ně ńgabte menzsǒ mɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ḿma’a tyèente nà nzsǒ yɔ̀ɔn ye lÿò». Yɔɔn áa mmó gie pàlÿɔ́’ ncù la gÿo.
en: They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.

ngiemboon: Má pà Yěsô pɔ́ mémá má we we manzwě, ńgÿo Malîɛ nzwě Kelopàs, mbɔɔ Malîɛ Magdala la tyé ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô.
en: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary thewifeof Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ má we tyé lejʉ́ŋ*ngàŋa kwò we gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’, ńgɔɔn né má we ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn, mìŋ gù wɛ.
en: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother,Woman, behold thy son!

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò we wá ngie: Má gù wɛ. Á fó fʉ̀’ áyɛ̌,*angàŋa kwò we wá lɔgɔ má pà Yěsô ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Then saith he to the disciple,Behold thy mother!And from that hour that disciple took her unto his ownhome.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, Yěsô zsé fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ kǔ’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Agág yɔ́ɔn shÿǒ, ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ge pumte.
en: After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith,I thirst.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ lekʉ̀ŋ laa jʉ’ó, mbà mé neŋé kikíi melù’ tsoló. Mé tsaba kusá tsoló, éshÿɔ́gɔ nà twó kekà’a, ńtsege ńnéŋe ncwò Yěsô.
en: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar: and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and putitupon hyssop, and putitto his mouth.

ngiemboon: Á sẅíte ńgɔɔn ngie: Ayɔ́ɔn fà’ magá, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́ŋe twó yé, ńkwé.
en: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,It is finished:and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Mé laa lyɛ’ó ńne ńcwoŋte*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, á piŋ tè poŋ ngie à gwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè, mepfó pʉ̀a gwɔ́ nà metÿǒ nkǐ wɔ́, yɛ̌ ge zɔɔn gwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè lÿò tɛ’. Mekěm pà Yuda gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à gÿo mé pwɔ́’te mekwò pʉ̀a pie ée nà metÿǒ nkǐ, pɔ́ kwéte, mé fó nà metÿǒ nkǐ ésẅí’i wɔ́b.
en: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, andthatthey might be taken away.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lêen ńké ńtó ḿbwɔ́’te mekwò ndùŋ mvfò, mbɔɔ me mbɔ́ɔntè nyìŋ gẅie mé pǔ ńkime wɔ́ba Yěsô.
en: Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná Yěsô, ńgyá, mbà à ně ńdá’ ńkwé. Pɔ́ té gíŋe ḿbwɔ́’te mekwò mé wɔ́.
en: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔg lekwòŋ, ésɔbɔ gwoŋó nnɛ́ Yěsô. Metse pɔ́ ntse gwóon ńkẅɛɛ jʉ’ó.
en: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à shwóŋó gẅi aa njÿò ńgyá nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á la cʉa. Á gwɔ́ kwà’ pá’ á la cʉa. Kwà’ yé lê twó yé ne ńnyɛte ńzsé ngie à gɔɔn nò nénʉ́, ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie pi gí ge záb ntʉ́m ná yɔɔn nò.
en: And he that sawitbare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔ́ɔn ńcʉate pá’ɔɔn pá’ mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ge pumte. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie: «Mé la tè pwɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ kẅǐ mbùm yé wɔ́».
en: For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńŋwe’e ngie: «Pɔ́ ge lá’ ne líe nyìŋ gẅie pɔ́ lɔ̌g lekwòŋ ésɔbɔ yé».
en: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, Yesyɛ̂b, nyìŋ tÿǒsoŋ Arimaté, á gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ, à sẅí’i pfó Yěsô ná tÿǒ nkǐ. Yesyɛ̌b ŋwɛ́ laa tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, tá shúte shuté, ńne ḿbɔ́gɔ pà Yuda.*Pilato zẅíŋ, Yesyɛ̂b gʉa sẅí’i pfó Yěsô.
en: And after this Joseph of Arimathæa, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gavehimleave. He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.

ngiemboon: Nikodem gẅie à lǎ’ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́’, ńtó ńgʉa ńgyá Yěsô la, tó yé, ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí laméndɔ́ɔn gie mé la cub metwó megǐ ńdɔg ńgwɔ’, mɛ̌ megǐ gwɔ́ myrre pɔ́ aloes. Á gwɔ́ mmó kilo móm ntá.
en: And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred poundweight.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b lêen ńké ńkaa pfó Yěsô, ńne ńkemte laméndɔ́ɔn mǒ, ńdɔgɔ shúm nzsǒ ńzémte, pá’ pà Yuda lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ le’e pfó nyìŋ, ńgÿo pú’u.
en: Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ nká’ laa ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ gie mé la kime Yěsô ná tÿǒ nkǐ wó. Etsɔ́ lesyè se sẅé gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nká’ áwɛ̌, mbà mé laa zɔɔn ńnéŋe nyìŋ tsoló wɔ́.
en: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pà Yuda la ne ńnyɛte mbùm yɔb ńtí lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b la, zà’ ne ńcʉa, mé kaa pfó Yěsô ńdɔg ńgʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè ŋwɛ́. Á nue é la gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ó.
en: There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews' preparationday; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nà ngàba lá’, tà ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ leme léme, ejʉ’ nyé té fɔ́g, Malîɛ Magdala gʉa jʉ’e lesyè, ńkúu wó, ńgyá mbà mé ně fó ncwò lesyè, ésẅɛ’te tóon.
en: The firstdayof the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Á kÿote, ńgʉa ńgyá Símo Piɛ pɔ́ wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅie Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mé ně fó tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, ńkẅile pfó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Peg tè ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mé ně ńzába wó wɔ́.
en: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ wéwɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò leen ńké ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa jʉ’e lesyè.
en: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ mépʉ́a la pú ne ńkÿo kÿo, tá wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô zá’te mvfò Piɛ, ḿvɔgɔ jʉ’e lesyè.
en: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Ńtéŋe twó yé, ńgyá shúm nzsó, é gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, tá’ á ké tè tsoló kú.
en: And he stooping down,and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gẅie à laa nzèm ńjwoŋte lêen ńké ńtó, ńzyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,

ngiemboon: Ńgyá mmó nzsó gie mé la zába nà twó Yěsô, á gwɔ́ ye mbwɔ’té, ńnuŋe nà yé jʉ’.
en: and the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅie à ně mvɔg ńtó lêen ńké ńkú yé tsoló, ńgyá mmó gie á cʉ̌a, ńzẅíŋ ngie áa nò.
en: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ mbɔɔ fʉ’ó, pɔ́ té jú’u mmó gie ŋwà’ne Ssé la lɔg ńda’te ngie Yěsô ge lá’ zíme nà legwé wɔ́.
en: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô lêen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm.
en: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ tó ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè, ńne ńdʉa, ńdʉa tà ńtéŋe twó yé, ńdíe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down,and lookedinto the sepulchre,

ngiemboon: Ńgyá*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé mépʉ́a, pɔ́ ma’ meféfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, ńnéŋe jʉ’ gie mé ka nuŋo pfó Yěsô wó. Tà’ ńnéŋe ná jʉ’ gie twó yé kaa wó, wetsɔ̌ ńnéŋe ná jʉ’ gie mekwò mé kaa wó.
en: and seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mɔ̌ɔn ɔ̀ lʉa kɔ́? Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mé ně ńkaa pfó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, m biŋ tè ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie mé ně ńzába wó wɔ́.
en: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, ésele nnɛ́, ńgyá Yěsô tyé jʉ’ó, tá’ á ké tè zsé ngie aa Yěsô wɔ́.
en: And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mɔ̌ɔn, ɔ̀ lʉa kɔ́? Ɔ̀ fa’a wɔ́? Tá á kwaŋ ngie kà à gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ nká’a ngale wɔ́, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie gù zɔ ně ńkaa pfó Yěsô, ɔ̀ la’te wɔ̀ɔn jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ ně ńnuŋe wó, n gʉa, ńkaa.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou?She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo yé ngie: Malîɛ, á sele nnɛ́ ńtóŋo yé nà shwóŋè pà Heber ngie: Rabuni, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie Tsítsà.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Mary.She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tè gíŋe ndáte wɔ̀ɔn, á nue mèŋ n nyě tè kwɔ̌’ tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Ké ńgʉa ńgyá mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ge kwɔ́’ nê lejʉ́ŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie à giŋé ńgwɔ́ Tá gẅi. Á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn gie e giŋé ńgwɔ́ Ssé gi.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; andtomy God, and your God.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ Magdala lêen ńké ńgʉa ńgyá megàŋa kwò Yěsô, éshwóŋó wɔ́b ngie à gyǎ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅii nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn mbwo yé.
en: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, andthathe had spoken these things unto her.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ ncwò nzém, pɔ́ lyɛ’ó gie á laa ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nà ngàba lá’,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ńnéŋe ndá, mbà pɔ́ ně ḿbú ńjÿɔ́’ mencwò ndá, ḿbɔ́gɔ pà Yuda. Yěsô kẅɛ ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né pi.
en: Then the same day at evening, being the firstdayof the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them,Peacebeunto you.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b mbwó mé, mbɔɔ gwoŋó nnɛ́ yé.*Ngàŋa kwò yé gyá yé, ḿbú ńkág tɛ’.
en: And when he had so said, he shewed unto themhishands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né pi. Pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn la túmo wɔ̀ɔn la, mèŋ n tumó gẅi yɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus to them again,Peacebeunto you: asmyFather hath sent me, even so send I you.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, éfÿɔ́g fÿɔ́g ncwò ye ná pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kẅé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: And when he had said this, he breathed onthem, and saith unto them,Receive ye the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b, mbà Ssé ge lege yé lege. Pi lɔɔn ńdʉ’ʉ lélege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b, mbà Ssé ge lʉ’ yé lʉ’ lélege.
en: whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them;andwhose soeversinsye retain, they are retained.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ná nùɔ pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Tomáse, ńdɔgɔ ngie mélefág, à la tè ssé fʉ̀’ gie Yěsô la tó wɔ́.
en: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńtó, yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Peg ně ńgyá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Tomáse tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: N dɔɔn ńnyé tè gyǎ lǎga fʉ̌ŋ gie membàŋ ka ńnéŋe nà mbwó mé, ńnyé tè shÿɔgɔ́ tepwó wɔ̀ɔn á nà jʉ’e membàŋ, ńnyé tè shÿɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn nà gwoŋó nnɛ́ yé, mèŋ ń de zẅíŋ.
en: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.

ngiemboon: É lêen ńké ńgÿo ńcʉa lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gíŋe ńcú’te ssé, Tomáse gwɔ́ yé nùɔ pɔ́b, á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ pǔ ńjÿɔ́’ mencwò ndá, Yěsô kẅɛ ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né pi.
en: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them:thencame Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said,Peacebeunto you.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né Tomáse ngie: Tsíŋe múɔ tepwó gù jʉ’ɔɔn. Líe mbwó mɔ́ɔn. Tsíŋe pwó jú, éshÿɔ́gɔ nà gwoŋó nnɛ́ yɔ́ɔn. Tè gíŋe ḿmʉ́’te, zẅíŋ ngie aa kwà’ mèŋ.
en: Then saith he to Thomas,Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrustitinto my side: and be not faithless, but believing.

ngiemboon: Tomáse tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, ńgwɔ́ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn.
en: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lěen ńké ńzẅíŋ, mélà’mie ɔ̀ gyǎ wɔ̀ɔn. Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zẅíŋ té zɔɔn ńgyá.
en: Jesus saith unto him,Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessedarethey that have not seen, andyethave believed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋe ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn á mvfò*ngàŋa kwò yé. Mé kaa mɛ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne ŋwe’e.
en: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:

ngiemboon: Tá mé la ké ńŋwe’e mɔɔn pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie pi ge zẅíŋ ngie Yěsô aa*Nzà’nkÿo, ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, á gÿo pi gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: but these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgíŋe ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé. Á gwaa gwɔ́ pɔ́ gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe letʉ̀ŋ Tiberiad. Ammó gie á la cʉa à yɔɔn.
en: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed hehimself.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô la pú ńcú’te tà’a jʉ’. Wɔɔn laa Símo Piɛ, né Tomáse mélefág, ńgÿo Natanaye mûɔ Kána tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, nê pènkʉ́ Zebede, mbɔɔ yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô yépʉ́a.
en: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and thesonsof Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ ńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: N ge gʉa ma’ messó. Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pege zɔ gee. Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńgʉa ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, tá’, ńdá’a lá’ ḿmwoon ntse, pɔ́ té tsɔ́ mmó gwoon
en: Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô kẅɛ ńtyé nkʉ̀ŋ ntse, tá*ngàŋa kwò yé té zsé ngie aa yé wɔ́.
en: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ńgie mbà pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, tà pi fǒ ńgẅiin mbaŋ ssó lá? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ.
en: Then Jesus saith unto them,Children, have ye any meat?They answered him, No.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, pi ma’ lekÿo á ngʉ̀ŋe kanú’, á nà gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀. Pi ge gwoon messó. Pɔ́ ma’ lekÿo, ḿbú ńgwoon messó tà le giŋé fó ntse shwoŋ lekÿo tè gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them,Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find.They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

ngiemboon: *Angàŋa kwò gẅie Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’ gɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Aa pá’a ńgwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Piɛ jú’ ngie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbí nzsǒ ye gie à ně sẅɛ, ḿma’, ńdeen ńké ńzyɛ́’ ńkúu ntse.
en: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girthisfisher's coatunto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô lɔgɔ kanú’ ńne ńtóo, ńne shwóŋó lekÿo, mbà messó kǔ tsoló tà ńdúe. Pɔ́ la zɔɔn tè séen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ taa soŋ ntse wɔ́. Lefǒ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse ńkúu jʉ’ gie pɔ́ laa wó laa mmó mita nkÿo.
en: And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó fó tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛ tà ńtyé ssé, ńgyá mmɔ̌g megɔ́’, mbà mé zǎb messó nê mbelég ndumó.
en: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lêen ńké ńdɔg tsɔ́ messó mie pi foo légwoon la ńtó la.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gíŋe ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, éshwoŋ lekÿo ḿma’a ssé, messó gwɔ́ tsoló memáa memáa mbaŋ nkÿo nê ntsɔ̀b tá lê móm ntʉ̀a, é tsɛ ńgyɔ́ɔn nzẅìŋ wɔɔn tá lekÿo ké tè shʉa.
en: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó. Tsoon tà’ nyìŋ ná*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tè shÿɔg tà ńzɛ́te ngie: Ɔɔ wɔ̌ wɔ́? Á nue pɔ́ ne ńzsé ngie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Comeanddine.And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké sẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ḿbí mbelég ńná né pɔ́b, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ńná messó né pɔ́b.
en: Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyɛɛ mbùm ye mbwo ngàŋa kwò yé pá’ɔɔn, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ à kẅɛ̌ mvfò pɔ́b tà fó pá’ à ka zíme nà legwé.
en: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńtẅé jʉ’, Yěsô gɔɔn né Símo Piɛ ngie: Símo, míŋ Jâŋ, tà ɔ̀ kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn tà ńcʉa pʉ̀a pɔɔn? Á tsɔ́’ ngie oon, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zsě ngie mèŋ n nkwoŋo gú. Yěsô lêen ńké ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Pféle púɔ*menjʉ̀njÿò pɔ́ɔn.
en: So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter,Simon,sonof Jonas, lovest thou me more than these?He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him,Feed my lambs.

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńzɛ́te yé nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a ngie: Símo, míŋ Jâŋ, tà ɔ̀ kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn? Á tsɔ́’ ngie oon, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zsě ngie mèŋ n kwoŋo gú. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pyɛ́b*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn.
en: He saith to him again the second time,Simon,sonof Jonas, lovest thou me?He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him,Feed my sheep.

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńzɛ́te yé nà mbɔ́ɔntè yétá ngie: Símo míŋ Jâŋ: Tà ɔ̀ kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn? Eshÿó Piɛ sẅɛ́’, á nue Yěsô zɛté yé taa ngʉ̀a ntá ngie tà à kwoŋo yé wɔ́. Á lêen ńké ńtsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zsé ngwòŋo nò ntsèm, ɔ̀ zsě ngie mèŋ n kwoŋo gú. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: pféle*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn.
en: He saith unto him the third time,Simon,sonof Jonas, lovest thou me?Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him,Feed my sheep.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gu, kwà’ nénʉ́, ɔ̀ ka nyě ńgwɔ́ mûɔ shùm, gù zɔ̌ kwɛ́ɛ nkandɔ́ɔn jù, ḿbiŋ ńgee jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ kwǒŋ, ɔ̀ ge ké gwɔ́ tà zẅiŋ, é cʉ́’ ka’ pɔ́ mbwó mú, é náa tÿǒ tá nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ kwɛ́ nkandɔ́ɔn jù, ńdɔgɔ gú ńgʉa jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ tè ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carrytheewhither thou wouldest not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńda’te ntí legwé gie Piɛ ge gÿo kwé yɛ̌, é lɔg gu’te Ssé. Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńcʉ́me ngie: Cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him,Follow me.

ngiemboon: Piɛ sele nnɛ́, ńgyá*ngàŋa kwò gẅie Yěsô kwoŋo yé tɛ’ la, á gẅie mé la ne ńjÿó shúm, á ŋwe’e letuŋó Yěsô ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a awɔ̌ gee sẅǐŋ gù wɔ́ la?
en: Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

ngiemboon: Piɛ gyá yé pú’u, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgʉa ná wɔɔn nyìŋ, mbà à kɔ́ ge gÿo gÿo yé?
en: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and whatshallthis mando?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n dɔɔn ńkwoŋ ngie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó tà mèŋ n dá’ ḿbiŋ nzèm, mbà à jú áa mǒ ńgwɔ́ kɔ́? Cʉ́m jú pɔ́ nzèm mèŋ.
en: Jesus saith unto him,If I will that he tarry till I come, whatis thatto thee? follow thou me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn nò ná wɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò we pá’ɔɔn, mé gÿo ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé, éshwóŋte shwoŋté ngie wɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò we tě ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́. Tá, mbà Yěsô kaa gɔɔn ngie à tě ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́ wɔ́. Mbà à gɔ̌ɔn pɔ́ ngie, à lɔɔn ńkwoŋ ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó tà à lá’ ńgíŋ ńtó, mbà à ye Piɛ áa mǒ ńgwɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but,If I will that he tarry till I come, whatis thatto thee?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅie mé gɔɔn, la gyá mɔɔn menò, yé zɔ la ŋwe’e. Peg piŋ ne ńzsé ngie nò gie à gɔɔn áa nénʉ́.
en: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋ ńgÿo tsɔ́ menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn. Nkwǎŋ ngie mé la gwé’e ḿbyɛ́te ńŋwe’e, mbà ńgwɔ́ meŋwà’ne le kúu tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm wɔ́.
en: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da ŋwe’e mvɔ́g mvfò ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo gù ńdɔg ḿbíte menò mie Yěsô la gÿó, mbɔɔ mie à la la’te mbwo pʉ̀a ta fó nzyète fà’ ye,
en: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ńkúu na lyɛ̌’ gie à la kwɔ́’ né tÿǒ lépwó. À la gwɔ́ kwɔ́’, ńcʉa na Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńtsẅii mmó gie ngàŋ ntúm gie à la tsɔ́’ ge cʉ́’ʉ ně gÿo.
en: until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:

ngiemboon: À la gyá ngɔ́’ tà ńkwé, ńgÿo ńzíme nà legwé. Ńdɔg mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo pɔ́b pɔɔn, ngie aa ntentʉ́, tà ńgwaa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le gíŋe ḿmʉ́’te wɔ́, ńkẅɛɛ mvfò pɔ́b kẅɛ nà melyɛ̌’ móm lekùɔ, ńně shwóŋó wɔ́b nò nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: to whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ fó lyɛ̌’ ńne ḿbúte ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, á tsẅi né pɔ̌b ngie, tà pɔ́ fó Yerósalem ńgʉa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a. Pɔ́ ke ńnéŋe pɔ́ wó, ńzẅí’te mmó gie Tá la ka’a lénáa mbwó pɔ́b.
en: and, being assembled together withthem, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, butwait for the promise of the Father, which,saith he,ye have heard of me.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pá’ à la shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Jâŋ la nù’ pʉ̀a ntse, tá ńgʉa ná pɔ́b, mbà é cʉ́’ lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, e Ssé ńnéŋe wɔ́b mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm la cú’te pú’u, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Andè, yɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo tà lefùɔ piŋe mbwo Israel keen?
en: When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi zɔ tè gẅiin lézsé kà fʉ̀’ wɔ́, ka lyɛ̌’ gie mɛ̌ menò ge gÿo wɔ́. Tá gíle yé zɔ la kwaŋte ńzáb.
en: And he said unto them,It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.

ngiemboon: !Pi zsé pɔ́ ndà’ ngie à Zẅìge Ssé ge gÿo tóo ná pi, é náa gẅi metʉ̀. Pi lɔg ńku’u léshwóŋó kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi zsé nà mèŋ! E zyé Yerósalem éshwóŋ shwóŋ maga Jẅidea. E piŋ fó Samalîɛ, éshwóŋ shwóŋ kúu jʉ’ gie tsetsá’ zsote wó.
en: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judæa, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, pɔ́ tyé ńnyé ne ńdíe yé líe, á kwɔ́’ le tÿǒ. Tsɔ́ melɔ́ɔn pwoon yé, á pyéte menÿɔ́g pɔ́b.
en: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ, pɔ́ tyé ńké ne ńdíe lefaŋ líe. Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a lêen ńkẅɛ ńtyé lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ḿmá’ mefefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ,
en: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ̌b ngie: Pà Galilea, pi tyě náŋte tÿǒ lepwó mélà’a kɔ́? Yěsô wɛ̂ gẅie Ssé fǒ mbwo pi ésa’a yé ńdɔg ńgee tÿǒ lépwó lɛ̀, à ge gÿó gíŋe piŋ nzèm pɔ́ na ntí gie pi gyǎ á lɔgɔ ńgee lɛ̀.
