en: which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô lêen ńké fó lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive ḿbiŋ nzèm né Yerósalem. Lefǒ nà sɛ̌ lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńgʉa kúu wó, á gwɔ́ mmó tà’ kilo mítà.
en: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day's journey.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu Yerósalem, ńkwɔ́’ɔ ná ndêg we tÿǒ, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lûm ndá gẅie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńcú’te wó. Wɔɔn laa Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâŋ pɔ́ Jâg, ńgÿo Ndeléya. Wɔɔn gwɔ́ Filib, ńgÿo Tomáse, pɔ́ Patelemî mbɔɔ Matio. Wɔɔn gwɔ́ Jâg míŋ Alfe, ńgÿo Símo gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé le mûɔ ngwòŋ, pɔ́ Jẅide míŋ Jâg.
en: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, Jamesthe sonof Alphæus, and Simon Zelotes, and Judasthe brotherof James.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b métsèm lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ tà’a zẅìge ésẅíŋte Ssé té tsó, pâ Malîɛ má pà Yěsô, ńgÿo petsɔ́ pànzwě mbɔɔ mefɛ́ Yěsô.
en: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ lyɛ̌’, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ cú’te ssé, (tà ńgwɔ́ mmó pʉ̀a nkÿo lemóm mbʉ́a). Piɛ lu ssé, ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, á ka ne ńzɛ́te ngie ammó gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la lɔg ncwò fùɔ Ndavíd ḿbÿé, mé ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé à pumte. Á nò gie à la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn ntí Jẅidas gẅie yé zɔ kéen ńkẅɛɛ nnyɛ̀ nzsè tá mé gwoon Yěsô.
en: Menandbrethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

ngiemboon: Tá mbà à kaa tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ nà nùɔ yég megàŋ ntúm. Tà ńgíŋe ńgẅiin yé twó fà’ gie à ge gÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

ngiemboon: À kéen ńkẅé nkáb sóon, ńdɔg ńjú nká’, ńkúu wó, ńgwe ssé mvfò mvfò. Lepfòm sé vɛ́. Ntú mé kẅɛ sa jʉ’.
en: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

ngiemboon: Yerósalem ntsèm ntsèm la jú’u yɔɔn nò, tà ńtsẅi lezíŋ nká’ ngie: Akelduma, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ńgie nká’ metse.
en: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńcʉ́me ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ’ɛ jÿó jʉ’ yé.
en: His bishoprick let another take.

ngiemboon: Mé la tÿɔ́g pʉ̀a mepʉ́a ssé. Wɔɔn laa Yesyɛ̂b gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Mbarsabas, setsɔ́ lezíŋ sé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ le Jẅistẅis. Wetsɔ́ nyìŋ gwɔ́ Matias.
en: And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔ̀ zsé ntʉ́m mânyìŋ ntsèm lá, gʉa nà pʉ̀a pɔɔn mépʉ́a, ńnyɛɛ wég nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ tsɔ’ɔ́ yé.
en: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of allmen, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ cʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô, ńtyé nà jʉ’ gie Jẅidas kaa wó tá ńgwá’ ńgʉa né yé jʉ’ la.
en: that he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.

ngiemboon: Ésẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿma’a tyèente lélɔg fa’a nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ́’ɔ yé, á gwe nà Matias. Mé kẅi’i yé nà nùɔ megàŋ ntúm ntsɔ́b yemɔ’ɔ́ nê legém.
en: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn gie mé tóŋo le Paŋtekɔ̂dgÿo ńtó, á gwɔ gwɔ, mbà megàŋa kwò Yěsô cu’té tà’a jʉ’ métsèm.
en: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.

ngiemboon: Mé ńnéŋe tà ńjú’ jʉ’ fó tÿǒ lépwó ńzye lénʉ’ʉ, ńnʉ’ʉ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie ntʉ̀ fóm ne ńcʉa lá, ńnʉ’ʉ nʉ’ʉ tà mbú ńjÿó ndá gie pɔ́ lá ńnéŋe wó.
en: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá tsɔ́ shúm kẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ pá’ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g lá, éshʉ́ate ńtyé nà wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó wɔ́b métsèm. Pɔ́ zye leshwóŋó meshwóŋè melá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ, éshwóŋó pá’ Zẅìge nǎ tʉ̀ ngie pɔ́ shwóŋó pú’u.
en: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.

ngiemboon: Á laa ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’, pà Yuda pie pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ Ssé, mbà pɔ́ ka fó tsɛ̀ɛ métúm ntsèm ńtó ńgwɔ́ Yerósalem.
en: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ jʉ’ nʉ’ʉ pú’u, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńtó ńcú’te tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nùɔ. Á gwaa kʉ’ʉ wɔ̌wɔɔ, á jú’ megàŋ ntúm lɔgɔ pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋó yɔ́b lá’ gie à fóo né wó ńgɔɔn nò.
en: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ gíŋe ne saŋa nÿɔ́g ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pie é shwóŋó lɛ̀ té gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Galilea métsèm gwɔ́ lê?
en: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilæans?

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ̌wɔɔ nà pege cʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u, pɔ́ shwóŋó pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋe lá’ ye?
en: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fóo Parte mbɔɔ pe Medes, ńgÿo pe Elam ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege jʉ’ɔɔn. Mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é ńnéŋe Mesopotamia lâ pie ée Jẅidea. Epʉ̀a Kapadosia mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Pôŋ lâ pʉ̀a nà pàga ngwòŋ Azia gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé.
en: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judæa, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,

ngiemboon: Pàfó Filigia pɔ́ Panfilia pɔ́ Egipto, pàfó Sirɛne á nà pàga ngwòŋ Libia, pàfó*Roma gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé. Lâ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ ée lá’ɔɔn nà melyɛ̌’ mɔɔn.
en: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gwɔ́ pà Yuda lyɛ’ɛ́ nzyé, petsɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la zẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Yuda. Té tʉ́ pàfó Kelɛt lâ Arabia. Á gÿo lêkɔ́ pege metsèm jú’u kwà’ nà meshwóŋe mégé mie ée mentí mentí, pá’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn gɔɔn pá’ mefà’ Ssé fáŋ pú’u?
en: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.

ngiemboon: Á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ kwaŋ pɔ́ té cʉ́me, ńcʉ́’ sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

ngiemboon: Tá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ně ńgẅe*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅe, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pɛ̂ pʉ̌a melù’.
en: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pâ megàŋ ntúm ntsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ lêen ńké ńdu ssé. Piɛ lɔg kwà’ ngyè te tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie: Pi pà Yuda, tà mbɔɔ mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie aa Yerósalem lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, pi zẅí’te, mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅi mmó gie áa yɛ̌.
en: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judæa, and allyethat dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pɔɔn kaa pʉ̌a melù’ pá’ pi kwaŋa lɛ̀ wɔ́. Wɔɔn zɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ mba’ámba’.
en: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it isbutthe third hour of the day.

ngiemboon: Anò gie Joel,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njyó ńgɔɔn zɔ̌ pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte.
en: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;

ngiemboon: n dɔg njÿòon ńgɔɔn nò mbwo mezẅìŋe pʉ̀a pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: And your old men shall dream dreams:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pɔ́ɔn.
en: I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:

ngiemboon: Mé gyá metse, ńgyá mmɔ̌g, ńgyá pá’ ndyé fu’u,
en: Blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé nyɛɛ mmó gie aa yɛ̌.
en: Day of the Lord come:

ngiemboon: À ké ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à ga’te ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à tsẅɛ́.
en: And it shall come to pass,thatwhosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pà Israel, pi teŋe tuŋo gí ńjú’u nò yɔɔn gie mèŋ n gee gɔɔn lɔɔn. Yěsô múɔ Nǎzarɛd, aa pá’a ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Ssé ka kwà’ ńnyɛɛ mbwo pi ngie yé zɔ ka tumo yé. À ka lɔg pá’ à ka cʉa na yé ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ńgÿo ndaa gyá, ńgíŋ ńnyɛɛ gẅi meliŋé menò ntí ntí. Tà pi cwoŋo ne ńzsé.
en: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa nyìŋ gẅie mé la ńnéŋe mbwo pi, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ e Ssé la lá’ ńkwaŋte ńzáb. Pi lêen ńké gÿo pàtezsě Ssé kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ńzẅé yé.
en: him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:

ngiemboon: Tá e Ssé la kyɛ́’te menkÿo legwé nà yé, ńzíme yé mélà’ mie, á la zɔɔn ńtʉ́ pà’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ legwé ńnéŋe yé ndá tsǎŋ.
en: whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nà gwǒŋo pwó yɔ́ɔn yé tʉ̀, nně ńtóonte wɔ̀ɔn, légwɔ́ gie ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn té vege wɔ́.
en: For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

ngiemboon: N zɔɔn fó ńkwé kwé, mbà pfó yɔ́ɔn ge nuŋe ne pyɛ́bɛ pyɛ̌b,
en: Moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ké lezẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’ɔ yé à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́.
en: Neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge tó gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie ɔ́ɔ wó, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn. M bú ńkág tɛ’.
en: Thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅíŋ ngie n zyɛ́b zyɛ́b shwóŋó gẅi nò á ná mangʉa njʉ̀’ wégè fùɔ Ndavíd. À la kwé, mé tuŋo yé tà lesyè sé ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lá’ɔɔn ta ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: Menandbrethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.

ngiemboon: Tá’ à laa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, ḿbiŋ ne ńzsé nò gie Ssé la ká’a mbwo yé tà ńkʉa ngie yé Ssé ge lá’ gÿo, múɔ gẅie à kẅɛɛ nà ngẅɛ̀ yé zɔ ńnéŋe nà leŋe lefùɔ yé.
en: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, mbà fùɔ Ndavíd tʉ́ njÿó ńzsé ngie*Nzà’nkÿo ge lá’ zíme nà legwé. Áa yɛ̌ tá à la gɔɔn nà*Nzà’nkÿo ngie: E Ssé ka té gwá’a yé, á zsó lá’ mepfó wɔ́, ḿbiŋ nke te zẅíŋ ngie à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́.
en: he seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.

ngiemboon: *Nzà’nkÿo aa Yěsô. E Ssé ka zíme yé nà legwé, peg pɔɔn metsèm ne shwóŋó yɔɔn nò, á gwɔ́ nò gie peg ka gyá.
en: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka gÿo, á kwɔ́’ tà ńnéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó yé ye tʉ̀. Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà Tá wé Ssé cʉmé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbwó yé, á gwɔ́ pá’ yé Ssé la ka’. Ammó gie pi jú’u ḿbiŋe ńgyá lɛ̀, áa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ gie Yěsô nǎ né pʉ̀a pé.
en: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Ndavíd lé twó yé léen ńké tè tÿǒ lépwó kwɔ́’. Tá ńké ńgɔɔn nò ńtí*Nzà’nkÿo ńgie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gɔ̌ɔn mbwó wɔ̀ɔn Ndè ngie: Néŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó yɔ́ɔn yé tʉ̀.
en: TheLORDsaid unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

ngiemboon: Ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔ́gɔ mekwò mú».
en: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, ngwòŋ ngẅɛ ndá Israel, pi gẅiin lekwà’ ńzsé mboŋó ngie, Yěsô gẅie pi ka kime yé nà tyǒ nkǐ la, àa yé gẅie e Ssé ka lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo Ndè, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, á pú ńkúte wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ zɛ́te Piɛ pâ petsɔ́ megàŋ ntúm ngie: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà peg ge gÿo lêkɔ́?
en: Now when they heardthis, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Menandbrethren, what shall we do?

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi kúbe mà. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ nà pi zẅíŋ mé nu’u ye ntse nà lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo. Légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge lege menò tepoŋ mé é naa mbwó yé. E Ssé lêen ńké ńnáa Zwìge Ndʉalʉ̌a né pi.
en: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Méla’mie eshúm sie e Ssé la ka’, à lɔ̌ɔn ńka’a mbwo pi, mbɔɔ mbwo gubé gí. À lɔ̌ɔn ńka’a mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, é ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yégè ge gÿo tóŋo wɔ́b.
en: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off,evenas many as the Lord our God shall call.

ngiemboon: Piɛ la gíŋ ńcwoŋo ńgɔ́ɔn nò mbwo pɔ́b lelɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b mmó gie à ne ńzsé nà Yěsô, ńně ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie á léen fʉa mánzsè ńkẅɛ ńzsé ngie pi ge tsẅɛ́.
en: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la jú’u nò gie Piɛ gɔ̌ɔn, ńzẅíŋ, mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse. Mé la nu’ pʉ̀a ntse lyɛ’ó tà ńgwaa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gwɔ́ ntsá’ tá. Pɔ́ kẅi’i nà nùɔ pʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were addedunto themabout three thousand souls.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóo fʉ̀’ ntsèm té tsó, megàŋ ntúm zí’i wɔ́b nò Ssé, ńně ńtemte ńnéŋe pá’ pùɔ memá la, ḿbúte ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋe ńcú’te sẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm la ně ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mbɔɔ pâ ndàa gyá. Pʉ̀a métsèm gyá pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

ngiemboon: Pàzẅíŋe nò Yěsô metsèm la gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ ntʉ́m, ńteme shúm sɔ́b tem.
en: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ně sẅiŋe metsetsá’ mɔ́b mbɔɔ shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ sɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ nkáb ńtóo mé gábte ńná ye wɔ̌wɔ ɔ pɔ́ pá’ e ge ku’u nà yé nò.
en: and sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to allmen, as every man had need.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ ngwòŋ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, lelè’e wɔ́b gwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ cú’te*jʉ’ʉ Ssé. Pɔ́ kúu mendá ḿbute ḿpfɛ́ shúm, ńjyó shúm lejÿo pɔ́ nê lekág. Wɔ̌wɔɔ gẅiin pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo.
en: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgu’te Ssé tɛ’. Alá’a ntsèm kwoŋ yɔ́b ntí leńnéŋe. Á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a pie à gyǒ pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i nùɔ yɔ́b.
en: praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ mbÿɛ̀ njÿó, tà nèm tá fʉ̀’ gie mé tsyɛ’te Ssé ne ńku’u. Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ pʉ ńgʉa jʉ’e Ssé.
en: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer,beingthe ninthhour.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ gwɔ́, mbà mé lɔ́ɔn ńkaa tsɔ̌ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te ńdɔgɔ ńtóo lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńnéŋe yé ncwò kɔ̀’ gẅie mé tóŋ le ncwò ndá meshùm. Pá’ à ge lúɔ shúm mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ cʉa jʉ’ó ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ gẅie mé la gwɔ́ zyé yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te.
en: And a certain man lame from his mother's womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;

ngiemboon: Á gyá Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ ně ńcʉa ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, á lúɔ nkáb mbwo pɔ́b.
en: who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ tÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g ná yé. Piɛ gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie, líe weg.
en: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa kwʉ́’te nyɛte ńtÿɔ́g menÿɔ́ ná pɔ́b, ńně ḿbyɛ́bɛ, ńně ńkwaŋa ngie á ge gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ náa mmó né yé.
en: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: N te tsɔ́ lagá nkáb gẅiin, tá’, ammó gie mèŋ n gẅiin, mèŋ n ge náa mbwo gù. Mèŋ, n tsẅii nà lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo múɔ Nǎzarɛd: Lu ssé ńgiŋ,
en: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńkibe pwó yé ye tʉ̀, ńně ḿbʉ’ʉ yé, mekwò mé pâ mejÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mé gwóon ńtʉte.
en: And he took him by the right hand, and liftedhimup: and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.

ngiemboon: Á lu ssé letʉ̀, ńzye légiŋ. Pâ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô pú ńcʉa ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé. Á giŋe ńkyɛ́te, ńně ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á laa jʉ’ó gyá pá’ à ne ńgiŋe ḿbiŋe ne ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyɛte ńdíe ńgyá á gwɔ́ pɔ́ kwà’ ngàŋ kwʉ́’te gẅie àa ńnéŋe ncwò ndá meshùm ńdúɔ shúm la, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b. Pɔ́ mɔɔn. Pɔ́ té zsé mmó gie á gÿǒ tá á giŋ wɔ́.
en: and they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

ngiemboon: Àndÿò ŋwɛ́ ké té ne fóo lejʉ́ŋ Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ wɔ́, alá’ ntsèm gwaa mɔɔn, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńtó ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, á ncwò kɔ̀’, é gwɔ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le ncwò kɔ̀’ Salomo.
en: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon's, greatly wondering.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gyá pá’ pɔ́ ne ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b pú’u, ńgɔɔn né là’ ngie: Pʉ̀a Israel, pi mɔɔn pá’ à zeŋé mélà’ a kɔ́? Pi né ndie wég pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pég lɔ̌g pɔ́ meg metʉ̀ ka pɔ́ meg mefà’ nzèm Ssé tá ńdɔg ńgÿo wɔɔn nyìŋ giŋ ńtí kɔ́?
en: And when Peter sawit, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie e Ssé Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Esâg, mbɔɔ yé Yakwɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ Ssé pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè, kéen náa legú’ á mbwo ngàŋa fà’ we Yěsô. Mbà pi ka sẅíŋe yé mbwo pàsá’a lá’, ḿmoŋe yé mvfò*Pilato. Tá, mbà à la ŋag ntsaŋ ye tà ńzáb ngie mé nyé yé.
en: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to lethimgo.

ngiemboon: Pi ka moŋe nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé la tsɔ́’, á gwɔ́ ndà’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ḿbiŋ sẅíŋte*pilato ngie à nyé fÿɛ́ né pi.
en: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;

ngiemboon: Pi ka gÿo pú’u, ńzẅé nyìŋ gẅie yé zɔ gÿo tá mé gwɔ́ wó. Tá e Ssé ké ńzíme yé nà legwé tà peg gyá yé lê nÿɔ́g még, peg ne sá’a shwóŋó gẅí.
en: and killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi ne ńgyá nyìŋ wɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ne ńzsé yé. Á cʉ̌a pɔ́ nà wég lézáb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô ŋwɛ́ tá lezíŋ sé ná metʉ̀ mbwo yé, á lɔg ńdu ssé ńtyé mvfò pi. Á cʉ̌a pɔ́ nà lezǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô tá á gwɔ́ ntentʉ́ pá’ pi ne ńgyá lɛ̀.
en: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n cwoŋo ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie pi lâ mefùɔ pí ka lɔg pɔ́ gʉ̀gʉ̀ tá ńgÿo yɔɔn ntí nò nà Yěsô.
en: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye didit, asdidalso your rulers.

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé fó mǒ ńgÿo anò gie à la tʉ́ njÿó ńdɔg ncwò pà Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé métsèm ńgɔɔn á pumte. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ ngie*Nzà’nkÿo we kɔ̌ɔn ńge lá’ gyá ngɔ́’.
en: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, pi ké ńkúbe mà gẅi, ḿbiŋe mbwo Ssé. À lege menò tepòŋ mí.
en: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo pi gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè. À gÿo ńtumo*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à la tʉ́ njÿo ńtsɔ́’ɔ yé ntí twó sí, á gwɔ́ Yěsô.
en: and he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn Yěsô ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ léńnéŋe tÿǒ lépwó. Tà lá’ ku lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ge lá’ gÿo akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ sele ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye sẅe. Pá’ à la lá’ ńdɔg ncwò kwà’ pà Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé ńgɔɔn tà ntyě sǎg.
en: whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi ge lá’ túmo tsɔ̌ Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ we. À gwɔ́ pá’ mèŋ, ńkẅɛ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. À lɔɔn ndà’ ńgɔɔn ngie pi gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́ pi jú’.
en: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à té lá’ jú’ ncwò wɛ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, mé fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la tsɔ́’, ńkẅile yé, ńzẅé yé».
en: And it shall come to pass,thatevery soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pie pɔ́ la gɔɔn nò tà fó ná Samîɛ, ńkúu nà pʉ̀a pie é lá pɔ́ɔnte nzèm ye métsèm, pɔ́ la la’te yɔ́b pá’ mɔ̀ɔn melyɛ̌’ ge lá’ gwɔ́ pú’u.
en: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.

ngiemboon: E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ ncwò pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé ŋwɛ́ ńgɔɔn né pi. Pi gẅiin gí mmó nà*kʉ̀a gie Ssé la gwa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pí. Á gwɔ́ pá’ à la gɔɔn né Ábalam ngie: Mèŋ n ge lá’ cʉa pɔ́ nà ngẅɛ̀ jù tá néŋ mbʉ́lè nà metsìŋe ndá ntsèm mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá Ssé la gwaa tsɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa fà’ wé é túm, ńzɔɔn ntíi pɔ́ twó sí, ńtúmo yé ngie à tó ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè nà pi, ńgÿo awɔ̌wɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́ gwá’ mefà’ tepòŋ.
en: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ la nyé ńgɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ gɔɔn, pànuŋe pwɔ́’, ńgÿo pàpyɛ̀bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé lâ pà*sadukay tó.
en: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,

ngiemboon: Anò pú ne ḿbÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, mélà’mie Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ la ne ńzi’i lá’ ngie e Ssé ge gÿo zím pʉ̀a nà legwé pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à ka zíme Yěsô.
en: being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwoon wɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ gwɔ́ ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò nzèm. Pɔ́ ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge lá’a wó tá njÿó lʉ́a.
en: And they laid hands on them, and putthemin hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ gwɔ́, mbà á gʉ̌a ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋó Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, lelÿò zẅíŋ. Tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a.
en: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lá lʉ́a, pàsa’á lá’ pà Yuda lâ melÿò, pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pú ńcú’te Yerósalem.
en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,

ngiemboon: Kwà’ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó, wɔɔn laa Ánnɔ́ɔn,*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, ńgÿo Kaifa, mbɔɔ Jâŋ lê Alekzáŋdele, lâ pʉ̀a metsèm nà tsìŋe ndà*tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’.
en: and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsẅi, mé lɔ́gɔ Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ ńtóo mvfò pɔ́b. Pɔ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Metʉ̀ ka fó nzɔ̌ pi lɔg ńgÿo mmó gie pi ka gÿo li? Pi kaa pe’e ńdɔg lezìŋ wɔ́ tá ńgÿo pú’u?
en: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó Piɛ. Á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

ngiemboon: Mefùɔ lá’ pég pâ mekěm pég, peg ka gÿo nò mbòŋo á ná tà’ nkÿǒon. Mé piŋ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te wég pá’, peg ka gÿo tá á zeŋe.
en: if we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm tà mbɔɔ pà Israel tà ḿmag, á ké ně ńzɛ́te ngie pi zsé tà’a nò. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ ngie peg ka lɔg pɔ́ lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo mûɔ Nǎzarɛd tá ńgÿo nyìŋ wɔɔn gwɔ́ ntentʉ́ pá’ pi gyá lɔɔn. Á Yěsô Kristo wa gẅie pi la kime ye nà tÿǒ nkǐ lá. E Ssé kéen ńgÿo á zíme nà legwé.
en: be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead,evenby him doth this man stand here before you whole.

ngiemboon: «Tóon gẅie pàkwɛ́ ndá la gwá’, à kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon lezẅé ndá».
en: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ké ńgẅiin lécʉa pɔ́ ná Yěsô tá ńtsẅɛ, á nue atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ tè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ńgwɔ́ gẅie e Ssé la zába yé légwɔ́ gie pege ge cʉa nà yé tsẅɛ wɔ.
en: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie la ńnéŋe ssé ně ŋaga wɔ́b, gyá ntí gie Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ lɔ̌g ńgɔɔn nò té pɔ́g á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ memeen pʉ̀a, mbà pɔ́ la té zí’i sekúd tɛ’ wɔ́. Pɔ́ léen ńké ńdiŋ ngie pɔ́ gÿo pu’u, á nue pâ Yěsô kɔ́ɔn ńteme kwò ńgiŋe.
en: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ńně ńgyá pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à ka zeŋe tyé lejʉ́ŋ Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńzsé tsɔ́ nò gie pɔ́ ge gɔɔn wɔ́,
en: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

ngiemboon: ńdêen ńké ńtsẅi mé gÿo pɔ́ fó jʉ’ʉ ntsaŋ ńkẅɛ. Pɔ́ kwaŋte pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo,
en: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege ge gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pʉ̀a pɔɔn? Pʉ̀a metsèm, ee Yerósalem wɔɔn ne ńzsé yɔɔn nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn gie pɔ́ ka gÿo. Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege é le moŋe.
en: saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by themismanifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot denyit.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pege vege wɔ́b, ḿbebe wɔ́b, ngie tà pɔ́ gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô ńgɔɔn nò mbwo tsɔ́ sɔɔn nyìŋ á lá’ yɔɔn. À cʉa pú’u, yɔɔn nò le gíŋe sa jʉ’ wɔ́.
en: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńtóŋo Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: MÀbɔ́ɔn pi le gíŋe ńkím lezíŋ Yěsô. Ta pi gíŋe ńzí’i nò yé mbwo pʉ̀a.
en: And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ammó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo gwɔ́ ngie mé jú’ pɔ́ ncwò gẅi kà wé? Pi gyá gí ngie kɔ́?
en: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà peg, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ peg léláŋte nà nò gie peg la jú’ ḿbiŋ ńgyá wɔ́.
en: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’ ntsaŋ é gíŋe ńnyɛte ḿbebe wɔ́b, ńnyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa. Mbà pɔ̀ fǎ’ shÿo gẅie pɔ́ ge fó mǒ lɔg nyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’, pɔ́ té gyá ńtí lá’. Á nue pʉ̀a metsèm laa jʉ’ó, ńně ńgu’te Ssé nà mmó gie á ka cʉa.
en: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for allmenglorified God for that which was done.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la zeŋe nà ntí ye mmɔɔn mmɔɔn lɔɔn, la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à tɔ̌g ngù’ móm lekúa.
en: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà nyé wɔ́b, Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ gʉa ńkẅɛte pʉ̀a pɔ́b. Mbú ḿbíte menò mie metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pàsá’a lá’ ně ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b, éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdêen ńké mbú ńcú’te ssé ńdɔgɔ tà’ ncwò ńzye lésẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù zɔ la nyɛte lefàŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’, ńnyɛte ntse, ńnyɛte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie áa ná mɔɔn mejʉ’.
en: And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thouartGod, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:

ngiemboon: Melá’ melá’ fa’a nò pá’ɔɔn á gwɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And the people imagine vain things?

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à la zɔ́’ɔ yé ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ
en: Against the Lord, and against his Christ.

ngiemboon: Áa kwà’ nò.*Herôd pɔ́ Ponte*Pilato kéen ńcú’te á tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔɔn pâ pàtúm tà mbɔɔ tsɔ́ metsìŋe ndá Israel, ńcú’te pú’u, lélÿɔ́’ɔ Yěsô, á ngàŋa fà’ gù gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’, ńzɔ́’ɔ yé.
en: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la táŋa yé pú’u, ńdêen ḿbú ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie gù Ssé, ɔ̀ lá lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó ńkwaŋte ńzáb ngie á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pú’u.
en: for to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, líe fʉ̀’ɔɔn tá ńgyá pá’ pɔ́ ne ḿbebe weg. Náa shÿɔ́g mbwo ngàŋa fà’ jú, pɔ́ shwóŋó nò jú té pɔ́g.
en: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

ngiemboon: Náa weg metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a zeŋe, lélɔg ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn pâ ndàa gyá, á ná lezíŋ Yěsô, á ngàŋa fà’ gú gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’.
en: by stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la sẅíŋte Ssé ta ńtsẅé jʉ’, ajʉ’ gie pɔ́ la cú’te wó cʉ’ʉ. À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿo wɔ́b métsèm. Pɔ́ zyé leshwóŋó nò Ssé té pɔ́g.
en: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.

ngiemboon: Anùɔ pʉ̀a Yěsô lɔ́ɔn ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ ncwò, ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ ntʉ́m. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgẅiin mmó ngie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ yé wɔ́. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńteme shúm tem.
en: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said anyof themthat ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.

ngiemboon: Á fó mǒ e Ssé náa máamáa metʉ̀ né megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, pɔ́ lɔg ńkẅi’i sá’a ná ntí gie pʉ̀a ge ju’ e zsé ngie e Ssé ka zíme Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô nà legwé. E Ssé ne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè nà pʉ̀a Yěsô metsèm pá’ɔɔn tɛ’.
en: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pɔ́b lɔ̌ɔn tě ńzága mmó wɔ́, mélà’mie pʉ̀a metsèm tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pie pɔ́ la gẅiin mendá lâ menká’ lá ne ńgee sẅiŋe ńdɔgɔ nkáb ńtóo,
en: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

ngiemboon: ńnuŋe mekwò megàŋ ntúm. Mé gabte náa yé wɔ̌wɔɔ pá’ e ge ku’u nà yé nò.
en: and laidthemdown at the apostles' feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.

ngiemboon: À tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Yesyɛ̂b, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, mbà mé la zyé yé á ngwòŋ Shʉ̀pele. Ngàŋ ntúm lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Panebâse, é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à kẅiŋte pʉ̀a.
en: And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite,andof the country of Cyprus,

ngiemboon: À la sẅiŋ wé nká’, ńdɔg nkáb ńtó nùŋe mekwò megàŋ ntúm.
en: having land, soldit, and brought the money, and laiditat the apostles' feet.

ngiemboon: Tá’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé le Ananias pɔ́ nzwě wé Safira gʉa sẅiŋe jʉ’ʉ nká’ yɔ́b,
en: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,

ngiemboon: ńkwaŋte, ńzá’a tsɔ́ gwǒŋo nkáb ńde’e, ńgʉa núŋe pfwɔ́’ mekwò megàŋ ntúm Yěsô.
en: and kept backpartof the price, his wife also being privyto it, and brought a certain part, and laiditat the apostles' feet.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ananias, mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ zẅǐŋ Sátà jÿó gú tà ɔ̀ fʉte zẅìge Ssé? Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ sẅǐŋ nká’ gù, ńkú’te tsɔ́ gwǒŋo nkáb?
en: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep backpartof the price of the land?

ngiemboon: Nká’ kɔ’ɔ́ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gú, tá ɔ̀ sẅiŋ. Ɔ̀ pǐŋ sẅiŋ, nkáb gwɔ́ pɔ́ jù. Ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ńgẅiin yɔɔn ntí nkwàŋte tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ̀m gú? Ɔ̀ kaa cÿɔ nò pɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a mésoŋ wɔ́. Ɔ̀ cÿɔ̌ nò pɔ́ mbwó Ssé.
en: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.

ngiemboon: Ananias jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńgwóon ńgwe ńkwé. Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la jú’u yɔɔn nò pú ḿbɔ́g.
en: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà á ně ńkwé pú’u, pûɔ ngwàshùm tó ńdɔgɔ pwó nzsǒ ńzémte pfó yé, ńkaa yé ńgʉa ńtúŋ,
en: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carriedhimout, and buriedhim.

ngiemboon: é gwaa cʉa mmó nèm ntá, nzwě wé tó ńzyɛ’ ńkúu ndá. À te ne ńzsé mmó gie á gÿǒ wɔ́.
en: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.

ngiemboon: Piɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: Shwóŋo wɔ̀ɔn, pi ně sẅíŋ nká’ pɔ́ pá’ɔɔn lá? Á gɔɔn ngie: Oon, peg ně sẅiŋ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ.
en: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pi lɔgɔ yɛ̌ shÿɔ́g tá ńtóo ńkwa’te Zẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a? Jú’ pá’ pʉ̀a ée ncwò ndá ńgiŋe, pɔ́ fóo ńtuŋ ndǔm gu. Tá pɔ́ ge kaa gú jú lɔg gʉa túŋ mo.
en: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husbandareat the door, and shall carry thee out.

ngiemboon: Á gwoon ńgwe ssé mvfò Piɛ, ńkwé. Pûɔ ngwàshùm kúu ndá, ńgyá pá’ à kwě, ńkaa pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋo lejʉ́ŋ yé ndǔm we.
en: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carryingherforth, buriedherby her husband.

ngiemboon: Acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mbɔɔ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la jú’u yɔɔn nò pú ḿbɔ́g tɛ’.
en: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm la ne ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn lâ mekʉ’ʉ́ menò mentí mentí tsɛ̀ɛ lá’. Pɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm lɔ́ɔn mbú ńtóo ńcú’te nà jʉ’ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le ncwò kɔ̀’ Salomo.
en: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon's porch.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ ké tě fʉ’ʉ lékúu nùɔ pɔ́b wɔ́, tá pʉ̀a metsèm ké ne ńgɔ’te ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa tà ńgyɔ́ɔn lâ pànzwě la ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ yɔ́b á kẅi’i.
en: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)

ngiemboon: Mé la gɔ̀’te nò yɔ́b gɔ́’te tà mé lɔg mekǔ lâ mematá ńkaa meguɔ nùŋe wɔ́b mengʉ̀ŋe nzsé légwɔ́ gie Piɛ à ge gwaa cʉa, jʉjʉ́ŋ wé tè téme nà tsɔ̌ wɔ́, à teme nà tsɔ̌.
en: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laidthemon beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tá ńgyɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe fóo tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe Yerósalem ńdɔgɔ meguɔ mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie mezẅìge tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b, ńtóo ńgyá megàŋ ntúm. Pɔ́ gÿo pɔ́b métsèm zeŋe.
en: There came also a multitudeoutof the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.

ngiemboon: Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ně ńtóonte nò yé lêen ńké ńzyé lekwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ ntí megàŋ ntúm. Pàtóonte nò yé ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ ná nùɔ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le ye pà*sadukay.
en: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ túm pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gwoon megàŋ ntúm ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe megàŋa tsǎŋ ntsèm wó.
en: and laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.

ngiemboon: Tá á gÿo ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ’, atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó, ńtsɔ́’ ndá tsǎŋ, ńgÿo megàŋ ntúm gwaa kẅɛ, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ gyɛ̌ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé éshwóŋó lá’ menò mie é líe le gwɔ́ we sẅe.
en: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

ngiemboon: Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pʉ̀a pé ńnéŋe tà ńcú’te mekěm pà Israel nà nò lésá’ ntsaŋ. Pâ pɔ̌ túm megàŋa fà’ ngie pɔ́ gʉa ndà tsǎŋ éfa’ megàŋ ntúm ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó.
en: And when they heardthat, they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

ngiemboon: Tá megàŋa fà’ gʉa ńkúu ndá tsǎŋ, pɔ́ te wɔ́b gya, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋ pʉ̀a pie é ně ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie:
en: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,

ngiemboon: Peg gʉa tá ńkuu wó, ńgyá mencwò ndá tsǎŋ gwɔ́ mé njÿɔ̌’. Pàpyɛ́b jʉ’ ké ńtyé pɔ́ ncwò ndá. Peg tsɔ́’ mencwò ndá, ńkúu tsòló, ńké tè nyìŋ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gyá.
en: saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.

ngiemboon: Tándá pàpyɛ́bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé pâ metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ jú’u yɔɔn nò a kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b. Pɔ́ té zsé mmó gie á ně ńgÿo megàŋ ntúm wɔ.
en: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ gwoon ńzyɛ́’ ńkúu ndá, ńgɔɔn ngie: Epʉ̀a pá pie pi ka ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ la, cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ gyɛ̌ á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńně ńzí’i lá’ mmó.
en: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.

ngiemboon: Tándá pàpyɛ́b jʉ’ pâ pʉ̀a pé gʉa lélɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó. Tá ńké tè lɔg tʉ̀ ńgwoon wɔ́b wɔ. Mélà’ mie àlá’ laa jʉ’ó tɛ’. Pɔ́ ně ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ mé ge lɔg metóon témte wɔ́b é zẅéte.
en: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg megàŋ ntúm ńtó, ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b mvfò pàsá’a lá’. Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: And when they had brought them, they setthembefore the council: and the high priest asked them,

ngiemboon: Peg ka té tɔ’ɔ gẅi legíŋ ńzí’i nò nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ á mbwo pʉ̀a wɔ́ le? Pi pǐŋ ńdɔgɔ nò yé mbú saa Yerósalem ntsèm. Pi te pɛ́’ɛ̀ fa’a ngie mé yé peg zsé nò nà legwé wé wáa?
en: saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man's blood upon us.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Piɛ pâ megàŋ ntúm tsɔ́’ ngie: Á zɛ́te ngie me jú’ ncwò Ssé, ńcʉa le jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a mésoŋ.
en: Then Peter and theotherapostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

ngiemboon: E Ssé pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè, ka gÿo Yěsô gẅie pi ka kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ la, zíme nà legwé.
en: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka gÿo á kwɔ́’, á ńnéŋe yé nà gwòŋo pwò yé ye tʉ̀, pú’u, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo fùɔ, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo*Nzà’nkÿo. E Ssé ka gÿo pú’u, le gwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a Israel ge kúbe mà wɔ́b, à lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b.
en: Him hath God exalted with his right handto bea Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pàjÿó ńgyá nà mɔɔn menò. À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie Ssé ne náa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ńjú’u ncwò wé zɔ̌ tsóte weg légɔɔn.
en: And we are his witnesses of these things; andso isalso the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.

ngiemboon: Mekěm jú’ pá’ pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, mbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ, ńzyé lékwaŋte lézẅé megàŋ ntúm.
en: When they heardthat, they were cutto the heart, and took counsel to slay them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b, mé tóŋo yé lê Gamaliel, lu ssé ńtsẅi ngie mé gÿo megàŋ ntúm ná’a ńkẅɛɛ pí. Pú’u, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nà nùɔ pà*farisay, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ndÿò nà lékyagte mbʉ̌ Mǒsê, àlá’ ná mekù’ mé tɛ’.
en: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm kẅɛ, Gamaliel gɔɔn ngie: Pà Israel, pi laga twó gí nà nò gie pi fa’a légÿo nà pʉ̀a pɛ.
en: and said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte pá’ Tedas la kẅɛ, ńcú’te pʉ̀a nkÿo lekùɔ nà ye nùɔ, mé zẅé yé, pɔ́ tága tà ḿmag, ésa jʉ’.
en: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.

ngiemboon: Á lá’ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mé la ne sáŋa lá’, Jẅidas, nyìŋ Galilea kẅɛ. Mé cʉ́me nzèm yé tɛ’. Mé gíŋe ńzẅé yé ye, epʉ̀a pé tága sa jʉ’, ayɔ́b mag.
en: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all,evenas many as obeyed him, were dispersed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn shwóŋó gẅi ngie, pi nyé pʉ̀a pɛ, pɔ́ gʉa, mélà’mie ammó gie pɔ́ gÿo lɔɔn fóo pɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a mésoŋ, ńgwɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ zɔ̌ taŋté, mbà á ge lɔg pɔ́ ndɔ́ɔn ndɔ́ɔn mag.
en: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zẅíŋe nò gie Gamaliel gɔ̌ɔn,
en: but if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.

ngiemboon: ńtóŋ megàŋ ntúm, ńtsẅi mé lɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn ńcúa wɔ́b. Pɔ́ tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b légíŋ ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô ńgɔɔn nò, ndêen ńké ńnyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beatenthem, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa fó tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pàsá’a lá’ kẅɛ, ńgíŋe ńkága kǎg. Mélà’ mie e Ssé gyá ngie pɔ́ ku’u légyá ngɔ́’ ntí nò lezíŋ Yěsô.
en: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, á tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ mendá mendá, ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ńně sá’a nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô, aa*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Á láa nà yɛ̌ fʉ̀’, anùɔ pʉ̀a Kristo ně ńkẅi’i tɛ’. Atsɔ́ gwǒŋ gwɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ shwóŋó Gelekia, yetsɔ́ gwɔ́ yé pà shwóŋó kwà’ shwóŋè lá’. Pàshwóŋe Gelekia zyé lézẅɛ́te nà pàshwóŋe kwà’ shwóŋè lá’ ngie: Pɔ́ ne ńgaba shúm lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, pɔ́ téen náa sé mepfɔ̌g pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ntúm ntsɔ̀b pʉ̀a nê legém lêen ńké ńtóŋo cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm ńgɔɔn ngie: Á té poŋ ngie peg nyé léshwóŋó nò Ssé, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwá ńgaba pɔ́ shúm lejÿó wɔ́.
en: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciplesunto them, and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, mbà mefɛ́ mefɛ̀, pi gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, éfa’ pʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a pá’ pɔ́ ge ně fa’a yɛ̌ fà’. Pi cʉ́’ʉ letsɔ́’, ńdíe pʉ̀a pie tsẅé yɔ́b poŋ. Epʉ̀a pie Zẅìge Ssé léen ńjÿó letʉ́m sɔ́b. Pɔ́ piŋ ńgẅiin zsé nò. Peg cʉ́me fà’a shúm léjÿó mbwo pɔ́b,
en: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà peg, peg ké ńzsé yég pɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbiŋ ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a pɔ́ nò yé.
en: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo jú’, á pú ḿboŋo wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ lêen ńké ntsɔ́’ɔ Etien. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ ńzáb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé tɛ’, mbà Zẅíge Ssé léen ńjÿó yé. Mé gíŋe ńtsɔ́’ɔ Filib, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Porokɔr, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Nikanor, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Timon, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Parmenas pɔ́ Nikola gẅie a laa nyìŋ Antiokia. Mbà à la kúu nà nò Ssé pà Yuda.
en: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó, ńnyɛɛ mbwo megàŋ ntúm. Megàŋ ntúm sẅíŋte Ssé, ńzáb mbwo twó pɔ́b.
en: whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laidtheirhands on them.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Ssé la ne ńkẅi’i saa pɔ́ jʉ’. Anùɔ pàzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô ně ńkẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn Yerósalem. Pànuŋe pwɔ́’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn záb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô.
en: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

ngiemboon: Etien gẅie mé la tsɔ́’ɔ yé la, à laa nyìŋ, mbà Ssé la tsẅagte pwó yé, ńně náa yé metʉ̀. Á lɔgɔ ńgÿo menkʉ̀’ʉ menò lâ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a.
en: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a gÿo ńzyé lézoŋo nò gie Etien gɔɔn. Atsɔ́ gwǒŋ gwɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ fóo Sirɛne mbɔɔ Alekzáŋdeli, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gee nà*ndá cú’tè gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo le*ndá cú’tè pàkẅɛɛ ndá nkwɔɔn. Yetsɔ́ gwǒŋ gwɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ fóo nà pàga ngwòŋ Silisia mbɔɔ nà pàga ngwòŋ Azia.
en: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is calledthe synagogueof the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ně ńzoŋo pú’u, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ té ŋaga yé tà ńjÿó wɔ́, mélà’mie Zẅìge Ssé lɔ́ɔn náa yé legye lélɔg ńgɔɔn nò.
en: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ńdúŋ pʉ̀a, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ka jú’ pá’ Etien shwóŋó té pòŋ nà Mǒsê mbɔɔ nà Ssé.
en: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, andagainstGod.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńdɔg sẅite lá’, ésẅite mekěm mbɔɔ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, ḿma’a nzèm Etien. Mé lêen ńké ńgwoon yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa mvfò cú’tè pàsá’a lá’ pá’ mé ge ŋaga yé.
en: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came uponhim, and caught him, and broughthimto the council,

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lɔg mbɔɔ tsɔ́ megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, ńgʉa wó. Pɔ́ tó ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn zɔgɔ pɔ́ léshwóŋó té pòŋ á nà ndá Ssé yégè gie ee Yerósalem wɔɔn, mbɔɔ nà mbʉ̌ Mǒsê.
en: and set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:

ngiemboon: Peg ka fó ńzɔɔn ńjú’ á gɔɔn ngie Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd áwɛ̌ ge gÿo sa’ ndá Ssé yege, é piŋ kúbe mà gẅie Mǒsê la náa mbwó pege.
en: for we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’ pie laa ndá métsèm lêen ńké ně ńtÿɔ́gɔ menÿɔ́g nà Etien, ńgwaa gyá eshÿó wé cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ we*cÿɔ́’ Ssé lá.
en: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

ngiemboon: Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɛ́te Etien ngie: Anò gie n jú’u mé gɔɔn ná gù áa nò?
en: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?

ngiemboon: Etien tsɔ́’ ngie: Metá pɔ́ɔn, mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi jú’u nò gie mèŋ n gee gɔ̌ɔn. Á laa fʉ̀’ gie mangʉa njʉ’ wégè Ábalam la nyé Mesopotamia, tà ńnyé té gee Haraŋ, e Ssé gẅie à gẅiin shʉshÿɔ́g nyɛ mbùm ye mbwo yé,
en: Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Nye tsìŋe ndá gí, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅi ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa le nà tsɔ́ lá’ gie mèŋ n ge nyɛɛ gú.
en: and said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

ngiemboon: Ábalam lêen ńké fó ngwòŋ pà Kaldea, ńgʉa ńnéŋe Haraŋ, ńnéŋe wó tà tá wé lá’ ńkwé. E Ssé tsẅi á fó Haraŋ ńtó lé tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ gẅie pi tsẅê wó fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn.
en: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldæans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.

ngiemboon: À la kúu jʉ’ɔɔn, e Ssé fó tè nká’ wé ná, tà mbɔɔ ntÿɔ́gɔ kwò. Tá ńké ńká’a mbwó yé ngie à ge lá’ ná wɔɔn ngwòŋ mbwo yé, e cʉ́’ wé, mbàa we gubé yé á fʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ cʉ́’ʉ gwɔ́ wó wɔ́, ńké ńgwaa ka’ pú’u, Ábalam tè múɔ gẅiin.
en: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, notso much asto set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, whenas yethe had no child.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ké ńgɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: Gubé jú ge lá’ gʉa tsɔ́ túm tsẅé. E kúu wó mé lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo menkwɔɔn, ńnyɛ́ɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’ nyɛ nà ngù’u lá’ nkÿo lekùɔ.
en: And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreatthemevil four hundred years.

ngiemboon: Tá mèŋ Ssé n ké ŋag wɛ̌ ngwòŋ, ńzáb ngɔ́’ twó pɛ̌ pʉ̀a pie é lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo menkwɔɔn. Tá ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù fó wó ńkẅɛ ńtó, ńnéŋe ńgú’te wɔ̀ɔn jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ Ábalam gíŋe ńgwa mbɔɔ*kʉ̀a, à liŋé yɛ̌*kʉ̀a gwɔ́ lépú’u mûɔ mbàŋa. Á cʉa pú’u, tá Ábalam tǎ ḿbú’u Esâg pá’ mé la zyé yé tà é gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn. Esâg tǎ ḿbú’u míŋ wé Yakwɔ́b. Yakwɔ́b tǎ ḿbú’ púɔ pé pe mbàŋa pie ée pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém la.
en: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and soAbrahambegat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and IsaacbegatJacob; and Jacobbegatthe twelve patriarchs.

ngiemboon: Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè gÿo ńdíe fɛ́ wɔ́b Yesyɛ̂b ésíŋe shÿó tà sẅiŋe yé. Á cʉ́’ nkwɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto. Tá Ssé ke ńgwɔ́ né yé,
en: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,

ngiemboon: ńkẅile yé tsɛ̀ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntsèm gie é la kúu yé, ńgíŋe ńnáa yé legye tà Faraon fùɔ Pà Egipto, kwóŋo yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ŋwálá’ twó mbùm pá’ à ge líe ngwòŋ Egipto tà mbɔɔ menò mie é tswé’e nɔ’.
en: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ cÿó gÿo ńgwé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a Kanaan ntsèm. Pʉ̀a mésoŋ gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’. Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè pú ńzág shúm léjÿó.
en: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b lêen ńké ńjú’ mé yé shúm léjÿó ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto. Á túm pàmagʉa njʉ’ pégè á wó á nà nduŋ mvfò légʉa.
en: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tǎ ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe wó nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, Yesyɛ̂b lêen ńké ḿbÿé mbùm yé mbwo mefɛ́ pé. Fùɔ Faraon lɔg fó pú’u, ńzsé tsìŋe ndá pà Yesyɛ̂b.
en: And at the secondtimeJoseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph's kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b túm ngie mé gʉa fa’a tá wé Yakwɔ́b, à lɔg ngẅɛ̀ ye ntsèm ńtó. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó mbú ńcú’te ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mésoŋ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̀a nê móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob tohim, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b gʉa Egipto, ńnéŋe wó tà ndá’ ńkwé. Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè gÿo ńgíŋe ńkwéte yɔ́b.
en: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo ńkaa mekẅǐ mɔ́b, ńgʉa Sikem ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè sie Ábalam la lɔg nkáb yé ńjúu mbwo púɔ Emor. E gwɔ́ ndè’e mepfó.
en: and were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmorthe fatherof Sychem.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńge gÿo mmó gie à la ká’a mbwo Ábalam la gwɔ́ tà ńne ńkú’u, epʉ̀a pégè shʉ́a ngẅɛ̀ yɔb tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto pá’ɔɔn tɛ’.
en: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ fùɔ gÿo ńne sá’a pà Egipto, ńgwɔ́ gẅie à la tè Yesyɛ̂b zsé,
en: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.

ngiemboon: éfʉte pʉ̀a lá’ pégè, ńgÿo nò tepòŋ nà pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè, tà ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ ńgwa’ pûɔ mepÿɛ́ pɔ́ kwéte.
en: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ŋwɛ́, mé lêen ńké zyé Mǒsê, á gwɔ́ múɔ, kwáŋ shÿó we lʉ́ate tɛ’. Mé gẅiin yé pɔ́ ndá tá we nà mesaŋ métá,
en: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father's house three months:

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ ńgwá’a yé. Tá míŋ fùɔ Faraon we manzwě kaa yé ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé, ńkwé’te yé ńdɔg ńgÿo míŋ we.
en: and when he was cast out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê tsẅe wó, mé pú ńzí’i yé zsé nò pà Egipto, ńgú’ tà ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ, ńcʉ́’ʉ légɔɔn nò kà légÿo wɔ́, ńgÿo pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à zsé mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌.
en: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa, akwàŋte légyá mefɛ́ pé pà Israel, tóo twó ye.
en: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.

ngiemboon: Á kúu lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Egipto ně ńcúa nyìŋ Israel. Á tág nzèm nyìŋ Israel, ńzẅé nyìŋ Egipto.
en: And seeing oneof themsuffer wrong, he defendedhim, and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:

ngiemboon: Mbà legye sé shwoŋó yé ngie mefɛ́ pé ge gyá yé, é zsé ngie e Ssé zɔ tumó yé ngie à gʉa ńkẅile wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’. Tá nyìŋ wɔ́b tè zsé.
en: for he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, á gíŋe ḿbiŋe wó, ńgwɔ́ tó, pʉ̀a Israel mepʉ́a ně ńcúa nkwɛ̀. Á ně faga wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, pi ée mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ḿbiŋ sele ńcúa nkwɛ̀ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńzye mèlà’, pe’e Mǒsê ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Kwà’ wɔ́ zɔ ka lɔgɔ gú ńgÿo fùɔ pá’ ɔ̀ ge ŋag mentsaŋ még?
en: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn pá’ ɔ̀ ka zẅé nyìŋ Egipto jǔɔ la keen?
en: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?

ngiemboon: Mǒsê jú’ pú’u, ńkÿo ńgʉa né túm, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Madiaŋ, ńnéŋe wó, ńgÿo ńzyé pûɔ mbàŋa mepʉ́a.
en: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.

ngiemboon: E gÿo ńcʉa ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa, Mǒsê gʉa ngʉ̀ŋe lekwɔ’ɔ́ Sinay, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńtóo wó ńgyá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, á gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g, gẅie é la ně nkÿó na tsɔ̌ mûɔ métÿǒ.
en: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê gyá wɛ̌ mmɔ̌g, é kʉ’ʉ yé. Á sẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ńně ńdíe, ńjú’ ngyè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: When Moses sawit, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to beholdit, the voice of the Lord came unto him,

ngiemboon: Aa mèŋ Ssé pàmangʉa njʉ’ pí, é Ssé Ábalam, é Ssé Esâg, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ́b. Mǒsê jú’ ḿbɔ́g, ńzye lévɛ. À tè gíŋe ńkwoŋo lélíe jʉ’ó wɔ́.
en: saying, Iamthe God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Sẅɛ melɔ̌ɔn mie ée mekwò gù lɛ̀, á nue ajʉ’ gie ɔ̀ tyé wó lɛ, áa jʉ’ yɔ́ɔn mie mèŋ n gee Ssé.
en: Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyǎ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto, ńgíŋe ńjú’ pá’ pɔ́ ga’te. Mèŋ sẅɛ̌’ ńtóo légÿo pɔ́ fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ ńkẅɛ. Á nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn la, mèŋ n ge túmo gú ngwòŋ Egipto.
en: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gɔɔn pú’u, ńdêen ńké ńtúm pɔ́ Mǒsê wa pá’ à ge gʉa kẅile pà Israel tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ gie pɔ́ la ne ńgyá.*Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie Mǒsê ka gyá yé tsɛ̀ɛ mûɔ métÿǒ la ne ńkẅéte yé. Á ně sá’a wɔ́b. Tá mbà pɔ́ la lʉ’ʉ yé, tà ńzɛ́te yé ngie à wɔ́ ka zábá yé ngie à cʉ́’ʉ fùɔ wɔ́b, ńŋaga wɔ́b gwɔ́?
en: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? the same did God sendto bea ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê la gʉa tà ńkúu ngwòŋ Egipto, ńgÿo menkʉ̀’ʉ nò, lâ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn ńdɔg ńdá’te metʉ̀ Ssé. Yé zɔ̌ lêen ńké ńgÿo fó wó ńkẅile wɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn ngʉ̀ŋe pàŋ ntse, ńtóo nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńgÿo gÿo nà ngù’ móm lekùa.
en: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó púɔ pà Israel ngie: «E Ssé ge lá’ gíŋe náa tsɔ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé né pi. À gwɔ́ pá’ mèŋ. À ge lá’ kẅɛ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.»
en: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê zɔ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie á laa fʉ̀’ gie pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè la cú’te nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, á tyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b lâ*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn cʉ́me nò mbwo yé á ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ Sinay. Kwà’ yé Mǒsê zɔ la kẅé shwóŋe gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó léná né pege.
en: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, andwithour fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè pɛ̌, la tè kwoŋo le jú’ ncwò Mǒsê wɔ́, ḿbe’e yé pe’e. Tà ńtsɔ́ɔn le gíŋe ḿbiŋe ngwòŋ Egipto,
en: to whom our fathers would not obey, but thrusthimfrom them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né Aroŋ ngie: Peg tè ne ńzsé mmó gie á kéen ńgÿo Mǒsê gẅie à ka kẅile weg tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto wɔ́. Nyɛte tsɔ́ messé, é gwɔ́ mvfò peg ńnyɛɛ wég nzsè.
en: saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: foras forthis Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ lêen ńké ńnyɛte tútú. Á gwɔ́ pá’ mûɔ fòŋ la. Pɔ́ gwa menɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgwá’ pwɔ́’ mbwo yé. Anò seen ḿboŋo wɔ́b nà mmó gie pɔ́ lɔ̌g mbwó mɔ́b ńnyɛte tà pɔ́ jÿó línɔ́ɔn.
en: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

ngiemboon: ńgwa menɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn ka?
en: By the space offorty years in the wilderness?

ngiemboon: pi gʉa tà ńtɔ́g ngwòŋ Mbabilonia.
en: And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

ngiemboon: Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè laa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ pú’u, ńgẅiin ntàb gẅie é nyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee nùɔ pɔ́b. E Ssé zɔ la nyɛɛ Mǒsê ntí gie à ge lɔg nyɛte wɛ̌ ntàb pú’u, ńgɔɔn mbwo yé ngie à ke ńnyɛte pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à ne ńgyá é gwɔ́.
en: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.

ngiemboon: Epúɔ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè táa ńgẅiin yɔ́b wɔɔn ntàb ńdɔg ńtó tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn. Á gwɔ́ ná fʉ̀’ gie Yeshua la ne sá’a wɔ́b, e Ssé ne ńjwoŋo pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ tá pɔ́ ńnéŋe, wɛ̌ ntàb la lá’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn tà ńkúu nà fʉ̀’ gie fùɔ Ndavíd la ne sá’a lá’.
en: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la pú ńkwoŋo fùɔ Ndavíd tɛ’. Á sẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ à kwɛ́ɛ jʉ’ yé gẅie aa Ssé Yakwɔ́b.
en: who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

ngiemboon: Tá míŋ we fùɔ Salomo zɔ̌ lá’ ńcʉ́’ tá ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉ’ ná né Ssé.
en: But Solomon built him an house.

ngiemboon: Á ké tě ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie e Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie pʉ̀a mésoŋ zɔ̌ kwɛ́ wɔ́. Tsɔ̌ ntsẅì nkʉ̀ we la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,

ngiemboon: ajʉ’ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zẅɛte wó, áa wó?
en: Or whatisthe place of my rest?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔ la tè nyɛte shúm ntsèm wâ?
en: Hath not my hand made all these things?

ngiemboon: Etien la pú ḿbíte tà á ku’, á gɔɔn mbwo pàŋag ntsaŋ ngie: Pi tʉʉ twó tɛ’. Ntʉ́m gẅi pâ nkwaŋá nò gẅi gwɔ́ we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té Ssé zsé. Pi giŋé ńdʉ’ʉ nò gie Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ gɔ̌ɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo pɔ́ pá’ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pí.
en: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathersdid, sodoye.

ngiemboon: Metá pí la tè wɛ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé kʉ́e? Pɔ́ la zẅéte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la tʉ́ njÿó ne ḿbÿé ngie nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ gílé yé ge gÿo tó. A kéen ńtó, pi pɛ̂ sẅiŋe yé, ńgÿo mé zẅé yé.
en: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pi pɛ̂ pie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé la lɔg mbʉ̌ Ssé ńtó ńnáa mbwo pi, pi ké tè mǒ giŋ.
en: who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not keptit.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’ ntsaŋ la jú’ pú’u, lóŋ wɔb ffó. Pɔ́ lu ssé nzèm Etien,
en: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him withtheirteeth.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé jÿó Etien. Á pʉ’ʉ twó yé ńdíe tÿǒ lepwó, ńgyá legú’ Ssé, ńgíŋe ńgyá Yěsô, á tyé nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀.
en: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,

ngiemboon: Etien gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńgyá pá’ ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ’ɔ́ ńtyé.*Míŋ Nyìŋ tyé nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀.
en: and said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńziŋe metuŋó mɔ́b, ńga’te lê tʉ̀, ńzyɛ́’ ḿbʉle ná yé,
en: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,

ngiemboon: éshwoŋo yé, ńdɔgɔ yé fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńzye lélɔg metóon ńtémte yé. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ně sẅiŋe Etien, ně sẅɛ menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńde’e mbwo tsɔ̌ mûɔ shùm gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Sɔ̂l.
en: and casthimout of the city, and stonedhim: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man's feet, whose name was Saul.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gwaa ně lɔgɔ metóon témte Etien, á sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, azẅìge yɔ́ɔn yɛ nà mbwo mú.
en: And they stoned Stephen, calling uponGod, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅí’te ssé, ńga’te lê tʉ̀ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tè líe mmó gie pʉ̀a pɛ ne ńgÿo, ńgɔ́ɔn pú’u, ńkwé.
en: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

ngiemboon: Á la fó lyɛ̌’ ŋwɛ́, mé zye lényɛ pʉ̀a Kristo ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á Yerósalem tɛ’. Pɔ́ pú ńkÿo, ésa jʉ’ ná shÿó Jẅidea lâ Samalîɛ tà é cʉ́’ pɔ́ ndà’ megàŋ ntúm Yěsô á Yerósalem.
en: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judæa and Samaria, except the apostles.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ Ssé ka ńnéŋe pfó Etien tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, ḿbiŋ mbú ńdʉa legwé sé tɛ’.
en: And devout men carried Stephento his burial, and made great lamentation over him.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l ne ńkaga yé pɔ́ tʉ̀ lépyága cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, ńně ńkúu mendá mendá éfa’a pʉ̀a Kristo, ńgwoon mbàŋa lâ pànzwě, ńnáa mé ma’a wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ.
en: As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committedthemto prison.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ la sa jʉ’, gʉa jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńgiŋe ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô.
en: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.

ngiemboon: Filib gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ, ńkúu wó, ésá’a nò*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.

ngiemboon: Menùɔ lá’ la ne ńcwoŋo ńzẅí’te shwóŋè gie á lɔ́ɔn ńkẅɛɛ ncwò Filib. Á nue pɔ́ la ne ńjú’u mé kíme menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie à ne ńgÿo, ńgíŋe ne ńgyá tsɔ́ lê nÿɔ́g.
en: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie*messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b la ne ńzeŋe.*Messé tepòŋ gwaa ně fóo ná pɔ́b kẅɛɛ ńga’te lê tʉ̀. Megàŋa kwʉ́’te lâ pàpwɔ́’te mekwò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la ne ńzeŋe yɔ́b.
en: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessedwith them: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbú ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkága kǎg tɛ’.
en: And there was great joy in that city.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ ŋwɛ́, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Símo. À yé fà’ gwɔ́ légÿo lekàŋ. Pʉ̀a Samalîɛ gwá ńdie yé ḿmɔɔn mɔɔn. Á gwá ngie aa máa nyìŋ,
en: But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm tà fó nà ngwàshùm ńgʉa ńkúu nà mezẅìŋe pʉ̀a ne ńcʉ́me nzèm yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn ée ssé yá gie mé tóŋo le máamaa metʉ̀ la.
en: to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńcwoŋo ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yé, mélà’mie tà fó tàa lyɛ̌’, á ně ńdɔgɔ lekàŋ ńgÿo menò mie é kʉ’ʉ pʉ̀a kʉ’ʉ.
en: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

ngiemboon: Filib lêen ńké ńtó yé, ńne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô Kristo, ńne ńkyagte pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u. Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, mbàŋa pâ pànzwě zẅí’te shwóŋè yé, ńzẅíŋ, ńgÿo mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse.
en: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ Símo ŋwɛ́ jú’, ńzẅíŋ yé, mé nu’u yé ntse. À tè gíŋe fó lejʉ́ŋ Filib sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ wɔ́, ńne ńgyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn pâ ndaa gyá mie à lɔgɔ lezíŋ Ssé ńgÿo, é pú ńkʉ’ʉ yé tɛ’.
en: Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô gÿo ńnéŋe Yerósalem, ńjú’ pá’ pʉ̀a Samalîɛ zẅiŋé shwóŋè Ssé, ńtúmo Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ mbwo pɔ́b.
en: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu wó, ésẅíŋte Ssé nà twó pɛ̌ pʉ̀a Samalîɛ légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge ńnéŋe Zẅìge yé ná pɔ́b,
en: who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie a Zẅìge Ssé la nyé tè kǔ nà tsoon tà’ nyìŋ wɔb. Mé la nu’u wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse pɔ́ ndà’ ná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: (for as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ záb mbwo twó pɔ́b, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lêen ńké ńkúu ná pɔ́b.
en: Then laid theytheirhands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Símo gyá pá’ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô ne ńzába mbwo twó pʉ̀a, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a kúu ná pɔ́b, ḿbÿé wɔ́b nkáb,
en: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ pÿé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi gÿo mèŋ n ku’ yɔ́ɔn pá’ ngwɔ́ n záb mbwo twó nyìŋ, à Zẅìge Ssé kúu ná ngàŋ.
en: saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Tá Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tà pia nkáb ɔ̀ ŋwɛ́ pú ńdége, mélà’mie ɔ́ɔ pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńkwaŋa ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ lɔg nkáb, ńjúu mmó gie e Ssé náa mbwo pʉ̀a nǎ.
en: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pege teme nò wɔ́. Menò mie mé gÿo jʉ’ɔɔn, ɔ̀ tè nò mǒ gẅiin, mélà’mie ntʉ́m gú ée mvfò Ssé, é té tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́.
en: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.

ngiemboon: Ké kúbe nkwaŋá tepòŋ gẅie ée ntʉ́m gú lɛ, ésẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lege, ńnáa mbwo gù á ná pá’ ɔ́ zɔ̌ɔn ńkwaŋ pɛ́’ɛ̀ wɔ́.
en: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńgyá ngie kègɔ́’ léen ńcʉŋte ntʉ́m ɔ̀. Ɔ̀ cʉ́’ nkwɔ̀ɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, andinthe bond of iniquity.

ngiemboon: Símo tsɔ́’ ngie: Kwà’ pi zɔ sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ná twó yɔ́ɔn. À cʉa pú’u, ànò gie pi gɔɔn á le gÿo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô yɛ̌ yépʉ́a lɔgɔ lésá’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a shwóŋ pʉ̀a, ńgÿo mé zsé nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa wɛ̌, ńgwɔ piŋ nzèm né Yerósalem, ńgiŋe mánzsè ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo á tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ pà Samalîɛ.
en: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo ńtó, ńgɔɔn né Filib ngie: Lu ssé ńdɔg shÿó ntsíŋ ńgʉa, ńcwóŋo ná mánzsè gẅie à fóo Yerósalem ńgee Gaza. Mé té lwo ńcʉa wó wɔ́.
en: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.

ngiemboon: Filib gwóon ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńgiŋ tà ńkẅɛɛ nà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Etiopia, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ, mbà mé la shʉ́ʉ yé, mbà à ka gʉ̌a Yerósalem ńgu’te Ssé. À laa ŋwâlá’ twó mbúm, á lá’ manzwě gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn sá’a Etiopia. Lezíŋ lefùɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ le Kandas. Nyìŋ Etiopia ŋwɛ́ zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ḿbú ḿbyɛ́be ntaŋ fùɔ.
en: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,

ngiemboon: À la ne fóo Yerósalem ḿbiŋe, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kélêg, ńne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ntẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya.
en: was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé gɔɔn né Filib ngie: Jwoŋte kélêg wɛ.
en: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

ngiemboon: Filib jwoŋte kélêg tà ńkẅɛ́te, ńjú’ nyìŋ Etiopia ŋwɛ́ ne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya. Filib zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ tóŋo pɛ́’ɛ̀ tà ne ńjú’u mmó gie mé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn?
en: And Philip ran thither tohim, and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ ńjú’ té gwɔ́ gie nyìŋ kyagté shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn? Ńdeen ńké ńtóŋo Filib ngie à kwɔ́’ ńtó ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé tsɛ̀ɛ kélêg.
en: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

ngiemboon: ńdáŋte pɔ́ pá’ mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò gẅie mé ne ńkwóon menòŋ mé.
en: So opened he not his mouth:

ngiemboon: pá’ mé la zá’a yé zǎ’ ńzẅé.
en: For his life is taken from the earth.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ Etiopia ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te Filib ngie: Tsétsɔ́’, léen ńkyagte shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn. A*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gɔɔn nò pá’ɔɔn ná wɔ̌? À gɔɔn pɔ́ nà twó mbùm yé ka nà ye tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ?
en: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?

ngiemboon: Filib lêen ńké ńgwɔ gɔɔn nò lélɔg ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ná Yěsô, ńzye pɔ́ kwà’ ná yɔɔn jʉ’e ŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́.
en: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé la nyé ńgiŋe giŋ, ńkẅɛɛ nà tsɔ́ jʉ’, ntse gwɔ́ wó. Nyìŋ Etiopia ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né Filib ngie: Ntse wɛ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kɔ́ táte tà mé le wɔ̀ɔn ntse nu’u?
en: And as they went ontheirway, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See,here iswater; what doth hinder me to be baptized?

ngiemboon: [Filib gɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ḿbú ńzáb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná Yěsô Kristo, mbà tsɔ́ mmó té ge taté gú wɔ́. Nyìŋ Etiopia wa tsɔ́’ ngie: N zẅǐŋ ngie Yěsô Kristo aa Míŋ Ssé,]
en: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńtsẅi, mé gÿo kélêg tyé. Pɔ́ Filib pú sẅɛ́’, ńcwóŋ, ńkúu ntse. Filib lêen ńké ńnu’u yé ntse.
en: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gwɔ́ tà fó ntse ńkẅɛ, a Zẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔgɔ Filib ńgʉa tà nyìŋ Etiopia tè gíŋe ńgyá yé wɔ́, ńké ńgwɔ gíŋe cʉ́me mánzsè, ńgiŋe ńkága kǎg.
en: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná Filib, á gwɔ gyá, ńgwɔ́ Azɔ́d, éfó wó, ńgwaa kúu Sezare, ńgiŋe ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm mie à tɔgɔ́ wó.
en: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Cæsarea.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l kê ńgwɔ́ fʉ’ó, ńnyé nzèm*ngàŋa kwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńzá’a pɔ́ nkwɔ̀ɔn ngie à ge zẅéte wɔ́b, ńgʉa ńgyá Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’,
en: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,

ngiemboon: ńzɛ́te yé ngie à ŋwe’e meŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwó yé. À lɔg ńgʉa Ndamas, ńnáa mbwo pàtyé mvfò ná*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda mie ée wó. Á zɛ́te pú’u, lélɔg ńgẅiin pá’ à lɔɔn ńtóo wó, ńgyá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ná mánzsè Yěsô ŋwɛ́, ka é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa wɔ́, ka pànzwě wɔ́, á ku’u légwoonte wɔ́b, ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ́b, ńdɔg ḿbiŋ ne Yerósalem.
en: and desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè, tà mbà à gʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu Ndamas, ńgwóon ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó fó tÿǒ lepwó, ḿbú ńkyɛ’ɛ yé tɛ’.
en: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ ńgwe ssé, ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Sɔ̂l, Sɔ̂l, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́ɔn té poŋ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: and he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him,Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l zɛ́te ngie: Aa gù wɔ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a? Angàŋ tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n gee Yěsô. Ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ pá’a pɔ́ kwò yɔ́ɔn té poŋ.
en: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said,I am Jesus whom thou persecutest:it ishard for thee to kick against the pricks.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ké ńdu ssé ńgʉa le tÿǒsoŋ. Ɔ̀ ge kúu wó, mé shwóŋó gú mmó gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gyo.
en: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lordsaidunto him,Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pâ Sɔ̂l ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ, tyé, ńjú’ yɛ̌ ngyè, ńké tè nyìŋ gyá, ḿbiŋ tè ku’u légɔɔn tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l lu ssé, ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mé tá’, à tè gíŋe ńgyá jʉ’ wɔ́. Mé kíbe pwó yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa le Ndamas.
en: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and broughthiminto Damascus.

ngiemboon: Á kúu wó, ńnéŋe lyɛ̌’ tá té gyá jʉ’. À tè lǎga mmó jÿó, ńké tè ntse nú.
en: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ́ Ndamas, mé tóŋo yé le Ananias. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mé, á gyá yé, á tóŋo yé ngie: Ananias! Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision,Ananias. And he said, Behold, Iam here, Lord.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgie: Ɔ̀ ge lu ssé gʉa ná lǎŋ gie mé tóŋo le Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, é kúu ndá Jẅidas, é zɛ́te tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé le Sɔ̂l, á gwɔ́ mûɔ Tarso. Aa wó ne sẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And the Lordsaidunto him,Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas foronecalled Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,

ngiemboon: Mbà mèŋ n nyɛ̌ yé ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ge tó mé tóŋo yé le Ananias. À kúu ndá, ńzáb mbwo twó yé tá à lêen ńké ńgíŋe ńgyá jʉ’.
en: and hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and puttinghishand on him, that he might receive his sight.

ngiemboon: Ananias tsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ n zyě ńjú’ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kíme nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ gɔɔn yé lɛ. Mèŋ m bǔ ńzsé nò tepoŋ gie à ka gÿǒ nà pʉ̀a pú, á Yerósalem.
en: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:

ngiemboon: À piŋ ńgwɔ gwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɔ̌ tumó yé. Tà à gẅiin pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gwoon ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ tóŋo lezíŋ shú, ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ́b.
en: and here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn mbwó Ananias pɔ́ ngie: Gʉ̌a ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gyǎ, ńtí nue aa mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ mmó fà’. À ge gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té pà Israel wɔ́ pɔ́ zsé wɔ̀ɔn, mbɔɔ mefùɔ, tà mbɔɔ púɔ Israel.
en: But the Lord said unto him,Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ n ge zɔɔn gÿo, à pú ńzsé nzẅìŋ ngɔ́’ gie à ge gyá é tí nò yɔ́ɔn.
en: for I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Ananias lêen ńké ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá ŋwɛ́, ńzáb mbwo twó Sɔ̂l, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Afɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn, Sɔ̂l, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô zɔ tumó wɔ̀ɔn. Á Yěsô gẅie à ka nyɛ mbùm yé mbwo gù á fʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ kaa mánzsè ne ńtóo lê jʉ’ɔɔn la. À tumó wɔ̀ɔn ngie n gʉa ńgÿo ɔ̀ gíŋe ńgyá jʉ’. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó gú.
en: And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord,evenJesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Ncwò gwɔ́ cʉ́me ssé, atsɔ́ mmó lêen fó menÿɔ́g yé ńgwete ńgwá’a mega’á ssó la. Á gíŋ ńzye légyá jʉ’, ńdeen ńké ńdu ssé, mé nu’u yé ntse.
