en: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l ńnéŋe Ndamas tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ melyɛ̌’, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ gwɔ, mbà à ka tè zẅí’te tá ńzye légwá ńkú mendá mecú’tè pà Yuda mie ée wó, ńne sá’a ngie Yěsô aa Míŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ jú’ pá’ à gɔɔn, ḿmɔɔn tɛ’. Mé ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌, à tè nyìŋ gwá gẅie à kaa Yerósalem ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ̀ ne sẅiŋte Ssé, ńtoŋo lezíŋ Yěsô, gyá ngɔ́’ wɔ́ le? À ka tè tóo jʉ’ɔɔn légwoon wɔ́b, ńkwɛ́, ńgʉa náa mbwo metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́ le?
en: But all that heardhimwere amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l ké ńnyɛte ńgɔɔn nò pɔ́ tè pɔ́g. Ńcwoŋo ńda’te mbwo pà Yuda pie pɔ́ ée Ndamas ngie Yěsô aa*Nzà’nkÿo, ńgÿo pú’u, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńzsé tsɔ́ nò gie pɔ́ ge gɔɔn mbwo yé wɔ́.
en: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.

ngiemboon: É cʉa tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ lyɛ̌’, pà Yuda ŋwɛ́ zába légÿo mé zẅé Sɔ̂l,
en: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

ngiemboon: ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿbyɛ́bɛ metwó nzsè mie mé pfó mǒ tá fóo tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ḿbyɛ́bɛ tsẅɛ́’, ḿbyɛ́bɛ zsǒ. Légwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńcʉa mé zẅé yé. Tá Sɔ̂l vɔg ńzsé.
en: but their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ lêtsẅɛ́’, ńnéŋe yé tsɛ̀ɛ mâ kèkàg, éfó nà ndùm nká’ gẅie mé la lɔg ńkéle tÿǒsoŋ, ńdɔgɔ kèkàg ésẅí’i yé, ńtÿɔ́gɔ ná yetsɔ̌ nzèm á gʉa.
en: Then the disciples took him by night, and lethimdown by the wall in a basket.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l gʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, éfa’ shÿó lékúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ pʉ̀a Kristo. Tá mânyìŋ ntsèm ne ḿbɔ́gɔ yé pɔ́g, ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ pú tè ne ńzẅíŋe ngie Sɔ̂l kěen ńcʉ́’ʉ kwà’*ngàŋa kwò Kristo wɔ́.
en: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tà Panebâse lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa, ńtó ńnyɛɛ yé mbwo ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô, ńtóo ńnyɛ̌ yé, ḿbíte shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie Sɔ̂l ka gyǎ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô á mánzsè Ndamas, tà kwà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a yé máŋwɛ́ gɔɔn nò mbwo yé, ńgíŋ shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ Sɔ̂l ka lɔg lezíŋ Yěsô ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo á Ndamas té pɔ́g.
en: But Barnabas took him, and broughthimto the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉ’ó, Sɔ̂l kú yé nùɔ ngàŋ ntúm. Pâ pɔ̌ zɔ̌ cʉ́’ʉ ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem. Sɔ̂l ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo té pɔ́g,
en: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: ńgyá pà Yuda pie pɔ́ shwóŋe Gelekia, pâ pɔ̌ zoŋo nò mǒ zoŋ tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ fa’a shÿó pɔ́ lézẅé yé.
en: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ gwɔ́ tà ńzsé pú’u, ńdɔgɔ Sɔ̂l ńgʉa Sezare, ńtsege, ńkúu wó ńgÿo á lɔg ye Tarso ńgʉa.
en: Whichwhen the brethren knew, they brought him down to Cæsarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, à cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ sẅéte. Mé té gíŋe ńgege wɔ́b nà pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea tà mbɔɔ Samalîɛ. Pɔ́b metsèm ne ńtóonte mennɛ́ mɔ́b, ńkẅi’i ńtʉte, ńne ńjú’u ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. A Zẅìge Ssé piŋ ně ńkẅéte wɔ́b, ḿbiŋe ńgÿo e nùɔ wɔ́b kẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judæa and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ne ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgʉa mbʉ̀a pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ tsẅé Lida,
en: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout allquarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, mé tóŋo yé le Enée. Mbà à nuŋé kǔ guɔ ngù’ lefɔ̌ɔn, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te.
en: And there he found a certain man named Æneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ńgie: Enée, Yěsô Kristo gÿǒ ɔ̀ zeŋe. Lu ssé, kwà’ gù zɔ cwoŋte kǔ ɔ́. Enée gwóon ńdu ssé.
en: And Peter said unto him, Æneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie é tsẅé Lida, tà mbɔɔ pàtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ fú’u Saron, pú ńgyá yé, mbà à zeŋé, pɔ́ cʉ́’ yɔ́b pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mánzwě gwɔ́ Jope, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lé Tapita, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie nɔ̀ɔn ngáb. Á gwɔ́, mbà à la zẅíŋe nò Yěsô, ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, ḿbiŋe ńkẅéte pàte mmó.
en: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ guɔ gwoon yé, nà melyɛ̌’ ámɛ̌, á kwé. Mé sɔgɔ pfó yé, ńkaa ńkwɔ́’ɔ ná ndêg we tÿǒ, ńnuŋe wó.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laidherin an upper chamber.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo jú’ ngie Piɛ aa Lida, pá’ ngʉ̀a léfó Lida ńkúu Jope piŋ ńké tè sag la, pʉ̀a Kristo pe Jope túm mbàŋa yépʉ́a. Pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn né Piɛ ngie: Tsétsɔ’, sẅɛte ńtó tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a peg.
en: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiringhimthat he would not delay to come to them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńjú’, pâ pɔ̌ cʉ́me mánzsè té láte, ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ lûm ndá gẅie aa ná ndêg we tÿǒ. Á kúu tsoló, mepfɔ̌g pànzwě metsèm tó ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńdʉa, ńne ḿma’a mezìŋe ńnyɛɛ yé menzsǒ mie Tapita ka nyé ntentʉ́, ńtém ńná lé pɔ́b.
en: Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ fóo ndá ńkẅile pʉ̀a metsèm, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbiŋ sele nnɛ́ ńdíe mpfó, ńgɔɔn ngie: Tapita, lu ssé. Tapita lêen ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá Piɛ, ńdeen ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńnéŋe ńnéŋe.
en: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turninghimto the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

ngiemboon: Piɛ kíbe pwó yé, ńgÿo á lu ssé. Á leen ńké ńtóŋ pʉ̀a Kristo lâ mepfɔ̌g, ńnyɛɛ Tapita mbwo pɔ́b, á gwɔ́ ntentʉ́.
en: And he gave herhishand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ pʉ̀a pie é laa Jope, jú’u yɔɔn nò gie á cʉatě, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn záb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ná’a ńtsẅé Jope, ńne ńnéŋe ndá tsɔ̌ Símo gẅie aa ngàŋ levfò ná lelɔ́ɔn*mengùb menɔ̀ɔn.
en: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ Sezare, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Kornɛy, á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ tándá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pà*Roma, ésá’a pʉ̀a nkÿo. Mé tóŋo yɛ̌ nùɔ lê nùɔ ye Italia.
en: There was a certain man in Cæsarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italianband,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ, pâ ngẅɛ̀ yé ntsèm pú ńgÿo mekù’ Ssé pà Yuda, ńjú’u ncwò wé. Á piŋ ńkẅéte pà Yuda pie ée mepóŋ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńnéŋe sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: adevoutman, and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ lyɛ̌’, á nà mmó nèm tá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó, e Ssé nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mé. Á gyá tsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tó ńtsɛ́ɛ yé ndá, ńtóŋo yé ngie: Kornɛy!
en: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.

ngiemboon: Á pʉ’ʉ twó yé, ńdíe*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńne ḿbɔ́gɔ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Áa kɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a?*Cÿɔ́’ Ssé tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: E Ssé jǔ’ pá’ ɔ̀ zɔgɔ lésẅíŋte yé, ńgíŋ ńgyá mbɔɔ mmó gie ɔ̀ ne ńgÿo ná mepóŋ ńdɔgɔ ńkẅéte wɔ́b. E Ssé kaa gú lege.
en: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn lá, túm pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa Jope, éfa’a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Símo. Setsɔ́ lezíŋ sé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ lê Piɛ.
en: And now send men to Joppa, and call foroneSimon, whose surname is Peter:

ngiemboon: À neŋé ndá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ. Esé lezíŋ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ lê Símo. Angàŋ fa’a ná*mengùb menɔ̀ɔn, e ye ndá gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa.
en: he lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé tsẅii nò mbwo yé tà ńgʉa, Kornɛy cʉ́’ ńtóŋ megàŋa fà’ pé mépʉ́a, ńgÿo tà’ ndÿɔ́’ ncù. Á gwɔ́ gẅie pɔ́ yé zyě ńtsẅé. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgÿo yé mekù’ Ssé.
en: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;

ngiemboon: Kornɛy tóŋo wɔ́b pú’u, ńdeen ńké ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á cʉ̌a, éshwóŋó wɔ́b, tá ńtúmo wɔ́b Jope.
en: and when he had declared allthesethings unto them, he sent them to Joppa.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, pɔ́ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè, á gwɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ, tà mbà pɔ́ gʉ̌a tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋo Jope. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Piɛ kwɔ’ɔ́ nà jʉ’ gie áa ntsɔ̀’ ndá, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ tetʉ́a la lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:

ngiemboon: Nzyè zye légyáŋa yé, á tsɔ́ɔn léjÿó mmó. Mé gwaa gwɔ ne ńcwoŋte shúm sie à ge jÿó, e Ssé nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mé á gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie á fóo mbwo yé Ssé,
en: and he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,

ngiemboon: ńgyá ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé, atsɔ́ mmó fó wó sẅɛ́’, ńne ńtóo lê ssé, ńgwɔ́ pá’ máamáa pwó nzsǒ gie mé ku’tě nà mezẅé lekùa la.
en: and saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:

ngiemboon: Ntí ntí menɔ̀ɔn pú ńgwɔ́ tsoló. Menɔ́ɔn mekwo lekùa, menɔ̀ɔn pie pɔ́ shwóŋó lepfòm sɔ́b pɔ́ ssé, ńgÿo meshʉ́ŋ
en: wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

ngiemboon: Ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Piɛ, lu ssé, ńzẅé ḿpfɛ́.
en: And there came a voice to him,Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ngǎŋ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Mèŋ n daa zɔɔn ńjÿó mmó gie*lepʉ̌ tɔ’ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tè pfɛ́ɛ mmó nzse wɔ́.
en: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, é gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ammó lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà Ssé kẅile*lɔ̌’, tè gíŋe ńzse nzse mǒ.
en: And the voicespakeunto him again the second time,What God hath cleansed,thatcall not thou common.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńjú’ pɔ́ pú’u, tà é gwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá. Mé lêen ńké ńgwóon ńdɔgɔ yɛ̌ mmó ḿbiŋ ne tÿǒ lepwó.
en: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.

ngiemboon: Piɛ cʉ́’ ńkwaŋ á cʉa yé. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie: Ammó gie n du ssé légyá, aa pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a pie Kornɛy ně ńtúmo wɔ́b, gwǎ ńzɛ́te ngie: Ndá Símo ee nzɔ̌? Tà ńgwɔ́ fʉ’ó ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò ndá,
en: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon's house, and stood before the gate,

ngiemboon: ńtóŋ ńzɛ́te ngie: Símo gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Piɛ tsẅé jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: and called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ Piɛ ké nyé ńkwaŋte pɔ́ nò gie à fóo légyá. A Zẅìge Ssé shwóŋó yé ngie: Pʉ̀a métá ée jʉ’ɔɔn ne fa’a gú.
en: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

ngiemboon: Lu ssé, ésẅɛ́’, pia pɔ̌ gʉa. Tè zoŋ á nue mèŋ n zɔ tumó wɔ́b.
en: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ sẅɛ́’ ńkẅɛ́te pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ne fa’a nyìŋ! Àa wɔ̀ɔn. Pi tóo mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: whatisthe cause wherefore ye are come?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn lé yé ngie: Kornɛy zɔ tumó weg, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tándà ncù pà*Roma, ésá’a pʉ̀a nkÿo. Àa nyìŋ, ńgÿó mmó gie Ssé kwoŋ, ḿbɔ́g Ssé. Pà Yuda metsèm kíme yé pɔ́ mbòŋ. Tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ka tǒ ńgɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Túmo mé gʉa tóŋo Piɛ, à tóo ndá gù, ɔ̀ zẅí’te nò gie à ge shwóŋó gú.
en: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Piɛ pâ pʉ̀a pá métá cʉ́me mánzsè. Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pe Jope gʉa ńtsege wɔ́b.
en: Then called he them in, and lodgedthem. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’ tɔ́g, pɔ́ gwaa kúu Sezare, mbà Kornɛy ně ḿbú ńcú’te ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé tà mbɔɔ meshǔ ntʉ́m pé ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te Piɛ.
en: And the morrow after they entered into Cæsarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tó tà ńgwɔ́ ńkúu ndá, Kornɛy tó ńzá’a yé, ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ńgÿo mekù’ mé.
en: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshippedhim.

ngiemboon: Tá Piɛ pʉ’ʉ yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Lu ssé, mèŋ n gee yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ gù.
en: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé gwaa zyɛ́’ kúu ndá, ńgiŋe shwóŋe. Piɛ gyá, mbà pʉ̀a pǔ ńcú’te ndá tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn.
en: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ne ńzsé gí ngie*lepʉ̌ pà Yuda tɔ’ɔ nyìŋ wɔb légwɔ́ shǔ nyìŋ lá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Tà ḿbʉ́ mbɔɔ yé lékúu ndá yé. Tá’, e Ssé ka nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn tsɔ́ mmó. À ka nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n te gẅiin lékʉ́e tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ngie à gẅiin*lɔ̌’ tà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n dÿɔ́’te yé wɔ́.
en: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ, mèŋ n deen ńdu ssé té zoŋ, pá’ pi tǔm ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn. Afʉ̀’ɔɔn lá, pi gÿo mèŋ n zsé mmó gie pi toŋó wɔ̀ɔn jʉ’ɔɔn ńtí yɛ̌.
en: Therefore came Iunto youwithout gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?

ngiemboon: Kornɛy tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Piɛ ngie: Ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá, pá’ á laa ná nèm tá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó pá’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn, mèŋ n gwɔ́ ndá mèŋ ne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńgwaa gyá atsɔ̌ nyíŋ vege vege ńkẅɛ ńtyé mvfò mèŋ, ḿma’ menzsǒ é ne ńŋwʉŋe ŋwʉŋe,
en: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Kornɛy, e Ssé ju’ú sẅíŋte jú. À kaa lege shúm sie ɔ̀ náa mbwo mepóŋ ńdɔgɔ ńkẅéte wɔ́b la wɔ́.
en: and said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

ngiemboon: Túm pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gʉa Jope, ńgÿo Símo gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Piɛ tó. À tsẅe ndá Símo gẅie yé fà’ aa lényɛte megùb menɔ̀ɔn, ndá ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa.
en: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house ofoneSimon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.

ngiemboon: À ka gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, n gwóon ńtúm pʉ̀a fǎ’ gù. Ɔ̀ gÿǒ mboŋó pá’ ɔ̀ tǒ lɛ. Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, pege metsèm tyé mvfò Ssé. Peg tyě pá’ɔɔn, mbà peg taŋté mbùm yeg lé jú’u nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cʉmé mbwo gù ngie ɔ̀ shwóŋó wég.
en: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n děen ńké ńgyá, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie e Ssé tè tyɛ’te pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: Then Peter openedhismouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mekù’ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ yɛ̌ lá’ gwɔ́, mbà nò yé ge poŋ Ssé poŋ.
en: but in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka túmo shwóŋè yé mbwo púɔ Israel. E gwɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, ńgɔɔn nò na mbʉ́lè gie mé cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pʉ̀a metsèm, ńgẅiin.
en: The word whichGodsent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn nkʉ̀ ŋwɛ́ ka pɔ́ɔnte nò gie Jâŋ la gwɔ́ nu’ pʉ̀a ntse, ńne ńgɔɔn. Pi ne ńzsé ngie yɔɔn nò ka zye Galilea, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa ḿbú sa jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ Jẅidea ntsèm.
en: that word,I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judæa, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ne ńzsé ngie e Ssé la ná metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńzɔ́’ɔ yé, ḿbiŋ ne ńtÿɔ́’te yé. Á gʉa jʉ’ ntsèm, ńne ńgÿo menò mbòŋo, ńne ńkẅé pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ laa megàŋa tsǎŋ nà mbwó Sátà.
en: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

ngiemboon: Peg pɔɔn tyě pá’ɔɔn, mbà peg ka lɔg nÿɔ́g még, ḿbú ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ka gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a pà Yuda mbàa Yerósalem. Mé ka gwɔ zẅé yé, ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:

ngiemboon: Tá’, á kaa nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá, e Ssé zíme yé nà legwé, ńgÿo á kẅɛ ńnyɛ mbùm ye.
en: him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;

ngiemboon: À ka tè nyɛɛ mbwo lá’a ntsèm wɔ́, à ka nyɛ pɔ́ mbwo peg pàjÿó ńgyá pie Ssé la vɔg ńtsɔ́’. À ka zimé nà legwé pú’u, pega pɔ́ jÿó shúm ḿbiŋ ńnú.
en: not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God,evento us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.

ngiemboon: À ka piŋ ńtúmo wég ngie peg gʉa ńtsẅi nkù mbòŋo mbwo lá’, ńgÿo pɔ́ zsé ngie yé Yěsô ŋwɛ́ aa nyìŋ gẅie Ssé ka tsɔ̌’ ngie à zá’ ntsaŋ pʉ̀a metʉ̀ pâ mepfó ssé.
en: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of Godto bethe Judge of quick and dead.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé metsèm lɔ́ɔn ńda’te, pá’ pɔ́ la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná yé wɔ́, e Ssé ge lege menò tepòŋ ngàŋ é náa mbwó yé, é tí yé.
en: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.

ngiemboon: Piɛ nyé ńgɔɔn nò gɔɔn, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’, ńkúu nà ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ ne ńzẅí’te nò gie à ne ńgɔɔn.
en: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ ně ńtó ńtsege Piɛ, é laa pà Yuda. Pɔ́ gyá yɔɔn nò, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’, pá’ e Ssé nǎ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ à la náa mbwó pɔ́b yɔ́b!
en: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔɔn ńgíŋe ne ńjú’u pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè lá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ ńnáa mekù’ mbwo Ssé. Piɛ gyá pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie:
en: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn gie pɔ́ ně ńdá’ ńkẅé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pá’ peg la, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gíŋe ńtɔ́’ɔ lénu’u wɔ́b ntse lá?
en: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtsẅi ngie mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse ná lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo. Pɔ́ métsèm gÿo ńzɛ́te yé ngie pɔ́ laa pɔ̌ gíŋe ńná’a ńnéŋe tsɔ́ mbɔ́ melyɛ̌’.
en: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, pâ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée Jẅidea lêen ńjú’ mé ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ kéen ńzẅíŋ yɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judæa heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée pà Yuda zye léŋaga yé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka kúu ndá pʉ̀a pie mé la té wɔ́b pú’ tà pia pɔ̌ fó ńjÿó mbɔɔ shúm léjÿó.
en: saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńké ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie á ka cʉa, éshwóŋó wɔ́b tà fó nzyète, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But Peter rehearsedthe matterfrom the beginning, and expoundeditby order unto them, saying,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kaa tÿǒsoŋo Jope, ńne sẅíŋte Ssé, e Ssé nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gyá nkʉ̀’ʉ nò, n gyá tsɔ́ mmó yá, á gwɔ́ pá’ máamáa pwó nzsǒ gie mé kú’te nà mezẅé lekùa la, á fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’ ńtó ńcʉ́ŋe mvfò mèŋ.
en: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n nyɛte ńdíe mmó gie aa tsoló, ńgyá menɔ̀ɔn pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńgẅiin mekwò lekùa gwɔ́ tsoló, ńgyá menɔ̀ɔn mbà’ gwɔ́ tsoló, ńgyá mbɔɔ pie pɔ́ shwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b pɔ́ ssé, mbɔɔ meshʉ́ŋ.
en: upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

ngiemboon: N deen ńjú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Piɛ, lu ssé, ńzẅé, ḿpfɛ́!
en: And I heard a voice saying unto me,Arise, Peter; slay and eat.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsɔ́’ ngie: Ngǎŋ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Ammó gie*lepʉ̌ tɔ’, kà pɔ́ ye nzse wɔ́, a laa ncwò wɔ̀ɔn zyɛ́’ɛ
en: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè ŋwɛ́ nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, é gɔɔn ngie: Ammó lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà Ssé kẅile*lɔ̌’ mǒ tè gíŋe ńzse nzse mǒ,
en: But the voice answered me again from heaven,What God hath cleansed,thatcall not thou common.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà é gwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá. Eshúm ŋwɛ́ pú ńkwɔ́’ ńgee tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, pʉ̀a métá tóo ndá jʉ’ gie peg kaa wó. Mbà mé fǒ Sezare ńtúmo wɔ́b né mèŋ.
en: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Cæsarea unto me.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Lu ssé pia pɔ́ gʉa, tè zoŋ. Epʉ̀a ntɔgɔ́ pɔɔn pie n dɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn, la gʉa ńtsege wɔ̀ɔn Sezare. Pega pɔ́ púte ńkúu ndá Kornɛy.
en: And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house:

ngiemboon: Kornɛy lêen ńké ḿbíte shwóŋó wég ngie: Yé ně ḿvege ńgyá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tyé mvfò yé, à tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yé, ńtsẅi né yé ngie, túm pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa Jope, ńtsẅi, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie aa wó, mé tóŋo yé lê Símo, ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé lè Piɛ à tó.
en: and he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;

ngiemboon: À ge tó shwóŋó gú menò mie e Ssé ge cʉa mǒ gÿo pia ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù tsẅɛ́.
en: who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tó, ńdeen ńké ńzye légɔɔn nò mbwo wɔ́ba pʉ̀a pie mèŋ n gwǎ tó, pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndá, ńnyé ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pɔ́b gɔɔn, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’ ńkúu ná pɔ́b ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ á la kúu ná pege, á nzyetě la.
en: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.

ngiemboon: N deen ńké ńkímte shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pá’ à la gɔɔn ngie: Jâŋ la nu’ pʉ̀a ntse, tá ńgʉa ná pi, mbà Ssé ge gÿo ńnéŋe gẅi mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said,John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: E Ssé lɔgɔ pú’u, ńnáa yɔ́b mmó gie pege la záb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo, á náa mbwo pege la. Mèŋ, n kaa yɔ́ɔn wɔ̌, tà ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ n tɔ’ Ssé légÿo mmó?
en: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift ashe didunto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Kristo jú’ menò mɔɔn, ḿbʉ́le ńnéŋe, ḿbiŋ ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: À yɔɔn gie e Ssé ka ná shÿó mbɔɔ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, á lékúbe mà, á gÿó pɔ́ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.

ngiemboon: À gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé la gwɔ́ tà ńzẅé Etien pá’a, ńzye létsɔ́’ɔ kwò pʉ̀a Kristo té pòŋ. Pɔ́ fó Yerósalem ńkẅɛ sa jʉ’. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔg ye Fenisia. Petsɔ́ lɔg ye Shʉ̀pele. Petsɔ́ lɔg ye Antiokia, ńkúu nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, éshwóŋó nò Ssé pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo pà Yuda.
en: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.

ngiemboon: Tá’, etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Kristo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pie é laa pʉ̀a Sirɛne, mbɔɔ pe Shʉ̀pele, gʉa tà ńkúu Antiokia yɔ́b, éshwóŋó nò Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô mbɔɔ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńtóonte wɔ́b tóonte, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, ńne sele ńcʉ́’ʉ pʉ̀a pé.
en: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò gwe letuŋó pʉ̀a cú’tè Kristo gie áa Yerósalem. Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ Panebâse, ńtúmo yé Antiokia.
en: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá yé pá’ Ssé ne ńdíe pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé pú’u, ànò poŋo yé tɛ’. Á kẅiŋte wɔ́b métsèm, ngie pɔ́ ké ńzsé pɔ́ ndà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńcʉŋe pɔ́ ná yé.
en: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Panebâse ŋwɛ́ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgẅiin tsẅé mbòŋo. Mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a léen ńjÿó yé. Á piŋ ńzáb ntʉ́m wé ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛ’. Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn fó mbɔɔ ná ye ntí, ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Panebâse piŋ ńgʉa Tarso, léfa’a Sɔ̂l,
en: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńgyá yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ḿbiŋ lê Antiokia. Pɔ́ mépʉ́a pâ pʉ̀a Kristo pú ńnéŋe Antiokia ná tà’ ngù’u lá’. Pɔ́ ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mmó. Mé la zye pɔ́ Antiokia ŋwɛ́ létóŋ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô lê Pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, epʉ̀a fó lyɛ̌’, éfóo Yerósalem ńtóo Antiokia, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mé tóŋo yé lê Agabus. A Zẅìge Ssé tsẅi, á tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ máamáa gwáŋa ge gwe ndùmo tsetsá’ ntsèm, ńgɔɔn pú’u, wɛ̌ gwáŋa gÿo ńkwa’ ńgwe fʉ̀’ gie Kɔlɔde laa Kása pà Roma.
en: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Cæsar.

ngiemboon: Agabus gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, epʉ̀a Kristo záb ngie awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ náa yé mmó gie à ku’u mǒ, mé túm, ńdɔg ńkẅéte mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pɔ́ tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea.
en: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judæa:

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ mwoonte pɔ̀ɔn yé. Mé cú’tè, ńnáa mbwo Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l. Pɔ́ lɔg ńgʉa lénáa mbwo pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, fùɔ*Herôd zye létsɔ́’ɔ kwò tsɔ́ ngàŋa cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo té pòŋ,
en: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forthhishands to vex certain of the church.

ngiemboon: ńtúm mé gʉa ńdɔg nně ncù ńzẅé Jâg gẅie aa fɛ́ Jâŋ.
en: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.

ngiemboon: Á gyá, mbà à gÿǒ pú’u, á poŋ pà Yuda. Á lêen ńké ńgíŋ ńgÿo mé gwoon Piɛ yé, ńgwaa gwoon yé pú’u, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn*mbelég té mvòŋ.
en: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)

ngiemboon: *Herôd tsẅi mé gwoon Piɛ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńjÿɔ́’ɔ ndá tsǎŋ. Á táŋte pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lekùa lekùa ngʉ̀a lekùa ńtÿɔ́gte ngie pɔ́ ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ yé, ńne ńzẅí’te pá’ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà ge cʉa, à tÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò lá’, mé ŋaga yé.
en: And when he had apprehended him, he puthimin prison, and deliveredhimto four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿɔ́’ɔ Piɛ ndá tsǎŋ pú’u, acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé nà twó yé té kʉ́a.
en: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó, ge lʉ́a, fùɔ*Herôd gÿo mé tÿɔ́gɔ Piɛ mvfò lá’, mé ŋaga yé. Piɛ gwɔ́ lêtsẅɛ́’, ńnuŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù mémbʉ́a, ńne ńdyé. Mbà mé lɔ̌g mentsɛ̂n mémbʉ́a ńcʉŋe yé. Pàpyɛ́b jʉ’ gwɔ́ ncwò ndá, lépyɛ́bɛ yé.
en: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a vege vege ńkẅɛɛ jʉ’ gie Piɛ aa wó, ejʉ’ pú ńkyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá.*Cÿɔ́’ Ssé pú’te gwǒŋo nnɛ́ Piɛ, ńzyeen yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé lê tʉ̀! Mentsɛ̂n lêen ńké fó nà mbwó mé ńkyɛ́’te ḿbʉle ssé.
en: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came uponhim, and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off fromhishands.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tʉ́m nzsǒ jù, ńjÿɔ́g melɔ̌ɔn mú. Piɛ gÿo pú’u.*Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ma’ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g jù, ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.

ngiemboon: Piɛ fó ndà tsǎŋ ńkẅɛ, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé. À tè ne ńzsé ngie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé kwǎ’ ńtó ńkẅéte yé wɔ́, ńkwaŋ ngie Ssé nyɛ̌’ pɔ́ nÿɔ́g mé tá á gyá mɛ̌ menò.
en: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé lɔgɔ Piɛ ńtɔ́gɔ mvfò mvɔg mvfò nùɔ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, ńgíŋe ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńtɔ́gɔ mvfò yetsɔ́ nùɔ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ncwò ndá gẅie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńnyɛte, mé fóo jʉ’ó ńkẅɛɛ ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ. Ncwò ndá tsɔ́’ɔ gílé yé, á mvfò pɔ́b, pɔ́ lêen ńkẅɛ, ńcʉ́me láŋ tà ńná’a ńzye ńgiŋ,*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gwóon ńnyé Piɛ, ńgʉa.
en: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.

ngiemboon: Legyè sé lêen ńké ńtó. Á gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n děen ńké ńcwoŋo ńgyá mboŋó fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie áa nò, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tumó cÿɔ́’ we, á tó ńkẅé wɔ̀ɔn mbwo fùɔ*Herôd. À giŋé ńkẅé wɔ̀ɔn nà nò tepòŋ ntsèm gie pà Yuda ka ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie á gÿo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, andfromall the expectation of the people of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Piɛ kwaŋte, ńgʉa ne ndá Malîɛ, má pà Jâŋ gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Malékuse. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a Kristo cu’té tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne sẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And when he had consideredthe thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.

ngiemboon: Á kwá’te ncwò nká’, atsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ we mánzwě, mé tóŋo yé lê Rode, á tóo létsɔ́’,
en: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.

ngiemboon: ńjú’ ngyè Piɛ, ńdiŋ. Á poŋo yé poŋ tà á lege létsɔ́’ ncwò nká’, ńkÿote ḿbiŋe ndá ńtsẅii mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, ngie: Piɛ wɛ̂ ncwò nká’!
en: And when she knew Peter's voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ pʉ̀a! Á gɔɔn ngie n gɔɔn shwóŋó nò. À wɛ̂ ncwò nká’. Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ndyɛ̀’, mbà à gwɔ́ pɔ́*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie aa ḿbyɛ́bɛ yé.
en: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ké ńkwá’te ncwò nká’ kwá’te tà pɔ́ tsɔ́’, ńgyá á gwɔ́ yé, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had openedthe door, and saw him, they were astonished.

ngiemboon: Piɛ myɛ’te pwó ńdɔg ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ láŋte. Pɔ́ láŋte, á zye lépíte shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńgÿo tá á kẅɛɛ ndá tsǎŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ńtsẅii yɔɔn nò, á mbwo Jâg mbɔɔ mbwo petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa lê jʉ’e ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, ejʉ’ pú ńnʉ’ʉ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù. Pɔ́ té zsé mmó gie Piɛ ně ńcʉ́’ʉ yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd tsẅi mé fa’a yé jʉ’ ntsèm, mé té yé gyá. Á zɛ́te menò mbwo pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie pɔ́ ké ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ Piɛ, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅi ngie mé zẅéte wɔ́b.*Herôd gÿo pú’u, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ne Sezare, ńkúu wó, ńná’a ńzye ńnéŋe.
en: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded thattheyshould be put to death. And he went down from Judæa to Cæsarea, andthereabode.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd ne ḿbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ nà pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ Tyr pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ Sidoŋ pá’ɔɔn tɛ’. Pɔ́ cú’te ńgwɔ́ tà’ ncwò légʉa ńgyá yé. Á cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ kwɛ́ɛ pwó Mbelatus, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie yé zɔ pyɛ́bɛ ndá fùɔ, pá’ à ge gíŋ kěm wɔ́b ná, acÿɔ́g gie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́ba fùɔ mag, ńtsɔ́ɔn pú’u, á nue ammó léjÿó gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńjÿó tÿǒsoŋ Tyr pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ Sidoŋ, á lɔ́ɔn fóo pɔ́ lá’ fùɔ*Herôd.
en: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king's chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king'scountry.

ngiemboon: Mé táŋa lyɛ̌’, afùɔ*Herôd ma’ nzsǒ lefùɔ ye, ńtó ńnéŋe nà lʉ̀ŋe lefùɔ yé, ńne ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pɔ́b,
en: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.

ngiemboon: alá’ ne ḿbú ńnáa gugẅî, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ těen ńgɔɔn nò pɛ́’ɛ̀ wɔ́, e gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ ssé.
en: And the people gave a shout,saying, It isthe voice of a god, and not of a man.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwóon ńtyé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, ḿma’a guɔ ná fùɔ*Herôd, mélà’mie à kǎŋ mekù’ mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ me Ssé, ńdɔg ńgÿo mé. Mengingi lú’te yé á kwé.
en: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Á ke ńgʉa nà shwóŋè Ssé, á ne ńkẅi’i saa jʉ’ ńgee pɔ́ nê mvfò.
en: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

ngiemboon: Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l gwɔ́ tà ḿmaga yɔ́b fà’ gie mé ně ńtúmo wɔ́b mǒ Yerósalem, ńgwɔ́ piŋe Antiokia ńdɔgɔ Jâŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Malékuse ńgʉa.
en: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilledtheirministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie á laa tÿǒsoŋo Antiokia, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé gwɔ́ wó, ńgÿo pàzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé. Wɔɔn laa Panebâse, ńgÿó Simeon gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê «ssé nyìŋ», ńgÿo Lusius, á mûɔ Sirɛne, ńgÿo Manaen gẅie pɔ́*Herôd gẅie à laa ngúmnɔ́ɔn la pú ńgú’, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo Sɔ̂l.
en: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ne*ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi faga Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l, ńnyé wɔ́b, pɔ́ fa’a fà’ gie mèŋ n ka tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńtí yɛ̌.
en: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ɔɔn, ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńdeen ńké ńzáb mbwó twó pɔ́b, ńnyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laidtheirhands on them, they sentthemaway.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a túmo Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l pú’u, pɔ́ gʉa lê Selesi. Efó wó ńkúu kanú’ légʉa lê Shʉ̀pele, é gwɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe sòŋ.
en: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńkẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ á tÿǒsoŋo Salamine, ńne shwóŋó nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda. Pâ Jâŋ Malékuse gwɔ́, á ne ńkẅéte wɔ́b.
en: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John totheirminister.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gÿo fó wó ńzyɛ́’ tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Pafos, ńkúu wó ḿbumte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ pà Yuda, mé tóŋo yé lê Mbar Yěsô. Á gwɔ́ ngàŋ lekàŋ, ńzɔ́gɔ shwóŋó pʉ̀a ngie yé aa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose namewasBar-jesus:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a pie ée lejʉ́ŋ ngúmnɔ́ɔn Serguis Pɔlos. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgẅiin legyè tɛ’. Á tsẅi mé gʉa ńtóŋo Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l ńná né yé, mélà’mie à la ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lé jú’u nò Ssé.
en: which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.

ngiemboon: Tá à ngàŋ lekàŋ wa, gẅie lezíŋ sé lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Elimas ná shwóŋè Gelekia la, ne ḿbʉa Panebâse pɔ́ Sɔ̂l, ńne fa’a létáte tà ngúmnɔ́ɔn le záb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô wɔ́.
en: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó Sɔ̂l, gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Pɔl la. Á lêen ńké ńdíe Elimas,
en: Then Saul, (who alsois calledPaul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mûɔ Sáta, ɔ́ɔ ngàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò. Ɔ̀ zsě pɔ́ léfʉte pʉ̀a. Ɔ̀ɔ ngàŋ mbù nò mbòŋo ntsèm, kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ssé gÿo á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, ɔ̀ lěen ńké ńtɔ́ɔn, ńŋwɔ́’te. Tà ɔ̀ te nyé wɛ nzẅìŋ pɛ́’ɛ̀ wɔ́?
en: and said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief,thouchild of the devil,thouenemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

ngiemboon: Ké ńjú’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé zabá pwó yé ná gù. Ɔ̀ ge fʉ̀ tà à ná’a ńnéŋe, ɔ́ le gíŋe lejÿɔ́g nèm ńgyá wɔ́, ńdeen ńgɔɔn pú’u, nÿɔ́g Elimas síŋ. Á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, ńzye lésele ńkéle jʉ’ó, éfa’a nyìŋ gẅie à ge kíbe pwó yé.
en: And now, behold, the hand of the Lordisupon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.

ngiemboon: Angúmnɔ́ɔn gyá mmó gie á cʉ̌a, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gie mé shwoŋó yé, á kuté yé tɛ’.
en: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pâ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ laa nùɔ, kúu kanú’ á tÿǒsoŋo Pafos, ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Pɛrge gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Panfilia. Jâŋ Malékuse gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńnyé wɔ́b ḿbiŋ nê Yerósalem.
en: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse cʉ́’ nzèm éfó tÿǒsoŋ Pɛrge, ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋo Antiokia gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe Pisidia. Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda gÿo ńku’, pɔ́ gʉa*ndá cú’tè, ésẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe ssé.
en: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.

ngiemboon: Mé tóŋo shwóŋè Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, ńtóŋ tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, melÿo tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌*ndá cú’tè túm mé gʉa ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mefɛ́, pi lɔɔn ńgẅiin shwóŋè lélɔg ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a, pi ná.
en: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying,Yemenandbrethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lu ssé, ńka’a pwó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pà Israel, tà mbɔɔ pi pie pi pɔ́g Ssé yeg pà Israel, pi jú’.
en: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning withhishand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.

ngiemboon: E Ssé yeg pà Israel la tsɔ́’ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pég, ńgÿo alá’ yɔɔn shʉ́a ngẅɛ̀ yé, áfʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé túm, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto. E Ssé gÿo ńdɔg pɔ́ tʉ̀ tá fó wó ńkẅile wɔ́b,
en: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.

ngiemboon: ńjÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b nkwòŋo tsẅɛ jÿɔ́g, á mmó ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa,
en: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ḿbyág melá’ pʉ̀a Kanaan sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńgabte tsetsá’a yɔ́b á mbwo pʉ̀a pég.
en: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó ngù’ lá’ nkÿo lekùa lê móm ntʉ̀a pá’ à la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b. E Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńná pàtág nzèm á mbwo pɔ́b. Tà ndá’ ńgʉa ńzsote nà fʉ̀’e*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Samîɛ.
en: And after that he gaveunto themjudges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.

ngiemboon: Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pég gÿo ńdúɔ fùɔ, e Ssé náa Saẅil, míŋ Kis né pɔ́b. Á fóo ná ngẅɛ̀ ndá Mběnjameŋ. Á sá’a lá’ ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa,
en: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.

ngiemboon: e Ssé gwá’a yé, ńtsɔ́’ɔ Ndavíd, ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ, ńgɔɔn nò ńtí Ndavíd ngie: «Mèŋ n gyá Ndavíd, míŋ Jesé á gwɔ́ lìi nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo. À ge gÿo gÿo mmó ntsèm gie n kwǒŋ».
en: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David thesonof Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavíd, ńgÿo mé zyé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pà Israel tsẅɛ́ pá’ à la ka’, angàŋ gwɔ́ Yěsô.
en: Of this man's seed hath God according tohispromise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwaa tó, mbà Jâŋ tǒ yé tà ne sá’a shwóŋó mbwó lá’a Israel ngie pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔ́b, ńgÿo mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse.
en: when John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gÿo ńcʉ́’ʉ lémege fà’ yé, ńzɛ́te lá’ ngie: Pi ee pá’ɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌? Mèŋ n ké tè*Nzà’nkÿo pù’ wɔ́! Pi ké ńjú’ mboŋó, àa nzèm mèŋ ńne ńtóo. N zɔɔn fó tè ku’u nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n kyɛ́’ nkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am nothe. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes ofhisfeet I am not worthy to loose.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, e Ssé gɔɔn yɔɔn nò pɔ́ mbwo pege metsèm. Á lélɔg ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́. À túmo yɔɔn nò mbwo pi pie pi ee púɔ Ábalam, mbɔɔ mbwo pi pie pi pɔ́g Ssé.
en: Menandbrethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.

ngiemboon: Tá á ke ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn, mbà pʉ̀a Yerósalem pâ pà sá’a lá’a yɔ́b kéen tè zsé nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa wɛ̌ wɔ́, pɔ́ kéen ńgíŋ tè jú’u mmó gie shwóŋè pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gɔɔn wɔ́, tá ḿbiŋ ne ńtóŋo ngwòŋ melyɛ’ɛ́ nzse mɔ́b ntsèm. Á ka cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ sẅiŋe Yěsô pá’ mé ge zẅé. Pɔ́ ka lɔg pú’u, ńgÿo ammó gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńtsẅi á púmte,
en: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilledthemin condemninghim.

ngiemboon: ńzága mmó gie pɔ́ ge cʉa mǒ é gÿo mé zẅé yé, ńgʉa ńgyá*Pilato ngie à ke ńzẅé yé zẅé.
en: And though they found no cause of deathin him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kéen ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbú ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńtí yé Yěsô, pɔ́ gÿo mé fó nà tÿǒ nkǐ ésẅé’e yé, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they tookhimdown from the tree, and laidhimin a sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Tá Ssé zíme yé nà legwé.
en: But God raised him from the dead:

ngiemboon: Á lɔg melyɛ̌’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńnyɛ mbùm ye á mbwo pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ la fóo Galilea ḿbúte ńgʉa Yerósalem. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé pàjÿò ńgyá á mvfò lá’.
en: and he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.

ngiemboon: Peg yég, peg tyě pá’ɔɔn, ńne ḿbÿé gẅi á yɛ̌ nò mbòŋo. Á gwɔ́ nò gie e Ssé la lá’ ńka’a mbwo pàmangʉa njʉ’ pà Israel.
en: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

ngiemboon: tà fó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mèŋ n cʉ’ʉ́ tá gù.
en: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

ngiemboon: e gwɔ́ kwà’ yɛ̌ gie n da pÿé mbwo fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead,nowno more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè lá’ nyé nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’ɔ yé, à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́
en: Wherefore he saith also in anotherpsalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná fùɔ Ndavíd, mbà à la pú ńgÿo mmó gie Ssé la gɔɔn ngie à gÿo nà yé fʉ̀’, ńgÿo ńkwé. Mé ńnéŋe pfó yé jʉ’ gie mé la ńnéŋe ye metá pé wó. Á lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná Yěsô, mbà à ka tè lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́. E Ssé kéen ńgÿo á zíme nà legwé.
en: but he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi ké ńdaga twó gí, ḿbɔ́gɔ mmó gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé légÿo gẅí. Pɔ́ la gɔɔn ngie:
en: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;

ngiemboon: mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le zẅíŋ.
en: A work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panepâse gÿo fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ. Mé sẅíŋte wɔ́b tɛ’ ngie pɔ́ lá’a lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda ye ngàb, ńgíŋe ńtó shwóŋó wɔ́b nò ńnáa ná yɛ̌ nò.
en: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.

ngiemboon: Mé kẅɛɛ*ndá cú’tè, ńgwaa fagte, lelÿò pà Yuda, pâ pʉ̀a pie é la zẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Yuda gʉa ńtsege wɔ́b. Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse gíŋe ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ kú’te menò mbòŋo mie e Ssé kà lɔg ńcÿó gem yɔ́b, ńkú’te kwà’ mboŋó.
en: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ zse pà Yuda gÿo ńgwɔ́, pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ pú ńkwɔ́’ tɛ’, ńtóo lé jú’u shwóŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gyá nzẅìŋ lá’ gie á kwɔ̌’, ńkwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ, ńzye lésa shÿó nò gie Pɔl pɔ́ Panepâse gɔ̌ɔn, ńzye lézoonte wɔ́b.
en: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse lêen ńké shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Peg kě ńzɔɔn ńgẅiin lévɔg shwóŋó nò Ssé pɔ́ mbwo pi pà Yuda. Pá’ pi kě ńdʉ’ lʉ’, ńnyɛ ngie pi kaa ku’ pá’ ńgwɔ́ pi gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì wɔ́ lá, peg ge sele nnɛ́ é gʉa fa’ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́,
en: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: E Ssé gÿǒ pi tsẅɛ́!
en: That thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ jú’u yɔɔn nò, ḿbú ńkág tɛ’, ńgu’te shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pʉ̀a pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà Ssé tsɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́b pá’ pâ pɔ̌ ge gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì, záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô.
en: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a piŋ ne ḿbú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ ntsèm.
en: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.

ngiemboon: Tá pà Yuda lêen ńké sẅite tsɔ́ pànzwě pie ée tÿǒsoŋo Antiokia ńcʉ́e. Mbà pɔ́ léen ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé pà Yuda, ésẅite mbɔɔ tsɔ́ mekěm pie ée tÿǒsoŋ. Pâ pɔ̌ gyɔ́ɔn sóon ná Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse, ńjwoŋo wɔ́b tà pɔ́ fóo lá’ pɔ́b ńké ńgʉa gʉa.
en: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse gwaa fó lá’ ŋwɛ́ kẅɛ, ḿbú’u pfepfɔ́b nà mekwò mɔ́b lélɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie á cʉ́’ʉ ńdíe pɔ́ wɔ́b, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa lê Ikonium.
en: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa nà*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ tÿǒsoŋo Antiokia, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lekág.
en: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse metsèm kúu Ikonium, menò gíŋe ńcʉate pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ é ka cʉate Antiokia. Pɔ́ gʉa*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda éshwóŋó nò Ssé. Tà lelÿò pà Yuda, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ zẅíŋe nò Yěsô.
en: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.

ngiemboon: Tá’ petsɔ́ pà Yuda lʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋ, ḿbímte pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, pɔ́ zye lélíe mefɛ́ mefɛ́ tepòŋ.
en: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse zye ńnéŋe Ikonium, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mvfò, ńne shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à kwoŋo wɔ́b. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ne ńcʉa ná menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie à lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo, ńnyɛɛ ngie anò gie pɔ́ gɔɔn ná pá’ Yěsô ne ńcÿo gem pʉ̀a, áa nénʉ́.
en: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

ngiemboon: E pʉ̀a pie ée tÿǒsoŋ shʉ́a, ńgábte nzsè pʉ́a. Tà’ nùɔ cʉ́me nzèm pà Yuda. Yetsɔ́ nùɔ cʉ́me nzèm megàŋ ntúm.
en: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, pâ mekěm lá’ pɔ́b, záb ngie pɔ́ ge lɔg tʉ̀ kúu mǒ. E tém megàŋ ntúm Yěsô lê metóon é zẅé,
en: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to usethemdespitefully, and to stone them,

ngiemboon: ńnyé ńkwaŋa kwaŋ, pɔ́ vɔg ńjú’, ńdeen ńké ńkÿo ńgʉa nê tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Likaonie, ńkúu wó ńgʉa tÿǒsoŋ Listele pɔ́ ye Nderbe, tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ metÿǒsoŋ mie ée shÿó jʉ’ó,
en: they were ware ofit, and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ně ńtsẅii pɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: and there they preached the gospel.

ngiemboon: Á laa tÿǒsoŋo Listele, tsɔ̌ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te gwɔ́ wó. Mbà mé la gwaa zyé yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nkÿǒon. Mbà à laa giŋe.
en: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńne ńzẅí’te shwóŋè gie Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn. Pɔl líe yé, ńgyá á ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé tà ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Ssé gÿo á sẅéte.
en: the same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,

ngiemboon: Pɔl lɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ńdɔg mekwò mú ńtyé tyé. Angàŋa kwʉ́’te jú’, ńgú’u ssé lê gub, ńzye légiŋ.
en: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gyá mmó gie Pɔl gÿǒ, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè lá’a yɔ́b, á shwóŋè Likaonie ńgɔɔn ngie: À yɔɔn gie messé selé ńcʉ́’ pá’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tà sẅɛ́’ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege lɔɔn!
en: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn ngie Panebâse aa ssé Zeus. Pɔl gwɔ́ ssé gie mé tóŋo lê Hermes, ńgɔɔn pú’u mélà’mie Pɔl zɔ la ne ńgɔɔn nòfʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńtɔ́gɔ nà tsɔ̌ ndá ssé yɔb tá ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ, é gwɔ́ ye ssé Zeus. Nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋe pwɔ́’ ná yɛ̌ ndá ssé, gʉa ńgwoon mefòŋ, ńdɔgɔ fèléwa ńnyɛte ńkẅiŋe wɔ́b, ńdɔg ńtóo ndùmo gyɛ̌. Pâ lá’ cú’te, éfa’a légwa mefòŋ ŋwɛ́ ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ mvfò Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse.
en: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’u yɔɔn nò, éshʉate menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ ńga’te lê tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Whichwhen the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heardof, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pég, pi fa’a légÿo kɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀? Peg léen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pá’ pi! Peg tǒ pɔ́ létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi, é gwɔ́ ngie pi gwá’ messé mɛ́ mie é té tsɔ́ mmó ku’, ésele nnɛ́ ńtó ńkẅɛ́te Ssé gẅie aa ntentʉ́. Yé zɔ la gÿo tÿǒ lépwó pɔ́ tsetsá’, mbɔɔ ntse tê pàa, tà mbɔɔ shúm ntsèm sie ée wó.
en: and saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

ngiemboon: À laa fʉ̀’e mvfò, ńnyé túmo túm ntsèm, pɔ́ giŋe nà memánzsè mie pɔ́ kwoŋ.
en: who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé ké tè tsó té lɔg mefà’ mbòŋo mé ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngie aa wó wɔ́, ńne fóo tÿǒ lepwó ńtúmo mbʉ̀ŋ mbwo pɔ́b, ńgÿo shúm zéme, pɔ́ laga ná fʉ̀’ gie á ne ńzɛ́te. Á lɔg ńgÿo pɔ́ gẅiin shúm léjÿó tà ntʉ́m wɔ́b poŋ, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe ńkág kág.
en: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tsɛ ńjú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè tá’, Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse lá’ ḿbú ńgyá ngɔ́’ nzèm pɔ́b tɛ’, tá pɔ́ tsẅé jʉ’. Tà pɔ́ té nuŋe pwɔ́’ mvfò pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.

ngiemboon: Étsɔ́ pà Yuda lêen ńgÿo fó Antiokia gẅie aa ngʉ̀ŋe Pisidie, petsɔ́ fó tÿǒsoŋ Ikonium, pɔ́ pú ńtó sele lá’ tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà yɔb nzèm. Pâ pɔ̌ lêen ńké ńdɔg metóon ńtémte Pɔl, tà ne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie à kwě, éshwoŋo yé ńdɔg fó tÿǒsoŋ, ńgʉa ńgwá’.
en: And there came thithercertainJews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drewhimout of the city, supposing he had been dead.

ngiemboon: Pàzẅíŋe nò Yěsô tÿɔ́’ɔ Pɔl ńnéŋe soŋ, á lu ssé, pâ pɔ̌ piŋ lê tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ. Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, pɔ́ Panebâse kẅɛ ńcʉ́me mánzsè légʉa lé tÿǒsoŋ Nderbe.
en: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse kúu Nderbe, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, tà pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo. Pɔ́ fó wó, ńgíŋ ḿbiŋe Listele pɔ́ Ikonium, ńgʉa gʉa tà ńkúu Antiokia gẅie aa ngʉ̀ŋe Pisidie,
en: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, andtoIconium, and Antioch,

ngiemboon: ńgiŋe ńtóonte ntʉ́m pʉ̀a Kristo ngie tà pɔ́ kʉ́a ná lézáb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô, ńne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pâ pɔ̌ cʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: confirming the souls of the disciples,andexhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse ne ńcʉa nzɔ̌ jʉ’ wɔ́, ńtsɔ́’ɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ge kẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo wó. Tà á ku’, pɔ́ kwoŋo kwoŋ, ńdʉ’ʉ shúm léjÿó, ésẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie pɔ́ zẅiŋé nò yé.
en: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse gÿo fó nà pàga ngwòŋ Pisidie, ńzyɛ́’, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná ye Panfilia,
en: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

ngiemboon: ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Pɛrge, éshwóŋó nò Ssé. Tà á ku’ pɔ́ cwóŋ né tÿǒsoŋo Atalia,
en: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:

ngiemboon: éfó wó, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, gie á gee lê Antiokia. Antiokia gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé la fó wó, ńcʉ́me wɔ́b mbwó Ssé, tá pɔ́ giŋe fa’a fà’ gie pɔ́ fa’a lɔɔn.
en: and thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńcú’te pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm, ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie Ssé cʉ̌a ná pɔ́b ńgÿo, éshwóŋó wɔ́b. Lelÿò menò gwɔ́ pá’ e Ssé kéen ná shÿó mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té pà Yuda wɔ́, ss lézáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô.
en: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pâ pʉ̀a Kristo zye ńnéŋe wó.
en: And there they abode long time with the disciples.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo fó Jẅidea, ńtóo Antiokia, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a Kristo ngie Ssé lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á légÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ té gwɔ́ gie mé pú’u wɔ́b pá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́.
en: And certain men which came down from Judæa taught the brethren,and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ̀ Panebâse lʉ’. Pâ pɔ̌ zye nzoŋ, ńké tè gwɔ́ tà’ ncwò wɔ́. Á cʉa wɔ́b tà pɔ́ gebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ, ńzáb ngie, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse, ńgyo tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a gʉa Yerósalem, ńgyá ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô pâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a kristo légwɔ́ gie pâ pɔ̌ ge sáŋa nò ńnáa mǒ.
en: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.

ngiemboon: Acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Antiokia ná shúm sie á ne ńzɛ́te mbwo pɔ́b lélɔg ńcʉ́me mánzsè. Pɔ́ cʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Fenisia, mbàa tsɛ̀ɛ we Samalîɛ, ńgiŋe shwóŋó mbwo pʉ̀a Kristo ngie pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ kéen sele nnɛ́ tà ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ jú’ ḿbú ńkág tɛ’.
en: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńgʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, megàŋ ntúm Yěsô pâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo kúe wɔ́b. Pɔ́ píte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie e Ssé ka lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo, éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, andofthe apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ́ ntá’ pà*farisay, pie pɔ́ ka záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô, é ne ńkẅi yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: Á zɛ́te ngie mé pú’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gwaa záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô, pɔ́ té pà Yuda wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te mbwo pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ giŋ pá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to commandthemto keep the law of Moses.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, lâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ńnéŋe ssé lélíe nò ńnáa mǒ,
en: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.

ngiemboon: ńdá’ ńkwaŋ, á tʉ tʉ. Tà Piɛ lu ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pi ne ńzsé gí pá’ Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ntyě saga ńgie n gʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô.
en: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Menandbrethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie à zsé ntʉ́m mânyìŋ ntsèm, la nyɛ ngie à zẅǐŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pé, ńtúmo Zẅìge yé mbwo pɔ́b yɔ́b. Pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la túmo mbwó pege.
en: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even ashe didunto us;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la té gÿo tsɔ́ lǎga metuŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pega pɔ̌ wɔ́. À la cʉa ná pá’ pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, ésɔg ntʉ́m wɔ́b.
en: and put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn, pi piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ńkumte Ssé? Pi fa’a lékaa pì’ gie metá pégè la tè ku’u lékaa wɔ́, kwà’ pege yégè gíŋe tè mǒ ku’, ńzába twó pɔ́b keen?
en: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pege ne ńnyɛte ńzsé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege la gwɔ́ tsẅɛ́, ńzẅɛ́’ pɔ́ pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô cÿǒ gem yégè. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ á cʉa pú’u, tá pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ yɔ́b.
en: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, pʉ̀a metsèm láŋte. Mé cʉ́’ʉ ńzẅí’te pɔ́ nò gie Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse ne ńgɔɔn. Pɔ́ ne ḿbíte menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn laa menkʉ̀’ʉ menò mie Ssé ka lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ píte tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, Jâg gɔɔn yé ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅí’te nò gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Menandbrethren, hearken unto me:

ngiemboon: Simo lǔ ssé lékímte wégè nò gie e Ssé ka gÿo nà pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ ngie tà fó nzyetě, e Ssé záb ngie à ge gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, é tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a lɔg gÿo pʉ̀a pie ée pé.
en: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie e Ssé la lá’ ńdɔg ncwò pà ntsẅì kʉ̀ pé ńgɔɔn. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie:
en: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge lá’ gíŋe pʉ’ʉ ndá ye gie mé la tágte tà è tyé tyé.
en: And I will set it up:

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgÿo menò mie à la záb.
en: Saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.

ngiemboon: É gwɔ́ menò mie aa ńzsé zsě.
en: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.

ngiemboon: Jâg gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pú’u la, mèŋ n kwǎŋ yɔ́ɔn ngie tà mé gege pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ tà á cʉa. N gɔɔn pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô.
en: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:

ngiemboon: Tá’, áa mbòŋ ngie pege ŋwe’e pɔ́ ndà’ ŋwà’ne ńdɔg ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie: Pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ɛ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé lɔ̌g ńgwá’ messé. Ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ mbab nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé fomó yé fóme. Ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ metse. Ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ́ nuŋe nuŋe
en: but that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, andfromfornication, andfromthings strangled, andfromblood.

ngiemboon: Tà fó mengù’u mengù’, ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mé ée ńzɔ́gɔ pɔ́ lésá’ mbʉ̌ Mǒsê tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ, ngwòŋ melyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda ntsèm. Mé tóŋo pɔ́ sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè mɔ́b.
en: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, pâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ ée Yerósalem, pâ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm lêen ńké ńzáb ngie á poŋ mé gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsɔ́’ tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a, ńtúmo wɔ́b lâ Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse a Antiokia. Mé tsɔ́’ɔ Jẅide gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Mbarsabas, ńgíŋe ńtsɔ́’ɔ Silas. Pʉ̀a pɔɔn mépʉ́a gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gɔɔn nò mé jú’.
en: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas;namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo ŋwà’ne gie pɔ́ ge lɔg gʉa, ńŋwe’e tsoló ngie: Peg megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, pâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo á Yerósalem, peg mefɛ́ pí peg tsyɛ’té gẅi metsèm, á gẅi mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pi tè pà Yuda wɔ́, á gẅi gẅie pi tsẅé Antiokia, tà mbɔɔ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée nà pàga ngwòŋ Siria, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie ée nà pàga ngwòŋ Silisia.
en: and they wrotelettersby them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethrensendgreeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:

ngiemboon: Peg ka jǔ’ ngie etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ka fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ peg, ńtó ḿma’a tág tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè yɔ́b ńgÿo tà pi cʉ́’ʉ ńzsé twó gí wɔ́. Tá’ peg zɔ ka ké tè túmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn pú’u wɔ́.
en: forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying,Ye mustbe circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave nosuchcommandment:

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ tá peg metsèm cú’te ńzáb ngie mé tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a, ńtúmo wɔ́b mbwo pi. Pâ Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse, é mentʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mefɛ́ pégè, pɔ́ tó ńgyá gẅí,
en: it seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

ngiemboon: ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ léen ńzẅíŋe lékwé ńtí nò Cʉ̀apùa wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńtúmo Jẅide pɔ́ Silas. Pɔ́ ge tyé mvfò pi, éshwóŋó gẅi mmó gie peg ŋwe’é tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne.
en: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tellyouthe same things by mouth.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔ̌ɔn ńgwâ zába yɔɔn nò, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gíŋe ńzáb yé ngie tà mé kẅi’i pì’ mbwo pi. Tá’, á ke ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi nyɛte ńkú’te mɔɔn mbʉ̌ mie peg gee ngɔ̌ɔn lɔɔn kwà’ mboŋó.
en: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ̀ɛ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé lɔ̌g ńgwá’ messé. Pi pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ mbab nɔ̀ɔn gẅie me fomé yé fóme. Pi pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ metse. Pi pɔ́ɔn lépumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pia pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe. Pi lɔɔn ńjú’ ncwò weg ná mɔɔn menò ńkú’te, mbà pi gÿǒ mboŋó. Peg mefɛ́ pí, peg tsyɛ’té gẅí.
en: that ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.

ngiemboon: Mé ŋwe’e pá’ɔɔn, ńdɔg ntúm pʉ̀a pa. Pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu Antiokia, ńcú’te pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm, ńnáa ŋwà’ne mbwo pɔ́b.
en: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ńtóŋo yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne, á kẅiŋte wɔ́b. Pɔ́ pú ńkág pá’ɔɔn tɛ’.
en: whichwhen they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

ngiemboon: Pá’ Jẅide pɔ́ Silas é laa pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwò Ssé la, pâ pɔ̌ gíŋe shwóŋó pá’ɔɔn tɛ’. Pɔ́ nyɛte ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b, ńtóonte wɔ́b pɔ́ tʉte.
en: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmedthem.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gíŋe ńná’a ńnéŋe Antiokia. Pɔ́ gÿo ńgwaa gʉa, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ nyɛte ńde’e wɔ́b. Ngie pɔ́ giŋ lê kwò mbòŋo, lépiŋ ńkẅɛ́te pʉ̀a pie é ka túmo wɔ́b.
en: And after they had tarriedtherea space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.

ngiemboon: [ Tá’ Silas cʉ́’ ńzáb pɔ́ ngie à ge zso Antiokia]
en: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse cʉ́’ ńnéŋe Antiokia. Pâ pàzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńgwá ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ḿbiŋ ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo.
en: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

ngiemboon: Á ná’a ńnéŋe méjʉ’, Pɔl gɔɔn né Panebâse ngie: Pɔgɔ piŋ nzèm, ńdíe mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pɔ́ ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mie pɔgɔ ka cʉa wó éshwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńdíe ńgyá pá’ pɔ́ ka cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pú’u.
en: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord,and seehow they do.

ngiemboon: Panebâse ne ńkwoŋo ngie pɔ́ yé lɔgɔ Jâŋ gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo lé Malékuse la ńgʉa.
en: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl tè kwoŋ pú’u wɔ́, á nue à la lá’ ńgwá’a wɔ́b yé Panfilia. À laa gíŋe ńcʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b pâ pɔ̌ fa’a fà’ wɔ́.
en: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse pú ńzoŋ zoŋ, ḿbú tè jú’e, tà ńgebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ é fege. Panebâse lɔgɔ Jâŋ Malékuse ńgʉa. Pɔ́ yé kúu kanú’ ńgʉa lê Shʉ̀pele.
en: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;

ngiemboon: Pɔl cʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ yé Silas, pɔ́ yé gwɔ gʉa, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ cʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: and Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.

ngiemboon: Á zyɛ́’ ye Siria pɔ́ Silisia, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte*mendá cú’tè ná lenyɛte ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Nderbe, ńgÿo fó wó ńdɔg ye Listele. Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ Kristo gwɔ́ wó, mé tóŋo yé lê Timoté. Má we gwɔ́ mûɔ Yuda, mbà à léen ńzẅíŋe nò Yěsô. Mbà tá we laa nyìŋ Gelekia.
en: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his fatherwasa Greek:

ngiemboon: Timoté gwɔ́ nyìŋ, epʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Listele mbɔɔ Ikonium kíme yé mboŋó tɛ’.
en: which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne ńkwoŋo ngie pɔ́ Timoté giŋe kwò, ńzɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgÿo mé pú’u yé, ńzsé ngie pà Yuda ge kúe yé, mélà’mie pà Yuda pie ée nà yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ la ne ńzsé ngie tá pà Timoté laa nyìŋ Gelekia
en: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.

ngiemboon: Pâ Pɔl lêen ńké ńne ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ńtsẅii pà’ ngàŋ ntúm lâ pákẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Yerósalem, ka zǎb, ńne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ kú’te yɛ̌ nò mboŋó.
en: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Kristo ne ńkẅi’i ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé ńdɔgɔ ńgee pɔ́ lê mvfò. Anùɔ yɔ́b ne ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pâ Silas ké ne ńgwá ńgiŋe giŋ, à Zẅìge Ssé gÿo ńtɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b légʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia éshwóŋó nò Ssé, Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ ńzyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Filigia pɔ́ ye Galatia zyɛ̌’,
en: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,

ngiemboon: ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Misia, éfa’ shÿó légʉa Mbitinia. Tá Zẅìge Yěsô té zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ gʉa wó wɔ́.
en: after they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńzyɛ́’ɛ Misia zyɛ̌’, ńcwóŋ ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Toras.
en: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ lêtsẅɛ́’, e Ssé nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g Pɔl, á gyá tsɔ̌ nkʉ̀’ʉ nò. Á gyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Makedonia tyé, ńne sẅíŋte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsétsɔ’, tó tà ńkúu Makedonia, ńkẅéte wég.
en: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gyá pú’u, peg lêen fa’ shÿó ńgʉa Makedonia, ńne ńcwóŋo ńzsé ngie Ssé zɔ tóŋo wég wó ngie peg tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu*máamáa kanú’ á tÿǒsoŋo Toras, ńgʉ́a pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ lá’ gie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ, mé tóŋo lê Samoteras. Njÿó lʉ́a peg gíŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ kanú’ ńgʉa nê tÿǒsoŋ Neapolis,
en: Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the nextdayto Neapolis;

ngiemboon: ńtóo wó ńkẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńgʉa nê tÿǒsoŋo Filib. Á gwɔ́ máamáa tÿǒsoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Makedonia, mbà mé léen ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo pà*Roma. Peg ńnéŋe wó tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ melyɛ̌’.
en: and from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia,anda colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda gwɔ́, peg fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe tsɔ̌ ntse, ńne ńkwaŋa yég pɔ́ ngie peg ge gʉa tà kúu wó, à gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́ peg gyá jʉ’ gie pà Yuda cú’te wó ésẅíŋte Ssé. Ńkẅɛ́te tsɔ́ pànzwě jʉ’ó, ńnéŋe yég ssé ńgɔɔn nò Ssé mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resortedthither.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mé tóŋo yé lê Litiɔ. Mbà à la fó tÿǒsoŋo Tiatire. Á táŋa tsɔ́ mepàŋ nzsǒ é poŋ tɛ’. Mbà à la zẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Yuda. Peg ne ńgɔɔn nò, á nyɛte ńzẅí’te kwà’ mboŋó, ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tsɔ́’ ntʉ́m wé pá’ à ge téŋe letuŋó sé ńnyɛte zẅí’te nò gie Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn.
en: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heardus: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.

ngiemboon: Mé pɔ́ɔnte ḿbú ńnu’u wɔ́ba ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé ntse. Á pɔ́ɔnte ńgwɔ tóŋo wég mbʉ̀a yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg lɔɔn ńgyá yég ngie à zẅiŋé nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà shwóŋó nò, peg tó ńtsẅé mbʉ̀a yé, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtsóte wég tsóte lézẅíŋ.
en: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besoughtus, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abidethere. And she constrained us.

ngiemboon: Peg fó lyɛ̌’ ńkẅɛ ńne ńgee jʉ’ gie mé sẅíŋte Ssé wó, atsɔ̌ múɔ manzwě gẅie à laa nkwɔɔn tó ńzá’a wég. Mbà tsɔ́*ssé tepòŋ la kúu ná yé, ńgÿo á ku’u léshwóŋ pʉ̀a menò mie é ge táa tá gÿo wɔ́b. Pàjúu yé lɔgɔ yé ńdaba nkáb tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́me nzèm peg lâ Pɔl, ńgiŋe ńgɔɔn lê tʉ̀ ngie: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn ée ngàŋa fà’ mbwo Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ! Pɔ́ ne shwóŋó gẅi pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi giŋ pú’u tá ńtsẅɛ́.
en: The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.

ngiemboon: Á ke ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, nà melyɛ̌’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Pɔl fó ńgebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ ńgyáŋa lóŋ, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn nê*ssé tepòŋ ngie: Mèŋ n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ fó ná manzwě wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ! E*ssé tepòŋ gwóon fó ná yé ńkẅɛ.
en: And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la júu yé, gyá ngie pɔ́ té gíŋe ńku’u lélɔgɔ yé ńdab nkáb wɔ́, ńdeen ńké ńgwoon Pɔl pɔ́ Silas, éshwoŋo wɔ́b ńdɔg ńgʉa ndùmo gyɛ̌, ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b mvfò pàsá’a lá’,
en: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drewtheminto the marketplace unto the rulers,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo pà*Roma pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn sá’a lá’ ngie: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn ne ḿma’a tág tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yégè, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pà Yuda.
en: and brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńda’te pʉ̀a tsɔ̌ mà we sẅé. Á gwɔ́ gẅie pege pà*Roma tè gẅiin lézẅíŋ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tè gẅiin légiŋ pá’ pɔ́ la’te wɔ́.
en: and teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pú ńgyáŋa lóŋ ná Pɔl pɔ́ Silas. Pà*Roma pie é lɔ́ɔn sá’a lá’ tsẅi, mé sẅɛ menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńdɔg mekésiŋ ńnyɛte ńcúa wɔ́b.
en: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beatthem.

ngiemboon: Mé cúa wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó, ńgʉa ḿma’a wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ, ńtsẅi nê mbyɛ̀b ndá tsǎŋ ngie à nyɛte ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó.
en: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they casttheminto prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:

ngiemboon: Mé gɔɔn pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ndá tsǎŋ gʉa ńnéŋe wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ lûm gẅie aa kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ, ńnéŋe*kɔ̌’ nà mekwò mɔ́b.
en: who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ gÿo ne ńku’u, Pɔl pɔ́ Silas ne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńzɔbɔ ntse ńdɔgɔ ńgú’te yé. Petsɔ́ megàŋa tsǎŋ ne ńjú’u,
en: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tà ńjú’, atsetsá’ cʉ’e lê tʉ̀ tà mesǎg ndá tsǎŋ pú ńnʉ’ʉ. Mencwò ndá gwóon ńtsɔ́’ɔ ńtyéte. Metsɛ̂n fó ná megàŋa tsǎŋ métsèm ńkyɛ́’te ḿbʉle ssé.
en: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one's bands were loosed.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie á ke ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ ndá tsǎŋ zyeen, ńgyá mencwò ndá tsǎŋ pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ me ntsɔ̌’. Á lêen ńké soŋ nně, ńne fa’a lélɔg sɔb mbùm ye, ńne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie ngàŋa tsǎŋ ně ńkẅɛ ńkÿote.
en: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl ga’te lê tʉ̀ ngie: Tè sɔb mbùm jù, peg gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé métsèm.
en: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.

ngiemboon: Ambyɛ̀b ndá tsǎŋ tsẅi mé lɔgɔ kyɛ̀’ ńtó. Á lɔg ńkÿote ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ. Mbú ne ńcÿɔ’ɔ tà ḿvɛɛ vɛ, ésẅɛ́’ ńnuŋe mekwò Pɔl pɔ́ Silas,
en: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pâ pɔ̌ fó tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ ńkẅɛ, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pà ndè, ńgwɔ́ n gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńtsẅɛ́?
en: and brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Záb ntʉ́m gú ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô. À gÿo pia ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù tsẅɛ́.
en: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Silas shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô mbwo pɔ́ba ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé.
