en: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó fʉ̀’ó, pɔ́ kwà’ lêtsẅɛ́’ ŋwɛ́, á lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa mbʉ̀a yé, ésɔg mefʉ̌ŋ mɔ́b, ńcÿɔ’. Pɔ́ lêen ńké ḿbú ńnu’u wɔ́ba ngẅɛ̀ ndá ye tsɛ̀ɛ ntse.
en: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washedtheirstripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b mépʉ́a ḿbʉ́ ńgʉa ndá yé, ńná shúm pɔ́ jÿó. Pâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá ye pú ńkág, mélà’mie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé.
en: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, pàtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ, ńgwɔ́ pà*Roma, túm pà mékɔ́ɔn ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńtsẅii mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ndá tsǎŋ ngie à kyɛɛ pʉ̀a pá ńnyé pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ndá tsǎŋ tó ńgɔɔn mbwo Pɔl ngie: Pàtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ tsẅǐ ngie mèŋ n nyé gẅi pi gʉa, ńgwɔ́ pi kẅɛ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgʉa lê mbʉ́lè!
en: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Pɔl gɔɔɔn mbwo pà mékɔ́ɔn ngie: Pɔ́ ka nyě pɔ́ tè ŋág ntsaŋ yeg, ńtsẅi mé cúa wég mvfò lá’. Tá peg gwɔ́ púɔ lá’a pà*Roma. Pɔ́ ka cua wég pú’u, tá á ku’ pɔ́ ńnéŋe wég tsǎŋ. Pɔ́ piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀ fa’a léshúte shúte ńkẅile wég. Peg lʉ̌’. Á zɛ́te ngie kwà’ pɔ́b zɔ tó ńkẅile wég ndá tsǎŋ.
en: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have castusinto prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.

ngiemboon: Pà mékɔ́ɔn gʉa ḿbíte yɔɔn nò éshwóŋ pàtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ pà*Roma, pɔ́ jú’ ngie Pɔl pɔ́ Silas ée púɔ lá’ pà*Roma ḿbú ḿbɔ́g tɛ’,
en: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.

ngiemboon: ńtó, ḿbú’ mbwó ńgÿo pɔ́ fó ndá tsǎŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgíŋe sẅíŋte wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńgʉa.
en: And they came and besought them, and broughtthemout, and desiredthemto depart out of the city.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Silas kẅɛ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgʉa nê mbʉ̀a Litiɔ, ńkúu wó, ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ̌kɔ́ɔ shwóŋ mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b, tá ńgʉa.
en: And they went out of the prison, and entered intothe house ofLydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Silas lu ssé ńcʉa ye tÿǒsoŋ Anfipolis mbɔɔ ye Apolonia, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Tesalonika, ńgyá tà’*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda gwɔ́ wó.
en: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:

ngiemboon: Pɔl kúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌*ndá cú’tè légyá pà Yuda, á gwɔ́ mà mbwo yé, ńgʉa wó té tsó nà lyɛ̌’ nzse pà Yuda sétá. Pâ pà Yuda ne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé ńtúu nò ńnáa mǒ.
en: and Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne ńnyɛte ńkyagte shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie a*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé ka ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ la, ka gẅiin légyá ngɔ́’, ńkwé, ḿbiŋ ńzíme nà legwé. A*Nzà’nkÿo áwɛ̌ aa Yěsô gẅie yé shwóŋó wɔ́b lɔɔn.
en: opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pà Yuda jú’ á kúte wɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅíŋ, ńcʉ́me nzèm Pɔl pɔ́ Silas, tà mbɔɔ tsɔ́ pà Gelekia tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie pɔ́ la zẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Israel. Tà mbɔɔ tsɔ́ pánzwě pie ée tÿǒsoŋ, ńcʉ́e la zẅíŋ yɔ́b.
en: And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.

ngiemboon: Tá pà Yuda pie e lʉ̌’, gyá pú’u, ńkwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ, ńgʉa metwó nzsè, ńcú’te pàtèkǔ nà nò, pâ pɔ̌ sẅite lá’, ḿma’a và’ tÿǒsoŋ. Pɔ́ gʉa ndá Jasoŋ léfa’a Pɔl pɔ́ Silas pá’ pɔ́ ge gwoon wɔ́b gʉa tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b mvfò lá’,
en: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, pɔ́ té wɔ́b gyá, éfó ńgwoon Jasoŋ pâ tsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa tà ńkúu mvfò pàtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ, pà Yuda lɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pɔɔn é pǔ ḿma’a và’ jʉ’ ntsèm. À gie pɔ́ lɔ̌g ńtó tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn!
en: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

ngiemboon: Jasoŋ kéen ńkúe wɔ́b mbʉ̀a yé. Pɔ́ né ńgwá ńgwága*lepʉ̌ Kása, ńgɔɔn ngie atsɔ̌ fùɔ aa wó, mé tóŋo yé lê Yěsô.
en: whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Cæsar, saying that there is another king,oneJesus.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn shwóŋè pú ńtágte twó lá’ tà mbɔɔ ye pàtsɔ́’te mentsaŋ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tà pàsá’a lá’ zɛ́te mbwo Jasoŋ pâ petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ ngie pɔ́ nuŋe mbwɔ́’ nkáb ssé tá mé nyé wɔ́b.
en: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.

ngiemboon: Nzěm lêen ńgwaa síŋ, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ gÿo Pɔl pɔ́ Silas gʉa nê tÿǒsoŋ Mbelɛ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgʉa*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda.
en: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who comingthitherwent into the synagogue of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda pie ée nà yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ gẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńcʉa pie ée Tesalonika. Pɔ́ zẅí’te shwóŋè Pɔl pɔ́ Silas lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé, ńtuu nò ńnáa mǒ, éfa’a lézsé ka nò gie pɔ́ shwóŋó wɔ́b, áa pú’u wɔ́.
en: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b fó pú’u, ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô. Tà mbɔɔ pànzwě pà Gelekia pie pɔ́ cʉ́e, mbɔɔ mbàŋa tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋe ńzáb yɔ́b.
en: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.

ngiemboon: Tá pà Yuda pe Tesalonika jú’ pá’ Pɔl áa Mbelɛ, ńgíŋe ne shwóŋó nò Ssé, ńjuŋte ńtóo wó, ńzye léma’a và’ ńdɔg sẅite lá’.
en: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ gwóon ńgÿo Pɔl lɔg shÿó ntse té pàa ńgʉa. Silas pɔ́ Timoté cʉ́’ ńzso Mbelɛ.
en: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gʉa ńtsege Pɔl lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tà ńkúu Atɛ̀ne, ńgwaa piŋ nzèm, Pɔl tsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gÿo Silas pɔ́ Timoté lwo ńtó ńkẅɛ́te yé.
en: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gwaa ne zẅí’te wɔ́b Atɛ̀ne, ńgyá shúm ntí ntí sie pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ áyɛ̌ gu’te ngie ee messé. E gyɔ́ɔn pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, mbùm ye pú ńtsyɛte.
en: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńgee ndà cú’tè pà Yuda, ńkẅɛ́te pà Yuda mbɔɔ pàzẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Yuda ńne shwóŋó wɔ́b nò, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńgee ndùmo gyɛ̌, ńgyá pʉ̀a pie ée wó, ńgíŋe shwóŋó wɔ́b nò.
en: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.

ngiemboon: Pâ tsɔ́*pàkwaŋte nò, la gíŋe ne shwóŋó, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée nà nùɔ Epikẅire mbɔɔ pie ée nà nùɔ Zenoŋ. Á laa pú’u, Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn nò Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b, mbɔɔ nò ná*lezimé nà legwé. Petsɔ́ ne ńzɛ́te ngie: Wɛ̂ ngàŋa shwǒŋ gɔɔn ngie kɔ́ lɛ? Petsɔ́ ne ngie á gwá’a fʉ̀’e à shwóŋó wégè nò ná tsɔ́ messé mendyɛ̀’ɛ lá.
en: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa mvfò Aeropage, á gwɔ́ cú’tè pàsá’ ntsaŋ tÿǒsoŋ, ńkúu wó, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ peg zsé yég á nò sẅé yɛ̂ gie ɔ̀ zí’i pʉ̀a lɛ?
en: And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest,is?

ngiemboon: Menò mie ɔ̀ gwaa shwóŋó wég ne ńkʉ’ʉ wég kʉ’ʉ. Peg ne ńkwoŋo lécwoŋo ńzsé pá’ ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn.
en: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, ńtí nue pʉ̀a pie ée tÿǒsoŋ Atɛ̀ne mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é fóo túm ńtóo ńtsẅé wó, lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńcú’te ńjú’u menò me sẅé mie é nyé tá ńkẅɛɛ.
en: (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)

ngiemboon: Pɔl lêen ńké ńdu ssé ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pàsá’a tÿǒsoŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: Epʉ̀a Atɛ̀ne, mèŋ n gyǎ pi tyé nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ńnéŋe twó nà nò Ssé tɛ’.
en: Yemen of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gwǎ ne giŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ gí, ńgyá mendá messé mí gyǎ, tà ńgyá tsɔ̌ gwɔ́ wó, mbà mé la ŋwe’e mǒ ngie: Yɔɔn áa jʉ’ʉ ssé gie peg kaa lezíŋ sé zsé. Áa yɛ̌ tá, yɛ̌ Ssé gie pi tsẅé ńgu’te yé té zsé yé la, mèŋ n tóo pá’ɔɔn léshwóŋó gẅi nò yé.
en: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie à la nyɛte njÿó laa shúm sie é pú ńgwɔ́ wó. Yé zɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Àa těen ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ mejʉ’ʉ ssé mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ lɔ̌g mbwo mɔ́b ńkwɛ́ wɔ́.
en: God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;

ngiemboon: À ké té ne ńzẅí’te ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo tsɔ́ mmó tá à lɔg ńgwɔ́ yé wó wɔ. Àtsɔ́ mmó té mbwo yé zág. Yé zɔ náa zẅìge mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tá pɔ́ lɔg ńgwɔ́ wó, tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́.
en: neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;

ngiemboon: À la fóo ná tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́, ḿbú ńgÿo melá’ melá’, légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge ńnéŋe jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńtʉ́ njÿó ńzáb mekème njÿó mɔ́b mbɔɔ mejʉ’ mie pɔ́ ge lá’ ńnéŋe wó.
en: and hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;

ngiemboon: E Ssé gÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge fa’a yé. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ lɔɔn fó fa’a yé pɔ́ lekyɛ̀bɛ lekyɛ̀bɛ, mbà ndyɛ̀’ tsɔ́ pɔ́ ké ńgyá yé gyá. Pege zɔɔn ńgwaa ńnéŋe pá’ɔɔn, á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ máa wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: that they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a á nà ngẅɛ̀ yé.
en: for in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ púɔ Ssé yé máŋwɛ́. Pú’u la, tà pege kwaŋ ngie Ssé áa tsɔ́ mmó gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔl, kà pɔ́ tʉ̌ nkáb wɔ́, kà tóon wɔ́, ńdɔg ńnyɛte. Pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔgɔ legyè sie é kẅɛɛ twó pɔ́b ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛte.
en: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man's device.

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ sáŋa yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ gie nyìŋ mesoŋ kɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pú’u ńdɔgɔ ńgʉe gʉe wɔ́. Àa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńne ńtóŋo ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm, á tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ ntsèm ngie pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔ́b.
en: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Ssé léen ńzába lyɛ̌’ gie à ge lá’ lɔgɔ nyìŋ gẅie à la tsɔ́’ɔ yé, é ŋag njÿó, é ké ŋag pɔ́ nà ntí gie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. À la zíme ngàŋ ná legwé lélɔg ńnyɛɛ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm ngie à ge lá’ gÿo pú’u.
en: because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness bythatman whom he hath ordained;whereofhe hath given assurance unto allmen, in that he hath raised him from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pà Gelekia gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pá’ Pɔl gɔ̌ɔn ngie nyìŋ la zíme nà legwé, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́b é gwaa zoonte yé, petsɔ́ gɔɔn lê yé ngie: Peg ge lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá gíŋ zẅí’te nò gie ɔ̀ gɔɔn lɛ!
en: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of thismatter.

ngiemboon: Pɔl cʉ́’ ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgʉa gʉa.
en: So Paul departed from among them.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ke ńcʉ́me nzèm ye, ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo. Á gʉa nà nùɔ yɔ́b, mé gyá Ndenis gẅie à laa nùɔ pàsá’ ntsaŋ á tÿǒsoŋo Atɛ̀ne, ńgyá tsɔ̌ mánzwě gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Ndamaris ńgÿo mbɔɔ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the whichwasDionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Pɔl fó tÿǒsoŋ Atɛ̀ne ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Korento,
en: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;

ngiemboon: ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Yuda gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Akilas. Mbà mé la zyé yé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Pôŋ. Pɔ́ nzwě we Piriska nyé tá ńtóo, éfóo ngwòŋ Italia. Mbà Kása Kɔlɔde ka tsẅi ngie pà Yuda metsèm é fó tÿǒsoŋo*Roma ńgʉa. Pɔl gʉa ńgúɔ wɔ́b.
en: and found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pâ pɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ḿbú fa’a pɔ́ tà’ ntí fà’. Á gwɔ́ lélɔg nzsǒ ńnyɛte*mentàb la, Pɔl cʉ́’ʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a pɔ́b, pâ pɔ̌ pú fa’a.
en: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda wɔ́, Pɔl gʉa*ndá cú’tè pɔ́b, éfa’a shÿó léshwóŋ pà Yuda pâ pà Gelekia nò tà pɔ́ jú’.
en: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

ngiemboon: Silas pɔ́ Timoté gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà fó Makedonia ńtó, Pɔl cʉ́’ ńnéŋe twó pɔ́ ndà’ léshwóŋó nò Ssé, ńne ńnyɛte ńkyagte, éshwóŋó pà Yuda ngie Yěsô zɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie pɔ́ tsẅé ḿbyɛ́bɛ.
en: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the JewsthatJesuswasChrist.

ngiemboon: Tá pà Yuda tiŋ pɔ́ ndʉ̀’, ńzoonte Pɔl. Á lêen ńcʉ́’ ḿbú’ pɔ́ pfepfɔ́b nà menzsǒ mé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie metse mí lɔɔn ḿpfɛte twó pi, mbà yɔ́ɔn nò té mǒ wɔ́. Mèŋ n gee fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, é cʉ́’ʉ shwóŋó nò Ssé pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shookhisraiment, and said unto them, Your bloodbeupon your own heads; Iamclean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gɔɔn pú’u, éfó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, mé tóŋo yé lê Tutius Jẅistẅis. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ, mbà à la záb ntʉ́m we nà Ssé pà Yuda. Ndá yé gwóon ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda.
en: And he departed thence, and entered into a certainman'shouse, named Justus,onethat worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.

ngiemboon: Krispus gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda pâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá ye ntsèm gÿo ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse. Pʉ̀a Korento tà ńgyɔ́ɔn jú’u shwóŋè Pɔl ńzẅíŋ yɔ́b légwɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo. Mé nu’u wɔ́b yɔ́b ntse.
en: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Pɔ́ɔn lécÿɔ’! Shwóŋo nò yɔ́ɔn shwóŋ, tè láŋte,
en: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision,Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pɔgɔ zɔ pǔ ńgwɔ́ nùɔ. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè ku’u légwoon gú tà ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ná gù wɔ́. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńtí nue pʉ̀a pie ée pɔ́ɔn, ée tÿǒsoŋ yɔɔn tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsẅé Korento tà’ ngù’ lê mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́, ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And he continuedtherea year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ áyɛ̌, Galion gwɔ́ ngúmnɔ́ɔn ná pàga ngwòŋ pà*Roma gie mé tóŋo lê Akay. Pà Yuda ńnéŋe tà ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ nzèm Pɔl, ńgwoon yé ńdɔg ńgʉa jʉ’ gie mé sá’a ntsaŋ wɔ́,
en: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,

ngiemboon: ésẅiŋe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn ne sẅite pʉ̀a ńgie pɔ́ gu’te Ssé nà ntí gie*lepʉ̌ té ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: saying, Thisfellowpersuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

ngiemboon: Pɔl jú’ tà ne fa’a lépÿɛ, Galion gwóon ńzá’, ńgɔɔn mbwo pà Yuda ngie: Á kéen pé’e ńgwɔ́ nò lézẅé nyìŋ kà pɔ́ tsɔ̌ máa nò tepòŋ gẅie nyìŋ gÿǒ wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ŋaga nò gí, mbà pà Yuda.
en: And when Paul was now about to openhismouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, OyeJews, reason would that I should bear with you:

ngiemboon: Tá pá’ pi ké sele pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzoŋo nò pɔ́ nà meshwóŋè, pâ mezíŋ mbɔɔ*lepʉ̌ sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ sí la, á líe pɔ́ gẅí. Mèŋ n te ne ńkwoŋo léŋag yɛ̂ ntí mentsaŋ wɔ́!
en: but if it be a question of words and names, andofyour law, look yeto it; for I will be no judge of suchmatters.

ngiemboon: Gallion gɔɔn pú’u, éfó jʉ’ gie mé sá’a ntsaŋ wó, ńjwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: And he drave them from the judgment seat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b métsèm gwoon Sostɛne gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pɔb, ńzye pɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé sá’a ntsaŋ wó lécua yé. Galion tè tsɔ́b.
en: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beathimbefore the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ná’a ńgíŋ ńzye ńnéŋe Korento. Tá ńde’e mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńgʉa Senkerée pá’ à ge kúu*máamáa kanú’ é gʉa lê Siria pâ Piriska pɔ́ Akilas gwɔ́. Pɔl gwaa kúu kanú’, ńzẅaga twó yé ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie à gÿǒ mmó gie à la ka’a mbwo Ssé tà ńcʉ́me.
en: And Paulafter thistarriedthereyet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shornhishead in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu Efeso, Pɔl nyé Piriska pɔ́ Akilas wó, ńgwɔ́ gʉa ńzɔɔn ńgʉa ńkúu*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, éshwóŋ pà Yuda nò.
en: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie pâ pɔ̌ ná’á ńzye ńnéŋe. Tá à tè zẅíŋ.
en: When they desiredhimto tarry longer time with them, he consented not;

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ le’e wɔ́b ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà mèŋ n ge táa tá gíŋe tóo mbʉ̀a pi. Á gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńkúu kanú’, éfó Efeso ńgʉa.
en: but bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Kanú’ gÿo ńkúu Sezare Pɔl sẅɛ́’ ḿbʉ nê Yerósalem, ńtsyɛ’te cú’tè pʉ̀a kristo tá ḿbiŋ fó wó ńgʉa lê Antiokia,
en: And when he had landed at Cæsarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.

ngiemboon: ńkúu Antiokia, ńná’a ńzye ńnéŋe tá ńgʉa, ńzyɛ́’ ye pàga ngwòŋ Galitia pɔ́ Filigia, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: And after he had spent some timethere, he departed, and went overallthe country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Yuda gẅie mé la zyé yé Alekzáŋdeli, mé tóŋo yé lê Apolos tóo Efeso, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgɔɔn nò á kẅɛ, ḿbiŋ ńzsé ŋwà’ne Ssé mboŋó.
en: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man,andmighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Mbà mé ka zí’i yé nò ńnáa nà mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô. Á ne ńnéŋe twó kwà’ mboŋó éshwóŋó yɛ̌ nò ḿbiŋe ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Yěsô pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ á gwɔ́. Tá ńgʉa nà nò kẅè ntse, á zsé yé pɔ́ pá’ Jâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse.
en: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn nò Ssé*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, éshʉa shʉ̌a. Piriska pɔ́ Akilas jú’u shwóŋè yé ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa, ńnyɛte ńda’te yé nò ńnáa ná mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him untothem, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.

ngiemboon: Appolos gÿo ne ńtsɔ́ɔn léfó Efeso ńgʉa nà pàga ngwòŋ Akay, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ jú’ ńkẅiŋte yé, ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo yé, légwɔ́ gie à ge kúu wó, é náa mbwo pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée wó pɔ́ kúe yé mboŋó. Á gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ḿbú ńkẅéte pʉ̀a Kristo pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, mélà’mie Ssé la ne ńtóonte yé,
en: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:

ngiemboon: pâ pà Yuda zɔɔn ńtyé mvfò lá’, ńzóŋo nò ńnáa ná Yěsô, á ne ńdɔgɔ nò gie á fóo tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńnyɛte ńda’te ngie Yěsô zɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, ḿbú ne ńdɔgɔ yé shwóŋè ńjÿɔ́’ɔ ncwò pà Yuda.
en: for he mightily convinced the Jews,and thatpublickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.

ngiemboon: Apolos gwaa gwɔ́ Korento pá’ɔɔn, Pɔl ne ńzyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ gie memáa mekwɛ́ ée wó, ńgʉa tà ńkúu Efeso, ńgyá tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Kristo gwɔ́ wó,
en: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,

ngiemboon: ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi la gwɔ́ tà ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo pé’e tà Ssé náa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a né pi? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg laa zɔɔn fó ńjú’ pá’ mé kíme tsɔ́ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a wɔ́.
en: he said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Pɔl zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Tà ntí lénu’u gẅi ntse la gwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: E laa ntí ye Jâŋ.
en: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John's baptism.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Jâŋ ka ne nu’u pʉ̀a ntse ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie pɔ́ zẅiŋé lékúbe mà, tá ńké ne ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: Pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná nyìŋ gẅie aa nzèm yé ńne ńtóo, ńgɔɔn pú’u, angàŋ gwɔ́ Yěsô.
en: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńgÿó mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse ná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: When they heardthis, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gwɔ́ tà ńzáb mbwó twó pɔ́b, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a kúu ná pɔ́b. Pɔ́ zye léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zɔɔn ńzí’i wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: And when Paul had laidhishands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn ŋwɛ́ métsèm laa mmó ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém.
en: And all the men were about twelve.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lɔg mesaŋ métá, ńké ńgee pɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda á Efesò ŋwɛ́. Eshwóŋó nò Ssé éshʉa shʉ̌a, éshwóŋó pʉ̀a pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u, éfa’a shÿó lékyagte tà pɔ́ zẅíŋ.
en: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Tá’, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a shÿɔg shÿɔg, ńdʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋ, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò lá’ ńgwága nò ná mánzsè Yěsô gẅie Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn. Pɔl lêen ńké ńnyé wɔ́b, éfag pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zẅiŋé lécʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo, ńdɔg ńgʉa lê jʉ’ʉ sekúd Tiranus, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b mmó lyɛ̌’ ntsèm,
en: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, nà ngù’u lá’ yépʉ́a. Tà pʉ̀a metsèm pie é tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia, kà à gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́, ka à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́ wɔ́, á jú’u nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

ngiemboon: E Ssé cʉa ná mbwó Pɔl ńgÿo kwà’ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie mé laa gyá,
en: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:

ngiemboon: tà mé cʉ́’ʉ ńdɔgɔ shúm nzsǒ laa tsì’i shÿó sie é kibé jʉ’e nnɛ́ Pɔl, ńgee ńnáa mbwo megàŋa guɔ. Meguɔ mɔ́b maga,*messé tepòŋ fóo nà petsɔ́ ńkẅɛɛ.
en: so that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pà Yuda gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yɔ́b wó, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ńgwá ńgiŋe ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ, gÿo fà’ shÿó lélɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ńjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ ná pʉ̀a, ńne ńgɔɔn mbwo*messé tepòŋ ngie: Mèŋ n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Yěsô gẅie Pɔl gɔɔn la, ńtsẅi ngie pi kẅɛ!
en: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.

ngiemboon: Epúɔ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pà Yuda sɔɔn mbʉ́a, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Seva, zɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo yɔɔn ntí nò.
en: And there were seven sons ofoneSceva, a Jew,andchief of the priests, which did so.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á fó lyɛ̌’ e*Ssé tepòŋ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé Yěsô, ńgíŋe ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie Pɔl aa wɛ̌, ńgʉa ná pi, pi ee pàwɔ̌?
en: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie essé tepòŋ laa ná yé, kem púɔ Seva nê melà’, ḿbú ńtʉ ńcʉa wɔ́b, ńnéŋ mefʉ̌ŋ ná pɔ́b, tà pɔ́ fó ndá ńkẅɛ ńkÿo té nzsǒ ná pɔ́b.
en: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie ée tÿǒsoŋ Efeso, pà Yuda laa pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, jú’u yɔɔn nò, ḿbú ḿbɔ́g, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô aa wó tɛ’.
en: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a zẅíŋe nò Yěsô, ḿbiŋe ne ńtóo ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a ńkwé’e ngyè yɔb tÿǒ ńzẅíŋe mmó gie pɔ́ ka gÿo, á tepòŋ.
en: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a pie é kaa megàŋ lekàŋ lɔg meŋwà’ne lekàŋ mɔ́b ńtó mé tuɔ pɔ́ mvfò lá’. Mé tsíg nkáb meŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́, é gwɔ́ pàg nkáb ntsá’ móm ntʉ̀a
en: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before allmen: and they counted the price of them, and founditfifty thousandpiecesof silver.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ne ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mé ńgÿo, ashwóŋè yé ne ńkẅi’i saa jʉ’, ńne ńkẅi’i ńgẅiin tʉ̀.
en: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, Pɔl záb ngie à ge gʉa Yerósalem, é gwɔ gʉa é cʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Makedonia pɔ́ ye Akay, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie n dɔɔn ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgíŋe ńgʉa*Roma,
en: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.

ngiemboon: ńkwaŋ pú’u, ńtʉ́ njÿó ńtúmo Timoté pɔ́ Eraste á Makedonia, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é kẅéte yé. Tá kwà’ yé lê twó yé gíŋe ńná’a ńzyé ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia.
en: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó atsɔ̌ máamáa và’ gwe ńtí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ná mánzsè Yěsô.
en: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tâlɔɔn gwɔ́ wó mé tóŋo yé lê Ndermetelẅis, á zɔ́gɔ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńtsó tsɔ́ púɔ mendá ńdɔgɔ fʉ’ʉ máa ndá ssé gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yɛ̌ ssé lê Artémis, ńtsó mé sẅiŋe, é pú ńnáa nkáb mbwo pà tsó tɛ’.
en: For a certainmannamed Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;

ngiemboon: Á cú’te pàtsó laa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn fa’a yɔ́b yɛ̌ ntí fà’, ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie pege jú’u mboŋó pá’ɔɔn ńtí yɔɔn fà’.
en: whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pi ne ńgyá gí ḿbiŋe ne ńjú’u mmó gie nyìŋ wɔɔn gẅie mé tóŋo lê Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn. À ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a ngie messé mie mé lɔgɔ pɔ́ mbwó ńnyɛte é té messé wɔ́. À gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, tà lelÿò pʉ̀a jʉ’ɔɔn zẅíŋ. Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ Efeso wɔ́. Á cʉ́’ pɔ́ mêjʉ’ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pàga ngwòŋ Azia ntsèm ntsèm.
en: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò fa’a lécʉŋte fà’ yégè. À ge gÿo pú’u, mé le gíŋe ńdɔgɔ máamáa ndá ssé Artémis ńtóŋo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Pʉ̀a é le gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie Artemis ee máamáa ssé yege wɔ́. Tá mânyìŋ ntsèm ne ńgu’te yé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia tà mbɔɔ jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo tsetsá’.
en: so that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

ngiemboon: Lóŋ pʉ̀a pie é la jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, la pú ffó. Pɔ́ zye lélɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie: Artémis, éssé pà Efeso, e fǎŋ.
en: And when they heardthese sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, GreatisDiana of the Ephesians.

ngiemboon: Àtÿǒsoŋ ntsèm ntsèm pú ńtága. Alá’ gwoon Gaẅis pɔ́ Alistag, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Makedonia pie pâ Pɔl kɔ́ɔn ńgiŋe, éshwoŋo wɔ́b ńdɔg ńgʉa nê ndùmo tsɔ̌ ntí gyɛ̌ gie mé cú’te wó, ńgÿo megʉa.
en: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne fa’a lézyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’, tá pʉ̀a Kristo tɔ’ɔ yé.
en: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ ngúmnɔ́ɔn ná pàga ngwòŋ Azia, pie ée meshǔ Pɔl, pɔ́ túm pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa sẅíŋte Pɔl ngie à pɔ́ɔn légʉa gyɛ̌.
en: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiringhimthat he would not adventure himself into the theatre.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, mbà jʉ’ é pǔ ńtága. Pɔɔn pʉ̀a gwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn ńga’te yɔb ngyè, petsɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’e ńga’te yɔ́b é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Lelÿò pʉ̀a tè zsé mmó gie mé zɔɔn ńcú’te ńtí yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńkyagte mmó gie á ne ńcʉate, éshwóŋó Alekzáŋdele gẅie pà Yuda ně ńtsóte yé ńtÿɔ́gɔ mvfò. Á ka’a pwó yé tÿǒ, lélɔg shwóŋó lá’ ngie à gẅiin nò gie à ge ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.

ngiemboon: Tá lá’ jú’ ngie aa nyìŋ pà Yuda, ḿbú ńga’te lê ngyè tetʉ̀, á nà mmó menèm mépʉ́a, ngie: Artémis, éssé pà Efeso e fǎŋ.
en: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, GreatisDiana of the Ephesians.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa tÿǒsoŋ, yé fà’ gwɔ́ le ŋwe’e mmó, gÿo tà lá’ láŋte. Á gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Epʉ̀a Efeso, à wɔ̌ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege ne ḿmoŋe ngie atÿǒsoŋo Efeso zɔ pyɛ́bɛ máamáa ndá ssé Artémis, tà mbɔɔ tútú we gẅie à la fó lefàŋ ńgwe?
en: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said,Yemen of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of theimagewhich fell down from Jupiter?

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lʉ’ tè wó wɔ́. Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie pi láŋte, ńgwaa gÿo nò ńkwaŋ.
en: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔ̌g pʉ̀a pɛ̂ ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn, tá, mbà pɔ́ kaa cʉŋte tsɔ́ mmó á nà ndá ssé Artémis wɔ́, ńké tè yé zoonte.
en: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie Ndermetelẅis pâ kwò fa’a yɔ́b gẅiin lésẅiŋe nyìŋ pá’ mé ge ŋaga yé, mbà pàsá’ ntsaŋ ée wó. Melyɛ̌’ mie mé sá’a mentsaŋ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó. Áa jʉ’ gie pɔ́ gẅiin légʉa wó sẅiŋ ntsaŋ!
en: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie pi zɔɔn ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nò ndyɛ̀’ɛ gie pi ge lê ńzɛ́te, pi lɔg ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè gie pàsá’a lá’ zɔɔn ńtáŋte menò wó,
en: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ pi gÿo pɛ́’ɛ̀ tà mé záb ntsaŋ twó pege ngie pege ma’á và’. Pú’u, éfóo ná menò mie é gÿǒ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. Á nue mé lɔɔn ńzɛ́te wégè, pege é le ku’u léshwóŋó mmó gie á gÿǒ tá lá’ pége jʉ’ nzẅìŋ wó wɔ́.
en: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day's uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa tÿǒsoŋ yé fa’ gwɔ léŋwe’e mmo la, gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńtsẅi ngie alá’ piŋ nê membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

ngiemboon: Avà’ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ḿmaga Efeso, Pɔl cú’te pʉ̀a Kristo, ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b, ńdeen ńde’e wɔ́b, ńcʉ́me mánzsè ńgʉa nê Makedonia,
en: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called untohimthe disciples, and embracedthem, and departed for to go into Macedonia.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńzyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a Kristo, éfó wó ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Gelekia,
en: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe wó mesaŋ métá tà ne ńkwaŋa pá’ à ge kúu*máamáa kanú’ gʉa nê Siria, ńdeen ńjú’ ngie pà Yuda ne fa’a lézẅé yé, ńcʉ́’ ńzáb pɔ́ ngie à ge lɔg ye Makedonia.
en: andthereabode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ pʉ̀a pie pâ Pɔl lɔ́ɔn ḿbú ńgiŋe ná yɔɔn kwò legìŋ é mɔɔn. Wɔɔn laa Sopatɛɛ, míŋ Pẅirẅis ńgwɔ́ múɔ Mbelɛ, ńgÿo Alistag pɔ́ Sekondus, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Tesalonika, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo Gaẅis gẅie à la fó Nderbe, ńgÿo Timoté, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo Tishig pɔ́ Torofine é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pàga ngwòŋ Azia.
en: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nùɔ vɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ḿbyɛ́bɛ wég Toras. Tá peg cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ nzèm,
en: These going before tarried for us at Troas.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná peg, peg gÿo ńcʉ́’ ńgwaa kúu yég*máamáa kanú’ á nkʉ̀ŋ ntse tÿǒsoŋ Fillipe, mbà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mie pà Yuda pfɛ́ɛ*mbelég té mvòŋ é kéen ńtɔ́g tà é gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tʉ̀a. Peg kẅɛ́te wɔ́b Toras, pega pɔ̌ ńnéŋe wó tà’ ngàb.
en: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nà ngàba lá’, peg cú’te léjÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Njÿó ne ńgee lʉ́a Pɔl gʉa. Á ne shwóŋó nò Ssé mbwo mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńké shwóŋó wɔ́b shwóŋ tà ńkú tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’.
en: And upon the firstdayof the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà peg cu’té tsɛ̀ɛ lûm ndá gẅie aa nà ndêg we tÿǒ. Mbà mé pǔ ńdyɛ melâm ńtÿɔ́gte ndá tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mûɔ ngwàshùm, mé tóŋo yé lê Eutig, ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe gúndu. Pɔl ké ńkẅi’i ńgɔɔn nò á sag sag, á lyé tà ḿbÿɛ́, ńnyí’i éfó ná ndêg mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, ńzyɛ́bɛ ńgwe nzème pǐ. Mé gɔɔn ngie mé ge pʉ’ʉ yé, ńgyá mbà à kwě.
en: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lêen ńké sẅɛ́’, ńŋwé’e ssé, ńkaa yé ńgẅiin mbwó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie tà pi pú’ mbùm gí, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́,
en: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracinghimsaid, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgíŋe ńkwɔ́’. Pâ pɔ̌ jÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á gíŋe shwóŋó shwóŋó tà njÿó lʉ́a, tá á lêen ńké ńgʉa.
en: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mûɔ shùm wa, mé lɔgɔ yé ḿbiŋ nzèm, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́, mbùm pʉ̀a kyɛ́’ɛ tɛ’.
en: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu*máamáa kanú’ ḿvɔgɔ Asos, á nue Pɔl la záb ngie à ge giŋ pɔ́ ssé tá kẅɛ́te wég wó, é kúu*máamáa kanú’.
en: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.

ngiemboon: Á kẅɛ́te wég Asos, pega pɔ̌ kúu*máamáa kanú’ ńgʉa nê Mitilene,
en: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.

ngiemboon: éfó wó, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ*máamáa kanú’ ńgʉa, ńdá’a lá’ ńgiŋ giŋ tà njÿó lʉ́a. Peg kúu ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ Cʉio ńzyɛ́’ zyɛ́’, yetsɔ́ njÿó gÿo ńgwɔ́ lʉ́a, mbà peg gʉ̌a tà ńzyɛ́’ɛ tÿǒsoŋo Samos, yetsɔ́ njÿó gÿo ńgwɔ́ lʉ́a, mbà peg gʉ̌a tà ńkúu Milet.
en: And we sailed thence, and came the nextdayover against Chios; and the nextdaywe arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the nextdaywe came to Miletus.

ngiemboon: Peg la gwɔ giŋ yɔɔn ntí, tà ńcʉa ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ Efeso cʉa, á gwɔ́ nue Pɔl la záb ngie à tě ge zɔg láte tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia wɔ́, ńne sẅɛ́te ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ Yerósalem lyɛ’ɛ́ Paŋtekɔ̂d pá’ Ssé lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ?
en: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.

ngiemboon: Pɔl kúu Milet, ńtúm mé gʉa ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie é kẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Efeso.
en: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi zsě pá’ mèŋ n ka lɔg ńnéŋe pú’u. Tà fó lyɛ̌’ gie n da kúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia.
en: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka fa’a fà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a té ŋá’té nnɛ́, ńgwaa fa’ ne ńdʉa, ńne ńgyá ngɔ́’, mélà’mie pà Yuda ka ne ńkwoŋo lényɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn ngɔ́’.
en: serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á kẅéte gẅi wɔ́, mèŋ n ka zí’i gẅí. Mèŋ n nka ńnéŋe nà jʉ’e mecú’tè ńzí’i gẅi mmó, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mendá mí ńzí’i gẅi mmó, ńda’te nò Ssé mbwo pi,
en: andhow I kept back nothing that was profitableunto you, but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,

ngiemboon: ńdɔg pú’u, ńtóŋ pà Yuda, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ńgie pɔ́ sele nnɛ́ ńcʉ́me nzèm Ssé, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô.
en: testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńgee nê Yerósalem. A Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ ké ne ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n gʉa wó. Mèŋ m biŋ ńké té ne ńzsé mmó gie á ge kúu wó, é gÿo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:

ngiemboon: Tá mèŋ n kě ne ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo mé shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n ge kúu wó gyá ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ tà mé ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn mbɔɔ tsǎŋ.
en: save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà wɔ̀ɔn le gwɔ́ tè séen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. Ammó gie mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, mèŋ fa’a fà’ gie mé nǎ mbwó mèŋ tà ḿmag. Á gwɔ́ légÿo ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ka tsẅi ngie mèŋ n gÿo. Mèŋ n gɔɔn légʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ lélɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b pá’ e Ssé fó ná Yěsô ńcÿó gem pʉ̀a pú’u.
en: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka cʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi metsèm, ńgiŋe sá’a pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u. M biŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńne ńzsé ngie pi tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńgyá shÿó wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ n ne ńnyɛte shwóŋó gẅi ngie mèŋ n kéen ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie mèŋ n ka ku’u légÿo ńdɔg ńkẅéte gẅí. Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ḿbyé, mbà yɔ́ɔn pwó té mǒ wɔ́.
en: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that Iampure from the blood of allmen.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ka shwóŋó gẅi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie e Ssé la ka’a légÿo. Tà mèŋ n te tsɔ́ mmó lÿoon.
en: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn gí twó kwà’ mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ḿbɔ́ɔn ye nùɔ*njʉ̀njÿò gie Zẅìge Ssé ka cʉ́me mbwo pi ngie pi ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ. Pi líe cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé mboŋó. À la pfɛte metse Míŋ we ńdɔg ńgÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.

ngiemboon: N zsé ngie mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ tá gʉa, menɔ̀ɔn ngẅi kúu nà nùɔ*njʉ̀njÿò yɔ́ɔn, ńzába nò.
en: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a kẅɛ mbɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzye lézí’i cÿɔ̌ nò ńdɔg shwoŋte pʉ̀a Kristo ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋ pɔ́ nzèm pɔ́b.
en: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn légwá’a lÿɔ̀g. Pi kímte ngie n ka lɔg ngù’ tá, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ letsẅɛ́’, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ zsǒ, mèŋ n ne ńnáa ntÿɔgɔ́ mbwo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi té kʉ́a. Tà ńgwɔ́ ná, ńne ńdʉa.
en: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pà’ɔɔn ńne ńcʉ́me gẅi mbwo Ssé ḿbiŋe ne ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie pi zẅí’te shwóŋè yé gie á nyɛɛ pá’ à cÿó gem yégè pú’u. Yɛ̌ shwóŋè ku’u légÿo pi kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé. E Ssé cʉa mǒ ńná shúm mbòŋo sie á la nyɛte ńzáb ńtí pʉ̀a pie ée pé.
en: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

ngiemboon: N daa nkáb nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn. N te ngɔl tsɔ́ɔn. N te menzsǒ nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn.
en: I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé gí ngie mèŋ n ka lɔg pɔ́ mbwó mɔ́ɔn mɔɔn, efa’a fà’ tá ńgẅiin yɔ́ɔn mmó tá mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pega pɔ̌ giŋe gẅiin yɔ́b mmó.
en: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ne ńnyɛɛ gẅi fʉ̀’ ntsèm ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé fa’ pú’u, ńzsé ngie mé ge kẅéte pàtè mmó. Á poŋo lékímte nò gie kwà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô la gɔɔn ngie: Lenǎ mmó à gẅiin fù’ ńcʉa lékẅé.
en: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said,It is more blessed to give than to receive.

ngiemboon: Pɔl la gɔɔn nò tà ńgwaa tsẅé jʉ’, pâ pɔ̌ métsèm kẅí’te ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm táŋte Pɔl, ńzye lélʉa.
en: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul's neck, and kissed him,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ mÿɔgɔ lelÿò mélà’mie à ně ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tè gÿo gíŋe gyá shÿó wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńgʉa ńtsege Pɔl ncwò*máamáa kanú’.
en: sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.

ngiemboon: Pega pɔ̌ gwɔ́ tà fege, peg kúu*máamáa kanú’, ńzyɛ́b zyɛ́b ńgʉa lê Kos. Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, peg gʉa tà ńkúu Rhode, éfó wó ńgʉa tà ńkúu Patara,
en: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and thedayfollowing unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:

ngiemboon: ńgyá*máamáa kanú’ gẅie à gee nê Fenicia, ńkúu tsoló ńgʉa,
en: and finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.

ngiemboon: ńgiŋ giŋ tà ne ńgyá Shʉ̀pele, é gwɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ, peg lɔg ye gwǒŋo ntsíŋ, ńké ńgiŋ giŋ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu ngwòŋ Siria, ńnyé tsetsá’ nà gwǒŋo pwó kyɛ̀bɛ, ńtéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó tʉ̀. Á gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé ge tyé wó, ésẅé’e shúm metʉ̌a tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’.
en: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu wó, ńgyá pʉ̀a Kristo. Pega pɔ̌ ńnéŋe lyɛ̌’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a. A Zẅìge Ssé shwóŋó wɔ́b nò, pɔ́ gɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Pɔ́ɔn lé gʉa Yerósalem.
en: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ngàb mag, peg gíŋ ńcʉ́me mánzsè. Pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm lâ pànzwě lê gubé yɔ́b gʉa ńtsege wég. Pega pɔ̌ gʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa, ńkẅí’te ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé,
en: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, tillwe wereout of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.

ngiemboon: ńde’e, peg gwaa kúu tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’, pɔ́ piŋ nê membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.

ngiemboon: Peg fó Tir ńgʉa tà ńkúu Petolemayis, ńtsyɛ’te mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée wó. Pega pɔ̌ ńnéŋe tà’a lyɛ̌’.
en: And when we had finishedourcourse from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, peg lu ssé, ńgʉa tà ńkúu Sezare, ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Filib gẅie aa Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a pie mé la tsɔ́’ɔ Yerósalem la. Pega pɔ̌ ńnéŋe.
en: And the nextdaywe that were of Paul's company departed, and came unto Cæsarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which wasoneof the seven; and abode with him.

ngiemboon: Á gẅiin gubé yé púɔ pànzwě lekùa, mbà pɔ́ laa zɔ́’ɔ. Pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅii nò gie á fóo mbwo Ssé, a mbwo lá’.
en: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

ngiemboon: Peg tóo wó, tà ńnéŋe lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, mé tóŋo yé lê Agabus, á fó Jẅidea ńtó,
en: And as we tarriedtheremany days, there came down from Judæa a certain prophet, named Agabus.

ngiemboon: ńtó pú’u, légyá wég, ńtó ḿbí nkÿo nzsǒ gẅie Pɔl lɔgɔ ńcúu nzsǒ ye, ńdɔg sele ńkwɛ́ mekwò mé lâ mbwó mé ńgɔɔn ngie: Anò gie a Zẅìge Ssé tsẅǐ à yɔɔn: Mé ge kúu Yerósalem, pà Yuda gwoon ngàŋ nkÿo nzsǒ wɔɔn, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé pá’ɔɔn, ńnáa yé mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul's girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliverhiminto the hands of the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pega mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pɔ́ ée Sezare jú’ pú’u, ńcwoŋo sẅíŋte Pɔl ngie à pɔ́ɔn lépʉʉ Yerósalem.
en: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi lɔgɔ lelʉa ńdɔgɔ ḿvege wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́. N tyé pá’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n taŋté mbùm yɔɔn tà ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńkúu Yerósalem, ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn kwɛ́, ńzẅé wɔ̀ɔn zẅé ńtí Ndè wege Yěsô n de lʉ’.
en: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Peg fa’ shÿó pá’ peg ge tɔ’ɔ yé kékáŋ, éfó ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńcʉ́’ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: Á poŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo mmó gie à ně ńzáb ngie à ge gÿo.
en: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.

ngiemboon: É piŋ ńgwɔ tɔ́g lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, peg cwoŋte mbùm yeg ḿbʉ nê Yerósalem.
en: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Kristo pe Sezare gʉa ńtsege wég, ńkúu wó ńdɔgɔ wég ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Mnasoŋ. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ ngwòŋ Shʉ̀pele, mbà à la záb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô tà mbà ntyě sǎg. Peg gʉa wó pú’u, lélá’a mbʉ̀a yé.
en: There went with us alsocertainof the disciples of Cæsarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu Yerósalem pú’u, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pú ńkúe wég lê lekág.
en: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉa, pega Pɔl gʉa mbʉ̀a Jâg, ńkúu wó pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Yerósalem pú ńtó yɔ́b.
en: And thedayfollowing Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsyɛ’te wɔ́b tà á ku’, á pú ḿbíte menò mie Ssé ka lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

ngiemboon: Pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo jú’u yɔɔn nò á poŋo wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ kwé’e lezíŋ Ssé ńnáa tÿǒ, ńgɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Afɛ̌ weg, gyá jú. Pà Yuda ntsá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kéen ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ pàkú’te*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê té kʉ́a.
en: And when they heardit, they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ ké ne ńjú’u mé gɔɔn ná gù ngie: Ɔ̀ ne ńzí’i mbwo pà Yuda pie ée túmo túm ngie pɔ́ gwá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê. Ngie ɔ̀ ne ńtsẅi ngie tà pɔ́ gíŋe ḿbú’ gubé yɔ́b. Ngie ɔ̀ ne ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b légíŋ ńgiŋe ná pá’ mà lá’ wege né ńzɛ́te.
en: and they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcisetheirchildren, neither to walk after the customs.

ngiemboon: Pege ée pá’ɔɔn, é gÿo lêkɔ́? Pɔ́ ge gǎ wɔ́ é zsé ngie ɔ̀ tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌, á poŋ ɔ̀ gÿo mmó gie peg ge gɔɔn mbwo gù. Epʉ̀a ée jʉ’ɔɔn lekùa pie pɔ́ ka ka’a nò mbwo Ssé.
en: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

ngiemboon: Lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa, pia pɔ̌ gʉa sɔgɔ pʉ̀ ná pi. Gù zɔ ké ńná yɔ́b nkáb gie pɔ́ gẅiin lénáa mǒ, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge kwóon twó sɔ́b. Ɔ̀ gÿo pú’u, mbà pʉ̀a metsèm ge gyá ngie anò gie mé píte ná gù á té nò wɔ́, é zsé ngie ɔ̀ kě ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê kú’te.
en: them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shavetheirheads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; butthatthou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, mbà peg la ŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo pʉ̀a Kristo pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, lélɔg shwóŋó wɔ́b mmó gie peg ka zǎb ngie pɔ́ ne ńgÿo, ńgɔɔn tsoló ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé lɔ̌g ńgwá’ messé, ḿbɔ́ɔn lézẅí’ metse, ḿbiŋ ḿbɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ mbab nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé fomé yé fóme, ńgie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn lépumo wɔ̌wɔɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe.
en: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have writtenandconcluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves fromthingsoffered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lêen ńké ńdɔg pʉ̀a pá lekùa ńgʉa. Njÿó lʉ́a, pɔ́ zye légÿo línɔ́ɔn gie mé gÿo ńdɔg sɔgɔ pʉ̀, ńgÿo tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, ńkúu wó ńgɔɔn lyɛ̌’ gie lésɔgɔ*lɔ̌’ ge lá’ mag. Á lyɛ̌’ó gwɔ́ gie mé ge nuŋe pwɔ́’ é tí twó mâwɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.

ngiemboon: Elyɛ̌’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a sie mé lɔg sɔgɔ pʉ̀ ná nyìŋ cʉ́’ʉ ńgee pɔ́ nku’ú, etsɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ fóo ná pàga ngwòŋ Azia gyá Pɔl gwɔ́ jʉ’e Ssé, pɔ́ ma’a và’ á tsetsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’, ńgwoon Pɔl,
en: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,

ngiemboon: ńkwé’e ngyè yɔb tÿǒ ńga’te ngie: Pʉ̀a Israel, pi tó ńkẅéte wég! Nyìŋ wa wɔɔn. À ne ńgwá ńgiŋe jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńkíme pʉ̀a lá’ pégè té pòŋ, éshwóŋó té pòŋ ná*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê. Tà mbɔɔ ná jʉ’e Ssé yɔɔn. À wɔɔn, mbà à zɔ̌ɔn ńdɔg pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ńtó, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ mǒ,
en: crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth allmenevery where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ ka gya Pɔl pɔ́ Torofine, mûɔ Efeso gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ ne ńgiŋe. Pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa ngie Pɔl lɔgɔ́ yé ńtó ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé.
en: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)

ngiemboon: Avà’ pú ńjÿó tÿǒsoŋ ntsèm. Alá’ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńnɔ́ɔnte ńkÿo ńtó. Pɔ́ kẅi’i ńkú’te Pɔl, éshwoŋo yé ńdɔg fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ńkẅɛ́ tà ńkúu pǐ, mé gwóon ńjÿɔ́’ mencwò kɔ̀’.
en: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gwɔ́ pú’u, ne fa’a lézẅé Pɔl. Tá yɔɔn nò fóon ńgwe letuŋó Tándá metándá ncù pà*Roma. Á jú’ ngie và’ pǔ ńjÿó tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem,
en: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

ngiemboon: ńgwóon ńcú’te pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pâ mentándá pɔ́b. Pâ pɔ̌ nɔ́ɔnte ńgʉa lê jʉ’ gie àlá’ cú’te wó. Alá’ gwɔ́ tà ńgyá pá’ Tándá metándá ncù pâ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù tóo, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńcúa Pɔl wɔ́.
en: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.

ngiemboon: Á tó ńtsẅi mé gwoon Pɔl ńdɔg metsɛ̂n mémbʉ́a ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn aa wɔ̌? À gÿǒ lêkɔ́?
en: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commandedhimto be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.

ngiemboon: Tá’, alá’ ne ńga’te pɔ́ mengyè mengyè. Á pú tè tsɔ́ nò jú’, ńtí shwǒŋ. Á tsẅi ngie mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a pàlÿɔ́’ ncù.
en: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu jʉ’e mesetɔ̂b, alá’ nÿɔgɔ lézẅé yé. Tá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù fó ńcʉ́’ ńkaa yé kaa.
en: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, alá’ gwɔ́ nzèm ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé zẅé yé.
en: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.

ngiemboon: Mé gʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ léńnéŋe Pɔl á mbʉ̀a pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, á gɔɔn mbwo Tándá metándá ncù ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé zẅíŋ mèŋ n gɔɔn nò? Andÿò ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie ɔ̀ fǒon ńzsé léshwóŋó Gelekia ka?
en: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?

ngiemboon: Ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ tě ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Egipto wa gẅie á ka tóo jʉ’ɔɔn, ńnuŋe nzòŋ, ńcú’te pʉ̀a ntsá’ lekùa ńdɔg ńcʉ́me nkwòŋo tsẅɛ wa wɔ́ keen?
en: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ, n gee nyìŋ Yuda, mé zyé wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Tarso, á nà pàga ngwòŋ Silisia. Mèŋ n gee nyìŋ tÿǒsoŋ gie mé ée nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ ńzsé lezíŋ sé. Tsetsɔ́’, léen ńzẅíŋ mèŋ n gɔɔn nò mbwo lá’.
en: But Paul said, I am a manwhich ama Jew of Tarsus,a cityin Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.

ngiemboon: Tándá metándá ncù zẅíŋ. Pɔl tyé nà mesetɔ̂b, ńka’a pwó yé ńnáa tÿǒ. Ejʉ’ lêen ndáŋa, á lɔgɔ shwóŋè pà Yuda ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie:
en: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake untothemin the Hebrew tongue, saying,

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, metá pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅí’te. Mèŋ n gee ḿbíte ncwò wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defencewhich I makenow unto you.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda jú’ pá’ à ne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋè lá’ yɔ́b ńgɔɔn nò, ńkẅi’i ńdáŋte. Pɔl gɔɔn ngie:
en: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee mûɔ Yuda. Mé zyé wɔ̀ɔn tÿǒsoŋ Tarso, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Silisia. Tà mbà n da gú’ pɔ́ Yerósalem wɔɔn; tà Gamalielzɔ̌ gwɔ́ tsítsa wɔɔn. Á la nyɛte ńzí’i wɔ̀ɔn lepʉ̌ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pég. Mèŋ n daa nyìŋ, ńgáŋ nnɛ́ nà nò Ssé pɔ́ pá’ pi metsèm gÿo lyɛ̌’ɔɔn lɛ.
en: I am verily a manwhich ama Jew, born in Tarsus,a cityin Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel,andtaught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da gwɔ́ gwɔ̌ tà ńtsɔ́’ɔ kwò pàgiŋe ná mánzsè Yěsô té pòŋ, ńgÿo mé gwoon mbàŋa lâ pànzwě ḿma’a ndá tsǎŋ tà mbɔɔ pá’ mé lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ mé tóo wó ńzẅé wɔ́b zẅé.
en: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

ngiemboon: Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, mbaa cú’tè pàsá’a lá’ɔɔn, ne ńzsé ngie nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn áa nénʉ́. Pɔ́ zɔ̌ la zɔɔn ńná meŋwà’ne ńdɔg ńtúmo wɔ̀ɔn ngie n gʉa ńnyɛɛ mbwo mefɛ́ pégè pà Yuda pie pɔ́ ée tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Ndamas. Á gwɔ́ ngie n gwoon pʉ̀a Kristo, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ḿbiŋ nzèm nê Yerósalem. Légwɔ́ gie mé ge gÿo pɔ́ gyá ngɔ́’.
en: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n cʉ́me mánzsè, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu Ndamas, á gwɔ́ kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ. Atsɔ́ mmó lêen fó tÿǒ lepwó, ḿbú ńkyɛ’ɛ wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’.
en: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gwe ssé, ńgwóon ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn lé mèŋ ngie: Sɔ̂l, Sɔ̂l, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me,Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɛ́te ngie aa gù wɔ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a? Angàŋ tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ, n gee Yěsô, mûɔ Nǎzarɛd. Ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ pá’a pɔ́ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ.
en: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me,I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pega pɔ̌ ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ gyá pá’ ammó kyɛ̌’ jʉ’ tá’, ńké tè jú’ ngyè nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn nò lé mèŋ wɔ́.
en: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.

ngiemboon: N zɛ́te yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo mèŋ ngie: Lu ssé, ńgʉa Ndamas. Ɔ̀ ge kúu wó tá mé shwóŋó gú kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gÿo.
en: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me,Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mmó pǔ ńkyɛ’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn tà mèŋ fʉ. Epʉ̀a pie pega pɔ̌ é ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ lêen ńké ńkíbe pwó yɔ́ɔn, ńtsege wɔ̀ɔn tÿǒsoŋ Ndamas.
en: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu wó, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó. Mé tóŋo yé lê Ananias. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgÿo mekù’ Ssé kwà’ pá’*lepʉ̌ ségè ne ńzɛ́te. Pà Yuda pie pɔ́ tsẅé tÿǒsoŋ Ndamas tà ḿmaga wɔ́b pɔ́ kíme yé pɔ́ mboŋó.
en: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dweltthere,

ngiemboon: Ananias tó ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn, ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Afɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn Sɔ̂l, gíŋe ńzye légyá jʉ’. N gwóon ńtyé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn nyɛ́’ɛ tà mèŋ n cwoŋo ńgyá Ananias
en: came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé pàmagʉa njʉ’ pégè léen ntʉ́ njÿó ńtsɔ́’ɔ gú, á lé lɔgɔ gú ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie à ge zsé mmó gie à la zába légÿo, mbɔɔ légÿo ɔ̀ gyá nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ gílé yé, mbɔɔ lé jú’ ngyè wɛ̌ nyìŋ.
en: And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ zɔɔn ńtyé pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńgẅiin légʉa jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, éshwóŋ pʉ̀a nò gie ɔ̀ zsé ná yé. Á gie ɔ̀ gyǎ, mbɔɔ gie ɔ̀ jǔ’.
en: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńnyé ńzẅí’te kɔ́. Lu ssé ńtó mé lɔg lezíŋ sé ńnu’u gú ntse, ńdɔg sɔg menò tepòŋ mú.
en: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.

ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔnte ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ne sẅíŋte Ssé, Yěsô tó ńnyɛ mbùm yé mbwo mèŋ.
en: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá yé, á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Sẅɛte fó Yerósalem wɔɔn ńgʉa, mélà’mie pʉ̀a pie é tsẅe wó té ge zẅíŋe nò gie ɔ̀ ge shwóŋó wɔ́b é tí wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: and saw him saying unto me,Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pɔ́ ne ńzsé mboŋó pá’ mèŋ n dɔ̌ɔn ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda ńgwoon pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m ná gú, ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ mengwɔ̀ɔn ńcúa wɔ́b.
en: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa pfɛte metse Etien gẅie à la ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a nò gie à zsé ná gú, n gwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn ssé. Pega pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la zẅé yé laa tà’ ncwò; tà pɔ́ gwɔ témte yé lê metóon ézẅé, mèŋ n ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ menzsǒ mɔ́b.
en: and when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Lwo, mèŋ n túmo gú pá’ɔɔn ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a ntí ntí pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: And he said unto me,Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda pie pɔ́ la zẅí’te nò gie Pɔl ne ńgɔɔn, tà ńjú’ á gɔɔn pá’ à gɔ̌ɔn lɔɔn, la lêen ńkwé’e ngyè yɔ́b, ńnáa tÿǒ ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé véle shÿó ntí nyìŋ wɛ̂ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. À tè gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé nyé yé á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́,
en: And they gave him audience unto this word, andthenlifted up their voices, and said, Away with such afellowfrom the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńne ńdíte ngwòŋ, ńne ńcʉ’te menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńŋwaa pfepfɔ́b ḿma’a tÿǒ.
en: And as they cried out, and cast offtheirclothes, and threw dust into the air,

ngiemboon: Tándá metándá ncù pà*Roma, lêen ńké ńtsẅi ngie pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔgɔ yé ḿbiŋe mbʉ̀a pɔ́b, ńdɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn ńnyɛte ńcúa yé, ńtsóte yé à gɔɔn mmó gie alá’ kwʉŋe yé mǒ.
en: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.

ngiemboon: Mé zye lékwɛ́ɛ Pɔl pá’ mé gee ńcúa yé. Á gɔɔn mbwo tándá ncù gẅie aa jʉ’ó ngie: Mé ge líe líe pi cúa mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma té mé zɔɔn fó ńŋaga yé wɔ? À wɔ̌ tsẅi pú’u?
en: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

ngiemboon: Á jú’ ḿvege, ńkÿote ńgʉa ńgyá tándá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo lêkɔ́? Ambàŋa wa aa mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma.
en: When the centurion heardthat, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.

ngiemboon: Tándá wɔ́b jú’ yé, ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Pɔl, ńzɛ́te ngie: Shwóŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mé gɔ̌ɔn ngie ɔ́ɔ mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma lá? Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: Oon.
en: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.

ngiemboon: Tándá metándá ncù gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ, mé la lá’ ńgwɔ zẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n cʉ’ʉ́ mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma, ńcʉŋ nkáb mǒ tà e tè kɔ́g. Tá Pɔl tsɔ́’ yé mbwo yé ngie: Ɛɛ! Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mé la zyé wɔ̀ɔn n gwɔ́ pɔ́ mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma.
en: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kě ńtyé lécúa Pɔl, á lélɔg ńgÿo á gɔɔn nò, fó lejʉ́ŋ yé ńkÿo. Tándá metándá ncù zsé ngie à ně fʉa légÿo mé kwɛ́ɛ mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma lê metsɛ̂n, ńtyé ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ̌g.
en: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Tándá metándá ncù fa’a lékwa’ ńnyɛte ńzsé mmó gie pà Yuda ka gwaa sẅiŋe Pɔl, ésẅiŋe ńtí yɛ̌, ńtsẅi mé kyɛ́’ metsɛ̂n ná yé, ńgíŋe ńtsẅi mé tóŋ mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lâ petsɔ́ pàŋag ntsaŋ pà Yuda, ńdeen ńké ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńcwóŋ ńtó ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò pɔ́b.
en: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him fromhisbands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.

ngiemboon: Pɔl nyɛte ńtÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g mé ná pàŋag ntsaŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gee ńzɔ́gɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mvfò Ssé tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. Atsɔ́ mmó té tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ ne ńgege wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́,
en: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Menandbrethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, Ananias, tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée lejʉ́ŋ Pɔl ngie pɔ́ cúa yé ncwò yé.
en: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: E Ssé ge cúa pɔ́ gú mè ngàŋ mepàb. Ɔ̀ wɛ̂ ńnéŋe ssé ne ńdɔgɔ*lepʉ̌ ńŋaga wɔ̀ɔn. Ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńtsẅi ngie mé cúa wɔ̀ɔn. Á ké tè mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́.
en: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee,thouwhited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tyé lejʉ́ŋ Pɔl gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ zoonte tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie Ssé la záb la?
en: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n zɔ̌ɔn kaa zsé ngie wɛ̂ aa tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́. Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie tè lá’ shwóŋe té pòŋ ná fùɔ lá’ gẅi.
en: Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne ńzsé ngie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ né ńŋaga ntsaŋ yé, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ pà*sadukay, petsɔ́ gwɔ́ pà*farisay, ńdeen ńké ńtyé mvfò pɔ́b ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gee nyìŋ*farisay. Mbà tá wɔ̀ɔn laa nyìŋ*farisay. Mèŋ n ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ lyɛ̌’ gie mepfó ge lá’ zíme nà legwé. Mé ée jʉ’ɔɔn ńŋaga wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ yɛ̌ nò.
en: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Menandbrethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ka’a twó ńnyé té cʉ́me. Pà*farisay lâ pà*sadukay zye lézoŋ. Acú’tè gab nzsè pʉ́a.
en: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, pà*farisay gɔɔn ngie mepfó ge lá’ zím, ńgie*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔɔ*messé tepòŋ ée wɔ́, tá ńgʉa ná pà*sadukay pɔ́ té zẅíŋ yɔ́b pú’u wɔ́.
en: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm zye léshwóŋó shwǒŋ. Petsɔ́ pà kyágte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê nà nùɔ pà*farisay lu ssé ńgɔɔn nê metʉ̀ ngie: Peg kaa gyá nò tepòŋ gie nyìŋ wɛ̂ gÿǒ wɔ́. Ndyɛ̀’ tsɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ Zẅìge kà pɔ́ tsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé wɔ́ zɔ gɔ̌ɔn nò mbwo yé.
en: And there arose a great cry: and the scribesthat wereof the Pharisees' part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.

ngiemboon: Mé pú ńga’a lézoŋ. Tándá metándá ncù pà*Roma gyá ḿbɔ́g, ńgie pɔ́ ge tsyete Pɔl mekèm mekèm, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅi né pàlÿɔ́’ ncù ngie pɔ́ lwo sẅɛ́’, ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ Pɔl fó jʉ’ gie mé sá’a ntsaŋ wó ńkẅɛ, ńgie pɔ́ lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a pɔ́b.
en: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bringhiminto the castle.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ́’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó ńgɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Kag pɔ́ tʉ̀. Ɔ̀ ka gɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌ Yerósalem wɔɔn. Á gíŋe ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gìŋ ńgɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌ á tÿǒsoŋo*Roma.
en: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said,Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, etsɔ́ pà Yuda tÿɔ́g ntsèm, ńtyé mvfò Ssé ńkʉa ngie: Pɔ́ té jÿó mmó wɔ́, é ké le ntse nú. Tà lá’ zẅé Pɔl!
en: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la kʉa pá’ɔɔn la tɔ́g pʉ̀a móm lekùa.
en: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńgyá metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěm ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Peg ně ńtyé mvfò Ssé ńkʉa ngie peg tě ge jÿó mmó té gwɔ́ gie peg zẅě Pɔl wɔ́.
en: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te ngie; pia petsɔ́ pàŋag ntsaŋ túm mé gʉa mbʉ̀a Tándá metándá ncù, ńzɛ́te yé ngie à gÿo mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńtóo mvfò pi, ńgie mé tó shwóŋó yé ngie pi ne fa’a lényɛte ńdíe nò ná ntsaŋ nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ kwà’ mboŋó, ńgʉa ná peg, mbà peg tyé lézẅé yé tà á le tó tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa gɔɔn pú’u, tsɔ̌ mûɔ mbàŋa, ńgwɔ́ míŋ fɛ́ Pɔl we manzwě, ne ńjú’u pá’ pɔ́ lʉ̌’ lejÿɔ’, ńdu ssé ńgʉa mbʉ̀a pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, ńkúu ndá ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó Pɔl.
en: And when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tóŋo tsɔ̌ tà’ tándá ncù, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lɔgɔ mûɔ shùm wɔɔn, ńgʉa ńtsege yé mbʉ̀a tándá gẅì. À gẅiin nò gie à gee shwǒŋ yé.
en: Then Paul called one of the centurions untohim, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńtsege mbʉ̀a tándá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pɔl, ngàŋa tsǎŋ, à toŋó wɔ̀ɔn, ńcʉ́me ngie mèŋ n dɔgɔ wɔɔn mûɔ shùm ńtó, ńtsege yé mbwo gù, ńgie à gẅiin nò gie à gee shwǒŋ gù.
en: So he took him, and broughthimto the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me untohim, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.

ngiemboon: Tándá metándá ncù kíbe pwó mûɔ shùm pɔ́ yé gʉa nzèm. Á zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gẅiin kɔ́ gie ɔ̀ gee shwǒŋ mèŋ?
en: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and wentwith himaside privately, and askedhim, What is that thou hast to tell me?

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Pà Yuda é kwɛ̌ ngie, njÿó ge lʉ́a, pɔ́ tó ńzɛ́te gú ngie ɔ̀ gÿo mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńtóo mvfò pàsá’ ntsaŋ, é lɔg pú’u, epaba gú ngie pɔ́ fa’a lényɛte ńdíe nò ńnáa nà ye ntsaŋ kwà’ mboŋó.
en: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ lɔɔn ńtó ńgɔɔn ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lézẅíŋ, mélà’mie pʉ̀a tà ńtɔ́g móm lekùa ge lʉ’ lejÿɔ’ lélɔg ńgwoon Pɔl. Pɔ́ ně ńgɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie, pɔ́ lɔɔn nyé té zẅé Pɔl, pɔ́ le mmó zẅí’, é ké le ntse nú. Pɔ́ ée nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà pɔ́ nyɛté mbùm yɔ́b ne ńzẅí’te pɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ zẅíŋ.
en: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.

ngiemboon: Tándá metándá ncù jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn né mûɔ shùm ngie: Tè gíŋe shwóŋó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ nò gie ɔ̀ lu ssé léshwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn mɛ, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅi á gʉa.
en: So the chief captainthenlet the young man depart, and chargedhim, See thoutell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ńgʉa nà metándá ncù pé, ńtsɔ́’ pe mépʉ́a, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ nyɛte pàlÿɔ́’ ncù nkÿo pʉ́a, ńgÿo pàkwɔ́’ melÿoon móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a, lê pàgẅiin mekwoŋ nkÿo pʉ́a. Pɔ́ tyé pá’ nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ letsẅɛ́’ ge lêen gwaa ku’ pɔ́ lu ssé ńgʉa nê Sezare.
en: And he called untohimtwo centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Cæsarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe ńnyɛte metsɔ́ melÿoon pie Pɔl ge kwɔ́’ɔ ndùmó é lɔg giŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa ńtsege yé mvfò ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese tà nkǐb le yé kʉa.
en: and providethembeasts, that they may set Paul on, and bringhimsafe unto Felix the governor.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese, ńgɔɔn tsoló ngie:
en: And he wrote a letter after this manner:

ngiemboon: Àa mèŋ Kɔlɔde Lisias. Mèŋ n ŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo gù ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese. Màkwáŋ weg, n tsyɛ’té.
en: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felixsendethgreeting.

ngiemboon: Áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà pà Yuda ka gwoon nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n túmo yé ńnáa mbwo gù lɛ, ńne fa’a lézẅé yé. Mèŋ n jú’ mé gɔɔn ngie aa mûɔ lá’ pà*Roma, n deen ńké ńdɔg pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pɔ́ɔn ńtó ńkẅé yé mbwo pɔ́b.
en: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ne fa’a lécÿó nnɛ́ ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ kẅé mbwo yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa mvfò pàŋag ntsaŋ pɔ́b.
en: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:

ngiemboon: Tá ńdeen ńké ńgyá ngie pɔ́ sẅiŋe yé pɔ́ nà tsɔ́ mejʉ’ nà mbʉ̌ mɔ́b mie pâ pɔ̌ té shwóŋe ńjú’e mǒ wɔ́. Mèŋ m biŋ ńké té gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ mé cʉa mmó ńzẅé yé kà ńnéŋe yé pɔ́ tsǎŋ wɔ́.
en: whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.

ngiemboon: Mé tǒ shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn ngie pà Yuda ne fa’a lézẅé nyìŋ ŋwɛ́. Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ, n gwǒon ńtúmo yé ńnáa mbwo gù té láte. N zɛté mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sẅiŋé yé ngie pɔ́ gʉa sẅiŋ ntsaŋ pɔ́ kwà’ mbwo gù. [Mèŋ n cʉmé ŋwà’ne jʉ’ɔɔn, à cʉ́’ʉ wɔ́gɔ́]
en: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee whatthey hadagainst him. Farewell.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù gÿo mmó gie tándá wɔ́b tsẅǐ né pɔ́b, ńdá’a lá’ ńdɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa tà ńkúu Antipatelis.
en: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and broughthimby night to Antipatris.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, petsɔ́ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù nyé Pɔl mbwo pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin melÿoon. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ lɔgɔ yé gʉa, pɔ́ piŋ nzèm lê membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:

ngiemboon: Pàkwɔ́’ melÿoon lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tà ńkúu Sezare, ńnáa ŋwà’ne mbwo ngúmnɔ́ɔn, ńgíŋe nyé Pɔl mbwo yé.
en: who, when they came to Cæsarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn tóŋo ŋwà’ne, ńzɛ́te Pɔl ngie: Ɔ̀ fóo nà yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ? Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ fóo ná pàga ngwòŋ Silisia.
en: And when the governor had readthe letter, he asked of what province he was. And when he understood thathe wasof Cilicia;

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge zẅí’te tà pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sẅiŋé gù tó tá mèŋ n zɛ́te gú nò, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtsẅi ngie mé gʉa ńde’e Pɔl á nɔ’ fùɔ*Herôd.
en: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall.

ngiemboon: É tɔ́g lyɛ̌’ tʉ̀a, Ananias, tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, cwóŋ nê Sezare. Pâ tsɔ́ mekěm lá’, ńgÿo Tertulus, á gwɔ́ ntàg nzèm wɔ́b jʉ’e ntsaŋ. Pɔ́ tóo wó ésẅiŋe Pɔl mvfò ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese.
en: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, andwitha certain oratornamedTertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo Pɔl tó, Tertulus zye légɔɔn nò twó yé ngie: ANdè, peg ee lá’ɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwaa ńnéŋe kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ́lè, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ gú nà menò mie ɔ̀ ka lɔgɔ zsè nò jú ńzáb ngie mé kúbe tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a yég.
en: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accusehim, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńgwaa jÿó pì mɛ̌ menò, á jʉ’ ntsèm, éfʉ̀’ ntsèm ḿbú ne sie gú tà ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò.
en: we acceptitalways, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

ngiemboon: Tá’, n te ne ńkwoŋo létyé mvfò Ndè séen ńtseŋe nà shwóŋè tseŋe wɔ́. Á cʉa pú’u, tá mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte ngie Ndè lɔgɔ pòŋo ntʉ́m ńzẅí’te nò gie mèŋ n ge ná’a píte shwóŋó yé.
en: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.

ngiemboon: Peg ka gyǎ nyìŋ wɔɔn á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé pɔ́gɔ yé tɛ’. À ne ḿma’a tág tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda metsèm, á jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Àa pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ tándá tsɔ́ pàfag nnɛ́ pie mé tóŋo lê pà Nazaréen.
en: For we have found this manapestilentfellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:

ngiemboon: Á ka zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ mejʉ’ à zába tsɔ́ nò. À kɔ̌ɔn ge ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ nà jʉ’e Ssé tá peg lêen ńké ńgwoon yé. [Peg ka ne fá’a lélɔg kwà’*lepʉ̌ lá’ seg ńŋaga yé.
en: who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.

ngiemboon: Tá Lisias, tándá metándá ncù tó ńdɔg metʉ̀ sa’a yé mbwo peg,
en: But the chief captain Lysias cameupon us, and with great violence tookhimaway out of our hands,

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi ngie pʉ̀a pie é sẅiŋe yé pɔ́ lɔg ntsaŋ ńtó pɔ́ mvfò gú]. Zɛ́te nyìŋ wɛ nò, tà ɔ̀ lɔɔn séen tè gyá ngie menò mie peg sẅiŋe yé mǒ ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn Pà Yuda tóonte nò yé ngie: Oon à shwóŋó nò.
en: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese lɔgɔ tsɔ́ liŋé ńtsẅi ngie Pɔl gɔɔn nò. Pɔl gɔɔn ngie: Ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mengù’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pá’ ɔ̀ ne sá’a lá’ yɔɔn. Á cʉa pú’u, tá ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n dɔɔn ńtyé mvfò gù ne ńgee ńzoŋo twó yɔ́ɔn, n de pɔ́g.
en: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:

ngiemboon: Anò gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn, ɔ̀ ku’u léfa’ jú lê twó mbùm ɔ̀ ńgyá kà aa nénʉ́ wɔ́, ée lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndà’ lyɛ̌’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém pá’ mèŋ n ka gʉa Yerósalem légu’te Ssé.
en: because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.
