ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka tè kúu wó mé gyá peg tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tyé ne ńzoŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Mé ké tè gyá n ne sẅite lá’ gwɔ́, kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé wɔ́, kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda wɔ́, kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ wó wɔ́.
en: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:

ngiemboon: Menò mɛ mie pʉ̀a tÿɔ́gɔ twó mèŋ lɛ, mé lɔɔn ngie megàŋ píte pɔ́ le zsé lépíte wɔ́.
en: neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.

ngiemboon: Tá’, anò gie n ge tyé mvfò gù, éshʉ̀ashʉ̀a zẅíŋ á gwɔ́ ngie: Mèŋ fa’a mbwo Ssé pàmangʉa njʉ’ pega pɔ̌. N ne ńgiŋe pɔ́ ná mánzsè gẅie pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ ngie aa we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fǎg nnɛ́, tà mbɔɔ pá’ mèŋ n ne ńzẅíŋe kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, atsɔ́ mmó gwɔ́ wó gie mèŋ n ne ńzẅí’te. Tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sẅiŋé wɔ̀ɔn mɛ gíŋe ne ńzẅí’te yɔ́b pɔ́ yɛ̌. Á gwɔ́ ngie e Ssé ge lá’ zím mepfó, é zím pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gÿo pá’ à ne ńkwoŋo, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é la tè gÿo pú’u wɔ́.
en: and have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n ne ńkaga tʉ̀ légiŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ á mvfò Ssé, mbɔɔ mvfò pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, andtowardmen.

ngiemboon: N ka ńnéŋe túm tɛ’. N kaa pá’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ m biŋé Yerósalem pɔ́ léná nkáb ńdɔg ńkẅéte lá’a yég, mbɔɔ lénáa mmó lélɔg ńgu’te Ssé.
en: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.

ngiemboon: N ka léen ńké ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, tá pɔ́ tóo wó ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn, ńgwaa wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n kě fóo légÿo mmó gie mèŋ n dɔgɔ sɔgɔ pʉ̀ ná mèŋ. Alá’ ka tè wó wɔ́. Atsɔ́ tág piŋ ńké tè kẅɛ.
en: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.

ngiemboon: Á ka gwaa gwɔ́ etsɔ́ ntá’ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ fóo ná pàga ngwòŋ Azia gwɔ́ yɔ́b jʉ’ó. Tà á kaa pé’è ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ka fʉa tsɔ́ nò, mbà pɛ̌ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ zɔ kɔ’ɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn lésẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn mbwo gù.
en: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.

ngiemboon: Kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔɔn pie ée jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn, gɔɔn mmó gie mé ka lɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgʉa mvfò pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda pé’è, pàsá’a lá’ ŋwɛ́ gyá ngie mèŋ fʉ̌a wɔ́?
en: Or else let these sameheresay, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,

ngiemboon: Tà’a nò aa wó ńgwɔ́ gẅie n da tyé mvfò pɔ́b, ńkwé’e ngyè yɔɔn tÿǒ ńgɔɔn á gwɔ́ pá’ n da gɔɔn ngie, mé lɔ́ɔn sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn mvfò pɔ́b lyɛ̌’ó ńtí nue mèŋ n zẅǐŋ ngie e Ssé ge lá’ zím mepfó.
en: except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.

ngiemboon: Pá’ á la gwaa gwɔ́ Felese cwoŋo ne ńzsé nò ná mánzsè Yěsô la, á tsɔ́’ɔ lyɛ’ɛ́ ntsaŋ, ńgɔɔn né pà Yuda ngie: Lisias, tándá metándá ncù ge taa tó tá mèŋ n ŋag ntsaŋ gi,
en: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge ofthatway, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅii mbwo tándá ncù ngie à lɔ́gɔ Pɔl ńgʉa ńde’e yé ndá tsǎŋ. Tè ke ńkwɛ́ɛ yé. Tè ke ńtɔ’ meshǔ pé létó ńkẅéte yé.
en: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to lethimhave liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, angúmnɔ́ɔn Felese pɔ́ zwě we Ndelẅisile gẅie aa mûɔ Yuda tó. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn tsẅi mé gʉa fa’a Pɔl né yé. Pá’ à ge zẅí’te nò gie Pɔl ge shwóŋó yé nà lézáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tó tà ńzye lékyagte ntí gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔg ńnéŋe, mbà ngàŋ ge gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo mmó gie á poŋo mbwo Ssé, ńne ńkyagte mbɔɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kú’te mbùm ye pú’u, ńne ńkyagte shwóŋó yé ngie Ssé ge gÿo ŋag pʉ̀a metsèm. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese jú’ pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńcÿɔ’ɔ cÿɔ’, ńgɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Á nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńgʉa. Afʉ̀’ gÿo ńgíŋe ńku’, tá mèŋ n gíŋe ńtsẅi mé tóŋo gú ńné mèŋ.
en: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese gíŋe ne ńtsɔɔn ngie Pɔl ná nkáb lé yé. Áa mmó gie á gÿo á ńnéŋe ńgwá ńtsẅii mé gÿo Pɔl tóo pɔ́ yé shwóŋó,
en: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.

ngiemboon: ńgwá ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà é gwaa gwɔ́ ngù’ pʉ́a, mé lɔgɔ ngúmnɔ́ɔn Porsius Festus ńkúbe Felese. Pá’ Felese la ne ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋ pà Yuda la, à nyé Pɔl pɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ.
en: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe Festus lésá’a yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ é cʉa lyɛ̌’ tá, à fó tÿǒsoŋo Sezare ḿbʉ ńgʉa Yerósalem,
en: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Cæsarea to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, pâ mekěm pà Yuda tó sẅiŋe Pɔl mvfò yé, ḿbú ńkute nò mǒ tɛ’,
en: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,

ngiemboon: ésẅíŋte yé ngie: Tsetsɔ́’ gÿo, Pɔl tó tà ńkúu Yerósalem, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ne fa’a lénuŋe nzòŋ gie e ge zá’a Pɔl mánzsè zẅé yé.
en: and desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.

ngiemboon: Festus jú’, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pɔl aa ndá tsǎŋ Sezare. Kwà’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n zɔɔn tě ge ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn tɛ’ wɔ́.
en: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Cæsarea, and that he himself would depart shortlythither.

ngiemboon: Mekěme lá’ pi zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tó pegá pɔ̌ gʉa tà ńkúu Szare, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ ŋwɛ́, à ka gÿo nò tepòŋ, pɔ́ sẅiŋ ntsaŋ.
en: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down withme, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.

ngiemboon: Festus gÿo pú’u, ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b Yerósalem mmó lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn kà lyɛ̌’ legém tsɔ́ wɔ́, ńdeen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm lê Sezare. Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, á ńnéŋe ssé léŋag ntsaŋ, ńtsẅi ngie mé gÿo Pɔl tó.
en: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Cæsarea; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tó. Pà Yuda pie pɔ́ fǒ Yerósalem ńcwóŋ ńtó, tÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋe sòŋ, ńtÿɔ́g menò mie é tʉ tʉ twó yé tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn. Nyìŋ wɔb gẅie à ge ké píte tà metwó kẅɛ ké tè wó wɔ.
en: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.

ngiemboon: Pɔl zoon nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn ngie: N kaa nò tepòŋ gÿo. N kaa*lepʉ̌ pà Yuda fʉa. N kaa shwóŋó té pòŋ ná*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́, ńké tè shwóŋó té pòŋ ná Kása pà*Roma wɔ́.
en: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Cæsar, have I offended any thing at all.

ngiemboon: Festus piŋ ne fa’a légÿo pá’ nò ge poŋ pà Yuda, ńzɛ́te Pɔl ngie: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ zẅíŋ ḿbiŋe Yerósalem ńzsé ngie mèŋ n ge ŋag jù ntsaŋ?
en: But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn jʉ’ʉ ntsaŋ ye Kása. Mé ge ŋag yɔɔn ntsaŋ pɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn ŋwɛ́. N kaa tsɔ́ nò mbwo pà Yuda fʉa. Ɔ̀ cwoŋó ne ńzsé.
en: Then said Paul, I stand at Cæsar's judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.

ngiemboon: Á kɔ’ɔ́ pé’è ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ fʉ̌a tsɔ́ nò, tà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn zẅé, mbà mèŋ n te ne ńdʉ’ʉ lékwé wɔ́. Pá’ tsɔ́ nò nénʉ́ té nà nò gie pɔ́ zába twó mèŋ lɛ wɔ́ la, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè gẅiin pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á tsege wɔ̀ɔn ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́. Mèŋ n ne ńzɛ́te ngie, mé zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńŋag yɔɔn ntsaŋ pɔ́ mvfò Kása.
en: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Cæsar.

ngiemboon: Festus pâ pʉ̀a pé pie pɔ́ náa yé ntÿɔgɔ́ tuu nò mǒ. Á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né Pɔl ngie, pá’ ɔ̀ zɛté ngie Kása zɔ ge ŋag jù ntsaŋ la, ɔ̀ ge ké gʉa mvfò yé.
en: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Cæsar? unto Cæsar shalt thou go.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, afùɔ Agrippa pɔ́ fɛ́ we we manzwě gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Mbelenis, tóo Sezare, létsyɛ’te Festus.
en: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Cæsarea to salute Festus.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ná’a ńzye ńnéŋe, Festus píte nò ntsaŋ Pɔl éshwóŋó fùɔ Agrippa, ńgɔɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ aa jʉ’ɔɔn, mbà ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese ka gwɔ́ gʉa à gwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ.
en: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul's cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka gʉa Yerósalem, ńkúu wó, mentándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda sẅiŋe yé mbwo mèŋ, ńgie mèŋ n záb ngie à gwě ntsaŋ.
en: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informedme, desiringto havejudgment against him.

ngiemboon: Tá mèŋ n tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Peg pʉ̀a*Roma, peg tè gẅiin mà lézá’ ntsaŋ ná yɛ̂ ntí wɔ́. Á zɛ́te ngie nyìŋ gẅie mé sẅiŋé yé pâ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sẅiŋé yé pumte ssé. Nyìŋ gẅie mé sẅiŋé yé píte ncwò wé.
en: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.

ngiemboon: Meŋ n ka gɔɔn pú’u, pega pà Yuda ŋwɛ́ lêen ńké ḿbú ńtó lê jʉ’ɔɔn. Njÿó lʉ́a, n gwóon ńtóŋ ntsaŋ té láte, ńtsẅi mé lɔgɔ nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ńtóo mvfò mèŋ.
en: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.

ngiemboon: Pàsẅiŋe yé tó yɔ́b. Mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie pɔ́ sẅiŋe yé nà tsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ nò tɛ’. Tá’ á ké tè pú’u kẅɛ,
en: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:

ngiemboon: ńgyá pâ pɔ̌ ne ńzoŋo nò pɔ́ ná nò Ssé yɔ́b. Mbàa ná nò tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Yěsô. Mbà à la kwé, Pɔl piŋ ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa ntentʉ́.
en: but had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńtebe, mèŋ n tè gyá shÿó lézá’ ntsaŋ wɔ́, ńgebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ, ńzɛ́te Pɔl ngie à lɔɔn ńkwoŋ mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa Yerósalem tá ńŋaga yé ná yɔɔn nò.
en: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I askedhimwhether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl fó ngie yé ge ná ntsaŋ mvfò, ńzɔɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à ne ńkwoŋo ngie Kása zɔ cʉ́’ ńŋaga yé. Á cʉa pú’u, tá mèŋ n tsẅi mé ná’a ńde’e yé ndá tsǎŋ tà kúu fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ge túmo yé ná lé Kása.
en: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Cæsar.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Agrippa jú’ tà ńgɔɔn lé Festus ngie: Kwà’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo lé jú’u nò gie á ge kẅɛɛ ncwò nyìŋ ŋwɛ́. Festus tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo jú’u nò ncwò yé jǔɔ.
en: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, fùɔ Agrippa pɔ́ Mbelenis giŋ pɔ́ sɔɔn sɔɔn, ńgwaa kúu ndá gyɛ̌, nùɔ memáa pʉ̀a tÿɔ́’ɔ yé. Pâ metándá metándá ncù mbɔɔ mekěm pie ée tÿǒsoŋ pú ńgwɔ́ nùɔ. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn Festus tsẅi mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńtó.
en: And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus' commandment Paul was brought forth.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Nɔ̀ɔn tema’ fùɔ Agrippa, mbɔɔ pi metsèm pie pi tǒ tà ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn lɔɔn. Pi líe nyìŋ wɛ̂ ńgyá. À tyě pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà pà Yuda tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ka sẅiŋé yé mbwo mèŋ, á Yerósalem, ńgíŋe ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn sẅiŋe yé. Tà ne ńzɛ́te yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie mé ké ńzẅé yé zẅé.
en: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, andalsohere, crying that he ought not to live any longer.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n kaa gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie à ka gÿo tà ńgwɔ́ mé cʉa mǒ ńdeen ńzẅé yé zẅé wɔ́. Kwà’ yé máŋwɛ́ ka zɛté ngie Kása zɔ cʉ́’ ńŋaga yé. Tà mèŋ n záb yɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ n ge túmo yé, é náa mbwo yé.
en: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.

ngiemboon: N gee ńtúm yé pá’ɔɔn tá’, ńké tè ne ńzsé tsɔ́ nò gie n cwoŋó ńjú’ tà ńŋwe’e nà ŋwà’ne, á lélɔg ńtúmo yé ńnáa mbwo Kása wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ mèŋ n dɔgɔ yé ńtóo mvfò pi. Tá’, n kě ńtsẅe ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé pɔ́ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn tema’ fùɔ Agrippa. Nɔ̀ɔn tema’, kwà’ gù máŋwɛ́ zɛ́te yé nò, ka à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zẅɛ́’, ńgẅiin nò gie n ge ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne tá lɔg túmo yé, é náa mbwo Kása wɔ́.
en: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n zɔɔn ńtúmo ngàŋa tsǎŋ, ńnáa mbwó Kása té gɔɔn mmó gie à fʉ̌a, á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò cʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ.
en: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimeslaidagainst him.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa gɔɔn mbwo Pɔl ngie: Mèŋ n nǎ shwóŋè mbwo gù pá’ ɔ̀ ge píte ncwò gú nà menò mie mé sẅiŋe gú mǒ n jú’. Pɔl ma’ mbwó, ńzye lépíte ncwò wé, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:

ngiemboon: Nɔ́ɔn temà’, mèŋ n gee lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ḿbú ne ńkága tɛ’ létyé mvfò fùɔ ḿbíte ncwò wɔ̀ɔn nà menò mie pà Yuda zàba twó mèŋ,
en: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:

ngiemboon: ńkága tɛ’, mélà’mie kwà’ nkwɔbɔ́ yé máŋwɛ́ ne ńzsé mà lá’ gwɔb, ńgíŋe ne ńnyɛte ńzsé menò mie pɔ́ zoŋo. Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte nkwɔbɔ́ ngie à shÿɔg, ńcwoŋo ńju’u nò gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: especiallybecause I knowthee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda metsèm pú ne ńzsé pá’ mèŋ n gee ńnéŋe pú’u, tá fó pá’ n da lu ssé. Pɔ́ ée ssé ne ńzsé pá’ méŋ n dɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe pú’u, tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a yégè mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem.
en: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n dɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe ná ntí gie nyìŋ ná nùɔ pà*farisay neŋé pú’u, é piŋ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ńcʉŋe nà*lepʉ̌ nò Ssé yég tɛ’. Pà Yuda lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, pɔ́ shwóŋó nkwɔbɔ́ ngie, anò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, áa nò nénʉ́. Pɔ́ zɔɔn ḿbú ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn tà fó tàa lyɛ̌’.
en: which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn, ammó gie mé ŋaga wɔ̀ɔn mǒ à yɔɔn: Ńgwɔ́ Ńgie e Ssé la ka’a nò á mbwo pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè, m biŋ ne ńzẅí’te pá’ á ge gÿo pumte.
en: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:

ngiemboon: Mengẅɛ̀ ndá mégè ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém pú ne ńzẅí’te yɔ́b pɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ge gÿo yɛ̌ nò pumte. Tà ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’e zsǒ mbɔɔ letsẅɛ́’, ńne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńké ńzẅí’te pɔ́ yɛ̌. Ankwɔbɔ́, pà Yuda sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ nue mèŋ n ne ńzẅí’te yɛ̌ mmó.
en: unto whichpromiseour twelve tribes, instantly servingGodday and night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ne ńzẅí’te nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, pi lʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋ ngie e Ssé lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á zím pʉ̀a ná legwé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n ka ne ńkwaŋa ngie, n ge lɔg ncù lÿɔ́’ lezíŋ Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd, á nà meshÿó ntsèm.
en: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie n da gÿo tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem. N da gwoon pʉ̀a pé tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ḿmá’a ndá tsǎŋ, ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gÿo pú’u, metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɔ túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Mé gwɔ́ tà ne ńgee ńzẅéte pɔ́b mèŋ n záb wɔ̀ɔn ncwò mǒ.
en: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice againstthem.

ngiemboon: N da ne ńtɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, ńyɛɛ pʉ̀a Yěsô ngɔ́’. Mèŋ n da ne ńtsóte wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ zoonte lezíŋ Yěsô. N da pú ḿbʉa wɔ́b pʉa tà ńgee mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ lá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ, éfa’a wɔ́b, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’.
en: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelledthemto blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecutedthemeven unto strange cities.

ngiemboon: N da ne ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńne ńgee lê Ndamas, ńgẅiin meŋwà’ne mie metándà pànuŋe pwɔ́’ ně ńnáa mbwo mèŋ, ńdɔg ńtúmo wɔ̀ɔn wó.
en: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn temà’, mèŋ n gwɔ́ mánzsè pú’u, á nà mmó tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ, ńgyá atsɔ́ mmó fó tÿǒ lepwó, ḿbú ńkyɛ’ jʉ’, ńŋwʉŋe tà ńcʉa lejÿɔ́g nèm, ńkyɛ’ɛ wéga pʉ̀a pie pega pɔ̌ kɔ’ɔ́ ńgwɔ́ mánzsè.
en: at midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.

ngiemboon: Peg pú ńtsɔ́’ɔ ńgwete ssé métsèm. Mèŋ n jú’ ngyè nyìŋ lɔgɔ shwóŋè pà Heber ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Sɔ̂l, Sɔ̂l, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ mélà’a kɔ́? Ɔ̀ɔ pɛ́’ɛ̀ ne ńgÿo fʉ̌ŋ jù kẅi’i pá’ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé ne ńdɔgɔ twó lekwoŋ ńtsóte yé, á giŋe ḿma’a kwò yé nzèm lá.
en: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue,Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?it ishard for thee to kick against the pricks.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Àa gù wɔ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ́’ ngie, n gee Yěsô. Ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ pá’a pɔ́ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ.
en: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said,I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ké ńdu ssé fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńtyé tyé. Mèŋ n nyɛɛ mbùm yɔɔn mbwo gù pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie mèŋ n tsɔ’ɔ́ gú lélɔgɔ gú ńgÿo ngàŋa fà’ wɔ̀ɔn. Ɔ̀ gẅiin légÿo mé zsé mmó gie ɔ̀ gyá lyɛ̌’ɔɔn mbɔ́ɔ menò mie mèŋ n ge gÿo tá nyɛɛ gú.
en: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n túmo gú mbwo pà Yuda mbɔɔ mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ melá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Mèŋ n zɔ ge kábte gú tà pɔ́ légÿo tsɔ́ mmó ná gù wɔ́.
en: delivering thee from the people, andfromthe Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n túmo gú pú’u, ɔ̀ gʉa ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńgÿo pɔ́ fó tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm ńkẅɛ, ńkúu nà jʉ’ gie á ne fɔ́gɔ. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo gÿo pɔ́ fó nà mbwó Sátà ńkẅɛ, ḿbiŋe nà mbwó Ssé, é záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná mèŋ, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b, é piŋ náa yɔ́b jʉ’ á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé.
en: to open their eyes,andto turnthemfrom darkness to light, andfromthe power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn temà’ fùɔ Agrippa, á la fó pú’u, n daa tʉʉ twó nà nò gie e Ssé la nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn n jú’ wɔ́.
en: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà mèŋ n da zye ná pʉ̀a Ndamas létsẅii nò yé, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńkú pʉ̀a pe Yerósalem, éfó wó ńkúu nà pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea ntsèm, éfó wó ńkúu nà pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ńne ńtsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm ngie: Pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔb, ḿbiŋe mbwo Ssé, ńne ńgÿo menò mie é lá’te ngie pi kubé mà.
en: but shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judæa, andthento the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.

ngiemboon: Gyá mmó gie á ka gÿǒ tá pà Yuda gwoon wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé tà fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to killme.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n nyé wó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, e Ssé zɔ̌ ne ńkábte wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ m biŋ ne shwóŋó kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie mèŋ n zsé ná yé, á mbwo melÿò mbɔɔ mbwo pènkʉ́. Mé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn menò mie é ge lá’ tá tó tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Mǒsê. Mèŋ n kě ne ńgɔɔn pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:

ngiemboon: Mé la gɔɔn ngie,*Nzà’nkÿo pù’ ge gÿo tó, é gyá ngɔ́’, ńgie yé zɔ ge gÿo gwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò nyìŋ lézíme ná legwé, ńgie yé zɔ ge gÿo gɔɔn shwóŋè gie á ge kyɛ’ pà Yuda mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té pà Yuda wɔ́, pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: that Christ should suffer,andthat he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne ḿbíte ncwò wé pú’u, ngúmnɔ́ɔn Festus kwé’e ngyè ye ńgɔɔn ngie: Pɔl, ɔɔ pʉa. Ɔ̀ léen ḿbú, ńzí’i mmó zí’i tà á cʉŋte twó jú.
en: And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: A Ndè, mèŋ n tè pʉa wɔ́. Menò mie mèŋ n gɔɔn ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u. Mbà mèŋ n zɔ̌ɔn ńkwaŋ, tá ńgɔɔn.
en: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.

ngiemboon: Tà nɔ̀ɔn temà’ Agripa neŋé pɛ́’ɛ̀ ḿbú ne ńzsé pɔ́ ntsèm. Áa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n tyé mvfò yé ńgɔɔn nò té pɔ́g, mélà’mie mèŋ n zsé ngie, atsɔ́ nò gie áa mǒ, á ne ḿmoŋe, á té wó wɔ́. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà mɛ̌ menò kà tè cʉate pɔ́ jʉ’e lelyěen wɔ́.
en: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn temà’ fùɔ Agrippa, tà ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m gú nà menò mie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e? N zsé ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn temà’ le nyé té záb ntʉ́m wé mǒ wɔ́.
en: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Pɔl ngie: Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ̀ ge ná’a lɔg pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀ é gÿo n cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ Kristo keen?
en: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Kà mé ge lɔg pɔ́ nò gie á sag sag wɔ́, kà pɔ́ gie á vɔ́g vɔ̌g wɔ́, mbà yɔ́ɔn mmó gie méŋ n ne ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: Nɔ̀ɔn temà’ tà mbɔɔ pi métsèm pie pi ne ńjú’u nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, pi cʉ́’ pá’ mèŋ. Tá metsɛ̂n mɔɔn, é le ná pi wɔ́.
en: And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa, mbɔɔ ngúmnɔ́ɔn pɔ́ Mbelenis, pâ pʉ̀a pie é kě ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó lu ssé,
en: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:

ngiemboon: ńgwaa kẅɛ, ńne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn kà tè gÿo tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé cʉa mǒ ńzẅé yé wɔ́. Tà mbɔ́ɔ léńnéŋe yé tsǎŋ.
en: and when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa gɔɔn né Festus ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ kaa pé’è à tè gɔɔn ngie Kása zɔ ge ŋaga yé wɔ́, mbà mé cʉ́’ ńkyɛɛ yé ńnyé nyé á gʉa.
en: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Cæsar.

ngiemboon: Mé gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzáb ngie peg ge kúu máamáa kanù’, é gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Italia, ńcʉ́me Pɔl lâ tsɔ́ megàŋa tsǎŋ mbwo tsɔ̌ tándá ncù. Lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Julius. Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná kwò pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie pɔ́ laa pe Kása.
en: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners untoonenamed Julius, a centurion of Augustus' band.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ kúu*máamáa kanú’, á gwɔ́ gie á fóo lê tÿǒsoŋo Andelamite, é ge gʉa ngʉ̀ŋe metÿǒsoŋ mie ée nkʉ̀ŋ ntse, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia. Peg lâ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ nùɔ. Lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Alistag. Mbà mé la zyé yé tÿǒsoŋo Tesalonika, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Makedonia, peg cʉ́me mánzsè.
en: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia;oneAristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿó ńgwaa lʉ́a, peg gwɔ́ Sidoŋ. Julius gẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo ná Pɔl tà ńnyé yé ngie à gʉa ńgúɔ meshǔ pé. Pɔ́ kú, ńkẅéte yé.
en: And the nextdaywe touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gavehimliberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.

ngiemboon: Peg piŋ fó nà yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ tà ne ńgee, fefà fó mvfò mvfò ńtɔ’ɔ wég légʉa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Peg lÿɔ́’ɔ fefà ńdɔg ye menkʉ̀ŋ ntse Shʉ̀pele ńgʉa, é gwɔ́ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ, mbà ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ,
en: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

ngiemboon: ńgiŋ pɔ́ pú’u, ńtɔ́gɔ máa ntse gẅie ée ngʉ̀ŋe ngwòŋ Silisia, ńgíŋe ńtɔ́g gẅie ée ngʉ̀ŋe ngwòŋ Panfilia, ńdeen ńké ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋo Mira, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Lici, ńtyé,
en: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra,a cityof Lycia.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó pú’u, tándá ncù wɛ̌ gẅie pega pɔ̌ giŋe la, á gyá tsɔ́*máamáa kanú’ ye ndyɛ̀’ɛ, á fóo tÿǒsoŋo Alekzáŋdeli, ńdɔgɔ shÿó ngwòŋ Italia ńgee. Á gÿo peg kúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́.
en: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔg melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńké ńgiŋe pɔ́ ndɔ́ɔn ndɔ́ɔn. Tà ńgwɔ́ gyá tÿǒsoŋo Snide, mbà peg gyǎ ngɔ́’ tɛ’. Afóm pú ńtɔ’ɔ wég légʉa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ tà ndà’. Peg cʉ́’ ńtéŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ shÿó Crete ńgʉa, é gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ. Peg kúu wó, ńná’a ńdÿɔ́’ɔ fóm ńdɔg ye Salmone, ńgʉa. Á gwɔ́ jʉ’e tsetsá’ Kelɛt gie á la sẅige, ńkúu ntse.
en: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;

ngiemboon: Peg gwaa ne giŋe mengʉ̀ŋe ntse Kelɛt, ḿbú ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo lé letyé*máamáa kanú’ se mbòŋo, á gwɔ́ shÿó tÿǒsoŋo Lasé.
en: and, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the cityofLasea.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ kúu wó pú’u, mbà peg tsẅě mánzsè tɛ’. Tà saŋ lepfwɔ’ɔ́ gẅie pà Yuda ée*ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè á tɔ́g. Pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ*máamáa kanú’ ńgiŋ giŋ, á cʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ legwé we. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, Pɔl zá’ njÿó shwóŋ pʉ̀a*máamáa kanú’ ngie:
en: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonishedthem,

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, n ne ńgyá ngie pege lɔɔn ńgíŋe ńgʉa mvfò, mbà aa lenǎ twó. Mbà*máamáa kanú’ pâ shúm metʉ̌a sie ée tsoló ńgwɔ́ é pú ńcʉŋte. Ndyɛ̀’ tsɔ́ pege yégè é le tsẅɛ́.
en: and said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gɔɔn pú’u, tándá ncù jú’, à tè yé nò pá, ńjú’ pɔ́ nò gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò nyìŋ gẅie à sá’a pʉ̀a pie é fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ tà mbɔɔ gie ngàŋ*máamáa kanú’ gɔ̌ɔn,
en: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.

ngiemboon: ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, ajʉ’e letyé*memáamáa kanú’ gie mé ée wó á té lìi jʉ’ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a tsẅé wó nà fʉ̀’e fóm tà nò poŋo wɔ́b gwɔ́. Á cʉa pú’u, pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ laa tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ cʉ́’ ńzáb pɔ́ ngie mé fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie á lɔɔn ńná shÿó, pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu nà jʉ’e letyé*memáamáa kanú’ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Kelɛt mé tóŋ lê Fénis. Fénis gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie lezẅé tsetsá’ la tóo jʉ’ó ńkẅɛ, ayetsɔ́ sǎga tÿǒsoŋ gwɔ́ líe gwǒŋo Mbyě nèm ye kwóŋ, yetsɔ́ líe ngwǒŋo Mbyě nèm ye ntsíŋ. Pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn pú’u, lékúu wó ńdá’ ńnéŋe tà fʉ̀’e fóm tɔ́g.
en: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice,and thereto winter;which isan haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a*máamáa kanú’ gyá fefà ná’a fó shÿó ntsíŋ ńzye lécʉ’e, pɔ́ zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie anò gie pɔ́ kwǎŋ á ge giŋ, ńdeen ńkaa*máamáa kanú’ ńdɔg ńgiŋ pɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ngwòŋ Kelɛt.
en: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtainedtheirpurpose, loosingthence, they sailed close by Crete.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ńdeen ńtóo légiŋ, atsɔ̌ máamáa fóm gẅie mé tóŋo lê Erakiloŋ fó tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńzye lécʉ’e kwà’ lê tʉ̀,
en: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ*máamáa kanú’ ḿpfó shÿó we ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Peg gyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́’ ńnyé*máamáa kanú’. Á lɔgɔ wég ńgʉa lê jʉ’ gie fóm kwǒŋ.
en: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we letherdrive.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ wég ńgʉa tà ne ḿpfó tsìŋe tsɔ́ mûɔ méngwòŋ gẅie mé tóŋo lê Koda, mbà ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ. Ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́ ná’a ńkʉŋe fóm ná*máamáa kanú’. Peg zẅɛ́’, ńkag tʉ̀ tà ńgwoon kanú’ gie mé lɔgɔ sẅí’i shúm metʉ̌a tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ ńnáa ssé,
en: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńkwé’e kanú’ ŋwɛ́ ńzaba tÿǒ*máamáa kanú’, megàŋa fà’ lêen ńdɔg menkÿo ńzéme*máamáa kanú’, ńkwɛ́ mboŋó, ésẅí’i máamáa kème tÿǒ gẅie mé cʉŋe ná*máamáa kanú’, ḿma’a ntse, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa gʉa tà shÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ sàŋasáŋa gie á gwá ńcú’te tsɛ̀ɛ ntse á ngʉ̀ŋe ngwòŋ Lybia.
en: which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉa, afóm ké ńnyé ńcʉ’e pɔ́ lê tʉ̀. Megàŋa fà’ gyá kékáŋ, ńtsẅɛ́te tsɔ́ shúm metʉ̌a, ḿma’a ntse.
en: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the nextdaythey lightened the ship;

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ̌ njÿó gÿo ńgíŋ ńdʉ́a, kwà’ pɔ́b zɔ̌ sele ńtsɔ́’ metÿǒ*máamáa kanú’ lâ menzsǒ mǒ, ńgwá’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntse.
en: and the thirddaywe cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.

ngiemboon: Afóm ke ńcʉ’ pɔ́ pú’u, nà melyɛ̌’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Mé té gíŋe lejÿɔ́g nèm ńgyá wɔ́, ńké tè gíŋe mecÿɔ́’ saŋ ńgyá wɔ́. Á gwɔ gwɔ́ tà peg tè gíŋe ńzsé ngie peg ge tsẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay onus, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ńnéŋe nzyè ná melyɛ̌’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Pɔl lu ssé, ńtyé mvfò mânyìŋ ntsèm ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, pi kaa pé’è ńjú’ ncwò wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pege ka tè fó Kelɛt ńgʉa jʉ’ wɔ́. Mbà*máamáa kanú’ kà tè cʉŋte, eshúm metʉ̌a piŋ ńké tè kúu pyé wɔ́.
en: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mèŋ n ne ńzɛ́te gẅi ngie pi shÿɔg. Á nue atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi těen ńge ńkwé wɔ́. Ammó gie á ge pyé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’*máamáa kanú’
en: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss ofany man'slife among you, but of the ship.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà á ně ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ́’ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, e Ssé gẅie mèŋ n gu’te, túmo tsɔ̌ cÿɔ́’ we mbwo mèŋ mie mèŋ n gee ngàŋa fà’ we,
en: For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,

ngiemboon: Á tó ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Pɔl, pɔ́ɔn lépɔ́g. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé ŋag ntsaŋ jù mvfò Kása. E Ssé ge lɔg pá’ à gÿo nò mbòŋo ná gù, é nyé pʉ̀a pie pia pɔ̌ giŋe lɛ mbwo gù tà tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pɔ́b á le kwé.
en: saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Cæsar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, pi shÿɔg! Mèŋ n déen ńtém nzèm yɔɔn ńná né Ssé. Anò gie e Ssé ně ńgɔɔn mbwo mèŋ lɔɔn, á ge pumte pú’u.
en: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.

ngiemboon: Afóm ge kaa wégè pɔ́ pá’ɔɔn tà gʉa ma’a wégè tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, mbà fóm cʉ̌’ cʉ’ pàletsẅɛ́’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa nê legém. Afóm ke ńnyé ńkaa wég ńdɔgɔ ńgiŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Mediteranné. Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’, pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fa’a tÿǒ*máamáa kanú’ jú’ á gwɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pega pɔ̌ ne ńkúu nà tsɔ́ jʉ’e tsetsá’ la.
en: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉŋe mmó gie á ne ńzɛɛ ná tà’ shʉ̀a nkÿo, ésẅí’i ḿma’a ssé ntse, ńdɔg fʉ̀’ pá’ ntse cúu ssé pú’u, ńgyá é gwɔ́ mita ntsɔ̀b sɔɔn mbʉ́a lê móm ntá. Pɔ́ gíŋe ńná’a ńzye ńgiŋ, ḿma’, ńgyá á kẅɛɛ mita ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn lê móm mbʉ́a.
en: and sounded, and foundittwenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and founditfifteen fathoms.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ̌g ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́,*máamáa kanú’ yég tú memáa metóon, ńdeen ńké sẅí’i shúm sie mé lɔgɔ ńkú’te*máamáa kanú’ tà’a jʉ’, é lekùa, ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntse á nzèm*máamáa kanú’, ńgwɔ ńnéŋe, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie njÿó la’a ńdwo ńdʉ́a wɔ́.
en: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa fà’ tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ ne fa’a lékÿo, ésẅí’i kanú’, ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, éshwóŋ pʉ̀a ngie pɔ́ gee mvfò ḿma’ shúm sie é ge kú’te*máamáa kanú’ á le gíŋe ńgiŋ wɔ́.
en: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,

ngiemboon: Pɔl gyá pú’u, ńgɔɔn mbwo tándá ncù pà*Roma laa mbwo pàlÿɔ́’ ncù ngie: Pʉ̀a pɛ̂ lɔɔn tè ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ wɔ́, mbà pi tě ge tsẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lêen ńké ńtsyete menkÿo mie é kě ńgẅiin kanú’, ńnyé á gʉa ntse.
en: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ zẅí’te ngie njÿó lʉ́a, Pɔl néŋ ntʉ́m pʉ̀a metsèm ngie pɔ́ pfɛ́ɛ mémmó, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa nê legém pá’ pi ka zye lépyɛ́b ngie jʉ’ poŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké tè ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ sɔɔn mmó wɔ́.
en: And while the day was coming on, Paul besoughtthemall to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ, n gɔɔn ngie pi pfɛ́ɛ mmó. Á nue yɛ zɔ̌ ge gÿo tá mbùm gì tʉte pi tsẅɛ́. Atsɔ́ mmó zɔɔn těen ńgee ngÿǒ pi wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ tà’ nòŋo twó gi těen ńgee mbyě wɔ́.
en: Wherefore I pray you to takesomemeat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gɔɔn pú’u, ḿbí mbelég, ńtyé mvfò pʉ̀a metsèm, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’, ńzye lépfɛ́.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had brokenit, he began to eat.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm lêen ńké shÿɔg. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pfɛ́ yé.
en: Then were they all of good cheer, and they also tooksomemeat.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’, nyìŋ mesoŋ nkÿo pʉ́a lê ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lê móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́, ésẅí’i ngesáŋ ntsíŋ ḿma’a ntse légwɔ́ gie*máamáa kanú’ ge zeŋe.
en: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gwɔ́ tá ńdʉ́a, mé gyá tsetsá’ tá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’ té zsé jʉ’ gie pɔ́ tyé wó wɔ́. Tá’ ńké ńgyá tsɔ́ jʉ’e ntse gie á sẅige ńkúu nà tsetsá’. Pɔ́ záb ngie á lɔɔn ńná shÿó mé lɔgɔ*máamáa kanú’ ńgee jʉ’o,
en: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńkyɛ́’te shúm sie é kú’te*máamáa kanú’ tà’a jʉ’, ńnyé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńgíŋe ńkyɛ́’te mbɔ́ɔ menkÿo mie é cʉŋe nà mmó gie mé lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ*máamáa kanú’ nzsè, ḿbɔ́ɔnte, ńkyɛ́’ɛ tsɔ̌ máa nzsǒ gẅie áa mvfò*máamáa kanú’, légwɔ́ gie afóm ge kúu tsoló é tsó*máamáa kanú’ é náa nkʉ̀ŋ ntse.
en: And when they had taken up the anchors, they committedthemselvesunto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ńne ńgee, mvfò*máamáa kanú’ shú ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sàŋasáŋa gie á cú’te ńkwɔ́’ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdé’e tà tsɔ̌ légÿo tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ máamáa fóm kaa ntse ńdɔg ńcúa nzèm*máamáa kanú’, ḿbwɔ́’te.
en: And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù fa’a lézẅéte megàŋa tsǎŋ, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ tà’ zɔ́’ ntse ńkÿo.
en: And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tándá ncù piŋ tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zẅé Pɔl wɔ́, ńdeen ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b légÿo mmó gie pɔ́ kwǎŋ, ńtsẅi né pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zsé lézɔ́’ ntse ngie pɔ́ vɔ́g ńkúu ntse, ńzɔ́’ ntse, ńkẅɛɛ kwóŋ.
en: But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them fromtheirpurpose; and commanded that they which could swim should castthemselvesfirstinto the sea, and get to land:

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo ńgwɔ́ kẅɛ yɔ́b, kà ńcʉŋe pɔ́ nà mekèm peláŋ wɔ́, kà ná mekèm shúm mie é tsɔ’té ná*máamáa kanú’ wɔ́. Wɔɔn aa pá’ á la cʉa pú’u, mânyìŋ ntsèm pú fó ntse ńkwɔ́’ tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè kwé.
en: and the rest, some on boards, and some onbroken piecesof the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.

ngiemboon: Peg fó ncwò legwé ńkẅɛ pá’ɔɔn, mé kúu kwóŋ, éshwóŋó wég ngie lezíŋ ngwòŋ gẅie peg tyé wó ée lê Malte, é ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.

ngiemboon: Pàlá’ ŋwɛ́, pú ńgÿo nò mbòŋo ná peg tà ńnyɛɛ máamáa mmɔ̌g, ńtóŋo wég ńgie peg tó ńzɔ́g. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mbʉ̀ŋ zyé lélú, efÿɔ́g piŋ ne ńkúu.
en: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńzɔ́gɔ mmɔ̌g, Pɔl ŋwaa gígyé nkẅíŋ léma’a mmɔ̌g. Nnú gwɔ́ tsoló, ńjú’u gyě mmɔ̌g, ńdúmo pwó yé ńcʉŋe mǒ.
en: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laidthemon the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a lá’ ŋwɛ́ gyá pá’ nnú cʉŋé nà pwó yé, ésele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn ge gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́, é gwɔ́ fÿɛ́. À tsẅɛ̌ ntse tá’, messé gyǎ ngie pɔ́ té ge nyé yé à gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: And when the barbarians saw thevenomousbeast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl siŋe pwó yé, ńnÿɔgte ndùm mmɔ̌g. Nnú sẅɛ́’, ńgwé mmɔ̌g. Ammó té Pɔl gÿo.
en: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pá ne ńzẅí’te ngie jʉ’e pwó Pɔl ge kwɔ́’ mbɔɔ légyá á vege vege ńgwe ńkwé, ńzye ḿbyɛ́b, ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó té Pɔl gÿo. Pɔ́ leen sele shwóŋè ńgɔɔn ngie: Àa tsɔ̌ ssé!
en: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

ngiemboon: Atsetsá’ ŋwâlá’ we lÿò laa ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ó. Mé tóŋo ngàŋ lé Pẅibilẅis. Á gyá wég, ńkúe wég pá’ meshǔ pé lá. Peg ńnéŋe mbʉ̀a yé lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ tá pà Pẅibilẅis ŋwɛ́ nuŋe ndá, ńne ńguɔ. Nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ yé, ajʉ’ʉ kwɔ́’ ne ńgÿo yé. Pɔl gʉa ńgyá yé, ńzáb mbwó twó yé, ésẅíŋte Ssé, ńgÿo á zeŋe.
en: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ megàŋa guɔ lêen ńké ńjú’, éfó meshÿó meshÿó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́, ńtó ńgyá Pɔl. Á gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a jʉ’ó la pú ńgÿo mekù’ még tɛ’. Tà peg gÿo ne ńgee, pɔ́ náa wég kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie a lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á kúu nzsè legìŋ ńkẅéte wég.
en: who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they ladeduswith such things as were necessary.

ngiemboon: Peg la tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́ mesaŋ métá, ńgÿo ńgʉa, ńkúu tsɔ́*máamáa kanú’ gẅie mé tóŋo lé Messé mie ée mefág. Á gwɔ́ gie á la fó tÿǒsoŋo Alekzáŋdeli, ńgwɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’e fóm, á zso wó.
en: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.

ngiemboon: Peg fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Malte, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ Sirakuse, ésẅɛ́’, ńnéŋe wó lyɛ̌’ sétá,
en: And landing at Syracuse, we tarriedtherethree days.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo fó wó, ńjʉŋte pɔ́ megʉ̀ŋe ntse tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Reggio. Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, atsɔ̌ fefà fó shÿó ntsíŋ ńzye lécʉ’e, ńkẅéte wég, peg lɔg lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a, ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋo Puzɔles,
en: And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́. Pɔ́ tóŋo wég ngie peg laa pɔ̌ ńnéŋe mbʉ̀a pɔ́b tà’ ngàba lá’. Wɔɔn aa pá’ peg la gÿo tá ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo*Roma.
en: where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà peg kà ne ńtóo mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée tÿǒsoŋo*Roma jú’, ńkẅɛ ńtó, ńzá’a wég. Petsɔ́ zá’a wég ndùmo sɔ̌ɔn Apius, petsɔ́ zá’a wég á jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo lê Mendá méntá mie ée mé megʉ̀. Pɔl la gwɔ́ tá ńgyá mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ḿbú síe Ssé, ńgíŋe shÿɔg.
en: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu tÿǒsoŋo*Roma, mé zẅíŋ ngie Pɔl pɔ́ tà’ ndÿɔ́’ ncù gẅie à ge ne pyɛ́bɛ yé gʉa ńtsẅé jʉ’ gie Pɔl kwǒŋ.
en: And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu*Roma pú’u, é tɔ́g lyɛ̌’ tá, Pɔl tóŋ mekěm pà Yuda pie é tsẅé*Roma ngie pɔ́ tóo jʉ’ gie à ńnéŋe wó. Pɔ́ tó tà ńnéŋe ssé, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ, n daa tsɔ́ nò mbwo pàlá’ pégè fʉa, ḿbiŋ ńké tè tsɔ́ nò ná mà pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè fʉa. Tá’, à yɔɔn, mbà mé léen ńgwoon wɔ̀ɔn tÿǒsoŋo Yerósalem, ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn mbwo pà*Roma lɔɔn.
en: And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Menandbrethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka ŋaga wɔ̀ɔn tà ne fa’a lékyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn ńnyé, á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ kaa gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie mèŋ n ka gÿo tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé cʉa mǒ ńzẅé wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́,
en: Who, when they had examined me, would have letmego, because there was no cause of death in me.

ngiemboon: tá’ pà Yuda pú tè zẅíŋ. Mèŋ n gyá kékáŋ, ngie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Kása pa*Roma zɔ ge ŋag yɔɔn ntsaŋ. Tá’, n ke tě ńgɔɔn pú’u, lékúu jʉ’ɔɔn ésẅiŋe lá’a yégè wɔ́.
en: But when the Jews spake againstit, I was constrained to appeal unto Cæsar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo tá mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn légyá gẅi pege shwóŋe. Pi zsě gí mmó gie pà Israel ée ńzɔ́gɔ ḿbyɛ́bɛ. Metsɛ̂n mɔɔn piŋ ńgwɔ́ nà mbwó mɔ́ɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: For this cause therefore have I called for you, to seeyou, and to speak withyou: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda jú’ tà ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Pɔl ngie, peg laa zɔɔn ńkẅé tsɔ́ ŋwà’ne gie á fóo Jẅidea ńgɔɔn nò ná gù wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ fɛ́ wege ké tè tóo jʉ’ɔɔn ḿbíte tsɔ́ nò éshwóŋó wég ná gù wɔ́, tsɔ́ nyìŋ laa gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿǒ tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Judæa concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.

ngiemboon: Tá’ peg kě ne ńkwoŋo ngie ɔ̀ cwoŋo ńkyagte mmó gie áa lóŋ gù éshwóŋó wég. Peg gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn tá ńké ńzɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie mé ée nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, éshwóŋè pɔ́ te pòŋ á nà nùɔ pàfag nnɛ́ gie ɔ́ɔ mǒ lɛ.
en: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gɔɔn pú’u, pâ Pɔl táŋa lyɛ̌’ gie pâ pɔ̌ ge gÿo gíŋe pumte. Alyɛ́’ ŋwɛ́ gÿo ńku’, pɔ́ gíŋe ńtó, ńkẅɛ́te yé jʉ’ gie à ńnéŋe wó, ńgwaa tó sɛ̌ lekwò ḿbú ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’. Pɔl kyagte nò*lefùɔ Ssé éshwóŋó wɔ́b tà fó mba’á mba’ ńkúu ncwò nzém, éfa’ shÿó légÿo tà pɔ́ nyɛte ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa yé, ńne ńkẅile menò tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him intohislodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, andout ofthe prophets, from morning till evening.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b jú’u nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn, ńzẅíŋ. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lʉ’ lʉ’.
en: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ légʉa, pɔ́ té gíŋe shwóŋó ńjú’e wɔ́. Pɔl cʉ́’ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: A Zẅìge Ssé lɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò. Á la lɔg ncwò*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya ńgɔɔn né metá pi ngie:
en: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,

ngiemboon: é cwoŋo náŋte, é ké le gyá
en: And seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:

ngiemboon: ńké ńgÿote pɔ́ pú’u, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ té piŋe mbwo mèŋ Ssé, n zeŋe wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Pɔl gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gẅiin lézsé ngie, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé kéen ńtúm Nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é gÿo mé tsẅɛ́, á mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́. Pɔ́ ge jú’ é zẅíŋ. [
en: Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, andthatthey will hear it.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, pà Yuda gwɔ́ fó jʉ’ó gʉa, ńgiŋe ńzoŋo nò ŋwɛ́ tà ńcÿɔ́gɔ cÿɔ̌g.]
en: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ńnéŋe*Roma neŋé ngù’ pʉ́a. Á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie à la kẅé ne ḿbéen. Awɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à kwoŋó légyá yé, á tóo wó, pɔ́ yé shwóŋó.
en: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,

ngiemboon: Á ne sá’a shwóŋó pʉ̀a mmó gie*lefùɔ Ssé ée sɛ̌, ḿbiŋ ńcwoŋo ńzí’i wɔ́b nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo aa yé pɔ́ shʉ̀ashʉ̌a, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ piŋ ńké tè yé tɔ’.
en: preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, nyìŋ gẅie á fa’a fà’ Yěsô Kristo, e Ssé la tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo, ńzába wɔ̀ɔn ngie n gʉa ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo wé mbwo lá’.
en: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, calledto bean apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

ngiemboon: Ntyě sǎg pá’ Ssé la la’ ńka’ wɛ̌ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo tà ńgÿo pà Ntsẅi nkʉ̀ pé pe fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne yé.
en: (which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ gɔɔn nò nà Míŋ we Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. À la sele ńcʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mésoŋ mé zyé yé nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńzába yé á gwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé, ńgẅiin metʉ̀. Á lɔg pá’ à la gÿo á zíme tsetsɛ̀ɛ mepfó, mbɔɔ pá’ à la ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbwo yé.
en: and declaredto bethe Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉa pɔ́ nà yé Kristo ńcÿó gem yɔ́ɔn, ńdɔgɔ wɔɔn ńgÿo ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo légwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ge gʉa shwóŋó nò Ssé, tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm. Epʉ̀a záb ntʉ́m nà yé, ńjú’ ncwò wé, à cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ ná mekù’ mbwo Yěsô Kristo.
en: by whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, pi ee nà nùɔ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńtí nue e Ssé ka tóŋo gẅi ngie pi gwɔ́ gí pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ńnáa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo pi métsèm pie pi ee tÿǒsoŋo*Roma. Pi pie e Ssé kwoŋo gẅi, áa yɛ̌ à la tóŋo gẅi pá’ pi ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé pie à tsɔ̌’. Mèŋ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie Tá wégè Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńně ńnéŋe sẅéte ntʉ́m pi.
en: to all that be in Rome, beloved of God, calledto besaints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m vɔ̌g ńcʉa nà lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo ésie Ssé yɔ̀ɔn nà twó sí métsèm, mélà’mie mé ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó jʉ’ ntsèm ne ńgɔɔn ntí gie pi lɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô Kristo.
en: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ wɔ́, gie mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte Ssé, mèŋ n té nyé té kíme gẅi wɔ́. E Ssé ne ńzsé pú’u. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ne fa’a fà’ yé lé ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wé ntsèm, ńně ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é líe Míŋ we.
en: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gǐŋ ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, ńdúɔ mbwo yé ngie à gÿo, légwɔ́ gẅie mèŋ n zɔ́gɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn légʉa mbʉ̀a pi, à pumte nà we lékwoŋ.
en: making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.

ngiemboon: Á nue n kwà’ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn létó ńgyá gẅí, légwɔ́ gie n ge gÿo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a cÿó gem gí, mentʉ́m mí kẅi’i ńtʉte. Pi lɔg pú’u ńkẅi’i ńtʉte.
en: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ n kɔ’ɔ́ gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie n dɔɔn tó ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, egi ntí lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé é kẅiŋte wɔ̀ɔn, eyɔ́ɔn ntí kẅiŋte gẅí.
en: that is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi zsé mboŋó ngie n dǎ táŋ tɛ’ létó ńgyá gẅi tá shÿó ké tè kẅɛ tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. N daa pú’u ńtsɔ́ɔn létó fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà pi jÿó gí pì pá’ n ka fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengwòŋ pɔ́ jÿó pì.
en: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la náa yɔɔn fà’ né mèŋ, áa yɛ̌ mèŋ n gẅiin létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó pʉ̀a metsèm, á mbwo pʉ̀a pie é la zí’i zsenò mbɔɔ pie é la té zí’i, á mbwo pà zsé ŋwà’ne mbɔɔ pà tè zsé.
en: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn létó ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi gí, pie pi ee tÿǒsoŋo*Roma.
en: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ eshʉ́ lékúu wɔ̀ɔn á létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔ́, ée metʉ̀ mie e Ssé lɔgɔ ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m nà yé tsẅɛ́ɛ. À zye nà pà Yuda ńkúu ná pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ne ńgÿo mé zsé pá’ á cʉa pú’u, tá Ssé lɔg pʉ̀a mésoŋ ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé á cʉa pɔ́ ndà’ nà pá’ pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m nà yé. E tsɔ̌ nzsè ndyɛ̀’ɛ è tè wó wɔ́. Áa mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie aa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ńtí nue à záb ntʉ́m nà yé zɔ ge lá’ gwɔ́ wó.
en: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó ne ńnyɛɛ ngie à ne ńgyaŋa lóŋ, mélà’mie pʉ̀a mésoŋ é móŋo yé, ńnéŋe ńgÿo menò tepòŋ. Pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńtáte nò nénʉ́ léfa’a fà’. E Ssé ne ńnéŋe ntsaŋ twó pɔ́b,
en: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

ngiemboon: mélà’mie ammó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé zsé nà Ssé, pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzsé yɔ́b zsé. E Ssé la shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b yɛ̌ mmó.
en: because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath sheweditunto them.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà tá fó pá’ e Ssé la nyɛ́te njÿó, mé fó nà shúm sie à la nyɛ́te, ńzsé ngie aa Ssé, tà mbɔɔ pá’ mé té gyá yé lê nÿɔ́g wɔ́. Mé zsé metʉ̀ mé mie é téen ńdá’a maga wɔ́. Á cʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mésoŋ le lá’ ngie pɔ́ la tè ne ńzsé Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made,evenhis eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zsé Ssé, tá pɔ́ té gu’te yé, ésíe yé pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo pú’u, nà Ssé wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà legyè sɔ́b la fʉte wɔ́b pɔ́ fʉa mánzsè, ntʉ́m wɔ́b gẅie é gẅiin pɔ́ gʉ̀gʉ̀ nzsenò gÿo pɔ́ gwé tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm.
en: because that, when they knew God, they glorifiedhimnot as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tóo sá’a ngie pɔ́ zsé nò, ńcʉ́’ mepʉ̀a.
en: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyé légu’te Ssé gẅie à gẅiin legú’, ńgwɔ́ tè kwé, ńcʉ́’ ńgu’te pɔ́ shúm sẅɛ̀ɛ, éshúm sie é sẅé nyìŋ mésoŋ gẅie aa ńkwé, ésẅé meshʉ́ŋ, setsɔ́ sẅé menɔ̀ɔn pie é gẅiin mekwò lekùa, setsɔ́ sẅé menɔ̀ɔn pie éshwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b ssé.
en: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gÿo menò sẅile sẅile mie ntʉ́m wɔ́b la ně ńtsɔ́ɔn ndêen ńké ńdɔgɔ légÿo pú’u, ésele ńcʉ́ŋte mbùm yɔ́b, ńdɔg sele ntém shʉ́ twó pɔ́b.
en: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la nyé nò nénʉ́ gie áa nà Ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm cÿɔ nò, á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgu’te pɔ́ shúm sie e Ssé la nyɛ́te, ńcʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ mbwo sɛ̌ shúm. Tá mé gẅiin légu’te pɔ́ yé mbù’ ngwòŋ, ńgu’te yé á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ́ɔn,*Amen.
en: who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿó e Ssé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gÿo mmó gie nkwaŋá wɔ́b tyé mǒ tá é gwɔ́ menò mie ée néŋ shʉ́ nà pɔ́b. Mezwě pɔ́b nyé mbàŋa ńcʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ tsɔ́ pànzwě pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe, yɛ̌ ntí légÿo menò è té ntí gie Ssé la záb wɔ́.
en: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa gíŋe ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u, ńnyé pànzwě, letʉ́m sɔ́b cʉ́’ʉ shÿó pɔ́ sele ńtsɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ mámbàŋa pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ ge sele ńnuŋe, á gwɔ́ nò shʉ́ nà pɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ pú’u, e Ssé néŋ ngɔ́’ kwà’ nà pɔ́b á fóo nà tsẅé tepòŋ yɔ́b.
en: and likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́ la lʉ’ʉ lézsé Ssé lá, e Ssé la nyé wɔ́b, legyè sɔ́b sie é té tyé zɔ̌ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a wɔ́b pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ kɔ’ɔ́ tè gÿo wɔ́.
en: And even as they did not like to retain God intheirknowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

ngiemboon: Menò mie Ssé tè ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́ pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ gÿo menò tepòŋ, ńgẅiin kègɔ́’, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ńcÿɔ́g cÿɔ́g, légyá mmó nyìŋ ńkwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ mǒ pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅéte pʉ̀a, ńnéŋe ńtág pɔ́ melà’, ńgẅiin fʉte, akɔ́ sá’a twó pɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ gÿo gÿo, ńzáb menò twó pʉ̀a,
en: being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

ngiemboon: ésele ńtÿɔ́g sóon nà pɔ́b tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ megàŋ mbù Ssé, ńzoonte pʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa ŋá’tè, ńgwɔ́ pà nyɛ nnɛ́, éfa’ meshÿó ntsèm lélɔg ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, pɔ́ té jú’ ncwò metá pɔ́b mbɔɔ we memá pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

ngiemboon: Legyè zága wɔ́b. Pɔ́ ka’a nò pɔ́ té gÿo, ntʉ́m wɔ́b lêen ńtʉa, pɔ́ ee pà tè tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe.
en: without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cwòŋo ne ńzsé ngie áa mbwo Ssé, e pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin wɔɔn mà, ée pʉ̀a pie é tyé pá’ mé ge lá’ zẅé wɔ́b zẅé. Tá’, pɔ́ té fʉate mɔɔn menò fʉate ndà’ wɔ́, pɔ́ gíŋe ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a pie é ne fʉate mɛ̌ menò yɔ́b.
en: who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zye letúu*lɔ̌’ pʉ̀a pie é gÿo yɛ̌ ntí menò, gù gẅie ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ tú, zsé ngie ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ lényé té gwé jú ntsaŋ gwé wɔ́, tà pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ wɔ̌. Pú’u ńtí nue ɔ̀ ne ńtúu*lɔ̌’ pʉ̀a tá’ ńgíŋe ne ńgÿo jú pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b ńdɔgɔ sele ńtúu pɔ́ ndʉ̀ ńdɔgɔ ńkwɛ́ mbùm jù.
en: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ńzsé ngie Ssé gwɔ́ tà ne ńŋága pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ ntí menò, ńŋága wɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ menò mɔ́b ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

ngiemboon: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ túu*melɔ̌’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ ntí menò, ḿbiŋe ne ńgÿo jù pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b, ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ̀ ge gǎ tá tsẅɛ́ tà Ssé lénéŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó gù wɔ́?
en: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne gÿo pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńdɔgɔ ńgwága Ssé gwǎg, nne ngie à gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m, à té lwo ńcÿɔ́g wɔ́, à gẅiin kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́. Ɔ̀ɔ pú’u, ɔ̀ té ne ńzsé ngie à gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m nzèm gù pú’u, pɔ́ lélɔg ńgÿo ɔ̀ kúbe mà wɔ́ ka?
en: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńdʉ’ʉ léju’u nò, ɔ̀ té ne ńkwoŋo lékúbe mà gù wɔ́, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pú’u, ńtóŋte máamáa ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gẅie e Ssé ge gÿo ńnéŋe twó gù, á nà lyɛ̌’ gie à ge lá’ ně ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pʉ̀a. Á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ó mé gyá pá’ Ssé ŋaga menò pɔ́ pá’ é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

ngiemboon: À tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ ná pa’ ngàŋ la lɔg fa’ pú’u,
en: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

ngiemboon: é náa le gwɔ́ tèmì mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la lɔgɔ légÿo nò mbòŋo té kʉ́a, ńně ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie e Ssé zɔ náa wɔ́b legú’, ńnáa wɔ́b mékù’, ńgÿo pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ le gwɔ́ gẅie mé te gíŋe kwé mǒ wɔ́.
en: to them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé, ńdʉ’ʉ nò gie áa nénʉ́, ńgiŋe pɔ́ ná mánzsè gẅie e Ssé tè ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́, pɔ́ gyá pá’ e Ssé gyáŋa lóŋ ná pɔ́b, mbɔɔ pá’ nò yɔ́b pÿɔ́gɔ Ssé.
en: but unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ge lá’ kúu wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ nyìŋ mésoŋ wɔ́ gẅie à gÿo nò tepòŋ tà à tswág tsɔ̌. Pú’u é zye nà nyìŋ Yuda é pɔ́ɔnté kúu nà nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́.
en: tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa nà nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo nò mbòŋo, e Ssé náa legú’ né ye, ńná mékù’ lé ye, ńgíŋ náa yé mbʉ́lè, ńcʉ́’ʉ lé ná, ńzye nà nyìŋ Yuda ḿbɔ́ɔnte, ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́,
en: but glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé te gẅiin tyɛ̀’te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mésoŋ wɔ́.
en: for there is no respect of persons with God.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, é té*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê zsé. Tá’ ńké gÿo nò tepòŋ, ńgwe pɔ́ ntsaŋ, tà mbɔɔ pá’ nò*lepʉ̌ té cʉa mǒ wɔ́. Tá á ké ńgʉa nà pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gwaa gÿo nò tepòŋ, ńně ńzsé*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pɔ́ gwe ntsaŋ, ńtí sɛ̌*lepʉ̌.
en: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ zɔɔn tè jú’*lepʉ̌ Ssé jǔ’ ndà’ ńcʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ gẅie aa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́. Nyìŋ jǔ’ ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pá’ é zɛ́te tá ńcʉ́’ʉ wɛ̌ nyìŋ.
en: (for not the hearers of the lawarejust before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ḿbiŋ tè*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê zsé, gwá gÿo mmó gie sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, tà ńgÿo pɔ́ tè gwɔ́ gie mé zi’í wɔ́b. Mbùm yɔ́b zɔ lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzí’i wɔ́b ménò mie ée nà*lepʉ̌ tà mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ té*lepʉ̌ gẅiin.
en: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pú’u, ńnyɛ́ ngie mefà’ mie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te ngie me fa’, e Ssé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wɔ́b, tà mbùm yɔb ne ńzẅíŋe ngie áa nò. Nkwaŋá wɔ́b gʉa fʉ̀’ gie é ge ŋǎg pɔ́b, ńdɔg pɔ́ mefà’ ŋwɛ́ ńŋága wɔ́b, ńgʉa fʉ̀’ gie é gee tàg nzèm yɔb ńgíŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ mɛ̌ ńtág.
en: which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, andtheirthoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo nò Ssé gẅie mèŋ n da’te ńgɔɔn pá’ e Ssé ge lá’ zá’ ntsaŋ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ. Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’, e Ssé tsẅii mbwo Yěsô Kristo, à ŋág pʉ̀a nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie áa lelyěen tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pɔ́b.
en: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná gù, ɔ̀ ne ńnyɛte ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ Yuda, ńne ńŋá’te ngie ɔ̀ fó ná pá’ ɔ̀ kú’te*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pú’u, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Ssé,
en: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,

ngiemboon: ńzsé mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà á ka fó ná pá’ mé ka zí’i gú*lepʉ̌ ɔ̀ zsé mmó gie áa mbòŋ.
en: and knowesthiswill, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kwà’ ne ńgyá nà jú twó ngie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ gẅie à kíbe pwó mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ńne ńkyɛ’ɛ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm,
en: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

ngiemboon: ńně ńzí’i mmó mbwo pɔ́b megʉ̀gʉ̀ nà nò Ssé, ńgwɔ́ tsítsà mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ nà nò gie áa nénʉ́, mélà’mie ɔ̀ ne ńzsé, ɔ̀ lɔg pá’ ɔ̀ zsé*lepʉ̌, ńgẅiin zsé nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.

ngiemboon: Á yɛ tà ḿboŋ. Tá’ mélà’a kɔ́ gù gẅie ɔ̀ ne ńzí’i petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mmó, ɔ̀ té gÿo pá’ yɛ̌ mmó ně ńzɛ́te wɔ́? Ɔ̀ ne sá’a mbwo lá’ ngie tà mé jʉ, ḿbiŋ ne ńjʉʉ.
en: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ḿbʉ́ʉ ngie tà mé gÿo gàb, ḿbiŋ ne gÿo gàb, ńne ngie tà mé gu’te messé, ḿbiŋe ńgee nà mejʉ’ mie mé gu’te wɔ́b wó, ńjʉʉ shúm sie mé lɔ̌g ńgu’te wɔ́b.
en: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

ngiemboon: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ ne ńŋá’te tɛ’ ngie ɔ̀ zsé*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ḿbiŋe fʉa*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzoonte Ssé.
en: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?

ngiemboon: Mé la zɔɔn ńŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ne ńzoonte lezíŋ Ssé, á ké fó pɔ́ né pi.
en: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgiŋe ná pá’*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, mbà le gwɔ́ gẅie mé la pú’u gú pá’ ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ nyìŋ Ssé à ge kẅéte. Tá ńké té giŋe ná pá’*lepʉ̌ ně ńzɛ́te wɔ́, mbà mé la tsɛ ḿbú’u gú tá’, ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie mé la tè yé pú’ la,
en: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie mé la tè wɔ́b pú’, giŋe ná pá’*lepʉ̌ ně ńzɛ́te, mbà Ssé tè cʉ́’ líe wɔ́b gẅie mé la té wɔ́b pú’ pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a pie mé kéen ḿbú’u wɔ́b gwɔ́ ka?
en: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie mé la zyé wɔ́b mé té wɔ́b pú’, pɔ́ piŋ ne ńgÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te, pɔ́ zɔ ge lá’ tú*melɔ̌’ mí, pi pie pi fʉ̌a sɛ̌*lepʉ̌, tá mbà mé la ŋwe’e ńná né pi, pi gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé la pú’u wɔ́b.
en: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn tè gwɔ́ zsé kwà’ nyìŋ pà Yuda, á nyìŋ Ssé, ńdɔg pɔ́ mmó gie mé ne ńgyá nà ye á nzème pǐ wɔ́, lézsé nyìŋ gẅie mé la pú’u yé á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ légyá pá’ mé la zá’a jʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ yé wɔ́.
en: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neitheris thatcircumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

ngiemboon: Tá’ kwà’ nyìŋ Yuda, á nyìŋ Ssé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé la pú’u yé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tʉ́m ye. Á gwɔ́ lepú’ gẅie a Zẅìge Ssé zɔ gÿo, tà à tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅie à fóo ná pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ wɔ́. Wɛ̂ zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé zɔ ná mekù’ mé tà pʉ̀a mésoŋ zɔ té ná.
en: but heisa Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcisionis thatof the heart, in the spirit,andnot in the letter; whose praiseisnot of men, but of God.

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn, mbà nyìŋ Yuda lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńcʉa nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́? Lépú’u nyìŋ Yuda piŋ ńkẅéte yé nà kɔ́?
en: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profitis thereof circumcision?

ngiemboon: Apì ké ńgwɔ́ wó tɛ’, é meshÿó meshÿó nà légwɔ́ nyìŋ Yuda. Ndùŋ mvfò á gwɔ́ pá’ e Ssé la cʉ́me shwóŋè yé pɔ́ mbwo pà Yuda.
en: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgʉa nà pá’ etsɔ́ pà Yuda la nyé yɛ̌ shwóŋè pé’è, á ge cʉa pú’u, e Ssé nyé menò mie à la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b keen?
en: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ ŋaga gú á le gú jÿó.
en: And mightest overcome when thou art judged.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: Menò tepòŋ mie pege fʉ’ʉ gÿo pʉ̀a zsé ngie e Ssé ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, mbà pege ge tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie kɔ́? Pege ge gɔɔn ngie e Ssé gwɔ̌ tà ne ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pégè ntí mefʉ̌’ nò mégè, à té ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́ keen? N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ne ńgɔɔn.
en: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say?IsGod unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ ńgwɔ́ pege é le gɔɔn pú’u wɔ́, e Ssé gwé’e e tè ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, mbà à tè ku’ pá’ ńgwɔ́ á ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm pie ee ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́.
en: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

ngiemboon: Tà ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ge cʉa nà pá’ mèŋ n ne ńcÿɔ no, anò nénʉ́ gie á fó mbwo Ssé à kẅɛɛ mangyɛ̌, mé gu’te yé ntí pú’u, e Ssé piŋ ńgíŋe ńŋaga wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n gee nyìŋ tepòŋ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà ńgwɔ́ á cʉ́me ngie: Pege gÿo menò tepòŋ ńzsé ngie nò mbòŋo ge kẅɛɛ mǒ. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne shwóŋte nà lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ n zɔ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a ee pʉ̀a pie e Ssé ge gÿo ŋaga wɔ́b.
en: And notrather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege gɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Ńgie áa mvfò Ssé peg pà Yuda cʉa pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ keen? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́. Mèŋ n ně ńdá’ ńda’te pá’ nò tepòŋ léen ḿbú ńjÿó pà Yuda mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: What then? are we betterthan they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

ngiemboon: Tà tsǒon tà’.
en: There is none righteous, no, not one:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à kwa’ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lézsé mánzsè Ssé à tè wó wɔ́.
en: There is none that seeketh after God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ tè nò mbòŋo gÿo tà tsǒon tà’.
en: There is none that doeth good, no, not one.

ngiemboon: Anò gie á kẅɛɛ nà mekùb ncwò mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ sesìŋ nnú.
en: The poison of aspsisunder their lips:

ngiemboon: Ncwò wɔ́b zoon pʉ̀a zoon, ńnéŋ pɔ́ ndòon.
en: Whose mouthisfull of cursing and bitterness:

ngiemboon: Akwò yɔ́b zeŋe pɔ́ nà lénɔ̌ɔn pʉ̀a, ḿpfɛte metse mɔ́b.
en: Their feetareswift to shed blood:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, ńcʉŋte shúm pɔ̀ ntsèm, mé cʉ́’ ńdʉa.
en: Destruction and miseryarein their ways:

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo jʉ’ wɔ́.
en: And the way of peace have they not known:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo yɔ́b nò pɔ́ tè pɔ̌g Ssé.
en: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ Ssé, pege piŋ ńzsé ngie anò ntsèm gie*lepʉ̌ gɔɔn, é vɔgɔ ńgɔɔn mbwo pà Yuda pie*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ sá’a wɔ́b. Pá’ pɔ́ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ yɔ́b pɔ́ ngàŋ mefʉa la, ncwò wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, ge jÿɔ́’ɔ, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ piŋ tyé mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gwě ntsaŋ.
en: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

ngiemboon: Áa pá’ɔɔn nue nyìŋ tè lá’ lɔg pá’ à gɔɔn ngie à gÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, étyé mvfò Ssé é gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́. Afa’a*lepʉ̌ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lényɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ngie pɔ́ zsé ngie pɔ́ gyǒ nò tepòŋ.
en: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the lawisthe knowledge of sin.

ngiemboon: Tá’ aa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé kéen ńda’te ntí gie à fó mǒ ńcʉ́’ ńdíe nyìŋ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, é ké tè ntí gie e fóo ná*lepʉ̌ wɔ́. Ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê tà mbɔɔ ye pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn nò ńtí wɛ̌ mánzsè.
en: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo, mbà e Ssé ge cʉ́’ líe ngàŋ, à gwɔ́ mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Ee ndà’ nzsè mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm. Pɔ́ ée mvfò Ssé ḿbú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó,
en: even the righteousness of Godwhich isby faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:

ngiemboon: á nue pɔ́b metsèm la zɔɔn ḿbú ńgÿo menò tepòŋ tà sɔ́ɔn legú’ gẅie aa lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

ngiemboon: Tá’, pá’ Yěsô Kristo kéen ńtó, ńkyɛ́’ ńkÿo nò tepòŋ ná pʉ̀a la, e Ssé cʉ́’ fó mǒ ńdíe pʉ̀a pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á gwɔ́ mmó gie à lɔgɔ ńcÿó gem yɔ́b pɔ́ sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ.
en: being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka lɔgɔ́ yé ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ pá’ metse mé ge sɔg menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m ná yé Kristo. Pá’ nyìŋ la gẅiin lékwé ná menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a la, á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé gÿo menò mé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Á kaa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, pʉ̀a mesoŋ ne ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, yé Ssé gÿo pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie à tè ne ńgyá wɔ́ la.
en: whom God hath set forthto bea propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

ngiemboon: À kaa fʉ̀’ó ne shÿɔgɔ shÿɔg ńzẅí’te, tá’ áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, á ne ńnyɛɛ ngie àa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgíŋe ńnyɛɛ ngie à líe nyìŋ gẅie à záb ntʉ́m wé ná Kristo á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: to declare,I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pá’ɔɔn atsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ gíŋe ńdɔg ńŋá’te á gwɔ́ wó? Ngǎŋ á té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́ tà tsǒon kɔ́. Pú’u, mélà’a kɔ́? Mélà’mie ammó gie e Ssé ne ńzẅí’te, á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ légɔɔn ngie à gÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ lézáb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô.
en: Whereisboasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ne ńzsé yég ngie: E Ssé gwɔ́ líe nyìŋ á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, ńtí pɔ́ nò gie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô, á té fóo ná pá’ à gÿǒ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́.
en: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

ngiemboon: Á gwe’e ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Ssé cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pà Yuda gílé pɔ́b, tá’ e giŋé ńgwɔ́ Ssé pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: Is hethe God of the Jews only?is henot also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́. À líe pà Yuda pie é záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, yé zɔ́ gǐŋ ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, tá mbà pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: seeingit isone God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

ngiemboon: Ńzsé ngie áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, mbà*lepʉ̌ cʉ́’ʉ tsɔ́ nò wɔ́ keen? Ngǎŋ á té ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà pege lɔgɔ pú’u, ńtÿɔ́gɔ*lepʉ̌ kwà’ ná jʉ’e.
en: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pá’ɔɔn pege ge gɔɔn ngie kɔ́, á nà nò Ábalam gẅie aa mangʉa njʉ’ weg pà Yuda? À la lɔg metʉ̀ nyìŋ mesoŋ ńgẅiin kɔ́?
en: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?

ngiemboon: À laa pé’è e Ssé wɔ́ gɔɔn ngie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á fó pɔ́ nà mefà’ mbòŋo mé, mbà à lɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔg ńŋá’te, tá tsɔ̌ légwɔ́ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á lɔg ńŋá’te mvfò Ssé à tè wó wɔ́.
en: For if Abraham were justified by works, he hathwhereofto glory; but not before God.

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Á gɔɔn ngie: «Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, e Ssé fó mǒ ńcʉ́’ ńdíe yé, á gwɔ́ mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ».
en: For what saith the scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie, nyìŋ fa’a fà’, tà mé ná nkáb né yé ńtí yɛ̌ fà’, yɛ̌ nkáb é tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó gie mé náa né yé pɔ́ sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ wɔ́, ee gie á zɛ́te ngie mé ná né yé.
en: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à kaa lɔg pɔ́ mefà’ mé wɔ́, ńzáb pɔ́ ndà’ ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé gẅie à gÿo nyìŋ tepòŋ cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, e Ssé lɔg pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie fùɔ Ndavíd la gɔɔn. À la gɔɔn nò ná nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé cʉ̌’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, á ké tè fóo nà mefà’ ngàŋ wɔ́, wɛ̌ nyìŋ aa shÿó mbòŋo.
en: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,

ngiemboon: MÀvéle menò tepòŋ mɔ́b
en: And whose sins are covered.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cʉ’ʉ́ ńkímte menò tepòŋ mé wɔ́
en: Blessedisthe man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pá’ɔɔn wɔɔn légwɔ́ shÿó mbòŋo, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ we pʉ̀a pie mé la pú’u wɔ́b pá’ pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé kà à giŋé ńgwɔ́ mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie mé la tè wɔ́b pú’? Pege ee pá’ɔɔn ne ńgɔɔn ngie á la gʉa ná Ábalam, e Ssé lɔg pɔ́ pá’ à zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé Ssé, ńcʉ́’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: Comeththis blessedness then upon the circumcisiononly, or upon the uncircumcision also? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness.

ngiemboon: À la gÿo pú’u, ná yé á fʉ̀’e kɔ́? Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé pú’u Ábalam kà mé la nyé tè pú’u yé? Á la tè gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé pú’u yé wɔ́.
en: How was it then reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa pú’u Ábalam, e Ssé ne ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á nue à la ne ńzába ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé. Mé la gÿo tá ńcÿɔ’ɔ liŋé nyìŋ gẅie mé pú’u yé ná yé. Yɛ̌ liŋé lɔ́ɔn ńda’te ngie Ssé fǒ ná pá’ yé Ábalam zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé. Á fó pú’u Ábalam cʉ́’ʉ tá pà pʉ̀a métsèm pie pɔ́ ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé tà mbɔɔ pá’ mé kaa wɔ́b pú’u, e Ssé cʉ́’ʉ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith whichhe had yetbeing uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also:

ngiemboon: Ábalam gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ tá pà pʉ̀a pie mé la pú’u wɔ́b. N tě ńgɔɔn pʉ̀a pie mé la pú’u wɔ́b á ku’ pú’u mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́. N gɔɔn pie pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé, pá’ tá wege Ábalam la záb wé yé tá mé gÿo ḿbú’u yé.
en: and the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, whichhe hadbeingyetuncircumcised.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ nò gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ngie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo Ábalam, mbɔɔ mbwo ngẅɛ̀ ye ngie à ge lá’ ná ngwòŋ mbwo pɔ́b. E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn tě ńka’a pá’ɔɔn, pɔ́ mélà’mie Ábalam la ne ńgÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ à záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world,wasnot to Abraham, or to his seed, through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.

ngiemboon: Á la gwe’e pé’è ńgwɔ́ gie mé ge fó pɔ́ ná pá’ mé gÿǒ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, tá gẅiin mmó gie e Ssé la ka’, mbà lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé à gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ, ammó gie Ssé la ka’ piŋ le pumte.
en: For if they which are of the lawbeheirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ zɔɔn ńgÿo lóŋ Ssé gyáŋ gyáŋ á nue pʉ̀a té ne ńkú’te wɔ́. Á la gwé’e pé’è*lepʉ̌ té wó wɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a té fʉa*lepʉ̌ pá’ɔɔn wɔ́.
en: because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is,there isno transgression.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, nyìŋ lɔg pɔ́ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tá ńgẅiin shúm sie mé la ká’. E Ssé lɔgɔ pú’u, ńcÿó pɔ́ gem yé, á lêen ńké ńcʉa pú’u, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie aa nà ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam wɔ́ gẅiin ye mǒ. Tà é le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńjú’ yɔ́b pɔ́ mbwo*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê wɔ́, é gíŋe ńgwɔ́ mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zába yɔ́b pɔ́ ntʉ̀m nà Ssé pá’ Ábalam. Àa tá wege metsèm pie pege ee pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: Thereforeit isof faith, thatit might beby grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham; who is the father of us all,

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé ne ńgɔɔn ná yé ngie: «Mèŋ n zabá gú pá’ ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ mangʉa njʉ’ pʉ̀a melá’a melá’». Ábalam aa mvfò Ssé gẅie yé Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgwɔ́ mangʉa njʉ’ wege, é gwɔ́ Ssé gie e gÿo mepfó gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó, ńtóŋo mmó gie á zɔɔn tè wó wɔ́, á kẅɛɛ ńtyé.
en: (as it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed,evenGod, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.
