ngiemboon: E Ssé la ka’a mmó mbwo Ábalam, atsɔ́ légwɔ́ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ á kwaŋa légẅiin à la tè wó wɔ́, tá á ke ńzáb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé zǎb, ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te yɛ̌ mmó, ńgÿo ńcʉ́’ʉ tá pà mengwòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Á lɔgɔ ńcʉ́me ná nò gie Ssé la gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gyá pá’ ngẅɛ̀ jù ge lá’ gyɔ́ɔn pú’u».
en: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwɔ́ gɔɔn yɔɔn nò né Ábalam á cʉ́’ pɔ́ méjʉ’ à gẅiin ngù’ nkÿo. Mbà mbùm ye tǎŋ tɛ’. Anzwě we Sara gíŋ ńzẅiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le gíŋe ńzyé wɔ́. Tá Ábalam ké tè kʉ́a lézáb ntʉ́m nà nò gie Ssé gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́.
en: And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sarah's womb:

ngiemboon: À la tè mʉ́’te nà nò gie Ssé ka’á mbwo yé wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé la gÿo á tʉ́te, ńnéŋe ne ńgu’te Ssé,
en: he staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;

ngiemboon: ńkwa’ ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé ngie Ssé gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo ammó gie yé Ssé kǎ’ á pumte.
en: and being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé líe Ábalam á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.

ngiemboon: Tá mé lɔ́ɔn tě sáŋa pɔ́ ndà’ yé gílé yé tá ńŋwe’e ngie: «E Ssé la líe yé, á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé wɔ́».
en: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn sáŋa mbɔɔ wégè yégè, pie e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńge gÿo líe wégè, pege gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á wégè pie pege zába ntʉ́m ná yé Ssé gẅie à la gÿo Ndè wege Yěsô Kristo fó lá’ mepfó ńzím.
en: but for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la ńnéŋe Kristo mbwo pʉ̀a pá’ à ge kwé é tí menò tepòŋ mégè. Á la piŋ ńzíme yé nà legwé éfó mǒ ńcʉ́’ ńdíe wégè pege gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.

ngiemboon: Pá’ à la cʉa nà lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô Kristo, e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe wégè pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé la, pega Ssé ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńnéŋe mboŋó, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Yé Yěsô zɔ la tsɔ́’ɔ mánzsè tá Ssé cÿó gem yégè pá’ɔɔn, ta à cʉ̌’ ńgwaa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ né pégè pú’u éfó nà pá’ pege zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé Yěsô. Pege ee pá’ɔɔn lékag gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pege tɛ’, á nue pege neŋé ne ńzẅí’te pá’ Ssé ge gÿo gab shúm sie ée nà legú’ we, é ná ségè.
en: by whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

ngiemboon: Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, peg giŋé ńgẅiin lékag tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀’ gie peg ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, ńně ńzsé ngie e ngɔ́’ ge gÿo peg shÿɔg.
en: And not onlyso, but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;

ngiemboon: Léshÿɔg ge gÿo pege cÿɔgte. À cʉa pú’u, pege ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te ngie ammó gie shwóŋè Ssé ne ńgɔɔn, yé Ssé ge gÿo à pumte nà pege.
en: and patience, experience; and experience, hope:

ngiemboon: Pege kě těen ńzẅí’te pú’u, pɔ́ jʉ’e sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́, á nue Ssé kéen fó nà Zẅìge yé gie à ka nǎ né pege, ńnyɛɛ wege pá’ɔɔn tɛ’ ngie à kwoŋo wégè.
en: and hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pá’ á kaa fʉ̀’ gie pege ka zɔɔn ńnyé pɔ́ pàtè metʉ̀, Kristo tóo nà fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé lá záb, ńkwé nà twó pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńtʉ tɛ’ tá nyìŋ mésoŋ zẅíŋe lékwé nà twó wetsɔ̌, tà mbɔɔ pá’ wɛ̌ nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kú’te*lepʉ̌. Ndyɛ̀’ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zẅíŋe lékwé ńtí nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo menò mbòŋo.
en: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi lêen ńké ńgyá ntí gie Ssé la lɔg ńnyɛ pá’ á kwoŋo wege pú’u, aa pá’ Kristo la tó ńkwé nà twó ségè tà pege zɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà metse mé kéen ńgÿo e Ssé cʉ́’ʉ ńdíe wégè pege gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, ńgwɔ́ kɔ́ piŋ ńgÿo tà Kristo lá’ ńnyé té gÿo pege tsẅɛ ngɔ́’ gie e ge lá’ fó nà pá’ e Ssé ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ?
en: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.

ngiemboon: Pega Ssé ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ megàŋ mbù, tá Ssé lɔg pá’ Míŋ we kwé, ḿmag mbù wegá pɔ̌. Á ge piŋ gwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, à gaa wɔ́ ńdɔg pá’ Míŋ we gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́ ngɔ́’ tsẅɛ́!
en: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.

ngiemboon: Pege těen ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ ndà’ yɛ̌ nò ńka’te wɔ́, pege giŋé ńka’te ńtí pá’ Ssé kéen ńcʉa nà nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ńgÿo mbù gẅie é kaa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pega Ssé mag.
en: And not onlyso, but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.

ngiemboon: Anò tepòŋ la gwaa kúu tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ńcʉa pɔ́ nà tà’ nyìŋ mésoŋ wémɔ’ɔ́, gẅie à la fʉa nò, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Adam. Á nò tepòŋ la lɔgɔ legwé ńtó. Legwé lêen ńké ńkúu nà ngẅɛ̀ nyìŋ mésoŋ ntsèm, á nue pʉ̀a metsèm laa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ fʉa nò.
en: Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgwaa ńná*lepʉ̌ né Mǒsê, mbà nò tepòŋ léen ndà’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. Á laa fʉ̀’ gie*lepʉ̌ la nyé tè gwɔ̌ wó, e Ssé tè sáŋa nò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: (for until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

ngiemboon: À nò Adam sẅé yé nyìŋ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ge lá’ tá tó.
en: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam's transgression, who is the figure of him that was to come.

ngiemboon: Tá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le lɔgɔ mmó gie á fó nà mefʉa Adam ḿbí fʉ̀’ nà nzẅìŋ fù’ gie e Ssé ne ńgába mbwo pʉ̀a pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́, mefʉa tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ la gÿo legwé kúu nà mânyìŋ ntsèm tá’, ntí gie e Ssé la tsɔ́ɔn pʉ̀a ńcÿó gem yɔ́b pú’u, piŋ ḿbú fáŋ ńcʉa wɛ̌ légwɔ́ tɛ’. À fù’ gie á la fó nà tà’ nyìŋ gẅie aa Yěsô Kristo, e Ssé lɔg ńcÿó gem pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn á pú ńgẅiin nzẅìŋ tɛ’.
en: But not as the offence, so alsoisthe free gift. For if through the offence of one many be dead, much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace,which isby one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie e Ssé náa, la fa’a fà’ mboŋó. À yé fà’ á té pá’ ye nò tepòŋ wɔ́. Nò tepòŋ gie wɔɔn tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ la fʉa, la gÿo pʉ̀a metsèm gwé ntsaŋ. Tá’ e Ssé gwɔ́ tà ńcÿo gem pʉ̀a, á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ zɔɔn fʉa menò tɛ’ tá’, yé Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, ntsaŋ e té gíŋe ńgwoon wɔ́b gwɔ́,
en: And not asit wasby one that sinned,so isthe gift: for the judgmentwasby one to condemnation, but the free giftisof many offences unto justification.

ngiemboon: pá’ tà’ nyìŋ mesoŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ la fʉa nò, legwé fó nà yé ńgẅiin nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ tè vʉ’ʉ tsɔ̌, tá’ wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie àa Yěsô Kristo, à yé fà’ gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Epʉ̀a pie e Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b tɛ’ ńcÿó gem yɔ́b, à cʉ̌’ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò ye. Pɔ́ ge cʉa nà Yěsô é gwɔ́ wó, e piŋ gwɔ́ pá’ mefùɔ la é tíi Kristo.
en: For if by one man's offence death reigned by one; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.)

ngiemboon: Pá’ pege gyǎ ngie á la fó nà nò gie tà’ nyìŋ fʉ̌a, á Adam, pʉ̀a metsèm kwéte kwéte la, á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́, á Yěsô Kristo la gÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe ńcʉa mǒ ńtsẅɛ́ ntsaŋ, ńgwiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Therefore as by the offence of onejudgment cameupon all men to condemnation; even so by the righteousness of onethe free gift cameupon all men unto justification of life.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ tà’ nyìŋ mesoŋ la lʉ’ʉ lé jú’ ncwò Ssé, anùɔ lá’ fó mǒ ńcʉ́’ ngàŋ mefʉa la, tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ la jú’ ncwò Ssé, á fó mǒ anùɔ lá’ lá’ ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé líe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: For as by one man's disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.

ngiemboon: Tá á piŋ ńgʉa nà*lepʉ̌, mbà Ssé lɔ̌ɔn zába légwɔ̀ gie pʉ̀a ge fó mǒ é gyá nzẅìŋ gẅie pɔ́ lɔg ńgÿo nò tepòŋ pú’u. Pá’ menò tepòŋ ne ńgyɔ́ɔn lêkɔ́ wɔ́ e Ssé ne ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a ńcÿó gem yɔ́b tà ńtɔ́gɔ ntí.
en: Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound:

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, e Ssé lɔg pá’ à tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b, yé zɔ̌ cʉ́’ ńgẅiin wɔ́b, ńgÿo pɔ́ cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á lɔgɔ sẅé pá’ nò tepòŋ la gÿo legwé gẅiin pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńzẅéte wɔ́b. E Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mégè ńcÿó gem yégè pú’u, pege zẅɛ́’ɛ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo tá ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: that as sin hath reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà à pá’ɔɔn pege gÿo lêkɔ́? Pege ké ńkẅí’i ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge lɔgɔ lélege mefʉa wege, mé kwa’ ńgyá pá’ à ne ńcÿó gem pʉ̀a keen?
en: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ! Ńgwɔ́ pege é le pú’u, gÿo. Pá’ á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nà légÿo nò tepòŋ, mbà pege léen ńkwé lá, ńgwɔ́ pege gǎ tá ńgíŋe ne ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ?
en: God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?

ngiemboon: Pi legé ngie á gʉa ná pege metsèm pie mé la nu’u wégè ntse, pege lɔgɔ ńdaa nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo, lénu’u wégè ntse ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńda’te ngie pega pɔ̌ la púte ńkwé tà’ legwé ka?
en: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?

ngiemboon: Pá’ á la fó nà kẅé ntse, pega pɔ̌ púte ńkwé, mé gíŋe ḿbúte wega pɔ̌ ńtúŋ, légwɔ́ gie pá’ e Ssé Tá la lɔg metʉ̀ mie é gẅiin legú’, ńgÿo Kristo zíme ná legwé la, pege yégè ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ le gwɔ́ we sẅé.
en: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn pá’a, mbà pege la kwé legwé gẅie à sẅé we, ńdɔg pú’u, pega pɔ̌ pumo ná tà’a nò á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pega pɔ̌ ge gÿo gíŋe pumo ná lézíme nà legwé.
en: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be alsoin the likenessofhisresurrection:

ngiemboon: Tà pege lege ngie: Mé la púte Kristo laa nzẅìŋe nyìŋ gẅie à laa ná pege ńkíme nà tÿǒ nkǐ, légwɔ́ gie metʉ̀ mmó gie á laa ná pege, ńtsóte wégè pege gÿo nò tepòŋ, é ge mag pege é le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: knowing this, that our old man is crucified withhim, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńkwé, à tè gíŋe ńku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, nkÿo nò tepòŋ fó ná yé ńkyɛ́’ɛ.
en: For he that is dead is freed from sin.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pega Kristo la púte ńkwé la, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pega pɔ̌ ge gÿo é púte gwɔ́ wó.
en: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

ngiemboon: Peg cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie Kristo la vɔg tà ńzíme nà legwé, à tè lá’ gíŋe kwé wɔ́. Legwé tè gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nò ná yé wɔ́.
en: knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.

ngiemboon: Kristo la kwé, ńkwé pɔ́ tà’ légʉa, á nà menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a. Àa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó pɔ́ léná mekù’ Ssé.
en: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, pilíe twó mbùm gí pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée nà nò tepòŋ, ńcʉ́’ pɔ́ mepfó. Pi cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é lɔg pá’ pɔ́ la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ńcʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ ntí ye sẅé pá’ pɔ́ ge fa’a fà’ Ssé.
en: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie anò tepòŋ gíŋe sá’ mbùm nnɛ́ gi gie e ge gÿo kwé wɔ́, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńnyé mbùm gi é tsóte gẅi ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kegɔ́’.
en: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńdɔg mekèm mbùm mí ńgÿo nò tepòŋ pá’ mé lɔgɔ shúm ncù ńgÿo menò tepòŋ. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pi pú ńnyé mbùm gi mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ kwà’ pʉ̀a pie é ka kwě ḿbiŋ ńzím. Pi lɔg mekèm mbùm mí ńgÿo shúm sie pi ge lɔg gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Neither yield ye your membersasinstruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your membersasinstruments of righteousness unto God.

ngiemboon: Anò tepòŋ zɔɔn tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńgẅiin gẅi wɔ́, á nue pi cʉ’ʉ́ ńgiŋe ná mánzsè*lepʉ̌ wɔ́, pi cʉ’ʉ́ ńgiŋe pɔ́ ná mánzsè gẅie e Ssé ne ńcʉa mǒ ńcÿó gem gí, pi ne gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Mé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pege gÿo menò tepòŋ, á nue pege cʉ’ʉ́ ńgiŋe ná mánzsè*lepʉ̌ wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe pɔ́ ná gẅie e Ssé cʉa mǒ ńcÿó gem yégè, ńdɔgɔ wégè ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé keen? Ngǎŋ ńgwɔ́ pege le pú’u gÿo.
en: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ké ńdege ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ nkwɔɔn nyìŋ pá’ à ge ne jú’u ncwò ngàŋ, mbà à cʉ̌’ nkwɔɔn ngàŋ. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pi lɔɔn ne ńjú’u ncwò nò tepòŋ, mbà pi cʉ̌’ nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ, á gÿo pi kwé, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ne ńjú’u ncwò Ssé, mbà pi ge cʉ́’ nkwɔɔn Ssé, à gÿo pi gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

ngiemboon: Pege ké sie Ssé, mélà’mie pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwɔ́ nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ, pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà pi kéen ńdɔg ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm, ńzẅíŋe mmó gie mé ka zí’i gẅí. Á gwɔ́ gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi vɔg ńzsé,
en: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé kéen ńkyɛ́’ nkÿo nò tepòŋ ná pi, pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ nkwɔɔn nò gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

ngiemboon: Meŋ n dɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie m bǐ fʉ̀’ ná menò mie é ne ńcʉate tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ fa’a légÿo pi cwoŋo ńjú’, á nue nyìŋ mesoŋ pÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌. Pi la lɔg mekèm mbùm mí ńgÿo nkwɔɔn menò ncÿǒ laa ye menò lɔg ńtág jʉ’. Mɛ̌ menò gwɔ́ mie é gÿo mé tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé tʉ. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńdɔg mekèm mbùm mí ŋwɛ́ ńgÿo pɔ́ nkwɔɔn gie é fa’a mbwo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, à lêen ńké fó pú’u, léńnéŋe gẅi gwɔ́ we Ssé.
en: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie pi la nyé nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ, légÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé á té tsɔ́ nò ná pi gẅiin.
en: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.

ngiemboon: Pi la jÿó kɔ́ pì ná yɛ̌ ntí mefà’? Pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńkwaŋ mɛ̌ mefà’ éshʉ́ kúu gẅi mǒ kú, mélà’mie é gwaa mag ńná pɔ́ legwé.
en: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those thingsisdeath.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pá’ á ké ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé kéen ńkyɛ́’ nkÿo nò tepòŋ ná pi, pi cʉ́’ nkwɔɔn ye la, apì gie á ne ńkẅɛɛ áa pá’ Ssé ne ńkẅéte gẅi pi ne ńgẅiin tsẅé pʉ̀a pé, á ge gÿo cʉ́’ʉ lécʉ́me pi gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì,
en: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.

ngiemboon: a nue mmó gie nò tepòŋ lɔ́g ḿbéen fà’a nyìŋ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋ lekwé, tá afù’ gie e Ssé náa mbwo nyìŋ pɔ́ sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ, á gwɔ́ pá’ ngàŋ zẅɛ̌’ pá’ á la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: For the wages of sinisdeath; but the gift of Godiseternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi pie pi ne ńzsé mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ée yɛ̌, pi tè ne ḿmoŋe ngie*lepʉ̌ gẅiin nò ná nyìŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie angàŋ nyé ntentʉ́ wɔ́.
en: Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?

ngiemboon: Pege pí fʉ̀’ ná manzwě nzɔ̌’. Andǔm we nyé ntentʉ́, à tè gẅiin lényé yé ńgʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa pɔ́ yé zɔ́’ wɔ́,*lepʉ̌ lʉ’ pú’u. Tá andǔm we vɔg tà ńkwé,*lepʉ̌ zẅíŋ ngie aa ńgwɔ́ á gʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ tsɔ́ mámbàŋa pɔ́ yé zɔ́’.
en: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law toherhusband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law ofherhusband.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la ńgwɔ́ gie andǔm we lɔɔn ńnyé té kwé, á zɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa, mbà mé ge tóŋo yé le ngàŋa gÿɛ́ manzwě. Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie andǔm we lɔɔn ńkwé,*lepʉ̌ le gíŋe ńtɔ’ɔ yé lézɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa wɔ́. Á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzwě tsɔ́ nyìŋ fʉ̀’ó, á le gwɔ́ ngie à gÿo gÿɛ́ wɔ́.
en: So then if, whileherhusband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, ná pi, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn. Pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nà nò*lepʉ̌ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepfó tá ńdɔgɔ nku’u pʉa Ssé, á nue pia Kristo la púte ńkwé fʉ̀’ gie à la kwé, pia*lepʉ̌ lɔg pú’u, fege légwɔ́ gie pi ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, é pʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo gẅie e Ssé la gÿo á zíme ná legwé. Légwɔ́ gie pege ge fa’ mefà’ mie ée me mbòŋo mbwo Ssé.
en: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another,evento him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.

ngiemboon: Á ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mbùm yege zɔ ka nyě sá’a wégè, letsɔ̌ɔn légÿo nò gie á te poŋ pʉ́’te mbùm yege, a nue*lepʉ̌ tɔ́’, ńgíŋe ńkẅi’i ḿbʉ́’te wégè, pege fa’ pɔ́ mefà’ mie é ge tóŋ pɔ́ legwé é ńnéŋe ná pege.
en: For when we were in the flesh, the motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pege cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe ná mánzsè*lepʉ̌ tà ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, á nue pege ee ná wɛ̌ mánzsè gẅie à kɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ wégè ńgÿo megàŋa tsǎŋ, ńcʉ́’ pɔ́ mepfó. Tà peg ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ fa’a mbwo Ssé pɔ́ nà ntí ye sẅé, ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a éfa’a, tà peg tè gíŋe fa’a ná ntí ye fʉ̀’e mvfò, á fʉ̀’ gie peg kɔ̌ɔn ńjú’u pɔ́ ncwò*lepʉ̌ sie mé la ŋwe’e wɔ́.
en: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and notinthe oldness of the letter.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie*lepʉ̌ Ssé ée mmó tepòŋ keen? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́, a nue n ka kě fó pɔ́ nà*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ tá ńzsé nò tepòŋ, é laa pé’è é té gɔɔn ngie: «Tè gẅiin kègɔ́’» wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n tè kègɔ́’ zsé.
en: What shall we say then?Isthe law sin? God forbid. Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.

ngiemboon: Anò tepòŋ gie áa nà mèŋ la zẅɛ́’ pɔ́*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, ḿbʉ́’te wɔ̀ɔn, légÿo shúm tepòŋ sie ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn tsɔ́ɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn,*lepʉ̌ la zɔɔn ńgwé’e é té wó wɔ́, mbà nò tepòŋ té gẅiin tʉ̀ wɔ́.
en: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sinwasdead.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie n da nyé tè zsé*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńjú’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́, n da piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà ńzsé, létsɔ́ɔn légÿo nò tepòŋ kúu ná mèŋ,
en: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

ngiemboon: mèŋ n kwé. Á gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà*lepʉ̌ sie é kɔ’ɔ́ gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, mbà é cʉ̌’ ńtóo ná mèŋ ńtsege wɔɔn ńnéŋ pɔ́ nà legwé.
en: And the commandment, whichwas ordainedto life, I foundto beunto death.

ngiemboon: N da jú’ sɛ̌*lepʉ̌, nò tepòŋ gie áa ná mèŋ gyá shÿó ńdɔg*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ ńdʉte wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gÿo nò tepòŋ, anò tepòŋ cʉa mǒ ńzẅé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slewme.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ lɔgɔ pú’u, éfóo mbwo Ssé, anò gie é tsẅi ngie mé gÿo gíŋe fó yé pɔ́ mbwo Ssé, ńgwɔ́ nò gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgwɔ́ gie áa ḿboŋ.
en: Wherefore the lawisholy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pú’u pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie ammó gie áa mbòŋ kéen ńtóo ná mèŋ ńcʉ́’ pɔ́ legwé keen? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́. Anò tepòŋ zɔ̌ la gÿo n kwé, anò tepòŋ la kwa’ ńnyɛ ngie á té poŋ. Á la zẅɛ́’ɛ mmó gie áa mbòŋ ńdɔg ńgÿo mèŋ n kwé, ńdɔg pú’u, ńcʉa nà mmó gie e Ssé la tsẅi ngie mé gÿo, ńkẅɛɛ kwà’ máamáa nò tepòŋ.
en: Was then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie*lepʉ̌ fó mbwo Ssé. Tá á ké ńgʉa ná mèŋ, nyìŋ mesoŋ, mèŋ fege fege, mbà mé la sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn n cʉ́’ nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.

ngiemboon: N zɔɔn kwa’ tè ne ńzsé mmó gie mèŋ n gÿo wɔ́. Ammó gie mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo, mèŋ n tè yɛ̌ gÿo, n gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie mèŋ n tè kwòŋ.
en: For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n tè kwoŋo mmó gie mèŋ n gÿo wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ pú’u, ńzẅíŋe ngie*lepʉ̌ ée mbòŋ.
en: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law thatit isgood.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mèŋ n zɔ tě ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo mɛ̌ menò wɔ́, nò tepòŋ gie á léen ńjÿó wɔ̀ɔn zɔ̌ gÿo.
en: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie nò mbòŋo léen tè wɔ̀ɔn jÿó, n gɔɔn wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie mèŋ fege fege. N tsɔ́ɔn légÿo nò mbòŋo fʉ̀’ ntsèm tá ńké tè ku’u légÿo wɔ́.
en: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; buthowto perform that which is good I find not.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè gÿo nò mbòŋo gie mèŋ n tsɔ̌ɔn légÿo wɔ́, mèŋ n gÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ gie mèŋ n tè tsɔ́ɔn.
en: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n gÿo mmó gie mèŋ n tè tsɔ́ɔn légÿo wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n zɔ tě ńgÿo wɔ́, à nò tepòŋ gie á léen ńjÿó wɔ̀ɔn zɔ̌ gÿo.
en: Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pú’u, ńgyá ngie áa ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, n ngie kɔ tà mèŋ n gÿo nò mbòŋo, esɔ́ɔn*lepʉ̌ gwɔ́ ngie mèŋ n gÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ.
en: I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ,*lepʉ̌ Ssé poŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’.
en: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ mbùm mèŋ, n gyá tsɔ́*lepʉ̌ gwɔ́ wó, ésie é ńnéŋe ńdɔg ncù, ḿma’*lepʉ̌ sie legyè sɔ́ɔn kwa’ ńzẅíŋ, ńgÿó mèŋ n cʉ́’ʉ ngàŋa tsǎŋ*lepʉ̌ nò tepòŋ gie á léen ńjÿó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: but I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.

ngiemboon: N tè pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shÿó tepòŋ wɔ́, àwɔ́ ge lá’ fó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ gie e tóŋo legwé ńnéŋe ná mèŋ é kẅile wɔ̀ɔn?
en: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ ge tóo tsoló kẅile wɔ̀ɔn. Á cʉa ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo yé. Áa pú’u, legyè sɔ́ɔn ne shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn ngie n kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé, tá mbab nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ gie mèŋ n gẅiin ne ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn n kú’te pɔ́*lepʉ̌ nò tepòŋ.
en: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pʉ̀a pie é la nnɛ́ ná Yěsô kristo, é té ge lá’ gíŋe gwe ntsaŋ wɔ́,
en: There istherefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie nyìŋ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńda nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo*lepʉ̌ sie é cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé gwɔ́ pɔ́ se Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó. Sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ léen ńkẅé wɔ̀ɔn mbwo*lepʉ̌ sie ée se nò tepòŋ, ńgwɔ́ sie é gÿo mé kwé.
en: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ Mǒsê la tè ku’u légÿo yɛ̌ mmó wɔ́, á nue nyìŋ mesoŋ la lɔg pá’ à fege fege, ńtáte. Tá Ssé la ké ńgÿo yɛ̌ mmó, ńcʉ́’ʉ légÿo, ńtúmo kwà’ Míŋ we á sele ńcʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mésoŋ, á nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie aa ngàŋ mefʉa légwɔ́ gie à ge kẅile nyìŋ mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ nò tepòŋ. E Ssé la lɔg pú’u, ńzẅé metʉ̀ nò tepòŋ gie á sá’a pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:

ngiemboon: À la gÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pege ge ku’u léńnéŋe ná ntí gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te. Mèŋ n gɔɔn wégè pie pege cʉ́’ʉ́ ńgiŋe ná ntí gie mbùm yege ne ńtsóte wégè wɔ́, pege cʉ’ʉ́ ńgiŋe pɔ́ nà ntí gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne shwóŋó wégè.
en: that the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zɔɔn ńnéŋe pɔ́ nà ntí gie mbùm yɔb ne shwóŋó wɔ́b, tÿɔ́g ntʉ́m wɔ́b pɔ́ nà mmó gie mbùm yɔb ne ńkwoŋo, tá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe nà ntí gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne shwóŋó wɔ́b tÿɔ́g ntʉ́m wɔ́b pɔ́ nà mmó gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńkwoŋo.
en: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔg pɔ́ ntí gie mbùm ye ne shwóŋó yé ńdɔg ńnéŋe, mbà ngàŋ aa ná mánzsè legwé. Tá nyìŋ gẅie à lɔg ntí gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne shwóŋó yé ńdɔg ńnéŋe, mbà ngàŋ aa ná mánzsè le gwɔ́, à gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ mánzsè mbʉ́lè.
en: For to be carnally mindedisdeath; but to be spiritually mindedislife and peace.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée ná mánzsè legwé á nue pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtÿɔ́g ntʉ́m wɔ́b pɔ́ nà mmó gie mbùm yɔb ne shwóŋó wɔ́b ée megàŋ mbù Ssé. Pɔ́ té kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́, etsɔ́ shÿó lézɔɔn ńkú’te té wɔ́ mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Because the carnal mindisenmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ epʉ̀a pie mbùm yɔb zɔ ne sá’a wɔ́b zɔɔn le ku’u légÿo mmó gie á pòŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi tè ńnéŋe nà ntí gie mbùm gi ne shwóŋó gẅi wɔ́, pi neŋé pɔ́ nà ntí gie Zẅìge Ssé ne shwóŋó gẅí, á fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie Zẅìge Ssé áa nà pi. A Zẅìge Kristo lɔɔn tè ná nyìŋ wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́.
en: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

ngiemboon: Tá Kristo lɔɔn ńké ńgwɔ́ ná pi, mbà Zẅíge yé ge gÿo pi gwɔ́ wó. Á nue e Ssé kéen gÿo pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie à cʉ̌’ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé. Pi ge lá’ gwɔ́ wó, tà mbɔɔ pá’ mbab nnɛ́ gi ge tsɛ̀ kwé kwé é tí menò tepòŋ.
en: And if Christbein you, the bodyisdead because of sin; but the Spiritislife because of righteousness.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie Zẅìge Ssé gẅie à la zíme Yěsô ná legwé áa ná pi, mbà yé nyìŋ gẅie à la zíme Kristo ná legwé, ge gÿo gÿo mbùm gi gie ee ńkwé e lɔgɔ Zẅìge yé gie áa ná pi ńgwɔ́ yé wó.
en: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á gʉa nà Zẅìge Ssé, mbà njǔ ee twó pege, tà ńgwɔ́ pege é le ńnéŋe pɔ́ pá’ mbùm nnɛ́ yege ne shwóŋó wégè wɔ́.
en: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńnéŋe nà ntí gie mbùm nnɛ́ gi ne shwóŋó gẅí, mbà pi ge kwéte, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńdɔg metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ssé ḿbyága mà tepòŋ gẅie à fóo ná mbùm nnɛ́, mbà pi ge gwɔ́ wó.
en: For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.

ngiemboon: Á nue pʉ̀a pie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńtsyeen wɔ́b ée púɔ Ssé.
en: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge gie mé la ńnéŋe ná pi, zɔɔn tè Zẅìge gie á ge gÿo pi gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn pie pɔ́ ge ne cÿɔ’ɔ cÿɔ’ wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge gie á ge gÿo pi cʉ́’ púɔ Ssé. Pege piŋ ńzẅɛ́’ɛ yɛ̌ Zẅìge, ńtóŋo yé lê Abba; á gwɔ́ ngie Tɔ̌ɔnmé.
en: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ yé máŋwɛ́ ne ńgÿo pege cwoŋo ńzsé tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wégè ngie pege ee púɔ Ssé.
en: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:

ngiemboon: Pá’ pege ee púɔ Ssé la, pege ge lá’ gẅiin yégè mmó nà fù’ gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pé, ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin yégè mmó nà shúm Ssé, pega Kristo lɔgɔ ḿbú ńgẅiin. Pá’pege ne ńzẅíŋe légyá ngɔ́’ pá’ à la zẅíŋ yé la, pega pɔ̌ ge gÿo gíŋe púte gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we.
en: and if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer withhim, that we may be also glorified together.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie, ngɔ́’ gie pege ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne ńgyá e pú tè ku’u tsɔ́ mmó nà legú’ gẅie Ssé ge gÿo gÿo pege gyá wɔ́.
en: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present timearenot worthyto be comparedwith the glory which shall be revealed in us.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la nyɛte zɔɔn ḿbú ne ńzẅí’te tɛ’ légyá fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé ge gÿo mé gyá legú’ púɔ pé.
en: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.

ngiemboon: Kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la nyɛte léen ńgwe ná mbwo metʉ̀ mie é lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo shúm té ndyèen, pú’u ńké tè kwoŋ kwoŋ tá ńgwɔ́ shúm té ndyèen wɔ́, e Ssé zɔ zẅǐŋ pɔ́ cʉ́’ pú’u, á nue à la kwoŋ ngie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te mmó.
en: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjectedthe samein hope,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ngie tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ge lá’ ku’, à fó ndá nkwɔɔn ńkẅile kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la nyɛte, tsɔ́ mmó le gíŋe ńdʉ́ʉ mǒ wɔ́, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́ pú ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ gie púɔ Ssé ée wó tsɛ̀ɛ legú’, atsɔ́ mmó té jʉ’ó kwé, atsɔ́ ké tè lʉ́.
en: because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la nyɛte, tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn á ne ńtsẅii, ńgyá ngɔ́’ pá’ manzwě gẅie à gee ne ńzyé.
en: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.

ngiemboon: Eshúm ŋwɛ́ zɔ̌ té ńtsẅii gílé pɔ́b wɔ́. Pege yégè pie Ssé la lɔgɔ Zẅìge yé ńgÿo pege gẅiin ntwó mmó nà shúm sie à la ka’a léná né pege, pege yégè giŋé ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pege ńtsẅii pɔ́ pú’u, ńne ńzẅí’te lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ge lɔgɔ wégè gÿo púɔ pé ndà’ ndà’, pege gẅiin mbùm yé sẅé, ńtsẅɛ́ ngɔ́’.
en: And not onlythey, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption,to wit, the redemption of our body.

ngiemboon: Pege ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà pege ka tsẅɛ́, tá pege nyě tè gyǎ shúm ntsèm lê nÿɔ́g. Pege zɔɔn ńdɔg nÿɔ́g ńgyá shúm sie pege ka ne ńzẅí’te, pege é le gíŋe ńzẅí’te wɔ́, á nue é ně ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ mbwo pege. Ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ zɔɔn ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie à ne ńgyá?
en: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?

ngiemboon: Tá’ pá’ pege ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie pege tè ne ńgyá wɔ́ la, pege lɔgɔ kwɔgɔ nnɛ́ ńnyɛte ńzẅí’te.
en: But if we hope for that we see not,thendo we with patience wait forit.

ngiemboon: Lézẅí’te ŋwɛ́ giŋé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Zẅìge Ssé tó ńkẅéte wégè pie pege kʉ́a kʉ̌a. Pege tè zsé lésẅíŋte Ssé nà ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, à Zẅìge Ssé sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó ségè, à we létsẅi pá’ nyìŋ tsẅii la tɔ́gɔ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ pege gɔɔn mbwo Ssé.
en: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zsé mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pʉ̀a mesoŋ, à zsé mmó gie Zẅìge yé ne ńgɔɔn, a Zẅìge Ssé zɔɔn sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó pʉ̀a Ssé pɔ́ nà ntí gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth whatisthe mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according tothe will ofGod.

ngiemboon: Pege giŋé ne ńzsé ngie menò mie é gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńkwoŋo Ssé, e Ssé gÿo mɛ̌ menò gÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná pɔ́b, á wɔ́b gẅie à la tsɔ́’ɔ nà ntí gie à la tʉ́ njÿó ńkwaŋ.
en: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according tohispurpose.

ngiemboon: Á nue pʉ̀a pie e Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, à la gíŋe ntʉ́ njÿó ńzáb ngie mémmó ge lá’ ne kúbe ná pɔ́b kubé, tà pɔ́ sẅé Míŋ we. À cʉa pú’u, Míŋ we gwɔ́ mûɔ ndÿò á nùɔ mefɛ́ pé pie é gyɔ́ɔn.
en: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinateto beconformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie e Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, á lêen ńgíŋe ńtóŋ pɔ́ wɔ́b, ńtóŋo wɔ́b ńgíŋe ńcʉ́’ʉ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á té ku’ pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, à la gíŋe ńnáa legú’ mbwo pɔ́b.
en: Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ pege gíŋe ńkẅi’i kɔ́ nà nò gie pege gɔɔn lɔɔn? Pá’ e Ssé ee nà yégè gwǒŋ la, aa ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ ku’u ná pege?
en: What shall we then say to these things? If Godbefor us, whocan beagainst us?

ngiemboon: Yé gẅie à la tè pɔ́ɔn kwà’ Míŋ we légyá ngɔ́’ wɔ́, yé gẅie à la gÿo mé zẅé yé ńtí wégè métsèm, á ge gǎ tá á le gíŋe ńcÿó pɔ́ gem yégè ńdɔg pɔ́ yé ńná setsɔ́ shúm ntsèm né pege wɔ́?
en: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?

ngiemboon: Awɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á sẅiŋ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b? Angàŋ tè wó wɔ́, á nue Ssé zɔ ka lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie à cʉ̌’ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé,
en: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God's elect?It isGod that justifieth.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ wɔ́ ku’u légɔɔn ngie ntsaŋ jÿǒ wɔ́b? Angàŋ tè wó wɔ́, á nue Yěsô Kristo la kwé nà twó sɔ́b á té zso pú’u wɔ́ á gÿo ńzím. À ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀, ńne sẅíŋte yé nà twó ségè.
en: Whoishe that condemneth?It isChrist that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ́ mmó áa wó gie ngwɔ́ á fege wega Kristo tà á le gíŋe ńkwoŋo wégè wɔ́? Ngɔ́’ lá? Lepǔ’ mbùm lá? Mé lékʉ́e wégè lá? Nzyè lá? Apóŋ lá? E shúm sie é vege wégè lá? Ka legwé?
en: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ?shalltribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Áa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm legwé ne ńnÿɔgɔ weg nÿɔg ńtí gú. Mé ne ńdíe wég pá’*menjʉ̀njÿò mie mé gee ngwǎ la».
en: We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

ngiemboon: Tá’ á ké ńgʉa ná shúm sɛ̌ ntsèm, pege gwɔ́ pà tántʉ̀, pà cʉa sɛ̌ shúm ńzẅɛ́’ɛ nyìŋ gẅie à la kwoŋo wégè.
en: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé ngie, atsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á fege wega Ssé á té wó wɔ́, tá pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ legwé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngɔ́’ gie e tswé’e nà le gwɔ́, éfó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm sie é sá’a njÿó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɔɔn fʉ̀’ʉ njÿó ka pɔ́ gie á ge gÿo tá tó wɔ́,
en: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ metʉ̀ ntí ntí mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, é mie ée tÿǒ, kà mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ssé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ gie Ssé la pwóon, mbà tsɔ́ mmó té ńdá’a ńku’u létáte Ssé lékwoŋo wégè wɔ́. À la cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo, a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, ńnyɛ ngie à kwoŋo wégè.
en: nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

ngiemboon: Anò gie n ge gɔɔn áa nénʉ́. Pá’ mèŋ n déen ńda nnɛ́ ná Kristo la, mèŋ n tě ńgee shwóŋ cÿɔ̌ nò wɔ́. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńgÿo ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn ngie nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn áa nénʉ́.
en: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò áa ngie mèŋ n neŋé lê kwà’ lemÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ne ńjú’u kékáŋ ntʉ́m mèŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pà Yuda.
en: that I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

ngiemboon: Pega pɔ̌ ee tà’ ngẅɛ̀. Á laa gie ńgwɔ́ mánzsè gwɔ́ wó légwɔ́ gie Ssé ge gwá’a wɔ̀ɔn peg Kristo piŋ fege, tà á gwɔ́ gie mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pà Yuda ge cʉa mǒ é zsé nyìŋ gẅie Kristo aa wɛ̌, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de lʉ’.
en: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Israel. Mbà Ssé la kaŋa wɔ́b ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo púɔ pé, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b legú’ we, ńgÿo pâ pɔ̌ gwâ*kʉ̀a, á ná*lepʉ̌ sé né pɔ́b, éshwóŋó wɔ́b ntí gie pɔ́ ge lɔg gu’te yé, ńka’ menò mbwo pɔ́b tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: who are Israelites; to whompertaineththe adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the serviceof God, and the promises;

ngiemboon: Pà mangʉa njʉ’ pɔ́b la kẅɛɛ nà ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam. Kristo gẅie aa Ssé, la gÿo ńkẅɛ yé nà yɛ̌ ngẅɛ̀, á fʉ̀’ gie mé la zyé yé á gwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ. À pǔ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ná yé mengù’u mengù’.*Amen.
en: whosearethe fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christcame, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɛ ne ḿmoŋe Kristo, tá ńgwɔ́ n de gɔɔn ngie anò gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a Israel la tè kẅɛɛ nò wɔ́ wɔ́. Á nue á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, pʉ̀a pie ée nà ngẅɛ̀ Israel, lelÿò tè kwà’ pʉ̀a Israel wɔ́,
en: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect. For theyarenot all Israel, which are of Israel:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ mé le gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ée ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam pé’è ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ púɔ Ábalam wɔ́. Á nue e Ssé la gɔɔn né Ábalam ngie: «Epʉ̀a pie mé ge lá’ tóŋ ngie ngẅɛ̀ jù, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ zyé Esâg»
en: neither, because they are the seed of Abraham,are theyall children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Epúɔ pie mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě kwǒŋ kwoŋ ńzyé, é té púɔ Ssé wɔ́. Epúɔ pie mé la zyé wɔ́b ná pá’ Ssé la ka’ zɔ̌ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ púɔ Ssé.
en: That is, They which are the children of the flesh, thesearenot the children of God: but the children of the promise are counted for the seed.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte pá’ Ssé la ka’a mbwo Ábalam ngie: «Mèŋ n ge lá’ gíŋ gwɔ́ tó ntyě fʉ̀’ɔɔn á fʉ̀’ pá’ɔɔn, nzwě gù Sara gẅiin múɔ mbàŋa».
en: For thisisthe word of promise, At this time will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ fʉ̀’ giŋé ńgwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ Rebéka pá’ pɔ́ mangʉa njʉ’ wege Esâg la zyé mefág mbàŋa yépʉ́a.
en: And not onlythis; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one,evenby our father Isaac;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Mèŋ n kwoŋó Yakwɔ́b, ḿbe’e Esaẅi»
en: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Ńgie Ssé tè ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́ keen. Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́.
en: What shall we say then?Is thereunrighteousness with God? God forbid.

ngiemboon: Á nue à la gɔɔn mbwo Mǒsê ngie: «Yé Ssé ge gÿo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe nyìŋ gẅie yé gyǎ ngie à ge tsɔ́ɔn, é gÿo nò mbòŋo ná nyìŋ gẅie yé gyǎ ngie à ge gÿo ná yé»
en: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie e Ssé gwɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ nyìŋ à tè fó pɔ́ ná pá’ ngàŋ kwǒŋ wɔ́, ńké tè fó ná pá’ ngàŋ kǎg tʉ̀ ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, á fó pɔ́ ná pá’ yé Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe ngàŋ.
en: So thenit isnot of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.

ngiemboon: Áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, mbà mé la zɔɔn ńŋwe’e ngie: E Ssé gɔ̌ɔn né fùɔ Faraon ngie: Mèŋ n da lɔgɔ gú ńgÿo fùɔ légwɔ́ gie n ge nyɛɛ gú mmó, epʉ̀a fó mǒ ńgyá pá’ n tʉ pú’u, tá mé lêen ńké ńzsé lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ájʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ ngie e Ssé gÿo nyìŋ gẅie yé Ssé gyǎ ngie ngàŋ ge tʉʉ twó mbwo yé á tʉʉ twó, ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe nyìŋ gẅie yé Ssé gyǎ ngie à ge tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe ngàŋ.
en: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he willhave mercy, and whom he will he hardeneth.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ nyìŋ jú’ pá’ɔɔn tà ńzɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn ngie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, e Ssé gíŋe ńkaga nyìŋ ná nò mélà’a kɔ́, pá’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè ku’u légÿo mmó té gwɔ́ gie áa gie yé Ssé la záb ngie ngàŋ ge gÿo wɔ́?
en: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault? For who hath resisted his will?

ngiemboon: Gù nyìŋ mesoŋ, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzɛ́te pú’u, mbà ɔ́ɔ wɔ̌ tà Ssé gɔɔn nò ɔ̀ pʉŋe? Ngwɔ́ sɔ́’ zɛ́te mbwòon tsǎ’a ngie, ɔ̀ la pwóon wɔ̀ɔn ná yɔɔn ntí pá’ɔɔn mélà’a kɔ́ wɔ́?
en: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formedit, Why hast thou made me thus?

ngiemboon: Ambwòon tsǎ’a, à píi tsǎ’ ńdɔg ḿbwóon mmó nà ntí gie à kwǒŋ. À lɔg pɔ́ tà’a tsǎ’ ḿbwóon sɔ́’ gẅie nzẅìŋ ée mǒ, ńgíŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌ ḿbwóon gẅie nzẅìŋ ku’ ku’.
en: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

ngiemboon: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ e Ssé gÿo nà pʉ̀a mesoŋ. À la kwoŋo lényɛ ngie lóŋ we ne ńgyáŋa ná menò mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo, mé fó mǒ ńgyá pá’ à tʉ pú’u. Tá, mbà á la gʉa nà pʉ̀a pie, à lɔ̌ɔn ge gyáŋa lóŋ ná pɔ́b, á ke ńdɔg pɔ́ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ éshÿɔg shÿɔg. Tá mbà á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ kǔ’ pá’ à ge pyága wɔ́b pyág.
en: Whatif God, willing to shewhiswrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:

ngiemboon: Tá e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńgíŋe ńkwoŋo lényɛ nzẅìŋ fù’ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we, ńgwɔ́ gie à náa mbwo pʉ̀a pie à tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b, é pʉ̀a pie à la lá’ ntʉ́ njÿó ńcwoŋo wɔ́b ńtÿɔ́g, á légẅiin legú’ we ŋwɛ́.
en: and that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had afore prepared unto glory,

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wégè wɔɔn, á wégè gẅie à tsɔ’ɔ́ nùɔ pà Yuda mbɔɔ nùɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tóŋo wɔ́b lê pʉ̀a pie n kwoŋo wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And her beloved, which was not beloved.

ngiemboon: A gwɔ́ pú’u, ajʉ’ gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtyé wó mé gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ té pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn mɔ́, pɔ́ ge gÿo tyé jʉ’ó, mé gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ee púɔ Ssé gẅie aa ntentʉ́.
en: There shall they be called the children of the living God.

ngiemboon: *ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn yé ngie: Epúɔ pà Israel lɔɔn fó ńgyɔ́ɔn tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ saŋasáŋá gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa, mbà mbɔ́ ntá’ ndà’ zɔ̌ ge gÿo gʉa mǒ tsẅɛ́.
en: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:

ngiemboon: Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo lwo pú gÿo mmó gie à la ka’a légÿo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: for he will finish the work, and cutitshort in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.

ngiemboon: Esǎya la gíŋe ńtʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à pǔ sá’a shúm ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó la gwé’e pé’è à tè nyé tsɔ́ mbɔ́ ntá’ nà ngẅɛ̀ yege á mbwo pege wɔ́, mbà pege léen ńcʉ́’ pá’ tÿǒsoŋo Sodom kà pɔ́ pá’ ye Gomor wɔ́.»
en: We had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha.

ngiemboon: Pege fó ná yɔɔn nò ńgyá ngie kɔ́? Pege gyá ngie tà mbɔɔ pá’ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ la tè ne fa’a shÿó légwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́, eshÿó la kẅɛɛ mbwo pɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Kristo, e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé,
en: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.

ngiemboon: ńké ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a Israel pie pɔ́ la ne fa’a léfó pɔ́ nà leku’té*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, mbà pɔ́ la tè ku’, wɔb mánzsè pɔ́ we nkẅɛ̌ ndá*lepʉ̌ é la tè pumte.
en: But Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, hath not attained to the law of righteousness.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔɔn tě ńku’u wɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́? Á laa nue pɔ́ la tè ne ńkwaŋa ngie pɔ́ ge záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé tá yé zɔ gÿo pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé wɔ́, pɔ́ la ne ńkẅii kẅi ngie pɔ́ ge gwaa gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, é cʉa pɔ́ nà mefà’ mɔ́b. Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńtúu kwò yɔ́b ná tóon gẅie mé kwɔɔnte mǒ ńgwe ssé.
en: Wherefore? Becausethey sought itnot by faith, but as it were by the works of the law. For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;

ngiemboon: Tá’ nyìŋ gẅie à ge záb ntʉ́m wé ná yé, eshʉ́ té ge lá’ kúu yé wɔ́.
en: And whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ammó gie m bǔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ńne ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé ńtí pà Yuda, á gwɔ́ ngie à gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie, pɔ́ kwa’ ne ńkwoŋo léfa’a fà’ Ssé pɔ́ lê zeŋe nnɛ́, tá pɔ́ té ne ńjú’u kwà’ mánzsè wɔ́.
en: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nue pɔ́ té ne ńkwoŋo lézẅíŋ ntí gie e Ssé lɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé wɔ́ mbɔɔ nue pɔ́ fa’a pɔ́ wɔb mánzsè. Pɔ́ té zẅíŋe mánzsè gẅie e Ssé fó mǒ ngie epʉ̀a ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé wɔ́.
en: For they being ignorant of God's righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn ńtó, nkẅɛ̌ ndá*lepʉ̌ lɔg ḿbumte. Pú’u, nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo tá e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: For Christisthe end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u mmó gie Mǒsê la ŋwe’e nà nò mánzsè gẅie aa nyìŋ léfó ná pá’ à kú’te*lepʉ̌, ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé. «À la gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkú’te nò ntsèm gie*lepʉ̌ la tsẅi, tá mbà à ge zẅɛ́’*lepʉ̌ é tsẅɛ́»
en: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law, That the man which doeth those things shall live by them.

ngiemboon: Tá à nò nà mánzsè gẅie aa lézáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo tá ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé aa ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Tè gíŋe ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gú ngie: «Awɔ́ ge kwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ lepwó»? Wɛ̂ aa lélɔg ńgɔɔn ngie wɔ́ ge gʉa fó wó é sẅí’i Kristo wó wɔ́.
en: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ downfrom above:)

ngiemboon: Tè ké ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn mbɔɔ ngie: «Awɔ́ ge gʉa lá’ mepfó ssé wɔ́ wɔ́»? Wɛ̂ aa lélɔg ńgɔɔn ngie wɔ́ ge gʉa é fó wó é kwé’e Kristo wó wɔ́.
en: or, Who shall descend into the deep? (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie ashwóŋè Ssé áa lejʉ́ŋ gù, áa ncwò gù, ńgwɔ́ ntʉ́m gù. Yɛ̌ shwóŋè áa nò gie peg sá’a mbwo pʉ̀a ngie mé záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo.
en: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee,evenin thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńtyé mvfò lá’, éshʉa shʉa ńtsɔ́’ ncwò gú ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gù ńne ńzẅíŋe ngie e Ssé la gÿo á zíme ná legwé, mbà e Ssé ge gÿo gÿo ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́.
en: that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m wé ná Kristo, e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe ngàŋ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé. Nyìŋ piŋ ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ ńtsɔ́’ ncwò wé, éshʉa shʉa ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ Yěsô, e Ssé gÿo á tsẅɛ́.
en: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńzɔɔn ńcʉ́me nà pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, mbà shʉ́ té gÿo kúu ngàŋ wɔ́»
en: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, atsɔ́ tyɛ’te té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ nyìŋ Yuda pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́ wɔ́. Pɔ́ métsèm pú ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie à gÿo menò mbòŋo mé ná pʉ̀a metsèm pie é lʉa ńtóŋo yé.
en: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńcʉ́me ná pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdá’ ńdʉa ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, mbà ngàŋ ge tsẅɛ́.»
en: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ngwɔ́ pʉ̀a le záb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́, ńgÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńdʉa ńtóŋo yé? Ngwɔ́ pʉ̀a piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a té gwɔ́ gie pɔ́ jǔ’ pá’ nyìŋ shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á mbwo pʉ̀a? Ngwɔ́ pʉ̀a piŋ ńjú’ pá’ mé shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lêkɔ́, té gwɔ́ gie nyìŋ gẅie à ge shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a àa wó?
en: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ mé piŋ shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lêkɔ́ té gwɔ́ gie mé tǔm pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ge shwóŋ? Á sẅé nò gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, ńgwɔ́ ngie: Mântúm gwɔ́ tà ńtó, éshwóŋ pʉ̀a nò mbòŋo, lekág gwɔ́ ssé fʉ̀’ó.
en: And how shall they preach, except they be sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!

ngiemboon: Tá’ pʉ̀a metsèm la tè jú’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ńzẅíŋ wɔ́.*Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, peg la gɔɔn nò jú à wɔ̌ ké ńzẅíŋ»?
en: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Esaias saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgyá ngie, lézáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo à fóo pɔ́ nà nkʉ̀ gẅie nyìŋ jǔ’. Nyìŋ gwaa jú’ wɛ̌ kʉ̀, mbà nyìŋ tsẅǐ.
en: So then faithcomethby hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

ngiemboon: Anò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn gǐŋ giŋ tà ńkúu nzsòte tsetsá’.
en: And their words unto the ends of the world.

ngiemboon: Ńtí pà túm pie pi gɔɔn ngie legyè sɔ́b té wó wɔ́
en: Andby a foolish nation I will anger you.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka tè ne ńdúɔ tsɔ́ mmó mbwo mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa nà pà Israel, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n zɔgɔ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm pɔ́ létsíŋe pwó ńdɔgɔ ńtóŋo wɔ́b, pɔ́ tʉʉ twó tʉ, ésa shÿó nò gie n gɔ̌ɔn sa.
en: But to Israel he saith, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, mèŋ n zɛ́te ngie tà áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé gwǎ’ pʉ̀a pé keen? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́, á nue mbàa mèŋ yɔ́ɔn mèŋ n gee nyìŋ Israel, ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam, éfóo ná tsìŋe ndá Mběnjameŋ.
en: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham,ofthe tribe of Benjamin.

ngiemboon: E Ssé kaa gwá’ pʉ̀a pé pie à la tʉ́ njÿó ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b gwɔ́. Á ge gǎ wɔ́ pi ne ńzsé jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne Ssé gie áa mǒ*Elîɛ ne shwóŋó Ssé mmó gie pà Israel gÿǒ,
en: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pɔ́ kéen ńzẅéte pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pú, ńtágte mekye mmɔ̌g jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ shúm wó ńdɔgɔ ńgu’te gú. Mèŋ n cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gílé mèŋ gẅie n gee nzèm gù, pɔ́ piŋ ne fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn»
en: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, e Ssé tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie kɔ́? E Ssé tsɔ́’ ngie: «Mèŋ n ka tyɛ́te pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ ntsá’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kaa kẅí’te mvfò ssé gie mé tóŋo lê Baal wɔ́».
en: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee tothe image ofBaal.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. E tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ nùɔ peg pà Yuda pie e Ssé ka cÿó gem yɔ́b, ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b.
en: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé ka cÿó gem yɔ́b ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, mbà á té ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ka gÿo tsɔ́ mmó mbòŋo wɔ́. E Ssé ka gwé’e éfó pɔ́ nà mmó mbòŋo gie pɔ́ gÿǒ tá ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, mbà ńgwɔ́ mé le gíŋe ngie à kɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńcÿó gem yɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And if by grace, thenis itno more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But ifit beof works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́? Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie ammó gie pà Israel la ne fa’a pɔ́ la tè gyá métsèm wɔ́. Etsɔ̌ ntá’ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pie e Ssé la tsɔ́’ zɔ̌ la gyá. Á cʉ́’ʉ pfwɔ’ e Ssé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ tiŋ ndʉ̀’.
en: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded

ngiemboon: Tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: (according as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Ssé néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pɔ́b.
en: And a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

ngiemboon: Ńgÿó pɔ́ gyá ngɔ́’ tà nkà’ wɔ́b cʉ́’ ńŋwé’e ŋwé’e fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: And bow down their back alway.

ngiemboon: Ngɔ̂ɔn ngiembɔɔn, pá’ pà Israel la gwɔ́ tà ńtúu kwò yɔ́b ná Kristo ḿbú ńgwe Ssé la, á laa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ ndà’ la? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́. Tá’ á la fó pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ tǔ kwò yɔ́b, tá pʉ̀a pie é té pà Israel wɔ́ zẅɛ́’ ńtsẅɛ́. E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a Israel ge záb lejÿɔ́g mǒ, é kwɔ́’ɔ lóŋ.
en: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: butratherthrough their fall salvationis comeunto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie á la fó ná pá’ pɔ́ tǔ kwò yɔ́b, njÿó ntsèm zẅɛ́’ ńgẅiin fù’ gie á fóo mbwo Ssé, éfóo ná pá’ pɔ́ gwě ssé, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té pà Yuda wɔ́ zẅɛ́’ ńgẅiin fù’, mbà Ssé ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà pʉ’ʉ wɔ́b métsèm, afù’ á le mege ńgá’ wɔ́?
en: Now if the fall of thembethe riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?

ngiemboon: Anò gie n ge gɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn, n gɔɔn mbwo pi pie pi tè pà Yuda wɔ́. E Ssé la túmo wɔ̀ɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́. Atwó fà’ gie Ssé la ńná né mèŋ, mèŋ n néŋ mekù’ mǒ.
en: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:

ngiemboon: Méŋ n ké ńgwɔ́ ne fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pà Yuda gyá mefà’ Ssé ná pi lóŋ wɔb kwɔ́’, ńzsé ngie n ge gÿo e Ssé fó mǒ ńgÿo etsɔ́ ntá’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b tsẅɛ́.
en: if by any means I may provoke to emulationthem which aremy flesh, and might save some of them.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tá ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b nzèm tá ńgÿo yé Ssé pâ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó mag mbù, à ge piŋ lá’ gwɔ́ tà gíŋe líe wɔ́b á gwɔ́ lêkɔ́? À gwɔ́ kwà’ légíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó á mbwo pʉ̀a pie é la zɔɔn ńkwé.
en: For if the casting away of thembethe reconciling of the world, whatshallthe receivingof them be, but life from the dead?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿvɔg ńnáa ndùŋ mvfò kème mbelég mbwo Ssé, mbà mbelég ntsèm ntsèm e gwɔ́ pɔ́ yé Ssé. Menŋàŋ tà’a tÿǒ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé, mbà mbwó tÿǒ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo yé.
en: For if the firstfruitbeholy, the lumpisalsoholy: and if the rootbeholy, soarethe branches.

ngiemboon: Alá’a pà Israel áa pá’ tÿǒ mèvɛ olive nyìŋ, mbà ngàŋ ka kɔ́’ tsɔ́ mbwó mǒ ńgwá’. Gù gẅie ɔ̀ tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́, ɔ̀ gwɔ́ pá’ pwó tÿǒ mèvɛ olive gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbím, mbà mé ka lɔgɔ gú ńtó ńdaa nùɔ mbwó mie é ka nyě ńgwɔ́ nà tÿǒ ŋwɛ́. Ɔ̀ɔ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzẅɛ́’ɛ metse tÿǒ mie é ne fóo ná menŋàŋ ńkúu ná pia pɔ̌ métsèm.
en: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

ngiemboon: Tè ké ńdɔg pú’u, ńŋá’te mvfò mbwó mie mé ka*kɔ̌’. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa léŋá’te, ɔ̀ zsé ngie gù zɔ tè ne ńjÿɔ́gɔ menŋàŋ wɔ́, menŋàŋ zɔ̌ ne ńjÿɔ́gɔ gú.
en: boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ tsɔ́ ɔ̀ jú’ pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie mé la kɔ́’ mɛ̌ mbwó ńgwá’ légwɔ́ gie mé ge laa gú nà tÿǒ.
en: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.

ngiemboon: Oon mé la ké ńkɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńgwá’, á gwɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ kaa záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo wɔ́. Ɔ̀ piŋ ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mélà’mie ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, tá’ tè ké ńŋá’te, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, ɔ̀ lag pɔ́ twó jú.
en: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:

ngiemboon: Á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la kɔ́’ kwà’ mbwó yɛ̌ tÿǒ ńgwá’, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gíŋe ńkɔ́’ɔ gú jú pɔ́ pú’u.
en: for if God spared not the natural branches,take heedlest he also spare not thee.

ngiemboon: Zsé ngie e Ssé lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m, mbà e giŋé ńcÿɔ́g. E la cÿɔ́g pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gwe ssé. E piŋ ne ńgẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m ná gù. Tá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ ké ne ńkẅi’i ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á poŋo yé, tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà e ge zá’a gú jú gwá’ pá’ pwó tÿǒ la.
en: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue inhisgoodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pà Yuda, mbà pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwá’a tʉʉ twó, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, mbà à ge laa wɔ́b nà jʉ’ gie pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó. Á nue yé Ssé gẅiin metʉ̀ lélaa wɔ́b sẅé sẅé.
en: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pwó tÿǒ mèvɛ olive ye mbím. E Ssé zá’a gú, ńtó ńdaa nà tÿǒ mèvɛ olive ye nká’, é gwɔ́ nkʉ̀’ʉ nò. Á ké ńgʉa ná pà Yuda, mbà pɔ́ laa mbwó tÿǒ mèvɛ olive ye nká’. E Ssé lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńge piŋe wɔ́b nà tÿǒ ŋwɛ́, mbà á ge zeŋe tɛ’, á nue pɔ́ la zɔɔn fó pɔ́ mǒ.
en: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the naturalbranches, be graffed into their own olive tree?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé mmó gie áa ná yɔɔn nò, mbà á la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lelyěen, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅi lékwaŋ ngie pi ee pàzsé nò. Yɛ̌ mmó áa ngie atsɔ́ gwǒŋo pà Israel ne ńtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé fʉ̀’ɔɔn, tá á ké lěen ńdá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u wɔ́. Pɔ́ ge tʉʉ twó tà kú fʉ̀’ gie pʉ̀a metsèm pie e Ssé la tsɔ́’, é piŋ tè pà Yuda wɔ́, ge cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

ngiemboon: E sele ngẅɛ̀ Yakwɔ́b pɔ́ le gíŋe ńtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé wɔ́.
en: And shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn aa kʉa gie pega pɔ̌ ge lá’ gwa, á fʉ̀’ gie n ge lá’ kẅile menò tepòŋ mɔ́b.
en: When I shall take away their sins.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka lʉ’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, ńcʉ́’ ngàŋ mbù Ssé, pi zẅɛ́’. Tá’, pá’ e Ssé la lá’ ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé la, à nyě ńkwoŋo wɔ́b kwoŋ ńtí pà mangʉa njʉ’ pɔ́b.
en: As concerning the gospel,they areenemies for your sakes: but as touching the election,they arebeloved for the fathers' sakes.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, nue e Ssé tè lɔgɔ mmó ńcÿó gem nyìŋ ńgíŋe ńkẅé wɔ́, ńké tè gɔɔn ngie à toŋó nyìŋ ḿbiŋ ńkúbe nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́.
en: For the gifts and calling of Godarewithout repentance.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ pi pie pi tè pà Yuda wɔ́, pi tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé ka tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mí, mélà’mie pà Yuda ka tʉʉ twó mbwo yé.
en: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gíŋe gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u ná pɔ́b. Pɔ́ ne ńtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé fʉ̀’ɔɔn, á fó pú’u e Ssé ne ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mí, ńgÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge piŋe mbwo yé, á tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b yɔ́b pá’ à ka tsɔ́ɔn mí.
en: even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé la nyémânyìŋ ntsèm á pú ńtʉʉ twó mbwo yé légwɔ́ gie à ge gÿo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b pɔ́ metsèm.
en: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

ngiemboon: E Ssé kwa’ ńgẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m nzèm pʉ̀a metsèm, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ le kaa legyè Ssé wɔ́, é ke le zsé mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwaŋa wɔ́, ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ zsé mmó gie e Ssé zǎb ngie à ge gÿo? Ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ kyagte pá’ e Ssé gÿo menò pú’u?
en: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchablearehis judgments, and his ways past finding out!

ngiemboon: Awɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á náa yé ntÿɔgɔ́,
en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?

ngiemboon: Légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge gẅiin létsɔ́’ ńnáa mbwo yé.
en: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

ngiemboon: Kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔɔn fóo pɔ́ mbwo ye. Kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwaa gwɔ́ wó yé zɔ̌ gÿo tá á gwɔ́ wó, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yé. Mé gu’te yé, é mengù’u mengù’.*Amen.
en: For of him, and through him, and to him,areall things: to whombeglory for ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pá’ Ssé léen ḿbú ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mégè la, mèŋ n ne ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie pi pú ńná mbùm gi mbwo yé pá’ shúm pwɔ́’ la, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe ńjú’u pɔ́ mbwo yé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pé ndà’, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ge poŋo yé. Legÿo pú’u, aa legu’te Ssé nà ntí yé mbòŋo.
en: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God,which isyour reasonable service.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gÿo mí menò pá’ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn. Pi zẅíŋ e Ssé ne ńnáa legyè se sẅé né pi ńdɔgɔ ńkúbe gi ntí lékwaŋa nò pɔ́ ntsèm, à cʉa pú’u, pi ku’u lézsé mmó gie yé Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi gÿo. Pi zsé mmó gie áa mbòŋ, ńzsé gie á poŋo yé, ńzsé gie tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ té mǒ wɔ́.
en: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove whatisthat good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge fó ná pá’ e Ssé la cʉ́’ʉ lécÿó gem yɔ́ɔn, ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn nà jʉ’e lÿò, é gɔɔn mbwo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsestsɛ̀ɛ pi ngie: Tà nyìŋ kwaŋ ngie aa mmó té gwɔ́ gie aa yɛ̌. Nyìŋ gẅiin we nkwaŋá é ku’ ku’. Nyìŋ kú’te pɔ́ yé fà’ gie e Ssé la ná, ńgwɔ́ ná, éfó ná pá’ à zǎb ntʉ́m ná Kristo.
en: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to thinkof himselfmore highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nà mbùm nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mekèm gwɔ́ mǒ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ḿbiŋ ńké tè gẅiin tà’a fà’ wɔ́
en: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná pá’ pege gwɔ̌ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn tá’, ńdɔg pá’ pege la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ḿbú ńcú’te ńtsẅé’e ná tà’ nyìŋ, pá’ mekèm mbùm pú ńtemte, yɛ̌ wɔ́ ne ńtóonte yetsɔ́ la.
en: so we,beingmany, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ e Ssé cÿó gem yégè, ńnáa fù’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye ntí. Afù’ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ léńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, á gwɔ́ tsẅi, ńtswii nà ntí gie à ne ńjú’u, mbà e Ssé lɔ̌g shwóŋó yé pú’u.
en: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy,let us prophesyaccording to the proportion of faith;

ngiemboon: Afù’ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lékẅéte ná mefà’, á kẅéte. A ye nyìŋ gwɔ́ lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó, á zí’i.
en: or ministry,let us waitonourministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;

ngiemboon: Afù’ ye nyìŋ gwɔ́ lékẅiŋte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, á kẅiŋte. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńnáa mmó né nyìŋ, á ná té sáŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à táŋte cú’tè, á táŋte tà ńzsé mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkẅéte mepóŋ, á kẅéte lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo.
en: or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth,let him do itwith simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

ngiemboon: Pi kwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pɔ́ lê ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm. Pi kÿo nò tepòŋ tà fÿɔ́g mekɔ́ɔn, ńkú’te nò mbòŋo tà à tʉ̀.
en: Letlove be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg pá’ pi ee mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńkwoŋe pi né pi, nyìŋ gẅi à vɔg ńná mekù’ fɛ́ we.
en: Bekindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ́ melǒŋ, pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ megàŋa fà’. Pi lɔg ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm éfa’a mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

ngiemboon: Pi ńnéŋe nê lekág ńtí mmó gie pi ne ńzẅí’te. Ngɔ́’ lɔɔn ńkúu gẅí, pi shÿɔg shÿɔg. Pi ké ńne sẅíŋte pɔ́ Ssé té kʉ́a.
en: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

ngiemboon: Ammó lɔɔn ńzága mbwo mefɛ́ pi pʉ̀a Kristo, pi kẅéte wɔ́b. Pi ńnéŋe ńkúe pà túm mboŋó.
en: distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo á nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńgÿo pi gyá ngɔ́’. Pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, tà pi tsɔ́ɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a lɔɔn ne ńkága pia pɔ̌ pú ńkág, ńne ńdʉa pia pɔ̌ pú ńdʉa.
en: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

ngiemboon: Pi gẅiin tà’ ncwò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, tà pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mencwò fà’ melÿò, pi zẅíŋe légÿo mefà’ mie é ku’ ku’, tà pi kwaŋ ngie pi zsé nò.
en: Beof the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tsɔ́’ɔ piŋé nò tepòŋ ńnáa nò tepòŋ. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pi fa’ shÿó ńgÿo pɔ́ nò gie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ge gyá é zẅíŋ ngie áa mbòŋ.
en: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

ngiemboon: Mbàa yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ssé, tà shÿó gwɔ́ mbwo gù, ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ légwɔ́ gie pia pʉ̀a métsèm ge ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè.
en: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

ngiemboon: Pi meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, tà nyìŋ gẅi sele ńtsɔ́’ɔ nò tepòŋ gie mé gÿǒ ná yé, ńnáa tsɔ́. À nyé e Ssé zɔ lá’ ḿbÿɛ, á nue áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n zɔ gẅiin létsɔ́’ɔ nò tepòŋ ńnáa tsɔ́, mèŋ n zɔ gẅiin ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ we wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ».
en: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, butrathergive place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeanceismine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

ngiemboon: À giŋé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nzyè lɔɔn ne ńgyáŋa ngàŋ mbù gù ɔ̀ náa mmó á pfɛ́. Nzyè ntse ne ńgyáŋa yé, ɔ̀ ná ntse á nú. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà shʉ́ ge kúu yé, à kúbe mà we».
en: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ cʉ́’ nò gie nyìŋ gÿǒ ná yé tsóte yé, á gÿo nò tepòŋ, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, á lɔgɔ légÿo nò mbòŋo, ḿbyága nò tepòŋ.
en: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pie é sá’a ngwòŋ, mélà’mie lesǎ’ ngwòŋ fóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé. E Ssé zɔ la záb pàsá’ ngwòŋ pie ée wó.
en: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtʉʉ twó mbwo pàsá’ ngwòŋ, mbà à lɔgɔ ńdʉ’ʉ pɔ́ mmó gie e Ssé la záb. Yɛ̌ ntí pʉ̀a ee pú’u, ńdɔgɔ sele ńtóŋte ntsaŋ ńnéŋe twó pɔ́b.
en: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.

ngiemboon: Pàgÿo nò mbòŋo té gẅiin lépɔ́g pàsá’ ngwòŋ wɔ́, pàgÿo nò tepòŋ zɔ̌ gẅiin lépɔ́gɔ wɔ́b. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn tè ne ńkwoŋo lépɔ́g pàsá’ ngwòŋ wɔ́, ɔ̀ gÿo nò mbòŋo, pɔ́ ná ngɔ́ɔnte jù.
en: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:

ngiemboon: Á nue pɔ́ fa’a pɔ́ fà’a Ssé gẅie à ge tsóte gú légÿo nò mbòŋo. Tá’, ɔ̀ ke fʉa nò ɔ̀ ńnéŋe ḿbɔ́gɔ wɔ́b, á nue metʉ̀ mie e Ssé náa né pɔ́b, à tě ńnáa sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ wɔ́. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ lénéŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á twó nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌a nò, ńdɔgɔ fa’a fà’a Ssé, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé gyáŋa lóŋ nà megàŋ mefʉa.
en: for he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger toexecutewrath upon him that doeth evil.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá á ne ńzɛ́te lésẅí’i mbùm ńnáa ssé mvfò pàsá’ ngwòŋ. Mé lě ńnáa á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ lélɔg ḿbɔ́g ngie Ssé ge gyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́, mélà’mie ntʉ́m wégè ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege gÿo pú’u.
en: Whereforeyemust needs be subject, not only for wrath, but also for conscience sake.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gíŋe ńgÿo tá pi ma’ ncùb ngwòŋ, á nue e Ssé zɔ la záb pàfà’a yɛ̌ fà’, pá’ pɔ́ ge cÿó nnɛ́ fa’a fà’ yɔ́b.
en: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God's ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á gʉa nà pàsá’ ngwòŋ, pi náa mmó gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi náa mbwo wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ né yé. E lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ncùb ngwòŋ, pi náa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé ncùb ngwòŋ, ńgwɔ́ nkáb gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te mbwo pi ná tsɔ́ nò, pi náa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé yɛ̌. Pi jú’ ncwò nyìŋ gẅie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé jú’ ncwò wé, ńná mekù’ nyìŋ gẅie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé ná mekù’ mé.
en: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tributeis due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ gẅi gẅiin tsɔ̌ njǔ ndyɛ̀’ɛ tà ndí ndà’ lékwoŋo nyìŋ, ee njǔ gie mefɛ́ mefɛ́ gẅiin létoŋo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, mbà à lɔgɔ ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé ntsèm.
en: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé mbʉ̌ mie é gɔɔn ngie: «Tè gÿo gÿɛ́. Tè zẅé nyìŋ. Tè jʉ. Tè tÿɔ́g nÿɔ́g nà mmó nyìŋ». Lɔg ńkwá metwó mɔɔn mbʉ̌ tà mbɔɔ metsɔ́ gwɔ́ ngie: «Kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú».
en: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and ifthere beany other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo fɛ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ, mbà à tě ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ ná ngàŋ wɔ́, à lɔgɔ pú’u, ńkú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé ntsèm.
en: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore loveisthe fulfilling of the law.

ngiemboon: Pi kag tʉ̀, ńgÿo mɛ̌ menò á nue pi ne ńzsé kème njÿó gie pege ee mǒ. Yɔɔn áa fʉ̀’ gie á zɛ́te ngie pi zyeen. Á nue áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà fʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, á pɔɔnté, ńtɔ́g pá’ á laa fʉ̀’ gie pege lá nyé ńzyete lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: And that, knowing the time, that nowit ishigh time to awake out of sleep: for nowisour salvation nearer than when we believed.

ngiemboon: Letsẅɛ́’ zyě ńgiŋ, njÿó ne ńdʉ́a. Pú’u la, pege gwá’ mefà’ mie mé fa’a pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, pege kaa shúm ncù sie mé tyé ná jʉ’e kyɛ̀’, ńdɔg ńdÿɔ́’ ncù.
en: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

ngiemboon: Pege gẅiin tsẅé mbòŋo ná pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gẅiin pú’u, fʉ̀’ gie jʉ’ ne fɔ́gɔ, ḿbɔ́ɔn lé pfɛ́ɛ mmó kà lé nú melù’ wɔ́ lê gʉ̀gʉ̀, ḿbɔ́ɔn lé pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pega pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe, ḿbɔ́ɔn shúm sie shʉ́ ge kúu wégè mǒ, ḿbɔ́ɔn lé tág melà’, ḿbɔ́ɔn kègɔ́’.
en: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.

ngiemboon: Pi kaa le gwɔ́ we sẅé gẅie Yěsô Kristo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege náa, ḿma’. Tà pi gíŋe ńnéŋe ńkwaŋa nò ná shúm tepòŋ sie mbab nnɛ́ gi tsóte gẅi pi tsɔ́ɔn léná né yé.
en: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, tofulfilthe luststhereof.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńzsé ngie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, tsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔg pá’ pɔ́ ne ńjú’u yɔ́b nò Ssé, ńne ńdÿɔ́’te tsɔ́ shúm, pi kú’te wɔ́b kú’te tà pia pɔ̌ zoŋo nò ná yɔ́b mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa.
en: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye,butnot to doubtful disputations.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔgɔ nò Ssé ńzsé ngie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ á pfɛ́ ye pfɛ́. Wetsɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ nò Ssé ńdÿɔ́’te tsɔ́ shúm zsé ngie à ge pfɛ́ pɔ́ ndà’ nzab.
en: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́ ńgwɔ́ á pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́, à pɔ́ɔn lékʉ́e nyìŋ gẅie à tè pfɛ́ shúm ntsèm wɔ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à tè pfɛ́ shúm ntsèm wɔ́ à pɔ́ɔn létúu*lɔ̌’ nyìŋ gẅie à gyá yé kɔ́ wɔ́ ńgwɔ́ á pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́ á nue e Ssé kúe yé yé.
en: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ɔ wɔ̌ tà ńtúu*lɔ̌’ ngàŋa fà’ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ? À lɔɔn fʉa nò lo, à tè fʉa lo, mbà tá fà’ we zɔ gẅiin légɔɔn. Yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔɔn ńku’u légɔɔn ngie ngàŋ kaa nò fʉa.
en: Who art thou that judgest another man's servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, á zsé ngie tsɔ́ melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ cʉa metsɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mbwo wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ, á zsé yé ngie melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Á zɛ́te ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kwa’ ńnyɛte ńzsé mmó gie aa ntʉ́m yé ne ńzsé.
en: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every dayalike. Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin tyɛ’te ná melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, à gÿo tyɛ’te pú’u, pɔ́ lélɔg ńgu’te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Nyìŋ gẅie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́ ńgwɔ́ à pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́, à pfɛ́ pú’u, pɔ́ lélɔg ńgu’te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á nue à ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé mǒ. Nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ tè gyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ḿpfɛ́ pfɛ́ wɔ́, à tè pfɛ́ pú’u, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńgu’te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á giŋé ńne ńnáa yé ndǎg mbwo Ssé.
en: He that regardeth the day, regardethitunto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regardit. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ wege tè gwaa gwɔ́ wó á gwɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á poŋo yé wɔ́, à tsɔ̌ nyìŋ piŋ ńké tè gwɔ kwé á gwɔ́ légʉa ńgÿo mmó gie á poŋo yé wɔ́.
en: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

ngiemboon: Pege gwaa gwɔ́ wó á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege ge gwɔ́ shúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ kwé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege ge gwɔ́ shúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pú’u la, pege lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́ lo, mbà pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńkwé kwé lo, mbà pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn ńkwé ḿbiŋ ńzím légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mepfó mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ntentʉ́.
en: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

ngiemboon: Pá’ áa pá’ɔɔn la, gù, mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ gíŋe ńtúu*lɔ̌’ fɛ́ gú? Gù jú mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ gíŋe ńkʉ́e fɛ́ gú? Pege metsèm zɔɔn ḿbú ńgẅiin lélá’ ńcʉa mvfò Ssé à ŋaga wégè.
en: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

ngiemboon: Wɔ́ɔwɔ́ɔ tsɔ́’ ncwò we, éshʉashʉa ńzẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n gee Ssé.
en: And every tongue shall confess to God.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgyá ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege wɔ́ ge lá’ tyé mvfò Ssé, kwà’ yé zɔ píte ncwò wé ná pá’ à kɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo.
en: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tà pege gíŋe ńŋag mennɛ́ mégè. Ammó gie pi gẅiin légÿo á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pi ge pɔ́ɔn légÿo tsɔ́ mmó gie fɛ́ gẅi ge kwɔɔnte mǒ à tsóte yé à gÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall inhisbrother's way.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé, tá ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ pá’ mèŋ n da nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, ńnyɛte ńzsé ngie atsɔ́ mmó té wó gie á pu’ ssé ńgẅiin*lɔ̌’ wɔ́. Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie*lɔ̌’ áa nà tsɔ́ mmó, mbà á ge gwɔ́ nà yé twó à*lɔ̌’ gwɔ́ nà yɛ̌ mmó.
en: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, thatthere isnothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to himit isunclean.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ cʉa ná nò mmó gie ɔ̀ pfɛ́ɛ, ńgÿo mbùm fɛ́ gù kÿo, mbà ɔ̀ tè gíŋe ńgÿo ná ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńkwoŋo fɛ́ gù wɔ́. Tè lɔgɔ nò mmó léjÿó ńgÿo fɛ́ gù gẅie Kristo la kwé nà twó yé kúu pyé,
en: But if thy brother be grieved withthymeat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ légÿo mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ, éshwóŋte ná gù, tà mbɔɔ pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzsé jú pɔ́ ngie yɛ̌ mmó áa mbòŋ.
en: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, anò*lefùɔ Ssé té nò shúm léjÿó kà nò melù’ wɔ́ wɔ́. Anò*lefùɔ Ssé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo menò mie é fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo menò mie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, ńgwɔ́ léńnéŋe lê sẅéte, ńgwɔ́ léńnéŋe nê lekág.
en: for the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn fa’a fà’ Kristo lê yɔɔn ntí, mbà nò yé ge poŋ Ssé, epʉ̀a mesoŋ piŋ ńná mekù’ ngàŋ.
en: For he that in these things serveth Christisacceptable to God, and approved of men.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege fa’a mmó gie á ge gÿo pege ńnéŋe ńnéŋe lê sẅéte, ḿbiŋ ńkẅi’i ńtóonte mennɛ́ mégè ná lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

ngiemboon: Tè cʉŋte fà’a Ssé ńtí nò mmó léjÿó. Áa nénʉ́ ngie*lɔ̌’ té pu’ ssé ńgwɔ́ nà tsɔ́ mmó léjÿó wɔ́, tá’ á pÿɔ́gɔ ná nyìŋ lé jÿó tsɔ́ mmó gie pʉ̀a ge gyá é kwɔɔnte mǒ gwe ssé.
en: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeedarepure; butit isevil for that man who eateth with offence.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie áa mbòŋ, aa lélʉ’ʉ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ gù kwɔɔnte mǒ ńgwe ssé, kà ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lépfɛ́ mbab wɔ́, kà lénú melù’ wɔ́.
en: It isgood neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, norany thingwhereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgʉa ná sɔɔn shúm ńzsé ngie kɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gu wɔ́, pi Ssé zɔ̌ zsé. Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie ntʉ́m wé té sá’a yé nà mmó gie à gee ńgÿo wɔ́.
en: Hast thou faith? haveitto thyself before God. Happyishe that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

ngiemboon: Tá’ nyíŋ lɔɔn ḿmʉ́’te nà mmó tà á jÿó, ńké ńjÿó, mbà à gwě ntsaŋ mvfò Ssé. Á nue à kaa gÿo pá’ à zsě ngie nò Ssé ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gÿo mmó ńne ḿmʉ́’te, mbà à gÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, becausehe eatethnot of faith: for whatsoeverisnot of faith is sin.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pege gẅiin légÿo áa ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ nò Ssé ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ ge gÿo, gẅiin lélɔg ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té ne ńzsé pá’ pɔ́b wɔ́. Nyìŋ tè gẅiin légÿo mmó gie á poŋ pɔ́ yé wɔ́.
en: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege fa’ pá’ à ge gÿo mmó gie á poŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pú’u ńdɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn nò mbòŋo ná pɔ́b, é lɔg kẅéte wɔ́b pɔ́ kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Let every one of us pleasehisneighbour forhisgood to edification.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn tè fa’ pɔ́ mmó gie á poŋ pɔ́ ndà’ yé wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà à la zẅíŋe mmó gie mé gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Nzòon pà zoonte gú la gwe twó mèŋ».
en: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mé la lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó ńŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, mé lɔ́ɔn ńŋwe’e pɔ́ lélɔgɔ ńnéŋe ńzí’i wégè mmó, légwɔ́ gie á ge lɔg pá’ á ne ńkẅiŋte wégè, ḿbiŋ ne ńgÿo ngie tà pege kʉ́a, pege zsé ngie pege gẅiin mmó gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pege.
en: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ne ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé ngie yé gẅie à kẅiŋte wégè, ńgÿo ngie tà pege kʉ́a, á gÿo pi gẅiin tà’ nkwaŋá tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ mmó gie Yěsô Kristo la zí’i gẅí.
en: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:
