ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, pi lɔgɔ tà’ ncwò, ńdɔgɔ tà’ ngyè ńgu’te Ssé Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: that ye may with one mindandone mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́ zẅíŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lejʉ́ŋ yé, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Kristo la zẅíŋe gẅi lejʉ́ŋ yé, pi gÿo pú’u, epʉ̀a gyá ńgu’te Ssé.
en: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo Kristo tó fa’a mbwo pà Yuda, légÿo menò mie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pà mangʉa njʉ’ pɔ́b pumte. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé gɔɔn wɔ́ ké ḿbumte pumte.
en: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promisesmadeunto the fathers:

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ńzɔb ńgu’te lezíŋ shú.
en: And sing unto thy name.

ngiemboon: Pia pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a temte ḿbú ńkág.
en: Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie pʉ̀a melá’ ntsèm pú ńkwé’e lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńnáa tÿǒ.
en: And laud him, all ye people.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tÿɔ́g nÿɔ́g mɔ́b pɔ́ ná yé, ńne ńzẅí’te ngie à gÿo pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó.
en: In him shall the Gentiles trust.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie e Ssé gẅie yé zɔ gÿo tá mé ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te mmó, à cʉa ná pá’ pi záb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgÿo lekág pɔ́ sẅéte à pú ńjÿó ntʉ́m gẅí, ńzsé ngie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge lɔg metʉ̀ mé é gÿo pi gwɔ́ kwà’ pà ńnéŋe ńzẅí’te mmó gie Ssé la ká’.
en: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, kwà’ mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie pi gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m tɛ’, ńne ńnyɛte ńzsé mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie mé zsé, ḿbiŋ ńku’u létÿɔ́gte mennɛ́ mí pi né pi.
en: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

ngiemboon: N ne zsé pú’u tá’, n gʉ̌a nà tsɔ́ mejʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńgyá ngie n ge nyɛte gɔɔn tsɔ́ menò, lélɔg ńkímte gẅi menò mie mé la zí’i gẅí. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pú’u, ńcʉa ná pá’ e Ssé la cÿó gem yɔ́ɔn,
en: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie à ge ne fa’a fà’ Yěsô Kristo á nùɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́. À la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn légwɔ́ gie n ge cʉ́’ʉ tsẅii pɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pɔ́b, Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a Ssé, mèŋ n náa wɔ́b mbwo Ssé, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pá’ shúm pwɔ́’ sie é poŋ Ssé.
en: that I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔg pá’ n da nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo, ńku’u lélɔgɔ fa’a Ssé gie mèŋ n ne fa’a ńka’te.
en: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.

ngiemboon: Á nue n dɔɔn ńgɔɔn kɔ́ wɔ́ gie n dǎ gÿo ná fa’a Ssé, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ gie Kristo zɔ la lɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo. Pú’u, légÿo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ pɔ́ jú’ ncwò Ssé, á cʉa nà shwóŋè gie mèŋ n gɔɔn mbɔɔ ná mefà’ mie mèŋ fa’a,
en: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,

ngiemboon: ńcʉa nà meliŋé menò lâ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ńgíŋe ńcʉa nà metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ssé. Yɔɔn ee ntí gie n da lɔg ńnyɛte ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo jʉ’ ntsèm, léfó Yerósalem ńgʉa ńkúu Ilirie.
en: through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá’, n da kag tʉ̀ léké ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo pɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé zɔ̌ɔn kaa Kristo wó kíme, ḿbɔ́gɔ lékwɛ́ ndá nà cÿǒ ndá gie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ ka nuŋe.
en: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man's foundation:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la tè jú’u tsɔ́ nò ná yé wɔ́, ge gÿo jú’.
en: And they that have not heard shall understand.

ngiemboon: Legwǎ ńgiŋ ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo áa mmó gie á la vele wɔ̀ɔn mengʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn létó ńgyá gẅí.
en: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n kéen ḿmaga fà’ yɔ́ɔn ná mɔɔn mepàga ngwòŋ, ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mengù’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pá’ mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn létó ńgyá gẅí.
en: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ké ne ńgyá fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ gʉa Spana, étóo lá’ pi. Mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ cʉa, ńgyá gẅí, pi kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn légʉa wó. Á ge gÿo wɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ pege gÿo ḿbú ńná’a ńnéŋe méjʉ’.
en: whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with yourcompany.

ngiemboon: Tá’ áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn mèŋ n ne ńgee nê Yerósalem léná nkáb mbwo pʉ̀a Ssé pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.

ngiemboon: Á nue pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Makedonia mbɔɔ pe Akay ka gyǎ ngie pɔ́ ge ma’ nkáb lɔg kẅéte pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Yerósalem, ńgwɔ́ mepóŋ.
en: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔ ka pʉlé ńgyá pú’u tá’, é zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ njǔ gie pɔ́ gẅiin létoŋo mbwo pɔ́b. Á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ kéen ńgẅiin yɔ́b mmó nà shúm sie Ssé la pu’ ssé ńná pɔ́ né pà Yuda, mbà pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gẅiin pá’ pɔ́ ge gʉa ná shúm sie ée sɔ́b, é pi tsɔ́ é ná mé lɔg ńkẅéte pà Yuda.
en: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà gʉa cʉ́me yɔɔn nkáb gie mé ka ma’ lɔɔn, é gʉa Spana, é gwɔ́ gʉa cʉa yé lá’ pi.
en: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ne ńzsé ngie n ge gÿo tó, e Ssé cʉa ná mèŋ, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi tɛ’.
en: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á cʉa ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo mbɔɔ ná pá’ a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńgÿo pege gẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege la, mèŋ sẅíŋte gẅi ngie pi lɔgɔ lésẅíŋte Ssé ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn. Pi sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó yɔ́ɔn, ńcʉ́’ʉ lésẅíŋte, ésẅíŋte lê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm,
en: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ's sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me inyourprayers to God for me;

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie n tè gwe ná mbwo pʉ̀a Jẅidea pie pɔ́ tě ńzába ntʉ́m ná Kristo wɔ́ wɔ́, ńgíŋ sẅíŋte Ssé ngie à gÿo pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Yerósalem lɔg ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńkẅé mmó gie ń dɔgɔ ńgee wó lékẅéte wɔ́b.
en: that I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judæa; and that my service whichI havefor Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;

ngiemboon: Pú’u, n gwɔ́ tóo mbʉ̀a pi, ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkága, e Ssé zẅíŋ, mbà n ge nèŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, é zẅɛ́te.
en: that I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Ssé gẅie à náa sẅéte à ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.*Amen.
en: Now the God of peacebewith you all. Amen.

ngiemboon: N cʉmé fɛ́ wege we manzwě gẅie mé tóŋo yé lé Febée á mbwo pi, à fa’a mefà’ tsɛ̀ɛ ndà cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie aa tÿǒsoŋo Senkeré.
en: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńkúe yé nà ntí gie pʉ̀a Kristo gẅiin lékúe nyìŋ pú’u. Pi tyé pá’ yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ lɔɔn ńcʉa yé, tà á ga’te mbwo pi, pi kẅéte yé mǒ. Kwà’ yé léen ńkẅéte pʉ̀a tɛ’, ńgíŋ ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn yɔ́ɔn.
en: that ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Piriska pɔ́ Akilas ńná né mèŋ, ée pʉ̀a pie pega pɔ́ pǔ fa’a fà’a Yěsô Kristo.
en: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

ngiemboon: Á ka cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ pɔ́ kwé nà twó yɔɔn. Mèŋ zɔ tè ndà’ nyìŋ gẅie yɔɔn nò ńnéŋe ḿboŋo yé wɔ́. Á gíŋe ḿboŋ mbɔɔ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ mie é té me pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Epenete, á fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ. Àa ndùŋ mvfò nyìŋ lézáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia.
en: Likewisegreetthe church that is in their house. Salute my wellbeloved Epænetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Malîɛ. À ka téŋe zì’i tɛ’ ńtí gẅí.
en: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Andelonikus pɔ́ Zunias. Pega pɔ́ pǔ ńgwɔ́ pà Yuda, mbà pega pɔ́ ka pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ. Pɔ́ ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ megàŋ ntúm mé kwoŋo nò yɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ la zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo tá mèŋ n gÿo ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn.
en: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellowprisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gǐŋ ńtsyɛ’te Ampliatus. Àa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Wirbiŋ, pega pɔ́ zɔ pǔ fa’a fà’a Kristo, ńtsyɛ’te mbɔɔ fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ Stakis.
en: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Apelès, à ka nyɛ̌ ngie àa kwà’ nyìŋ Kristo. Pi tsyɛ’te pʉ̀a ndá Aristobul.
en: Salute Apelles approved in Christ. Salute them which are of Aristobulus'household.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te*Herôdine. Àa nyìŋ Yuda pá’ mèŋ. Pi tsyɛ’te pʉ̀a ndá Narsise pie é la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Greet them that be of thehouseholdof Narcissus, which are in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Tirifene pɔ́ fɛ́ we Tirifose, ée pànzwě pie pɔ́ fa’a fà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛ’. Pi tsyɛ’te Pɛrsid. Àa ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we manzwě. À ka fa’a yé fà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛ’.
en: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsyɛ’té Rẅifẅis. Àa nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka tsɔ’ɔ́ yé á piŋ ńnéŋe twó nà fà’ yé tɛ’. Pi gíŋ ńtsyɛ’te mbɔɔ má we, má we ŋwɛ́ gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ má wɔ̀ɔn yɔ́ɔn.
en: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Asinkelite, lê Flégon, lê Hermes, lê Patfobas, lê Hermas, mbɔɔ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pâ pɔ́ gwɔ́.
en: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Filolog, lê Zulius, lê Neré tà mbɔɔ fɛ́ we wé manzwě, ńgÿo Olimpas, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm pie pâ pɔ́ gwɔ́.
en: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te mennɛ́ mí, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te, ńtáŋte mennɛ́ mí nà ntí ye pʉ̀a Ssé. Mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm ná wɔɔn shÿó pǔ ńtsyɛ’te gẅí.
en: Salute one another with an holy kiss. The churches of Christ salute you.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n ge gɔɔn né pi ngie pi pɔ́ɔn pʉ̀a pie é ma’a fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńdɔgɔ pá’ pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ mmó gie mé la zí’i gẅi ná Kristo, ńgÿo pʉ̀a fʉa mánzsè. Pi kÿo pɛ̌ pʉ̀a.
en: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

ngiemboon: Á nue yɛ̌ ntí pʉ̀a tě fa’a fà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo wɔ́, pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ lepfòm sɔ́b. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ shwóŋè mbʉ́lè pʉlé mbɔɔ shwóŋè lʉte, éfʉte pʉ̀a pie legyè sɔ́b vɔ́g vɔ̌g.
en: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pi, pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ngie pi jú’ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Tà ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ńnéŋe nkág kág nà mmó gie pi ne ńgÿo. Tá’ mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi gẅiin zsě nò mbòŋo lélɔg ńgÿo nò mbòŋo, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ lékÿo nò tepòŋ ńgwɔ́ pàtè*lɔ̌’.
en: For your obedience is come abroad unto allmen. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn, mbà e Ssé gẅie à náa sẅéte, ge ma’a Sátà ssé, pi lɔg mekwò ńnéŋte yé. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi.
en: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith you. Amen.

ngiemboon: Timoté gẅie peg yé fa’a, à tsyɛ’té gẅí. Lusius mbɔɔ Jasoŋ mbɔɔ Sosipatɛɛ, pie pega pɔ́ pǔ ńgwɔ́ pà Yuda pɔ́ tsyɛ’té gẅi yɔ́b.
en: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Tertilus gẅie mé tsẅǐ ngie mèŋ n ŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, n dɔ̌g pá’ n da nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à léen ńtemte wégè, ńtsyɛ’te gẅi yɔ́ɔn.
en: I Tertius, who wrotethisepistle, salute you in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Gaẅis gẅie à kúe wɔ̀ɔn, à tsyɛ’té gẅí, àcú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo áa ndá yé. Eraste, gẅie aa tÿǒsoŋ ńgwɔ́ ndè’e nkáb, mbɔɔ fɛ́ wege Kartẅis pɔ́ pǔ ńtsyɛ’te gẅí. [
en: Gaius mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you, and Quartus a brother.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.*Amen]
en: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith you all. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pege gu’te Ssé. Yé zɔ ku’u légÿo pi tʉte tʉte nzèm yé. Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie mèŋ n tsẅii é gɔɔn nò ná Yěsô Kristo, é ge ne fa’a yɛ̌ fà’. E Ssé lɔgɔ wɔɔn Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo, ńnyɛɛ mmó gie à la zába ná Kristo, mbà á ka zɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lelyěen tà fó taa mángù’.
en: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà á kéen ńkẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌. Pá’ Ssé la tsẅi la, mé ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne fóo ná mmó gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e, ńne sá’a légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ge zsé Kristo, é záb ntʉ́m ná yé, é jú’ ncwò wé.
en: but now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ zsé nó gílé yé. Pege cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo ńgu’te yé nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.*Amen.
en: Written to the Romans from Corinthus, and sent by Phebe servant of the church at Cenchrea.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. E Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ zɔ la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn ná we lekwòŋ ńdɔg ńgÿo wɛ̌. Fɛ́ wege Sostɛne aa yé ssé.
en: Paul, calledto bean apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenesourbrother,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ŋwe’e ńnáa mbwo cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé á tÿǒsoŋo Korento, á wɔ́b pie e Ssé la laa wɔ́b nà Yěsô Kristo ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé, ńzɛ́te mbwo pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ kwà’ pʉ̀a pé. N náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbɔɔ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie aa nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, ńtóŋo lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo. À lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, calledto besaints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both their's and our's:

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi ḿbiŋ ne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeunto you, and peace, from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí gẅí, á nà menò mbòŋo mie à ka lɔg ńcÿó gem gí, ńcʉa nà pá’ pia Yěsô Kristo kéen ńtemte.
en: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;

ngiemboon: Pá’ pia kristo kéen ńtemte la, e Ssé ka fǒ pú’u, ńnáa fù’ ntsèm né pi. À ka gÿo pi ku’u léshwóŋó nò yé, ńgíŋ ńgÿo pi ku’u lézsé nò nénʉ́.
en: that in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, andinall knowledge;

ngiemboon: Á fó ná pá’ mé ka shwóŋó gẅi nò gie mé zsé ná Kristo, pi zẅíŋ lê ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm,
en: even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

ngiemboon: tà áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbwo pi pie pi ne ńzẅí’te fʉ̀’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ge kẅɛ, atsɔ́ fù’ gie á fóo mbwo Ssé, tà pi nyé ne ḿmoŋe á té wó wɔ́.
en: so that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Yé Yěsô Kristo ge gÿo pi tʉte tʉte tà ndá’ ńcʉ́me, à lá’a lyɛ’ gie yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, ge lá’ gíŋe tó mé le ne ńda’a gẅi nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: who shall also confirm you unto the end,that ye may beblameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Yé Ssé gẅie à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi pá’ pi ge ńnéŋe fʉ̀’ ntsèm é la nnɛ́ nà Míŋ we Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, aa ntě ńka’a mmó gie à ge gÿo ḿbiŋe ńkúbe wɔ́.
en: Godisfaithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: Pi gwɔ́ tà’ ncwò, ńgie tà fàgte gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgie pi gẅiin tà’ ntí lesaŋá nò, ńgẅiin tà’ nkwaŋá.
en: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, andthatthere be no divisions among you; butthatye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n zɔɔn ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue epʉ̀a nà ngẅɛ̀ Keloé ka shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn nò ná pi, ngie fàgte kéen ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by themwhich are of the houseof Chloe, that there are contentions among you.

ngiemboon: N ka fó mǒ ńjú’ ngie awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńcʉ́’ʉ shwóŋó pɔ́ nà ye ntí. Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwaa ne gɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Pɔl, wetsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Apolos. Wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ ne gɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ Kéfas, wetsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Kristo.
en: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.

ngiemboon: Kristo aa pá’ɔɔn, mbà à kéen ńgabte mbùm ye lá? Mé la kim pɔ́ Pɔl nà tÿǒ nkǐ ńtí gẅi lá? Kà pi la kẅé ntse pɔ́ nà lezíŋ Pɔl?
en: Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ne síe Ssé á nue é té ndà’ Gaẅis pɔ́ Krispus wɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi la tè kẅé ntse mbwo mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ á gɔɔn ngie pi la kẅé ntse ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn à tè wó wɔ́.
en: lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.

ngiemboon: Oon, n dege kɔ́, atsìŋe ndá Stefanas la gíŋe ńkẅé ntse mbwo mèŋ, é té ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n kaa gíŋe ńzsé tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gẅie à la kẅé ntse mbwo mèŋ wɔ́.
en: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn tè túmo wɔ̀ɔn ngie n gʉa ńgÿo pʉ̀a kẅé ntse mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. A là túmo wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ ngie n gʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Tá ńké lelɔg pɔ́ zse nò nyìŋ mésoŋ ńtsẅi wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo metʉ̀ mie é fóo nà pá’ Kristo la kwé nà tÿǒ nkǐ é mag.
en: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn nò nà legwé Kristo nà tÿǒ nkǐ á gwɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée nà mánzsè lepyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò ngàŋ lejÿɔ́g, tá ńké ńgʉa nà pege pie pege ee nà mánzsè letsẅɛ́, yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ mbwó pege ńda’te pɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé.
en: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tágte zse nò pazsé nò, é pyág legyè pʉ̀a pie legyè sɔ́b ée wó.
en: And will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

ngiemboon: Anzse nò lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ nzɔ̌? Anzse ŋwà’ne Ssé gwɔ́ nzɔ̌? Anzoŋo nò ná yɔɔn kème njÿó gwɔ́ yé nzɔ̌? E Ssé léen tè gÿo azsé nò tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó cʉ́’ menò pʉ̀a wɔ́ le?
en: Whereisthe wise? whereisthe scribe? whereisthe disputer of this world? hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, pá’ɔɔn á nue pʉ̀a mesoŋ la tè lɔgɔ yɔ́b zse nò, ńzsé Ssé wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ pá’ e Ssé ne shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńnyɛɛ zsé nò yé. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé záb ngie à ge gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná ye tsẅɛ́, éfó ná yɔɔn nò gie pege ne ńgɔɔn, epʉ̀a ne ńgyá ngie é gwɔ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a lɔɔn.
en: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda ée nà wɔ́b nkwɔ’ɔ́ ńně ńzɛ́te ngie mé nyɛɛ mmó gie á la’te metʉ̀ Ssé. Pʉ̀a Gelekia ne ńzɛ́te mmó gie á la’te kwà’ zsé nò.
en: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná peg, peg ne sá’a pɔ́ nò Kristo gẅie mé la kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ mbwo pà Yuda ńgwɔ́ nò gie ngwɔ́ mé zɔɔn le kím tà shwóŋó nyìŋ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a.
en: but we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa mbwo pʉ̀a pie e Ssé tsɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́b, kà é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà Yuda wɔ́, kà pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ wɔ́, Kristo la’te pá’ metʉ̀ Ssé ée pú’u, mbɔɔ pá’ zsè nò Ssé áa pú’u.
en: but unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.

ngiemboon: Á nue ammó gie e Ssé gÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gyá ngie áa nò pʉ̀a, azsé nò áa mǒ ńcʉa gie áa nà mmó gie nyìŋ mesoŋ gÿo. Ammó gie Ssé piŋ ńgÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gyá ngie á pÿɛ pÿɛ̌, yɛ̌ gẅiin tʉ̀ ńcʉa we shúm sie nyìŋ mesoŋ gÿo.
en: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pi pie Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, pi gyá ntí gie pi lɔg ńgwɔ́, epʉ̀a pie mé ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgyá ngie ée pàzsé nò, é té tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Pàgẅiin metʉ̀ é té tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Pàfó nà metsìŋe ndá memáa pʉ̀a piŋ ńké tè tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́.
en: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble,are called:

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé la tsɔ́’ shúm sie njÿo gyǎ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm pʉ̀a ńdɔg ńtém shʉ́ ná pàzsé nò, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pepÿɛ́ ńdɔg ńtém shʉ́ ná sie é gẅiin tʉ̀.
en: but God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó á té tsɔ́ mmó ku’, ńkɔ́g kɔ́g, mé gwág gwǎg, ńdɔg ńzẅé nzẅìŋ gie mé kwǎŋ ngie áa mmó tɛ’.
en: and base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen,yea, and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ le ŋá’te mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: that no flesh should glory in his presence.

ngiemboon: Yé Ssé zɔ la temte gẅia Yěsô Kristo, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo yégè zsé nò. E Ssé fó ná ye ńgyá wégè pá’ pà tè fʉa, ńdɔgɔ wégè ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé, ńzá’ nkÿo pù’ nò tepòŋ ná pege.
en: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉ́me nà nò gie ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo leŋá’te, á lɔg pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo tá ńdɔg ńŋá’te.
en: that, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á laa fʉ̀’ gie kwà’ mèŋ n da tóo lá’ pi létsẅii nò Ssé, á gwɔ́ nò gie á la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lelyěen, n gwaa tsẅii mbwo pi, n tè lɔgɔ tsɔ́ shwóŋè gie á tʉ tʉ ńtsẅi wɔ́, ńké tè lɔg pɔ́ lényɛɛ gẅi tsɔ́ mmó gie mèŋ sěen ńzsé tɛ’ ńdɔg ńtsẅi wɔ́.
en: And I, brethren, when I came to you, came not with excellency of speech or of wisdom, declaring unto you the testimony of God.

ngiemboon: Á nue n da záb ngie n tě ńgee zsé tsɔ́ nò ndyɛ̀’ɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò Yěsô Kristo, á Yěsô Kristo gẅie mé la kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ wɔ́.
en: For I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

ngiemboon: N da tyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńjú’ ḿbú ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́, ńjú’ ḿbɔ́g pɔ́g tà ne ḿvɛɛ.
en: And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè gie á lɔ̌ɔn ńkẅɛɛ ncwò mèŋ, mbɔɔ nò Kristo gie n da ne sá’a mbwo pi, lɔ́ɔn tě ńnyɛɛ zsé nò nyìŋ mesoŋ gie mé lɔg ńgÿo nyìŋ zẅíŋe nò wɔ́. Metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ la ne ńgÿo epʉ̀a gyá ngie áa nò nénʉ́.
en: And my speech and my preachingwasnot with enticing words of man's wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:

ngiemboon: Pú’u légwɔ́ gie gẅi lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tè jʉ́’ʉ nà zsé nò pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. Á ge jʉ́’ʉ pɔ́ nà metʉ̀ Ssé.
en: that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.

ngiemboon: Peg pìŋ ńké ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ cÿɔgté nà lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńzí’i wɔ́b zsé nò. Tá yɛ̌ zsé nò ké tè zsé nò yɔɔn njÿó wɔ́, ńké tè zsé nò gie á fóo mbwo shúm tepòŋ sie é sá’a yɔɔn njÿó, ńgwɔ́ sie mé ge gÿo pyág wɔ́.
en: Howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the princes of this world, that come to nought:

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná peg, mbà peg la’te yég pɔ́ zsé nò Ssé gie ee nkʉ̀’ʉ nò gie e kɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lelyěen, mbà Ssé la lá’ ńnyɛte ńzáb tà njÿó nyé té gwɔ̌ wó légwɔ́ gie, à ge lá’ lɔg ńnáa legú’ wege.
en: but we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery,eventhe hiddenwisdom, which God ordained before the world unto our glory:

ngiemboon: Tsoon tà’ nà shúm tepòŋ sie é sá’a yɔɔn njÿó laa zsé yɛ̌ zsé nò wɔ́. Pɔ́ la gwé’e ńzsé yɛ̌ zsé nò, mbà pɔ́ la tè gÿo mé kime Ndè nà tÿǒ nkǐ, á Ndè gẅie à gẅiin legú’ wɔ́.
en: which none of the princes of this world knew: for had they knownit, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

ngiemboon: Légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋo yé ge gÿo zẅɛ́’.
en: The things which God hath prepared for them that love him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka piŋ ńgÿo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo pege zɔ̌ zsé yɛ̌ nò gie á laa lelyěen. À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔɔn mwoon zẅi nò ntsèm, tà mbɔɔ menò mie Ssé nyě ńgẅiin pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mvwɔ́’.
en: But God hath revealedthemunto us by his Spirit: for the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ awɔ̌ zsé nò gie nyìŋ mesoŋ ne ńkwaŋa ntʉ́m ye té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋ? Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le zsé nò gie e Ssé ne ńkwaŋa té gwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge Ssé wɔ́.
en: For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pege, mbà mé la tè náa zẅìge njÿó né pege wɔ́. Mé la ná pɔ́ Zẅìge gie á fóo mbwó Ssé né pege pá’ á ge gÿo pege zsé fù’ gie e Ssé la lɔg ńcÿó gem yégè.
en: Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.

ngiemboon: Pege tè gwaa gɔɔn nò ná sɛ̌ shúm sie Ssé la náa mbwo pege ńdɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la lɔgɔ zsé nò yɔ́b ńzí’i wégè wɔ́. Pege lɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè gie Zẅìge Ssé zí’i wégè tá ńgɔɔn nò mǒ. Á cʉa pú’u, pege cʉ́’ʉ lé gwɔ́ kyagte nò nà shúm sie é fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ssé, ńdɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè gie á fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ssé tá ńkyagte.
en: Which things also we speak, not in the words which man's wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ lɔɔn nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà ntí gie mé la zyé yé á gwɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le jú’u mmó gie á fóo mbwo zẅìge Ssé wɔ́. Áa mbwo ye ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a. À tè ku’u lé jú’u nò gie á gɔɔn wɔ́. Á nue à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ gÿo tá mé jú’u nò gie yɛ̌ mmó lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn.
en: But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he knowthem, because they are spiritually discerned.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a áa ná ye, à ku’u létsa’a yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ ntsèm ńdíe. Tá ńgʉa ná ye, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ letsa’a yé nò ńdíe wɔ́.
en: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pege, mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ gie Kristo ne ńkwaŋa kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà pege zsě.
en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But we have the mind of Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n ka cʉ́’ʉ légɔɔn nò mbwo pi, ńgyá ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ń de gɔɔn pá’ ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u ncwò Zẅìge Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ ka gɔɔn pɔ́ nà ntí gie ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nyé ńjú’u pɔ́ mmó gie mbùm yɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn. N gɔɔn pɔ́ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée nà lezǎb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pûɔ mepÿɛ́.
en: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal,evenas unto babes in Christ.

ngiemboon: N ka náa gẅi lepʉ́. N tè ná shúm lejÿó mpfɛ́ pfɛ̌ né pi wɔ́, mélà’mie pi ka nyé tè ku’u lépfɛ́ɛ mmó. Tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pi nyě pɔ́ tè ku’u lé jú’u nò gie á tʉʉ lé jú’,
en: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not ableto bear it, neither yet now are ye able.

ngiemboon: anue mbùm gí zɔ nyé sá’a gẅí, kègɔ́’ zɔɔn nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi nyě ńzoŋo nò zoŋ. Mbùm gí zɔ tě ńdɔgɔ ńnyé sá’a gẅi wɔ́? Pi tě ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńnyé ńgÿo pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a njÿó gÿo wɔ́?
en: For ye are yet carnal: for whereasthere isamong you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi neŋé tà ńgɔɔn ngie yé gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ we Pɔl, wetsɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie à gwɔ́ yé pɔ́ nyìŋ we Apolos, mbà á téen ńdɔgɔ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shwóŋè pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́ ka?
en: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, Iamof Apollos; are ye not carnal?

ngiemboon: Apolos aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́? Pɔl gwɔ́ wɔ̌? Tá pi gɔɔn pú’u? Peg ye gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pafa’a fà’ Ssé pie pi la zẅɛ́’ɛ wég tá ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná peg yé gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ná shÿó ngie à gÿo.
en: Who then is Paul, and whoisApollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka paa tÿǒ ssé, Apolos pfɛte ntse mǒ. Tá e Ssé zɔ̌ gÿo á kẅág.
en: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à paa tÿǒ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛte ntse téen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. E Ssé gẅie à gÿó á kẅága zɔ gẅiin nò ntsèm.
en: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à paa tÿǒ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛte ntse mǒ pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b gwɔ́ gÿo ńkẅé wé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ é ku’u nà fà’ gie à fǎ’.
en: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

ngiemboon: Á nue peg puté ńně fa’a pɔ́ fà’a Ssé. Pi gwɔ́ nká’ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndá gie Ssé ne ńkwɛ́ɛ.
en: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God's husbandry,ye areGod's building.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka cÿó gem yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n nuŋe cÿó ndá pá’ ngàŋ levfò we mbòŋo. Mèŋ n ka nuŋe cÿó ndá, wetsɔ́ nyìŋ ne ńdɔgɔ fà’ ńgee mvfò. À ne ńkwɛ́ɛ ndá ndùmó. Tá’ awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ laga twó yé nà ntí gie à lɔgɔ ńkwɛ́ɛ ndá ndùmó.
en: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà cÿó ndá, mbà á kéen ndá’ ńgwɔ́ ssé, ńgwɔ́ Yěsô Kristo. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á legíŋ ńnuŋe tsɔ́ ye ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ cʉ́’ʉ lépwoon ndá nà cÿó ŋwɛ́ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ́l ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ lɔgɔ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ metóon ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔg yé pɔ́ metÿǒ ńkwɛ́. Wetsɔ̌ lɔgɔ legǐ njǔm kà pǐŋ wɔ́ ḿbá’.
en: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

ngiemboon: Mbà e tè tsɔ̌ ntsaŋ wɔ́. Afà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ge lá’ kẅɛɛ mángÿɛ̌. Mé ge lá’ gyá á nà lyɛ̌’ gie mé tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ. Á nue mmɔ̌g ge lá’ cʉa nà fà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tá mé gyá pá’ áa jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u.
en: every man's work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man's work of what sort it is.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie nyìŋ la lɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá nà cÿó ndá ŋwɛ́, lɔɔn ńdá’ tè shÿó, mbà ngàŋ ge lá’ kẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’.
en: If any man's work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

ngiemboon: Tá fà’ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńdá’ shÿó, mbà ngàŋ ge lá’ táŋa pyé, é ké tsẅɛ́ tsẅɛ́ tá’, é tsẅɛ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à tɔgɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g tá ńtsẅɛ́ la.
en: If any man's work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie pi ee pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, à Zẅìge Ssé tsẅé tsoló wɔ́ ka?
en: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, andthatthe Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtágte*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, mbà Ssé ge gÿo tágte ngàŋ é gwá’. Á nue*jʉ’ʉ Ssé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ yé gílé ye. Pi piŋ ńgẅiin le zsé ngie*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ŋwɛ́ á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅi wɛ̂.
en: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, whichtempleye are.

ngiemboon: MÀbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉte twó mbùm yé. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńne ńkwaŋa ngie pʉ̀a njÿó ne ńgyá ngie áa nzsé nò, á zɔɔn ḿvɔg sele ńcʉ́’ʉ pʉ̀a tá ńdeen ńké ńgwɔ́ kwà’ nzsé nò.
en: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

ngiemboon: Á nue anò gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ńgwɔ́ zsé nò, áa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a. Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé lɔg pɔ́ lejÿɔ́’ nzsé nò ńdɔg ńgwoon yé».
en: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zsé nkwaŋá nò pàzsé nò. À zsě ngie é té tsɔ́ mmó ku’».
en: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà nyìŋ gẅi lɔg pá’ aa nyìŋ we mákyè ńdɔg ńka’te. Á nue akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, gwɔ́ pɔ́ gí.
en: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are your's;

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Pɔl, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Apolos, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Kéfas, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ njÿó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le gwɔ́ wó ka pɔ́ lekwé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɔɔn kème njÿó ka gie à nyé tá ńtóo wɔ́, mbà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo pi.
en: whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are your's;

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná pi, pi gwɔ́ mbwo Kristo, Kristo piŋ ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé.
en: and ye are Christ's; and ChristisGod's.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi líe wég pá’ pafa’a fà’ Kristo mbɔɔ pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin nò nà lekyɛ’té nò Ssé gie á laa lelyěen é shwóŋ pʉ̀a.
en: Let a man so account of us, as of the ministers of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mé ne ńzẅí’te mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin nò nà fà’, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ zsé pɔ́ ndà’ mmó gie mé zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ gÿo.
en: Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà á té ne ńgege wɔ̀ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi gɔɔn nò nà fà’ yɔ́ɔn mɔ́. Kà pɔ́ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mendyɛ̀’ɛ léńnéŋe ssé ńdíe nò ńnáa mǒ wɔ́. Kwà’ mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ n de zsé léshwóŋe nyìŋ pá’ fà’ yɔ́ɔn áa pú’u wɔ́.
en: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man's judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie mbùm yɔ̀ɔn tè ne ńcúa wɔ̀ɔn nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Tá mèŋ n tě ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie atsɔ́*lɔ̌’ té ná fà’ gie mèŋ n gÿo wɔ́ wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin létsa’a fà’ yɔ́ɔn.
en: For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pú’u, shwóŋó gẅi ngie tà pi tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn nò nà fà’a nyìŋ té gwɔ́ gie fʉ̀’ kǔ’. Té gwɔ́ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tǒ. Yé zɔ ge gÿo kyɛ’ɛ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm. À ge gÿo gÿo mé gyá ménkwaŋá mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m pʉ̀a. E Ssé lêen ńké ńná ngɔ́ɔnte ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ nà ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ngàŋ gẅiin.
en: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn nò ḿbiŋ ńda’te pá’ nò gie n gɔ̌ɔn áa ná mèŋ ńgwɔ́, mbɔɔ pá’ áa ná Apolos ńgwɔ́ pú’u. N da’te pú’u, pɔ́ lélɔg ńzí’i gẅi mmó. Mèŋ n kwǒŋ ngie pi fó ná peg ńzí’i mmó gie esag lekid gie e gɔɔn ngie: Mbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ légÿo mmó tà ńtɔ́gɔ gie mé la ŋwe’e, e lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋó gẅi ngie nyìŋ gẅi à tè gẅiin lélɔg pá’ aa nzèm wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńŋá’te mvfò wetsɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself andtoApollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to thinkof menabove that which is written, that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ zɔɔn ńgÿo ɔ̀ kwaŋ ngie ɔ̀ cʉ́a petsɔ́ pʉ̀a? Ɔ̀ gẅiin kɔ́ tà á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ gie e Ssé la ná né gù wɔ́? À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la ná né gù nǎ, mbà ɔ̀ piŋe ńdɔgɔ ńŋá’te pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé la tè ná né gù nǎ wɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: For who maketh thee to differfrom another? and what hast thou that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receiveit, why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not receivedit?

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ʉ ńzɔ́gɔ ngie pi kéen ndá’ ḿbú ńgẅiin shúm ntsèm sie é ka ne ńzága mbwo pi. Pi kéen ndá’ ńcʉ́’ ngàŋa mmó ká? Pi kéen ḿvɔg ńcʉ́’ méfùɔ ńcʉa wég lá? Tá á kěen pé’e pi gwɔ́ méfùɔ, kwà’ nénʉ́, mbà á póŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, mbà à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pege.
en: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ke ně ńgyá yɔ́ɔn ngie e Ssé ka gʉa ná peg megàŋ ntúm ńnáa yég jʉ’ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzsò nzèm. Pá’ pʉ̀a pie mé zǎ’ ntsaŋ yɔ́b tà ne ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkwɔ́’ɔ né gÿɛ̌ pá’ mé ge zẅéte wɔ́b. Ngwòŋo ngwòŋ ne ńgyá, epʉ̀a mesoŋ mbɔɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ne ńgyá yɔ́b.
en: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.

ngiemboon: Anò Kristo kéen ńgÿo peg cʉ́’ mepʉ̀a. Tá ńké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi kéen ńcʉa ná Kristo ńzsé nò. Peg gwɔ́ mepepÿɛ́ɛ pʉ̀a. Pi gẅiin metʉ̀. Mé gÿo mekù’ mí, ḿbiŋ ńtóo ná peg ńgwága wég gwǎg.
en: Wearefools for Christ's sake, but yearewise in Christ; weareweak, but yearestrong; yearehonourable, but wearedespised.

ngiemboon: Enzyè ee zɔ́gɔ légyáŋa wég. Agága yég zɔ́gɔ léshÿó. Nzsǒ ma’ e tè wó wɔ́. Mé ee zɔ́gɔ pɔ́ lécúa wég. Atsɔ̌ le gwɔ́ gẅie ńgwɔ́ peg pʉ́le ńnéŋe tà’a jʉ’ à tè wó wɔ́.
en: Even unto this present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace;

ngiemboon: Kwà’ peg lɔg mbwó még é fa’a fà’ tà ńzi’i tá ńgẅiin yég mmó. Mé zóonte wég tá peg tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná pʉ̀a. Mé kʉ́e wég peg tè zoŋ.
en: and labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:

ngiemboon: Mé shwóŋó té poŋ nà lezíŋ ség, peg lɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè mbòŋo ḿbÿɛ. Tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn mé líe wég ńgyá peg gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ kʉ̀ŋe sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mefùbe sẅɛ̀ɛ mie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world,and arethe offscouring of all things unto this day.

ngiemboon: N kě tě ŋwe’e yɔɔn nò ńdɔgɔ ńtéme pɔ́ shʉ́ ná pi wɔ́, n dɔgɔ ńzí’i gẅi pɔ́ mmó, á nue pi ee pènkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn pie mèŋ n kwoŋo gẅi tɛ’.
en: I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warnyou.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńgẅiin pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zí’i gẅi nò Kristo tà é fó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntsá’ legém, mbà metá pí té gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Mèŋ n zɔ tá gẅi á nue mèŋ n zɔ ka tǒ ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi, tá pi la nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: For though ye have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yethave yenot many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la n dɔgɔ ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie, pi pí fʉ̀’ ná mèŋ.
en: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.

ngiemboon: N gwɔ̌ túmo Timoté né pi ńtí pɔ́ pú’u. Aa nà nò Kristo ńgwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mie n kwoŋo yé tɛ’. À zsé pɔ́ ndà’ nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á ge tó kímte gẅi mmó gie n zí’i pʉ̀a á nà legiŋe nzèm Kristo pɔ́ kwà’ pá’ mèŋ n ne ńtóo nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ńzí’i pʉ̀a.
en: For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, who is my beloved son, and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ, as I teach every where in every church.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ka kwaŋ ngie n tè lá’ gíŋe tó tà gyá gẅi wɔ́, ńkwaŋ pú’u, ńzye léŋá’te.
en: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà mèŋ n ge tɔ́g tó gyá gẅí. E tó pú’u, ńde líe nò pɔ́ ndà’ nà shwóŋó gie pɔ́ sěen ńtáŋte ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ gwɔ́, n gíŋe fa’a le zsé mmó gie pɛ̌ megàŋa ŋá’tè ku’u légÿo.
en: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will, and will know, not the speech of them which are puffed up, but the power.

ngiemboon: Á nue anò*lefùɔ Ssé, á té gwɔ́ léseen ńtáŋte shwóŋè ńgɔɔn wɔ́, metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ̌ fa’a fà’.
en: For the kingdom of Godisnot in word, but in power.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa nà menò mɔɔn mémbʉ́a ńkaŋa gí. Pi kwǒŋ ngie n gwɔ tóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńgẅiin pɔ́ ngwɔɔn kà mèŋ n gwɔ tó ntʉ́m wɔɔn ne ḿboŋo poŋ, n ne ńkwoŋo gẅi kwoŋ?
en: What will ye? shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, andinthe spirit of meekness?

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńjú’u mé gwɔ́ nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ éshwóŋó ngie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, atsɔ́ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó é fʉ’ʉ tsɔ́ ntí menò tɛ’, Yɛ̌ ntí tsẅé pǔ ḿbÿág pÿág tà pàtè zsé Ssé zɔɔn tè pú’u, gÿo. N ne ńjú’u ngie atsɔ́ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi kéen ńnéŋe nzwě tá we ndá.
en: It is reported commonlythat there isfornication among you, and such fornication as is not so much as named among the Gentiles, that one should have his father's wife.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ńne ńŋá’te, tá mbà pi kěen lúŋ yɛ̌ ntí nò lǔŋ, é piŋ fóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi jwoŋo nyìŋ gẅie à ka gÿo pú’u.
en: And ye are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn lenÿɔ́g tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́. Tá á cʉa ná tà’ ncwò wege ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n kéen ndá’ ńŋaga nyìŋ gẅie à ka gÿo yɛ̌ nò pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie n ka gwɔ̌ pɔ́ ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi la, ńzáb ngie:
en: For I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have judged already, as though I were present,concerninghim that hath so done this deed,

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńcú’te nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô. Mbà á cʉa ná tà’ ncwò wege n gwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ssé. Pi lɔg metʉ̀ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô,
en: in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: ńtsege wɛ̌ nyìŋ náa mbwo Sátà. À tágte mbab nnɛ́ ngàŋ légwɔ́ gie á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lá’ tó, àzẅìge ngàŋ tsẅɛ́.
en: to deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á té poŋ pi ŋá’te lé yɛ̌ ntí nò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́. Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ gÿo à feléwa ntsab pú ńkwɔ́’ wɔ́ ka?
en: Your gloryingisnot good. Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?

ngiemboon: Pi kẅile*mvòŋ nzẅìŋe mà tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzsé ngie pi ge gwɔ́ té*lɔ̌’. À fó pú’u, pi gwɔ́ feléwa ntsab gie á nyé pɔ́ ye sẅé, té tsɔ̌*mvòŋ mǒ. Pi kéen ńzɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ pú’u, á nue mé lá lɔgɔ Kristo ńnuŋe pwɔ́’, á gwɔ́ pá’ wege mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò línɔ́ɔn*Páskà la.
en: Purge out therefore the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened. For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us:

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege jÿó línɔ́ɔn*páskà nê*mbelég té mvòŋ, nê ntʉ́m ndʉalʉ̌a, é ntʉ́m gẅie é shwóŋó nò nénʉ́. Tà pege pfɛ́ mbelég gie mé lɔgɔ́*mvòŋ nzẅìŋe mà ńdɔg ńnyɛte, ée mefà’ tepòŋ, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ ye nò tepòŋ.
en: therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavenedbreadof sincerity and truth.

ngiemboon: N da túmo ŋwà’ne mbwo pi ńgɔɔn tsoló ngie: Pi pɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ gie pia pʉ̀a pie é púmo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ núŋe nuŋe teme nò.
en: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators:

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ḿbumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe wɔ́, ńké tě ńgɔɔn metsǒŋ métsèm wɔ́, ńké tě ńgɔɔn ngàŋ kègɔ́’ métsèm wɔ́, ńké tě ńgɔɔn pàgu’te shúm ngie ee messé metsèm wɔ́. Á nue á laa pú’u, mbà pi ka cʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ lefóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńkẅɛ.
en: yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or with idolaters; for then must ye needs go out of the world.

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, n kɔ̌ɔn ńŋwe’e ńgɔɔn mbwo pi pɔ́ ngie, pi pɔ́ɔn nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńně ńgɔɔn ngie aa fɛ́ gẅi nzèm Kristo, ḿbiŋe ḿbumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ ye nuŋe nuŋe, ńgwɔ́ ntsǒŋ, kà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gu’te shúm ngie ee messé wɔ́, kà pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à shwoŋo té poŋ nà mezíŋ pʉ̀a wɔ́ɔ, kà pʉ̀a melù’ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋ nkáb tɛ’ wɔ́. Tà pi lâ yɛ̌ ntí nyìŋ fó ńzɔɔn ńteme mmó ńjÿó.
en: But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater, or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not to eat.

ngiemboon: Pega pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́ zɔɔn ńgẅiin kɔ́ tà mèŋ n ŋaga wɔ́b? Pi gẅiin pɔ́ léŋag pʉ̀a pie pia pɔ̌ pú ńgwɔ́ ndá.
en: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without? do not ye judge them that are within?

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ ŋag pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́. Pi fóo nùɔ pi ńjwoŋo nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: But them that are without God judgeth. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.

ngiemboon: Á gaa nyìŋ gẅi pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ Kristo gẅiin ntsaŋ á nyé té lɔg ńgʉa ńgyá pʉ̀a Ssé pɔ́ ŋag, ńgʉa ńgyá pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té Ssé zsé?
en: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unjust, and not before the saints?

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a Ssé ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ ŋag pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́ ka? À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pi ge lá’ ŋag pʉ̀a njÿó, mbà kɔ́ piŋ ńgÿo pi tè ku’u léŋag menò mie é zɔɔn fó tè tsɔ́ mmó ku’?
en: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie pege ge lá’ ŋag*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé wɔ́ ka? Tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ nà menò me fʉ̀’ɔɔn?
en: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

ngiemboon: Tá pi ké ńgwɔ́ tà ntsaŋ gie e líe menò me fʉ̀’ɔɔn é kẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi gwóon ńdɔg ńgʉa ńgyá pʉ̀a pie cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo té sáŋa wɔ́b nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, ńgie pɔ́ ŋag.
en: If then ye have judgments of things pertaining to this life, set them to judge who are least esteemed in the church.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńtéme shʉ́ ná pi. Pi lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzága nzsé nò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á giŋ kěm nà nò gie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ nyìŋ Kristo pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ keen?
en: I speak to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you? no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brethren?

ngiemboon: Tá áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, nyìŋ Kristo lɔgɔ wetsɔ́ ńgʉa jʉ’ gie mé ŋaga mentsaŋ wó, tà á fó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mvfò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té záb ntʉ́m ná kristo wɔ́.
en: But brother goeth to law with brother, and that before the unbelievers.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi lézɔɔn ńdɔgɔ wetsɔ́ ńgʉa jʉ’ gie mé ŋaga mentsaŋ wó, á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie cú’te gí té ne ńgiŋe wɔ́. Á zɔ́ɔn ngǎ mé fʉa nò mbwo nyìŋ gẅi, angàŋ tè shÿɔg shÿɔg wɔ́, ńjʉʉ mmó nyìŋ, à tè gwág?
en: Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you, because ye go to law one with another. Why do ye not rather take wrong? Why do ye not rathersuffer yourselves tobe defrauded?

ngiemboon: Tá, pi zɔ̌ ke ńgíŋe fʉa nò á mbwo mefɛ́ pí. Pi zɔ jʉʉ shúm sɔ́b.
en: Nay, ye do wrong, and defraud, and thatyourbrethren.

ngiemboon: Áa pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u. Tá’ e Ssé ka sɔg mɛ̌ menò ná pi, ńdɔgɔ gẅi ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé. E Ssé yege ka lɔgɔ Zẅìge yé ńgÿo pi cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò ye ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo.
en: And such were some of you: but ye are washed, but ye are sanctified, but ye are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ ně ńgɔɔn ngie à gÿo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ pɔ́ tè pɔ̌g*lepʉ̌. Áa nò tá’ eshúm ntsèm té kẅéte. Áa nò ngie ngwɔ́ n gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ té pɔ́g*lepʉ̌. Tá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n ké lezẅíŋ atsɔ́ mmó lɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo nkwɔɔn ye wɔ́.
en: All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ně ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé la gÿo mmó lejÿó ńtí lepfòm, ńgÿo lepfòm ńtíi mmó lejÿó. Áa nò tá’ e Ssé ge gÿo tágte mmó lejÿó gwá’, é gíŋe tágte lepfòm. Mbɔɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ á lelɔg mbùm ye ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à kwǒŋ wɔ́, á nue mbùm nyìŋ ee ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ̌ líe nò náa mǒ.
en: Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats: but God shall destroy both it and them. Now the bodyisnot for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ pi lege ngie e Ssé gẅie à la zíme Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nà legwé, à ge gÿo lɔg metʉ̀ mé é gíŋe zíme wégè yégè nà legwé.
en: And God hath both raised up the Lord, and will also raise up us by his own power.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie mbùm gi ée mekèm mbùm Kristo wɔ́ ka? N ge lɔgɔ kème mbùm Kristo lɔg gÿo kème mbùm káa tÿǒ manzwě lá? Ngǎŋ,
en: Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ? shall I then take the members of Christ, and makethemthe members of an harlot? God forbid.

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pi tè ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ pɔ́ káa tÿǒ manzwě lɔɔn ńtemte, mbà pɔ́ ye cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbùm nɛ́ wɔ́? Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Pɔ́b mépʉ́a ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbàb nnɛ́.
en: What? know ye not that he which is joined to an harlot is one body? for two, saith he, shall be one flesh.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie à laa ye nɛ́ pɔ́ nà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pɔ́ yé cʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’a Zẅìge.
en: But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛte ḿbɔ́ɔn lélɔg mbùm gi ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi kwǒŋ. Metsɔ́ menò tepòŋ mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo, ée nà pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzème pǐ. Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔg mbùm ye ńgÿo kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà à sele ńgÿo nò tepòŋ pɔ́ ná ye.
en: Flee fornication. Every sin that a man doeth is without the body; but he that committeth fornication sinneth against his own body.

ngiemboon: Tsyee pi tè ne ńzsé ngie mbùm gi aa jʉ’e Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a wɔ́ ka? Yɛ̌ Zẅìge á tsẅé tsoló, mbà Ssé la ná né pi. Pi zɔ tè gẅiin twó mbùm gí wɔ́.
en: What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghostwhich isin you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la náa mmó ńdɔg fó ndá nkwɔɔn ńcu’u gẅi. Pi ké ńdɔg mbùm gi ńná mekù’ mbwo Ssé.
en: For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's.

ngiemboon: Pege gɔɔn nò fʉ̀’ɔɔn nà menò mie pi ka ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne ńzɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn. Pi ka gɔɔn ngie: «Áa mbòŋ mbwo nyìŋ mbàŋa léńnéŋe té cʉa ná nzwě we».
en: Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me:It isgood for a man not to touch a woman.

ngiemboon: Tá’ à ke ńcʉ́’ gie nyìŋ pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ yé nuŋe nuŋe, wɛ̌ mámbàŋa wɔ́ kú’te nzwě we, wɛ̌ manzwě wɔ́ kú’te ndúm we.
en: Nevertheless,to avoidfornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mámbàŋa gÿo nò mámbàŋa ná nzwě we, manzwě gÿo nò manzwě nà ndúm we.
en: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.

ngiemboon: Manzwě tè gẅiin lélɔg mbùm ye ńgÿo mmó gie à kwoŋ wɔ́, mbùm ye gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye ndúm we. Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mámbàŋa tè gẅiin lélɔg mbùm ye ńgÿo mmó gie à kwoŋ wɔ́, mbùm ye gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye nzwě we.
en: The wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body, but the wife.

ngiemboon: Tà mámbàŋa lʉ’ʉ nò mbwo nzwé we, tà manzwě ké ńdʉ’ yé. À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pi gÿo pú’u, pɔ́ ná mûɔ méfʉ̀’ gẅie pi lɔgɔ́ tà’ ncwò ńgyá ngie pi ge sẅíŋte Ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, pi gíŋe ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lɔ́ɔn ndá gí pá’ pi zɔɔn ńnéŋe, ḿbɔ́gɔ légwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Sátà lɔg pá’ pi kʉ́a légwoonte mbùm gí ńkwa’te gẅí,
en: Defraud ye not one the other, exceptit bewith consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again, that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency.

ngiemboon: é té pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́*lepʉ̌ sie mèŋ n zába wɔ́, n gɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie pi lɔɔn ńgÿo á poŋ.
en: But I speak this by permission,andnot of commandment.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a metsèm gwɔ́ pá’ mèŋ. Tá wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ à gẅiin yé mmó á gwɔ́ pɔ́ gie e Ssé la ná. Aye wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ à ge zɔ́’, aye wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ à ńnéŋe pú’u.
en: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gɔɔn mbwo menkẅì lâ mbwo mepfɔ̌g pànzwě ngie áa mboŋ ngie pɔ́ pʉ́le ńnéŋe pá’ mèŋ.
en: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ gyǎ ngie pɔ́ té ku’u légwoonte mbùm yɔ́b wɔ́, pɔ́ zɔ́’, á nue mvfò lézɔ́’ ńcʉa léńnéŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kéen ńdá’ ńzɔ́’, mbà mèŋ n ge tsẅii nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la záb á gwɔ́ ngie, manzwě gẅie à zɔ̌’, à tè gẅiin lékẅɛɛ ná ndúm we wɔ́.
en: And unto the married I command,yetnot I, but the Lord, Let not the wife depart fromherhusband:

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńkẅɛɛ nà ndúm we tà á ke ńgíŋe ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, ńcʉ́’ pú’u, á piŋ nzèm pɔ́ ndúm we maga cÿɔ́g. Mámbàŋa piŋ ńké tè gẅiin léjwoŋo nzwě we wɔ́.
en: but and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled toherhusband: and let not the husband put awayhiswife.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, ńgẅiin manzwě gẅie à tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́, wɛ̌ manzwé zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ yé ńnéŋe tà ngàŋ jwoŋo yé. Mèŋ n zɔ gɔɔn yɔɔn nò, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ tě ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: But to the rest speak I, not the Lord: If any brother hath a wife that believeth not, and she be pleased to dwell with him, let him not put her away.

ngiemboon: Manzwě piŋ ngwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, andúm we tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́, ńzẅíŋ pá’ pɔ́ yé ge ńnéŋe, tà á kẅɛ̀ɛ ná ye,
en: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.

ngiemboon: á nue mámbàŋa gẅie à tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́, à lɔg pá’ à la nnɛ́ ná nzwě we gẅie aa nyìŋ Kristo, ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé. Manzwě gẅie à tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́ lɔg pá’ à la nnɛ́ nà ndúm we gẅie aa nyìŋ Kristo, ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ gie á ké tè pú’u wɔ́, mbà pènkʉ́ pɔ́b é té gẅiin légwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé wɔ́. Pɔ́ piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your children unclean; but now are they holy.

ngiemboon: Tá á lɔɔn ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́ gyǎ ngie à ge fag nnɛ́, mé nyé yé á fag. Á gʉa ná yɛ̌ ntí, atsɔ́ mmó té kú’te nyìŋ Kristo we mbàŋa kà we manzwě wɔ́. E Ssé la zɔɔn ńtóŋo wégè pɔ́ pá’ pege ge ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè.
en: But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart. A brother or a sister is not under bondage in suchcases: but God hath called us to peace.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ gwɔ́, gu gẅie ɔ́ɔ manzwě, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ gǎ tà ńkwa’ ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge lá’ gÿo tà ndúm gù tsẅɛ́? Kà gu gẅie ɔ́ɔ mámbàŋa, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ gǎ tá ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge lá’ gÿo tà nzwě gù tsẅɛ́?
en: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt savethyhusband? or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt savethywife?

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná mɔɔn menò ntsèm, mbà á poŋ ngie àwɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà jʉ’ gie e Ssé la záb ngie à gwɔ́ wó, ńnéŋe nà jʉ’ gie e Ssé ka gwaa tóŋo yé á ńnéŋe wó. Áa mmó gie mèŋ n ne ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm ngie mé gÿo.
en: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk. And so ordain I in all churches.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé ka gwɔ tóŋo nyìŋ, mbà mé la pú’u yé, pá’ mé pú’u pà Yuda, tà ngàŋ fa’a lélʉ’ ngie à tè nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gie à ka gwɔ tóŋo nyìŋ, mbà mé laa ngàŋ pú’u, tà á gɔɔn ngie à ge gÿo cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ Yuda.
en: Is any man called being circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised. Is any called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised.

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ gie mé la pú’u nyìŋ kà mé la tè yé pú’ wɔ́ tè tsɔ́ nò mvfò Ssé wɔ́. Leku’té mbʉ̌ Ssé zɔɔ nò.
en: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la gwaa tóŋo nyìŋ, á ńnéŋe ná yɛ̌ jʉ’ wɔ́, angàŋ ké ńnéŋe pɔ́ jʉ’ó,
en: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie Ssé la gwaa tóŋo gú ɔ̀ gwɔ́ nkwɔɔn, tè pú’ mbùm jù ńtí pú’u. Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ eshÿó kẅɛ tà ɔ̀ cʉ́’ ndù nnɛ́, ɔ̀ zẅɛ́’.
en: Art thou calledbeinga servant? care not for it: but if thou mayest be made free, useitrather.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gwaa tóŋo yé, á gwɔ́ nkwɔɔn, à kẅɛ̌ ndá nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ, ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á giŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná nyìŋ gẅie mé ka gwaa tóŋo yé á gwɔ́ ndù nnɛ́, angàŋ kéen ńcʉ́’ nkwɔɔn Kristo, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ yé nyìŋ Kristo
en: For he that is called in the Lord,beinga servant, is the Lord's freeman: likewise also he that is called,beingfree, is Christ's servant.

ngiemboon: Kristo la cú’u gẅi ndá nkwɔɔn lê ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mmó. Pú’u la tà pi cʉ́’ menkwɔɔn pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé, ńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’ gie e Ssé ka gwaa tóŋo yé á ne ńnéŋe jʉ’ó.
en: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kaa zɔ́’ɔ, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka tè tsẅii nò gie mèŋ n ge gɔɔn né pɔ́b wɔ́. Tá’, mèŋ n ge gɔɔn pá’ mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́ɔn nà nò yɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ pá’ n gee nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, ńdɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á gɔɔn nò mé jú’.
en: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

ngiemboon: Pá’ yɔɔn kème njÿó ne ńtʉʉ nzẅìŋ wɔɔn lɔɔn, n kwǎŋ yɔ́ɔn ngie áa mbòŋ mbwo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ léńnéŋe té zɔ́’. Oon áa mbòŋ mbwo wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ léńnéŋe pɔ́ pá’ à gwɔ̌.
en: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress,I say, thatit isgood for a man so to be.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pi manzwé kéen ńzɔ́’, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn léfa’a lékẅɛɛ ná yé, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ kaa zɔ́’ɔ, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn léfa’a manzwě.
en: Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. Art thou loosed from a wife? seek not a wife.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńzɔ́’, mbà ɔ̀ kaa tsɔ́ nò fʉa. Mûɔ manzwě lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńzɔ́’, mbà à kaa tsɔ́ nò fʉa. Tá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zɔ̌’ ge gÿo gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm ne gyá pɔ́ ngɔ́’. Mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie tà pi kú yɛ̌ ngɔ́’.
en: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned. Nevertheless such shall have trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ammó gie mèŋ fa’a légɔɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: Mefʉ̀’ njÿó té gíŋe ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zɔ̌’ ńnéŋe pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ kaa zɔ́’ɔ la.
en: But this I say, brethren, the timeisshort: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had none;

ngiemboon: Tà fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn pʉ̀a pie é ne ńdʉa, e ńnéŋe pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ té ńne ḿmÿɔgɔ tsɔ́ nò wɔ́ la. Pʉ̀a pie é ne ńgẅe e ńnéŋe pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ té ne ńkága wɔ́ la. Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńjúu mmó ńnéŋe pá’ fʉ̀’ gie ammó gie pɔ́ júu á té yɔ́b wɔ́ la.
en: and they that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy, as though they possessed not;

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńjÿó fù’ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ńnéŋe pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ té ne ńjÿó wɔ́ la, á nue njÿó yɔɔn gie pege ne ńgyá lɔɔn tě ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: and they that use this world, as not abusingit: for the fashion of this world passeth away.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ne ńkwoŋo ngie tà tsɔ́ menò, gwaa ńgege gẅi ntʉ́m pi. Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa zɔ́’ɔ à kwǎŋte pɔ́ menò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. À fa’ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: But I would have you without carefulness. He that is unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ̌’, mbà à kwaŋte pɔ́ menò me ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. À fa’ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo nzwě we.
en: but he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may pleasehiswife.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, legyè sé té tyé ná tà’a nò wɔ́. Manzwě gẅie à kaa zɔ́’ɔ kà pɔ́ múɔ manzwě wɔ́, à ké ńkwaŋte yé pɔ́ menò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńzsé ngie à ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie à ne ńgÿo, mbɔɔ gie à ne ńkwaŋa kwaŋ. Tá ńgʉa ná manzwě gẅie à zɔ̌’, à kwaŋte pɔ́ menò me ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, à fà’ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo ndúm we.
en: There is differencealsobetween a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married careth for the things of the world, how she may pleaseherhusband.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò, pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅéte gẅí, mèŋ n tě ńdɔgɔ ńdʉ’ʉ pɔ́ lejÿɔ’ á mvfò pi wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi tyé ná kɔ́ nò wɔ́, ńgÿo pɔ́ gie á poŋ ngie mé gÿo, ńgíŋe ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi la nnɛ́ pɔ́ ndà’ ná fà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mûɔ mbàŋa gẅie à kaŋá múɔ manzwě, anò yé gwɔ́ twó yé tɛ’, tá á ne ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo pá’ á té ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́ ná ye, ńgyá ngie mé ge táŋte menò pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te, á gÿo pá’ à gyǎ pú’u. À tè pú’u, ńdɔgɔ fʉa pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Á poŋ ngie pɔ́ zɔ́’.
en: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower ofher age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ mûɔ mbàŋa ńnéŋe tà ńkwaŋte ntʉ́m ye ngie, à tè zɔ́’ wɔ́, é ké le gÿo mmó gie á té ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́ ná mùɔ manzwě wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńkwa’ ńkwaŋte pú’u, pɔ́ ntʉ́m ye, té nyìŋ ńtsóte yé, ḿbiŋ ńkú’te mbùm ye, mbà à gÿǒ mboŋó pá’ à kaa múɔ manzwě zɔ́’ɔ.
en: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ’ɔ́ múɔ manzwě we gẅie à kaa pǐ, à gÿǒ mboŋó. Tá nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ ngie à tè zɔ́’ wɔ́, à gÿǒ mboŋó tɛ’.
en: So then he that givethherin marriage doeth well; but he that givethhernot in marriage doeth better.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná manzwě gẅie à zɔ̌’, à ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ léla nnɛ́ nà ndúm we á nà fʉ̀’ gie ndúm we nyé wó. Andúm we ké ńkwé, á gẅiin lézɔ́’ɔ nyìŋ gẅie yé manzwě kwǒŋ. Anò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie wɛ̌ mámbàŋa gwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo.
en: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tá n kě ńkwaŋ yɔ́ɔn ngie à lɔɔn ńnéŋe té gíŋe nzɔ́’, mbà à ge jú’ mboŋó tɛ’. M biŋ ne ńkwaŋa ngie a Zẅìge Ssé áa ná mèŋ yɔ́ɔn.
en: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò pfwɔ́’ɔ mbabgie mé nǎ nà shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ee messé, mbà áa nénʉ́ ngie pi metsèm zɔ́gɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pi zɔ zsé nò mǒ. Tá’ yɛ̌ ntí zsé nò gÿo nyìŋ ŋá’te ŋa’té. Tá mmó gie á gÿo mé kẅi’i ńzáb pɔ́ ntʉ́m nà Ssé, aa nyìŋ lé ně ńkwoŋo fɛ́ we.
en: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie à ne ńzsé tsɔ́ mmó, mbà à nyě tè zsě pá’ á kɔ’ɔ́ ne ńzɛ́te ngie à zsé pú’u.
en: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo Ssé, mbà ngàŋ aa nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé ně ńdá’ ńzsé yé.
en: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa nà nò pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé nǎ nà shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé, mbà pege ne ńzsé ngie atsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gu’te ngie ée tsɔ́ ssé à té tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́. Pege ne ńzsé ngie e Ssé gwɔ̌ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́.
en: As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idolisnothing in the world, and thatthere isnone other God but one.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pá’ eshúm ée léfaŋ mbɔɔ ndùme ssé tsetsá’ etsɔ́ pʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie ée messé, ńdɔg pú’u, ńgÿo messé ńgyɔ́ɔn, mecʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgíŋe ńgyɔ́ɔn yɔ́b,
en: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, (as there be gods many, and lords many,)

ngiemboon: tá á ké ńgwɔ́ mbwo pege, tà’ Ssé wémɔ’ɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ Tá gẅie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ fóo pɔ́ mbwo yé. Pege piŋ ńgwɔ́ wó ńtí pɔ́ ye. Tà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ́ wó ńgwɔ́ Yěsô Kristo gẅie à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwaa gwɔ́ wó wɔ́ɔ yé zɔ̌ gÿo. Pege piŋ ńgwaa gwɔ́ wó ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ ye.
en: but to usthere is butone God, the Father, of whomareall things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whomareall things, and we by him.

ngiemboon: Tá mânyìŋ ntsèm tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege zɔ tè zsé ngie messé zɔɔn tè kwa’ ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Ntyě kaa sag pá’ tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a kɔ́ɔn ńgee jʉ’e shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée tsɔ́ messé wɔ́. Á cʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔɔn ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé nǎ nà shúm ŋwɛ́ pé’e, á gwɔ́ mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ ne ńzsé ngie mé nǎ mbwo kwà’ messé, mbùm yɔ́b cúa wɔ́b. Ntʉ́m wɔ́b gẅie é nyé ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́ jú’, mbà é kǎ ncÿǒ.
en: Howbeitthere isnot in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eatitas a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie ammó léjÿó té gÿo tá Ssé kẅi’i ńkwoŋo wégè wɔ́. Pege lɔɔn tè pfɛ́, mbà pege kaa tsɔ́ mmó pyé, ḿpfɛ́, mbà tsɔ́ mmó kaa ná pege kẅi’i.
en: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

ngiemboon: Tá, pi ké ḿbɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gí mmó gie pi ne ńzsé ngie pi ku’u légÿo, cʉ́’ʉ mmó gie pʉ̀a pie é nyé mbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́ ge kwɔɔnte mǒ é gwe ssé,
en: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of your's become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgyá gú gẅie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ gẅie à zsé nò, ɔ̀ ńnéŋe ssé, ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, nà tsɔ̌ jʉ’e messé ŋwɛ́, mbà wɛ̌ légwɔ́ tè tsóte nyìŋ gẅie à nyě ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́ lépfɛ́ɛ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé nǎ nà shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé wɔ́?
en: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, à cʉa nà mmó gie ɔ̀ ne ńzsé, nyìŋ gẅie à nyě ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́, à kúu pyé. Tá ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ wege gẅie Kristo la kwé nà twó yé.
en: and through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo nò tepòŋ ná yɔɔn ntí á nà mefɛ́ pi, á légÿo mmó gie á ge gege wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wɔ́b gẅie é nyé ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́, mbà pi gÿo nò tepòŋ pɔ́ ná Kristo.
en: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńjÿó mmó léjÿó, le gwɔ́ gẅie mèŋ n jÿǒ gÿo fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn gwe ssé, mbà á cʉ́’ gie mèŋ n ké ńgÿo fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn gwe pɔ́ ssé, n de lá’ ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́ mbab wɔ́.
en: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de gÿo mmó nà ntí gie mèŋ n zsé wɔ́ ka? N te ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô wɔ́ ka? Mèŋ n da tè gyá yɔ́ɔn Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô wɔ́ ka? Pi ka tè gwaa zsé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, éfóo pɔ́ nà fà’ gie mèŋ fa’a mbwo ye wáa?
en: Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔɔn ne ńdʉ’ʉ ngie n te ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô wɔ́, mbà á fó ńgʉa mbwo pi, mèŋ n gwɔ́ wɛ̌. Pá’ pi la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la, pi lɔg pú’u, ńgwɔ́ liŋé gie á la’te ngie n gee ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo.
en: If I be not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u nò gie n ge gɔɔn lélɔg ńkẅé twó yɔ́ɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ túu*lɔ̌’ nà yɔɔn ntí lélɔg fa’.
en: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,

ngiemboon: Peg tè gẅiin yég lékẅé mmó ḿpfɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńnú ńtí fà’a yég wɔ́ ka?
en: Have we not power to eat and to drink?

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná peg tè gẅiin yé légwɔ giŋ, pɔ́ tsɔ̌ fɛ́ wege nyìŋ Kristo we manzwě gwɔ́, á gwɔ́ nzwě we wɔ́ ka? Á té pá’ Kéfas, laa petsɔ́ megàŋ ntúm, mbɔɔ mefɛ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo wáa?
en: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, andasthe brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

ngiemboon: Kà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie peg Panebâse gílé peg yé zɔ gẅiin léfa’ tá ńjÿó?
en: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

ngiemboon: Pi lǎ jú’u nzɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ ndÿɔ́’ ncù, ésele ḿpfɛ́ɛ pɔ́ pɔ̀ɔn ye? Kà ńgyá nzɔ̌ nyìŋ pye tÿǒ nzěm, à tè jÿó ntɔ̌ɔn mǒ wɔ́? Kà ńgyá nzɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ mpfèle mefòŋ, à tè ńnéŋe ńkyéen mbʉ́ ńnúu wɔ́?
en: Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges? who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ pi gɔɔn ngie mèŋ m bǐ fʉ̀’ pɔ́ nà menò mie é ne ńcʉate pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.*Lepʉ̌ Mǒse té gíŋe ńgɔɔn yé pɔ́ pú’u wɔ́ ka?
en: Say I these things as a man? or saith not the law the same also?

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ngie: «Tè kwɛ́ ncwò fòŋ gie ɔ̀ ne ńdɔgɔ yé ḿbú’u ngesáŋ ntsíŋ». Tà Ssé lɔgɔ pú’u, ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mezìŋe fòŋ?
en: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take care for oxen?

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ wégè wáa? N kwǎŋ ngie à gɔɔn ntí pɔ́ wégè. Mé la ŋwe’e yɔɔn nò, ńtí pɔ́ wégè, á zɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te ngie njʉ̀’ ngwóŋ, pɔ́ ndàg shúm, pɔ́ ne ńzẅí’te yɔ́b mmó nà shúm sie é ge kẅɛɛ nká’.
en: Or saith heitaltogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt,thisis written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.

ngiemboon: Peg ka pye mbyè mmó gie e fóo mbwo Ssé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Peg lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńgʉa nà shúm sí, ńgẅiin tsɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fóo nká’, ńdag shúm la, mbà peg lɔgɔ séen ńjÿó pi gí tà á cʉa cʉa lá?
en: If we have sown unto you spiritual things,is ita great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, peg ka ké tè kẅé. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà peg ne shÿɔgɔ ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ shÿɔg, ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo mmó gie á ge táte pʉ̀a lé jú’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo.
en: If others be partakers ofthispower over you,arenot we rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie jʉ’e Ssé zɔ̌ jÿɔ́g pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fa’a tsoló wɔ́ ka? MÀbiŋ tè ne ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nuŋe pwɔ́’ jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó jʉ’e Ssé, pɔ́ gẅiin yɔ́b mmó nà shúm pwɔ́’ sie mé lɔ̌g ńtóo mvfò Ssé wɔ́ ka?
en: Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things liveof the thingsof the temple? and they which wait at the altar are partakers with the altar?

ngiemboon: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la záb ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mboŋo, pɔ́ ge ne jÿó shúm sie é fóo ná fa’a létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie mèŋ n da gẅiin lézɛ́te shúm mbwo pi, tá n kě laa zɛ́te. Mèŋ n ké tě ńŋwe’e pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńzɛ́te ngie mé ná shúm né mèŋ wɔ́. À cʉ́’ gie n zẅíŋ nyìŋ gÿo mèŋ n nyé yɔɔn nò, gie mèŋ n dɔgɔ ńka’te, mèŋ n kwé.
en: But I have used none of these things: neither have I written these things, that it should be so done unto me: forit werebetter for me to die, than that any man should make my glorying void.

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo mèŋ, letsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô Kristo, á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó lɔg ńŋá’te wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie mèŋ n ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ légÿo. N dɔɔn ńdʉ’ʉ létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô Kristo, mbà mèŋ n kǎ ndòon.
en: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

ngiemboon: Á laa pé’è mèŋ n zɔ̌ kaŋa yɔɔn fà’, mbà mèŋ n gẅiin lézẅí’te ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’. Tá’, pá’ áa fà’ gie mèŋ n ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ léfa’ la, áa mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pì’ gie n kě ńgẅiin pɔ́ lékaa.
en: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensationof the gospelis committed unto me.

ngiemboon: Ewɔ̀ɔn ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ ée pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kɔ́? À gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo pɔ́ tè kẅě mmó, pɔ́ tè zɛté shúm sie mèŋ n gẅiin lélɔg pá’ mèŋ n gee nyìŋ gẅie à tsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ńzɛ́te.
en: What is my reward then?Verilythat, when I preach the gospel, I may make the gospel of Christ without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.

ngiemboon: Pá’ mèŋ n ně ńgɔɔn la, mèŋ n gẅiin légÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ nà ntí gie mèŋ n zsé, tá’ mèŋ n déen ńzẅíŋ nkwɔɔn pʉ̀a metsèm, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, gÿo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: For though I be free from allmen, yet have I made myself servant unto all, that I might gain the more.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ne fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda, mèŋ n ńnéŋe pá’ nyìŋ Yuda la, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, é gÿo pà Yuda cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo. Ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie n gee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie*lepʉ̌ Mǒse ne sá’a wɔ́b, mèŋ n ńnéŋe pá’ nyìŋ gẅie*lepʉ̌ ne sá’a yé la, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, é gÿo pʉ̀a pie*lepʉ̌ ne sá’a wɔ́b é cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo, ńnéŋe pú’u, tá*lepʉ̌ Mǒse ké tè ne sá’a wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And unto the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews; to them that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain them that are under the law;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ne fa’a tsɛtsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie*lepʉ̌ Mǒse té ne sá’a wɔ́b gwɔ́, mèŋ n ńnéŋe pá’ nyìŋ gẅie*lepʉ̌ té ne sá’a yé wɔ́ la, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, é gÿo pʉ̀a pie*lepʉ̌ té ne sá’a wɔ́b gwɔ́, e cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Kristo, ńnéŋe pú’u, á té ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie*lepʉ̌ Ssé té ne sá’a wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, é ne sá’a wɔ̀ɔn sá’, á nue mèŋ n neŋé pɔ́ ná pá’*lepʉ̌ Kristo ne ńzɛ́te.
en: to them that are without law, as without law, (being not without law to God, but under the law to Christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ne fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nyé ḿbÿɛ́ɛ pÿɛ̌ nà lezǎb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, mèŋ n ńnéŋe pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à nyě ḿbÿɛ́ɛ yé pÿɛ̌ la, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, é gÿo pɔ́ cʉ́’ kwà’ pʉ̀a Kristo. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, n cʉ́’ pá’ yé, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg pú’u, é gÿo ná ntí gie ńgwɔ́ á tsẅɛ́.
en: To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to allmen, that I might by all means save some.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gÿo wɛ̌ ngwòŋo nò ntsèm pɔ́ pá’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ge sa jʉ’, mbɔɔ pá’ mèŋ n ne ńzẅí’te sɔ́ɔn shúm mbòŋo sie é fóo ná nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: And this I do for the gospel's sake, that I might be partaker thereof withyou.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé gí ngie á gʉa jʉ’ gie mé kÿo ndʉ̌ wó, pàkÿo ndʉ̌ kÿo pɔ́ metsèm, tá tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ ná pɔ́b zɔ̌ kaa mmó gie mé ně ńzáb. Wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pi gwɔ́ à kÿo nà ntí gie à ge kaa mmó gie mé ně ńzáb.
en: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize? So run, that ye may obtain.

ngiemboon: Pàgÿo metɔ́ɔntè mie nò metʉ̀ áa mǒ, pɔ́ lʉ’ shúm tɛ’, ńzsé pá’ pɔ́ ge gẅiin mbùm yɔb pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ pá’ mé ge lá’ tɔ’*ngǔ’yɔb. Yɛ̌ ngǔ’ gwɔ́ gie e ge lá’ cʉŋte. Tá ńgʉa ná pege, pege gwaa gÿo pú’u, ńtsɔ́ɔn ngǔ’ gie e těen ńdá’a ńcʉŋte wɔ́.
en: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things. Now theydo itto obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿó mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ńně ńkÿo ndʉ̌. Tá ne ńkÿo nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn tyé nà mmó gie n dʉŋe yɛ̌. Mèŋ n gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à ne tsẅiŋe nkwɛ̀ la, tá ńké tè ne ḿma’a pwó ńcúa jʉ’ʉ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńgẅiin mbùm yɔɔn pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, ńkú’te tà ńzsé mmó gie mèŋ n gÿo yɛ̌, ḿbɔgɔ létsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo mbwo pʉ̀a, mé piŋ ńgÿo ḿbe’e wɔ̀ɔn ńnáa nzèm.
en: but I keep under my body, and bringitinto subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n te ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi lege nò ná mmó gie á la gÿo metá pégè á fʉ̀’ gie pâ Mǒse la ne ńgiŋe wɔ́, pɔ́b métsèm la gyá melɔ́ɔn Ssé lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b. Pɔ́b métsèm la tɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa,
en: Moreover, brethren, I would not that ye should be ignorant, how that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

ngiemboon: ńdɔg pú’u, ńkẅé ntse, ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Mǒsê.
en: and were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b métsèm la púte ńjÿó tà’a twó mmó léjÿó gie á lɔ́ɔn fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: and did all eat the same spiritual meat;

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ la gíŋe ḿbúte ńnú ntse gẅie é gíŋe fóo mbwo Ssé. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńnúu wɛ̌ ntse é fóo ná máa tóon gẅie e Ssé la gÿo ngie à gwɔ́ nzèm pɔ́b. Wɛ̌ máa tóon laa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Kristo.
en: and did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was Christ.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tsɛ ńgyá mɔɔn menò tá’ lelÿò pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b tè gÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo pɔ́ gwete nkwòŋo tsẅɛ ńkwéte.
en: But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la gÿo pá’ɔɔn pá’ pege ge fó mǒ é laga twó yégè. Tá à cʉa pú’u, pege e le tsɔ́ɔn shúm tepòŋ pá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe tè ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gu’te shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé wɔ́. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b la gÿo. Á fó mǒ mé ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Alá’ sẅɛ̌’ ńnéŋe ssé, ḿpfɛ́ shúm, ńnúu mmó. Afʉ̀’ ku’ pɔ́ lu ssé ńgÿo megʉa».
en: Neither be ye idolaters, asweresome of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

ngiemboon: Pege pɔ́ɔn lékẅɛ́te wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ pega pɔ́ nuŋe nuŋe. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b la gÿo. Tà á tyé tà’a lyɛ̌’ nyìŋ mesoŋ ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b tá nê móm mbʉ́a gwete tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńkwéte.
en: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

ngiemboon: Pege pɔ́ɔn létsiŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsiŋé. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b la gÿo tá menú tsɔ́gte wɔ́b pɔ́ kwéte.
en: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅɛ́te ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b la gÿo. Á cʉa pú’u,*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie aa ńzẅéte pʉ̀a tó ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la gÿo wɔ́b pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ fʉ̀’ʉ nò. Mé la piŋ ńŋwe’e pá’ pege pie pege cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ʉ nzsòté lɔɔn ge fó mǒ zsé nò.
en: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

ngiemboon: Pege fǒ ná yɔɔn nò ńjú’ ngie lenyě ńgee ge ńzɔb, à tè poŋ
en: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

ngiemboon: Menkwà’te mie é ka kúu gẅí, ée mie é kúu nyìŋ mesoŋ. E Ssé gẅie à tè gɔɔn nò ḿbiŋ ńkúbe wɔ́, à tè zẅíŋ ngie nkwà’te kúu gẅi tà ńgá’ metʉ̀ mí wɔ́. Nkwà’te ge gwɔ́ tà tó, à náa gẅi metʉ̀ lélɔg shÿɔg ḿbiŋ ńnáa gẅi shÿó lélɔg fó tsoló ńkẅɛ.
en: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but Godisfaithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bearit.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà menò mɔɔn ntsèm, mbà meshǔ pɔ́ɔn pentʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, tà pi gẅiin tsɔ́ nò ná legu’te shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé.
en: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn nò pá’ɔɔn ná ntí gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sáŋa nò. Kwà’ pi líe gí tá ńgyá kà nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn áa nénʉ́ wɔ́?
en: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

ngiemboon: Pege ne ńnúu ntú’ melù’ gie pege nǎ ndǎg mbwo Ssé mǒ, pege tě ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńtemte ná metse Kristo wáa? Mbelég gie pege pwɔ́’te ńgaba, e tě ńtemte wégè ná mbab nnɛ́ Kristo wáa?
