en: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?

ngiemboon: Pá’ tà’ mbelég wémɔ’ɔ́ zɔɔ ssé la, pege metsèm púte ḿpfɛ́ɛ wɛ̌ tà’ mbelég á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie pege puté ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbùm nnɛ́ yémɔ’ɔ́.
en: For webeingmany are one bread,andone body: for we are all partakers of that one bread.

ngiemboon: Pi líe pà Israel tá ńgyá, áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ pfɛ́ɛ yɔ́b mbab ná shúm pwɔ́’ sie mé lɔ̌g ńtóo mvfò Ssé, pâ Ssé gẅie jʉ’e pwɔ́’ áa yé lɔgɔ pú’u, ńtemte ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ.
en: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn n gɔɔn ngie kɔ́ nà mbab gie mé náa nà shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé? Mbab ŋwɛ́ zɔɔn fa’a tsɔ́ fà’? Messé ŋwɛ́ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó?
en: What say I then? that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ! É té wó wɔ́. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pʉ̀a pie é té Ssé zsé gwá’a pwɔ́’ pɔ́ mbwo*messé tepòŋ. Pɔ́ téen ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ mbwo Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ n te ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi lâ*messé tepòŋ temte wɔ́.
en: ButI say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have fellowship with devils.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pi é le gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi núu ntú’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ núu ye*messé tepòŋ wɔ́. Ngwɔ́ pi é le gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi jÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jÿó shúm léjÿó*messé tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot be partakers of the Lord's table, and of the table of devils.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pege tě ńdɔgɔ fa’a ngie lóŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyáŋ ńtí wégè wɔ́? Tsye pege tʉ ńcʉa yé ka?
en: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ té pɔ́g*lepʉ̌. Áa nò tá’, eshúm ntsèm té kẅéte. Áa nò ngie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ té pɔ́g*lepʉ̌, tá’ shúm ntsèm sie mé gÿo é té kẅéte pʉ̀a lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ fà’ pɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte pɔ́ twó mbùm yé. Nyìŋ fa’a mmó gie á ge kẅéte fɛ́ we.
en: Let no man seek his own, but every man another'swealth.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò mbab, mbà pi tóo metʉ̌a ńgyá mbab pi jú, ńkúu mbʉ̀a ḿpfɛ́ té gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá, té zɛ́te tsɔ́ nò.
en: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles,thateat, asking no question for conscience sake:

ngiemboon: «Ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: Njÿó tà mbɔɔ shúm tsèm sie ée tsoló zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a».
en: for the earthisthe Lord's, and the fulness thereof.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́ lɔɔn ńtóŋo gẅi ndá ye ngie pia pɔ̌ jÿó mmó, pi zẅíŋ, pi tóo wó mé náa kɔ́ né pi wɔ́, pi jÿó té gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá, té zɛ́te tsɔ́ nò.
en: If any of them that believe not bid youto a feast, and ye be disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ ké ńgɔɔn ngie mbab yɔɔn, ee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé nǎ nà shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé, pi lêen ńké ńdʉ’ʉ lépfɛ́, ńdʉ’ʉ ńtí nyìŋ gẅie à shwoŋó gẅi jʉ’ gie e fóo lê wó. Mbɔɔ légwɔ́ gie ntʉ́m té jú’ kékáŋ tsoló wɔ́.
en: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earthisthe Lord's, and the fulness thereof:

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ zɛ́te ngie mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ gÿo mmó pɔ́ nà gù lekwòŋ, ntʉ́m tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ piŋ ńŋaga yɛ̌ mmó?
en: conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of anotherman'sconscience?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔɔn ńgwaa jÿó mmó léjÿó, ńzɔɔn ḿvɔg ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, mbà mélà’a kɔ́ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ ge tém shʉ́ ná mèŋ tí yɛ̌ mmó tá mbà mèŋ n gwaa jÿó, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé?
en: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?

ngiemboon: N ge gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn ngie, pi lɔɔn ne ńjÿó pɔ́ mmó, kà ne ńnúu pɔ́ mmó wɔ́, kà ne ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi gÿo sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm pɔ́ nà ntí gie mé ge gu’te Ssé.
en: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gÿo mmó gie nyìŋ Yuda kà nyìŋ Gelekia wɔ́, kà nyìŋ cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́, ge kwɔɔnte mǒ gwe ssé.
en: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:

ngiemboon: Áa pá’ mèŋ n ne ńgÿo yɔ́ɔn. Mèŋ n ne fa’a shÿó légwɔ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, á gwɔ́ gie á ge poŋo mânyìŋ ntsèm. Mèŋ n te fá’ pɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Mèŋ fá’ pɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńzsé ngie e Ssé ge gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: even as I please allmenin allthings, not seeking mine own profit, but theprofitof many, that they may be saved.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi píi fʉ̀’ ná mèŋ, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mèŋ m bíi fʉ̀’ ná Kristo.
en: Be ye followers of me, even as I alsoamof Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n nǎ ngɔ́ɔnte gi pá’ pi tyé nà yɛ̌ nò wɔ́, ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn kimté. Mbɔɔ pá’ pi ne ńcwoŋo ńkú’te mà gẅie n da zí’i gẅí.
en: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I deliveredthemto you.

ngiemboon: Áa mbòŋ tá’, ammó ké nyé wó gie n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé mboŋó. Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin nyìŋ mbàŋa ntsèm aa Kristo, nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ ńgẅiin manzwě aa mámbàŋa, nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin Kristo aa Ssé.
en: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the womanisthe man; and the head of ChristisGod.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa lɔɔn ńgwaa sẅíŋte Ssé, kà ńgwaa tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé wɔ́, ńdɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé, mbà à lɔgɔ ńcʉŋe nzẅìŋ Kristo gẅie à gẅiin yé.
en: Every man praying or prophesying, havinghishead covered, dishonoureth his head.

ngiemboon: Tá manzwě gẅie à gwaa sẅíŋte Ssé, kà ńgwaa tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé wɔ́, à tè lɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, à lɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉŋe nzẅìŋ ndǔm we gẅie à gẅiin yé, à tyé fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ manzwě gẅie mé zẅagá twó yé la.
en: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth withherhead uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

ngiemboon: Manzwě gẅie à kaa lɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, à zẅag. Tá’ pà’ áa mbwó manzwě ńgwɔ́ nò shʉ́ pá’ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ à twó yé gwɔ́ ye ńzẅag kà ye nkwǒon wɔ́ la, à pwoon twó yé.
en: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mámbàŋa, à tè gẅiin légwɔ tsyɛ’te Ssé, ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, mélà’mie à sẅé Ssé. Mé líe yé ńgyá legú’ Ssé. Tá ńgʉa ná manzwě, mbà mé líe yé ńgyá pɔ́ legú’ mámbàŋa,
en: For a man indeed ought not to coverhishead, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé la fó pɔ́ ná mámbàŋa ḿbwóon manzwě. À la tè fó pɔ́ ná manzwě ḿbwóon mámbàŋa wɔ́.
en: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la piŋ tè pwóon mámbàŋa ńtí manzwě wɔ́. À la pwóon pɔ́ manzwě ńtí mámbàŋa.
en: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿó manzwě gẅiin lépwoon twó yé, ńdɔg ńnyɛ ngie à ná nnɛ́ ssé á mvfò ndúm we. Pú’u, ńtí*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé.
en: For this cause ought the woman to have power onherhead because of the angels.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgwɔ́ pú’u tá’, ńgʉa ná pá’ pege la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ manzwě le gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ mámbàŋa ée té nò wɔ́. Mámbàŋa ké le gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ manzwě ée té nò wɔ́.
en: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pá’ e Ssé la fó pɔ́ ná nyìŋ mbàŋa ḿbwóon manzwě, manzwě zɔ kě ńzyé mámbàŋa. Ngwòŋo nò ntsèm piŋe fóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé.
en: For as the womanisof the man, even soisthe man also by the woman; but all things of God.

ngiemboon: Pi sáŋ gí tá ńjú’. Tà áa pé’e ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ ngie manzwě sẅíŋte Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo té pwoon twó yé?
en: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

ngiemboon: Mé ée nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ ńzsé ngie áa nò shʉ́ mbwo mámbàŋa létsẅɛ́’ɛ twó tà á sag sag.
en: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

ngiemboon: Tá letsẅɛ’ɛ́ twó tà á sag sag ké ńgwɔ́ mbwo manzwě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò mekù’, á nue Ssé la gÿo menòŋo twó manzwě sag sag, ńgwɔ́ pá’ mmó gie á pwoon twó yé la.
en: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: forherhair is given her for a covering.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńgyá ngie à ge zoŋo nò náa ná yɔɔn nò, mbà peg tè gẅiin mà we ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́. Mecú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé ké tè gẅiin mà we ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ nò gíŋe ńgwɔ́ ssé gie n ge gɔɔn nò mǒ fʉ̀’ɔɔn. Á gwɔ́ gie pi ne ńgÿo á téen ḿboŋo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́. Pi ne ńkúu mecú’tè mí, á cʉ́’ʉ légwɔ́ gie nò mbòŋo á kɔ’ɔ́ kẅɛɛ wó, à ye tepòŋ zɔ̌ kẅɛɛ.
en: Now in this that I declareunto youI praiseyounot, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà menò mie ée ssé, andùŋ mvfò nò aa pá’ n ka jǔ’ ngie pi ńnéŋe ssé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè gí, éfagte menùɔ menùɔ, ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gyá ngie áa gǎ wɔ́, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò.
en: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie pi gwɔ́ tà fagte menùɔ menùɔ, mé fó mǒ ńgyá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té kwoŋo fàgte wɔ́.
en: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ ńgyá ngie pi kúu tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, ńgwɔ jÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkwaŋá gẅi té tyé ná yé wɔ́.
en: When ye come together therefore into one place,thisis not to eat the Lord's supper.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, á nue afʉ̀’ʉ léjÿó gwɔ́ tà ńku’, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ sẅɛte ńnéŋe ssé, ńjÿó sé shúm sie à ně ńdɔg ńtó. Tà mé gyá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ ńnéŋe nzyè, mbà petsɔ́ pʉ̀a é nǔ tà ḿbʉ́a
en: For in eating every one taketh beforeotherhis own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

ngiemboon: Pi te gẅiin mendá mí léńnéŋe wó, ḿpfɛ̂ mmó, ḿbiŋ ńnú wɔ́ ka? Kà pi kwoŋo pɔ́ lélɔg shʉ́ ńkú pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té mmó léjÿó gẅiin, ńdɔgɔ pú’u ńgwága cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo? Pi gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie kɔ́? Ngie n ná ngɔ́ɔnte gi la? Ngǎŋ! Kwà’ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n de ngɔ́ɔnte gi ná.
en: What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praiseyounot.

ngiemboon: N da ké ńzí’i gẅi mmó gie mèŋ n zɔ la jú’u mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á gwɔ́ ngie: Á laa letsẅɛ́’ gẅie mé la sẅiŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, á pí mbelég,
en: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus thesamenight in which he was betrayed took bread:

ngiemboon: ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Yɔɔn ee mbùm nnɛ́ yɔɔn mie mé náa ná twó sí. Pi cʉ́’ ńne ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn.
en: and when he had given thanks, he brakeit, and said,Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jÿó mmó tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, á gíŋe ńkaa ntú’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Ntú’ yɔɔn ee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́*kʉ̀a sẅé gie e Ssé lɔgɔ metse mɔ́ɔn ńgwaa. Pi cʉ́’ ńne ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn fʉ̀’ ntsèm gie pi ge gÿo ne núu.
en: After the same manner alsohe tookthe cup, when he had supped, saying,This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drinkit, in remembrance of me.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm gie pi pfɛ̌ yɔɔn mbelég, ńgíŋe ńnú yɔɔn ntú’, pi lɔgɔ pú’u ésá’a ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kwé, é ké lá’a sá’a pɔ́ pú’u, tà lá’ kú lyɛ̌’ gie à ge lá’ gíŋe tó.
en: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord's death till he come.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mé gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ mbelég Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kà ńnú pɔ́ ntú’ ye nê ngwág wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ fʉ̌a nò ná mbùm nnɛ́, mbɔɔ nà metse Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drinkthiscup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsa’ mbùm ye. Tá ńdeen ńké ḿpfɛ́ yɔɔn mbelég ḿbiŋ ńnú yɔɔn ntú’,
en: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat ofthatbread, and drink ofthatcup.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ mbelég, ńnú tú’, té ne ńkímte mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ lɔgɔ ńtóŋte ntsaŋ ńnéŋe ná ye.
en: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿó tá pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ mé guɔ. Petsɔ́ gwɔ́ menkǒon, mbà petsɔ̌ léen ńkwéte.
en: For this cause manyareweak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

ngiemboon: Pege laa pé’è ḿvɔg ńtsa’ mbùm yege, mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pege lÿɔ́’te tà pege é le gwe nà ntsaŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

ngiemboon: Tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à ŋaga wégè, ńdɔgɔ ńtÿɔ́gte wégè, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé lá’ ńteme wég laa pʉ̀a njÿó ńŋag.
en: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie pi cu’té léjÿó shúm, pi pyɛ́b petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

ngiemboon: Nzyè lɔɔn ne ńgyáŋa nyìŋ, á gwɔ́ fó mbʉ̀a yé, ḿvɔg ńjÿó mmó, légwɔ́ gie pi tè gʉa jʉ’ gie pi cú’te wó, étóŋte pɔ́ ntsaŋ gie Ssé ge ŋaga gẅi ŋag wɔ́. Á gʉa ná metsɔ́ menò, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo tó tá nyɛte.
en: And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á gʉa ná pá’ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a á cÿó geme wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, ńnáa yé fù’, mbà mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé nò nénʉ́ nà fù’ ŋwɛ́.
en: Now concerning spiritualgifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé ngie, á laa fʉ̀’ gie pi la nyé tè zǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo, atsɔ́ mmó ne ńtsó gẅi pi gu’te messé, tà mbɔɔ pá’ ée shúm sie é lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é le nò gɔɔn.
en: Ye know that ye were Gentiles, carried away unto these dumb idols, even as ye were led.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé ngie: A Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńtsóte nyìŋ légɔɔn nò, mbà ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ á le néŋ ndòon twó Yěsô wɔ́. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔɔn ḿbiŋ tè ne ńtsóte nyìŋ légɔɔn nò wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ á le gɔɔn ngie Yěsô aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: andthatno man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Afù’ gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔg ńcÿó geme nyìŋ, áa mentí mentí, tá Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie á cÿó gem ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́.
en: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

ngiemboon: Mefà’ mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a náa mbwo pʉ̀a, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mentí mentí. Tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à náa ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́.
en: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

ngiemboon: Pàmánzsè lélɔg fa’ mefà’, ée mentí mentí. Tá’ tà’ Ssé wémɔ’ɔ́ zɔ náa metʉ̀ mbwo wɛ̌ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which worketh all in all.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔgɔ fù’ ńcÿó geme wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, ńdɔg pú’u, ńnyɛ ngie áa ná ngàŋ. Yɛ̌ fù’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅéte pʉ̀a métsèm.
en: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá à Zẅìge cÿó geme wetsɔ́ nyìŋ, á gwɔ gẅiin shÿó lélɔgɔ zsě nò ḿbÿɛɛ nò, wetsɔ́ gẅiin shÿó lépÿɛ nò ná ntí gie mé ge zsé nò nénʉ́, tà’a zẅìge zɔ ké ńgÿo.
en: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ zɔ̌ gíŋe ńgÿo wetsɔ́ nyìŋ gwɔ záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé tɛ’, wetsɔ̌ gẅiin légÿo megùɔ zeŋe.
en: to another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

ngiemboon: Á tóo nà tsɔ́ nyìŋ yé fù’ gie à lɔg ńcÿó gem ngàŋ á gwɔ́ ngàŋ légÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ńtóo nà wetsɔ̌ ńcÿó gem yé á gwɔ́ létsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, ńtóo nà wetsɔ̌ ńcÿó geme yé á zsé mmó gie á fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbɔɔ gie á fóo mbwo*messé tepòŋ, ńgʉa ná wetsɔ̌ ńcÿó gem yé á shwóŋe meshwóŋè mie à laa zí’i, ńgʉa ná wetsɔ̌ ńcÿó gem yé á zsé shÿó lélɔg ńkyagte mɛ̌ meshwóŋè.
en: to another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to anotherdiverskinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:

ngiemboon: Tà’ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌, zɔ̌ gÿo mɛ̌ menò, ńne ńcÿó geme wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ yé Zẅìge á kwǒŋ.
en: but all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mbùm nnɛ́ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ la, tà mbɔɔ pá’ e gẅiin mekèm mbùm tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn la, mekèm mbùm tsɛ ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’ tá’, ńké ńcú’te ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbùm nnɛ́ la, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná Kristo.
en: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so alsoisChrist.

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé la lɔgɔ tà’ Zẅìge wémɔ’ɔ́ ḿbú ńtemtewégè metsèm légwɔ́ gie pege ge lɔg pú’u, é gwɔ́ tà’ mbùm nnɛ́, epʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pà Yuda, kà pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn kà púɔ lá’ gwɔ́, mbà Ssé la pú ńnéŋetà’ Zẅìge wémɔ’ɔ́ á ntʉ́m pege pɔ́ metsèm.
en: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whetherwe beJews or Gentiles, whetherwe bebond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie mbùm nnɛ́ tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a kèm wɔ́, e gẅiin mekèm nnɛ́ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: For the body is not one member, but many.

ngiemboon: Akwò lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’è ńgɔɔn ngie pá’ yé tè pwó wɔ́ la, à tě ńdɔgɔ ńtswé’e ná mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́, mbà á té gɔɔn pú’u, é lɔg nyé té gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́.
en: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

ngiemboon: Letuŋó lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’è ńgɔɔn ngie pá’ yé tè lejÿɔ́g wɔ́ la, é té ńdɔgɔ ńtswé’e ná mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́, mbà é té gɔɔn pú’u, é lɔg nyé té gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́.
en: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

ngiemboon: Mbùm nnɛ́ ntsèm laa pé’è ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ lejÿɔ́g, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńjú’u nò? É laa pé’è ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ letuŋó, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńjú’u gyě mmó?
en: If the whole bodywerean eye, wherewerethe hearing? If the wholewerehearing, wherewerethe smelling?

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé la kwoŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yɛ̌ kème nnɛ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ nà yé jʉ’.
en: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.

ngiemboon: Mbùm nnɛ́ laa pé’è ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a kèm wémɔ’ɔ́ gílé yé, mbà mé tóŋ lê mbùm nnɛ́?
en: And if they were all one member, wherewerethe body?

ngiemboon: Mekèm nnɛ́ tsɛ ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’ tá’ ńké ńcú’te ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbùm nnɛ́.
en: But noware theymany members, yet but one body.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lejÿɔ́g le gɔɔn lê pwó ngie ńgwɔ́ á le yé zẅɛ́’ wɔ́, à twó á ké le gɔɔn né mekwò ngie ńgwɔ́ á le mekwò zẅɛ́’ wɔ́.
en: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà mbɔɔ mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ mie mé kwaŋ ngie yɔ́b fà’ té gyɔ́ɔn, é kẅéte kẅetě.
en: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

ngiemboon: Mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ mie mé piŋ tè néŋ mekù’ mǒ mboŋó wɔ́, mé zɔ́bte mɛ̌ tɛ’. Metsɔ́ mie mé zɔɔn tè ńnéŋe ńkím mbɔɔ kǐm wɔ́, pege líe nò náa mǒ tɛ’,
en: and thosemembersof the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomelypartshave more abundant comeliness.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná mie mé zɔɔn ńnéŋe ńkíme nò náa mǒ, mé té líe nò ńnáa mǒ nzẅìŋ wó wɔ́. Tá’ e Ssé la cʉ́’ʉ lé nyɛte mbùm nnɛ́, ńná mekù’ ná mekèm nnɛ́ mie mé gwága nò ńnáa mǒ gwág,
en: For our comelypartshave no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to thatpartwhich lacked:

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie mbùm nnɛ́ tè ńnéŋe mesǎ mesǎ wɔ́, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, kème mbùm nnɛ́ gwɔ́ fa’a yé fà’, éfa’ pá’ metsɔ́ mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ ge zẅɛ́’.
en: that there should be no schism in the body; butthatthe members should have the same care one for another.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie tsɔ́ kème mbùm nnɛ́ lɔɔn ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, metsɔ́ mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ gíŋ ńgyá yɔ́b ngɔ́’ pɔ́ pá’ yɛ̌, ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ne ńnáa mekù’ tsɔ́ kème mbùm nnɛ́, metsɔ́ mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ gíŋ ńkág yɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ yɛ̌.
en: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà mbùm Kristo, mbà pi pɛ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pi, gwɔ́ tà’a kèm nà mbùm ŋwɛ́.
en: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉ́’ʉ létaŋte cú’tè yé, ḿvɔg ńzáb megàŋ ntúm, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńzáb pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pie é fóo mbwo yé, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńtÿɔ́g pà zí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé, mé fó ná pɔ́b ńgyá pʉ̀a pie à la cÿó gem yɔ́b, á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgyá pʉ̀a pie à la cÿó gem yɔ́b, á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo megùɔ zeŋe, mé fó ná pɔ́b ńgyá pʉ̀a pie ayɔ́b fù’ áa lékẅéte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ táŋte cú’tè, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie à la cÿó gem yɔ́b á gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zí’i.
en: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè é té megàŋ ntúm wɔ́, ńké tè pà Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pie é fóo mbwo Ssé wɔ́, ńké tè pàzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé wɔ́, e Ssé la tè cÿó gem pʉ̀a metsèm pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn wɔ́,
en: Areall apostles?areall prophets?areall teachers?areall workers of miracles?

ngiemboon: kà pɔ́ légÿo megùɔ zeŋe wɔ́, kà pɔ́ léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zí’i wɔ́, kà pɔ́ lékyagte mɛ̌ meshwóŋè wɔ́.
en: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie e Ssé lɔg shúm sie é kẅéte tɛ’ ńcÿó geme gí. Tá’, mèŋ n ge ké nyɛɛ gẅi mánzsè gẅie à cʉa petsɔ́ métsèm.
en: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńzsé léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mé shwóŋó tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm tà mbɔɔ mie*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé shwóŋó, tá ḿbiŋ tè kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà mèŋ m bege pɔ́ jʉ’ pá’ mmó tʉ̌ gie mé pǔ’, mbɔɔ pá’ kẅì’ fùɔ gẅie à zẅɛ zẅɛ.
en: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am becomeassounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé cÿó gem yɔ́ɔn mèŋ n tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo ye, ńzsé nò nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa lelyěen, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nò nà shúm ntsèm. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n záb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn nà Ssé, tà ńku’u légÿo mekwɛ́ sẅɛ́’te nnɛ́, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn tè kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n tè tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And though I havethe gift ofprophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gabte shúm sɔ́ɔn ntsèm ńnáa mbwo pʉ̀a pie nzyè ne ńgyáŋa wɔ́b, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zẅíŋ ngie mé túɔ wɔ̀ɔn, tá á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, n tè kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà á té kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And though I bestow all my goods to feedthe poor, and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, à gẅiin kwɔgɔ nnɛ́, à kẅete pʉ̀a, à tè gẅiin kègɔ́’ wɔ́, à tè nyɛ nnɛ́ wɔ́, à tè ŋá’te,
en: Charity suffereth long,andis kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

ngiemboon: à tè gÿo menò shʉ́ wɔ́, à tè kim, à tè lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́, à tè gẅiin nyìŋ lóŋ ye wɔ́,
en: doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

ngiemboon: à tè kága nà cÿɔ̌ nò wɔ́, à kǎg yé pɔ́ nà nò nénʉ́.
en: rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nyìŋ mésoŋ, nyìŋ fʉa pɔ́ yɛ̌ nò mbwo ye wɔ́, á lege lege, á gʉa nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ á záb ntʉ́m wé pɔ́ nà Ssé, ńnéŋe ně ńzẅí’te yé pɔ́ ngie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ge gÿo má’a twó pɔ́ mboŋó, à gyá ngɔ́’ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ ńkwé pɔ́ ntsème tsème.
en: beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

ngiemboon: Nkwòŋe gie nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅiin nzèm wetsɔ̌, e ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Tá á gʉa nà pá’ e Ssé cÿó geme pʉ̀a, pɔ́ tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo ye, wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ à mag, leshwoŋó meshwóŋè mie mé laa zí’i à mag yé, le zsé mmó gie áa lelyěen á le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́,
en: Charity never faileth: but whetherthere beprophecies, they shall fail; whetherthere betongues, they shall cease; whetherthere beknowledge, it shall vanish away.

ngiemboon: á nue pege fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńzsé pɔ́ tsɔ́ gwǒŋ, e Ssé tè nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm tá pege tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo ye wɔ́.
en: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

ngiemboon: À ge ké lá’ gwɔ́ tà nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm, múɔ mézsé nò we fʉ̀’ɔɔn à mag.
en: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie n da nyé mûɔ mémûɔ, mèŋ shwóŋó pá’ mûɔ mémûɔ, ńkwaŋa nò pá’ mûɔ mémûɔ, legyè sɔ́ɔn sáŋa nò pá’ se mûɔ mémûɔ. Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn n cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndÿò, mèŋ n tè gíŋe ně ńgÿo menò pá’ mûɔ mémûɔ wɔ́.
en: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pege ne ńgyá shúm é tele tele pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pege gyá tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe gya shÿó la. Á ge lá’a tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ pege kwà’ ńgyá, e gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ mvfò pege, áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn n tè zsé shúm ntsèm wɔ́, tá’ n ge lá’a tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ é zsé shúm nà nti gie e Ssé ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn pú’u.
en: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgyá ngie eshúm sie é ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó ée sétá: Wɔɔn aa lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, wɔɔn gwɔ́ léńnéŋe ńně ńzẅí’te mmó mbwo Ssé, ńgÿo lékwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ. Tá’, atwó ye lÿò nà shúm sɔɔn sétá à gwɔ́ pɔ́ lekwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of theseischarity.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá pi vɔg ńkag tʉ̀ ńgÿo tà’a mmó, à gwɔ́ lékwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, pi piŋ ńtsɔ́ɔn shúm ntí ntí sie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔg ńcÿó gem pʉ̀a, ńtʉʉ lelÿò ńtsɔ́ɔn létsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé,
en: Follow after charity, and desire spiritualgifts, but rather that ye may prophesy.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔg meshwóŋè mie mé té ne ńzsé wɔ́ ńgɔɔn nò, mbà à těen ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. À gɔɔn pɔ́ mbwo Ssé, á nue tsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ tè ne ńjú’u nò gie à gɔɔn wɔ́, angàŋ ne ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ńgɔɔn nò nà shúm sie ée lelyěen.
en: For he that speaketh in anunknowntongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandethhim; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à tsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, á gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńdɔg ńkẅéte wɔ́b pɔ́ kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńdɔg ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b mbɔɔ lélɔg ńnéŋ ntʉ́m wɔ́b.
en: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto mentoedification, and exhortation, and comfort.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ne shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mé té zsé, à fó pú’u, ńkẅéte pɔ́ twó mbùm yé lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé. Tá á gʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à tsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, à lɔg pú’u, ńkẅéte cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: He that speaketh in anunknowntongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá yɔ́ɔn ngie áa mbòŋ ngie pi metsèm shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pi laa zí’i, tá’ mèŋ n tʉ̌ lelÿò ńkwoŋ pɔ́ ngie pi tsẅi pɔ́ nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé. Letsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé aa mbòŋ ńcʉa léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mé té ně ńzsé wɔ́, tà ńdí ndà’ pá’ nyìŋ gwaa shwóŋó, wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ ssé ne ńkyagte shwóŋó cú’tè tá á lêen ńké ńkẅéte pʉ̀a lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: I would that ye all spake with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied: for greaterishe that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pege gɔɔn ngie ngwɔ́ n tó tà ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńcʉ́’ʉ légɔɔn nò né pi, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie pi tè ne ńzsé wɔ́, mbà á ge kẅéte gẅi lêkɔ́? Mèŋ lékẅéte gẅí, aa pi léfó nà mmó gie n gɔɔn ńzsé mmó gie e Ssé nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn á gwɔ́ lelyěen, mèŋ n gÿo pi zsé nò nénʉ́ nà tsɔ́ nò. Pi gíŋe ńzẅɛ́’ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńjú’ tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé. Mèŋ fó nà nò gie n gɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i gẅi tsɔ́ nò.
en: Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná màndèle pɔ́ kekÿɛ́, éshúm sie mé lɔgɔ ḿbú’u leluŋó. Á la gwé’e pé’e mengyè mie é fóo nà sɛ̌ shúm pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó, mbà ńgwɔ́ mé gwɔ́ zsé leluŋó sie mé lɔgɔ màndèle ḿbú’ ńgÿo lêkɔ́, ńgwɔ́ zsé se kekÿɛ́ ńgÿo lêkɔ́,
en: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie ngyè ntàŋ lɔɔn tè kẅɛ mboŋó wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ awɔ̌ nyɛte mbùm ye légʉa ḿma’ ncù?
en: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo pi ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, pi lɔɔn shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mé té ne ńjú’u wɔ́, mbà mé ge gǎ tá jú’u nò gie pi gɔɔn yɛ̌? Mbà pi zẅɛɛ zẅɛ pá’ fefà la.
en: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall speak into the air.

ngiemboon: Meshwóŋè ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, tá’ mé lɔgɔ yɛ̌ wɔ́ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò.
en: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of themiswithout signification.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńgɔɔn nò né mèŋ, mèŋ m biŋ tè ne ńzsé shwóŋè yé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n gee mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yé mvfò mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀.
en: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speakethshall bea barbarian unto me.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mbwo pi ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u. Pá’ pi ee ssé ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ ngie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔgɔ fù’ ntí ntí ńcÿó gem gí la. Pi gwɔ́ ne tsɔ́ɔn ngie à kẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńgÿo acú’tè ntsèm kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritualgifts, seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá nyìŋ gẅie à shwóŋó shwóŋè gie mé té ne ńzsé wɔ́, à gẅiin lésẅíŋte Ssé ngie à lɔgɔ lékyagte ńgíŋe ńcÿó gem yé,
en: Wherefore let him that speaketh in anunknowntongue pray that he may interpret.

ngiemboon: á nue n dɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie mé té ne ńzsé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ne ńdɔgɔ zẅìge yɔ́ɔn é sẅíŋte Ssé tá ńké tè ne ńjú’u nò gie mèŋ n ne ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: For if I pray in anunknowntongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.

ngiemboon: Tà áa pú’u, pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́? N gyǎ ngie n ge sẅíŋte Ssé nà ntí gie Zẅìge ne ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ sẅíŋte pú’u, tá’ é gíŋe sẅíŋte nà ntí gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ jú’u nò gie n gɔ̌ɔn. Mèŋ n ge zɔb ntse nà ntí gie Zẅìge ne ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n zɔb pú’u, tá’ é gíŋe zɔb á nà ntí gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ jú’u mmó gie azɔ́b gɔɔn yɛ̌,
en: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’e ésíe Ssé pɔ́ ndà’ nà ntí gie Zẅìge tsóte yé ngie à gÿo, mbà nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ssé à tè ne ńzsé nò nà yɛ̌ ntí wɔ́, à ge gwaa gɔɔn ngie*amen, é lɔg cʉ́me nò gie ngàŋ lɔgɔ síe Ssé é gÿo lêkɔ́ pá’ à tè ne ńjú’u nò gie à gɔɔn wɔ́?
en: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí lesíe Ssé tsɛ ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ tɛ’ tá’, e tè kẅéte wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne síe Ssé ná pá’ à la gÿo mèŋ shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mèŋ n da tè zí’i, tà ńcʉa gẅi métsèm.
en: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:

ngiemboon: Tá’ á gʉa fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gee tsɛ̀ɛ Cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, mèŋ n kwoŋo légɔɔn nò metwó méntʉ̀a á gwɔ́ gie mé ge jú’, ńzsé ngie n dɔgɔ ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ńcʉa légɔɔn nò metwó ntsá’ legém á gwɔ́ gie mé ké té jú’ wɔ́.
en: yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, thatby my voiceI might teach others also, than ten thousand words in anunknowntongue.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, tà pi cʉ́’ʉ lésáŋa nò, ésáŋ pá’ pènkʉ́ la. Pi gʉa nà nò tepòŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ. Tá’ ńgʉa nà lesaŋá nò, ńnyɛ ngie pi cÿɔgté.
en: Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, pɔ́ le kwoŋo lé jú’u nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: In the law it is written, Withmen ofother tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á lɔg pú’u, ńgwɔ́ ngie, e Ssé cʉa nà leshwoŋó meshwóŋè mie mé la tè zí’i, ńda’te tsɔ́ liŋé pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té záb ntʉ́m ná ye wɔ́, à ké tè la’te pú’u, mbwo pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m ná ye wɔ́. Letsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, à la’te tsɔ́ mmó pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, á ké tè mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to them that believe not: but prophesyingservethnot for them that believe not, but for them which believe.

ngiemboon: Pi pʉ̀a Kristo lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’e ńcú’te métsèm, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pi gwɔ́ zye léshwóŋó shwóŋè gie à laa zí’i, epʉ̀a pie é té zsé nò ná yɛ̌ ntí leshwóŋó wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, é zyɛ́’ ńkúu ndá, mbà pɔ́ té lɔgɔ gẅi é tóŋ mepʉ̀a wɔ́?
en: If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come inthose that areunlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie pi metsèm lɔɔn ne ńtsẅii pɔ́ nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, nyìŋ kúu ndá, kà gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́, kà nyìŋ gẅie à tè zsé nò ná yɛ̌ ntí wɔ́ wɔ́, mbà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńjú’u á ge gÿo à sáŋa nò, à shwóŋè ŋwɛ́ ntsèm à gɔɔn nò mbwo ye.
en: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, oroneunlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all:

ngiemboon: Eshúm sie é kɔ’ɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, á lelyěen, é kẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌, á kẅí’te ssé, ésɔb shÿó wé ssé, ńgwɔ ne gu’te Ssé, é ne gɔɔn ngie: Áa nénʉ́ e Ssé kwà’ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: and thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so falling down onhisface he will worship God, and report that God is in you of a truth.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pá’ áa pá’ɔɔn lɔɔn pege gÿo lêkɔ́? Pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńcú’te nyìŋ gẅi gẅiin zɔ́bɔ ntse á zɔb, nyìŋ gẅiin mmó gie à ge zí’i petsɔ́ pʉ̀a á zí’i, nyìŋ gẅiin mmó gie e Ssé ne ńnyɛɛ yé, á shwóŋ, nyìŋ gẅiin nò gie à ge gɔɔn lê shwóŋè gie mé té ne ńzsé wɔ́ á gɔɔn, nyìŋ gẅiin lékyagte á kyagte. Tá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm e kẅéte lélɔg ńgÿo à cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mé té zsé, pʉ̀a mépʉ́a shwóŋó. Mé gɔɔn ngie mé shwoŋó tɛ’ pʉ̀a métá shwóŋó. Tà’ nyìŋ shwóŋó tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, tá wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ shwóŋó yé, á zɔɔn ńgíŋ ńzɛ́te ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ kyagte.
en: If any man speak in anunknowntongue,let it beby two, or at the mostbythree, andthatby course; and let one interpret.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge kyagte meshwóŋè mie mé té ne ńzsé wɔ́ lɔɔn tè ssé wɔ́, mé pɔ́ɔn légɔɔn nò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè tà ngyè kwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ. Á gwɔ́ pú’u, nyìŋ gɔɔn nò pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m ye á mbwo Ssé.
en: But if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà letsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, epʉ̀a mépʉ́a kà métá wɔ́, pɔ́ gɔɔn nò, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a sáŋa nò ńnáa nà nò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn.
en: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the other judge.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńgɔɔn nò, e Ssé tsẅii nò mbwo wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie aa jʉ’ó, angàŋ zá’a légɔɔn nò.
en: Ifany thingbe revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi metsèm gẅiin shÿó létsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, nyìŋ tsẅi tà ńgwɔ tsẅé jʉ’ wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsẅi yé. Pú’u, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a metsèm ge zẅɛ́’ é zí’i nò Ssé, nkʉ̀ gẅie mé tsẅi é kẅiŋte wɔ́b.
en: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gÿo ngie à gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo ye, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b zsé yé fʉ̀’ gie à ge gɔɔn nò, ayé nò á le tsẅiŋe yé tsẅiŋ wɔ́,
en: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pànzwě, mbà pi gẅiin léké ńgÿo pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ áa tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pú’u la,
en: For God is notthe authorof confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.

ngiemboon: pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, pànzwě ná’a ńdáŋte. Pɔ́ té gẅiin lékẅé shwóŋè ńgɔɔn nò wɔ́. Pɔ́ gẅiin lépʉ́le ńnéŋe, ńzẅí’te nò gie mé ne ńgɔɔn, á gwɔ́ pá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê é gɔɔn pú’u.
en: Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; butthey are commandedto be under obedience, as also saith the law.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńjú’u tsɔ́ nò, tà ne fa’a lécwoŋo ńzsé, pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu mbʉ̀a tá ńzɛ́te melúm pɔ́b. Á té poŋ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo cú’te tà’a jʉ’, manzwě gɔɔn nò wɔ́.
en: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.

ngiemboon: Anò Ssé á la sá’ pɔ́ lá’ pi ka? Kà mé la gɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo pi?
en: What? came the word of God out from you? or came it unto you only?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńkwaŋa ngie à tsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, kà pɔ́ mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a wɔ́, mbà à gẅiin lézsé ngie yɔɔn nò gie mèŋ n ŋwe’e ńnáa mbwo pi lɔɔn ée*lepʉ̌ sie é fóo mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: If any man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿmoŋe, mbà e Ssé moŋé ye yé.
en: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pá’ aa pú’u la, pi tsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ légwɔ́ pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ pie é fóo mbwo Ssé ḿbiŋ ḿbɔ́ɔn létáte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zí’i.
en: Wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mé lɔg pɔ́ mbʉ́lè ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, tà nyìŋ néŋ ḿvéle nkàŋ.
en: Let all things be done decently and in order.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, tà mèŋ n kímte gẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie mèŋ n da tsẅi mbwo pi, é nkʉ̀ gẅie pi la jú’ ńzẅíŋ, pi ee ńké ńzába ntʉ́m mǒ záb tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne fóo nà nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ŋwɛ́ ńgÿo pi tsẅɛ́ɛ, pá’ pi lɔɔn ńké ne ńkú’te kwà’ mmó gie n da tsẅi mbwo pi kú’te. Tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: by which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.

ngiemboon: N da cʉ́me nò gie mé la cʉ́me pɔ́ mbwo mèŋ á mbwo pi, á gwɔ́ ná nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ńgwɔ́ kwòŋ. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ ngie: Kristo la kwé nà menò tepòŋ mégè, á gwɔ́ pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn.
en: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe yé tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, á gwaa gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sétá á zíme nà legwé, pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn.
en: and that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:

ngiemboon: À la nyɛ mbùm ye mbwo Piɛ, mbɔɔ mbwo yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a,
en: and that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo mefɛ́ mefɛ́ tà é tɔ́g pʉ̀a nkÿo tʉ̀a, pɔ́ pú ńgyá yé tà’ legʉa. Áa ná pɔ́b lelÿò nyé pɔ́ ntentʉ́, tá mbà etsɔ́ ntá’ kéen ńkwéte.
en: after that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.

ngiemboon: À la gÿo ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo Jâg ńgíŋe ńnyɛɛ mbwo megàŋ ntúm métsèm.
en: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.

ngiemboon: Ńcʉ́’ nzsòté, pá’ à nyɛ̌ mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, á nyɛ mbùm ye mbwo mèŋ. Mèŋ n gee pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ tsege múɔ,
en: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.

ngiemboon: á nue mèŋ n gee tsetsɛ̀ɛ megàŋ ntúm ńgwɔ́ we nkʉ́. N zɔɔn tè ku’u légwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ mé tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê ngàŋ ntúm wɔ́, á nue n dɔ̌ɔn ńnyɛɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé ngɔ́’.
en: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

ngiemboon: Á la ké ńcʉa pɔ́ ná pá’ e Ssé cÿǒ gem yɔ́ɔn, ńnéŋe ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn tá mèŋ n cʉ́’ʉ mmó gie mèŋ n gee yɛ̌ lɔɔn. Yɛ̌ ntí lecÿó gem yɔ́ɔn e la tè cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́, mèŋ fa’a fà’ ńcʉa petsɔ́ megàŋ ntúm, tá mèŋ n zɔ tě ńdɔgɔ mɔ́ɔn metʉ̀ fa’a wɔ́. E Ssé zɔ kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn ńnáa metʉ̀ n dɔgɔ fa’a.
en: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace whichwas bestowedupon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

ngiemboon: Pá’ áa pá’ɔɔn la, pɔ́ zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò ná nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, kà mèŋ wɔ́, mbà pi ju’ú mmó gie pega pɔ́ pǔ sá’a éshwóŋó pʉ̀a. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ gie pi la záb ntʉ́m mǒ.
en: Therefore whetherit wereI or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.

ngiemboon: Pega pɔ́ lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ne sá’a éshwóŋó pʉ̀a ngie Kristo la zíme nà legwé, mbà á ge gǎ etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gɔɔn ngie mé té kwé ńgíŋ ńzím wɔ́ wɔ́?
en: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé té kwé ńgíŋe ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà mbɔɔ Kristo la tè zím yé nà legwé wɔ́.
en: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie Kristo la tè zíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà nò gie peg sá’a éshwóŋó pʉ̀a á gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ nò, mbɔɔ gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ nò.
en: and if Christ be not risen, thenisour preaching vain, and your faithisalso vain.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé té kwé ńgíŋ ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà peg pie peg ne ńgɔɔn nò gie peg zsé nà Ssé, peg lɔgɔ ńgwɔ pɔ́ megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, á nue peg cÿɔ pɔ́ nò tá ńgɔɔn ngie peg ne ńzsé ngie e Ssé la zíme Kristo nà legwé á gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ńké tè pú’u wɔ́,
en: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.

ngiemboon: á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé té kwé ńgíŋ ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà mbɔɔ Kristo la tè zíme nà legwé wɔ́.
en: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ gie Kristo la tè zíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé à gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ nò, pi piŋ, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ menò tepòŋ mí.
en: and if Christ be not raised, your faithisvain; ye are yet in your sins.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie, epʉ̀a pie é la gwɔ kwé, letʉ́m sɔ́b zébe ná Kristo, pɔ́ léen ḿbyé.
en: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pege zẅí’te mmó gie á ge fóo mbwo Kristo, ńtí pɔ́ ndà’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie pege nyé ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ lɔɔn, mbà pege ee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ megàŋ ngɔ́’.
en: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

ngiemboon: Tá’ á ké tè pú’u wɔ́, Kristo la kwa’ ńzíme nà legwé ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò, ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie epʉ̀a pie é la kwé ge lá’ gíŋ zím yɔ́b nà legwé.
en: But now is Christ risen from the dead,andbecome the firstfruits of them that slept.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie, pá’ legwé la cʉ́’ʉ létóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ńcʉa ná tà’ nyìŋ la,*lezimé nà legwé la gíŋe ńcʉa yé pɔ́ ná tà’ nyìŋ tá ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: For since by mancamedeath, by mancamealso the resurrection of the dead.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm lɔg pá’ pɔ́ la tswé’e ná Adam ńkwéte la, pɔ́ métsèm ge gíŋ lɔg pá’ pɔ́ tswé’e ná Kristo é zíme nà legwé.
en: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.

ngiemboon: Tá’ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ zím pɔ́ nà yé fʉ̀’. Kristo la vɔg ńzím. Epʉ̀a pé ge lá’ zím yɔ́b, á fʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ gíŋ tó.
en: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ's at his coming.

ngiemboon: Á pɔ́ɔnte ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie njÿó maga. Kristo pyága kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne sá’a njÿó, ḿbyág mbɔɔ tándá wɔ́b, mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie á gẅiin tʉ̀ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ḿbyág pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńná lefùɔ mbwo Ssé Tá.
en: Thencomeththe end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔɔn ńgẅiin lé ne sá’a njÿó tà ńkú fʉ̀’ gie Tá we lɔ̌g megàŋ mbù pé ńgÿo jʉ’ gie yé kristo ge tÿɔ́gɔ mekwò mé wó.
en: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.

ngiemboon: Anzsò nzèm ngàŋ mbù gẅie e Ssé ge lá’ pyága yé aa legwé gẅie à lɔgɔ pʉ̀a.
en: The last enemythatshall be destroyedisdeath.

ngiemboon: Á zɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Yé Léen ḿbú ńdɔgɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò Kristo». E Ssé gɔɔn pú’u, pá’ɔɔn, á té ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie yé Ssé ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà mbwo Kristo wɔ́, á nue e Ssé zɔ zɔɔn ńnáa metʉ̀ né Kristo tá á lɔgɔ sá’a kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put underhim, it ismanifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.

ngiemboon: Eshúm ntsèm piŋ ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u pɔ́ mbwo ye Múɔ, kwà’ yé Múɔ lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u pɔ́ mbwo Ssé gẅie à la náa yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńzsé ngie e Ssé ge kwà’ sá’ shúm ntsèm.
en: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé kwé mé té gíŋe ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a kẅé ntse á nà twó mepfó pie pɔ́ la tè ntse kẅé pé’e ńtsɔ́ɔn kɔ́? Mbà mélà’a kɔ́ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a kẅé ntse ná twó mepfó?
en: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

ngiemboon: Mbà peg zẅiŋé léńnéŋe fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, lyɛ̌’ ntsèm mèŋ n tsẅíle ncwò legwé tsẅíle, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ammó gie n dɔg ńzá’ nkwèen ngie áa nénʉ́, á gwɔ́ pá’ n dɔgɔ gẅi ńka’te tɛ’, ńcʉa ná pá’ pege pǔ ńgwɔ́ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

ngiemboon: N da tóo Efeso wɔɔn pega pʉ̀a ma’, yɔ́b ntí gwɔ́ tà pâ menɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pega pɔ́ lɔ̌ɔn ḿma’a pú’u, e sɔ́ɔn legyè tyé pɔ́ nà shúm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, mbà pì gie n da jÿó mǒ áa kɔ́? Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé kwé mé té gíŋe ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà á cʉ́’ʉ ńzɛ́te pɔ́ ngie pege gÿo pá’ sag legʉa la gɔɔn la ngie: Aye nyìŋ áa ye ncwò wé, á nue njÿó ge lʉ́a mé gʉa.
en: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ mé fʉʉ gẅí, pi legé ngie mbàŋ tepòŋ cʉ́ŋe pʉ́a ka?
en: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

ngiemboon: Pi gwoonte mbùm gí nà ntí gie e poŋ Ssé, tà pi gíŋ ńgÿo menò tepòŋ. N gɔɔn nue mèŋ n ne ńgyá e tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɔ́ té Ssé zsé, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtsɔɔn ngie eshʉ́ kúu gẅí.
en: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speakthisto your shame.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɛ́te ngie mepfó zíme nà legwé lêkɔ́ wɔ́? MÀbiŋ ńgẅiin yɛ̌ ntí mbùm nnɛ́ fʉ̀’ó wɔ́?
en: But somemanwill say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ zɛ́te pú’u, mbà aa gʉ̀gʉ̀, á nue nyìŋ pye mmó, á vɔg ńdʉ́, tá ńdeen ńké sá’ ńná letsìŋe mmó se sẅé.
en: Thoufool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:

ngiemboon: Ammó gie nyìŋ piŋ ḿbye ssé é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mvòmo mmó sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, kà ye ngesáŋ wɔ́, kà ye tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, é té letsìŋe mmó sie é ge tó kẅɛɛ ssé wɔ́.
en: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some othergrain:

ngiemboon: E Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńná ntí letsiŋé sie à kwǒŋ né mbyè mmó ŋwɛ́, ńná kwà’ ntí letsiŋé ye yɛ̌ mbyè mmó wɔ́ né ye.
en: but God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.

ngiemboon: Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mbab nnɛ́ tsɔ́ mmó e tè ye yetsɔ́ sẅé, mbab nnɛ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ee ndyɛ̀’ɛ, eye menɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, eye meshʉ́ŋ gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, eye messó gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: All fleshisnot the same flesh: butthere isonekind offlesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes,andanother of birds.

ngiemboon: Eshúm gíŋ ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ lefaŋ, etsɔ́ gwɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Lesí we shúm sie ée tÿǒ lefaŋ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, awe shúm sie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: There arealso celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestialisone, and thegloryof the terrestrialisanother.

ngiemboon: Lesí we nèm aa ndyɛ̀’ɛ, awe sàŋ gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, awe mecÿɔ́’ saŋ á gwɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Wɛ̌ cÿɔ́’ saŋ wɔ́, à sǐ pɔ́ ye ntí nà petsɔ́.
en: There isone glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: foronestar differeth fromanotherstar in glory.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gíŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, á fʉ̀’ gie mepfó ge lá’ zíme nà legwé. Ammó gie mé pye ssé ee mbùm gie e lʉ̌, tá mbùm gie e zíme nà legwé e tè lá’ ńgíŋe ńdʉ́ wɔ́.
en: So alsoisthe resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:

ngiemboon: Mé gwaa néŋ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ ssé, e tè ku’u nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzíme nà legwé, ńgẅiin legú’. Mé gwaa ńnéŋe ssé é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pepÿɛ́ɛ, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzíme nà legwé ńgẅiin metʉ̀ tɛ’.
en: it is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:

ngiemboon: Mé gwaa ńnéŋe ssé, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzíme nà legwé, ńgwɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́ gie e fóo mbwo Zẅìge gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, á lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngie etsɔ̌ mbùm nnɛ́ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye nyìŋ mesoŋ, yetsɔ́ piŋ fóo mbwo Zẅìge.
en: it is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo mé ŋwe’e ngie: Ádam gẅie à laa ndùŋ mvfò nyìŋ mesoŋ, e Ssé la gÿo tá á gwɔ́ wó, tá’ nzsò nzèm Adam tó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó.
en: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adamwas madea quickening spirit.

ngiemboon: Mé té vɔg ńgyá pɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́ gie e fóo mbwo Zẅìge gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó wɔ́, mé vɔg ńgyá pɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ. Mbùm nnɛ́ gie e fóo mbwo Zẅìge gÿo ḿbɔ́ɔnte tá ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: Howbeit thatwasnot first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉ́’ʉ lépwóon ndùŋ mvfò nyìŋ mesoŋ, ńdɔgɔ tsetsá’ ḿbwóon yé. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ lɔgɔ pú’u, éfóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, tá’ nyìŋ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a á fóo pɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó.
en: The first manisof the earth, earthy: the second manisthe Lord from heaven.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ésẅé nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé la lɔgɔ tsetsá’ ḿbwóon yé, epʉ̀a pie ée tÿǒ lepwó é sẅé nyìŋ gẅie à la fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’.
en: Asisthe earthy, sucharethey also that are earthy: and asisthe heavenly, sucharethey also that are heavenly.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’, pege sẅé nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé la lɔgɔ tsetsá’ ḿbwóon yé la, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, pege sẅé nyìŋ gẅie à la fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’.
en: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, n dɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔg mbùm nnɛ́ yɔɔn gie e gẅiin mbab nnɛ́ nê metse lɔɔn, ńdɔg ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ shúm sie é lʉ́ pâ sie é té lʉ́ le teme tà’a jʉ’ wɔ́.
en: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi tsɔ́ nò gie á la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lelyěen, pege metsèm tè lá’ pú kwé wɔ́, tá’ pege metsèm ge lá’ pú gẅiin tsɔ̌ mbùm ye sẅé,
en: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

ngiemboon: pɔ́ tà’ legʉa, lê gàg, mbà nzsòte nzèm ngyè ntàŋ e cʉ̌m, á nue yɛ̌ ngyè ntàŋ ge lá’ cʉ́m mepfó e zíme nà legwé pá’ pɔ́ té ge lá’ gíŋe kwé wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pú’u, pege gẅiin mbùm ye sẅé.
en: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie yɔɔn mbùm gie e kwě, ńdʉ́ lɔɔn, e ge lá’ sele cʉ́’ gie e tè gíŋe kwé wɔ́, é ké le lʉ́.
en: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortalmustput on immortality.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà yɔɔn mbùm gie e kwě ńdʉ́ lɔɔn, e sele ńcʉ́’ gie e tè gíŋe kwé wɔ́, é ké le gíŋe ńdʉ́ wɔ́, ashwóŋè gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé lɔgɔ ḿbumte. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Legwé à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, mé ma’á yé tà ńjÿó ye.
en: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.

ngiemboon: Legwé, e mú metʉ̀ lɔg ńjÿó ncù é pfǒ nzɔ̌? Legwé, à jú sisìŋ á pfǒ nzɔ̌?
en: O death, whereisthy sting? O grave, whereisthy victory?

ngiemboon: Sisìŋ gie legwé lɔg ńtsɔ́gɔ nyìŋ ée menò tepòŋ, metʉ̀ menò tepòŋ fóo ná*lepʉ̌ Ssé sie é nyɛ ngie nyìŋ à gwě ntsaŋ.
en: The sting of deathissin; and the strength of sinisthe law.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege cʉa ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, ńgÿo pege cʉa nò tepòŋ mbɔɔ legwé.
en: But thanksbeto God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pentʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pá’ áa pú’u la, pi tʉte tʉte, tà nyìŋ cÿɔ’, pi kẅi’i fa’ mefà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńdɔg ńgʉa pɔ́ lê mvfò, ńgwɔ fa’ ńne ńzsé ngie fà’ gie pi fà’a, ńtí nue pi ee pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á té ge cʉ̀a sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò ncùb gie mé ne ńcú’te lénáa mbwo pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Yerósalem, pi gí pi gÿo pá’ n ka tsẅii mbwo mecú’tè mie ée Galatia.
en: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie à ńnéŋe ńgwɔ́ wɛ̌ sóondi, wɛ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́ à gee ná mmó gie à gẅǐin, ńdʉŋte ḿbí tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ nkáb mǒ, ńde’e ndá ye, ńzsé ngie mé té ge zẅí’te tà mèŋ n tó tá mé ma’ ncùb wɔ́.
en: Upon the firstdayof the week let every one of you lay by him in store, asGodhath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tó, é gwɔ́ ntúm pʉ̀a pie pi tsɔ̌’, ńná meŋwà’ne mbwó pɔ́b, pɔ́ lɔg ńgʉa Yerósalem ńná nkáb gie pi cu’té.
en: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve byyourletters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńtó ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gʉa yɔ́ɔn wó, mbà pega pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ kwò.
en: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tóo lá’ pi, é zɔɔn pfó tsɛ̀ɛ paga ngwòŋ Makedonia, á nue mèŋ n gẅiin légʉa wó.
en: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ mèŋ n ge gÿo ná’a láte lá’ pi, ndyɛ̌’ é ńnéŋe tà fʉ̀’e mbʉ̀ŋ lá’ ḿmag, à gwɔ́ pú’u, n gwɔ́ tà ńkwaŋte jʉ’ gie n gee né wó pi kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

ngiemboon: N te ne ńkwoŋo légwaa gyá gẅi fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńně ńcʉa cʉa wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà pege ge ná’a ńnéŋe.
en: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa léneŋe Efeso wɔɔn tà línɔ́ɔn Paŋtekɔ̂d lá’ ńtɔ́g,
en: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

ngiemboon: á nue tsɔ̌ mánzsè kéen ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo mèŋ jʉ’ɔɔn léfa’a fà’ gie á ge kẅéte tɛ’. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ pàlʉ’ʉ nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’.
en: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, andthere aremany adversaries.

ngiemboon: Timoté lɔɔn ńtóo lá’ pi, pi kúe yé mboŋó. Légwɔ́ gie à ge ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, éjú’ mbùm ye poŋ, á nue à fa’a yé pɔ́ fà’a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pá’ mèŋ.
en: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I alsodo.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, tà nyìŋ gwága yé. Pi náa yé shÿó pá’ à ge gwaa piŋ kẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn, é giŋe kága kǎg. Mèŋ n ne ńzẅí’te yé pá’ pâ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ ge tó.
en: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná fɛ́ wege Apolos, mbà mèŋ n zyě ńkẅiŋte yé pá’ pâ tsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ ge gʉa lá’ pi. Tá’ à tè ne ńkwoŋo légʉa fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́, à ge gÿo gẅiin fʉ̀’ tá gʉa.
en: As touchingourbrother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwá’a lÿɔ̀g ńdyé, pi záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé té kʉ́a, pi gwɔ́ mbàŋa, pi tʉ tʉ.
en: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi lɔg pɔ́ nkwòŋe.
en: Let all your things be done with charity.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńzsé ngie Stefanas pɔ́ tsìŋe ndá yé, pɔ́ ée melùŋ mvfò pàzáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo tsɛ̀ɛ lá’a gí Akay, pɔ́ ne ńnéŋe twó ńgÿo mmó gie cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ge zẅɛ́’. Áa pú’u, tá mèŋ n gíŋe ne ńzɛ́te mbwo pi ngie:
en: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, andthatthey have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

ngiemboon: Pi jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b, mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ pú ńtéŋe zì’i.
en: that ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth withus, and laboureth.

ngiemboon: Anò ne ḿboŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’ ńtí pá’ Stefanas, pɔ́ Fortunatus pɔ́ Akaikẅis tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ. Pɔ́ ée jʉ’ɔɔn, ńkúbe twó gí lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ.
en: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka néŋ ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn pá’ pɔ́ ka néŋ gẅi gí. Pi ná mekù’ á mbwó ntí pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b lɔɔn.
en: For they have refreshed my spirit and your's: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

ngiemboon: Mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée nà shÿó Azia é tsyɛ’té gẅí. Akilas pɔ́ Piriska mbɔɔ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie á jÿó ndá pɔ́b pɔ́ lɔ̌g lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńtsyɛ’te gẅi tɛ’.
en: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ métsèm pie ée jʉ’ɔɔn é tsyɛ’té gẅí. Pi tsyɛ’te mennɛ́ mí, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te, ńtáŋte mennɛ́ mí nà ntí ye pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl, n dɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn, ńŋwe’e yɔɔn tsyɛ’te.
en: The salutation ofmePaul with mine own hand.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô wɔ́, e Ssé néŋ ndòon twó ngàŋ. Marana tha. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a weg, tóo!
en: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maran-atha.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo néŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi métsèm.
en: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔg pá’ pege puté ńgwɔ́ nzèm Kristo ńkwoŋo gẅi métsèm.
en: The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, and Timotheus.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ pɔl gẅie e Ssé la kwoŋ kwoŋ ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. Peg fɛ́ wege Timoté ŋwe’é yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé á tÿǒsoŋo Korento. Mèŋ n gǐŋ ńŋwe’e ńnáa mbɔɔ mbwo pʉ̀a Ssé metsèm, pie pɔ́ ée nà shÿó Akay ntsèm.
en: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothyourbrother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi ḿbiŋ ne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeto you and peace from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: !Pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wégè Yěsô Kristo, gẅie letsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a fóo pɔ́ ne yé, letoonté wɔ́b á fóo pɔ́ ne yé.
en: BlessedbeGod, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

ngiemboon: À tóonte wégè ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm gẅie pege ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ légwɔ́ gie pege yege ge ku’u létóonte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’, é cʉ́’ʉ létóonte wɔ́b é tóonte nà ntí gie e Ssé ka tóonte wégè.
en: who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pege ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, pá’ Kristo la gyá yé ngɔ́’ tɛ’ la, e Ssé giŋé ne ńtóonte wégè tɛ’ ńcʉa nà Kristo.
en: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔɔn ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, mbà pi ge zẅɛ́’, e Ssé cʉa mǒ, ńtóonte gẅí, pi ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná mánzsè Ssé. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé ne ńtóonte wég, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńtóonte gẅí, pú’u pi ku’u léshÿɔg á ná fʉ̀’ gie ntí ngɔ́’ gie e ne ńkúu wég, e kǔ gẅi gí.
en: And whether we be afflicted,it isfor your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted,it isfor your consolation and salvation.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa fʉ̀’ gie peg ne ńkwaŋte gẅi peg kwà’ ńzsé ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ peg é le gẅi pɔ́g, anue peg ne ńzsé ngie, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pi ne ńgyá gi ngɔ́’ la, e Ssé giŋé ne ńtóonte gẅi gí pá’ peg.
en: And our hope of youisstedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, soshall ye bealso of the consolation.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi zsé nzẅìŋ ngɔ́’ gie peg ka gyǎ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Azia, peg la gyá ngɔ́’ wó gyá tà metʉ̀ még mag, peg cʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u ńgee pɔ́ ńkwéte.
en: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

ngiemboon: Kwà’ peg yég la zẅíŋ ngie mé záb ngie mé ge zẅéte weg, á cʉa pú’u, peg tè gíŋe ńkwaŋ ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ peg lê twó ség gíŋ ńku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, peg cʉ́’ ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ lényé wég ngwòŋo nò ntsèm mbwo Ssé gẅie à zíme mepfó nà legwé.
en: but we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

ngiemboon: Peg laa ncwò legwé mbÿág pú’u, yé zɔ̌ kẅile wég, à ge gÿo gíŋe kẅile wég tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀. Áa nénʉ́ peg kwá’ ne ńzsé ngie à ge gÿo gíŋe kẅíle wég tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀,
en: who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliverus;

ngiemboon: é gwaa kẅile wég, agí pwó gwɔ́ mǒ, ńtí nue pi ne sẅíŋte yé nà twó ség. Pá’ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne sẅíŋte yé nà twó ség la, à ge gÿo cÿó gem yég, é ne tóonte wég, à gwɔ́ pú’u, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé yɔ́b nà twó ség.
en: ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the giftbestowedupon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà weg léńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà yeg mmó gie peg lɔg ńka’te áa pá’ peg gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á fóo mbwo Ssé. Peg tè ne fʉte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, peg ee pàshwóŋ pʉ̀a nò lê ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbùm yeg neŋé shwóŋó wég pú’u. Áa pá’ peg la gÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Peg la tè lɔg pɔ́ zsě nò pʉ̀a mesoŋ tá ńdɔg ńnéŋe pú’u wɔ́. Peg la lɔg pɔ́ pá’ e Ssé ne ńcÿó gʉm yég, ńkẅéte wég.
en: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá peg tè ŋwe’e tsɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne ńná né pi á gwɔ́ ye ndyɛ̀’ɛ ná nò gie pi tǒŋ ńjú’ wɔ́, n kwǎŋ ngie pi ge pú jú’ tà cʉ́me.
en: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi ka zye lé jú’ ntí nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌ la, á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo tóo, mèŋ n gwaa gwɔ́ mbwo pi é gwɔ́ gí mmó ka’te, pi gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn.
en: as also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye alsoareour's in the day of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka ne ńzsé ngie á ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u. Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mèŋ fa’a lévɔg ńcʉa mbʉ̀a pi, tá ńgÿo ńgíŋ ńcʉa, ńzsé ngie n ge gÿo pi kág kág ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a.
en: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka ne ńkwaŋa le gwaa gʉa Makedonia ńcʉa lá’ pi, ḿbiŋ fó Makedonia ńgíŋ ńtó né lá’ pi, pi kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn légʉa tà ńkúu Jẅidea,
en: and to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judæa.

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie n kɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo légÿo pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ḿma’a pɔ́ kwàŋ la? Kà pi kwǎŋ ngie n cʉ́’ʉ légɔɔn nò gie mèŋ n ge gÿo, ńdɔg pɔ́ legyè nyìŋ mesoŋ ńgɔɔn, tà á gwɔ́ ngie n gwɔ́ mèŋ n gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńkúbe?
en: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ! Á gʉa nà nò gie peg ka shwóŋó gẅí, peg ka tè gɔɔn nò ḿbiŋ ńkúbe wɔ́. E Ssé ne ńzsé.
en: ButasGodistrue, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue Yěsô Kristo, Míŋ Ssé gẅie peg Silase, ńgÿo Timoté ka shwóŋó nò yé mbwo pi, à la tè tó ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńkúbe wɔ́. À la tó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn nò, à té kúbe.
en: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us,evenby me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo ngie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la ka’ wɔ́, à pumte. Pú’u, pege lɔg lezíŋ sé, ńgɔɔn ngie*amen, ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńnáa mekù’ mbwo Ssé.
en: For all the promises of God in himareyea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ Ssé zɔ gÿo tá peg ne ńtʉte tʉte nzèm Kristo tà mbɔɔ pi. À la faga wégè,
en: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us,isGod;

ngiemboon: ńcÿɔ́’ɔ liŋé yé ná pege, ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ntʉ́m pege. Á lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò mmó nà shúm sie à ge náa mbwo pege.
en: who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mèŋ n tè gíŋe ńtóo lá’ pi Korento wɔ́, n ka tè ne ńkwoŋo légÿo pi jú’ kékáŋ wɔ́. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn éshwóŋó nò. N dɔɔn ńcÿɔ nò, e Ssé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńzsé ngie gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo à tʉte, peg tě fa’a létó sẅɛ́ɛ gẅí, ńzáb pá’ pi ge gÿo wɔ́. Peg tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ létó ńkẅéte gẅi pi mege ńjú’ mboŋó.
en: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u mmó gie á ka gÿo n gyá ngie mèŋ n te gíŋe piŋe lá’ pi, é gÿo pi gíŋ ḿmÿɔg wɔ́,
en: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

ngiemboon: á nue n dɔɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg, mbà pà wɔ̌ ge piŋ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn kág tà á légwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅi gẅie n zɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg wɔ́?
en: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo n ŋwe’e pɔ́ ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo pi, á nà ntí gie n ka ŋwe’e la, n ka tè ne ńkwoŋo lé lêen tóo lá’ pi, ńgyá pʉ̀a pɔ́ gÿo mèŋ n gẅiin lémÿɔg tá mbà pɔ́ kɔ’ɔ́ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn kág kág wɔ́. N ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie n dɔɔn ne ńkága, mbà pi ge kág gí.
en: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy isthe joyof you all.

ngiemboon: N ka gwɔ́ ŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́, ńdɔg pɔ́ ntse nÿɔ́g, letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn ne ńgyáŋa tɛ’, mbùm yɔɔn ne ńtsyɛte, tá mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńké tě ńŋwe’e ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo ngie pi mÿɔg wɔ́. Mèŋ n kɔ̌ɔn ńŋwe’e pú’u, pɔ́ lélɔg ńnyɛɛ gẅi máamáa nkwòŋe gie n gẅiin nzèm pi.
en: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nyìŋ gẅie à ka gÿo pi ńnéŋe nê lemÿɔg, mbà à ka tè gÿo pɔ́ ná mèŋ wɔ́, à ka gÿo pɔ́ ná pi metsèm. Ndyɛ̌’ á ka tè ná pi métsèm wɔ́, tá á ka kě ńgwɔ́ ná lelÿò pʉ̀a.
en: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a ké ńkaga yé, á ku’ pú’u.
en: Sufficient to such a manisthis punishment, whichwas inflictedof many.

ngiemboon: Tà á ne zɛ́te fʉ̀’ɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pi lege ńnáa mbwo yé, ńtóonte yé, ḿbɔ́g pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á mÿɔg séság, ńkʉ́a.
en: So that contrariwise yeoughtrather to forgivehim, and comforthim, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi gÿo nà ntí gie à ge zsé ngie pi nyě ńkwoŋo yé kwoŋ.
en: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirmyourlove toward him.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n ka gǐŋ ńgwaa ŋwe’e ŋwà’ne mbwo pi ńne fa’a lélʉŋte gẅi ńgyá, ka pi ku’u lé jú’ ncwò ná menò ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdege mefʉa nyìŋ, ńnáa mbwo yé, mbà mèŋ n degé yɔ́ɔn ńnáa mbwo ngàŋ, ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńgẅiin lélege mefʉa nyìŋ, ńdege, mbà mèŋ n tyé mvfò Kristo ńdege pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅéte gẅí,
en: To whom ye forgive any thing, Iforgivealso: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgaveit, for your sakesforgave I itin the person of Christ;

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pege tè nyé Sátà à cʉa wégè wɔ́, á nue pege tè ne ḿmoŋe mmó gie aa nzèm pege é fa’a wɔ́.
en: lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà wɔɔn legìŋ ŋwɛ́, mbà mèŋ n da kúu tÿǒsoŋo Toras létsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo Kristo wó, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɛ ńtsɔ́’ɔ mánzsè mbwo mèŋ léfa’a fà’ yé,
en: Furthermore, when I came to Troas topreachChrist's gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,

ngiemboon: tá’, mbùm yɔ̀ɔn ké ńtsyɛte tsyɛte, mélà’mie n da tè fɛ́ wege Titus wó gyá. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo mèŋ n de’e pʉ̀a Toras ńgʉa nê Makedonia léfa’a yé.
en: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

ngiemboon: Tá’, peg ge ké ná pɔ́ ndǎg mbwo Ssé, á nue peg lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà à ge gÿo peg gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná mánzòŋ Kristo, mbà yé Kristo jÿǒ ncù. Yé Ssé lɔgɔ wég ńgÿo mé zsé Kristo jʉ’ ntsèm, pá’ mmó gie mé túɔ, àgyě kwɔ́’ɔ ésa jʉ’ ntsèm la.
en: Now thanksbeunto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ gyě mmó mbòŋo gie á fóo mbwo Kristo. Á gyě gie á kwɔ́’ ńtéme mezẅé pʉ̀a, á mezẅé pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńtsẅɛ́ɛ, tà mbɔɔ ná me pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ḿbyé.
en: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ gyě áa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ḿbyé ńgwɔ́ gyě legwé gie á náa legwé, ńgwɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é ne ńtsẅɛ́ɛ, ńgwɔ́ gyě le gwɔ́ wó gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, tà áa pá’ɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ ku’u légwɔ́ mmó gie mé ge lɔg fa’a yɔɔn fà’?
en: to the onewe arethe savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And whoissufficient for these things?

ngiemboon: Tá’ peg tè pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ shwóŋè Ssé ńgÿo sɔ́b shúm metʉ̌a wɔ́, peg shwóŋ yég pɔ́ lê ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé ka tǔm. Peg gwɔ́ shwóŋ e Ssé ne ńgyá wég peg piŋ ńda nnɛ́ ná Kristo.
en: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgíŋe ńzye zye léla’te ntí pʉ̀a pie peg ée pɛ̌ keen? Kà á ne ńzɛ́te pɔ́ ngie peg kẅé ŋwà’ne gie á la’te pʉ̀a pie peg ee pɛ̌, pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo tá ńdɔg ńtóo mvfò pi, kà lékẅé mbwo pi tá ńdɔg ńgʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’ wɔ́?
en: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as someothers, epistles of commendation to you, orlettersof commendation from you?

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ zɔ yég ŋwà’ne, mbà mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wég, pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ḿbiŋ ne ńtóŋo,
en: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ mé lɔg pɔ́ nÿɔ́g ńgyá ngie pi ee ŋwà’ne gie Kristo la ŋwe’e, ńtúmo wég peg tó ńná. À la tè lɔg pɔ́ nkwòŋ ŋwà’ne tá ńŋwe’e yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne wɔ́, à la gwɔ́ ŋwe’e, ńcʉa pɔ́ nà Zẅìge Ssé, yé Ssé gẅie aa wó, ńgwɔ́ ntentʉ́. À la tè ŋwe’e nà metǎfelé tóon wɔ́, à la ŋwe’e pɔ́ nà ntʉ́m pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: forasmuch as ye aremanifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn nò ná fa’a yég pá’ɔɔn, á nue peg lɔg pá’ peg la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ńkwa’ ńzsé ngie e Ssé zẅíŋe nò yég.
en: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

ngiemboon: Peg ké tě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ngie ńgwɔ́ peg lɔg kwà’ még metʉ̀ ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Metʉ̀ mie peg lɔgɔ ńgÿo yɔɔn fà’ é fóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé.
en: not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiencyisof God;

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ ka gÿo peg ku’u légwɔ́ pafa’a fà’, á nà*kʉ̀a ye sẅé. Yɛ̌*kʉ̀a á té fóo pɔ́ nà*lepʉ̌ sie mé la ŋwe’e wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ nà Zẅìge Ssé.*Lepʉ̌ sie mé la ŋwe’e, é gyó nyìŋ kwé kwě, a Zẅìge gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ne ńzsé gí pá’ nò*lepʉ̌ á laa pú’u. Mé la ŋwe’e nà tǎfelé tóon, é gÿo mé kwé kwě. Tá’ mbɔɔ pú’u, afà’ ná nò*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, gẅiin máamáa shʉ́shÿɔ́g, tà pʉ̀a Israel é té fʉ̀’ʉ lélíe wɛ̌ shʉ́shÿɔ́g nà shÿó Mǒsê wɔ́, mbɔɔ pá’ à lɔ̌ɔn tě ńnéŋe wɔ́.
en: But if the ministration of death, writtenandengraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; whichglorywas to be done away:

ngiemboon: Pá’ á laa pú’u la, á ge gǎ tá fà’ ná nò Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, á le náa shʉ́shÿɔ́g tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɛ̌ wɔ́?
en: how shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie nò ná fà’a*lepʉ̌ sie, tà mbɔɔ pá’ é lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo mé kwé kwě á la gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g, mbà anò ná fà’ gie á gÿo pʉ̀a tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé á ge ké gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g é cʉa yɛ̌,
en: For if the ministration of condemnationbeglory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ pege zɔɔn éfó ńgɔɔn ngie, shʉ́shÿɔ́g we fʉ̀’ɔɔn pǔ ńgwɔ́ wó tɛ’, tà we fʉ̀’e mvfò à la tè tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ammó gie á lɔ́ɔn tè lá’a zɔ́gɔ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó wɔ́, á la gẅiin we shʉ́shÿɔ́g, mbà mmó gie á ge lá’a zɔ́gɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, ge ké gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g é cʉa yɛ̌.
en: For if that which is done awaywasglorious, much more that which remainethisglorious.

ngiemboon: Pá’ peg ne ńnyɛ́te ńzsé ngie mɔɔn menò ée nénʉ́ la, peg shʉashʉa ńgɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńgÿo pá’ Mǒsê gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn éshuu nkǔɔ nà shÿó wé ńdɔgɔ ḿbɔ́gɔ shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn tè ńnéŋe wɔ́ légwɔ́ mag pʉ̀a Israel ne ńgyá wɔ́.
en: and not as Moses,whichput a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

ngiemboon: Tá’, á la zɔɔn ńgwaa wɔ́, mbà legyè sɔ́b léen ńjÿɔ́’ɔ, é léen ńjÿɔ́’ɔ jÿɔ́’ɔ tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, á nue pɔ́ gwɔ́ tóŋo ŋwà’ne Nzẅìŋe*Kʉ̀a, nkǔɔ yá yɛ̌ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, é nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, mélà’mie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńnyé té la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, yɛ̌ nkǔɔ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: but their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; whichvailis done away in Christ.

ngiemboon: Tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pʉ̀a Israel gwɔ́ tà ne ńtóŋo meŋwà’ne Mǒsê, étsɔ̌ nkǔɔ pwoon legyè sɔ́b.
en: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ kě ńgwɔ́ tà sele nnɛ́ ńdíe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkǔɔ zyɛ́bɛ,
en: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

ngiemboon: á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge, ajʉ’ gie Zẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a piŋ ńgwɔ́ wó la, atsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ á táte nyìŋ, á té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó wɔ́.
en: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lordis, thereisliberty.

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm tè gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ nkǔɔ ná shÿó wégè wɔ́, shʉ́shÿɔ́g Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńtéme ná pege ḿbiŋe nzèm pá’ kyɛ̀’ gie á téme ná gyá shÿó la. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ Zẅìge, à ne ńgÿo pege kúbe ntí, ńgÿo pege sẅé yé, shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie aa ná pege, piŋ ne ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory,evenas by the Spirit of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pá’ e Ssé la lɔg pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe yé, ńnáa yɔɔn fà’ mbwo peg la, peg tè kʉ́a wɔ́.
en: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

ngiemboon: Peg tè nà mentí lɔg fa’a fà’ mie ée me ntsèm, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ me shʉ́ wɔ́, atsɔ̌ nkÿonkÿo tè ná kwò legiŋ yég wɔ́, peg piŋ ńké tè ne ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ menò ḿvoŋo shwóŋè Ssé wɔ́, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, peg lɔg pá’ peg ee mvfò Ssé ńdá’te pɔ́ nò nénʉ́ á mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tà ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ léla’a wég ná tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: but have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie peg tsẅii, ée mbwo tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ńnyé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nkǔɔ, mbà nkǔɔ pwoon pú’u, pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńkÿo Ssé ńgee ḿbyé pyé,
en: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

ngiemboon: ée pà jú’u nò Ssé té záb ntʉ́m mǒ, pie e ssé yé yɔɔn njÿó kéen ńjÿɔ́’ legyè sɔ́b ńdɔg ńtɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b légyá kyɛ̀’ gie á fóo ná nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, pú’u, pɔ́ té zsé pá’ shʉ́shÿɔ́g Kristo aa pú’u wɔ́. Yé Kristo aa pá’ e Ssé gwɔ̌.
en: in whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńgwɔ tsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, éfa’a pɔ́ pá’ mé ge zsé wég wɔ́, peg fa’a pɔ́ pá’ mé ge zsé ngie Yěsô Kristo aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Peg tyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pafa’a fà’ pie éfa’a mbwo pi ńtí Yěsô,
en: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé gẅie à la gɔɔn ngie: «Á poŋ ngie akyɛ̀’ kyɛ’ nzěm», yé lê twó yé kéen ńtó ńkyɛ’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m még, légÿo peg zsé pá’ shʉ́shÿɔ́g we aa pú’u, á shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie mé ne ńgyá ná shÿó Kristo.
en: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, togivethe light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá peg pie yɔɔn fù’ áa ná peg, peg gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pá’ megwʉ̌ŋ tsa’á la. Á fó mǒ mé gyá mboŋó ngie mɛ̌ metʉ̀ mie efʉ̀’ yé tè wó wɔ́, éfóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé, é té fóo mbwo peg wɔ́.
en: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
