ngiemboon: Ngɔ́’ ne fóo meshÿó meshÿó ńtóo ná peg tá ńké tè ne ńgwɔ’ɔ wég wɔ́. Á gʉa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ peg tè gíŋe ńzsé pá’ peg ge gÿo wɔ́, tá ńké tè gɔɔn ngie anò á zsòté wɔ́.
en: We aretroubled on every side, yet not distressed;we areperplexed, but not in despair;

ngiemboon: Mé kʉ́e wég e Ssé ké tè wég gwá’. Á gʉa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwá’a fʉ̀’ gie mé temé wég ssé la, tá peg ké tè kwé.
en: persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ne ńzẅíŋe ngie peg ge kwé ntí legwé gie Yěsô la kwé yɛ̌, pú’u, légwɔ́ gie mé ge gyá ngie le gwɔ́ we Yěsô aa yé soŋ nnɛ́ peg.
en: always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.

ngiemboon: Peg pie peg nyé wó, peg ee fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé, ńtí nò Yěsô. Áa pú’u, légwɔ́ gie mé ge líe wég, é gyá ngie le gwɔ́ we Yěsô aa nà mbùm yeg tà mbɔɔ pá’ e ge gÿo kwé.
en: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.

ngiemboon: Á fó pú’u, legwé gwaa gwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ peg ne fa’a yé fà’, le gwɔ́ wó ne fa’a yé fà’ soŋ nnɛ́ pi.
en: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: N ka záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, áa mmó gie á ka gÿo mèŋ n gɔɔn nò, peg ka lɔg pá’ peg záb ntʉ̀m nà Ssé, á nà yɛ̌ ntí, ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ légɔɔn nò Ssé,
en: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

ngiemboon: ńne ńzsé ngie Ssé gẅie à la gÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô zíme ná legwé, ge gÿo gíŋe gÿo pege zím yégè, á nue pege la nnɛ́ ná Yěsô, e Ssé gÿo pege métsèm kẅɛ, pega Yěsô pú ńcú’te.
en: knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall presentuswith you.

ngiemboon: Peg zẅíŋe mɔɔn menò ntsèm mie e Ssé ne ńgyá ngie é ku’ még, ńdɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie pi zẅɛ́’. Pú’u, ńzsé ngie nzẅìŋ pàzsé ngie e Ssé kwoŋo wɔ́b ge kẅi’i gyɔ́ɔn, nzẅìŋ pàná ndǎg mbwo yé, mbɔɔ pàgù’te yé, é kẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For all thingsarefor your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.

ngiemboon: Áa mmo gie á gÿo peg tè kʉ́a, mbùm nnɛ́ yèg tsɛ ne ńkẅi’i ńkʉ́a kʉ̌a tá’, ntʉ́m wég gwɔ́ tsoló ne shumo shum lyɛ̌’ ntsèm.
en: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inwardmanis renewed day by day.

ngiemboon: Múɔ méngɔ́’ gẅie peg ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne ńgyá, à cʉa cʉa. Mé lɔɔn ńgʉa ḿbí fʉ̀’ á le ku’u tsɔ́ mmó nà legú’ tendège gẅie à tě ńdà’a ḿmaga wɔ́, á gẅie yɛ̌ ngɔ́’ lɔgɔ ńtsɔ́’ɔ mánzsè ńnáa né pege wɔ́.
en: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceedingandeternal weight of glory;

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne fa’a pɔ́ mmó gie mé lɔg menÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́, peg ne fa’a pɔ́ gie mé té ne ńgyá lê nÿɔ́g wɔ́. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa wɔ́, ammó gie mé lɔgɔ nÿɔ́g ńgyá á té ńnéŋe tɛ’ wɔ́, tá gie mé té lɔg nÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́, áa ńdá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seenaretemporal; but the things which are not seenareeternal.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie ntàb wɔɔn gẅie pege ee tsoló, é gwɔ́ mbùm yege lɔɔn, é lɔɔn fó lyɛ̌’ ńkeme, mbà pege gẅiin ndá tÿǒ lepwó, é gwɔ́ gie e ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ la tè pwóon, e Ssé zɔ la pwóon.
en: For we know that if our earthly house ofthistabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo pege ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne ńdʉa, ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yege yé tÿǒ lepwó, á légwɔ́ tsoló pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ nzsǒ sẅé gie à ma’ la.
en: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ mbùm nnɛ́ lɔɔn ńkábte wégè, pege le gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ pàtè ma’ nzsǒ wɔ,
en: if so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

ngiemboon: á nue áa fʉ̀’ gie pege nyé tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ntàb, menò ne sẅɛɛ wégè, pege lʉa. Áa nénʉ́ ngie pege tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé fó ná pege ńkẅile yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́, pege fa’a léma’ nzsǒ ye tÿǒ lepwó mǒ, légwɔ́ gie mbùm gie e té kwé ge mi mbùm gie é gẅiin lekwé.
en: For we that are inthistabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ ka cwoŋte wégè ná wɛ̌ légwɔ́, ńnáa Zẅìge yé mbwo pege ńdɔg ńgÿo zyě ssé ná shúm sie à ge gÿo tá ná né pege.
en: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thingisGod, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tá pege ee fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ nê lekág pá’ɔɔn tɛ’. Pege té ne ḿmoŋe ngie pege lɔɔn ńdá’ ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́, mbà pege nyě tè gwɔ̌ lejʉ́ŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà pege gwɔ̌ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Thereforewe arealways confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pege nyě tè lɔg nÿɔ́g mégè ńgyá yé. Tá’, pege neŋé ne ńzẅí’te pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie pege záb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: (for we walk by faith, not by sight:)

ngiemboon: Pege cʉ̌’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ nê lekág pá’ɔɔn, atwó mmó lÿò gie pege ne ńtsɔ́ɔn á gwɔ́ lékẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́, ńgʉa ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: we are confident,I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, ammó gie peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légÿo tɛ’ aa legÿo mmó gie á poŋo yé. Kà pɔ́ pá’ peg ee tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ pá’ peg kẅɛ̌ tsoló wɔ́,
en: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

ngiemboon: á nue á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege metsèm cʉa mvfò Kristo à ŋaga wégè, à cʉa pú’u, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kẅé wé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ ná mmó gie à la gÿo, á gwɔ́ ye mbòŋo kà ye tepòŋ wɔ́, á fʉ̀’ gie à laa tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ mbùm nnɛ́.
en: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the thingsdoneinhisbody, according to that he hath done, whetherit begood or bad.

ngiemboon: Pá’ peg ne ńzsé mmó gie mé tóŋo lê lepɔgɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la, peg neŋé fa’ pɔ́ shÿó, ńgÿo pʉ̀a cwoŋo ńzsé pʉ̀a pie peg ee pɛ̌. E Ssé ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé pʉ̀a pie peg ee pɛ̌, mèŋ m biŋ ne ńkwaŋa ngie pi ee tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅi ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé gí pʉ̀a pie peg ee pɛ̌.
en: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

ngiemboon: Peg tè pá’ɔɔn tá ńgíŋe fa’a léshwóŋó gẅi pʉ̀a pie peg ee pɛ̌ wɔ́, peg náa gẅi pɔ́ shÿó pá’ ńgwɔ́ pi kwaŋte wég, anò yég poŋo gẅi poŋ. À cʉa pú’u, pi zsé létsɔ́’ɔ nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ shúm sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzème pǐ ńŋá’te, tá mbà pɔ́ kɔ’ɔ́ lɔg pɔ́ sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m é ŋá’te.
en: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat toanswerthem which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgyá ngie peg ne ńgÿo pá’ mepʉ̀a la, mbà peg ee pɛ̌, pɔ́ pá’ nò Ssé ge giŋ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie legyè ség ée wó, mbà pi zɔ ge zẅɛ́’.
en: For whether we be beside ourselves,it isto God: or whether we be sober,it isfor your cause.

ngiemboon: Ayég gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pá’ Kristo kwoŋo wégè la, peg ne ńjú’u pɔ́ ncwò yé. Peg ne ńkwa’a ńzsé ngie tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ la kwé nà twó mânyìŋ ntsèm. Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ ngie pâ pʉ̀a metsèm la pú ńkwé.
en: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

ngiemboon: À la kwé nà twó mânyìŋ ntsèm, légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie ée ntentʉ́ té gíŋe gwɔ́ wó pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo mmó gie á poŋo wɔ́b gwɔ́. Pɔ́ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ wó, pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo mmó gie á poŋo yé, á yé gẅie à la kwé nà twó sɔ́b tá Ssé zíme yé nà legwé.
en: andthathe died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

ngiemboon: Pá’ áa pú’u la, peg ee nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzsé nyìŋ ná ntí gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ lɔg ńzsé nyìŋ wɔ́. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie peg la zɔɔn ńzsé Kristo ná yɛ̌ ntí, mbà peg ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn peg tè gíŋe ne ńzsé yé pú’u wɔ́.
en: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know wehimno more.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gwɔ̌ tá ńda nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ we sẅé, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pá’ à ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́, mbà à zyě léńnéŋe we sẅé.
en: Therefore if any manbein Christ,he isa new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ menò ntsèm fóo mbwo Ssé gẅie à ka lɔgɔ Kristo ḿmag mbù gẅie é kaa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege lâ yé Ssé, à ka piŋ ńcʉ́me fà’ mbwo peg, á gwɔ́ légʉa shwóŋ pʉ̀a ngie eshÿo lémag mbù gẅie é kaa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b lâ Ssé é kẅɛ̌.
en: And all thingsareof God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ná Kristo, ńne ḿmaga mbù gẅie pâ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó gẅiin, pú’u, té gíŋe sáŋ menò tepòŋ mɔ́b, ńgÿo ńcʉ́me shwóŋè lɔg ḿmag mbù mbwo peg.
en: to wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ memântúm Kristo tá ńgɔɔn nò. Áa pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie e Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ zɔ tóŋo pʉ̀a. Peg lɔ̌g lezíŋ Kristo, ésẅíŋte ngie pʉ̀a zẅíŋ e Ssé gÿo pâ pɔ́ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseechyouby us: we prayyouin Christ's stead, be ye reconciled to God.

ngiemboon: Pá’ ndòon laa twó pege la, e Ssé la kaa menò tepòŋ mégè, ńzába twó Kristo, mbà à la tè tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ gẅiin. À la gÿo pú’u, pá’ pege ge lɔgɔ léla nnɛ́ ná Kristo, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: For he hath made himto besin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pega Ssé zɔ puté ne fa’a la, peg ne ńkẅiŋte gẅi ngie tà pi gÿo ná ntí gie, légwɔ́ gie é Ssé tsɔ̌ɔn gẅí, ńcÿó gʉm gí, à ge cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: We then,asworkers togetherwith him, beseechyoualso that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.

ngiemboon: alyɛ’ɛ́ légÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsẅɛ́ la ku’, n tó ńkẅéte gú. Pi zsé ngie yɔɔn ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ mbòŋo, yɔɔn áa lyɛ̌’ gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tsẅɛ́.
en: behold, nowisthe accepted time; behold, nowisthe day of salvation.)

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná peg ngàŋ ntúm, peg tè ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kwɔɔnte mǒ ńgwe ssé, mé fó mǒ ńdɔg ńzoonte fà’a yég wɔ́.
en: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, peg tyé nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńnyɛ ngie peg ee pafa’a fà’ Ssé, ńdɔgɔ pá’ peg ne shÿɔgɔ tɛ’, á ná fʉ̀’e ngɔ́’, á nà fʉ̀’ gie nò á cʉa wég, á nà fʉ̀’ gie peg ne ńcÿɔ’ɔ tɛ’,
en: But in allthingsapproving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,

ngiemboon: kà pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mé ne ńcúa wég wɔ́, kà pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mé neŋé wég tsǎŋ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mé pimté lá’ ḿma’a nzèm peg wɔ́, kà ná fʉ̀’ gie peg tyé nà mefà’ mie é tʉ tʉ wɔ́, kà ná fʉ̀’ gie peg ne ńdá’a té lyé wɔ́, mbɔɔ ná fʉ̀’ gie peg ne ńnéŋe té pfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńdɔgɔ weg mà ńnyɛɛ ngie peg ee pafa’a fà’ Ssé. Peg gẅiin ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbɔɔ zse nò gie á fóo mbwo Ssé, ńgÿo kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́. Peg gẅiin pɔ́ pòŋo ntʉ́m nzèm pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńzẅí’te yég kɔ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńgẅiin nkwòŋe gie è tè nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g wɔ́,
en: by pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

ngiemboon: Peg shwóŋ yég pɔ́ nò nénʉ́, ammó gie peg gÿo á nyɛ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé. Peg lɔg pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ńdɔg ńgÿo yég mmó lɔg ńkem ncù tà mbɔɔ yé lɔg ńdÿɔ́’ ncù.
en: by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgwaa náa mekù’ még, petsɔ́ ne ńtéme shʉ́ ná peg. Etsɔ́ gwaa gɔ’te mmó gie peg ne ńgÿo, petsɔ́ ne ńzoon wég zoon. Mé ne ńdɔgɔ wég ńgÿo megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, tá peg ké ne shwóŋó pɔ́ nò nénʉ́.
en: by honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, andyettrue;

ngiemboon: Mé ne ḿmoŋe wég, tá ńké ne ńzsé wég zsé, ńdɔgɔ wég ńtóŋo mepfó tá peg kwà’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́, ńnyɛɛ wég ngɔ́’, tá ńké tè wég zẅé.
en: as unknown, andyetwell known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;

ngiemboon: Mé kwaŋ ngie peg ne ḿmÿɔgɔ tsɔ́ nò, tá peg ńnéŋe fʉ̀’ ntsèm pɔ́ nê lekág. Mé ne ńdɔgɔ wég ńtóŋo mepóŋ, tá peg ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńgÿo ngàŋa mmó. Mé ne ńdíe wég pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mmó yég té wó wɔ́ la, tá peg ké ńgẅiin shúm ntsèm.
en: as sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, andyetpossessing all things.

ngiemboon: Pi meshǔ peg pie ée Korento, peg shwoŋó gẅi nò té le’e mvwɔ́’, peg pǔ ńnyɛ́’ ntʉ́m wég ńnyɛɛ gẅí.
en: OyeCorinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńdʉ’ʉ lékwoŋo gẅi wɔ́, atsɔ́ mmó lɔɔn ńne ńtáte gẅi lékwoŋo wég, mbà à fóo né pi.
en: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gɔɔn nò mbwo pi fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ nyìŋ gɔɔn nò mbwo pènkʉ́ pé. Á gwɔ́ ngie pi kwoŋo wég gí pá’ peg ne ńkwoŋo gẅi yég.
en: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as untomychildren,) be ye also enlarged.

ngiemboon: Tà pia pàtezǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô temte pà’ nyìŋ pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ púte ńgiŋe tà’a kwò ńgÿo tà’a mmó la, ńgwɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pɔ́ gie á té tyé zɔɔn ńteme kwò ńgiŋ lêkɔ́? Ńgwɔ́ kyɛ̀’ pɔ́ nzěm gwɔ́ tà’a jʉ’ lêkɔ́?
en: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

ngiemboon: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Kristo pɔ́ Bétialgwɔ́ tà’ ncwò? Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kaa záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́ pú ńgẅiin tà’ nkwaŋá?
en: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ Ssé yɔ́b, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn.
en: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk inthem; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńké ńkúe gẅí.
en: And I will receive you,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm zɔ gɔɔn.
en: saith the Lord Almighty.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pá’ e Ssé la ka’ mɔɔn menò á mbwo pege la, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie kwà’ pege lê twó yégè kÿo menò mie é té Ssé poŋ, é mie mé gÿo gÿo, tà mbɔɔ mie mé kwaŋa kwaŋ, ńkẅi’i ńdɔgɔ légwɔ́ tè*lɔ̌’ ńgʉa lê mvfò tà ńcʉ́me, ńgwɔ gwɔ́ ne ḿbɔ́gɔ Ssé.
en: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gÿo tà peg zsé ngie anò yég áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, peg laa fʉa nò mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, peg laa gÿo nyìŋ fʉa mánzsé Ssé wɔ́, peg ké tè fʉʉ tsɔ́ nyìŋ, ńjÿó mmó yé wɔ́.
en: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

ngiemboon: N ké tě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pi fʉ̌a tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Mèŋ n ně ńzɔɔn ńdá’ shwóŋó gẅi ngie, anò gí áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wég. Peg jǔ’ pege pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná tà’a nùɔ, kà pege ne ńjú’u pɔ́ mboŋó wɔ́, kà pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé wɔ́.
en: I speak notthisto condemnyou: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live withyou.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n déen ńtém nzèm yɔɔn ńná né pi, mèŋ n dɔg pɔ́ gẅi ńka’te tɛ’, mèŋ n nyě ńgẅiin pɔ́ shÿɔg tɛ’, lekág aa ntʉ́m mèŋ tɛ’ tà mbɔɔ pá’ peg ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’.
en: Greatismy boldness of speech toward you, greatismy glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.

ngiemboon: Peg ka zɔɔn ńgʉa tà ńkúu Makedonia, atsɔ̌ lézẅɛte à tè wó wɔ́. Ngɔ́’ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńtó. Epʉ̀a gwɔ gwɔ́ nzème pǐ ne ḿma’a wég lê ncù, ntʉ́m wég gwɔ́ tsoló ḿbɔ́gɔ ńtí tsɔ́ menò.
en: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; withoutwerefightings, withinwerefears.

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g még pá’ aa ńtsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńdʉa. Á gwɔ́ pá’ à la gÿo Titus fɔ́ɔn ńtó ńgyá wég.
en: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

ngiemboon: E Ssé tè lɔg pɔ́ ndà’ pá’ Titus tǒ wɔ́, á gíŋ ńdɔg mbɔɔ pá’ pi la tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g Titus yé. Titus ka pité, éshwóŋó wég ntí gie pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá wɔ̀ɔn pú’u, ńgíŋ ḿbíte ntí gie pi ne ńdɔgɔ ḿmÿɔgɔ nò yɔ́ɔn pú’u, ńgíŋe shwóŋó wég pá’ pi tyé létág nzèm yɔ̀ɔn pú’u. Tà mèŋ n jú’, anò gíŋe ńkẅi’i ḿboŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’.
en: and not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

ngiemboon: Anò gẅiin lépoŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’. Ŋwà’ne gie n ka vɔg ńtúmo mbwo pi, á ka gÿo pi mÿɔg, tá mèŋ n te ne ńgyá tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ mǒ wɔ́. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie n da gyá*lɔ̌’ mǒ, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ n ka ne ńzsé ngie á ge gÿo pi zye ḿmÿɔg.
en: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, thoughit werebut for a season.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n kě ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ne ńkága kǎg. N ké tě ńkága, pɔ́ mélà’mie pi ka mÿɔ̌g wɔ́, n kága pɔ́ mélà’mie lemÿɔg gẅi ka gÿo pi kúbe mà. Pi ka mÿɔgɔ nà ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi é le gɔɔn ngie peg ka gÿo tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ ná pi wɔ́,
en: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.

ngiemboon: á nue lemÿɔgɔ ná ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, à gÿo nyìŋ kúbe mà. Wɛ̌ lékúbe mà gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́, tà ńgwɔ́ nò á le pÿɔ́gɔ yé pá’ à mÿɔ̌g wɔ́. Tá lemÿɔg ná ntí ye pʉ̀a njÿó, à ná pɔ́ legwé.
en: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

ngiemboon: Pi líe pɔ́ mmó gie yɛ̌ ntí lemÿɔg, á nà ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, e ka gÿo ná pi tá ńgyá. Gyá gẅi lésẅɛte á fʉ̀’ gie nò áa ssé, gyá gẅi lélúɔ ngie mé lege mefʉa mí ńná né pi. Gyá gẅi lemÿɔgɔ nò yɔ́ɔn, gyá gẅi lépɔ́gɔ nò, gyá gẅi létsɔ́ɔn légyá wɔ̀ɔn, gyá gẅi lézeŋe nnɛ́, gyá gẅi lézáb ngɔ́’ twó nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌a nò. Pi ka lɔg meshÿó ntsèm ńda’te ngie pi ka tè gíŋe ńne ńzsé tsɔ́ nò ná yɔ̀ɔn nò wɔ́.
en: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea,whatclearing of yourselves, yea,whatindignation, yea,whatfear, yea,whatvehement desire, yea,whatzeal, yea,whatrevenge! In allthingsye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.

ngiemboon: Pá’ n ka ŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo pi la, n kɔ̌ɔn tě ńŋwe’e ńtí megàŋ mefʉa wɔ́, ńké tě ńŋwe’e ńtí nyìŋ gẅie mé gÿǒ nò tepòŋ ná yé wɔ́. N kɔ̌ɔn ńŋwe’e pɔ́ ngie pi tyé mvfò Ssé, ńgyá ntí gie pi lɔg sẅɛte ná nó yég.
en: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you,I did itnot for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.

ngiemboon: Ntse nÿɔ́g még zɔ̌ ka tè me ntsi’í ndà’ wɔ́, peg ka giŋé ńkẅi’i ńkág tɛ’ ná nò gie Titus ka ne ńkága yé, mbà pi metsèm gÿǒ ntʉ́m wé sẅéte.
en: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ka tyé mvfò Titus ńná’a ńdɔgɔ nò gí ńka’te. À piŋ fó lá’ pi, eshʉ́ ké té wɔ̀ɔn kú. Ammó gie peg kɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ nò gí ńka’te mvfò Titus mǒ, á ka piŋ ńkẅɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò nénʉ́, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ peg ee ńzɔ́gɔ shwóŋó gẅi pɔ́ nò nénʉ́.
en: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, whichI madebefore Titus, is found a truth.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á fó pú’u, n gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńkwoŋo gẅi pɔ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, ńnéŋe ne ńkímte pá’ pi metsèm ka pǔ ńtyé lé jú’ ncwò, mbɔɔ pá’ pi ka kúe yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ yé pá’ mé pɔ́gɔ mântúm, ńná nnɛ́ ssé mvfò yé.
en: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m bǔ ńne ńkága tɛ’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, n gʉa ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńtém nzèm yɔ̀ɔn ńná né pi, té pɔ́g.
en: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in allthings.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég, peg ne fa’a légÿo pi zsé mmó gie e Ssé ka cÿó gʉm mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée Makedonia pɔ́ gÿo.
en: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí ne ńkúu pʉ̀a Kristo wó tá’, ntʉ́m wɔ́b ne ńkága kǎg tɛ’. Pɔ́ tsɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepóŋ tɛ’ tá’, ńgẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo lénáa mmó tà á gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: how that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mmó gie mèŋ n ka gyá gyǎ, pɔ́ ka náa mmó gie pɔ́ ku’u léná tà ńgíŋ ńtɔ́g pá’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná, ńké ńkwoŋo kwoŋ tá ńnáa pú’u.
en: For totheirpower, I bear record, yea, and beyondtheirpowerthey werewilling of themselves;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka sẅíŋte wég tɛ’ ngie peg zẅíŋ pɔ́ náa yɔ́b mmó lélɔg ńkẅéte pʉ̀a Ssé pie ée Yerósalem.
en: praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, andtake upon usthe fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

ngiemboon: Peg la zɔɔn tè kwaŋ ngie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ náa mmó nzẅìŋ wɔ́ wɔ́, pɔ́ kɔ́ɔn ńnáa nzẅìŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ ka vɔg ńnyé wɔb le gwɔ́ á mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgíŋe tyé lézẅí’te kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie peg ge gɔɔn né pɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ pá’ e Ssé kwoŋ.
en: Andthis they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo peg sẅíŋte Titus ngie à gʉa lá’ pi, ńgÿo yɔɔn fà’a pòŋo ntʉ́m gie à la gÿo pi zye, á mege ńcʉ́me.
en: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

ngiemboon: Á tyé nà kɔ́ wɔ́ pi zɔ̌ ná fʉ̀’ mbòŋo, pi záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé mboŋó, ńzsé légɔɔn nò á kẅɛ, ńzsé nò Ssé kwà’ mboŋó, ńzeŋe nɛ́ ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńgẅiin nkwòŋe á nzèm peg, pú’u la pi gíŋ ńná fʉ̀’ mbòŋo á ná yɔɔn fà’a pòŋo ntʉ́m.
en: Therefore, as ye abound in everything, infaith, and utterance, and knowledge, andinall diligence, andinyour love to us,seethat ye abound in this grace also.

ngiemboon: N tě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńtsẅii pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò gie pi ge gÿo wɔ́. Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi pɔ́ pá’ metsɔ́ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo zeŋe nnɛ́ ńgÿo pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńnáa gẅi shÿó légÿo mé zsé ngie pi gẅiin nkwòŋe tà shwóŋó nò.
en: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ne ńzsé mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo la lɔg pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńná. À la gẅiin shúm ntsèm, tá’, ńcʉ́’ʉ mbóŋ ńtí gẅí, pá’ pi ge fó nà póŋ yé, é cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé náa shúm sé né pɔ́b tɛ’.
en: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ɔɔn éshwóŋ pi mmó gie mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ná yɔɔn nò nkáb. Á laa fʉ̀’ pá’ɔɔn pi zɔ̌ vɔgɔ lékwaŋte ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé náa mmó ńdɔg ńkẅéte pʉ̀a Kristo. Pi zɔ̌ gíŋe ḿvɔgɔ lézye. Ammó gie pi lɔɔn ńgÿo fʉ̀’ɔɔn á poŋ,
en: And herein I givemyadvice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

ngiemboon: áa pá’ pi ge cʉ́me yɛ̌ fà’ gie pi la zye. Pi gwɔ cʉ́me yɛ̌ fà’, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ à ná pɔ́ mmó gie à ku’u mǒ. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pi la lɔgɔ zeŋe nnɛ́ ńkwaŋte, pi gíŋ ńdɔgɔ zeŋe nnɛ́ ńgÿo.
en: Now therefore perform the doingof it; that asthere wasa readiness to will, sothere may bea performance also out of that which ye have.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ náa mmó ne ntʉ̀m mbòŋo, e Ssé gwɔ́ zẅíŋe mmó gie ngàŋ nǎ, éfó pɔ́ ná gie ngàŋ gẅiin, à tè fó ná gie ngàŋ tè gẅiin wɔ́.
en: For if there be first a willing mind,it isaccepted according to that a man hath,andnot according to that he hath not.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná yɔɔn nò, mé téen ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie nyìŋ náa mmó ńdɔg ńkẅéte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà ńzága yé wɔ́. Mé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅiin we méjʉ’.
en: ForI meannot that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò gie pege gɔɔn lɔɔn, pi zyɛ́bɛ mmó gie á zébe nà sí shúm ńnáa mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńzága, á cʉa pú’u, à lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ pi ne ńzága gí, pɔ́ zyɛ́bɛ mmó gie á zébe nà yɔ́b ńdɔg ńdẅíŋe gí, pia pɔ́ lɔg ńgẅiin mmó ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: but by an equality,thatnow at this time your abundancemay be a supplyfor their want, that their abundance also may bea supplyfor your want: that there may be equality:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńcʉ́me ná pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Nyìŋ gẅie à la lag shúm tà é gyɔ́ɔn la tè gẅiin tà é cʉa wɔ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à la lag shúm é té gyɔ́ɔn la tè tsɔ́ mmó zág.»
en: as it is written, He thathad gatheredmuch had nothing over; and he thathad gatheredlittle had no lack.

ngiemboon: Pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé á ná pá’ à gÿo Titus zeŋe nnɛ́ nà nò gí pá’ peg.
en: But thanksbeto God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo peg gɔɔn né yé ngie à piŋe lá’ pi ńdíe gẅí, á gwóon ńzẅíŋ. À tě ńtóo ńtí pɔ́ ndà’ pá’ peg tumó yé wɔ́, à ka ne ńkwaŋte létó ńgyá gẅí, tà mbùm yé ne ńzeŋe mǒ tɛ’.
en: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

ngiemboon: Peg tumó wɔ́b tsɔ̌ fɛ́ wégè. Á gwɔ́ gẅie mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm gÿo mekù’ mé tɛ’, éfóo nà yé ntí leneŋé twó nà Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo.
en: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praiseisin the gospel throughout all the churches;

ngiemboon: Peg zɔ tě ńtúmo yé gílé peg wɔ́, mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ka gǐŋ ńtsɔ́’ɔ yé ngie pega pɔ́ giŋe kwò, ńcú’te yɔɔn nkáb. Peg gÿo yɔɔn fà’a pòŋo ntʉ́m lélɔg ńgÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ̌ gẅiin legú’ mbɔɔ lélɔg ńnyɛ ngie peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lékẅéte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: and notthatonly, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, anddeclaration ofyour ready mind:

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zoonte wég ná wɔ̀ɔn máamáa mbwɔ́’ nkáb gẅie mé ne ńcubo ńge cʉ́me mbwo peg wɔ́.
en: avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légÿo mmó gie á té poŋ pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légÿo gie á ge gíŋe poŋ mbɔɔ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

ngiemboon: Peg tumó wɔ́b Titus, ńgíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́ fɛ́ wégè. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo lékẅéte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tɛ’. Peg zyé ńgyá pú’u, á nà menò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn mbùm ye gíŋe ńne ńzeŋe pá’ɔɔn tɛ’ létó ńgyá gẅi ńtí pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á tém nzèm yé ńná né pi té cÿɔ’.
en: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence whichI havein you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná Titus, mbà aa*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn, à ne ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn nà fà’ gie mèŋ fa’a ńtí gẅí, ńgʉa ná pɔɔn mefɛ́ pégè mépʉ́a, mbà pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pie mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo kà tumó wɔ́b, ée pʉ̀a pie yɔ́b fà’ kwé’e lezíŋ Kristo ńnáa tÿǒ.
en: Whetherany do enquireof Titus,he ismy partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethrenbe enquired of, they arethe messengers of the churches,andthe glory of Christ.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ lɔɔn ńtó, pi gÿo tà pɔ́ zsé ngie pi ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́b tà shwóŋó nò. Mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo lêen ńké ńzsé ngie peg lɔgɔ nò gí ńká’te mvfò pɔ́b pá’a éshwóŋó nò.
en: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà mmó lɔg ńkẅéte mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée Yerósalem, mbà mèŋ n gyǎ ngie á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n gíŋe ne ńŋwe’e nò mǒ ŋwe’e wɔ́.
en: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:

ngiemboon: Á nue mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie pi gẅiin pòŋo ńtʉ́m ná yɔɔn nò, tá mbà n ka lɔgɔ nò gí ńka’te mvfò pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Makedonia. Mèŋ n ka shwoŋó wɔ́b ngie pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée nà pàga ngwòŋ yé Akay, é tyé lénáa mmó tà fó fʉ̀’ pá’ɔɔn. Agẅi lézeŋe nnɛ́ ńnáa mmó ka gÿo lelÿò pʉ̀a ná pɔ́b gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m lénáa yɔ́b mmó.
en: for I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ, n túmo mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pá’ɔɔn, légwɔ́ gie le gwɔ́ gẅie peg ka lɔgɔ nò gí ńka’te ná yɔɔn nò. À tè cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi kwa’ ńtyé léná pá’ mèŋ n ka shwóŋ pʉ̀a,
en: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:

ngiemboon: á nue pega tsɔ́ pʉ̀a Makedonia lɔɔn ḿbú ńtó, ńké tè gyá pi tyé lénáa mmó wɔ́, mbà le gwɔ́ gie peg ka la’te mmó gie pi tyé légÿo, tà peg tè mʉ́’te, ge sele gÿo éshʉ́ kúu wég. Egẅí piŋ ńcʉa wég.
en: lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo n gyá ngie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ sẅíŋte mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pɔ̀ɔn, pɔ́ vɔgɔ mbʉ̀a pi tá peg táa ńtó, ḿvɔgɔ pú’u, lécú’te gí mmó gie pi ka lǎ’ ńka’ lélɔg ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńná, ńzsé ngie n ge gwɔ tó, á gwɔ́ tà’a jʉ’. Mé gyá ngie áa kwà’ mmó pòŋo ntʉ́m, tà á té mmó gie pi náa mé ne sẅɛ́ɛ gẅi sẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, asa matter ofbounty, and not asofcovetousness.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbye mmó á té gyɔ́ɔn, mbà á ge lá’a fʉ̀’e lélag shúm, à lag é le gyɔ́ɔn, ḿbye á gyɔ́ɔn, mbà á ge lá’a fʉ̀’e lélag shúm, à lag é gyɔ́ɔn.
en: But thisI say, He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á poŋ ngie awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ náa mmó pɔ́ pá’ à ně ńkwaŋte tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, ńná té ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ, té gwɔ́ gie mé sẅɛ́ɛ yé sẅɛ́, á nue e Ssé kwoŋo nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ lekág ńnáa mmó.
en: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart,so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńku’ pá’ ńgwɔ́ á ná shúm mbóŋo mentí mentí né pi, légwɔ́ gie pi ge gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm é gẅiin shúm sie é ne ńzɛ́te mbwo pi, tà gíŋ gẅiin mbɔɔ sie ńgwɔ́ pi lɔg fa’ mefà’ mbòŋo nzsè nzsè.
en: And Godisable to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in allthings, may abound to every good work:

ngiemboon: Apòŋo ntʉ́myé áa ntě ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: His righteousness remaineth for ever.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie aa náa mbyè mmó mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à pye, ńnáa mmó léjÿó á pfɛ́ɛ, à ge gÿo ké ne kẅi’i shúm sí kẅi’i, é gÿo e shʉ́a, légwɔ́ gie pi ge lɔgɔ pòŋo ntʉ́m é kẅi’i náa mmó né pʉ̀a.
en: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread foryourfood, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

ngiemboon: Á ge cʉa pú’u, pi gẅiin shúm lélɔg fa’ mefà’ pòŋo ntʉ́m ntí ntí, à cʉa pú’u, e pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé tɛ’, á nà nò shúm sie pi nǎ peg gaba mbwo pɔ́b.
en: being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie yɔɔn ncùb gie pi ma’a e tè gÿo pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Yerósalem é gẅiin pɔ́ mmó gie à zága mbwo pɔ́b ndà’ wɔ́, e ge gíŋe gÿo pʉ̀a kẅi’i ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé tɛ’.
en: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge zsé nzẅìŋ yɔɔn fà’, é gu’te Ssé ná pá’ pi ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò ná nò gie nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo ne ńgɔɔn. Pɔ́ ge gíŋe gu’te Ssé ná pá’ pi lɔgɔ́ pòŋo ntʉ́m, ńnáa mmó né pɔ́b tà mbɔɔ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and foryourliberal distribution unto them, and unto allmen;

ngiemboon: Anò gí ge kúu ntʉ́m pɔ́b, pɔ́ ńnéŋe ne sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó sí, á nue pɔ́ gyá ngie à cÿó gʉm gí, pi gẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo tɛ’, tà ne ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pá’ɔɔn.
en: and by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á poŋ ngie pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńtí fù’u té fʉ̀’ gie à la ná né pege.
en: Thanksbeunto God for his unspeakable gift.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Pɔl, mèŋ n ge lɔg pá’ Yěsô Kristo pʉ́le tɛ’ ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa pòŋo ntʉ́m, éshwóŋó gẅi tà’a nò. Aa kwà’ mèŋ pɔl wá gẅie mé gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n ge fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ń nẅéen nẅéen, ńké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gee ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pi tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne té pɔ́g la.
en: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presenceambase among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

ngiemboon: M bǔ’ mbwó mbwo pi ngie tà pi gÿo ná ntí gie mèŋ n ge gÿo tóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, é gɔɔn nò pɔ́ lê cÿɔ́g. Mèŋ n ge ké gÿo cÿɔ́g pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńgyá yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie peg gÿo yég kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ńdɔgɔ fa’a pɔ́ pì pá’ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: but I beseechyou, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

ngiemboon: Peg tsɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pá’ petsɔ́ tá’, e yeg ntí léma’ ncù e tè leen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

ngiemboon: Eshúm sie peg lɔgɔ ḿma’a ncù é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ se pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́, metʉ̀ mie ée mǒ fóo mbwo Ssé, légwɔ́ gie peg ge lɔg tágte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á tʉʉ twó. Peg ne ńjÿɔ́’ɔ menkwaŋá mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ me cÿɔ̌ nò.
en: (for the weapons of our warfarearenot carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńnyɛɛ ngie meshwóŋè mie pʉ̀a lɔgɔ ńŋá’te, é ne ńtáte pʉ̀a lézsé nò Ssé, é té tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, ńkaga tʉ̀ ńkúbe mmó gie pʉ̀a gẅiin ntʉ́m pɔ́b, ńgÿo pɛ̌ pʉ̀a cʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u pɔ́ ncwò Kristo.
en: casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi kag tʉ̀, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò Kristo ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńtʉʉ twó tʉ, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà peg tyé lénéŋ ngɔ́’ twó yé.
en: and having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ nà nzème pǐ. Pá’ áa pú’u la, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ Kristo, à cwoŋo ńzsé ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, mbà peg gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ yég pʉ̀a Kristo pá’ yé.
en: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ's, let him of himself think this again, that, as heisChrist's, even soarewe Christ's.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la zába wég, létyé mvfò ńgɔɔn nò né pi, lélɔg ńgÿo àcú’tè gí kẅi’i ńgʉa pɔ́ lê mvfò, á la tè lélɔg ńtág wɔ́. À lɔɔn fó ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ne ńdɔgɔ wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ ńka’te tà á cʉa, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ eshʉ́ le wɔ̀ɔn kú.
en: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:

ngiemboon: N te kwoŋo légwɔ́ mbwo pi, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’e mèŋ n kǔ’ pɔ́ létyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńdɔg ḿvege gẅi wɔ́.
en: that I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie pɔl túmo ŋwà’ne ńcÿɔ́gɔ tsoló tɛ’, ńgɔɔn nò á tʉ, ḿbiŋ ńtó tà ńtyé ssé ḿbÿɛ́, anò gie à gɔɔn té gíŋe ńcʉ́e wɔ́.
en: Forhisletters, say they,areweighty and powerful; buthisbodily presenceisweak, andhisspeech contemptible.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ gẅiin lézsé ngie, ammó gie peg gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne á fʉ̀’ gie peg ee ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, peg ge gÿo tó tà tyé mvfò pi é ké gÿo pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, suchwill we bealso in deed when we are present.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sele ńda’te pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée pɛ̌, mbà peg tè gẅiin shÿɔg légɔɔn ngie peg ee pá’ pɔ́b wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ peg é le lʉŋte ntyě wég nà ntí pʉ̀a ápɛ̌ wɔ́. Atwó yɔ́b té tyé. Pɔ́ pí fʉ̀’ yɔb pɔ́ ná pɔ́b, ńdʉŋte mennɛ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná peg, mbà ńgwɔ́ peg é le ka’te tà ńzyɛ́’ ndège wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ pú’u, peg gwɔ ka’te ńdɔg pɔ́ mejʉ’ mie e Ssé la cʉ́me mbwo peg pá’ peg ge gʉa wó. À la gÿo peg gʉa tà ńkúu mbɔɔ lá’ pi.
en: But we will not boast of things withoutourmeasure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

ngiemboon: Peg tě ge zyɛ́’ ndège fà’ yég pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie peg la zɔɔn tè gʉa tà ńkúu lá’ pi wɔ́ wɔ́. Peg pɔɔn zɔ la vɔg mvfò ńdɔg nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo ńtóo lá’ pi.
en: For we stretch not ourselves beyondour measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also inpreachingthe gospel of Christ:

ngiemboon: Peg tě ge ka’te tà zyá’ wég ndège fà’, é lɔgɔ fà’ pʉ̀a mendyɛ̀’ɛ é ka’te wɔ́. Pá’ pi ee nà wég ndège fà’ la, peg ne ńzẅí’te ngie à gẅì lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé kẅi’i ńgʉa pɔ́ lê mvfò. Anò gie peg ka gɔɔn à cʉŋ menŋàŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: not boasting of things withoutourmeasure,that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

ngiemboon: Peg lêen ńké fó pú’u, ńgʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ná metsɔ́ melá’ mie mé cʉa lá’ pi tá ńkúu wó, peg é le lɔgɔ fà’ gie petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ka fa’a nà yɔ́b gwǒŋo fà’ ńdɔg ńka’te wɔ́.
en: to preach the gospel in theregionsbeyond you,andnot to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

ngiemboon: Mé ké kímte pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo léka’te, á lɔg pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿǒ ńdɔg ńka’te.»
en: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅíŋe nò yé, à tè nyìŋ gẅie yé zɔ la’te mmó gie à gÿǒ wɔ́. À gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ la’te mmó gie ngàŋ gÿǒ.
en: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

ngiemboon: N kwǎŋ ngie n dɔɔn ńgɔɔn yɔ́ɔn nò mbwo pi pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à pʉ̌a la, mbà pi ge zẅíŋ, pi ké ńcʉ́’ n gɔɔn ná yɛ̌ ntí.
en: Would to God ye could bear with me a little inmyfolly: and indeed bear with me.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n kwoŋo gẅi tà mèŋ n te zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ gwaa gÿo mmó ná pi n ne ńgyá wɔ́. Yɛ̌ ntí nkwòŋo gie mèŋ n gẅiin nzèm pi e fóo pɔ́ mbwo Ssé, mélà’mie pi ée mbwo mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ pá’ múɔ manzwě gẅie mèŋ n da pÿé mbwo tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́, angàŋ gwɔ́ Kristo. Mèŋ n ne ńda’te gẅi mbwo yé ngie pi ee pá’ mûɔ ngùɔ gẅie à kaa tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ kaa.
en: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may presentyou asa chaste virgin to Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá’ n kě ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ́ ngie, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉŋte twó gí pá’ nnú la pá’ legyè, éfʉte Eva, pi le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gwɔ gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ ndà’ nò Kristo ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò wɔ́.
en: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue mèŋ n ne ńgyá ngie nyìŋ léen ńgwɔ́ tà ńtó, éshwóŋó gẅi nò ná tsɔ̌ Yěsô, á ké tè gẅie peg la gɔɔn nò ná yé wɔ́, pi gwóon ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋe ne ńgyá, nyìŋ tó ńgɔɔn nò ndyɛ̀’ɛ ná Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, kà pɔ́ nà nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔ́, á ké tè pumte nà menò mie pi la vɔg ńzẅíŋ wɔ́, pi zẅíŋ zẅǐŋ.
en: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, orifye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear withhim.

ngiemboon: Tá n ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́ɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie pi gyá ngie pɔ́ ée memǎ megàŋ ntúm Yěsô lɛ, pɔ́ té cʉa wɔ̀ɔn nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ áa nò ngie mèŋ m bubte pubte tá’, ńgʉa nà le zsé nò Ssé, atsɔ́*lɔ̌’ té kẅɛ. Peg léen ńnyɛɛ wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ mbwo pi á nà mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm gẅie á la ná shÿó.
en: But thoughI berude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé mbwo pi, ńtsẅi pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ. Esẅí’i mbùm yɔ̀ɔn ńnáa ssé, lélɔg ńka’a pwó gí ńnáa tÿǒ pé’è á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ keen?
en: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

ngiemboon: N da ne fa’a lá’ pi, ńzẅíŋ petsɔ́ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo zɔ̌ ne ńnáa nkáb né mèŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńtóonte wɔ̀ɔn tà ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie n da gÿo pɔ́ fÿɔg.
en: I robbed other churches, taking wagesof them, to do you service.

ngiemboon: N daa lá’ pi, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’e n zága mmó, n te kẅé mmó mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́. Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie é la fó Makedonia la náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á la ne ńzága mbwo mèŋ. Á la gʉa nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, n te zẅíŋe légwɔ́ pì’ á mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́, é ké le lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá gwɔ́ pì’ mbwo tsɔ́ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́.
en: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in allthingsI have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, andsowill I keepmyself.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge fó nà nò nénʉ́ Kristo gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ, é gɔɔn mbwo pi ngie, n dɔɔn ńgʉa pɔ́ nzɔ̌ jʉ’ á tsɛ̀ɛ Akay wɔ́, n de gwá’a wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ gẅie n dɔg ńka’te wɔ́. N te lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ é kẅé mmó mbwo nyìŋ gẅì wɔ́.
en: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pú’u, mélà’a kɔ́? Áa nue mèŋ n te gẅi kwoŋ keen? Ngǎŋ, e Ssé ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n kwoŋo gẅí.
en: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie n ne ńgÿo, n ge gíŋe kẅi’i gÿo pɔ́ pú’u, lɔg gʉa lê mvfò, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg zá’ mekwò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne fa’a ndilétáŋ lélɔg ńka’te ńgɔɔn ngie pega pɔ́ pǔ fa’a pɔ́ tà’ ntí.
en: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ápɛ̌ é té kwà’ megàŋ ntúm Kristo wɔ́, pɔ́ cÿɔ nò ngie pɔ́ fa’a fà’ Kristo. Mbà pɔ́ léen ńgÿo tà ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńgyá wɔ́b mé gɔɔn ngie ée megàŋ ntúm Yěsô.
en: For sucharefalse apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

ngiemboon: Á té pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn wɔ́, á nue Sátà giŋé ńnéŋe yé tà sele ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à fóo jʉ’ gie kyɛ̀’ áa wó la.
en: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie, á té tʉʉ mbwo pafa’ fà’ Sátà lésele tà mé cʉ́’ ńgyá wɔ́b ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ée pafa’a fà’ Ssé wɔ́. Tá’ á ge ké lá’ cʉ́’ʉ nzsòte, pɔ́ kẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mefà’ mɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: Thereforeit isno great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

ngiemboon: Tà méŋ n gíŋe shwóŋó gẅí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ gẅì lékwaŋ ngie n gee pʉ̀a, ńkwoŋ pi kwaŋ, ńzẅíŋ ngie n gÿo pá’ pʉ̀a la, n zẅɛ́’ yɔ́ɔn ńná’a ńka’te mêjʉ’.
en: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

ngiemboon: Pá’ á gwɔ̌ légwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ge ka’te la, ammó gie n gee ńgɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn, n tě ge gɔɔn ná ntí gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. N ge gɔɔn pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie n kwǎ’ ḿbʉ́a la.
en: That which I speak, I speakitnot after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ shúm sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ se pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńka’te, pú’u la, n ge ka’te yɔ́ɔn.
en: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńkwaŋa ngie legyè sí ée wó, tá á ké yɛ̂ gie pi zẅiŋé nò mepʉ̀a lɛ!
en: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing yeyourselvesare wise.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ne ńdɔgɔ gẅi ńgÿo menkwɔɔn pɔ́b, pi fa’a pɔ́ jÿó, pɔ́ ne ńjʉʉ shúm sí, ńne ńnwile gẅí, ńtúu pwó legɔ̌’ pi, pi zẅíŋe zẅǐŋ.
en: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devouryou, if a man takeof you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńná’a fʉ’ʉ fʉ’ʉ ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó ńka’te, mbà mèŋ n ge ka’te cʉa yé, é gɔɔn nò pá’ pʉ̀a la.
en: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Heber ńka’te keen? Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌. Kà pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Israel? Mbà mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌. Kà pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a ná ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam? Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔɔn n gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌.
en: Are they Hebrews? soamI. Are they Israelites? soamI. Are they the seed of Abraham? soamI.

ngiemboon: Kà pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ée pafa’a fà’ Kristo? Mbà mèŋ n ge gɔɔn nò kwà’ pá’ pʉ̀a la, é gɔɔn ngie n gee nyiŋ gẅie a fà’ Kristo tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɔ́b métsèm, é gɔɔn pú’u, éfóo ná pá’ n dǎ téŋe zì’i ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo ná nzẅìŋ gẅie n dǎ kúu tsǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo ná nzẅìŋ gẅie mé lǎ cúɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo ná nzẅìŋ mengʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mie legwé la ńnÿɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńcʉa wɔ́b,
en: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) Iammore; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a méntʉ̀a pá’ pà Yuda cǔa wɔ̀ɔn mengwɔ̀ɔn ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm tá,
en: Of the Jews five times received I fortystripessave one.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ pà*Roma lǎ lɔgɔ tsěme mmó ńcúa wɔ̀ɔn, mé la lɔg mentóon ńtéme wɔ̀ɔn tà’ legʉ̀a, éfa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn, ée ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ á lǎ cʉ́’ʉ mêjʉ’, stima lɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn fÿɛ́ɛ ntse. N dǎ lá’a ndùm ntse tà ńgíŋe ńzɔ́g.
en: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

ngiemboon: N dǎ giŋ tɛ’, legwé nÿɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, ńgwá ńgyá ngɔ́’ mentse mie é kwɔ̌’ tà sa jʉ’, ńgwá ńgwe nà mbwo mesèm ncwò, ńgwá ńgwe nà mbwo mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pà Yuda, ńgwá ńgwe nà mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ńgwá ńkúu nò tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ, ńgwá ńkúu nò kwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńgwá ńkúu nò tsɛ̀ ntse té pàa, ńgwá ńkúu nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ cÿɔ nò ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Kristo,
en: injourneyings often,inperils of waters,inperils of robbers,inperils bymine owncountrymen,inperils by the heathen,inperils in the city,inperils in the wilderness,inperils in the sea,inperils among false brethren;

ngiemboon: ńgwá fa’ mefà’ mie é tʉ̀ tà ńjú’ ńkʉ́a tɛ’, ńgwá ńdá’ té lyé. Nzyè gwá ńgyáŋa wɔ̀ɔn, agág yɔ́ɔn gwá shÿó, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, eshúm léjÿó pú ḿmaga mbwo mèŋ, efÿɔ́g gwá ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn, mbà mèŋ n zǎg nzsǒ.
en: in weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

ngiemboon: N kaa tʉ́ ntsèm wɔ́, áa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm mèŋ n ne sáŋa nò ná mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée jʉ’ ntsèm,
en: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ Kristo lɔɔn ḿbÿɛ́ n jú’ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ m bÿɛ̌ yɔ́ɔn ma, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ Kristo lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, á gege wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’.
en: Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?

ngiemboon: Á gwé’e ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé ka’te, mbà ńgwɔ́ ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ m bÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌ ńka’te.
en: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie aa tá pà Ndè wege Yěsô Kristo, yé Ssé gẅie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gu’te yé té zá’a pàa, à ne ńzsé ngie n tě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńcÿɔ nò wɔ́.
en: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’e n daa tÿǒsoŋo Ndamas, ngúmnɔ́ɔn gẅie fùɔ Aristate la zába yé, á tsẅi mé ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mencwò nká’a tÿǒsoŋ, éfa’a légwoon wɔ̀ɔn.
en: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:

ngiemboon: Tá mé ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ kekág, éfó nà tsɔ́ tɔ́g gie áa nà nká’ ńtsege wɔ̀ɔn, ésẅí’i wɔ̀ɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ ssé, tá mèŋ n tsẅɛ́ɛ yé.
en: and through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńka’te ńdɔg ńgʉa lê mvfò la? Á tè kẅéte légÿo pú’u wɔ́. Tá’ n ge ké shwóŋó gẅi nò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ná shúm sie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gyá mbɔɔ sie n da gyá pá’ fʉ̀’ gie n dyé njÿòon la.
en: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à la la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ nê legém pá’ e Ssé la kaa yé ńdɔg ńkwɔ́’ kwɔ́’ tà ńkúu tàa tÿǒ lépwóKà á laa pú’u, kwà’ yé zɔ̌ gʉa wó wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n kaa zsé, kà à la lyé pɔ́ njÿòon wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n kaa zsé. E Ssé zɔ ne ńzsé.
en: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ n dɔgɔ nyìŋ áwɛ̌ ńka’te. Tá ńgʉa nà lelɔgɔ twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ńka’te, mbà ńgwɔ́ n gwɔ lɔg ka’te, éfó pɔ́ ná pá’ mèŋ m bÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌.
en: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

ngiemboon: N gwé’e ńge lɔgɔ twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ka’te, mbà mèŋ n tě ńdɔgɔ ḿbʉ́a pʉ̌a wɔ́, á nue n ge gɔɔn pɔ́ nò nénʉ́. Tá’ n tě ńgee ńka’te wɔ́, ḿbɔgɔ mé légyá wɔ̀ɔn ńcʉa mmó gie mé ne ńgyá n gÿo, tà mbɔɔ gie mèŋ n ne ńgɔɔn.
en: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: butnowI forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth meto be, orthathe heareth of me.

ngiemboon: Pá’ n da gyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn la, e Ssé gyá ngie ńgwaa ńgwɔ́ n dɔg ńŋá’te, ńzẅíŋ mântúm Sátà ńnéŋe ńcúa wɔ̀ɔn, é gwɔ́ ngɔ́’ gie e la kúu ná mèŋ pá’ nzóŋ gie e lé’e ná mèŋ ńne ńnéŋe ńgége wɔ̀ɔn la, pú’u, légwɔ́ gie n te ka’te wɔ́,
en: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ mèŋ sẅiŋté Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ngie à fó ná mèŋ ńkẅile yɛ̌ ngɔ́’,
en: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

ngiemboon: é sẅíŋte yé pú’u, á tsɔ́’ ngie, mèŋ n ne ńdíe gú, ńkẅéte gú, ajú ku’ pú’u, á nue ɔ̀ gwɔ̌ tà ne ḿbÿɛ́ɛ pÿɛ̌ tá ńdɔg ńná shÿó pá’ mɔ́ɔn metʉ̀ ge cwoŋo fa’. Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n kwoŋo lévɔg ńdɔg pá’ ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌ ńka’te, pú’u, ńzsé ngie metʉ̀ Kristo ge tó é gwɔ́ ná mèŋ.
en: And he said unto me,My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness.Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo n gwɔ́ tà ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, mélà’mie mèŋ n gee nyìŋ Kristo, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn, ńgwɔ́ tà ne ńzága mmó, kà mé ne ńkʉ́e wɔ̀ɔn kʉ́e wɔ́, kà mèŋ ne sáŋa pɔ́ tsɔ́ menò kékáŋ wɔ́, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn poŋ, á nue n gwɔ́ tá ne ḿbÿɛ́ɛ pÿɛ̌ tá ńdeen ńké ńjú’ ńgẅiin tʉ̀.
en: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’ ń cʉ’ʉ shwóŋó pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a la, á ke fóo pɔ́ né pi, á nue pi zɔ ka gẅiin légÿo mé zsé yɔɔn ntí lefa’. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ mèŋ n gee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi n te ná tsɔ́ mmó ku’. Epʉ̀a pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi mé tóŋo lê kwà’ ngàŋ ntúm lɛ, pɔ́ kaa gÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà ńdɔg ńcʉa wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́
en: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

ngiemboon: Á kaa fʉ̀’ gie n kaa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi kwa’ ńgyá meliŋé mie é la’te ngie mèŋ n gee kwà’ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. Á gwɔ́ pá’ yɛ̌ ngɔ́’ wɔ́ kɔ̌ɔn ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn mèŋ shÿɔgɔ shÿɔg, á gwɔ́ pá’ pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgyá meliŋé menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, ńgíŋe ńgyá ndàa gyá menò.
en: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

ngiemboon: Àpì yɔ́ɔn mie metsɔ́ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo la jÿó ńcʉa gẅi áa kɔ́? Kà á fó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ n da tè nkáb gí kẅé. Pi gyá wɛ̌ légwɔ́ tě ńdɔgɔ ńgiŋe wɔ́. Pi ké ńdege ńná né mèŋ la.
en: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, exceptit bethat I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.

ngiemboon: À yɔɔn gie mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa létóo lá’ pi ná mbɔ́ɔntè yétá lɔɔn. Tá mèŋ n ge tó, pi ké le tsɔ̌ pyé twó mèŋ táŋ, á nue mèŋ n tě ńtóo fa’ shúm sí wɔ́, mèŋ n tóo pɔ́ fǎ’ pi. Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pá’a, gígyé penkʉ́ zɔ tè gẅiin lélab nkáb ńná né metá pɔ́b wɔ́, metá zɔ̌ gẅiin lélab nkáb ńná né penkʉ́ pɔ́b.
en: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not your's, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á poŋo wɔ̀ɔn poŋ lénáa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mèŋ n gẅiin né pi. Ngwɔ́ n gíŋe ńná mbɔɔ twó yɔ́ɔn ńtí gẅí. N dɔɔn ne ńkẅi’i ńkwoŋo gẅi pɔ́ nzẅìŋó, egì kwoŋo nzèm mèŋ ne ńtsẅɛ́te tsẅɛté lá?
en: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ndyɛ̌’ á fó ná pá’ n da tè zẅíŋ pi táŋa pyé twó mèŋ wɔ́, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ne ńgɔɔn ngie legyè sɔ́ɔn ée wó tɛ’, mèŋ n ne ńdɔgɔ legyè tá ńkẅé nkáb mbwo pi.
en: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n ne ńzɛ́te gẅi ngie n da túm pʉ̀a mbwo pi pé’è pɔ́ ke ńtó ńkẅé tsɔ́ mmó gí ka?
en: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

ngiemboon: N da sẅíŋte Titus ngie à gʉa tà ńgyá gẅí, ńtúmo wɔ́b wetsɔ́ fɛ́ wege gẅie pi ne ńzsé yé la. Tsye Titus la tó fʉte gẅi ńkẅé tsɔ́ mmó mbwo pi ka? À la tè giŋ pɔ́ nà mekwò mɔ́ɔn maa? Peg yé ké tè gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ nkwaŋá waa?
en: I desired Titus, and withhimI sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit?walked wenot in the same steps?

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ tsɔ́, mbà pi ně ńdá’ ńzye lékwaŋ ngie peg ne fa’a lézoŋo twó yég mbwo pi. Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́. Peg gwɔ́ gɔɔn nò, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà ntí gie Kristo ne ńkwoŋo, peg piŋ ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò Ssé tá ńgɔɔn. Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, peg gwɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńgÿo, pi kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé.
en: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: butwe doall things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

ngiemboon: N zɔɔn ne ḿbɔ́gɔ légwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gÿo tóo lá’ pi, ńgyá pi le gwɔ́ nà ntí gie mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. Mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ké le gwɔ́ nà ntí gie pi ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. Mèŋ n ne ḿbɔ́gɔ ngie ńgwɔ́ n gwɔ́ tó mencwò mencwò gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, kègɔ́’ gwɔ́ wó, acÿɔ́g gwɔ́ wó, lézoŋ jʉ’ gwɔ́ wó, lekimé nyìŋ tepòŋ gwɔ́ wó, shwóŋte gwɔ́ wó, aŋá’te nɛ́ gwɔ́ wó, atág gwɔ́ wó.
en: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, andthatI shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lestthere bedebates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n giŋé ńne ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo ńgíŋe ńtó tà ńkúu lá’ pi, e Ssé yɔ̀ɔn gíŋe sẅí’i nzẅìŋ wɔ̀ɔn mvfò pi tà ndyɛ̌’ tsɔ́ n gẅiin lélʉa ńtí pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔɔn pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo menò tepòŋ, pɔ́ laa mà wɔ́b kúbe, pɔ́ laa kẅɛɛ nà menò ncÿǒ mɔ́b wɔ́, ńké tè nò mpfwɔ́’ yɔ́b gwá’, ńké ne ńkẅi’i ńgÿo pɔ́ menò tepòŋ ntí ntí té gwoonte mbùm yɔb.
en: andlest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, andthatI shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge tóo mbʉ̀a pi fʉ̀’ɔɔn e lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá, é tó mé gwɔ́ ŋág mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ntsaŋ wɔ́, é zẅí’te nò ncwò pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kà pʉ̀a métá wɔ́ pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé ne ńgɔɔn.
en: Thisisthe thirdtimeI am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge tʉ́ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, é gíŋ gɔɔn nò mbwo pʉ̀a pie á la gwaa gwɔ́ setsɔ́ lekwò, mbà pɔ́ gÿo menò tepòŋ mbɔɔ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm. Áa nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mèŋ n te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́, tá mèŋ n ge kímte gẅi nò gie n da gɔɔn né pi á fʉ̀’ gie n da tóo lá’ pi ná mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a. Mèŋ n da gɔɔn ngie n ge gÿo tó, é néŋ ntsaŋ twó mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à fʉ̌a nò.
en: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi ké ne fa’a légyá mmó gie á nyɛɛ ngie anò gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò mèŋ á fóo mbwo Kristo la, pi ge ké gÿo gyá. Pi zsé ngie Kristo tè ne ńzɔ́bte gẅi wɔ́. À ne ńnyɛɛ metʉ̀ mé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie à laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, ḿbÿɛ́ pá’ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mé kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Tá’ à ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ntentʉ́, é gwɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé. Peg yég, peg fó ná pá’ peg la nnɛ́ ná yé, ḿbÿɛ́ pá’ à la gwɔ́. Tá’ é ké gÿo lɔg yeg ntí légẅiin gẅí, é nyɛɛ gẅi ngie pega Kristo ee ntentʉ́, é gwɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé.
en: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.

ngiemboon: Pi lê twó gí pi líe mbùm gí ńgyá. Kà pi ne ńgiŋe ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná nò Kristo gie pi la zẅíŋ wɔ́. Pi nyɛte ńtsa’. Pi tè ne ńgyá ngie Kristo aa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi wɔ́ ka? Á gwé’e pé’è á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pi tè pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́.
en: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?

ngiemboon: N kwǎŋ ngie pi ge zẅíŋ ngie á gʉa ná peg, mbà peg kéen ńnyɛ kwà’ mboŋó ngie peg ee mengàŋ ntúm Kristo.
en: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.

ngiemboon: Peg ne sẅíŋte Ssé ngie à kẅéte gẅi tà pi le gÿo sɔɔn nò tepòŋ wɔ́. N ké tě ńdɔgɔ fa’a pú’u, pɔ́ légÿo tá pi gyá ngie peg ee ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo wɔ́. Peg tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ ngie pi gÿo nò mbòŋo tà mbɔɔ pá’ fà’a yég ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fà’ gie mé gwág gwǎg.
en: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ létóon nò gie áa nénʉ̀, peg tè gẅiin létáte nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ná mánzsè Ssé, ńgwɔ́ metʉ̀ pʉ̀a, peg gwɔ́ yég mǒ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepepÿɛ́ɛ pʉ̀a, mbà nò ge poŋo wég poŋ. Áa mmó gie á gÿo peg gwɔ́ tà ne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńdúɔ ngie à gÿo pi giŋ pɔ́ ná mánzsè we tà ńcʉ́me.
en: For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish,evenyour perfection.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ, n nyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ńŋwe’e yɔɔn nò ntsèm, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie n te gÿo tó tà kúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi é lɔg pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn mvfò pi, é cÿɔ́gɔ gẅi cÿɔ́g wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn mvfò pi pɔ́ légÿo acú’tè kẅi’i ńgʉa lê mvfò. À la tè tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n tág tág wɔ́.
en: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.

ngiemboon: Á nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi ńnéŋe nê lekág. Pi ne fa’a shÿó pá’ tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ té ge gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́. Pi ne ńkẅiŋte mennɛ́ mí. Pi ne ńgẅiin tà’ ncwò, ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè, à cʉa pú’u, e Ssé, yé gẅie à gẅiin nkwòŋe pɔ́ mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi tsyɛ’te fɛ́ we, nyìŋ tsyɛ’te fɛ́ we, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te ńtáŋte mennɛ́ mí nà ntí yé pʉ̀a Ssé. Mecú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm pǔ ńtsyɛ’te gẅí.
en: Greet one another with an holy kiss.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm, nkwòŋo Ssé mbɔɔ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie á témte wege ne ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi metsèm.
en: All the saints salute you.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo, mbà pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ̌ la tè wɔ̀ɔn tsɔ́’, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ̌ ké tè wɔ̀ɔn túm. Yěsô Kristo pɔ́ Ssé Tá zɔ̌ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn. Yé Tá la gÿo Yěsô zíme ná legwé.
en: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)

ngiemboon: Pega mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pega pɔ̌ ee jʉ’ɔɔn pǔ ńnáa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mbwo mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galatia.
en: and all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅéte ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeto you and peace from God the Father, andfromour Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé ngie Kristo yé máŋwɛ́ la náa twó yé nà menò tepòŋ mégè lélɔg sẅɛ’ ndòon yege, pú’u léfó mbwo yɔɔn kème njÿó gie á té poŋ ńkẅile wégè. Mɔɔn menò gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Tá wege Ssé la záb.
en: who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a mesoŋ gu’te Ssé mengù’u mengù’, Ameŋ.
en: to whombeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Á pǔ ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’ ná pá’ e Ssé ka cʉa ná Kristo, ńtóŋo gẅí, ńcÿó gʉm gí, n ka léen ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pi sele nzèm ye, tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u pɔ́ tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo we ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:

ngiemboon: N tě ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie etsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, tsɔ́ pʉ̀a zɔ̌ ssé ńne ḿbue twó gi, ńne fa’a lékúbe nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo.
en: which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg kéen ńdá’ ńtswi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi. Tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńtó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, kà pɔ́ nyìŋ weg wɔ́, kà pɔ́*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, éfóo tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́, ńtsẅi tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo we ndyɛ̀’ɛ mbwo pi, tà é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅie peg ka tsẅi wɔ́, mbà á zɛ́te ngie Ssé néŋ ndòon twó ngàŋ.
en: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

ngiemboon: Peg ka zɔɔn ńgɔɔn né pi. Mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgíŋe ńkímte kimtě ngie, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtó ńtsẅi tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo we ndyɛ̀’ɛ mbwo pi, tà é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅie peg ka tsẅǐ wɔ́, mbà á zɛ́te ngie e Ssé néŋ ndòon twó ngàŋ.
en: As we said before, so say I now again, If anymanpreach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

ngiemboon: Pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn, anò gie mèŋ fóo légɔɔn lɔɔn, á nyɛɛ ngie mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie nò yɔ́ɔn poŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ kà ngie à poŋ pɔ́ Ssé? Mèŋ n gee pá’a ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ka? Á gwé’e pé’è, mèŋ n ne fa’a mbɔɔ légÿo mmó gie á poŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà mèŋ n te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kwa’ fa’a fà’a Kristo wɔ́.
en: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie pi la jú’ n tsẅi é té nkwaŋá nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ la zɔɔn tè cʉ́me wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. Nyìŋ mesoŋ ké tè wɔ̀ɔn zí’i, Yěsô Kristo zɔ la gÿo mèŋ n zsé.
en: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taughtit, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ pi la zɔɔn ńjú’ pá’ n dɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pú’u, á fʉ̀’ gie n da nyé ńgu’te Ssé nà ntí ye pà Yuda. Pi ne ńzsé ntí gie n dɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ sá’a tʉ̀ ńtsɔ́’ɔ kwò cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé té poŋ ḿbiŋe fa’a lépú ḿbyág pú’u.
en: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews' religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà legu’te Ssé nà ntí ye pà Yuda, mbà n daa mǒ tà ḿbú ńcʉa kwò nkàŋ yég púɔ pà Yuda. N dɔ̌ɔn ḿbú ḿma’a mbùm yɔ̀ɔn tɛ’ ná mà gẅie metá pég la zí’i wég, ńcʉa wɔ́b.
en: and profited in the Jews' religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

ngiemboon: Ká’a mbà n da nyé pɔ́ lepfòm, e Ssé tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn, ńgÿo ńcÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn, ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà mé mbwo.
en: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and calledmeby his grace,

ngiemboon: À la piŋ ńnéŋe tà ńgyá ngie à ge gÿo mèŋ n zsé Míŋ we, légwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ge gʉa tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é líe Míŋ we ŋwɛ́ á mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́. Mèŋ n gya míŋ we ŋwɛ́, n te gwóon ḿbíge tsɔ́ nyìŋ tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

ngiemboon: N ké tè pʉʉ Yerósalem, ńgyá pʉ̀a pie é la vɔg ńgwɔ́ megàŋ ntúm Yěsô tá mèŋ n tó yɔ́ɔn mɔ́; tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà mèŋ n da gwóon ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ Arabia, ńgÿo ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe tÿǒsoŋ Ndamas.
en: neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.

ngiemboon: N da lá’ ńgwɔ́ pʉʉ Yerósalem légʉa ńgyá Piɛpeg yé zséte, mbà é cʉ̌a ngù’ tá. N kúu wó peg yé ńnéŋe lyɛ̌’ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̀a nê legém,
en: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

ngiemboon: é té ndà’ yé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n da tè gíŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô we ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, n da gíŋ ńgyá pɔ́ Jâg fɛ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord's brother.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mèŋ n ŋwe’e shwóŋó gẅi lɔɔn, áa nénʉ́. Mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn mvfò Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n tě ńcÿɔ nò wɔ́.
en: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

ngiemboon: N da pɔ́ɔnte ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ ngwòŋ Siria mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ me Silisia,
en: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ ne gwaa giŋe fa’a pú’u, mbà pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Jẅidea laa zí shÿó wɔ̀ɔn gyá.
en: and was unknown by face unto the churches of Judæa which were in Christ:

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ la jú’ pɔ́ pá’ mé ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńne ńtsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́b té poŋ la, aa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, ńgɔɔn nò ná lezáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô gẅie à laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ésá’a tʉ̀ pɔ́ lépyág la.
en: but they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ ne ńgu’te Ssé ńtí wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And they glorified God in me.

ngiemboon: Ńdá’ ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ piŋe Yerósalem, mbà é cʉ̌a ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa nê legém, ńgwaa piŋ pú’u, peg Panebâse gwɔ́, ńgíŋ ńdɔg mbɔɔ Titus ńgʉa.
en: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus withmealso.

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌ɔn ńgee wó, mélà’mie e Ssé la gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gʉa wó. N da tóo wó, ńkyagte nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie mèŋ n tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, éshwóŋ pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b ngie ée melÿò. Pega pɔ̌ ńnéŋe pɔ́ jʉ’ʉ ntsèm tá mèŋ n kyagte shwóŋó wɔ́b. Pú’u, nue n da tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie à fà’ gie n dǎ fa’ mbɔɔ gie mèŋ n ne fa’a à cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.

ngiemboon: Titus gẅie peg yé la gwɔ́, laa nyìŋ Gelekia, tá’ tà mbɔɔ pú’u, pɔ́ ké tè sẅɛ́ɛ yé ngie à zẅíŋ mé pú’u yé tá à gwɔ́ nyìŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pá’ tsɔ́ pàcÿɔ nò ngie pɔ́ ée mefɛ́ pég la ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé pú’u yé. Pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ la shú ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ yég pá’ pà mánaŋ. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóo lé gyá pá’ peg ee pà ndù nnɛ́ ná mà pà Yuda, ńcʉa ná Yěsô Kristo ńgÿo még menò pú’u. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn fa’a lé lɔgɔ wég ńgÿo menkwɔɔn.
en: and that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:

ngiemboon: Tá’ peg la tè zẅíŋe tsɔ́ nò mbwo pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ lé ná’a ńzẅíŋ tá ḿbiŋ ńdʉ’. Pú’u, le gwɔ́ gie nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ge tyé pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ é gwɔ́, pi zẅɛ́’.
en: to whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ee melÿò, mbà pɔ́ la tè gyá ngie pɔ́ ge kẅi’i tsɔ́ mmó ná nò gie mèŋ n tsẅii wɔ́. Ammó gie pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ fʉ̀’e mvfò á té líe wɔ̀ɔn nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Á nue e Ssé tè gẅiin tyɛ̀’te ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man's person:) for they who seemedto be somewhatin conference added nothing to me:

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà pɔ́ la gyá pɔ́ ngie Ssé la cʉ́me létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo né pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ á mbwo mèŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la cʉ́me mbwo Piɛ létsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée pà Yuda.
en: but contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, asthe gospelof the circumcisionwasunto Peter;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie e Ssé gẅie à la zɔɔn ńnáa Piɛ tʉ̀, ńtúmo yé mbwo pà Yuda, yé zɔ la gíŋ ńnáa wɔ̀ɔn tʉ̀ ńtúm wɔ̀ɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: (for he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)

ngiemboon: Jâg, Piɛ mbɔɔ Jâŋ, é pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b pá’ mentóon tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo la, la gwɔ́ tà ńzsé ngie e Ssé la kwa’ ńcʉ́me yɔɔn fà’ mbwo mèŋ, ńnáa pwó né peg Panebâse, lélɔg ńda’te ngie pega pɔ̌ ee tà’ ncwò nà fà’a Ssé. Pú’u, peg gẅiin légʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, pɔ́b yɔ́b pâ Piɛ gẅiin légʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda ńtsẅi.
en: and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that weshould gounto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né peg pɔ́ ndà’ ngie peg kímte mépoŋ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo Yerósalem. N ka kě ńkímte wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó.
en: Onlythey wouldthat we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Piɛ la gÿo ńtóo Antiokia mèŋ shʉa shʉa ńtyé mvfò lá’ ńdʉ’ʉ mmó gie à gÿǒ, á nue à la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à fʉ̌a nò.
en: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ pá’, pʉ̀a pie Jâg la túm, la gwaa tó, Piɛ pâ pʉ̀a Kristo pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ne ńteme ńjÿó mmó. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tà ńtó á lɔg pɔ́ ndɔ́ɔn ndɔ́ɔn ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, pâ pɔ̌ cʉ́’ʉ ńteme mmó wɔ́, á nue à la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ nò gie pʉ̀a pie é kẅite nò lépú’ pʉ̀a ge gɔɔn ná yé.
en: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie é laa Antiokia ńgwɔ́ pà Yuda, gíŋ ńkẅɛ yɔ́b pà zẅíŋe ncwò ńdʉ’ʉ lóŋ pá’ Piɛ. Á gwɔ́ gwɔ̌ tà kwà’ Panebâse gíŋe ńgÿo yé pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.

ngiemboon: Tá’ n da gwɔ́ tà ńgyá ngie pɔ́ té ně ńgiŋe ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná pá’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́, éshʉa shʉa ńtyé mvfò lá’, ńgɔɔn mbwo Piɛ ngie: Gù gẅie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ Yuda, ɔ̀ kɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn á nà ntí gie pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ne ńnéŋe, tà ɔ̀ tè ńnéŋe pá’ nyìŋ Yuda wɔ́. Ɔ̀ piŋe fa’a lésẅɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, léńnéŋe pá’ pà Yuda mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter beforethemall, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn né Piɛ pá’ɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pega pɔ̌, é pà Yuda tà fó lyɛ’ɛ́ nzyé, peg tè pʉ̀a pie é kaa ndòon pá’ petsɔ́ melá’, e mie é té zsé*lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́.
en: Wewho areJews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,

ngiemboon: Tá’ peg ké ně ńzsé ngie nyìŋ mésoŋ tè gwaa gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé cʉ̌’ ńdíe yé pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, á fóo ná pá’ ngàŋ gɔɔn ngie à kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́. Á zɛ́te pɔ́ ngie à záb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô Kristo. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo peg yég la záb ntʉ́m wég ná Yěsô Kristo, pá’ peg ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé cʉ’ʉ́ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. À ké fó pɔ́ ná pá’ peg zǎb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, tà á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò gie peg ku’té*lepʉ̌ wɔ́, á nue e Ssé la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie sɔɔn nyìŋ té lá’ gwɔ ku’u légwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé à fó ná pá’ ngàŋ gɔɔn ngie à ku’té*lepʉ̌ wɔ́.
en: knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.

ngiemboon: Pá’ peg ne fa’a lécʉa ndà’ nzèm Kristo tá ńku’ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ la, pà Yuda lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pé’e ńdɔgɔ wég ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie ndòon ée twó pɔb pá’ pɔ́ tóŋo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té zsé*lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́, á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ ngie Kristo aa nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo pʉ̀a kaa pɔ́ ndòon keen? Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́.
en: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners,istherefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ n gíŋ ńzɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn nà nò*lepʉ̌ gie mèŋ n ka nyé lá? N gÿo pú’u, mbà kwà’ mèŋ n ge lɔg nyɛ ngie mèŋ n gee nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌a*lepʉ̌, é lɔgɔ pú’u, é kaa ndòon.
en: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.

ngiemboon: Á kaa fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ka nyě ne fa’a ngie e Ssé fó ná pá’ mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n kú’te*lepʉ̌, ńcʉ́’ ńdíe wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, mèŋ n jú’ ngie ńgwɔ́ á le gwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́, áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ ná nò*lepʉ̌ yɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mpfó, pú’u, ńzsé ngie n ge gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé é gwɔ́ ntentʉ́. E Ssé la zɔɔn ńteme wég Kristo mé púte wég yé ńkime nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔ tè pá’ɔɔn ńgíŋe sá’a twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, Kristo zɔ cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ mèŋ ésá’a wɔ̀ɔn. N dɔɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie m bǔ ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ná Míŋ Ssé. Àa nyìŋ gẅie à la kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋ tà ńkwé nà twó yɔ́ɔn.
en: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

ngiemboon: N tě ge zẅíŋ, ànò mbòŋo gie e Ssé la lɔg ńcÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn à cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́. N gɔɔn ńtí, mélà’mie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ cʉa ná nò*lepʉ̌ tá e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe yé pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, mbà á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie Kristo la kwé sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousnesscomeby the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

ngiemboon: Pi pʉ̀a Galatia, tsye legyè sí pyě ka? À wɔ̌ ka lɔg lekàŋ ḿbue gẅi pɛ́’ɛ̀? Tá, mbà mé ka nyɛte shwóŋó gẅi nò nà legwé Yěsô Kristo tà á gwɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi lɔ̌g nÿɔ́g mí ńgyá yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ la.
en: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?

ngiemboon: N ge zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò, pi ka lɔg pɔ́ pá’ pi ka ne ńgÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te tá Ssé náa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a né pi keen? Kà pi ka lɔg pɔ́ pá’ pi jǔ’ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo ńzáb ntʉ́m mǒ tá Ssé ná né pi?
en: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

ngiemboon: Legyè sí gǎ ḿbyé pɔ́ nzẅìŋ wɔɔn? Á gâ ammó gie pi la lɔg metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ssé ńzye, pi piŋ ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńně fa’a lélɔg pɔ́ mí metʉ̀ tá ḿmege?
en: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ ngie menò mie pi lǎ gyá, pi lɔ̌ɔn ńgyá pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ lá?
en: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? ifit beyet in vain.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á poŋ ngie pi gíŋ ńgyá ngie e Ssé ne ńnáa Zẅìge yé né pi, ḿbiŋe ne ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Pi kwǎŋ ngie à gÿo pú’u, mélà’mie pi ne ńgÿo mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te lá? Ngǎŋ à gÿo, pɔ́ mélà’mie pi la jú’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ńzáb ntʉ́m gẅi mǒ.
en: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you,doeth he itby the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

ngiemboon: Aŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie Ábalam la lɔg yé pɔ́ lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, tá Ssé fó ná pá’ à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná ye pú’u, ńzẅíŋe yé pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi zsé ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé zɔ̌ kwà’ ngẅɛ̀ gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo Ábalam.
en: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Aŋwà’ne Ssé la zɔɔn ńtʉ́ njÿó ńnyɛ ngie: E Ssé ge lá’ fó ná pá’ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ge lá’ záb ntʉ́m ná yé à zẅíŋe wɔ́b pá’ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Áa yɛ̌ tá ŋwà’ne Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńtsẅi wɔɔn nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo Ábalam ngie: E Ssé ge lá’ cʉa ná gù é néŋ mbʉ́lè nà melá’ ntsèm mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham,saying, In thee shall all nations be blessed.

ngiemboon: Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, e Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè ná yé. Pú’u la, pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ pie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé pá’ Ábalam la, e Ssé ge néŋ mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔɔn néŋ pɔ́ ndòon twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ légɔɔn ngie pɔ́ kú’te*lepʉ̌ ńdɔg ńgÿo yɔ́b kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, á nue ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kú’te*lepʉ̌ pɔ́ ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńně ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ kǎ ndòon.
en: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it is written, Cursedisevery one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋ ńnyɛte nyɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lelɔg pá’ à gɔɔn ngie à kú’te*lepʉ̌ ńdɔg ńku’u nyìŋ gẅie aa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, á nue mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à ku’u légwɔ́ mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mélà’mie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà yé, zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ̀ wó.
en: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God,it isevident: for, The just shall live by faith.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ leku’té*lepʉ̌ tá ńgwɔ́ wó à tè pumte nà lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́. Á gʉa nà nò*lepʉ̌, mbà mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ kú’te*lepʉ̌ sɔ́ɔn ntsèm zɔ ge lá’ gwɔ́ wó.
en: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pá’ mánzsè we*lepʉ̌ gÿo pege kaa pɔ́ ndòon la, Kristo la tó ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́ ndòon ŋwɛ́. À la zyɛ́b ńkaa ḿbi’, ńcʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ ndòon ńtí wégè. Mé gɔɔn nue mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie mé kimé yé nà tÿǒ.
en: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursedisevery one that hangeth on a tree:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò gwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge fó nà mmó gie Yěsô Kristo, gẅie aa nà ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam gÿǒ, é pú néŋ mbʉ́lè ná pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, é cʉa ná Ábalam, mbɔɔ légwɔ́ gie pege ge lɔg pá’ pege záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo é gẅiin Zẅìge gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pege.
en: that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, n ge pí fʉ̀’ ná mà wege pʉ̀a mesoŋ, pege zsě ngie nyìŋ gwɔ́ tà ńŋwe’e mmó ńdɔg ńtÿɔ́g legwé sé nà ntí gie á zɛ́te, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lelʉ’, ńké le gíŋe ńkẅi’i tsɔ́ mmó mǒ wɔ́.
en: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men; Thoughit bebut a man's covenant, yetif it beconfirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth thereto.

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo Ssé ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u. E Ssé la ka’a mmó mbwo Ábalam tà mbɔɔ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie Ábalam lɔ̌ɔn ńge gÿo zyé yé. Aŋwà’ne Ssé té gɔɔn ngie mé la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pie à lɔ̌ɔn ńge gÿo tá zyé wɔ́b pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńka’a yɛ̌ mmó à gwɔ́ yɔ́b la gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn wɔ́.
