ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pǐŋ ńgÿo mèŋ n zsé ngie kwà’ mèŋ n ge tɔ́g tó gyá gẅí.
en: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka kě ńgyá ngie á poŋ, n gÿo fɛ́ wege Epafolodite piŋ nzèm, ńtsɛ́ɛ gẅí. Á yé gẅie pi ka túmo yé á tó ńná shúm sie é ka ne ńzága mbwo mèŋ lá. Àa nyìŋ gẅie peg yé lǎ zye fà’, ńzye ńdÿɔ́’ ncù ná nò Yěsô Kristo.
en: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ yé zɔɔn ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ légíŋe ńgyá gẅi métsèm, á nue à zsě ngie pi ka jú’u nò guɔ yé, á gege gẅi tɛ’.
en: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

ngiemboon: Á ka gẅiin légege gẅí, aguɔ ŋwɛ́ laa wó tɛ’, tà á ka cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ à kwé. Tá e Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé, ńgíŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn mbàa mɔ́ɔn ngie tà mèŋ n gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’, ńgíŋe ńkaa tsɔ̌.
en: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo kwà’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lélwo ńtúmo yé mbwo pi, éfa’a ngie pi gwaa ne kága pá’ pi giŋé ńgyá yé, letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn ná’a sẅéte.
en: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi kúe yé lê kwà’ lekág, ńzsé ngie aa fɛ́ gẅi nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pi gÿo mekù’ ntí pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b lɛ,
en: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

ngiemboon: á nue á ka cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’, à tóo fa’a fà’ Kristo, ńkwé mǒ. À ka tóo ńgÿo mmó gie pi kɔ̌ɔn ńge gÿo ná mèŋ, tá ńtúm pɔ́ yé, á cʉ́’ʉ méjʉ’ à náa twó yé.
en: because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńkága kǎg ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de kʉ́a léŋwe’e ŋwà’ne mbwo pi lélɔg ńkímte gẅi á mmó gie n ka zɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo pi wɔ́. Á ge pyɛ́bte gẅi légwe ná mejÿɔ’.
en: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeedisnot grievous, but for youit issafe.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn pàzí’i pʉ̀a mmó pie ée pè tepòŋ! Mefà’ mɔ́b ée mbwo Ssé é sẅile sẅile! Ayɔ́b nò wɔ́ pɔ́ ngie mé lɔɔn tè nyìŋ pú’, e Ssé légÿo á tsẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.

ngiemboon: Pege pɔɔn zɔ ee pʉ̀a pie mé la kwà’ ḿbú’u wégè. Pege zɔ̌ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é gwɔ ne gu’te Ssé, ńne ńzẅí’te nò ncwò Zẅìge yé. Pege lɔgɔ pɔ́ Yěsô ńka’te, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege zɔɔn le lɔg shúm sie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo ńtí mà lá’ gwɔ́b ńdɔg ńka’te wɔ́ le.
en: For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.

ngiemboon: Tá mèŋ n gee nyìŋ gẅie n gwé’e ńkwoŋ, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n dɔg shúm sie mé gÿo ńtíi mà lá’ weg ńdɔg ńka’te. Tà ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn ngie à zsé nò mǒ, mèŋ shwóŋó yé ngie mèŋ n zsé nò mǒ ńcʉa yé.
en: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more:

ngiemboon: Mé la zye wɔ̀ɔn, é cʉa lyɛ̌’ lefɔ̌ɔn, mé pú’u wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ n gee nyìŋ ná ngẅɛ̀ Israel, á nà tsìŋe ndá Mběnjameŋ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Heber tà metá pɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà Héber, ńgʉa ná*lepʉ̌ pà Yuda, n gwɔ́ nyìŋ ná nùɔ pà*farisay.
en: circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel,ofthe tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌ɔn ńtíɛ kẅǐ nà*lepʉ̌ tɛ’, tà ńtsɔ́’ɔ kwò pʉ̀a Kristo té poŋ. Léku’té*lepʉ̌ lá’ zɔ laa pé’è ńtyɛ’te ngie nyìŋ aa tè fʉa, mbà a lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi ngie n daa tè fʉa.
en: concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mɔɔn menò mɛ́ mie é lâ mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lemaŋ, Kristo léen ńgÿo n gyá, mbà à la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pyé,
en: But what things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

ngiemboon: é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, le zsé Yěsô Kristo, á Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn zɔ cʉ̌’ ńcʉa nò ntsèm. À kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pyé. Mbà mèŋ n déen ńdʉ’ shúm ntsèm ńtí pɔ́ yé. N cʉ̌’ ńdíe sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm é gwɔ́ pɔ́ kʉ̀ŋe. Kristo zɔ̌ cʉ́’ʉ yɔ́ɔn pì,
en: Yea doubtless, and I count all thingsbutloss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count thembutdung, that I may win Christ,

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nà mbwo mé, ńgwɔ́ n de gíŋ ngie n gee tè fʉa mvfò Ssé, mélà’mie mèŋ n zsé*lepʉ̌ pà Yuda wɔ́. Mèŋ n gee mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ tè fʉa ńtí pɔ́ nò gie mèŋ n záb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ná Kristo, e Ssé zɔ gÿo ngie mèŋ n gwɔ́ nyìŋ nénʉ́ pá’ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná Kristo.
en: and be found in him, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tà’a nò wémɔ’ɔ́. Á gwɔ́ ngie n zsé yé Kristo, ńzsé metʉ̀ mie é la gÿo á zíme ná legwé, ńgyá ngɔ́’ pá’ à la gyá yé, ńzẅíŋe lénáa twó yɔ́ɔn ńkwé pá’ à la náa yé,
en: that I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death;

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie, á lɔɔn tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, e Ssé lá’ ńgÿo n zím yɔ́ɔn nà legwé pá’ Kristo.
en: if by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n de gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n ku’ú ná mɔɔn menò ntsèm mie mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lɔɔn wɔ́. N ké légɔɔn ngie n cʉ’ʉ́ nyìŋ gẅie tsɔ́ mmó té gíŋe ne ńzága nà yé wɔ́ wɔ́. N nyé mánzsè, ńtsaa ndʉ̌, ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ pá’ Kristo, mélà’mie à kéen ńzába pwó nà mèŋ ńtí pú’u.
en: Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ńgwɔ́ n de gɔɔn ngie n noonté tà ḿbú ńgwɔ́ pá’ Kristo wɔ́, mèŋ n ne ńgÿo pɔ́ tà’a mmó, á gwɔ́ légwɔ́ gÿo mmó, ńdege Kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mèŋ n ka gÿó, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńdíe pɔ́ gie áa mvfò.
en: Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: butthisone thingI do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee mánzsè ńtsaa pɔ́ ndʉ̌ lékúu jʉ’ gie n gee wó ńkẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ gẅie e Ssé la ka’ lénáa mbwo pege á tÿǒ lepwó ńtí nò gie Kristo la kwé nà twó ségè.
en: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pege pie pege cʉ̌’ pɔ́ melÿò nà léju’ú nò Ssé, á poŋ ngie é wégè nkwaŋá e gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ɔɔn, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pi gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá tà é té wɔɔn wɔ́, mbà Ssé ge shʉa shʉa, éshwóŋó gẅi nò gie áa yɛ̌.
en: Let us therefore, as many as be perfect, be thus minded: and if in any thing ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.

ngiemboon: Anò lÿò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, à jʉ’ gie pege gʉ̌a tà ńkúu wó lɔɔn, pege ké ńgʉa pɔ́ lé mvfò.
en: Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi métsèm, pi pí fʉ̀’ ná mèŋ. Peg ka nyɛɛ gẅi pá’ pi ge giŋ pú’u. Pi líe pʉ̀a pie é ne ńgiŋe pú’u, ńgiŋ gí.
en: Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔɔn zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, mà wɔb sẅé pɔ́ we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nyiŋe legwé Kristo nà tÿǒ nkǐ nyiŋe. N dǎ zye shwóŋó gẅí, tà mbɔɔ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, n giŋé ne ńgɔɔn tà ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ ntse nÿɔ́g ńgɔɔn.
en: (For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping,that they arethe enemies of the cross of Christ:

ngiemboon: Emɔ́b melyɛ̌’ ge lá’ maga tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, pɔ́ gee lepÿé mmɔ̌g, mélà’mie yɔ́b ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ lepfòm sɔ́b. Pɔ́ kága nà mmó gie eshʉ́ kɔ’ɔ́ kúu wɔ́b mǒ kǔ, ewɔ́b nkwaŋá piŋ ńtyé pɔ́ nà shúm njÿó.
en: whose endisdestruction, whose Godis theirbelly, andwhosegloryisin their shame, who mind earthly things.)

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pege, mbà wégè ngwòŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó. Pege ne ńzẅí’te ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo fó wó ńtó, à gyô pege tsẅɛ̂.
en: For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo tó é sele yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ gie e tè ná tsɔ́ nò ku’, e cʉ́’ pá’ ye gie e gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g. À gwɔ́ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mie à gẅiin lélɔg ńgÿo à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ cʉ́’ ńjú’ pɔ́ ncwò wé.
en: who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi ngie, pi lɔgɔ gẅi leńnéŋe ńnyɛ ngie pi kú’te nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà á tʉ̀. Mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńgyá gẅí. Pi ée mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ. Pi pie pi ee ssé ńgwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn lekág, ńgwɔ́ yɔ̀ɔn*ngǔ’.
en: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord,mydearly beloved.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sẅiŋté Evodie pɔ́ Sintishe ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà’ ncwò á nue pɔ́ métsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

ngiemboon: ḿbìŋ ńgʉa ná gù, kwà’ shǔ wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ fà’, mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ kẅéte wɔ́b, ée pánzwě pie pega pɔ̌ nê Kelemaŋ ka pǔ ńdÿɔ́’ ncù ná nò nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Pega tsɔ́ pʉ̀a la gíŋe ńgwɔ́, tà mezíŋ mɔ́b ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne gie áa mbwo Ssé.
en: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, andwithother my fellowlabourers, whose namesarein the book of life.

ngiemboon: N ge gɔɔn né pi ngie ntʉ́m gẅi ńnéŋe ńkág kág, á nue pi ee pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. N gɔ̌ɔn né pi ngie, ntʉ́m gẅi ńnéŋe ńkág kág.
en: Rejoice in the Lord alway:andagain I say, Rejoice.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé zsé ngie pi pʉ́le pʉlé. Pi kímte ngie ntyě pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó té ság.
en: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lordisat hand.

ngiemboon: Tà pi pú’ mbùm gí nà tsɔ́ nò. Tá’, akɔ́ nò zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńtyé ssé wɔ́, pi pú’ mbwó mbwo Ssé, éshwóŋó yé mmó gie pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, ésẅíŋte yé, ḿbiŋ ńná ndǎg mbwo yé.
en: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo pú’u, e Ssé náa sẅétè gie nyìŋ mesoŋ tè zsé pá’ á gwɔ́ wɔ́ né pi. Yɛ̌ sẅétè pyɛ́bte mentʉ́m mí, nê nkwaŋá gẅí, ńgÿo é tyé pɔ́ ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, anò gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n dɔg ńcʉ́me á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, nkwaŋá gẅi ńnéŋe ńtyé pɔ́ ná menò mbòŋo mie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gɔ’te, ńtyé nà nò nénʉ́, á nà nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, á nà nò té*lɔ̌’, á nà menò mie ée me mekù’, á nà menò mie mé gÿo pʉ̀a ná ngɔ́ɔnte, é menò mie é kẅéte, á nà menò mie mé siŋte nyìŋ mǒ.
en: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever thingsarehonest, whatsoever thingsarejust, whatsoever thingsarepure, whatsoever thingsarelovely, whatsoever thingsareof good report; ifthere beany virtue, and ifthere beany praise, think on these things.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n ka zí’i gẅí, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka jú’u ncwò mèŋ, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka gyǎ mèŋ n gÿo, pi la’te mé gyá. E Ssé gẅie à náa sẅétè à gwɔ́ né pi.
en: Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńnáa ndǎ’ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńne ńkága tɛ’, mélà’mie pi gíŋe ńgẅiin shÿó lényɛ ngie pi ne ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn. Pi ka zɔɔn ne ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn kímte tá ńzága mánzsè lélɔg ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me hath flourished again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye lacked opportunity.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie tsɔ́ mmó ne ńzága mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. N dá zí’i légwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńzága mmó lo, ńgẅiin lo, mèŋ n ne ńkága kǎg.
en: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am,therewithto be content.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n déen ńzí’i léshÿɔg nzyè, ńgíŋ ńzí’i léńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ fù’. Mèŋ n déen ńzí’i légwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńtyé pɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, akɔ́ zɔ̌ gwɔ́ ssé wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ léshÿɔg nzyè, mèŋ shÿɔg, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lépfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́ mèŋ m pfɛ́, ńgwɔ́ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’e nzyè, kà fʉ̀’e shúm léjÿó wɔ́, mèŋ n de pɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every where and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔ náa wɔ̀ɔn metʉ̀, tá mèŋ n ku’u légÿo pú’u.
en: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, pi ka gÿo mboŋó lékẅéte wɔ̀ɔn ná fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie mèŋ n ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ lɔɔn.
en: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.

ngiemboon: Pi pà Filipo, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie pi gílé pi zɔ la ké ńkẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, á fʉ̀’ gie n dá fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅi Makedonia ńgʉa, légwa ńgiŋ ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Á laa fʉ̀’ gie mé la nyé ńzye zye létsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo, atsɔ́ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ndyɛ̀’ɛ la tè zába pwó nà fà’ yɔ́ɔn, ńzsé mmó gie á ne ńzága wɔ̀ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńzsé gie fà’ yɔ́ɔn ne ńnáa wɔ́.
en: Now ye Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ́ tà ńkúu Tesalonika, pi túm shúm sie é la ne ńzága mbwo mèŋ. Pi la túm ngʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, n ne fa’a pɔ́ shúm sie mé ge túm ná né mèŋ wɔ́. Mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie e Ssé fó mǒ ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi.
en: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà shúm sie pi ka tǔm ńna né mèŋ, mbà mèŋ m bǔ ńgyá. N gẅiin shúm fʉ̀’ɔɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’. Mèŋ n gyǎ shúm ŋwɛ́ sie Epafolodite lɔ̌g ńtó. N te gíŋe ne ńzága tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Eshúm ŋwɛ́ poŋó wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ shúm pwɔ́’ sie mé lɔ́ɔn ńnuŋe mvfò Ssé, é poŋo yé tɛ’ la.
en: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the thingswhich were sentfrom you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.

ngiemboon: E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn ge lɔg ntí gie aa gẅiin shúm pú’u, é cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo, é náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzága mbwo pi té sáŋ.
en: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo Tá wege Ssé ná mengù’u mengù’.*Amen.
en: Now unto God and our Fatherbeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ la zẅɛ́’ɛ Yěsô Kristo ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé. Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pegá pɔ̌ ee jʉ’ɔɔn é tsyɛ’té gẅi yɔ́b.
en: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm é tsyɛ’té gẅí, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn té lege tsyɛ̀’te ye pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée nɔ́’ɔ Kása.
en: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Cæsar's household.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěso Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: It was written to the Philippians from Rome by Epaphroditus.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, e Ssé la kwoŋ ngie n gwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. Peg fɛ́ wege Timoté náa
en: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheusourbrother,

ngiemboon: mbwo pi pʉ̀a Ssé pie pi ńnéŋe Kolos. Pi pǔ ńgwɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ á nà nò Kristo, pi ké ńzsé pɔ́ ndà’ yɛ̌. Tá wege Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: to the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Gracebeunto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg ee fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgwaa ne sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó sí, ńne síe yé síe. Peg síe yé gẅie aa Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo,
en: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

ngiemboon: á nue mé ka shwóŋó wég ntí gie pi ne ńdɔgɔ ńzába ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo mbɔɔ ntí gie pi ne ńdɔgɔ ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm.
en: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the lovewhich ye haveto all the saints,

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo pú’u, nue pi ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie e Ssé la cwoŋte ńzába tÿǒ lepwó ńtí gẅí. Pi ka gwɔ zsé yɛ̌ mmó, éfó nà nò nénʉ́ gie mé ka shwoŋó gẅí, yɛ̌ nò nénʉ́ fóo ná Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo.
en: for the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;

ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo ne saa jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó té vʉ’ʉ tsɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pá’ tÿǒ gie á ne ńzéme ntɔ̌ɔn, ńgíŋe ne ńgú’u la, ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgíŋe ńne ńgee ne mvfò pɔ́ pú’u, tà fó ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’ gie pi la jú’ mé zye lékím pá’ e Ssé lɔgɔ menò mbòŋo mé ńcÿó gʉm pʉ̀a, pi kéen ńgyá yɛ̌ nò, ayɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ gie áa nénʉ́.
en: which is come unto you, asit isin all the world; and bringeth forth fruit, asit dothalso in you, since the day ye heardof it, and knew the grace of God in truth:

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńzsé ngie Epafalas zɔ ka zí’i gẅi yɛ̌ nò. Aa fɛ́ weg we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pega pɔ̌ pǔ fa’a. Pi zsé ngie, yé gẅie aa lejʉ́ŋ pi lɛ, à zsě pɔ́ nò Kristo.
en: as ye also learned of Epaphras our dear fellowservant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ;

ngiemboon: À ka shwoŋó wég ntí nkwòŋe gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ka ńnéŋe ntʉ́m pi.
en: who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie é gÿo tá peg laa kʉ́a lésẅíŋte Ssé nà twó sí tà fó lyɛ̌’ gie mé la shwóŋó wég ntí gie pi lɔ̌g ńkú’te nò Ssé pú’u wɔ́. Peg ne ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé ngie à gÿo pi kwa’ ńzsé mmó gie à kwoŋ, ńcʉa nà zsě nò mbɔɔ ná legyè sie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńnáa mbwo pi.
en: For this cause we also, since the day we heardit, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi ku’u léńnéŋe ná ntí gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńkwoŋo, ńne ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á poŋo yé, éfa’ mefà’ mbòŋo mentí mentí, ńkẅi’i ńzsé yé Ssé.
en: that ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;

ngiemboon: Peg gǐŋ ne ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé ngie à lɔg pá’ metʉ̀ pɔ́ legú’ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ mé, ńgÿo pi kwa’ ńtʉte tá ńku’u léshÿɔg menò ntsèm té tsyɛte nnɛ́.
en: strengthened with all might, according to his glorious power, unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ lekág ésíe Ssé gẅie aa Tá wege, yé gẅie à la gÿo pi ku’u légẅiin gí mmó nà tÿɔgɔ́ gẅie à la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pé. Wɛ̌ tÿɔgɔ́ ée nà jʉ’e kyɛ̀’.
en: giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:

ngiemboon: À la sa’a wégè mbwo metʉ̀ nzěm, ńtsege wégè ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ Míŋ we, à kwoŋo míŋ we ŋwɛ́ tɛ’.
en: who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translatedusinto the kingdom of his dear Son:

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la gÿo e Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ nò tepòŋ ńcu’u wégè, ńdege mefʉa mégè, ńnáa mbwo pege.
en: in whom we have redemption through his blood,eventhe forgiveness of sins:

ngiemboon: Mé té gyá Ssé wɔ́, tá Miŋ we gẅie mé lǎ gyá yé à gwɔ́ pɔ́ Ssé tà ḿmag. Yé zɔ tyé twó mvfò ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la pwóon.
en: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ cʉa ná mbwó Míŋ we tá yé Ssé pwóon. Mé gɔɔn shúm ntsèm sie ée tÿǒ lepwó, mbɔɔ sie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, éshúm sie mé gyá mbɔɔ sie mé té gyá, á kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgẅiin metʉ, ńnẅɛɛ pʉ̀a, ésá’a setsɔ́, ńgẅiin jʉ’. E Ssé la gÿo sɛ̌ shúm cʉa ná mbwó Míŋ we tá mé pwóon, ḿbiŋ ḿbwóon é gwɔ́ pɔ́ se Míŋ we.
en: for by him were all things created, that are in heaven, and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whetherthey bethrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him:

ngiemboon: Njÿó la nyé pɔ́ tè gwɔ̌ wó, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ piŋ ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ pá’ á tswé’e ná yé tá ńgwɔ́ wó, ńké gwɔ̂ pɔ́ wó.
en: and he is before all things, and by him all things consist.

ngiemboon: Ye zɔɔ twó nà mbùm nnɛ́ gie áa cú’tè pʉ̀a pé. Legwɔ́ wó we sẅé à zye pɔ́ ná yé, aa ndùŋ mvfò nyìŋ gẅie à la kwé ḿbiŋ ńzím, pú’u ńzsé ngie yé zɔ ge gwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́, mbà Ssé la kwoŋ ngie tà tsɔ́ mmó gie áa ná yé zága ná Míŋ we,
en: For it pleasedthe Fatherthat in him should all fulness dwell;

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ ńkwoŋ ngie à ge fó pɔ́ ná yé, éshwoŋte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, égíŋ ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé, kà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́, kà tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́, é lɔg pá’ Míŋ we la pfɛte metse mé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, é mag mbù gẅie é laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ yé lâ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: and, having made peace through the blood of his cross, by him to reconcile all things unto himself; by him,I say, whetherthey bethings in earth, or things in heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi gí, pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ pi tè lejʉ́ŋ Ssé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ megàŋ mbù Ssé, á nue pi lɔ̌ɔn ńkwaŋa nò tepòŋ, ńgÿo pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: And you, that were sometime alienated and enemies inyourmind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà á ka fó ná pá’ Míŋ we ka cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ńkwé, éshwoŋte gẅi ńgíŋe ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ ye, éshwoŋte gẅi pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pi ge gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, é gwɔ́ pà tèfʉa, é gwɔ́ pà tè*lɔ̌’.
en: in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi záb ntʉ́m ná yé Yěsô ńzsé ngie pi ge tyé té zóŋe, nkwaŋá gẅi e ké ńtyé pɔ́ nà mmó gie pi ne ńzẅí’te mbwo Ssé, mbà pi la jú’u yɛ̌ mmó á fʉ̀’ gie mé la ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌ gẅie mé tsẅii mbwo nyìŋ mesoŋ ntsèm. Mèŋ Pɔl à yɔ́ɔn fà’ kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ létsẅi wɛ̌ nkʉ̀.
en: if ye continue in the faith grounded and settled, andbenot moved away from the hope of the gospel, which ye have heard,andwhich was preached to every creature which is under heaven; whereof I Paul am made a minister;

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngɔ́’ gie mèŋ n ne ńgyá ná twó gí gÿo mèŋ n kág kǎg. Ngɔ́’ gie mèŋ n gee tsoló áa pfwɔ́’ɔ ngɔ́’ Kristo gie mèŋ n gyá ntí mbùm ye gie áa cú’tè pʉ̀a pé.
en: who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake, which is the church:

ngiemboon: N kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ ngàŋa fà’ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, pú’u, á léfa’a fà’ gie e Ssé ka cʉmé mbwo mèŋ ńtí gẅí. Yɛ̌ fà’ gwɔ́ légɔɔn shwóŋè Ssé pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: whereof I am made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given to me for you, to fulfil the word of God;

ngiemboon: À ka tsẅi ngie mèŋ n kyɛ́’ ntsem gie à la lá’ ńdÿoon mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ é mejwoŋó mejwoŋó tà fó ngù’. Á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà à kéen ńké ńkyɛ́’ yɛ̌ ntsem ńnyɛɛ mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée pé.
en: eventhe mystery which hath been hid from ages and from generations, but now is made manifest to his saints:

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé ka gyǎ ngie à ge gÿo pʉ̀a pé zsé mmó gie á la zɔɔn ńdyeen menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a lyeen, ńgwɔ́ gie à la ka’a légÿo ná metúmo metúm, yɛ̌ mmó gẅiin fù’, ḿbiŋ ḿboŋ tɛ’. Yɛ̌ ntsem gwɔ́ ngie pi zsé ngie Kristo aa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, ńne ńgÿo pi zẅí’te fʉ̀’ gie pi ge lá’ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ Ssé.
en: to whom God would make known whatisthe riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌, tá peg kě ne shwóŋó nò Kristo mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm shwóŋ, ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ zsě nò gie e Ssé náa mbwo peg, ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ńtẅíi letuŋó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, légwɔ́ gie à ge ké laa nnɛ́ ná Kristo é lɔgɔ gee pɔ́ lê mvfò, tá cÿɔgte pá’ pʉ̀a Ssé gẅiin légwɔ́ pú’u.
en: whom we preach, warning every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus:

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u mmó gie mèŋ n kwé mǒ. Mèŋ n kě ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ mie é fóo mbwo Kristo tá fa’a yɔɔn fà’. Mɛ̌ metʉ̀ kwa’ ńgwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ mèŋ ńne fa’a.
en: whereunto I also labour, striving according to his working, which worketh in me mightily.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé ngie ncù gẅie mèŋ n ne ḿma’a é tʉ. Mèŋ m ma’a wɛ̌ ncù ná twó sí, mbɔɔ ná twó pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Laodisé, mbɔɔ ná twó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie pɔ́ laa wɔ̀ɔn gyá.
en: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, andforthem at Laodicea, andforas many as have not seen my face in the flesh;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gÿo pú’u, lélɔg ńnéŋ ntʉ́m wɔ́b, nkwòŋe temte wɔ́b, mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ ge nyɛte zsé nò gie aa ná Kristo, éfó mǒ é zsé ntsem Ssé gie à ka gÿo peg zsé, yɛ̌ ntsem gwɔ́ pɔ́ Kristo yé máŋwɛ́.
en: that their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ;

ngiemboon: Azse nò ntsèm, mbɔɔ legyè ntsèm pú ńgwɔ́ fù’ gie á cú’te ńdyeen pɔ́ ná Yěsô.
en: in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ létó ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie mé neŋé ssé ńtáŋte, ésele twó gí.
en: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsɛ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, tá nkwaŋá wɔ̀ɔn tyé pɔ́ ná pi. Mèŋ n ne ńkága á nue mèŋ n zsě ngie pi ne ńtáŋte menò mí mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńkú’te nò Kristo tà á tʉ.
en: For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi ka kě ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô Kristo aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅi la, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie gẅi leńnéŋe gwɔ́ pá’ à ne ńkwoŋo.
en: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord,sowalk ye in him:

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛte ńcʉŋ leŋàŋ sí pɔ́ ná ye, ńtÿɔ́gɔ gẅi le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná ye pá’ mé tÿɔ́gɔ ndá nà cÿǒ la, ńne ńkẅi’i ńkú’te pɔ́ nò yé mboŋó, yɛ̌ nò ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mé la zí’i gẅí. Pi ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé tɛ’.
en: rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn nyìŋ lélɔgɔ zse nò pʉ̀a mesoŋ gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ, éfʉte gẅí, pi gwe ná lejÿɔ̀’ sé. Yɛ̌ gwɔ́ pɔ́ cÿɔ̌ nò gẅie é jʉ́’ʉ ná nùŋe pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgíŋ ńjʉ’ʉ nà metʉ̀ mentí mentí mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, é té jʉ́’ʉ ná Kristo wɔ́.
en: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn á nue, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa nà Ssé wɔ́, mé gyá ná Kristo, yé gẅie à la sele ńcʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.

ngiemboon: Pia Kristo kéen ńtemte, e Ssé fó mǒ ńnáa gẅi fù’ ntí ntí. Kristo ŋwɛ́ pǔ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin tʉ̀, ésá’a njÿó.
en: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:

ngiemboon: Pi lâ Kristo la gwɔ́ tà ńtemte, e Ssé gÿo liŋé ná pi. Á gwɔ́ gie á nyɛɛ ngie pi ee pʉ̀a pé. À laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńtsẅii mbwo pà Yuda ngie pɔ́ gÿo mé pú’uwɔ́b, á gwɔ́ liŋé, tá’ á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà liŋé gie a gÿǒ ná pi, á téen fóo mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ mbwo Kristo. Yɛ̌ liŋé kéen fó mbwo mmó gie áa soŋ nnɛ́ pege, ńtsóte wégè ńnéŋe ná nò tepòŋ, ńkẅile wégè.
en: in whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie mé la nu’u gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, mé laa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ḿbúte gẅia Kristo ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, pia pɔ́ gíŋe ḿbúte ńzíme nà legwé, á nue pi zẅǐŋ ngie e Ssé gẅie à la zíme Yěsô ná legwé, à gẅiin tʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo pi zím gí nà legwé.
en: buried with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen withhimthrough the faith of the operation of God, who hath raised him from the dead.

ngiemboon: Pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepfó, ńtí menò tepòŋ mí, mbɔɔ pá’ pi la tè pʉ̀a pie mé la pú’u wɔ́b lélɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́. Á ké ńgwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé kéen ḿbúte gẅia Kristo ńzíme nà legwé. À kéen ḿbú ńdege menò tepòŋ mégè ntsèm, ńnáa mbwo pege.
en: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;

ngiemboon: À la véle ŋwà’ne njǔ yega pɔ̌, mbà*lepʉ̌ laa tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne ńne sẅiŋe wégè ná menò mie pege fʉaté, ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie à la pú wɔ́b Yěsô ńkime nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉŋte ŋwà’ne.
en: blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross;

ngiemboon: E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwoonte*messé tepòŋ, é pie é gẅiin tʉ̀, ésá’a njÿó yɔɔn, ńkẅile metʉ̀ mɔ́b ńgwá’a, ńtéme shʉ́ twó pɔ́b mvfò lá’. Á gwɔ́ pá’ à la lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pu’u ncù, Kristo lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgwá ńgiŋ ńdɔg ńda’te ngie à jÿǒ ncù.
en: andhaving spoiled principalities and powers, he made a shew of them openly, triumphing over them in it.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie tà pi cʉ́’ nyìŋ ŋaga gẅi nà nò mmó mpfɛ̌ kà ye nu nǔ wɔ́, kà ná nò*melínɔ́ɔn pà Yuda wɔ́, kà ná línɔ́ɔn sàŋ sẅé wɔ́, kà ná*melyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè Sséwɔ́.
en: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbathdays:

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ shúm lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ shúm sie é ne ńtóo. Mé ge gÿo gyá Kristo, é zsé ngie mé gyǎ kwà’ sɛ̌ shúm.
en: which are a shadow of things to come; but the bodyisof Christ.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ḿbaba gẅi pi pyé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ ncù gẅie Kristo la jÿó ńná né pi. Mèŋ n gɔɔn pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ná mbùm yɔb ssé tɛ’, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gú’te*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé. Pɔ́ gíŋe ńdɔg shúm sie pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie e Ssé nyɛ̌’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́b pɔ́ gyá ńdɔg ńŋá’te sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gẅiin pɔ́ nkwaŋá pʉ̀a mesoŋ, é gÿo pɔ́ zẅíŋ pɔ́ mmóm.
en: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té ne ńkẅi’i ńdaa nnɛ́ ná Kristo gẅie yé zɔɔ twó wɔ́. Tá mbà twó zɔ̌ náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ge kẅéte mbùm nnɛ́. Atwó zɔ̌ gÿo mejwoŋó nnɛ́ mbɔɔ menŋàŋ nnɛ́ cú’te ńkú’te mbùm nnɛ́, é gú’ pá’ e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: and not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.

ngiemboon: Pia Kristo la pú ńkwé, á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńkẅé gẅi mbwo metʉ̀ nzěm mie é sá’a njÿó. Mélà’a kɔ́ mé gíŋe shwóŋó gẅi ngie tsɔ́ shúm ée shúm sie nzse ée mǒ tà pi zẅí’te pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pʉ̀a yɔɔn njÿó?
en: Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ mé gɔɔn ngie tà pi jÿó tsɔ́ shúm léjÿó, tà pi zẅí’ mbɔɔ zẅǐ’, tà pi záb mbɔɔ pwó mǒ.
en: (touch not; taste not; handle not;

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menzse ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà shúm sie mé jÿó é mag mag, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnéŋe ssé ńkwaŋte ńzáb.
en: which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

ngiemboon: Mé tyé ńgyá mɛ̌ menzse mie mé zsé é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie ée mbòŋ la, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńzsé lélɔg pú’u, ńnyɛte ńgu’te Ssé, à ná nnɛ́ ssé tɛ’, ńnyɛ mbùm ye ngɔ́’ tɛ’. Tá mɛ̌ menzse ńgwɔ́ é le kẅéte wégè lékú’te ntʉ́m tà nkwaŋá tepòŋ lâ tsɔ́ ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm é le gwɔ́ tsoló wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body; not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pia Kristo la púte ńzíme nà legwé la, pi tÿɔ́g lejÿɔ́g sí pɔ́ nà shúm sie ée tÿǒ lepwó, ajʉ’ gie Kristo aa wó, ńnéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ.
en: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.

ngiemboon: Pi nɔ́ɔnte pɔ́ mmó gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, tà pi nɔ́ɔnte gie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie áa nà menò njÿó, mbà pi léen ńkwé. Agẅi le gwɔ́, aa mbwo Kristo á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, mé té ne ńgyá pá’ à gwɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔɔ kwà’ gẅi le gwɔ́. À ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà kẅɛ, pi gíŋ ńkẅɛ gí, pia pɔ́ zɔ púte ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we.
en: When Christ,who isour life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

ngiemboon: Pá’ áa pú’u la, pi zẅé mà tepòŋ we ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ gẅie aa ná pi. Mé gɔɔn mmó pá’ mbàŋa letóŋ panzwě, é panzwě léfa’ mbàŋa, á mmó pá’ nò mpfwɔ́’, á mmó pá’ ntʉ́m nyìŋ légwá shÿó, pá’ legẅiin tsɔ́ ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm, pá’ letÿɔ̌g ntʉ́m nà shúm, á nue letÿɔ̌g ntʉ́m nà shúm, à giŋé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ ntí legu’te shúm ngie ée Ssé.
en: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie é gÿo e Ssé gyáŋa lóŋ ná pʉ̀a pie é té ne ńjú’u ncwò wé wɔ́,
en: for which things' sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:

ngiemboon: ée menò mie pi ka ne ńgÿo á fʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò tepòŋ ka nyě sá’a gẅí.
en: in the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzɛ́te ngie pi sẅɛ mɛ̌ menò ná pi ńgwá’, pá’ mé gwá’a nzẅìŋe nzsǒ la. Mé gɔɔn nyìŋ gẅi légyáŋa lóŋ, á nyìŋ gẅi léńnéŋe ńcÿɔ́g cÿɔ́g, á nyìŋ gẅi lézá’ lekwɔɔn nyìŋ, á nyìŋ gẅi lézoon nzòon, á shwóŋe tepòŋ légíŋe ńkẅɛɛ ncwò pi.
en: But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi kéen sẅɛɛ mà we zẅìŋ pâ menò mé ná pi tà ńgwá’ la, tà cÿɔ̌ nò gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;

ngiemboon: Pi ee pɛ́’ɛ, mbà pi ka kaa mà we nyìŋ sẅé, ḿma’a mbùm pi. Wɛ̌ mà fóo mbwo Ssé. Yé zɔ̌ ne ńtáŋte ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm légwɔ́ gie à ge sẅé we. E Ssé gÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pi ge pú zsé yé.
en: and have put on the newman, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi metsèm kéen ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a pe mesẅé la, à tyɛ̀’te té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà áa gie mé ge gíŋe gɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa nyìŋ Gelekia, wɔɔn gwɔ́ nyìŋ pà Yuda wɔ́. Mé le gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie wɔɔn aa nyìŋ gẅie mé la pú’u yé, wɔɔn gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé la tè yé pú’ wɔ́. Kà pɔ́ légíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie wɔɔn la zí’i ŋwà’ne, wɔɔn tè zí’i wɔ́. Mé ké le gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie wɔɔn nyìŋ aa nkwɔɔn, wɔɔn tè nkwɔɔn wɔ́ wɔ́. Kristo zɔ cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ gí nò ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi metsèm.
en: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bondnorfree: but Christisall, and in all.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la kwoŋo gẅí, ńtsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé. Pú’u la, pi píi tsẅé sẅé ḿma’, ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tɛ’, ńgẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m, ńná nnɛ́ ssé, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ mbʉ́lè, ńgẅiin shÿɔ̀gɔ ntʉ́m.
en: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

ngiemboon: Pi gẅiin shÿɔ̀gɔ ntʉ́m tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, nyìŋ gẅi fʉa nò pi lege ńnáa mbwo ye, ńdege mefʉa mí tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi né pi, pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege la lege mefʉa mí gí la.
en: forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so alsodoye.

ngiemboon: Anò gie á cʉa mɔɔn menò ntsèm, aa pi légẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Nkwòŋe ee nkenkÿo gẅie é ge kwɛ́ɛ gẅi lɔg gÿo tà’ leka’á pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi temte pú’u.
en: And above all these thingsput oncharity, which is the bond of perfectness.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mbʉ́lè gie e fóo mbwo Kristo e jÿó ntʉ́m gẅí, e Ssé la tóŋo gẅi métsèm légwɔ́ gie pi ge gẅiin mbʉ́lè ŋwɛ́, pá’ pi ge gwɔ́ mekèm tà’ mbùm nnɛ́. Pi ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé.
en: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ shwóŋè Kristo ńzye ntʉ́m gẅi kwà’ mboŋó. À cʉa pú’u, pi gẅiin zse nò lélɔg ńzí’i mmó tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbɔɔ lélɔg ńtÿɔ́gte mennɛ́ mí. Pi zɔb ntse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm, ńdɔg ńná ndǎg mbwo yé. Pi zɔbɔ pú’u, mezɔ́b mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, ńzɔbɔ zɔ́bɔ pʉ̀a Kristo, ńzɔb mezɔ́b mie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńnéŋe ntʉ́m pi.
en: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, kà shwóŋó pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi záb pɔ́ lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô mvfò, ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Tá wege Ssé, ńcʉa ná Yěsô
en: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed,doall in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

ngiemboon: Pi pànzwě pie pi zɔ̌’, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pi, ná mbùm ye ssé mvfò ndùm we. Áa pá’ á poŋ ngie manzwě gẅie à la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo.
en: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi mbàŋa pie pi zɔ̌’, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pi kwoŋo nzwě we, tà á gÿo nzwě we cʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ ngɔ́’.
en: Husbands, loveyourwives, and be not bitter against them.

ngiemboon: Pi penkʉ́ pi jú’ ncwò metá pí lâ memá pí nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, á nue áa mmó gie á poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Children, obeyyourparents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi metá penkʉ́, tà pi lába lóŋ penkʉ́ pí, ḿbɔ́g mbùm yɔ́b létsyɛte.
en: Fathers, provoke not your childrento anger, lest they be discouraged.

ngiemboon: Pi menkwɔɔn pi jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin gẅi ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, á nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Pi pɔ́ɔn léfa’a fà’ pɔ́ ndà’ fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ tyé nzèm pi pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ge poŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ la. Pi fa’ nê ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm ńtí pá’ pi ne ńnáa mekù’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Servants, obey in all thingsyourmasters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God:

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńná yɛ̌ ntí fà’ né pi wɔ́, pi fà’ pɔ́ nê ntʉ́m mbòŋo, pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi fa’a pɔ́ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà pi tě fa’a pɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́ la.
en: and whatsoever ye do, doitheartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;

ngiemboon: Tà pi lege ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Kristo zɔ ge lá’ tsɔ́’ɔ fà’a gí, é gʉa ná shúm sé, é náa gí, á nue yé zɔɔ kwà’ nyìŋ gẅie pi fa’a mbwo ye.
en: knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie Ssé tè kwoŋ, mbà Kristo ge lá’ ná pɔ́ mmó gie á ku’u ná ye né yé, á nue e Ssé ee ntěen ńtuŋo metùŋ wɔ́.
en: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.

ngiemboon: Pi metá pu’, pi gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò menkwɔɔn pí, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie mé gÿo, ńne ńkímte ngie pi gí gẅiin gẅi Tá fà’ tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Masters, give untoyourservants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ne sẅíŋte Ssé sẅíŋte, tà pi lyé, pi gwɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé,
en: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ne sẅíŋte Ssé nà ség twó, à ná shÿó peg lɔg shwóŋó nò yé. Mèŋ fo pú’u, ńkyagte nò Kristo gie á la zɔɔn ńdyeen menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a lyeen, mèŋ n gee tsǎŋ pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo sẅíŋte Ssé ńzsé ngie mèŋ n ge shʉa shʉa gɔɔn nò yé pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n gɔɔn.
en: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́, pi zsé ntí gie pi ge lɔg ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b. E Ssé ná shʉa létsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo mbwo pɔ́b, tà pi cʉ́’ yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ tɔ́g.
en: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgẅiin pɔ́ ncwò mbòŋo, ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie á ge kẅéte, ńtsɔ́’ɔ nò mbwo nyìŋ pɔ́ pá’ á kě ḿboŋ ngie mé tsɔ́’.
en: Let your speechbealway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.

ngiemboon: Antʉ̀ nzẅìŋ fɛ́ wege Tishig, gẅie pega pɔ̌ zɔ pǔ fa’a mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó shwóŋó gẅi pá’ mèŋ n gee jʉ’ɔɔn ńnéŋe pú’u. Aa ngàŋa fà’ tɛ’, à zsě pɔ́ nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you,who isa beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tʉʉ lélÿo ńtúmo yé ngie à gʉa shwóŋó gẅi pá’ peg lɔg ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn pú’u, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge tó kẅiŋte gẅí.
en: whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;

ngiemboon: Tychite pɔ́ Onesime ge gÿo pú tó. Onesine aa tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ gẅi, ńgwɔ́ ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ fɛ́ wege, ńzsé yé pɔ́ ndà’ nò Yěsô. Pɔ́ ge tó, éshwóŋó gẅi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńcʉate jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who isoneof you. They shall make known unto you all things whichare donehere.

ngiemboon: Alistag gẅie peg yé pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ, à tsyɛ’té gẅí. Malékuse gẅie aa míŋ fɛ́ Panebâse giŋé ńtsyɛ’te gẅi yé. Mèŋ n ka zɔɔn ńkíme yé mbwo pi. À lɔɔn ńkúu jʉ’ɛ, pi kúe yé mboŋó.
en: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you, and Marcus, sister's son to Barnabas, (touching whom ye received commandments: if he come unto you, receive him;)

ngiemboon: Yěsô gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Jẅistẅis tsyɛ’té gẅi yé. Á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda pie é ka zẅíŋe nò Kristo, ée ndà’ wɔ́b pɔɔn métá pie pega pɔ̌ ee jʉ’ɔɔn, éfa’a ńtí nò*lefùɔ Ssé. Pɔ́ zɔ̌ ka ne ńnéŋe ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn.
en: and Jesus, which is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These onlyare myfellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, which have been a comfort unto me.

ngiemboon: Epafalas gẅie aa nyìŋ lá’ gẅi, a tsyɛ’té gẅí. Wɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie a fà’ fà’ Kristo ńnéŋe ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńne ńdɔgɔ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ḿma’a ncù ná twó sí. À gÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pi ge tʉ tʉ ná nò Yěsô, atsɔ́ mmó le gíŋ ńzága ná pi wɔ́, pi ńnéŋe ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńzẅíŋ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi gÿo.
en: Epaphras, who isoneof you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔ̌g nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn ńgyá pá’ à gya ngɔ́’, éfa’a ńtí gẅí, éfa’a ńtíi mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Ssé pie ée Laodisé mbɔɔ pie ée Hierapolis.
en: For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and themthat arein Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.

ngiemboon: Ashǔ wege Lukase, á lɔ́gta lÿò, mbɔɔ Ndemas tsyɛ’té gẅí.
en: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée Laodisé, ńtsyɛ’te Nimfa mbɔɔ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie áa ndá yé.
en: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

ngiemboon: Pi ge tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwà’ne tà à mag, éfa’ shÿó túm náa mbwo pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Laodisé, pɔ́ tóŋ yɔ́b. Ayɔ́b ŋwà’ne gie mèŋ n tǔm, pɔ́ ná pi gíŋe ńtóŋ gí.
en: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read theepistlefrom Laodicea.

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn mbwò Aleshʉpe ngie, tà á lɔgɔ fà’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka cʉ́me mbwo yé ńdɔg ńgÿo megʉa, ńgie à fa’ mboŋó.
en: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm!
en: Written from Rome to the Colossians by Tychicus and Onesimus.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Pɔl, n ŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á nà lezíŋ séga Silase mbɔɔ Timoté, ńnáa mbwo pʉ̀a cú’tè kristo, pie ée Tesalonika, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé Tá, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ndè Yěsô Kristo. E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonianswhich isin God the Father andinthe Lord Jesus Christ: Gracebeunto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg neŋé síe Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, ńkwaŋte gẅi kwaŋte.
en: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

ngiemboon: Peg ne sẅíŋte Tá wege Ssé fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, ńkímte pá’ pi lɔg pá’ pi záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô éfa’ mefà’, ńkímte ntí fà’ gie pi lɔg nkwòŋe éfa’, ḿbiŋ ńkímte pá’ pi ne ńzẅí’te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěso Kristo té kʉ́a.
en: remembering without ceasing your work of faith, and labour of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, in the sight of God and our Father;

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég, peg ne ńzsé ngie e Ssé kwoŋo gẅí, mbà à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé.
en: knowing, brethren beloved, your election of God.

ngiemboon: Á nue peg ka tè lɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè ndà’ ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo lá’ pi wɔ́, peg ka lɔg pɔ́ metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ḿbiŋ ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé ngie Nkʉ̀ gẅie peg kɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅii kaa nénʉ́, pi ne ńzsé mmó gie peg la gÿo fʉ̀’ gie peg laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, á la gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅéte gẅí.
en: For our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

ngiemboon: Pi la pí fʉ̀’ ná peg, mbɔɔ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Mé tsɛ ne ńnyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’ tɛ’ tá’, pi lɔgɔ lekág gẅie à fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńzẅíŋe shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pàzẅíŋe shwóŋè Ssé pie ée Makedonia mbɔɔ Akay píi fʉ̀’ ná pi.
en: so that ye were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la zɔɔn fó pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńjÿó pàga ngwòŋ Makedonia mbɔɔ ye Akay. Tá mé ké ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ ntsèm ńzsé ntí gie pi lɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, tà ńgwɔ́ peg le gíŋ shwóŋó nyìŋ shwǒŋ wɔ́.
en: For from you sounded out the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith to God-ward is spread abroad; so that we need not to speak any thing.

ngiemboon: Mé ńnéŋe shwóŋ ntí gie pi la lɔg ńkúe wég, á fʉ̀’ gie peg la tóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbɔɔ ntí gie pi la lɔg ńtém nzèm shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé, ésele nnɛ́ ńdíe Ssé ye nénʉ́, ńcʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ mbwo yé gẅie aa ntentʉ́.
en: For they themselves shew of us what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;

ngiemboon: Pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzẅí’te pɔ́ ngie Míŋ we fó tÿǒ lepwó ńtó, Míŋ we ŋwɛ́ aa Yěsô, mbà Ssé la zíme yé nà legwé. Yé zɔ ne ḿbe’e wégè nà ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ne ńtóo.
en: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead,evenJesus, which delivered us from the wrath to come.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég nzèm Kristo, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie peg ka tè tóo tÿǒsoŋ pi pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé né ńzsé ngie peg ka gwaa tó, éfóo ne Filipo, mbà mé nyɛ̌ wég ngɔ́’ wó tɛ’, ńzoonte wég. Tá’ e Ssé náa wég shÿɔg létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wé mbwo pi tà mbɔɔ pá’ mé la gíŋ ne ńnyɛɛ wég pɔ́ ngɔ́’.
en: but even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.

ngiemboon: Anò gie peg zɔɔn ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a, á té nò gie á téŋe wɔ́, peg tè gẅiin nkwaŋá tepòŋ wɔ́, ńké těen ḿbá’a pɔ́ legyè wɔ́.
en: For our exhortationwasnot of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie peg gɔɔn, á nue à la lʉŋte wég tà ńgyá ngie peg ku’u létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wé. Pú’u tá peg těen ńgɔɔn nò pɔ́ nà ntí gie pʉ̀a ge kwoŋo wég wɔ́, peg gɔɔn nò pɔ́ nà ntí gie Ssé ge kwoŋo wég, yé gẅie à líe ntʉ́m wég.
en: but as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie peg laa shwóŋó shwóŋè lʉte wɔ́, ńké tè gɔɔn nò gie peg lɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn pì gie á ge kúu pɔ̀ɔn peg wɔ́. Tà Ssé ne ńzsé.
en: For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; Godiswitness:

ngiemboon: Peg la tè zɛ́te ngie me ná mekù’ még wɔ́, kà pɔ́ gẅi lénná wɔ́, kà pɔ́ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, noryetof others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá, mbà peg la ku’u lélɔg tʉ̀ ńzɛ́te, á nue peg ee ngàŋ ntúm Kristo. Peg la tè pú’u gÿo, peg la pʉ́le yég pʉlé pɔ́ pá’ má múɔ gẅie à ne ńdíe gubé yé la.
en: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:

ngiemboon: Peg la kwoŋo gẅi kwoŋ tà ńtyé pá’ ńgwɔ́ peg é le ná pɔ́ ndà’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé mbwo pi wɔ́, pá’ ńgwɔ́ peg gíŋe ńná mbɔɔ twó ség, á nue á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pi cʉ’ʉ́ mmó ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo peg.
en: so being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gǎ wɔ́ ne kímte pá’ á laa fʉ̀’ gie peg la ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi la, peg gíŋe fa’a tà ḿbú ńkʉ́a, tá ńgẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌. Peg lɔ̌ɔn fa’a zsǒ éfa’a tsẅɛ́’. Peg la tè kwoŋo lécʉ́’ʉ pì’ á mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́.
en: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé mmó gie peg la gÿo, e Ssé gíŋe ne ńzsé yé mà weg tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pàzẅíŋe shwóŋè Ssé, à laa mbòŋ. Peg gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ atsɔ́*lɔ̌’ɔ yég té wó wɔ́.
en: Yearewitnesses, and Godalso, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ne ńzsé ngie peg laa lejʉ́ŋ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pi, ńgÿo pɔ́ pá’ tá múɔ gÿo lejʉ́ŋ gubé yé la.
en: as ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a fatherdothhis children,

ngiemboon: Peg la kẅiŋte gẅí, ńnéŋ ntʉ́m gẅí, ńcwoŋo ńgɔɔn né pi ngie pi giŋe ná mánzsè gẅie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. Yé gẅie à ne ńtóŋo gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ sé, á tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we.
en: that ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó gie á gÿo peg sie Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, áa nue peg la shwóŋó nò Ssé mbwo pi, pi jú’, ńzẅíŋ ngie áa shwóŋè Ssé, ńgie á té shwóŋè nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́. Á ne fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, pi pie pi ka záb ntʉm gẅi ná Yěso.
en: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye receiveditnotasthe word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ngɔ́’ gie e la kú pʉ̀a Jẅidea pie pɔ́ la záb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, ńcú’te ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Ssé, e la kúu gẅi gí. N gɔɔn nue pʉ̀a lá’ pí la nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’, á gwɔ́ pá’ pà Yuda, epʉ̀a lá’ pɔ́b yɔ́b, la nyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’.
en: For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judæa are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as theyhaveof the Jews:

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda ŋwɛ́ la zẅé pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe fʉ̀’e mvfò, pɔ́ kéen ńgíŋ ńzẅé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô. Pɔ́ piŋ ne ńkʉ́e wég. Pɔ́ té gÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé wɔ́, pɔ́ pʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkaga tʉ̀ ńtɔ’ɔ wég léshwóŋó nò Ssé mbwo pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ á ge gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́. Pɔ́ ée pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i nzẅìŋe nò wɔb kẅi’i. E Ssé kéen ńgyáŋa lóŋ tá ńzába pwó yé ná pɔ́b.
en: forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná peg, mbà mefɛ́, tà fó pá’ pege la fege, tà pege cʉ’ʉ́ ne ńgyáte ná meshÿó wɔ́, tá ńké ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ nkwaŋá la, peg fǎ’ meshÿó tɛ’ légíŋe ńtó pege gyáte ná meshÿó, á nue nzyè gi ne ńgyáŋa wég tɛ’.
en: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

ngiemboon: Áa nò ngie peg ka kwoŋo légiŋe ńtóo lá’ pi, kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl, méŋ fǎ’ meshÿó mekwò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tá Sátà ké ńtáte wég táte.
en: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo peg ne ńzẅí’te lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛ’. Pi zɔɔ weg lekág, ńgwɔ́ yeg*ngǔ’ gie peg ge lá’ lɔg tyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, á fʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ gíŋe tó.
en: For whatisour hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing?Arenot even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?

ngiemboon: Oon pi ee weg legú’, ńgwɔ́ weg lekág.
en: For ye are our glory and joy.

ngiemboon: Pá’ nzyè gi ka ne ńgyáŋa wég tɛ’ la, peg ka tè jú’u légiŋe shÿɔg wɔ́. Áa yɛ̌ tá peg Silas ka gyǎ ngie peg yé ge gwɔ́ ńnéŋe Atɛ̀ne,
en: Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left at Athens alone;

ngiemboon: é túmo Timoté né pi. Pi ne ńzsé ngie aa fɛ́ wege gẅie pega pɔ̌ fa’a fà’a Ssé, ńgwá ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo. Peg ka túmo yé légwɔ́ gie à ge gÿo pi tʉte, é piŋ kẅiŋte gẅi nà gẅi lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé,
en: and sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie pi ne ńgyá fʉ̀’ɔɔn, e tè gÿo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɔ́g, ńgwá’a nò Ssé wɔ́. Pi zɔɔn ne ńzsé gí ngie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gẅiin lékúu wégè pàzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: that no man should be moved by these afflictions: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte pá’ peg la nyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ḿvɔg shwóŋó gẅi ngie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ge tóo ná pege. E kéen ńtó tà pi né ńzsé gí.
en: For verily, when we were with you, we told you before that we should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass, and ye know.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mèŋ n te gíŋe ńku’u lézẅí’te wɔ́, éfó ńtúmo Timoté, ńgie à gʉa ńgyá pá’ gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé ka cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ túmo yé, ńne ḿbɔ́gɔ ngie Sátà ka cʉ̌’ ńkwa’te gẅi tà fà’ gie peg la fa’ cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: For this cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter have tempted you, and our labour be in vain.

ngiemboon: Tá áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà a fǒ lá’ pi ḿbiŋ tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn. A shwoŋó wég nò ná gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, á nà nkwòŋo gie pi gẅiin, tà nò poŋo wég. A shwoŋó wég pá’ pi neŋé ńkíme wég pɔ́ mboŋó, mbɔɔ pá’ pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légiŋ ńgyá wég pá’ peg yég ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légiŋe ńgyá gẅí.
en: But now when Timotheus came from you unto us, and brought us good tidings of your faith and charity, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, desiring greatly to see us, as we alsoto seeyou:

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg jǔ’ pú’u, menò tsɛ ne sẅɛ́ɛ wég sẅɛ́, peg tsɛ ne ńgyá pɔ́ ngɔ́’ tá’, anò gí mbɔɔ gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé kẅiŋté wég kẅiŋte.
en: therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, peg ge gíŋe jú’, é gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, á nue pi kaa kʉ́a légwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́,
en: for now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ peg síe Ssé kwà’ lêkɔ́ ńtí gẅí? A ne ńgÿo peg gẅiin lekág pá’ɔɔn tɛ’ ńtí gẅí.
en: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

ngiemboon: Á gʉa fʉ̀’ gie peg ne sẅíŋte Ssé, kà zsǒ wɔ́, kà tsẅɛ́’ wɔ́, peg lʉa mbwo yé tɛ’, ńgie à gÿo peg gíŋ ńgyá meshÿó mí, peg piŋ ńnáa gẅi mmó gie á ne ńzága ná gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: night and day praying exceedingly that we might see your face, and might perfect that which is lacking in your faith?

ngiemboon: Pú’u, peg ne ńdúɔ ngie e Ssé yé máŋwɛ́, gẅie aa Tá wege, mbɔɔ Yěso gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege tsɔ́’ɔ mánzsè peg tó tà ńgyá gẅí.
en: Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.

ngiemboon: Peg giŋé ne ńdúɔ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo nkwòŋe gie pi gẅiin tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbɔɔ gie pi gẅiin ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm, e kẅi’i kẅi’i, ńgie à gÿo e gwɔ́ pá’ gie peg gẅiin ná pi,
en: And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward allmen, even as wedotoward you:

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe gÿo ntʉ́m gẅi ké ne ńzébe pɔ́ ná yé. Tá à lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěso pâ pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’ é tǒ, pi tyé mvfò Tá wege Ssé, ńgwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, atsɔ́*lɔ̌’ɔ gí le gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: to the end he may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, anò gie peg ge lɔg cʉ́me á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie peg ka shwóŋó gẅi ntí gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi lɔg ńnéŋe pú’u, anò gí poŋ Ssé. Á ge gǎ wɔ́ pi ne ńnéŋe pɔ́ pú’u. Tá’ peg giŋé ne sẅíŋte gẅí, tà ḿbú’u pɔ́ mbwo nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ngie, pi gÿo pɔ́ pú’u, ńdɔg ńgee mvfò.
en: Furthermore then we beseech you, brethren, and exhortyouby the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God,soye would abound more and more.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ne ńzsé mmó gie peg la lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ńtsẅi ngie pi gÿo.
en: For ye know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pi gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, tà mbàŋa fa’ pànzwě, tà pànzwě fa’ mbàŋa,
en: For this is the will of God,evenyour sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:

ngiemboon: ńgie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi kú’te mbùmye ná ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ee ntí gie e gẅiin mekù’.
en: that every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

ngiemboon: Tà á le zẅíŋ nkwaŋá tepòŋ jÿó yé pá’ é jÿó pʉ̀a pie é té Ssé zsé wɔ́.
en: not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God:

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa nà nò manzwě, tà nyìŋ gÿo nò tepòŋ ná fɛ́ we, tà á zɔɔn fó fʉte yé fʉte, mélà’mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege ge lá’ néŋ ngɔ́’ twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo pú’u. Peg la lá’ shwóŋó gẅi tà shwóŋ.
en: that nomango beyond and defraud his brother inanymatter: because that the Lordisthe avenger of all such, as we also have forewarned you and testified.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn tè tóŋo wégè ngie pege gÿo menò mie é gẅiin ncÿǒ wɔ́, à la tóŋo wégè ngie pege gẅiin pɔ́ mà gẅie aa we pʉ̀a pé.
en: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ gẅie à ju’ú yɔɔn nò ńdʉ’, à tě ńdʉ’ʉ pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, à lʉ’ʉ pɔ́ Ssé gẅie à la náa zẅìge ndʉalʉ̌a yé mbwo pi.
en: He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, who hath also given unto us his holy Spirit.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó gie ngwɔ́ n ŋwe’e ńná né pi ńtí nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ á té wó wɔ́, n gɔɔn nue pi ka zi’í pɔ́ kwà’ mbwo Ssé lékwoŋ mennɛ́ mí.
en: But as touching brotherly love ye need not that I write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another.

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ne ḿbú ńkwoŋo mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée Makedonia ntsèm. Pú’u la, peg ne ńgɔɔn né pi ngie pi gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńdɔg ńgʉa né mvfò.
en: And indeed ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increase more and more;

ngiemboon: Pi kag tʉ̀, ńnéŋe té cÿɔ́g tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, nyìŋ gẅi gɔɔn nò pɔ́ nà nò gie á ne ńdíe yé. Pi lɔg ntóŋ mbwó mí éfa’ tá ńjÿó pá’ peg la gɔɔn ngie pi gÿo la,
en: and that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́, ge gyá pú’u, é gɔ’te gi ntí leńnéŋe. Pi piŋ ńké le cʉ́’ʉ pì’ mbwo tsɔ́ nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: that ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, andthatye may have lack of nothing.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé nò nénʉ́ gie á líe mepfó, légwɔ́ gie pi tè ńnéŋe nê lemÿɔg pá’ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie pɔ́ té ne ńzẅí’te tsɔ́ mmó mbwo Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: But I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope.

ngiemboon: Pege ne ńzẅíŋe ngie Yěsô la kwé ḿbiŋ ńzíme nà legwé. Áa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ e Ssé ge lá’ lɔgɔ Yěsô gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gwaa kwé ńne ńzába ntʉ́m ná ye, é zím.
en: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńjú’u yɔɔn nò gie peg gee ngɔ̌ɔn, á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ tà’a nò gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la shwóŋó wégè ngie: Epʉ̀a pégè pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lá’ gwaa tó, pɔ́ nyé pɔ́ ntentʉ́ té ge lá’ luŋ mvfò tá pʉ̀a pie é la kwé e pɔ́ɔnte wɔ́.
en: For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we which are aliveandremain unto the coming of the Lord shall not prevent them which are asleep.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ áyɛ̌, mé jú’u mmó gie á pÿé, á gwɔ́ pá’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé we lÿò ge ná ngyè ye tÿǒ gɔɔn nò, ńgwɔ́ pá’ mé ge jú’ ngyè ntàŋ Ssé, kwà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Kristo à fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’, pʉ̀a pie é la gwɔ kwé ńne ńzába ntʉ́m ná ye vɔg ńzíme nà legwé.
en: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pégè pie pɔ́ ge lá’ nyé ntentʉ́, e Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńkaa wɔ́ba pɔ̌ á nà melɔ́ɔn, pâ pɔ̌ métsèm gʉa ńkẅɛ́te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege á tÿǒ. Pâ pɔ̌ lâ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lá’a ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ ye.
en: then we which are aliveandremain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá pi ńnéŋe ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè yɔɔn, ésele ńtÿɔ́gte mennɛ́ mí.
en: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, atsɔ́ nò gie peg ge gíŋe ŋwe’e mbwo pi lélɔg shwóŋó gẅi lyɛ̌’ kà pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò ge lá’ cʉate wɔ́ á té wó wɔ́,
en: But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.

ngiemboon: á nue pi ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé gí ngie lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lá’ vege vege tó pá’ ntsǒŋ gẅie à tóo lêtsẅɛ́’ la.
en: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà ne gɔɔn ngie: Mbʉ́lè ee tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, pɔ́ té gíŋ ne ńcÿɔ’ɔ wɔ́, tá máamáa ngɔ́’ lêen ńké ńtóo ná pɔ́b pá’ múɔ neŋé tà ńgwoon mánzwě shwòŋ la. Atsɔ̌ wɔb á le lÿɔ́’te tà ńtsẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pi mefɛ́ mefɛ́, mbà pi tè nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm wɔ́, á nà ntí gie yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gé tóo ná pi pɔ́ pá’ ntsǒŋ wɔ́.
en: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é giŋe ná jʉ’ gie áa ye kyɛ̀’, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é giŋe pɔ́ zsǒ. Pege tè pʉ̀a pie é giŋe tsẅɛ́’ wɔ́, ńké tè pʉ̀a pie é giŋe lê nzěm wɔ́.
en: Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pege lyé pá’ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Tà pege gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé, pege jÿó mmó à ku’ ku’.
en: Therefore let us not sleep, asdoothers; but let us watch and be sober.

ngiemboon: Pàlyé lelɔ́g lyé lêtsẅɛ́’, pànú melù’ tà ḿbʉ́a nú pɔ́ lêtsẅɛ́’.
en: For they that sleep, sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pege pie pege giŋe fʉ̀’ʉ zsó, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege jÿó mmó à ku’ ku’, nkwòŋe mbɔɔ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé e gwɔ́ yege nzsǒ ncù gie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńnyɛte. Lezẅi’té lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ge gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, à gwɔ́ yégè cÿɔ́’ɔ ncù gie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńnyɛte.
en: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn tè tsɔ́’ɔ wégè pɔ́ légyáŋa lóŋ ná pege, pege gyá ngɔ́’ wɔ́, à la tsɔ́’ɔ wégè pɔ́ légÿo pege cʉa nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ńgẅiin letsẅɛ́.
en: For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: À la kwé nà twó ségè, légwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn fó ńkwé mbɔɔ kwě, kà ńnyé pɔ́ ntentʉ́ wɔ́, mbà pega pɔ́ zɔɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́.
en: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi kẅiŋte mennɛ́ mí pi né pi, nyìŋ tóonte nyìŋ, nyìŋ tóonte nyìŋ, pá’ pi ne ńgÿo pú’u lɛ.
en: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg sẅiŋté gẅi ngie pi ná mekù’ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fa’a fà’a Ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, á mbwo pʉ̀a pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b á mvfò pi ngie pɔ́ tÿɔ́gte gẅí.
en: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo mekù’ mɔ́b mboŋó, ńkwoŋo wɔ́b tɛ’, ńtí twó fà’ gie pɔ́ ée mǒ, ḿbɔ́ɔn cÿɔ́g tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake.Andbe at peace among yourselves.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg ne sẅíŋte gẅi ngie pi tÿɔ́gte melóŋ, ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a pie ntʉ́m wɔ́b nyé ḿvɛɛ vɛ, ńtóonte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ nyé pɔ́ tè tʉte, ńgẅiin pɔ́ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ nzèm wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward allmen.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔgɔ nò tepòŋ ńtsɔ́’ɔ nò tepòŋ. Pi gÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi té tyɛ̀’te.
en: See that none render evil for evil unto anyman; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to allmen.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńkága kǎg fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: Rejoice evermore.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm,
en: Pray without ceasing.

ngiemboon: ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo ye nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Áa mmó gie e Ssé kwoŋ ngie pi pie pia Yěsô Kristo léen ńcʉ́’ʉ tà’ nyìŋ la, pi ne ńgÿo.
en: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tɔ’ɔ Zẅìge Ssé léfa’a fà’.
en: Quench not the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwága shwóŋè pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé,
en: Despise not prophesyings.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà kɔ́ wɔ́, ńtsa’ ḿbí pɔ́ ye mbòŋo,
en: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

ngiemboon: ḿbú ńkÿo nò tepòŋ ntsèm.
en: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńdúɔ ngie e Ssé lê twó yé, gẅie aa ngàŋ mbʉ́lè, à gÿo pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé tà ńcʉ́me, ńgie à pyɛ́bɛ zẅìge gí, ḿbyɛ́b ntʉ́m gẅí, ḿbyɛ́b mbùm gi, à gÿo ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo gé gÿo tó, pi gwɔ́ té sɔɔn*lɔ̌’ ná pi.
en: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; andI pray Godyour whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi pi cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé ge gÿo à gwɔ́ pú’u, á nue à tè kúbe.
en: Faithfulishe that calleth you, who also will doit.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pi sẅíŋte Ssé mbɔɔ ná ség twó.
en: Brethren, pray for us.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te mefɛ́ mefɛ́ métsèm, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te ńtáŋte mennɛ́ mí nà ntí ye pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

ngiemboon: Á nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n gɔɔn né pi ngie pi tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mvfò pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm.
en: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi.
en: The first epistle unto the Thessalonians was written from Athens.

ngiemboon: Pɔl, Silase mbɔɔ Timoté náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo cú’tè gie áa Tesalonika ńgwɔ́ cú’tè Tá wege Ssé, mbɔɔ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo.
en: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg gẅiin léná ndǎg mbwo Ssé nà twó sí ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm. Áa mbòŋ ngie mé gÿo pú’u, mélà’mie pi tè ne ńkʉ́a lézáb ntʉ̀m ná yé wɔ́, ńgíŋe ne ńgẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńdɔgɔ ńgee pɔ́ lê mvfò.
en: We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, tá peg gwaa ńkím lezíŋ sí tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé, ńkím pɔ́ nê ka’te, mélà’mie pʉ̀a ne ńnyɛɛ gẅi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀, ńne ńkʉ́e gẅí, pi ké tè cú’tè kÿo, pi ké shÿɔg shÿɔg, ńne ńzába ntʉ́m gẅi pɔ́ ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: so that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ŋag ntsaŋ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Á nue ngɔ́’ gie pi ne ńgyá fʉ̀’ɔɔn, e gÿo ngie pi ku’ pʉ̀a pie pi ge lá’ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé. Pi gyá ngɔ́’ ńtí pɔ́ pú’u.
en: which isa manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer:

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mbóŋo ngie e Ssé ge lá’ ŋag ntsaŋ pɔ́ pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te, é ná ngɔ́’ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn,
en: seeingit isa righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

ngiemboon: é náa sẅétè mbwo pi pie pi ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn, é gíŋe ná mbɔɔ mbwo peg yég. Mɔɔn menò ge lá’ cʉate á fʉ̀’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wégè Yěsô Kristo ge lá’ fó tÿǒ lepwó é kẅɛ, é nyɛ mbùm ye. Pâ mecÿɔ́’ pé pie é gẅiin metʉ̀ tɛ’ é gwɔ́.
en: and to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwaa tó pege gyá mmɔ̌g tÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋ soŋ, à gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la lʉ’ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo wé gyá ngɔ́’.
en: in flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Ngɔ́’ gie pɔ́ ge lá’ gyá á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge pú lége, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege tsɛ́ nzsè mbwo pɔ́b tà pɔ́ le sɔb nÿɔ́g ná yé wɔ́, é ké le gyá máamáa shʉ́shÿɔ́g we wɔ́.
en: who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pú’u, nà lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lá’ tó, á gwɔ́ nà yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lÿò, epʉ̀a pé ne ńnáa mekù’ mé, pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m ná yé métsèm ne ńgu’te yé. Pi gwɔ́ gí tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mélà’mie pi la zẅíŋe nò yé gie peg la shwóŋó gẅí.
en: when he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá peg ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm ná twó sí, ńgie à gÿo pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi ku’u létsẅɛ́ pá’ à la ká’a mbwo pi. Peg giŋé ne sẅíŋte yé, ngie à lɔg metʉ̀ mé ńkẅéte gẅi pi gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ nò mbòŋo wɔ́ gie pi ne ńkwoŋo légÿo, mbɔɔ fà’ gie pi ne ńgÿo ńtí pá’ pi záb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy ofthiscalling, and fulfil all the good pleasure ofhisgoodness, and the work of faith with power:

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, epʉ̀a mesoŋ gu’te lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô, ńcʉa ná mà gẅí. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ gu’te gẅi ńcʉa ná yé yé. Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pú’u, á nue e Ssé yege mbɔɔ Yěsô Kristo ne ńdɔgɔ pá’ pɔ́ kwoŋo wégè, ńcÿó gʉm yégè.
en: that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, á gʉa ná nò gie á ne ńdíe lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô ge lá’ gíŋe tó, pege cú’te mvfò yé la, peg ne sẅíŋte gẅi ngie:
en: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, andbyour gathering together unto him,

ngiemboon: Tà pi jú’ pá’ etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tǒ, ḿvege vege. Tà pi pɔ́g. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à neŋé ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé zɔ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn, tà fó ńgwɔ́ gie pi jǔ’ pɔ́ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ne shwóŋó nò Ssé, kà mé fó shwóŋó gẅi pɔ́ ngie mèŋ n zɔ ŋwe’é pú’u wɔ́, tà pi zẅíŋ.
en: that ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ nyìŋ fʉte gẅí, kà pɔ́ nê yɛ̌ ntí wɔ́. Yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ té lá’ tó té gwɔ́ gie etsɔ̌ ntí menò vɔ̌g ńcʉate wɔ́. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a tá ńgyɔɔn ge lá’ lʉ’ʉ lé jú’ ncwò Ssé. Fùɔ menò tepòŋ kẅɛ ńtyé tá yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ lêen ńké ńtó. Á yé wá gẅie mé ge lá’ ma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g la.
en: Let no man deceive you by any means: forthat day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ kẅɛ tyé, é lêen ké zye létɔ’ pʉ̀a ngie tà pɔ́ gíŋe ńgu’te tsɔ́ mmó tà mbɔɔ Ssé, é ne gɔɔn ngie yé pú ńcʉa wɔ́b métsèm, é kú mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ńnéŋe, é gɔɔn ngie yé zɔɔ Ssé.
en: who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tè ne ńkímte ngie afʉ̀’ gie n daa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, n da shwóŋó gẅi menó mɔɔn wɔ́?
en: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé mmó gie á táte fùɔ menò tepòŋ tá à těen ńkẅɛɛ ńtyé fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́. Yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo ku’, tá à kẅɛ.
en: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.

ngiemboon: Menò mie fùɔ menò tepòŋ ge lá’ gÿo, é kěen ńzɔɔn ńzyéte, tá ńké ńnyé shúu shú, é cʉ́’ pɔ́ ndà’ pá’ mé ge pe’e nyìŋ gẅie à táte yé.
en: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now lettethwill let, until he be taken out of the way.

ngiemboon: Yé fùɔ menò tepòŋ lêen ńké ńkẅɛ. Á yé gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ge lá’ fÿɔ́gɔ zẅɛ̌ ncwò yé ná yé à kwé, ńtí gie Yěsô lɔ̌g ńtó, e gÿo à mag.
en: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

ngiemboon: Fùɔ menò tepòŋ ge lá’ gwaa tó, Sátà néŋ metʉ̀ mé ná yé, à lɔg ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn laa ndàa gyá menò mentí mentí, é lɔg fʉte pʉ̀a.
en: even him, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ lɔg menò mie é té nò wɔ́ mentí mentí, éfʉte pʉ̀a pie é ge lá’ pyé. Pɔ́ pyé pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ lékwoŋo nò gie áa nénʉ́ gie á kě gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: and with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, e Ssé zẅíŋ atsɔ́ mmó tó ńgÿo pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ḿbúu pǔ, légwɔ́ gie nkwaŋá wɔ́b ge cʉ́’ tyé pɔ́ nà menò mie é té nò wɔ́.
en: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kaa zẅíŋe nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́, á nò gie á té nò wɔ́ zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ḿboŋo wɔ́b, pɔ́ lêen ńké ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: that they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pie e Ssé kwoŋo wɔ́b, á gʉa ná peg, mbà peg gẅiin lésíe Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí gẅí, mélà’mie à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi tà fó nzyète légwɔ́ gie pi ge tsẅɛ́. Pi tsẅɛ́ɛ ńtí pá’ a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńgÿo pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé, mbɔɔ pá’ pi záb ntʉ̀m nà nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie é la gÿo e Ssé lɔg Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie peg la tsẅii mbwo pi, ńtóŋo gẅí, légwɔ́ gie pi ge kúu tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà pi kʉ́a. Ammó gie peg ka zí’i gẅí, kà lê ncwò wɔ́, kà ńŋwe’e pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne wɔ́, pi kú’te mboŋó.
en: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé la kwoŋo wégè, ńdɔgɔ lécÿó gʉm yégè, pege cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé, ńkẅiŋte wégè ná ntí gie e těen ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pege ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te mmó mbòŋo gie à la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pé. Pú’u, peg ne ńdúɔ mbwo yé mbɔɔ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ngie:
en: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath givenuseverlasting consolation and good hope through grace,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kẅiŋte gẅí, ńnáa gẅi tʉ̀ pi lɔg ńgÿo pɔ́ menò mbòŋo, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin pɔ́ shwóŋè mbòŋo.
en: comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, anò gie peg ge lɔg cʉ́me, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pi sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó ség, tá shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kẅi’i sa jʉ’, ńgwɔ́ mmó mekù’ pá’ áa mbʉ̀a pi ńgwɔ́ lɛ.
en: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may havefreecourse, and be glorified, even asit iswith you:

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe sẅíŋte Ssé ngie tà peg gwe mbwo pʉ̀a tepòŋ, pie ée pàfa’ mentsaŋ. Pú’u, á nue pʉ̀a metsèm zɔ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe lézáb ntʉ̀m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for allmenhave not faith.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa ńké těen ńkúbe wɔ́. À ge gÿo pi le kʉ́a, é piŋ le zẅíŋ Sátà zába pwó ná pi wɔ́.
en: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keepyoufrom evil.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pi, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgÿo peg zsé ngie pi ne ńgÿo mmó gie peg ne ńtsẅii ngie pi gÿo. Ńgwɔ́ gie peg lɔɔn ńgíŋ ńtsẅi ngie pi gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà pi ge gÿo pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńdúɔ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zí’i gẅi lékẅi’i ńkwoŋ Ssé, mbɔɔ léshÿɔg ngɔ́’ pá’ ye Kristo.
en: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, peg lɔ̌g lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo, ńtsẅii mbwo pi ngie pi lÿɔ́’ mbɔɔ wɛ̌ fɛ́ gẅi wɔ́ gẅie à pɔ́gɔ fà’ pɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ńké tè ne ńgiŋe ná ntí gie peg la zí’i gẅi laa pɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ pi gí ne ńzsé pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gÿo pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgiŋe ná mekwò még, á nue peg laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, peg tě ḿbɔ́gɔ fà’ wɔ́.
en: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

ngiemboon: Peg la tè jÿó mmó léjÿó nyìŋ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́, peg la fa’ tá ńtéŋe zì’i tá ńjÿó mmó, éfa’ tsẅɛ́’ mbɔɔ zsǒ ḿbɔ́gɔ lécʉ́’ pʉ̀a pie pi ge zɔ́gɔ jÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b jÿɔ́g.
en: neither did we eat any man's bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:

ngiemboon: Peg la zɔɔn ńkwa’ ńgẅiin légɔɔn ngie pi jÿɔ́gɔ wég, tá ńgwɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie pi pí fʉ̀’ ná peg.
en: not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie peg la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, peg ne ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à tè fa’a fà’ wɔ́, tà á ké ńjÿó mmó léjÿó.
en: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.

ngiemboon: Peg piŋ ne ńjú’u, mé gɔɔn ngie é tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ḿbɔ́gɔ fà’ pɔ̌g, ńgwá shwóŋó pɔ́ menò mie é té ne ńdíe wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔ̌g lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ńgɔɔn né pɛ̌ pʉ̀a tà ńdɔgɔ ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b tÿɔ́g ngie pɔ́ pʉ́le nnɛ́ éfa’a fà’, ńjÿó shúm léjÿó sie pɔ́ zɔ̌ fǎ’.
en: Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná pi, mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà pi kʉ́a légÿo pɔ́ menò mie ée mbòŋ.
en: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò gie peg gɔ̌ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne lɔɔn, pi líe yé mboŋó. Tà pia pɔ̌ gíŋe ńtéme nò, ńzsé ngie eshʉ́ ge kúu yé.
en: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ḿbɔ́ɔn gẅi lélɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ngàŋ mbù gẅi. Pi kaga yé pɔ́ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kaga fɛ́ we.
en: Yet counthimnot as an enemy, but admonishhimas a brother.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pʉ̀a, yé lê twó yé zɔ ne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi fʉ̀’ ntsèm, á nà meshÿó ntsèm. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lordbewith you all.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl, mèŋ n tsyɛ’té gẅí. Mèŋ n dɔ̌g pɔ́ kwà’ pwó yɔ́ɔn, ńŋwe’e yɔɔn tsyɛ̀’te. Áa pá’ mèŋ n gee ńzɔɔn ńŋwe’e ná yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne wɔ́ gie mèŋ n tǔm. Pi ge liŋe pwó léŋwe’e mmó yɔ́ɔn.
en: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsǒ Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: The second epistle to the Thessalonians was written from Athens.
