ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne áa ŋwe’e mèŋ Pɔl, ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. Mèŋ n gee ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô á nue e Ssé pɔ́ Yěsô la tsẅi ngie mèŋ n gwɔ́ wɛ̌. Yé Ssé zɔ gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ, Yěsô Kristo ne ńgÿo yé ngie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pege ne ńzwí’te mbwo Ssé à pumte.
en: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ,which isour hope;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ŋwe’e ńnáa mbwo gù Timoté. Ɔ̀ɔ mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, ńtí nò Yěsô Kristo gẅie pɔgɔ pǔ ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé. Mèŋ n ne ńdúɔ mbwo Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ né gù, ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mú, ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m gù.
en: unto Timothy,myown son in the faith: Grace, mercy,andpeace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie ɔ̀ ńnéŋe Efeso, pá’ mèŋ n ka gwɔ́ gʉa lê Makedonia ńtsẅii mbwo gù la, ńnéŋe wó, ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge lʉ’ʉ mbwo tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée wó ngie tà pɔ́ gíŋe ńzí’i pʉ̀a menò mie ée ná nò Yěsô Kristo é té ná mánzsè wɔ́.
en: As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,

ngiemboon: Gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ nyé menò pú’nkwɔb, lâ menò pà mangʉa njʉ’ pɔ́b pie pɔ́ tʉ́ é té mag. Yɛ̌ ntí menò gÿo mé zoŋo nò pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, é té kẅéte lézsé mmó gie Ssé la kwaŋa légÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ tsẅɛ́ wɔ́. Mé lɔg pɔ́ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tá ńzsé yɛ̌ mmó.
en: neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith:so do.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gɔɔn yɛ̌ nò né pɔ́b légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge kwoŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà shwóŋó nò. Lekwoŋo nyìŋ tà shwóŋó nò, à zɛ́te légẅiin ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńzɛ́te légÿo mmó gie mbùm ɔ̀ té cúa gú mǒ wɔ́, ḿbiŋe ńzɛ́te lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, kwà’ nénʉ́.
en: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, andofa good conscience, andoffaith unfeigned:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a kéen ńnyé mɔɔn menò, ńkúu pyé, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzɔ́gɔ ńzoŋo pɔ́ menò mie é té tyé.
en: from which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkwoŋo légwɔ́ pà zí’i mbʉ̌ Mǒsê mbwo pʉ̀a. Pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn nò gie kwà’ pɔ́b té ne ńjú’u wɔ́, ḿbiŋe ne ńdá’te nò gie pɔ́ té ne ńzsé wɔ́ tà ńnéŋe pɔ́ twó.
en: desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm ne ńzsé ngie mbʉ̌ mie e Ssé la cʉa ná Mǒsê ńná, ée mbòŋ ná pá’ mé lɔɔn ńkú’te ná ntí gie é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But we know that the lawisgood, if a man use it lawfully;

ngiemboon: Pege giŋé ńne ńzsé ngie e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn těen ńtÿɔ́gɔ*lepʉ̌ ńtí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo nò gie á tyé wɔ́, à lɔ̌ɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ*lepʉ̌ ńtí pàfʉ̀’ menò, lâ pàtʉʉ twó, ńtí pàgwág Ssé, lâ pàgÿo menò tepòŋ, ńgíŋe ńtí mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té jú’ ncwò Ssé wɔ́, ńké tè lɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó gie á fóo mbwo yé ńtóŋo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńgíŋe ńtÿɔ́gɔ*lepʉ̌ ńtí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zẅéte metá pɔ́b lâ memá pɔ́b, ńtí mefÿɛ́.
en: knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

ngiemboon: Mé la tÿɔ́g*lepʉ̌ ńtí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe, ńtí mbàŋa gie é nuŋe petsɔ́, ńtí pàtáŋa pu’. Mé la tÿɔ́g*lepʉ̌ ńtí ngàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, ńtí pàjÿò ńgyá pie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mengàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò. À la tÿɔ́g*lepʉ̌ ńtí pʉ̀a pie é fa’ shÿó ńgÿo mmó gie á té pumte nà nò nénʉ́ gie mé zí’i wégè wɔ́.
en: for whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò gie mé zí’i wégè, áa tsɛ̀ɛ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie pege fó mǒ ńzsé shʉ́shÿɔ́g Ssé. Yé Ssé gẅie à ne ńkwoŋo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná pege léen ńcʉ́me wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo mèŋ.
en: according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sǐe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo pá’ à la náa wɔ̀ɔn metʉ̀ á lélɔg fa’a fà’ yé. Mèŋ sǐe yé pá’ à la gyá ngie mèŋ n ku’u we nyìŋ, ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋa fà’ we.
en: And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pá’ á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, mèŋ shwóŋó ná yé té poŋ, ńtsɔ́’ɔ kwò pʉ̀a pé té poŋ, ńzoonte yé. E Ssé la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, mélà’mie n dɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo té zsé mmó gie mèŋ n gÿo yɛ̌, mbà mèŋ n kaa záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I diditignorantly in unbelief.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, la gÿo nò mbòŋo yé ná mèŋ tà á zyɛ́’. Á la gÿo mèŋ n záb ntʉ́m ná yé, mèŋ m biŋ ńkwoŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Á fóo ná pá’ mèŋ n da nnɛ́ ná yé.
en: And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô Kristo la tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó légÿo pʉ̀a tepòŋ tsẅɛ́, yɛ̌ nò áa jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m wé mǒ ntsèm ntsèm. Mèŋ m biŋ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a tepòŋ ńgwɔ́ ndúm.
en: Thisisa faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

ngiemboon: Tá’, e Ssé la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn, tà Yěsô Kristo nyɛɛ ná mèŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee ndúm tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàgÿo menò tepòŋ ngie à zsé léshÿɔg. Pú’u ńdɔg ńná fʉ̀’ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é ge gÿo záb ntʉ́m ná yé, é gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.

ngiemboon: Mekù’ lâ gù’te é lá’a ńgwɔ́ mengù’u mengù’, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo fùɔ gẅie à ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Yé gẅie aa ndá’ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ tèkwé, ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé té gyá yé nê lejÿɔ́g wɔ́.*Amen.
en: Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God,behonour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Timoté, gù míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n cʉ́me yɔɔn shwóŋè mbwo gù, á gwɔ́ pá’ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔ́ɔn ná gù. Néŋe ne ńkímte menò mie pɔ́ la gɔɔn ŋwɛ́, ńzsé ngie é ge gwɔ́ shú shúm lɔg ńdÿɔ́’ ncù mbòŋo ná lezíŋ Ssé.
en: This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ lélÿɔ́’ wɛ̌ ncù, ɔ̀ lɔg pɔ́ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ḿbiŋ ḿbɔ́ɔn légÿo mmó gie mbùm jù ge cúa gú mǒ. Mbùm tsɔ̌ lelÿò pʉ̀a la cúa wɔ́b, pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ lé jú’, wɔb lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé kúu pyé.
en: holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:

ngiemboon: Áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɛ̌, Himené pɔ́ Alekzáŋdele gwɔ́ wó. N da néŋ pɔɔn pʉ̀a mépʉ́a nà mbwó Sátà. Légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge kúu mbwo yé, é zí’i pá’ pɔ́ té gíŋe gwá kʉ́’ʉ cʉŋte lezíŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: of whom is Hymenæus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mèŋ n ge gwɔ gíŋ gɔɔn nò, é vɔg gɔɔn ngie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pʉ̀a Ssé ne tsyɛ’te yé nà twó mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńne ńdúɔ mbwo yé ngie à kẅéte wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, ńne sẅíŋte yé, ńne síe yé nà twó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions,andgiving of thanks, be made for all men;

ngiemboon: Mé ne sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó mefùɔ, tà mbɔɔ ná twó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é sá’a lá’. Légwɔ́ gie pege ge ńnéŋe mboŋó, à lá’a yege gwɔ́ lá’a mbʉ́lè. Pege gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é gÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé, ńgẅiin tsẅé gie á gẅiin mekù’.
en: for kings, andforall that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

ngiemboon: Lesẅiŋté Ssé nà twó pʉ̀a aa mbòŋ, ńgwɔ́ mmó gie á poŋ Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: For thisisgood and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;

ngiemboon: Yé gẅie à ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm tsẅɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nò nénʉ́.
en: who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

ngiemboon: Aa Yěsô Kristo, ńgwɔ́ yé nyìŋ mesoŋ
en: Forthere isone God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

ngiemboon: Kwà’ yé máŋwɛ́ la náa twó yé ńdɔg ńcu’ pʉ̀a metsèm mbwo legwé, ńdɔg pú’u, ńnyɛɛ ná fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé la záb ngie yé Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie epʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm tsẅɛ́.
en: who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zába wɔ̀ɔn ngie mèŋ n gwɔ́ ntsẅì nkʉ̀ we, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô létsẅii yɛ̌ nò. À la cʉ́me mbwo mèŋ ngie mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, lézáb ntʉ́m ná Kristo, mbɔɔ lézsé nò gie áa nénʉ́. Mèŋ shwóŋó nò nénʉ́, mèŋ n těen ńcÿɔ nò wɔ́.
en: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ,andlie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná nò létsyɛ’te Ssé mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ gie pʉ̀a Kristo cu’té wó wɔ́, mbàŋa tsyɛ’te Ssé, ńgwɔ tsyɛ’te, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é té záb mbwó nà shúm tepòŋ tá ḿbiŋ ńkwé’e ńnáa tÿǒ fʉ̀’e létsyɛ’te Ssé wɔ́. Pɔ́ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é té ngàŋ lóŋ wɔ́, ńké tè fa’ mentsaŋ wɔ́.
en: I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.

ngiemboon: N giŋé ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pànzwě lɔɔn ńne ńgee lê tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, pɔ́ ma’ menzsǒ mie ée mbòŋ mbwo pʉ̀a Ssé, é menzsǒ mie é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ ntí wɔ́, é mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mé pànzwě pie mekù’ ée ná pɔ́b. Tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ lékẅiŋ mbùm yɔb, ńtáŋte menòŋo twó mɔ́b pɔ́ nà tsɔ̌ ntí gie e sẅile sẅile. Kà ńjÿɔ́g pɔ́ shúm sie é cÿɔ́g pɔ́ nkáb tɛ’ wɔ́, tà pɔ́ ma’ menzsǒ lélɔg ńnyɛ pɔ́ nnɛ́.
en: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ lɔg pɔ́ mà wɔ́b ńnyɛ ngie pɔ́ ée pànzwě pie é sí. Áa pá’ pànzwě pie é gÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé gẅiin légÿo.
en: but (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě lɔɔn ńnéŋe ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, pɔ́ pʉ́le ńnéŋe ssé, ńzẅí’te mmó gie mé ne ńzí’i tà pɔ́ le pége shwǒŋ wɔ́.
en: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

ngiemboon: N kaa zẅíŋ ngie pànzwě zí’i mbàŋa mmó wɔ́. Pɔ́ gíŋe tè gẅiin lésá’ mbàŋa wɔ́. Pɔ́ gẅiin pɔ́ lépʉ́le ńnéŋe, ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò wɔ́b.
en: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie Ssé la vɔg ḿbwóon Adam, tá mbɔ́ɔntè ḿbwóon Eva.
en: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

ngiemboon: Adam zɔ la piŋ tè zẅíŋ mé fʉte yé wɔ́. Manzwě zɔ la zẅíŋ mé fʉte yé, á fʉa nò mbwo Ssé.
en: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, manzwě ge lɔg pɔ́ pá’ à gẅiin penkʉ́ tá tsẅɛ́. Tá’, á zɛ́te ngie à ké ńzáb pɔ́ ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńkwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgẅiin mbùm yé lê mekù’, ńgÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé.
en: Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.

ngiemboon: Anò gie n gee ńgɔɔn áa nénʉ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ ndìe cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, mbà à tsɔ́ɔn fà’ gie á gẅiin mekù’.
en: Thisisa true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie ndìe cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé té kíme yé té poŋ wɔ́. Á zɛ́te ngie à gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ manzwě wémɔ’ɔ́, tà á gÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà á cʉa. À gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à sáŋa nò tá ńgÿo, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kúe megʉ̀ mboŋó, ńku’u lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó.
en: A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;

ngiemboon: Á té zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ma’ mbùm yé ná melù’ wɔ́, ńgie à sá’ mbʉ̀’ wɔ́. Á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pʉlé, á nyìŋ gẅie à tè ntsaŋ fa’. Tà á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à záb ntʉ́m wé nà nkáb.
en: not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à líe mbʉ̀a ye mboŋó, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin penkʉ́ pé nà ntí gie pɔ́ ge jú’ ncwò wé, é gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: one that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn tè zsé lélíe mbʉ̀a yé wɔ́, á líe cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé lêkɔ́?
en: (for if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

ngiemboon: Á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie nyìŋ gẅie à líe cú’tè à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ka nyě ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ á tóo ńŋá’te nnɛ́, éfʉa nò, ńgwe ntsaŋ pá’ Sátà.
en: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńne ńzɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́ é kíme yé pɔ́ mboŋó. Pú’u, etsɔ́ menò mé mie ńgwɔ́ mé kem é le gwɔ́ wó wɔ́, Sátà le ku’u lélʉ’ lekÿo tà ńdɔg ńgwoon yé wɔ́.
en: Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie pàfa’ mefà’ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gwɔ́ yɔ́b pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin mekù’, ńgwɔ́ pàshwóŋó nò nénʉ́, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é té ma’ mbùm yɔb ná melù’ wɔ́, ńké le gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋ nkáb ńgáte gaté wɔ́.
en: Likewisemustthe deaconsbegrave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ kú’te nò nénʉ́ gie á laa lelyěen, e Ssé nyɛɛ wégè, ńkú’te nà ntí gie mbùm yɔb tè cúa wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie mé zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtsa’a wɔ́b mboŋó, ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn tè*lɔ̌’ɔ yɔ́b gyá, mé lêen ńké ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pàfa’a tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, beingfoundblameless.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie pànzwě pɔ́bgíŋe ńgẅiin mekù’, pɔ́ le gwɔ́ ngàŋ melɔ̀ɔn wɔ́, pɔ́ légÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà á cʉa wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mé cʉmé mbwo pɔ́b tà mé le lɔ̌’ mǒ gyá.
en: Even somust theirwivesbegrave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie pàfa’ mefà’ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ tà’ manzwě, ńdíe membʉ̀a mɔ́b mboŋó, tà mbɔɔ penkʉ́ pɔ́b.
en: Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.

ngiemboon: Pàfa’ mefà’ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo lɔɔn fa’a fà’ mboŋó, mbà mé ge ná mekù’ mɔ́b, pɔ́ ku’u légɔɔn nò gie pɔ́ zába ntʉ́m ná Yěsô ńtí yɛ̌ tà pɔ́ le pɔ́g.
en: For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Timoté, mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie n te láte tá tó gyá gú wɔ́. Mèŋ n ké ńŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo gù pá’ɔɔn,
en: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn tè tɔ́g ńtó wɔ́, ɔ̀ tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńjú’ pá’ pʉ̀a pie e Ssé ee tá wɔ́b gẅiin légiŋ pú’u, á tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè yɔ́b. Yɛ̌ cú’tè áa ye pʉ̀a Ssé gie ee ntentʉ́. Á tÿɔ́g ntóon gie e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ á nà nò gie áa nénʉ́ tà ńgíŋ ńjÿɔ́’ tsɔ̌.
en: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la sa’a yé, ńdɔg ńgʉa né tÿǒ lepwó, á jʉ’ʉ legú’.
en: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńnyɛte ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ge lá’a nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsònzèm pɔ́ le gíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m nà nò gie pege ne ńzába ntʉ́m mǒ lɔɔn wɔ́, legyè sɔ́b cʉ́’ ńtyé pɔ́ nà*messé tepòŋ mie é fʉte pʉ̀a, ńtʉʉ lelÿò ńtyé pɔ́ nà menò mie*messé tepòŋ zí’i pʉ̀a.
en: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie mɛ̌ menò ge lá’ kẅɛɛ ncwò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ cÿɔ nò, ńgwɔ́ pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, mbà pɔ́ léen shÿɔg tà mbùm yɔb cʉ́’ʉ ńcúa wɔ́b pɔ́ téen ńjú’u wɔ́.
en: speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a ngie tà pɔ́ zɔ́’, ńgie tà pɔ́ pfɛ́ tsɔ́ shúm léjÿó, tá mbà Ssé la nyɛte sɛ̌ shúm légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ̀m ná yé, ńne ńzsé nò gie áa nénʉ́, ge pi, ésie yé mǒ, é jÿó.
en: forbidding to marry,and commandingto abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ gwɔ́, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la nyɛte wɔ́ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ. Atsɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ mé gwá’a mǒ á té wó wɔ́. Tá á ké ńzɛ́te ngie mé gwaa ne jÿó sɛ̌ shúm, ńne sie Ssé.
en: For every creature of Godisgood, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

ngiemboon: Mé jÿó á nue e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, mé gíŋ ńne sie yé mǒ.
en: for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ kwà’ ngàŋa fà’ Yěsô Kristo, pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńzí’i mefɛ́ mefɛ́ mɔɔn menò zí’i. Á gʉa ná kwà’ gù, anò Yěsô gÿo ɔ̀ cwoŋo ńtʉte pá’ ɔ̀ kě ńkú’te nò gie peg ka záb ntʉ́m mǒ mboŋó mbɔɔ pá’ ɔ̀ ka jú’u nò nénʉ́ gie mé ka zí’i gú lɛ.
en: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

ngiemboon: Ké ḿbɔ́ɔn menò pú’kwɔb mie é té kẅéte, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, é tɔ’ pʉ̀a lézáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô. Ké ńne ńzí’i pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé.
en: But refuse profane and old wives' fables, and exercise thyselfratherunto godliness.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkÿo ndʉ̌, mbà é ge kẅéte ndà’ mbùm ye. Tá legÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé, á kẅéte nà shúm ntsèm. Pege fó mǒ ńzsé ngie pege ge gwɔ́ wó nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn tà mbɔɔ ná fʉ̀’ gie á ge gÿo tá tó.
en: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè yɔɔn áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ jú’ ńzẅíŋ.
en: Thisisa faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á gÿo peg fa’a fà’ Ssé tà ńtéŋe zì’i, ḿma’a ncù. Peg fa’a, ńne ńzẅí’te kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ mbwo Ssé gie ee ntentʉ́. Yé zɔ̌ gÿo pá’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm ge tsẅɛ́, tá nyìŋ ké ńgwɔ́ tsẅɛ́, éfó pɔ́ ná pá’ à záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô.
en: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie ɔ̀ ge tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a, é piŋ ne zí’i wɔ́b.
en: These things command and teach.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn légÿo mé gwága gú ngie ɔ́ɔ múɔ. Kag tʉ̀ tà pʉ̀a Kristo pí fʉ̀’ ná gù. À cʉa nà shwóŋè jú, á nà megiŋe mú, á nà jù ntí lekwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, á nà jù ntí lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, á ná gù lépɔ́ɔn nkwaŋá gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é cʉŋte gú.
en: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

ngiemboon: Ne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé mvfò pʉ̀a, ńne ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b mmó tá ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

ngiemboon: Tè lɔgɔ mmó gie e Ssé la lɔg ńcÿó gʉm jú, ḿma’a kwaŋ. Néŋe ne ńkímte pá’ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo la cú’te, ńgwɔ záb mbwó mɔ́b twó gù, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

ngiemboon: Nyɛte ńnéŋe twó ná yɔɔn fà’ té tsyɛte nnɛ́, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a metsèm ge gyá pá’ fà’a jú ne ńgiŋe.
en: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

ngiemboon: Laga twó jú nà gù leńnéŋe mbɔɔ ná mmó gie ɔ̀ zí’i pʉ̀a. Tè lɔgɔ tsɔ́ twó ḿma’a kwaŋ. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo pú’u, e Ssé fó mǒ ńgÿo, ɔ̀ zẅɛ́’, ńgwɔ tsẅɛ́ ntsaŋ, epʉ̀a pie é zẅí’te nò gie ɔ̀ gɔɔn gíŋe ńtsẅɛ́ yɔ́b.
en: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńne shwóŋó nzẅìŋe ndÿò nò, tè cÿɔ́gɔ yé cÿɔ́g. Gɔɔn nò mbwo yé pá’ ɔ̀ gɔɔn mbwo tá gù. Líe ngwàshùm pá’ mefɛ́ pú pe mbàŋa,
en: Rebuke not an elder, but intreathimas a father;andthe younger men as brethren;

ngiemboon: ńdíe mezẅìŋe pànzwě pá’ memá pú, ńdíe ngwàngùɔ pá’ mefɛ́ pú pe pànzwě, tè gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá ndyɛ̀’ɛ ntʉ́m gù.
en: the elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

ngiemboon: Lɔg mekù’ ńkẅéte mepfɔ̌g pie nyìŋ tè nzèm pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

ngiemboon: Ampfɔ̌g manzwě lɔɔn ńgẅiin penkʉ́, kà penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pé wɔ́, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pɔ́ kẅéte yé tá ńdíe mánzsè. Pɔ́ gẅiin léfó ná yɔb mbʉ̀a, ńzí’i légÿo mmó gie á poŋ Ssé, ńdíe metá pɔ́b pá’ pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńdíe wɔ́b yɔ́b. Á nue yɛ̌ nò áa mboŋ mvfò Ssé.
en: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

ngiemboon: Ampfɔ̌g gẅie nyìŋ tè nzèm yé wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ gílé yé, à ńnéŋe yé ńdíe mánzsè ńzẅí’te pɔ́ Ssé, ńne sẅíŋte yé zsó pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’ té kʉ́a, ngie à kẅéte yé.
en: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa nà mpfɔ̌g gẅie à gwáa ńjÿo mbàŋte, mbà mé líe yé tà ne ngie manzwě wɛ̂, tá á gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ mpfó.
en: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin létsẅii mbwo pɔ́b, ńzsé ngie mé tè kíme wɔ́b té poŋ wɔ́.
en: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà gubé mepfɔ̌g, mbà nyìŋ wɔb lɔɔn ńgwá’ pʉ̀a tsìŋe ndá yɔ́b, mé gɔɔn pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ tsẅé, mbà à lɔgɔ pú’u, ńdʉ’ʉ nò Yěsô gie pege zẅíŋe. Angàŋ lɔgɔ pú’u, ḿbú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ ńcʉa nyìŋ gẅie à kaa záb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô wɔ́.
en: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

ngiemboon: Ampfɔ̌g gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ ŋwe’e lezíŋ sé nà mezíŋ mepfɔ̌g pie acú’tè ge ne kẅéte wɔ́b, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ gẅie à tɔ̌g ngù’ móm ntɔgɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gẅie à la zsé pɔ́ ndà’ ndǔm we.
en: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ gẅie pʉ̀a ne ńzẅíŋe ngie aa ńgÿo mefà’ mbòŋo, á gẅie aa ńkwɔ́’te penkʉ́ pé mboŋó, á gẅie aa ńkúe megʉ̀ mbʉ̀a yé, á gẅie aa ńnáa nnɛ́ ssé, ńkẅéte pʉ̀a Kristo, ńgwɔ́ gẅie aa ńkẅéte megàŋ ngɔ́’, á gẅie aa ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo.
en: well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

ngiemboon: Tè ké ńŋwe’e mezíŋ mepfɔ̌g pie é nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pe mekʉ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne mepfɔ̌g. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pɔ́ ge ńnéŋe tà lézɔ́’ lu ssé twó pɔ́b, pɔ́ gwá’a fà’ gie pɔ́ ké ne fa’a nzèm Kristo, ńgʉa ńzɔ́’,
en: But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;

ngiemboon: é gÿo pú’u, é lɔg fʉa nò, mélà’mie pɔ́ kubé nò gie pɔ́ la ka’, á gwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge ńnéŋe té zɔ́’, éfa’a mbwo Kristo.
en: having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó gie á gÿo mé té lwo ńŋwe’e mezíŋ mɔ́b wɔ́ áa pá’ mé lɔɔn ńŋwe’e pɔ́ cʉ́’ melǒŋ, ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ mendá mendá, á gwɔ́ mege pÿɔ́g pɔ́ gwá ńkaa mezíŋ pʉ̀a, ńgwá ńkyɛ́’ menò mie mé ée ntěen ńkyɛ́’ɛ wɔ́, ńgɔɔn nò ná menò mie é té ne ńdíe wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And withal they learnto beidle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n gyá ngie á poŋ ngie mepfɔ̌g pie é nyé pe mekʉ́ pɔ́ zɔ́’, ńzyé gubé, ńtáŋte mendá mɔ́b, á cʉa pú’u, megàŋ mbù pégè é le gẅiin shÿó légɔɔn nò ná pege wɔ́.
en: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue tsɔ́ lelÿò mepfɔ̌g pe mekʉ́ kéen ńnyé nò Ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm Sátà.
en: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

ngiemboon: Manzwě lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, mepfɔ̌g gwɔ́ nà tsìŋe ndá yɔ́b, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie yé zɔ ne ńkẅéte wɔ́b tà á le náa yɛ̌ pì’ á mbwo cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́, ńzsé ngie cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ge kẅéte pɔ́ mepfɔ̌g pie nyìŋ tè nzèm pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pʉ̀a pie é kẅé mvfò ná cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, ńne fa’a mboŋó, mé gÿo mekù’ mɔ́b, ńná ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ gẅie é ńzɛ́te né pɔ́b, ńtʉʉ lelÿò ńgÿo me pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ shwóŋó nò Ssé ḿbiŋe ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó.
en: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà nyìŋ kwɛ́ ncwò fòŋ gẅie à gÿǒ, á ne ńnẅɛ’ɛ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ pá’ mé ge cʉ́’ fÿɔ́g fÿɔ́g. Á gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie mé ná ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à fa’á fà’.
en: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourerisworthy of his reward.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńtó shwóŋó gú nò ná nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé mvfò cú’tè, ɔ̀ nyé té jú’u ncwò pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kà pʉ̀a métá wɔ́, tè lɔg ńtóŋo nò.
en: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pʉ̀a pie é kwǎ’ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, ɔ̀ tyé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè ńkága wɔ́b, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gyá pú’u, ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Ssé, ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô Kristo mbɔɔ lezíŋ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie Ssé la tsɔ́’ ńgɔɔn mbwo gù ngie: Cwoŋo ńjú’u mmó gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn. Pɔ́ɔn lélíe shÿó nyìŋ, kà ńdɔg pɔ́ metùŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mmó ná nyìŋ.
en: I chargetheebefore God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

ngiemboon: Tè sẅɛte ńzáb mbwo ná nyìŋ ńcʉ́me fà’a cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mbwo yé. Zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtsa’a yé mboŋó, ḿbɔ́gɔ ngàŋ légÿo nò tepòŋ, á cʉ́’ʉ jú. Pɔ́ɔn kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ńgwɔ́ á cʉŋte gú.
en: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men's sins: keep thyself pure.

ngiemboon: Tè gíŋe ńnú pɔ́ ndà’ ntse. Núu méjʉ’ʉ melù’, ńtí lepfòm shú sie ée ńgwá ńgege gú lɛ.
en: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake and thine often infirmities.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo nò tepòŋ mé gyá pɔ́ lê nÿɔ́g. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a fʉa mé lá’ ńŋaga wɔ́b tá ńzsé.
en: Some men's sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and somementhey follow after.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná mefà’ mbòŋo, ée ńzɔɔn ńkẅɛɛ pɔ́ menÿɔ́g, tà mbɔɔ mie mé té lwo ńgyá wɔ́, mé lá’ ńgyá gyá.
en: Likewise also the good worksof someare manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ndá nkwɔɔn, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pɔ́ zsé ngie pɔ́ gẅiin légÿo mekù’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin wɔ́b, ńzsé ngie mé té ge kím lezíŋ Ssé té poŋ wɔ́, é ké le gwága nò gie mé zí’i pʉ̀a ná Yěsô Kristo wɔ́.
en: Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God andhisdoctrine be not blasphemed.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie ɔ̀ ge ne zí’i pʉ̀a, é piŋ ne ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b légÿo pú’u, à yɔɔn:
en: And they that have believing masters, let them not despisethem, because they are brethren; but rather dothemservice, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò ndyɛ̀’ɛ ńdɔgɔ ńgwá’a shwóŋè nénʉ́ gie á fóo mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, mbɔɔ mmó gie pege zí’i pʉ̀a, pɔ́ fóo mǒ ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé,
en: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words,eventhe words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

ngiemboon: mbà ngàŋ ŋa’te ngie à zsé nò, tá ńké tè ne ńzsé wɔ́. À zsé yé pɔ́ lézoŋo nò, ńgwá fó nà nò gie mé gɔɔn, ńcu’u twó pʉ̀a. Á cʉa pú’u, pʉ̀a zye légẅiin kègɔ́’, ńzye lézoŋo nò, ńzye zoonte, ńzye légyéte mefɛ́ pɔ́b ná nò tepòŋ,
en: he is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ne ńzoŋo nò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b zoŋ, á nue pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ ńzsé nò nénʉ́ wɔ́, ńkwaŋa yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, mbà àa mánzsè gẅie à ge fó mǒ gẅiin nkáb.
en: perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́ ngie nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m ná Ssé, mbà aa ngàŋa fù’ pá’ nò lɔɔn ḿboŋo yé nà mmó gie Ssé nǎ mbwo yé.
en: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

ngiemboon: Pege la zɔɔn tè lɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔ́ɔn njÿó wɔ́, pege piŋ ńké tě ńdá’a ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ éfóo wó ńgee wɔ́.
en: For we brought nothing intothisworld,and it iscertain we can carry nothing out.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, ńgwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn ńgẅiin mmó léjÿó mbɔɔ nzsǒ ḿma’, mbà wɛ̌ nzẅìŋ kaa kɔ́gɔ.
en: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwoŋo légẅiin shúm tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, mbà pɔ́ gwe tsɛ̀ɛ nkwà’te. Eshúm tepòŋ sie pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn, é gwɔ́ sie é cʉŋte nyìŋ cʉŋte, é gwoon wɔ́b pá’ lejÿɔ́’ la. Sɛ̌ shúm tsóte pʉ̀a mesoŋ pɔ́ gwe ssé, ńkúu pyé.
en: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, andintomany foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.

ngiemboon: Á nue le ké ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ légẅiin nkáb, à lɔg menò ntí ntí ńtó. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a léen ńgwá’ mbùm yɔb ná nò nkáb, éfʉa mánzsè, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, ńdɔg ńtóŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe ná pɔ́b.
en: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa ná gù gẅie ɔ́ɔ ngàŋa fà’ Ssé, ɔ̀ ne ńkÿo mɛ̌ menò tepòŋ, ńne ńkaga tʉ̀ ńgÿo pɔ́ menò mie é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ḿbiŋ ne ńjú’u pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò Ssé, ńne ńzába ntʉ́m gú ná yé, ńne ńkwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, ńne ńtʉte tʉte nzèm Ssé, ńtyé nà yɛ̌ nò wɔ́, ńgẅiin pɔ́ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́.
en: But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

ngiemboon: Ké ne ḿma’a jú pɔ́ ncù mbòŋo we pàzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé. Kú’te le gwɔ́ tèmì mboŋó, mélà’mie e Ssé la tóŋo gú, ntí pɔ́ wɛ̌. Ɔ̀ piŋ ńtyé mvfò pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńzẅíŋe nò mbòŋo gie ɔ̀ zába ntʉ́m gú mǒ.
en: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsẅii yɔɔn nò né gú, ńtyé mvfò Ssé gẅie à gÿo shúm ntsèm gwɔ́ wó, mbɔɔ mvfò Yěsô Kristo gẅie à la tyé mvfò Ponte*Pilato ńgɔɔn nò nénʉ́ gie à zsé.
en: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, andbeforeChrist Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńtsẅii né gù ngie ɔ̀ gÿo shúm sie e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn né gù. Tè gʉa mǒ ńgwá’a tsɔ́. Tè gÿo mé túu*lɔ̌’ mǒ, ké ńne ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà ńkúu lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ge gÿo gíŋe tó.
en: that thou keepthiscommandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo tóo nà fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé la záb. Yé Ssé gẅie à gẅiin tʉ̀ ntsèm. Yé zɔ̌ ndà’ Ssé, ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekág, ńgwɔ́ Fùɔ cʉa mefùɔ, ńgwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mecʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: which in his times he shall shew,who isthe blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

ngiemboon: ée ndà’ yé gílé yé gẅie aa tèkwé. À ńnéŋe nà jʉ’ gie á pú ńŋwʉŋe tà ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ le tsíŋte tà ḿbɔ́ɔnte jʉ’ó wɔ́. Nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńgyá yé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le ku’u légyá yé wɔ́. Á poŋ mekù’ mé mbɔɔ lefùɔ sé e lá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.*Amen.
en: who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whombehonour and power everlasting. Amen.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée megàŋa mmó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, tsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn le ŋá’te nnɛ́, ńgie tà pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńzẅí’te wɔb lepòŋ pɔ́ nà shúm sie pɔ́ gẅiin, á nue á gwɔ́ pɔ́ fù’u njÿòon. Tsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ zẅí’te wɔb lepòŋ pɔ́ mbwo Ssé gẅie à náa wege shúm ntsèm tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn ngie pege lɔg ńkẅéte mbùm yege.
en: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

ngiemboon: Tsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gÿo nò mbòŋo. Lefa’ mefà’ mbòŋo, à gwɔ́ yɔ́b fù’, ńgie pɔ́ zí’i légaba pwó, ńdɔg shúm sɔ́b ńkẅéte pʉ̀a.
en: that they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńcú’te fù’ yɔ́b ńde’e ná jʉ’ʉ mbòŋo, á jʉ’ gie yɛ̌ fù’ ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, é lɔgɔ pú’u, gẅiin kwà’ le gwɔ́ wó.
en: laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.

ngiemboon: Timoté, pɔ́ɔn lélɔgɔ mmó gie e Ssé ka cʉ́me mbwo gù, ńdɔg ḿma’a kwàŋ. Pɔ́ɔn shwóŋè gie á té kẅéte, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, á tɔ’ pʉ̀a tɔ’ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, á shwóŋè gie á gÿo mé zoŋo nò tà ńkwaŋ ngie mé lɔgɔ ńzsé nò.
en: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profaneandvain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge cʉ́’ʉ lécʉ́me, ésẅíŋte ngie e Ssé gwɔ́ né pi.
en: The first to Timothy was written from Laodicea, which is the chiefest city of Phrygia Pacatiana.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo, mbà Ssé zɔ la kwoŋ ngie n gwɔ́ wɛ̌. Ayɔ́ɔn fà’ gwɔ́ légʉa ńgɔɔn nò ná le gwɔ́ gẅie e Ssé la ka’ ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gẅiin é zẅɛ́’ɛ Yěsô Kristo.
en: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n naa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo gù Timoté, gù míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, n kwoŋo gú tɛ’. N ne ńdúɔ mbwo Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ngie pɔ́ ne ńgwɔ́ né gù, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mú, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m gù.
en: To Timothy,mydearly beloved son: Grace, mercy,andpeace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé nà twó jú, e Ssé gie mèŋ n gu’te lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo pá’ pà mangʉa njʉ’ peg la gu’te yɔ́b. Áa fʉ̀’e zsó kà lêtsẅɛ́’ wɔ́, mèŋ n gwɔ́ sẅíŋte Ssé, n te nyé té kím lezíŋ shú wɔ́.
en: I thank God, whom I serve frommyforefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

ngiemboon: N daa lege pá’ pɔgɔ la gwaa fege ɔ̀ lʉa wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ́’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gíŋe ńgyá gú, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

ngiemboon: N daa lege ngie ɔ̀ záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo tà shwóŋó nò wɔ́, n te lege ngie má gù we ndÿò Lowas tà mbɔɔ má gù Eunis lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u wɔ́. N zsě ngie mbàa gù jú ɔ̀ giŋé ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b.
en: when I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n ge kẅiŋte gú ngie, ammó gie n ka záb mbwó mɔ́ɔn twó gù, e Ssé cÿó gʉm jú, ɔ̀ ku’u légÿo, tè lɔg ḿma’a kwàŋ.
en: Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge gie Ssé ka zɔɔn ńná né pege á té gie á gÿo pege nẅíin nẅǐin wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà Zẅìge yé néŋ pɔ́ metʉ̀ ná pege tɛ’, ńgÿo pege kwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tɛ’, ḿbiŋ ńkú’te mbùm yege mboŋó.
en: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tè kú shʉ́ légɔɔn mmó gie ɔ̀ zsé ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. Tè kú shʉ́ mbɔɔ ná mèŋ pá’ mèŋ n gee ndá tsǎŋ ńtí yé. Zẅíŋ jú pɔ́ légyá ngɔ́’ pá’ mèŋ, ńdɔg ńgÿo Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo sa jʉ’, ńzẅɛ́’ pɔ́ metʉ̀ mie e Ssé náa mbwo gù.
en: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

ngiemboon: À la gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, éfaga wégè ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé. À lɔ̌ɔn těen ńgÿo pú’u, éfóo pɔ́ nà mefà’ mbòŋo mie pege fǎ’ wɔ́, à la cÿó pɔ́ gʉme yégè. Pú’u, mbà njÿó la nyé pɔ́ tè gwɔ̌ wó, kwà’ yé zɔ̌ záb ngie à ge gÿo lɔgɔ Yěsô Kristo, é gÿo pú’u, ná pege.
en: who hath saved us, and calleduswith an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà yɛ̌ nò mbòŋo kéen ńkẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌, á nue Yěsô Kristo gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ, à kéen ńtó. Yé zɔ ka gwoon legwé ńkẅé metʉ̀ mé. À ka tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo peg, ńnyɛɛ le gwɔ́ tèmi tà peg ne ńzsé. Á le gwɔ́ gẅie nyìŋ gẅiin à tè gíŋe ńkwé wɔ́.
en: but is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka nǎ fà’a létsẅi wɔɔn nkʉ̀ mbòŋo á mbwo mèŋ, pá’ mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm we é piŋ ne la’te mmó mbwo pʉ̀a.
en: whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá yɔɔn ngɔ́’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ pú’u. Tá’, eshʉ́ ké tè ne ńkúu wɔ̀ɔn mǒ wɔ́, á nue mèŋ n ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n zába ntʉ́m ná yé. N cwoŋo ńne ńzsé ngie e Ssé gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńku’u lékábte nò gie à la cʉ́me mbwo mèŋ, tà lá’ kúu nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsònzèm.
en: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

ngiemboon: Timoté, ne ńkímte shwóŋè nénʉ́ gie ɔ̀ la jú’u ncwò mèŋ, ńne ḿbíi fʉ̀’ mǒ, ńzí’i pʉ̀a pú’u. Záb ntʉ́m gú pɔ́ nà Ssé, ńne ńkwoŋo yé pá’ peg pie peg la la nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo peg gÿo pú’u.
en: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé gie áa ná pege kẅéte gú. Ɔ̀ le zẅíŋ nyìŋ gʉa ná nò mbòŋo gie mé la cʉ́me mbwo gù ńkúbe tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńzsé jú pá’ pʉ̀a ná pàga ngwòŋ Azia kéen ḿbú ńgwá’a wɔ̀ɔn métsèm tà mbɔɔ Figele pɔ́ Hergène yɔ́b.
en: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ké ne ńdúɔ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ngie à gÿo nò mbòŋo ná tsìŋe ndá Onésifor, ńdúɔ pú’u, Á nue à neŋé ńnéŋ ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’, à laa kú shʉ́ ná mèŋ pá’ mèŋ n gee ngàŋa tsǎŋ wɔ́.
en: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

ngiemboon: À la lêen ńkúu*Roma wɔɔn, ḿbáte jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee wó tà ńdá’ ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: but, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and foundme.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lá’a lyɛ’ɛ́ létsɔ́’te ntsaŋ ńgÿo nò mbòŋo ná ye. Kwà’ gù ne ńzsé pá’ n da nyé Efeso á kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn pú’u.
en: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.

ngiemboon: Ńké ńgʉa ná gù míŋ wɔɔn, ɔ̀ ké ne ńjʉ́’ʉ pɔ́ nà metʉ̀ mie Yěsô Kristo lɔgɔ ńcÿó gʉm yégè, ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge tʉte tsɛ̀ɛ nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Kímte nò gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌ɔn ńjú’u mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a, é laa pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ ée pàjÿò ńgyá. Ké cʉ́me pɔ́ yɛ̌ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ku’u légʉa ńzí’i yɔ́b petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, tè gʉa mǒ ńkúbe mmó.
en: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.

ngiemboon: Gyá jú ngɔ́’ pá’ kwà’ ndÿɔ́’ ncù we Yěsô Kristo.
en: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ vɔg tà ńgwɔ́ tsẅɛ̀ɛ ncù, ńdege kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńdíe yé mbʉ̀a, ńzsé ngie à ge cʉ́’ʉ gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ge poŋo tándá wɔb.
en: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs ofthislife; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkÿo ndʉ̌, à tè kÿo nà ntí gie*lepʉ̌ ndʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, mé le fà’ yé tsɔ́’.
en: And if a man also strive for masteries,yetis he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a nká’ nyìŋ, à lɔɔn ńtéŋe zì’i mboŋó, mbà yé zɔ ge vɔgɔ lépfɛ́ɛ mmó gie á fóo nká’.
en: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.

ngiemboon: Sáŋa nò ná menò mie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge zɔɔn náa gú legyè lélɔg ḿbú ńjú’ ntsèm.
en: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.

ngiemboon: Kímte Yěsô Kristo, pá’ à la zíme nà legwé, à la fó nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd pá’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie mèŋ n ne ńtsẅii é ne ńgɔɔn.
en: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá ngɔ́’ tà mé lɔgɔ metsɛ̂n ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gee nyìŋ tepòŋ la pá’ɔɔn ńtí pɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ŋwɛ́. Tá’ mé kaa shwóŋè Ssé kwɛ́ɛ.
en: wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer,evenunto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, ńtíi pʉ̀a pie e Ssé tsɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́b, éshÿɔgɔ shÿɔg, ńzsé ngie Kristo ge gÿo pɔ́b yɔ́b tsẅɛ́. Pɔ́ fo pú’u, ńgẅiin legú’ tèmì.
en: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

ngiemboon: mbà pege lâ pɔ̌ ge gÿo púte gwɔ́ wó.
en: It isa faithful saying: For if we be dead withhim, we shall also live withhim:

ngiemboon: mbà à ge gÿo gwá’a wégè yé.
en: if we suffer, we shall also reign withhim: if we denyhim, he also will deny us:

ngiemboon: té gwɔ́ gie áa nà we mà wɔ́
en: if we believe not,yethe abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie ɔ̀ gẅiin lékímte mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńtyé mvfò Ssé éshʉa shʉa shwóŋ pʉ̀a ngie tà pɔ́ gwáa ńtága melà’ ná menò mie mé gɔɔn. Pɔ́ tág melà’ pú’u, é té kẅéte nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà é cʉŋte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u mɛ̌ menò cʉŋte, á nzèm Ssé.
en: Of these things putthemin remembrance, chargingthembefore the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit,butto the subverting of the hearers.

ngiemboon: Kag tʉ̀ légwɔ tyé mvfò Ssé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé zẅíŋe nò yé, gwɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ gẅie eshʉ́ té ge ne kúu yé nà fà’ yé wɔ́. Gwɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ gẅie à tsẅi nkʉ̀ nò gie áa nénʉ́, té gʉa mǒ ńkúbe tsɔ́ mmó.
en: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn le záb gú ncwò ná we pàzoŋ meshwóŋè mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, é meshwóŋè mie é táte nyìŋ taté lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé. Pʉ̀a pie é zoŋo mɛ̌ meshwóŋè ké fó lejʉ́ŋ Ssé ńkẅi’i ńkÿo kÿo.
en: But shun profaneandvain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ lêen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̌ŋ gie e něŋ mbìd, ńne ńkẅi’i ńgá’a la. Himené pɔ́ Filétos lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lii pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́.
en: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenæus and Philetus;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kéen ńgwá’a mánzsè nò gie áa nénʉ́. Pɔ́ zɔ́gɔ ńgɔɔn ngie e Ssé kéen ńdá’ ńgÿo pege zíme ná legwé. Pɔ́ kéen ńgÿo pú’u, tà tsɔ̌ lelÿò pʉ̀a tè nyé ńgwɔ́ ná mánzsè nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, àcÿǒ ndá gie e Ssé la nuŋe á nyé ńtʉʉ tʉ. Mé la ŋwe’e ndùmo ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie ée pé, ńgíŋe ńŋwe’e ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á tém nzèm nò tepòŋ.
en: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńgʉa ndá ngàŋa mmó mé gyá mekáŋ mentí mentí. Mé gyá mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, ńgyá mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte, ńgíŋe ńgyá mbɔɔ mie mé la lɔgɔ tÿǒ ńkwóon, mbɔɔ mie mé la lɔgɔ tsǎ’ ḿbwóon. Me tʉ̌ gɔ̂l pɔ́ me tʉ̌ nkáb ée mie mé tÿɔ́gɔ ssé pɔ́ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ lÿò. Metsɔ́ gwɔ́ mie mé tÿɔ́gɔ ssé lyɛ̌’ ntsèm.
en: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbɔ́ɔn meshwóŋè cÿɔ̌ nò mie mé zí’i pʉ̀a lɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ ge gwɔ́ pá’ káŋ gie mé tÿɔ́gɔ ssé pɔ́ nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lÿò. Mbà à ge gwɔ́ nyìŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà à ge kẅéte Ndè we, à lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie áa mbòŋ.
en: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master's use,andprepared unto every good work.

ngiemboon: Kÿo shúm tepòŋ sie nkàŋ nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn. Pia pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo fa’a nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńkwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, éfa’ mbʉ́lè.
en: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

ngiemboon: Kÿo menò mie mé gwá ńzoŋo é gwɔ́ pɔ́ megʉ̀gʉ̀ menò mie é té kẅéte. Ɔ̀ zsě ngie mé zoŋ mɛ̌ menò tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lémag, ńtág pɔ́ melà’.
en: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńké tè poŋ ngie ngàŋa fà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tág mélà’ wɔ́. À gẅiin pɔ́ lékwoŋo mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńku’u lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó mboŋó, ńku’u légwɔ́ gie mé ge fʉ̀’ nò ná ye, á le pá.
en: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto allmen, apt to teach, patient,

ngiemboon: À gẅiin lélɔg mbʉ́lè ńda’te mmó mbwo pʉ̀a pie à gɔɔn nò pɔ́ kúbe pɔ́ shÿó. Ndyɛ̌’ tsɔ́ e Ssé gÿo ńná shÿó mbwo pɛ̌ pʉ̀a pɔ́ kúbe yɔb ntí lɔg sáŋa nò, éfó pú’u, ńzsé nò gie áa nénʉ́,
en: in meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńkwaŋa nò pá’ á kě ńne ńzɛ́te ngie pɔ́ kwaŋ, ńdeen ńké fóo tsɛ̀ɛ mejÿɔ́’ mie Sátà la lɔg ńgwoon wɔ́b ńkẅɛ. Mbà pɔ́ kaa tsoló ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ megàŋa tsǎŋ, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie Sátà ne ńkwoŋo.
en: andthatthey may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.

ngiemboon: Zsé ngie, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsònzèm, ejʉ’ tʉ tɛ’.
en: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ gwɔ́ mekìm, ńkwoŋ pɔ́ nkáb, ńzẅíŋe mmóm tɛ’, é gwɔ́ ngàŋa ŋá’te, é ne zoonte Ssé zoonte, é tʉʉ twó mbwo metá pɔ́b, é gwɔ́ pàjÿò ńjÿɔg ncwò, pɔ́ le gíŋe ńdɔgɔ mmó gie áa ye Ssé ńdɔg ńtóŋo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

ngiemboon: Letʉ́m sɔ́b tʉ pá’ tóon la, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pà tètsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, éshwóŋe té poŋ ná pʉ̀a, ayɔ́b nò gwɔ́ pɔ́ léma’a tág. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mefÿɛ́, é gwɔ́ ngàŋ mbù nò mbòŋo,
en: without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ pàjÿò menáŋ, é gÿo nò pɔ́ ḿvege vege, é gwɔ́ ngàŋ ŋá’te tɛ’, é kwoŋo mmó gie á poŋo wɔ́b, pɔ́ le Ssé kwoŋ,
en: traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé pɔ́ nzème pǐ, é moŋe metʉ̀ Ssé mie é kɔ’ɔ́ lɔgɔ wɔ́b gÿo pʉ̀a Ssé. Timoté lÿɔ́’te ntí pʉ̀a ápɛ̌.
en: having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pú’u, gwá shú ńkú mendá pʉ̀a, ńdÿɔgte pànzwě pie tsẅé yɔ́b zeŋe zeŋe, é gwɔ́ pànzwě pie é gÿo menò tepòŋ tɛ’, ńnéŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn shúm pɔ́ ntí ntí.
en: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ tó, ńzí’i yɛ̌ ntí pànzwě nò, pɔ́ zẅí’te zẅi’té tá ńké tè ku’u lézsé nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é zí’i wɔ́b zɔɔn ne ńdʉ’ʉ nò gie áa nénʉ́. Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, Jannès pɔ́ Jambrès lʉ’ʉ nò gie Mǒsê gɔɔn la, pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gíŋe ne ńdʉ’ʉ nò gie áa nénʉ́, ée pʉ̀a pie legyè sɔ́b té tyé, pɔ́ piŋ ńké tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tà shwóŋó nò wɔ́.
en: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

ngiemboon: Tá’, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg yɛ̌ ntí ńkẅi’i ńgʉa tà ngʉ̀a sag wɔ́, á nue pʉ̀a metsèm ge gyá ngie pɔ́ té tsɔ́ nò zsé, anò yɔ́b gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nò Jannes pɔ́ Jambrès.
en: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto allmen, as theirs also was.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná gù, mbà pɔgɔ lǎ zye ńnéŋe. Ɔ̀ ne ńzsé mmó gie mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a, ɔ̀ ne ńzsé yɔ́ɔn tsẅé, ńne ńzsé mmó gie mèŋ n gwɔ fa’ ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn yɛ̌, ńne ńzsé pá’ n záb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn nà Ssé, ńzsé pá’ n gẅiin kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ pú’u, pá’ n kwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pú’u, ḿbiŋ ńzsé pá’ n kag tʉ̀ té kʉ́a pú’u.
en: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńzsé pá’ pʉ̀a ka kʉ́e wɔ̀ɔn pú’u, ńzsé pá’ n ka gyá ngɔ́’ pú’u. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé la gÿo lêkɔ́ nà mèŋ á Antiokia, á Ikonium, á Listele wɔ́, mbà ɔ̀ ne ńzsé. N da gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, tá’ á gʉa ná sɛ̌ lekwò wɔ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ké fó tsoló ńkẅile wɔ̀ɔn kẅile,
en: persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out ofthemall the Lord delivered me.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɔɔn le la nnɛ́ ná Yěso Kristo tà ńne ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mé nyé té kʉ́e yé kʉ́e wɔ́.
en: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

ngiemboon: Tá’ n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn pʉ̀a tepòŋ pâ ngàŋa fʉte ge gÿo lɔgɔ nò tepòŋ é kẅi’i gʉa pɔ́ lê mvfò, é ne fʉte pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gíŋe ne fʉte wɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná gù, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ kú’te pɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ la zí’i tà ńzáb ntʉ́m mǒ. Ɔ̀ tè ne ḿmoŋe nyìŋ gẅie à ka zí’i gú wɔ́.
en: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learnedthem;

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la gwaa lu ssé ńne ńzsé mmó gie ŋwà’ne Ssé áa yɛ̌, ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ zɔ̌ náa gú legyè lélɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo, e Ssé gÿo ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́.
en: and that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa ŋwe’e kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ ncwò Ssé. Pú’u ammó gie mé la ŋwe’e, à ku’u lélɔg ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò gie áa nénʉ́, ńku’u lélɔg ńdʉ’ʉ nò gie á té nò wɔ́, ńku’u lélɔg ńtÿɔ́gte pʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńku’u lélɔg ńzí’i pʉ̀a pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gÿo tá ńnéŋe nà ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: All scriptureisgiven by inspiration of God, andisprofitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

ngiemboon: Pú’u ńzsé ngie nyìŋ Ssé ge fóo nà ŋwà’ne Ssé, é zsé nò Ssé mboŋó, tá gwɔ́ fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, é ku’u légÿo nò gie áa mbòŋ.
en: that the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tyé mvfò Ssé mbɔɔ mvfò Yěsô Kristo gẅie à cʉ’ʉ́ ńtó tǒ léŋag pʉ̀a metʉ̀ lâ mepfó ssé, mbɔɔ ná pá’ à ge gÿo tó ńnuŋe lefùɔ sé, n cwoŋo ńgɔɔn né gù ngie:
en: I chargetheetherefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé, ńtyé pɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ ńcwoŋo ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, kà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé ee wó ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ ngie mé gɔɔn wɔ́, kà pɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé té wó ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́ wɔ́, ɔ̀ gɔɔn gɔɔn. Nyìŋ fʉa nò ɔ̀ kaga yé nà ntí gie à ge jú’, ńkẅiŋte yé légÿo nò mbòŋo. Gwáa gÿo pú’u, ńdɔg pɔ́ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ḿbiŋ ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó.
en: preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

ngiemboon: Á nue atsɔ́ fʉ́’ ge gÿo gwɔ́, epʉ̀a le gíŋe ńkwoŋo lézẅí’te nò nénʉ́ gie mé zí’i pʉ̀a ná Yěsô Kristo wɔ́, é lɔg pá’ pɔ́ kwoŋo lézẅí’te pɔ́ nò gie ntʉ́m wɔ́b ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, éfa’ pɔ́b pàzí’i wɔ́b mmó tà e gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ zí’i wɔ́b nò gie pɔ́ kwoŋo lé jú’.
en: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té gÿo ńgíŋe ńzẅí’te nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́, é cʉ́’ zẅí’te pɔ́ menò pú’kwɔb.
en: and they shall turn awaytheirears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, gÿo jú kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ à ku’ ku’. Ngɔ́’ kúu gú ɔ̀ shÿɔg shÿɔg. Ké ně fa’a pɔ́ fà’ jú gie áa létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé mbwo pʉ̀a. Fa’a fà’ Ssé gie ɔ́ɔ mǒ mboŋó.
en: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà wɔɔn léfó ndùmo ssé tsétsá’ ńgʉa à ne ńku’u. Afʉ̀’ kǔ’ pá’ mé ge zẅé wɔ̀ɔn, é lɔg ńgwɔ́ pá’ wɔ̀ɔn pwɔ́’ gẅie mé nuŋe mvfò Ssé.
en: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

ngiemboon: N ka lÿɔ́’ ncù mbòŋo, mèŋ n ka kÿo ndʉ̌ tà ńkúu nzotě. N ka kě ně ńzába ntʉ́m pɔ́ ná Yěsô, ńně ḿbɔ́ɔnte mboŋó.
en: I have fought a good fight, I have finishedmycourse, I have kept the faith:

ngiemboon: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé cwoŋté ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ nyìŋ gẅie à kÿǒ ndʉ̌ tà njÿó, ńzáb ńne ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn. Wɛ̌ ée tsɔ’ɔ́ fa’ pá’, n gÿǒ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à za’ ntsaŋ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, à ge gÿo náa mbwo mèŋ nà lyɛ’ gie à ge tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ. À tè lá’ ná pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. À ge lá’ gíŋe ná mbɔɔ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńkwoŋo légyá fʉ̀’ gie à ge gÿo kẅɛ.
en: henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

ngiemboon: Kag tʉ̀ ńtɔ́g ńtó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

ngiemboon: Zsé ngie Ndemas kéen ńgwá’a wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie à kwoŋ shúm njÿó tɛ’. Yɛ̌ zɔ̌ ka gÿo á gʉa né Tesalonika. Kelesens ka gʉa lé Galatia, Titus gʉa lé Ndalmatia.
en: for Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

ngiemboon: Peg Lukase zɔ cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ tó, pi Malékuse gwɔ́, á nue à ge kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn nà fà’a Ssé.
en: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

ngiemboon: N ka túmo Tishig á tÿǒsoŋo Efeso.
en: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńne ńtóo, ɔ̀ lɔg nzsǒ fÿɔ́g yɔ̀ɔn gie n da nyé Toras á mbʉ̀a Karpus ńdɔg ńtó, ńgíŋ ńdɔg mbɔɔ meŋwà’ne ńtó, n tʉʉ lelÿò ńgɔɔn mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́*ngùb nɔ̀ɔn.
en: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bringwith thee, and the books,butespecially the parchments.

ngiemboon: Zsé ngie Alekzáŋdele gẅie aa tâlɔ́ɔn la, à ka gÿo nò tepòŋ ná mèŋ tɛ’. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ ge lá’ zsé pá’ à ge gÿo ná ye, ńtí menò mé.
en: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

ngiemboon: Mbǎ gù jú lÿɔ́’te yé, á nue à ka pǔ ńtɔ’ɔ nò Ssé gie peg ka ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a.
en: of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná nò yɔ́ɔn, mbà n daa ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’ gie mé la tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn jʉ’ʉ ntsaŋ, ńgʉa wó ḿbíte ncwò wɔ̀ɔn. Mânyìŋ ntsèm gwá’a wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kẅɛ gílé mèŋ. E Ssé lége yɛ̌ nò ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: At my first answer no man stood with me, but allmenforsook me:I pray Godthat it may not be laid to their charge.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ la tè wɔ̀ɔn gwá’. À la tóonte wɔ̀ɔn tá mèŋ n tsẅi nkʉ̀ wé pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé tsẅi, ta pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ jú’ metsèm. Á fó ncwò mepú’ ntʉ̀ ńkẅile wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, andthatall the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo fó nà nò tepòŋ ntí ntí é kẅile wɔ̀ɔn, é gÿo mèŋ n tsẅɛ́ légwɔ́ gie mèŋ n ge kúu nà nò lefùɔ yé á tÿǒ lepwó. Agù’te lá’a ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fʉ̀’ ntsèm.*Amen.
en: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preservemeunto his heavenly kingdom: to whombeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Tsyɛ’te Piriska pɔ́ Akilas ńná né mèŋ. Tsyɛ’te mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Onésifor.
en: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

ngiemboon: Eraste kéen ńzso Korento. N ka nyé Tolofine á Milet, mélà’mie à ka ne ńguɔ.
en: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

ngiemboon: Kág tʉ̀ ńtó tá fʉ̀’ʉ fÿɔ́g zye. Eubule, mbɔɔ Pẅideŋ, mbɔɔ Linus, mbɔɔ Kelɔdia ńgÿo petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pɔ́ tsyɛ’té gú.
en: Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgwɔ́ né gù! Ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè yé ntʉ́m pi metsèm.
en: The second epistle unto Timotheus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Ephesians, was written from Rome, when Paul was brought before Nero the second time.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne áa ńŋwe’e mèŋ Pɔl, mèŋ fa’a fà’ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. E Ssé la zába wɔ̀ɔn lékẅíŋte pʉ̀a pie yé Ssé la tsɔ́’ ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé. Á lékẅíŋte wɔ́b pɔ́ ké ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé záb, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pɔ́ zsé nò nénʉ́ gie mé cʉa mǒ ńzsé legìŋ gẅie à póŋ Ssé.
en: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

ngiemboon: Pú’u mé ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te légwɔ́ tèmì gẅie e Ssé la lá’ ńnyé pɔ́ tè pú’ ngwòŋ, ńka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pé. Mé zsé ngie àa těen ńgɔɔn nò mé fa’a kékáŋ wɔ́.
en: in hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

ngiemboon: À la ńnéŋe tà fʉ̀’ ku’, à gÿo mé zsé légwɔ́ tèmì ŋwɛ́, éfó nà shwóŋè yé. Yé Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, à la cʉ́me yɛ̌ shwóŋè mbwo mèŋ, ńgie mèŋ sá’a mbwo lá’.
en: but hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ŋwe’e yɔɔn nò, ńnáa mbwo gù Titus. Ɔ̀ɔ mbwo mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ míŋ wɔɔn tɛ’. Pɔgɔ pú ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Yěsô Kristo. Mèŋ n ne ńdúɔ mbwo Tá wege Ssé pɔ́ Yěsô Kristo, yé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ, ńgie pɔ́ ne ńgwɔ́ né gù, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m gù.
en: to Titus,mineown son after the common faith: Grace, mercy,andpeace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka nyé gù Kelɛt légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge cʉ́’ mege táŋte menò mie mèŋ n ka nyě, é piŋ záb pà kẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ, é cʉ́’ʉ lézáb, é záb pɔ́ pá’ mèŋ n ka tsẅi né gù.
en: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie nkẅè mvfò gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé té kíme yé té poŋ wɔ́. Á zɛ́te ngie à gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ manzwě wémɔ’ɔ́, penkʉ́ pé záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, mà wɔ́b gwɔ́ we mbòŋo, pɔ́ piŋ ńnéŋe ńjú’ ncwò we.
en: if any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

ngiemboon: Pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à líe cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, à fa’a pɔ́ mefà’ Ssé la, á té zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mé kíme yé té poŋ wɔ́. Tà á ńnéŋe ńgwag pʉ̀a, tà á ńnéŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ, tà á ma’ mbùm yé nà melù’, tà á ńnéŋe sá’ pɔ́ mbʉ̀’, tà á lɔgɔ gate fa’ nkáb.
en: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie á kúe megʉ́ mboŋó, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à neŋé ńkwoŋ yé pɔ́ menò mie ée mbòŋ. Á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à sáŋa nò tá ńgÿo, à gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo menò mie é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mà we poŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à zsé lékú’te mbùm ye.
en: but a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie à nyɛ́te ńkú’te nkʉ̀ gẅie ée gẅie ńgwɔ́ mé záb ntʉ́m mǒ, é gwɔ́ gẅie peg zí’i pʉ̀a. À cʉa pú’u, à ku’u lelɔgɔ shwóŋè gie áa nénʉ́, ńkẅíŋte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, ńku’u le shʉa shʉa ńdá’te*melɔ̌’ mie ée nà nò yé pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ nò gie à gɔɔn.
en: holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ záb pʉ̀a pá’ɔɔn, á nue pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ée ssé ně ńtʉʉ twó. Lelÿò gwɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ zẅíŋe nò Yěsô Kristo. Pɔ́ ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a menò mie é té tyé, ńdɔgɔ fʉte wɔ́b.
en: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ jÿɔ́’ ncwò wɔ́b, mélà’mie pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ mmó gie pɔ́ zí’i pʉ̀a ńtébe metsìŋe ndá ńtÿɔ́gɔ. Á gwɔ́ mmó gie aa tè lɔg ńtÿɔ́gɔ múɔ, pɔ́ lɔgɔ fʉte wɔ́b, ḿpfɛ́ɛ nkáb yɔ́b.
en: whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.

ngiemboon: Kwa’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Kelɛt pá’ pɔ́b gẅie aa mbwo pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ pá’ ntsẅi nkʉ Ssé, à la gɔɔn ngie: Epʉ̀a Kelɛte e gwɔ́ pɔ megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepʉ̀a ngwe, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ melǒŋ, ayɔ́b nò gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie á ge kúu lepfòm pɔ́b.
en: One of themselves,evena prophet of their own, said, The Cretiansarealway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

ngiemboon: Anò gie à la gɔɔn lɔɔn, áa nò nénʉ́. Áa yɛ̌ tá á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò ne pɔ́b té kú shʉ́, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge jú’ pɔ́ nò Ssé gie mé zí’i,
en: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

ngiemboon: pɔ́ legíŋ ńjú’ menò pú’kwɔb pà Yuda, ńcʉŋe mǒ wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ mbʉ̌ pʉ̀a pie é teme nzèm nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin ntʉ́m mbòŋo mvfò Ssé. Tá ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie ntʉ́m wɔ́b té poŋ, á nue pɔ́ té zába nà Ssé wɔ́, atsɔ́ mmó mbòŋo té wó mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́. Legyè sɔ́b neŋé ńtyé pɔ́ nà menò tepòŋ tà mbùm yɔb tè gíŋe ńcúa wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: Unto the pure all thingsarepure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelievingisnothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tyé ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ne ńzsé Ssé, tá menò mie pɔ́ gÿo nyɛɛ ngie pɔ́ té Ssé zsé. Pɔ́ tʉʉ twó tɛ’, ńgÿo mmó gie á sẅile sẅile, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ zɔɔn legÿo nò mbòŋo wɔ́.
en: They profess that they know God; but in works they denyhim, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, ké ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó à pumo pɔ́ nà nò nénʉ́ gie mé zí’i pʉ̀a ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

ngiemboon: Gɔɔn né mbàŋa gie é zẅǐŋ ngie tà pɔ́ gÿo tsɔ́ mmo tà á cʉa, ńgie pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a mekù’, ńgie pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é sáŋa nò tá ńgÿo. Pɔ́ gíŋ ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tà ńzáb, ńnéŋe ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a tà ńkwoŋo, éshÿɔgɔ menò tà shÿɔgɔ.
en: that the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ ɔ̀ ge gɔɔn lé pànzwě pie é zẅǐŋ ngie pɔ́ gẅiin mà gẅie à poŋ Ssé, ngie tà pɔ́ shwóŋte nà mezíŋ pʉ̀a, ńgie tà pɔ́ ma’ mbùm yɔb nà melù’. Á zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ nyɛɛ mà mbòŋo,
en: The aged women likewise, thatthey bein behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge nyɛ pànzwě pie é nyé ńzɔ́’ɔ pá’ wɛ̌wɛ̌ wɔ́ à ge kwoŋo ndǔm we mbɔɔ penkʉ́ pé,
en: that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ manzwě gẅie à sáŋa nò tá ńgÿo, é gwɔ́ manzwě gẅie à zsě pɔ́ ndà’ ndǔm we, éfa’ mefà’ ndá mé mboŋó, é gwɔ́ manzwě gẅie mé kwoŋo nò yé, é gwɔ́ manzwě gẅie à jú’ ncwò ndǔm we. Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, nyìŋ léshwóŋe té poŋ nà nò Ssé wɔ́.
en: to bediscreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ ɔ̀ ge kẅiŋte pûɔ mbàŋa lésáŋa nò fʉ̀’ ntsèm tá ńgÿo.
en: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ gù tyé nà kɔ́ wɔ́, ńnyɛ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ mmó mbòŋo. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ɔ̀ zí’i wɔ́b pɔ́ ndà’ nò gie áa nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńzí’i tà ńzsé mmó gie ɔ̀ zí’i yɛ̌.
en: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrineshewinguncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

ngiemboon: Gɔɔn nò à tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, á gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lezoŋ, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a pie é lʉ’ʉ nò gie ɔ̀ gɔɔn, ge zág sóon gie pɔ́ ge zába nà pege, éshʉ́ kúu wɔ́b.
en: sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

ngiemboon: Gɔɔn né mekwɔɔn ngie, pɔ́ jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin wɔb, tà mbɔɔ nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńgie pɔ́ fa’ shÿó ńgÿo mmó gie á poŋ pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin wɔ́b, ńgie tà pɔ́ zoŋo nò ncwò pɔ́b,
en: Exhortservants to be obedient unto their own masters,andto pleasethemwell in all things; not answering again;

ngiemboon: ńgie tà pɔ́ jʉ shúm pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin wɔ́b. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pɔ́ nyɛ ngie pɔ́ kwa’ ńgwɔ́ nzèm pɔ́b. Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgÿo pá’ɔɔn, mbà pʉ̀a ge gẅiin shwóŋè mbòŋo nà menò mie pege zí’i ná Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

ngiemboon: Áa pá’ pʉ̀a Ssé gẅiin légÿo, á nue e Ssé la kwà’ nyɛɛ mbwo pʉ̀a ngie à kwoŋó wɔ́b, ńcÿó gʉm yɔ́b, tà ńgÿo légwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́b métsèm tsẅɛ́.
en: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí nkwòŋe ne ńzí’i wege légwá’a mà gẅie à tè Ssé poŋ mbɔɔ pá’ pege tè gíŋe ńgÿo shúm sie ntʉ́m wege tsóte wege ngie pege gÿo wɔ́. Pege cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é sáŋa nò tá ńgÿo, ńgÿo pɔ́ menò mie é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ḿbiŋe ńjú’u pɔ́ ndà’ ncwò Ssé.
en: teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ mbɔɔ pá’ pege ne ńzwí’te máa maa lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gie Yěsô Kristo ge lá’ nyɛɛ legú’ we. Yé zɔɔ Ssé yege yé lÿò, à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

ngiemboon: Kwà’ yé à la náa twó yé ńtí wégè, lélɔg cu’u wégè mbwo menò tepòŋ mégè ntsèm. À la nyɛ́te wégè, pege cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé, ńgwɔ́ pà tè*lɔ̌’, ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋe twó ńgÿo pɔ́ shúm sie ée mbòŋ.
en: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie ɔ̀ gẅiin léke ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a gɔɔn, ńgẅiin lékẅiŋte wɔ́b, ńnyɛɛ nyìŋ mmó gie à fʉ̌a. Gÿo mɔɔn menò tà ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Ssé ńgÿo. Tè cʉ́’ nyìŋ gwága gú.
en: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

ngiemboon: Tè cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Ssé lege ngie pɔ́ gẅiin lé jú’ ncwò pà sá’ ngwòŋ, ńgÿo mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńzɛ́te, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe ńtyé pɔ́ légÿo pɔ́ menò mie ée mbòŋ.
en: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

ngiemboon: Gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie tà pɔ́ gɔɔn nò tepòŋ né nyìŋ, ńgie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn mentsaŋ, ńgie pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a mbʉ́lè pʉ́lè, ńnéŋe ńná mekù’ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: to speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers,butgentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ pege yégè gwɔ́ pà gÿo nò té sáŋ, ńgwɔ́ pà tʉʉ twó, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà nò gie á té nò wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mekwɔɔn mbwo shúm ntsèm sie ntʉ́m wégè tsɔ́ɔn lâ sie é poŋo wégè. Pege laa pʉ̀a ńcÿɔ́g, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa kègɔ́’, ńgÿo mé pʉa wégè tɛ’, pege gíŋe ḿbʉa yégè pʉ̀a.
en: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful,andhating one another.

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ nyɛ ngie ntʉ́m wé poŋ, á piŋ ńkwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ,
en: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

ngiemboon: á gÿo pege tsẅɛ́. Pege těen ńtsẅɛ́ɛ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege gÿǒ menò mie é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, pege tsẅɛ́ɛ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie à tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mégè. À la sɔgɔ wégè, ńdɔg ńgÿo mé zyé wégè lezyé se sẅé, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a náa le gwɔ́ we sẅé né pege.
en: not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ ntʉ́m pege té gɔ’, ńtí Yěsô Kristo, yé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

ngiemboon: À la néŋ pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie pege ge lá’ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì gẅie pege neŋé ńne ńzẅí’te. E Ssé ge lá’ ná né pege, mélà’mie à la kwoŋo wégè, ńcÿó gʉm yégè, ńgÿo pege cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò ye ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: that being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

ngiemboon: M bíŋ ne ńkwoŋo ngie ɔ̀ cwoŋo shwóŋó wɔ́b mboŋó, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a pie é zǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé pɔ́ ge kag tʉ̀ légÿo menò mbòŋo lékwɔgɔ nnɛ́, à gwɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie á kẅéte pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: This isa faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ɔn légɔɔn nò nà menò mie é té tyé, pá’ menò mie mé zoŋo nà mezíŋ pàmangʉa njʉ̀’ peg, pá’ menò mie mé zoŋo nà mbʉ̌ Mǒsê, é té menò mie é kẅéte nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, tà tsǒon méjʉ’.
en: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ma’a fagte, ɔ̀ pebe yé tà’ legʉ̀a à tè jú’, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔnte ńgíŋ ḿbebe yé à tè jú’, tà pi yé gíŋe ńteme nò.
en: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

ngiemboon: N kwaŋ ngie ɔ̀ ne ńzsé ngie ntí pʉ̀a apɛ̌ é té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nà mánzsè Ssé wɔ́. Pɔ́ gÿo menò tepòŋ, menò tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ ne ńnyɛɛ ngie pɔ́ èe nà mánzsè tepòŋ.
en: knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńtúmo Artemas kà pɔ́ Tishig wɔ́ mbwó gù, ɔ̀ kag tʉ̀ tà ńtó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn Nikopolos. Áa jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ka zǎb ngie n ge ńnéŋe wó nà fʉ̀’ʉ mbʉ̀ŋ.
en: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

ngiemboon: Zenas gẅie à tága nzèm pʉ̀a jʉ’ʉ ntsaŋ, tà mbɔɔ Apolos lɔɔn ńgwaa cʉ́me mánzsè legìŋ, ɔ̀ náa wɔ́b kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pɔ́ gẅiin.
en: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pégè nzèm Kristo gẅiin lékag tʉ̀ yɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńgÿo menò mbòŋo, ńzsé ngie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kẅéte pʉ̀a pie nò tyě nà pɔ́b, pɔ́ le gwɔ́ pà té zẅɛ́’ɛ wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And let our's also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, ngàŋa tsǎŋ ńtí nò Yěsô Kristo. Peg Timoté gẅie aa fɛ́ wɔgɔ nzèm Yěsô Kristo náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mbwo gù Filemo. Ɔ̀ɔ fɛ́ weg we tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pege metsèm pú fa’a nà nò Yěsô Kristo.
en: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothyourbrother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

ngiemboon: Áa jú, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ye Apia, fɛ́ wege we manzwě, mbɔɔ yé Aleshʉpe, á*ngàŋa kwò wege tsẅɛɛ ncù, ńgÿo cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie á kúu ndá gù.
en: and toourbeloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé, mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Fɛ́ wɔɔn Filemo, mèŋ ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńké ńkwaŋte gú kwaŋte, ésie Ssé, yé gẅie mèŋ n gu’te.
en: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sie yé á nue mèŋ n ne ńjú’u mé la’te ntí nkwòŋe gie ɔ̀ gẅiin nzèm pʉ̀a Ssé mbɔɔ ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m gú nà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo.
en: hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte Ssé ngie à lɔg pá’ pege temte, á fóo nà lézǎb ntʉ́m nà yé la, ńgÿó ngie ɔ̀ cwòŋo ńzsé menò mbòŋo mie á zɛ́te ngie pege gÿo tá ńdɔgɔ fa’a mbwo Kristo.
en: that the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn nue, nkwòŋe gie ɔ̀ gẅiin e ka gÿo m bú ńkág tɛ’. À fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn, ntʉ́m wɔɔn sẅeté, á fóo nà pá’ ɔ̀ ka kẅiŋte pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee ngàŋ ntúm Kristo, n tsɛ ńku’u léshwóŋó gú mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gÿo tá’, á fó nà mmó gie ɔ̀ ne gÿo,
en: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

ngiemboon: n gyá ngie n ge cʉa nà nkwòŋe yɔgɔ, ésẅíŋte gú sẅíŋte. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ mèŋ Pɔl, n cʉ̌’ pɔ́ nzẅìŋe ndÿò, ńgíŋe ńgwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ ńtí Yěsô Kristo lɔɔn.
en: yet for love's sake I rather beseechthee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte ɔ̀ nà twó Onesime, aa míŋ wɔɔn nà nò Yěso gẅie mèŋ n ka kúu ndá tsǎŋ ńzyé.
en: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ɔ̀ těen ńzẅɛ́’ɛ yé wɔ́ tá’, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ɔ́ɔ gwaa ne zẅɛ́’ɛ yé, mèŋ n ne ńzẅɛ́’ɛ yé yɔ́ɔn.
en: which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

ngiemboon: N tumó yé ngie à piŋ nzèm ńtsɛ́ɛ gú. Aa pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ tʉ́m yɔ́ɔn.
en: whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá ngie á kěen ḿboŋ ngie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńne fa’a fà’ gie ɔ̀ kěen ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ fa’, á ná fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie mèŋ n gee menkÿo ńtí Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo lɔɔn.
en: whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n kaa kwoŋo légÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà ɔ̀ jú’u jú’ wɔ́. N té ne ńkwoŋo létsóte gú tsóte tà ɔ̀ gÿo nò mbòŋo ná mèŋ wɔ́. Mèŋ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ kwǒŋ.
en: but without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀’, mbà à ka na’á fó lejʉ́ŋ gù ńgʉa légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo gíŋe gwaa gyá yé, à gwɔ́ pá’ pi yé ge cʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

ngiemboon: Á le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwɔɔn wɔ́. À cʉa nkwɔɔn, ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fɛ́ gù gẅie ɔ̀ ge kwoŋo yé tɛ’. Aa mbwo mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ pá’ à ge gwɔ́ mbwo gù? À ge gwɔ́ mbwo gù, é gwɔ́ kwà’ nyìŋ mesoŋ, é gíŋ gwɔ́ fɛ́ gù nzèm Yěsô Kristo.
en: not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ zsě ngie pɔgɔ ee nà tà’a nò, ɔ̀ kúe yé pá’ á ké ńgwé’e ńgwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà ɔ̀ kúe wɔ̀ɔn pú’u,
en: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie à la cʉŋte tsɔ́ mmó mbwo gù, kà ɔ̀ ne ńkʉ́a pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó mbwo yé wɔ́, ɔ̀ nyé mèŋ n gÿo ntÿó mbwo gù.
en: If he hath wronged thee, or oweththeeought, put that on mine account;

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl zɔ lɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn ńŋwe’e yɔɔn jʉ’, ńgie, n ge gÿo tÿó mbwo gù. Tá’ zsé ngie n gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ tÿó mbwo mèŋ. À gwɔ́ pá’ ɔ̀ gwaa gẅiin légwɔ́ gẅie ɔ̀ gẅiin fʉ̀’ɔɔn tɛ’, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ wɔɔn.
en: I Paul have writtenitwith mine own hand, I will repayit: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

ngiemboon: Á fɛ́ wɔɔn, tsétsɔ’ lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n ne ńdúɔ mbwo gù. Lɔg pá’ pɔgɔ pǔ ńda nnɛ́ nà Kristo, ḿbʉ́le ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pɔ́ pá’ ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ ńjú’ ncwò tá ńŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne. Mèŋ ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo mmó gie mèŋ n ne ńzɛ́te mbwo gù tà tɔ́g pú’u.
en: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

ngiemboon: Gíŋe ńnyɛ́te lûm ndá, ńdɔg ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn á nue mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie e Ssé lɔɔn jú’u sẅíŋte gí, mbà mé ge gíŋe tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn né pi.
en: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

ngiemboon: Epafalas, gẅie peg yé pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ ńtí nò Yěsô Kristo tsyɛ’té gú.
en: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ Malékuse, mbɔɔ Alistag, mbɔɔ Ndemas pɔ́ Lukase pie pegá pɔ̌ pǔ fa’a tà’a fà’.
en: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi.
en: Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, e Ssé gɔɔn nò mbwo pà mangʉa njʉ̀’ pégè, á nà mekwò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, mbɔɔ ná mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Pú’u, ńcʉa ná pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé.
en: God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,

ngiemboon: Á kéen ńgwɔ́ nà yégè kème njÿó yɔɔn gie á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye lɔg ńzsote, á gɔɔn nò né pege, ńgwɔ gɔɔn, ńcʉa pɔ́ ná Míŋ we. Á gwɔ́ yé gẅie à la cʉa ná yé, ńnyɛte njÿó ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńzába yé pá’ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ yé.
en: hath in these last days spoken unto us byhisSon, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;

ngiemboon: Mé fó pɔ́ ná múɔ wɔ̀ɔn tá ńgyá pá’ legú’ Ssé aa tè laa yé pú’u. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé aa lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà míŋ we giŋé ńgwɔ́ yé kwà’ pú’u. Á yé gẅie à lɔg pɔ́ metʉ̀ mie ée nà shwóŋè yé, ńtóonte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ntsèm. À la gwɔ́ tà ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne fóo mǒ ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tà á mag, á gʉa nê tÿǒ lepwó, ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀, yé Ssé gẅie à pǔ sá’a kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: who being the brightness ofhisglory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa pú’u, múɔ cʉa*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, tà Ssé ná lezíŋ sé, é nyɛ ngie à fǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ́b.
en: being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.

ngiemboon: à gwɔ́ mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And he shall be to me a Son?

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie mecÿɔ́’ pé, yé Ssé, métsèm gu’te yé,
en: And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgÿo megàŋa fà’ pé ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ melʉ́me mmɔ̌g la.
en: And his ministers a flame of fire.

ngiemboon: Ntí gie ɔ̀ ne ńdɔgɔ sá’a lá’ jú ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: A sceptre of righteousnessisthe sceptre of thy kingdom.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da cÿó gʉme jú ńcʉa ye*ngàŋa kwò jú.
en: With the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

ngiemboon: Lepwó gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mefà’ mú.
en: And the heavens are the works of thine hands:

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ shúm ge gÿo zẅìŋ pá’ nzsǒ la
en: And they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà ɔ̀ ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ɔ̀ gwɔ̌, agù le gwɔ́ wó à tě ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́
en: And thy years shall not fail.

ngiemboon: ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú wɔ́?
en: Until I make thine enemies thy footstool?

ngiemboon: Anò*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé zɔɔn pá’a ńgwɔ́ kɔ́? Pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mezẅìge mie é fa’a mbwo Ssé, á ne ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa fa’a fà’ gie á ge kẅéte pʉ̀a pie yé Ssé ge tâ gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege kwa’ ńgẅiin lé ké ńkú’te nò gie pege la jú’ kú’te, tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà pege ge fʉa mánzsè, é gʉa pyé,
en: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should letthemslip.

ngiemboon: pege ne ńzsé ngie, nò gie*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé la lɔg ńtó fʉ̀’e mvfò, á la tè méjʉ’ʉ nò wɔ́. Wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn fʉa yɛ̌ nò, ńtʉʉ twó mǒ, e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ná ye pɔ́ ná pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;
