ngiemboon: Pá’ á laa pú’u la, pege lɔɔn ńgwágte nò ná máamáa nò gẅie aa pá’ e Ssé la gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, e Ssé gǎ tà ńnyé wégè? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô lê twó yé la vɔg ńzye létsẅii yɛ̌ nò. Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la jú’u ncwò yé, gÿo ńkwa’ shwóŋó wégè ngie aa kwà’ máamáa nò.
en: how shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heardhim;

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋ ńtóonte wɔ́b á nà nò gie pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn, ńcʉa nà meliŋé, pâ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, pâ mendàa gyá mentí mentí, ńgíŋ ńcʉa nà mefà’ mie à zába na we lekwoŋ ngie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge cÿó gʉm pʉ̀a pɔ́ ku’u léfa’.
en: God also bearingthemwitness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn tè gÿo ngie mecÿɔ́’ pé gẅiin nò ná lesǎ’ ngwòŋ gẅie é ne ńtóo wɔ́, é ngwòŋ gẅie pege ne ńgɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gẅie nyìŋ mesoŋ zyě á gwɔ́ kɔ́ tà ɔ̀ ńnéŋe ńtÿɔ́’te yé?
en: Or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

ngiemboon: ńcÿó gʉm yé, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ twó yé, á gie á gÿo á gẅiin legú’.
en: And didst set him over the works of thy hands:

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa ye à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ jú’ ncwò nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ɔɔn à těen ńgɔɔn ńtsẅe tsɔ́ gie á ge nyé té jú’ ncwò wé wɔ́. Á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, pege tè ne ńgyá ngie shúm ntsèm ne ńjú’u ncwò nyìŋ mesoŋ ŋwɛ́ wɔ́.
en: For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothingthat isnot put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ammó gie pege ne ńgyá fʉ̀’ɔɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie Yěsô gẅie e Ssé la sẅé’e yé ńnáa ssé tà*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé cʉa yé méjʉ’, e Ssé lêen ńtɔ́’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ twó ye, á gie á gÿo á gẅiin legú’, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋ mekù’ mé, mélà’mie à la zẅíŋe légyá ngɔ́’ tà ńkwé. Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwé ná twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm, á fó pɔ́ ná pá’ e Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a tɛ’.
en: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gÿo shúm ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó é gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm sé. Pá’ à la piŋ ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge cʉ́’ púɔ pé, é gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we la, Yěsô zɔ̌ piŋ ńgẅiin légÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ la, á la ne ńzɛ́te ngie à gÿo Yěsô fó nà ngɔ́’ gie à gyǎ, ńku’u nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: For it became him, for whomareall things, and by whomareall things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gẅie à zɔɔn ńgÿo pʉ̀a ku’u pʉ̀a Ssé mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie à kéen ńgÿo pɔ́ ku’, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a tà’ nyìŋ. Áa mmó gie á gÿo eshʉ́ té kúu yé létóŋo wɔ́b lê mefɛ́ pé wɔ́.
en: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctifiedareall of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tyé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè é gu’te gú.
en: In the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.

ngiemboon: Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn, mbà pega gubé gie e Ssé la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ tǒ.
en: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, e gubé ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pá’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó, ńgẅiin mbab nnɛ́, ńgẅiin metse la, yé lê twó yé la gíŋe ńcʉ́’ yé nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ pɔ́b, légwɔ́ gie à ge táa fó nà legwé we, é gwoon nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo pʉ̀a kwéte, é kẅé metʉ̀ mé. Mé tóŋo ngàŋ lê Sátà
en: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;

ngiemboon: À la táa ńkwé, lélɔg pú’u, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ndá nkwɔɔn, ńkẅile pʉ̀a metsèm pie tà fó pá’ mé la zyé wɔ́b, pɔ́ ée ńzɔ́gɔ ḿbɔ́gɔ lékwé tà mbà pɔ́ léen ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ mbwo legwé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn pé.
en: and deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie Yěsô la tè tó lékẅéte*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé wɔ́, à la tóo lékẅéte pʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ábalam.
en: For verily he took not onhim the nature ofangels; but he took onhimthe seed of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, ńne ńzɛ́te ngie à gʉa nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ yé pɔ́ pá’ mefɛ́ pé, à cʉa pú’u, à gwɔ́*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gẅie à neŋé ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a, ńzsé yé pɔ́ ndà’ léfa’a mbwo Ssé, légwɔ́ gie à ge gÿo e Ssé lege mefʉa pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like untohisbrethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in thingspertainingto God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn fó ná pá’ Yěsô lê twó yé la gyá ngɔ́’, nkwà’te gíŋe ńkúu yé, á ku’u lékẅéte pʉ̀a pie nkwà’te ne ńkúu wɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pʉ̀a kristo, e Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ zɔ ka tóŋo gẅi nà nò yé, àwɔ̌ɔwɔɔ tóo ná yé mmó. Pi sáŋa nò ná nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa wɛ̌, aa yé gẅie e Ssé la túmo yé ngie à gwɔ́ wege*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò ná nò Ssé gie pege tyé mǒ.
en: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;

ngiemboon: À la gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie e Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ yé légwɔ́ gie à ge gÿo, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Mǒsê la gíŋe ńgÿo yé pú’u, á nà fʉ̀’ gie à la ne ńdíe pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moseswas faithfulin all his house.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ we legú’ gẅie mé la ná tɔ́gɔ we Mǒsê, á nue nyìŋ kwɛ́ ndá mé gɔ’te ngàŋ ńtɔ́g ndá gie à kwɛ̌.
en: For thismanwas counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́ zɔɔn ńgẅiin nyìŋ gẅie à la kwɛ́, tá nyìŋ gẅie à la gÿo shúm ntsèm aa Ssé.
en: For every house is builded by someman; but he that built all thingsisGod.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa ná Mǒsê, mbà á laa fʉ̀’ gie à la ne ńdíe pʉ̀a Ssé, ńzsé yé pɔ́ ndà’ mmó gie e Ssé la gɔɔn ngie à gÿo, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋa fà’, àkɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo nyɛɛ mmó nà menò mie e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńge lá’ gÿo e kẅɛ.
en: And Moses verilywasfaithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná Kristo, á gwɔ zsé yé pɔ́ ndà’ mmó gie e Ssé la gɔɔn ngie à gÿo wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ múɔ ndá, gẅie mé la tÿɔ́gɔ yé pá’ à ge sá’ pʉ̀a Ssé. Epʉ̀a Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wégè, pá’ pege lɔɔn ńkú’te mmó gie pege la zẅíŋ tà pege tè mʉ́’te, ńgíŋ ńnéŋe ńne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ ka’te ńzẅí’te mmó gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pege.
en: but Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńjú’ ngyè Ssé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn
en: To day if ye will hear his voice,

ngiemboon: Á lyɛ̌’ gie pɔ́ la tsóte yé nkwòŋo tsẅɛ̀ ngie à gÿo mmó né pɔ́b
en: In the day of temptation in the wilderness:

ngiemboon: ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn tà mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ gyǎ mmǒ gie mèŋ n gÿǒ gyá ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa.
en: And saw my works forty years.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la lá’ tè lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná menò mie n da ne ńtsẅii mbwo pɔ́b, ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And they have not known my ways.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie n da ka’a mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: They shall not enter into my rest.)

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi laga twó gí, tà ntʉ́m tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi é le tiŋ ndʉ̀’ á fó ná Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó ńzyɛ́b ntʉ́m wé wɔ́.
en: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pi ne ńkẅiŋte mennɛ́ mí pi né pi kẅiŋte, pú’u ńzsé ngie nò tepòŋ té ge fʉte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi, letʉ́m sé tʉ, á le gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́. Pi gÿo pú’u, lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, á nue yɔɔn áa lyɛ̌’ gie mé ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńtóŋ ngie à lyɛ̌’ɔɔn. Yɔɔn zɔɔ lyɛ̌’ gie ńgwɔ́ mé jú’ ngyè Ssé.
en: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

ngiemboon: Pega Kristo zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná tà’a nò, tá’ á ne ńzɛ́te tà’a mmó wémɔ’ɔ́, á gwɔ́ lékú’te mmó gie mé la shwóŋó wégè tá pege záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ńkú’te kú’te tà ńdá’ ńkúu nà lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsoté.
en: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;

ngiemboon: tà pi ziŋe metuŋó mí pá’ pi la ziŋe nà lyɛ̌’ gie pi la ne ńtʉʉ twó mbwo ye.
en: while it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie la zɔɔn ńjú’ ngyè Ssé, ńtʉʉ twó mbwo yé é laa pà wɔ̌? É laa pʉ̀a metsèm pie Mǒsê la lɔgɔ wɔ́b éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto ńkẅɛ.
en: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

ngiemboon: Anò pà wɔ̌ piŋ ńdá’ ḿbÿɔ́g Ssé pÿɔ́g ngù’ móm lekùa? Á laa nò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la fʉate menò, tà ńgwete nkwòŋo tsẅɛ̀ ńkwéte, mepfó mɔ́b sa jʉ’.
en: But with whom was he grieved forty years?was itnot with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńkʉa nà nò pà wɔ̌ ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie à la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́? Á laa ná nò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la tʉʉ twó mbwo yé.
en: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie pɔ́ la tè kúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la tè jú’u nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn, ńzẅíŋ wɔ́.
en: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.

ngiemboon: Tá’ le gwɔ́ gẅie e Ssé la ka’a sẅétè gie ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a kúu tsoló à nyě pɔ́ wó. Pá’ wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wégè la, pi pɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lá’ le tsoló kú.
en: Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being leftusof entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.

ngiemboon: Pege ka zɔɔn ńgíŋe ńjú’ yégè nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ŋwɛ́ pɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ laa nkwòŋo tsẅɛ la jú’ yɔ́b. Tá pɔ́ la ké ńjú’ yɔ́b é té wɔ́b kẅétè, á nue pɔ́ la tè záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b mǒ wɔ̌.
en: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heardit.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà à la lá’ fa’ mefà’ mé á fʉ̀’ gie à la nyɛte njÿó tà é mag.
en: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Mé la gɔɔn nò tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne yé, ńtí lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a ngie: E Ssé la fa’ mefà’ mé ntsèm, ńzẅɛte nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: For he spake in a certain place of the seventhdayon this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie n da nyɛte ńtí wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: If they shall enter into my rest.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la záb ngie etsɔ́ pʉ̀a ge gÿo kúu tsoló, tá mevɔ́g mvfò pʉ̀a le jú’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo la piŋ ńké tè tsoló kú, ńtí nue pɔ́ la jú’ pɔ́ té zẅíŋ.
en: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:

ngiemboon: Tà pi ziŋe metuŋó mí.
en: Harden not your hearts.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwe’e ńgwɔ́ gie Yeshua la lɔg pʉ̀a ńgʉa tà pɔ́ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ sẅétè, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé le gíŋe ńkíme tsɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie: Asẅétè gie e Ssé la fa’ mefà’ mé tà ńgẅiin nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a, gíŋe ńtyé tyé ńne ńzẅí’te pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ gẅie à kǔ tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie e Ssé la nyɛte ńtí yé, à giŋé ńzẅɛte yé nà mefà’ mé pá’ e Ssé la fa’ mé yé tà ńzẅɛte
en: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as Goddidfrom his.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege kag tʉ̀, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ sẅétè, pege gÿo nà ntí gie à tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pege à tě ge tʉʉ twó pá’ metá pégè, ésɔ́ɔn wɔ́.
en: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Ssé zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ntentʉ́ tà ńkwa’ fa’ mefà’, atwó yé sẅíte tà ńcʉa mbɔɔ ye yɛ̌ nně ncù wɔ́ gie e gẅiin mengʉ́ŋ mbʉ́a, á shú ńkúu ná nyìŋ kǔ tà ńcʉa nà jʉ’ gie azẅìge ngàŋ pɔ́ ntʉ́m wé temte wó, tà ńcʉa nà jʉ’ gie mejwoŋó mbùm ngàŋ pɔ́ mefóon mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mekẅǐ mé ée wó. Á ŋaga nyìŋ ná mmó gie ngàŋ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ ná gie à ne ńkwaŋa ntʉ́m yé.
en: For the word of Godisquick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, andisa discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

ngiemboon: Áa mvfò Ssé tsɔ́ mmó té lelyěen wɔ́, á tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó gie à la nyɛte. À gyá shúm ntsèm, à má’ nÿɔ́g ḿbú ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ pá’ á gwɔ́. Pege ge gÿo pú tyé mvfò ye é píte ncwò wégè.
en: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all thingsarenaked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pege gẅiin tà’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gẅie aa kwà’ wɛ̌, á gẅie à la gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Ssé ńtí wégè, á gwɔ́ Yěsô, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Ssé la, pege kú’te nò gie mé ka shwóŋó wégé, pege záb ntʉ́m mǒ, ḿbiŋ ne shwóŋó yɛ̌ nò mbwo petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fastourprofession.

ngiemboon: À wege*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò ŋwɛ́ zɔɔn ḿbú ńzsé ntí gie menò gyá wégè pú’u, menò la gyá yé, nkwà’te mentí mentí kúu yé yé pá’ pege, tá á ké ńdá’ tè tsɔ́ nò fʉa.
en: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like aswe are, yetwithout sin.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pege mʉ́’te lésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńgʉa nê jʉ’ gie lʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé áa wó, lélɔg pú’u, ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ yé Ssé gẅie à gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m. Pege sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ pú’u, tá Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mégè, ńnyɛɛ wégè pòŋo ntʉ́m yé, ńne ńkẅéte wégè ná fʉ̀’ gie pege zagá légÿo.
en: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńgʉa pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńtsɔ́’ɔ*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò pɔ́ légwɔ́ gie à ge fa’a mbwo Ssé, á nà twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ. À yé fà’ gwɔ́ lélɔg shúm ńtóo mvfò Ssé ńnyɛɛ yé mbɔɔ lénuŋe pwɔ́’ ńdɔg sẅíŋte yé ngie à lege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in thingspertainingto God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

ngiemboon: Pá’ yé nùŋe pwɔ́’ giŋé ńkʉ́a yé kʉ́a nà meshÿó ntsèm la, ńgwɔ́ á jú’u mmó gie á gÿo tá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té ne ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ wɔ́, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é fʉa mánzsè, éfʉa nò mbwo Ssé.
en: who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

ngiemboon: À lɔg pá’ yé lê twó yé giŋé ńkʉ́a yé kʉ́a la, ńgẅiin lénuŋe pwɔ́’ mbɔɔ ná yé twó ńdɔg sẅíŋte Ssé ngie à lege menò tepòŋ mé yé, tà á le nuŋe pɔ́ ndà’ nà twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́,
en: And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɔɔn le ńnéŋe tà yé zɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie mé ná mekù’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò né yé wɔ́. E Ssé zɔ tsɔ́’ɔ nyìŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la tsɔ́’ɔ Aroŋ.
en: And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, aswasAaron.

ngiemboon: tà fó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn n gwɔ́ tá gù».
en: To day have I begotten thee.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la gíŋe ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ jʉ’ ngie: «Ɔ̀ɔ nùŋe pwɔ́’, tà ké lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌, á nà ntí gie Melekisedeg la gwɔ́ yé».
en: After the order of Melchisedec.

ngiemboon: À giŋé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yé Yěsô gẅie à laa fʉ̀’ gie à la nyé ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, á sẅíŋte Ssé gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gÿo tà yé le kwé, ḿbú’ mbwó mbwo yé tà ne ńga’te ńdʉa. E Ssé fó ná pá’ Yěsô zẅí’te kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ mbwo yé, ńjú’u sẅíŋte yé.
en: Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ pɔ́ Míŋ Ssé tá’, ńgyá ngɔ́’ gyǎ, tà fó pɔ́ mǒ ńzí’i lé jú’ ncwò Ssé,
en: though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńjú’ tà ńku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á gÿo pʉ̀a pie é jú’u ncwò wé pú ńtsẅɛ́ ndà’ ndà’.
en: and being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Ssé la lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò á nà ntí gie Melekisedeg la gwɔ́ yé.
en: called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò Melekisedeg, mbà peg gẅiin menò mie peg ge gɔɔn mǒ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, lekyagte mɛ̌ menò mbwo pi à tʉ tɛ’, á nue mé té gɔɔn nò pi lwo ńjú’u mmó gie mé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.

ngiemboon: Pi kɔ’ɔ́ gwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn é cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pàzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé tá’, pi giŋé ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mé gíŋe ńzí’i gẅi menò mie mé zyé mǒ lézí’i nyìŋ nò Ssé. Á gwɔ́ wɔ̌ tà pi nyé ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ lepʉ́, tá mbà pi kɔ’ɔ́ cʉ́’ tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ mmó léjÿó gie á ne ńtʉte.
en: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again whichbethe first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńnyé ńnóŋo pɔ́ lepʉ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le ku’u lézsé nò á nà mmó gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, á nue ngàŋ nyě pɔ́ mûɔ mbÿɛ́.
en: For every one that useth milkisunskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ cÿɔgtě, mbà pɔ́ pfɛ́ pɔ́ mmó léjÿó gie á tʉte. Pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kéen ńzí’i tà ńgẅiin mà we lesaŋá nò, ńzsé yé mbòŋo, ńzsé yé tepòŋ.
en: But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age,eventhose who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo á ne ńzɛ́te ngie tà pege zso ndà’ ná mendùŋ mvfò menò mie pege la zye mǒ lézsé nò kristo. Pege kag tʉ̀ ńzí’i menò mé mie mé zí’i pʉ̀a pie é cÿɔgté nà nò yé, tà pege é le lá’a ńzɔ́gɔ ńnuŋe pɔ́ cÿɔ̌ ndá wɔ́. Mé gɔɔn légíŋe ḿbiŋe nà menò pá’ letěm nzèm mefà’ mie é náa pɔ́ legwé, pá’ lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé,
en: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

ngiemboon: pá’ lezi’í nò nà mekẅé ntse, pá’ lezi’í nò ná lezǎb mbwó twó pʉ̀a, pá’ lezi’í nò ná*lezimé nà legwé mbɔɔ ná pá’ e Ssé ge lá’ tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ é lɔg zsote.
en: of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

ngiemboon: Pege nyé mɔɔn menò, ńzyɛ́’ ńgʉa lê mvfò, pá’ Ssé lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ.
en: And this will we do, if God permit.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ńzsé ngie, mbʉ̀ŋ lɔɔn ńdúu nà tsetsá’ kwà’ mboŋó, eshúm sie é ge kẅéte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿǒ mé jʉ́’ʉ yɛ̌ tsetsá’ é kwɔ́’, mbà Ssé ge néŋ mbʉ́lè ná yɛ̌ jʉ’e tsetsá’.
en: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie kɔ́ɔn*ngùb pɔ́ nyɛ́’ ŋu’ zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńkwɔ́’ɔ nà yɛ̌ jʉ’ʉ tsetsá’, mbà á té kẅéte nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, mbà Ssé ge néŋ ndòon mǒ, mé gwá’, ńgÿo ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwá ńtuɔ tuɔ.
en: but that which beareth thorns and briersisrejected, andisnigh unto cursing; whose endisto be burned.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, peg ké ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé kwà’ mboŋó ngie pi ee ná mánzsè we mbòŋo á gwɔ́ gẅie mé pfó mǒ ńtsẅɛ́.
en: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.

ngiemboon: E Ssé tè gÿo nò gie á té tyé wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le lege mmó gie pi ka gÿo wɔ́, pá’ pi ka kẅéte mefɛ́ pi pʉ̀a Kristo, pi kě ńnyé ńkẅéte wɔ́b kẅéte, á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie pi kwoŋ Ssé.
en: For Godisnot unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie peg ké ne ńtsɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie àwɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́, à ké ne ńkaga tʉ̀ pɔ́ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgee lê mvfò, tà ńdá’ ńkúu nzsoté légwɔ́ gie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńzẅí’te mbwo Ssé, á ge gÿo pumte.
en: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:

ngiemboon: Tà pi cʉ́’ melǒŋ. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pi pí fʉ̀’ ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé mbɔɔ lé zẅí’te té kʉ́a, ńkẅé mmó gie e Ssé la ka’a lénáa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: that ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ̌ɔn ńzsé ngie e Ssé la ka’a mmó mbwo Ábalam. Pá’ tsɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à fǎŋ ńtɔ́gɔ yé Ssé, tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔgɔ yé ńkʉa tè wó wɔ́ la, yé Ssé lɔgɔ kwà’ twó mbùm yé ńkʉa,
en: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n gɔɔn tà shwóŋó nò, mèŋ n ge gÿo néŋ mbʉ́lè ná gù tɛ’, é gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù pú ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’».
en: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

ngiemboon: Ábalam jú’, ńzẅí’te té kʉ́a, á cʉa pú’u, á lá’ ńgẅiin mmó gie Ssé la ka’a mbwo yé.
en: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ lékʉa nò, ńdɔg lezíŋ nyìŋ gẅie à fǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ́b ńkʉa, ńgwaa kʉa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie áa nò, ńgíŋe ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò pàzoŋo yɛ̌ nò.
en: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmationisto them an end of all strife.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie e Ssé la gÿo, à la gɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa, á nue à la ne fa’a lé cwoŋe ńnyɛɛ mbwo pʉ̀a pie à la ka’a mmó mbwo pɔ́b ngie, ammó gie à la záb áa gie à téen ńdá’a ńkúbe wɔ́.
en: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmeditby an oath:

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, eshúm ée wó sépʉ́a sie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é le kúbe, pá’ e Ssé la ka’a nò mbɔɔ pá’ à la kʉa, é gwɔ́ menò mie á tʉ tà Ssé gɔɔn mé fa’ kékáŋ. Wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ kẅiŋte wég tɛ’, á wég gẅie peg léen ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, nkwaŋá wég cʉ́’ ńtyé pɔ́ nà mmó gie peg zẅí’te mbwo yé.
en: that by two immutable things, in whichit wasimpossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ gẅie pege ne ńzẅí’te mmó pɔ́ mbwo Ssé gÿo ntʉ́m wégè pʉ́le ńnéŋe té vɛ. Pege ne ńkwa’a ńzsé ngie pege ge lá’ shúu sẅɛ́, é kúu jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó.
en: whichhopewe have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;

ngiemboon: Á nue Yěsô la vɔg ńkúu wó ńtí wégè. À piŋ ńgwɔ́ wó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ nùŋe pwɔ́’ wege we lÿò, á nà ngù’u nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn, á nà ntí ye Melekisedeg.
en: whither the forerunner is for us entered,evenJesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

ngiemboon: Melekisedeg ŋwɛ́ à laa fùɔ pʉ̀a Salem, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ nùŋe pwɔ́’ we Ssé, é Ssé gẅie à pi’i kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Ábalam laa lyɛ̌’ gie à la gʉa ncù, ńtó ńdÿɔ́’ mefùɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńjÿó wɔ́b, ńne ḿbiŋe nzèm, Melekisedeg gʉa ńzá’a yé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná yé.
en: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;

ngiemboon: Á gabte shúm sie à lɔ̌g fóo ncù nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè né yé. Lezíŋ Melekisedeg é zɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Fùɔ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ», à gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pʉ̀a Salempú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ mbʉ́lè.
en: to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;

ngiemboon: Mé té tá pà Melekisedeg zsé. Mé té má we zsé, ńké tè zsé tsìŋe ndá gie á fóo mǒ wɔ́, mé té tóo tsɔ́ jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ńjú’ mé gɔɔn nò ná lezyě yé wɔ́, ńké tè jú’ mé gɔɔn nò ná legwé we wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pá’ Míŋ Ssé, á nue aa nùŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’ Melekisedeg lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ máa nyìŋ pú’u, á yé gẅie Ábalam, á mangʉa njʉ’ pʉ̀a Israel, la lɔg shúm éfó ncù, ńgabte nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwo yé.
en: Now consider how great this manwas, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ mǒsê zɛ́te mbwo pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi ngie, pɔ́ zɛ́te mbwo pʉ̀a Israel ngie pɔ́ gabte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie pɔ́ gẅiin, ńgabte nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwo pɔ́b pànuŋe pwɔ́’, ńzɛ́te pú’u, mbwo mefɛ́ pɔ́b, tá pɔ́b metsèm pú fóo pɔ́ nà ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam.
en: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:

ngiemboon: Melekisedeg la tè nyìŋ ná ngẅɛ̀ ndá Lěvi wɔ́, tá’, Ábalam gabte shúm sé nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè né yé, á kẅé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná yé gẅie e Ssé la ka’a mmó mbwo yé.
en: but he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńzsé mboŋó ngie nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè à cʉa nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé mbʉ́lè.
en: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.

ngiemboon: Pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, pie pɔ́ kẅé tà’ nzsè á nà shúm nzsè legém, pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pie é ńnéŋe ńkwéte. Tá ńgʉa ná Melekisedeg gẅie à la kẅé tà’ nzsè á nà nzsè legém, aa nyìŋ gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé ne shwóŋó wégè pú’u.
en: And here men that die receive tithes; but there hereceiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege gɔɔn ngie e pʉ̀a Lěvi pie é kẅé tà’ nzsè, á nà nzsè legém, la ná yɔ́b tà’ nzsè á nà nzsè legém mbwo Melekisedeg, pú’u ńcʉa ná Ábalam.
en: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.

ngiemboon: Á nue á laa lyɛ̌’ gie Melekisedeg la gʉa ńzá’a Ábalam, Lěvi gwɔ́ yé ssé, ńcʉa ná pá’ à laa lepfòm Ábalam, ngàb ngẅɛ̀ wɔb.
en: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ pʉ̀a Israel zɛ́te ngie mé lɔg pɔ́ púɔ ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi ńgÿo pànuŋe pwɔ́’. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ á nà ntí gie Aroŋ la gwɔ́ yé pú’u. Ammó laa pé’e á té zága nà yɔb ntí lenuŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́, mbà lenyé wɔ́b, ńcʉ́’ fa’a tsɔ́ nùŋe pwɔ́’ pɔ́ nà ntí ye Melekisedeg lɔ̌ɔn ńge kẅéte nà kɔ́?
en: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further needwas therethat another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

ngiemboon: Ntí ye lelɔg ńtsɔ́’ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkúbe, mbà*lepʉ̌ gẅiin lékúbe yé.
en: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

ngiemboon: Mé gɔɔn mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. Yé gẅie à fóo nà tsɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ ye ndyɛ̀’ɛ, é gie tsɔ́ nyìŋ laa fó mǒ éfa’a fà’ á jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó wɔ́.
en: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege fóo ná ngẅɛ̀ Jẅida, é ngẅɛ̀ gie Mǒsê la tè kím lezíŋ sɔ́b á fʉ̀’ gie à la ne ńgɔɔn nò ná pànuŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́.
en: Forit isevident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mé ge fóo mǒ é nyɛte jú’u nò gie mé ně ńdá’ ńzye légɔɔn, áa pá’ wetsɔ̌ nùŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie à la kẅɛ, aa nà ntí ye Melekisedeg.
en: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,

ngiemboon: À tè gwaa gwɔ́ nùŋe pwɔ́’ pá’ɔɔn, á fóo ná tsɔ́*lepʉ̌ sie mé la záb ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ giŋe mǒ wɔ́. Á fóo pɔ́ nà metʉ̀ mie ée nà we le gwɔ́. Wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ á gwɔ́ tèmì,
en: who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.

ngiemboon: mbà mé la ŋwe’e nò ńtí yé á gwɔ́ ngie: «Ɔ̀ɔ nùŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie à ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌ ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn, á nà ntí ye Melekisedeg».
en: After the order of Melchisedec.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔg pú’u, ḿvɔg ńtsɛ́ɛ nzẅìŋe nzsè gẅie mé la vɔg ńtsẅi ngie me giŋe mǒ, á nue mmó la zága ná yɛ̌ nzsè, é piŋ tè kẅéte.
en: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.

ngiemboon: Pú’u á nue*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê la tè gÿo tà tsɔ́ mmó ku’ ná ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Ssé la tsɔ́’ nzsè sẅé, nkwaŋá wégè ńnéŋe fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńtyé pɔ́ mǒ. Ee mbòŋ ńcʉa yetsɔ́, á nue pege pfó mǒ ńgʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hopedid; by the which we draw nigh unto God.

ngiemboon: E gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ, á nue e Ssé la gwaa tÿɔ́gɔ*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿo we yɛ̌ nzsè, ńgɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa. Pà nùŋe pwɔ́’ pe melÿò la gwaa kẅɛɛ ná ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, e Ssé tè gɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa wɔ́,
en: And inasmuch as not without an oathhe was made priest:

ngiemboon: N gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ nùŋe pwɔ́’, é la’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌ á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn
en: After the order of Melchisedec:)

ngiemboon: Á la fó mǒ, e Ssé lɔgɔ Yěsô ńcwóŋ lezyɛ̌ ná yɔɔn*kʉ̀a ye sẅé gie áa mbòŋ ńcʉa yetsɔ́.
en: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ mǒ gwɔ́ ngie: Pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pe ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi la gwaa gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn á nue legwé lɔ̌ɔn ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b lé ké ńdá’a fa’a fà’ yɔ́b fa’ tà pɔ́ lekwé.
en: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná Yěsô, mbà yê fa’a nùŋe pwɔ́’ té gie ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ fa’ wɔ́, á nue yé Yěsô ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, é ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: but thisman, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gíŋe ńgÿo á ku’u légÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ yé ńtsóte nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ ndà’ ndà’. Pú’u nue yé Yěsô aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, pá’ à ge sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó yɔ́b.
en: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gẅie á la ne ńzɛ́te mbwo pege. Àa kwà’ Míŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbú’ nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńgwɔ́ té tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ ná ye, pâ pàgÿo menò tepòŋ té tsɔ́ nò tem, mbà Ssé la ńnéŋe yé tàa tÿǒ tà tsɔ́ mmó té gíŋe ńtɔ́gɔ yé ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ wɔ́.
en: For such an high priest became us,who isholy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

ngiemboon: À tè pá’ petsɔ́ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pe melÿò pie pɔ́ la gẅiin lénuŋe pwɔ́’ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm wɔ́. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿvɔgɔ ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ ná mɔ́b menò tepòŋ, tá ḿbiŋe ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ ná menò tepòŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. À la nuŋe wé pwɔ́’ pɔ́ tà’ legʉ̀a, á gwɔ́ pá’ à la náa twó mbùm yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, á ku’ pú’u.
en: who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people's: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ Mǒsê zɔɔn ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie à kʉ́a kʉ̌a pá’ petsɔ́ ńgÿo*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. Tá anò gie e Ssé la záb*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ḿbiŋ tâ ńgɔɔn tà ńkʉa, á la gÿo á lɔgɔ Míŋ we gẅie à léen ńdá’ ńku’u nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie yé Ssé la ne ńzẅí’te yé mǒ, ńdɔg gÿo*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò ná ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law,makeththe Son, who is consecrated for evermore.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ nò gie peg ne fa’a lé shwóŋó gẅi á yɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngie pege kwá’ ńgẅiin yɔɔn ntí*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. À kéen ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ, á nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀, á yé gẅie à pǔ fáŋ ńcʉa wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: Now of the things which we have spokenthis isthe sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;

ngiemboon: À fa’a fà’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò á kwa’ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó, á tsɛ̀ɛ kwà’ ntàbSsé. Wɛ̌ ntàb gwɔ́ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ la lɔg kwà’ mbwo mé ńnÿɔg tà nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ tè nÿɔg.
en: a minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńzába*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò pɔ́ légwɔ́ gie à ge lɔg shúm tóo mvfò Ssé nyɛɛ yé mbɔɔ pá’ à ge nùŋe pwɔ́’ mvfò Ssé. Áa mmó gie á gÿo á ne ńzɛ́te ngie wege*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò à gíŋe ńgẅiin yé mmó gie à ge náa mbwo Ssé.
en: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: whereforeit isof necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.

ngiemboon: Kristo la gwé’e ńgwɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà à zɔɔn fó tè nùŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́, á nue pànuŋe pwɔ́’ ná pá’*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne ńzɛ́te, é léen ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

ngiemboon: Afà’ gie pɛ̌ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ fa’a, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ ná kwà’ nò gie áa tÿǒ lepwó. Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pá’ e Ssé la nyɛɛ Mǒsê pá’ à ge gÿo á fʉ̀’ gie á lɔ̌ɔn ńge nÿɔg ntàb Ssé, e Ssé la gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Lʉŋte pɔ́ ná gie mèŋ n da nyɛɛ gú ndùm lekwɛ́ la».
en: who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he,thatthou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.

ngiemboon: Tá áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Kristo kéen ńgẅiin yé fà’ á cʉa ye pànuŋe pwɔ́’ ŋwɛ́ tɛ’, ńtí nue à zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ màmekěm nà nò*kʉ̀a gie á poŋ cʉa ye mvfò, e Ssé la ne ńgwaa yɔɔn*kʉ̀a, ńka’ menò mbwo pege, é gwɔ́ mbòŋ tà ńcʉa.
en: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.

ngiemboon: Ammó laa pé’e ńzɔɔn tè zága ná ndùŋ mvfò*kʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà mé la tè gíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́*kʉ̀a ńdɔg ńkúbe yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: For if that firstcovenanthad been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ge gÿo gwa*kʉ̀a sẅé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pega pʉ̀a Israel lâ pʉ̀a Jẅida.
en: When I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n da tè gíŋe sáŋa wɔ́b nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.
en: And I regarded them not, saith the Lord.

ngiemboon: pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn
en: And they shall be to me a people:

ngiemboon: Á léfóo ná mûɔ mémúɔ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgʉa ńkúu ná nzẅìŋe ndÿò.
en: From the least to the greatest.

ngiemboon: N te gÿo gíŋe kímte menò tepòŋ mɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la lɔg pá’ à toŋó yɔɔn*kʉ̀a lê*kʉ̀a sẅé, ńdɔg ńda’te ngie ndùŋ mvfò zẅǐŋ. Pege piŋ ńzsé ngie ammó gie á zẅǐŋ, tà ne ńkwote áa gie á cʉ́’ʉ ńgee pɔ́ ḿmagá.
en: In that he saith, A newcovenant, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth oldisready to vanish away.

ngiemboon: Nndùŋ mvfò*kʉ̀a la gẅiin ye ntí mendendá’ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgiŋe mǒ tá ńnuŋe pwɔ́’. Mé la gíŋ ńgẅiin jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ Ssé wó, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: Then verily the firstcovenanthad also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.

ngiemboon: Mbà mé la jwoŋo máamáa ntàb, ńdɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ ńzá’ nzsè pʉ́a, ńtóŋo lúm we pǐ ngie tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wo, tsɔ̌ ntí máamáa túlukáŋ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńgẅiin mentyɛ’ɛ́ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, tápele gíŋ ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mbelég gie mé nǎ mbwo Ssé gwɔ́ ndùmo.
en: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, whereinwasthe candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.

ngiemboon: Lúm we tsoló gẅie aa nzèm mmó nzsǒ yɛ̌ gwɔ́ kwà’ jʉ’e Ssé.
en: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ lúm, lekyè mmɔ̌g tyé tsoló, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, mé tuɔ shúm gyě ndùmo, àkʉ̀be*kʉ̀a gie e Ssé pâ pʉ̀a la gwa tyé yé tsoló, mbà mé la pú ńdɔg pɔ́ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńdɔg shʉŋ menzèm ntsèm, atsɔ̌ mûɔ méngwʉ̌ŋ gẅie mé la gíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte á tyé tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ kʉ̀b lé mána tsoló, atÿǒ Aroŋ gie metootǒ la lá’ ńkẅɛte mǒ gíŋe ńnùŋe tsoló, metǎfelé tóon mie mé la ŋwe’e nò*kʉ̀a gie e Ssé pâ pʉ̀a pé la gwa gíŋ ńgwɔ́ tsoló.
en: which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, whereinwasthe golden pot that had manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ndùmo kʉ̀be*kʉ̀a, mbà mé la tÿɔ́g metútú*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, é ne ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee jʉ’ó, jʉ́jʉ́ŋ mbabá mɔ́b kábte jʉ’ gie mé pfɛte metse menɔ̀ɔn wó, ḿpfɛte légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge lege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Tá’, yɔɔn té fʉ̀’ gie pege ge gɔɔn nò ná menò mɔɔn ntsèm tà tyɛ’te wɔ́.
en: and over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

ngiemboon: Me pú ńtáŋte pá’ɔɔn, pànuŋe pwɔ́’ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ lûm we pǐ é lyɛ̌’ ntsèm éfa’a fà’ yɔ́b.
en: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the serviceof God.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná lûm we tsoló,*anùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gílé yé zɔ̌ kúu jʉ’ó tà’ legʉ̀a ná ngù’u lá’, ńké těen ńkúu jʉ’ó té gẅiin metse mie à lɔgɔ ńtóo mvfò Ssé ńnyɛɛ ńtí menò tepòŋ mé yé, mbɔɔ me petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: But into the secondwentthe high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, andforthe errors of the people:

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńnyɛɛ ngie wɔɔn ndùŋ mvfò ntàb lɔɔn ńké ńdá’ ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, mbà mánzsè létɔ́g tà ńkúu ná kwà’ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó, à tè tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́.
en: the Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:

ngiemboon: Áa mbwo pege ná fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ liŋé gie mé lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ wégè nò. Yɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ ngie: Ammó gie mé náa mbwo Ssé lâ pwɔ́’ gẅie mé nuŋe mvfò yé, ńgwɔ́ é le gÿo tà ntʉ́m nyìŋ gẅie à gu’te Ssé ná yɛ̌ ntí, é nyé té ké ne ńŋaga yé ŋag wɔ́.
en: whichwasa figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí legu’te Ssé ee ntí gie e lǐe pɔ́ mbùm nyìŋ, á gwɔ́ nò ńdíe shúm léjÿó, ńdíe melù’, ńdíe lésɔg*melɔ̌’. Metʉ̀ mɛ̌ mbʉ̌ la gẅiin légwɔ́ wó tà ńdá’ ńkú pɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńge gíŋe gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ sẅe sẅé.
en: which stoodonly in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposedon themuntil the time of reformation.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà Kristo léen ńtó ńgwɔ́*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò ná shúm mbòŋo sie é ne ńtóo. À ka gwaa tó, ńzyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ntàb, é gwɔ́ gẅie é pú fáŋ ńcʉa wetsɔ́ wɛ̌, atsɔ́ mmó piŋ tè ne ńzága mǒ wɔ́, é té gẅie pʉ̀a la lɔg mbwo mɔ́b ńnyɛte wɔ́, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie wɛ̌ ntàb é té tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó gie mé la nyɛte nyɛte wɔ́.
en: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;

ngiemboon: Kristo la kúu kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó. À la kú pɔ́ tà’ legʉ̀a á ku’. Á la gwɔ kú, à tè gẅiin metse mbÿɔ́b, kà me púɔ fòŋ lényɛɛ mbwo Ssé wɔ́. À la lɔg pɔ́ kwà’ metse mé ńkú. Wɔɔn aa pá’ à la kẅile wégè ndá tsǎŋ pú’u, pɔ́ ndà’.
en: neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemptionfor us.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, mé pfɛte metse mbÿɔ́b, kà me melúm mefòŋ, kà pfó gie á fóo ná mûɔ fòŋ gẅie mé tǔɔ wɔ́, ḿpfɛte sɛ̌ shúm ná pʉ̀a pie ncÿǒ nò tepòŋ ée ná pɔ́b, é gÿo*alɔ̌’ maga ná mbùm yɔb tà pɔ́ ku’u légíŋ ńgu’te Ssé.
en: For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie á laa pú’u, mbà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ ná pá’ metse Kristo ge gwɔ́? Á Kristo gẅie Zẅìge tèmì la gÿo, á lɔgɔ twó yé ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie*lɔ̌’ té mǒ wɔ́, á mvfò Ssé. Metse mé ge lá’ sɔg ncÿǒ mefà’ mie é náa pɔ́ legwé gẅie ée ná pege tà ntʉ́m wégè é le gíŋe ńŋaga wégè wɔ́, légwɔ́ gie pege ge fa’a mbwo Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á gÿo Kristo gwɔ́ ná nò tsɔ́*kʉ̀a gie áa ye sẅé, á gie á gíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pá’ ŋwà’ne lɔg ńtÿɔ́g legwé, ńgwɔ́ màmekěm. À la kwé á gwɔ́ lélɔg pú’u, éfóo ndá tsǎŋ gie menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ la ńnéŋe wɔ́b wó, á fʉ̀’ gie mé la nyé ńgwɔ́ nà nò ndùŋ mvfò*kʉ̀a, ńkẅile wɔ́b. Á lêen ńké fó pú’u, pʉ̀a pie mé la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, é ku’u lékẅé shúm mbòŋo sie à la pÿé, é gwɔ́ sie é ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressionsthat wereunder the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ mé le zɔɔn ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne gie nyìŋ ka lɔg ńtÿɔ́g legwé sé té gwɔ́ gie ngàŋ kwě tà mé gyá wɔ́.
en: For where a testamentis, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńkwé tá ŋwà’ne gie á lɔgɔ ńtÿɔ́gɔ legwé sé á kẅɛ, mé lɔg ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò. À lɔɔn nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntèntʉ́, yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne kẅɛ, mé le lɔg ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: For a testamentisof force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo mé té nuŋe mbɔɔ ndùŋ mvfò*kʉ̀a té pfɛte metse wɔ́.
en: Whereupon neither the firsttestamentwas dedicated without blood.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê la tóŋ mbʉ̌ mie e Ssé la tsẅi á ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌, ńtóŋo mvfò lá’a ntsèm tà mɛ̌ mbʉ̌ mag, á kaa metse púɔ fòŋ, ńtemte ná me mbÿɔ́b, ńnéŋ ntse mǒ, ḿbíi tsǎŋa légí gẅie mé tóŋo lê hysope, ńkáte menoŋ*njʉ̀njÿò mie é paŋ paŋ á nà twó, ńcÿɔ’ɔ mǒ, ńzɛɛ ná kwà’ ŋwà’ne, ńgíŋ ńzɛɛ ná mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńgwɔ́ zɛ ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée metse*kʉ̀a gie e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn ngie tà pi lá’ ńdɔg ḿma’a kwàŋ,
en: saying, Thisisthe blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńzɛ metse ná ntàb mbɔɔ ná shúm ntsèm sie pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lɔgɔ fa’a.
en: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńdíe nà ntí ye*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, mbà ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie mé lɔg metse menɔ̀ɔn, ésɔgɔ*lɔ̌’ ná lelÿò shúm. Mé piŋ ńzsé ngie: Mé lɔɔn ńké tè pfɛte metse wɔ́, e Ssé ké le mefʉa pʉ̀a mesoŋ lege.
en: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à la ne ńzɛ́te ngie me lɔg ntí gie mé la’te la, ńkẅile*lɔ̌’ ná shúm sie mé kǐm, é gwɔ́ sie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ fʉ’te sie ée tÿǒ lepwó fʉ’te, mbà á gʉa ná kwà’ sɛ̌ shúm sie ée tÿǒ lepwó, á zɛ́te ngie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie é poŋ ńcʉa wɛ̌.
en: It wastherefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn tè kúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó, á gwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la lɔg mbwó mɔ́b ńnyɛte ńdɔgɔ fʉ’ʉ kwà’ yɛ̌ gie áa tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́. À la kú pɔ́ kwà’ tÿǒ lepwó, tà aa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ yégè nò ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands,which arethe figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:

ngiemboon: À la tè kúu wó pá’ à ge lɔgɔ twó yé nuŋe pwɔ́’ mengʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pá’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò lɔ̌ɔn ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kwà’ jʉ’e Ssé, é mengù’u mengù’, ńdɔgɔ metse nɔ̀ɔn ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ wɔ́.
en: nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;

ngiemboon: Á nue á laa pé’e ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà tà fó pá’ e Ssé la nyɛte njÿó, Kristo la gẅiin léńnéŋe ńgyá ngɔ́’, ńkwé ḿbiŋe ńkwé. Tá pege zsé ngie afʉ̀’ la gwɔ́ tà ńku’, á kẅɛ pɔ́ tà’ legʉ̀a, á ku’ pú’u, á lɔgɔ twó mbùm yé ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ lélɔg ḿbyága nò tepòŋ.
en: for then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

ngiemboon: Pá’ e Ssé la záb ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ ge ké kwé pɔ́ tà’ legʉ̀a, é kwé pú’u, à cʉ́’ pɔ́ pá’ yé Ssé ge tsɔ́’te ntsaŋ ngàŋ la,
en: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:

ngiemboon: áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la gÿo Kristo lɔgɔ twó mbùm ye, ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ pɔ́ tà’ legʉ̀a, lélɔg ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. À ge gÿo gíŋe kẅɛɛ ná mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a. Á le gíŋe ńtóo fʉ̀’ó lézyɛ́b menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. À tóo pú’u, légÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńzẅí’te yé tsẅɛ́.
en: so Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.

ngiemboon: Mendendá’ mie ée nà*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ shúm mbòŋo sie e Ssé la gÿo pá’ é ge lá’ tó, é téen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwà’ sɛ̌ shúm wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á gÿo, ńgwɔ́*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ é le lɔgɔ nò pwɔ́’ gẅie á né ńzɛ́te ngie me lɔg ńtóo mvfò Ssé ngù’ ntsèm, é ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ ntí, ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn létsóte nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ku’u légwɔ́ pà tè*lɔ̌’ wɔ́.
en: For the law having a shadow of good things to come,andnot the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

ngiemboon: Á laa pé’e lenùŋe pwɔ́’ mvfò Ssé ná yɛ̌ ntí kẅile*lɔ̌’ ná pʉ̀a tà ntʉ́m wɔ́b té gíŋe ńŋaga wɔ́b nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, mbà mé ée ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnuŋe tsɔ́ pwɔ́’ wɔ́.
en: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńcwoŋo ńdíe mboŋó, mbà yɛ̌ ntí lenùŋe pwɔ́’ aa legwɔ̌ ngù’ ntsèm ńkímte mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: But in thosesacrifices there isa remembrance againmadeof sins every year.

ngiemboon: Á nue atsɔ̌ le gwɔ́ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ metse melúm mefòŋ mbɔɔ me mekùkwòon fó ná nyìŋ mesoŋ ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ á té wó wɔ́.
en: Forit isnot possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńná mbùm nnɛ́ né mèŋ
en: But a body hast thou prepared me:

ngiemboon: ńké tè kwoŋ pwɔ́’ gẅie mé nuŋe mvfò gù ńtí nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: In burnt offerings andsacrificesfor sin thou hast had no pleasure.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ lepu’ú ŋwà’ne jú ńtí wɔ̀ɔn.
en: To do thy will, O God.

ngiemboon: À zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔ̀ tè kwoŋ pwɔ́’ wɔ́, ńké tè kwoŋo mmó gie mé lɔg ńtóo mvfò gù wɔ́, ńké tè kwoŋo nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé pǔ ńtuɔ yé pɔ́ ntsèm wɔ́, ńké tè kwoŋ pwɔ́’ gẅie mé nuŋe mvfò gù ńtí nò tepòŋ wɔ́, sɛ̌ shúm té gú poŋ, tá é ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm sie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo».
en: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings andofferingfor sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasuretherein; which are offered by the law;

ngiemboon: Kristo gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, ńdɔg ḿbyága ndùŋ mvfò ntí lenuŋe pwɔ́’, ńdɔg ye sẅé ńkúbe.
en: then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

ngiemboon: Kristo la gÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. À la náa twó mbùm yé tà’ legʉ̀a á ku’. Á lɔg pú’u, ńgÿo peg ku’ pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ oncefor all.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná nùŋe pwɔ́’ we nzẅìŋe*kʉ̀a, mbà à gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńtyé pɔ́ ncwò fà’ ye, ńké ńnuŋe pɔ́ tà’ ntí pwɔ́’ gie e lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é le lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ńku’u léfóo ná nyìŋ ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ mé wɔ́.
en: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná Kristo, mbà à la nuŋe pwɔ́’ ńtí menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, á tà’ legʉ̀a á ku’ pɔ́ ndà’ ndà’. Á gʉa sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀.
en: but this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

ngiemboon: Áa jʉ’ó tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńne ńzẅí’te ngie Ssé lɔg megàŋ mbù pé ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mé.
en: from henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ à la lɔg pɔ́ tà’a mmó wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie à nǎ mbwo Ssé, ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zẅɛ́’ɛ yé, ńku’ pʉ̀a Ssé, é gwɔ́ pà tè*lɔ̌’ pɔ́ ndà’ ndà’.
en: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gíŋe ńne shwóŋó wégè ngie áa nò. Á vɔg ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Whereofthe Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ nkwaŋá wɔ́b tyé pɔ́ nà mbʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn
en: And in their minds will I write them;

ngiemboon: «Á gʉa nà menò tepòŋ mɔ́b mbɔɔ nà menò mɔ́b mie é té tyé, n de lá’ ńgíŋ ńkímte wɔ́».
en: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńzɔɔn ńgʉa nà fʉ̀’ gie, e Ssé vɔ̌g tà ńdege mefʉ̀a nyìŋ ńnáa mbwo ye, agàŋ tè gíŋe ńtóo mvfò Ssé ńnáa tsɔ́ mmó ńtí menò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: Now where remission of theseis, there isno more offering for sin.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pá’ áa pú’u la, pege ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńkwa’ ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie atsɔ́ mmó cʉ́’ʉ ńne ńtáte wégè lécʉa ńkúu ná kwà’ jʉ’e Ssé wɔ́, pú’u, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pá’ Yěsô la pfɛte metse mé.
en: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,

ngiemboon: À la shʉa máamáa mmó nzsǒ gẅie mé la lɔg ńtsɛ́ nzsè lékúu kwà’ jʉ’e Ssé, ńdɔg pú’u, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mánzsè gẅie pege ge pfó mǒ kúu jʉ’ gie e Ssé ee wó. Á gwɔ́ we sẅé gẅie pege ge cʉa mǒ é gwɔ́ wó. Máamáa nzsǒ gie à la shʉa, e gwɔ̌ pɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́ ye gie mé la kime nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: by a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgẅiin*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò gẅie aa kwà’ wɛ̌, yé zɔ̌ líe pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: andhavingan high priest over the house of God;

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege gwɔ́ sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgẅiin ntʉ́m gẅie ée nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé kwà’ mboŋó, á nue Yěsô ka lɔg metse mé ésɔg letʉ́m ségè tà é té gíŋe ńne ńŋaga wégè wɔ́, à ka lɔg ntse gẅie é ne ńdʉ́a ésɔg mbùm yege.
en: let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka ka’a mmó mbwo pege. Aa ḿbiŋe ńka’a mmó, ńdá’a ńgÿo pɔ́ yɛ̌. Pú’u la, pege ké ńne ńkẅi’i shʉa shʉa ńgɔɔn ngie, pege ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie à la ka’ tà pege é le ne mʉ́’te wɔ́.
en: Let us hold fast the profession ofourfaith without wavering; (for heisfaithful that promised;)

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ wege gwá’a lÿɔ̀g á lélíe fɛ́ we, á gíŋ ńdíe yé yé, ńzsé ngie pege ge lɔg pú’u, kẅiŋte membùm mégè ná legẅiin nkwòŋe mbɔɔ ná lefa’ mefà’ mbòŋo.
en: and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

ngiemboon: Tà pege nyé lé ké ńne ńtóo mecú’tè mégè tǒ, tà mbɔɔ pá’ letsǒ cú’tè à kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ mà mbwo tsɔ́ pʉ̀a la, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, nyìŋ wege kẅiŋte fɛ́ we, á kẅiŋte yé yé, á nue pi ne ńgyá pá’ lyɛ̌’ lá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of someis; but exhortingone another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńnyɛɛ wégè nò nénʉ́ tà pege ne ńzsé mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńgwá’, ńké ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ tà ńne ńzsé zsě, mbà tsɔ́ pwɔ́’ ndyɛ̀’ɛ gẅie ńgwɔ́ mé nuŋe lélɔg ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ mégè, é té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

ngiemboon: Pege cʉ̌’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ légwɔ zẅí’te mmó gie á ne ńtóo, ńgíŋe ne ḿvɛɛ, yɛ̌ mmó wɔ́ ngie mé ge gÿo ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ mbɔɔ ngie, nkʉ̀’ʉ pà mmɔ̌g e ge gÿo tuɔ pàtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé.
en: but a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńzsé ngie, nyìŋ lɔɔn fʉa*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, mé zẅé ngàŋ, pɔ́ tè tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe mé, pá’ pàjÿò ńgyá mépʉ́a kà métá wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie áa nò.
en: He that despised Moses' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà pi kwǎŋ gí ngie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé zába twó nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ míŋ Ssé ńtóŋ sɛ̌ shúm e ge lá’ ńgwá’a la? Mé gɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie à gwagá nò metse mie e Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwaa*kʉ̀a, é gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔg ńgÿo á cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ Ssé, á nyìŋ gẅie à zoonté Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie á gÿo pege zsé pá’ ntʉ́m Ssé poŋo nzèm pege pú’u.
en: of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ńcwoŋo ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à la gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n zɔ gẅiin létsɔ́’ɔ nò tepòŋ ńnáa tsɔ́, mèŋ n zɔ gẅiin ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ we wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ». À la gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo ŋag pʉ̀a pé».
en: For we know him that hath said, Vengeancebelongethunto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ńnéŋe ḿbɔ́g tɛ’, aa légwe ntsaŋ á mvfò Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó!
en: It isa fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tà pi lege pá’ á laa ná mendùŋ mvfò melyɛ̌’, á ná pá’ pi la gwɔ́ tà Ssé lɔgɔ kyɛ̀’ ńkyɛ’ɛ gẅí, pi gyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’. Mé ma’a gẅi lê ncù tɛ’, tá pi ke shÿɔg shÿɔg.
en: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńtyé mvfò lá’ ńzoon gẅí, ńkʉ́e gẅí, pi gíŋe ńgyá ngɔ́’ nue pi ne ńtága nzèm pʉ̀a pie mé ne ńgege wɔ́b pá’ pi.
en: partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa tsǎŋ la ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, pi kú gí nùɔ pɔ́b. Afʉ̀’ gie mé la gwoon shúm sí ńkẅé, pi lɔg pɔ́ lekág ńzẅíŋ mé kẅé, á nue pi la ne ńzsé ngie pi gẅiin tsɔ́ shúm é gwɔ́ sie é poŋ ńcʉa sɛ̌ ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ sie é ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pi kʉ́a lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, á nue máamáa ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ aa mǒ.
en: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńne ńzɛ́te ngie pi ké ńkag pɔ́ tʉ̀, ńzsé ngie pi ge ne gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, à fó pú’u, pi gẅiin mmó gie à la ka’a lé náa mbwo pi.
en: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

ngiemboon: À tè láte wɔ́.
en: And he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.

ngiemboon: anò yé le gíŋe ḿboŋo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: But ifany mandraw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pege, mbà pege tè ntí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ piŋe nzèm, ńkúu pyé wɔ́. Pege ee pá’ɔɔn ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé, à cʉa pú’u, à gÿo ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́.
en: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.

ngiemboon: Lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, aa lecwoŋo ńzsé mboŋó ngie, ammó gie mé ne ńzẅí’te ngie e Ssé ná, à ge lá’ ná, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ lécwoŋo ńzsé ngie, eshúm sie mé té ne ńdɔgɔ nÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́ kwà’ ńgwɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gɔɔn nà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pé pe fʉ̀’e mvfò ngie, ée kwà’ pʉ̀a, á fó pɔ́ nà yɔb ntí lezǎb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: For by it the elders obtained a good report.

ngiemboon: Pege fǒ pɔ́ ná pá’ pege záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tá ńjú’ ngie e Ssé la lɔgɔ shwóŋè yé ńnyɛte njÿó, éfó mǒ ńzsé ngie ammó gie pege gyǎ lê nÿɔ́g, á la fóo nà mmó gie mé té gyá lê nÿɔ́g wɔ́.
en: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Abe la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á nuŋe wé pwɔ́’ é poŋo mbwo Ssé ńcʉa we Kain. Á la fó pɔ́ mǒ, e Ssé líe yé tà ngie, aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, mbà à la cʉ́’ʉ lényɛ, ńzẅíŋe mmó gie Abe lɔ̌g ńtóo mvfò yé. Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Abe la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, à nyé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pege gɔɔn, tá mbà à léen ńkwé.
en: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Henɔg la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá Ssé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa gʉa tà à tè kwé. Mé fa’a yé mé té gíŋe ńgyá yé wɔ́, á nue á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Ssé ně ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa. Ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie e Ssé la gwaa lɔgɔ yé gʉa, mbà nò yé poŋó yé.
en: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn tè záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, mbà shÿó pá’ ńgwɔ́ nò yé poŋ Ssé té wó wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé á gẅiin lé zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńzẅíŋ ngie e Ssé ee wó, ḿbiŋ ńne ńtsɔ́’ɔ fà’a pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne fa’a yé.
en: But without faithit isimpossible to pleasehim: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, andthathe is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Noah zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, à tè lɔgɔ mmó gie Ssé tʉ̌ njÿó ńnyɛɛ yé, ńdɔg ḿma’a kwàŋ wɔ́. À piŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie mé la nyé tè gyá. Áa yɛ̌ Noah kwóon*máamáa kanú’, lélɔg ńgÿo ngẅɛ̀ ye kúu tsoló ńtẅɛ́, ńdɔg pú’u, ńnyɛ ngie ntsaŋ ee twó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, tá mbà á gʉa ná yé, á fó ná pá’ à zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, e Ssé cʉ́’ ńdíe yé pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá e Ssé tóŋo yé á jú’ ncwò wé, ńgʉa lê tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie e lɔ́ɔn ńge gÿo cʉ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ we, ńdu ssé ńgʉa té zsé jʉ’ gie à gee tà kúu wó.
en: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ à zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé tá á tó ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo yé, ńnéŋe wó pɔ́ pá’ ngʉ̀ la, pâ pʉ̀a pé tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ*mentàb, Esâg lâ pé pʉ̀a lá’ ńtsẅé pɔ́ jʉ’ó á tsɛ̀ɛ*mentàb, Yakwɔ́b lâ pé pʉ̀a lá’ ńtsẅé pɔ́ jʉ’ó á tsɛ̀ɛ*mentàb, pɔ́b yɔ́b gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé la ka’a lé ná wɔɔn ngwòŋ mbwo pɔ́b.
en: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, asina strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

ngiemboon: Ábalam la gÿo pú’u, á nue à la ne ńzẅí’te tÿǒsoŋ gie á gẅiin cÿǒ gie á tʉ́te. E Ssé lê twó yé zɔ̌ ne ńzsé pá’ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ ge gÿo gwɔ́, yé lê twó yé zɔ piŋ ńkwɛ́.
en: for he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and makerisGod.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Sara la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé yé, á tsɛ ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndÿò tɛ’ tá’, e Ssé ké ńgÿo yé gẅie à laa zyé shwoŋ, ńzyé múɔ á nue à la ne ńkwa’a ńzsé ngie e Ssé ka’a mmó mbwo nyìŋ ndà’ ńná.
en: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo Ábalam, tà’ mangʉa njʉ’ wémɔ’ɔ́, gẅie à la cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ńkwé kwě, á gab ngẅɛ̀ tà’ máamáa tsìŋe ndá. Nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie à fóo ná yɛ̌ tsìŋe ndá, á gyɔ́ɔn pá’ mecÿɔ́’ saŋ pie ée tÿǒ lefaŋ mbɔɔ pá’ memvòm mváŋ mie é tue nkʉ̀ŋ ntse té pàa, ńgwɔ́ mé le sáŋ tà ńzsé nzẅìŋ wɔ́.
en: Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead,so manyas the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b metsèm la gwaa kwéte ńne ńzába ntʉ́m wɔ́b pɔ́ nà Ssé, ńké nyé pɔ́ tè gẅiin mmó gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b. Tá pɔ́ la ké ńtyé ńgyá pá’ á nyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, anò poŋo wɔ́b tɛ’, pɔ́ shʉa shʉa ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ megʉ̀, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ legúɔ.
en: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded ofthem, and embracedthem, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńkwa’a ńnyɛɛ ngie pɔ́ nyé tá ńgwá fa’a jʉ’ gie kwà’ lá’a yɔ́b áa wó.
en: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ laa pé’e ńnéŋe ńkwaŋa nò ná lá’ gie pɔ́ la pu’ ssé éfó wó ńgʉa, mbà pɔ́ la tè zág shÿó légÿo tá ḿbiŋe wó wɔ́.
en: And truly, if they had been mindful of thatcountryfrom whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ légÿo pú’u la tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, á nue pɔ́ la cʉ́’ʉ ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tsɔ́ lá’ gie á poŋ ńcʉa yé yɛ̌, á lá’ gie áa tÿǒ lepwó. Áa mmó gie á gÿo e Ssé lɔg pɔ́ lekág ńzẅíŋ ngie mé tóŋo yé lê Ssé yɔb. À la zɔɔn ńnyɛte tà’a tÿǒsoŋ ńne ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te wɔ́b.
en: But now they desire a bettercountry, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á tyé lélɔgɔ Esâg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ mbwo Ssé nuŋe, á nà fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé la lʉŋte yé, ńtyé lélɔgɔ Esâg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ pú’u, á gwɔ́ mbwo ye ńgwɔ́ ndà’ múɔ, ńgwɔ́ mámbàŋa, mbà e Ssé la lá’ ńka’a nò mbwo yé ńtí Esâg.
en: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begottenson,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pá’ e Ssé la gɔɔn nò mbwo Ábalam ngie: «Ɔ̀ ge lá’ cʉa pɔ́ ná Esâg tá gẅiin ngẅɛ̀ gie n da ka’a mbwo gù».
en: of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:

ngiemboon: Tá Ábalam tyé lélɔgɔ yé ńnuŋe pwɔ́’, á nue à la ne ńzsé tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé ngie, e Ssé kǔ’ mbàa lezíme nyìŋ gẅie à kwě. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé piŋe míŋ we mbwo yé, tà á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie múɔ zimé nà legwé la, ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ńnyɛɛ fʉ̀’ʉ nò
en: accounting that Godwasable to raisehimup, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Esâg la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé tá á néŋ mbʉ́lè ná Yakwɔ́b mbɔɔ ná Esaẅi, ńne ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó shwóŋó wɔ́b menò ná pɔ́b, é gwɔ́ mie pɔ́ ge lá’ tá gyá.
en: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Yakwɔ́b la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á gwɔ́ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékwé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná penkʉ́ Yesyɛ̂b wémɔ’ɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, ńne ńtóonte twó yé, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped,leaningupon the top of his staff.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Yesyɛ̂b la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á gwɔ́ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgʉa gʉa, ńkím ngie púɔ Israel ge lá’ fó Egipto kẅɛ, ńgíŋe ńtsẅi pá’ à ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà kwé, mé cʉ́’ ńgÿo nà mekẅǐ mé.
en: By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ tá pà Mǒsê pɔ́ má we la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé, tá pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ńzyé yé, ńdÿoon yé lÿoon ná mesaŋ métá. Pɔ́ la gyá á poŋo ná shÿó tɛ’, pɔ́ zɔɔn tè pɔ́gɔ léfʉa*lepʉ̌ fùɔ wɔ́.
en: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they sawhe wasa proper child; and they were not afraid of the king's commandment.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Mǒsê la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á gwɔ́ tà ńgwɔ́ ndÿò, ńdʉ’ mekù’ nyìŋ gẅie má we aa míŋ fùɔ Faraon.
en: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter;

ngiemboon: À la gyá yé, á gwɔ́ mbòŋ mbwo yé lékúu nùɔ pʉ̀a Ssé pâ pɔ̌ púte ńgyá ngɔ́’, ńtɔ́gɔ yé lé jú’ mboŋó ná mûɔ méfʉ̀’ tá ńké ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mefʉa.
en: choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;

ngiemboon: À la ne ńgyá ngie mé lɔɔn ńgwága yé pá’ mé la gÿo ńgwága*Nzà’nkÿo, mbà le gwɔ́ pú’u, ge gwɔ́ mbwo yé gwɔ́ mbòŋ é cʉa fù’ gie áa Egipto, á nue nÿɔ́g mé la tyé pɔ́ nà ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ gẅie à ge lá’ gẅiin.
en: esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ à la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá fùɔ Egipto tsɛ ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ, á fó wó ńkẅɛ ńgʉa té pɔ́gɔ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gÿo ná ye. Letʉ́m sé e tʉte tʉte, á nue á la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie à ne ńdɔgɔ nÿɔ́g ńgyá Ssé gẅie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ á le yé gyá.
en: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ à la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá á zye nò*Páskà. Á gwɔ́ pá’ à la tsẅi mé lɔg metse*menjʉ̀njÿò, ńzɔ́’ mezí ndá, ńzsé ngie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à tóo ḿbyág ngàŋ mbù Ssé, à tè kíbe púɔ letwó pʉ̀a Israel yɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ pʉ̀a Israel la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé, tá pɔ́ zyɛ́’ɛ máa ntse gẅie mé tóŋ ngie ntse pepàŋ, ńgwɔ zyɛ́’ ńne ńgiŋe ná tsetsá’a njǔm. Epʉ̀a Egipto gyá fʉ̀’ʉ, ntse kaa wɔ́b.
en: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dryland: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ pʉ̀a Israel la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé, pɔ́ kéle tÿǒsoŋ Yériko kéle lyɛ̌’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, tá nká’ gẅie mé la pwóon ńdɔg ńkéle tÿǒsoŋ é keme ḿbʉle ssé.
en: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ Raab ngàŋa gÿɛ́ manzwě la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, tá pâ pàtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé té pú ńdége wɔ́. Mé la tè yé zẅé á nue à la kúe pà mánaŋ pà Israel mboŋó, á nà fʉ̀’ gie mé la túmo wɔ́b.
en: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.

ngiemboon: N ge kíme wɔ́, é nyé wɔ́? N dɔɔn ngie n ge gɔɔn nò ná Gédeon, é gɔɔn ná Barag, é gɔɔn ná Samsoŋ, é gɔɔn ná Jefte, é gɔɔn ná fùɔ Ndavíd, é gɔɔn ná Samîɛ mbɔɔ ná petsɔ́ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, n de gẅiin fʉ̀’ lélɔg ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, andofBarak, andofSamson, andofJephthae;ofDavid also, and Samuel, andofthe prophets:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la fó pɔ́ ná pá’ pɔ́ la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé, ḿma’ ncù ńjÿó túmo túm, ésá’a lá’ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, pɔ́b léen ńzẅí’te mmó gie Ssé la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b tà ńgẅiin, ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò mepú’ ntʉ̀,
en: who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

ngiemboon: ḿbyág mentʉ̀ ntʉ̀ mmɔ̌g, ńtsẅɛ́ nně ncù tá mé té lɔg ńzẅé wɔ́b gwɔ́, ńguɔ ḿbiŋ sẅéte tà ḿboŋ, ńtyé tsẅɛɛ ncù, ńgwɔ́ pàlÿɔ́’ ńgwá, ḿbú ńjwoŋ mencwò ncù mie é fóo melá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ.
en: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, mé gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́ ná pɔ́b wɔ́, pɔ́ té nyé lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé ńzsé ngie mé ge kyɛɛ wɔ́b nyé wɔ́. Á laa mbwo pɔ́b, mvfò gwɔ́ pá’ pɔ́ ge kwé, ńzsé ngie e Ssé ge gÿo zíme wɔ́b,
en: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ ńgʉa ná tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, mé tém shʉ́ ná pɔ́b, ńdɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúa wɔ́b, ńtóo ná tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mé té gÿo pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, ńgíŋ ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ́b lê metsɛ̂n, ḿma’a wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ,
en: and others had trial ofcruelmockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

ngiemboon: ńtóo nà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mé lɔg metóon ńtémte wɔ́b ńzẅé, ńtóo nà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, ńdɔgɔ sɔ̌ shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b ńzá’, ńtóo ná tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, ńdɔg nně ncù ńgwaa wɔ́b. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a cʉ́’ pà tè ndá, ḿma’*mengùb*njʉ̀njÿò lâ*mengùb mvfó, atsɔ́ lága mmó té nyé ńgwɔ́ mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, me nẅɛɛ wɔ́b, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’.
en: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńgwá ḿbúu menkwòŋo tsẅɛ, mbɔɔ ndùm mekwɛ́, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ memvwɔ́’ tóon, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ mvwɔ́’ wɔ́. E laa pʉ̀a, mà wɔb poŋ poŋ, tà njÿó yɔɔn tè ku’u jʉ’ gie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ńnéŋe wó wɔ́.
en: (of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, andinmountains, andindens and caves of the earth.

ngiemboon: Á la fó ná pá’ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ métsèm la záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé, nò yɔ́b poŋ Ssé, tá’ sɔɔn nyìŋ wɔb tè záb lejÿɔ́g nà lepoŋ gẅie Ssé la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

ngiemboon: Pú’u mélà’mie e Ssé la kwaŋa tsɔ́ nò ńzáb, á gwɔ́ ye mbòŋo mbwo pege tɛ’. À la ne ńkwoŋo ngie pega pɔ̌ pú ńgwɔ́ métsèm, tá à gÿo pega pɔ̌ ku’ pʉ̀a pé ndà’ ndà’.
en: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pege, pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ métsèm tÿɔ́’ɔ wégè ńnéŋe soŋ, ńne ńnyɛɛ wégè mánzsè. Pú’u la, pege tsó kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńtáte wégè ńgwá’, té lege menò tepòŋ, é kú’te wégè, ḿbiŋ ńdúe ńcʉ́’ʉ mà. Pege gwá’, ńtɔ́ɔnte yégè ndʉ̌ gẅie e Ssé gɔɔn ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege kÿo. Pege gwɔ́ tà ńne ńkÿo tà pege kʉ́a.
en: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily besetus, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

ngiemboon: Pege ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menÿɔ́g pɔ́ ná Yěsô gẅie à la zí’i wégè lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, yé zɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ ńnéŋe wégè ná mbwó Ssé ndà’ ndà’. À la nyé lekág gẅie à laa we, mé kíme yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ á shÿɔg shÿɔg, à tè lɔg shʉ́ gẅie ée nà lekwě pú’u, ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Aa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe lʉŋe lefùɔ ye Ssé, á nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀.
en: looking unto Jesus the author and finisher ofourfaith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńnéŋe ńkwaŋte pɔ́ Yěsô, megàŋ mefʉa lɔ́ɔn ḿbʉa yé, ńgege yé, á ké shÿɔgɔ shÿɔg. Pi gÿo pú’u, ńzsé ngie ntʉ́m gẅi té pÿɛ́ pi kʉ́a wɔ́.
en: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ́ɔn fó ńnyé pɔ́ tè lɔg pá’ pi ne ńdʉ’ʉ nò tepòŋ, ḿbyɛ́b ncù tà mé pfɛte metse mí.
en: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńcÿɔ́gɔ gú ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn létsyɛte nnɛ́
en: Nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ tsemé mmó ńcúa wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gwie yé Ssé zsě ngie aa míŋ we.
en: And scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńne ńgyá ngɔ́’ pi shÿɔg shÿɔg, á nue Ssé lɔgɔ ńkaga gẅi kag ńtí pá’ pi ee gubé yé, ńgwɔ́ mé gyá múɔ gẅie tá we tè yé kag á nzɔ̌?
en: If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?

ngiemboon: E Ssé lɔɔn tè kaga gẅi pá’ à kaga penkʉ́ pé wɔ́, mbà pi lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ púɔ gÿɛ́, pi tè kwà’ púɔ pé wɔ́.
en: But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.

ngiemboon: Pá’ metá pégè pe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ka ne ńkaga wégè, pege jú’u ncwò wɔ́b la, tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ pá’ pege ge ná nnɛ́ ssé mvfò Tá wege gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, à náa le gwɔ́ wó mbwo pege.
en: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which correctedus, and we gavethemreverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

ngiemboon: Metá pégè pe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kɔ́ɔn ńzɔɔn ńkaga wégè ná yɔb ntí, á ka kě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ná mûɔ méfʉ̀’. Tá ńgʉa nà Ssé, mbà à kaga wégè, ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo pɔ́ kwà’ nò mbòŋo ná pege, légwɔ́ gie pege ge gwɔ́ té*lɔ̌’ pá’ yé.
en: For they verily for a few days chastenedusafter their own pleasure; but he forourprofit, thatwemight be partakers of his holiness.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie á gʉa fʉ̀’ gie mé ne ńkaga nyìŋ, anò té ngàŋ fʉ̀’ó poŋ, anò pÿɔ́gɔ yé pÿɔ́g. Tá tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ gÿo ńgwɔ́, pʉ̀a pie é la fó mǒ ńzí’i mmó, gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfo Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè.
en: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi siŋ mbwó mí mie é kʉ̌a, ésiŋ mekẅi’té mí mie é ne ńzóŋe.
en: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;

ngiemboon: Pi giŋe ná mánzsè gẅie à tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, légwɔ́ gie lejÿɔgɔ́ kwò nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńnyí’i té mege pwɔ́’ɔ wɔ́, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, ésẅéte sẅeté.
en: and make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’ pá’ pia mânyìŋ ntsèm ge ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè. Pi fa’ mbɔɔ pá’ pi ge gÿo mmó gie Ssé tè gyá*lɔ̌’ mǒ wɔ́. Á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ge gyá*lɔ̌’ mǒ, ngaŋ lelá’ ńgyá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Follow peace with allmen, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ tém nzèm Ssé gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ lékwoŋo wégè ńcÿó gʉm yégè, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ gẅi lésele, tà ngÿǒ menò mé cʉ́’ lelaŋ tepòŋ, mbà à ge nɔ́g petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè gí, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gÿo pá’ ye.
en: looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up troubleyou, and thereby many be defiled;

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅi pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ yé nuŋe nuŋe, ḿbɔ́ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nyé té néŋ mekù’ ná shúm sie ée se Ssé, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Esaẅi gẅie à la sẅiŋe nò mûɔ ndÿò gẅie à laa wɛ̌, mé lɔgɔ tà’a káŋa mmó léjÿó ńjú.
en: lest therebeany fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńne ńzsé ngie afʉ̀’ gie tá we lɔ̌ɔn ńge ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná yé la gÿo ńku’, tá we cʉ́’ ḿbe’e yé pe’e. Á lɔgɔ lélʉa, éfa’ shÿó pá’ tá we ge kúbe nkwaŋá wé, á tè mǒ ku’.
en: For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà gi ntí lelɔg sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, mbà e tè pá’ ye pà Israel á ngʉ̀ŋe lekwɔ’ɔ́ Sinay gie e gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́. Pɔ́ la gyá mmɔ̌g mǒ pá’ é kÿo, ńgyá e jʉ’ síŋ, nzěm gwe, ńjú’ afóm cʉ’,
en: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,

ngiemboon: ńjú’ mé tóŋ ntàŋ, ńjú’ tsɔ̌ máamáa ngyè ne ńgɔɔn nò, ńzẅɛ tà pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ńjú’u, té gíŋe ńkwoŋ ngie e gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò né pɔ́b wɔ́,
en: and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; whichvoicethey that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:

ngiemboon: á nue pɔ́ la jú’ mé záb ngie: Nyìŋ mesoŋ kà pɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn wɔ́ lɔɔn ńkíbe lekwɔ’ɔ́ ŋwɛ́ mé lɔg metóon ńtémte yé ńzẅé, pɔ́ jú’ á gege wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: (for they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:

ngiemboon: Àammó gie mé la ne ńgyá, á vege pʉ̀a vege, tà Mǒsê gɔɔn ngie à pǔ ńcÿɔ’ cÿɔ’ tà ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿvɛɛ vɛ.
en: and so terrible was the sight,thatMoses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi ka sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtóo lekwɔ’ɔ́ Sioŋ, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo ye Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, á Yerósalem gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, á jʉ’ gie*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tè sǎŋ ńzsé nzẅìŋ cú’te wó tsɛ̀ɛ lekág.
en: but ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

ngiemboon: Pi ka sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a pie Ssé la lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo púɔ pé pie ée twó mvfò, pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekág, mezíŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ me ŋwe’e á tÿǒ lepwó. Pi ka sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtó nê kwà’ lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ée ndà’ yé, ńgwɔ́ ŋàg pʉ̀a mesoŋ métsèm. Pi ka tǒ nê jʉ’ gie mezẅìge pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie pɔ́ ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé ée wó. Pɔ́ ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé pɔ́ ndà’ ndà’.
en: to the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

ngiemboon: Pi ka sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtó nê lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô gẅie à la pfɛte metse mé lélɔg sɔgɔ*lɔ̌’ ná pege, aa mamekěm nà*kʉ̀a gie áa ye sẅé, metse mé gẅiin nò gie é gɔɔn mbwo pege, á cʉ́e ńcʉa nò gie metse Abe gɔɔn.
en: and to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things thanthat ofAbel.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi pɔ́ɔn le lʉ’ʉ lézẅí’te nò gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pi, á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé la néŋ ntsaŋ twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u nò gie Mǒsê laa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńne ńkága tuŋó yɔ́b mǒ, mbà pege lɔɔn ńtém nzèm Ssé gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, ńne shwóŋó wégè nò, mbà á ge gǎ tá pege e le kú pɔ́ ngɔ́’ gie e tɔ́g yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much moreshall notweescape, if we turn away from him thatspeakethfrom heaven:

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie à la lá’ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgɔɔn nò, ngyè ye gÿo tsetsá’ cʉ’ʉ la, aa nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mbà à ka ka’a mbwo pege ngie: Á ge lá’ gíŋ gwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, á le gÿo tsetsá’ ndà’ zɔ̌ cʉ’ʉ wɔ́, à gÿo mbɔɔ tÿǒ lepwó cʉ’ʉ.
en: whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ge lá’a tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ mé pe’e shúm sie à lɔɔn ńnʉ’te é zóŋe, ńnáa nzèm é mag, á nue ée shúm sie mé la nyɛte nyɛte, é gÿo pú’u, é zsé ngie shúm sie mé nʉ’te é té zóŋe, zɔ̌ ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ wó.
en: And thisword, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pege ge lá’ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ sie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó le nʉ’te é zóŋe wɔ́ la, pege síe Ssé, éfa’a mbwo yé nà ntí gie à ne ńkwoŋo, ńná nnɛ́ ssé, ḿbɔ́gɔ yé.
en: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé yege, ée mmɔ̌g gẅie é tuɔ shúm ntsèm sie ée mbwo yé ńgwɔ́ se tepòŋ.
en: for our Godisa consuming fire.

ngiemboon: Pi kẅi’i ńgẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pʉ̀a Kristo gÿo pú’u, tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: Let brotherly love continue.

ngiemboon: Tà pi lege lékúe megʉ̀ pie é tǒ mbʉ̀a pi, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a la lá’ ńkúe megʉ̀ kǔe, tà ńdá’a lyɛ̌’ ńkúe*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé té zsé.
en: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ndá tsǎŋ tà à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pia pɔ̌ zɔ puté ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ la, ńkímte mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie mé ne ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ngɔ́’ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé nyɛɛ pɔ́ gẅi ngɔ́’ la.
en: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them;andthem which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie lɔ́ɔndá gwɔ́ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ mmó mekù’, mámbàŋa zsé ndà’ nzwě we, manzwě zsé ndà’ ndúm we, e Ssé ge zɔɔn lá’ ŋag pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe, mbɔɔ pàgÿo gÿɛ́.
en: Marriageishonourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwoŋ nkáb kwoŋ tà é cʉ́’ʉ sá’a gẅi sá’, pi kág kág nà kɔ́ wɔ́ gie pi gẅiin, á nue e Ssé la gɔɔn né nyìŋ mesoŋ ngie: «N te lá’ gwá’a gú wɔ́, é ké le nyé té ne ńdíe gú wɔ́.»
en: Let yourconversationbewithout covetousness;and becontent with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ ku’u légÿo kɔ́ ná mèŋ?
en: What man shall do unto me.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la vɔgɔ létsyeen gẅi ná mánzsè Ssé, é pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la shwóŋó gẅi nò Ssé, ńkímte ntí gie pɔ́ la lɔg ńnéŋe tà ńdá’ ńkwé, pi pí fʉ̀’ nà yɔb ntí lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end oftheirconversation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô Kristo à laa kúbe, à kaa kúbe, à tě ńdá’a lyɛ̌’ ńkúbe wɔ́.
en: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.
