ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ mé zí’i gẅi menò ntí ntí mie é té tsẅé’e nà nò gie pege zába ntʉ́m mǒ wɔ́, e gÿo pi fʉa mánzsè. Á poŋ ngie atsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe Ssé zɔ néŋ ntʉ́m nyìŋ tà mbʉ̌ mie mé zába, é gɔɔn nò ná shúm léjÿó zɔ̌ le néŋ. Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kú’te mɛ̌ mbʉ̌ pɔ́ laa jÿó tsɔ́ pì mǒ wɔ́.
en: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. Forit isa good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.

ngiemboon: Pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pe pà Yuda, pɔ́ nuŋe pwɔ́’ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, ńzẅɛ́’ ḿpfɛ́ɛ pfwɔ́’ɔ mbab gie mé lɔ̌g nuŋe pwɔ́’, á ké ńgʉa ná pwɔ́’ gẅie Yěsô la nuŋe ńtí wégè, pɔ́ té mmó mǒ zẅɛ́’.
en: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ pwɔ́’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ we*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò we pà Yuda. À lɔg metse menɔ̀ɔn pie mé zẅeté, ńgʉa ná kwà’ jʉ’e Ssé, á lélɔg ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, á cʉ́’ʉ pfó menɔ̀ɔn, mé lɔg fó jʉ’ gie mé tsẅé wó, ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa nzème pǐ ńtuɔ.
en: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, mbɔɔ Yěsô yé gwɔ́ lɔg metse mé é gÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ cʉ́’ pʉ̀a Ssé, á kwé pɔ́ nzème pǐ, tà à tè kwé tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́. Áa jʉ’ gie à la gyá ngɔ́’ wó.
en: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege fó yégè á jʉ’ gie mé tsẅé wó, ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ yé, ńne ńzẅíŋe ngie mé zoonte wégè pá’ yé.
en: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

ngiemboon: Á nue à tÿǒsoŋ yégè ye ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ jʉ’ɔɔn á té gie á ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó wɔ́, tá peg ké ńně fa’a gie á ge gÿo tá tó.
en: For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

ngiemboon: Pege cʉa nzèm Yěsô, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, pege lɔgɔ légu’te Ssé, ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’, é lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pwɔ́’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ náa mekù’ ná lezíŋ sé.
en: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit ofourlips giving thanks to his name.

ngiemboon: Tà pi lege légÿo nò mbòŋo mbɔɔ lélɔgɔ mmó gie pi gẅiin ńkẅéte pʉ̀a, á nue legÿo mɛ̌ menò áa lii pwɔ́’ gie á poŋ Ssé.
en: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tsyeen gẅí. Pi ná nnɛ́ ssé mvfò pɔ́b, á nue pɔ́ ne ńdíe gẅi ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńne ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge lá’ tyé mvfò Ssé píte ntí gie pɔ́ la lɔg fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Pú’u la, pi gÿo nà ntí gie pɔ́ ge fa’a fà’ yɔ́b nê lekág, tà pɔ́ le ne ńga’te ga’te wɔ́, á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, pi le zẅɛ́’.
en: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for thatisunprofitable for you.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ńne sẅíŋte Ssé sẅíŋte nà twó ség. Peg kwa’ ńne ńjú’u ngie mbùm yeg tè ne ńcúa wég nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, á nue peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ gie kɔ́ zɔ̌ lɔɔn ńtyé ssé wɔ́, peg gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.

ngiemboon: M bǔ ńcwoŋo ńdúɔ mbwo pi ngie pi nyɛte sẅíŋte Ssé, à zẅíŋ m biŋ nzèm ńtó ńtsɛ́ɛ gẅí.
en: But I beseechyouthe rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie e mbʉ́lè fóo mbwo ye, à la gÿo Yěsô Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege fó lá’ mepfó ńkwɔ́’. Yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege la lɔg pá’ à pfɛté metse mé, e Ssé lɔg ńgwaa*kʉ̀a gie á té ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́, ńcʉ́’ʉ mbyɛ̀b mvfó we lÿò, pá’ à ge pyɛ́bɛ*njʉ̀njÿò yé.
en: Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie e Ssé mbʉ́lè ŋwɛ́, à gÿo pi ku’u légÿo nò mbòŋo légwɔ́ gie pi ge gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie à ne ńkwoŋo. Á poŋ ngie yé Ssé fó ná Yěsô Kristo, ńgÿo ammó gie á poŋo yé, à gwɔ́ ná pege. Legú’ à gwɔ́ mbwo Yěsô Kristo á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn!*Amen.
en: make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whombeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe mbàŋa mbɔɔ pe pànzwě, mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte gẅi ngie pi lɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́, ńzẅí’te yɔɔn shwóŋè gie mèŋ n nǎ mbwo pi, ńdɔg ńkẅiŋte gẅí. N zɔ̌ɔn ńké kaa ŋwe’e á sag wɔ́.
en: And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mé kě ńnyé pwó ná fɛ́ wege Timoté. À lɔɔn ńtɔ́g ńtó, mbà mèŋ n ge gwɔ tó gyá gẅi peg yé gwɔ́.
en: Know ye thatourbrother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te pàtsyeen gẅi té vʉ’ʉ tsɔ̌, ńtsyɛ’te mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm. Epʉ̀a pe Italia é gɔ̌ɔn ngie mèŋ n tsyɛ’te gẅí.
en: Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: Written to the Hebrews from Italy by Timothy.

ngiemboon: Àa mèŋ Jâg, mèŋ fa’a fà’ Ssé, mbɔɔ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo. Mèŋ n náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mbwo pi púɔ Ssé pie ée nà mengẅɛ̀ ndá pà Israel ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, mbà pɔ́ léen sa jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ. Mèŋ n tsyɛ’té gẅí.
en: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí lɔɔn ńne ńkúu gẅí, pi lɔg pɔ́ kwà’ lekág ńkẅé.
en: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

ngiemboon: !Pi gÿo pú’u, nue pi ne ńzsé ngie, pi lɔɔn shÿɔg ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ne ńkúu gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńne ńkẅi’i ńzába ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé, mbà pi ge ne tʉte tʉte.
en: knowingthis, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á poŋ ngie letʉte ŋwɛ́ à fa’a yé fà’ tà ńcʉ́me, ńzsé ngie pi ge cʉ́’ melÿò, é ku’ pʉ̀a Ssé, atsɔ́ mmó le zága ná pi wɔ́.
en: But let patience haveherperfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńtyé nà nò, azse nò zága yé, á lúɔ mbwo Ssé, mbà Ssé ge ná. Á nue e Ssé zɔɔn ńdɔg pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńnáa mmó mbwo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ té zẅɛ́te.
en: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to allmenliberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

ngiemboon: Tá ngàŋ ké ńcʉ́’ʉ lélúɔ, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé té ne ḿmʉ́’te, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à mʉ’té, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ kanú’ gie á tyé ndùm ntse, fefa ne ńdɔgɔ ḿbʉʉ, ńdɔgɔ ńcwóŋo la.
en: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

ngiemboon: Tà ntí nyìŋ pú’u, kwaŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge náa tsɔ́ lága mmó né yé,
en: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

ngiemboon: mélà’ mie nyìŋ pú’u, tè gɔɔn tsɔ́ nò tà ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ wɔ́. À kwaŋa lépʉ, ńgíŋ ńkwaŋa lécwóŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó.
en: A double minded manisunstable in all his ways.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie fɛ́ wege gẅie aa fÿɔg kág, á nue e Ssé ŋǎ’ nzẅìŋ wé.
en: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

ngiemboon: À gẅie aa ngàŋa mmó kág yé á nue e Ssé kéen sẅí’i nzẅìŋ wé, tà á zsé ngie à ge lá’ mag yé pɔ́ pá’ tootǒ maga nà legǐ la.
en: but the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

ngiemboon: Nèm tʉ̌a tɛ’ ńtuɔ legǐ á pÿɛ́, tootǒ gwe, à we lepoŋ lɔgɔ ḿmaga, áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ ngàŋa mmó ge gÿo gwá’ mefà’ mé é kwé.
en: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo, aa nyìŋ gẅie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ kúu yé á tʉte tʉte, á nue pá’ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ lʉŋté yé á tʉte tʉte lá, e Ssé ge tɔ’ ngú’ twó yé. E lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ le gwɔ́ tèmì gẅie à la ka’a mbwo wɔ̌ɔwɔ́ɔ gẅie à kwoŋo yé Ssé.
en: Blessedisthe man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

ngiemboon: Nkwà’te lɔɔn ńké ńtóo ná ngàŋ, tà á gɔɔn ngie nkwà’te yɔɔn fóo mbwo Ssé, á nue à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé le gẅiin kwàŋte légÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́, kwà’ yé ké le tsóte nyìŋ ngie à gÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

ngiemboon: Ye ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm zɔ shwoŋte yé, á gwe ná lejÿɔ̀’.
en: but every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

ngiemboon: Letsɔ̌ɔn shúm ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ tà ńgá’, ńkẅɛɛ nò tepòŋ, anò tepòŋ gá’ ńkẅɛɛ legwé.
en: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, tà nkwaŋá gẅi fʉte gẅí.
en: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

ngiemboon: Afù’ gie á poŋ tɛ’, mbɔɔ ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ we mbòŋo pú fóo pɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó, á mbwo Ssé gẅie à la nyɛte nèm lâ mecÿɔ́’ saŋ á lefaŋ. À tè kúbe, ńké tè nzěm gẅiin.
en: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la kwoŋ, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋe gie áa nénʉ́, ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́, légwɔ́ gie pege ge gwɔ́ mbwo yé, é gwɔ́ ntwó mmó ná ngwòŋ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la gÿo.
en: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pi zsé ngie áa mbòŋ mbwo nyìŋ lézsé lézẅí’te nò gie mé gɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn yé nò á ku’ ku’, é ké le lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́,
en: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgyáŋa lóŋ, mbà à tě ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: for the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi gwá’ menò ncÿǒ ntsèm, ńgwá’a mà gẅie à fóo nà lecÿɔ́g cÿɔ́g. Pi nuŋe ssé mvfò Ssé, ńzẅíŋe shwóŋè gie á ka pye tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi. Á nue à ku’u légÿo pi tsẅɛ́.
en: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ́ pàjú’u shwóŋè Ssé jú’ ndà’, pi gÿo mmó gie shwóŋè ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn ngie pi gÿo. Tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà pi sele fʉte mennɛ́ mí.
en: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńké tè gÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à líe shÿó wé tsɛ̀ɛ gyà shÿó, ńgyá pá’ à gwɔ̌.
en: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

ngiemboon: À lǐe tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, tà fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ḿbú ńdege pá’ à gwɔ̌.
en: for he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à nyɛte ńtuu nò á ná*lepʉ̌ sie tsɔ́ mmó té mǒ zág, ésie é gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ ndù nnɛ́, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé mǒ té kʉ́a tà à tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ jù’u ńdege wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ jù’u ńgÿo, mbà à ge gwɔ́ shÿó mbòŋo ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à gÿo.
en: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueththerein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńkwaŋa ngie aa nà nò Ssé, ncwò wé piŋ tè poŋ, mbà à fʉte twó mbùm yé. À we légwɔ́ ná nò Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man's religionisvain.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé líe yé á gwɔ́ kwà’ ná nò yé Ssé, tà mmó té ná yé zág, aa nyìŋ gẅie à líe púɔ métsé mbɔɔ mepfɔ̌g tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ yɔb, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pɔ́ɔn mbùm ye, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lécʉŋte yé.
en: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction,andto keep himself unspotted from the world.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn tà pi ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo wege gẅie à gẅiin máamáa legú’, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin tyɛ̀’te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ,the Lordof glory, with respect of persons.

ngiemboon: Pege gɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kǔ tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè gí, tà’ nyìŋ jÿɔ́gɔ kwáŋ gẅie à cÿɔ́g nkáb, ḿma’ menzsǒ nkáb. Wetsɔ̌ ma’ yé pɔ́ metsyàg nzsǒ.
en: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;

ngiemboon: Pi tÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g ná nyìŋ gẅie à ma’ menzsǒ nkáb, nyìŋ gẅi gɔɔn né ye ngie à jʉ’ʉ melÿò yɔɔn, mbà! Tóo ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn nê fÿɔg ngie gyá jʉ’ ńtyé wó, ńké tè pú’u wɔ́ ɔ̀ tó ńtém ntsẅɛ̀’ jù ssé, á ngʉ̀ŋe mmó gie n tÿɔ́g mekwò mɔ́ɔn mǒ lɔɔn.
en: and ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, pi lě ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin tyɛ̀’te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́? Pi lě ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ nkwaŋá tepòŋ ńdíe pʉ̀a éfa’a pì wɔ́?
en: are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pe ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pi jú’ mboŋó, e Ssé la tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a pie mé tóŋo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lê mefÿɔg, ńdɔg ńgÿo pàzáb ntʉ́m ná yé tɛ’, pɔ́ gẅiin yɔ́b jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ sie à la ka’a mbwo pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋo yé.
en: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi kéen ńcʉŋ nzẅìŋ mefÿɔg. Tá megàŋa mmó zɔ̌ téen sẅɛ́ɛ gẅi wɔ́ le? Pɔ́ zɔ̌ téen ńgwá ńdɔgɔ gẅi ńgiŋe mendá tsǎŋ wɔ́ le?
en: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔ̌ téen shwóŋó tepòŋ ná Yěsô Kristo gẅie Ssé la ná lezíŋ sé né pi wɔ́ le?
en: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ gie pi gÿo pú’u, mbà pi giŋé ná pá’*lepʉ̌ se lÿò ná nò*lefùɔ Ssé gɔɔn, é gɔɔn ngie: «Kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú». Pi lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgÿo mboŋó.
en: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

ngiemboon: Tá pi ké ńgẅiin tyɛ̀’te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà pi gÿǒ nò tepòŋ.*Lepʉ̌ Ssé gwoon gẅi mélà’ mie pi fʉ̌a*lepʉ̌.
en: but if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkú’te mbʉ̌ Ssé, ńgʉa mǒ fʉa pɔ́ ndà’ tà’, mbà à pǔ fʉa pɔ́ mbʉ̌ ntsèm.
en: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in onepoint, he is guilty of all.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, nue e Ssé gẅie à la gɔɔn ngie: «Tè gÿo gÿɛ́», à la gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tè zẅé nyìŋ». Tá ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ lɔɔn tè gÿɛ́ gÿo, ḿbiŋ ńzẅé nyìŋ, mbà ɔ̀ fʉ̌a*lepʉ̌ sé fʉa.
en: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

ngiemboon: Pi gwaa ne gɔɔn nò, ńne ńgÿo pá’ pʉ̀a pie mé ge lá’ lɔg*lepʉ̌ sie é gÿo mé cʉ́’ʉ pà ndù nnɛ́ e lɔg ŋaga wɔ́b.
en: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ ne tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ, á le tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe tè tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a wɔ́, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, mbà á ge lá’ lɔg pú’u, e Ssé le yé ŋag.
en: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ lɔɔn ngie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, à tè fa’ méfà’ ńdɔg ńnyɛ wɔ́, mbà á ge kẅéte nà kɔ́? Tà ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé é gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́?
en: Whatdoth itprofit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?

ngiemboon: Pege gɔɔn ngie tsɔ́ fɛ́ wege we mbàŋa mbɔɔ we manzwě, pɔ́ té nzsǒ ma’, ḿbiŋ ńne ńzága mmó gie pɔ́ ge pfɛ́ɛ nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’,
en: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ná pi piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lo nê kwò gí ye mbòŋo. Mbùm gí lumte. Pi pfɛ́ ńzẅɛ́, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńké tê náa tsɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte wɔ́b gwɔ́, mbà wɛ̌ légɔɔn ge kẅéte nà kɔ́?
en: and one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, beyewarmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; whatdoth itprofit?

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, ná nyìŋ gẅie à ne ngie à záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, pá’ mé lɔɔn tè ne ńgyá mefà’ mé wɔ́, mbà wɛ̌ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé aa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gɔɔn ngie: Aye tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lézáb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, aye wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ pɔ́ léfa’ mefà’. Mbà mèŋ n ge gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn mbwo yé ngie: Nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé té ne fa’a mefà’, mèŋ n dɔg mefà’ mɔ́ɔn ńnyɛɛ gú ngie n záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńzẅíŋe ngie e Ssé, ee yémɔ’ɔ́, oon áa mbòŋ,*messé tepòŋ gíŋe ńne ńzẅíŋe yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u, tá ḿbiŋe ńne ḿvɛɛ.
en: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

ngiemboon: Agʉ̀gʉ̀ yɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ kwoŋo kɔ́? Mèŋ n ge nyɛɛ gú ngie lezǎb ntʉ́m nà Ssé gẅie à tè mefà’ gẅiin áa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa gɔɔn ngie tá wege Ábalam aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, né ngie á cʉa pɔ́ nà mefà’ mé? Á la tè cʉa pɔ́ ná pá’ à lɔgɔ́ míŋ we Esâg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’ á jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó wɔ́ le?
en: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie we lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé pâ mefà’ mé la púte ńgiŋe kwò. Á la fó nà mefà’ mé we lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé gwɔ́ wó tà ńku’.
en: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

ngiemboon: Anò gie mé la ŋwe’e ńtí yé fó pú’u, ḿbumte, mé la ŋwe’e ngie: Ábalam la záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé, e Ssé fó mǒ, ńcʉ́’ ńdíe yé á gwɔ́ mvfò ye, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, á tóŋo yé lê shǔ we.
en: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie á cʉa pɔ́ nà mefà’ mie nyìŋ ne fa’a, tá Ssé gɔɔn ngie ngàŋ aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, tà é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pá’ ngàŋ zǎb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé wɔ.
en: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

ngiemboon: Á la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná Raab, káa tÿó manzwě, e Ssé la gwɔ gɔɔn ngie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé, ńcʉa pɔ́ nà mefà’ mé. Pá’ à la náa jʉ’ʉ lelyěen mbwo pʉ̀a Israel pie mé la túm, ḿbiŋ ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b nzsè gie pɔ́ ge pfó mǒ é gʉa.
en: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sentthemout another way?

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Zẅìge lɔɔn tè ná mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́, mbà e kwě la, lezǎb ntʉ́n nà Ssé, á lezáb gẅie mé té ne ńgyá mefà’ wɔ́, mbà wɛ̌ aa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, tà pi metsèm tsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ pàzí’i pʉ̀a mmó, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie, peg pie peg zí’i pʉ̀a mmó, ntí gie mé ge lá’ lɔg ŋaga wég, e ge lá’ tʉ cʉa ye petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

ngiemboon: Pege pǔ fʉate menò ntí ntí pɔ́ tè vʉ’ʉ nyìŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à laa tóo ńgɔɔn nò é fʉa wɔ́, mbà aa nyìŋ té*lɔ̌’, ńku’u légwoonte mbùm ye ntsèm.
en: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the sameisa perfect man,andable also to bridle the whole body.

ngiemboon: Pi líe melÿóon tá ńgyá, pege ńnéŋe kwáŋ ncwò pɔ́b lélɔg ńgÿo ngie pɔ́ jú’ ncwò wégè. Pege lêen ńké ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa jʉ’ gie pege ne ńkwoŋo.
en: Behold, we put bits in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

ngiemboon: Pi líe mbɔɔ setíma tá ńgyá, á fáŋ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, fefa gẅie à tsó yé tʉ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà stiya gie nyìŋ gẅie à ne shwoŋo lɔgɔ shwoŋo yé ńnáa ná jʉ’ gie à ne ńkwoŋo gwɔ̌ pɔ́ múɔ méntsẅilé.
en: Behold also the ships, which thoughthey beso great, andaredriven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ńne ńzsé pá’ múɔ mésesà’ mmɔ̌g lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á tuɔ máamáa mbím.
en: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

ngiemboon: Alʉ́m gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yé pɔ́ mmɔ̌g, ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ gie menò tepòŋ fó wó. Alʉ́m áa nà mekèm mbùm nyìŋ, ńgwɔ́ kèm gie á néŋ ncÿǒ nà mbùm nnɛ́ ntsèm. Á gʉa lepÿé mmɔ̌g, ḿbí mmɔ̌g, ńtó ńdɔg ńtuɔ léneŋe we nyìŋ pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: And the tongueisa fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ ku’u lékúe menɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ mentí mentí, ńku’u lékúe meshʉ́ŋ, ńku’u lékúe menɔ̀ɔn mie é shwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b pɔ́ ssé, lékúe messó.
en: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa nà lʉ́m, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè ku’u lékúe wɔ́. Á tág jʉ’ té zẅite. Á gẅiin sesiŋ gie á kúu ná nyìŋ ńzẅé yé zẅé.
en: but the tongue can no man tame;it isan unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔg pɔ́ lʉ́m ńdɔg ńgu’te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Tá wege, ńgíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌ ńnéŋ ndòon twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie Ssé la pwóon ńgÿo pɔ́ sẅé yé.
en: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

ngiemboon: Mbʉ́lè mbɔɔ ndòon pǔ ńkẅɛɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tà’ ncwò wémɔ’ɔ́. Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á kɔ’ɔ́ tè poŋ ngie à gwɔ́ pú’u wɔ́.
en: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lesa’á ntse le ne fóo nà jʉ’ ńnáa ntse nǔ, ńgíŋe fó pɔ́ jʉ’ó ńnáa ntse gẅie é ne ńdẅe wɔ́.
en: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweetwaterand bitter?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé kába zoon ná tÿǒ mbÿě? Ńké ńkáb lepfò ná tÿǒ zoon? Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ lesa’á ntse gẅie é ne ńnáa ntse gẅie é gẅiin ngwáŋ, ńgwɔ́ é le ná ntse nnǔ wɔ́.
en: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? socanno fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie à gẅiin zse nò, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin legyè, á lɔgɔ tsẅé mbòŋo yé ńnyɛ, ńgíŋ ńdɔg mefà’ mie é nyɛɛ ngie aa nyìŋ mbʉ́le pʉlé ńgwɔ́ nzsè nò, ńnyɛ.
en: Whoisa wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńgẅiin kègɔ́’ gẅie à léen ńgá’ mbɔɔ lʉŋte nnɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi, tà pi gíŋ ńŋá’te ngie pi ee pàzsé nò, tà pi lɔg cÿɔ̌ nò, ḿbyága nò nénʉ́.
en: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí zse nò tě fóo tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ yɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ, éfóo mbwo*messé tepòŋ.
en: This wisdom descendeth not from above, butisearthly, sensual, devilish.

ngiemboon: Alʉŋte nnɛ́ mbɔɔ kègɔ́’ vɔg tà ńgwɔ́ jʉ’, atág mbɔɔ mefà’ tepòŋ mentí mentí gwɔ́ wó.
en: For where envying and strifeis, thereisconfusion and every evil work.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin zse nò gie á fóo tÿǒ lepwó, à zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ té nà ngÿǒ menò mé wɔ́, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgiŋe pɔ́ lê mbʉ́lè, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mbʉ́le pʉlé, ńgÿo nò á ku’ ku’, ńzsé létsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe tɛ’, éfa’ mefà’ mbòŋo pɔ́ pú’u. À tè tyɛ̀’te gÿo, ńké tè nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g wɔ́.
en: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle,andeasy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ lɔgɔ pɔ́ mbʉ́lè ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, pɔ́ ne ḿbye mmó lê mbʉ́lè. Mentɔ̌ɔn mie pɔ́ káb á gwɔ́ léńnéŋe pá’ Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

ngiemboon: Mencwò mencwò aa pé’e fóo nzɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi? Melà’ fóo nzɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi? Né ngie é fóo ná gi ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm gie ee tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅi ńtsóte gẅí.
en: From whencecomewars and fightings among you?come theynot hence,evenof your lusts that war in your members?

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn shúm tɛ’ tá’ ńké tè ku’u légẅiin wɔ́, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́’ ńtyé pɔ́ lézẅé nyìŋ. Pi gyá mmó ńtÿɔ́g ntʉ́m gẅi mǒ, tá tsɔ́ légẅiin à tè wó wɔ́. Pi gebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ ńgwɔ́ mencwò mencwò, ńtág melà’. Pi tě ńgẅiin mmó gie pi ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́, á nue pi tè lúɔ mbwo Ssé wɔ́.
en: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

ngiemboon: !Pi zɔɔn ńdúɔ, e Ssé tè ná, mbà áa, mélà’mie pi tè zsé lélúɔ wɔ́. Pi zɔ̌ɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ lélɔg ńgʉa ńgÿo mmó gie á ne ḿboŋo pɔ́ gẅí.
en: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consumeitupon your lusts.

ngiemboon: Pii pàlaŋ nzèm pʉ́a. Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ gẅie aa shǔ shúm njÿó, cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋ mbù Ssé wɔ́ ka? Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋ shúm njÿó cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋ mbù Ssé.
en: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ ngie ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: E Ssé pǔ tè zẅíŋ ngie pege nyé tsɔ̌ nyìŋ á jÿó jʉ’ Zẅìge gie à la ńnéŋe ná pege wɔpé’e, ḿmeen, meen ńgɔɔn keen?
en: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

ngiemboon: Tá, e Ssé kě ńne ńcÿó gʉm yégè, apòŋo ntʉ́m yé nzèm pege fáŋ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé lʉ’ pàŋá’te nnɛ́ lʉ’, ńké ńdɔgɔ pòŋo ntʉ́m ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é sẅí’i mbùm yɔb ńnáa ssé.
en: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi ne ńnuŋe ssé mvfò Ssé, ńne ńdʉ’ʉ Sátà, à fó lejʉ́ŋ pi ńkÿo.
en: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, à sẅɛ’te yé nnɛ́ nê lejʉ́ŋ pi. Pi megàŋ mefʉa, pi sɔg mbwó mí, pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pi kẅile ncÿǒ tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m mí.
en: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanseyourhands,yesinners; and purifyyourhearts,yedouble minded.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie pi ee megàŋ ngɔ́’, ńdúŋ legwé ńdʉa. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie gẅi légẅe sele ńcʉ́’ʉ lélʉa, agẅi lekág sele ńcʉ́’ʉ lémÿɔg.
en: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, andyourjoy to heaviness.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅí’i mbùm gí ńnáa ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à pʉ’ʉ gẅí.
en: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, tà zẅɛ́te gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅɛ́te ná fɛ́ we, kà ńtú pɔ́*lɔ̌’ yé wɔ́, mbà à zẅɛ́te pɔ́ nà*lepʉ̌, ḿbiŋe ńtúu pɔ́*lɔ̌’lepʉ̌. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńtúu lɔ̌’ɔ lepʉ̌, mbà à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kú’te lepʉ̌ wɔ́, à cʉ’ʉ́ ńtúu lɔ̌’ɔ lepʉ̌ tú.
en: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil ofhisbrother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíle yé zɔ zába*lepʉ̌, ḿbiŋe ńzá’a ntsaŋ pʉ̀a, yé gíle yé zɔ ku’u légÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ kà légÿo á kwé wɔ́. Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie ɔ́ɔ wɔ̌ tà ńtúu*lɔ̌’ fɛ́ gù?
en: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te ńjú’. Pi pie pi ne ńka’a ngie: «Peg ge lɔg lyɛ̌’ɔɔn kà jǔɔ wɔ́, é gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ye kikyè, é ńnéŋe wó tà’ ngù’ é táŋ sɔ̌ɔn é gẅiin nkáb».
en: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

ngiemboon: Pi tè zsé pá’ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ jǔɔ ge gwɔ́ pú’u, mbwo pi wɔ́, !pi zsé ngie pi ee pá’ zẅɛ̌ lekʉŋ gie á kẅɛ, ńtóo léńnéŋe é syeen.
en: whereas ye know not whatshall beon the morrow. For whatisyour life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

ngiemboon: Pi ke’e gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà peg ge gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, é gÿo yɔɔn, é gÿo gi.
en: For that yeoughtto say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

ngiemboon: Tá pi tsẅiŋ pɔ́ kékʉ́b gẅi, ńgɔɔnte pɔ́ menò mie pi ge gÿo gÿo. Yɛ̌ ntí leŋá’te e tè poŋ.
en: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ gẅie à zsé légÿo nò gie áa mbòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké tè gÿo, à lɔgɔ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doethitnot, to him it is sin.

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te ńjú’, pi megàŋa mmó, pi lʉa tà ngyè gi kwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ ńtí ngɔ́’ gie e ne ńtóo ná pi.
en: Go to now,yerich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come uponyou.

ngiemboon: Shúm sí sie é cÿɔ́g nkáb lʉ̌, shÿɔ́’ ngwɔ̌’ jÿǒ menzsǒ mí.
en: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

ngiemboon: Avɛkɔ́ɔn gwǒon tʉ ngɔ̂l gí mbɔɔ nkáb gi. Mé ge gÿo fó pɔ́ mǒ é gyá ngie pi gwě ntsaŋ, mbab nnɛ́ gi mag pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé tǔɔ gẅi mmɔ̌g la. Pi ka cú’te shúm sie é cÿɔ́g nkáb ná mɔɔn melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mie ée menzsònzèm.
en: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa fà’ ka lag shúm sí nká’, pi jÿó nkáb yɔb. Pi jú’ pá’ pɔ́ lʉa. Ngyè pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ laga shúm sí ńnáa ndá e kwɔ̌’ tà ńkúu letuŋó Ssé, yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à sá’a pàlÿɔ́’ ncù ntsèm pie ée tÿǒ.
en: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

ngiemboon: Pi ka ńnéŋe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńgẅiin shúm meshùm, ńtsɔ́ɔn kɔ́ wɔ́ ńgẅiin, ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó fáŋ pá’ menɔ̀ɔn pie é zẅí’te lyɛ̌’ gie mé ge gwaa wɔ́b la.
en: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

ngiemboon: Pi ka záb menò twó pà tèfʉa, ńzẅéte wɔ́b, pɔ́ ké tè tíɛ tsɔ́ tʉ̀ mvfò pi wɔ́.
en: Ye have condemnedandkilled the just;andhe doth not resist you.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pú’u la pi lɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńzẅí’te tà ńkú fʉ̀’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó. Pi gyá pá’ njʉ’ ngwóŋ kě ńdá’ ńdɔg pɔ́ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńzẅí’te ngie tsetsá’ zém shúm mbòŋo, é zém, à káb ntwó, ńzẅí’te tà ńtáa ńgíŋe ńkáb nzèm.
en: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, pi lɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńzẅí’te, tà pi tsyɛte nnɛ́ á nue á cʉ́’ pɔ́ mejʉ’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó.
en: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi pɔ́ɔn légẅiin zẅɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzsé ngie Ssé tè gÿo gɔɔn ngie pi gwě ntsaŋ wɔ́, à ntsɔ́’te mentsaŋ tǒ tà ńtyé ncwò ndá.
en: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi gʉa nà leshÿɔgɔ ná ngɔ́’, mbɔɔ ná lelɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńzẅí’te mmó, ḿbí fʉ̀’ ná pàntsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé pie é lɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn nò ná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’ pege tóŋo pʉ̀a pie é la tʉte tʉte lê pà shÿó mbòŋo. Pi la jú’ pá’ mé la la’te ntí gie Job la lɔg shÿɔg pú’u. Pi piŋ ńzsé mmó gie à la cʉ́’ʉ lézsote Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo ná yé, á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m tɛ’, ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò kɔ́ wɔ́, tà pi gɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa. Tà pi lɔg lepwó ńkʉa nò. Tà pi lɔgɔ tsetsá’ ńkʉa, tà pi zɔɔn fó ńkʉa nò kʉa. Á poŋ ngie gẅi oon à gwɔ́ pɔ́ oon, agẅi ngǎŋ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngǎŋ. À cʉa pú’u, tá Ssé le gÿo e ngie pi gwě ntsaŋ wɔ́.
en: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; andyournay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ńne ńgyá ngɔ́’, á sẅíŋte Ssé, ńne ńkága á zɔb mezɔ́bɔ ntse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé.
en: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi ne ńguɔ, á tóŋ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, pɔ́ tó ńdɔg mèvɛ ńzɔ́’ɔ yé nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, éswíŋte Ssé.
en: Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

ngiemboon: Asẅíŋte gie mé gwaa gÿo, ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, à gÿo, à zeŋe. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pʉ’ʉ yé, ńgwɔ́ gie à ka fǒ ńgÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ, mbà Ssé ge lege menò tepòŋ mé náa mbwo yé.
en: and the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi zẅíŋ mefʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Nyìŋ zẅíŋ mefʉa mbwo fɛ́ we, afɛ̌ we zẅíŋe mbwo yé. Nyìŋ gẅi sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó fɛ́ we. À cʉ́a pú’u, pi zeŋe. Asẅíŋte nyìŋ gẅie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, á giŋ tɛ’.
en: Confessyourfaults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

ngiemboon: *Elîɛ la gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ pege, à la sẅíŋte Ssé lê ntʉ́m wé ntsèm ngie tà mbʉ̀ŋ lú, e Ssé gÿo mbʉ̀ŋ tè lú tà é gwɔ́ ngù’ tá nê mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́.
en: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe sẅíŋte Ssé, mbʉ̀ŋ lú, àtsetsá’ ná shúm léjÿó.
en: And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn fʉa mánzsè, ńnyé nò gie áa nénʉ́, mé piŋ ńtÿɔ́gte yé, tà á piŋ nzèm,
en: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

ngiemboon: mbà nyìŋ gẅie à tÿɔgté yé tà á fóo ná mánzsè tepòŋ ńkẅɛ, ge gÿo à tsẅɛ́. À cʉa pú’u, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

ngiemboon: Aa mèŋ Piɛ, ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo, mèŋ n náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo pi pie Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, pi lěen sa jʉ’, ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Pôŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ we Galatia, á tsɛ̀ɛ we Kapadosia, á tsɛ̀ɛ we Azia, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ we Mbitinia. Pi ee tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ŋwɛ́ ńgwɔ́ megʉ̀.
en: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅí, á gwɔ́ pá’ à la lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó ńzáb, ḿbiŋ ńcʉa nà Zẅìge yé ńgÿo pi cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé, légwɔ́ gie pi ge jú’ ncwò Yěsô Kristo, à lɔg metse mé é sɔgɔ gẅí. E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńnáa sẅétè né pi tà à gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn.
en: elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

ngiemboon: Pege síe Ssé Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo. À la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mege, ńgÿo mé zyé wégè lezyé se sẅé, ńcʉa ná Yěsô Kristo gẅie à la zíme nà legwé. Á cʉa pú’u, pege ńnéŋe fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńne ńzẅí’te kwà’ le gwɔ́,
en: Blessedbethe God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ tÿɔgɔ́ wégè gẅie ée tÿǒ lepwó, mbà Ssé la le’e né pege, ée gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ é le cʉŋte, ncÿǒ ké le gwoon, é ké le lʉ́,
en: to an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

ngiemboon: ée shúm sí, pi pʉ̀a pie Ssé ne ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mé ḿbyɛ́bɛ gẅí, á gwɔ́ pá’ pi ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé. À pyɛ́bɛ gẅi pá’ pi ge gÿo gẅiin letsẅɛ́ gẅie à ge lá’a lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsònzèm é gÿo mé gyá.
en: who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá mmó gie á gÿo pi ne ńkága kǎg, tà mbɔɔ pá’ áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzɛ́te ngie pi ná’a ḿmÿɔgɔ nà ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí gie é ne ńkúu gẅí.
en: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ kúu gẅi légwɔ́ gie mé ge gyá ngie pi kwa’ ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé. Tʉ̌ gɔ̂l gie á té ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó wɔ́, mé cʉ́’ʉ lézẅí’, ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g, ncÿǒ kẅɛɛ mǒ. Áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé gẅie aa mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa tʉ̌ gɔ̂l, ge cʉa pɔ́ ná pá’ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí gie e ne ńkúu gẅí, e ge ne zẅí’i gẅi yé, tá nyɛ ngie à tʉte. À lêen ńké ńcʉa pú’u, pi lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie Yěsô Kristo tǒ, mé ná ngɔ́ɔnte gi, ńnéŋe gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ legú’, ńgÿo mekù’ mí.
en: that the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Pi laa Yěsô gyá, tá’ ńké ńne ńkwoŋo yé. Pi ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná ye, tá mbɔɔ pá’ pi nyě tè gwǒon ńgyá yé. Máamáa lekág gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le zsé léshwóŋó nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye seehimnot, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

ngiemboon: Pi kága nue, pi ne ńgee ńgẅiin mmó gie pi kɔ̌ɔn ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé ńtí yɛ̌, á gwɔ́ pá’ Ssé ge gÿo pi tsẅɛ́.
en: receiving the end of your faith,eventhe salvation ofyoursouls.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn nò na ńtí gie Ssé la nyɛ́te ńzáb pá’ à ge lá’ cÿó gʉm gí pú’u, pɔ́ la fa’, ńtúŋte ńzɛ́te pá’ á ge lá’ cʉa pú’u, tá Ssé gÿo pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́.
en: Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the gracethat should comeunto you:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la kag tʉ̀ lézsé fʉ̀’ʉ njÿó, mbɔɔ mmó gie á ge lá’ cʉa tá mmó gie Zẅìge Kristo la ne ńda’te wɔ́b à gÿo. Yɛ̌ Zẅìge gie á laa ná pɔ́b, la zɔɔn ńtʉ́ njÿó ńne ńda’te wɔ́b ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie Kristo ge gÿo gyá tà mbɔɔ legú’ gẅie à ge lá’ pɔ́ɔnte ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ye ŋwɛ́.
en: searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gÿo pɔ́ zsé ngie anò gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅii, lɔ́ɔn těen ńge gÿo gÿo ná yɔ́b fʉ̀’ wɔ́, á lɔ́ɔn ńge gÿo gÿo pɔ́ nà gí fʉ̀’. Áa yɛ̌ nò ŋwɛ́ gie pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé, á fó pɔ́ nà nò gie pà Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ne ńgɔɔn, ńgwɔ gɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie Ssé ka fǒ tÿǒ lepwó ńtúm.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ne ńdʉa ńtsɔ́ɔn lézsé yɛ̌ nò.
en: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, legyè sí tyé pɔ́ nà legÿo mmó nà ntí ye pʉ̀a Ssé, tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg, pi ńnéŋe ńne ńnyɛte ńzwí’te fù’ gie Ssé ge gÿo ná né pi, á ná fʉ̀’ gie Yěsô Kristo ge gÿo tó.
en: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

ngiemboon: Pi jú’ ncwò Ssé, pá’ penkʉ́ pie é jú’u ncwò, tà pi gíŋe ńzẅíŋ menkwaŋá tepòŋ mie é kɔ́ɔn sá’a gẅi fʉ̀’ gie pi ka nyě tè zsě Kristo gíŋe sá’a gẅí.
en: as obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ Ndʉalʉ̌a nà kwò legìŋ gí ntsèm, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Ssé gẅie à ka tóŋo gẅi aa Ndʉalʉ̌a la.
en: but as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Pi gwɔ́ Ndʉalʉ̌a, á nue mèŋ n gee Ndʉalʉ̌a.»
en: because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa fʉ̀’ ntsèm gie pi ne sẅíŋte Ssé, pi tóŋ Ssé lê Tá gẅi, pú’u la, pi lɔg melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mie pi nyě ńgẅiin tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, ńnyɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ gẅi leńnéŋe ngie pi ne ńnáa mekù’ mé. Aa nyìŋ gẅie à zá’ ntsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ té gẅiin tyɛ̀’te, éfó pɔ́ nà mmó gie nyìŋ gÿǒ tá ńzá’ ntsaŋ ngàŋ.
en: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man's work, pass the time of your sojourningherein fear:

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ne ńzsé tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mmó gie e Ssé la ná tá ńdɔg ńkẅile gẅi nà ntí leńnéŋe gie e tè kẅéte, é gie metá pi la zí’i gẅí, yɛ̌ mmó á té pá’ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l kà nkáb wɔ́ gie nzẅìŋ ge fó lyɛ̌’ mag wɔ́.
en: forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things,assilver and gold, from your vain conversationreceivedby tradition from your fathers;

ngiemboon: À la lɔg pɔ́ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ metse Kristo gẅie tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ té ná yé wɔ́, atsɔ́*lɔ̌’ ké tè ná yé wɔ́. Kristo laa pá’ mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò gẅie mé la zẅé yé ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔ́’.
en: but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

ngiemboon: E Ssé la mvɔg ńtsɔ́’ɔ yé ná yɛ̌ nò, tá ńnyɛte njÿó. À kéen ńgʉa ná yɔɔn fʉ̀’ gie á lɔgɔ ńzsote, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mangyɛ̌ ńtí gẅí.
en: who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

ngiemboon: Pi zẅɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ yé tá ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé gẅie à la zíme yé nà legwé, mbɔɔ pá’ à la náa yé legú’, tà pi gwaa záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, é piŋ ne pyɛ́bɛ mmó gie Ssé ka’a, yé zɔ̌ gÿo.
en: who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

ngiemboon: Pi ka lɔgɔ lézẅíŋe nò gie áa nénʉ́, ésɔg ntʉ́m gẅí. Légwɔ́ gie pi ge kwoŋ mefɛ́ pi pie pia pɔ̌ zába ntʉ́m nà Ssé, é kwoŋo wɔ́b tà shwóŋó nò. Pú’u la, pi gẅiin kwà’ nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, nyìŋ kwoŋo fɛ́ we lê ntʉ́m we ntsèm.
en: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren,see that yelove one another with a pure heart fervently:

ngiemboon: Mé ka zɔɔn ńzyé gẅi lezyé we sẅé, tà à tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ lezyě we nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie aa ńkwé wɔ́. À gwɔ̌ pɔ́ gẅie à fóo ná mbyè mmó gie e tě ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́, yɛ̌ mbyè mmó gwɔ́ shwóŋè Ssé gie á náa kwà’ le gwɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gie á ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

ngiemboon: Legǐ jǔm, à tootǒ tsɔ́’ɔ ńgwe ssé.
en: The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ shwóŋè áa gie pi ka jú’u tsɛ̀ɛ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie mé ka tsẅii mbwo pi.
en: And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi lêen ńké ńgwá’ menò tepòŋ ntsèm, tà pi gíŋe fʉte pʉ̀a, tà pi gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pà nkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, tà pi gíŋe ńgẅiin kègɔ́’ ná shúm pʉ̀a, tà pi gíŋe ńzẅɛ́te nzèm pʉ̀a.
en: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,

ngiemboon: Pi lêen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ púɔ mepÿɛ́ pie pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn lepʉ́, ashwóŋè Ssé ée*lepʉ̌ té*lɔ̌’, pi ne ńnóŋo, ńzsé ngie pi ge gú’, e Ssé gÿo pi tsẅɛ́.
en: as newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kéen ńzẅí’ tà ńjú’ pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a poŋ pú’u.
en: if so be ye have tasted that the Lordisgracious.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtó nê lejʉ́ŋ yé, yé zɔ náa kwà’ le gwɔ́. À lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ tóon gẅie ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la gwá’, tá’ e Ssé kaŋa yé, á gwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo yé.
en: To whom coming,as untoa living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God,andprecious,

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie pi gí pie pi gẅiin kwà’ le gwɔ́, pi zẅíŋ, e Ssé lɔgɔ gẅi ńgÿo metóon, ńdɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a. Pi gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńgwɔ́ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pie Ssé la tsɔ́’, pie é ge cʉa nzèm Yěsô Kristo, é nuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie é poŋ Ssé.
en: ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gẅie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, eshʉ́ le lá’ ńkúu ngàŋ wɔ́.
en: And he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

ngiemboon: léen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon lezẅé ndá.
en: The same is made the head of the corner,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwɔɔnte mǒ, mélà’mie pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ lé jú’u shwóŋè Ssé. Á ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Ssé la záb ngie á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná pɔ́b.
en: even to themwhich stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná pi, mbà pi ee ngẅɛ̀ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la kaŋ, ńgwɔ́ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ fùɔ ndÿò, ńgwɔ́ lá’ gie áa yé, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie à la cwoŋo wɔ́b é gwɔ́ pé, pá’ pɔ́ ge gʉa shwóŋ memáa menò mie à la gÿo, yé gẅie à la fó tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm ńkẅile gẅí, ńnéŋe gẅi nà jʉ’ʉ fɔ̌g gie kyɛ̀’ɛ mbòŋo yé áa wó.
en: But yearea chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’, pi tè pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́, pi kéen ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé. Pi pie pi la tè tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe Ssé zsé e Ssé kéen ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mí.
en: which in time pastwerenot a people, butarenow the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn pé tʉ nzẅìŋ, pi ee ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ jʉ’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pà ncʉ̀anzsè, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ megʉ̀. Áa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n ne shwóŋó gẅi ngie tà pi zẅí’te mbùm gí gie e ne ńtsó gẅi légÿo mmó gie e ne ńkwoŋo, á nue ee pú’u, ne ńdÿɔ́’ɔ ntʉ́m gẅi lê ncù.
en: Dearly beloved, I beseechyouas strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

ngiemboon: !Pi gẅiin tsẅé mbòŋo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà tèzsé nò Ssé, tà ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ lɔɔn ne shwóŋte té poŋ ná lezíŋ sí, pɔ́ gyá menò mbòŋo mie pi ne ńgÿo, ńgu’te lezíŋ Ssé fʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge gÿo tó gɔɔn nò né pɔ́b.
en: having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may byyourgood works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

ngiemboon: !Pi cʉa nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńjú’ ncwò pàsá’a lá’ métsèm. Pi jú’ ncwò Kasa gẅie à tyé mvfó pàsá’a lá’ métsèm,
en: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ ńjú’ ncwò meŋwâ lá’ pé. Á nue à fùɔ túmo wɔ́b légʉa ńnyɛ pàgÿo menò tepòŋ ngɔ́’, ḿbiŋ ńná ngɔ́ɔnte pʉ̀a pie é ne ńgÿo nò mbòŋo.
en: or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie e Ssé kwoŋ ngie pi gÿo, ńzsé ngie pi ge lɔgɔ légÿo nò mbòŋo, é jÿɔ́’ ncwò megʉ̀gʉ̀ pie pɔ́ lʉ’ʉ nò Ssé, pɔ́ le gíŋe shwóŋte ná pi wɔ́.
en: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ mà gẅi ńgwɔ́ pá’ pʉ̀a pie mé ka kẅile wɔ́b ndá nkwɔɔn. Tá’, tà wɛ̌ légwɔ́ ké ńcʉ́’ʉ mbwo pi ńgwɔ́ nkǔɔ gie pi ge lɔg lÿoon menò tepòŋ. Pi lɔgɔ mà gẅi ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn pe yé Ssé.
en: as free, and not usingyourliberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

ngiemboon: Pi ná mekù’ mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńkwoŋ mefɛ́ pi pʉ̀a Kristo, ḿbɔ́g Ssé, ńná mekù’ fùɔ.
en: Honour allmen. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi fa’a mbwo pʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ penkʉ́ pɔ́b, pi sẅí’i mbùm gi ńnáa ssé á mvfò metá pi nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, pi le sẅí’i pɔ́ ndà’ mvfò pie pɔ́ gẅiin pòŋo ntʉ́m, ḿbíŋ ḿbʉ́le pʉ́le wɔ́, pi gíŋ sẅí’i mbɔɔ mvfò pie e cÿɔ́g cÿɔ̌g.
en: Servants,besubject toyourmasters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie pi lɔɔn ńdɔg pá’ pi ne ńkwoŋo léké ńzsé pɔ́ Ssé ndà’, éshÿɔg ngɔ́’ gie é kúu gẅi ńtíi mmó gie pi kaa gÿo, mbà aa nò mbòŋo.
en: For thisisthankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ leshÿɔg ngɔ́’, éshÿɔg gie e kúu gẅi ńtí nò tepòŋ gie pi gÿǒ, mbà mé ge ná mekù’ mí nà kɔ́? Tá pi ké ńgÿo nò mbòŋo, mé náa gẅi ngɔ́’, pi shÿɔg, mbà wɛ̌ léshÿɔg aa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ nò mbòŋo.
en: For what gloryis it, if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and sufferfor it, ye take it patiently, thisisacceptable with God.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa tóŋo gẅí, ńne fa’a ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ pú’u. Kristo la gyá yé ngɔ́’ ńtí gẅí, ńdɔgɔ ńnáa gẅi fʉ̀’, ngie pi giŋ pá’ yé.
en: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

ngiemboon: Yé Kristo la tè tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ gÿo, ńké tè shwóŋ cÿɔ̌ nò wɔ́.
en: who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

ngiemboon: Mé la zoonte yé, à tè nzòonte tsɔ́’. À la ne ńgyá ngɔ́’, ńké tè nyìŋ vege, ḿbú ńnyé yé nò ntsèm pɔ́ nà mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à zá’ ntsaŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committedhimselfto him that judgeth righteously:

ngiemboon: Kwà’ yé Kristo la kaa menò tepòŋ mégè ńnéŋe soŋ nnɛ́ yé, á fʉ̀’ gie mé la kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ. À la gÿo pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pege ge cʉ́’ gwɔ́ mbwo nò tepòŋ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mepfó, é lêen ké ku’u légÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé. Pi la zẅɛ́’ pɔ́ mefʉ̌ŋ mé tá ńzeŋe.
en: who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ngie pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwáa ḿbúu pá’*menjʉ̀njÿò mie é fʉ̌a mánzsè. Tá’ pi kéen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńdíe gẅí, yé zɔ̌ ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ gẅí.
en: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí pànzwě, pi sẅí’i mbùm gi ńnáa ssé mvfò melúm pí, à cʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńdʉ’ʉ lézáb ntʉ́m nà shwóŋè Ssé, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm pi té gwɔ́ gie pi gɔ̌ɔn nò, éfó ná tsẅé gí.
en: Likewise, ye wives,bein subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

ngiemboon: Mbà pɔ́ gyǎ kwò legìŋ gí gie*lɔ̌’ té mǒ wɔ́, á piŋ ńgẅiin mekù’.
en: while they behold your chaste conversationcoupledwith fear.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lékẅiŋ mbùm gi pɔ́ nzème pǐ, pá’ lenyɛte ḿbá’a twó gí, ńjÿɔ́g mekwáŋ mie mé lɔgɔ gɔ̂l ńnyɛ́te, ḿma’a menzsǒ mbòŋo.
en: Whose adorning let it not be that outwardadorningof plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie à gí kẅìŋe nnɛ́ fó pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí. Yɛ̌ áa kẅìŋe nnɛ́ gie á ge lá’a zɔ́gɔ ńnéŋe, à gwɔ́ lépʉ́le pʉlé té fa’ ntsaŋ. Áa mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ máamáa kẅìŋ.
en: butlet it bethe hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible,even the ornamentof a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ zɔɔ ńtí gie pánzwě pe fʉ̀’é mvfò pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿbɔ́gɔ Ssé, ńnéŋe ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie Ssé la ka’, lɔ́ɔn ńkẅiŋe mbùm yɔ́b pú’u, ńne sẅí’i mbùm yɔ́b ńnáa ssé á mvfò melúm pɔ́b,
en: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

ngiemboon: pá’ Sara gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńjú’u ncwò ndǔm we Ábalam, ńtóŋo yé lê Ndè wé. Pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńgÿo nò mbòŋo té pɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ mmó, mbà pi ge cʉ́’ púɔ pé pe pànzwě.
en: even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí mbàŋa pi gẅiin pànzwě pi mboŋó, ńkímte pá’ pànzwě gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a nzɔbte zɔbté. Pi ná mekù’ mɔ́b, á nue e Ssé la pú ńcÿó gʉm gia pɔ̌ métsèm, ńgÿo pá’ pi ge lá’ gẅiin kwà’ le gwɔ́. Pi gÿo pú’u, ńne sẅíŋte Ssé, atsɔ́ mmó le gẅi táte.
en: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell withthemaccording to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gwaa cʉ́me, é gɔɔn fʉ̀’ɔɔn mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm ngie, pi gẅiin tà’ ncwò, nyìŋ gẅi gyá nò nyìŋ pá’ yé, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, ńgẅiin nkwòŋe mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńná nnɛ́ ssé.
en: Finally,be yeall of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren,bepitiful,becourteous:

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔgɔ nò tepòŋ ńtsɔ́’ɔ nò tepòŋ. Tà mé zoonte gẅi pi pʉŋe. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pi gɔɔn ngie e Ssé gwɔ́ nê ngàŋ, e Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi pɔ́ pá’ à ge gwɔ́ né pi.
en: not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́ɔn ncwò we, ḿbɔ́g cÿɔ̌ nò.
en: And his lips that they speak no guile:

ngiemboon: é fa’ mbʉ́lè, ńzsete nzèm yé.
en: Let him seek peace, and ensue it.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kě ńtém pɔ́ nzèm pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: But the face of the Lordisagainst them that do evil.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńnéŋe twó ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, mbà wɔ́ ge gÿo nò tepòŋ ná pi?
en: And whoishe that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

ngiemboon: Pi ke fó lyɛ̌’ ńgwɔ gyá ngɔ́’, á gwɔ́ nue pi ne ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, mbà pi ee pà shÿó mbòŋo. Tà pi mɔ́ɔn tà ḿbɔ́g pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Tà ntʉ́m nyìŋ gẅi mɔ́ɔn tà ḿvɛ.
en: But and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake, happyare ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

ngiemboon: Tá ńcʉ́’ pú’u, pi gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, ńne ńnáa pɔ́ mekù’ Kristo ngie yé zɔɔ Ndè gẅi. Pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtyé pɔ́ pá’ nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅi ngie mélà’a kɔ́ pi tÿɔ́g nkwaŋá gẅi ná Kristo wɔ́, pi kyɛ́’te shwóŋó ngàŋ.
en: but sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: andbeready always togivean answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ʉ léshwóŋó yé ńdɔg pɔ́ ndɔ́ɔn ndɔ́ɔn, ńdɔg mekù’. Á poŋ ngie tà mbùm gi gwɔ gwɔ́ ńne ńcúɔ gẅi ná tsɔ́ mmó, tá à cʉa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńne ńtÿɔ́gɔ sóon twó pi, éfó ná pá’ pɔ́ ne ńzoonte leńnéŋe gẅi we pʉ̀a Kristo, gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ, eshʉ́ kúu wɔ́b.
en: having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

ngiemboon: Mvfò aa nyìŋ légwɔ gyá ngɔ́’ ńne ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo pá’ Ssé lɔɔn ńkwoŋ ngie à gwɔ́ pú’u, ńcʉa pá’ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gwaa gyá ngɔ́’ ńne ńgÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: Forit isbetter, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn ńgyá yé ngɔ́’ tà ńkwé lélɔg ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńké ńkwé ndà’ tà’ legʉ̀a, á ku’. Yé tè fʉa kwé ńtí ngàŋ mefʉa, pú’u, lélɔgɔ gẅi ńtóo mvfò Ssé. Mé la zẅé mbab nnɛ́ ye, tá Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ gÿo á gʉa lá’ mepfó é shwóŋó nò Ssé mbwo mezẅige pʉ̀a mesoŋ mie é laa ndá tsǎŋ.
en: by which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ mezẅige gwɔ́ me pʉ̀a pie é la tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé á fʉ̀’ gie Nóa la ne ńnyɛte kanú’, e Ssé ne ńdɔgɔ kwɔ́gɔ nnɛ́ ńzẅí’te pʉ̀a zẅí’te. Tá’ pʉ̀a lefɔ̌ɔn ndà’ zɔ̌ gÿo ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ tà ńtsẅɛ́ ntse.
en: which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ ntse é laa liŋé kẅe ntse gie á gÿo pi tsẅɛ́ɛ fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn. Mé téen ńdɔgɔ sɔgɔ pɔ́ ncÿǒ nà mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńdúɔ mbwo Ssé ngie à sɔg mentʉ́m mégè, é le gíŋe ńŋaga wégè wɔ́. Akẅe ntse lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgÿo pi tsẅɛ́ɛ, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pá’ Yěsô Kristo la zíme nà legwé.
en: The like figure whereuntoevenbaptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: À la kwɔ́’ né tÿǒ lepwó, ńnéŋe nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀. Àa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne sá’a*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ntsèm, ńne sá’a kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á sá’a njÿó, ésá’a metʉ̀ ntsèm mie ée tÿǒ.
en: who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

ngiemboon: Pá’ Kristo la gyá ngɔ́’ ná mbab nnɛ́ la, pi gí pi gwɔ́ twó pi, ńtyé légyá ngɔ́’ pá’ yé, ńne ńzsé ngie yé Kristo gẅie à la gyá ngɔ́’ nà mbab nnɛ́, à la maga nò nò tepòŋ.
en: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi gʉa nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mie pi nyě ńgẅiin ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, tà pi gÿo mmó gie mbùm nyìŋ zɔ tsóte yé á gÿo.
en: that he no longer should live the rest ofhistime in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

ngiemboon: Apàa á zɔ̌ɔn ńzá’a pá’ pi ka ne ńgÿo mmó gie pà tézsé Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. Pi kɔ̌ɔn fʉ̀’ʉ menò tà sá’a sǎ’, ńne ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mbùm gi tsóte gẅi légÿo, ḿbʉ́a melù’, ńcú’te ná linɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ shúm, ńgÿo menò shʉ́, pi kɔ̌ɔn ńzɔ́gɔ pɔ́ lénú melù’, pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgu’te shúm ngie ee messé, á gwɔ́ mmó gie Ssé pǔ tè kwoŋ.
en: For the time past ofourlife may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn pà tèzsé Ssé cʉ́’ʉ ńgyá gi ntí ḿmɔɔn mɔɔn, á nue pia pɔ̌ cʉ’ʉ́ ńteme kwò ńgiŋe légÿo menò mie pɔ́ gyo é gwɔ́ pɔ́ menò shʉ́ wɔ́. Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzoon gẅi zoon.
en: wherein they think it strange that ye run not withthemto the same excess of riot, speaking evil ofyou:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tyé mvfò Ssé gẅie à tyě pá’ à ge zá’ ntsaŋ pʉ̀a metʉ̀ pâ mepfó ssé, építe ncwò wɔ́b nà ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b.
en: who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mé tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbɔɔ mbwo mepfó. Mé ka tsẅi tà mbɔɔ pá’ e Ssé ka ŋag mbùm yɔb, pá’ à ŋaga pʉ̀a metsèm, pɔ́ gẅiin lékwé. Pɔ́ ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńku’ pá’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gwɔ́ ná zẅìge sɔ́b pâ Ssé ńnéŋe.
en: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ʉ nzsòte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, á ne ńku’u. Pá’ áa pú’u la, pi gwɔ́ pàzsé nò. Tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg, ńzsé ngie pi ge ku’u lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

ngiemboon: Andùŋ mvfò mmó gie pi ge gÿo, aa gẅi légẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mélà’mie nkwòŋe pyaga lelÿò menò tepòŋ.
en: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

ngiemboon: Pi kúe mefɛ́ pi tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi á tsɛ̀ɛ mendá mí té ne ńzẅɛ́te.
en: Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ lɔgɔ yé fù’ gie Ssé lɔ̌g ńcÿó gʉm yé, ńkẅéte mefɛ́ pé. Pi gwɔ́ pá’ megàŋa fà’ pe mbòŋo pie pɔ́ ne ńkú’te fù’ mentí mentí gie Ssé náa mbwo pɔ́b pá’ á ge kẅéte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: As every man hath received the gift,even sominister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

ngiemboon: Afù’ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ légɔɔn nò Ssé, á gɔɔn pɔ́ gie á fóo mbwo Ssé. Aye nyìŋ gwɔ́ léfa’ mefà’ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, á lɔg pɔ́ metʉ̀ mie Ssé náa mbwo yé ńdɔg fa’. Pi gÿo pá’ɔɔn ńzsé ngie mé ge cʉa ná Yěso Kristo, égu’te Ssé nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, yé gẅie metʉ̀ ntsèm, mbɔɔ lésá’ njÿó ée mbwo yé nà mengù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ́ɔn. Amɛn
en: If any man speak,let him speakas the oracles of God; if any man minister,let him do itas of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn pe tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, pi ee tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g ńne ńgyá ngɔ́’. Tà pi gyá á kʉ’ʉ gẅí, á té tsɔ́ nò sẅé wɔ́. Mé ge fó mǒ e zsé mmó gie pi ee yɛ̌.
en: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́’ ńkág kág á nue pi ne ńgyá gi ngɔ́’ pá’ kristo, à cʉa pú’u, pi gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá legú’ we ńgíŋe ńgẅiin gí máamáa lekág.
en: but rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzoon gẅi ńtí lezíŋ Kristo, mbà pi ee pà shÿó mbòŋo, á nue a Zẅìge legú’, á Zẅìge Ssé áa ná pi,
en: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happyare ye; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ gẅi légwaa gyá ngɔ́’ á gwɔ́ ngie à zẅě nyìŋ, ngie à jʉ̌, kà pɔ́ ngie à gÿǒ nò tepòŋ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ ngie à gyǎ nò nyìŋ ńkúu mǒ wɔ́.
en: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, orasa thief, orasan evildoer, or as a busybody in other men's matters.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwaa gyá ngɔ́’, á gwɔ́, mélà’mie aa nyìŋ Kristo, tà ngàŋ kú shʉ́. Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, á gu’te pɔ́ Ssé ńtí lezíŋ Kristo sie à gẅiin.
en: Yet ifany man sufferas a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kú’ pá’ Ssé ge zá’ ntsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, à ge zye pɔ́ nà pʉ̀a pé. À lɔɔn ńzye ná pege, mbà á ge cʉ́’ʉ nzsoté é gwɔ́ lêkɔ́ ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té kwoŋo lézẅíŋ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo we Ssé wɔ́?
en: For the timeis comethat judgment must begin at the house of God: and ifitfirstbeginat us, what shall the endbeof them that obey not the gospel of God?

ngiemboon: mbà á ge tó gwɔ́ nà pʉ̀a pie é té gÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́, é pʉ̀a tepòŋ, é gwɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á poŋ ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gwaa ne gyá ngɔ́’, á gwɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ ne ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, pɔ́ cʉ́me yɔ́b nò ntsèm á mbwo mbù’ ngwòŋ gẅie, à ka’a mmó, ńgÿo ńná, ńcʉ́me pú’u, ńkẅi’i ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo.
en: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their soulsto himin well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò fʉ̀’ɔɔn lélɔg ńtÿɔ́gte pàkẅé mvfò pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè gí, ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn kẅè mvfò pá’ pɔ́b, mbà Kristo la gwɔ ne gyá ngɔ́’, mèŋ n tyé jʉ’ó. Mèŋ n ge gÿo gẅiin yɔ́ɔn jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ gẅie e Ssé ge gÿo gÿo à kẅɛ́.
en: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn mbwo pi pàkẅé mvfò ngie pi pféle nùɔ*njʉ̀njÿò Ssé gie à la cʉ́me mbwo pi, tà pi pféle pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé gwǒon gẅi gwoon la, pi pféle lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo, pá’ Ssé ne ńkwoŋo. Tà pi gÿo pá’ fʉ̀’ gie pi fa’a nkáb la, pi lɔg pɔ́ nkwòŋe.
en: feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversightthereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔg metʉ̀ sá’ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la cʉ́me mbwo pi, pi giŋ pɔ́ nà mbú gie pɔ́ ge pí fʉ̀’ ná pi.
en: neither as being lords overGod'sheritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà á ge lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie mbyɛ̀b mvfó we lÿò tǒ, à tɔ’ ngú’ twó pi, é gie nzẅìŋ we téen ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pi gí pûɔ shùm, pi ná nnɛ́ ssé mvfò pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a metsèm, tà pi ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó, nyìŋ gẅi kwaŋ ngie à cʉa wetsɔ̌. Á nue ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: E Ssé lʉ’ pàŋá’te nnɛ́ lʉ’, ńké ńdɔgɔ pòŋo ntʉ́m ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é sẅí’i mbùm yɔb ńnáa ssé.
en: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, allof yoube subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la pi ná nnɛ́ gi ssé á mvfò Ssé gẅie à gẅiin metʉ̀, à cʉa pú’u, à gÿo ḿbʉ’ʉ gẅi nà fʉ̀’ gie à la záb.
en: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

ngiemboon: Pi pú ńnéŋe kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńcʉa gẅí, á nà mbwo Ssé, ńtí nue à ne ńdíe gẅí.
en: casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg, tà pi lyé. Angàŋ mbù gẅi, Sátà, à ne ńgwá ńzéme, éfa’a nyìŋ gẅie à ge gwoon yé, pá’ pú’ ntʉ̀ gẅie à ga’te éfa’a mmó gie à ge pfɛ́ la.
en: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé, ńkẅi’i ńtʉte, ńdʉ’ʉ Sátà, ńne ńzsé ngie mefɛ́ pi ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńne ńgyá pɔ́ ntí ngɔ́’ gie pi gyá.
en: whom resist stedfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world.

ngiemboon: Ngɔ́’ gi ge ná’a ńnéŋe pɔ́ méjʉ’, e Ssé gẅie à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ nò mbòŋo gwɔ́ fóo pɔ́ mbwo yé, yé gẅie à la cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo ńtóŋo gẅi pá’ pi ge gwɔ́ gí tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we gẅie à pàa té wó wɔ́, à ge fó pú’u, é gÿo tsɔ́ mmó le gíŋe ńzága ná pi wɔ́, étsẅìŋ ndù gi, pi tʉte, mé le gíŋe ńku’u létsó gẅi tà ḿma’a ssé wɔ́.
en: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settleyou.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ gẅiin lésá’ njÿó á nà mengù’u mengù’.*Amen
en: To himbeglory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Silase ka kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn léŋwe’e wɔɔn mûɔ méŋwà’ne. Àa mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ fɛ́ gẅie à zsé yé pɔ́ ndà’ nò Yěsô. Mèŋ n náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo pi lélɔg ńkẅiŋte gẅi mbɔɔ lélɔg ńnyɛte shwóŋó gẅi ntí gie e Ssé la lɔg menò mbòŋo ńcÿó gʉm yégè, kwà’ pá’ mèŋ n ŋwe’é lɔɔn. Pi tʉte nà menò ŋwɛ́ mboŋó.
en: By Silvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, I have written briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand.

ngiemboon: Acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie áa Mbabilonia tsyɛ’té gẅí. E Ssé la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b yɔ́b pá’ pi. Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn Malékuse tsyɛ’té gẅi yé.
en: Thechurch that isat Babylon, elected together withyou, saluteth you; andso dothMarcus my son.

ngiemboon: Asẅétè ne ńgwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm.
en: Peacebewith you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

ngiemboon: Aa mèŋ Símo Piɛ, nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a fà’ Yěsô Kristo, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm we. Mèŋ n náa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne mbwo pi pie pi la záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo pá’ peg yég. Lezǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo áa mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo pi mbɔɔ mbwo peg yég. Yěsô Kristo yé maŋwɛ́ zɔ la gÿo pú’u, né pege, á nue à gÿo mmó nà wɔ̌ɔwɔɔ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Aa Ssé yege, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie á gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi mboŋó, éfó ná pá’ pi zsé yé Ssé, ńgíŋ ńzsé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô.
en: grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

ngiemboon: E Ssé léen ńdɔg metʉ̀ mé, ḿbú náa wégè kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege gẅiin tá ńdɔg ńnéŋe, ńne ńdáa nnɛ́ pɔ́ ndà’ ná yé. À la zɔɔn ńgÿo pege zsé yé Ssé gẅie à la tóŋo wégè pá’ paga pɔ̌ ge pú gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we, é jÿó pì póŋo ntʉ́m yé.
en: according as his divine power hath given unto us all things thatpertainunto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:

ngiemboon: Á la fó pú’u, á ná shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ á mbwo pege, é gwɔ́ sie é kẅéte wégè tɛ’, ńgwɔ́ sie à la ka’, ńnáa pú’u, légwɔ́ gie pege ge cʉa ná sɛ̌ shúm, é ku’u lékÿo menò ncÿǒ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, éfóo ná shúm sie mbùm yege tsóte wégè légÿo, é kÿo pú’u, é cʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ tsẅé ye yé Ssé.
en: whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi kag tʉ̀, ńkẅi’i mà mbòŋo ná gẅi lézáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa ná mà mbòŋo ńkẅi’i lézsé mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo,
en: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná le zsé mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ńkẅi’i pá’ pi ge gwoonte mbùm gí, ńgʉa ná legwoonte mbùm ńkẅi’i létʉte tʉte, ńgʉa ná letʉte tʉte, ńkẅi’i lé zsé pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé,
en: and to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná lezsě pɔ́ ndà’ Ssé, ńkẅi’i pá’ à nò mefɛ́ pí ge poŋo gẅí, ńgʉa ná pá’ nò mefɛ́ pí ne ḿboŋo gẅí, ńkẅí’i nkwòŋe.
en: and to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

ngiemboon: Á nue pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo menò mie mé tʉté lɔɔn, ńne ńdɔgɔ ńgee né mvfò, mbà é ge gÿo mbùm gi zeŋe légÿo mmó gie e Ssé kwoŋ, é gíŋe gÿo pi ne ńkẅi’i ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo aa yé
en: For if these things be in you, and abound, they makeyou that ye shallneitherbebarren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn tè ne ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́, mbà à tè ne ńgyá jʉ’ mboŋó wɔ́, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g la. Mbà à legé ngie mé léen sɔg yɛ̌ ntí menò tepòŋ mie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo.
en: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pá’ áa pú’u la, pi kẅi’i ńkag tʉ̀, légwɔ́ gie pi ge gÿo mé zsé mboŋó ngie Ssé la tóŋo gẅí, ńtsɔ́’ɔ gẅí. Pi lɔɔn ńnéŋe ná yɛ̌ ntí, mbà pi těen ńdá’a ńgwe nà nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ pú’u, mé lá’ shʉa shʉa ńtsɔ́’ nzsè gie e gee ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ tèmì se Yěsô Kristo, ńná né pi. Aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: for so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo n ge lá’a zɔ́gɔ kímte gẅi mɔɔn menò kimté tà mbɔɔ pá’ pi ne ńzsé, ḿbiŋ ne ńgiŋe pɔ́ nà nò gie áa nénʉ́ gie mé la shwóŋó gẅí.
en: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye knowthem, and be established in the present truth.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ n kwǎŋ ngie à fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n nyé ntentʉ́ lɔɔn, mèŋ n ge ké ne kímte gẅi mɔɔn menò kimté, é lɔgɔ zyeen gẅí.
en: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by puttingyouin remembrance;

ngiemboon: Á nue mèŋ n zsě ngie, à fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gee ńkwé cʉ́’ʉ ńku’u ku’. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ka gÿo mèŋ n zsé.
en: knowing that shortly I must put offthismy tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńne ńnyɛ́te ńcwoŋte nà ntí gie mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ tà kwé, pi tyé mbɔɔ ná yɛ̌ nò wɔ́, ńkímte mmó gie n da zí’i gẅí.
en: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

ngiemboon: Peg ka tè gwɔ shwóŋó gẅi pá’ Yěsô Kristo, Ndè wege ge gÿo tó, lê shʉ́shÿɔ́g, éfó pɔ́ ná menò pú’kwɔ́b mie peg neŋé ssé ńdɔg legyè ńdʉ’te wɔ́. Peg ka fó ná pá’ peg lɔ̌g nÿɔ́g még ńgyá legú’ we.
en: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

ngiemboon: Á fʉ̀’ gie Ssé Tá la ná legú’ mbɔɔ mekù’ á mbwo yé, mé jú’ ngyè Ssé gẅie à gẅiin metʉ̀, á gɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo yé tɛ’, aa wɔ̀ɔn lekág.
en: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ peg nê twó yég la jú’ yɛ̌ ngyè, peg la jú’ pá’ e fóo tÿǒ lépwó á fʉ̀’ gie pega Yěsô laa ndùm lekwɛ́ Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

ngiemboon: Á té ndà’ pú’u wɔ́ pege giŋé ńgẅiin shwóŋè pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le jú’ ḿmʉ’te wɔ́. Á póŋ ngie pi cwòŋo ńjú’u yɛ̌ shwóŋè. Áa pá’ lâm gẅie à kyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ gie á ne síŋe. Pi cwoŋo ne ńjú’u ńdɔg ńzẅí’te lyɛ̌’ gie Yěsô ge lá’ gíŋ tó. Pá’ cÿɔ́’ saŋ gẅie à kwɔ̌’, njÿó gwóon ńdʉ́a. À ge tó kyɛ’ jʉ’ mbwo mentʉ́m mi.
en: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi gẅiin lévɔg ńzsé á gwɔ́ ngie: Á tsɔ́ shwóŋè*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé, ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔg legyè sé gílé yé ńkyagte á té wó wɔ́
en: knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

ngiemboon: Á nue kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lǎ tsẅi, pɔ́ laa gwaa tsẅi, a fóo pɔ́ nà legyè nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ gwaa gɔɔn nò gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pɔ́ gɔɔn, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ̌ tsóte wɔ́b tá pɔ́ gɔɔn.
en: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spakeas they weremoved by the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌ nò laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Israel, áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pà zí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé pe cÿɔ̌ nò ge gÿo kẅɛte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Pɔ́ ge gÿo lɔg pɔ́ ndɔ́ɔn ndɔ́ɔn é zí’i pʉ̀a cÿɔ̌ nò, é gwɔ́ gẅie ńgwɔ́ é cʉ́ŋte letʉ́m pʉ̀a, é gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà moŋe Ndè gẅie à la gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, é gÿo pú’u, lɔg shwoŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ge pyága wɔ́b, e ké le líi létó wɔ́.
en: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔɔn cʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgÿo pɔ́ menò shʉ́. Mé cʉa ná pɔ́b, ńzoonte mánzsè nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́b kwoŋ nkáb tɛ’ la, pɔ́ ge lɔgɔ shwóŋè gie pɔ́ lʉ’té lʉ’te, é lɔg lÿɔgte gẅí, é kẅé shúm sí, ńke ńgÿo pú’u pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà Ssé la lá’ ńzá’ ntsaŋ yɔb, tà á cʉ́’ pɔ́ méjʉ’ ngɔ́’ gwé ná pɔ́b.
en: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.

ngiemboon: *Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé la zɔɔn fʉa nò, e Ssé tè wɔ́b nyé. À la tsó wɔ́b ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ á jʉ’ʉ nzěm, pɔ́ ée ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ menkÿo, ńne ńzẅí’te lyɛ̌’ gie mé ge tsɔ́’te mentsaŋ.
en: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but castthemdown to hell, and deliveredtheminto chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ ngwòŋ we fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò gẅie pʉ̀a mesoŋ laa tsoló, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ mefʉa e Ssé la tè nyé. À la gÿo ntse fó meshÿó meshÿó ńkwɔ́’, ńjÿó tsetsá’, mengàŋ mbù pé fÿɛ́ɛ tsoló. Á gÿo ndà’ Nóa, gẅie à la ne shwóŋó lá’ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, lê pʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a zɔ̌ tsẅɛ́.
en: and spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighthperson, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gíŋe ńtém ngɔ́’ ná pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ Sodom lâ ná pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋo Gomor ńdɔg mmɔ̌g ḿbyága wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ pʉ̀a tepòŋ fʉ̀’ mmó gie á ge gÿo tóo ná pɔ́b.
en: and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemnedthemwith an overthrow, makingtheman ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;

ngiemboon: À la fó wó ńkẅile Lod. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé Ssé, tà ńgyá tsẅé tepòŋ, lâ menò shʉ́ mie pʉ̀a mɛ̌ metÿǒsoŋ lɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ʉ tà sá’a sǎ’, é pú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ yé tɛ’.
en: and delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:

ngiemboon: Yé nyìŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe nùɔ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńgyá ntí gie pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńnéŋe, ńjú’u menò mie pɔ́ gɔɔn. Pá’ letʉ́m sé la tyé pɔ́ nà mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ la, mɛ̌ menò gege yé gege lyɛ̌’ ntsèm.
en: (for that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexedhisrighteous soul from day to day withtheirunlawful deeds;)

ngiemboon: Mé fó ná mɔɔn menò ńgyá ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kwoŋo léfóo tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́’ ńkẅile pʉ̀a pie é zsé pɔ́ ndà’ yé, é cʉ́’ pʉ̀a tepòŋ á nyé wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ zẅí’te ngɔ́’ lyɛ’ɛ́ létsɔ́’te mentsaŋ.
en: the Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:

ngiemboon: Pà zí’i pʉ̀a cÿɔ̌ nò, pɔ́ tsẅiŋe kʉ́kʉ́b wɔ́b tɛ’, ńzẅíŋe móm tà pɔ́ té pɔ́gɔ lézoonte mezẅìge mie é gẅíin legú’ wɔ́.
en: but chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuousare they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoonte wɔ́b pú’u, tá mbà mbɔɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ké tè*lɔ̌’ mɛ̌ mezẅìge tú, ḿbiŋ ńké tè sẅiŋe wɔ́b mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́. Tá ńké ńgẅiin metʉ̀ ńcʉa pɛ̌ pà zí’i pʉ̀a cÿɔ̌ nò.
en: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà tè legyè pá’ menɔ̀ɔn, é pie é la fó jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie mé ge lʉ’ lejÿɔ̀’ lɔg gwoon é zẅé. Pɔ́ zoonte mmó té ne ńzsé pá’ á gwɔ́, mé gÿo ńzẅé wɔ́b pá’ menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg pú’u, ńkẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ menò tepòŋ mie pɔ́ la fʉ̀’. Anò poŋo wɔ́b tɛ’ légÿo shúm tepòŋ sie membùm mɔ́b ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, tà pá’ á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ zsǒ. Pia pɔ́ pǔ ńnéŋe ssé ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm tá wɛ̌ légwɔ́ gwɔ́ nò shʉ́, ḿbú ḿbÿɔ́g tɛ’, á nue á ne ḿbóŋo wɔ́b pá’ pɔ́ ne fʉte gẅí.
en: and shall receive the reward of unrighteousness,asthey that count it pleasure to riot in the daytime. Spotsthey areand blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

ngiemboon: Sɔ́b legyè tyé pɔ́ ná pànzwě. Pɔ́ té kʉa légÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ lÿɔgte pʉ̀a pie é pÿɛ́ pÿɛ́. Letʉ́m sɔ́b ée fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtyé pɔ́ nà pì gie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jÿó. Ndoon ee twó pɔ́b.
en: having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lěen ńgwá’a mánzsè gẅie à tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ḿbyé, ńcʉ́’ ńgiŋe pɔ́ ná we Mbalam, míŋ Bozor. Mbà mé la ná nkáb mbwo yé, ńdɔg ńjúu yé pá’ à ge gÿo nò tepòŋ. Á líe nkáb é póŋo yé, á zẅíŋ.
en: which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaamthe sonof Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé kàga yé ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ we nà nò gie à fʉ̌a. Á jú’ nzikássèe gie ee tě shwóŋó wɔ́ gɔɔn nò pá’ nyìŋ mesoŋ la, ńdɔg ńjɔ́’ɔ mánzsè mbwo yé ná yɛ̌ gʉ̀gʉ̀ nò gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgÿó.
en: but was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with man's voice forbad the madness of the prophet.

ngiemboon: Pà zí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé pé cÿɔ̌ nò ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà’ jʉ’ gie ntse kɔ́ɔn ńkẅɛ’ɛ wò, é kěen ńjúm la, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mbʉ̀ŋ gie é kwɔ̌’, à fóm kaa ńdɔg ńgʉa. E Ssé lěen ńnyɛte jʉ’ʉ yɔ́b ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ssé nzěm.
en: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ mmó gie pɔ́ zí’i pʉ̀a ńŋá’te, tá é gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ gie é zẅɛɛ. Pɔ́ gɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a ngie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mbùm nyìŋ mesoŋ tsɔ́ɔn, tá á gwɔ́ nò shʉ́. Pɔ́ lɔg pú’u, éshwoŋte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ka nyé ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie ée nà mánzsè tepòŋ,
en: For when they speak great swellingwordsof vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh,through muchwantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ ne shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ge gÿo pɔ́ le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn wɔ́, tá kwà’ pɔ́b yɔ́b gwɔ́ menkwɔɔn mbwo shúm sie pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn, é piŋ ńne ḿbyága wɔ́b. Ammó lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńjÿó ntʉ́m nyìŋ, à ngàŋ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kwɔɔn mbwo yɛ̌ mmó.
en: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.

ngiemboon: E pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńdɔg pá’ pɔ́ zsé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ, éfó nà ncÿǒ gẅie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńkẅɛ, ńgÿo ńgíŋ ḿbiŋe tsoló, ńzẅíŋ sɛ̌ shúm pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, mbà pɔ́ ge pÿɔ́g tà cʉa pá’ pɔ́ ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́.
en: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

ngiemboon: Mvfò kaa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le zsé mánzsè ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́, ńcʉa pá’ pɔ́ ge zsé mbʉ̌ Ssé mie mé ka zí’i wɔ́b e piŋ gwa’.
