en: After this I looked, and, behold, a doorwasopened in heaven: and the first voice which I heardwasas it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said,Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé lêen ńgwoon wɔ̀ɔn, n gwóon ńgyá tsɔ́ lʉŋe lefùɔ tyé tÿǒ lepwó, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńnéŋe mǒ.
en: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, andonesat on the throne.

ngiemboon: À la ŋwʉŋe pɔ́ pá’ tsɔ̌ ntí metóon pie ée pe tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, mé tóŋo tsɔ̌ lê Jaspe, ńtóŋo wetsɔ̌ lê Sardoine la. Nkwòŋ nnù ngém kéle lʉŋe lefùɔ ŋwɛ́ ńnéŋe soŋ ńne ŋwʉŋe pá’ tsɔ̌ ntí tóon tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo lê Emerod.
en: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: andthere wasa rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ melʉŋe lefùɔ ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm mbʉ́a la kéle yɛ̌ lʉŋe lefùɔ ńnéŋe soŋ. Melÿò ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm mbʉ́a néŋte mǒ, ḿma’ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, ńtɔ’ mecÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte.
en: And round about the thronewerefour and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

ngiemboon: Menne mbʉ̀ŋ la ne fóo ná lʉŋe lefùɔ ńkẅɛɛ. Mengyè pʉ̀a ne fóo mǒ ńkwɔ́’ɔ. Lefàŋ ne fóo mǒ ḿvɛ́te. Melâm sɔɔn mbʉ́a tyéte mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńne ńkÿó, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Mezẅìge sɔɔn mbʉ́a mie ée me Ssé.
en: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: andthere wereseven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ soŋ jʉ’ gie lʉŋe lefùɔ tyé wó, etsɔ̌ ntí menɔ̀ɔn, ńgwɔ́ tà ńgwɔ́ lekùa tyé ńkéle lʉŋe lefùɔ ńnéŋe soŋ. Menÿɔ́g pú ńgwɔ́ ná pɔ́b, á mvfò mbɔɔ nzèm.
en: And before the thronethere wasa sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne,werefour beasts full of eyes before and behind.

ngiemboon: Andùŋ mvfò ná pɔ́b la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pú’ ntʉ̀ la, ambɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mûɔ fòŋ gẅie aa ndúm, ambɔ́ɔntè yétá gẅiin shÿó wé, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ we nyìŋ mesoŋ la, ambɔ́ɔntè lekùa gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ gúm ndóŋ gẅie à ne ńzie la.
en: And the first beastwaslike a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beastwaslike a flying eagle.

ngiemboon: aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé Ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm, á gẅie à laa wó, aa wó, à piŋ ńne ńtóo.
en: And the four beasts had each of them six wings abouthim; andthey werefull of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ngwòŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm gie menɔ̀ɔn pɔɔn lekùa ne ńzɔbɔ, ńdɔgɔ ńnáa legú’, ńdɔgɔ ńnáa mekù’, ńdɔgɔ ńnáa ndǎg mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn,
en: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,

ngiemboon: melÿò pá ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm mbʉ́a, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te mvfò nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńgu’te yé nyìŋ gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn, ńtsɔ́’ mecÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ twó pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ nùŋe mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: the four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,

ngiemboon: gù zɔ piŋ ńne ńkwoŋo tá é gwɔ́ wó.
en: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie à la ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ la, á gẅiin tà’ shʉ̀a ffo ŋwà’ne á nà pwó yé ye tʉ̀, mbà mé la ŋwe’e mmó mǒ, á nzèm ntsèm, ńkáte, ńdɔgɔ lìi nŋwá’ ńdɔg ńdyɛtenà mejʉ’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńgyá tsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à gẅiin metʉ̀, á gɔɔn lê ngyè tétʉ́ʉ ngie: Tà nyìŋ aa wó gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á ku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á nyɛ́’te lìi nŋwá’, ńkyɛ́’ɛ ŋwà’ne yɔɔn?
en: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, mé té gyá nyìŋ fó tÿǒ lepwó, kà ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́, kà tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’ wɔ́, ńku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á kyɛ́’, ḿbiŋ ńdíe mmó gie áa tsoló wɔ́.
en: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá pú’u, ńzye lélʉa tɛ’, mélà’mie mé kaa gyá nyìŋ gẅie à ku’u lékyɛ́’ɛ tà’ shʉ̀a ffo ŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńdíe mmó gie áa tsoló wɔ́.
en: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ná melÿò pá tó ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tè gíŋe ńdʉa. Nyìŋ aa ssé. Pú’ ntʉ̀ gẅie à fóo ná tsìŋe ndá Jẅida, é lejÿɔ́g mmó sie é fóo ná lenŋàŋ fùɔ Ndavíd, à kéen ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tà ńcʉa nò tepòŋ. À ge lɔg pú’u, é ku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á kyɛ́’te lìi nŋwá’ gie mé la lyɛte nà mejʉ’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, é piŋ kyɛ́’ɛ tà’ shʉ̀a ffo ŋwà’ne.
en: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, mèŋ n deen ńké ńgyá mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò tyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lʉŋe lefùɔ, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn lekùa, mbɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ melÿò, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé la shʉ́ʉ lóŋ we la. Mendóŋ gwɔ́ twó yé sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Menÿɔ́g mé gwɔ́ sɔɔn mbʉ́a ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mezẅìge sɔɔn mbʉ́a mie ée me Ssé, é mie e Ssé ne ńtúmo wɔ́b ngwòŋ jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò tóo lejʉ́ŋ nyìŋ gẅie à la ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ la, ńkẅé ŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́ gie à la gẅiin nà pwó yé ye tʉ̀.
en: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò la kẅé ŋwà’ne tà ńgẅiin, menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa, mbɔɔ melÿò pɛ̌ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ lê móm mbʉ́a kẅí’te mvfò yé. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ gẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí kekÿɛ̀ mbɔɔ mentú’ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, lamendɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsoló tà ńdúe, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mesẅíŋte pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and fourandtwenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

ngiemboon: ńcu’u wɔ́b pú’u, pɔ́ piŋe mbwo Ssé.
en: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo sá’ pʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: and hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

ngiemboon: N nyé ńdíe lǐe, ńjú’, ngyè*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, pɔ́ gwɔ́ mentsá’ tà ngwɔ́ mé le sáŋ ńzsé nzẅìŋ wɔ́, mbà pɔ́ tÿɔ’ɔ́ lʉŋe lefùɔ, mbàa menɔ̀ɔn pá lâ melÿò pá, ńnéŋe soŋ,
en: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;

ngiemboon: ńnáa legú’ né yé, ńzɔb lezíŋ sé.
en: saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ mbwo mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power,beunto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔb pú’u, menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa lêen ńké ngie*Amen. Melÿò pá lêen ńké ńkẅí’te ssé, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And the four beasts said, Amen. And the fourandtwenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: N nyé ńdíe lǐe, ńgyá mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ ná ndùŋ mvfò jʉ’ ná mejʉ’ mɛ̌ sɔɔn mbʉ́a. N jú’ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa gɔɔn nò lê tsɔ̌ ngyè gie e gwá’a lefàŋ sie é vɛ́te la ngie: Tóo.
en: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.

ngiemboon: N díe ńgyá, tà’ fɔ́gɔ lÿóon kẅɛ, nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ á gẅiin kyɛ̀’. Mé náa cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ mbwo yé. Á ne ńgee, ńgiŋe ńtuɔ mengwòŋ, ńne sá’a.
en: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, n jú’ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a kwé’e ngyè ye tÿǒ ngie: Tóo.
en: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ lÿóon gwóon ńkẅɛ, ḿbaŋ pá’ mmɔ̌g la. Mé ná metʉ̀ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à la ńnéŋe mǒ ngie à gʉa ḿma’a tág ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge sele sɔbte mennɛ́ mɔ́b é kwéte, ńgÿo pú’u, ńnáa máamáa nně ncù né yé.
en: And there went out another horsethat wasred: andpowerwas given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, n jú’ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yétá kwé’e ngyè ye tÿǒ ngie: Tóo. N díe ńgyá tà’ ssé lÿóon kẅɛ. Nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ gẅiin kílo lɔg fʉ̀’ʉ mmó mbwo yé.
en: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.

ngiemboon: N jú’ tsɔ́ mmó fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn lekùa ńkẅɛ, ńgwá’a ngyè nyìŋ la, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Gÿo ná ntí gie mé ge lɔg nkába fà’ ye tà’a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, éjú pɔ́ ndà’ tà’ kílo ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, ńgwɔ́ gie e lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngesáŋ yege, mé lɔg nkába fà’ ye tà’a lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, ńjúu kílo yétá, ńgʉa nà mèvɛ pɔ́ melù’, tè gÿo ná ntí gie mé ge zág.
en: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; andseethou hurt not the oil and the wine.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè lekùa, n jú’ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè lekùa kwé’e ngyè ye tÿǒ ngie: Tóo.
en: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.

ngiemboon: N díe ńgyá atsɔ̌ lÿóon kẅɛ, ńgeme síŋ sǐŋ. Lezíŋ nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ gwɔ́ le legwé. À jʉ’ gie mepfó ée wó á gwɔ́ nzèm ye. Mé gabte ndùmo tsetsá’ nzsè lekùa, ńnáa tà’ nzsè ngie pɔ́ sá’ légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge lɔg nně ncù, é lɔgɔ gwáŋa, é lɔgɔ gwá’a mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ̀, é zẅéte pʉ̀a ná yɛ̌ gwǒŋ.
en: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̀a, mèŋ n gyá mentʉ́m pʉ̀a pie mé la zẅéte wɔ́b, mélà’mie pɔ́ la shwóŋó nò Ssé mbɔɔ ná pá’ pɔ́ la gɔɔn mmó gie pɔ́ zsé nà nò Yěsô, é nuŋte tsìŋe jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó,
en: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:

ngiemboon: ńne ńga’te lê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔ́ɔ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à shwóŋó nò nénʉ́, ɔ̀ ge zẅí’te tà kú pɔ́ síŋe, tá ŋag pʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, é néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pɔ́b ńtí pá’ pɔ́ la zẅéte wég?
en: and they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńnáa fɔ́gɔ zsǒ mbwo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ná’a ńgíŋe ḿbʉ́le ńzẅí’te méjʉ’, apfwɔ́’ɔ mefɛ́ pɔ́b pie pâ pɔ̌ kɔ́ɔn ḿbú fa’a fà’a Ssé, é tó tà ḿmag, á nue á ne ńzɛ́te ngie me gíŋe ńzẅéte wɔ́b yɔ́b pá’ pɔ́b.
en: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as theywere, should be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò ne ńnyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́, n ne ńdíe, ńjú’ atsetsá’ pú ńcʉ’e pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, nèm sele síŋ pá’ nzsǒ gie mé lɔgɔ ńdúŋo legwé la. Saŋ pú sele ḿbaŋ pá’ metse la.
en: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;

ngiemboon: Mecÿɔ́’ saŋ fó lefaŋ ńkeme ḿbʉle ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ pá’ máamáa fóm ne ńcʉa, mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ mie é kaa tʉʉ é keme ḿbʉle ssé pú’u la.
en: and the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ mag pá’ tà’ shʉa ffò ŋwà’ne gẅie mé ně ńkate la. Mé fó ná mejʉ’ mie mekwɛ́ ée wó, tà mbɔɔ ná mejʉ’ mie melá’ mie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ ée wó, ésa’ ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

ngiemboon: Mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, memáa pʉ̀a, mentándá pà lÿɔ́’ ncù, megàŋ nkáb, megàŋ metʉ̀, menkwɔ̀ɔn tà mbɔɔ pà ndù nnɛ́. Pɔ́ métsèm lyeen tsɛ̀ɛ memvwɔ́’, á nà metóon mie ée ndùm mekwɛ́,
en: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn mbwo mekwɛ́, mbɔɔ mbwo memáa metóon ngie: Pí keme sẅɛ́ɛ wég, ńdÿoon wég. Nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ lɛ, á le gíŋe ńgyá wég wɔ́. Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò le gíŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ ná peg wɔ́.
en: and said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:

ngiemboon: Á nue máamáa lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gie pɔ́ ge gyáŋa lóŋ aa pá’ɔɔn, mbà a tǒ, ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ vwɔ’ɔ?
en: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?

ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔntè ńgyá*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé lekùa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, é tyéte ná meshÿó lekùa, ńne ńtáte mefefà lekùa mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, légwɔ́ gie atsɔ̌ fefà tè cʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́, é ké le cʉa ndùm ntse té pàa wɔ́, é ké le cʉ’e tsɔ̌ tà’a tÿǒ wɔ́.
en: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá tsɔ̌ tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, á ne fóo shÿó sá’ nèm ńkwɔ́’ɔ né tÿǒ, ńgẅiin mmó gie e Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, aa ńdɔgɔ ńcÿɔ’ɔ liŋé yé nà mmó. Wɛ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn mbwo*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé lekùa pie mé la túmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa gÿo nò tepòŋ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbɔɔ ná ntse té pàa la ngie:
en: And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God: and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwóon ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Tà pi gÿo ná ntse té pàa. Tà pi gÿo ná metÿǒ. Pi zẅí’te tà peg cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé nà zǐ pafa’a fà’ Ssé yege.
en: saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńké ńjú’ mé gɔɔn ngie, epʉ̀a pie mé cÿɔ’ɔ́ liŋé ye Ssé nà zǐ yɔ́b ée pʉ̀a ntsá’ nkÿo lê ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm lekùa (144.000), ḿbú fóo nà metsìŋe ndá púɔ pà Israel ntsèm ntsèm.
en: And I heard the number of them which were sealed:and there weresealed an hundredandfortyandfour thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.

ngiemboon: Á la gʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Jẅida, mé cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé ná pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Rẅiben, é gwɔ́ ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Gad, é gwɔ́ ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000),
en: Of the tribe of Judaweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Reubenweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Gadweresealed twelve thousand.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Asɛ̀ɛ, é gwɔ́ ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Neftali, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Manase, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000),
en: Of the tribe of Aserweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Nepthalimweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Manassesweresealed twelve thousand.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Simeon, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Lěvi, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Isakar, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000),
en: Of the tribe of Simeonweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Leviweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Issacharweresealed twelve thousand.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Zabulon, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Joseph, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000), ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ Mběnjameŋ, é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém (12.000) pie mé cÿɔ’ɔ́ liŋé ye Ssé nà zǐ yɔ́b.
en: Of the tribe of Zabulonweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Josephweresealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Benjaminweresealed twelve thousand.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, e Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá nùɔ lá’ gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le sáŋ tà ńzsé nzẅìŋ wɔ́. Mbà pʉ̀a fǒ nà mengwòŋ ntsèm, éfó nà mengẅɛ̀ mengẅɛ̀, ńgwɔ́ mentí mentí, éshwóŋó meshwóŋè ntí ntí mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Pɔ́ la tyé mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, mbɔɔ mvfò Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ḿma’ meféfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, ńgẅiin meyáŋa letÿǒon,
en: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

ngiemboon: ńne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ létsẅɛ́ à fóo mbwo Ssé yege gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ mbɔɔ mbwo Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò.
en: and cried with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God which sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé métsèm tyéte ńtÿɔ́’ɔ lʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé, ńtÿɔ́’ melÿò, mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn lekùa ńnéŋe soŋ.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ŋwɛ́ gwe ssé, ésɔb shÿó wɔ́b ssé, á mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńgu’te Ssé,
en: And all the angels stood round about the throne, andaboutthe elders and the four beasts, and fell before the throne on their faces, and worshipped God,

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:*Amen, agù’te, legú’, azse nò, lenǎ ndǎg, lenǎ mekù’, metʉ̀ pâ ngʉ̀’ e gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ̌ɔn.*Amen.
en: saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might,beunto our God for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná melÿò lêen ńké ńzɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn ngie: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn pie pɔ́ ma’ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ lɔɔn ée pà wɔ̌, ḿbiŋe fóo nzɔ̌?
en: And one of the elders answered, saying unto me, What are these which are arrayed in white robes? and whence came they?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsɔ́’ ngie, a Ndè, gù zɔ ne ńzsé. Á gɔɔn ngie ée pʉ̀a pie éfóo tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa ngɔ́’ ya. Pɔ́ ka lɔg metse mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ésɔg menzsǒ mɔ́b tà é lʉ́a, ńcʉ́’ʉ féfɔ́gɔ.
en: And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest. And he said to me, These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo pɔ́ tyé mvfò lʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé, á tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ yé, ńne ńgu’te yé zsó pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’. Nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ, à ge taa ntàb we é lɔg kábte wɔ́b.
en: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them.

ngiemboon: Nzyè é le gíŋe ńgyáŋa wɔ́b gwɔ́, agàga yɔ́b le gíŋe é shÿó wɔ́. Nèm le gíŋe ńcúɔ ndù pɔ́b wɔ́. Atsɔ́ mmó le gíŋe ńgÿo mbùm yɔb tween wɔ́.
en: They shall hunger no more, neither thirst any more; neither shall the sun light on them, nor any heat.

ngiemboon: Á nue mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gẅie à tyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lʉŋe lefùɔ ge gwɔ́ ngàŋa pyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b, é lɔgɔ wɔ́b é gʉa nà meti’í ntse, á jʉ’ gie ntse ge gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó. E Ssé gÿo ḿbú ńtsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b ntsèm.
en: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò la gwɔ́ tà nyɛ́’ɛ lìi nŋwá’ nà jʉ’ mbɔ́ɔntè Sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ejʉ’ pú ńdáŋte tÿǒ lepwó lê kěm nà mmó minẅid móm ntá.
en: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá mé ná mentàŋ Sɔɔn mbʉ́a á mbwo*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a pie pɔ́ ée ntyé mvfò Ssé.
en: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tó ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ shúm gyě wó, ńgẅiin mmó gie mé ńnéŋe mmó gyě tsoló ńtuɔ. Á gwɔ́, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte. Mé náa laméndɔ́ɔn mbwo yé tà á gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn pá’, à ge temte mesẅíŋtè pʉ̀a Ssé mǒ, é tuɔ jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó, é náa mbwo Ssé. Yɛ̌ jʉ’ gwɔ́, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte. Á gwɔ́ mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ.
en: And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offeritwith the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.

ngiemboon: Ndyé melaméndɔ́ɔn lâ mesẅíŋtè pʉ̀a Ssé fó mbwo*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ńkwɔ́’ ńgʉa ne mvfò Ssé.
en: And the smoke of the incense,which camewith the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angel's hand.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé piŋ ńkaa mmó gie mé tuɔ shúm gyě tsoló, ńnéŋ mmɔ̌g gẅie éfóo jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó tà é lúe, á zé’e ḿma’a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Lefàŋ vɛ́te. Mé jú’ mengyè, ńgyá menně mbʉ̀ŋ. Atsetsá’ ńcʉ’e.
en: And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and castitinto the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.

ngiemboon: *Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie pɔ́ la gẅiin mentàŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a la, pɔ́ nyɛte mbùm yɔb pá’ pɔ́ gee ńtóŋ mentàŋ ŋwɛ́.
en: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

ngiemboon: Ndùŋ mvfò tóŋ wé ntàŋ. Mé ma’ megẅì lê mmɔ̌g á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Á gwɔ gwɔ́ mbà mé temté metse mǒ. Tà’ nzsè á nà ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ nzsè tá, pú shÿó lê metÿǒ, lâ legǐ gẅie à ne sẅéte.
en: The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a tóŋ wé ntàŋ. Etsɔ́ ntí máamáa lekwɛ́ sie mé těm mmɔ̌g mǒ, mé zé’e ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa. Tà’ nzsè ntse té pàa nà menzsè méntá sele ńcʉ́’ metse.
en: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;

ngiemboon: Tà’ nzsè ná shúm sie ée ntse tà ńŋele ŋele á nà nzsè tá pú ńdége. Tà’ nzsè nà mestíma nzsè tá pú ńtágte.
en: and the third part of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè yétá tóŋ wé ntàŋ. Atsɔ̌ máamáa cÿɔ́’ saŋ fóo lefàŋ ńgwe, ńne ńkÿó pá’ máamáa nkà’ mmɔ̌g gẅie mé lǐɛ la, ńgwe pú’u, ná tà’ nzsè nà memí nzsè tá tà mbɔɔ ná mesá’a ntse.
en: And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ wɛ̌ cÿɔ́’ saŋ gwɔ́ lé melẅe mie ée mecÿɔ́b, tà’ nzsè ná mentse nzsè tá cʉ́’ melẅe ŋwɛ́ mie ée mecÿɔ́b. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kwéte ńtí pá’ pɔ́ nǔ wɛ̌ ntse gẅie é cʉ́’ʉ ńdẅe lẅe.
en: and the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè lekùa tóŋ wé ntàŋ. Ammó cʉa ná tà’ nzsè lejÿɔ́g nèm á nà nzsè tá, ńcʉa ná tà’ nzsè lejÿɔ́g saŋ á ná nzsè tá, ńcʉa ná tà’ nzsè mecÿɔ́’ saŋ á ná nzsè tá légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge cʉ́’ʉ lékyɛ’ jʉ’, tà’ nzsè pyé mǒ á nà nzsè tá, mbɔɔ pá’ fʉ̀’e zsó ge pyé tà’ nzsè nèm, afʉ̀’e lêtsẅɛ́’ à gíŋe ḿbyé yé tà’ nzsè ná saŋ lâ mecÿɔ́’ saŋ á nà nzsè tá.
en: And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.

ngiemboon: N nyé ńdíe lǐe, ńjú’ atsɔ̌ máamáa gúm ndóŋ gẅie à la ne ńzie tàa tÿǒ á ne ńgɔɔn nê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Pi ee pà shÿó tepòŋ. Pi ee pà shÿó tepòŋ. Pi ee pà shÿó tepòŋ. Pi pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńtí ngyè mentàŋ mie*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé méntá nyé tá ńgee ńtóŋo.
en: And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound!

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̀a tóŋ wé ntaŋ. Mèŋ n gyá tsɔ̌ cÿɔ́’ saŋ, mbà à ně fó lepwó ńgwe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mé náa kí lɔg ńtsɔ́’ ncwò pÿé té lǎŋ mbwo ye.
en: And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́’ saŋ awɛ̌ tsɔ́’ ncwò pÿé té lǎŋ. Ndyé fó wó ńkwɔ́’ pá’ ndyé gẅie éfóo jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ tsǎ’ wó la. Wɛ̌ ndyé pú ńjÿó jʉ’ tà mé té gíŋe ńgyá lejÿɔ́g nèm wɔ́.
en: And he opened the bottomless pit; and there arose a smoke out of the pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit.

ngiemboon: Ngǐm kẅɛte tsɛ̀ɛ ndyé mmɔ̌g ŋwɛ́, ḿbú sa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mé ná metʉ̀ mbwo pɔ́b lélɔg ńtsɔ́gte pʉ̀a pá’ mengɔ́ɔn ssé mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ńtsɔ́gte pʉ̀a la.
en: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.

ngiemboon: Mé tsẅii mbwo pɔ́b ngie tà pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ ná legǐ, ńgie tà pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ ná tsɔ́ mmó gie á sa’á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, tà ńne sẅéte, ńgie pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ ná tsɔ́ tÿǒ, ńgie pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ pɔ́ ná pʉ̀a pie à liŋé ye Ssé á té nà zǐ yɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads.

ngiemboon: Mé la tè náa wɔ́b metʉ̀, á gwɔ́ lélɔg ńzẅé pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. Á la gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńnáa wɔ́b ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ná nǎ mesaŋ métʉ̀a. Yɛ̌ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ lêen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ gie nyìŋ gyá ná pá’ ngɔ́ɔn ssé tsɔgɔ́ yé la.
en: And to them it was given that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months: and their tormentwasas the torment of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.

ngiemboon: Á ge gwɔ́ nà mesaŋ ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a mesoŋ fa’a legwé pɔ́ légyá, é tsɔ́ɔn lékwé, tá legwé kÿo wɔ́b kÿo.
en: And in those days shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and shall desire to die, and death shall flee from them.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ngǐm ŋwɛ́ e la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ melÿóon pie mé nyɛté wɔ́b lélɔg ńgʉa ńdÿɔ́’ ncù la. Atsɔ́ mmó laa twó pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte la. Meshÿó mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ meshÿó pʉ̀a mesoŋ la.
en: And the shapes of the locustswerelike unto horses prepared unto battle; and on their headswereas it were crowns like gold, and their faceswereas the faces of men.

ngiemboon: Menòŋo twó mɔ́b la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ menòŋo twó pànzwě la. Mesoŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mesoŋ pú’ ntʉ̀ la.
en: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were asthe teethof lions.

ngiemboon: Kʉ́kʉ́b wɔb la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé zǎb nzsǒ ncù gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńtsó á mǒ la. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ne ńzie, mbabá mɔ́b gÿo jʉ’ zẅɛ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mekélêg mie melÿóon tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne shwoŋo, é ne ńzẅɛɛ ńcʉa ńgee ńdÿɔ́’ ncù la.
en: And they had breastplates, as it were breastplates of iron; and the sound of their wingswasas the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.

ngiemboon: Menku mɔ́b lâ mesisìŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mengɔɔn ssé la. Metʉ̀ mɔ́b lélɔg ńná pʉ̀a ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á nà mesaŋ métʉ̀a éfó ná menku mɔ́b.
en: And they had tails like unto scorpions, and there were stings in their tails: and their powerwasto hurt men five months.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa mbwo pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ pá’ fùɔ wɔb, ésá’a wɔ́b, é gwɔ́*ssé tepòŋgie e gẅiin nò ná pÿé té lǎŋ gẅie lezíŋ sé ée nà shwóŋè pa Heber ńgwɔ́ lê abaddon, ńgwɔ́ nà shwóŋè pà Gelekia ńgwɔ́ lê Apolion ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: ngàŋa tág.
en: And they had a king over them,which isthe angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew tongueisAbaddon, but in the Greek tongue hathhisname Apollyon.

ngiemboon: Ndùŋ mvfò ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉ̌a. Á yɔɔn metsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ mémbʉ́a gwɔ́ nzèm ńne ńtóo.
en: One woe is past;and, behold, there come two woes more hereafter.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́ tóŋ wé ntaŋ. N jú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè fó ná mendóŋ lekùa mie ée nà jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ shúm gyě wó ńkẅɛɛ. Yɛ̌ jʉ’ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte.
en: And the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God,

ngiemboon: Ngyè ŋwɛ́ tsẅii mbwo*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie aa mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́, gẅie à la gẅiin ntaŋ ngie à kyɛ́’te*messé tepòŋ lekùa pie mé la lɔg metsɛ̂n ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse gẅie mé tóŋo lê Efalate la.
en: saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńkyɛ́’te*messé tepòŋ ápɛ̌ lekùa. Mbà Ssé la cwoŋte wɔ́b ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’, á wɛ̌ saŋ, é yɛ̌ ngù’, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge zẅé tà’ nzsè á nà pʉ̀a mesoŋ nzsè tá.
en: And the four angels were loosed, which were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n jú’ mé gɔɔn nzẅìŋ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie é lɔgɔ melÿóon ńgiŋe ngie pɔ́ ée memillion nkÿo pʉ́a.
en: And the number of the army of the horsemenweretwo hundred thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn pá’ e Ssé la nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n gyá melÿóon, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é laa ndùm wó. Pɔ́ la ma’a kème nzsǒ ncù gie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńgÿo, á gwɔ́ kʉ́kʉ́b pɔ́b ḿbaŋa pá’ mmɔ̌g la, ńgíŋe ńgʉme gʉme pá’ tsɔ́ tóon gẅie nzẅìŋ ée mǒ tɛ’ la, ńgíŋe ńne ḿbaŋa pá’ ffò tÿó gie á ne ńkwé la. Atwó melÿóon la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ twó pú’ ntʉ̀ la. Mmɔ̌g, lê ndyé mbɔɔ tsɔ̌ ntí*mekʉ̀a ne fóo ncwò pɔ́b ńkẅɛɛ.
en: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and them that sat on them, having breastplates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horseswereas the heads of lions; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone.

ngiemboon: Mmɔ̌g ŋwɛ́, lâ ndyé, mbɔɔ lâ yɛ̌ ntí*mekʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ée shúm sa sie é náa ngɔ́’, mbà é la ne fóo ncwò melÿóon ńkẅɛɛ la, é la zẅé tà’ nzsè ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ nzsè tá.
en: By these three was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issued out of their mouths.

ngiemboon: Á nue metʉ̀ melÿóon é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò pɔ́b, mbɔɔ ná mesǎŋ mɔ́b. Mesǎŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ mennú la, ńgẅiin metwó, ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ mɛ̌ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: For their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their tailswerelike unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do hurt.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pfwɔ́’ɔ pʉ̀a pie sɔɔn shúm sie é náa ngɔ́’ la tè wɔ́b zẅé, pɔ́ ké tè kúbe mà wɔ́b ńgwá’ mefà’ tepòŋ mie pɔ́ fa’a wɔ́. Pɔ́ la tè nyé légu’te*messé tepòŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ té nyé légu’te shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ee messé wɔ́, é sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, kà pɔ́ sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte wɔ́, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nʉ̀ ńnyɛte wɔ́, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ tóon ńnyɛte wɔ́, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ kème tÿǒ ńnyɛte wɔ́, éshúm sie é té ku’u légyá jʉ’ wɔ́, ńké tè ku’u lé jú’u nò wɔ́, ńké tè ku’u légiŋ wɔ́.
en: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship devils, and idols of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone, and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋ tè kúbe mà wɔ́b, ńnyé lézẅé nyìŋ wɔ́, ńké tè nyé lekàŋ wɔ́, ńké tè nyé pá’ ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa lâ pànzwě tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kẅɛ́te wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe wɔ́, ńké tè tsǒŋ nyé.
en: neither repented they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá tsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à gẅiin metʉ̀, á ne fóo lepwó sẅɛ́’ɛ, etsɔ̌ ntí melɔ́ɔn pwoon mbùm ye pá’ nzsǒ pwoon mbùm nyìŋ la. Nkwòŋ nnù ngém zéme twó yé. Eshÿó wé gwɔ́ pá’ lejÿɔ́g nèm la. Mentɔ́ɔn mé gwɔ́ pá’ melʉ́me mmɔ̌g mie é pʉ’ʉ́ nnɛ́ ńtyé tyé la.
en: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud: and a rainbowwasupon his head, and his facewasas it were the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire:

ngiemboon: À la gẅiin tsɔ̌ mûɔ méŋwà’ne mbwó yé, á gwɔ́ we nkyɛ’té, ńzé’e kwò yé ye tʉ̀ ńtÿɔ́gɔ ndùm ntse té pàa, ńtÿɔ́gɔ ye kyɛ̀bɛ á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’,
en: and he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, andhisleftfooton the earth,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńga’te lê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ pá’ pú’ ntʉ̀ gẅie à ne ńcu’u la, ńga’te pú’u, mé jú’ lefaŋ vɛ́te vɛtě ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: and cried with a loud voice, aswhena lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ la vɛ́te ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a pú’u, tà mèŋ n ne fa’a léŋwe’e mmó gie lefaŋ gɔ̌ɔn, ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ fóo lefaŋ ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Lÿoon nò gie lefaŋ vɛtě ngʉ̀a sɔɔn mbʉ́a ńgɔɔn. Tè ŋwe’e.
en: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write: and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered, and write them not.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie mèŋ n ne ńgyá yé á tyé ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò yé ndùm ntsè té pàa, yetsɔ́ gwɔ́ ndùmo tsetsá’ la, á ka’a pwó yé ye tʉ̀ ńnáa tÿǒ ńne ńkʉa,
en: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven,

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ nyìŋ gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn, yé gẅie à la nyɛte lefaŋ mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsoló, yé gẅie à la nyɛte tsetsá’ mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa ndùmo, yé gẅie à la nyɛte ntse té pàa mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsoló, ńkʉa, ńgɔɔn ngie atsɔ̌ légíŋe ńzẅí’te à tè nyé ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: and sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé we mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a zyě létoŋ wé ntaŋ, ammó gie e Ssé la záb, á gwɔ́ lelyěen, à pumte ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn mbwo pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé pá’ pɔ́ fa’a mbwo yé.
en: but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound, the mystery of God should be finished, as he hath declared to his servants the prophets.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ngyè nyìŋ gie mèŋ n ně ńzɔɔn ńjú’ éfó tÿǒ lepwó ńgɔɔn nò la, é gíŋe ńgɔɔn né mèŋ tsɔ́ legʉ̀a ngie: Gʉa, éfó mbwo*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à tyě ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò ndùm ntse té pàa, yetsɔ́ gwɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ lɛ, ńkẅé mûɔ méŋwà’ne gie mé kyɛ’té.
en: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and said, Goandtake the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gʉa lejʉ́ŋ*cÿɔ́’ Ssé ŋwɛ́, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à náa mûɔ méŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́ né mèŋ. Á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Kɔ̀, ḿpfɛ́. Á ge ké kúu lepfòm gù é lẅe lẅe, tá’, é ké gwɔ́ ncwò gù é lʉm pá’ lwò nŋwá’.
en: And I went unto the angel, and said unto him, Give me the little book. And he said unto me, Takeit, and eat it up; and it shall make thy belly bitter, but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ fó mbwo*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńkẅé mûɔ méŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́, ḿpfɛ́. Á gwɔ́ ncwò mèŋ ńdʉme pá’ nŋwá’ la. Tá mèŋ n gwɔ́ tà mi, á kúu lepfòm mèŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ ńdẅe lẅe.
en: And I took the little book out of the angel's hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

ngiemboon: Mé pɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gíŋe ńgʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé mbwo pʉ̀a ntí ntí, á mbwo ngwòŋo ngwòŋ, á mbwo pʉ̀a pie é shwóŋó meshwóŋè mentí mentí, mbɔɔ mbwo mefùɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And he said unto me, Thou must prophesy again before many peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.

ngiemboon: Mé gɔɔn pú’u, tà á ku’, mé ná tsɔ́ ntí kekà’a, á gwɔ́ pá’ kème mmó gie mé lɔgɔ fʉ’ʉ mmó, ńgwɔ ná, ńne ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Lu ssé éfʉ’ʉ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé gie áa Yerósalem, éfʉ’ mbɔɔ jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó, ésáŋ nzẅìŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée tsoló ńne ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein.

ngiemboon: Tá à ké ńgʉa ná tetʉ́a jʉ’e Ssé gie áa nzème pǐ, ɔ̀ nyé té fʉ’. Á nue mé la náa yɛ̌ tetʉ́a mbwo mengwòŋ mie é té Ssé zsé, tà pɔ́ ge gÿo neŋte tÿǒsoŋ Ndʉalʉ̌a neŋte nà mesaŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê móm lekùa,
en: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot fortyandtwo months.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná pʉ̀a pɔɔn mépʉ́a pie pɔ́ ge gɔɔn nò gie pɔ́ zsé ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo náa wɔ́b metʉ̀ lélɔg ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ wɔ̀ɔn. Pɔ́ ne ńtsẅii, ḿma’ menzsǒ lɔg ńdúŋ legwé ma’ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ntsá’ lê nkÿo pʉ́a lê móm ntɔgɔ́ (1.260).
en: And I will givepowerunto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundredandthreescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a pie pɔ́ gɔɔn nò gie pɔ́ zsé ná mèŋ, ée metÿǒ mèvɛ olive mémbʉ́a, ńgÿo melâm mémbʉ́a mie é tyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à sá’a njÿó ntsèm.
en: These are the two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne fa’a légege wɔ́b, á zsé ngie etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g ée fóo ncwò pɔ́b kẅɛ pyág megàŋ mbù pɔ́b. Áa nénʉ́ ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn fa’a légege wɔ́b, mbà ngàŋ ge kwé pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And if any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if any man will hurt them, he must in this manner be killed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńkíle mbʉ̀ŋ lefaŋ, á nà ntí gie mbʉ̀ŋ tě ge lúu nà melyɛ̌’ mie pɔ́ ne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́. Pɔ́ gíŋ ńgẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg sele ntse é cʉ́’ metse, ńgíŋe ńku’ pá’ pɔ́ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, pɔ́ gÿo ngɔ́’ ntí ntí tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pɔ́ ge gÿo ké gɔɔn nò gie pɔ́ ne ńzsé ná mèŋ tà tsẅé jʉ’, nkʉ̀’ʉ pà nɔ̀ɔn gie ee fóo tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ ńkwɔ́’ɔ, à tó ḿma’a wɔ́b lê ncù, ńjÿó wɔ́b, ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.

ngiemboon: Mepfó mɔ́b ge gÿo nuŋte ná lǎŋ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa tÿǒsoŋ. Mé lɔg ntí gie e Ssé lɔg ńgyá yé mmó, ńtóŋo wɛ̌ máa tÿǒsoŋ lê Sodom, mbɔɔ lê Egipto. Á gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé la zɔɔn ńkime Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔb ná tÿǒ nkǐ wó.
en: And their dead bodiesshall liein the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ mentí mentí, epʉ̀a ná mengẅɛ̀ mengẅɛ̀, pàshwóŋó meshwóŋè ntí ntí, mbɔɔ pà tèzsé Ssé ge lá’ gyá pá’ mepfó mɔ́b nuŋte gyá nà lyɛ̌’ tá lê kèm, é piŋ ké le zẅíŋ ngie mé kaa pfó sɔ́b ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mesyè wó.
en: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ge gÿo kág é tí pá’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn mépʉ́a kwě. Anò poŋo wɔ́b. Nyìŋ túm lepu’ú ńnáa mbwo shǔ we, à gíŋe ńná sé. Pɔ́ yé lɔg pú’u, ńkág. Á nue pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ ŋwɛ́ mépʉ́a ka ná pʉ̀a ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ tɛ’.
en: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them, and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.

ngiemboon: Tá’, melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ ma méntá lê kèm è gwɔ́ tà ńcʉa, a Zẅìge gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, à fó mbwo Ssé, ńtó ńkúu ná pɔ́b. Pɔ́ lu ssé ńtyé tyé. Ecÿɔ’ pú ńgwoon pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ńgyá mepfó mɔ́b.
en: And after three days and an half the spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pa mépʉ́a jú’, etsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ fóo tÿǒ lepwó ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwɔ́’ ńtó né jʉ’ɔɔn. Pɔ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn, megàŋ mbù pɔ́b ne ńgyá.
en: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them, Come up hither. And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud; and their enemies beheld them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ pú’u, atsetsá’ pú ńcʉ’e tɛ’. Tà’ nzsè tÿǒsoŋ á nà nzsè legém á kème. Tsetsá’ cʉ́’e pú’u, ńzẅete pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsá’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Apfwɔ́’ɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tsẅɛ̌, á gyá ḿbɔ́g, ńnáa legú’ mbwo Ssé gẅie à ńnéŋe tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And the same hour was there a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glory to the God of heaven.

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a lɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉa. Á ké yɔɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gwɔ́ mánzsè ńne ńtóo.
en: The second woe is past;and, behold, the third woe cometh quickly.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a tóŋ wé ntaŋ. Mé jú’*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé gwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Lesǎ’ njÿó cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege mbɔɔ ná mbwo*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à la tsɔ́’. Wɛ̌ lésá’ ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are becomethe kingdomsof our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: Melÿò pá ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm mbʉ́a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe nà melʉŋe lefùɔ mɔ́b á mvfò Ssé la, pɔ́ gwe ssé ésɔb shÿó wɔ́b ssé, ńne ńgu’te Ssé,
en: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ nue gù zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a njÿó á nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: saying, We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, which art, and wast, and art to come; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and hast reigned.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie ɔ̀ ge cÿɔ́gte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zɔ́gɔ ńtágte ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, tà ńgwɔ cʉ́me, ncwò jʉ’e Ssé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé, akʉ̀b gie e Ssé la lɔg ńgwaa*kʉ̀a kẅɛ ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ yé ŋwɛ́. Menně mbʉ̀ŋ kyɛ’ jʉ’. Mé jú’ ngyè*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńjú’ lefaŋ vɛ́te ngʉ̀a ngʉ̀a. Atsetsá’ cʉ’e. Megẅì pú ńgwe pá’ɔɔn tɛ’.
en: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ nkʉ̀’ʉ pà mmó kẅɛɛ lefaŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ mánzwě, á ma’ ye nzsǒ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ lejÿɔ́g nèm, ńtÿɔ́g mekwò mé ná saŋ, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ, mecÿɔ́’ saŋ gwɔ́ mǒ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém.
en: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars:

ngiemboon: À laa mánzwě shwoŋ, ńne ńga’te nue múɔ la ne ńdúmo yé, á ne ńgee ńzyé.
en: and she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó gíŋe ńkẅɛɛ lefaŋ, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ ntí máamáa nnù ngém ya, ḿbaŋa pá’ mmɔ̌g la, metwó mé gwɔ́ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, mendóŋ mé gwɔ́ legém, acÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ gwɔ́ ná metwó mé sɔɔn mbʉ́a ntsèm.
en: And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńdɔgɔ nku wé ńjÿɔgɔ tà’ nzsè ná Mecÿɔ́’ saŋ nzsè tá, ḿbÿɛɛ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńtyé mvfò manzwě wá, ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ pá’ à ge zyé à gwóon ńkaa múɔ ḿmi.
en: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ zyé mûɔ mbàŋa. Á gwɔ́ gẅie mé la tÿɔ́gɔ yé, á tyé ńku’ pá’ à ge lá’ lɔgɔ tÿǒ tʉ̌, ésá’ ngwòŋo ngwòŋ. Mé sa’a múɔ ŋwɛ́ ńdɔg ńkwɔ́’ né lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, né jʉ’ gie lʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé áa wó.
en: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, andtohis throne.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wa lêen ńké ńkÿo ńgʉa né nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, á nà jʉ’ gie Ssé la nyɛte pá’ à ge ńnéŋe wó, ńzsé ngie mé ge nyɛte jÿɔ́gɔ yé jÿɔ́g nà melyɛ̌’ lá’ ntsá’ lê nkÿo pʉ́a lê móm ntɔgɔ́ (1.260).
en: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundredandthreescore days.

ngiemboon: Ncù lêen ńké ńgwe tÿǒ lepwó, Méshÿɛɛ, tándá*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, lɔg*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pie ée nzèm yé, ḿma’ ntí máamáa nnù ngém ya lê ncù. Máamáa nnù ngém ŋwɛ́ lɔg mecÿɔ́’ pé, ńdÿɔ́’ɔ Méshÿɛɛ lê ncù.
en: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,

ngiemboon: Tá máamáa nnù ngém wa ké tè ncù jÿó. Ayɔ́b jʉ’ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́
en: and prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńtsó máa nnù ngém ya, pâ pé mecÿɔ́’, ḿbÿɛɛ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Áa yé ńgwɔ́ nnú yá gie e la fó tàa fʉ̀’e mvfò la, mé tóŋo yé lé ndebele, ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Sátà, aa yé gẅie à fʉte pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’
en: And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.

ngiemboon: Á nue mé tsǒ nyìŋ gẅie à kɔ̌ɔn ńzɔ́gɔ ńtyé mvfò Ssé yege fʉ̀’e zsó pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’, ésẅiŋe mefɛ́ pege. Mé tsǒ yé ḿma’a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pégè ka zẅɛ́’ metse mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ńgíŋe ńzẅɛ́’ mbɔɔ shwóŋè gie pɔ́ ka ne ńgɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńda’te mmó gie pɔ́ zsé ná mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ńjÿó wɛ̌ nyìŋ. Pɔ́ ka tè lɔg twó sɔ́b ńtóŋo tsɔ́ mmó tà ḿbɔ́g pá’ ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, atÿǒ lepwó lâ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe wó, pi kág. Tá ńgʉa nà ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ mbɔɔ ntse té pàa, anò yɛ gie á kě ńgÿo gẅi lɛ. Á nue ndebele sẅɛ̌’ ńtó ńtsɛ́ɛ gẅí, lóŋ we ne ńgyáŋa tɛ’. Á ne ńzsé ngie à tè gíŋe fa’a yé fà’ tà ntyě sag wɔ́.
en: Therefore rejoice,yeheavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time.

ngiemboon: Máamáa nnù ngém yá, gwɔ́ tà ńgyá pá’ mé tsǒ yé ḿma’a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńzyɛ́’ ńcʉ́me nzèm manzwě wa gẅie à ně ńzyé mûɔ mbàŋa la, ńzye lénɔ́ɔn yé.
en: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the manchild.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńná mémbabá mémbʉ́a, é me máamáa gúm ndóŋ wɛ̌ né manzwě ŋwɛ́ pá’ à ge lɔg zie gee nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, á nà yé jʉ’, á jʉ’ gie máamáa nnù ngém wa à tè gíŋe gyá yé wɔ́. Á jʉ’ gie mé la nyɛte léjÿɔ́gɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́ wó, á nà ngù’ tá ńgÿo mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́.
en: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

ngiemboon: Máamáa nnù ngém ya zé’e ntse, é kẅɛ ńcwóŋo nzèm manzwě wa pá’ mí légwɔ́ gie é ge kaa yé.
en: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood.

ngiemboon: Tá tsetsá’ kẅéte manzwě wá, ńŋá’ ncwò wé, ḿbú ńnú ntse gẅie máamáa nnù ngém wá ze’é la.
en: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

ngiemboon: Lóŋ máamáa nnù ngém wá pú ńgyáŋ ńtí manzwě wá tɛ’. Nnù ngém gʉa ńdɔg ncù ńcʉ́’ ńdÿɔ́’ pɔ́ pfwɔ́’ɔ ngẅɛ̀ manzwě wa, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńkú’te mbʉ̌ Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńne ńkímte nò nénʉ́ gie Yěsô la gɔɔn.
en: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ nkʉ̀’ʉ pà nɔ̀ɔn fóo tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa ńkẅɛ, ńgẅiin metwó sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńgẅiin mendóŋ legém, yɛ̌ yɛ̌ ndóŋ wɔ́ gẅiin cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ, mbà mé ŋwe’é lezíŋ sie mé lɔgɔ ńzoonte Ssé zoonte á ná yɛ̌ yɛ̌ twó yé wɔ́.
en: And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the name of blasphemy.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn gẅie n da gyá à la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ŋɔ́ɔn ŋʉ́, mekwò mé gwɔ́ pá’ me tsɔ́ máamáa tsò, ncwò wé gwɔ́ pá’ we pú’ ntʉ̀. Máamáa nnù ngém wa ná metʉ̀ mé mbwo yé, ńnáa lʉŋe lefùɔ yé né yé, ńnyé lésá’ pʉ̀a mbwo yé.
en: And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard, and his feet were asthe feetof a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion: and the dragon gave him his power, and his seat, and great authority.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná twó sé la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mé ka néŋ fʉ̌ŋ mǒ tà ńgwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅé la, tá fʉ̌ŋ ŋwɛ́ gie e kɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅé gwɔ́ mbà e kéen ńtʉ. Epʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ gyá pú’u, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn, ńzẅɛ ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And I saw one of his heads as it were wounded to death; and his deadly wound was healed: and all the world wondered after the beast.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gu’te nnù ngém ya, á nue à ka nyé lésá’ pʉ̀a á mbwo nɔ̀ɔn, ńne ńgu’te nɔ̀ɔn, ńgɔɔn ngie: À wɔ̌ gẅiin tʉ̀ pá’ nɔ̀ɔn? Ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ ma’a yé lê ncù?
en: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast: and they worshipped the beast, saying, Whoislike unto the beast? who is able to make war with him?

ngiemboon: Mé ná ncwò gẅie à ge lɔg fwɔ’te meshwóŋè ngwág, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge lɔg zoonte Ssé né yé, ńnyé yé pá’ à ge sá’ sé lefùɔ á nà mesaŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê móm lekùa.
en: And there was given unto him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and power was given unto him to continue fortyandtwo months.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ zye léshwóŋó té poŋ ná Ssé, ńzoonte lezíŋ Ssé, ńzoonte jʉ’ gie e Ssé ńnéŋe wɔ́, ńzoonte mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.

ngiemboon: Mé nyé yé ngie à gʉa ḿma’ pʉ̀a Ssé lê ncù ma’ tà ńcʉa wɔ́b, ńnyé yé ngie à sá’ mengẅɛ̀ ntsèm, ngie à sá’ pʉ̀a ntí ntí, ngie à sá’ pàshwóŋó meshwóŋè ntí ntí, ngie à sá’ mengwòŋ ntsèm.
en: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them: and power was given him over all kindreds, and tongues, and nations.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ge gÿo kẅí’te mvfò yé, é gu’te yé. Mé gɔɔn ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie mé la tè ŋwe’e lezíŋ sɔ́b á tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne le gwɔ́ wó, tà fó fʉ̀’ gie njÿó la zye wɔ́. Aŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́ áa ye mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gẅie mé la zẅé yé.
en: And all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him, whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: If any man have an ear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé la záb ngie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ pu’u ncù, mbà à ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌. Nyìŋ gẅie mé la záb ngie mé ge lá’ lɔg nně ncù, é zẅé yé, mé ge lá’ lɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌ zẅé yé. Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie ée pe Ssé gẅiin léshÿɔg, ńké ńne ńzába pɔ́ ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: He that leadeth into captivity shall go into captivity: he that killeth with the sword must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ńgyá wetsɔ̌ nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn ne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’ ńkẅɛɛ. Mendóŋ mé gwɔ́ mémbʉ́a pá’ me mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, tá á ne ńgɔɔn nò pá’ máamáa nnù ngém la.
en: And I beheld another beast coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns like a lamb, and he spake as a dragon.

ngiemboon: À la gẅiin metʉ̀ ndùŋ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn, lélɔg ńgÿo menò, á nà lezíŋ sé, ńne ńgÿo mânyìŋ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kẅí’te mvfò ndùŋ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn, ńgu’te yé. Á nɔ̀ɔn wá gẅie fʉ̌ŋ laa ná yé tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gie à ńgwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅě ḿbiŋ ńtʉ la.
en: And he exerciseth all the power of the first beast before him, and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn nɔ̀ɔn ḿbɔ́ɔnte yépʉ́a pú ńgÿo memáa menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn, tá ńgÿo mmɔ̌g fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́’ɛ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mânyìŋ ntsèm tyé ne ńgyá.
en: And he doeth great wonders, so that he maketh fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men,

ngiemboon: Á lɔg pá’ mé la náa yé metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn á nà lezíŋ wetsɔ̌ nɔ̀ɔn wa, ńdÿɔgte pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ngie pɔ́ pwóon tútú ńdɔg ńgu’te nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé la lɔg nně ncù ńnéŋ fʉ̌ŋ ná yé tá à tè kwé la. Wɛ̌ tútú à gwɔ́ gẅie à sẅé nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: and deceiveth them that dwell on the earth bythe means ofthose miracles which he had power to do in the sight of the beast; saying to them that dwell on the earth, that they should make an image to the beast, which had the wound by a sword, and did live.

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋe ńnáa yé metʉ̀ pá’ à ge gÿo tútú gẅie mé lɔ̌g fʉ’te nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, à ŋele, ńzsé ngie tútú ŋwɛ́ ge ku’u légɔɔn nò, é ku’u lézẅéte pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ kaa zẅíŋe légu’te yé tútú wɔ́.
en: And he had power to give life unto the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause that as many as would not worship the image of the beast should be killed.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn we mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gÿo ná ntí gie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, ge gẅiin liŋé á nà pwó yé kà ná zǐ yé wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mênkʉ́, á ndÿò, á ngàŋa mmó, á mbóŋ, á ndù nnɛ́, á nkwɔɔn.
en: And he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark in their right hand, or in their foreheads:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le júu mmó, kà lésẅiŋ wɔ́ té gwɔ́ gie à gẅiin yɛ̌ liŋé gie ée lezíŋ ndùŋ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ menómbà mie é cú’te ńgwɔ́ lezíŋ sé wɔ́.
en: and that no man might buy or sell, save he that had the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie e pʉ̀a cwoŋo ńkwaŋte mboŋó. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin legyè á liŋ menómbà mie é cú’te ńdɔgɔ ńda’te lezíŋ nɔ̀ɔn. Yɛ̌ nómbà lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lezíŋ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ. Áa ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lê móm ntɔgɔ́ nzèm nkÿo ntɔgɔ́ (666).
en: Here is wisdom. Let him that hath understanding count the number of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and his numberisSix hundred threescoreandsix.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, e Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, á tyé ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ Sioŋ. Pâ pʉ̀a ntsá’ nkÿo lê ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm lekùa gwɔ́ (144.000). Mbà mé la ŋwe’e lezíŋ Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò mbɔɔ se Tá we á nà zǐ sɔ́b.
en: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred fortyandfour thousand, having his Father's name written in their foreheads.

ngiemboon: N jú’ etsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ fóo tÿǒ lepwó, ńzẅɛ pá’ máamáa ntse gẅie é ne ńzyɛ́’ɛ la, ńgíŋe ńgwá’a lefaŋ sie é vɛ́te la, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ ngyè leluŋó gie pàpú’ tsɔ̌ ntí kèkÿɛ̀ ne ḿbú’u la.
en: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tyé mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, mbɔɔ mvfò menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa lâ mvfò melÿò pɛ̌, ńne ńzɔbɔ tsɔ́ zɔ́bɔ ntse sẅé, é té ndà’ pʉ̀a ntsá’ nkÿo lê ntsá’ ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm lekùa (144.000) pie mé la cu’u wɔ́b ndá nkwɔɔn ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ la tè wó tà ńku’u lézí’i yɛ̌ zɔ́bɔ ntse tà ńzɔb wɔ́,
en: and they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundredandfortyandfour thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.

ngiemboon: ée pʉ̀a pie pâ panzwě la tè gÿo menò ncÿǒ wɔ́, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ laa mánzwě zsé. Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, pɔ́ zse pɔ́ nzèm ye, ée pʉ̀a pie mé la gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńcu’u wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé mbɔɔ mvfò Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ntwó mmó gie é fǒ nká’ la,
en: These are they which were not defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth. These were redeemed from among men,beingthe firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.

ngiemboon: mbà mé laa mé ńjú’ cÿɔ̌ nò kẅɛɛ ncwò pɔ́b wɔ́,*alɔ̌’ɔ yɔ́b té wó wɔ́.
en: And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńgyá tsɔ̌ tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gwɔ́ tàa tÿǒ lefaŋ ńne ńzie, ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie ée we tèmì, pá’ à ge gʉa tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, á tsɛ̀ɛ mbɔɔ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ wɔ́, á mbwo yɛ̌ ngẅɛ̀ ndá wɔ́, á mbwo pàshwóŋó yɛ̌ ntí shwóŋè wɔ́, á mbwo yɛ̌ ntí ntí nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,

ngiemboon: Á ne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi pɔ́g Ssé, ńnáa legú’ mbwo yé. Á nue afʉ̀’ gie à ge ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’. Pi gu’te nyìŋ gẅie à la nyɛte lepwó, ńnyɛte tsetsá’, ńnyɛte ntse té pàa, ńnyɛte mbɔɔ mesá’a ntse.
en: saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a pɔ́ɔnte ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: À kéen ńgwe ssé, ńgie à kéen ńgwe ssé. N gɔɔn máamáa tÿǒsoŋo Mbabilonia, gẅie à ka ne ńgÿo ngwòŋo ngwòŋ ne ńnúu melù’ mpfwɔ́’ mé, é mpfwɔ́’ gie é pǔ ńtɔ́g ntí.
en: And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá pɔ́ɔnte wɔ́b, ńne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgu’te nɔ̀ɔn mbɔɔ tútú we, ńzẅíŋ mé cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé nɔ̀ɔn ná zǐ yé kà ná pwó yé wɔ́,
en: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receivehismark in his forehead, or in his hand,

ngiemboon: angàŋ zsé ngie mbɔɔ yé yé ge gÿo nú melù’ gyáŋa lóŋ Ssé, é mie Ssé ge gÿo ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’ gyáŋa lóŋ yé, tà fó le gwate. Angàŋ pɔ́ɔnte ńkú ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g*mekʉ̀a, á mvfò*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pe ndʉalʉ̌a mbɔɔ mvfò Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò.
en: the same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:

ngiemboon: Ndyé mmɔ̌g gẅie pɔ́ ée tsoló e lá’a ńzɔ́gɔ ńkwɔ́’ɔ kwɔ̌’ nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à ne ńgu’te nɔ̀ɔn, ńgíŋe ńne ńgu’te tútú nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, tà mbà mé cÿɔ’ɔ́ liŋé lezíŋ nɔ̀ɔn ná yé, á lá’a ńzɔ́gɔ légyá ngɔ́’ á zsǒ mbɔɔ tsẅɛ́’, atsɔ̌ lézẅɛte á le gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: and the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a Ssé, epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kú’te*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńzába ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, pɔ́ shÿɔg.
en: Here is the patience of the saints: herearethey that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.

ngiemboon: N jú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ fóo tÿǒ lepwó ńgɔɔn ngie: Ŋwe’e ngie: Á ge fó fʉ̀’ɔɔn, pà shÿó mbòŋo gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ge gwɔ kwé, é kwé ncwò fà’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a: A Zẅìge ndʉalʉ̌a zẅíŋ ngie áa nò, pɛ̌ pʉ̀a ge gʉa zẅɛte ná mefà’ lÿò mɔ́b. Á nue pɔ́ ge lɔgɔ Píte mefà’ mɔ́b é gʉa.
en: And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessedarethe dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, e Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, ńgwóon ńgyá tsɔ̌ féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ ńnéŋe ndumó ńgwɔ́ pá’ míŋ nyìŋ mesoŋ la, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí nně gie mé lɔgɔ ńdaga shúm nká’, é ne ńdúmo tɛ’.
en: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloudonesat like unto the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńtsẅii mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ndùm féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn la ngie: Lɔg nně ńdag shúm, ńdag shúm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Afʉ̀’e lélag shúm kǔ’, á nue shúm ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà é tʉ̌.
en: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Thrust in thy sickle, and reap: for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie á ke ńnéŋe ndùm féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn la lêen ńké ḿma’ nně ye, ńdɔg ńdag shúm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, tà shúm ndàg lag maga ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó ńkẅɛ, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin yé ntí nně ya gie mé lɔgɔ ńdaga shúm nká’ la, é ne ńdúmo tɛ’.
en: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé fóo jʉ’ gie mé nuŋo pwɔ́’ wó ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé la cʉ́me nò mmɔ̌g mbwo yé, á lɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńtsẅii mbwo gẅie á kě ńgẅiin nně é ne ńdúmo tɛ’ la ngie: Ma’ nně jù gie e ne ńdúmo lɛ, ńdɔg ńzá’ mencùɔ mentɔ̌ɔn mie mé kyéen ńdɔg ńnyɛte melù’, é gwɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà é tʉ̌ lɛ.
en: And another angel came out from the altar, which had power over fire; and cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé lɔg nně ye, ńgʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńzá’ mencùɔ mie ée nà metÿǒ melù’, á tsɛ̀ɛ nká’a melù’ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ḿbÿɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa gÿǒon, á jʉ’ gie mé tsẅɛ́’ɛ mentɔ̌ɔn wó, ńgẅiin melù’. Letsẅɛ’ɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńda’te ngie e Ssé ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ ná pʉ̀a tepòŋ.
en: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and castitinto the great winepress of the wrath of God.

ngiemboon: Mé fó tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ tá ńgyá yɛ̌ gÿǒon. Mé lêen ńtsẅɛ́’ mentɔ̌ɔn ŋwɛ́ tsoló, metse zɔ̌ fó tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon ŋwɛ́ ńkẅɛ, ńcwóŋo nà mekílomíta nkÿo tá, lecǔ ssé gwɔ́ tà’ míta nê kèm.
en: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousandandsix hundred furlongs.

ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔntè ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó gíŋe ńkẅɛɛ lefaŋ, ńgwɔ́ wó tɛ’, ńgwɔ́ gie á gÿo mé vege vege, é gwɔ́*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Pɔ́ tyéte ńgẅiinte ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí sɔɔn mbʉ́a mie é ge kúu ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ menzsònzèm mengʉ̀ngʉ̀, á nue lóŋ Ssé ge gÿo gwɔ pʉ́le, mbà mɛ̌ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ tɔ̌g.
en: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńgyá tsɔ̌ ntí tetʉ́a, ésaŋte pá’ ntse té pàa, ńne síi pɔ́ pá’ tsɔ̌ ntí tóon gie e gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pá’ gyà shÿó, mé tóŋ lê Kristal la. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie mmɔ̌g ée tsoló ńne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ la. Epʉ̀a tyéte ndùm wó, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ mǎ’ ncù tà ńcʉa nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn, é pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kaa tútú we gu’te, ńké tè zẅíŋ mé ŋwe’e menómbà mie é la’te lezíŋ sé ná pɔ́b wɔ́. Megàŋ gẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí mekèkÿɛ̀ mbwó pɔ́b, é gwɔ́ mie e Ssé la ná né pɔ́b.
en: And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark,andover the number of his name, stand on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie ɔ̀ ka’á légÿo áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgwɔ́ nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: And they sing the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellousarethy works, Lord God Almighty; just and truearethy ways, thou King of saints.

ngiemboon: á nue wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kéen ńgyá mefà’ mú pá’ é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Who shall not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name? forthouonlyartholy: for all nations shall come and worship before thee; for thy judgments are made manifest.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, e Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá jʉ’ yé, gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, á nyɛ́’ɛ ńtyé, ntàb gẅie é nyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee nùɔ pʉ̀a pé, é tyé tsoló.
en: And after that I looked, and, behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened:

ngiemboon: *Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a, pie pɔ́ la gẅiin ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí sɔɔn mbʉ́a la, fó jʉ’e Ssé ńkẅɛ, ḿma’ metà’ shʉ̀a meféfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, é ne ńŋwʉŋe. Mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ tsɔ́ pɔ́ɔn mmó, ńtʉ́me kʉ́kʉ́b wɔb, á gwɔ́ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte.
en: and the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa, á ná mentú’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a mbwo*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pa sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Mentú’ ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, agyáŋa lóŋ Ssé gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mentú’ ŋwɛ́ tà ńdúe.
en: And one of the four beasts gave unto the seven angels seven golden vials full of the wrath of God, who liveth for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: Metʉ̀ Ssé pɔ́ legú’ we, pú ńgÿo ndyé kúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’ yé tà ńdúe, tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè ku’u lékúu tsoló wɔ́, tà ńdá’ ńkú fʉ̀’ gie mentí ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ma sɔɔn mbʉ́a mie ée mbwo*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a la, é tɔ̌g tà ḿmag.
en: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power; and no man was able to enter into the temple, till the seven plagues of the seven angels were fulfilled.

ngiemboon: N jú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ńne ńgɔɔn mbwo*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé pa sɔɔn mbʉ́a ngie: Pi gʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ḿpfɛte gyáŋa lóŋ Ssé gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ mentú’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a lɛ.
en: And I heard a great voice out of the temple saying to the seven angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.

ngiemboon: Andùŋ mvfò gʉa ḿpfɛte ye ntú’ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Etsɔ̌ ntí mefʉ̌ŋ gie mé líe é vege pʉ̀a vege, ḿbiŋ ńgyáŋ pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, é kẅɛte ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie mé la cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn ná pɔ́b, pɔ́ piŋ ńne ńgu’te tútú nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: And the first went, and poured out his vial upon the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore upon the men which had the mark of the beast, anduponthem which worshipped his image.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a pfɛte ye ntú’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa. Ntse té pàa sele ńcʉ́’ pá’ metse nyìŋ gẅie à kwě la. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa tà ńŋele ŋele pú ńkwé.
en: And the second angel poured out his vial upon the sea; and it became as the blood of a deadman: and every living soul died in the sea.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yétá pfɛte ye ntú’ á tsɛ̀ɛ memí mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ mesá’a ntse, mentse ŋwɛ́ sele ńcʉ́’ metse.
en: And the third angel poured out his vial upon the rivers and fountains of waters; and they became blood.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n jú’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à la gẅiin nò ná mentse ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Gù gẅie ɔ́ɔ wó, mbà ɔ̀ laa wó, Gù gẅie ɔ́ɔ Ssé, ɔ̀ gÿo pɛ́’ɛ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ á kɔ’ɔ́ gwɔ́ pú’u, á nue, ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: And I heard the angel of the waters say, Thou art righteous, O Lord, which art, and wast, and shalt be, because thou hast judged thus.

ngiemboon: Á nue pɔ́ la pfɛte metse pʉ̀a pú, mbɔɔ me pà Ntsẅi nkʉ̀ pú. Ɔ̀ kě ńná metse pɔ́ nú. Á gwɔ́ pá’ á kě ńne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo ná pɔ́b pú’u.
en: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.

ngiemboon: N jú’ ngyè nyìŋ fóo jʉ’ gie mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé Ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm, agù létsɔ́’te ntsaŋ aa nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: And I heard another out of the altar say, Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and righteousarethy judgments.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè lekùa pfɛte ye ntú’ ná nèm, e Ssé gÿo pá’ nèm ge lɔg mmɔ̌g tuɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire.

ngiemboon: Ejʉ’ lêen ńké ḿbú ńdum lum tà ńtuɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pɔ́ zoonte lezíŋ Ssé, gẅie yé zɔ gÿo tá pɔ́ gyá yɔɔn ngɔ́’ ntí ntí, ńgÿo pú’u, ńké tè kúbe mà wɔ́b ńnáa legú’ mbwo Ssé wɔ́.
en: And men were scorched with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, which hath power over these plagues: and they repented not to give him glory.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̀a pfɛte ye ntú’ nà lʉŋe lefùɔ nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn wɛ̌. Nzěm pú ńjÿó lá’a nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ gyá ngɔ́’ gyǎ tà ḿpfɛ́ lʉ́me yɔ́b.
en: And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast; and his kingdom was full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues for pain,

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ yɔb mbɔɔ mefʉ̌ŋ mɔ́b gÿo pɔ́ zoonte Ssé gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó, tá’ ńké tè kúbe mà wɔb, ńgwá’ mefà’ tepòŋ mɔ́b wɔ́.
en: and blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, and repented not of their deeds.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́ pfɛte ye ntú’ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ máamáa mí gẅie mé tóŋo lê Efalate. Ntse mí ŋwɛ́ júm, ńtsɔ́’ nzsè mbwo mefùɔ pie éfóo Sá’ nèm.
en: And the sixth angel poured out his vial upon the great river Euphrates; and the water thereof was dried up, that the way of the kings of the east might be prepared.

ngiemboon: N gyá tsɔ̌*ssé tepòŋ fóo ncwò máa nnùngém ńkẅɛ, yetsɔ̌ fóo ncwò nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn ńkẅɛ, yetsɔ̌ fóo ncwò*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé we cÿɔ̌ nò ńkẅɛ, tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ metá, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ metetɔ́’ la,
en: And I saw three unclean spirits like frogscomeout of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

ngiemboon: ée pú’u, ńgwɔ́ messe tepòŋ mie é gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn. Pɔ́ ge gʉa gyá mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ntsèm, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge cú’te wɔ́b lɔg zẅí’te ncù gẅie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ ná máamáa lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ gie, e Ssé ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm ge lá’ ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles,whichgo forth unto the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: Pi ké ńzsé ngie, mèŋ n ge tó pá’ ntsǒŋ la. Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n ge gwɔ tó, á le ne ńdyé wɔ́, menzsǒ mé gwɔ́ ná yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à ge lu ssé giŋ té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ, eshʉ́ kúu yé.
en: Behold, I come as a thief. Blessedishe that watcheth, and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ pɛ̌ lêen ńké ńcú’te mefùɔ nà tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo ná shwóŋè pà Heber ngie: Amagedoŋ.
en: And he gathered them together into a place called in the Hebrew tongue Armageddon.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a pfɛte ye ntú’ tÿǒ tsɛ̀ fÿɔ́g. Etsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ fóo ná lʉŋe lefùɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ńkẅɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Á zsoté
en: And the seventh angel poured out his vial into the air; and there came a great voice out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, It is done.

ngiemboon: Menně mbʉ̀ŋ kyɛ’ jʉ’, mé jú’ mengyè pʉ̀a mesoŋ, lefaŋ vɛ́te ngʉ̀a ngʉ̀a. Atsetsá’ pú ńcʉ’ʉ tɛ’, tà mbà tà fó pá’ nyìŋ mesoŋ aa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, á laa zɔɔn ńcʉ’ʉ pú’u wɔ́.
en: And there were voices, and thunders, and lightnings; and there was a great earthquake, such as was not since men were upon the earth, so mighty an earthquake,andso great.

ngiemboon: Máamáa tÿǒsoŋ wɛ̌ shʉ́ate nzsè tá. Metÿǒsoŋ mie ée ngwòŋo ngwòŋ é keme. E Ssé lêen ńké ńkímte máamáa tÿǒsoŋo Mbabilonia, ńgÿo á nú ntú’ melù’ gyáŋa lóŋ yé gie á pú ńgá’.
en: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell: and great Babylon came in remembrance before God, to give unto her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of his wrath.

ngiemboon: Melá’ mie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ épú shú ńkúu ntse. Mé té gíŋe ńgyá mekwɛ́ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ wɔ́.
en: And every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.

ngiemboon: Memáa megẅì mie à ńgwɔ́ tà’ jÿó kílo móm lekùa, fó tÿó ńgwete ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ zoonte Ssé, ńtí ngɔ́’ gie pɔ́ gyǎ, é fóo nà megẅì, á nue yɛ̌ ngɔ́’ la pú ńtʉ tɛ’.
en: And there fell upon men a great hail out of heaven,every stoneabout the weight of a talent: and men blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail; for the plague thereof was exceeding great.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ tà’ ná*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a pie é la gẅiin mentú’ sɔɔn mbʉ́a la tó ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tóo, mèŋ n ge nyɛɛ gú pá’ Ssé ge gÿo néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó máamáa ngàŋ mpfwɔ́’ manzwě pú’u. Á máamáa tÿǒsoŋ gie mé la kwɛ́ɛ ngʉ̀ŋe mentse tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la.
en: And there came one of the seven angels which had the seven vials, and talked with me, saying unto me, Come hither; I will shew unto thee the judgment of the great whore that sitteth upon many waters:

ngiemboon: Pâ mefùɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ métsèm kéen ńgÿo mpfwɔ́’. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, nú melù’ mpfwɔ́’ mé tà ḿbʉ́a.
en: with whom the kings of the earth have committed fornication, and the inhabitants of the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her fornication.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a tó ńjʉʉ wɔ̀ɔn,*cÿɔ́’ Ssé wa kaa wɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgʉ́a né tsɔ̌ nkwòŋo tsẅɛ. Mèŋ n gyá tsɔ̌ manzwě ńnéŋe ndùm tsɔ̌ nɔ̀ɔn, á paŋa lê gʉm, mezíŋ lɔg ńzoonte Ssé pú ḿbáte mbùm nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, e twó sé gwɔ́ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, mendóŋ mé gwɔ́ legém.
en: So he carried me away in the spirit into the wilderness: and I saw a woman sit upon a scarlet coloured beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.

ngiemboon: Manzwě áwɛ̌ ma’ menzsǒ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, é paŋa lê gʉm. Eshúm sie à lɔgɔ ńkẅiŋe mbùm ye, é gwɔ́, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l, lâ metóon mie ée me tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, laa metɔgɔ́ tsyé ńdɔg ńnyɛte. Á gẅiin tsɔ̌ ntú’ mbwo yé, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte. Menò ncÿǒ mie éfóo ná menò mpfwɔ́’ mé gwɔ́ tsoló tà ńdúe.
en: And the woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet colour, and decked with gold and precious stones and pearls, having a golden cup in her hand full of abominations and filthiness of her fornication:

ngiemboon: Mbà mé la ŋwe’e tsɔ́ lezíŋ nà zǐ yé. Lezsě mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn á tʉ tɛ’. Lezíŋ ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie máamáa tÿǒsoŋ Mbabilonia, má pà pà ngÿò mpfwɔ́’ mbɔɔ ntí ntí menò tepòŋ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: and upon her foreheadwasa name written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá yé ḿbú ḿmɔɔn tɛ’.
en: And I saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus: and when I saw her, I wondered with great admiration.

ngiemboon: Tá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Ɔ̀ mɔɔn kɔ́? N ge kyɛ́’ ntsèm manzwě wɛ, éshwóŋó gú, mbɔɔ ye nɔ̀ɔn gẅie etwó sé ée sɔɔn mbʉ́a, mendóŋ mé gwɔ́ legém la.
en: And the angel said unto me, Wherefore didst thou marvel? I will tell thee the mystery of the woman, and of the beast that carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and ten horns.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn gẅie ɔ̀ gyǎ lɛ, à laa wó, tá’ à ké ńcʉ́’ʉ wó wɔ́. À ge gÿo gíŋe gwɔ́ wó, éfóo tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ kwɔ́’ gʉa lé jʉ’ gie à ge kúu wó é kúu pyé. Epʉ̀a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, mbà mé la tè ŋwe’e lezíŋ sɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, tà fó fʉ̀’ gie mé la nuŋe njÿó wɔ́, pɔ́ ge gÿo gyá nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ é mɔɔn tɛ’. Á nue à laa wó, à tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, é ké gÿo gíŋe kẅɛ.
en: The beast that thou sawest was, and is not; and shall ascend out of the bottomless pit, and go into perdition: and they that dwell on the earth shall wonder, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, when they behold the beast that was, and is not, and yet is.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa jʉ’ gie á zɛ́te ngie zse nò à kẅéte legyè sie nyìŋ gẅiin lélɔg ńjú’u mmó gie mé gɔɔn yɛ̌. Etwó sɛ̌ sɔɔn mbʉ́a lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mekwɛ́ sɔɔn mbʉ́a mie wɔɔn manzwě à ńnéŋe ndumó,
en: And hereisthe mind which hath wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains, on which the woman sitteth.

ngiemboon: é gíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mefùɔ sɔɔn mbʉ́a. Epe métʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kéen ńgwe, tà’ gwɔ́ nà kwɔ̀’ɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, wetsɔ̌ nyé té tó, à ge ké gÿo gwɔ́ tà tó, é ké le ńnéŋe tɛ’ wɔ́.
en: And there are seven kings: five are fallen, and one is,andthe other is not yet come; and when he cometh, he must continue a short space.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, à piŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́ la, yé lê twó yé lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ mbɔ́ɔntè lefɔ̌ɔn, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pe sɔɔn mbʉ́a. À piŋ ńne ńgee, légʉa ńkúu pyé.
en: And the beast that was, and is not, even he is the eighth, and is of the seven, and goeth into perdition.

ngiemboon: Mendóŋ legém mie ɔ̀ kě ńgyá la lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mefùɔ legém pie mé nyé tè ná sɔ́b lefùɔ. Tá pâ nɔ̀ɔn ge gÿo pú temte sá’a lá’ ndà’ ná tà’ nèm wémɔ’ɔ́.
en: And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings, which have received no kingdom as yet; but receive power as kings one hour with the beast.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b legém e pú ńgẅiin tà’ nkwaŋá. À gwɔ́ lépúte mɔ́b metʉ̀, pâ sɔ́b lefùɔ, ńnáa mbwo nɔ̀ɔn.
en: These have one mind, and shall give their power and strength unto the beast.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge ma’a Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò lê ncù, tá à ké ńcʉa wɔ́b, á nue aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mecʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ Fùɔ mefùɔ. Epʉ̀a pie à la tóŋo wɔ́b, ńtsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, pɔ́ zsé pɔ́ ndà’ yé, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńcʉa nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: These shall make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb shall overcome them: for he is Lord of lords, and King of kings: and they that are with himarecalled, and chosen, and faithful.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Mentse mie ɔ̀ ně ńgyá, é gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ gie ngàŋ mpfwɔ́’ manzwě wa tsẅé wó la, mentse ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntí ntí, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a menùɔ menùɔ, ńgwɔ́ ngwòŋo ngwòŋ, ńgwɔ́ meshwóŋè ntí ntí.
en: And he saith unto me, The waters which thou sawest, where the whore sitteth, are peoples, and multitudes, and nations, and tongues.

ngiemboon: Mendóŋ legém mie ɔ̀ ně ńgyá mbɔɔ nɔ̀ɔn, pɔ́ ge gÿo pʉa ngàŋ mpfwɔ́’ manzwě wɛ̌, é pú kẅé shúm sé tà à tyé té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ, é pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ ye, é tuɔ pfwɔ́’ mmɔ̌g.
en: And the ten horns which thou sawest upon the beast, these shall hate the whore, and shall make her desolate and naked, and shall eat her flesh, and burn her with fire.

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé la kwaŋa mmó ńnéŋe ntʉ́m pɔ́b pá’ pɔ́ zɔ̌ ge cʉ́’ gÿo mmó gie à la kwaŋ. Á gwɔ́ pá’ mendóŋ ŋwɛ́ legém ge gẅiin tà’ nkwaŋá, é cú’te lefùɔ sɔ́b náa mbwo nɔ̀ɔn, e gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo yé tà lá’ ńkú lyɛ̌’ gie ammó gie Ssé la gɔɔn á pumté.
en: For God hath put in their hearts to fulfil his will, and to agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the words of God shall be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Manzwě gẅie ɔ̀ ně ńgyá, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ máamáa tÿǒsoŋ gie á sá’a mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And the woman which thou sawest is that great city, which reigneth over the kings of the earth.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, e Ssé gíŋe ńnyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá wetsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́’, e sé lefuɔ fáŋ tɛ’, we shʉ́shÿɔ́g pú ńkyɛ’ɛ tsetsá’ ntsèm.
en: And after these things I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was lightened with his glory.

ngiemboon: Á lɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: À kéen ńgwe ssé. N gɔ̌ɔn ngie à kéen ńgwe ssé. N gɔɔn máamáa tÿǒsoŋo Mbabilonia. Mbabilonia kéen ńcʉ́’ mbʉ̀a*messé tepòŋ, ńcʉ́’ nkʉ̀a mezẅìge tepòŋ ntsèm, mbaa ye meshʉ́ŋ pie nzse ée ná pɔ́b, á lépfɛ́, mé piŋ tè nò yɔ́b kwòŋ,
