en: And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.

ngiemboon: ńgwe ssé pú’u, á nue, mengwòŋ ntsèm kéen ńnú melù’ mpfwɔ́’ mé tɛ’, á nue pâ mefùɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kéen ńgÿo mpfwɔ́’, mbɔɔ pá’ pàtáŋa metʉ̌a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kéen ńcʉ́’ megàŋ nkáb, ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pá’ à ka gẅiin shúm kẅìŋ é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’.
en: For all nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication, and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth are waxed rich through the abundance of her delicacies.

ngiemboon: N jú’ yetsɔ̌ ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Epʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, pi fó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋo ńkẅɛ, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅi légÿo menò tepòŋ pá’ yé, ńzsé ngie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntí ntí gie e ge kúu ná yé e tè kúu gẅi wɔ́.
en: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out of her, my people, that ye be not partakers of her sins, and that ye receive not of her plagues.

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntí ntí ge kúu yé, á nue à kéen ńcub menò tepòŋ á ná metsɔ́ cub tà é kwɔ́’ tà ńkúu tÿǒ lepwó. Mbɔɔ pá’ e Ssé kéen ńkímte menò mé mie à gwǎ ńgÿo, é té tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́.
en: For her sins have reached unto heaven, and God hath remembered her iniquities.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋe ńgÿo ná yé pá’ à ka zɔɔn ńgÿo yé ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Pi cʉ́’ʉ légÿo, ammó gie à ka gÿǒ ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà’ legʉ̀a, pi gÿo ná yé ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a. Ntú’ gie à ka néŋ melù’ ntʉ̀ tʉ tsoló, ńná né petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pí néŋ mé tsoló é gwɔ́ mie é tʉ ńcʉa mɛ̌ ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a.
en: Reward her even as she rewarded you, and double unto her double according to her works: in the cup which she hath filled fill to her double.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à ka fǎŋ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ shúm kẅìŋ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, pi ná ye ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pɔ́ nzẅìŋó, ńgíŋe ńgÿo á lʉa legwé pɔ́ nzẅìŋó. Á nue à ka ne ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wé ngie: À ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe memáfùɔ, ngie à tè mpfɔ̌g wɔ́, ngie à tè lá’a tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ tá lʉa legwé wɔ́,
en: How much she hath glorified herself, and lived deliciously, so much torment and sorrow give her: for she saith in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.

ngiemboon: pá’ à ka ne ńgɔɔn pú’u la, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntí ntí gie mé la nyɛte ńtí yé, e ge tóo ná yé pɔ́ tà’a lyɛ̌’, é gwɔ́ lékwé, é gwɔ́ lélʉa legwé, é gwɔ́ gwáŋa, mé piŋ ńdɔg mmɔ̌g ńtuɔ yé. Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gẅie à ŋaga yé, à gẅiin metʉ̀.
en: Therefore shall her plagues come in one day, death, and mourning, and famine; and she shall be utterly burned with fire: for strongisthe Lord God who judgeth her.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ntsèm, é pie pâ pɔ̌ kɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́gɔ ńgÿo mpfwɔ́’, ńzɔ́gɔ ńgẅiin shúm meshùm, pɔ́ kɔ́’ legwé ńdʉa yé, á fʉ̀’ gie pɔ́ ge gÿo gyá ndyé mmɔ̌g kwɔ́’, à ne shÿó.
en: And the kings of the earth, who have committed fornication and lived deliciously with her, shall bewail her, and lament for her, when they shall see the smoke of her burning,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo tyé pɔ́ tàa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, á nue pɔ́ ne ḿbɔ́gɔ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e kǔ yé, é ne gɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Gù máamáa tÿǒsoŋ Mbabilonia. Ɔ̀ kaa wó tɛ’. Ndòon jù gwǒon gú, é ge gwaa cʉa tà’ áwà mbɔɔ mǎg.
en: standing afar off for the fear of her torment, saying, Alas, alas, that great city Babylon, that mighty city! for in one hour is thy judgment come.

ngiemboon: Pàtáŋa metʉ̌a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ge gÿo ńnéŋe tetʉ́a legwé ne lʉa, á nue mé cʉ́’ʉ ńjúu shúm sie pɔ́ lɔgɔ stima ńkaa ńdɔgɔ ńtóo wɔ́,
en: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and mourn over her; for no man buyeth their merchandise any more:

ngiemboon: é shúm pá’ tʉ̌ gɔ̂l, mbɔɔ tʉ̌ nkáb. Eshúm pá’ metóon pie ée pe tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, mbɔɔ metɔgɔ́ tsyé, mbɔɔ menzsǒ mie é fɔ́g tɛ’, mbɔɔ mie é paŋ paŋ, mbɔɔ menzsǒ meselɛg, mbɔɔ mie é paŋa lê gʉm, mepeláŋ mie éfóo ná tsɔ̌ ntí tÿǒ gie mé té lwo ńgyá wɔ́, mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ntí mmó wɔ́ gie mé la lɔg lesoŋ shÿɔ́ɔ ńnyɛte, mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ntí mmó wɔ́ gie mé lɔgɔ tÿǒ gie nzẅìŋ ée mǒ tɛ’ ńnyɛte, mbɔɔ gie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nʉ̀ ńnyɛte, mbɔɔ gie mé lɔgɔ kwà’ tʉ̌ ńnyɛte, lâ gie mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ ntí tóon gie mé tóŋo lé marbre ńnyɛte.
en: the merchandise of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and of pearls, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyine wood, and all manner vessels of ivory, and all manner vessels of most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble,

ngiemboon: Ammó pá’ tsɔ̌ ntí shúm nná’ pá’ gie mé tóŋo lé kanɛl mbɔɔ laméndɔɔn ntí ntí, lê lìi lâ tsɔ́ shúm sie mé tuɔ, lê melù’, lê mèvɛ, lê faline ntí ntí, lê mefòŋ, lê*menjʉ̀njÿò, lê melÿóon lâ mekélêg, lâ pu’ ye ńjú jǔ mbɔɔ ye ncù.
en: and cinnamon, and odours, and ointments, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves, and souls of men.

ngiemboon: Pàtáŋa métʉ̌a ne ńgɔɔn ná tÿǒsoŋ ngie: Eshúm sie ɔ̀ ka ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légẅiin pǔ shÿó mbʉ̀a gù tà mag. Eshúm ntsèm sie ɔ̀ ka gẅiin, é gwɔ́ sie mé lɔɔn ńgẅiin tepòŋ é cʉŋte, mbaa sie é ńnéŋe neŋé, é pǔ maga mbwo gù, mé piŋ tè lá’ gíŋe gyá sɛ̌ shúm wɔ́.
en: And the fruits that thy soul lusted after are departed from thee, and all things which were dainty and goodly are departed from thee, and thou shalt find them no more at all.

ngiemboon: Pàtáŋa metʉ̌a pie pɔ́ la sẅiŋ pɔ́ shúm sɔɔn mbwo yé tà ńdɔg ńcʉ́’ megàŋ nkáb ge gÿo tyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, é ne pɔ́gɔ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e kǔ yé, é ne kɔ́’ɔ legwé lʉa,
en: The merchants of these things, which were made rich by her, shall stand afar off for the fear of her torment, weeping and wailing,

ngiemboon: é ne gɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Gù máamáa tÿǒsoŋ gẅie ɔ̀ kɔ̌ɔn ḿma’a meféfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, ḿma’a mie é paŋ paŋ, lâ mie é paŋa lê gʉm, ńdɔgɔ shúm gɔ̂l ńkẅiŋe mbùm jù, mbɔɔ metóon pe tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, mbɔɔ metɔgɔ́ tsyé,
en: and saying, Alas, alas, that great city, that was clothed in fine linen, and purple, and scarlet, and decked with gold, and precious stones, and pearls!

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ shwóŋó mestíma, ngwòŋ pàkúu stima ńdɔg ńgʉa jʉ’, ngwòŋ megàŋa fà’ tsɛ̀ɛ stíma, ngwòŋ pàgiŋe ntse ńtáŋa sɔ̌ɔn, tyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a,
en: For in one hour so great riches is come to nought. And every shipmaster, and all the company in ships, and sailors, and as many as trade by sea, stood afar off,

ngiemboon: ńne ńgyá ndyé mmɔ̌g gẅie éfóo ná tÿǒsoŋ pá’ á ne shÿó, ńne ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ kaa gwɔ́ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ pá’ máamáa tÿǒsoŋ?
en: and cried when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, Whatcity islike unto this great city!

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńŋwaa pfepfɔ́b ńdɔgɔ ńdɔɔn twó sɔ́b, ńne ńkɔ́’ɔ legwé ńga’te ńdʉa ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Ɔ̀ɔ shÿó tepòŋ. Gù máamáa tÿǒsoŋ gẅie ɔ̀ ka gẅiin nkáb tɛ’, ḿbiŋ ńne ńjú’u mboŋó, ńgíŋe ńgÿo epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin stíma tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa cʉ́’ megàŋ nkáb, á yɛ, mbà ɔ̀ lɔ̌g pɔ́ tà’ nèm wémɔ’ɔ́ ńcʉ́’ʉ nkwòŋo tsẅɛ lɛ.
en: And they cast dust on their heads, and cried, weeping and wailing, saying, Alas, alas, that great city, wherein were made rich all that had ships in the sea by reason of her costliness! for in one hour is she made desolate.

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńdʉa Mbabilonia, tá’, á gʉa ná pi tÿǒ lepwó, pi kág kág ńtí pá’ á gwě ssé. Mbɔɔ pi pʉ̀a Ssé, pia megàŋ ntúm lâ pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, pi kág gí. Á nue e Ssé ŋagá yé nà nò tepòŋ gie á ka gÿo ná pi.
en: Rejoice over her,thouheaven, andyeholy apostles and prophets; for God hath avenged you on her.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à gẅiin metʉ̀ tɛ’ lêen ńké ńkaa tsɔ̌ máamáa tóon, á zɛ pá’ lùŋo mesaŋá la, ńgwaa zé’e ma’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntse té pàa, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé ze’é wɔɔn tóon, ḿma’, á gwe ntse lê tʉ̀ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé ge gÿo zé’e gù Mbabilonia, máamáa tÿǒsoŋ, é ma’, ɔ̀ gwe jú pú’u. Mé piŋ le lá’ ńgíŋe ńgyá gú wɔ́.
en: And a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone, and castitinto the sea, saying, Thus with violence shall that great city Babylon be thrown down, and shall be found no more at all.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pá’ mé téen ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńjú’u ngyè pàpú’ tsɔ̌ ntí kèkÿɛ̀, á mbʉ̀a gù wɔ́, é ké le ye pàpú’ leluŋó lâ ye pàtóŋo màndèle mbɔɔ ye pàtóŋ ntaŋ á mbʉ̀a gù jú’. Mé le gíŋe ńgyá tsɔ̌ ngàŋ levfò mbʉ̀a gù wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ gẅie à fa’a pɔ́ yɛ̌ fà’ wɔ́. Mé le gíŋe ńjú’ pá’ mé lɔgɔ lùŋo ńgwɔ’ɔ mmó mbʉ̀a gù wɔ́.
en: And the voice of harpers, and musicians, and of pipers, and trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in thee; and no craftsman, of whatsoever crafthe be, shall be found any more in thee; and the sound of a millstone shall be heard no more at all in thee;

ngiemboon: Akyɛ̀’ gie á fóo ná lâm á téen ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ mbʉ̀a gù wɔ́. Mé ké le gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè ndǔm nzwě ngʉ̀ wɔ́, é ké le ye nzwě ngʉ̀ jú’. Mé lě ńjú’u wɔ́ pú’u, á nue pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kɔ́ɔn ńtáŋa metʉ̌a gù, é kaa memáa pʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Ɔ̀ lɔg mekàŋ mú ńdʉte mengwòŋ ntsèm.
en: and the light of a candle shall shine no more at all in thee; and the voice of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more at all in thee: for thy merchants were the great men of the earth; for by thy sorceries were all nations deceived.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ nue mé ka tóo mbʉ̀a gù, ńgyá metse pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, ńgyá me pʉ̀a Ssé mbɔɔ me pʉ̀a metsèm pie mé la zẅéte wɔ́b ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: And in her was found the blood of prophets, and of saints, and of all that were slain upon the earth.

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńjú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ́ʉ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ngyè máamáa nùɔ lá’ la, é gwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Alelúyà, letsẅɛ́ ńgÿo legú’ mbɔɔ metʉ̀ ée mbwo Ssé yege,
en: And after these things I heard a great voice of much people in heaven, saying, Alleluia; Salvation, and glory, and honour, and power, unto the Lord our God:

ngiemboon: á nue awe létsɔ́’te ntsaŋ aa nénʉ́ ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. À kéen ńtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ máamáa ngàŋ mpfwɔ́’ manzwě gẅie à kɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ nò mpfwɔ́’ yé, ńtága jʉ’ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. À tsɔ’ɔ́ piŋé nò metse megàŋa fà’ pé pie ngàŋ mpfwɔ́’ ŋwɛ́ la pfɛte. À tsɔ̌’ pɔ́ kwà’ ná yé.
en: for true and righteousarehis judgments: for he hath judged the great whore, which did corrupt the earth with her fornication, and hath avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.

ngiemboon: Anùɔ lá’ gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Alelúyà! Ndyé gẅie é fóo nà tÿǒsoŋ gie á shÿǒ, é ge lá’a kwɔ́’ɔ kwɔ̌’ nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: And again they said, Alleluia. And her smoke rose up for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: Melÿò pá ntsɔ̀b lekùa lê móm mbʉ́a, mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn pá lekùa kẅí’te ssé, ńgu’te Ssé gẅie à ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńne ńgu’te yé, ńgɔɔn ngie:*Amen! Alelúyà!
en: And the four and twenty elders and the four beasts fell down and worshipped God that sat on the throne, saying, Amen; Alleluia.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ lêen ńké fó jʉ’ʉ lʉŋe lefùɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi gu’te Ssé yege, pi megàŋa fà’ pé tà maga gẅí, pi penkʉ́ mbɔɔ melÿò pie pi pɔ́gɔ yé.
en: And a voice came out of the throne, saying, Praise our God, all ye his servants, and ye that fear him, both small and great.

ngiemboon: N jú’ ngyè nùɔ lá’ zẅɛ̂ pá’ lepí sie é zyɛ́’ɛ la, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ ntʉ̀ lefaŋ sie é vɛ́te la, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Alelúyà. Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yege, ńgwɔ́ Ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm, á nuŋé lefùɔ sé.
en: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of mighty thunderings, saying, Alleluia: for the Lord God omnipotent reigneth.

ngiemboon: Pege kág, ńnáa gugẅî, ńnáa legú’ mbwo yé. Á nue eshúm léjÿó línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò é sɔ́ɔn. Anzwě ngʉ̀ we, kẅǐŋ mbùm ye tà ne ńzẅí’te.
en: Let us be glad and rejoice, and give honour to him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready.

ngiemboon: Mé ka gÿo nà ntí gie à ge ma’ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ mie é ŋwʉŋe ńgwɔ́ té*lɔ̌’. Á nue mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mefà’ pʉ̀a Ssé mie é tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: And to her was granted that she should be arrayed in fine linen, clean and white: for the fine linen is the righteousness of saints.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne ngie pàshÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pie mé toŋó wɔ́b á jʉ’ʉ línɔ́ɔn lɔ́ɔn ndá mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Áa shwóŋè gie á kẅɛ̌ kwà’ ncwò Ssé.
en: And he saith unto me, Write, Blessedarethey which are called unto the marriage supper of the Lamb. And he saith unto me, These are the true sayings of God.

ngiemboon: N jú’ pú’u, ńnuŋe mekwò yé légu’te yé. Tá’ á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tè gÿo pɛ́’ɛ̀. Mèŋ n gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ nà kwò fà’ gí, lâ petsɔ́ mefɛ́ pú pie, pia pɔ̌ kú’te mmó gie Yěsô Kristo ka gÿo mé zsé. Legÿo pú’u, áa mmó gie á tsóte pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pɔ́ tsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé. Pú’u la, gu’te pɔ́ Ssé.
en: And I fell at his feet to worship him. And he said unto me, Seethou do itnot: I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren that have the testimony of Jesus: worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá ncwò lepwó nyɛ́’ɛ ńtyé, fɔ́gɔ lÿóon kẅɛ ńtyé. Nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ná wɛ̌ lÿóon, mé tóŋo yé lê tèkubé shwóŋè, mbɔɔ lê nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. À tsɔ́’te ntsaŋ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńdÿɔ́’ pɔ́ ncù gẅie ée ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that sat upon himwascalled Faithful and True, and in righteousness he doth judge and make war.

ngiemboon: Enÿɔ́g mé kyɛ’ jʉ’ pá’ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g la, á tɔ́’ mecÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, mbà mé ŋwe’é tsɔ́ lezíŋ ná yé, ésie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè zsé mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́ tà ndí ndà’ yé.
en: His eyeswereas a flame of fire, and on his headweremany crowns; and he had a name written, that no man knew, but he himself.

ngiemboon: Á ma’ tsɔ̌ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g, mbà mé la nu’u tsɛ̀ɛ metse. Mé tóŋo yé lê shwóŋè Ssé.
en: And hewasclothed with a vesture dipped in blood: and his name is called The Word of God.

ngiemboon: Menùɔ ncù mie ée tÿǒ lepwó gwɔ́ nzèm yé, ńnéŋte ná mefɔ́gɔ lÿóon, ḿma’ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ mie tsɔ́ pǎb té mǒ wɔ́.
en: And the armieswhich werein heaven followed him upon white horses, clothed in fine linen, white and clean.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ nně ncù ne fóo ncwò nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à ńnéŋe ndùm fɔ́gɔ lÿóon ńkẅɛɛ. Esẅíte sẅité, ńgwɔ́ gie à ge lɔg kɔ́’ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋo mengwòŋ. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ge lɔgɔ tÿǒ tʉ̌ ésá’ pʉ̀a mésoŋ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ge tsẅɛ́’ mentɔ̌ɔn mie mé lɔgɔ ńnyɛte melù’ tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon mélù’ mie é la’te ngie e Ssé ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ tɛ’.
en: And out of his mouth goeth a sharp sword, that with it he should smite the nations: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and he treadeth the winepress of the fierceness and wrath of Almighty God.

ngiemboon: Mbà mé ŋwe’é tsɔ́ lezíŋ nà nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye, mbɔɔ nà ntɔ́ɔn wé, é gwɔ́ lê: Fùɔ ncʉ̀a mefùɔ, mbɔɔ lê Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mecʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And he hath onhisvesture and on his thigh a name written, KING OF KINGS, ANDLordOF LORDS.

ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔntè ńgyá atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tyé nà lejÿɔ́g nèm, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńtsẅii mbwo meshʉ́ŋ ntsèm pie é ne ńziete tàa tÿǒ lefaŋ ngie: Pi tó. Pi cú’tè léjÿó máamáa línɔ́ɔn Ssé,
en: And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the fowls that fly in the midst of heaven, Come and gather yourselves together unto the supper of the great God;

ngiemboon: lépfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ mefùɔ. Lépfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ mentándá ncù. Lépfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ mentʉ̀ pʉ̀a. Lépfɛ́ mbab melÿóon, mbɔɔ mbab nnɛ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie é néŋte ndumó. Lépfɛ́ mbàb nnɛ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm. E pà ńnéŋe ńgwɔ́ mendù nnɛ́ kà pà ńnéŋe ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn wɔ́, é penkʉ́ mbɔɔ melÿò.
en: that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses, and of them that sit on them, and the flesh of allmen,bothfree and bond, both small and great.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gyá nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn wa, ńgyá mefùɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ mbɔɔ menùɔ ncù mɔ́b. Mbà pɔ́ cu’té léma’a nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ná lÿóon pâ wé nùɔ ncù lê ncù.
en: And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies, gathered together to make war against him that sat on the horse, and against his army.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿo nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn wa, ńgwoon yé, ńgíŋe ńgwoon mbɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé we cÿɔ̌ nò gẅie, à la tyé mvfò yé, ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn ńdɔg fʉte pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la zẅíŋ mé cÿɔ’ɔ liŋé nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ ná pɔ́b, pɔ́ gíŋ ńgu’te tútú nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ la. Mé gwoon wɔ́b pú’u, ńzé’e wɔ́b mépʉ́a pɔ́ ntentʉ́, ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon mmɔ̌g*mekʉ̀a.
en: And the beast was taken, and with him the false prophet that wrought miracles before him, with which he deceived them that had received the mark of the beast, and them that worshipped his image. These both were cast alive into a lake of fire burning with brimstone.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, nně ncù gie e la ne fóo ncwò nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe ná lÿóon ńkẅɛɛ la, é zẅéte wɔ́b. Ngwòŋ meshʉ́ŋ ntsèm pfɛ́ mbab yɔb tà ńzẅɛ́.
en: And the remnant were slain with the sword of him that sat upon the horse, whichswordproceeded out of his mouth: and all the fowls were filled with their flesh.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé fó tÿǒ lepwó ńne sẅɛ́’ɛ, ńgẅiin kí lɔg ńtsɔ́’ ncwò pÿé té lǎŋ, ńgíŋ ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ máamaa tsɛ̂n á pwó yé,
en: And I saw an angel come down from heaven, having the key of the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.

ngiemboon: ńgwoon máamáa nnù ngém ya, á yé gẅie aa nnù ya gie e la fó tàa fʉ̀’e mvfò la, yé gẅie aa ndêbele, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ Sátà la, ńdɔgɔ tsɛ̂n wa ńkwɛ́ɛ yé pá’ à ge ké gwɔ́ pɔ́ me nkÿo nà ngù’ ntsá’,
en: And he laid hold on the dragon, that old serpent, which is the Devil, and Satan, and bound him a thousand years,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńzé’e yé ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ, ńdɔgɔ kí ńjÿɔ’ɔ yé tsoló, ńtse lê lìi nŋwá’ légwɔ́ gie à tè gíŋe gwá tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋo mengwòŋ é fʉte pʉ̀a wɔ́ tà ngù’ ntsá’ e lá’ ńku’. E lá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńku’, mé ná’a ńkyɛ’ɛ yé ná mûɔ méfʉ̀’.
en: and cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be fulfilled: and after that he must be loosed a little season.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńgyá melʉŋe lefùɔ tyéte. Epʉ̀a tó ńnéŋe mǒ. Mé ná metʉ̀ mbwo pɔ́b lélɔg ńtsɔ́’te ntsaŋ. Mèŋ n gyá mbɔɔ mentʉ́m pʉ̀a pie mé la gwoonte wɔ́b ńzá’ twó sɔ́b, ńtí pá’ pɔ́ zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ ndà’ nò gie Yěsô ka gÿo mé zsé, mbɔɔ nò Ssé. Mbà pɔ́ ka tè gu’te nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn wɔ́, ńké tè tútú we gu’te, aliŋé nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ piŋ tè na zí yɔ́b kà nà pwó yɔ́b wɔ́. Pɔ́ fó lá’ mepfó ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó, pâ Kristo púte sá’ njÿó nà ngù’ ntsá’. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò*lezimé nà legwé.
en: And I saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment was given unto them: andI sawthe souls of them that were beheaded for the witness of Jesus, and for the word of God, and which had not worshipped the beast, neither his image, neither had receivedhismark upon their foreheads, or in their hands; and they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ mepfó ké tè fó la’ mepfó ḿbiŋ nzèm ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó té gwɔ́ gie yɛ̌ ngù’ ntsá’ e kǔ’ wɔ́.
en: But the rest of the dead lived not again until the thousand years were finished. Thisisthe first resurrection.

ngiemboon: Pàshÿó mbòŋo, ée pʉ̀a pie é ge zíme nà legwé ná ndùŋ mvfò lezím, ée pʉ̀a pie ée kwà’ pe Ssé. Legwé we mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a tè gíŋe ńku’u lé kíbe wɔ́b gwɔ́. Pɔ́ ge gÿo gwɔ́ pànuŋe pwɔ̀’ pe Ssé, mbɔɔ pe Kristo, pâ Kristo sá’ jÿó nà ngù’ ntsá’.
en: Blessed and holyishe that hath part in the first resurrection: on such the second death hath no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.

ngiemboon: Mengù’ ntsá’ mɛ̌ ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà ku’, mé gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ gie Sátà aa tsoló la, ńkyɛ́’te metsɛ̂n ná ye ńnyé yé.
en: And when the thousand years are expired, Satan shall be loosed out of his prison,

ngiemboon: À kẅɛ, légwa fʉte pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋo mengwòŋ, á nà njÿó mesǎg lekùa. Mé tóŋ mɔɔn mengwòŋ lê Gɔg ńgíŋ ńtóŋ lê Magɔg, éfʉte wɔ́b pú’u, é cú’te wɔ́b lélɔg ńgʉa ḿma’ ncù. Pɔ́ gyɔ́ɔn pá’ memvòm sàŋasáŋa gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa la.
en: and shall go out to deceive the nations which are in the four quarters of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to battle: the number of whomisas the sand of the sea.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ńjÿó jʉ’ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, ńkéle mbàa jʉ’ gie pʉ̀a Ssé cú’te ńnéŋe wó, á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie e Ssé kwoŋ tɛ’. Tá’ etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g é ké fó tÿǒ lepwó, ńtó ńtuɔ wɔ́b.
en: And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and compassed the camp of the saints about, and the beloved city: and fire came down from God out of heaven, and devoured them.

ngiemboon: Sátà gẅie á kě ne fʉte wɔ́b la, mé tsó yé ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon mmɔ̌g*mekʉ̀a, á lejʉ́ŋ nkʉ̀’ʉ nɔ̀ɔn mbɔɔ lejʉ́ŋ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé we cÿɔ̌ nò. Pɔ́ lá’a ńtsẅé wó, ńgyá ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntí ntí, á zsó pɔ́ tsẅɛ́’, á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn lê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophetare, and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ máamáa lʉŋe lefùɔ tyé, ńgwɔ́ féfɔ́gɔ, ńgyá mbɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ. Tsetsá’ pɔ́ lefaŋ pú fó mvfò yé ńkÿo. À yɔ́b jʉ’ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá mepfó ssé, é melÿò mbɔɔ penkʉ́, pɔ́ tyéte mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ. N gíŋ ńgyá pá’ mé nyɛ́’ɛ meŋwà’ne. Mé gÿo ńgíŋe nyɛ́’ɛ yetsɔ́, á gwɔ́ gie mé la ŋwe’e mezíŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin légwɔ́ tèmì tsoló. Mé lɔgɔ mmó gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ meŋwà’ne ńŋag mepfó ssé, ńŋaga wɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ mefà’ mɔ́b ka gwɔ̌.
en: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which isthe bookof life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

ngiemboon: Ntse té pàa ná mepfó pʉ̀a pie é la fÿɛ́ɛ ntse. Legwé mbɔɔ lá’ mepfó gíŋe ńná pɔ́b mepfó, mé ŋaga wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pá’ mefà’ mé la gwɔ́.
en: And the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and hell delivered up the dead which were in them: and they were judged every man according to their works.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńzé’e legwé mbɔɔ lá’ gie mepfó ée wó, ḿma’a tsɛ̀ɛ lepÿé mmɔ̌g. Lepÿé mmɔ̌g ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ legwé mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a.
en: And death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.

ngiemboon: Wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie mé la tè gyá lezíŋ sé tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne gie mezíŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì ée tsoló wɔ́, mé ma’a yé tsɛ̀ɛ lepÿé mmɔ̌g.
en: And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.

ngiemboon: N deen ńké ńgyá lefaŋ se sẅé mbɔɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ye sẅé. Mbà ndùŋ mvfò lefaŋ mbɔɔ ndùŋ mvfò ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ kéen ḿmag, mbɔɔ ntse té pàa cʉ́’ʉ wó wɔ́.
en: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá tÿǒsoŋo Ndʉalʉ̌a, á Yerósalem ye sẅé, á ne fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé sẅɛ́’ɛ, ńgwɔ́ pá’ nzwě ngʉ̀ gẅie à kẅǐŋ mbùm ye ńne ńzẅí’te ndǔm we la.
en: And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ jú’ etsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ̀ fóo jʉ’ʉ lʉŋe lefùɔ ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà jʉ’ gie Ssé ńnéŋe wó, á gwɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pâ pɔ̌ zɔ̌ ge cʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé, à gwɔ́ Ssé yɔb.
en: And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying, Behold, the tabernacle of Godiswith men, and he will dwell with them, and they shall be his people, and God himself shall be with them,and betheir God.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b ntsèm. Legwé tè gÿo gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Mé le gíŋe ńdʉa legwé wɔ́. Mé le gíŋe ńga’te wɔ́. Mé le gíŋe ńgyá ngɔ́’ wɔ́. Á nue ngwòŋ we nzẅìŋ kéen ḿmag.
en: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la ńnéŋe nà lʉŋe lefùɔ gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn n ne ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ sẅé sẅé, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Ŋwe’e. Á nue nò yɔɔn té gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ jú’ ḿmʉ́’te wɔ́, áa nénʉ́,
en: And he that sat upon the throne said, Behold, I make all things new. And he said unto me, Write: for these words are true and faithful.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Á zsoté. Mèŋ n gee Alfa, ńgwɔ́ Omega, ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò, ńgwɔ́ nzsònzèm. Agága nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne shÿó, mbà mèŋ n ge ná ntse gẅie é gÿo mé ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó á mbwó yé. Wɛ̌ ntse fóo nà lesa’á ntse sɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n ge ná pɔ́ sẅɛɛ sẅɛɛ.
en: And he said unto me, It is done. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à mǎ’ ncù tà ńcʉa nò tepòŋ, mèŋ n ge gÿo náa yɛ̌ fù’ mbwo yé, é gwɔ́ Ssé ye, à gwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgʉa nà metsóon, mbɔɔ ná pàzẅíŋ ḿbiŋ ńdʉ’, mbɔɔ ná pàgÿo menò ncÿǒ, mbɔɔ ná pàzẅéte pʉ̀a, mbɔɔ ná pàgÿo menò mpfwɔ́’, mbɔɔ ná pàgẅiin mekàŋ, mbɔɔ ná pàgu’te shúm ngie ee messé, ńgÿo megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò metsèm, mbà yɔ́b mmó gie mé ge gÿo lɔg tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ yɔ́b áa pá’ mé ge gÿo ma’a wɔ́b á tsɛ̀ɛ lepÿé mmɔ̌g*mekʉ̀a, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lekwé ńgʉa mbʉ́a.
en: But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé piŋ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nà*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé sɔɔn mbʉ́a pie é la kú’te mentú’ mɛ̌ sɔɔn mbʉ́a, menzsònzèm mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ sɔɔn mbʉ́a gwɔ́ tsoló tà ńdúe la, ńtó pú’u, ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tóo, Mèŋ n nyɛɛ gú nzwě ngʉ̀, á nzwě mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò,
en: And there came unto me one of the seven angels which had the seven vials full of the seven last plagues, and talked with me, saying, Come hither, I will shew thee the bride, the Lamb's wife.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, à Zẅìge jʉʉ wɔ̀ɔn, á kaa wɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgʉa ndùm tsɔ̌ máamáa lekwɛ́, ńtÿɔ́g, ésag ńgʉa tÿó tɛ’, ńdeen ńké ńnyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn tÿǒsoŋ ndʉalʉ̌a, á Yerósalem. Á ne fóo tÿǒ lépwó á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ésẅɛ́’ɛ.
en: And he carried me away in the spirit to a great and high mountain, and shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God,

ngiemboon: Shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie à laa mǒ, à laa we Ssé, ńne ńgÿo á ŋwʉŋe pá’*tsɔ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́ tsye, pá’ tɔgɔ́ tsyé gie mé tóŋo lê jaspe, ńtele tele pá’ ngeláse la.
en: having the glory of God: and her lightwaslike unto a stone most precious, even like a jasper stone, clear as crystal;

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé ka pwóon tà’ shʉ̀a tʉ́a nká’ gẅie à gʉa tÿǒ, ńdɔg ńkéle. Á gẅiin mencwò nká’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém. Tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tyé ná wɛ̌ ncwò wɔ́, ńně ḿbyɛ́bɛ. Mbà mé la ŋwe’e mezíŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a mǒ, é gwɔ́ mezíŋ mengẅɛ̀ púɔ Israel ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: and had a wall great and high,andhad twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written thereon, which arethe namesof the twelve tribes of the children of Israel:

ngiemboon: Á laa shÿó sǎ’ nèm mencwò nká’ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿó twó, mencwò nká’ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿo ntsíŋ mencwò nká’ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿó mbyě nèm, mencwò nká’ gwɔ́ méntá.
en: on the east three gates; on the north three gates; on the south three gates; and on the west three gates.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg memáa métóon ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém nuŋe ncwò nká’ gẅie é la kéle tÿǒsoŋ, mbàa wɛ̌ tóon wɔ́ á gẅiin lezíŋ tà’ nyìŋ á nà megàŋ ntúm Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò pie é laa ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and in them the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à la ne ńgɔɔn nò né mèŋ gẅiin kème mmó gie mé lɔgɔ fʉ’ʉ mmó, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̀ gɔ̂l ńnyɛte, á ne ńge lɔg fʉ̀’ʉ tÿǒsoŋ, éfʉ̀’ mencwò, éfʉ̀’ mbɔɔ tʉ́a nká’ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ.
en: And he that talked with me had a golden reed to measure the city, and the gates thereof, and the wall thereof.

ngiemboon: Atÿǒsoŋ la gẅiin meshÿó lekùa, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Ntyě pɔ́ lepfòm gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.*Cÿɔ́’ Ssé lɔgɔ kème mmó yá éfʉ’ʉ tÿǒsoŋ, á gwɔ́ mmó mekílomíta, ntsá’ pʉ́a lê nkÿo pʉ́a (2.200 km). Ntyě pɔ́ lepfòm mbɔɔ lekwɔ́’ ńgʉa tÿǒ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó.
en: And the city lieth foursquare, and the length is as large as the breadth: and he measured the city with the reed, twelve thousand furlongs. The length and the breadth and the height of it are equal.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé fʉ’ʉ tʉ́a nká’ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ, lé fóo ssé ńtyé tÿǒ, á gwɔ́ mmó míta móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a (70m), mbà à lɔg fʉ̀’ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ fʉ’ʉ mmó fʉ̀’ó, éfʉ’.
en: And he measured the wall thereof, an hundredandfortyandfour cubits,according tothe measure of a man, that is, of the angel.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔgɔ tsɔ́ tɔgɔ́ tsyé ḿbwóon tʉ́a nká’, mé tóŋo yɛ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́ tsyé le Jaspe, ntí gɔ̂l gie mé la lɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, é gwɔ́ atsɔ́ lɔ́’ té mǒ wɔ́, é tele tele pá’ ngeláse.
en: And the building of the wall of it wasofjasper: and the citywaspure gold, like unto clear glass.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg ntí ntí metɔgɔ́ tsye ńkẅiŋ mémáa metóon mie mé la lɔg ńnuŋe mecÿó tʉ́a nká’ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ. Ndùŋ mvfò cÿó mé lɔg tsɔ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́ tsyé gie mé tóŋ lê jaspe, ńkẅiŋ, mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a mé lɔg tsɔ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́ tsyé gie mé tóŋ lê safir, mbɔ́ɔntè yétá mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lè kalsedonia, mbɔ́ɔntè lekùa mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê emerod,
en: And the foundations of the wall of the cityweregarnished with all manner of precious stones. The first foundationwasjasper; the second, sapphire; the third, a chalcedony; the fourth, an emerald;

ngiemboon: mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̀a mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê sardoine, mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́ mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê kornaline, mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔn mbʉ́a mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê chrysolithe, mbɔ́ɔntè lefɔ̌ɔn, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê beril, mbɔ́ɔntè lepfwɔ’ɔ́ mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê topaze, mbɔ́ɔntè legém mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê krizopraze, mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b yémɔ’ɔ́ lê legém mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê hyacinthe, mbɔ́ɔntè tsɔ̀b pʉ̀a lê legém mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê améthyste.
en: the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, chrysolyte; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, a topaz; the tenth, a chrysoprasus; the eleventh, a jacinth; the twelfth, an amethyst.

ngiemboon: Mencwò nká’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém é laa metɔgɔ́ tsyé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ntí gie efɔ́g tɛ’, mbàa wɛ̌ ncwò nká’ wɔ́, é gwɔ́ mbà mé la lɔg pɔ́ tà’a tɔgɔ́ tsyé ná yɛ̌ ntí ńnyɛte. Alǎŋa lÿò gie á tɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ gwɔ́, mbà mé lɔgɔ́ gɔ̂l té*lɔ̌’ ńdɔg ḿbwóon, é tele tele pá’ ngeláse.
en: And the twelve gatesweretwelve pearls; every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the citywaspure gold, as it were transparent glass.

ngiemboon: Tá’ n ké ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ ntsèm n tè*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wó gyá, á nue*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ye tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, Ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm mbɔɔ Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò.
en: And I saw no temple therein: for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple of it.

ngiemboon: Shʉ́shÿɔ́g Ssé ne ńkyɛ’ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, kyɛ’ mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gíŋe ne ńkyɛ’ɛ yé. Tà yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ té gíŋe ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie nèm tʉ́a wó wɔ́, ńké tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie saŋ kyɛ’ jʉ’ wó wɔ́.
en: And the city had no need of the sun, neither of the moon, to shine in it: for the glory of God did lighten it, and the Lambisthe light thereof.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋo ngwòŋ ge gÿo lɔg pɔ́ kyɛ̀’ gie á fóo ná yé é ńnéŋe. Mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ lɔgɔ wɔb legú’ ńdɔg ńtó ńnuŋe wó.
en: And the nations of them which are saved shall walk in the light of it: and the kings of the earth do bring their glory and honour into it.

ngiemboon: Méncwò nká’ ge ké nyɛ́’ɛ tyé tyé fʉ̀’ ntsèm. Mé té lá’ jÿɔ́’ wɔ́, á nue nzěm ee ntěen síŋe wó wɔ́.
en: And the gates of it shall not be shut at all by day: for there shall be no night there.

ngiemboon: Mé ge lá’ lɔgɔ legú’ lâ mekù’ túmo túm ntsèm, é lɔg tó nuŋe wó.
en: And they shall bring the glory and honour of the nations into it.

ngiemboon: Tá’ atsɔ́ mmó gie ncÿǒ ée mǒ, á té gÿo tɔ́g tà kúu wó wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ sɔɔn nyìŋ á ná pàgÿo menò ncÿǒ, mbɔɔ nà megàŋa cÿɔ̌ nò. Ndà’ pʉ̀a pie mezíŋ mɔ́b ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò gie lezíŋ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì ée tsoló, ge lá’ kúu wó.
en: And there shall in no wise enter into it any thing that defileth, neitherwhatsoeverworketh abomination, ormaketha lie: but they which are written in the Lamb's book of life.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńnyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn mí gẅie ntse gẅie e gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó, é ne síi pá’ ntí tɔgɔ́ tsyé gie mé tóŋo lê christal la, é ne fóo nà lʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé pɔ́ Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò ńkẅɛɛ.
en: And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

ngiemboon: Metÿǒ mie é gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó é gwɔ́ soŋ lǎŋa lÿò gie áa tÿǒsoŋ, á nà mengʉ̀ŋe ntse mémbʉ́a, ńne ńzéme ngʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a, ngwòŋ mesaŋ ntsèm, mentɔ̌ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ tÿó. Mé piŋe ńdɔgɔ meffo mé ńzoŋo meguɔ ná pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée metúmo metúm.
en: In the midst of the street of it, and on either side of the river,was therethe tree of life, which bare twelvemanner offruits,andyielded her fruit every month: and the leaves of the treewerefor the healing of the nations.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ ndòon tè gÿo gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Alʉŋe*lefùɔ Ssé pɔ́ Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò ge gÿo gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ. Pafa’a fà’ Ssé é ne ńgu’te yé.
en: And there shall be no more curse: but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it; and his servants shall serve him:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo ne lɔgɔ nÿɔ́g mɔ́b é gyá shÿó Ssé. À gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé ŋwe’é lezíŋ sé nà zǐ yɔ́b.
en: and they shall see his face; and his nameshall bein their foreheads.

ngiemboon: Letsẅɛ́’ těen ńge gÿo gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Pɔ́ té nge gÿo gíŋe tsɔ́ɔn kyɛ̀’ gie á fóo ná lâm wɔ́, é ké le ye nèm tsɔ́ɔn. Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ge gÿo lɔgɔ yé kyɛ̀’ é kyɛ’ɛ wɔ́b. Pâ pɔ̌ sá’ njÿó nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.
en: And there shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light: and they shall reign for ever and ever.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Menò mɔɔn é té mie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ jú’ mʉ́’te wɔ́, ée nénʉ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gẅie yé zɔɔ ńdɔgɔ Zẅìge yé ńtúmo pà Ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé, kwà’ yé zɔ tumó cÿɔ́’ we pá’ à ge nyɛɛ mbwo megàŋa fà’ pé, mmó gie á ge tɔ́g tó.
en: And he said unto me, These sayingsarefaithful and true: and the Lord God of the holy prophets sent his angel to shew unto his servants the things which must shortly be done.

ngiemboon: Ayɔɔn, Yěsô kě ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge tɔ́g tó. Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à kú’te menò mie mé tsẅii tsɛ̀ɛ sɔɔn lepu’ú ŋwà’ne, é gwɔ́ mie é ge gÿo fʉ̀’ɔɔn mbɔɔ mie é ge lá’ tá gÿo.
en: Behold, I come quickly: blessedishe that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Jaŋ, n ka jú’ mɔɔn menò, ńgíŋe ńgyá. N ka jú’ mɔɔn menò ńgíŋe ńgyá pú’u, ńnuŋe mekwò*cÿɔ́’ Ssé légu’te yé, á*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gẅie à ka ne ńnyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn mɛ̌ menò.
en: And I John saw these things, and heardthem. And when I had heard and seen, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel which shewed me these things.

ngiemboon: Tá’ á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tè gÿo pɛ́’ɛ̀. Mèŋ n gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò gù nà fà’, mbɔɔ we mefɛ́ pú pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kú’te menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne. Gu’te pɔ́ Ssé.
en: Then saith he unto me, Seethou do itnot: for I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren the prophets, and of them which keep the sayings of this book: worship God.

ngiemboon: MÀbɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Tè lÿoon menò mie mé tsẅǐ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ée menò mie é ge gÿo, mbɔɔ mie e ge lá’ tá gÿo. Tè lÿoon, á nue afʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò gee mbumté á tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: And he saith unto me, Seal not the sayings of the prophecy of this book: for the time is at hand.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à tè ne ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́, á ké ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, ńdɔg ńgʉa lé mvfò. Nyìŋ gẅie ncÿǒ ée ná yé, à gíŋ ńkẅi’i ńnéŋ ncÿǒ ná yé. Tá nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, á ke ńgíŋe ńkẅi’i ne ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ. Nyìŋ gẅie aa nyìŋ Ssé, à ké ńgíŋe ńkẅi’i ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌.
en: He that is unjust, let him be unjust still: and he which is filthy, let him be filthy still: and he that is righteous, let him be righteous still: and he that is holy, let him be holy still.

ngiemboon: Ayɔɔn, Yěsô ké ně ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge tɔ́g tó, n gẅiin mmó gie n ge lɔg tsɔ́’ɔ fà’a pʉ̀a, á le ná ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ pá’ mefà’ mé ée pú’u.
en: And, behold, I come quickly; and my rewardiswith me, to give every man according as his work shall be.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee Alfa, ńgwɔ́ Omega, ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò, ńgwɔ́ nzsònzèm, ńgwɔ́ nzyeté, ńgwɔ́ nzsoté.
en: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last.

ngiemboon: Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ sɔgɔ menzsǒ mɔ́b tà é lʉ́a, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge ku’ léfó nà mencwò nká’, ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ, ńjÿó ntɔ̌ɔn tÿó ya gie á gÿo mé kwa’ ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: Blessedarethey that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and may enter in through the gates into the city.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgʉa ná pàgÿo menò pá’ ngwé, é pàgẅiin mekàŋ, é pàgÿo menò mpfwɔ́’, é pàzẅéte pʉ̀a, é pàgu’te shúm ngie ee messé, mbɔɔ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à kwoŋ cÿɔ̌ nò, tà shwóŋó yé pɔ́ cÿɔ̌ nò, megàŋ zso nzème pǐ.
en: For withoutaredogs, and sorcerers, and whoremongers, and murderers, and idolaters, and whosoever loveth and maketh a lie.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n tumó cÿɔ́’ wɔ̀ɔn ngie à gʉa ńtsẅi mɔɔn menò mie ée nénʉ́ mbwo pi, ńzsé ngie mé ge gɔɔn mbwo mecú’tè pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn. Mèŋ n gee lejÿɔ́g mmó sie é fóo nà leŋaŋ fùɔ Ndavíd, ńgwɔ́ cÿɔ́’ sàŋ gẅie à kwɔ̌’ ńjÿó gwóon ńdʉ́a.
en: I Jesus have sent mine angel to testify unto you these things in the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David,andthe bright and morning star.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pɔ́ nzwě ngʉ̀ ne ńgɔɔn ngie tóo. Á poŋ ngie nyìŋ gẅie à jú’u yɔɔn nò à gɔɔn yé ngie tóo. Nyìŋ gẅie nzyè ntse ne ńgyáŋa yé à tó. Nyìŋ gẅie à kwǒŋ à nú ntse gẅie é gÿo mé kwa’ ńgwɔ́ wó, ńnú pɔ́ tè náa tsɔ́ mmó.
en: And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Jaŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò pá’ɔɔn á mbwo wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ gẅie à ge jú’ menò mie mé gɔ̌ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, é gwɔ́ menò mie é ge gÿo mbɔɔ mie ge lá’ tá gÿo. Nyìŋ kẅi’i mmó mǒ, mbà Ssé ge gÿo gʉa nà yé nò, é kẅi’i mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ mie mé la’té tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne lɔɔn.
en: For I testify unto every man that heareth the words of the prophecy of this book, If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues that are written in this book:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ké ńgʉa ná menò mie mé gɔ̌ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, é gwɔ́ mie é ge gÿo mbɔɔ mie e ge lá’ tá gÿo lɔɔn, ńtsẅɛ́te tsɔ́ mmó, mbà Ssé ge gÿo tsẅɛ́te yé mmó gie á kɔ’ɔ́ ńgẅiin nà mentɔ̌ɔn tÿó gie á gÿo mé kwa’a ńgwɔ́ wó tà mbɔɔ ye mmó gie á ké ńgẅiin tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋo ndʉalʉ̌a gie mé la’te tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne.
en: and if any man shall take away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part out of the book of life, and out of the holy city, andfromthe things which are written in this book.

ngiemboon: *Amen. Tóo me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: He which testifieth these things saith,Surely I come quickly.Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm!
en: THE END
